Although he was known by his rank as a general, Grievous was the Supreme Commander of the Separatist Droid Army that engaged the Grand Army of the Republic throughout the pan-galactic conflict of the Clone Wars. Noted for his ruthlessness and extensive cybernetic enhancements, Grievous inspired fear as he traveled across the galaxy, invading entire worlds and engaging the Jedi Knights of the Republic.

A native of the planet Kalee, Grievous sustained severe injuries that required extensive repair by the time of the Clone Wars. Willingly submitting to a procedure that rendered him more mechanical than organic, he became a living weapon, granting him lightning-quick reflexes and devastating strength. Although he was neither Jedi or Sith, nor even sensitive to the power of the Force, Grievous was a skilled lightsaber duelist, having trained in the art of the lightsaber under the fallen Jedi Master-turned-Sith Lord Count Dooku. Known for his hatred of the Jedi Order, Grievous killed Jedi over the course of the war, and would claim their lightsabers both as trophies and weapons to be used against other opponents, be they Jedi or clone troopers.

In addition to his combat skills, Grievous was a brilliant military strategist who oversaw multiple campaigns throughout the Clone Warsfrom the Battle of Kamino, where he failed to halt the production line of clone troopers; to the Battle of Dathomir, where his battle droids massacred the Nightsisters led by the witch Mother Talzin. In 19 BBY, Grievous launched a daring raid on Coruscant, the Republic capital world, resulting in the abduction of Supreme Chancellor Sheev Palpatine. However, the Jedi succeeded in rescuing the Chancellor while driving back the Separatist invaders. Following the loss of Dooku, Grievous and his army went into hiding in the Outer Rim Territories. Unknown to Grievous, his master, the Sith Lord Darth Sidious, betrayed the general's location to the Jedi Order, allowing them to invade the planet Utapau in an effort to bring a swift and decisive conclusion to the war. As a result, Grievous was ultimately slain by his nemesis, Jedi General Obi-Wan Kenobi, whose 212th Attack Battalion went on to secure Utapau even as Order 66 went into effect, marking the fall of the Republic and the rise of the Galactic Empire.

name: Tarfful
description: Tarfful was a male Wookiee chieftain and general who helped defend his native planet Kashyyyk during the Clone Wars. During the war, he led a band of Wookiees to answer a distress signal made by Chewbacca, who was imprisoned on the Trandoshan hunting grounds of Wasskah. Tarfful later participated in the Battle of Kashyyyk alongside Chewbacca and Jedi Master Yoda. In the wake of Order 66 and the rise of the Galactic Empire, Tarrful helped facilitate Yoda's escape and continued fighting against the tyranny of the Empire in the following years. At some point prior to the Great Jedi Purge, Tarfful met and befriended Jedi Master Eno Cordova, and helped him navigate Kashyyyk to learn about Zeffo culture. A male Wookiee native to his species's homeworld of Kashyyyk, Tarfful served as the chieftain of the coastal city Kachirho at the time of the Clone Wars. He also held the rank of general among his people. One standard year into the war, one of Tarfful's fellow Wookiees, Chewbacca, was captured by Trandoshans and taken to Wasskah to be hunted for sport. There, Chewbacca managed to build a device which sent a distress signal to Kashyyyk. Upon hearing of his friend's situation, Tarfful hired the bounty hunters Sugi and Seripas to transport him and a group of his most trusted warriors to Wasskah. Once there, the chieftain and his men made quick work of the Trandoshans and rescued Chewbacca, as well as Jedi younglings Ahsoka Tano, Jinx, and O-Mer. At one point, Tarfful was captured by Trandoshan slavers who had made a deal with Count Dooku, but he was rescued by a squad of clone commandos soon after. Tarfful took part in the Battle of Kashyyyk alongside Chewbacca and Jedi Generals Yoda, Luminara Unduli and Quinlan Vos. Aided by the Grand Army of the Republic, he led a local militia against the invading Separatist droid forces. Following the implementation of Order 66, Tarfful and Chewbacca helped Yoda elude the clone troopers and escape from the planet. In the wake of the Galactic Empire's rise, Tarrful's anti-Imperial stance made him a wanted criminal, forcing him to take shelter in the Shadowlands. In 14 BBY, Saw Gerrera's rebel cell, the Partisans, agreed to help Cal Kestis and the crew of the Stinger Mantis track down Tarfful, as the Wookiee chieftan was aware of information that could aid the Jedi Padawan in locating a Jedi holocron containing a list of names of several Force-sensitive children. After locating Tarfful in the Shadowlands, the majority of the Partisans evacuated Kashyyyk, whilst Wookiee Commander Choyyssyk and Partisan Mari Kosan remained with Tarfful. Tarfful later provided the information Kestis was seeking upon the Padawan's return to Kashyyyk.

name: Raymus Antilles
description: Raymus Antilles was a male Human and the captain of the corvette Sundered Heart at the time of the Clone Wars and the Galactic Civil War. He served the Royal Alderaan Civil Fleet under Senator Bail Prestor Organa. During the early stages of the Civil War, he served the Rebel Alliance in the fight against the Galactic Empire. He captained the Alderaan Diplomatic Cruiser Tantive IV before his death in 0 BBY at the hands of Darth Vader.

name: Sly Moore
description:
Sly Moore was a female Umbaran Force Adept who was employed by Supreme Chancellor Palpatine as his Senior Administrative Aide during the final decades of the Galactic Republic. In secret, Moore was also an acolyte of the dark side, trained in the ways of the Force by Palpatine, who was in truth the Dark Lord of the Sith Darth Sidious.

Following Sidious' Declaration of a New Order, Moore became one of the first members of the Imperial Ruling Council and gained the sobriquet "Queen of the Empire" from the holomedia, with rumors spreading that she and the Emperor shared a relationship. She oversaw a series of experiments on Byss studying the spontaneous generation of life, which produced the future Imperial warlord Trioculus. Moore disappeared shortly into the Empire's reign, and was rumored to have died in seclusion in the Ghost Nebula after giving birth to Palpatine's biological son Triclops.

name: Tion Medon
description:
Tion Medon was a male Pau'an and the Master of Port Administration of Utapau. A gaunt, gray-skinned humanoid, Tion Medon wore elaborate red robes and carried an ornate staff of office. He assisted Obi-Wan Kenobi during the late Clone Wars.
A member of the tall, thin Pau'an species, Tion Medon had an unsettling appearance to some, with glassy, sunken black eyes and a mouth of crooked teeth. However, appearances were deceptive, as Tion Medon was an accommodating, helpful being. As Port Administrator of his sinkhole sanctuary of Pau City, Tion welcomed guests, offering them his services.
Longevity came naturally to the Pau'ans, and Tion Medon had been Master of Port Administration for Pau City for more than 200-standard years by the time of the Clone Wars. Tion was a descendant of Timon Medon, who was credited with unifying Utapau. Like all Pau'ans, Tion preferred darkness to sunlight, and raw meat to cooked.
In the final weeks of the Clone Wars, Tion Medon was forced to accommodate General Grievous and his associates in his sanctuary. Grievous threatened to destroy Medon's city if he did not assist, or if he were to bring in aid from the Galactic Republic. Medon had no choice but to allow the Separatists to use his sanctuary as their base of operations.
Fortunately for the Administrator, help arrived of its own accord, in the form of Jedi Master Obi-Wan Kenobi. Despite General Grievous's threats, Tion Medon welcomed Kenobi to the spaceport, and discreetly divulged helpful information pertaining to the Separatist presence on Utapau. Kenobi, sent by the Jedi Council to track down General Grievous, was able to seek and destroy the Separatist Supreme Commander with Tion Medon's help.

name: Finn
description:
Finn, formerly designated FN-2187 ("Eight-Seven"), was a Force-sensitive human male stormtrooper who served the First Order until his desertion and subsequent defection to the Resistance during the First OrderResistance war. Though trained since birth to be a loyal and obedient soldier, FN-2187's conscience conflicted with the methods of the First Order. For a time he was unwilling to support the Resistance, hoping to escape the galactic conflict instead of fighting for a cause he believed was doomed to fail. As the galaxy became consumed by war, the renegade trooper was ultimately forced to decide where his true loyalties lay.

Born in 11 ABY during the New Republic Era, FN-2187 was part of a new generation of stormtroopershuman children conscripted into the military forces of the First Ordermodeled on the Republic clone troopers and Imperial stormtroopers of the past. He originally trained with Batch Eight before joining the FN Corps, a sub-branch of the Stormtrooper Corps, and although his potential was recognized by his commanding officers, FN-2187 lacked the ruthlessness that had become common in the ranks under the influence of Captain Phasma. In the waning days of the Cold War, he hesitated to kill civilians during his first mission and consequently decided to desert after witnessing the massacre of Tuanul. Lacking experience as a pilot, FN-2187 freed a Resistance prisoner, Commander Poe Dameron, who coined the nickname "Finn" to supplant the renegade stormtrooper's alphanumeric designation. He then sought his own freedom while forming friendships with the Jakku scavenger Rey and the droid BB-8, as well as the Rebel war heroes Han Solo and Chewbacca.

After the destruction of the New Republic, Finn provided the Resistance with the information they needed to destroy the First Order's superweapon, Starkiller Base. During the attack, he was defeated and nearly killed by the dark warrior Kylo Ren. Rescued by Rey and Chewbacca, Finn recuperated from his injuries and by the time he awoke, the Resistance was forced to evacuate their base on D'Qar. Despite attempting to escape from the conflict once more, a mission with Rose Tico convinced Finn to truly join the Resistance to the extent where he nearly sacrificed his life for their cause during the Battle of Crait in 34 ABY. In 35 ABY, Finn continued assisting the Resistance by joining Rey on the quest to find the Sith wayfinder and destroy the malevolent religion once and for all, eventually becoming a general along with Poe after Leia's passing, with his first mission as a general being spent leading the ground forces during the Battle of Exegol.

name: Rey
description:
Rey Skywalker, once known only as Rey, was a human female Jedi Master who fought on the side of the Resistance in the war against the First Order. A former scavenger from the planet Jakku, her life was changed by the tumultuous events of the last days of the New Republic Era. Her decision to help the droid BB-8 would set Rey on a course to discovering the Force that awakened within her, leading her to seek out Jedi Master Luke Skywalker for training. Yet despite her commitment to the Jedi Order and the light side of the Force, Rey felt the pull to the dark side due to her anger and the adversarial relationship she had with Ben Solo, a fallen Jedi whom she knew as the dark warrior Kylo Ren. The unique Force-bond between them was a result of their nature as a dyad in the Force.

Rey was born in 15 ABY during the rise of the New Republic. Her father was a bioengineered Strand-Cast cloned from the genetic template of Darth Sidious, the Sith Lord who ruled the Galactic Empire as Emperor Palpatine. The clone and Rey's mother chose to live as simple junk traders in order to hide their daughter, who inherited Sidious' connection to the Force, from his followers. After the deaths of her parents, Rey was forced to survive on her own in the Jakku desert, and became a skilled mechanic, pilot and combatant in the process. Her isolated life was disrupted shortly before war broke out across the galaxy in 34 ABY. Determined to help the Resistance, Rey gained several new allies including Finn, a renegade stormtrooper, as well as the veterans Han Solo and Chewbacca. In the course of their journey, she discovered her latent Force powers and sought guidance under Skywalker, who taught her the art of the Force despite his decision to end the Jedi legacy. After Skywalker sacrificed himself to save the Resistance, Rey assumed his mantle as the last Jedi and became the apprentice of General Leia Organa.

With the return of Darth Sidious in 35 ABY, Rey set out to find the dark world of Exegol and prevent the Sith from being reborn. It was through Kylo Ren that Rey discovered her origins as the Dark Lord's granddaughter, and upon confronting Sidious in person, she was nearly swayed to the dark side of the Force. However, Rey was saved by Ben Solo after he renounced his dark alter ego. Aided by the spirits of all the Jedi, Rey died vanquishing her grandfather, causing Solo to make the ultimate sacrifice in order to bring Rey back to life. The two embraced and shared a kiss as Solo peacefully vanished in Rey's arms. Although Solo was the last of the Skywalker bloodline, Rey assumed the name "Skywalker" to honor their memory, repudiating her own heritage as a Palpatine.

name: Poe Dameron
description:
Poe Dameron was a human male who originally served as a member of the Spice Runners of Kijimi, before becoming a pilot in the New Republic and eventually joining the Resistance, rising to become acting General of the Resistance, during its conflict and subsequent war with the First Order. The son of Lieutenant Shara Bey and Sergeant Kes Dameron of the Alliance to Restore the Republic, Dameron followed in his late mother's footsteps in becoming a pilot, serving the New Republic Defense Fleet as the commander of Rapier Squadron, but grew disillusioned with the Republic's inaction to the First Order's violations of the Galactic Concordance. Dameron defected to the Resistance, where he became one of General Leia Organa's most trusted operatives. Dameron flew under the callsign of Black Leader while piloting his specialized T-70 X-wing starfighter, Black One.

As the conflict with the First Order grew more desperate, Dameron was sent to find Lor San Tekka on Jakku, who had part of a map to locate Organa's brother, Jedi Master Luke Skywalker. Though Dameron entrusted the map to his astromech droid BB-8, he was captured by the First Order and interrogated for the location of the map, eventually being forced to hand over the information. He escaped with the help of a defecting stormtrooper, whom Dameron nicknamed Finn, and returned to the Resistance base on D'Qar on his own. He aided Finn, Rey, Han Solo, and Chewbacca with air support during the Battle of Takodana, and he later flew during the battle to destroy the superweapon known as Starkiller Base. During the battle, after the base was damaged by Solo, Finn, Rey, and Chewbacca, Dameron fired the shots that destroyed the Starkiller weapon, saving the Resistance from certain destruction.

During the subsequent battle of D'Qar, Dameron disobeyed orders and led an attack on the First Order Dreadnought Fulminatrix, but his reckless actions caused him to be demoted from Wing Commander to captain. As the First Order pursued the Resistance by tracking them through hyperspace to the Crait system, Dameron did not approve of the passive strategy of Vice Admiral Amilyn Holdo and worked with Finn and mechanic Rose Tico to break into Supreme Leader Snoke's flagship, the Supremacy, and disable the First Order's hyperspace tracker before eventually staging a mutiny against Admiral Holdo in an effort to buy Finn and Rose time.

However, Dameron and the mutineers had not realized that Holdo's plan was to discreetly transport the Resistance to an abandoned Rebel base on the nearby planet Crait, and his group's actions caused the First Order to discover the Resistance's escape vessels and destroy many of them. Even so, General Organa gave Dameron command after Holdo sacrificed herself, and he led a last-ditch counterattack against the First Order during the Battle of Crait. The counterattack was unsuccessful, but Dameron was able to lead the surviving Resistance fighters while a Force projection of Luke Skywalker distracted Kylo Ren and the First Order, where they found their way to Rey and the Millennium Falcon, allowing them to escape.

After the escape, the group took the brief moment of peace to catch up on recent events, and as he left for the Battle of Grail City, the ace was promoted back to commander. After that, he reflected on what it truly meant to be a member of the Resistance, and how he believed it was about bringing light to dark and saving one's galaxy.

name: BB8
description: BB-8, sometimes spelled and pronounced Beebee-Ate and nicknamed BB, was a BB-series astromech droid who operated approximately thirty years after the Battle of Endor. It had a dome head, similar to that of R2 series astromech droids, with the bulk of its body made up of a ball on which the droid's head rolled. BB-8 was mostly white, with some silver and orange on its body, as well as a black photoreceptor. The droid belonged to Resistance pilot Poe Dameron, whom he accompanied during his flights on his T-70 X-wing starfighter.

name: Captain Phasma
description:
Phasma was a human female stormtrooper captain of the First Order. Phasma grew up as a member of the Scyre clan on the nuclear-ravaged world of Parnassos. She was a formidable warrior who became the clan's military leader. Seeking passage offworld, Phasma helped the First Order General Brendol Hux find his ship in the process betraying her own brother Keldo and clan. After being rescued, Phasma joined the First Order, abandoning her former life on Parnassos.

Over the years, Phasma rose through the ranks of the First Order and became in charge of their stormtrooper training program. She conspired with Brendol's son General Armitage Hux to assassinate her former benefactor. Phasma also survived an assassination attempt by Brendol's former protege Cardinal, who sought revenge for Brendol's death. Having consolidated her position within the First Order, Phasma became part of an unofficial triumvirate consisting of General Hux and the dark enforcer Kylo Ren.

As a senior officer, Phasma commanded First Order forces in their struggle against the Resistance. Under orders from the Supreme Leader of the First Order, Snoke, the triumvirate searched for a galaxy map that would lead to the last of the Jedi, Luke Skywalker, on the planet Jakku. Phasma participated in a massacre at Tuanul village, an atrocity which led the stormtrooper FN-2187 to defect to the Resistance.

Following the Hosnian Cataclysm, Phasma was ambushed by FN-2187, now with the Resistance as Finn, who had infiltrated Starkiller Base with the smugglers Han Solo and Chewbacca. Surviving the Battle of Starkiller Base, Phasma framed Lieutenant Sol Rivas for the base's destruction and led a mission to hunt down the fugitive in order to conceal her own malfeasance. During the pursuit of the Resistance fleet, Phasma fought with the infiltrator Finn aboard the First Order flagship Supremacy, which had recently been devastated by a hyperspace ramming attack that freed the former stormtrooper. Phasma was defeated by the combined efforts of Finn and his new companion, Rose Tico. Subsequently, the captain fell to her death into a fire that was consuming the stricken ship.

name: Padmé Amidala
description:
Padmé Amidala, also known as Padmé Amidala Naberrie, was a human female senator who represented the people of Naboo during the final years of the Galactic Republic. Prior to her career in the Galactic Senate, Amidala was the elected ruler of the Royal House of Naboo. A political idealist, she advocated for the preservation of democracy as well as a peaceful resolution to the Clone Wars. However, her secret marriage to the Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker would have a lasting effect on the future of the galaxy for decades to come.

Born in 46 BBY during the Age of the Republic, Padmé Naberrie was raised by her parents, Ruwee Naberrie and his wife Jobal, on the peaceful Mid Rim world of Naboo. Despite the humble background of the Naberrie family, Padmé was identified early for her potential in public service. Devoting her life to civic duty, she was elected queen and, therefore, adopted the regnal name "Amidala" in 32 BBY. Due to the machinations of her advisor, Senator Sheev Palpatine, Amidala's reign was put to the test by the Trade Federation's blockade and subsequent invasion of Naboo. Unable to fight the Federation's army of battle droids without assistance, the queen beseeched the Galactic Senate on Coruscant for help, only to see her efforts hampered by bureaucracy and procedure. Although she ultimately liberated her homeworld with the help of the Jedi Order and the Gungan Grand Army, her decision to cast a Vote of No Confidence against Finis Valorum enabled Palpatine to become the Supreme Chancellor.

Following her reign, Amidala joined the Senate and struggled to resolve the Separatist Crisis through diplomacy, becoming a leading voice in the Loyalist Committee by 22 BBY. After surviving an assassination attempt, she was removed from the capital and sent back to Naboo under the protection of Padawan Anakin Skywalker. Though the Jedi Code forbade personal relationships, deeming attachment, and possession unbecoming of a Jedi, the two gradually became closer as their feelings for each other grew. In the aftermath of the First Battle of Geonosis, Amidala secretly married her Jedi protector, despite her own reservations about their relationship and the consequences they would face if the truth ever came to light. Their subsequent interactions were limited throughout the Clone Wars, with Amidala continuing to advocate peaceful solutions in the Senate while Skywalker served on the front lines as a Jedi General in the Grand Army of the Republic. In the waning months of the pan-galactic conflict, Amidala revealed to her husband that she was pregnant. As a result of Skywalker's fear of loss, he was seduced by the dark side of the Force, believing that by becoming a Sith Lord he would gain the power to prevent his wife from dying in childbirth. Amidala, who learned of her husband's transformation into a Sith, ultimately died of a broken heart after giving birth to the twins Luke Skywalker and Leia Amidala Skywalker. With her dying breath, she claimed that there was still good in the former Anakin Skywalker, who embraced the persona of Darth Vader throughout the reign of the Galactic Empire.

Amidala's children played a major role in the fragmentation of the Empire and the redemption of her husband. Like her mother, Leia entered public service and became a flag-bearer for the democratic ideals of liberty and justice as a leader in the Alliance to Restore the Republic and its successor, the New Republic, before becoming the founding general of the Resistance against the First Ordera successor state to the Galactic Empire. Luke, on the other hand, was trained in the ways of the Jedi like his father before him and was a celebrated war hero of the Rebel Alliance. Through Luke's efforts to redeem his father back to the light, Amidala's last words proved true when Anakin killed the Emperor during the Battle of Endor.

name: Din Djarin
description:
Din Djarin, commonly known as "the Mandalorian" or "Mando" for short, was a human male Mandalorian who worked as a bounty hunter during the New Republic Era. With his Mandalorian armor and distinctive beskar helmet, Djarin was both well-equipped and enigmatica stranger whose past was shrouded in mystery to others. Orphaned during the Republic Era and raised as a foundling, he was trained to become a Mandalorian warrior and eventually joined the Tribe, who operated on Nevarro. Djarin became battle-hardened, a man of few words, and a formidable hunter in an increasingly dangerous galaxy.

After the fall of the Galactic Empire, Djarin made a reputation for himself as a member of the Bounty Hunters' Guild, collecting bounties as he traveled across the galaxy's Outer Rim Territoriesfar from the authority of the New Republicin his personal starship, the Razor Crest. Around 9 ABY, Djarin was hired on Nevarro by a client of an Imperial remnant faction, who offered a substantial reward for the acquisition of an asset located on the world Arvala-7. During his mission on Arvala-7, he met an Ugnaught named Kuiil, who guided him to the location of the asset. On his way to the asset, Djarin encountered a droid bounty hunter, IG-11, and the two entered the building in the encampment guarded by mercenaries where the asset was kept. Upon seeing the asset itself, they discovered that it was in fact a Force-sensitive child who belonged to the same species as Jedi Grand Master Yoda. Djarin, who was tasked with bringing the Child alive, shot IG-11, who was about to kill the Child, and saved the infant, taking him into his custody.

Discovering the Child's Force-sensitivity during his time on Arvala-7, Djarin then took the Child back to the Client and collected his reward. However, the Mandalorian warrior had already begun to form a bond with the infant. Feeling remorseful for subjecting the Child to a cruel fate, Djarin entered the facility where the Child was kept and rescued him from the Imperials stationed there, and later fended off Guild hunters with the help of the Tribe. The two would go on to embark on various adventures around the galaxy as they formed a close bond, including an encounter with former rebel shock trooper Carasynthia Dune, a job on Tatooine, and a run-in with a group of mercenaries.

Djarin was later contacted by the Guild's agent, Greef Karga, who wished to make amends for his actions during the Child's rescue. The Guild agent offered to work with the Mandalorian to drive away the Imperials, who took control over Nevarro's city, in exchange for dropping the bounty on the Child. Djarin then gathered his alliesDune, Kuiil, and a re-programmed IG-11and met with Karga on Nevarro. Djarin and his allies entered the city and fought the Imperials led by Moff Gideon, later retreating to the Tribe's covert after facing heavy opposition. The Mandalorian known as "The Armorer," who had remained in the hideout after the covert's attempted relocation, tasked Djarin with returning the Child to his people, and declared the creation of his clan. After dealing with Gideon and his remaining Imperials, Djarin departed the planet with the infant and began his search for the Child's people.

name: The Child
description:
"The Child" was a male Force-sensitive Mandalorian foundling that belonged to the same species as Jedi Grand Master Yoda and Jedi Master Yaddle. The Child was born around 41 BBY, and was held at an encampment run by Nikto mercenaries on Arvala-7 during the New Republic Era. While still an infant at the age of fifty years old, he was sought by an Imperial who hired a Mandalorian bounty hunter named Din Djarin to retrieve him.

However, Djarin chose not to leave the Child with the Imperials and saved him from the Imperial remnant facility. After attempting to hide with the Child along the fringes of the galaxy, Djarin returned to Nevarro to deal with the Imperials chasing the Child in hopes of keeping him safe. In the process, the Child became a Mandalorian foundling and the single other member of Djarin's newly created clan.

name: Aldanna
description: [[File:Battle_in_the_Hexus_system.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Aldanna's forces are attacked by the Valahari.]]Aldanna was an [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] in the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="Hero2" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="HotC date">{{FFCite|y=2014|8|22 BBY 1&ndash;2, ''The Second Battle of Geonosis''}} dates "[[Landing at Point Rain]]" to [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. Since ''[[Star Wars: The Ultimate Visual Guide: Updated and Expanded]]'' places the events of ''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Hero of the Confederacy]]'' prior to "Landing at Point Rain," it can be concluded that ''Hero of the Confederacy'' also takes place in 22 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|BBY]].</ref> the first [[Standard year/Legends|year]] of the war,<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> the people of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Valahari/Legends|Valahari]] joined the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], in response, established [[Blockade/Legends|blockades]] of neutral worlds that supplied military aid to the Confederacy. Aldanna was placed in charge of a blockade of the [[Hexus system]] and was given command of three [[Venator-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Venator''-class Star Destroyers]]. Soon, however, the Valahari, led by the [[Ace/Legends|ace]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Tofen Vane]], began attacking the Republic blockades, crushing all resistance.<ref name="Hero2" />When the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] learned that Vane's next target would be Aldanna's blockade, they sent [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] to help the Admiral withstand the attack. When Vane arrived, Skywalker [[Battle of the Hexus system|engaged]] him in a [[Starfighter combat/Legends|dogfight]] while Vane's [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]], [[Tofen's Raiders/Legends|Tofen's Raiders]], attacked Aldanna's forces. Vane managed to best Skywalker and shoot him down, but ultimately spared his life. Aldanna's [[Starship/Legends|ships]] received major damage, but the timely arrival of Republic reinforcements led by Admiral [[Wullf Yularen/Legends|Wullf Yularen]] forced the Valahari to retreat.<ref name="Hero2" />

name: Joodiel Amgris
description: Joodiel Amgris was a native of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Varonat]], located on the [[Ison Corridor]]<ref name="FC" /> in the [[Anoat sector/Legends|Anoat sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="TEA-OC">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> Amgris lived in [[Tropis-on-Varonat]], and around [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], a [[Krish (species)/Legends|Krish]] named [[Gamgalon]] arrived on the planet and began organizing safaris [[Hunting/Legends|hunting]] the [[Morodin/Legends|Morodin]], a [[Species/Legends|species]] of giant [[Diet/Legends|herbivores]], out of the settlement that boosted the local economy. In response, Amgris opened [[Great Jungle Outfitters]], a store that sold hunting gear exclusively to the individuals who participated in Gamgalon's hunting expeditions. Conveniently located by Tropis-on-Varonat's landing field next to a [[Hotel/Legends|hotel]], Amgris's equipment was always brand new and looked to be fresh-out-of-the-box when worn by the customers.<ref name="FC" />

name: Flesh Raider Ravager Chieftain
description: {{Quote|Kill Jeehd-ay!|The Flesh Raider Ravager Chieftain|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Flesh Raider]] with black [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] and grey skin with white stripes, the Ravager Chieftain commanded other Force-wielding Adepts in the [[Flesh Raider uprising]] on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]]<ref name="Enemy Force" /> in [[3643 BBY]].<ref name="Time" /> The [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Bengel Morr]], who was commanding the natives' invasion in order to destroy the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], gave the chieftain a [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]] and sent the group to an [[ancient shrine]] near the ruins of the temple [[Kaleth]] to learn from the device.<ref name="Enemy Force" />However, the Flesh Raider and Adepts were interrupted by the [[Hero of Tython|apprentice]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Orgus Din]], who had been sent to investigate activity in the area. The Jedi was astonished to hear the Flesh Raider speak, as the Order had believed the natives were not [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]]. The Ravager Chieftain then [[Telekinesis/Legends|blasted]] the Padawan with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], [[Skirmish at the ancient shrine|attacking the Jedi]] with the Adepts. However, the Chieftain and Adepts were [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the Padawan, and the holocron was recovered off of the Chieftain's corpse by Jedi Master [[Bela Kiwiiks]].<ref name="Enemy Force" />

name: Dias Athacorr
description: Dias Athacorr was a [[Arkanian/Legends|native]] of [[Arkania/Legends|Arkania]],<ref name="TAL" /> a snowy [[Planet/Legends|world]]<ref name="KOTOR 33">''[[Knights of the Old Republic 33: Vindication, Part 2]]''</ref> located in the [[Colonies/Legends|Colonies]].<ref name="EGtPM">''[[The Essential Guide to Planets and Moons]]''</ref> The Arkanian<ref name="CSWE" /> served the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] as an [[Republic officer/Legends|officer]] in the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] during the [[Mandalorian Wars]]. This war, between the Republic and the resurgent forces of the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]], began in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], where the [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorians]] made a three-pronged assault against the Republic in [[3963 BBY]]. In the aftermath of this assault, known by the Republic media as the "Onslaught," Athacorr received a promotion to the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Commander/Legends|commander]]. This promotion, reported in the [[The Admiral's List: Jimas Veltraa Memorial Edition|Jimas Veltraa Memorial Edition]] of ''[[The Admiral's List]]'', an official publication of the Republic Navy, occurred alongside that of notable officer [[Saul Karath]] to [[Rear Admiral/Legends|Rear Admiral]].<ref name="TAL" />

name: Bront Autin
description: Autin sent Kem Tija a message about the [[Iyra]] [[sentientologist]] [[Tem Eliss]] and the impending publication of his book ''[[The University of Sanbra Guide to Intelligent Life]]''. Autin recommended to Tija that Eliss be detained for questioning, and that the distribution of his manuscript be restricted. Eliss fled the [[University of Sanbra]] campus before being arrested.

name: Epoh Bahb
description: A [[Bith/Legends|Bith]], Epoh Bahb was a [[Musician/Legends|musician]] and a good friend of [[Epoh Trebor]]. By the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Bahb and Trebor had partnered with up-and-coming holo-actor [[Jasod Revoc]] to participate in a tour produced by [[HoloNet Entertainment]] under the banner of [[Jasod Revoc and his Galactic Revue]]. As they toured [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], the performers would hold concerts for the troops of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Each performance began and ended with Bahb's most popular piece, the "[[Appreciated Reminiscences]]".<ref>''[[Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away]]''</ref>

name: Baintorf
description: During [[16 ABY/Legends|16 ABY]], Baintorf held rank of [[General/Legends|General]], commanding the units responsible for [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant's]] [[Planetary shield/Legends|planetary shield]]. When the [[Yevetha]]n [[Aramadia-class thrustship|thrustship]] [[Aramadia (Aramadia-class)|''Aramadia'']] broke off negotiations with the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] and made an unauthorized launch to return to [[N'zoth]], [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Gial Ackbar]] ordered Baintorf to raise the planetary shield to prevent the ''Aramadia''{{'s}} passage and for the [[Nebula-class Star Destroyer|''Nebula''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Brilliant (Nebula-class)|''Brilliant'']] to shadow the ''Aramadia'' while it held position underneath the shield. When [[Nil Spaar]] protested that this was an illegal violation of his right of free passage, [[Leia Organa Solo]] ordered General Baintorf to lower the shield and to allow the ''Aramadia'' to escape.<ref name="Before the Storm" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Balliol
description: While being chased by an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]], the [[Corvette/Legends|corvette]] lost its way and was nearly captured by a [[Unidentified Imperial Star Destroyer|Star Destroyer]], but both ships were captured by a technologically advanced and [[extra-galactic]] [[Unidentified googly-eyed species|alien]] [[Fathership|craft]]. Balliol and other individuals present aboard the Rebel corvette were rendered unconscious and brought aboard the alien craft by [[alien droid]]s. There, the aliens celebrated a festival by pitting them against members of the Star Destroyer's crew in a series of competitions. Balliol and the Rebels bested the Imperials, receiving plaudits from the aliens. Shortly before leaving for their own galaxy, the aliens rewarded the Rebels with the Star Destroyer and declared the losers to be [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] of the Rebels.

name: Clayton Balrog
description: Clayton Balrog served in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] [[Stormtrooper Corps/Legends|Stormtrooper Corps]] as a [[Zero-G assault stormtrooper]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], holding the rank of [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]]. Balrog commanded [[Spacetrooper Platoon 243-XT]], which was based off a [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]]. At some point, Balrog briefed the [[Platoon/Legends|platoon]] on a mission to capture the ''[[GrimDeath I]]'', a converted [[Victory-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Victory''-class Star Destroyer]] crewed by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and suspected to be in league with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. The ''GrimDeath I'' had conducted a series of raids throughout the [[Woldona system]] before heading to [[Galpos II/Legends|Galpos II]]. Originally, the plan had been to stand off and track the ''GrimDeath I'' while waiting for support from the [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']] and ''[[Terminator]]'' but [[Imperial High Command/Legends|Imperial High Command]] decided that they could not allow the pirates the opportunity to escape.<ref name="Briefing" />Balrog outlined the new plan to the platoon; their Star Destroyer was to create a diversion while the platoon's [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] coasted in under cover of the ''GrimDeath I''{{'s}} engine noise. The objective was to capture the [[Starship/Legends|starship]] along with some command personnel for interrogation, which would be achieved by disabling the engines and then breaching the ship in two different positions; [[Strike Force One]] through the lower hull, and [[Strike Force Two]] through the bridge.<ref name="Briefing" />

name: Beramsh
description: In [[12,293 BBY]], Dr. Beramsh led an expedition from [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] to Tandun III. Beramsh supervised the exploration of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] and found massive ancient population centers the [[Doctor/Legends|doctor]] theorized were constructed by the [[Rakata]]. Though Dr. Beramsh's survey had proven that Tandun III was suitable for colonization, it was never colonized before its destruction in [[43 ABY]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Vob Bitas
description: {{Quote|Bitas had bet a fortune, so the tainted blob saved me over a million credits.|Slish Fondine|url=http://www.holonetnews.com/48/sports/13321_1.html}}Vob Bitas was an individual who lived during the final [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], and the owner of an [[Umgullian blob]] named [[Blob 14]]. In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Bitas entered Blob 14 in the third [[Blob racing|blob race]] at the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Umgul/Legends|Umgul's]] [[Fondine Blob Raceways]]. Blob 14 was not expected to win, but Bitas introduced prohibited viscosity-enhancing substances into the creature's system, an offense that was punishable by [[Death/Legends|death]]. Bitas then [[Gambling/Legends|bet]] over one million [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] on Blob 14, who defied expected odds and won the race. The [[Umgullian Racing Commission]] immediately investigated the unlikely victory, and when the banned substances were discovered two [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] later, Bitas was taken into custody and executed.<ref name="HoloNet News" />[[Slish Fondine]], the owner of the raceways, used Bitas's winnings to recuperate financial losses incurred by the scandal. As Bitas was the fourth cheater caught at the raceways that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], Fondine considered deterring further fraud by instituting a harsher penalty than death. Bitas's victory and execution were soon thereafter reported on by [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]].<ref name="HoloNet News" />

name: Blake
description: Blake was a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] who was present at the Alliance's secret [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]] on [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]].<ref name="Gamer 46" /> When the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] discovered Echo Base after one of their [[Viper probe droid/Legends|Viper probe droids]] landed on Hoth, they launched a [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|full-scale assault]] against the Rebels. The Rebels decided to flee,<ref name="ESB">[[Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back|''Star Wars'': Episode V ''The Empire Strikes Back'']]</ref> and Blake was present in Echo Base's south [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] when [[Quantum Storm/Legends|the first]] of the Alliance's [[GR-75 medium transport/Legends|evacuation transports]] safely escaped the [[Hoth system/Legends|system]]. Though the Alliance was able to successfully evacuate Echo Base, they suffered many casualties and the battle was viewed as a significant victory for the Empire. Nevertheless, Blake believed that the battle was the Alliance's finest hour and that it proved that the spirit of the Rebel Alliance could never truly be broken by a military power.<ref name="Gamer 46" />The Alliance went on to win a major victory against the Empire in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]] at the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]<ref name="RotJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref> and soon after reformed itself into the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'', p. 131</ref> Blake served the New Republic as a [[General/Legends|general]] and used the experiences at Hoth to train [[Officer/Legends|officer]] [[Cadet/Legends|cadets]] in combat. Blake put the cadets through a three-part simulation of the Battle of Hoth, splitting them up into two teams that each took on the role of either the Alliance's General [[Carlist Rieekan/Legends|Carlist Rieekan]] or the Empire's General [[Maximilian Veers]], and pitting them against each other to gain control of Echo Base. Blake hoped that the simulation would give the cadets a better understanding of Alliance's victory at Hoth,<ref name="Gamer 46" /> and that they would pass on the lessons they learned.<ref name="Gamer 52">{{GamerCite|6|The Battle of Hoth (game)|The Battle of Hoth}}, p. 52</ref>

name: Boofer
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Boofer was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Boofer remained at the Temple and participated in the [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]]. Administrated by Master [[Ilena Xan]], Boofer faced off against fellow Initiate [[Horororibb]] .<ref name="YDR" />

name: Bogeega Bu'Daay
description: {{Dialogue|Boorka|&laquo;Keep in touch, Bogeega.&raquo;|Bu'Daay|&laquo;I will&hellip; wait, there is movement up ahead.&raquo;|Wookiee|[Wookiee roar interrupts transmission]|Bu'Daay|&laquo;I am&hellip; discovered.&raquo;|attr=A Wookiee interrupts Boorka and Bu'Daay's transmission|src=Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds: Clone Campaigns}}Bogeega Bu'Daay served as an operative for the [[Hutt Cartel]], a criminal organization run by the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Species/Legends|species]], around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Bu'Daay [[Spy/Legends|spied]] on Republic weapons research on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Eredenn Prime]], where [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiees]], a Republic member species, were testing and building [[Superweapon/Legends|superweapons]] called [[Decimator (war machine)|Decimators]]. After gaining enough information on the Decimator, such as its [[Deflector shield/Legends|shielding]] and firepower capabilities, Bu'Daay contacted a Hutt cartel leader, [[Boorka]], and gave [[Sexes/Legends|him]] the information about the superweapon, assuring the Hutt that he could find use for the intelligence. Boorka told Bu'Daay to update him with any further information, but the Wookiees, who had found Bu'Daay, interrupted the transmission. Boorka, nonetheless, later used the information to make a deal with [[General/Legends|General]] [[Sev'rance Tann]] of the Confederacy, greatly profiting the Hutt and leading to the Separatists gaining control of the Decimators and using them [[Hunt for the Decimator|against]] the Republic.<ref name="GB:CC" />

name: Candabrine Bu
description: Candabrine Bu served as the [[Senator/Legends|senator]] of [[Lansono]],<ref name="HNN" /> a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] located in the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]],<ref name="EAOC">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> representing the world in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] by [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]].<ref name="HNN" /> At that [[Time/Legends|time]], in the midst of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], the Senate was debating the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]], a piece of legislation that, if passed, would authorize the creation of an [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Army of the Republic]].<ref name="MCA">{{Hnn|46|news/1337_1.html|Palpatine Sets Army Vote Date|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728124227/http://www.holonetnews.com/46/news/1337_1.html}}</ref> As a [[Militarist/Legends|pro-military]] senator, Bu was among the supporters of the Act.<ref name="HNN" />On [[Great ReSynchronization|13:5:16]]&mdash;the date upon which the Military Creation Act was to be brought before the Senate for a vote<ref name="MCA" />&mdash;Bu and other proponents of the bill were prepared to cast their ballots when word reached the Senate of an [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|assassination attempt]] on Senator [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]], a vehement opponent of the Act. Amidala was believed [[Death/Legends|dead]] in the attack, and, to allow for a period of mourning for the senator's passing, [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] delayed the vote on the Act until the following [[Standard day/Legends|day]]. Amidala was very much alive, however; though [[Sexes/Legends|her]] sudden appearance before her peers in the midst of the Chancellor's makeshift eulogy served to dispel any rumors of her death, it did nothing to alter Palpatine's decision to postpone the vote. This move angered a number of pro-military senators, Bu included.<ref name="HNN" />Following the conclusion of the session, the Lansono senator spoke to [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]], conveying the militarists' frustration over the day's events and accusing the Chancellor of exploiting the [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] attempt on Amidala to derail the Act.<ref name="HNN" /> Ultimately, the Senate never voted on the Act, but Bu and the other pro-military senators got what they wanted&mdash;when word reached the Republic that the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] was preparing for [[Clone Wars/Legends|war]], the Senate granted Palpatine emergency powers, which he used to create a Grand [[Army/Legends|Army]] of the Republic to counter the Separatist threat.<ref name="AOTC">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>

name: Camur
description: In [[3641 BBY]], Camur served as a [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]] during the [[Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]]. During a [[Battle of Kalandis Seven|battle]] on the desolate [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kalandis Seven]], Camur was part of [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Shanra Immel]]'s [[Shanra Immel's squad|squad]] and served with [[Republic Special Forces Division|SpecForce]] [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Jace Malcom]]. During the battle, the [[Squad/Legends|squad]] was tasked with the destruction of the local [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]&ndash;controlled [[Kalandis Seven's spaceport|spaceport]]. Along the way to the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] they were attacked and [[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] [[Amden vor Keioidian]], a fellow member of Camur's squad, was [[Death/Legends|fatally]] wounded. Camur's sergeant, Immel, activated Keioidian's [[med tracer]] before leaving him behind.<ref name="TLBoCJM" />Three [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] later, Camur and the squad reached their objective and checked in with Immel before proceeding with their mission. Malcom attempted to capture the Sith [[Planetary command ship]] that recently landed, while Camur and the squad started planting their [[targeting beacon]]s, which would allow their [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] to destroy the spaceport regardless of the [[Water/Legends|fog]]. Shortly after, Malcom failed to capture the [[Command ship/Legends|command]] [[Unidentified planetary command ship|ship]] and the spaceport was destroyed by Republic fighters.<ref name="TLBoCJM" />

name: Nygreena Clo
description: Discovered near birth to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and raised at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], Clo trained at the [[Jedi academy|academy]] there and learned the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduating]] and studying as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Clo passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] and was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|recognized]] as a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="HNN" />Just prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Clo was dispatched to [[Kabal/Legends|Kabal]] with fellow Knights [[Ixian Rovieda]], [[Plessus Ghon]], and the Padawan [[Renxis Dielle]] to end the month-long riots in the capital city of [[Shoribus]]. The riots begun due to planet-wide food shortages, and were only ended when the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] dropped parcels of rations and other food stuff within the city. The riots claimed many lives, including that of [[Premiere (Kabal)|Premiere]] [[Jan Dovu]]; holo-footage of several robed bodies were transmitted over the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] and the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] confirmed that Clo and the other Jedi were indeed dead.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Clu
description: Clu was captured, along with fellow Savrips [[Taf]] and [[Mev (Savrip)|Mev]], by a [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver known as [[Phylus Mon|The Mon]]. The Savrips were sent to The Mon's slave [[Zoo/Legends|zoo]] aboard the ''[[Animiasma]]'' and jailed in the same cell. Still unbroken, the Savrips would rather find and hurt the Mon more than escape.Although unwilling to communicate to anyone outside the cells, the Savrips noticed four [[Tarasin]] children imprisoned in another cell, [[Li'Iri]], [[Honna]], [[Tiscak]] and [[Kaj]]. Honna spoke with the Savrips and understood their language using her own [[The Force/Legends|Force]] abilities. The Savrips, feeling sorry for the children, promised to protect them: Should anyone try to take the children against their wills, the Savrips would defy the energy bars of their cell to stop the evil-doers. Honna was glad that it did not happen, because the energy bars could have easily wounded or [[Death/Legends|killed]] the Savrips.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion blaster/Legends|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Kaloor Cofi
description: Kaloor Cofi was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and later made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Active during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], a growing division between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Cofi accepted missions on behalf of the High Council which took the Jedi across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. One such mission began when the High Council was contacted by the [[Gotal/Legends|Gotal]] representative, Emissary [[Nathanjo Nirrelz]] of [[Antar 4/Legends|Antar 4]]. Reporting to Coruscant that the terrorist group known as the [[Roshu Sune/Legends|Roshu Sune]] had [[Gotal hostage standoff|taken hostages]] during a [[Battle of Antar 4|battle]] on the planet, Nirrelz begged the Jedi to intervene.<ref name="Hnn53" />Cofi was dispatched as part of a six-member Jedi task force to the Gotal colony world [[Atzerri/Legends|Atzerri]], under the leadership of fellow Jedi Knight, [[Sarrissa Jeng]]. Once there, Kofi and the team of [[Jedi Diplomat|diplomats]] were to negotiate the release of Nirrelz. During the negotiations, a group of unaffiliated vigilantes opened fire on the Roshu Shone guerrillas. This attack panicked the Gotal separatists, who opened fire on their captives. Leaping to defend the unarmed hostages, the Jedi managed to subdue the guerrillas on their [[commuter hopper]], but not before Cofi and [[Antyard-Wo Shissan]] lost their lives. Survived by his colleagues, including Jeng and [[Kerrshnek]], Cofi's body was transported to the [[Jedi chapter house (Aleen Minor)|Order's chapter house]] on [[Aleen Minor/Legends|Aleen Minor]] for the [[Jedi funeral/Legends|cremating]]. Meanwhile, across the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] network, the Jedi were heavily criticized by [[Gotal Foreign Affairs Commune]] leader [[Shagrad Loset]] for what he saw as meddling in an internal affair. Rebuffing this assault on the Order, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and High Council member [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]] commended the Jedi effort on Atzerri.<ref name="Hnn53" />

name: Dursa Conegan
description: At some point during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Conegan received a report from [[General/Legends|General]] [[Crix Madine/Legends|Crix Madine]]. The report briefed the colonel on [[Operation Death-Hunter]], a secret Imperial project based in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. Madine had contacted Conegan because one of his [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core World]] spies had filed a report that a large order of [[Tech 4 PDV]]s with connections to the Death-Hunter project was being sent to the [[Jaemus shipyards]]. Madine wished for Conegan to assemble a team to investigate the shipyards and pinpoint the location of the project.However, Madine clarified the report by explaining that the source of the information, the [[Spy/Legends|spy]] known as "[[Tigress]]", had broken off contact with [[Alliance Intelligence]] for a time before re-establishing contact. The troubling thing was that after this incident, the accuracy of the spy's reports dropped by 20%. Due to this, Madine warned Conegan that the Death-Hunter project might just be a ruse by a double agent. The truth of the Imperial project was eventually revealed by Conegan's team.{{Char-stub}}

name: Cuthallox
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Cuthallox lived on [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]], the home of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during its early years. Apprenticed to the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Blendri]], Cuthallox and Blendri became enamored with the enigmatic teachings of [[Xendor]], who preached that the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] was too restrictive in their teachings and wished to limit understanding of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. When Xendor parted with the Order to found an [[Legionnaire Academy|academy]] on [[Lettow/Legends|Lettow]], Cuthallox and Blendri departed with [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Jook-jook H'broozin]] to learn from Xendor. Calling themselves the [[Legions of Lettow]], the Jedi Renunciates grew strong in the Force as they studied the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|Bogan]] through many different Force-traditions.<ref name="JvS" />When the High Council declared war on the Legions of Lettow, Cuthallox and Blendri took up [[Force-imbued blade|swords]] to protect their right to study the Force. Meeting the Order in a full-blown conflict called the [[First Great Schism|Great Schism]] by the Order, the Master-[[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] pair jumped from world to world to fight off the Jedi. At the [[Battle of Corulag|battle]] of [[Corulag/Legends|Corulag]] Jedi Padawan [[Danzigorro Potts]] killed Master H'broozin and attempted to kill Cuthallox and Blendri but the pair managed to escape. Padawan Potts would continue to hunt the pair throughout the war until he finally met them on the field of [[Battle of Columus|battle]] at [[Columus/Legends|Columus]]. Engaging Potts, Cuthallox was outmatched and killed.<ref name="JvS" />

name: Danyawarra
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Danyawarra began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] under the tenets of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduating]] from the Order's [[Jedi academy|academy]], Danyawarra was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] learner by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ludwin Katarkus]].<ref name="HNN45" />In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] assigned Master Katarkus to mediate the ongoing [[Virgillian Civil War]] between the [[Virgillian Free Alignment/Legends|Virgillian Free Alignment]] and the [[Aristocracy]]. Consisting of two Master-Padawan teams, the diplomatic envoy was made up of Katarkus and Danyawarra, and Master [[Everen Ettene]] and [[Halagad Ventor]]. As the [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] carrying the Jedi envoy entered [[Virgillia 7]]'s orbit and touched down on the [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] surface, it was attacked by terrorists and destroyed. After receiving no word from the diplomatic team for three months, the High Council announced that it presumed the Jedi dead and would be holding [[Jedi funeral/Legends|memorial services]] for them within the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s walls.<ref name="HNN45" />While the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] overshadowed this loss, both Danyawarra and Ventor did reappear and rejoin the Order, serving as [[Jedi Commander/Legends|commander]] and [[Jedi General/Legends|general]] respectively in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="HNN45" /> As a commander, Danyawarra was placed in command of the [[101st Regiment]], commanding well over 2,000 soldiers.<ref>{{InsiderCite|84|Guide to the Grand Army of the Republic}}</ref>

name: Dayn
description: Both Dayn and Nira had been serving Hudorra for some time when [[Dass Jennir]], [[Beyghor Sahdett]], and the crew of the ''[[Uhumele]]'' arrived at the casino in search of him.After Sahdett's [[Duel on Kestavel|betrayal]], the two Bith helped clean up the bodies and debris. When Hudorra tried to force his remaining staff to flee in advance of the upcoming [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] attack, Dayn, along with Nira, [[Bryti]], [[Kal (bodyguard)|Kal]], and [[Shaylai Veila]], reaffirmed their loyalty to the Jedi Master, refusing to abandon him. The pair would later prepare a final feast, as there would be little use for the food assuming the casino's destruction in the upcoming attack. The pair would sit between Veila and [[Bomo Greenbark]] during the meal itself, where the [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] told everyone that only he and Jennir would be staying.Later, as [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and his [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] marched across the bridge to the casino, Dayn was already aboard the ''Uhumele''. Both Dayn and Nira would be witness to Hudorra's final message, recorded on a [[holodisc]] given to Jennir by Bryti, wishing that [[May the Force be with you/Legends|the Force be with them]].

name: Dobi Deene
description: Dobi Deene was a [[Jizz/Legends|jizz]]<ref name="ST">{{SW|url=news/slugthrowers-an-overview-of-popular-music-and-musicians-in-a-galaxy-far-far-away-part-1|text=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away, Part 1|int=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away|archivedate=20180311051325}}</ref> [[Musician/Legends|musician]] whose [[Music/Legends|music]] was popular during the onset of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. At one point in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="HNN">{{Hnn|53||Top-Selling Sound Slugs|https://web.archive.org/web/20130909032307/http://www.holonetnews.com:80/53/}}</ref> the musician's unabashedly infectious song ''[[Wroonian Tramp]]'' topped out<ref name="ST" /> as the third best selling [[sound slug]]&mdash;a method of storing music&mdash;placing below only ''[[11011101 2]]'' by [[Plexo-33/Legends|Plexo-33]] and ''[[Stardance]]'' by [[Miracle Meriko]]. Deene's track did beat the songs ''[[Stark Memory]]'' by [[Lord Kavad and the Skaalite Orchestra]] and ''[[Does Anyone Weep?]]'' by [[Maxa Jandovar]] in terms of sales, which placed fourth and fifth respectively in the charts. Deene's chart position was reported in the [[HoloNet News Vol. 531 53|fifty-third]] issue of the [[HoloNet News Vol. 531|five hundred and thirty-first volume]] of the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] [[HoloNet News CoCo District Edition|CoCo District Edition]].<ref name="HNN" />

name: Imar Deez
description: [[File:Relin-Crosscurrent.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Relin Druur, who learned the shielding technique from Deez]]Imar Deez was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] being who lived during the [[Time/Legends|time]] prior to the outbreak of the [[Great Hyperspace War]] in [[5000 BBY/Legends|5000 BBY]]. As a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Deez [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and also taught the [[Human/Legends|Human]] Jedi [[Relin Druur]] sometime before 5,000 BBY. As one of the first [[Force power/Legends|techniques]] that Druur learned as a Jedi, Deez taught him how to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Force resistance|shield himself]] from the effects of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] by imagining in his mind an impenetrable fortress, of which the walls were the Force and he was the keep.<ref name="CC" />Druur eventually became a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], and he passed on the lesson that he had learned from Deez to his own [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Drev Hassin]]. Later, after [[Skirmish over Phaegon III|accidentally]] [[Time travel/Legends|traveling through time]] to [[41 ABY]], Druur recalled learning the power from Deez as he taught it to the [[Cerean/Legends|Cerean]] [[Marr Idi-Shael]], so that Idi-Shael could resist the nauseating effects of [[Lignan]], a powerful dark side [[Ore/Legends|ore]].<ref name="CC" />

name: Ivixa Delbaeth
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Ivixa Delbaeth was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] after years of dedicated study and service. Following the foundations laid by Master [[Morrit Ch'gally]], Master Delbaeth and fellow Master [[Fin-So-Rowan]] saw Master Ch'gally's dream of a massive [[praxeum ship]] come to fruition. Dubbed the ''[[Chu'unthor]]'', the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] approved construction of the ship circa [[500 BBY]].Believing that the Jedi had become too stagnant on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Delbaeth and Rowan led the inaugural class of the ''Chu'unthor'' across the Republic, educating their students in the ways of the Jedi and [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. While results from the mobile academy were exceptional, the High Council did not seek to build additional ships to replace smaller ships lost in the past. Despite producing evidence that not as many [[Jedi Initiate]]s were being brought into the Order, Delbaeth and Rowan were unhappy with the Council's decision.<ref name="POTJ" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Dembaline
description: Dembaline was a member of the [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] [[Species/Legends|species]],<ref name="vp" /> [[Amphibian/Legends|amphibious]] [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoids]] native to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dac]].<ref name="tegtas">''[[The New Essential Guide to Alien Species]]''</ref> Dembaline became a [[Musician/Legends|composer]] at some point prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] and produced a number of works that were notable in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], one of the more prominent being the [[Music/Legends|song]] "[[Shwock Dubllon]],"<ref name="vp" /> a [[Time/Legends|timeless]] masterpiece that served as most species' first exposure to Mon Calamari diaspora and which was considered one of Dac's most significant contributions to [[Galaxy/Legends|galactic]] culture.<ref name="Slugthrowers">{{SW|url=news/slugthrowers-an-overview-of-popular-music-and-musicians-in-a-galaxy-far-far-away-part-1|text=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away, Part 1|int=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away|archivedate=20180311051325}}</ref> Translated into [[Galactic Basic Standard]], "Shwock Dubllon" meant "Crested Wake," and it was known as a rousing, dramatic piece.<ref name="vp" />Around [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], the musician [[Gaeriel Capens]] released<ref name="hnn531">{{Hnn|56|business/13516_4.html|Balmorran Secures Musician Rearmament Contract|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728120559/http://www.holonetnews.com/56/business/13516_4.html}}</ref> to renewed acclaim<ref name="Slugthrowers" /> a remix of "Shwock Dubllon," which the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] agency later revealed to have been produced with the aid of [[RetSpan Audionics]] [[TribBot mimic series|TribBot mimic droids]].<ref name="hnn531" /> Dembaline's music remained popular following the Clone Wars and into the period of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] in [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]]. A [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]] dedicated to tracking down [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], known as the [[Kyp's Dozen|Dozen-and-Two Avengers]] and led by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Kyp Durron]],<ref name="vp" /> adopted "Shwock Dubllon" as its unofficial theme song.<ref name="cswe">{{CSWECite|I|182|Dembaline}}</ref>

name: Denov
description: {{Quote|Just give me the information I asked for, Denov.|Fett asks Denov for information on the ''Reverie''|Star Wars Adventures: Boba Fett and the Ship of Fear}}Denov was a [[Snivvian/Legends|Snivvian]] who worked as a member of the [[Bounty Hunters' Guild/Legends|Bounty Hunters' Guild]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] between the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. While serving the Guild, Denov also secretly worked for the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] as a mole, providing [[Sexes/Legends|him]] with information on the Guild. In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], Fett contacted Denov via [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]] after ambushing the bounty hunting brothers [[Edo Strom|Edo]] and [[Rolu Strom]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dolva Prime]]. The Mandalorian had taken a fake copy of the artifact known as the [[Arachedron sculpture]] from the two and discovered a [[Hologram/Legends|hologram]] inside showing the location of the true sculpture to be aboard a [[Luxury liner/Legends|luxury liner]] [[Starship/Legends|starship]] named the ''[[Reverie]]'', which he needed Denov to locate.<ref name="BFatSoF" />Fett later contacted Denov via hologram while [[Pilot/Legends|piloting]] his [[Firespray-31-class patrol and attack craft/Legends|ship]], [[Slave I/Legends|''Slave I'']], and asked for an update on the missing ''Reverie''. Denov claimed to have found it but then informed Fett of four new [[Bounty/Legends|bounties]] that the Guild had yet to post, allowing the Mandalorian a head start on them. Uninterested, Fett asked for information on the ''Reverie'', which Denov reluctantly provided, detailing the ship's history as a luxury [[Cruiser/Legends|cruiser]] followed by its destruction due to cut costs concerning [[Engineer/Legends|engineering]]. The Snivvian then told Fett that the ship was currently located in a [[ship graveyard]] located at the edge of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], where it was unlikely he would find it without having to face off against [[Scavenger/Legends|junkers]] and scrap [[Merchant/Legends|merchants]], if at all. Unperturbed, Fett made his way to the graveyard after refusing to reveal to Denov what he was looking for in the ship.<ref name="BFatSoF" />The mole then used old concept designs of the ship to try and guide Fett through the ''Reverie'' to its vault; however, the Mandalorian was attacked by many small [[Arachedron]]s en route and then captured by the Strom brothers. The brothers tied Fett up and then explained they too had a mole in the Guild who had helped them find the ''Reverie'', at which point Denov denied being the brothers' mole before they switched off Fett's [[Comm unit/Legends|communication device]]. Denov did not contact Fett again throughout the rest of his mission, which ended with the Mandalorian abandoning the sculpture, as it was too risky to escape with.<ref name="BFatSoF" />

name: Renxis Dielle
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Renxis Dielle was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] which plagued the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]]. Just prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Padawan Dielle was dispatched to [[Kabal/Legends|Kabal]] with fellow Knights [[Ixian Rovieda]], [[Plessus Ghon]], and [[Nygreena Clo]] to end the month-long riots in the capital city of [[Shoribus]]. The riots begun due to planet-wide food shortages, and were only ended when the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] dropped parcels of rations and other food stuff within the city. The riots claimed many lives, including that of [[Premiere]] [[Jan Dovu]]; holo-footage of several robed bodies were transmitted over the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] and the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] confirmed that Dielle and the other Jedi were indeed dead.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Domino
description: Domino was a [[Senator/Legends|senator]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] and planned to assassinate all the other members of the senate and bring about a revolution. Under the alias of "Domino", over the course of a few months, the senator hired a number of criminals and kidnappers, who were operating in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. They were organized into a number of different cells and Domino tasked them with planning the assassinations of hundreds of different senators who were going to be away from [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] on a particular date.The senator's aide began to suspect that the senator was having dealings with Domino, not realizing that they were the same person. The aide told this to a group of agents who working for the [[Senate Guard/Legends|Senate Guard]] [[Bail Falcris]] and the agents began investigating the senator. Domino responded by recalling Falcris and placing bureaucratic obstacles in the way of the investigation.A [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]] who worked for Domino contacted the agents and from a [[computer core]] that the Sullustan possessed, the agents learned about the assassination plans. They went to warn the senator about them, but soon worked out that the senator was Domino. The senator then informed the agents that a [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]] was going to attack the [[Senate Hall]] on Coruscant during a Senate meeting, while revolutionary forces would rise up and kill any senators that survived.

name: Dono (Squib)
description: [[File:VeryGenericTransport-SH.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Dono served aboard the Imperial Armored Transport ''Elusive''.]]Although the crew of the [[Imperial Armored Transport]] [[Elusive (transport)|''Elusive'']] considered the [[Squib/Legends|Squib]] Dono to be a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]], the [[Squib Reclamation Fleet]] viewed Dono as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]]. Dono lived and worked aboard the ''Elusive'', which afforded the Squib the opportunity to transmit the [[Starship/Legends|vessel's]] coordinates to the ''[[Thrifty]]'', the Squib [[Momship]]<ref name="SH 8" /> and [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] of the [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]].<ref name="SH 6">''[[Scavenger Hunt]]'', p. 6.</ref> This allowed the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Scavenger/Legends|scavengers]] to collect the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] ship's garbage,<ref name="SH 8" /> which it jettisoned prior to each [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] jump per Imperial procedure.<ref name="SH 19">''[[Scavenger Hunt]]'', p. 19.</ref> Dono kept these transmissions secret by sending them via a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]]-band signal and by using a [[Language/Legends|language]] known as [[Old High Squibbian]].<ref name="SH 8" />At some point between [[0 ABY/Legends|0]] and [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]],<ref name="date">''[[Scavenger Hunt]]'' takes place at an unspecified point after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|destruction]] of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]], which occurs in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], according to ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'', p. 110; and before the assignment of [[Carlist Rieekan/Legends|Carlist Rieekan]] to [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]], which occurs in [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], according to ''The New Essential Chronology'', p. 117.</ref> Dono was aboard the ''Elusive'' in the [[Dankayo system]], where the ship's Imperial crew was [[Battle of Dankayo|attacked]] by a [[Lambda-class T-4a shuttle/Legends|''Lambda''-class shuttle]] operated by a group of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] [[operative]]s.<ref>''[[Scavenger Hunt]]'', pp. 5&ndash;6.</ref> As the ''Elusive'' dumped its refuse into [[Realspace/Legends|space]] and jumped to [[Lightspeed/Legends|lightspeed]], Dono dutifully transmitted the coordinates for its next destination to the Squib fleet so that they could reclaim its garbage there.<ref name="SH 8" />

name: Draci
description: {{Quote|There is a civil war going on, if you hadn't noticed. Supplies and equipment are going to be in short supply for the civilian population. The Darklighters saw this coming and have been accumulating a cache of supplies to help get though these times.|Draci|Star Wars Galaxies}}Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Draci served as the guard for the [[Darklighter family]]'s [[Darklighter cache|cache]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. The cache was a [[Cave/Legends|cave]] used as a storage area, close to the [[Darklighter estate]]. In anticipation of supply shortages due to the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], the Darklighter's relied on the cache to help get themselves through hard times.<ref name="AED" />However, circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> a criminal gang known as the [[Desert Demons]] blew their way into the cache, and Draci was powerless to stop them. To root out the criminals, Draci entrusted [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]]s with securing the cache. Draci estimated that the spacers had only about fifteen [[Standard minute/Legends|minutes]] to eliminate the criminals before everything of value was looted. The spacers who were looking for a cargo smuggled from [[Tansarii Point Station]] assaulted the cave. They eliminated many Desert Demons and accessed the inventory terminals they were looking for.<ref name="AED" />

name: Hervey Douglas
description: Douglas was based inside the [[Imperial Data Processing Facility]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tazan]] and along with the clerk [[Mir Vladick]], the Human was responsible for ensuring the orderly running of the facility's contingent of [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]. Sometime after the [[Destruction of Alderaan|destruction]] of the planet [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], the child [[Jastina Clines]] was imprisoned inside the Data Processing Facilty and Douglas and Vir took pity on her, so they smuggled some toys and [[Book/Legends|books]] into her cell, to keep her happy. A short time later, a team of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] agents [[Mission to Tazan|infiltrated]] the base and encountered Douglas and Vir, and the two clerks attempted to press an alarm button.{{Char-stub}}

name: Durnar
