description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] being, Durnar was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Attaining the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Durnar survived until the final year of war when he was dispatched to the [[Siege of Saleucami/Legends|front lines]] of [[Saleucami/Legends|Saleucami]] under the command of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Oppo Rancisis/Legends|Oppo Rancisis]].<ref name="R76" />During the fighting there, Durnar was killed in the fighting with the [[Morgukai Shadow Army]]. During the [[Funeral of Oppo Rancisis|funeral]] of Master Rancisis, fellow Jedi [[Sian Jeisel]] mourned her fallen comrade, along with the others who had died on the battle field.<ref name="R76" />

name: Eckerd
description: {{Quote|They were good soldiers. Far better than any of the others I've had under my command.|Sergeant Rusk|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]] during the [[Great Galactic War]] with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]],<ref name="Bad Intel" /> Eckerd<ref name="Vanished">{{TORcite|type=conversation|Sergeant Rusk|Vanished}}</ref> served in a [[Surgeons|squad]] under the [[Commander/Legends|command]] of the [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Fideltin Rusk]], and its first [[Attack on an Imperial outpost|mission]] was to free several [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]]-of-war from an [[Imperial outpost (prison camp)|Imperial outpost]]. However, intelligence on the mission was incorrect, forcing the [[Squad/Legends|squad]] to fight through more enemy forces than it expected. Despite its disadvantage, the squad was able to rescue all of the prisoners and escape with heavy injuries, without a single [[Death/Legends|fatality]].<ref name="Bad Intel" /> In the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] following that mission, Eckerd was among the squad members who were recruited into the [[Republic Special Forces Division]]'s [[Special Forces black ops program|black ops program]], and the squad&mdash;which included fellow veterans [[Karsim]] and [[Naja]]&mdash;was tasked with the [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] of Imperial leaders by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Elin Garza]]. The squad, which became known as the "Surgeons," soon began to go after its targets' families. Eckerd and the others were arrested by the Republic for war crimes and [[Prison/Legends|imprisoned]] in a [[Berrun detention center|detention center]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Berrun]] with life sentences.<ref name="The Surgeons" />

name: Anwis Eddicus
description: [[File:Eddicus-class_planetary_shuttle.jpg|thumb|right|220px|The ''Eddicus''-class planetary shuttle was named for Supreme Chancellor Eddicus.]]Living approximately [[700 BBY|seven hundred]] [[Standard year/Legends|years]] before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]],<ref name="Time">Anwis Eddicus is said to have been instrumental in ending the Death Seed plague which, according to ''[[Planet of Twilight]]'', took place c. 700 BBY.</ref> Anwis Eddicus served as [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="HNN" /> During this [[Time/Legends|time]], a pandemic known as the [[Death Seed]] [[plague]] struck [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], [[Death/Legends|killing]] millions of beings. The outbreak ended when the parasitic [[droch]]s responsible for the plague were quarantined on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Nam Chorios/Legends|Nam Chorios]]. Supreme Chancellor Eddicus played a role in bringing the pandemic to an end.<ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref>Eddicus was honored on occasion during the final years of the Republic. [[Kuat Systems Engineering/Legends|Kuat Systems Engineering's]] [[Eddicus-class planetary shuttle|''Eddicus''-class planetary shuttle]], developed in the decades before the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], was named for the celebrated Chancellor.<ref name="Databank">{{DB|vehicle|valorumshuttle|shuttle, Chancellor Valorum's|archivedate=20100202191712}}</ref> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], [[Biscuit Baron]], a chain of restaurants owned by the [[Tagge Company]], launched a [[Standard month/Legends|month]]-long promotion known as "[[Heroes of the Republic (campaign)|Heroes of the Republic]]" to highlight some of the Republic's more notable historical figures; [[Holocube/Legends|holocubes]] depicting these beings were included in bundles of Biscuit Baron's [[QuickSnack]] and [[QuickSnackLite]] foods. Eddicus was among those honored by the campaign.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Kime Enanrum
description: [[File:JarJarIce.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Represantive Jar Jar Binks, after destroying Enanrum's ice statue]]Kime Enanrum was a famous [[Artist/Legends|sculptor]] who worked during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|I|235|Enanrum, Kime}}</ref> At the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] in [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], Enanrum sculptured an elaborate statue from [[Water/Legends|ice]], which was displayed at a gala fundraiser taking place in [[Jrade Plaza]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant's]] posh [[Jrade District/Legends|Jrade District]]. Unfortunately for the statue, [[Associate Planetary Representative|Representative]] [[Jar Jar Binks/Legends|Jar Jar Binks]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] was invited to the gala. Binks, who was infamous for his clumsiness, managed to accidentally tuck the tablecloth upon which the statue rested into his cummerbund. At the same time, he attempted to catch tumbling [[canapé]]s he had knocked from a nearby [[Waiter/Legends|waiter]], and, as a result, the [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] [[Congressman|Representative]] pulled down the statue, which shattered to pieces. The incident was reported by [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]], and Enanrum, saddened by the loss of the statue, gave an interview in which the sculptor expressed regret for bringing the statue at the gala in the first place.<ref name="BinksDestroys">{{Hnn|45|news/13228_3.html|Rep. Binks Destroys Ice Statue at Gala Fundraiser|https://web.archive.org/web/20130730110156/http://www.holonetnews.com:80/45/news/13228_3.html}}</ref>

name: Eron (soldier)
description: In [[3641 BBY]], during the [[Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]], Eron served as a [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]]. Eron was assigned to [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Shanra Immel]]'s [[Shanra Immel's squad|squad]] and served with [[Republic Special Forces Division|SpecForce]] [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Jace Malcom]] in a [[Battle of Kalandis Seven|battle]] taking place on [[Kalandis Seven]], a desolate [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] covered in [[Water/Legends|fog]]. During the battle Eron and the [[Squad/Legends|squad]] were tasked with the destruction of the local [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]&ndash;controlled [[Kalandis Seven's spaceport|spaceport]]. On the trek to the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]], Eron and the squad were attacked, and fellow squad member [[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] [[Amden vor Keioidian]] was [[Death/Legends|fatally]] wounded. Erron's squad leader, Immel, activated Keioidian's [[med tracer]] before making the decision to leave him behind, ordering the squad to move out.<ref name="TlBoCJM" />Three [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] later, Eron, Immel, Malcom, and the rest of the squad reached their objective and went on to plant several [[targeting beacon]]s, which would allow Republic [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] to destroy the spaceport regardless of the fog. Eron and the squad succeeded in planting the beacons, and the spaceport was destroyed shortly after.<ref name="TlBoCJM" />

name: Everen Ettene
description: Everen Ettene began training in the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during infancy as with all Jedi of the era. Studying at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Ettene eventually passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] and was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|knighted]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Serving as part of a delegation of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], Ettene served beneath [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Jorus C'baoth]] as the Jedi negotiated the [[Alderaan Ascendancy Contention]] between [[House of Organa/Legends|House Organa]] and [[House of Antilles|House Antilles]].<ref name="swcw">''[[SkyeWalkers: A Clone Wars Story]]''</ref> Further pursuits of knowledge of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] skill earned her the rank of Master. Years after meeting [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]], Ettene agreed to discuss with the newly appointed [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] the possibilities of taking on his dear friend, [[Halagad Ventor]] as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. Having trained at the [[Almas Academy|experimental Jedi academy]] on [[Almas]] since the age of seventeen, Ventor had been refued an apprenticeship by every Master he approached. Where all other Masters refused based on age and an uncontrolled mind, Ettene was intrigued by the challenge presented by the teenager that reminded her of herself at that age and agreed to take him on as a Padawan.<ref name="DOE" /><ref name="swcw" />Under her tutelage, Ettene showed Ventor compassion while chastising him and castigating the young Jedi in order to tame his brash personality. Nurturing him as a mother would tend to her son, the pair formed a strong bond that enable Ventor to grow in the Force.<ref name="swcw" /> In the wake of the failed [[Outbound Flight Project]], the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] dispatched Ettene and her apprentice to investigate the reasons behind the disaster and the two grilled Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and his Padawan [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] in their involvement in the affair. Despite the unpleasantness of this original meeting, Ettene saw that Ventor and Skywalker became quick friends sometime after the investigation was concluded.<ref name="swcw" /> In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]] the High Council assigned Ettene to mediate the ongoing [[Virgillian Civil War]] between the [[Virgillian Free Alignment/Legends|Virgillian Free Alignment]] and the [[Aristocracy]]. Consisting of two Master-Padawan teams, the diplomatic envoy was made up of [[Ludwin Katarkus]] and [[Danyawarra]], and Master Ettene and Padawan Ventor. As the [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] carrying the Jedi envoy entered [[Virgillia 7]]'s orbit and touched down on the [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] surface, it was attacked by terrorists and destroyed. After receiving no word from the diplomatic team for three months, the High Council announced that it presumed the Jedi dead and would be holding [[Jedi funeral/Legends|memorial services]] for them within the Temple's walls.<ref name="HNN45" />Despite the official reports of their deaths, [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]] of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] had not given up on his old friend, Ventor. In the days following the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|start]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] at [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], Organa, his close friend [[Giles Durane]], and the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ashka Boda]] traveled to Virgillia in search of the Master-Padawan pair. While Ettene and Katarkus perished before being rescued, both Padawans Danywarra and Ventor made it off the planet alive, going on to serve as [[Jedi Commander/Legends|commanders]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="swcw" />

name: Giffis Fane
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Giffis Fane was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] three centuries after the end of the [[Jedi Civil War]]. Following the signing of the [[Treaty of Coruscant]] between the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in the wake of the [[Great Galactic War]], the Jedi Order retreated from [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and took up residence on their ancestral homeworld, [[Tython/Legends|Tython]]. As a prolonged [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] took its toll on the galaxy, Fane was made a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and earned a seat on the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="TORFA" />

name: Feswe
description: Feswe blazed a [[hyperlane]] from [[Ladarra]] to the [[Feswe Corridor]], allowing the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebels]] to escape the [[Yavin blockade|Blockade of Yavin]]. The [[Star system/Legends|system]] was named after him.

name: Flerp
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Flerp was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received his [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Flerp remained at the Temple and participated in the [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]]. Administrated by Master [[Ilena Xan]], Flerp faced off against fellow Initiate [[Zrim]] .<ref name="YDR" />

name: Manon Flint
description: Manon Flint served the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and, later, the [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] empire of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]]. At some point, Flint was appointed as [[Governor/Legends|governor]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Oon Tien]] and its surrounding [[Oon Tien system|system]], which was within the [[Kathol sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. The world served as a construction and maintenance hub for [[Moff Sarne's forces]]&mdash;boasting three large [[Shipyard/Legends|spacedocks]]&mdash;and was heavily defended by [[IPV-1 System Patrol Craft]], [[TIE/LN starfighter]]s and [[proton mine]]s. In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], after Moff Sarne was forcibly [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|removed from power]] on his [[Capital/Legends|capital]], [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]], by [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[New Republic task force (Kal'Shebbol)|forces]], he retreated into the depths of the Kathol [[Sector/Legends|sector]]. As he withdrew, Sarne ordered Governor Flint to hold Oon Tien's stardocks at all costs, or to scuttle them to stop them from falling into New Republic hands if they chose to invade the [[Star system/Legends|system]].<ref name="TDC" />

name: Triddle Flipinigan
description: During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Kaeline Ungasan wished to become a new force in [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine's]] criminal activities. Fortunately for him, he encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] willing to help him during his stay in [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]]. Seeing [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] as his greatest obstacle, Ungasan wished to forge an alliance with [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Valarian/Legends|Valarian]], a powerful enemy of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Jabba's empire]]. The spacer agreed, and was sent to deliver a [[Datacard/Legends|datadisc]] to Triddle "Flip" Flipinigan, containing a proposal for Ungasan to ally with Valarian.<ref name="SWG" />

name: Gaarn
description: Gaarn served the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] as an [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], the [[Zann Consortium/Legends|Zann Consortium]]&mdash;a criminal organization led by [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Tyber Zann]]&mdash;[[Battle for the Eclipse|attacked]] the Imperial [[Shipyard/Legends|shipyards]] above the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kuat/Legends|Kuat]] to capture the [[Eclipse-class dreadnought|Super Star Destroyer]] [[Eclipse (Eclipse-class)|''Eclipse'']]. Gaarn, along with the Admiral's [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]], the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|''Executor''-class Star Dreadnought]] [[Annihilator (Executor-class)|''Annihilator'']], led a small [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] of three [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial''-class Star Destroyers]] to assist the struggling Imperial forces over Kuat.<ref name="FoC" />Gaarn's fleet attacked the forces of the Zann Consortium, which had already boarded and seized control of the ''Eclipse''. The ''Annihilator'' focused on destroying the massive [[Warship/Legends|warship]] before the enemy could use it to destroy the Imperial fleet. However, the Consortium forces were able to destroy the ''Annihilator'' and all other Imperial [[Starship/Legends|ships]], allowing Zann to gain access to the data archives of the ''Eclipse''.<ref name="FoC" />

name: S. Gawley
description: This individual worked on the [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']]<nowiki>'</nowiki>s design, as well as on the [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder's]] design, the [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighter's]] design, and the basic design of the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] that became the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']].

name: Lorka Gedyc
description: Following the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] and the [[Declaration of a New Order|rise]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Gedyc had become the [[Secret Mandalore|leader]] of the [[Death/Legends|Death]] Watch.<ref name="ImpCom501st" /> Gedyc thought highly of the [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorians]] of ages past, who had [[Mandalorian Wars|conquered]] [[Star system/Legends|star systems]] and forged an empire<ref name="ImpCom501st" /> that spanned across vast swaths of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. The state of the greatly diminished [[Mandalore sector/Legends|Mandalore sector]] following the defeat of [[Mandalore the Ultimate]]<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> was abhorrent to Gedyc, who considered Mandalorian holdings in [[Republic Classic era|the era]] to be little more than an assortment of "dirtball" [[Planet/Legends|worlds]], and felt that the Mandalorians' penchant for [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] and [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunting]] work was tantamount to scrambling for crumbs.<ref name="ImpCom501st" />Seeing this as an opportunity to restore the glory the Death Watch leader believed the Mandalorians had lost, Gedyc allied Death Watch with the Galactic Empire, and the Death Watch soldiers [[Dred Priest]] and [[Isabet Reau]] assisted the Imperials in establishing their [[Garrison/Legends|garrison]]<ref name="ImpCom501st" /> on the Mandalorian [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]],<ref name="TEA" /> just outside the planetary [[Capital/Legends|capital]] city of [[Keldabe/Legends|Keldabe]], in the failed adventure park<ref name="ImpCom501st" /> known as the "[[City of Bone]]."<ref name="TEA" /> Priest thought highly of Gedyc and the Death Watch leader's plans, and like Gedyc, saw the Empire as an opportunity to re-establish the Mandalorians' former power.<ref name="ImpCom501st" />

name: Gilp
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Gilp was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Page remained at the Temple and participated in the [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]]. Administrated by Master [[Ilena Xan]], Gilp faced off against fellow Initiate [[Page]] .<ref name="YDR" />

name: Ginzet
description: Born on the [[Saurton]] [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Essowyn]],<ref name="DSC" /> located within the [[Trax sector]] of the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]],<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> Ginzet served as a [[Soldier/Legends|warrior]] for the ''[[Des'mar]]'' of Essowyn, and worked to disrupt the ''[[Quenno]]'' faction.<ref name="DSC" /> Ginzet followed fellow Saurton and personal friend, [[Miktiss]], in several attacks against the ''Quenno'' despite the illegality of their actions. After Miktiss was captured, the members of the [[Council of Elders (Saurton)|Saurton Council of Elders]] loyal to the ''Des'mar'' [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggled]] Miktiss offworld to avoid execution; Ginzet was one of several soldiers loyal enough to follow him into [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]].<ref name="DSC" />In [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], Miktiss and his supporters formed the [[Des'maric Pirates]] and gifted Ginzet with the title of [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] and one of a trio of [[GAT-12 Skipray Blastboat]]s called ''[[Des'maric One]]''. The pirates would quickly capture the [[Corellian Engineering Corporation/Legends|Corellian Engineering Corporation]] [[Action IV transport]] [[Asagov Raider|''Cekbar Servant'']], renaming the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] as the ''Asagov Raider''. Despite forming an allegiance with [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Crev Bombaasa/Legends|Crev Bombaasa]], Miktiss was unaware that his seemingly loyal Lieutenant Ginzet had entered into a deal all her own. Having been paid off, Ginzet planned to help Bombassa assume control of the organization and oust Miktiss.<ref name="DSC" />

name: Goorth
description: Goorth was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]] some 650 years before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] and was part of an advanced civilization of gaseous beings known as [[Neo-Bespinian]]s, that were able to hide within the atmosphere of the planet. Sometime during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Goorth infiltrated [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]]. With his gaseous nature, the Neo-Bespinian was able to stow aboard a [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] and escape the planet. However, Goorth's invisible nature disappeared when the Neo-Bespinian exposed itself to foreign atmospheres. At one point when this happened, the grayish form that Goorth had taken brought a group of bandits after him. Although they tried to ionize him and disperse his molecules, Goorth had absolute control over the gases surrounding its body. As a result, Goorth was able to change the nature of the air around the bandits, suffocating them.

name: Gopple
description: Gopple served as [[Erigorm]]'s [[Senator/Legends|senator]] in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]]. Gopple served on the [[Procurement Panel/Legends|Procurement Panel]] of the [[Naval Subcommittee/Legends|Naval Subcommittee]] alongside Senator [[V'troren]]. During the Senator's tenure on the Panel, Gopple oversaw the testimony of [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Jerjerrod (admiral)|Jerjerrod]] when the latter was summoned to account for public statements that called into question the procurement procedure of the Republic for its naval forces. Jerjerrod maintained that he had not released the statements to the public, but that they had been taken from reports he had filed with Naval Command.<ref name="Testimony" />In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Gopple commented on the legality of the [[Corporate Alliance/Legends|Corporate Alliance's]] [[Raid on Yirt-4138-Grek-12|raid]] on a [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]] [[Yirt-4138-Grek-12 slicer compound|compound]] on the [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] [[Yirt-4138-Grek-12]]. Despite believing it to be against the spirit of the law, Gopple commented that it was legally permissible as the asteroid fell within the borders of Corporate Alliance space.<ref name="HNN48">{{Hnn|48|business/13321_1.html|Corporate Alliance Attacks Slicer Compound|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728125145/http://www.holonetnews.com/48/business/13321_1.html}}</ref>

name: Grimgrim
description: {{Quote|What's the plan, Chief?''"''<br />''"''To stop them, of course.|Soo Rcharrz and F4-MF|The Rebel Four}}The [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Soldier/Legends|warrior]] Grimgrim joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] at some point during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], a conflict in which the Rebels attempted to overthrow the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and restore the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Old Republic]]. Grimgrim eventually became a member of an Alliance unit known as the [[Rebel Four]], a quartet in which the Wookiee served alongside [[F4-MF]], [[Falaem Onn]], and [[Soo Rcharrz]].<ref name="TRF" />[[File:Grimgrim crushed SWT9.jpg|thumb|left|upright|Grimgrim was crushed to death in Vader's trap.]]At some point before [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]],<ref name="date" /> an [[Unidentified informant|informant]] tipped the Rebel Four off to the location of a hidden Imperial base on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Vatleria]], a world that had been abandoned by its original population. Under the command of the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] F4-MF, Grimgrim and the others sought out the base to stop whatever Imperial machinations were afoot there. The team eventually discovered [[stone ruins]] guarded by Imperial [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]. Confident that the fortress was the base they sought, they sneaked past the guards. Upon F4-MF's command, Grimgrim and the others stormed the base and attacked the last group of stormtroopers there. In the ensuing [[Skirmish on Vatleria|fray]], Grimgrim fought with bare [[Limb/Legends|hands]], while the other Rebels fired on their enemies with [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]].<ref name="TRF" />Unbeknownst to Grimgrim and the Rebel Four, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]], detected the Rebels' assault with the [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and watched the goings-on from a [[Viewscreen/Legends|viewscreen]] inside the fortress. When Vader sprung a trap for the intruders, [[Rope/Legends|ropes]] ejected from the ground and snagged Grimgrim and the others. The Wookiee was separated from the rest of the Rebel Four and dropped into a pit. There, a barrage of boulders tumbled down upon the warrior. Although the Rebel attempted to deflect the rocks with brute strength, the barrage proved too much, and the Wookiee [[Death/Legends|died]]. Similar traps killed the rest of the unit.<ref name="TRF" />

name: Unidentified Gungan villager (Otoh Sancture)
description: {{Quote|The time has come to gather the animals for the great feast! Gallo, as is the custom of our peoples, you must go into the forest and find the beasts.|The villager, to Boss Gallo|Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds}}[[File:OtohSancture.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Otoh Sancture]]In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3000 BBY]],<ref name="EA" /> a [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] villager lived in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Otoh Sancture]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]. The villager lived under the rule of [[Boss/Legends|Boss]] [[Gallo/Legends|Gallo]], who maintained Otoh Sancture's neutrality in a [[War of the Gungan tribes|war]] between the Gungan tribes at that [[Time/Legends|time]]. At some point in the war, Otoh Sancture celebrated its annual [[Sacred Feast]], a thanksgiving celebration to the Gungan [[Deity/Legends|deities]] known as the [[Gud/Legends|Guds]], requiring Gallo to leave [[Sexes/Legends|his]] city to [[Hunting/Legends|hunt]] animals suitable for the feast. The Gungan villager told the Boss of his duties in finding animals shortly before his departure.<ref name="GB" />While Gallo was away, Otoh Sancture was [[Destruction of Otoh Sancture|attacked]] by a [[Bursa clan (Otoh Sancture)|tribe]] of [[Bursa/Legends|bursas]], a [[Sentience/Legends|semi-sentient]], carnivorous [[Species/Legends|race]] of quadrupeds native to Naboo. The bursas had been sent by [[Rogoe]], the Boss of the city [[Spearhead]] and the secret manipulator of the war, who wanted Gallo [[Death/Legends|dead]] to ensure he could not take a side in the war and swing its tide. The Gungan villager cried out for help in the attack, which Gallo heard, but the Boss was unable to reach Otoh Sancture because of a [[Unidentified river|river]] between his location and the city. The villager perished along with the rest of Otoh Sancture's residents.<ref name="GB" />

name: C fire 4
description: C fire 4 did not manage to pull his fighter out of a dive and crashed during the battle.

name: Toma Hi'llani
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Toma Hi'Ilani was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Training independently as a [[Jedi Sentinel|Sentinel]], Master Hi'Ilani became one of the Order's foremost [[Technician/Legends|technical]] authorities on galactic state-of-the-art technologies.Stationed at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], it was common for [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] serving in the field to keep their [[Datapad/Legends|datapads]] updated with Master Hi'Ilani's latest techniques.In [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]], Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] utilized Hi'Ilani's methods during his [[mission to Romin]] with his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and other Jedi in their pursuit of galactic criminal [[Jenna Zan Arbor]].<ref name="COTG" />

name: Bashinan Hodizwen
description: A [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] during the last [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Bashinan Hodizwen was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Pursuing the teachings of the [[Jedi Consular]] during independent study as a Knight, Hodizwen became a noted [[Jedi Lore Keeper|Lore Keeper]], and was considered a scholar by many within the Order.<ref name="HNN" />During the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], conflicting reports emerged regarding the identity of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]' leader, the mysterious [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] of [[Serenno/Legends|Serenno]]. While the High Council remained tight-lipped on the subject, reporters from the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] network were able to interview Hodizwen, who gave brief insight into former [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] Dooku's personal interests. Citing Dooku's fascination with antiquities from across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] as reason for Dooku's appearance in the [[Gree Enclave/Legends|Gree Enclave]], Hodizwen did not comment further on the Count's sudden return from self-imposed exile.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Dovish Hokken
description: Dovish Hokken was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Eventually passing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Hokken was raised to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="HNN" />When the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] broke out between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Hokken was called before the High Council to accept a mission. The Council informed Hokken that the Confederacy had been in contact with the [[Pirates of Iridium]] in the [[Atrivis sector/Legends|Atrivis sector]] and were planning to steal shipments of [[Spice/Legends|spice]] from a host of Republic convoys. Under the leadership of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] and [[Belsed-Qan Idan]], Hokken and several other Jedi accompanied a task force of [[Judicial Department/Legends|Judicial Department]] [[Judicial/Legends|agents]] aboard the [[Consular-class cruiser|Republic cruiser]] ''[[Monitor III]]''. Protected by a number of [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Jedi-piloted starfighters]], the Jedi were ambushed immediately after coming out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]].<ref name="HNN" />Surprised by the Pirates' powerful weaponry, augmented by their unique [[Power gem|gem technology]], the ''Monitor III'' sustained heavy damage, killing many Judiciaries and three Jedi Knights. Among the dead were Jedi [[Aruden Kej]], [[Yrada Soludisan]], and Dovish Hokken. The ''Monitor III'' survived the skirmish and was able to return to Coruscant without any further causalities, though the mission was deemed a failure.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Homack
description: {{Quote|Almost in unison, we turned on those excluders. Shredder bats literally fell out of the sky as their senses got scrambled.|Homack|Gundark's Fantastic Technology: Personal Gear}}Homack was a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] and a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]. While flying an [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]], the pilot was involved in an engagement over the planet [[Atrivis]], and was shot down. Pursued on the planet's surface by [[storm commando]]s,<ref name="GFT50" /> elite [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] units specially trained in commando tactics,<ref name="Rules of Engagement 102">''[[Rules of Engagement: The Rebel SpecForce Handbook]]'', p. 102</ref> Homack was able to successfully evade them with the help of a set of [[Creshaldyne Industries/Legends|Creshaldyne Industries]] [[camo scout armor]]. Stored in the starfighter's survival gear kit, the suit was capable of mimicking surrounding terrain by generating a small holographic distortion, thus enabling Homack to avoid capture long enough to steal a ship and escape the planet.<ref name="GFT50" />[[File:Shredder bat.jpg|thumb|right|Shredder bats, such as these, attacked Homack while on the planet Hethar.]]On another mission, this time to the planet [[Hethar]], Homack and a number of other Rebels were investigating an Imperial contingent. Spending a night on the planet, Homack was on night duty with three other Rebels when they were attacked by [[shredder bat]]s.<ref name="GFT79">''[[Gundark's Fantastic Technology: Personal Gear]]'', p. 79</ref> The creatures, known to hunt in packs, were armed with sharp fangs with which they tried to pierce their target's coronary arteries.<ref name="Creatures of the Galaxy 65">''[[Creatures of the Galaxy]]'', p. 65</ref> Homack and the sentries were able to avoid such an attack by activating their [[Merr-Sonn Munitions, Inc./Legends|Merr-Sonn]] [[Excluder]]s. Small sonic devices that emitted waves of high frequency sound, they scrambled the bats' senses, causing them to fall from the sky. The sentries were then able to kill the creatures without drawing Imperial attention, or even waking the other Rebels. The bats were later enjoyed as breakfast the next day.<ref name="GFT79" />After retiring from the Rebellion, Homack posted a number of comments and reviews on equipment in [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]]. Three of these made their way into ''[[Gundark's Gear Datalog]]''. For instance, when discussing the [[A3AA personal defense module]] created by [[Corellian Technologies]], Homack recommended using [[Grenade/Legends|grenades]] or [[Slugthrower/Legends|slugthrowers]] to overcome the suit dissipation field.<ref name="Gundark's Fantastic Technology 48">''[[Gundark's Fantastic Technology: Personal Gear]]'', p. 48</ref>

name: C. Drover
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Drover sent an internal memo to [[Osten Dal'Nay]], the leader of the Militia, concerning the creation of [[Division Cloud Force]], a military unit that was specialized for operations on the gas [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]]. The memo was later leaked to the press and Dal'Nay denied that Drover even existed, when asked about the memo.

name: Horororibb
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Horororibb was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Horororibb remained at the Temple and participated in the [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]]. Administrated by Master [[Ilena Xan]], Horororibb competed against fellow Initiate [[Boofer]] in the first round.<ref name="YDR" />

name: Farh j'Hien
description: J'Hien served the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] as a [[General/Legends|general]]. The [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Kei Loo Bross]] captured a [[Unidentified Sith warrior|Sith warrior]] who was bonded to j'Hien through Sith battlelord rituals and included the warrior's description of j'Hien in his work, ''[[Speculations on Tactics of the Sith]]''.

name: Nanda-Ree Janoo
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] being, Nanda-Ree Janoo was a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], which taught Janoo the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. After passing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Janoo was elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="TCSWE" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Janoo became a [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the ranks of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. At some point during the conflict, Janoo was assigned to work with [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] in leading a task force to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Balamak/Legends|Balamak]] in order to destroy an experimental communications jamming array. During the [[Battle of Balamak/Legends|battle]] above the world, Janoo piloted a [[Jedi starfighter|starfighter]] against the CIS fleet. After fellow Jedi [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] destroyed the array, the Republic forces returned to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].<ref name="TCSWE" />

name: Jaxa
description: When the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] cracked down on [[Ralltiir/Legends|Ralltiir]], Bettle and Jaxa became one of many groups of smugglers who attempted to run the blockade.<ref name="SWAJ3">{{Journal|3|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> However, that venture didn't pan out, and they began marketing [[Slugthrower/Legends|slugthrowers]] to warring species located beyond the [[Corporate Sector/Legends|Corporate Sector]]; this job was more successful, and they brought back a full cargo of [[canta salt]] and [[havao tabacc]], though the ''Mallixer'' was damaged in the process.<ref name="SWAJ5">{{Journal|5|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref>Eventually, however, Bettle insisted on aiding the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], beginning by restarting their gunrunning venture to Ralltiir. Jaxa was quite unhappy with the risk, an unhappiness that was exacerbated by the near-capture of the ''Mallixer'' by Imperial forces<ref name="SWAJ10">{{Journal|10|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref>; this unhappiness apparently led to the two splitting up for a while, though they soon worked out their disagreements and were operating as a team again to make the "[[Spirva Run]]," smuggling items from [[Galladinium's Galactic Datalog of Fantastic Technology|Galladinium's Datalog]] to rioters in [[Spirva sector/Legends|Spirva sector]].<ref name="SWAJ14">{{Journal|14|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> During their career, the pair visited at least thirty-four [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowports]] around the galaxy.<ref name="DarkStryder">''[[The DarkStryder Campaign]]''</ref>Bettle got caught up in the Rebellion itself, working with her father [[Jerell]] in the Ralltiir resistance; it is unknown if Jaxa was talked into this as well, or if Bettle and Jaxa went their separate ways for a time. Eventually, Ralltiir fell to [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] forces, and the team of Bettle and Jaxa returned to the smuggling profession.<ref name="Heroes">''[[Heroes & Rogues]]''</ref>During the [[Thrawn campaign]], [[Talon Karrde]] formed an organization known as the [[Smugglers' Alliance]], and Bettle and Jaxa eventually joined it. When the New Republic declared the [[Moruth Doole]] regime of [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]] to be illegitimate, the Smugglers' Alliance was cleared to occupy the world; Bettle and Jaxa were responsible for developing preliminary distribution plans for the [[Glitterstim/Legends|glitterstim]] market.<ref name="JASB" />

name: J. Johnston
description: This individual worked on the [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']]{{'s}} design, as well as on the [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder's]] design, the [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighter's]] design, and the basic design of the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] that became the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']].

name: Jonoin
description: Jonoin was an individual who served the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] as an [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] in the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]],<ref name="Point Blank" /> an [[The galaxy/Legends|intergalactic]] conflict that was fought between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].<ref name="TCWCG">''[[The Clone Wars Campaign Guide]]''</ref> Sometime near the end of the war, Jonoin commanded Republic forces during an [[Battle of Garia|attack]] on a [[Separatist base  (Garia)|Confederate base]] that was located on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Garia]], in the [[Brak sector]]. Jonoin's forces carried out an [[Orbital bombardment/Legends|orbital bombardment]] of the base, but the strike was unsuccessful because the base was protected by [[Ray shield/Legends|energy shields]]. The Admiral was therefore forced to alter the battle plan. Jonoin contacted all of the Republic units participating in the attack and ordered a ground assault on the base's control center to destroy the [[Droid/Legends|droids]] stationed there and shut down the [[Deflector shield/Legends|shield]].<ref name="Point Blank" />Republic ground forces landed on Garia, and a number of [[All Terrain Tactical Enforcer/Legends|AT-TE]] [[Walker/Legends|walkers]] began to approach the command center. However, Confederacy fire inflicted heavy damage onto the walkers, so Jonoin ordered a group of Republic [[Commander/Legends|commanders]] to assist the lead AT-TE, which had been rendered immobile near the base.<ref name="Point Blank" />

name: Kaj
description: In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> as a child, Kaj was captured along with three fellow Tarasin children, [[Tiscak]], [[Honna]] and [[Li'Iri]], due to their innate Force-sensitivity. Their captor, [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver [[Phylus Mon]], jailed them in a cell in his slave zoo aboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. He also flogged all of the children with his three-tailed barbed whip.Their disappearance did not go unnoticed: Jedi Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] knew of the kidnappings, and even suspected Phylus Mon, but still could do nothing to rescue them.The children were kept in the cell, the only Force-sensitives in the zoo. They instinctively disliked fellow prisoner [[Halin Bok]]. Honna also managed to communicate with the [[Mantellian Savrip/Legends|Mantellian Savrips]] in another cell, [[Clu]], [[Taf]] and [[Mev (Savrip)|Mev]]. The Savrip promised to go through the energy bars to rescue the children should anyone try to take them against their will. Honna was scared of that, because the energy bars could easily kill the Savrips should they ever attempt that.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion gun|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Kallic
description: Kallic was an [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] [[Imperial officer/Legends|officer]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] who served aboard the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|Super Star Destroyer]] [[Executor/Legends|''Executor'']],<ref name="CSWE" /> the personal [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] of<ref name="Piett Databank">{{DB|character|admiralpiett|Piett, Admiral|archivedate=20110517074252}}</ref> the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]].<ref name="Temporary Reassignment">{{WEGCite|book=Shadows of the Empire Sourcebook|story=Temporary Reassignment|stext=''Temporary Reassignment''}}</ref> After Vader [[Death/Legends|executed]] [[Sexes/Legends|his]] flagship's former [[Commanding officer/Legends|commander]], [[Fleet Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Kendal Ozzel/Legends|Kendal Ozzel]], for incompetence during the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]]<ref name="Piett Databank" /> in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> the Dark [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] promoted [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Firmus Piett/Legends|Firmus Piett]] to [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]]. In turn, the ''Executor''{{'s}} captaincy soon passed to [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Venka]], whom Kallic eventually succeeded as captain of the ''Executor''.<ref name="Piett Databank" />Shortly after the [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] campaign, Kallic was given temporary command of the ''Executor''<ref name="CSWE" /> at Vader's request<ref name="Vader: The Ultimate Guide">''[[Vader: The Ultimate Guide]]''</ref> while the Dark Lord returned to<ref name="Temporary Reassignment" /> the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]]<ref name="SOTE Sourcebook">''[[Shadows of the Empire Sourcebook]]''</ref> of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] had personally recalled Vader to make his report<ref name="Temporary Reassignment" /> concerning his [[Duel on Cloud City/Legends|failed conversion]] of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] on [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin's]] [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]].<ref name="SOTE Sourcebook" /> With Kallic escorting Vader to Coruscant, Admiral Piett remained with the [[Death Squadron/Legends|Imperial Death Squadron]], Vader's [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]], to continue the Empire's hunt for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. Once Vader's business on Coruscant concluded, Kallic was scheduled to relinquish command of the ''Executor'' back to Piett.<ref name="Temporary Reassignment" />

name: Karsim
description: {{Quote|They were good soldiers. Far better than any of the others I've had under my command.|Sergeant Rusk|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]] during the [[Great Galactic War]] with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]],<ref name="Bad Intel" /> Karsim<ref name="Vanished">{{TORcite|type=conversation|Sergeant Rusk|Vanished}}</ref> served in a [[Surgeons|squad]] under the [[Commander/Legends|command]] of the [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Fideltin Rusk]], and its first [[Attack on an Imperial outpost|mission]] was to free several [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]] of war from an [[Imperial outpost (prison camp)|Imperial outpost]]. However, intelligence on the mission was incorrect, forcing the [[Squad/Legends|squad]] to fight through more enemy forces than it expected. Despite its disadvantage, the squad was able to rescue all of the prisoners and escape with heavy injuries, without a single [[Death/Legends|fatality]].<ref name="Bad Intel" /> In the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] following that mission, Karsim was among the squad members who were recruited into the [[Republic Special Forces Division]]'s [[Special Forces black ops program|black ops program]], and the squad&mdash;which included fellow veterans [[Naja]] and [[Eckerd]]&mdash;was tasked with the [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] of Imperial leaders by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Elin Garza]]. The squad, which became known as the "Surgeons," soon began to go after its targets' families. Karsim and the others were arrested for war crimes and [[Prison/Legends|imprisoned]] in a [[Berrun detention center|detention center]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Berrun]] with life sentences.<ref name="The Surgeons" />

name: Ludwin Katarkus
description: Ludwin Katarkus became a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Katarkus eventually passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] and was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|knighted]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Further pursuits of knowledge of the Force earned Katarkus the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. At some point later, Katarkus chose a [[Jedi Initiate|Jedi initiate]] named [[Danyawarra]] as his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]].<ref name="HNN45" />In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], the High Council assigned Katarkus to mediate the ongoing [[Virgillian Civil War]] between the [[Virgillian Free Alignment/Legends|Virgillian Free Alignment]] and the [[Aristocracy]]. Consisting of two Master-Padawan teams, the diplomatic envoy was made up of Katarkus and Danyawarra, and Master [[Everen Ettene]] and [[Halagad Ventor]]. As the [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] carrying the Jedi envoy entered [[Virgillia 7]]'s orbit and touched down on the [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] surface, it was attacked by terrorists and destroyed. After receiving no word from the diplomatic team for three months, the High Council announced that it presumed the Jedi to be [[Death/Legends|dead]] and would be holding [[Jedi funeral/Legends|memorial services]] for them within the Temple's walls.<ref name="HNN45" />Both Danywarra and Ventor actually survived the attack and rejoined the Order, serving as [[Jedi Commander/Legends|commander]] and [[Jedi General/Legends|general]] respectively in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="HNN45" />

name: Aruden Kej
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] being, Aruden Kej was inducted into the ranks of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Over time, Kej attained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. As a Knight of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Kej continued his studies of the Jedi Path, choosing to pursue the way of the [[Jedi Guardian]]. Becoming an [[Jedi ace|ace pilot]] within the Order's [[Jedi Starfighter Corps|starfighter corps]], Kej was a well respected Jedi.<ref name="HNN49" />Active during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Kej was assigned to a strike force sent to deal with the [[Pirates of Iridium]] which were harrying the [[Atrivis sector/Legends|Atrivis sector]]. Under the leadership of Masters [[Belsed-Qan Idan]] and [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]], Kej piloted a [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Delta-7 interceptor]] amongst the Republic diplomatic fleet, hoping to encourage a non-violent solution.However, as the [[Consular-class cruiser|Republic cruiser]] the ''[[Monitor III]]'' moved into the sector, the fleet was attacked by the [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]]. Engaging the Pirates' [[2 Warpod|warpod]] pinnaces, [[Longprow attack cruiser]]s, and [[Z-95 Headhunter/Legends|Z-95 Headhunter]] starfighters, Kej and five other Jedi were able to beat back the marauders and saved the ''Monitor III'' from utter destruction. While the pirates were defeated in the end, Kej was killed in a dogfight with a Z-95 Headhunter while making an attack run on the Longprow cruisers.<ref name="HNN49" />

name: Kep-She/Legends
description: [[File:Trench headshot.png|thumb|right|180px|Admiral Trench, Kep-She's adversary at the Battle of Malastare Narrows]]Kep-She was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual who lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Kep-She was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and eventually reached the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]].<ref name="Cat and Mouse Ep Guide">{{SWArchive|url=theclonewars/guide/episode216.html|text=''The Clone Wars'' Episode Guide: Cat and Mouse|archivedate=20110713001323}}</ref> In [[34 BBY/Legends|34 BBY]],<ref name="EGW">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref> a [[Corporate fleet (Malastare)|corporate fleet]] under the command of the [[Harch/Legends|Harch]] [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Trench/Legends|Trench]] [[Blockade/Legends|blockaded]] the Republic [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Malastare/Legends|Malastare]].<ref name="TCWCM" /> Kep-She was dispatched to the planet as a military "observer," along with several [[Officer/Legends|officers]] like the capable [[Wullf Yularen/Legends|Wullf Yularen]].<ref name="EGW" /> Later, after Trench had repelled a Republic [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] under the command of Yularen,<ref name="TCWCM" /> Master Kep-She<ref name="Cat and Mouse Ep Guide" /> was assigned to lead a Republic task force to end the blockade.<ref name="TCWCM" />The [[Battle of Malastare Narrows/Legends|Battle of Malastare Narrows]] claimed many Republic lives and [[Starship/Legends|ships]], but Kep-She's task force managed to destroy [[Trench's flagship/Legends|Trench's flagship]], breaking the corporate blockade and supposedly [[Death/Legends|killing]] the Harch Admiral. Admiral Trench escaped and survived, and joined the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="TCWCM" />

name: Melvor Khamp
description: In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Khamp was stationed in the [[Sluis Van Shipyards]] when the Empire attacked his [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], in what became known as the [[Sixty Hour War]], and Khamp's entire family were [[Death/Legends|killed]]. Following the attack, Khamp returned to Derilyn, and after learning of his family's fate, he disappeared into Derilyn's underworld community and eventually became a member of the [[Friends of Paran]], an anti-Imperial resistance group. After joining the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] as well, Khamp became a resident of the [[Friends of Paran base]] in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Knellis]]. There, he tasked some Rebel agents and several Friends of Paran operatives to infiltrate Derilyn's [[Imperial Monitoring Garrison]], to steal [[Datafile/Legends|datafiles]] regarding [[Operation: Elrood]]. Using the data that was gathered in the raid, Khamp subsequently sent the Rebels to board the [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] ''[[Brazen]]''.

name: Farn Klin
description: Farn Klin, a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual of a [[Farn Klin's species|species]], was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at a young age and began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], shortly before the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. Stationed at the Temple throughout the war, Klin, joined by fellow student [[Ran Deezy/Legends|Ran Deezy]], attended a gathering of Jedi in a [[Jedi Temple communication center/Legends|Temple comm station]] when [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] sent a [[Hologram/Legends|holographic]] transmission in which the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] gloated over his capture and [[Torture/Legends|torture]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Eeth Koth/Legends|Eeth Koth]].<ref name="GI" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Meso Laloo
description: Around [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Meso Laloo worked at the [[Jawa Mountain Fortress]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].<ref name="AED" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Nan Latourain
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Nan Latourain was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] before passing his [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Delving into the work of the [[Jedi Sentinel|Sentinel]], Latourain became an expert [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]] and attained the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] at some point in time.<ref name="TFP" />Latourain was stationed at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] in [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]], having been offered a position as an [[Jedi instructor|instructor]]. Accepting, Latourain taught classes in codes, ciphers, and encryption bypasses at the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]] to [[Jedi Initiate|older initiates]]. Famed Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] studied under Latourain during his time at the academy.<ref name="TFP" />

name: Vrook Lamar's Padawan
description: [[File:Vrookfull.jpg|thumb|right|150px|The Padawan trained under Vrook Lamar in the time period before the Mandalorian Wars.]]A [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Jedi training/Legends|learned]] the ways of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] under [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vrook Lamar]] in the [[Time/Legends|time]] period before the [[Mandalorian Wars]], a [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]-spanning conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders]]. While the Padawan was at the [[Jedi Enclave]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]], the student engaged in an intense debate with fellow Padawan<ref name="Holovid" /> [[Meetra Surik]].<ref name="Note">The character of the Jedi Exile, the protagonist of ''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords]]'', was later confirmed to have been known as Meetra Surik in the novel ''[[The Old Republic: Revan]]''.</ref> As a result, Lamar sought to have [[Meetra Surik's Jedi Master|Surik's Master]] discipline her, but the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] refused. After this, Lamar brought the issue up to Master [[Vandar Tokare]], who also refused to take any action.<ref name="Holovid" />

name: Cruva Lenda
description: Cruva Lenda was a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]]<ref name="TF" /> who lived during the era of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]<ref name="Scourge">[[Scourge (novel)|''Scourge'']]</ref> and was employed by the [[organization]] of [[Nirama]],<ref name="TF" /> an [[Oblee]]<ref name="Recursion">''[[Recursion]]''</ref> [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] who was based in the [[Cularin system]].<ref name="TF" /> In [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]],<ref name="Scourge" /> Lenda and fellow Twi'lek [[Ranso Li]] journeyed from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]] in order to acquire some fast, used [[Freighter/Legends|freighters]] for Nirama's [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] operation. On arrival on the world, the pair attended a party that was held by the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Popara Anjiliac Diresto]] in [[Popara's penthouse]],<ref name="TF" /> to commemorate the recent rescue of Popara's son [[Mika Anjiliac Chiera|Mika]] by the [[Jedi archivist]] [[Mander Zuma]] and the [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] [[Eddey Be'ray]] and [[Reen Irana]].<ref name="Scourge" />

name: Li'Iri
description: In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> as a [[Youngling/Legends|youngling]], Li'Iri was captured along with three fellow Tarasin children, [[Tiscak]], [[Honna]] and [[Kaj]], due to their innate Force-sensitivity. Their captor, [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver [[Phylus Mon]], jailed them in a cell in his slave zoo aboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. He also flogged all of the children with his three-tailed barbed whip.Their disappearance did not go unnoticed: Jedi Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] knew of the kidnappings, and even suspected of Phylus Mon, but still could do nothing to rescue them.The children were kept in the cell, the only Force-sensitives in the zoo. They instinctively disliked fellow prisoner [[Halin Bok]]. Honna also managed to communicate with the [[Mantellian Savrip/Legends|Mantellian Savrips]] in another cell, [[Clu]], [[Taf]] and [[Mev (Savrip)|Mev]]. The Savrip promised to go through the energy bars to rescue the children should anyone try to take them against their will. Honna was scared of that, because the energy bars could easily kill the Savrips should they ever attempt that.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion gun|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Ranso Li
description: Ranso Li was a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] who worked for [[Nirama]],<ref name="TF" /> an [[Oblee]]<ref name="Recursion">''[[Recursion]]''</ref> [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] who operated a [[Organization|smuggling concern]] in the [[Cularin system]].<ref name="TF" /> In [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]], during the reign of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]],<ref name="Scourge">[[Scourge (novel)|''Scourge'']]</ref> Li and the Twi'lek [[Cruva Lenda]] traveled from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]] to acquire some fast, second-hand [[Freighter/Legends|freighters]] for use by Nirama's organization. There, the pair attended a banquet that was held by the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Popara Anjiliac Diresto]] inside [[Popara's penthouse]],<ref name="TF" /> in honor of the Hutt's guests [[Eddey Be'ray]], [[Reen Irana]], and [[Mander Zuma]].<ref name="Scourge" />

name: Pertaal Logris
description: Pertaal Logris was an [[Imperial officer/Legends|officer]] serving in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] who rose to the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]]. By [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], Logris was serving in [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]]'s [[Moff Sarne's forces|forces]] in the [[Kathol sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. Sarne had established himself as a [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] following the [[Death/Legends|death]] of [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] at the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], and the subsequent fracturing of [[Imperial High Command/Legends|Imperial authority]], by quietly withdrawing his [[Sector/Legends|sector]] from the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. Under Sarne, Logris commanded the [[Charis Fleet]], the largest military formation in the sector, consisting of several [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ships]] and smaller [[Starship/Legends|vessels]] based on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Charis]].<ref name="TDC" />In 8 ABY, Sarne was [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|ousted]] from his [[Capital/Legends|capital]], [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]], by [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[New Republic task force (Kal'Shebbol)|forces]] as part of their [[DarkStryder Campaign|military offensive]] against him. As the Moff fled into the depths of the Kathol sector, Sarne ordered the Charis Fleet to be broken down into smaller task forces to undertake missions to undermine the New Republic's efforts to expand their sphere of influence in the region through both [[Diplomat/Legends|diplomatic]] and military missions.<ref name="TDC" />

name: Gydio Lucone
description: During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Lucone was approached by captain [[Elga Arbo]], a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] specialized in fast deliveries. Arbo had bought a modified [[Starfeld Industries/Legends|Starfeld Industries]] [[Z-10 Seeker-class scout ship|Z-10 Seeker]], the ''[[Redshift Runner]]'', and wanted to borrow money from Lucone to improve the [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]]. Lucone agreed.Lucone had purposefully signed strict conditions so that, should Arbo did not pay monthly, Lucone would then impound the [[Starship/Legends|ship]]. Lucone did hope this situation would happen, as it would give Lucone the chance to blackmail Arbo and make her [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggle]] for Lucone. However, Arbo systematically paid in time and at the same time, she got a reputation as a legal pilot.One day, Arbo wanted to pay three days after her deadline. Lucone attempted to claim the ship. Arbo refused and violence ensued. Arbo was seriously injured during the fight, but she and [[Maceb Joodsen]] eventually escaped on the ''Runner''.Enraged, Lucone then issued a 20,000-[[Galactic Credit Standard|credit]] [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] for the ship and took measures so that it was a well-known fact. Three months later, the bounty had not been claimed.

name: Machook
description: Machook shared a name with a figure of Ewok legend, one said to have been a hero who built the first tree village on [[Endor/Legends|Endor]].<ref name="GCG">''[[Galactic Campaign Guide]]''</ref>

name: Tirs Maladane
description: {{Quote|But I never expected the order I got. Fire into the forests? I had to ask my CO to repeat that. But that's what Solo wanted. And so every battery on the Black Annie that had a firing arc opened up.|Maladane, in an excerpt from a transcript of ''Wookiee World Horror Witness!''|The Essential Guide to Warfare}}Tirs Maladane was from [[Little Mochot]] on the [[Water/Legends|rainless]] [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. When Maladane was fifteen, the Tatooine native's [[Tirs Maladane's aunt|aunt]] sent the teenager to the world [[Pii III]] during the [[Summer/Legends|summer]] to earn some [[Galactic Credit Standard|money]] in the [[Greel wood]] logging industry. During the first [[Standard day/Legends|day]] there, it rained heavily, and Maladane stood out in it laughing and cheering, even though the other workers thought the youth strange. Maladane returned to Little Mochot, where the teenager dreamed of rain every night.<ref name="TEGTW" />Later in life, Maladane served as a [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] on the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]]' [[Imperial II-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial II''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Anakin Solo (Imperial II-class)|''Anakin Solo'']], [[Commander/Legends|commanded]] by the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]], the Galactic Alliance's [[Chief of State (Galactic Alliance)|Chief of State]]. Maladane and some of the crew called the ''Anakin Solo'' the "Black Annie." The Tatooine native was a [[Gunner/Legends|gunner]] operating the starboard lateral quad [[Turbolaser/Legends|turbolaser]] cannon and fought in engagements such as [[Battle of Kuat (Second Galactic Civil War)|Kuat]] and [[Battle of Hapes (Second Galactic Civil War)|Hapes]] as the [[Second Galactic Civil War]] raged between the Galactic Alliance and the [[Confederation]].<ref name="TEGTW" /> After the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] abandoned the Galactic Alliance at [[Kuat/Legends|Kuat]] in [[40 ABY]] for Solo's [[Battle of Ossus (Second Galactic Civil War)|move against]] the [[Jedi Academy (Ossus)|Jedi Academy]] on the world [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]], Jacen Solo, who had now secretly taken the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] title [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Caedus, led the ''Anakin Solo'' to the forested world of [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] to confront the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and the native [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiees]], who were harboring Jedi on their homeworld.<ref name="inferno">''[[Legacy of the Force: Inferno]]''</ref>Maladane and all of the other gunners were ordered to fire into the forests of Kashyyyk after the Jedi and the Wookiees refused to yield to Solo. Maladane asked the commanding [[Officer/Legends|officer]] to repeat the order, but fired anyway because if Maladane refused, the gunner would be put in the brig, with someone else firing at the forests. Maladane cried as they continued to open fire on the forests, setting ablaze the ancient [[Wroshyr tree/Legends|Wroshyr trees]]. As [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] began to attack the ''Anakin Solo'', Maladane gladly turned the [[Cannon/Legends|cannon]] to fire on the fighters, since they could actually fight back. In [[41 ABY]], the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] the war ended, a feature from [[TriNebulon News/Legends|TriNebulon News]] called ''[[Wookiee World Horror Witness!]]'' contained Maladane remembering the experience during the battle.<ref name="TEGTW" />

name: Desic Malboan
description: During the conflict, Malboan was sent to serve aboard the customs ship ''[[Thaere Runner]]''. After the [[Heroes of Cularin]] docked their ship with it, Malboan secretly attached a tracking device to it.

name: Linx Mallicker
description: Together with another [[Wroonian]] gunrunner, [[Fillio Androu]], Linx Mallicker bought the [[Corellian Engineering Corporation/Legends|CEC]] [[YT-2400 light freighter/Legends|YT-2400 light freighter]] ''[[Lambarian Crab]]'', previously used by smuggler [[Finious Crab]]. The Wroonians discovered two of the three secret smuggling compartments that Crab had used.<ref name="ss">''[[Stock Ships]]''</ref>They then began dealing with illegal weapons from the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] to the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], avoiding the [[Corellian system]] because Crab had earned himself some enemies in the local law enforcement agencies and they would recognize the ship. The Wroonians sold their cargo to Imperial officers that liked illegal firearms and to some cells of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="ss" />

name: R. McQuarrie
description: This individual worked on the [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']]<nowiki>'</nowiki>s design, as well as on the [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder's]] design, the [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighter's]] design, and the basic design of the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] that became the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']].

name: Telan Medon
description: {{Quote|You've given my fleet safe haven many times these past eight years.''"<br />"''My kin have supported the Republic since before the Clone Wars. Utapau's caves can be an impossible maze. Your wounded will be safe.|Gar Stazi and Telan Medon|Legacy 49: Extremes, Part 2}}[[File:Greetingsoldfriend.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Medon welcomes Admiral Gar Stazi to Utapau.]]The [[Pau'an/Legends|Pau'an]] Telan Medon lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Utapau/Legends|Utapau]] and served as the [[Master of Port Administration|Port Administrator]] of [[Pau City/Legends|Pau City]], a large sinkhole [[City/Legends|city]] that plunged deep into the planet's surface, during the [[Second Imperial Civil War]].<ref name="Legacy 49" /> The war pitted [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire]]&mdash;a [[One Sith|Sith]]-led organization that ruled much of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]&mdash;against several rebel factions, among them the [[Galactic Alliance Remnant]].<ref name="LECG">''[[Legacy Era Campaign Guide]]''</ref> Medon was sympathetic to the Remnant and constantly provided its [[Galactic Alliance Core Fleet|fleet]] safe haven from [[Darth Krayt|Krayt's]] Empire throughout an eight-[[Standard year/Legends|year]] period beginning in [[130 ABY]].<ref name="Legacy 49" />In [[138 ABY]],<ref name="Extremes Trade">Although the [[Star Wars comic books|comic book]] ''[[Legacy 47: The Fate of Dac]]'' indicates that its events take place in [[137 ABY]], the more recently released [[Star Wars: Legacy Volume 10: Extremes|''Star Wars: Legacy: Extremes'' trade paperback]] dates them at [[138 ABY]].</ref> after the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Vul Isen]] [[Final Protocol|poisoned]] the [[Ocean/Legends|oceans]] of the planet [[Dac]], the Remnant [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] led a massive [[Evacuation of Dac|evacuation]] of the [[Water/Legends|water]] world<ref name="Legacy 47">''[[Legacy 47: The Fate of Dac]]''</ref> and suffered many casualties during a consequent battle with Krayt's forces. Medon welcomed the fleet to Pau City in the skirmish's aftermath and personally greeted its leader, [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gar Stazi]], upon his arrival onworld. As the wounded were unloaded from the [[Starship/Legends|ships]] of the fleet, Stazi promised Medon that he would leave as soon as possible.<ref name="Legacy 49" />Unbeknownst to either of them, their conversation was recorded by a [[MSE-series|mouse droid]] that belonged to [[Muerdo]], an [[Utai/Legends|Utai]] [[Spy/Legends|spy]] employed by the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Vedo Anjiliac Atirue]]; Vedo in turn passed the information to the Sith in the hopes of luring Isen into a trap. The scientist had also [[Devastation of Da Soocha|poisoned]] the Hutt [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Da Soocha]], and, seeking revenge, Vedo hired [[Cade Skywalker]]&mdash;a former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who was actively [[Hunting/Legends|hunting]] Sith&mdash;to [[Mission to Utapau (Second Imperial Civil War)|go to Utapau]] and [[Death/Legends|kill]] Isen, whom Vedo suspected would seek to punish the Pau'ans for harboring Krayt's enemies.<ref name="Legacy 49" /> Vedo's gamble paid off, and Skywalker [[Sai tok|slew]] Isen on Utapau in [[Time/Legends|time]] to save the planet from a [[Viral spore|poisonous]] fate.<ref name="Legacy 50">''[[Legacy 50: Extremes, Part 3]]''</ref>

name: Mev (Savrip)
description: Mev was captured, along with fellow Savrips [[Clu]] and [[Taf]], by a [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver known as [[Phylus Mon|The Mon]]. The Savrips were sent to The Mon's slave zoo onboard the ''[[Animiasma]]'' and jailed in the same cell. Still unbroken, the Savrips would rather find and hurt the Mon more than escape.Although unwilling to communicate to anyone outside the cells, the Savrips noticed four [[Tarasin]] children imprisoned in another cell, [[Li'Iri]], [[Honna]], [[Tiscak]] and [[Kaj]]. Honna speaked with the Savrips and understood their language using her own Force abilities. The Savrips, feeling sorry for the children, promised to protect them: Should anyone try to take the children against their wills, the Savrips would defy the energy bars of their cell to stop the evil-doers. Honna was glad that it did not happen, because the energy bars could have easily wound or kill the Savrips.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion blaster/Legends|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Mas Missur
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Mas Missur achieved the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] by the end of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] that plagued the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]].
