When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Master Missur took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]] in the newly created [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], leading [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] on several fronts.<ref name="RCTC" />When the Republic incited a [[Battle of Gaftikar|rebellion]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Gaftikar]], Master Missur was assigned to lead the [[Acclamator-class assault ship|''Acclamator''-class assault ship]] ''[[Leveler]]'' to the world to provide support against a CIS invasion. Assisting the [[Marit]] population, Missur and the [[35th Infantry]] were successful in securing the planet's mineral wealth for the planet.

name: Ista Kezever
description: Kezever published an article in the [[Corellia Times]] about the repair of [[Viewscreen/Legends|viewscreens]]<ref name="viewscreen">[https://web.archive.org/web/20050208070124/http://starwarsgalaxies.station.sony.com/content.jsp?page=Broken%20Viewscreen The Broken Viewscreen, or How to Save a Picture Forever] on the official ''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]'' website (archived version)</ref> and the article "''Galaxy in Review ... Intergalactic Report 12.1''" in the [[Naboo Herald]] about changes in politics and technology.<ref>''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]'', loading screen during Publish 12.1 in January 2005</ref>

name: Naja
description: {{Quote|They were good soldiers. Far better than any of the others I've had under my command.|Sergeant Rusk|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]] during the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]],<ref name="Bad Intel" /> Naja<ref name="Vanished">{{TORcite|type=conversation|Sergeant Rusk|Vanished}}</ref> served in a [[Surgeons|squad]] under the [[Commander/Legends|command]] of the [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Fideltin Rusk]]. The [[Squad/Legends|squad's]] first [[Attack on an Imperial outpost|mission]] was to free several Republic [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]] of war from an [[Imperial outpost (prison camp)|Imperial outpost]]; however, intelligence on the mission was bad, forcing the squad to fight through more enemy forces than it expected. Despite its disadvantage, the squad was able to rescue all of the prisoners and escape with heavy injuries but no [[Death/Legends|fatalities]].<ref name="Bad Intel" /> In the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] following that mission, Naja was among the squad members who were recruited into the [[Republic Special Forces Division]]'s [[Special Forces black ops program|black ops program]], and the squad&mdash;which included fellow veterans [[Karsim]] and [[Eckerd]]&mdash;was tasked by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Elin Garza]] with the [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] of Imperial leaders. The squad, which became known as the "Surgeons," soon began to go after its targets' families. When this came to light, Naja and the others were arrested for war crimes and [[Prison/Legends|imprisoned]] in a [[Berrun detention center|detention center]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Berrun]] with life sentences.<ref name="The Surgeons" />

name: Nardakka
description: Nardakka worked as a courier for the criminal [[Vex (Human)|Vex]] and during the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], was among a group of couriers that were sent by Vex to collect an illicit cargo in the jungles of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. However, they were ambushed by thugs working for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Riboga]]. Nardakka was [[Death/Legends|killed]] when the thugs detonated a [[thermal mine]].

name: Delt Nerris
description: The [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and the [[Corellian Security Force]]s organized a joint operation using the ship illegally-modified [[GX1 Short Hauler|Short Hauler]] ''[[Nova Whisper]]'', that had been captured from the pirate [[Dharus]], as a bait for criminals. Delt Nerris was assigned to pilot the ship. Making use of his chance, Nerris hijacked the ship and gave it to the forces of the Alliance. The Alliance then added the ship to its forces on [[Asher III]].

name: Nira
description: Both Nira and Dayn had been serving Hudorra for some time when [[Dass Jennir]], [[Beyghor Sahdett]], and the crew of the ''[[Uhumele]]'' arrived at the casino in search of him.After Sahdett's [[Duel on Kestavel|betrayal]], the two Bith helped clean up the bodies and debris. When Hudorra tried to force his remaining staff to flee in advance of the upcoming [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] attack, Nira, along with Dayn, [[Bryti]], [[Kal (bodyguard)|Kal]], and [[Shaylai Veila]], reaffirmed their loyalty to the Jedi Master, refusing to abandon him. The pair would later prepare a final feast, as there would be little use for the food assuming the casino's destruction in the upcoming attack. The duo would sit between Veila and [[Bomo Greenbark]] during the meal itself, where the [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] told everyone that only he and Jennir would be staying.Later, as [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and his [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] marched across the bridge to the casino, Nira was already aboard the ''Uhumele''. Both Nira and Dayn would be witness to Hudorra's final message, recorded on a [[holodisc]] given to Jennir by Bryti, wishing that [[May the Force be with you/Legends|the Force be with them]].

name: Tolan Nokkar
description: {{Quote|He's dead? We are forever in your debt. The survivors of our village has gathered what we could to show our appreciation for your heroism. It's not much, but all we have, please accept it.|Tolan Nokkar, to a spacer after the death of the Tusken King|Star Wars Galaxies}}Early in the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Tolan Nokkar lived in a [[Tusken Village|village]]<ref name="SWG:TN" /> of [[Moisture farmer/Legends|moisture farmers]],<ref name="SWG:AC">{{SWG|An Empire Divided}}—Herald NPC: "A commoner" on Tatooine</ref> located in the [[Western Dune Sea/Legends|Western Dune Sea]] of the planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].<ref name="SWG:TN" />[[File:TolanNokkar'sCamp.jpg|thumb|right|250px|The refugee camp used by Tolan Nokkar and other escaped villagers]]By the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], the village was attacked and taken over by a tribe of [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]] led by a [[Tusken King (rank)|Tusken King]]. Most of the villagers were killed but Tolan Nokkar and a few of the villagers managed to escape. They established a refugee camp in the [[Dune Sea/Legends|Dune Sea]], not far from the village.<ref name="SWG:TN" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Tolan Nokkar encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] in the camp. Nokkar begged the spacer to kill the Tusken King. The spacer headed to the pillaged village and fought the Tusken King and other Tuskens who would get in the way. The spacer succeeded and returned to Nokkar. Tolan Nokkar was thankful and gave the spacer 20,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] pooled together by the surviving villagers as a reward. Tolan Nokkar and other survivors thus planed to move back into the village as soon as they drove the remaining Tusken Raiders away.<ref name="SWG:TN" />

name: Darth Nox
description: {{Quote|Now, go. Return to Harkun and nurture your hatred for him, and use your fear of him to grow stronger. He may raise his fist to strike, but it is Lord Zash who will determine where the blow will land.|Spindrall's advice to the young Acolyte|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}[[File:Sith acolytes shipment-SWTOR.png|thumb|right|300px|The heir of Kallig arrives on Korriban with a shipment of new acolytes.]]Discovered as a slave, the acolyte was brought to Korriban for training as a Sith, as the acolyte's [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitivity]] impressed those who discovered them. This was a time in which the [[Sith Order]] had decided to accept non-Imperials to be trained as Sith Inquisitors. Upon arrival at the academy on Korriban, the newly-dubbed acolyte was assigned to Overseer [[Harkun]], who was instructing other non-Imperial Sith, whom he held in contempt, especially former slaves. The overseer made no attempt to hide his disdain as he openly discriminated against the acolyte in favor of another acolyte in the group, a [[Sith (species)|pureblooded Sith]] named [[Ffon Althe]]. After a brief introduction upon the acolytes' arrival, Harkun assigned the acolyte their first quest: to travel into [[Ajunta Pall]]'s [[Tomb of Ajunta Pall|tomb]] and be tested by Lord [[Spindrall]].<ref name="Of Mind and Matter">{{TORcite|type=class|Sith Inquisitor|Of Mind and Matter|Korriban}}</ref>After killing some [[K'lor'slug/Legends|K'lor'slugs]] and tomb looters along the way, the acolyte finally reached Spindrall, who tested the young acolyte by sending his own six acolytes to attack. They swiftly defeated them all, passing the test and leaving the tomb thereafter. Successful, the acolyte returned to Harkun, who was awaiting them in the Sith Academy, but not without first meeting an assistant overseer called [[Markan]], who introduced the acolyte to some core Sith tenets before redirecting him to Lord [[Samus]] for further training.Back in Harkun's office, Harkun executed an acolyte, [[Kory]], for her weakness and not living up to her potential before assigning the acolyte to a quest in the academy's jails, which [[Darth Zash|Lord Zash]] herself had requested for him. In the jail, Inquisitor [[Zyn]] told the acolyte to [[Torture/Legends|interrogate]] a weak acolyte named [[Alif]]; they succeeded, getting the answer that Zyn wanted from Alif.<ref name="The Plight Of The Acolyte">{{TORcite|type=class|Sith Inquisitor|The Plight Of The Acolyte|Korriban}}</ref> Harkun then proceeded to assign both the acolyte and Ffon to different trials of intellect. While Ffon's task was less dangerous, merely having to translate some ancient texts, the acolyte's task was to travel to [[Marka Ragnos]]'s [[Tomb of Marka Ragnos|tomb]] and recover an ancient [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]]. The acolyte fought through hordes of [[Tuk'ata/Legends|Tuk'ata]] and [[Shyrack/Legends|Shyracks]] to reach the objective but succeeded nonetheless, retrieving the holocron through the use of [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]].<ref name="A Little Knowledge">{{TORcite|type=class|Sith Inquisitor|A Little Knowledge|Korriban}}</ref>Upon returning to Harkun, he was both surprised and displeased that the Acolyte had survived and was quick to send the acolyte on another difficult task. At the same time, the acolyte was gaining renowned praise for the feats they performed in the tombs.

name: Obitoki
description: Obitoki was a [[Alien/Legends|non-Human]] [[Podracer (profession)/Legends|Podracer]] active in the [[Time/Legends|time]] frame<ref name="CSWE" /> preceding [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]].<ref name="JQTDG">As of the events of the novel ''[[Jedi Quest: The Dangerous Games]]'', which takes place in [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]], [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]] had retired from [[Podracing/Legends|Podracing]] to coach his son, [[Hekula]].</ref> In one [[Podracing/Legends|race]] against the [[Dug/Legends|Dug]] [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]], Obitoki tried to overtake the competitor, who responded by opening a side vent on his [[Podracer/Legends|pod]] and spewing fire into Obitoki's [[Engine/Legends|engine]]. Obitoki's pod exploded and crashed while expelling a cloud of debris, removing Obitoki from the race. Another racer, [[Habba Kee]], tried to navigate the wreckage, but he collided with Obitoki's pod, knocking him out of the race as well.<ref name="CSWE" />

name: Harribore Onuta
description: Living on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Harribore Onuta was appointed as Medxec of the [[Coruscant Health Administration]] before [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. During the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Medxec Onuta oversaw the rise in [[Brainworm Rot Type A]] on the galactic capital. During an interview with [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]], Onuta blamed the rising rate of contracting Brainrot on the increased number of different species entering the planet's [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport's]] each and everyday. This statement was taken offensively by many non-Humans, believing it to be Republic anti-alien hate speech.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Kanzhei Opli
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Kanzhei Opli was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and training independently as a [[Jedi Beast Master]]. Serving the Order and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] for decades, Opli was responsible for creating the [[Tuk'ata Nobilis|nobilis]] subspecies of the fierce [[Tuk'ata/Legends|tuk'ata]] beasts. Gifting the two nobilis creatures to the people of [[Vaklin]] for their devotion to the Order and support of its members, the Vaklin people kept the beasts inside the [[Jedi Temple (Vaklin)|Jedi Temple]] there to safeguard its halls. Considered to be one of the finest Beast Masters of the Order by the adherents on Vaklin, the nobilis creatures were slain by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] as the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] asserted its control over the world.<ref name="TTF2" />

name: Oshi-Jid
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sentience/Legends|being,]] Oshi-Jid attained the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] in the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].<ref name="OTF" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] broke out between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and Oshi-Jid took the [[Duros/Legends|Duros]] [[Teo Gronn]] as his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] after Gronn's [[Lyron|former master]] had been [[Death/Legends|killed]] at the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|first battle of the war]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]].<ref name="OTF" />Four [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the start of the war in 21.66 BBY,<ref name="TNEC" /> Oshi-Jid was part of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Republic forces]]<ref name="OTF" /> sent [[Battle of Muunilinst|to capture]] the planet [[Muunilinst/Legends|Muunilinst]], home of the [[InterGalactic Banking Clan/Legends|InterGalactic Banking Clan]].<ref name="CWC1">{{CW|1}}</ref> Oshi-Jid was presumed to be killed in action [[Space warfare|in combat]] [[Realspace/Legends|over]] Muunilinst, leaving Gronn once again without a master.<ref name="OTF" />

name: Ore'mun
description: {{Quote|Predor Skal'nas has sent a message, ordering you back to Byss. I am to stay to oversee the culling.|Ore'mun, to Predor Tul'kar|Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 1}}Ore'mun was a [[Rakata]]n,<ref name="Dawn of the Jedi 1" /> a member of a naturally [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Species/Legends|species]]<ref name="The Unknown Regions">''[[The Unknown Regions]]''</ref> whose [[Infinite Empire]] ruled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. [[The Force/Legends|The Force]] fueled all Rakatan technology,<ref name="Warfare">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref> and the Empire accordingly sought out and [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] [[Planet/Legends|worlds]] whose populations were strong in the Force through the use of Force-sensitives known as [[Force Hound]]s.<ref name="Dawn of the Jedi 0">''[[Star Wars: Dawn of the Jedi 0]]''</ref> In [[25,793 BBY]],<ref name="date" /> Ore'mun served the Infinite Empire as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] for [[Predor]] [[Skal'nas]],<ref name="Dawn of the Jedi 1" /> a Rakatan overlord.<ref name="Dawn of the Jedi 0" /> Skal'nas dispatched Ore'mun to accompany the subordinate yet ambitious Predor [[Tul'kar]] on a [[Conquest of Tatooine|conquest]] of the planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], which had been discovered by Tul'kar's Force Hound [[Tau (individual)|Xesh]].<ref name="Dawn of the Jedi 1" />The [[Rakatan ship|starships]] of the Infinite Empire arrived at the lush world, and Rakatan warriors subjugated the native [[Kumumgah/Legends|Kumumgah]]. On the outskirts of a [[Unidentified Tatooine city|burning city]], Ore'mun watched as Xesh identified Force-sensitives among the locals; the spy then received new orders transmitted from Skal'nas. Ore'mun complimented Tul'kar on Xesh's abilities in such a way as to point out that Skal'nas was his superior, and then confidently relayed the orders: Tul'kar had been summoned to meet with Skal'nas on the planet [[Byss/Legends|Byss]], and Ore'mun was to remain on Tatooine to oversee the culling of local Force-sensitives. Furious with the display of smugness, Tul'kar [[Telekinesis/Legends|telekinetically choked]] Ore'mun and killed the spy with [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]]. Ore'mun's body was then prepared by Tul'kar's minions so the Predor could [[Cannibalism|eat]] his conquered foe.<ref name="Dawn of the Jedi 1" />

name: Orland
description: {{Quote|Lord Stryfe, the last of the patrols are returning to the ship now. There is no sign of anyone below on the planet.|Imperial [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Meeshal]], reporting on the activities of Orland and the rest of Joker Squad on Ossus|Legacy 17: Claws of the Dragon, Part 4}}Orland was a [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] who served [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire]] during the [[Second Imperial Civil War]]. In [[137 ABY]], Orland was a [[Private/Legends|private]] in [[Joker Squad]],<ref name="Legacy 17" /> a fighting [[Squad/Legends|squadron]] of the Empire's [[407th Stormtrooper Division]] under the command of [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Ran Harkas]].<ref name="Legacy 4">''[[Legacy 4: Noob]]''</ref> That [[Standard year/Legends|year]], the Jokers were part of an Imperial force led by the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Stryfe]] that was dispatched to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]] to search the world's former [[Jedi Academy (Ossus)|Jedi Temple]]. Although the temple was widely believed abandoned following an [[Massacre at Ossus|attack]] by [[Darth Krayt]]'s [[One Sith]]<ref name="Legacy 16">''[[Legacy 16: Claws of the Dragon, Part 3]]''</ref> [[130 ABY|seven years prior]],<ref name="Legacy 1">''[[Legacy 1: Broken, Part 1]]''</ref> Stryfe suspected it was a haven for [[New Jedi Order|Jedi]] survivors.<ref name="Legacy 16" />While Stryfe waited aboard a [[Unidentified Pellaeon-class Star Destroyer|Star Destroyer]] in Ossus's [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]], Orland and the rest of the Jokers searched the temple and its surroundings on the planet's surface. Orland found nothing and reported such to Harkas, who reminded the Private that Stryfe demanded thoroughness. Meanwhile, [[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] [[Anson Trask]] and [[Unidentified Joker Squad stormtrooper (sub-basement)|one other]] [[Trooper/Legends|trooper]] stumbled across a group of hidden [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in a sub-basement of the temple, but the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Shado Vao]] used a [[Mind trick/Legends|mind trick]] to cloud their thoughts and convince them that the temple was indeed abandoned. Satisfied, Joker Squad returned to the [[Pellaeon-class Star Destroyer|Star Destroyer]] and reported its lack of findings, but an unconvinced Stryfe ordered an [[Destruction of Ossus Jedi Academy|orbital bombardment]] of the temple.<ref name="Legacy 17" />

name: Ozz (soldier)
description: In [[3643 BBY]], Ozz and several other soldiers were called to [[Sebaddon]] where the [[Fastbreeder|hex droids]] produced there had the potential to wipe out the entire [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. During the [[Independent Operation Sebaddon|attack]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]], Ozz was short on words, but willing to follow [[Larin Moxla]]'s orders. They were commissioned by Larin to watch the weather so as not to land in a [[Volcano/Legends|volcano]].

name: Page
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Page was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Page remained at the Temple and participated in the [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]]. Administrated by Master [[Ilena Xan]], Page faced off against fellow Initiate [[Gilp]] .<ref name="YDR" />

name: Unidentified alien scientist
description: The [[Alien/Legends|alien]] took part in creating the [[Planet Killer]]. After [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] destroyed it, [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] had [[B1 battle droid/Legends|his guards]] to take him away.<ref name="Run Mace Run" />

name: Plevitz
description: {{Quote|While Zeltrons have little concern for military defense, they tend to keep themselves in peak physical condition.|An excerpt from ''Plevitz Essential Guide to Species''{{'s}} entry on Zeltrons|One of a Kind (comic)}}Plevitz was a professional [[author]] active during the last [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Plevitz was hired by the<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|36|Plevitz}}</ref> [[Sentientologist|senior anthropologist]]<ref name="EGAS">''[[The Essential Guide to Alien Species]]''</ref> [[Mammon Hoole]] to write the ''[[Plevitz Essential Guide to Species]]'',<ref name="CSWE" /> a piece of non-fiction reference literature that contained anthropological information on a variety of [[Species/Legends|species]] from across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. The ''Plevitz Essential Guide to Species'' was released sometime before the conclusion of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]],<ref name="One of a Kind">{{CWACite|8|One of a Kind}}</ref> which ended in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]].<ref name="TNEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref>In the reference literature, Plevitz included an entry on the [[Zeltron/Legends|Zeltrons]], a [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]] [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] species famous for their crimson [[red]] skin, insouciant lifestyle, and ability to love others unreservedly. In the entry, Plevitz wrote how the Zeltrons were naturally able to release potent [[Pheromone/Legends|pheromones]] and sense the emotions of other beings. Plevitz also noted that while the Zeltrons lacked concern for any military defense of their [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Zeltros/Legends|Zeltros]], they usually kept themselves physically fit. As a result, if a Zeltron found no other way to show their passion, they could become a fierce and dangerous warrior.<ref name="One of a Kind" />

name: Prod
description: [[Reproduction/Legends|Born]] on [[Newenurf]] and a member of a [[Prod's species|species]] that could display a large [[Bone/Legends|cranium]], Prod had little to no education, and the being's first notable job was as a [[terroga]] trainer for the [[Freklas Snarl Circus]], where Prod invented the concept of [[Random Audience Death]]. Sometime later, Prod moved on to work as a [[Prison/Legends|cell block]] disciplinarian for [[Our Mistress of the Bad Boys Prison]].<ref name="MAGL" />Prod served as [[Sergeant-at-Claws]] in the [[Special Loathsome Forces]] during the [[Megalomaniac Wars]]. After the conflict, Prod saw employment as a henchcreature, or private guard, for tyrannical despot [[Hortentious Clee]], [[Torture/Legends|torturing]] individuals with techniques such as [[air drowning]], [[Tooth/Legends|tooth]] removal, and [[Dismemberment/Legends|dismemberment]].<ref name="MAGL" />Sometime after these professional experiences, an unemployed Prod, living in the [[Sqra Castle]] on Newenurf, looked for a job in the field of institutional harassment and torture, creating a comprehensive resume. According to the document, employer references could be available upon request.<ref name="MAGL" />

name: Pumav
description: A [[Selonian/Legends|Selonian]] from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Selonia/Legends|Selonia]]<ref name="HoloNet" /> in the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] region,<ref name="atlas">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> Pumav was a sprinter alive during the waning days of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Pumav was capable of racing on either two or four [[Limb/Legends|limbs]], and, in [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], the Selonian won the quadruped race in the prestigious [[Mobquet Presents: Fastest Land Beings]] racing meet, held annually in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Pyre Folas]] on the planet [[Teyr/Legends|Teyr]]. The [[22 BBY/Legends|next year]], Pumav repeated as the Mobquet Presents' quadruped champion and also finished seventh in the meet's biped race, losing to the [[Teek (species)/Legends|Teek]] [[Yeep]], who easily outran Pumav and the rest of the competitors. Pumav received a [[Medal/Legends|medal]] for his victory, and he later posed for a picture along with Yeep and the meet's hexaped race winner, [[Yopaxtul]]. The events of that [[Standard year/Legends|year's]] meet, including Pumav's participation, were later reported on by the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]].<ref name="HoloNet" />

name: Ribbo Qua'lu
description: Around [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Ribbo Qua'lu worked at the [[Jawa Mountain Fortress]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].<ref name="AED" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Jinn Reeso
description: [[File:NaviorRacing.png|thumb|left|175px|Jinn Reeso (far right) races on Tatooine.]]Jinn Reeso competed as a professional [[Podracer/Legends|Podracer]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] in [[Podracing/Legends|Podraces]] during the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]]. Reeso flew a massive [[Color/Legends|black-and-gray]] [[Jinn Reeso's Podracer|Podracer]] that had average acceleration and an acceptable top speed.<ref name="E1R" />On the [[Spice/Legends|spice]]-[[Mining/Legends|mining]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Mon Gazza/Legends|Mon Gazza]], Reeso became quite skilled at the course known as the [[Spice Mine Run]] and shared the title of track favorite with fellow pilot [[Mars Guo/Legends|Mars Guo]].<ref name="E1R" /> Reeso also once raced on the [[Desert/Legends|desert]] planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] sometime before the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]] of 32 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|BBY]], going up against fellow Podracers [[Navior|"Bullseye" Navior]], [[Boles Roor/Legends|Boles Roor]], [[Neva Kee/Legends|Neva Kee]], [[Ody Mandrell/Legends|Ody Mandrell]], and [[Clegg Holdfast/Legends|Clegg Holdfast]] on a course that sped through the [[Hutt Flats/Legends|Hutt Flats]].<ref name="Prima">''[[Star Wars: Episode I Racer: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref><ref name="Prima2">''[[Star Wars: Episode I Racer: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]'' includes a picture of Jinn Reeso, [[Navior]], [[Boles Roor/Legends|Boles Roor]], [[Neva Kee/Legends|Neva Kee]], [[Ody Mandrell/Legends|Ody Mandrell]], and [[Clegg Holdfast/Legends|Clegg Holdfast]] competing in a [[Podracing/Legends|Podrace]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. According to {{DB|character|nevakee|Kee, Neva|archivedate=20100209230126}}, Kee disappeared during the the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]], which ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'' dates to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], never to be seen again. No source states that Jinn Reeso or Navior competed in the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]], so this article assumes that the pictured Tatooine race from the [[Star Wars: Episode I Racer|''Episode I Racer'']] strategy guide must have preceded the Boonta Eve race.</ref>

name: Homonix Rectonia
description: Homonix Rectonia was a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the early [[Manderon Period]],<ref name="TJP" /> which began in [[7000 BBY]].<ref name="Manderon Period">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'' {{C|The Hundred-Year Darkness (7,000 B.B.Y.)}}</ref> One of Rectonia's lasting contributions to the Order was the transcription of the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] in its classical form. Consisting of five precepts, the Code would be modified and altered over the [[Time/Legends|millennia]]; however, following the [[Ruusan Reformation]] of [[1000 BBY]], Rectonia's original work was restored by [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Fae Coven]] in ''[[The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force]]'', a [[Jedi Initiate|Jedi trainee]] [[Book/Legends|guidebook]] that was still in use during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] almost a millennium later.<ref name="TJP" />

name: Red Blade
description: A mysterious pirate who wore full body armor and never showed his face, Red Blade earned his name from the blood-red color of his armor. The Blade operated primarily in the [[Ison Corridor]] in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]], where the Blade raided and pillaged mid-size trade vessels with military escorts.<ref name="TOR Codex">{{TORcite|type=codex|Red Blade (Imperial Agent)}}</ref> According to Imperial dossiers, the Red Blade regularly docked at shadowports such as [[Port Nowhere]] and Wild Byth's. The Blade himself rarely emerged from his ship or the private suites the Blade would purchase upon landing, only appearing during celebrations of his latest score.<ref name="TOR Codex" />Sometime during his travels, the Blade encountered [[Dheno Rey]] on [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]]. The Blade ended up owing Rey credits, which the [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] would later attempt to collect from an impostor.During the Cold War, the identity of the Red Blade was assumed by an [[Cipher Nine|operative]] of [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]]. The [[Imperial agent]], who was attempting to convince [[Nem'ro]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] to form an alliance with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], used the identity they received from their [[Arcona/Legends|Arcona]] contact [[Jheeg]]. During their time on [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]], the agent encountered Dheno Rey in [[Jiguuna]], and was forced to kill him when the Zabrak threatened to blow their cover.<ref name="TOR:LH" />The real Red Blade became aware of the impostor on Hutta and sent his men to plant a bug in the agent's room, but they were discovered and killed by the agent. The agent continued under the alias until they departed Nal Hutta, when they were contacted by Jheeg on their way to Jiguuna's hangar. The Arcona informed the agent that the real Red Blade was on their way to the planet. The Red Blade was confronted by the agent as they landed, and the pirate threatened to reveal the deception to Nem'ro. As a result, the agent and the [[Rattataki/Legends|Rattataki]] [[Kaliyo Djannis]] fought and killed the pirate. With his last breath, Red Blade cursed his impostor.<ref name="TOR:LH" />

name: Rislar
description: Rislar served in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], rising to the rank of [[Captain/Legends|captain]] and commanding a small [[Starcutter/Legends|cutter]] for [[Imperial Office of Customs/Legends|Imperial Customs]]. On one occasion, the cutter was attacked by a crew of [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]]; one of the pirates was armed with a [[BlasTech Industries/Legends|BlasTech]] [[Firespray DL-87 stun rifle|Firespray DL-87]], which blew a hole right through the [[Starship/Legends|starship's]] [[Airlock/Legends|airlock]], resulting in half the cutter's crew being sucked out into vacuum. Most of the rest of the crew was killed by the pirates, although Rislar survived the encounter.<ref name="GFT" />The captain later left the Imperial Navy and struck out as a pirate and ship-jacker, in command of a crew. Rislar gave each member of the crew an elegant [[LaserHone]] [[Duelist vibrorapier]] in order to win their loyalty. The pirate believed this was one reason that none of the crew ever challenged for command.<ref name="GFT" />Rislar preferred weapons that could subdue opponents with minimal casualties. As such, the pirate often used [[DAS-430 Neural Inhibitor/Legends|DAS-430 Neural Inhibitors]] and [[stun grenade]]s. These also proved useful when encountering hostile [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]. In the final years of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]], at what Rislar considered a career low point, the pirate signed up with the Alliance to Restore the Republic as a [[Privateer/Legends|privateer]]. While having an [[Alliance observer]] aboard was not particularly pleasant, the privateer did appreciate the shipping schedules the Alliance provided. Rislar ceased working with the Alliance shortly after it transitioned into the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].<ref name="GFT" />Years later, Rislar often posted comments on arms and equipment in [[Gundark (arms dealer)|Gundark's]] [[Gundark's Gear Datalog|''Gear Datalog'']].<ref name="GFT" />

name: Ixian Rovieda
description: Discovered near birth to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and raised at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], Ixian Rovieda trained at the [[Jedi academy|academy]] there and learned the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduating]] and studying as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Rovieda passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] and was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|recognized]] as a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="HNN" />Just prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Rovieda was dispatched to [[Kabal/Legends|Kabal]] with fellow Knights [[Nygreena Clo]], [[Plessus Ghon]], and the Padawan [[Renxis Dielle]] to end the month-long riots in the capital city of [[Shoribus]]. The riots begun due to planet-wide food shortages, and were only ended when the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] dropped parcels of rations and other food stuff within the city. The riots claimed many lives, including that of [[Premiere]] [[Jan Dovu]]; holo-footage of several robed bodies were transmitted over the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] and the High Council confirmed that Rovieda and the other Jedi were indeed dead.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Ryssk
description: {{RPG|''[[Tempest Feud]]''}}The [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] Ryssk lived and operated as a [[Scout/Legends|scout]]<ref name="TFMUD" /> in the early [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] reign.<ref name="CSWEts">{{CSWECite|III|230|tempest spice}}</ref> A capable [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] who carried several weapons,<ref name="TFA1">''[[Tempest Feud]]'' Appendix One: GM Characters pg.114</ref> Ryssk was hired by the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Mika Anjiliac Chiera]] to pursue [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] who had learned that Mika was controlling the distribution of [[Tempest (spice)|tempest]] [[Spice/Legends|spice]] to [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. The scout often appeared before the [[Bounty/Legends|targets]] while they were at a disadvantage, particularly when those spacers were already involved in combat with a third party.<ref name="TFMUD" />{{Endgame}}

name: S'diawae
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], S'diawae had gained the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and served the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] with distinction. Postmortem, Master S'diawae was recognized by the [[Biscuit Baron]] corporation during the time of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], a political schism threatening the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] during its final decade. As part of a campaign to boost patriotism and historical recognition, Biscuit Baron released commemorative [[Holocube/Legends|holocubes]] of Master S'diawae in their [[QuickSnack]] and [[QuickSnackLite]] bundles.<ref name="HNN49" />

name: Skein
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Skein was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. When the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] devolved into open war against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Master Skein was raised to the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Due to the Confederacy's employment of Force-users and other dangerous beings, the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] found it necessary to reopen an ancient prison facility known as [[The Prism]]. Assigning Skein to the facility in secret, the warden of the clandestine [[Space station/Legends|space station]] was attended by one hundred [[Security droid/Legends|security droids]] to assist in the day to day operations of the facility. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] visited the facility to conduct a survey of the living conditions of the prisoners. By the end of the war, the facility was attended by [[Unidentified Prism Jedi|another Jedi Master]].<ref name="GP3" />

name: Siro
description: {{Quote|Lieutenant Siro! You have the bridge for a sim. The admiral and I will be running it from the auxiliary bridge.|Captain Biurk, to Lieutenant Siro|Legacy of the Force: Exile}}Siro was a [[Gotal/Legends|Gotal]] who served as a [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] aboard the [[Shamunaar (frigate)|''Shamunaar'']], a [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]] that belonged to the [[Galactic Alliance Defense Fleet]]. In [[40 ABY]], the ''Shamunaar'' was stationed in the [[Both system]] in order to prevent [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] forces from attacking a [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]] task force that had [[Blockade of Corellia|blockaded]] the [[Corellian system]]. The [[Corellian/Legends|Corellians]] were [[Second Galactic Civil War|revolting]] against the [[The galaxy/Legends|Galactic]] Alliance, and the Bothans had pledged their support to the insurrection.<ref name="Exile" />While the ''Shamunaar'' waited in the Both [[Star system/Legends|system]], Galactic Alliance [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Matric Klauskin]] arrived on the [[Starship/Legends|ship]]. Unbeknownst to the crew, he was being manipulated by the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lady]] [[Lumiya]], who had been fueling the war from its onset and had convinced the Admiral to betray the Galactic Alliance. Klauskin ordered the ''Shamunaar''{{'s}} [[Captain/Legends|captain]], [[Biurk]], to run a simulation involving a Bothan [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] attacking the ''Shamunaar'', and the Captain placed Siro in control of the [[Bridge (starship)/Legends|bridge]] as he and Klauskin left to run the simulation from the ship's auxiliary bridge. Klauskin promptly [[Death/Legends|killed]] Biurk and contacted Siro, informing the Gotal that the frigate's external communications had been disabled. Siro indicated receipt of the message, and the Admiral proceeded to [[Slicer/Legends|slice]] into the ship's main [[Computer/Legends|computer]] and open every external [[Airlock/Legends|hatch]], exposing Siro and the rest of the crew to outer [[Realspace/Legends|space]] and suffocating them. Klauskin sealed the auxiliary bridge and survived, however; he then turned the ''Shamunaar'' over to the Bothans.<ref name="Exile" />

name: Yrada Soludisan
description: When the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] broke out between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Soludisan was called before the High Council to accept a mission. The Council informed Soludisan that the Confederacy had been in contact with the [[Pirates of Iridium]] in the [[Atrivis sector/Legends|Atrivis sector]] and were planning to steal shipments of [[Spice/Legends|spice]] from a host of Republic convoys. Under the leadership of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] and [[Belsed-Qan Idan]], Soludisan and several other Jedi accompanied a task force of [[Judicial Department/Legends|Judicial Department]] [[Judicial/Legends|agents]] aboard the [[Consular-class cruiser|Republic cruiser]] ''[[Monitor III]]''. Protected by a number of [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Jedi-piloted starfighters]], the Jedi were ambushed immediately after coming out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]].<ref name="HNN" />Surprised by the pirates' powerful weaponry, augmented by their unique [[Power gem|gem technology]], the ''Monitor III'' sustained heavy damage, killing many Judiciaries and three Jedi Knights. Among the dead were Jedi [[Aruden Kej]], [[Dovish Hokken]], and Soludisan. The ''Monitor III'' survived the skirmish and was able to return to Coruscant without any further causalities, though the mission was deemed a failure.<ref name="HNN" />

name: Sooloot
description: A [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], Sooloot studied the [[Chosen One/Legends|Prophecy of the Chosen One]] before concluding that it was written down sometime around the [[First Great Schism]]. As to the mention of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], Sooloot believed that the mention of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] on the prophecy was added at a later date for clarification of the intended meaning. Jedi [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Fae Coven]] would remark on Sooloot's beliefs in the chapter entitled, ''The Prophecy of the Chosen One'' within her [[Jedi Temple|Temple]] guidebook, ''[[The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force]]''. However, the text about the Chosen One would later be removed by [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Sidious]].<ref name="TJP" />

name: Spineless Headcheese
description: The Spineless Headcheese never left Orion Ferret's presence during an incident when Ferret tried and failed to cheat [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]].

name: Jan Stakross
description: {{Quote|And guess who gets to clean it up? Old Jan, that's right.|Maintenance Logs of Jan Stakross, speaking of the T-16 skyhopper|Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II}}[[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] Jan Stakross was a [[Sentience/Legends|being]] who warned a group of [[Species/Legends|individuals]] not to take a [[T-16 skyhopper/Legends|T-16 skyhopper]] down to a place called [[Agarees Shipyard Township]], because the township was infested with [[Mynock/Legends|mynocks]]. Stakross knew that, despite the warnings, [[Unidentified joyrider|one]] of the beings was taking the [[Skyhopper/Legends|skyhopper]] down to the [[Shipyard/Legends|Shipyard]] [[Hangar/Legends|docking bay]] for a joyride. The T-16 became infested with mynocks, and nearly every bit of cabling had bite marks on it from the creatures. Although Stakross did not like it, the Corporal was the one who had to clean up the skyhopper. After cleaning the T-16, Stakross asked the group of beings to stay away from the Shipyard, where the mynocks were.<ref name="TFUII">''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II]]'' {{C|[[PlayStation 3|PS3]]/[[Xbox 360]] databank}}</ref>

name: Sthonnart
description: In the year [[5 ABY/Legends|5.5 ABY]], Major Sthonnart served in the fleet under the command of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], the son of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], who directed a full scale assault against the warlord [[Cronal|Shadowspawn]]. The major was stationed onboard the cruiser [[Justice (MC80 cruiser)|''Justice'']] where it was destroyed moments later during the start of the [[Battle of Mindor|battle]] on [[Mindor/Legends|Mindor]]. Afterwards, Sthonnart moved with the survivors inside a cave and were to await further instructions from Skywalker.{{Char-stub}}

name: Galdos Stouff/Legends
description: [[File:Sora_bulq.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Sora Bulq, Stouff's Master]]A [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], Galdos Stouff was selected to be the [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] of [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Sora Bulq/Legends|Sora Bulq]], a gifted [[Swordmaster|swordsman]] and [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|fighting]] instructor.<ref name="Databank: Sora Bulq" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> separatist forces of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] captured [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] after [[Sexes/Legends|he]] [[Dogfight over Geonosis/Legends|tracked]] the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]] to the<ref name="AOTC">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref> [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]]. [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] member [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] assembled a [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] of 200 Jedi to rescue Kenobi from the Separatists. Stouff and Bulq were part of the team that infiltrated the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]] on Geonosis, where Kenobi was being held.<ref name="ITWOSW" />The Jedi task force faced numerous [[Geonosian/Legends|Geonosian]] [[Warrior caste (Geonosian)/Legends|warriors]] and Confederate [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] as the ensuing [[Lightfight|fight]] turned into a [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|full-scale battle]]. Though Bulq and Stouff incapacitated a dozen guards on the arena's tribune,<ref name="ITWOSW" /> the number of adversaries overwhelmed the Jedi, and many were [[Death/Legends|killed]], including Stouff. In the engagement's aftermath, Bulq was listed as a casualty of the battle, but he ultimately survived. The loss of Stouff and many other of his former students on Geonosis<ref name="Databank: Sora Bulq" /> eventually led Bulq to fall to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], and he subsequently joined the Separatists.<ref name="Jedi: Mace Windu">''[[Jedi: Mace Windu]]''</ref>

name: T'Bolton
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] being, T'Bolton was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Attaining the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], when the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], T'Bolton survived until the final year of war when he was dispatched to the [[Siege of Saleucami/Legends|front lines]] of [[Saleucami/Legends|Saleucami]] under the command of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Oppo Rancisis/Legends|Oppo Rancisis]].<ref name="R76" />During the fighting there, Jedi T'Bolton was killed in the fighting with the [[Morgukai Shadow Army]]. During the [[Funeral of Oppo Rancisis|funeral]] of Master Rancisis, fellow Jedi [[K'Kruhk]] mourned his fallen comrade, along with the others who had died on the battle field.<ref name="R76" />

name: Taf
description: Taf was captured, along with fellow Savrips [[Clu]] and [[Mev (Savrip)|Mev]], by a [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver known as [[Phylus Mon|The Mon]]. The Savrips were sent to The Mon's slave zoo onboard the ''[[Animiasma]]'' and jailed in the same cell. Still unbroken, the Savrips would rather find and hurt the Mon more than escape.Although unwilling to communicate to anyone outside the cells, the Savrips noticed four [[Tarasin]] children imprisoned in another cell, [[Li'Iri]], [[Honna]], [[Tiscak]] and [[Kaj]]. Honna speaked with the Savrips and understood their language using her own Force abilities. The Savrips, feeling sorry for the children, promised to protect them: Should anyone try to take the children against their wills, the Savrips would defy the energy bars of their cell to stop the evil-doers. Honna was glad that it did not happen, because the energy bars could have easily wound or kill the Savrips.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion blaster/Legends|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Tan'tro
description: After the Rebels learned of an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] convoy gathering near [[Orron III]] en route to the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star]], Tan'tro was part of a combined force of [[BTL Y-wing starfighter/Legends|Y-wings]] from [[Red Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Red]] and [[Gold Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Gold]] squadrons and a [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]] from [[Blue Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Blue Squadron]] sent to destroy the convoy. Tan'tro would fly in Red Squadron along with [[Keyan Farlander]] and [[Ahsmar]] for the mission.Ahsmar and Tan'tro were engaging escorting [[Alpha-class Xg-1 Star Wing/Legends|Assault Gunboats]] when Farlander requested their assistance in destroying a [[BFF-1 bulk freighter|freighter]]. Both Y-wings turned tail on the Imperial fighters in their haste to help and were destroyed by the Gunboats, killing the pilots.Farlander's briefing officer, [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Lagrane]] suspended him from operations pending an official inquest regarding the incident. He was eventually returned to active duty with a warning and a compulsory visit to the flight simulators for some brushing up.

name: Asvo Tel
description: Tel was in a shuttle with fellow Sarkan [[Wub Vevris]] and other travelers. Both Sarkans believed that non-Sarkans where stinking barbarians, and disliked the company of others. The shuttle was captured by slavers, probably under the orders of slaver ringleader [[Phylus Mon]]. Both Tel and Vevris were captured, while the other travelers were apparently left unharmed.The Sarkans, resentful of the situation, were sent to Phylus Mon's slave zoo onboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. They were eager to trade gems for their freedom &ndash; none of them believed in the [[Galactic Credit Standard]]. Nevertheless, they tried to retain their composure while doing so, "like any self-respecting being should do."Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion gun|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Darth Tenebrous's Sith Master
description: [[File:DarthTenebrousHS-SWI130.jpg|thumb|left|150px|The Sith Master trained Darth Tenebrous in the Sith ways.]]In the final [[Standard century/Legends|centuries]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]],<ref name="TTW" /> a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]]<ref name="DP" /> who was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|sensitive]] to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] joined the [[Order of the Sith Lords]], eventually ascending to the rank of [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]]. In keeping with the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Bane/Legends|Darth Bane's]] [[Rule of Two/Legends|Rule of Two]], which limited the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] to a [[Sith Master/Legends|Master]] and [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]], the Twi'lek Sith [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] eventually took the [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] [[Sexes/Legends|male]] [[Darth Tenebrous|Rugess Nome]] as his pupil, naming him [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Tenebrous. The Twi'lek Sith Master and Tenebrous were dedicated to advancing the [[Grand Plan]], which was a Sith imperative focused on destroying the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and the Republic. The pair worked for [[Standard year/Legends|years]] to develop a [[virus]] that would target and sever a Jedi's connection to the Force. However, the Master and Tenebrous ultimately abandoned the project. At some point during the Sith Master's reign, the Twi'lek opened a [[Wound in the Force|rift in the Force]], allowing the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] to sense the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] for the first [[Time/Legends|time]] in the eight centuries since the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[New Sith Wars]].<ref name="DP" />[[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Tenebrous's Sith Master burdened the Bith with studying the Force, which Tenebrous viewed as simple. The Bith eventually came to believe that the Force was an energy source that he could manipulate in order to achieve his goals. After reading the prophecies in the [[Journal of the Whills/Legends|Journal of the Whills]] regarding the [[Chosen One/Legends|Chosen One]] who would bring balance to the Force, Tenebrous was determined to use a variation of the [[Dark transfer|essence transfer]]&mdash;a [[Force power/Legends|Force technique]] that enabled its user to transfer his or her consciousness into another body&mdash;at the moment of the [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|individual's]] [[Reproduction/Legends|birth]], thus making himself the Chosen One.<ref name="TTW" /> Around [[167 BBY]],<ref name="Note 1" /> when Tenebrous's calculations for his scheme were complete, the Twi'lek was [[Death/Legends|slain]] by his apprentice, who went on to take the [[Muun/Legends|Muun]] [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Hego Damask]] as his apprentice, naming him Darth Plagueis.<ref name="TTW" />Plagueis, the Sith Master's eventual successor, acknowledged the Twi'lek's role in advancing the Grand Plan to topple the Jedi and the Republic and opening a rift in the Force. The Muun Sith Lord recounted the Master's and Tenebrous's achievements to his apprentice, [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]].<ref name="DP" />

name: Tiscak
description: In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> as a youngling, Tiscak was captured along with three fellow Tarasin children, [[Li'Iri]], [[Honna]] and [[Kaj]], due to their innate Force-sensitivity. Their captor, [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver [[Phylus Mon]], jailed them in a cell in his slave zoo aboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. He also flogged all of the children with his three-tailed barbed whip. The following day, Tiscak still retained the lash marks in the face.Their disappearance did not go unnoticed, Jedi Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] knew of the kidnappings, and even suspected of Phylus Mon, but still could do nothing to rescue them. The children were kept in the cell, the only Force-sensitives in the zoo. They instinctively disliked fellow prisoner [[Halin Bok]]. Honna also managed to communicate with the [[Mantellian Savrip/Legends|Mantellian Savrips]] in another cell, [[Clu]], [[Taf]] and [[Mev (Savrip)|Mev]]. The Savrip promised to go through the energy bars to rescue the children should anyone try to take them against their will. Honna was scared of that, because the energy bars could easily kill the Savrips should they ever try that.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the [[Heart/Legends|heart]] of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's [[Death/Legends|death]], but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion gun|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Jorus Trass
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Jorus Trass was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], achieving the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Stationed on [[Almas]] in the [[Cularin system]], Master Trass served as the [[Chief Linguist]] of the [[Jedi academy|academy]], having trained as a [[Jedi Researcher|researcher]] and specializing as a [[Jedi Researcher#Jedi linguist|linguist]] for many years.<ref name="SOM" />Among Master Trass' contributions to the field, the Jedi was most famed for the endeavors put into the research of the [[Tarasin Skintone Language|Skintone Language]] of the [[Tarasin]] species. Master Trass compiled all the research findings in a published document entitled, ''[[Shades of Meaning]]''.<ref name="SOM" />

name: Tren (Kolatill)
description: Tren was a resident of the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Domaz]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kolatill]] in the [[Kathol sector]] during the early [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].<ref name="O">{{DarkStryder|Omens|The DarkStryder Campaign}}''</ref> In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], ruler of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], was [[Death/Legends|killed]] at the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]],<ref name="ROTJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref> prompting the local Imperial [[Moff/Legends|Moff]], [[Kentor Sarne]], to withdraw the Kathol [[Sector/Legends|sector]] from the Empire. [[8 ABY/Legends|Four years later]], the New Republic launched a campaign against Sarne, [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|liberating]] the sector [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]] and forcing the [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] to flee into the Kathol sector with the majority of his [[Moff Sarne's forces|fleet]].<ref name="TSB">{{DarkStryder|The Saga Begins|The DarkStryder Campaign}}</ref> News of the New Republic's victory at Kal'Shebbol reached the population of Kolatill shortly after, prompting an uprising that resulted in the imprisonment of their Imperial [[Governor/Legends|governor]], [[Tetrum]], and the reinstatement of the [[Kolatill Council]] to lead them.<ref name="O" />In response to this turn of events, the Imperial [[Ton-Falk-class escort carrier|''Ton-Falk''-class escort carrier]] ''[[Kathol Protector]]'' arrived [[Kolatill system|in-system]] and deployed [[TIE/sa bomber/Legends|TIE bombers]] to [[Bombing of Domaz|assault]] Domaz. The attack left the city aflame and in ruins, leveling much of the infrastructure. Tren survived the assault and, in the aftermath, ran the [[Foodstuff/Legends|food]] distribution efforts from an emergency relief complex. Four [[Standard day/Legends|days]] after the attack, the New Republic [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'' arrived at the planet, having intercepted a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress call]] about the bombing. [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Keleman Ciro]], [[Commander/Legends|commanding]] [[Officer/Legends|officer]] of the [[Corvette/Legends|corvette]], deployed relief teams to the surface to assist in recovery efforts.<ref name="O" />{{RPGseed}}Due to a shortage of available personnel, Tren requested the assistance of ''FarStar'' crew members in delivering food supplies to outlying neighborhoods. During the mission, Tren and the New Republic representatives defused an unexploded [[Bomb/Legends|bomb]], protected the supplies from looters, and prevented a building from exploding due to a severe gas leak. They also managed to dig several survivors of the attack out of the rubble of a demolished building.<ref name="O" />{{Endgame}}

name: Gabrel Treon
description: Treon wrote an extensive historical article called ''[[Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Praji: A Cartel of Genes]]'', which focused on the powerful [[Praji family]]. The article was later published in the ''[[Byblos Journal of Historical Science]]'', around [[104 ABY]].<ref>{{Hyperspace|url=hyperspace/source/praji/20090205.html|text=Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Praji|int=Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Praji}}</ref>

name: Hoche Trit
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Hoche Trit was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and active during the era known to history as the [[Golden Age of the Old Republic]]. Master Trit was influential in the reforms that followed the [[Ruusan Reformation]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]], introducing the notion that a Jedi served the Force first and could not have external loyalties that trumped loyalty to the Order. Trit's writings would influence the codification of the Order's policies regarding the age of [[Jedi Initiate|Initiates]] and the forbidding of marriages amongst Jedi. Additionally, Master Trit's words aided the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] to make it officially inappropriate for Jedi to accept political positions or gifts unless they could aid a mission.<ref name="POTJ" />

name: Adarian Tropis
description: Adarian Tropis was a [[legislator]] from [[Salliche/Legends|Salliche]] who had grown tired of the corrupt government on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. Around [[242 BBY]], Tropis had gained a following of like-minded idealists, and they left Salliche to form a new colony where each member of the community had a voice in government. They choose the planet [[Varonat]], as scouting reports had identified rich, fertile soil in the area known as the [[Great Jungle]]. The colonists established a settlement that would eventually become [[Tropis-on-Varonat]]. However, the soil's fertility lasted only a single season, and the native [[Morodin/Legends|Morodin]] creatures constantly trampled crops and spread their secretions over the plants.<ref name="FC" />Tropis theorized that the animals secretions were a natural fertilizer, and gave the Morodin free run of several fields for a season. However, the food grew to be yellow and inedible, and the settlers treated the Morodin as pests, chasing them away from the fields. Tropis eventually died on Varonat, and the colonists lost their idealism of a self-sufficient society and began to rely on off-world shipments.<ref name="FC" />

name: Broon Ters
description: Broon Ters was an individual who was a contemporary of the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Doton Het]], who was alive during the<ref name="kotor2">''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords]]''</ref> [[Dark Wars]],<ref name="kotorcg">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> a series of conflicts between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Triumvirate|remnants]] of the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]]<ref name="kotor2" /> that began in [[3955 BBY]].<ref name="kotorcg" /> On one occasion, Ters played a [[Gambling/Legends|gambling]] card game called [[Pazaak/Legends|pazaak]] against Het.<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|III|15|Pazaak}}</ref> At one point during the pazaak match, both Ters and Het had won two rounds of play each. At the time, Ters had two cards left to use and Het had three cards remaining.<ref name="TCSWE" />

name: Unidentified Aqualish aide
description: In 32 BBY, during the Invasion of Naboo, an [[Ualaq/Legends|Ualaq]] [[Aqualish/Legends|Aqualish]] aide was beside [[Po Nudo/Legends|Po Nudo]] in the senate. They also continued to serve alongside [[Po Nudo|Nudo]] when the Senator pledged his allegiance to the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and the [[Separatist Council]] respectively, they also continued to assist [[Po Nudo]] and work alongside the Senator's other aide, the [[Shi'ido]] changeling, [[Nank Tun]] after the formation of the [[Hyper-Communications Cartel]] and up until their deaths at the hands of the newly christened [[Darth Vader ]]on [[Mustafar]] along with the other members of the [[Separatist Council]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Unidentified Aurorient Express band conductor
description: {{Quote|Well, should we play another?|The conductor to the band|Qui-Gon and Obi-Wan: The Aurorient Express 2}}[[38 BBY/Legends|Thirty-eight]] [[Standard year/Legends|years]] before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], an individual from an [[Insectoid/Legends|insectoid]] [[Species/Legends|species]] served as the [[Musician/Legends|conductor]] for a [[Aurorient band|band]] that played on board the ''[[Aurorient Express]]'', a [[Luxury liner/Legends|luxury liner]] that was cruising the [[Gas giant/Legends|gas giant]] of [[Yorn Skot]]. Unbeknownst to the conductor and the other passengers, the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] was besieged by [[Fastlatch-class defense droid|''Fastlatch''-class defense droids]], and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] had been dispatched on a mission to thwart the attack. It was when the two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] had crashed through a [[Window/Legends|skylight]] and onto a banquet table that the conductor and the band were interrupted and made aware of their presence.<ref name="Ish1" />Disguised as an attack by [[pressure pirates]] and orchestrated by the [[Green Forge]] eco-[[Terrorist/Legends|terrorist]] organization, the group intended to use the ship to destroy the Yorn Skot [[Yorn Skot mining station|gas mines]] owned by wealthy business being [[Clode Rhoden]]. Due to the attack, the passengers of the beleaguered ship were ordered to evacuate. The evacuation was carried out in an orderly fashion, with the passengers assigned to various [[Escape pod/Legends|life pods]] by number. During the evacuation, the conductor was still directing the band, and inquired as to whether or not they should play another [[Music/Legends|song]]. The maestro was asked by the [[Cephalopoid|mollusk]] musicians if the ship had life pods large enough to support them, to which the insectoid replied that such a design feature was assumed. The band leader was interrupted by a boarding call that announced the insectoid's assigned life pod. The conductor bid the band good luck and hurried to evacuate.<ref name="Ish2" />Later, the conductor was reunited with the band aboard a [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[rescue frigate]]. The insectoid rushed to greet the bandmates, who appeared irritated.<ref name="Ish2" />

name: Unidentified bounty hunter (Dova Brigger)
description: A unidentified [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] captured [[Dova Brigger]], who had a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] placed on her and her [[Kal Brigger|brother]], by the leader of the [[Smugglers' Confederation]] [[Nirama]].<ref name="Millennium Falcon">[[Millennium Falcon (novel)|''Millennium Falcon'']]</ref>

name: Unidentified Coruscant Police officer (Panza Hondi)
description: An individual worked for the [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Police Force]] as a [[Police officer/Legends|police officer]]<ref name="SWBH" /> as of the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]].<ref name="Date" /> While working as an [[Officer/Legends|officer]], the individual served on the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic's]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]], [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. At one point, the officer was taking a break from [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|police]] duties only to be attacked<ref name="SWBH" /> and [[Death/Legends|murdered]]<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|II||Hondi, Panza}}</ref> by a [[Guineo]] criminal named [[Panza Hondi]], who beat the officer to death. In response to the killing, the Coruscant Police Force put a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on Hondi worth 2,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for live capture and 1,000 credits for [[Sexes/Legends|his]] death.<ref name="SWBH" /> Hondi was eventually apprehended by the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]]<ref name="TCSWE" /> after the [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|Battle of Naboo]] in 32 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|BBY]].<ref name="Date" />

name: Unidentified duck individual
description: [[File:Duckfull.jpg|thumb|left|100px|The space duck, running to warn Tana]]In [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] seized the [[Ionic Ring Ship]] of noted inventor [[Renn Volz]], which housed the [[Ion Ring]], a device that could alter the climate of a [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. The Empire wanted to turn the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] on worlds with a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] presence; their first target was the world of [[Rion/Legends|Rion]]. The Ion Ring [[Devastation of Rion|turned]] the once-tropical planet into an [[Water/Legends|icy]] world, freezing the planet's [[Foodstuff/Legends|food]] supply and driving its people into desperation, amongst them this duck-like being, who was at [[Tana's Resort]], a resort facility on the world operated by [[Tana (Human)|Tana]]. The Empire then demanded the arrest of all Rebels on the planet and sent down [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] to enforce this.<ref name="kessel" />When [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo's]] vessel, the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']], carrying Renn Volz's daughter [[Mira Volz|Mira]]&mdash;on the run from the Empire ever since the capture of her father&mdash;arrived on Rion, a number of resort patrons, including the duck, stormed the ship, demanding food and bemoaning their plight. Solo was directed towards Tana, who was in the resort, and the duck followed. Within the resort it met with a number of other [[Alien/Legends|aliens]].<ref name="kessel" />However, the Empire was close behind Mira Volz. The duck soon left the resort, and while outside overheard another local informing a squad of stormtroopers that Volz was in the resort. It ran back to Tana and warned her of the stormtroopers on the way, and thanks to the being's alert, Tana was able to help Solo and Volz [[Skirmish on Rion|escape]].<ref name="kessel" />

name: Unidentified Dulok cub 3
description: {{Quotetrans|I'm sure you know how we Duloks love to torture Ewoks. Well, your torture will be the most exquisite of all: babysitting the Dulok brats.|Gorneesh, to Latara|The Travelling Jindas}}[[File:Urgah's ultimatum (TTJ).jpg|thumb|left|The Dulok child joined two other toddlers in driving their mother to demand a babysitter.]][[Urgah]], [[Queen/Legends|queen]] of a [[Gorneesh's tribe|tribe]] of [[Dulok/Legends|Duloks]] who lived in a [[Dulok Swamp|swamp]] on the [[Endor/Legends|Forest Moon]] of [[Endor (planet)/Legends|Endor]], [[Reproduction/Legends|bore]] at least three [[Youngling/Legends|cubs]]<ref name="TTJ" /> by [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]],<ref name="TTJ" /><ref name="BTM">''[[Star Wars: Behind the Magic]]''</ref> children sired by her [[Marriage/Legends|husband]], [[King/Legends|King]] [[Gorneesh]]. That [[Standard year/Legends|year]], the three pups were toddlers; although [[Unidentified Dulok cub 1|one]] [[Sexes/Legends|male]] and [[Unidentified Dulok cub 2|one]] female child went about with some clothing, the third was unadorned.<ref name="TTJ" /><ref name="gender">This article assumes that the Dulok child with shell pauldrons is male, because they match the body adornments of the child's father, King Gorneesh. Likewise, the Dulok with the pink shawl is assumed to be female due to the clothing's similarities to the shawl worn by Queen Urgah. Conversely, the third Dulok has no clothing; thus no gender identity is evident.</ref>In 3 ABY, the naked Dulok child joined the other two toddlers in harassing their [[Parent/Legends|mother]] while she attempted to do laundry in the family hut; the unclothed Dulok stood atop the matriarch's shoulders and pulled furiously at her [[Hair/Legends|hair]]. The experience drove Urgah to threaten Gorneesh: either find a babysitter for the children or go hungry. The King accordingly enlisted [[Unidentified Dulok (X)|two]] [[Unidentified Dulok (O)|guards]] to kidnap a caregiver from nearby [[Bright Tree Village/Legends|Bright Tree Village]], a [[City/Legends|settlement]] of [[Ewok/Legends|Ewoks]]. The pair returned with a [[Color/Legends|gray]]-furred female Ewok named [[Latara]], a newcomer whom Gorneesh considered a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] fit for the [[Torture/Legends|torture]] of watching the children. The three Dulok pups greeted their new babysitter by embroiling her in an impromptu wrestling match.<ref name="TTJ" />The new babysitting arrangement did not last long, however: Latara's friends&mdash;the Ewoks [[Paploo/Legends|Paploo]], [[Kneesaa a Jari Kintaka]], [[Teebo/Legends|Teebo]], and [[Wicket Wystri Warrick|Wicket W. Warrick]]&mdash;infiltrated the Dulok village by disguising themselves and joining the [[Travelling Jindas]], a group of wandering [[entertainer]]s who were admitted into the Dulok swamp to put on a show. After the three Dulok cubs dragged Latara to the front row, the toddlers joined their fellow Duloks in lampooning the performers. However, the [[Jinda]] [[magic]]ian [[Trebla]] pulled Latara onto the stage to serve as his assistant, leaving the children with their parents. Although the Ewok interlopers inadvertently revealed their presence during the performance, the Jindas managed to abscond with Latara in tow.<ref name="TTJ" />

name: Unidentified Elomin task force commander
description: [[File:Elomin task force.png|thumb|right|The Elomin task force]]This [[Elomin/Legends|Elomin]] was a [[Combined Defense Forces of the New Republic|New Republic Military]] officer who commanded a [[Elomin task force|task force]] comprising four [[Assault Frigate Mark I]]s supported by several [[Fighter wing/Legends|wings]] of [[Incom Corporation/Legends|Incom Corporation]] [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighters]]<ref name="HTTE" /> and manned exclusively by his fellow Elomin. In [[9 ABY/Legends|9 ABY]], the [[Task force/Legends|task force]] was on patrol in the [[Obroa-skai system/Legends|Obroa-skai system]]<ref name="HTTESB">''[[Heir to the Empire Sourcebook]]''</ref> as part of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic's]] [[Diplomat/Legends|diplomatic]] efforts to bring the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Obroa-skai/Legends|Obroa-skai]] into the Republic. While in-[[Star system/Legends|system]], a small force of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Scout/Legends|scout]] [[Starship/Legends|ships]] decanted from [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] and began an information raid against Obroa-skai's [[Celebratus Archive|massive library]]. The Elomin commander directed his task force to intercept, and the Imperial scout ships began to flee back into hyperspace. The Elomin ordered his ships to pursue and, before the task force entered hyperspace, a communication was sent back to their New Republic superiors informing them of the formation's actions.<ref name="HTTE" />Upon reversion to [[Realspace/Legends|realspace]], the Elomin commander ordered his task force to deploy in a [[symmetric cloud-vee formation]] as they chased the scout ships toward their mother ship, the [[Imperial II-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial II''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Chimaera/Legends|''Chimaera'']]. The Republic force was more than sufficient to deal with one lone [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]], so the Elomin commander elected to engage the Imperial force. As the task force moved in, the ''Chimaera''{{'s}} [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] sentry line engaged the vanguard of the New Republic task force while the scout ships made for the safety of the Star Destroyer; the sentry line took a single casualty before falling back. As the New Republic task force closed on the ''Chimaera'', the Star Destroyer's Sector Four sentry line scrambled out of the way, then reformed behind the Elomin task force and began [[Jammer|jamming]] all transmissions.<ref name="HTTE" />[[File:Battle of Obroa-skai (Galactic Civil War)2.JPG|thumb|left|The wreckage of the task force]]The commander of the ''Chimaera'', the [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]], had deduced that there was an Elomin commanding the task force judging by the way that the opposing New Republic commander had engaged the initial sentry line during the opening moments of the engagement. With that in mind, Thrawn tailored a counter to the opposing commander's attack. Knowing that the Elomin mind was logical and incapable of reacting to unstructured and undisciplined attack profiles, Thrawn deployed his starfighter [[Squadron/Legends|squadrons]] in a simple [[Marg Sabl/Legends|Marg Sabl]] closure maneuver to break up the incoming attack. The Elomin commander, psychologically unable to deal with the tactic, attempted to counter it, but to no avail. The ''Chimaera'' entered the battle, and within an hour the commander was [[Death/Legends|dead]], and his task force completely destroyed.<ref name="HTTE" />

name: Unidentified Fian apprentice
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Fian]] was identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] with the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] circa [[25,000 BBY]]. Stationed at a camp with several other Jedi, the Fian sat around a campfire with fellow apprentices [[Cope Shykrill]], a [[Unidentified Human apprentice|Human]] and a [[Unidentified Nosaurian apprentice|Nosaurian]]. While listening to a shadow play by Shykrill, the [[Selonian/Legends|Selonian]] apprentice called upon the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] to send the [[Nosaurian/Legends|Nosaurian]] into a rage and slaughter the Fian and the Human. While Shykrill was injured himself in an attempt to cast suspicion onto the Nosaurian, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Sar Agorn]] and [[Nuck Lyu]] saw through the ruse and killed the dark sider.<ref name="JVS" />

name: Unidentified Givin Jedi
