description: {{Quote|It's time to brief the other Jedi.|Obi-Wan Kenobi, prior to leading a mission briefing that the Givin Jedi attended|Republic 50: The Defense of Kamino}}A [[Givin/Legends|Givin]] with sunken [[Color/Legends|black]] [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] and a white, [[Hair/Legends|hairless]] [[exoskeleton]] was a [[Jedi/Legends|member]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. During the opening [[Standard month/Legends|months]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the Givin was an [[Officer/Legends|officer]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]],<ref name="Republic 50" /> and two months into the war,<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> the Givin was one of several Jedi who were withdrawn from their commands and sent to defend the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]] from the [[Invasion/Legends|invading]] [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Kamino was [[Homeworld/Legends|home]] to over one million developing [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Army/Legends|Army]], and when intelligence uncovered by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]] and [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] revealed that it was the Confederacy's next target, the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] gathered Jedi there to repulse the invaders.<ref name="Republic 50" />In Kamino's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Tipoca City/Legends|Tipoca City]], the Givin stood with a group of fellow Jedi and listened to a pre-[[First Battle of Kamino|battle]] briefing led by Jedi Knight [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Kenobi and Master [[Oppo Rancisis/Legends|Oppo Rancisis]], the latter joining the group via [[Hologram/Legends|hologram]], outlined a defensive plan that involved Jedi [[Pilot/Legends|manning]] [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Delta-7 ''Aethersprite''-class interceptors]] and [[Starfighter combat/Legends|intercepting]] incoming Confederate [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] while other Jedi remained planet-side to supervise [[Ground warfare|ground defenses]]. Confederate [[Confederacy military/Legends|forces]] attacked shortly thereafter, but the Jedi and [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] [[Trooper/Legends|troopers]] were able to repel them and ultimately force a Confederate retreat.<ref name="Republic 50" />

name: Unidentified Gungan villager (Otoh Raban)
description: [[File:Otoh_Raban.png|thumb|right|200px|Otoh Raban, the villager's home]]{{Quote|The Boss has returned! Wesa are at your service, Gallo.|The Gungan villager, following Hoxie's rescue|Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds}}A [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] villager lived in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Otoh Raban]], under the leadership of [[Boss/Legends|Boss]] [[Hoxie]], on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]<ref name="SW:GB" /> in the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3000 BBY]],<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]'' places the [[War of the Gungan tribes|Gungan war]], in which the villager fought, in this [[Standard year/Legends|year]].</ref> During a [[War of the Gungan tribes|war]] between the Gungan tribes at that [[Time/Legends|time]], the villager saw the [[Kidnapping of Hoxie|kidnapping]] of Hoxie committed by the [[Rogoe's army|forces]] of the Gungan [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[Rogoe]] in order to cause Otoh Raban to continue fighting in the conflict in the absence of their leader. Later, the villager encountered Boss [[Gallo/Legends|Gallo]], a Gungan who was attempting to unite the tribes against Rogoe, and the villager told [[Sexes/Legends|him]] of Hoxie's kidnapping, and also warned that Otoh Raban would keep fighting until their Boss was returned. Gallo agreed to [[Battle of the Forest Cities|rescue]] Hoxie to gain Otoh Raban's allegiance and, after following up rumors of a [[Rogoe's stronghold|prison camp]] north of Otoh Raban that belonged to Rogoe, found Hoxie there and brought him back to his city. The villager thanked Gallo for rescuing Hoxie, and they, along with the rest of Otoh Raban, joined Gallo's crusade against Rogoe.<ref name="SW:GB" />

name: Unidentified Horned Soldier (Army of Light)
description: A hairy biped with cranial horns, the warrior served [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]], a [[Jedi Lord]] who maintained a feudal kingdom on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. During the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[New Sith Wars|war]] with the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Skere Kaan]]'s [[Brotherhood of Darkness]], the warrior answered the call of his Lord to join together with a band of [[Farfalla's Knights|three hundred warriors]], made up of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] and commoners, to reinforce the entrenched forces of the [[Army of Light]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]]. Armed with a [[Sword/Legends|sword]], the soldier fought in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[Ruusan campaign|campaign]].<ref name="jvs" />

name: Unidentified Human apprentice
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] was identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] with the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] circa [[25,000 BBY]]. Stationed at a camp with several other Jedi, the Human sat around a campfire with fellow apprentices [[Cope Shykrill]], a [[Unidentified Fian apprentice|Fian]] and a [[Unidentified Nosaurian apprentice|Nosaurian]]. While listening to a shadow play by Shykrill, the [[Selonian/Legends|Selonian]] apprentice called upon the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] to send the [[Nosaurian/Legends|Nosaurian]] into a rage and slaughter the Fian and the Human. While Shykrill was injured himself in an attempt to cast suspicion onto the Nosaurian, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Sar Agorn]] and [[Nuck Lyu]] saw through the ruse and killed the dark sider.<ref name="JVS" />

name: Unidentified Humanoid Soldier (Farfalla's Knights)
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|male]] [[Humanoid/Legends|Humanoid]], the warrior served [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]], a [[Jedi Lord]] who maintained a feudal kingdom on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. During the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[New Sith Wars|war]] with the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Skere Kaan]]'s [[Brotherhood of Darkness]], he answered the call of his Lord to join together with a band of [[Farfalla's Knights|three hundred warriors]], made up of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] and commoners, to reinforce the entrenched forces of the [[Army of Light]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]]. Armed with a [[Sword/Legends|sword]], the soldier fought in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[Ruusan campaign|campaign]].<ref name="jvs" />

name: Unidentified Jedi (SX troop shuttle)
description: Serving the Order when tensions between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] came to a breaking point, this Jedi reported to Coruscant at the onset of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] and received the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. When the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] disbanded the Jedi Order with the issuance of [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], this Jedi was surrounded by [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] who opened fire without apparent cause. Managing to escape, this Jedi responded to [[Iwo Kulka]]'s [[Emergency Code Nine Thirteen/Legends|distress call]] on [[Dellalt/Legends|Dellalt]] where they met with eight other Jedi survivors. Hijacking an [[SX troop transport|SX troop shuttle]] in order to escape the world, the Jedi were attacked by agents of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. The resulting firefight took the life of this Jedi and three others. Their body was taken on board the smuggler ship, the ''[[Drunk Dancer]]'' after having died in [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]].<ref name="DL" />

name: Unidentified Jedi (Talasea)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], this individual had received [[Jedi training/Legends|instruction]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and had been a member of the Order during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. While their position in the Order and their rank or degree of involvement in the war is lost to history, it is known that they escaped the horrors of [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], a treacherous order issued by the twisted [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]]' alter ego, [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] of the Republic [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] to wipe out the Jedi. With the Order disbanded and the Republic in ashes as the anti-Jedi [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] emerged, this individual fled to the planet [[Talasea]] and took up residence on a sparsely settle continent. Living in a small farming village, this individual's presence was discovered by Sith Lord [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. Arriving on planet with a group of [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]], Vader slew all of the villagers for aiding the Jedi in hiding before executing the Jedi.<ref name="XRS" />

name: Unidentified Jedi Knight (Clone Wars)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], this individual was discovered by the Jedi Order<ref name="TJP">[[The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force (real-life book)|''The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force'']]</ref> sometime prior to [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]<ref name="Warfare date">''The Essential Guide to Warfare'' places the beginning of the Clone Wars in 22 BBY, and the game starts shortly after the First Battle of Geonosis, also in 22 BBY; therefore, the apprentice must have been trained prior to the Clone Wars.</ref> and was trained in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. The Initiate, who had earned distinction as a promising student, proved their comprehension of the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]], self-discipline via [[Meditation/Legends|meditation]] and [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]], and their strong attunement to the flow of the Force, passing the [[Initiate Trials]]. The apprentice gained the attention of a Master and was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] student.<ref name="TJP" />At about this time the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] (CIS) had united against the Republic, and the Jedi had no choice but to fight in the conflict, and like all apprentices the Padawan was given the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Jedi Commander]].<ref name="Warfare">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref> In the [[War room (Jedi Temple)|war room]] of the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the Padawan convened with famed [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]], [[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] and [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], along with [[Clone marshal commander/Legends|clone marshal commander]] [[CC-2224/Legends|CC-2224]] and [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]] [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]]. They welcomed the Padawan formally into the Jedi Order, and Windu<ref name="CWA: War Room">{{TCWA|loc=War room}}</ref> presented them their first [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="Virtual World">''[[Star Wars: Clone Wars Adventures: The Official Guide to the Virtual World]]''</ref>Fighting in many early battles such as the [[Mission to Iceberg Three|campaign on]] [[Iceberg III]], the [[Battle of Umbara/Legends|conflict]] on [[Umbara/Legends|Umbara]], the [[Battle of Ryloth/Legends|battle]] for [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], the [[Skirmish on Carlac|skirmish]] on [[Carlac/Legends|Carlac]] and the [[Second Battle of Geonosis/Legends|second battle]] of [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], the Padawan was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] and given the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]].<ref name="CWA" />

name: Unidentified Jedi Knight (documentarian)
description: This [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual was inducted into the Jedi Order at an early age and [[Jedi training/Legends|instructed]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at one of the Order's [[Jedi academy|academies]] before passing his [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], this Jedi took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and fought throughout the war. During this time, this Jedi was in the process of assembling a documentary on the species represented within the Order. It is unknown how much of the documentary he accomplished by the time of the end of the war, but it is known that death prevented him from completing his work. During the fighting, the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] betrayed the Order by issuing [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] being led by the Jedi Generals in battle. This particular Jedi was one of many to die during the fall of the Order and the Republic.<ref name="FOTJ" />

name: Unidentified Jedi Knight (Garth Ezzar)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and achieved the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] during the decade marked by the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] and the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. During an encounter with the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]], the Knight was [[Death/Legends|slain]], one of three Jedi who met their end on Ezzar's [[Lightsaber/Legends|blade]].<ref name="LFD" />

name: Unidentified Jedi Knight 1 (Murkhana)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], this individual received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at an [[Jedi academy|academy]] and eventually attained the rank of Knight. Accepting the role of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] at the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], this individual was stationed on [[Murkhana/Legends|Murkhana]] during the last part of the war. Participating in the [[Battle of Murkhana (Clone Wars)|battle]] there under the leadership of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Saras Loorne]], this Jedi was aboard a [[Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry/Legends|Republic gunship]] with Loorne and [[Unidentified Jedi Knight 2 (Murkhana)| another Knight]] when the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] betrayed the Order with the issuance of [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]]. The [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] under this Jedi's command obeyed the executive order and shot down the Jedi's gunship, killing all three.<ref name="DL" />

name: Unidentified Jedi Knight 2 (Murkhana)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], this individual received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at a [[Jedi academy|academy]] and eventually attained the rank of Knight. Accepting the role of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] at the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], this individual was stationed on [[Murkhana/Legends|Murkhana]] during the last part of the war. Participating in the [[Battle of Murkhana (Clone Wars)|battle]] there under the leadership of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Saras Loorne]], this Jedi was aboard a [[Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry/Legends|Republic gunship]] with Loorne and [[Unidentified Jedi Knight (Murkhana) 1|another Knight]] when the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] betrayed the Order with the issuance of [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]]. The [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] under this Jedi's command obeyed the executive order and shot down the Jedi's gunship, killing all three.<ref name="DL" />

name: Unidentified Jedi Master (Gran)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Gran/Legends|Gran]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], he was appointed as a member of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], the governing body of the Order. During his time on the Council, the [[Kaleesh/Legends|Kaleesh]] [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] was revealed to be the [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies]]. By [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] he was no longer a member of the Council.<ref name="GG" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Unidentified Jedi student (Garth Ezzar)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the decade marked by the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] and the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. During an encounter with the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]], the Padawan was [[Death/Legends|slain]], one of three Jedi meet their end on Ezzar's [[Lightsaber/Legends|blade]].<ref name="LFD" />

name: Unidentified Junker
description: This [[Junker/Legends|Junker]] lived in a camp in the junkyards of Lotho Minor, along with other Junkers. Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Dathomirian/Legends|Dathomirian]] [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] arrived on the planet in search of his lost brother, [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]], and was accompanied by [[Morley/Legends|Morley]], an [[Anacondan/Legends|Anacondan]] he used as a guide.While searching the planet, the two came across the Junker campsite, and the Junkers, along with this one, became agitated and started attacking the two. Morley retreated back into a pile of rubbish while Savage confronted the Junkers with [[Savage Opress's lightsaber/Legends|his dual-bladed]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. However, this Junker stayed behind and pulled out his [[Blaster/Legends|Sniper blaster]], preparing to snipe Savage. Morley spotted the Junker and hit him with his tail, causing him to miss to shot which was then deflected back at him by Savage's lightsaber.

name: Unidentified light-haired Imperial Knight
description: In [[137 ABY]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] with light hair served [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] of the [[Empire-in-exile]] as an [[Imperial Knight]]. The Knight was one of many who acted as a [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] to the Emperor in that [[Standard year/Legends|year]]<ref name="Legacy 46" /> as [[Sexes/Legends|he]] secretly [[Mission to Agamar|rendezvoused]] with representatives of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]]. The two groups met on the planet's [[Grass/Legends|grassy]] plains, and every Imperial Knight and [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] dressed in a [[Farm/Legends|farmer]] disguise. Several Imperial Knight Masters stood with Fel as he and the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[K'Kruhk]] negotiated an alliance against the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Krayt]]'s [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Empire]];<ref name="Legacy 45">''[[Legacy 45: Monster, Part 3]]''</ref> the light-haired Knight and a group of other Imperial Knights stood away from the proceedings and furthered their farmer deception by pretending to tend to a nearby field.<ref name="Legacy 46" /><ref name="Legacy 45" /> After Fel and K'Kruhk struck an agreement, the talks were interrupted by [[Morrigan Corde|Nyna Calixte]]&mdash;the [[Director of Imperial Intelligence]] for Krayt's Empire&mdash;who was secretly an ally of Fel's.<ref name="Legacy 45" />As she rode a [[Agamarian beast|local animal]] into the field where the light-haired Knight stood, Calixte was knocked to the ground when two Imperial Knights fired [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifles]] at the beast. She told the two groups that [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Krayt's [[One Sith|Sith]] knew about the meeting, and that a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]&ndash;Imperial [[First Sith Imperial Strikeforce|task force]] was en route to Agamar to capture or [[Death/Legends|kill]] the Emperor.<ref name="Legacy 45" /> A Sith strike team emerged from nearby swamps, and the Jedi and Imperial Knights jettisoned their farmer disguises as a [[Operation: Thunderstroke|battle]] began. When [[Antares Draco]],<ref name="Legacy 46" /> the leader of the Imperial Knights,<ref name="LECG">''[[Legacy Era Campaign Guide]]''</ref> called on his Knights to defend their Emperor, the light-haired Knight ignited a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. Every Jedi and Imperial Knight began to fight off the attacking Sith in an effort to protect Fel, and at least ten Sith fell to their enemies' blades and to Calixte's [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]].<ref name="Legacy 46" /> Some Jedi and Imperial Knights died as well,<ref name="Legacy 48">''[[Legacy 48: Extremes, Part 1]]''</ref> but the Emperor and most of the survivors managed to evacuate the battlefield on the escape [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] ''[[Defender One]]''.<ref name="Legacy 46" />

name: Unidentified Padawan (Dark Jedi Conflict)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the last millennia of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. A student of the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], the [[Jedi Initiate]] was selected by a [[Unidentified Jedi Knight (Dark Jedi Conflict)|a female Jedi Consular]] to train as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. Along with his master, the pair was dispatched by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] to bring an end to the [[Dark Jedi Conflict]] which had consumed the [[Cularin system]] in [[181 BBY]]. Teaching the natives of the [[Star system/Legends|star system]] to fight and mobilize against the [[Kibh Jeen's army|armies]] of the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|fallen Jedi]] [[Kibh Jeen]], the Jedi pair were able to lure Jeen's warriors into a trap. During [[Final battle of the Dark Jedi Conflict|the battle]], the Padawan and the Knight confronted Jeen and slew him, bringing his reign of terror to an end.<ref name="JVS" />

name: Unidentified Padawan (Wasskah)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the final decade of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. During a training mission the Padawan was captured by [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] slavers and taken to the hunter's [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Wasskah/Legends|Wasskah]].<ref name="pl" /> around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]]<ref name="swa-2011" /> Once there, the Padawan was to be hunted by Trandoshan [[Hunting/Legends|hunters]] and, while attempting to avoid the murders, was [[Death/Legends|killed]] there. [[Kalifa/Legends|Kalifa]], the leader of a group of [[Jedi Initiate]]s hiding on the moon, later informed the newly arrived [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] about the Padawan's fate.<ref name="pl" />

name: Unidentified Reptilian Soldier (Farfalla's Knights)
description: A large reptilian [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]], the warrior served [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]], a [[Jedi Lord]] who maintained a feudal kingdom on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. During the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[New Sith Wars|war]] with the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Skere Kaan]]'s [[Brotherhood of Darkness]], the warrior answered the call of the Lord to join together with a band of [[Farfalla's Knights|three hundred warriors]], made up of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] and commoners, to reinforce the entrenched forces of the [[Army of Light]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]]. Armed with a [[Sword/Legends|sword]], the soldier fought in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[Ruusan campaign|campaign]].<ref name="jvs" />

name: Unidentified Revwien Tyia adept
description: In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], at the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the Tyia masters on [[Revyia]] were highly disturbed by the deaths of so many [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] during the execution of [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], which they could sense through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. The [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]] prompted them to call a meeting within a [[Revyia temple|temple]] grown from the largest [[Tree/Legends|trees]] on their world. They then charged their most capable students, including this individual, with seeking out any surviving Jedi in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and aiding them in whatever way possible.This Tyia adept sought out and consulted with a Human Jedi.<ref name="Jedi Academy">''[[Jedi Academy Training Manual]]''</ref>

name: Unidentified Selkath Jedi
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Selkath/Legends|Selkath]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the final [[Time/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. The Selkath served during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], which was a [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy-wide]] conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. During an engagement with a squad of [[B2 super battle droid/Legends|B2 super battle droids]], the Selkath Jedi used a [[protosaber]] during [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|combat]], utilizing [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] during the skrimish.<ref name="JATM" />

name: Unidentified Sith (Taalon's strike team)
description: [[File:GavarKhai-Allies.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Gavar Khai, who accidentally killed the Sith]]A [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] who lived around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Second Galactic Civil War]] was a member of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], a group from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]].<ref name="Allies" /> In [[44 ABY]],<ref name="TERC" /> the Sith member was chosen to accompany [[High Lord (Circle of Lords)|High Lord]] [[Sarasu Taalon]]'s [[Sith armada (Lost Tribe of the Sith)|convoy]] of eleven [[ChaseMaster]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigates]] to ally with [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] for a [[Mission to the Maw|mission]] to find the [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] being [[Abeloth]]. However, afterward, Taalon planned to betray and [[Death/Legends|kill]] Skywalker and force Abeloth to serve the Sith Tribe.<ref name="Allies" />After arriving on [[Abeloth's planet]] and finding the being, the allied forces engaged her in combat. The Sith, along with Taalon, Skywalker, [[Sith Saber]] [[Gavar Khai]], and one [[Unidentified Sith 2 (Taalon's strike team)|other]] Sith, battled with Abeloth. However, she suddenly disappeared, and Khai's [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] strike, intended to hit Abeloth, passed through the empty space where she had been a moment before and carved through the Sith, resulting in the Sith's death. As Abeloth reappeared and the battle continued, [[Diet/Legends|carnivorous]] [[Plant/Legends|vines]] began to rip apart the dead Sith's corpse.<ref name="Allies" />

name: Unidentified Sith trooper (catacombs)
description: {{Quote|I began this project ''decades'' ago, culling those strongest in the Force shortly after their births&hellip; augmenting and improving them&hellip; forging them into my ''Sith troopers''.|Darth Krayt, speaking of his Sith trooper army|Legacy 50: Extremes, Part 3}}[[Time/Legends|Decades]] before [[138 ABY]],<ref name="Extremes Trade" /> a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual was discovered by the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Krayt]] shortly after being [[Reproduction/Legends|born]]. Krayt gathered the individual and a number of other [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-sensitive [[Youngling/Legends|infants]] and began to physically augment and improve them, forging them into extremely loyal and obedient [[Darth Krayt's Sith trooper|Sith troopers]]<ref name="Legacy 50" /> deep beneath the surface<ref name="Legacy 49">''[[Legacy 49: Extremes, Part 2]]''</ref> of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Korriban]]. He kept the project secret from his [[One Sith]] Order, whose members he knew to harbor their own ambitions and desires.<ref name="Legacy 50" />By 138 ABY,<ref name="Extremes Trade" /> the individual had become a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Trooper/Legends|trooper]] in the Dark [[Lord/Legends|Lord's]] [[Army/Legends|army]]. The trooper was in Korriban's catacombs, guarding the doors to a [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] full of [[Annihilator-class starfighter|''Annihilator''-class starfighters]], as Krayt gave a tour of the project's facilities to [[Darth Nihl]] and [[Darth Talon]], two of his most trusted [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]]. When Krayt ordered the trooper to commit [[Suicide/Legends|suicide]] in a demonstration of the army's loyalty, the trooper immediately ignited a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and was [[Shiak|impaled]] beneath the chin before falling over, [[Death/Legends|dead]].<ref name="Legacy 50" />

name: Unidentified spaceport controller
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] controller worked at [[Montrol Spaceport]], located in [[Montrol City]], the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Gandle Ott]] in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] of the [[Kathol sector]]. In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], the controller was on duty when the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'' entered the [[Ott system]] and requested permission to land. The [[Starship/Legends|ship]], in [[DarkStryder Campaign|pursuit]] of the rogue [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]], had learned that their quarry had been at Gandle Ott [[Standard day/Legends|days]] before, and were seeking leads to continue their mission. As per standard procedure, the ''FarStar''{{'s}} request was handled by the spaceport traffic control computer. However, the computer had been influenced by Montrol City's resident [[BRT supercomputer]], [[CUTH-BRT-92-X3]]. Moff Sarne, aware of the New Republic pursuit, had arranged for CUTH-BRT-92-X3's control systems to be overridden, and instructed the computer to delay any ship following him by any means necessary.<ref name="dirp" />To that end, CUTH-BRT-92-X3 interfered with the traffic control computer and kept suggesting to it that the ''FarStar'' had only just arrived in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]], and was a low-priority vessel. This caused the traffic control computer to bump the ''FarStar'' to the back of the landing queue every ten [[Standard minute/Legends|minutes]]. Eventually, the command crew of the ''FarStar'' tired of the delay, and bypassed the [[automated beacon]] to speak directly to the controller. The Human could not explain the reason for the delay, noting that they rarely had problems with the landing software. Despite the malfunction, the controller worked swiftly, clearing the ''FarStar'' for landing in a VIP berth space.<ref name="dirp" />

name: Unidentified Weequay Mag-lev officer
description: During the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]], the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] wanted to capture [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]. When [[Stass Allie/Legends|Stass Allie]], [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]], [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]], and [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] attempted to take Palpatine to safety, [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] caught up to them on a [[Hovertrain/Legends|mag-lev]] train, where this [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]] was working as part of the security personnel. The Weequay told Windu that they could not fight against Grievous and his [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]]. Windu told the Weequay to open the door of the mag-lev train, which allowed him and Fisto to get to the rear car, and defend against the [[Droid/Legends|droids]].

name: Unidentified Wide-Eyed Soldier (Farfalla's Knights)
description: A long-necked biped with wide eyes, the warrior served [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]], a [[Jedi Lord]] who maintained a feudal kingdom on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. During the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[New Sith Wars|war]] with the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Skere Kaan]]'s [[Brotherhood of Darkness]], the warrior answered the call of his Lord to join together with a band of [[Farfalla's Knights|three hundred warriors]], made up of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] and commoners, to reinforce the entrenched forces of the [[Army of Light]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]]. Armed with a [[Sword/Legends|sword]], the soldier fought in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[Ruusan campaign|campaign]].<ref name="jvs" />

name: Unidentified Wookiee mercenary
description: While operating as a [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]], a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] worked for the security firm known as [[Aurodium Sword/Legends|Aurodium Sword Executive Security]], an organization that protected wealthy clients from those who might try to harm them. In that position, the Wookiee worked alongside a free-agent [[Advanced Recon Commando/Legends|ARC trooper]] known as [[Alpha-66|Muzzle]] and another Wookiee, a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Snoova]]. Some [[Time/Legends|time]] before [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], a [[Unidentified Sullustan executive|Sullustan executive]] hired Aurodium Sword's services. When an industrial [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] [[Squad/Legends|squad]] found the [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] and [[Unidentified Aurodium Sword skirmish|opened fire]], the Wookiee mercenary, Muzzle, and Snoova came to their charge's aid.<ref name="UAGoSaV 39" />An image of the altercation reached an [[Unidentified Imperial intelligence agent|Imperial intelligence agent]],<ref name="UAGoSaV 39" /> who sent it along with a report on Aurodium Sword to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Maximillian Seerdon]] of the [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]]<ref name="UAGoSaV 34">{{InsiderCite|89|Underworld: A Galaxy of Scum and Villainy}}, p. 34</ref> placed both the report and the image in a dossier on underworld figures he compiled shortly after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. The report made no mention of the Wookiee's name or that of the agent who had sent the image of the mercenary skirmish.<ref name="UAGoSaV 39" />

name: Unidentified Wookiee passenger
description: At some point in the early [[Standard day/Legends|days]] of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] passenger once traveled aboard a [[StarSpeeder 1000]] chartered by the [[Star Tours/Legends|Star Tours]] [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] travel agency. When the Wookiee tourist boarded the [[Starship/Legends|spacecraft]], he or she took a seat between a [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] [[Unidentified Mon Calamari passenger|passenger]] and an elderly [[Sexes/Legends|female]]. Shortly before departure, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Youngling/Legends|youngling]] sitting in front of them used a [[Camera/Legends|camera]] to take a picture of the two [[Alien/Legends|non-Humans]]. As the flash option was activated, the Wookiee and the Mon Calamari were blinded by the sudden burst of light. While the startled Wookiee tourist threw their arms up in the air in displeasure, the child's mother reprimanded her son. That event was later immortalized when it was included on the safety video Star Tours showed to their passengers before taking off<ref name="ST2" /> between the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] [[1 BBY/Legends|1]] and [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]].<ref name="ST2 date">According to ''[[Star Wars Insider 127]]'', p. 48, ''[[Star Tours: The Adventures Continue]]'' takes place between [[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']] and [[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']]. In the attraction's queue, the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[G2-9T/Legends|G2-9T]] refers to the secret base of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], the [[Great Temple (Yavin 4)/Legends|Great Temple]] on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]]. According to {{FFCite|132|VAS3-4, ''The Yavin Vassilika''}}, the Rebels only acquired the key to the Great Temple in [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]]. The attraction must therefore take place after that.</ref>

name: Unidentified Wookiee pirate
description: This individual was a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]]<ref name="Mott 52" /> who worked for [[Xishel]], a [[Falleen/Legends|Falleen]] competing for control of the fractured [[Nanth'ri Pirates]].<ref name="Mott 55" /> The Nanth'ri Pirates were a loose assortment of brigands who plundered the [[Nanth'ri Route]] under [[Celis Mott]]. Following Mott's capture by the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] sometime after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]],<ref name="Era">This adventure occurs while Celis Mott is captured. [[Otherspace (adventure)|''Otherspace'']], pp. 3&ndash;4, establishes that this occurs after the genesis of the [[Shantipole Project]], circa the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]].</ref><ref name="Otherspace">[[Otherspace (adventure)|''Otherspace'']], p. 4</ref> Xishel hired the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Scout/Legends|scout]] [[Marka Durn]] to uncover Mott's treasure hoard. When Durn tried to squeeze Xishel for more [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], Xishel dispatched this Wookiee, along with several other pirates, to [[Death/Legends|kill]] Durn.<ref name="Mott 55" /> The Wookiee shot Durn fatally in the chest, but not before the Human passed on clues to the treasure's location to an [[Marka Durn's associate|old associate]]. The pirates confronted the associate and tried to bully him into revealing Durn's message; however, following a [[Lightfight|firefight]], the ruffians were forced to flee.<ref name="Mott 52" />

name: Unidentified Wookiee worker 2
description: Between the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] [[39 BBY/Legends|39 BBY]] and [[36 BBY/Legends|36 BBY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'' places the [[Alaris Prime colonial war]] between [[39 BBY/Legends|39 BBY]] and [[36 BBY/Legends|36 BBY]].</ref> a [[Color/Legends|brown]]-[[Hair/Legends|haired]] worker of the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Species/Legends|species]] traveled to [[Alaris Prime/Legends|Alaris Prime]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of the [[Gas giant/Legends|gas giant]] [[Alaris/Legends|Alaris]], to be part of the [[Alaris Prime colonial war|colonization effort]] being undertaken by the Wookiees. Along with [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 1|two]] [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 3|other]] Wookiees, the worker went to a [[Unidentified Wookiee command center|base]] to collect resources under instructions from [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], who was sent by the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] to oversee the colonization effort.<ref name="SW:GB" />{{Gamemechanics|option=1|Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds}}The workers began their task by harvesting [[Foodstuff/Legends|food]] from [[Muja fruit/Legends|muja fruit]] [[Bush/Legends|bushes]] close to the [[command center]], the only building in the base. The workers soon had gathered enough food to allow the base to support a [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 4|fourth]] worker to join them, and once even more food was collected, [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 5|another]] worker arrived at the base. Jinn then instructed the workers to practice a drill in case they were attacked by [[Gundark/Legends|gundarks]], a predatory species on Alaris Prime. The drill required the workers to cease activity and take refuge in the command center. After the drill was completed, the worker and the other Wookiees were told to focus their attention on gathering [[Carbon/Legends|carbon]], a resource collected from [[Tree/Legends|trees]] that could be turned into [[Duraplast/Legends|duraplast]] and used as building material.<ref name="SW:GB" />Soon after, one of the leaders of the colonization of Alaris Prime, [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], arrived at the command center. Simultaneously, four gundarks [[Attack on the Wookiee command center|attacked]] the base, forcing the worker and the other Wookiees to take shelter in the command center as they had previously practiced. With assistance from Chewbacca and using the building's [[Autoturret/Legends|turret]] system, the workers were able to fight off the gundarks and [[Death/Legends|kill]] them. Chewbacca then explored the nearby area, finding deposits of [[Nova crystal/Legends|nova crystals]], which could be used as a form of currency in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], and [[Ore/Legends|ore]], a resource that could be processed into [[Durasteel/Legends|durasteel]]. The worker took part in gathering these resources for the base.<ref name="SW:GB" />{{Endgame}}

name: Unidentified yellow-eyed Twi'lek Jedi
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], this [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually achieving the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Active in the year [[340 BBY]], they successfully averted an assassination attempt on a public official. Reporting back to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], this individual filed an official report with the [[Unidentified High Master|current]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] of the age.<ref name="TCOPL" />

name: Urtsk
description: When [[Dass Jennir]], [[Beyghor Sahdett]], and the crew of the ''[[Uhumele]]'' arrived at the casino in search of Hudorra, Urtsk and its partner, [[Kal (bodyguard)|Kal]], backed the already imposing [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] up, greatly intimidating [[Meekerdin-maa]]. When Sahdett [[Duel on Kestavel|betrayed]] Hudorra and Jennir, Urtsk and fellow guard [[Makall]] rushed to attack the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] with their [[Vibro-ax/Legends|vibro-axes]]. The pair were no match for the former [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], however, and the [[Verpine/Legends|Verpine]] killed them both by [[Sai tok|bisecting]] them with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].

name: Va'too
description: Va'too was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual who lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Va'too was taken and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], reaching the rank of a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and later that of a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. At some point, Va'too took the [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Aargauun]] [[Talia Moonseeker]] as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] learner.<ref name="WS" /> Around [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> Moonseeker successfully passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] and became a full-fledged [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knight herself.<ref name="WS" />Four [[Standard month/Legends|months]] later, Jedi Knight [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] was captured by forces of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] during a mission on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]]. Jedi Master [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] summoned a [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]]<ref name="WS" /> consisting of over 200 Jedi<ref name="Inside AOTC">''[[Inside the Worlds of Star Wars: Attack of the Clones]]''</ref>&mdash;including Va'too and Moonseeker&mdash;to rescue the trio. However, their rescue effort turned into a large [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|battle]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] in the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|arena]] where Kenobi was to be executed, and Va'too was [[Death/Legends|killed]] during the fighting. When the battle had ended, Moonseeker returned to the arena and mourned the loss of her Master. Afterward, she made sure that Va'too's corpse was carried away from the battlefield.<ref name="WS" />

name: Gyaos Vader
description: {{Quote|Luke, it's Obi-Wan. I'm being held on Kessel. Help!|Obi-Wan Kenobi's distress call to Luke Skywalker|Star Wars (1987 video game)}}In the early [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], a [[Changeling/Legends|changeling]] named Gyaos Vader lived in an [[Abandoned Kessel temple|ancient temple]] on [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]],<ref name="SW87" /> a barren [[Planet/Legends|planet]] located in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="GATORW">''[[Geonosis and the Outer Rim Worlds]]''</ref> In its natural form, this being looked like a [[Bone/Legends|skeletal]] [[Bird/Legends|bird]], but it could take the likeness of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]],<ref name="SW87" /> [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] and second-in-command of the [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]].<ref name="DBVader">{{DB|character|darthvader|Vader, Darth|archivedate=20110824160257}}</ref>Around [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Gyaos Vader captured the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and held him [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoner]] on Kessel,<ref name="SW87" /> the [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]]-shaped planet.<ref name="EGP">''[[The Essential Guide to Planets and Moons]]''</ref> The young [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooinian]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], who had began his [[Jedi training/Legends|Jedi training]] under Kenobi, came to the rescue of his Master. Once Skywalker reached the creature's lair in the temple, he faced Gyaos Vader, who had taken the shape of the Lord Vader in order to surprise him. Both opponents drew their [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] and engaged in a duel. During the [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|fight]], the creature turned back to its true shape and began flying around the room. Skywalker and the changeling traded several blows, but the young Jedi got the upper hand. Having killed Gayos Vader, Luke Skywalker freed Master Kenobi and set off for [[Iskalon/Legends|Iskalon]], where the [[Gold/Legends|golden]] [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] had been been taken hostage by [[Clados Vader|another shapeshifter]].<ref name="SW87" />

name: Va'Lonis
description: Va'Lonis and the band traveled to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]-owned [[Yacht/Legends|Yacht]], ''[[Sleemo Poya Jeedai]]'', where they were due to perform at a concert. While they waited for the show to begin, they met with a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] who were providing them with extra security during the event. They were investigating [[Niklas Cories]], who they believed posed a threat to the band. Va'Lonis claimed that he knew the location of Cories, claiming that he was on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coriesant]], as it was named for his family. He also revealed to them his interpretation of the [[Rule of Two/Legends|Rule of Two]] and claimed that there were two [[Sith academy|Sith Academies]], a [[Sith Master/Legends|Master]] Academy and an [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] Academy. Va'Lonis and the band performed in the concert and during it, Cories attempted to destroy the ship.Va'Lonis had a large ego and disagreed with the band's [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] manager, [[Zim Zimley]], over what was best for the band.

name: Clados Vader
description: {{Quote|It's C-3PO. I'm being held on Iskalon. Come save me!|C-3PO calling Luke Skywalker for help|Star Wars (1987 video game)}}Clados Vader was a malevolent [[Changeling/Legends|shapeshifter]] who lived on the [[Water/Legends|oceanic]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Iskalon/Legends|Iskalon]],<ref name="SW87" /> in the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim Territories]].<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> It could assume the appearance of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]&mdash;hence the creature's name.<ref name="SW87" />Shortly before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|destruction]] of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]], Clados Vader took the [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] hostage in an underwater chamber. [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] came to rescue his friend and confronted the monster, who had metamorphosed into Lord Vader. One swipe of the [[Padawan/Legends|Jedi apprentice's]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and the fake Vader transformed back into its real form, an enormous [[Shark/Legends|shark]]-like creature with a pinkish [[Color/Legends|hue]]. After the shapeshifter was defeated, Luke Skywalker and C-3PO set off to battle the Death Star.<ref name="SW87" />

name: Sarn Vals
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Sarn Vals was discovered by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] as an infant and [[Jedi training/Legends|instructed]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. Eventually completing training and passing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Vals was elevated to the rank of Jedi Knight by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="BTT" /> Serving the Order throughout the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a violent and costly conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Vals was able to survive an attack by the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]]. The Grand Army, which the Order had fought alongside and commanded during the entire conflict, turned on their Jedi leaders when [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] betrayed the Jedi and initiated [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] in a secret scheme to destroy the Order.<ref name="BTT" />Fleeing into exile, Vals escaped to the [[Corporate Sector/Legends|Corporate Sector]] and went to ground. However, when a disturbance was reported in the sector, the [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitorius]] of the newly formed [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] traced it back to the fugitive Vals and sent agents to locate and destroy the Quarren Jedi outlaw.<ref name="BTT" />

name: Vamilad
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Vamilad achieved the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Active during the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Vamilad survived the end of the conflict, which also heralded the end of the Republic and the Jedi Order.<ref name="IC501" />As the Republic died and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] sprung up to replace it in the newly [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-controlled [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]], Vamilad went to ground to avoid [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|execution]]. Making contact with fellow survivors such as Masters [[Djinn Altis]], [[Plett]], and [[Iri Camas]], Vamilad agreed to shelter any Jedi survivors sent his way. Vamilad managed to seclude himself in an undisclosed location, while remnants of the Order and its allies, such as [[Antarian Rangers/Legends|Antarian Ranger]] [[Jilam Kester]], would lead others to safety. Though he attempted to remain under the radar of the Empire, Imperial forces were aware of Vamilad's involvement in the underground movement, but were unsure of where the Jedi was.<ref name="IC501">''[[Imperial Commando: 501st]]''</ref>

name: Teelo Vang
description: Teelo Vang was a [[Coruscanti/Legends|native]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]],<ref name="TAL" /> an [[Ecumenopolis/Legends|ecumenopolis]]<ref>''[[Coruscant and the Core Worlds]]''</ref> located in the [[Coruscant sector]] of the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]].<ref>''[[The Last Command]]''</ref> The Coruscanti served the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] as an [[Republic officer/Legends|officer]] in the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] during the [[Mandalorian Wars]]. This war, between the Republic and the resurgent forces of the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]], began in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], where the [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorians]] made a three-pronged assault against the Republic in [[3963 BBY]]. In the aftermath of this assault, known by the Republic media as the "Onslaught," Vang received a promotion to the rank of [[Captain/Legends|captain]]. This promotion, reported in the [[The Admiral's List: Jimas Veltraa Memorial Edition|Jimas Veltraa Memorial Edition]] of ''[[The Admiral's List]]'', an official publication of the Republic Navy, occurred alongside that of notable officer [[Saul Karath]] to [[Rear Admiral/Legends|Rear Admiral]].<ref name="TAL" />

name: Ilm Vaz-Weplinn
description: Ilm contacted [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Minister of Corrections]] [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Chawkroft]] and proposed the joint development of an advanced prison facility in the [[Corporate Sector/Legends|Corporate Sector]]. Chawcroft was pleased with this proposal: her ministry welcomed the chance to share costs of prison development with the CSA, and [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]] had blocked the budget requests of the [[Admiralty (Imperial)/Legends|Admiralty]] for their own prison facilities.<ref name="HSCSSB" />Shortly after she signed on, Viceprex [[Mirkovig Hirken]] took control of the project, code-named "Stars' End".<ref name="HSCSSB" />Following the [[Liberation of Stars' End|Mytus VII disaster]] and the death of Hirken, Vaz-Weplinn was named [[Vice-President in charge of Corporate Security|Viceprex of Security]] by the [[Executive Directorship Board]].<ref name="HSCSSB" />

name: Wub Vevris
description: Vevris was in a shuttle with fellow Sarkan [[Asvo Tel]] and other travelers. Both Sarkans believed that non-Sarkans where stinking barbarians, and disliked the company of others. The shuttle was captured by slavers, probably under the orders of slaver ringleader [[Phylus Mon]]. Both Tel and Vevris were captured, while the other travelers were apparently left unharmed.The Sarkans, resentful of the situation, were sent to Phylus Mon's slave zoo onboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. They were eager to trade gems for their freedom &ndash; none of them believed in the [[Galactic Credit Standard]]. Nevertheless, they tried to retain their composure while doing so, "like any self-respecting being should do."Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion gun|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Vocatara
description: As a [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Rocket-Jumper Elite Advance Unit|rocket-jumper]], the individual known as Vocatara served as one of the [[Jetpack/Legends|jetpack]]-equipped elite [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]] of the [[Republic Army]].<ref name="GatW" /> Vocatara received many decorations while with the rocket-jumpers.<ref name="Blog">{{SW|url=news/the-essential-guide-to-warfare-authors-cut-part-4-the-rise-of-the-republic-needs-author-entry|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Guide to Warfare'' Author's Cut, Part 4: The Rise of the Republic|int=Star Wars: The Essential Guide to Warfare Author's Cut|archivedate=20190527002543}}</ref> Like several other members of the rocket-jumpers, Vocatara went on to serve the Republic as a [[Politics/Legends|politician]].<ref name="GatW" /> By the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[4800 BBY]], Vocatara led the Republic as [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]]. At that [[Time/Legends|time]], while Vocatara was in [[Office of the Supreme Chancellor|office]],<ref name="Droids" /> a [[Species/Legends|species]] known as the [[Gank/Legends|Ganks]] had begun [[Speciecide|exterminating]] other species after they had been hired by the [[Neimoidian/Legends|Neimoidian]] species to deal with the [[Porporite]]s, a species that had gone into a [[Death/Legends|homicidal]] frenzy after becoming addicted to the [[Spice/Legends|drug]] known as [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]].<ref name="TOR">{{TORcite|type=codex|Galactic History 35: The Gank Massacres}}</ref>In response to the Gank threat, which later became known as the [[Gank Massacres]], Chancellor Vocatara quickly ordered the commissioning of the first [[juggernaut war droid]]s<ref name="Droids" /> to assist Republic forces and the [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] peacekeepers known as the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] in their fight against the Ganks.<ref name="TCSWE1">{{CSWECite|III|309|Vocatara}}</ref> By the year [[4775 BBY]], the conflict had ended, but Vocatara's commissioning of the juggernaut war [[Droid/Legends|droids]] later harmed the Republic when the droids went rogue on the Republic's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] during the [[Great Droid Revolution]] in [[4015 BBY]].<ref name="GatW" />

name: Vurrulf
description: {{Quote|Pick targets carefully, three flight.|Corran Horn, to Vurrulf and the rest of Three Flight|I, Jedi}}Vurrulf, a [[Klatooinian/Legends|Klatooinian]], was a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] in the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic's]] [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] in [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]]. The Rogues were a twelve-person [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]] of [[X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing fighter]] pilots<ref name="I, Jedi chapter 1" /> who served [[New Republic Starfighter Command/Legends|New Republic Starfighter Command]].<ref name="Rebel Dream chapter 2" /> Vurrulf flew in the squadron's [[Three Flight]] along with [[Wingmate/Legends|wingmate]] [[Ghufran]], as well as [[Rogue Ten/Legends|Rogue Ten]], [[Ooryl Qrygg]]; and [[Rogue Nine]], [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Corran Horn]]&mdash;the [[Flight/Legends|flight]] group's [[Flight leader|leader]]. The Rogues were commanded overall by [[Rogue Leader/Legends|Rogue Leader]], [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Tycho Celchu]]. 11 ABY saw Rogue Squadron assigned to [[Hunting/Legends|hunt]] for the elusive [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] group known as the [[Invids]], who managed to elude every New Republic attempt to capture them, leaving the Rogues with about a [[Standard week/Legends|week]] of down [[Time/Legends|time]] in between raids.<ref name="I, Jedi chapter 1" />When [[New Republic Intelligence Service|New Republic Intelligence]] received a tip that the Invids would be attacking the [[Luxury liner/Legends|luxury liner]] ''[[Glitterstar]]'' near the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Alakatha/Legends|Alakatha]], the Rogues were ferried almost all of the way to [[K'vath system|Alakatha's star system]] aboard the [[MC80 Home One type Star Cruiser|MC80 Star Cruiser]] [[Home One/Legends|''Home One'']]. They finally entered the [[Star system/Legends|system]] using [[Precision hyperspace jump|micro-jumps]], and their X-wings went to ground on several large [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroids]] near the moon. When the modified [[Bulk cruiser/Legends|bulk cruiser]] ''[[Booty Full]]'' arrived in-system and dispatched numerous [[Ugly/Legends|ugly]] starfighters to attack the ''Glitterstar'', Rogue Squadron intercepted and [[Battle of Alakatha|engaged]] them. Horn told Three Flight to pick their targets carefully, and after their enemies' ranks had been thinned considerably, Vurrulf covered Horn as the captain pursued and destroyed an ugly [[Clutch (fighter)|tri-fighter]].<ref name="I, Jedi chapter 1" />The ''Booty Full'' quickly surrendered, and with all of the uglies defeated, ''Home One'' and two New Republic [[Victory-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Victory''-class Star Destroyers]] entered the system to collect both the Rogues and the defeated bulk [[Cruiser/Legends|cruiser]]. Vurrulf<ref name="I, Jedi chapter 1" /> and the Rogues underwent a debriefing aboard ''Home One'' while en route to the New Republic's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]], [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], and upon arrival, they all landed their X-wings in a [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]].<ref name="I, Jedi chapter 2">''[[I, Jedi]]'', chapter 2</ref> Not long afterward, Vurrulf's flight leader, Corran Horn, left the squadron to train as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[New Jedi Order]].<ref name="I, Jedi, chapter 5">''[[I, Jedi]]'', chapter 5</ref>

name: Wampa (pilot)
description: One of the pilots who flew [[Black 11]] and was known as "Wampa" for icy precision in battle. She often served as escort to [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader's]] [[ST 321/Legends|shuttle]].

name: Talilia Weden
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Talilia Weden was [[Jedi training/Legends|instructed]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and eventually passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]]. Accepting missions from the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], Weden was active during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], a time of strife and conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the growing [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].<ref name="HNN56" />When the ''[[Moulee-rah Patogga]]'' was impounded at a [[Xizor Transport Systems/Legends|Xizor Transport Systems]] refueling station on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Karnst]], Crew Chief [[Asador Leen]] of XTS contacted Republic [[Judicial Forces/Legends|Judicial Forces]] after suspecting that the light freighter was carrying illegal substances. With the Judiciaries ready to depart [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the High Council assigned Weden to accompany them and ensure a smooth boarding of the ship. Upon arrival, Weden led her team aboard the ship and discovered 3.5 million [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] worth of illegal [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]] [[Spice/Legends|spice]]. Arresting [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Barada Rakul]] and his crew of five, it was quickly determined they were not aware of their illicit cargo.<ref name="HNN56" />After the owners of the freighter, the [[Besadii/Legends|Besadii]] [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] clan, were notified of the discovery, the other clans began to voice their opinions. Blaming each other for the cargo's transport, the Besadii insisted that the freighter actually belonged to the [[Desilijic/Legends|Desilijic]] clan and that they had planted the spice to create bad blood between the Republic and the Besadii.<ref name="HNN56" />

name: Unidentified Wookiee worker 1
description: A [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] worker traveled to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Alaris Prime/Legends|Alaris Prime]]<ref name="SW:GB" /> between the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] [[39 BBY/Legends|39 BBY]] and [[36 BBY/Legends|36 BBY]]<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'' places the [[Alaris Prime colonial war]], in which this [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] participates, between these [[Standard year/Legends|years]].</ref> to take part in its Wookiee [[Alaris Prime colonial war|colonization effort]]. Together with [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 2|two]] [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 3|other]] Wookiees, the worker went to a [[Unidentified Wookiee command center|base]] to gather resources under instructions from [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], who had been sent by the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] to oversee the colonization effort.<ref name="SW:GB" />{{Gamemechanics|option=1|Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds}}The workers started by gathering [[Foodstuff/Legends|food]] from [[Muja fruit/Legends|muja fruit]] bushes near the command center, the only building in the base. The Wookiees eventually gathered enough food, which allowed for another [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 4|worker]] to join them at the base. The first worker and the others continued harvesting the [[Fruit/Legends|fruit]], gaining enough supplies to bring an extra [[Unidentified Wookiee worker 5|worker]] to the base. Following that, Jinn instructed the workers to perform a drill in case they were attacked by [[Gundark/Legends|gundarks]], a [[Sentience/Legends|non-sentient]] [[Species/Legends|species]] of predators on Alaris Prime, which involved the workers ceasing activity and taking shelter in the command center. Once the drill was completed, Jinn told the workers to focus their attention on gathering [[Carbon/Legends|carbon]], a resource collected from [[Tree/Legends|trees]] that could be turned into [[Duraplast/Legends|duraplast]] and used for building.<ref name="SW:GB" />Later, one of the Wookiee leaders of the [[Alaris Prime colonists|colonists]] of Alaris Prime, [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], arrived at the command center. Simultaneously, four gundarks [[Attack on the Wookiee command center|attacked]] the command center, forcing the worker and its fellow Wookiees to retreat into the building, as they had practiced in the drill. With help from Chewbacca and using the building's [[Turret/Legends|turret]] system, the workers fought off and [[Death/Legends|killed]] the gundarks. Chewbacca then explored the nearby area, finding deposits of [[Nova crystal/Legends|nova crystals]], which could be used as a form of currency in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], and [[Ore/Legends|ore]], a resource that could be processed into [[Durasteel/Legends|durasteel]]. The worker took part in gathering these resources.<ref name="SW:GB" />{{Endgame}}

name: Xeltek
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] being, Xeltek was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Attaining the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], when the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Xeltek survived until the final year of war when he was dispatched to the [[Siege of Saleucami/Legends|front lines]] of [[Saleucami/Legends|Saleucami]] under the command of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Oppo Rancisis/Legends|Oppo Rancisis]].<ref name="R76" />During the fighting there, Xeltek was killed in the fighting with the [[Morgukai Shadow Army]]. During the [[Funeral of Oppo Rancisis|funeral]] of Master Rancisis, fellow Jedi [[Xiaan Amersu]] mourned her fallen comrade, along with the others who had died on the battle field.<ref name="R76" />

name: Yennir of the Green
description: In [[3641 BBY]], during the [[Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]], Yennir of the Green served as a [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]]. Yennir was assigned to [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Shanra Immel]]'s [[Shanra Immel's squad|squad]] and fought alongside [[Republic Special Forces Division|SpecForce]] [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Jace Malcom]] in a [[Battle of Kalandis Seven|battle]] on [[Kalandis Seven]], a desolate [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] covered in [[Water/Legends|fog]]. During the battle, Yennir and the [[Squad/Legends|squad]] were tasked with the destruction of the local Imperial-controlled [[Kalandis Seven's spaceport|spaceport]]. On the way to their target, Yennir and the squad were attacked, and [[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] [[Amden vor Keioidian]] was [[Death/Legends|fatally]] wounded. Yennir's sergeant activated Keioidian's [[med tracer]] before ordering the squad to move out and leave Keioidian behind.<ref name="TLBoCJM" />Three [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] later, Yennir and the squad finally reached their objective and started planting [[targeting beacon]]s, which would allow Republic [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] to destroy the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] regardless of the fog. Shortly after Yennir and the squad planted the last of the beacons, the fighters destroyed the spaceport.<ref name="TLBoCJM" />

name: Yerem
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Yerem was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], Master Yerem was appointed as an [[Jedi academy|academy]] [[Jedi instructor|instructor]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. Yerem taught beginning courses of the [[Force power/Legends|technique]] of [[Telekinesis/Legends|levitation]], and one of his students was [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jax Pavan]]. Pavan recalled Yerem's lessons while attempting to survive during the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|dangerous times]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] the [[18 BBY/Legends|year after]] the Order was [[Operation: Knightfall|dissolved]].<ref name="CNII" />

name: Zenhai
description: [[File:Shanra_Immel_headshot.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Zenhai's sergeant, Shanra Immel]]Zenhai served as a [[Republic soldier|soldier]] in the [[Republic Army]]. In [[3641 BBY]], during the [[Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]], Zenhai was assigned to [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Shanra Immel]]'s [[Shanra Immel's squad|squad]]&mdash;along with [[Camur]], [[Eron (soldier)|Eron]], [[Vaskus Kayle]], [[Amden vor Keioidian]], [[Min-Reva]], and [[Yennir of the Green]]&mdash;and [[Battle of Kalandis Seven|fought]] alongside [[Republic Special Forces Division|SpecForce]] [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Jace Malcom]] on the desolate [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kalandis Seven]]. During the [[Ground warfare|battle]], Zenhai and the [[Squad/Legends|squad]] were tasked with the destruction of a local Imperial-controlled [[Kalandis Seven's spaceport|spaceport]]. On the way to the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]], Zenhai and the squad were attacked, and [[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] Keioidian was [[Death/Legends|fatally]] wounded. Immel activated Keioidian's [[med tracer]] before ordering the squad to move out and leave Keioidian behind.<ref name="TLBoCJM" />Three [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] later, Zenhai and the squad finally reached the spaceport and were ordered to check in with Immel before proceeding with the mission, while Malcom attempted to capture a [[Unidentified planetary command ship|Sith planetary command ship]]. Zenhai and the squad started planting [[targeting beacon]]s, which would allow their [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] to destroy the spaceport regardless of the planet's [[Water/Legends|fog]]. Shortly after they finished planting the last of the beacons, the spaceport was eliminated, though Malcom failed to capture the [[Command ship/Legends|command ship]].<ref name="TLBoCJM" />

name: Zittaasabba/Legends
description: Zittaasabba was a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] who lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], during [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]-spanning [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. In that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid armies]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] [[Battle of Kashyyyk/Legends|invaded]] the Wookiee [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] in an attempt to secure [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] [[Hyperlane|routes]] from a [[Claatuvac Guild/Legends|guild]] of [[Navigator/Legends|navigators]] who resided in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Kachirho/Legends|Kachirho]].<ref name="Cross sections" /> Wookiees from across Kashyyyk flocked to the coastal city to aid in its defense. Their efforts were organized and [[Commander/Legends|commanded]] by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Tarfful/Legends|Tarfful]], the leader of Kachirho, under whom<ref name="Visual Dictionary">''[[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref> Zittaasabba served as a [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]].<ref name="Cross sections" /> The Wookiee forces were bolstered by support from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], the Confederacy's opponent in the war. [[Clone trooper/Legends|Clone troopers]] and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] arrived in Kachirho, and the joint forces established defensive positions on the city's [[Beach/Legends|beaches]].<ref name="Revenge of the Sith">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref>The fighting began when Confederate [[Tank (vehicle)/Legends|assault vehicles]] crossed Kachirho's lagoon.<ref name="Revenge of the Sith" /> Zittaasabba served as the [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] of an [[Oevvaor jet catamaran]], an unarmed Wookiee [[Airspeeder/Legends|aerial vehicle]], during the fray. Fellow Wookiee [[Eugroothwa/Legends|Eugroothwa]] sat immediately to Zittaasabba's rear in the vehicle's starboard pod and utilized a portable heavy [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifle]], acting as a [[Gunner/Legends|gunner]]. [[Parent/Legends|Father]] and son warriors [[Attichitcuk/Legends|Attichitcuk]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] were in the catamaran's portside pod, throwing [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonators]] and co-piloting, respectively. Hundreds of catamarans darted through the lines of Confederate vehicles during the battle,<ref name="Cross sections" /> and, after a fierce skirmish, the Wookiee and Republic forces gained a considerable edge and forced the [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] to surrender.<ref name="Republic 82">''[[Republic 82: Hidden Enemy, Part 2]]''</ref> The war itself [[Mission to Mustafar/Legends|ended]] shortly thereafter.<ref name="Revenge of the Sith" />

name: Zrim
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Zrim was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Zrim was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="YDR" />In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Padawan Zrim was stationed at the Temple and participated in the annual [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|Apprentice Tournament]] overseen by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ilena Xan]]. During the competition, Zrim faced off against Padawan [[Flerp]].<ref name="YDR" />

name: Cha'nagh
description: A member of the [[Flesh Raider]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Cha'nagh lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] fought between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]].<ref name="TOR" /> During the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Date" /> the Flesh Raider was serving with<ref name="TOR" /> an [[Flesh Raider army|army]] formed by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Bengel Morr]], who was leading a [[Flesh Raider uprising|campaign]] against the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Pilgrims]].<ref name="High-Tech Savages" /> Around the start of the fighting, Cha'nagh was stationed with two Flesh Raider [[Scout/Legends|scouts]] at a small camp in the [[Tythonian Gnarls]] region of the planet.<ref name="TOR" />{{Gamemechanics}}While Cha'nagh was in the Gnarls, an individual affiliated with the Galactic Republic came upon the camp and [[Death/Legends|killed]] the Flesh Raider.<ref name="TOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Zephata'ru'tor
