description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Duinuogwuin]],<ref name="US" /> a flying dragon [[Species/Legends|species]] that measured up to 100 [[Imperial standard meter|meters]] long and possessed the ability to breathe [[Fire/Legends|fire]] and survive in [[Vacuum/Legends|vacuum]],<ref name="Galaxy Guide 4">''[[Galaxy Guide 4: Alien Races]]''</ref> Zephata'ru'tor was accepted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and taken as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] learner by the<ref name="US" /> [[Coway]]<ref name="CSWET">{{CSWECite|III|253|Tone, B'dard}}</ref> [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[B'dard Tone]] in the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] leading up to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].<ref name="US" />In [[22 BBY/Legends|21.6 BBY]], five [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|beginning]] of the Clone Wars on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]],<ref name="Date" /> Master and Padawan served in a [[Battle of Nadiem|battle]] on the planet [[Nadiem]]. When [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]], the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies|commander]] of the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]], fled from the battlefield after the Republic triumphed, Tone attempted to stop the notorious [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]&ndash;killer but was badly wounded by Grievous. Zephata'ru'tor also tried to hinder the general from escaping in [[Sexes/Legends|his]] [[Belbullab-22 starfighter/Legends|Belbullab-22 starfighter]], but Grievous [[Death/Legends|killed]] the Duinuogwuin<ref name="US" /> in [[Realspace/Legends|space]] over Nadiem.<ref name="CSWEZ" />

name: Borna
description: Borna was an early classical [[Music/Legends|composer]]<ref name="Slugthrowers1">{{SW|url=news/slugthrowers-an-overview-of-popular-music-and-musicians-in-a-galaxy-far-far-away-part-1|text=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away, Part 1|int=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away|archivedate=20180311051325}}</ref> who lived during the [[Imperial Period]],<ref name="df:jk" /> a [[Time/Legends|time]] when the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] rose to power and ruled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].<ref name="EGTW">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref> A member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], [[Borna's second symphony]] was composed as a protest against the administration of the empire.<ref name="df:jk" />Unfortunately for Borna, the Empire did not appreciate his activism, and Borna [[Death/Legends|died]]<ref name="df:jk" /> between [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]] and [[5 ABY/Legends|5 ABY]].<ref name="date" />Borna's music furthered understanding between different [[Species/Legends|species]] and cultures, and the composer was described as immortal.<ref name="Slugthrowers1" /> Despite the anti-imperial themes in the music, Imperial [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitor]] [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec]] enjoyed Borna's work, listening to the second symphony whilst reflecting aboard his [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] [[Vengeance (Vengeance-class)|Vengeance]]<ref name="df:jk" /> in 5 ABY,<ref name="dfjkdate">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]'' places the events of ''[[Dark Forces: Jedi Knight]]'' in [[5 ABY/Legends|5 ABY]].</ref> feeling the piece was dark and moody. Jerec expressed remorse that Borna died prematurely, but mused that art and [[Politics/Legends|politics]] did not mix well.<ref name="df:jk" />

name: Rebu
description: {{Quote|Both the Hellcaster cannon and concussion missiles were highly effective in, respectively, an anti-personnel and anti-armor capacity, and the gunship returned to base with only minimal damage.|Inspector-General Moff Rebu|Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II}}Rebu was a [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] who served the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] during its [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|war]] with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="Databank" /> Sometime between the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] and [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]],<ref name="TFUII">Since Rebu lived during the time of the Galactic Empire ([[Declaration of a New Order|formed]] in 19 BBY), and since the events of ''The Force Unleashed II'' occur in 1 BBY, prior to the [[Rebellion era]], Rebu's lifetime is based in the Rise of the Empire era.</ref> in the Moff's capacity as an [[Inspector-General]], Rebu was responsible for overseeing the development and field testing of the newly created [[Nemesis-class gunship|''Nemesis''-class gunship]].<ref name="Databank" />Rebu oversaw the [[Gunship/Legends|gunship]] model's first [[Battle of Polomie|deployment]] to [[Polomie]], a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] that contained a [[Alliance Military/Legends|Rebel military]] outpost. The gunship exceeded all expectations when it obliterated the Rebel presence on Polomie. Following the success of the craft's first field test, Rebu provided a detailed report to the [[Imperial Department of Military Research/Legends|Imperial Department of Military Research]], and was pleased to inform the department that the new gunship was an excellent addition to the vast quantity of [[Imperial Military/Legends|military]] [[Starship/Legends|vessels]] at the Empire's disposal. However, Rebu was disappointed by the fact that the gunship's heavy arsenal was far too expensive for mass production. Consequently, Rebu anticipated that the small number of ''Nemesis''-class gunships would only be affordable to the exceptionally wealthy Moffs and [[Governor/Legends|governors]] of the Empire.<ref name="Databank" />

name: Krav Noblis
description: {{Quote|Until lately, our trade's had a good run. When guys like the Moomo Brothers can get work, anybody can. But if the Mandalorians keep knocking off the customers, those times may be over.|Krav Noblis|The Adjudicator Special Report: The Outer Rim}}Krav Noblis was a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] who, by [[3963 BBY]], was the [[Journalist/Legends|editor]] of ''[[The Adjudicator]]'', a [[Holofeed]] specifically for [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] hunters and "freelance security professionals." Noblis frequently wrote columns that were published in ''The Adjudicator'', as well as a feature called "Krav's Hot List," which detailed some of the more notorious and lucrative bounties in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. Regulars on the "Hot List" included [[Zayne Carrick]], a former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] wanted for allegedly [[Death/Legends|killing]] his Jedi class in the [[Padawan Massacre]] of [[Taris/Legends|Taris]]; [[Marn Hierogryph]], a [[Snivvian/Legends|Snivvian]] criminal and Carrick's supposed accomplice; and [[Toki Tollivar|Kelven Garnatrope]], feared as the so-called "[[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] Strangler." During Noblis' career at ''The Adjudicator'', Noblis reported on events such as the effects of the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Mandalorian Wars|invasion]] of [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Realspace/Legends|space]] on the bounty market, the proliferation of [[Droid/Legends|droids]] entering the bounty hunting trade,<ref name="tools">''[[The Adjudicator Special Report: Tools of the Trade]]''</ref> and the strange effect the war was having on corporations that dealt with bounty hunters.<ref name="colonies">''[[The Adjudicator Special Report: The Colonies]]''</ref> Noblis cultivated a network of sources and informants that provided the editor with information on companies such as [[Czerka Arms/Legends|Czerka Arms]]<ref name="tools" /> and [[The Adasca BioMechanical Corporation of Arkania|Adascorp]], inside knowledge that Noblis passed on to the audience at ''The Adjudicator''.<ref name="colonies" />Through all this, Noblis still found the [[Time/Legends|time]] to be an active bounty hunter during the Mandalorian Wars era. At one point, Noblis captured a bounty on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Wayland/Legends|Wayland]]&mdash;however, the world was under a Mandalorian [[Battle of Wayland (Mandalorian Wars)|attack]], and when Noblis brought the target to the [[Unidentified constable|Constable]], the hunter found the [[Constable/Legends|lawman]] leaving with [[Sexes/Legends|his]] family. When Noblis asked the Constable for a voucher to take to the nearby [[Lhosan Industries]] building, Noblis was told that the building was full of Mandalorian [[Basilisk war droid|Basilisk droids]].<ref name="outerrim" /> On another occasion, Noblis decided to set out after a "[[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Gorman Vandrayk|Hyro Margryph]],"<ref name="tools" /> who had a bounty on his head for 100,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]],<ref name="outerrim" /> but as soon as Noblis reached the [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]], the hunter found that there were multiple autonomous [[HK-24 series assassin droid|HK-24]] [[Assassin droid/Legends|assassin droids]] also out for Margryph. Soon afterward, the bounty was canceled.<ref name="tools" />

name: Yrral
description: Yrral was one of three Cerean triplets who joined the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and became [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]]. However Yrral's siblings, [[Lyrrad]] and [[Lerred]], and Yrral, all fell to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] and became Dark Jedi.The three Cereans were present in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Tolea Biqua]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]] during the [[SoroSuub Anniversary celebration, 31 BBY|SoroSuub Anniversary celebration]] that was held there in [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]]. After the [[heroes of Cularin]] were attacked by a group of thugs during the event, word spread to the Cereans that a group of people were wandering the streets of Tolea Biqua in search of a fight. The three Cereans decided to oblige and, along with a group of thugs, they moved to attack the heroes. While the thugs opened fire on the heroes with their [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]], Lerred, Lyrrad and Yrral looked on from a balcony. The three Dark Jedi then jumped down, ignited their [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] and joined the fight.

name: Barsen'thor (second)
description: [[File:Jedi_symbol.svg|thumb|left|200px|The Barsen'thor served the Jedi Order.]][[Millennium/Legends|Millennia]] before the conflict known as the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]]&mdash;which was fought between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]]&mdash;a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual was found by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. At some point in the Jedi's career, the individual was recognized by the Jedi Order for exceptional accomplishments by being granted the honorific title of "[[Barsen'thor]]," which translated to "Warden of the Order"<ref name="Vivicar Awaits" /> from the [[Cerean (language)|Cerean language]].<ref name="TOR Encyclopedia">''[[Star Wars: The Old Republic Encyclopedia]]''</ref>Up until that point, the title had been used only once in the entire history of the Order, when it was [[Death/Legends|posthumously]] bestowed upon the Jedi [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Lorjan Sakku]], in memory of [[Sexes/Legends|him]] sacrificing his life to protect his fellow Jedi from his insane brother [[Lyhesh Sakku|Lyhesh]].<ref name="TOR Encyclopedia" />By awarding that title to the second Barsen'thor, the Jedi Order acknowledged the individual as possessing great wisdom and skill,<ref name="Vivicar Awaits" /> comparable to Sakku's.<ref name="TOR Encyclopedia" /> After the second Barsen'thor's tenure, it would be thousands of [[Standard year/Legends|years]] until that ceremonial rank would be used again, when it was granted during the Cold War to a [[The Barsen'thor|Jedi Consular]] who [[Duel on Vivicar's ship|prevented]] the [[Dark Plague crisis|near-eradication]] of the Jedi Order by the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-[[Terrak Morrhage|engineered]] disease called the [[Dark Plague]].<ref name="Vivicar Awaits" />

name: Shroud SF-4
description: Shroud SF-4 was a member of the [[The Shroud's organization|intelligence network]] that served the independent operative known as [[the Shroud]] during the [[Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Shroud SF-4 was stationed at [[Kuat/Legends|Kuat]] to observe Imperial Asset K-33, an Imperial agent undercover in the [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]]. K-33 married into the [[House Kuat|Kuat family]], giving him more political power. K-33 took up residence in the [[Kuat Drive Yards Governor Quarters]]. K-33 took control of the Kuat Drive Yards security oversight. SF-4 took the guise of a shipyard administrator concerned with lax security so that he can learn about the security of the Drive Yards. K-33 promised to take SF-4 through the security measures as a act of reassurance. SF-4 made a analysis that several newly made capital ships could be liberated for the network. SF-4 intercepted a transmission from K-33 to [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Zasha Ranken|Ranken]]. K-33 suggested a [[Kuat Defensive Station|single defensive station]] was key to subverting all Kuat Drive Yards security protocols. K-33 found SF-4 out, and stabbed SF-4 in the back with a [[vibroknife]]. SF-4 managed to transmit the logs to the Shroud before he [[Death/Legends|died]]. The Shroud sold the information provided by SF-4 through numerous intermediaries for the [[Republic Strategic Information Service]] to obtain. The Republic started mounting a force to counter the Sith Empire's invasion. The Shroud sent [[Asset SF-5]] to dispose of SF-4's body and belongings, and to observe the outcome of the [[Battle of Kuat (Galactic War)|Battle for Kuat]].

name: Imperial asset K-33
description: An [[Imperial Agent]] in the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Imperial Asset K-33 was sent to discover a weakness in the [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]] defense. K-33 [[Imperial Asset K-33's spouse|married]] into the [[House Kuat|Kuat family]] in order to get more power. K-33 moved to a residence in the [[Kuat Drive Yards Governor Quarters]] to be closer to his objective. K-33 started heading the Kuat Drive Yards security, putting strain on his relationship with his family. [[Shroud SF-4]] of the [[The Shroud's organization|The Shroud's network]] had been tracking K-33 in a attempt to recruit him, but thought of him as not a very good agent but could be used as a unwilling collaborator. SF-4 made initial contact with K-33 under the guise of a shipyard administrator concerned with lax security to learn about the defenses of the Drive Yards. K-33 promised to take SF-4 through all the security measures as a act of reassurance. K-33 made a transmission to [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Zasha Ranken]] of the [[Imperial Navy (Sith Empire)|Imperial Armada]], suggesting a [[Kuat Defensive Station|single defensive station]] was key to subverting all Kuat Drive Yards security protocols. SF-4 went to the station to liberate some newly manufactured capital ships for the network, but was found out by K-33 and got stabbed in the back with a [[vibroknife]]. SF-4 managed to transmit his journal entries to [[The Shroud]] before [[Death/Legends|death]]. [[Asset SF-5]] of the network was later sent to dispose of SF-4's body and belongings and to observe the [[Battle of Kuat (Galactic War)|Battle of Kuat]] to learn who the victor was.

name: Hazeen
description: During the Empire's [[Battle of Corellia|invasion]] on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], Hazeen infiltrated the Corellian rebel forces that were planning on leading an assault on the occupation forces. Hazeen managed to alert the Imperial forces through the [[Probe droid/Legends|probe droid]] [[G-05]], who was situated by [[Coronet Spaceport/Legends|Coronet Spaceport]], and sent a strike team to put a stop to the attack.

name: Greddin Zel
description: Zel owned the [[Starship/Legends|starship]] engineering firm [[ZelFlight]], and secured an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] contract with the help of [[Zerex]], the [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Adinorr]]. When Zerex was promoted to become the [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] of the [[Meridian sector/Legends|Meridian sector]], Zel attended a celebratory party that Zerex held in his mansion, on Ord Adinorr.

name: Brult Kiais
description: Kiais worked as a [[Bank/Legends|banker]] and invested heavily with [[Zerex]], the [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Adinorr]]. When Zerex was promoted to become the [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] of the [[Meridian sector/Legends|Meridian sector]], Kiais attended a celebratory party that Zerex held in his mansion on Ord Adinorr.

name: Betancy
description: Betancy was [[Reproduction|born]] in the [[Standard year|years]] leading up to [[18 BBY]]<ref name="Betancy age" /> and entered the [[Galactic Empire]]'s [[Academy for Young Imperials]] on the [[planet]] [[Lothal]] as a [[Imperial cadet|cadet]]<ref name="Rebel in the Ranks" /> at some point after turning thirteen.<ref name="Rogue One: The Ultimate Visual Guide">''[[Star Wars: Rogue One: The Ultimate Visual Guide]]''</ref> [[5 BBY|Five]] years before the [[Battle of Yavin]],<ref name="Star Wars: Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''</ref> Betancy was a member of the promising [[cadet]] squad [[LRC077]] with [[Zare Leonis]] and "[[Ezra Bridger|Dev Morgan]]," and served in the squad's [[Unit Besh]].<ref name="Rebel in the Ranks" />When Unit Besh and [[Unit Aurek]], the other unit in LRC077, were summoned to [[The Well (Imperial Academy)|the Well]] training facility in the academy, Betancy and fellow Besh cadet [[Thurgos]] were ordered by [[Taskmaster]] [[Myles Grint]] to not take part in the exercise and instead stand with [[Sergeant]] [[Currahee]] and Units [[Unit Cresh|Cresh]] and [[Unit Dorn|Dorn]]. Betancy and Thurgos's shoulders slumped when given they were given the order, but the cadets obeyed and removed their helmets before walking away from their squad.<ref name="Rebel in the Ranks" />

name: Old One-Eye
description: {{Quote|There's ''no way out'' of the arena. I'm going to have to&hellip; ''fight''!|Ahsoka Tano|Prize Contender}}[[File:OldOneEyeAndTheOtherOne-TCWCUK611p11.png|thumb|left|200px|Old One-Eye and another rancor face Jedi Padawan Ahsoka Tano.]]Old One-Eye was a [[Color/Legends|brown]]-skinned [[Rancor/Legends|rancor]] who lived during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. During the war, [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Sexes/Legends|his]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], went [[Mission to Coruscant (Anakin Skywalker)|undercover]] at an illegal rancor fight featuring Old-One Eye on the galactic [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], about eighty [[Kilometer/Legends|kilometers]] away from the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]]. They aimed to stop [[Raice Liq]], a [[Muun/Legends|Muun]] who used the fights to transfer Republic munitions data to the Separatists.<ref name="PC" />The fight pitted Old One-Eye against another rancor with six-to-one odds in favor of Old One-Eye. Tano fell into the [[Coruscant gladiatorial arena|arena]] during the match and had to fight Old One-Eye and the other rancor, and Skywalker quickly joined the fight as well. Although the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] had no effect on the rancors' tough hides, Skywalker was able to [[Animal bond|calm]] the beasts through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Before calling [[Clone trooper captain|Captain]] [[CT-7567/Legends|Rex]] of the [[501st Legion/Legends|501st Legion]] to bring [[Transport/Legends|transports]] and additional [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] to assist in arresting the 200 law-breaking [[Gambler/Legends|gamblers]], Tano mounted Old One-Eye while Skywalker mounted the other rancor to go after Liq. After the arrival of the [[Cloning/Legends|clones]], the Jedi approached Liq on rancors and arrested him.<ref name="PC" />

name: Ruchikila
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Ruchikila was [[Jedi Initiate]] who was [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].<ref name="CWGS" />[[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] oversaw Ruchikila's [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|clan's]] training. During a session of blindfolded [[Seeker droid|seeker]] testing, Yoda received an urgent message from Jedi Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and his former apprentice, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Lanteeb/Legends|Lanteeb]]. On an [[Mission to Lanteeb|undercover mission]], the two Jedi's request was met without hesitation and Master Yoda left Ruchikila and the other Initiates to test by themselves for a time.<ref name="CWGS" />

name: Alix Balan
description: Following the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] [[Second Battle of Coruscant|reconquest]] of the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]], [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], in [[10 ABY/Legends|10 ABY]], [[General/Legends|General]] Alix Balan led a formal ceremony to reconsecrate [[Galactic City|Imperial City]]. This action earned General Balan fame throughout Imperial space, as well as a triumphant parade<ref name="DESB" /> where Balan led ground forces through Coruscant's grandest boulevards.<ref name="EGW">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref>

name: JA189
description: {{Quote|Well done today, Lieutenant Commander."<br />"But&mdash; I lost all four pilots, sir."<br />"They had no chance, really. You kept them alive longer than they could have made it on their own.|Piett praises Ree for aiding JA189 and the other pilots|Lost Stars}}[[File:JA189.png|thumb|left|250px|JA189's TIE fighter was destroyed.]]JA189 was the designation<ref name="LS">''[[Lost Stars]]''</ref> of a [[human]]<ref name="USW" /> [[TIE fighter pilot]] who served in the [[Imperial Navy]] of the [[Galactic Empire]] during the [[Galactic Civil War]] against the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. JA189<ref name="LS" /> was stationed on board an [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer|''Imperial''-class Star Destroyer]], when it traveled to the [[Hoth system]] as part of an [[Battle of Hoth|attack]] on the [[Echo Base|Rebel Base]] located on the [[planet]] [[Hoth]]. The Empire successfully defeated the Alliance on the surface of Hoth, but a large number of the Rebels escaped the planet in [[transport]]s protected from the Imperial [[fleet]] by [[V-150 Planet Defender|an]] [[ion cannon]]. Following the conclusion of the battle, the [[Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]] demanded that at least three of the six ''Imperial''-class [[Star Destroyer]]s present for the battle, chase and capture one Rebel [[Starship|vessel]] in particular, the [[YT-1300 light freighter]] named the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]''.<ref name="ESB" />The ''Falcon'' fled from the Imperials into an [[Hoth asteroid belt|asteroid belt]] located in the Hoth system in the hopes of hiding from them there. As the Star Destroyers were unable to give chase in the belt, JA189 and three other TIE [[pilot]]s were dispatched from one of the Destroyers and gave chase in [[TIE/ln space superiority starfighter]]s,<ref name="ESB" /> despite entering such a [[Asteroid field|belt]] in an unshielded craft being tantamount to [[Death|suicide]]. [[Lieutenant Commander]] [[Ciena Ree]] provided auxiliary [[Navigator|navigational]] assistance for the four [[pilot]]s from onboard the [[Bridge (starship)|bridge]] of Vader's personal [[flagship]], the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought|''Executor''-class Star Dreadnought]] ''[[Executor]]''. Despite [[Sexes|her]] assistance, the TIE pilot [[CR978]]'s vessel collided with an [[asteroid]] and exploded. Moments later, Ree gave warning that JA189's [[computer]] was not linking up, but was too late, as a small asteroid clipped JA189's [[TIE line|TIE]] and caused it to spin out of control and then explode, [[Death|killing]] the pilot. The two remaining pilots, [[OL701]] and [[Penrie|NA811]], soon suffered a similar fate to JA189,<ref name="LS" /> and the ''Falcon'' ultimately escaped Imperial clutches.<ref name="ESB" /> Ree was deeply disheartened by the deaths of the four pilots, but was congratulated for her work helping them by [[Admiral]] [[Firmus Piett]], the commanding [[officer]] of the ''Executor''. Piett believed the four pilots had never stood a chance anyway, and that Ree had managed to keep them alive longer than they would have survived on their own.<ref name="LS" />

name: Sli'woon Biul
description: At some point between [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] and [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], [[Crev Bombaasa/Legends|Crev Bombaasa]] hired Biul to follow [[Didina Lippinoss]] as she committed criminal actions in the service of [[Karrek Flim]], in order to gather incriminating evidence that [[Shalera]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] could use to blackmail Flim. Bombaasa hired a passing [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to convey Biul's data from a meeting place outside [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]] to the [[Tyrena cantina]].<ref name="AED" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Thorbo
description: When the [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Maarek Stele]] disabled the ''[[Onece 3]]'', which was carrying [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|rebels]], the freighter was impounded and the fugitive rebels were taken to the station's brig. The rebels were removed one at a time to be interrogated in a hastily made interrogation room. There, [[Major/Legends|Major]] Thorbo, along with [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Flanken]], would interrogate the [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]] with an [[interrogation droid]].

name: Unidentified stormtrooper (Mos Eisley)
description: {{Quote|We gotta get out of here as soon as we can. Imperial stormtroopers are everywhere.|Obi-Wan Kenobi, after killing the stormtrooper|Star Wars (LINE Webtoon)}}[[File:Stormy death.png|thumb|left|150px|The stormtrooper was killed by Obi-Wan Kenobi.]]This [[human]]<ref name="ECUC" /> was serving as a [[stormtrooper]] at the [[time]] of the [[Galactic Civil War]]. During the [[trooper]]'s service in the [[Stormtrooper Corps]],<ref name="LINE" /> the plans to the [[Galactic Empire]]'s secret [[superweapon]], the [[DS-1 Death Star Mobile Battle Station]], were stolen by the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. [[Prince]]ss [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], a member of the Rebellion, received the plans, but was forced to hide them in [[R2-D2]]&mdash;an [[astromech droid]]&mdash;when [[Sexes|her]] [[starship]] came under [[Secret mission to Tatooine|attack]] over the [[planet]] [[Tatooine]]. R2-D2 and his counterpart, the [[protocol droid]] [[C-3PO]], flew via [[escape pod]] to the [[desert]] planet,<ref name="ANH">[[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']]</ref> and came into the possession of a young [[moisture farmer]] named [[Luke Skywalker]].<ref name="LINE" />Aided by [[Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]], Skywalker took the [[droid]]s to the [[Mos Eisley]] [[spaceport]] where they sought a [[pilot]] who could transport them to [[Alderaan]]. After searching [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]], they were met by the stormtrooper, who asked to see their identification. Before the soldier could react, Kenobi drew his [[lightsaber]] and cut the trooper's [[blaster]]. The [[Jedi]] then used [[the Force]] to crush their antagonist with a large piece of metal, [[Death|killing]] the stormtrooper.<ref name="LINE" />

name: Kronn
description: Kronn was a member of the [[Imperial Navy]]. During the [[Galactic Civil War]], Kronn became [[captain]] of the [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer|Star Destroyer]] ''[[Adjudicator]]''. Shortly after the [[Battle of Yavin]], the vessel was deployed to blockade the [[moon]] [[Cymoon 1]] after a party of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|Rebels]] [[Assault on Cymoon|attacked]] [[Weapons Factory Alpha]], the [[Galactic Empire]]'s weapons manufacturing facility on the moon. The ''Adjudicator'' attempted to prevent the Rebels escaping from the moon in the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]'', but their efforts failed. Kronn reported the failure to the [[Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]] over [[comlink]]. As Captain Kronn reported, Vader [[Force choke|choked]] the [[officer]] through [[the Force]], ending the communication.<ref name="SW3" />

name: Hobin Carsamba
description: Hobin Carsamba<ref name="Twitter">{{Twitter|pablohidalgo|status/749616406245699584|[[Pablo Hidalgo]]|quote=@LelalMekha Yeah, same with Infinity.|image=File:Pablo_lego_character_name_confirmation.png}} &mdash; [[Pablo Hidalgo]] of the [[Lucasfilm Story Group]] confirmed that the character names introduced in ''[[LEGO Star Wars: The Force Awakens]]'' are considered [[canon]], despite the [[video game]] itself being non-canon.</ref> was an [[alien]]<ref name="Art" /> [[scavenger]] who made a living on the [[desert]] [[planet]] of [[Jakku]].<ref name="TFA">[[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']]</ref> In the [[Standard year|year]] [[34 ABY]],<ref name="SWGA">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']], which includes Hobin Carsamba's [[time]] in [[Niima Outpost]], to [[34 ABY]].</ref> Carsamba was present in [[Niima Outpost]], a Jakku [[Merchant|trading]] settlement run by the<ref name="TFA" /> [[Crolute]]<ref name="TL">{{Shortstory|story=True Love|sformatted=True Love|book=Tales from a Galaxy Far, Far Away: Aliens: Volume I|bformatted=''Tales from a Galaxy Far, Far Away: Aliens: Volume I''}}</ref> [[junk dealer]] [[Unkar Plutt]].<ref name="TFA" />[[File:Hobin_Carsamba_Niima.jpg|thumb|left|225px|Hobin Carsamba passed the scavenger Rey in Niima Outpost.]]Having salvaged junk to trade, Carsamba once joined the line of customers waiting to deal with Plutt at [[Sexes|his]]<ref name="TFA" /> [[Concession Stand]]<ref name="TL" /> while the scavenger [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] was dealing with Plutt at the front of the line. Carsamba fell into position between<ref name="TFA" /> the pet seller and storyteller [[Bobbajo]]<ref name="ACGAS">{{Shortstory|story=All Creatures Great and Small|sformatted=All Creatures Great and Small|book=Tales from a Galaxy Far, Far Away: Aliens: Volume I|bformatted=''Tales from a Galaxy Far, Far Away: Aliens: Volume I''}}</ref> and another [[humanoid]] scavenger at the end of the line.<ref name="TFA" />Carsamba was in Niima again the next [[Standard day|day]] and, while heading away from Plutt's stand, passed Rey as [[Sexes|she]] arrived with the [[Resistance]] [[BB-series astromech droid|astromech droid]] [[BB-8]] on her [[Rey's speeder|speeder]]. Carsamba was still present later that day when Niima was [[Escape from Jakku|attacked]] by the [[First Order military|forces]] of the [[First Order]] in their search for BB-8. Rey, BB-8, and the First Order deserter [[Finn]] fled past Carsamba through a number of Niima's marquees while trying to escape from pursuing [[Stormtrooper (First Order)|stormtroopers]].<ref name="TFA" />

name: Kep-She
description: {{Quote|A corporate fleet was blockading Malastare. A fleet led by Trench.|Wullf Yularen to Anakin Skywalker, regarding the Battle of Malastare Narrows|audio=AFleetLedByTrench-CaM.ogg|Cat and Mouse}}[[File:Trench_headshot.png|thumb|left|250px|Kep-She's task force destroyed the flagship of Trench (pictured), but the admiral survived.]]Kep-She was a [[Force-sensitive]] individual who was inducted into the [[Jedi Order]] and had acquired the [[Military rank|rank]] of [[Jedi Master]]<ref name="Cat and Mouse Guide">{{SWArchive|url=theclonewars/guide/episode216.html|text=''The Clone Wars'' Episode Guide: Cat and Mouse|archivedate=20110713001323}}</ref> prior to the [[Clone Wars]]. When a [[Unidentified corporate fleet|corporate fleet]] [[blockade]]d<ref name="Cat and Mouse" /> the [[planet]]<ref name="USW">''[[Ultimate Star Wars]]''</ref> [[Malastare]]<ref name="Cat and Mouse" /> by [[22 BBY]],<ref name="Trench Enc">{{SWE|characters|admiraltrench|Admiral Trench|archivedate=20131212101344}} states that the [[Battle of Malastare Narrows]] took place prior to the [[Clone Wars]]. ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the start of the Clone Wars to [[22 BBY]]. Therefore, the Battle of [[Malastare Narrows]] must have taken place by 22 [[Galactic calendar|BBY]].</ref> the [[Galactic Republic]] engaged them in what came to be known as the [[Battle of Malastare Narrows]]. The [[fleet]] was [[Commanding officer|commanded]] by the [[Harch]] [[Admiral]] [[Trench]], who inflicted heavy casualties on the Republic forces. Despite their losses, a number of Republic personnel survived and escaped the battle, including [[Republic officer|officer]] [[Wullf Yularen]]. Eventually, Kep-She led a [[Kep-She's task force|task force]] to defeat the blockade. Kep-She's [[task force]] seemingly achieved success, as [[Trench's flagship]] was destroyed and the admiral was presumed to have [[Death|perished]] along with it.<ref name="Cat and Mouse" />The actions of Kep-She's task force at the Battle of [[Malastare Narrows]] were not forgotten. During the Clone Wars, Yularen recognized the [[Trench's crest|crest]] of the supposedly deceased Admiral Trench while attempting to [[Battle of Christophsis|destroy]] the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems|Separatist]] [[Christophsis blockade|blockade]] over [[Christophsis]]<ref name="Cat and Mouse" /> in 22 [[Galactic calendar|BBY]].<ref name="Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''</ref> Having acquired the rank of admiral [[Sexes|himself]] after the war began,<ref name="SWCT">{{SWCT|Wullf Yularen - Republic Captain - Base Series 1|Wullf Yularen - Republic Captain - ''Base Series 1''}}</ref> Yularen correctly deduced that the blockade was under the command of Trench, who had somehow survived the battle at Malastare. Yularen relayed his findings to [[Jedi General]] [[Anakin Skywalker]], recounting his own experience and the actions of Kep-She's task force during the battle. Yularen then proceeded to assist Skywalker in his subsequent defeat of Trench's blockade,<ref name="Cat and Mouse" /> although Trench again survived his apparent demise.<ref name="The Unknown">{{TCW|The Unknown}}</ref>

name: Borgo
description: Borgo the [[Hutt]] was barely an adolescent in the aftermath of the [[Battle of Endor]].<ref name="Empire's End">''[[Aftermath: Empire's End]]''</ref> In [[5 ABY]],<ref name="Life Debt">{{LifeDebtdate}}</ref> the self-proclaimed [[Sheriff]] [[Cobb Vanth]] and [[Sexes|his]] [[Twi'lek]] companion [[Issa-Or]] foiled a plot by the [[Red Key Raiders]] to sneak the Huttlet into [[Freetown]] as a puppet ruler. Finding the Huttlet difficult to manage, Vanth hired [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure|Jabba's]] former [[Beastmaster]] [[Malakili]] to tame the Huttlet in return for lodging. Malakili agreed but insisted on treating Borgo as a [[Sentience|sentient]] being.<ref name="LD" />Malakili became the Huttlet's mentor and christened him Borgo. Borgo came to trust Malakili. Malakili also helped Vanth to forge a pact with the local [[Tusken Raider]]s. In return for the townsfolk giving the Tusken Raiders [[water]], the Raiders agreed to leave Freetown alone and to protect it from criminal elements like the Red Key syndicate. Shortly before the [[Battle of Jakku]], Red Key forces led by [[Lorgan Movellan]] managed to invade and occupy the town. Borgo along with Malakili and Vanth were taken captive by the [[gangster]]s.<ref name="Empire's End" />Movellan's henchmen [[Vommb]] and [[Trayness]] carried the Huttlet in a [[Color|red]] tarp. Borgo struggled to break free of the chart. In the presence of Vanth and Malakili, Movellan announced that he was going to take the Huttlet and sell it back to the [[Hutt Clan|Hutts]]. At Movellan's signal, his henchmen unrolled the tarp. Malakili went to comfort Borgo. Movellan then announced that he was going to [[Slavery|enslave]] the inhabitants of Freetown. While Movellan confronted Vanth, Malakili whispered into Borgo's [[ear]]. Lorgan saw this and ordered Trayness to strike Malakili as punishment.<ref name="Empire's End" />When the Beastmaster cried out in pain, Borgo let out a shrieking wail. This turned out to be the signal for the Tusken Raiders to [[Skirmish in Freetown|attack]] the Red Key forces. The Tuskens [[Death|killed]] the Red Key gangsters but left the Freetown citizens alone per their covenant with Vanth and Malakili. Vanth then subdued Movellan and carved a message on his face as a warning to his Red Key masters.<ref name="Empire's End" />

name: Arran Flekk
description: Flekk came from a long line of [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]] who served the [[Queen/Legends|queens]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] for many generations. Flekk entered the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]] at age seventeen and eventually rose to the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]]. Flekk was highly decorated during his time in service and was eventually transferred to the [[YT-2400 light freighter/Legends|YT-2400 light freighter]] ''[[Predator's Beak]]''. However, it crash-landed on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Yorgraxx]] and was left with no functioning engines of communication systems, while Flekk and [[Vor Harkass]] were the only survivors. After they had been there over a month, they encountered the surviving crew of a crashed [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] [[Starship/Legends|ship]] and they joined forces. They soon after entered the [[Fornayh's fortress|fortress]] of the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Quorlac Fornayh]], where they confronted his reawakened [[Force ghost|spirit]].

name: Ria (General)
description: Ria was a [[general]] who served in the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. In [[0 BBY]], Ria was a member of [[Operation Fracture Oversight]] which was made up of the leading members of [[Operation Fracture]]. In a report to Operation Fracture Oversight, Alliance [[Chancellor (Rebel Alliance)|Chancellor]] [[Mon Mothma]] reported that one of her contacts in the [[Imperial Senate]] had informed her that [[Imperial Military|Imperial forces]] were evacuating the [[moon]] [[Jedha]] because of a massive energy burst in the moons [[orbit]]. Mothma asked the members of the Oversight if they had any new information on Operation Fracture. Ria replied that they did not and asked if Mothma had told the contact about the rumors of an [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] [[planet]] [[Death|killer]].<ref name="Rogue One novel" />

name: Davan Marak
description: {{Quote|This is exactly what I needed, thanks! Here are some credits for the effort.|Davan Marak thanks the traveler for checking the landspeeder|Star Wars: Datapad}}[[File:Stormtroopers_and_Marak.png|thumb|left|250px|Davan Marak was approaching Niima Outpost as the First Order attacked.]]Davan Marak was a [[scavenger]]<ref name="TFAVD" /> who was active in [[Niima Outpost]] on the [[desert]] [[planet]] [[Jakku]].<ref name="TFA">[[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']]</ref> In the [[Standard year|year]] [[34 ABY]],<ref name="SWGA">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']], including Davan Marak's appearance, to [[34 ABY]].</ref> Marak was approaching the outpost on [[Limb|foot]] alongside another individual when it came [[Escape from Jakku|under attack]] by the [[First Order]] military faction, which was searching for the [[astromech droid]] [[BB-8]].<ref name="TFA" />In [[34 ABY]]<ref name="Date">''[[The Star Wars Book]]'' dates the [[Battle of Batuu]], which is depicted in ''[[Star Wars: Galaxy's Edge]]'' via the attraction ''[[Star Wars: Rise of the Resistance]]'', to 34 [[Standard year|years]] after [[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']]. ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of ''A New Hope'' to [[0 BBY]], therefore the events of ''Galaxy's Edge'', including Davan Marak's appearance in [[Star Wars: Datapad|''Star Wars'': Datapad]], must take place in [[34 ABY]].</ref> Marak came to need an [[X-34 landspeeder]] for parts and learned that such a [[Landspeeder|vehicle]] could be found at [[Black Spire Station]] in [[Black Spire Outpost]] on the planet [[Batuu]]. During the [[First Order]] [[Battle of Batuu|occupation]] of the world, the scavenger made a posting on the job board in the outpost and messaged an interested party, asking them to check that the [[speeder]] at the station was of the right make. After Marak's contact confirmed the model of the vehicle, the scavenger messaged them thanks and sent them one hundred [[credit]]s.<ref name="Datapad">{{DatapadCite|Speeder Sale. Need Inspector.|DavanMarakConv-GEDatapad.png|DavanMarakConv2-GEDatapad.jpg}}</ref>

name: Kelkon Selavir
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] named Kelkon Selavir served as a [[Commander/Legends|commander]] in the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. During that [[Time/Legends|time]], Selavir was stationed at the [[Alliance High Command/Legends|Alliance High Command's]] secret [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]] on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Water/Legends|ice]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]]. Commander Selavir later participated in the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], while stationed at the end of one of the base's hallways. Along with [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Kenki Spriow]], [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Scohen Shnaus]], [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Scodo Simas]], and [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Alebry Slemic]], Selavir was among the defenders [[Death/Legends|killed]] by an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Sniper/Legends|sharpshooter]] during the course of the battle.<ref name="SWG" />

name: Scott (Human)
description: During [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] Scott watched over one of several entrances into [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]]. Scott was a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] [[Commando/Legends|commando]], and guarded the entrance into Echo Base alongside another Rebel commando, named [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Downey]]. When guarding the base, Scott was equipped with a [[Alliance Cold Weather Headgear|cold weather headgear]], [[Alliance Cold Weather Gloves|gloves]], and [[Alliance Cold Weather Backpack/Legends|backpack]]. When the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] infiltrated Echo Base during the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of]] [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]], Scott and Downey were killed by Imperial forces.<ref name="SWG" />

name: D. Beasley
description: This individual worked on the [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']]{{'s}} design, as well as on the [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder's]] design, the [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighter's]] design, and the basic design of the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] that became the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']].

name: FN-417
description: {{Quote|Oh, safety.|Rey realizes the safety of her blaster is still on while trying to shoot FN-417|audio=Rey-Saftey.ogg|Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens}}[[File:FN-417 killed.jpg|thumb|left|150px|FN-417 was killed on Takodana.]]FN-417<ref name="TFA" /> was a [[human]]<ref name="ECUC" /> who served in the [[FN Corps]],<ref name="BTA" /> a [[Stormtrooper (First Order)|stormtrooper]] unit in the [[First Order]]'s [[First Order military|military]] during their [[Cold War|conflict]] with the [[New Republic]]&ndash;backed [[Resistance]].<ref name="TFA" /> In the [[Standard year|year]] [[34 ABY]],<ref name="SWGA" /> the [[trooper]] was amongst many deployed to the [[planet]] [[Takodana]] in order to recover the Resistance [[astromech droid]] [[BB-8]], who had been sighted in the [[Takodana Castle|castle]] of the [[pirate]] [[Maz Kanata]]. As the [[Battle of Takodana|attack]] on the castle began, FN-417 moved into the surrounding [[forest]] but was ordered to hold position via radio.<ref name="TFA" />Overhearing the order from nearby, the [[scavenger]] [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] attempted to shoot the stormtrooper, but failed in [[Sexes|her]] first attempt as the [[safety]] of her<ref name="TFA" /> [[Rey's NN-14 blaster pistol|NN-14 blaster pistol]]<ref name="TFAVD">''[[Star Wars: The Force Awakens: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref> was still on. Before she had another chance to shoot, FN-417 turned and opened fire but missed. Rey then fired off two more shots with her [[NN-14 blaster pistol|pistol]], the second of which hit and [[Death|killed]] the trooper; however, she was captured shortly thereafter by First Order forces.<ref name="TFA" />

name: Downey
description: In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] Downey watched over one of several entrances into [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]]. Downey was a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] [[Commando/Legends|commando]], and guarded the entrance into Echo Base alongside another Rebel commando, named [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Scott (Human)|Scott]]. When guarding the base, Downey was equipped with a [[Alliance Cold Weather Headgear|cold weather headgear]], [[Alliance Cold Weather Gloves|gloves]], and [[Alliance Cold Weather Backpack/Legends|backpack]]. When the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] infiltrated Echo Base during the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of]] [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]], Downey and Scott were killed by Imperial forces.<ref name="SWG" />

name: Tepra Tseelit
description: Sometime during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], the [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] Patrol discovered [[Slave I/Legends|''Slave I'']], the personal [[Starship/Legends|starship]] of [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], abandoned geosynchronous orbit of the planet Tatooine. [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] Tepra Tseelit, with [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Noan Jeraddi]], wrote Incident Report 39:3:22 detailing what happened to ''Slave I'' and the blast-proof strongbox found in the [[Cockpit/Legends|cockpit]].

name: Secon Daree
description: Secon Daree<ref name="Rebel Assault Trivia Gallery" /> was a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|Rebel Alliance]] [[Rebel pilot|starfighter]] [[pilot]]. In [[1 BBY]], Daree took part in [[General]] [[Hera Syndulla]]'s [[Attack on Lothal|attack]] on [[Lothal]] to destroy the [[Imperial Armory Complex|Imperial factories]] there. Syndulla's [[starfighter]] force was intercepted by [[Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo|Thrawn's]] [[Seventh Fleet]] and suffered heavy [[Death|casualties]]. After Syndulla managed to create a perimeter in the [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] defenses by causing [[Commander]] [[Vult Skerris]]' [[TIE/D Defender Elite]] to crash into two Imperial [[warship]]s, Daree and the remaining fighters including Syndulla and [[Mart Mattin]]'s [[X-wing starfighter|X-wing]] breached Lothal's [[atmosphere]]. The [[pilot]] cheered once Syndulla created an opening.<ref name="Rebel Assault" />When the remaining Rebel starfighters were shot down by the second wave of [[TIE/ln space superiority starfighter|TIE fighters]], Daree was one of the few survivors, crash-landing in [[Capital City|Lothal City]]. Daree was captured by [[Rukh]], Grand Admiral Thrawn's personal [[assassin]], who had been sent out to capture the remaining Rebel pilots. Upon being brought to [[Governor]] [[Arihnda Pryce]], she ordered that Daree be taken away for interrogation.<ref name="Rebel Assault" />

name: Nicki
description: Nicki was an [[Ewok]] who lived on the forest [[moon]] of [[Endor]] during the [[Galactic Civil War]]. Nicki was part of the tribe of [[Bright Tree Village]] and was present when a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|Rebel]] [[Endor strike team|strike team]] led by [[General]] [[Han Solo]] was brought to the village by members of the tribe. When the [[protocol droid]] [[C-3PO]] told stories about the Rebels' adventures during the war, Nicki was present to hear the tale. Nicki was later present in the Bright Tree Village celebration commemorating the Rebel victory after the [[Battle of Endor]]. During the celebration, Nicki danced with [[Wicket Wystri Warrick/Canon|Wicket W. Warrick]].<ref name="ROJ" />

name: Unidentified pilot (Lord Junn)
description: {{Quote|Wait. Sensors are picking something up..|The pilot while above Sullust|Princess Leia 3}}This [[pilot]] lived during the [[Imperial Era]] including the [[The Disaster|destruction]] of [[Alderaan]] and [[Battle of Yavin]]. After [[Prince]]ss [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] and the [[Alderaanian]] [[starfighter]] [[pilot]] rescued the [[Melodic Order]] from traffickers on [[Naboo]], the pilot was assigned to fly the [[Lord]] [[Junn]]'s eponymous [[Lord Junn|luxury yacht]]. With [[Uwa Pareece]] serving as co-pilot, he flew the ''Lord Junn'' to the [[Sullust system]] in the [[Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="L2" />While Organa, Verlaine, and [[R2-D2]] went to meet with the [[Alderaan Enclave]] on [[Sullust]], the pilot and Pareece waited aboard the [[cockpit]] of the ''Lord Junn'' for Organa. When Organa told them to leave [[orbit]] and jump into [[hyperspace]], Pareece refused to abandon Organa while the pilot reported that [[sensor]]s were picking up an [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] [[Sentinel-class landing craft|''Sentinel''-class landing craft]]. An Imperial [[platoon]] attacked the Alderaan Enclave but were defeated by a pack of [[rockrender]]s unleashed by R2 and Verlaine. This enabled the Alderaanians on Sullust to evacuate offworld aboard the ''Lord Junn'' and [[Mellcrawler (starship)|''Mellcrawler'']].<ref name="L3">[[Princess Leia 3|''Princess Leia'' 3]]</ref>Later, the pilot and their co-pilot brought Organa's caravan to the planet [[Espirion]] where they discovered that an [[Alderaan Flotilla|armada]] of Alderaanian [[refugee]] [[Starship|ships]] had converged on the planet, hearing of Organa's mission to unite the Alderaanian diaspora.<ref name="L4">[[Princess Leia 4|''Princess Leia'' 4]]</ref> An [[Dreed's Star Destroyer|Imperial Star Destroyer]] later attacked the Alderaanian refugee [[fleet]] but was destroyed by the [[Alder-Espirion]] [[warship]] ''[[Espirion Multi]]''.<ref name="L5">[[Princess Leia 5|''Princess Leia'' 5]]</ref>

name: Seventh Guard
description: The Seventh [[Bodyguard|Guard]] was a member of the [[Elite Praetorian Guard]]&mdash;[[Color|crimson]] [[Soldier|warriors]] who served as the personal bodyguards of [[Supreme Leader]] [[Snoke]] of the [[First Order]].<ref name="TLJVD" /> The Third Guard was stationed in [[Snoke's throne room]] along with the other Praetorian Guards at the [[time]] of [[Ben Solo|Kylo Ren's]] audience with the Supreme Leader<ref name="Episode VIII" /> in [[34 ABY]].<ref name="Date" /> Angered by Snoke's disapproving appraisal of [[Sexes|his]] [[Battle of Starkiller Base|defeat]] on [[Starkiller Base]],<ref name="Episode VII">[[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']]</ref> the [[Master of the Knights of Ren|Master]] of the [[Knights of Ren]] took a step in his master's direction, causing the Seventh Guard to snap into a combat stance against the [[Dark side of the Force|dark]] apprentice as his fellows.<ref name="Expanded Edition">''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi: Expanded Edition]]''</ref>The Seventh Guard was still present in the [[throne]] room when Ren returned with the [[Jedi]] [[Padawan|learner]] [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] as his [[prisoner]]. However, instead of executing the former [[scavenger]] as Snoke ordered, Ren chose to [[assassin]]ate his master&mdash;resulting in a [[Attack on the Resistance fleet|confrontation]] between the two [[Force-sensitive]]s and the Praetorian Guards. Like the other Praetorians, the Seventh Guard attempted to avenge the slain Supreme Leader,<ref name="Expanded Edition" /> engaging the traitorous apprentice and Rey. After the death of the [[Third Guard]] at the hands of Rey, the Seventh Guard engaged the Padawan into fight him with his [[vibro-arbir blade]]s immediately after she send flying the Third Guard's [[Bilari electro-chain whip]] towards the room's curtain behind the Seventh Guard, setting it on [[fire]].<ref name="Episode VIII" />Separating his weapon in two, the Seventh Guard proved to be a fitting opponent to Rey, even injuring her with one of his blades in her right [[Limb|arm]]. Overpowering the Jedi, the Seventh Guard kicked her into the [[stomach]] to the floor and then subdued her at the edge of the suspended platform, grabbing her from the armlock, but Rey outsmarted him by letting go [[Skywalker lightsaber|her]] [[lightsaber]] and then grabbing it, cutting the Seventh Guard's right leg and then striking it on his neck, causing the Seventh Guard to fall off the platform to an assured demise. The last Praetorian was killed soon after.<ref name="Episode VIII" />

name: First Guard
description: The First [[Bodyguard|Guard]] was a member of the [[Elite Praetorian Guard]]&mdash;[[Color|crimson]] [[Soldier|warriors]] who served as the personal bodyguards of [[Supreme Leader]] [[Snoke]] of the [[First Order]].<ref name="TLJVD">''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref> The First Guard was stationed in [[Snoke's throne room]] along with the other Praetorian Guards at the [[time]] of [[Ben Solo|Kylo Ren's]] audience with the Supreme Leader<ref name="Episode VIII" /> in [[34 ABY]].<ref name="Date" /> Angered by Snoke's disapproving appraisal of [[Sexes|his]] [[Battle of Starkiller Base|defeat]] on [[Starkiller Base]],<ref name="Episode VII">[[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']]</ref> the [[Master of the Knights of Ren|Master]] of the [[Knights of Ren]] took a step in his master's direction, causing the First Guard to snap into a combat stance against the [[Dark side of the Force|dark]] apprentice as his fellows.<ref name="Expanded Edition">''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi: Expanded Edition]]''</ref>The First Guard was still present in the [[throne]] room when Ren returned with the [[Jedi]] [[Padawan|learner]] [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] as his [[prisoner]]. However, instead of executing the former [[scavenger]] as Snoke ordered, Ren chose to [[assassin]]ate his master&mdash;resulting in a [[Attack on the Resistance fleet|confrontation]] between the two [[Force-sensitive]]s and the Praetorian Guards. Like the other Praetorians, the First Guard attempted to avenge the slain Supreme Leader,<ref name="Expanded Edition" /> engaging the traitorous apprentice and Rey. The other guard was quickly overpowered and decapitated by Ren with [[Kylo Ren's lightsaber|his]] [[crossguard lightsaber]], but First Guard was able to wrangle his staff round Kylo Ren's neck. Rey noticed him in danger and threw [[Skywalker lightsaber|her]] [[lightsaber]] to him, which he then swiftly ignited, through the Guard's head, instantly killing him.<ref name="Episode VIII" />

name: Third Guard
description: The Third [[Bodyguard|Guard]] was a member of the [[Elite Praetorian Guard]]&mdash;[[Color|crimson]] [[Soldier|warriors]] who served as the personal bodyguards of [[Supreme Leader]] [[Snoke]] of the [[First Order]].<ref name="TLJVD">''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref> The Third Guard was stationed in [[Snoke's throne room]] along with the other Praetorian Guards at the [[time]] of [[Ben Solo|Kylo Ren's]] audience with the Supreme Leader<ref name="Episode VIII" /> in [[34 ABY]].<ref name="Date" /> Angered by Snoke's disapproving appraisal of [[Sexes|his]] [[Battle of Starkiller Base|defeat]] on [[Starkiller Base]],<ref name="Episode VII">[[Star Wars: Episode VII The Force Awakens|''Star Wars'': Episode VII ''The Force Awakens'']]</ref> the [[Master of the Knights of Ren|Master]] of the [[Knights of Ren]] took a step in his master's direction, causing the Third Guard to snap into a combat stance against the [[Dark side of the Force|dark]] apprentice as his fellows.<ref name="Expanded Edition">''[[Star Wars: The Last Jedi: Expanded Edition]]''</ref>The Third Guard was still present in the [[throne]] room when Ren returned with the [[Jedi]] [[Padawan|learner]] [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] as his [[prisoner]]. However, instead of executing the former [[scavenger]] as Snoke ordered, Ren chose to [[assassin]]ate his master&mdash;resulting in a [[Attack on the Resistance fleet|confrontation]] between the two [[Force-sensitive]]s and the Praetorian Guards. Like the other Praetorians, the Third Guard attempted to avenge the slain Supreme Leader,<ref name="Expanded Edition" /> engaging the traitorous apprentice and Rey. After the death of one of his fellow guards, the Third Guard entangled [[Skywalker lightsaber|Rey's]] [[lightsaber]] with his [[Bilari electro-chain whip]] and pulled her towards him, after which he grabbed her from the throat to pierce it with the sharp edge of his weapon. But the Third Guard underestimated the young apprentice's skills: Rey broke free from the weapon and fatally cut the Third Guard from his groin to the back. The remaining Praetorians were soon killed also.<ref name="Episode VIII" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Stattata
description: [[Senator]] [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] of [[Alderaan]] sent a formal grievance to [[Moff]] Stattata&mdash;the [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] [[Governor]] [[Governor of the Lothal sector|of the]] [[Lothal sector]] in the aftermath of a [[Mission on Lothal|theft]] on [[Lothal]] of three [[Sphyrna-class Hammerhead corvette|''Sphyrna''-class Hammerhead corvettes]] owned by the [[Imperial Senate|senator]], demanding full compensation for [[Sexes|her]] lost [[Starship|ships]], which were fully loaded with relief supplies that made up of cargo the [[Alderaanian]] also requested Imperial compensation for. In rebel hands, [[Phoenix Squadron]] modified the [[Thief|stolen]] [[corvette]]s, and Stattata eventually paid Organa under the latter's threat of bringing the issue to the Senate.<ref name="Rebel Files" />

name: Cobb Sonbepol
description: In the [[Standard year|year]] [[0 BBY]],<ref name="Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']] that occur prior to the [[Battle of Yavin]], which includes Cobb Sonbepol's [[time]] in [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]], to [[0 BBY]].</ref> shortly before the [[Battle of Yavin]], the [[Gotal]]<ref name="ANH" /> Cobb Sonbepol<ref name="Tweet">{{Twitter|pablohidalgo|status/853330463041232897|[[Pablo Hidalgo]]|quote=Two newly named cantina denizens courtesy of the panel @TomSpinaDesigns and I just wrapped. #SWCO|image=File:Cobb_Sonbepol_tweet.png}}</ref> sat in a booth right next to the door in [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]] in the [[Mos Eisley]] [[spaceport]] on the [[planet]] [[Tatooine]], conversing with the [[Ithorian]] [[Momaw Nadon]] and the [[Stennes Shifter]] [[Trinto Duaba]].<ref name="Complete locations">''[[Star Wars: Complete Locations]]''</ref> While they spoke, local hermit [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and the young [[moisture farmer]] [[Luke Skywalker]] entered the [[cantina]] with their [[droid]]s, [[C-3PO]] and [[R2-D2]], to look for a [[pilot]].<ref name="ANH" />The [[bartender]] [[Wuher]]<ref name="Absolutely Everything">''[[Star Wars: Absolutely Everything You Need to Know]]''</ref> turned the droids away, leaving Kenobi and Skywalker to approach the bar alone. At the counter, Skywalker caught the attention of criminals<ref name="ANH" /> [[Ponda Baba]] and [[Cornelius Evazan]].<ref name="Absolutely Everything" /> While Nadon discussed putting down roots on Tatooine with Duaba in the booth with Sonbepol,<ref name="Complete locations" /> the confrontation at the bar quickly escalated and drew interest from the rest of the cantina, ending when the criminal duo tried to attack Skywalker but were incapacitated by Kenobi with [[Sexes|his]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi's third lightsaber|lightsaber]].<ref name="ANH" />

name: Lufa Danak
description: Lufa Danak was a [[Neimoidian]]<ref name="Visual Encyclopedia">''[[Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia]]''</ref> who served the [[Trade Federation]] during the reign of the [[Galactic Republic]]. After the Federation [[Invasion of Naboo|invaded]] the [[planet]] [[Naboo]]<ref name="TPM" /> in [[32 BBY]]<ref name="Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''</ref> Danak attended a session of the Republic's [[Galactic Senate]] in the [[Senate Building]] on the [[planet]] [[Coruscant]]. The Neimoidian sat in a [[repulsorpod]] with the Federation's representative, [[Senator]] [[Lott Dod]], and another Neimoidian. During the session, [[Queen]] [[Padmé Amidala]] took to the floor to ask the senate for aid in stopping the invasion of her [[homeworld]] Naboo, but before she could even finish her plea, Dod moved the Federation's repulsorpod forward and objected, claiming that there was no proof an invasion was taking place.<ref name="TPM" />[[File:TF Senate.png|thumb|left|250px|Danak accompanied Lott Dod in the Senate.]][[Senator]] [[Aks Moe]] of [[Malastare]] agreed with Dod, causing [[Supreme Chancellor]] [[Finis Valorum]] to declare the point conceded and ask if Amidala would defer her motion to be investigated by a committee. Amidala refused to defer and called for a [[Vote of No Confidence]] in Valorum. This led to Valorum ultimately being replaced by Naboo's [[senator]] [[Darth Sidious|Sheev Palpatine]], while Amidala returned to Naboo and managed to [[Battle of Naboo|defeat]] the Federation forces there.<ref name="TPM" />

name: Pote Snitkin
description: Pote Snitkin was a [[Sexes|male]] [[Skrilling]] [[pilot]] and contraband [[arms dealer]] who served in the [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire|criminal empire]] of the [[Hutt]] [[crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure]].<ref name="Geektionary" /> In [[4 ABY]],<ref name="Galactic Atlas" /> He was amongst the members of Jabba's entourage present alongside their master in [[Sexes|his]] [[Jabba's Palace|palace]] on the [[planet]] [[Tatooine]]. In the palace's throne room, Snitkin stood with other court members and watched a performance<ref name="ROTJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref> of [[Jedi Rocks]] by the [[Max Rebo Band]].<ref name="AEYNTK" />[[File:Snitkinskiff.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Pote Snitkin piloted one of Jabba's skiffs.]]Snitkin later piloted one of two [[Bantha-II cargo skiff]]s that accompanied Jabba's [[sail barge]] ''[[Khetanna]]'' to the [[Great Pit of Carkoon]] in the [[Dune Sea]], where the crime lord planned to feed a group of prisoners to the [[sarlacc]] that inhabited the pit. Snitkin's skiff only carried guards, with the prisoners being transported on the other skiff; however, during the attempted [[Death|execution]], the [[Jedi]] prisoner [[Luke Skywalker]] attacked and defeated the guards on the prisoner transport skiff.<ref name="ROTJ" />Snitkin then manoeuvred the second skiff so the guards on board could shoot at Skywalker and the other prisoners, but the Jedi leapt aboard the Skrilling's skiff and made short work of the guards it carried. Snitkin was one of the last on board the skiff to be defeated, and ended up lying on the floor of the skiff as Skywalker leapt from the vehicle onto the ''Khetanna''.<ref name="ROTJ" /> The pilot was then thrown overboard into the pit beneath the skiff,<ref name="Geektionary" /> where the Skrilling was devoured by the sarlacc.<ref name="AEYNTK" /> Skywalker and his companions ultimately killed Jabba and destroyed his sail barge before escaping.<ref name="ROTJ" />

name: Unidentified Whill
description: {{Quote|May the Force be with me as I begin the sacred task of writing in the ''Journal of the Whills''&hellip;|The Whill|Whills (short story)}}Long after the [[Galactic Civil War]], this Whill took on the task of writing an account of the events of the [[Timeline of galactic history|history]] of [[the galaxy]], to be recorded in the [[Journal of the Whills]]. Going through extensive research on the subject&mdash;hearing every version of the story, viewing every [[holocron]], studying every artifact&mdash;the Whill planned to begin the story with the events that occurred in the [[Imperial Era]]. A [[Second Whill (From a Certain Point of View)|fellow Whill]] protested and suggested starting from the [[Republic Era|Republic era]], but the writer rejected the protest and insisted the other Whill write their own account in the Journal of the Whills&mdash;which the other Whill agreed to, leaving the writer alone while murmuring about having great ideas for an episode of [[Chewbacca]]'s [[Chewbacca's family|family]] celebrating [[Life Day]].<ref name="Whills" />The writer Whill continued summarizing events: from the war between the [[Galactic Empire]] and the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|Rebel Alliance]], to the Alliance [[Battle of Scarif|victory]] on [[Scarif]] by Rebel [[Rogue One (squad)|spies]], and finally [[Prince]]ss [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa's]] [[secret mission to Tatooine]].<ref name="Whills" />

name: Akers Radch
description: {{Quote|He brought me my meds. Thanks for not killing Akers. Sometimes I can't think right.|Vermon Skeetz, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Akers Radch was captured by the [[Corellian slavers]] and [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] in the [[Corellian Slaver Bunker]] near [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]]. During his captivity, he befriended with [[Vermon Skeetz]], a mentally sick man who managed to be fine as long as he took his medication.<ref name="SWG:PR" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Vermon Skeetz escaped the bunker with a group of slaves led by [[Kyran Silene]] but he lost his medicine during the escape.<ref name="SWG:PR" /> A spacer later infiltrated the bunker to find evidence of the slaver operations for the [[Corellian Security Force]].<ref name="SWG:IE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Incriminating Evidence" on Corellia</ref> The spacer met Akers Radch and explained that Vermon was experiencing a psychotic episode, ordering to assassinate Akers. Nevertheless, Radch agreed to help the spacer to retrieve Vermon's medicine.<ref name="SWG:PR" /> The spacer eventually broadcasted the slavers' records on the CorSec emergency request channels,<ref name="SWG:IE" /> leading dozens of CorSec agents to quickly move to the slaver bunker and free all the slaves.<ref name="SWG:HbtKS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Head back to Kyran Silene" on Corellia</ref> After he escapaded the bunker, Akers brought the medicine to Vermon who quickly recovered from his crisis and apologized for his aggressive behavior.<ref name="SWG:PR" />

name: Theda
description: {{Quote|Last night hostiles took pot shots at our base camp, wounding another technician and Doctor Theda.|Extract from Lancer Brunou's journal|Artifact of Aaris}}In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] Theda served in the [[Moff Sarne's forces|forces]] of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]], the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] who ruled the [[Kathol sector]] in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. A [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]], Theda was assigned to [[MS-133]], a research unit that Sarne tasked with performing an [[Archaeology/Legends|archaeological]] excavation on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Aaris III]]. The team, headed by Theda's colleague, Doctor [[Lancer Brunou]], was to investigate ruins left by a [[Aaris|long-dead civilization]] and attempt to discover the cause of their extinction.<ref name="AOA" />Several [[Standard month/Legends|months]] into their expedition, other members of the team discovered a [[Plaque of Victory|strange artifact]] hidden in a floor vault within a [[Place of Kastays|chamber]] they had uncovered among the ruins. The artifact&mdash;known as the Plaque of Victory&mdash;was an inanimate artifact that housed an [[Sentience/Legends|entity]] that fed off of the life force of beings around it, causing them to become suspicious, paranoid, and homicidal. Soon, the Plaque began to influence the members of MS-133; the team started to feel like they were being watched from the jungle surrounding their base camp and generally ill at ease. A small contingent of the team's security detachment headed into the jungle to investigate but never returned, although [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] fire was heard in the distance. Theda, along with the rest of the scientific staff, was issued a weapon in case of trouble.<ref name="AOA" />That night the base camp was attacked<ref name="AOA" /> by the primitive descendants of the Aaris,<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|154|Jelok}}</ref> the planet's native species, using energy weapon technology. Theda was badly wounded during the confrontation. Over the next several days, the injured doctor's condition continued to worsen as the rest of MS-133 either disappeared or were [[Death/Legends|killed]]<ref name="AOA" /> by the Aaris.<ref name="CSWE" /> The last survivors&mdash;Lancer Brunou, a research assistant named [[Solla Deremot]], two [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]] and a [[Technician/Legends|technician]]&mdash;constructed a primitive fortification in an effort to survive while a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress signal]] was sent to Moff Sarne's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] on [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]], requesting help. The call was intercepted by the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'', and the [[Starship/Legends|vessel]] diverted to assist. By the time the crew sent a landing party down to assist the survivors, Theda had succumbed to the injuries sustained several nights earlier, although both Brunou and Deremot managed to survive to be rescued.<ref name="AOA" />

name: Unidentified Krozurbian merchant
description: [[File:KrozurbianMerchant2.jpg|thumb|left|The merchant negotiates with Zorneth and C-3PO over Zorneth's thookahs]]The merchant was present at market when he met with the [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Zorneth]] and his [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]]. The merchant negotiated with Zorneth through C-3PO to purchace Zorneth's herd of [[thookah]]s, noting that although their coats looked good, they were scrawny. Zorneth, a [[vegetarian]], countered that his thookahs were for shearing and not consumption. Before their negotiations could continue, "[[Klorr Vilia|Smiley]]," an individual under Zorneth's care who had been rendered permanently euphoric and pacifistic by the effects of [[savorium herb]], was nearly kidnapped by [[Targonnian]] agents. Once "Smiley" was rescued, Zorneth decided to sell his thookah herd at a loss and depart immediately.<ref name="SOR1" />Unbeknownst to the merchant, these thookahs had been fed with savorium, and their meat possessed the same euphoric effect as the herb itself. These thookahs were butchered and made into [[Thookah-steak|steaks]] that were fed to the [[Krozurbian War Council]], who brought an end to two centuries of [[Krozurbian war|war]] as a result.<ref name="SOR4" />

name: Glowen Faquidde
description: Glowen Faquidde was an [[alien]] who was present in the [[city]] of [[Canto Bight]] on the [[planet]] [[Cantonica]]<ref name="TLJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VIII ''The Last Jedi'']]</ref> in the [[Standard year|year]] [[34 ABY]].<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VIII ''The Last Jedi'']], which includes the appearance of Glowen Faquidde, to the same [[Standard year|year]] as the [[Battle of Starkiller Base]], which ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates to [[34 ABY]].</ref> Faquidde sat with a drink next to a diminutive alien at a table near a bar inside the [[Canto Casino and Racetrack|Canto Casino]] while the [[Resistance]] agents [[Rose Tico]] and [[Finn]] [[Mission to Canto Bight|searched]] the establishment for the [[Master Codebreaker]]. While the alien pair sat together, the [[casino]] shook around them as several [[fathier]]s raced past on the nearby Canto Bight racetrack.<ref name="TLJ" />

name: Guswan Askreeth
description: Shortly after the outbreak of the [[First Order–Resistance war|war]] between the [[First Order]] and the [[Resistance]] in around the [[Standard year|year]] [[34 ABY]], the [[cyborg]] "Colonel" Gusawn Askreeth<ref name="TLJVD" /> spent time on the [[planet]] [[Cantonica]] in the [[city]] of [[Canto Bight]]. The cyborg watched a [[fathier]] race at the [[Canto Bight racetrack]] and cheered while seated in the racetrack's stands.<ref name="TLJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VIII The Last Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VIII ''The Last Jedi'']]</ref>

name: Ran Deezy/Legends
description: Ran Deezy was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual of an [[Ran Deezy's species|unknown species]], was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at a young age and began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] shortly before the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. Stationed at the Temple throughout the war, Deezy, joined by fellow student [[Farn Klin]], attended a gathering of Jedi in a [[Jedi Temple communication center/Legends|Temple comm station]] when [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] sent a [[Hologram/Legends|holographic]] transmission in which the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] gloated over his capture and [[Torture/Legends|torture]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Eeth Koth/Legends|Eeth Koth]]. Due to the shocking nature of the hologram, [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] asked [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] to escort Deezy and Klin out of the transmission room.<ref name="GI" />

name: Noan Jeraddi
description: Sometime during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], the [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] Patrol discovered [[Slave I/Legends|''Slave I'']], the personally [[Starship/Legends|starship]] of [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], abandoned in geosynchronous orbit of the planet Tatooine. [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] Noan Jeraddi, with [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Tepra Tseelit]], wrote Incident Report 39:3:22 detailing what happened to ''Slave I'' and the blast-proof strongbox found in the [[Cockpit/Legends|cockpit]].

name: Tundra Dowmeia
description: In [[19 BBY]], Tundra Dowmeia was present when the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems]] launched a massive [[Battle of Coruscant|invasion]] on [[Coruscant]]. During the invasion the [[Supreme Chancellor]] was captured by the [[Confederacy military]] and taken to [[General]] [[Grievous]]' [[flagship]] the ''[[Invisible Hand]]''. [[Jedi General]]s [[Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] were sent to rescue the [[Darth Sidious|Chancellor]], with Skywalker [[Death|killing]] the Separatist [[Head of State]] [[Count]] [[Dooku]] and crash landing the Invisible Hand onto the surface of the [[planet]].<ref name="Episode III">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref>Shortly after Palpatine's rescue, Dowmeia and [[Mon Cala]] [[Senator]] [[Meena Tills]] were two of the many senators who greeted the Chancellor upon his return to the [[Imperial Executive Building|Senate Office Building]]. Dowmeia was later present at Coruscant's [[Galaxies Opera House]] in the company of a [[Twi'lek]] during a recital of [[Squid Lake]], a [[Mon Calamari]] [[opera]].<ref name="Episode III" />

name: Voren Renstaal's Jedi Master
description: The master [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Darth Voren|Voren Renstaal]] to become a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]]. Following the outbreak of the [[Mandalorian Wars]], the master fought alongside Renstaal during the early stages of the conflict. However, the master was killed during the [[First Battle of Onderon (Mandalorian Wars)|First Battle of Onderon]] in [[3963 BBY]].

name: Bodo Baas's Master
description: [[File:Bodo_Baas_color.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Bodo Baas, an apprentice of this individual]]This [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] lived around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[New Sith Wars]], from [[2000 BBY/Legends|2000 BBY]] to [[1000 BBY]]. Around [[990 BBY]],<ref name="jvs">[[Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force (real-life book)|''Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force'']], p. xix, 25&ndash;29</ref> early in the era known as the [[Great Peace of the Republic]],<ref name="tcswe-era">{{CSWECite|I|363|Great Peace of the Republic}}</ref> this [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] individual wrote a prediction of a new [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] threat: a [[Sexes/Legends|male]] Jedi would be corrupted by a [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord]], while his pregnant sister's choice of action would decide the fate of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]].<ref name="DE6" />At some point, this individual took a Jedi [[Padawan/Legends|apprentice]], the [[Krevaaki]] [[Bodo Baas]].<ref name="DE6" /> Around [[600 BBY/Legends|600 BBY]],<ref name="jvs" /> after completing his [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] and being promoted to Jedi Master, Baas inherited the [[Tedryn Holocron]].<ref>''[[The Essential Guide to Characters]]'', p. 9</ref> By [[590 BBY]], Baas had added the prophecy written by his Master to the [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]].<ref>[[Dark Empire endnotes|''Dark Empire 5: Emperor Reborn'' endnotes]]</ref>

name: Jubnuk
description: Shortly before the [[Battle of Endor]], Jubnuk was present for [[Luke Skywalker]]'s [[Rescue of Han Solo|arrival]] at [[Jabba's Palace]] with the intention of negotiating with [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure|Jabba]] in order to free [[Sexes|his]] friend [[Han Solo]]. As Jabba was not interested in Skywalker's proposal, Skywalker used [[the Force]] to snatch [[Nizuc Bek]]'s [[DL-18 blaster pistol|blaster]] from his [[holster]], prompting Jubnuk to try and wrestle it out of Luke's hand to protect Jabba.
