The Hutt, however, opened the trapdoor of the room in which they were and Skywalker fell into the pit of [[Pateesa]], the [[Hutt]]'s pet [[rancor]].<ref name="VI" />As being near to Skywalker when the trapdoor was opened, Jubnuk fell into Pateesa's pit despite his attempts to hold onto Jabba's moving throne. The Jedi Knight and the [[Gamorrean]] then slipped down the slide which led to the pit. After getting up, both saw the door open revealing Pateesa, who had previously [[Death|eaten]] Jabba's dancer [[Oola]]. Jubnuk went to a barred window and tried to alert someone to get out of there. As his fellow Gamorrean guards laughed at his misfortune, the rancor grabbed Jubnuk and ate him. Skywalker, on the other hand, was able to kill the beast and avoid a similar fate, greatly angering Jabba.<ref name="VI" />

name: Mustag Olus
description: Mustag Olus was a [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] who operated in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. After the conclusion of the [[Stark Hyperspace War/Legends|Stark Hyperspace War]], the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]] pushed Olus to construct an army of [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] and rise up against the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in the [[Kol Huro system]]. Palpatine hoped to both test and further weaken the strength of both the Republic and the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].<ref name="TEA" /> In what became known as the [[Kol Huro Unrest]], the absence of a centralized Republic military forced the intervention of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in order to destroy Olus's growing army, which they succeeded in doing.<ref name="TEA" /><ref name="Rogue Planet">''[[Rogue Planet]]''</ref>

name: Maceb Joodsen
description: An efficient starship mechanic and co-pilot from the planet [[Demar]], Maceb Joodsen worked with captain [[Elga Arbo]]. She had bought a modified [[Starfeld Industries/Legends|Starfeld Industries]] [[Z-10 Seeker-class scout ship|Z-10 Seeker]], the ''[[Redshift Runner]]'', and intended to make it a fast ship for courier works; Joodsen helped her in this task.Arbo borrowed money from [[Gydio Lucone]], an unsavory entrepreneur who wanted her to smuggle for him. As Arbo managed to fulfill monthly payments (and at the same time make herself a reputation), Lucone had nothing to use against her. When she finally delayed, Lucone tried to impound the ship. Arbo refused, the situation went violent and Arbo was seriously injured. With Arbo on the ship, Joodsen piloted it and escaped from Lucone. Soon afterward, Lucone issued a bounty on the ship.{{Char-stub}}

name: Voidhound
description: {{GameLS}}

name: Cy Yunga
description: [[File:Cy Yunga Podrace.png|thumb|left|200px|Cy Yunga participated in a Podrace on Tatooine.]]Hailing from an [[Alien/Legends|alien]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Cy Yunga was a [[Podracer/Legends|Podracer]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]<ref name="E1R" /> during the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]]. Alongside fellow pilot [[Navior|"Bullseye" Navior]], Yunga was viewed as a crowd favorite for the [[Sunken City]] race course located on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Aquilaris]].<ref name="E1R" />At some point during their career, Yunga participated in a race on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. Yunga's competitors included the [[Devlikk/Legends|Devlikk]] [[Wan Sandage/Legends|Wan Sandage]], the [[Gran/Legends|Gran]] [[Mawhonic/Legends|Mawhonic]], the [[Toong/Legends|Toong]] [[Ben Quadinaros/Legends|Ben Quadinaros]], and [[Podracing/Legends|Podrace]] champion [[Bozzie Baranta]].<ref name="Prima">''[[Star Wars: Episode I Racer: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref>Eventually, one of Yunga's [[Cy Yunga's Podracer|Podracer]] [[Engine/Legends|engines]] ended up in the junkyard of a Tatooine-based [[Wald's Parts|parts shop]] owned by the [[Toydarian/Legends|Toydarian]] [[Watto/Legends|Watto]].<ref name="E1R" />

name: Ucce's servant
description: In [[14 ABY/Legends|14 ABY]], this individual served [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Ucce]], a [[Slavery/Legends|slave trader]] and supporter of the underground [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] movement known as the [[Empire Reborn]]. That group, headed by [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Hethrir]], sought to oust the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] and replace it with a new Empire with the [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] Hethrir as its [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]]. The movement was financed by [[Merchant/Legends|trade]] in slaves, patronized by Lady Ucce and other Imperial nobility. Ucce and her servant traveled to [[Crseih Station]] to witness the [[Death/Legends|sacrifice]] of [[Anakin Solo]], son of New Republic [[Chief of State (New Republic)|Chief of State]] [[Leia Organa Solo]], by Hethrir to the [[Waru]], a being from a [[Waru's universe|parallel universe]]. The servant stayed behind on Ucce's [[Lady Ucce's starship|golden starship]] and encountered Organa Solo. In the belief that Organa Solo was interested in purchasing slaves, the servant directed her to find Lady Ucce at the [[Crater Lodge]].<ref name="Crystal" />

name: Tura Sanga
description: Tura Sanga was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]]<ref name="Note">In ''[[Fate of the Jedi: Omen]]'', it is stated that shikkars were crafted from the Force; thus, as a shikkar-maker, Sanga must have been able to utilize the Force</ref> born on the [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]]<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]].<ref name="Allies" /> A member of the planet's [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], Sanga used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to mold [[Glass/Legends|glass]] into intricate dagger-like weapons known as [[shikkar]]s. Sanga's style in crafting shikkars was unique, and Sanga's work became very well known among members of the Sith Tribe.<ref name="Allies" />One shikkar made by Sanga was eventually kept in the personal collection of the [[Sith Saber]] [[Gavar Khai]]. In [[44 ABY]], Khai passed the shikkar on to his daughter, [[Vestara Khai|Vestara]], who hoped that she would be able to use the weapon to [[Death/Legends|kill]] the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] or Skywalker's son, [[Ben Skywalker|Ben]], during their [[Mission to the Maw|upcoming mission]]. Vestara instantly identified the shikkar as one designed by Sanga, recognizing the distinctive style in which the weapon had been made.<ref name="Allies" />

name: Unidentified Imperial stormtrooper drill instructor
description: {{Quote|You sand slime have two minutes to change into your physical training gear and get out here with the rest of your squad&mdash;or your butt is mine. Now move!|The drill instructor|When the Desert Wind Turns: The Stormtrooper's Tale}}During [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] recruit [[Davin Felth/Legends|Davin Felth's]] first day at the [[Academy of Carida]], this drill instructor entered the barracks of Felth and fellow recruits [[Mychael Ologat]] and [[Geoff f'Tuhns]], only to discover an open bag of contraband food, which belonged to f'Tuhns. When Felth, covering for his comrade, claimed the bag belonged to him, the drill instructor let Felth go with a warning rather than issuing punishment since it was his first day.

name: Unidentified Sith communications officer
description: {{Quote|They're sending out a distress signal. They're trying to contact the Hutts to come protect them.|The communications officer|Fate of the Jedi: Allies}}A [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[communications officer]] was born on<ref name="Allies" /> the [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]]<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]]. By [[44 ABY]], the [[Officer/Legends|officer]] had joined the [[Sith armada (Lost Tribe of the Sith)|Sith armada]],<ref name="Allies" /> the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]]'s newly-formed [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]].<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Omen]]''</ref> In that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], the officer was chosen to be a part of the fleet sent under the command of [[Keshiri]] [[High Lord (Circle of Lords)|High Lord]] [[Sarasu Taalon]] to ally with [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] for a [[Mission to the Maw|mission]] to force the powerful [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] being [[Abeloth]] to cooperate with the Tribe. During the mission, the communications officer served aboard the [[ChaseMaster]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]] ''[[Starstalker]]'', under the command of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vyn Holpur]]. After convincing Skywalker to join them by pretending that their mission was to destroy Abeloth, the Sith traveled to the planet [[Klatooine/Legends|Klatooine]] to await Skywalker's friend, [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], who was to provide [[Rockhound|an asteroid tug]] for assistance in navigating [[the Maw]], where Abeloth lived. However, Skywalker and Taalon soon decided to wait for Calrissian just outside the Maw, and Taalon convinced Skywalker to let him leave two frigates&mdash;the ''Starstalker'' and the ''[[Winged Dagger]]''&mdash;behind, under the premise that they were to wait for Calrissian in case any difficulties arose. Taalon revealed his true orders to Captain [[Leeha Faal]] of the ''Winged Dagger'', which she passed on to the communications officer's captain, Holpur&mdash;Taalon wanted them to obtain samples of the strong, [[Glass/Legends|glass]]-like material [[wintrium]] from the sacred [[Fountain of Ancients|Fountain of the Hutt Ancients]] on Klatooine.<ref name="Allies" />After the rest of the fleet departed Klatooine, Holpur and his crew began to carry out their [[Violation|mission]]. The ''Starstalker'' was soon hailed by the [[Council of Elders (Klatooinian)|Klatooinian Council of Elders]]; the communications officer received their signal and reported to Holpur that the Elders wanted the Sith to cease their actions and submit themselves to the Klatooinian government for penalty for their sacrilege. Holpur found that to be humorous, but requested that the officer patch through the message anyway. The officer did so, and soon after discovered that the Klatooinians were sending a distress signal to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]], calling for their assistance in the defense of the Fountain; the officer then reported the finding to Holpur. Holpur was unconcerned by the development, however, and explained to the officer that he believed that the Hutts&mdash;in spite of the [[Treaty of Vontor|treaty]] that bound them to the protection of the Fountain in return for the Klatooinians' perpetual [[Slavery/Legends|servitude]]&mdash;were still too weakened by the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] to provide an adequate defense. Holpur was proven wrong, however, as the Hutts soon arrived and captured the Sith. The entire Sith crews of the ''Starstalker'' and ''Winged Dagger'' were brought to a hearing, and Faal lied that Holpur and his crew had acted of their own accord. The communications officer, Holpur, and the rest of the ''Starstalker''{{'s}} crew were then sentenced to [[Death/Legends|death]] for their violation of the Fountain.<ref name="Allies" />

name: Fitre
description: Fitre had a broad knowledge of beverages and was employed as a bartender in the [[Fungus Pit]], a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] that was located on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]]. Fitre was present in the cantina when it was attacked by a group of [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]].

name: Unidentified TIE/IN Interceptor pilot
description: Two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the battle they served as a [[TIE/IN interceptor/Legends|TIE/IN interceptor]] pilot on board a [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] which was sent to the [[Dominus sector]] to attack a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] scouting party which was attempting to find a new base for the Alliance. Once the Star Destroyer arrived in the system the [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] immediately launched from the Destroyer and flew out against the Rebels, who were piloting [[Incom Corporation/Legends|Incom Corporation]] [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighters]]. The pilot and a number of other Interceptors engaged the X-wings in a dog fight above the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dominus III]]. During the fighting one of the Rebel pilots, [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], and the Imperial pilot were caught in the blast of a missile, which caused enough to damage to force them to try and land on the planet.Organa crashed first and quickly left her ship to chase the Interceptor to its crash site. Once the pilot crashed and attempted to leave his burning vehicle, she was ready for them and shot the Imperial in the chest, knocking them to the ground before they could shoot. Organa then shot the pilot several more times killing them. After the pilot's death Organa and the other rebel pilots, [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] and [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] who had landed on the planet to find Organa, burned the pilot's ship to prevent the Empire using the ship's [[transponder]] to find them.<ref name="SW1" />

name: Fillio Androu
description: Together with another [[Wroonian]] gunrunner, [[Linx Mallicker]], Finious Androu bought the [[Corellian Engineering Corporation/Legends|CEC]] [[YT-2400 light freighter/Legends|YT-2400 light freighter]] ''[[Lambarian Crab]]'', previously used by smuggler [[Finious Crab]]. The Wroonians discovered two of the three secret smuggling compartments that Crab had used.<ref name="ss">''[[Stock Ships]]''</ref>They then began dealing with illegal weapons from the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] to the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], avoiding the [[Corellian system]] because Crab had earned himself some enemies in the local law enforcement agencies and they would recognize the ship. The Wroonians sold their cargo to Imperial officers that liked illegal firearms and to some cells of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="ss" />

name: Davv'si
description: In c. [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], members of the [[Believers]] [[Sith cult]] began poisoning [[kaluthin]] plants on Almas and shortly after the poisoning of a [[Farm/Legends|farm]] owned by [[Rashen Sotose]], Davv'si and a number of other Almas farmers sighted some unidentified [[Airspeeder/Legends|airspeeders]] moving about. Because of the incident at Sotose's farm, Davv'si and the other farmers decided not to take any chances, so they pulled all of their [[harvester]]s into a tight circle and waited in the middle, with their [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifles]] at the ready. The [[Heroes of Cularin]], who were investigating the poisoning of the Kaluthin, approached the group of farmers, and Davv'si informed them of the speeders that the farmers had seen.

name: Malbo
description: Along with fellow Ranger [[Tyri]], Malbo had some criminal dealings with the [[Joruba Consortium]], a shipping company that secretly ran a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] operation. To get rid of some data that implicated them in dealing with the Consortium, Malbo and Tyri hired some agents to steal the data from a Consortium compound on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Nyriaan/Legends|Nyriaan]]. To persuade the agents to go on the assignment, the Rangers claimed that they were on a deep cover operation to investigate the Consortium's criminal activities and that they required the data as evidence, to seal their case against the company.Malbo and Tyri gave the agents some Joruba Consortium uniforms and sent them to board the Consortium [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[Windswept]]'', which was en route to Nyriaan. The agents were to then steal some [[Code cylinder/Legends|code cylinders]] from some Consortium troubleshooters who were aboard the [[Starship/Legends|starship]], then use them to enter the Joruba Consortium branch office on Nyriaan, where they would [[Slicer/Legends|slice]] into the [[Computer/Legends|computer]] system and recover the data. Malbo and Tyri then said that they would pick the agents up with the starship [[Last Call (Malbo and Tyri)|''Last Call'']] and leave Nyriaan, then pay the agents 15,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for their services.The agents agreed to go on the assignment and after Malbo and Tyri outfitted them with Joruba Consortium uniforms, left on the ''Windswept''.{{RPG}}During the course of their mission, the agents learned the real reason why Malbo and Tyri had sent them to recover the data, and bought proof of their corruption to the officer's superiors.{{Endgame}}

name: Tyri
description: Along with fellow Ranger [[Malbo]], Tyri had some criminal dealings with the [[Joruba Consortium]], a shipping company that secretly ran a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] operation. To get rid of some data that implicated them in dealing with the Consortium, Malbo and Tyri hired some agents to steal the data from a Consortium compound on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Nyriaan/Legends|Nyriaan]]. To persuade the agents to go on the assignment, the Rangers claimed that they were on a deep cover operation to investigate the Consortium's criminal activities and that they required the data as evidence, to seal their case against the company.Malbo and Tyri gave the agents some Joruba Consortium uniforms and sent them to board the Consortium [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[Windswept]]'', which was en route to Nyriaan. The agents were to then steal some [[Code cylinder/Legends|code cylinders]] from some Consortium troubleshooters who were aboard the [[Starship/Legends|starship]], then use them to enter the Joruba Consortium branch office on Nyriaan, where they would [[Slicer/Legends|slice]] into the [[Computer/Legends|computer]] system and recover the data. Malbo and Tyri then said that they would pick the agents up with the starship [[Last Call (Malbo and Tyri)|''Last Call'']] and leave Nyriaan, then pay the agents 15,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for their services.The agents agreed to go on the assignment and after Malbo and Tyri outfitted them with Joruba Consortium uniforms, left on the ''Windswept''.{{RPG}}During the course of their mission, the agents learned the real reason why Malbo and Tyri had sent them to recover the data, and bought proof of their corruption to the officer's superiors.{{Endgame}}

name: Darth Bandon's Jedi Master
description: A [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] lived around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Mandalorian Wars]], and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|male]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] who would eventually come to be known as [[Darth Bandon]]. Bandon's [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] tried to curb the the brash young man's anger and hatred, but Bandon chafed under his master's guidance.<ref name="databank" /> Shortly after the heroes of the [[Mandalorian Wars]], the former [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] and [[Darth Malak|Malak]], declared war on the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi Council]]<ref>''[[Heritage of the Sith]]''</ref> and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Bandon betrayed his Master, defecting to Revan's [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]]<ref name="KotOR SG: Darth Bandon" /> during the ensuing [[Jedi Civil War]]. Bandon would go on to became a student in the revitalized [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] on the Sith [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Korriban]], and eventually Darth Malak's [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] and [[Shadow Hand]].<ref name="KotOR CG">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref>

name: Kem Tija
description: One of Tija's subordinates, [[Bront Autin]], sent the director a message about the [[Iyra]] [[sentientologist]] [[Tem Eliss]] and the impending publication of his book ''[[The University of Sanbra Guide to Intelligent Life]]''. Autin recommended to Tija that Eliss be detained for questioning, and that the distribution of his manuscript be restricted. Eliss fled the [[University of Sanbra]] campus before being arrested, however.

name: Zez-Kai Ell's Padawan
description: [[File:Zezkaiell.jpg|thumb|right|150px|Zez-Kai Ell trained the Padawan prior to the Mandalorian Wars.]]A [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] lived around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Mandalorian Wars]] and was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. The apprentice eventually came under the tutelage of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Zez-Kai Ell]]. During the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] conflict with the [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders]], the apprentice joined the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan's]] [[Revanchist|faction of Jedi]] and entered the war.<ref name="KotOR II game" /> In [[3960 BBY]],<ref name="KotOR CG">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> Ell's Padawan fell to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] after the war's [[Battle of Malachor V|final battle]] at the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Malachor V]].<ref name="KotOR II game" /> The Padawan fell as a result of Sith teachings imparted by Revan, who had become the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] of a [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|new Sith Empire]].<ref name="KotOR II game" />In [[3951 BBY]],<ref name="KotOR CG" /> Zez-Kai Ell recalled his Padawan's fall to the dark side in a conversation with<ref name="KotOR II game" /> [[Meetra Surik]],<ref name="Note 2">The character of the [[Meetra Surik|Jedi Exile]], the protagonist of ''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords]]'', was later confirmed to have been known as Meetra Surik in the novel ''[[The Old Republic: Revan]]''.</ref> who had also participated in the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] Wars. In the conversation, Ell concluded that he knew why his Padawan followed Revan, stating that his apprentice had made the right choice to do so when so many others did not.<ref name="KotOR II game" />

name: Dek Laffer
description: Laffer became a [[Staff Sergeant/Legends|Staff Sergeant]] in the [[Alliance Military/Legends|Alliance Military]] and was based in [[Quagmire|Outpost DVL-181]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Aracara]]. Laffer would sometimes welcome personnel who had been newly assigned to the outpost.{{Char-stub}}

name: Gal Brello
description: Brello worked from a base on [[Milarian]], the sector capital, and had replaced the former Moff, [[Nebin Cray]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Trunk-thing
description: This [[Alien/Legends|alien]] played [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] with the [[Gambling/Legends|gambler]] [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], [[Administrator Senior]] of the [[Oseon system]] [[Lob Doluff]], and several others in [[4 BBY/Legends|4 BBY]] at Doluff's home on [[Oseon 6845]]. When it learned from Calrissian that the [[Sharu/Legends|Sharu]] had regained control over the [[Rafa system/Legends|Rafa system]], it unhappily asked whether they would continue selling [[life-crystal]], expensive objects which granted the wearer a lengthened life.

name: Gold Wing
description: [[File:DS2 attack run.jpg|thumb|220px|Gold Wing joined other Rebel pilots in an attack on the second Death Star's reactor.]]Though the term "Gold Wing" could refer to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance's]] [[Gold Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Gold Squadron]],<ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref> the designation was also the [[call sign]] of an individual [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] who served with the [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]].<ref name="ROTJ novel" /> In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], after learning that the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] was constructing a [[Death Star II/Legends|second Death Star]] in the [[Endor system/Legends|Endor system]], the Rebel Alliance decided to launch an [[Battle of Endor/Legends|attack]] on the incomplete [[battlestation]]. A [[Endor strike team/Legends|commando team]] was dispatched to the [[Endor/Legends|Forest Moon of Endor]] to destroy the [[Deflector shield generator/Legends|shield generator]] protecting the [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star]]; with the [[Deflector shield/Legends|deflector shield]] out of the way, the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Alliance Fleet]], under the command of [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Ackbar]], could arrive in-[[Star system/Legends|system]] to destroy the station. However, the Alliance had fallen into a trap orchestrated by [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]; when the Alliance Fleet arrived, they were trapped between an Imperial [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] and a shielded and operational Death Star. As the battle raged between the opposing armadas, the strike team succeeded in destroying the shield generator, leaving the Death Star vulnerable to attack.<ref name="ROTJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref>[[General/Legends|General]] [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], flying the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|freighter]] [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] as [[Gold Leader/Legends|Gold Leader]], used the opportunity to lead several Rebel starfighters&mdash;including Gold Wing&mdash;into the battlestation's superstructure to destroy the Death Star's main [[Reactor/Legends|reactor]]. Racing through the battlestation's interior, the Rebels contended with numerous obstacles and pursuing Imperial [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighters]]. Several Alliance starfighters broke off and doubled back to the Death Star's surface, luring away some of the [[TIE Series|TIE]] fighters and leaving Calrissian, [[Red Leader/Legends|Red Leader]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]], and Gold Wing to destroy the reactor. Gold Wing fell in behind the other two as the trio of [[Starship/Legends|ships]] homed in on their target, but this move left the pilot vulnerable&mdash;Gold Wing was shot down by one of the remaining Imperials. Calrissian and Antilles managed to take out the main reactor, creating a chain reaction that destroyed the Death Star.<ref name="ROTJ novel" />

name: Unidentified Jedi (Yinchorri Uprising)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], this being had at least achieved the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] sometime before [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], having crafted a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] before that time. In that year, a [[Yinchorri Uprising|series of uprisings]] were springing up throughout the [[Yinchorri system]], a conflict which drew most of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] away from [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Stationed at the [[Jedi Temple]] on Coruscant at the time, this Jedi was present when a group of [[Yinchorri]] infiltrated the [[Tower of First Knowledge/Legends|Tower of First Knowledge]] in an attempt to slay the [[Jedi Initiate]]s housed there. The Jedi in the Temple [[Raid on the Jedi Temple (Yinchorri Uprising)|attacked]] the raiding party in force, this being among their number. Successful, the invaders were repelled and the Jedi only suffered two casualties, Jedi [[Tieren Nie-Tan]] and [[Jude Rozess]].<ref name="AOW" />

name: Ib Dekeet
description: Dekeet was one of the five powerful representatives present at the [[Pentastar Talks]], and was initially hesitant to join forces with [[Grand Moff/Legends|Grand Moff]] [[Ardus Kaine]]. However, the Grand Moff's skills as an orator and negotiator won the governor over. In particular, Governor Dekeet objected to putting the Pentastar logo on vehicles and troops under their command.

name: Jay Jay
description: When [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] crashed on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] shortly after [[Order 66/Legends|the fall]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], [[Jar Jar Binks/Legends|Jar Jar Binks]] was there to greet him and introduced Vader to his children: Jay Jay, [[Jo Jo]] and [[Jee Jee]]. The enthusiastic children then pounced on the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] and covered [[Darth Vader's armor|his armor]] in crayon.

name: Jo Jo
description: When [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] crashed on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] shortly after [[Order 66/Legends|the fall]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], [[Jar Jar Binks/Legends|Jar Jar Binks]] was there to greet him and introduced Vader to his children: Jo Jo, [[Jay Jay]] and [[Jee Jee]]. The enthusiastic children then pounced on the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] and covered [[Darth Vader's armor|his armor]] in crayon.

name: Jee Jee
description: When [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] crashed on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] shortly after [[Order 66/Legends|the fall]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], [[Jar Jar Binks/Legends|Jar Jar Binks]] was there to greet him and introduced Vader to his children: Jee Jee, [[Jo Jo]] and [[Jay Jay]]. The enthusiastic children then pounced on the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] and covered [[Darth Vader's armor|his armor]] in crayon.<ref>''[[Escape from the Jedi Temple]]''</ref>Some time after the destruction of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first]] [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star]], Jar Jar took Jee Jee to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] for his child's birthday.<ref>''[[Race for the Holocrons]]''</ref>

name: Rojer 621
description: Nothing was known about Rojer 621, not even if they were male or female. In fact, it was not even sure if they were a true New Republic agent, or a ploy by Sarne himself to feed false information to the ''[[FarStar]]''. All that was clear is that they were a member of Sarne's administration, and that they funneled information to the ''FarStar''.Roger 621 first made their presence known when they started to leave clues for the ''FarStar'' to follow during their hunt for Moff Sarne. Unfortunately for the crew of the ''FarStar'', they were out of contact with the New Republic at that point, and had no way of verifying whether or not Rojer 621 was a genuine intelligence asset or not.

name: Urna
description: Urna was a member of a group of [[Believers]] who were sent to place transmitters on fault lines on the surface of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Caarimon]], as part of a plot to release a virus on the planet. Urna attacked the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who were investigating the plot, and was defeated by them.

name: Willus
description: Willus was a member of a group of Believers who were sent to place some transmitters on fault lines on the surface of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Caarimon]], as part of a plot to release a virus on the planet. Willus attacked the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who were investigating the plot, and was defeated by them.

name: G. Bresch
description: Following the publishing of a story on the Cularin holonet node about the [[Thaereian military]] officer [[Nightwing]], many people believed that Nightwing may have been [[Osten Dal'Nay]], the commander of the Cularin Militia. A discussion thread was set up on the holonet node to discuss Nightwing and Bresch was tasked with monitoring any postings on the subject of the story.

name: Seggor Tels
gender: ''Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II'' novel
description: {{Quote|I seek to understand why I still weep at night for those who died, why I still hate the dreamers who caused it all, and why I feel shame for my role in what transpired. Perhaps what I truly seek is a dream of my own.|Seggor Tels|The Shame of Seggor Tels}}Shortly after the [[Declaration of a New Order]], Mon Calamari leaders such as [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Ackbar]] initially welcomed the Empire. Quarren leaders like Seggor Tels, on the other hand, preferred to stay in the oceans. Tels, in particular, derided the Mon Calamari's fixation on the stars, and considered them to be pompous dreamers who were ignorant of what life was like for the Quarren of the ocean depths.<ref name="Shame" />An Imperial agent, acting as an advance scout for a planned Imperial invasion, approached Tels at this time. Seeing a chance to strike back at the hated Mon Calamari, the Quarren leader agreed to sabotage Dac's [[Planetary shield/Legends|planetary shields]]. In the ensuing [[Subjugation of Mon Calamari|conquest of Dac]], the Imperial forces overwhelmed the defenseless Mon Calamari. However, Tels' initial joy in seeing the Mon Calamari brought down soon turned bitter, as both the Quarren and the Mon Calamari were [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]]. No record exists of any special consideration given to Tels or any other Quarren collaborators by the Empire.<ref name="Shame" />Blaming the Mon Calamari for forcing the Quarren to become involved in [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] affairs, Tels was nevertheless convinced that the Empire had to be forced off their shared homeworld. Over time, Tels convinced the Quarren to join the Mon Calamari-led resistance movement.<ref name="Shame" /> Seggor Tels and others helped the Mon Cal rebel leader Ackbar in a [[Heurkea operation|mission]] in [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]].<ref name="TFU2n" /> When the long struggle finally ended with the [[Calamarian Revolt|liberation of Dac]] in 1 BBY, many of Tels' newly freed people left their homeworld, in search of a new life away from Mon Calamari, Empires, and [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellions]]. Tels remained on Dac, however, to live a meditative life in the oceans.<ref name="Shame" />

name: Garr
description: Garr was born in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] and belonged to the [[Exargan]] species.Raised to respect the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], Garr wished even to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]].Garr was [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett's]] friend from the time when Boba was saved from [[Raxus Prime/Legends|Raxus Prime]] by a group of [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] and a [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Glynn-Beti|Jedi]]. They met on the ship ''Candaserri '' which was taking them and other orphans to [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]]. At this time Garr was 10 years old and identified as being neither male nor female.During their time together, to avoid suspicion, Boba lived under the name of Teff, and was assumed to be an orphan too. Both children loved to explore, and their curiosity almost resulted in [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] and Garr being left floating in space.Upon arriving at Bespin, Boba tried to escape, but he was followed by Garr, who brought to Boba his flight bag that he'd forgotten. But while trying to persuade Boba to come back, they were interrupted by [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]]. Garr left Boba with Aurra. Assuming, however, that Boba was in trouble, Garr sought to help rescue him by telling the Jedi at the orphanage everything. This resulted, ironically, in Boba almost losing his life.

name: Harc Seff
description: [[File:Max Rebo Band applause.png|thumb|left|250px|Harc Seff applauded the Max Rebo Band at Jabba's palace.]]The [[Ishi Tib]] Harc Seff<ref name="Topps" /> spent time in the [[Jabba's Palace|palace]]<ref name="ROTJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref> of the [[Hutt]] [[crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]<ref name="Absolutely Everything">''[[Star Wars: Absolutely Everything You Need to Know]]''</ref> on the [[planet]] [[Tatooine]]<ref name="ROTJ" /> in the [[Standard year|year]] [[4 ABY]].<ref name="Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' establishes that the events of [[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']], including Seff's appearance, take place in [[4 ABY]].</ref> While in the palace, Seff viewed a performance of the song<ref name="ROTJ" /> "[[Jedi Rocks]]" by the [[Max Rebo Band]]<ref name="Absolutely Everything" /> in the Hutt's courtroom and applauded when the band finished. Jabba then called for a repeat of the song, but during the second performance the Hutt dropped the [[Slavery|slave]] [[Oola]] into the pit containing his pet [[rancor]]<ref name="ROTJ" /> [[Pateesa]]<ref name="Lifedebt">''[[Aftermath: Life Debt]]''</ref> underneath the throne room.<ref name="ROTJ" />After the performance [[Prince]]ss [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] arrived in the throne room disguised as the [[bounty hunter]] [[Boushh]] in order to claim the [[bounty]] on the [[Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca]]. While Jabba and Organa haggled over the price of the bounty, Seff stood in front of the bounty hunter [[Boba Fett]] and the dancers [[Rystáll Sant]] and [[Lyn Me]]. Organa then shocked those present in the courtroom by activating a [[thermal detonator]] in order to threaten Jabba into paying more. The ploy amused Jabba and he agreed to pay more, satisfying Organa and causing her to de-activate the detonator. Organa and her allies [[Rescue of Han Solo|later]] [[Death|killed]] Jabba above the [[Great Pit of Carkoon|Pit of Carkoon]].<ref name="ROTJ" />

name: Lila
description: {{Quote|Do everything you can. Everything. We have to make it.|Lila, to the crew of the ''Aurora Flare''|Star Wars 49}}Lila was a [[Mon Calamari]] who served the [[Mon Cala Mercantile Fleet]] as a [[captain]] of the [[Star Cruiser]] ''[[Aurora Flare]]''. After learning of the [[death]] of [[King of Mon Cala|King]] [[Lee-Char]], the Mercantile [[Fleet]], which was stationed above the [[planet]] [[Mon Cala]], began to [[Mutiny on Mon Cala|rebel against]] the [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] personnel aboard their [[Starship|ships]], during this [[time]] Lila clubbed a [[stormtrooper]] to death with their [[Stormtrooper armor|helmet]]. Shortly after, the Empire [[blockade]]d the planet and as they began their plan to put down the Mon Cala resistance, a [[Alliance Fleet|fleet]] of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|rebel]] starships, led by [[Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar]], emerged from [[hyperspace]] after being contacted by [[Regent]] [[Urtya (Mon Calamari)|Urtya]].<ref name="Star Wars 49" />In an attempt to breach the blockade, Ackbar contacted Lila aboard the ''Aurora Flare'' asking the captain to volunteer for the act even though it was far from certain that the tactic would work and that Lila could end up dying for nothing. In response Lila recounted how they had volunteered when they clubbed a stormtrooper to death, before asking Ackbar what they had to do. Honored, Ackbar expressed [[Sexes|his]] wish that there was more time for them to know one another as he informed Lila of his plan. After being informed of what had to be done, Lila had the ''Aurora Flare'' head towards the [[Star Destroyer]] commanded by Admiral [[Meori]] with a full load of [[coaxium]] from [[Redhurne system|Redhurne]] stored aboard.<ref name="Star Wars 49" />[[File:Aurora Flare.png|thumb|left|250px|The ''Aurora Flare'' is badly damaged by the [[turbolaser]] fire]]As the ship made its way to the destroyer, Lila stood on the ship's [[Bridge (starship)|bridge]] and was informed by crew members that the [[Deflector shield|shields]] were failing as the Imperials were firing on the ship, Lila told the crew to do whatever they could and that they had to make it to the lead destroyer. As the ''Aurora Flare'' drew closer, Meori asked for the records to be checked and to identify the ship. When he learned of what the ship was carrying, he immediately ordered his crew to stop firing on the ship. However, it was too late and Lila's ship crashed into and significantly damaged the Star Destroyer, the act destroying the ''Aurora Flare'' in the process, killing Lila. Lila's sacrifice allowed the rebels and twelve Mon Cala cruisers to escape to the rebel's [[Mako-Ta Space Docks|Mako-Ta Base]].<ref name="Star Wars 49" />

name: Arnod
description: Arnod was one of the four [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] that pursued the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] into the [[Hoth asteroid field]] following the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|invasion of Hoth]] in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]]. Arnod's fighter was destroyed during the pursuit, and he pilot was [[Death/Legends|killed]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Yorsh Manted
description: During the [[Imperial Era|reign]] of the [[Galactic Empire]], Yorsh Manted worked for the [[Mining Guild]] and represented its interests in the criminal [[Pyke Syndicate]]'s [[Spice mines of Kessel|spice mines]] on the [[planet]] [[Kessel]] by patrolling and ensuring the guild got its cut. The [[Pyke]]s agreed to Manted and the other guild employees being there, but often disagreed with them on tactics for running the mine, as the criminals prefered less bureaucratic and more brutal methods of security.<ref name="SoloOG" /> In [[10 BBY]],<ref name="Date">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide]]'' dates the events on [[Kessel]] in ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story]]'' to nine years after the [[Proclamation of the New Order|formation]] of the [[Galactic Empire]]. ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the formation of the Empire to [[19 BBY]], therefore the event on Kessel in ''Solo'' must take place in [[10 BBY]].</ref> Manted and another guild employee accompanied the Pyke [[capo]] [[Quay Tolsite]] when he traveled to one of the mine's landing pads to meet the crew of the [[YT-1300 light freighter]] known as the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]''.<ref name="Solo">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story]]''</ref>[[File:Tolsite-at-Kessel.jpg|thumb|left|Yorsh Manted worked on Kessel.|200px]]The crew was led by the [[human]] [[Qi'ra]] who claimed to be a [[Slavery|slaver]] and offered her captives [[Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca]] as a sample of her product. Manted and the other guild employee checked the two slaves and upon signalling that they were satisfied, Tolsite had Solo and Chewbacca taken away while he took Qi'ra to discuss business. However, the ''Falcon's'' crew were actually on Kessel to steal the Pyke's [[coaxium]] and started a [[Raid on Kessel|slave revolt]] in which the miners overthrew their Pyke overseers.<ref name="Solo" />

name: Sakai
description: [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] Sakai was the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] ruler of [[Thuris sector]] who was critical of the way Moff [[Abran Balfour/Legends|Abran Balfour]] controlled the neighboring [[Parmic sector]].<ref name="GG9" />Soon after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], an elite [[Alliance Special Forces/Legends|Rebel SpecForce]] team known as [[Reekeene's Roughnecks]] began opposing Sakai. To do so, they used the [[Corellian Engineering Corporation/Legends|CEC]] customized [[HT-2200 medium freighter]] ''[[Reekeene's Retribution]]'' in 1,200 armed attacks against their forces, as well as other resources. The Roughnecks were credited with the destruction of 872,000,000 tons of Imperial equipment including an orbital [[Shipyard/Legends|starship yard]], which might refer only to their actions against Sakai.<ref name="SS">''[[Stock Ships]]''</ref>Sakai managed to discover the identities of several members of the Roughnecks and contacted with the [[Special forces/Legends|special forces]] of the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]]. They assigned a special unit, codenamed [[Venom Guard]], to track and execute the Roughnecks. After a multi-ship compound attack of the Rebel fleet against an Imperial fort in Thuris sector, the ''Retribution'' was infiltrated by intruders; this ship did not join the rest of its fleet.<ref name="SS" />

name: Unidentified Mon Calamari commander (Mon Cala)
species: ''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 16
description: {{Quote|The Imperial bombardment continues to intensify, Admiral. They've started hitting targets in this hemisphere.''"<br />"''I see that, commander. Order all cruisers to launch.''"<br />"''Launch, sir? But these are trading ships, unarmed. If we try to run the Imperial blockade we'll&hellip;|The commander, and Admiral Raddus|Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 17}}During the [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] [[occupation of Mon Cala]], this [[Mon Calamari]] [[commander]] was aboard a Mon Calamari [[Star Cruiser]] in the [[Mon Cala Mercantile Fleet]]. His superior, [[Admiral]] [[Raddus]], was tasked with the [[defense of the southern polar regions]] by [[King of Mon Cala|King]] [[Lee-Char]] and came up with a formidable tactic, which Imperial [[Governor]] [[Wilhuff Tarkin]] thought brilliant. Raddus requisitioned the Star Cruiser and others from the nearby [[Mon Calamari Shipyards]] and linked their advanced [[Deflector shield|shielding]] together. Their combined shields created a large shield bubble around the small [[fleet]]. During the defense, the commander reported to Raddus that the shields were still holding at full power, to which Raddus retorted that they of course were. The commander then asked Raddus if the Imperials would ever become tired of losing and withdraw, with Raddus replying that he almost hoped they wouldn't.<ref name="Dark Lord 16" />Eventually, Tarkin's three [[Imperial I-class Star Destroyer|''Imperial I''-class Star Destroyers]] began [[Orbital bombardment|bombarding]] the northern hemisphere and the [[turbolaser]] fire began tearing through the Mon Calamari settlements. The commander soon reported to Raddus that a fifth settlement, [[Zeran Town]] had been destroyed. The commander then told Raddus that the bombardment was increasing its pace but had not targeted the southern hemisphere. Raddus told the commander that the [[planet]]'s curve was in their favor, but once the [[Star Destroyer]]s target them, their shields would only survive a few hits. Raddus had the commander order the other ships to de-link their shields on his command. When the commander asked what would happen in the meantime, Raddus said they would remain fighting.<ref name="Dark Lord 17">[[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 17|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 17]]</ref>[[File:Barr Prophecy DV17.png|thumb|left|200px|The commander ordered the cruisers to launch]]Shortly after, Raddus received an message from Mon Cala's [[Mon Cala monarchy|king]], [[Lee-Char]], which ordered a planet-wide ceasefire of all of [[Mon Cala planetary defense services|Mon Cala's defensive forces]]. Raddus was shocked at this and refused to do so, saying they could not just give up. Lee-Char surrendered to Moff Tarkin but the man had the bombardment continue until the [[king]] was arrested. The Star Destroyers now started hitting the southern hemisphere, prompting Raddus to act. He told the commander to order all cruiser to launch. The commander refused to believe the cruiser would survive against the Star Destroyers but Raddus told the Mon Calamari that they would be sitting there waiting to die otherwise. The commander did so and the cruisers launched and made to the [[blockade]]. As the cruisers passed, two of them were shot down but the one which Raddus and the commander were stationed on survived and Tarkin let the last three go, saying they would be found eventually.<ref name="Dark Lord 17" />

name: Sweitt Concorkill
description: Sweitt Concorkill was a [[Vurk]] [[senator]] who served in the [[Galactic Senate]] of the [[Galactic Republic|Republic]] during the [[Clone Wars]]. Concorkill joined the [[Delegation of 2,000]], a group of senators who were concerned with [[Supreme Chancellor]] [[Darth Sidious|Sheev Palpatine's]] continued use of emergency powers during the war.<ref name="VE" />[[File:Palpatines_private_viewing_box.png|thumb|left|200px|Sweitt Concorkill watches ''Squid Lake'' in the Chancellor's private box.]]Shortly after the [[Battle of Coruscant]]<ref name="Episode III" /> in [[19 BBY]],<ref name="Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']], which includes Sweitt Concorkill's appearance, to [[19 BBY]].</ref> Concorkill attended a performance of the [[opera]] ''[[Squid Lake]]'' at the [[Galaxies Opera House]] on the [[planet]] [[Coruscant]]. The senator sat in Palpatine's private viewing box along with<ref name="Episode III" /> [[Vice Chair]]<ref name="VE" /> [[Mas Amedda]],<ref name="Episode III" /> senior administrative [[aide]]<ref name="VE" /> [[Sly Moore]], and the Supreme Chancellor [[Sexes|himself]].<ref name="Episode III" />Midway through the performance, Palpatine calmly dismissed Concorkill, Amedda, and Moore from the box upon the arrival of [[Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker]], whom Palpatine had invited to watch the opera with him. Together, the two proceeded to have a private conversation on matters relating to knowledge of [[the Force]].<ref name="Episode III" />

name: Ro Vacca
description: Vacca worked as a scribe for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Direus'Pei]]. When the Hutt was commissioned by [[Kossak the Younger]] to write a play about [[Kossak Inijic Ar'durv]], Direus'pei began developing drafts and dictated them to Vacca. They toiled on the project for years and play came to be named [[Evocar (play)|''Evocar'']]. However, Kossak the Younger eventually lost patience and in [[671 BBY]] seized the draft of the play. However, Kossak was horrified by the play, which criticised the Hutt exploitation of the [[Evocii]], so he ordered Direus'pei and all copies of the play to be consumed by [[Maltorran protoplasm]].Vacca was able to escape with an older draft of the play, and circulated it among the Hutt's [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] [[Species/Legends|species]] per Direus'pei's last wish. As a result, many of the Hutt's client species rose up against their Hutt masters.

name: Unidentified Jedi (Accresker Jail)
description: {{Quote|A few short years when host and swarm coexisted! And then&mdash;the failure of frail flesh&hellip;the crash&hellip;the stillness&hellip;|The Force spirit of the hookspores|Doctor Aphra 23}}[[File:Hookspores.jpg|thumb|left|200px|The interior of the Jedi's ship, overrun with gundravian hookspores]]During the Jedi's life, they became the host to a swarm of [[gundravian hookspore]]s which infected them. Several [[Standard year|years]] afterwards, the Jedi was killed while in their [[Penumbra-1 shattersprite]], and the wreckage of the [[Starship|ship]] eventually came to be within the [[wreckage-prison]] of [[Accresker Jail]], where the hookspores were stuck. The hookspores mutated due to the presence of a [[The Force|Force]]-active [[kyber crystal]], and became psychically imprinted with the personality of the Jedi.<ref name="Aphra 23">[[Doctor Aphra 23|''Doctor Aphra'' 23]]</ref> The hookspores were able to appear as a [[Force spirit]], and had Force abilities.<ref name="Aphra 22" />The corpse of the Jedi was discovered by [[Chelli Lona Aphra|Chelli Aphra]], who was led to the wreckage of the Jedi's ship by the Force spirit. [[Sexes|She]] discovered the infestation of hookspores and the Jedi's [[lightsaber]], but was forced to return to the [[prison]] before she could do anything about either.<ref name="Aphra 22" />

name: Susaut Volupicite
description: [[File:Volupicite_loses.png|thumb|left|250px|Susaut Volupicite lost at sabacc to Lando Calrissian on the planet Vandor.]]Susaut Volupicite was an [[alien]] who spent [[time]] in the [[Cantina|saloon]] known as [[the Lodge]] on the [[planet]] [[Vandor]]<ref name="SoloOG">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide]]''</ref> in the [[Standard year|year]] [[10 BBY]].<ref name="Date">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide]]'' dates the portion of ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story]]'' set on [[Vandor]] to nine [[Standard year|years]] after the [[Proclamation of the New Order|founding]] of the [[Galactic Empire]]. ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the founding of the Empire to [[19 BBY]]; therefore, the events on Vandor take place in [[10 BBY]].</ref> While in the Lodge, Volupicite joined a game of the<ref name="Solo" /> [[Corellian Spike]]<ref name="SoloOG" /> variant of [[sabacc]] being played at one of the tables in the establishment's back rooms. Sitting between<ref name="Solo" /> the [[Nephran]] [[Therm Scissorpunch]]<ref name="Species">''[[Star Wars: Alien Archive]]''</ref> and the dealer, [[Saucer Head]].<ref name=Card Trader">{{SWCT|Saucer Head - 18 - Solo: A Star Wars Story - Physical Base - Limited|Saucer Head - 18 - ''Solo: A Star Wars Story - Physical Base'' - Limited}}</ref> Volupicite eventually lost to the [[human]] [[smuggler]] [[Landonis Balthazar Calrissian|Lando Calrissian]] and left the table.<ref name="Solo" />Following the loss, Volupicite returned to watch further rounds being played and stood behind the human criminal [[Han Solo]]. Solo and Calrissian then both [[Gambling|wagered]] their [[starship]]s on a round, and after Solo revealed [[Sexes|his]] hand of cards to be [[straight staves]], Volupicite cheered with the rest of the room and clapped the criminal on the shoulder. The alien was then displeased when Calrissian revealed that he had [[Full Sabacc]], meaning he had won the game.<ref name="Solo" />

name: Keeper of the Whills
description: Around [[104 ABY]], the [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]] [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] related the story of the [[Skywalker family/Legends|Skywalker family's]] exploits to a Keeper of the Whills, focusing on the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] and the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]].

name: Zzzs
description: {{Quote|Another storm of the endfire, Father Kkkt. They're getting more frequent.''"<br />"''And they're getting ''worse''. Gather out people together Zzzs. Keep them calm. I'll do what I can.|Zzzs and Kkkt|Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 23}}[[File:The-Sith-Lords-Arrival-DV-21.png|thumb|left|250px|Zzzs and Kkkt watch Darth Vader's ship arrive]]At some point, Zzzs and [[Father (title)|Father]] [[Kkkt]] witnessed the arrival of [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader's]] [[Naboo Royal Starship|ship]] on [[Mustafar]]. As the [[Starship|ship]] flew across the sky, set afire due to entering the [[planet]]'s [[atmosphere]] without [[Deflector shield|shields]], Zzzs asked Kkkt what it was. Kkkt thought it was an omen, and he examined the falling object through a ring of [[Magma|lava]] he had manipulated using [[The Force]].<ref name="Dark Lord 21" /> Fearing this new arrival, Kkkt sent a scout party out to investigate it, but only [[Rrrn]] returned. He described a dark figure&mdash;being Vader&mdash;who single-handedly dealt with the rest of the scout party.<ref name="Dark Lord 22">[[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 22|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 22]]</ref>Vader and the spirit of an ancient [[Sith]] began building a structure in the [[Gahenn Plains]]. It was meant to channel the Force energies from a [[Dark side of the Force|dark side]] locus to open the door to another realm. However, each design kept failing. Every time the attempt was made, lava storms erupted on the Mustafarians. Kkkt tried to keep them at bay while Zzzs gathered their people, but the storms were getting worse. Kkkt contacted the other clanholds, who were experiencing the same thing. He decided to gather them all in an attempt to destroy the structure being built.<ref name="Dark Lord 23">[[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 23|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 23]]</ref>

name: Osh Scal
description: Osh Scal was a [[Kallidahin]] [[technician]]<ref name="Visual Dictionary" /> who worked for the [[Archaeological Research Council]]<ref name="USW" /> at an [[Archaeologist|archaeological]] [[Polis Massa Base|dig site]] on an [[asteroid]] in the [[Polis Massa]] [[asteroid field]]. The Kallidahins at the dig site were searching for answers as to why the [[planet]] of Polis Massa had been destroyed and for traces of the extinct [[Eellayin]] [[species]], whom they believed to be their ancestors.<ref name="Visual Dictionary" />In [[19 BBY]],<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']], including the [[Reproduction|birth]] of the [[Luke Skywalker|Skywalker]] [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|twins]], to [[19 BBY]].</ref> at the end of the [[Clone Wars]], [[Senator]] [[Bail Organa]] and the [[Jedi]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Yoda]] brought the injured and heavily pregnant Senator [[Padmé Amidala]] to the dig site so that she could give [[Reproduction|birth]] to the [[twin]]s she was carrying.<ref name="ROTS">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref> Scal was part of a team consisting of two trained [[Doctor|physicians]] and several [[xenobiologist]]s who attended to Amidala, but as her condition was judged to be extremely critical, the group did not even have [[time]] to change out of their [[Clothing|caving jumpsuits]].<ref name="Visual Dictionary" />Amidala was placed in a medical facility designed for treating investigators rather than childbirth,<ref name="Visual Dictionary" /> and while she lay in labor,<ref name="ROTS" /> Scal and fellow technician [[Dznori Xam]]<ref name="Visual Dictionary" /> stood at a nearby monitor studying and gesturing at the readout. During the actual birth, the room was emptied, apart from Kenobi, a [[GH-7 medical droid]], and a [[midwife droid]]. The twins survived the birth, but Amidala [[Death|did not]], having lost the will to live following the betrayal of her [[Marriage|husband]], [[Anakin Skywalker]]. She survived only long enough to name the children [[Luke Skywalker|Luke]] and [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia]].<ref name="ROTS" />

name: Abil Vilorin
description: Vilorin was the leader of a ten-person cell located on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Brosi]]. Vilorin's cell performed surveillance on an area under the influence of the local resistance group known as the [[Brosin Underground]]. Although the Brosin Underground was opposed to the oppressive [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority]]-controlled government, their methods made the CSA nervous. Vilorin and their commanders, including [[General/Legends|General]] [[Carlist Rieekan/Legends|Carlist Rieekan]], feared the CSA would increase security and find Vilorin's cell&mdash;as well as three underground Rebel operatives working as false [[Zinsian]] spin-sealer technicians.Vilorin repeatedly attempted to contact one of the leaders of the Brosin Underground, [[Vuraj Marn]], to discuss this issue, and convince him to change the Underground's plans. However, as of [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], Vilorin doubted they would succeed due to the different goals of both resistance groups. Furthermore, Marn proved difficult to find.

name: N'tain Xalis
description: Xalis was the leader of [[Sandwind Team (Tatooine)|Sandwind Team]] cell, with eleven operatives coordinating Rebel activities in [[Arkanis sector/Legends|Arkanis sector]] from a farm on [[Motesta]], [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. They also used contacts and unofficial foster agents.Although Xalis wanted to work with relative stillness, Tatooine was a difficult place for it: The search for the [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star]] plans and later the hunt of [[Adar Tallon]] perturbed Xalis's activities. Afterward, a rogue [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raider]] known as the [[Jundland Banshee]] vandalized Xalis's equipment (such as communication sub-anchors 3 and 12). Besides, the Banshee's activities could lead to an increase in security presence, such as more stormtroopers, which could mean the end of Sandwind team.For a time, Xalis had to go to [[Elus sector]]. During this period, Xalis was replaced by Rebel officer [[Adazian Liebke]], who also had problems with the Jundland Banshee. Xalis also helped [[Tay Vanis]] to hide when he was being chased by [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Murquan]].Xalis eventually wrote a report for the [[Task Force on Alliance Security]] about the threat posed by the Jundland Banshee. Liebke and Vanis supported Xalis during it.

name: Palpatine Essex Yerac
description: Yerac fought in the [[Battle of Archais]], probably as a member of [[Midnight Squadron]] from [[Eclipse Team]]. During the battle, with the Rebel units trapped by the [[Assassin's Guild]] and by Lieutenant Colonel [[Freja Covell]]'s forces, Rebel officer [[Mosara Thiirn]] deserted, which led to an increasingly bad situation for the Rebels. Many Rebels died in the battle because of Thiirn's [[Treason/Legends|treason]]. Yerac's hatred towards Thiirn was well-known; [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] feared for her life should Yerac ever find her.Yerac also tracked independent [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] through the fog banks of [[Hewl]]'s [[Karap Valley]]. Suddenly, two [[Color/Legends|red]] [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] appeared from the fog itself and it asked the Rebel to keep his distance. Yerac obeyed, but identified the "eyes" as [[Filar-Nitzan]] [[Spy/Legends|spy]] [[Vacander]]. Yerac eventually tried to write a report on Vacander for the [[Task Force on Alliance Security]], but could not find very much information.

name: Colli's sibling
description: This infant was [[Reproduction|born]] to [[Jogg]] and [[Mareena]] prior to the [[Imperial Era]]. In [[19 BBY]], [[Sexes|her]] [[Parent|father]] was babysitting them infant when he heard noises and came out with the infant. He was shocked to hear that [[Jedi Master]] [[Kirak Infil'a]] had come back for them to mend [[Kirak Infil'a's Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor|his ship]], as it had been [[Standard year|years]] since he saw him last and most of the [[Jedi]] were [[Death|exterminated]] during [[Order 66]]. While they were mending his [[Starship|ship]], the infant was amazed when Infil'a [[Force power|used]] [[the Force]] to lift things up into the air. Then, Infil'a sensed [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]] coming and dropped all the things he was carrying using the Force. Colli protected the infant and ran before they both got hurt. They all witnessed Vader [[Mission to Al'doleem|challenging]] Infil'a to a [[lightsaber duel]]. They all ran back into the [[Jogg and Mareena's garage|garage]] to fix Infil'a's ship. The infant and their family was killed when Vader flooded the [[Am'balaar City|city]] by destroying a [[Am'balaar city dam|dam]].<ref name="Darth Vader 4" />

name: Bbbl
description: {{Quote|Well, ''something'' definitely came down from the sky around here&mdash;we all saw it&mdash;but... no debris.|Bbbl, pondering the nonexistence of any crash site|Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 22}}Bbbl was a [[Northern Mustafarian]] who was a member of a clan on [[Mustafar]] led by [[Father (title)|Father]] [[Kkkt]].<ref name="Dark Lord 22" /> In [[14 BBY]],<ref name="Bbbl death note" /> Father Kkkt and another [[Mustafarian]], [[Zzzs]], witnessed a fiery object crash near the [[Gahenn Plains]].<ref name="Dark Lord 21">[[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 21|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 21]]</ref> Concerned, Kkkt sent a scouting party consisting of Bbbl, [[Sssp]], [[Rrrn]], and another Mustafarian to investigate the site.<ref name="Dark Lord 22" />[[File:Bbbl-death-DV-22.png|thumb|left|250px|Darth Vader launched Bbbl into a molten death]]Upon reaching the supposed crash site the group were befuddled by the supposed lack of any debris. Sssp concluded the object must have landed in one of the lava flows and disintegrated prior to their arrival. As the group turned to report back to Father Kkkt, Bbbl spotted a dark figure through his binoculars. The Mustafarian had no time to [[Skirmish on Mustafar|react]] as the [[Anakin Skywalker|shadowy figure]] [[The Force|launched]] a boulder at Bbbl, knocking the Mustafarian off the [[lava flea]], and into the lava. In the end Rrrn was the only Mustafarian to survive this encounter with the [[Sith Lord]] Darth Vader, making his escape by lava flea while the [[Sith]] was occupied with Sssp.<ref name="Dark Lord 22" />

name: Caudle
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Caudle was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. After ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Caudle pursued independent studies in the ways of the [[Jedi Consular]], specializing as a [[Jedi healer|healer]]. Using [[Force healing/Legends|Force healing]] to tend to those Jedi wounded in the line of duty, Caudle served as a physician at the Coruscant Temple's [[Halls of Healing]].<ref name="YDR" />Caudle had achieved the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] by the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a bloody conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Remaining at the Temple during the war, Caudle continued to tend to [[Jedi Initiate]]s and [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]] injured during training bouts. Indeed, Caudle was the healer responsible for tending the wounds of [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy|Scout]] after her injuries in the [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|Apprentice Tournament]] of [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] and was mildly sarcastic about Scout's having grabbed a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] blade.<ref name="YDR" />

name: FN-1728
description: FN-1728 was a [[First Order]] [[Stormtrooper (First Order)|stormtrooper]] who was stationed at [[Starkiller Base]] during the [[Battle of Starkiller Base]]. FN-1728 and two other [[trooper]]s came across [[Captain]] [[Phasma]] as [[Sexes|she]] attempted to [[Hunt for Rivas|hunt]] down [[Lieutenant]] [[Sol Rivas]], FN-1728 reported to Phasma that word was that [[General]] [[Armitage Hux]] was being evacuated from the base before being told by Phasma that they should man their post until ordered otherwise.<ref name="Captain Phasma 1" />

name: Ephant Mon
description: Ephant Mon was an [[Arms dealer|illegal weapons dealer]]<ref name="VE">''[[Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia]]''</ref> worked for [[Masse Goskey]] at [[Masse Goskey's Arms Emporium and Explosives Mart]], purchasing and recording inventory for the business. Goskey routinely insulted Mon and criticized their work.<ref name="Star Wars: Smuggler's Guide" /> By [[10 BBY]]<ref name="Date">Ephant Mon recorded this event in the [[Smuggler's Guide]], which [[Dryden Vos]] later owned, meaning Mon owned the book before Vos' [[death]] during the events of ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story]]''. As ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide]]'' places the events of ''Solo'' to nine years after the [[Proclamation of the New Order|formation]] of the [[Galactic Empire]] which ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates to [[19 BBY]], it can be calculated that Mon's betrayal of Goskey must have occurred by [[10 BBY]].</ref> Mon turned on Goskey and shot [[Sexes|him]] in the torso with an [[HK8 Sawtooth]] [[blaster]] [[Blaster pistol|pistol]], [[Death|killing him]]. With Goskey eliminated, Mon planned to take over the Arms Emporium and rename it after themself.<ref name="Star Wars: Smuggler's Guide" /> Mon was present in the [[Jabba's Palace|palace]] of the crime lord Jabba the Hutt when [[Princess]] [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] attempted to rescue Jabba's [[prisoner]] [[Han Solo]]. As Jabba's longtime friend and head of security, Mon warned Jabba about the danger [[Luke Skywalker]] posed to him.<ref name="AEYNtK" /> Jabba not heading Ephant Mon's warning cost the Hutt his life.<ref name="ROTJ" />

name: Hudso Shaku
description: {{Quote|More offworlders. And they would only come here if there was something of value found.|Hudso Shaku|Age of Republic - Obi-Wan Kenobi 1}}Hudso Shaku led the [[Krypder Riders]] on the [[planet]] [[Dallenor]]. When an [[Dallenor Excavation|excavation site]] was established there, Shaku quarreled with them until they realized that what they were digging up was worthless to [[Sexes|him]] and his [[pirate]]s. They left the excavation site alone until the excavators discovered an ancient [[Jedi holocron]]. When Shaku took his pirates to have a second look at the site, the [[archaeologist]] in charge, [[Clatriffe]], planted guards around to keep them at bay. News of the [[holocron]] eventually reached the [[Jedi Order]], and they sent the [[Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and his [[apprentice]] [[Anakin Skywalker]] to collect it.<ref name="Age of Republic" />[[File:Krypder_Riders.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Shaku arrives with the Krypder Riders]]Kenobi's [[Mission to Dallenor|arrival]] quickly became known to Shaku, and he took the Krypder Riders to seize the holocron. Upon arriving, Shaku faced Kenobi, who activated his [[Obi-Wan Kenobi's lightsaber|lightsaber]] in defense. Shaku saw more value in the [[lightsaber]] and had his pirates try and steal that instead. As Kenobi began incapacitating the pirates, Shaku sneaked behind Skywalker and held him hostage. However, Skywalker used [[the Force]] to lift several stones, using them to knock Shaku to the ground. With Shaku unconscious, Kenobi prompted the rest of the pirates to leave before he and Skywalker left with the holocron.<ref name="Age of Republic" />

name: Rinn (Gand)
description: {{Quote|This is Tiver and Rinn. Worked with them before. Good people to have at your back.|Neelda introduces Rinn and Tiver|Age of Republic - Jango Fett 1}}At some point, Rinn became a [[bounty hunter]], eventually partnering with the [[Chadra-Fan]] [[Tiver]]. The pair took jobs alongside the [[Rodian]] [[Neelda]] a number of times. Sometime before the [[plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala]], the three of them were hired by a [[Unidentified Twi'lek's father|man]] to return his runaway [[Unidentified Twi'lek (Ord Mantell)|daughter]]. They met on [[Telerath]], where they were joined by the esteemed bounty hunter, [[Jango Fett]], who would also join them on the mission. They were surprised to find that he had brought his child, [[Boba Fett]], with him. Nevertheless, they were forced to accept Boba's company.<ref name="Age of Republic" />[[File:Tiver threatens to kill Boba.png|thumb|left|250px|Tiver and Rinn betray the Fetts]]Rinn and the other bounty hunters traveled to [[Ord Mantell]], where they waited at a [[cantina]] for the [[Twi'lek]] girl. Soon enough, she arrived to meet her lover [[Griph]]. While they conversed at a balcony, Rinn, Tiver, Neelda and Boba cornered them. Neelda prompted Griph to leave and he ran away as fast as he could. Desperate not to be taken back to her [[Unidentified Twi'lek's father|father]], the girl then jumped off the balcony. Luckily for the bounty hunters, Fett was watching the skies and caught her, [[stun]]ning her in the process. After putting the girl in Fett's ship, Rinn, Tiver and Neelda followed the him and Boba while they discussed why the elder was covering the skies. That was when Rinn and Tiver double-crossed them. Rinn held Fett at gunpoint, demanding he give over the girl, while Tiver tackled Boba to the ground. Neelda refused to back their movement, even when Rinn offered him a share of the bounty. Suddenly, Boba broke free of Tiver and [[Death|killed]] her. He then gunned down Rinn before while the [[Gand]] was confused about what had just happened.<ref name="Age of Republic" />

name: Reginald Danfillo
description: {{Quote|Maybe spacer trash will pay for this. Seems like their kind of thing.|Reginald Danfillo comments on the ''Smuggler's Guide''|Star Wars: Smuggler's Guide}}[[File:Tryphon Leo Death.png|thumb|left|250px|Reginald Danfillo discovered the corpse of Tryphon Leo.]]Reginald Danfillo was a member of the [[League of XenoExplorers]] who during the [[Imperial Era|reign]] of the [[Galactic Empire]] held the rank of [[senior terrain trekker]], [[silver leaf]], [[fullbloom cluster]]. Danfillo took part in the [[Typhojem Excavation]] on [[Pashvi]] during which the trekker recovered a piece of tapestry dating to the [[Neo-Middle Secundus]] and [[Quesoth]] pottery shards. At the site of the excavation, Danfillo also discovered the corpse of the [[alien]] [[smuggler]] [[Tryphon Leo]], who had been attempting to locate a cache of treasure hidden by the [[pirate]] [[Queen]] [[Maz Kanata]] in the [[Shrove of the Left Handed God Typhojem]].<ref name="SM" />Leo had been crushed by a massive stone block falling from the ceiling approximately seventy [[meter]]s along the [[Grand Causeway]] in front of a [[Typhojem]] Thrall. Beside the smuggler's remains, Danfillo recovered the [[book]] that would become known as the ''[[Smuggler's Guide]]'', but was disappointed to discover that it was a contemporary object. Danfillo then wrote a report summarising the recovery of the book including an image of the recovery site. The trekker commented that the book could probably be sold to a [[spacer]] and left the report inside the book. The book then ended up in a box of reading material elsewhere on Pashvi, where it was discovered by the [[Besalisk]] [[Dexter Jettster]], who purchased it for fifty [[credit]]s.<ref name="SM" />

name: Jabba's champion
description: {{Quote|Tah keeng barra.|Jabba calls the champion|Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace (video game)}}Unlike many of Jabba's monstrous pets, the champion didn't live in [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]], but rather in the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] [[Jabba's private box|suite]] in [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]], where it had a small room full of spikes next to the suite's spike-pit arena. Jabba used it to get rid of undesirable individuals.<ref name="TPMvg" />{{Gamemechanics|Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace (video game)|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'' video game}}In 32 BBY, shortly before the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]] [[Podracing/Legends|Podrace]], [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], whose ship had been stranded on Tatooine, was searching for a source of [[Peggat/Legends|peggats]] to make a bet with junk dealer [[Watto/Legends|Watto]]. Jabba, who was looking for amusement, lured Jinn to the arena, and promised to give the needed money to him if the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] could defeat his champion. With no other options left, Jinn agreed.<ref name="TPMvg" />[[File:Qui-GonChamp.jpg|thumb|left|Qui-Gon Jinn faces Jabba's champion]]On Jabba's signal, the champion emerged from its room, roaring with rage, and immediately attacked the Jedi Master. However, the beast proved no match for Jinn, who used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Telekinesis/Legends#Force push|push]] the champion against the spiked walls of the pit and overcame the monster with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. The beast was soon defeated and, shouting its last cry, fell lifeless to the ground.<ref name="TPMvg" />After the battle, Jabba thanked Jinn for the entertaining duel, gave him the peggats he needed, and released him. Because of the combat skills he had shown against the champion, Jinn was under the admiration and respect of Jabba and his [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|criminal empire]].<ref name="TPMvg" />{{Endgame}}

name: Kerra Holt's sibling
description: {{Quote|...Was there...Was there another child with them? My mother was expecting when... when we were separated."''<br>''"They came alone. They didn't mention another child... Are you, all right, little Holt?|Kerra and Aunt Zoojoo talking about Kerra's family|Knight Errant: Escape 2}}[[File:Mercia_Holt.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Mercia Holt, pregnant with her second child]][[Kerra Holt]]'s mother [[Mercia Holt|Mercia]] was known to have been pregant with the child during the [[Massacre of Aquilaris|invasion]] of [[Aquilaris Minor]] in [[1032 BBY]]. During the fighting, Mercia and her husband [[Aron Holt|Aron]] were taken captive by the Sith Lord [[Odion]], who had found out about their research into the [[Helm of Ieldis]] during a raid on [[Sanbra]]. Seeking to further his nihilistic ambitions of galactic domination, Odion started [[Project Pandemonium]] to capture the Helm for himself. At an unknown point prior to their second mission to [[Sarrassia]] in [[1039 BBY]], Mercia gave birth to this child and it was forcibly taken from her by Odion's minions. The child was raised at an [[Odionate cloister]], a planet-size orphanage where children from throughout the [[Odionate]] were indoctrinated and conditioned through solitary confinement into workers and warriors for Odion's war effort.Prior to their deaths on [[Skarpos]] in [[1038 BBY]], Mercia Holt lamented in a [[Holorecorder/Legends|holorecording]] that this sibling was the child she and her husband would never know. She also expressed her hopes that Kerra had somehow survived the events on Aquilaris. In 1032 BBY, the child's older sibling Kerra Holt infiltrated the Odionate, disguised as a [[Novitiate]] and learnt about the existence of the cloisters. She speculated that the child was incarcerated there but realized the process of reuniting with that younger sibling would be complicated by an Odionate policy of not maintaining written records on the inmates.After acquiring the [[Helm of Ieldis]] on [[Skarpos]] and [[Second Battle of Skarpos|successfully testing]] it on three entire armies with devastating consequences, Odion returned to the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Vanahame]] which hosted one cloister. There, Odion intended to harness the negative emotions of the thousands of child inmates there and convert into [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] energy. Odion planned to use this energy to drive all the inhabitants of the [[Grumani sector]] into a homicidal frenzy. However, his plans were thwarted by Kerra and his second-in-command [[General/Legends|General]] [[Beld Yulan]] who switched back on the lights in the cloister and then freed the children, creating a surge of positive emotions like joy and relief which caused the Helm to overload, burning Odion to death.With his fiefdom already collapsing due to attacks by his [[Calimondra family|Sith relatives]], Odion attempted to parley with Kerra for his life, by offering to help her find her younger sibling if she saved him. However, Kerra by then had come around to the view that all the children in the cloisters throughout the Odionate were her brothers and sisters, regardless of their species and gender. She refused and left Odion to die. Due to the lack of documentation, Kerra realized it would be very hard to find lost family members who had been processed into the cloister system. The sibling would have grown up not knowing the identity of its parents and its relationship to Kerra.Following the [[Battle of Vanahame]], Kerra and Yulan evacuated the orphans at the Vanahame cloister into [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] Space. They managed to liberate a few other cloisters but the others had been captured by the other Sith Lords, particularly Odion's estranged younger brother [[Daiman]] who had taken up the largest chunk of the former Odionate. Kerra thus made it her mission to free the children and their parents from Sith domination.

name: C. Cantwell
