description: This individual worked on the [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']]<nowiki>'</nowiki>s design, as well as on the [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder's]] design, the [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighter's]] design, and the basic design of the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] that became the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']].

name: Roan Shryne's first Padawan
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sentience/Legends|individual]] lived during the last [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. At some point before the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]<ref name="DL" /> in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> the individual was chosen as [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Roan Shryne]].<ref name="DL" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], was captured by forces of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] during a mission on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]]. [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] assembled a [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] to rescue Kenobi from execution. The Padawan, Shryne and Shryne's former master [[Nat-Sem]] were part of this strike team.<ref name="DL" />The rescue mission turned into a [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|full-scale battle]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] and the Padawan was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the battle alongside Nat-Sem and many other [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi]]. Shryne survived, but the loss of his pupil and his former master, coupled with the death of [[Roan Shryne's second Padawan|another student]] [[Battle of Manari|later]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|war]], led to the Jedi Master losing his faith in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]].<ref name="DL" />

name: Rrrn
description: {{Quote|<nowiki></nowiki>''Sssp! [To lava flea]'' Go! Go!|After witnessing Sssp's fate, Rrrn fled on a lava flea|Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 22}}Rrrn<ref name="Dark Lord 24">[[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 24|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 24]]</ref> was a [[Southern Mustafarian]] and a member of [[Father (title)|Father]] [[Kkkt]]'s [[Kkkt's clan|clan]] on the [[planet]] [[Mustafar]] during the [[Imperial Era]].<ref name="Dark Lord 22" />  By [[12 BBY]],<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]'' states that [[Fortress Vader]] was built forty-six [[Standard year|years]] before the [[Hosnian Cataclysm|Starkiller Incident]], which ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates to [[34 ABY]]. The confrontation between the [[Mustafarian]]s and [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]] occurs in [[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 22|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 22]], immediately following the construction of the [[fortress]] in [[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 23|issue 23]]. Therefore, the confrontation must have happened by [[12 BBY]].</ref> the [[Northern Mustafarian]]s [[Sssp]] and [[Bbbl]], and another Southern [[Mustafarian]] to investigate and report any findings. Arriving at the supposed crash site on two [[lava flea]]s, with Rrrn riding passenger behind Sssp, the group found nothing, and Sssp decided they should report back to Kkkt. Bbbl then spotted a dark figure nearby, the [[Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]]. Vader [[Telekinesis|hurled]] a rock at Bbbl using [[the Force]] and sent the Mustafarian flying into the [[Magma|lava]].<ref name="Dark Lord 22" />[[File:Mustafarians-vs-Vader-DV-22.png|thumb|left|250px|Rrrn (rear rider atop lava flea) and the other Mustafarians defend themselves against Darth Vader.]]The Mustafarians then [[Skirmish on Mustafar|shot]] at Vader, but [[Sexes|he]] used his [[Darth Vader's lightsaber|lightsaber]] to deflect the [[blaster]] bolts, [[Death|killing]] one of the Mustafarians. When the [[Sith Lord]] next used the Force to lift and [[Force choke|strangle]] Sssp in midair, Rrrn fled the scene atop the lava [[flea]]<ref name="Dark Lord 22" /> and reported the discovery of the dark figure to Kkkt.<ref name="Dark Lord 24" /> Fearing that the safety of his people was compromised, Kkkt contacted the nearby clanholds and united them against Vader and his [[Fortress Vader Imperial garrison|Imperial might]].<ref name="Dark Lord 23">[[Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith 23|''Darth Vader: Dark Lord of the Sith'' 23]]</ref>

name: CX-425
description: {{Cutstart}}

name: Unidentified Mikkian Jedi
description: {{Quote|Let's see if you last longer than your master.|Grievous, to the Mikkian Jedi's Padawan, before cutting the Jedi learner down|Age of Republic - General Grievous 1}}A member of the [[Jedi Order]] and a [[Force-sensitive]] [[Mikkian]], the [[Jedi]] lived in the [[time]] of the [[Clone Wars]].<ref name="Age of Republic" />When the [[cyborg]] [[general]] [[Grievous]] [[Destruction of the Ledeve Jedi Temple|made for]] the [[Jedi Temple (Ledeve)|Jedi Temple]] on [[Ledeve]], the Mikkian's [[Unidentified Jedi Padawan (Grievous)|Padawan]], a [[Sexes|male]] [[human]], fled towards a [[starship]] as his [[Jedi Master|master]] took up [[Melee weapon|arms]] and stood against the [[lightsaber]]-[[Lightsaber combat|wielding]] Grievous.<ref name="Age of Republic" />However, the ensuing [[Lightsaber duel|confrontation]] became the defending Mikkian's end; the Jedi master was effortlessly impaled by the cyborg. Left [[Death|dead]] on the [[forest]]'s ground, the lightsaber used against the [[Jedi hunter]] was claimed by Grievous, who proceeded to dispatch of the [[Padawan]] with the blade just as quickly.<ref name="Age of Republic" />

name: Kallos Sook
description: Around [[3900 BBY]], a group of [[Human/Legends|Humans]] from the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core World]] of [[Grizmallt/Legends|Grizmallt]] colonized [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]].<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> About a [[Millennium/Legends|thousand]] [[Standard year/Legends|years]] later,<ref name="AED" /> around [[2900 BBY]],<ref name="Founding">''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]'' stated that Kaadara was founded about one [[Millennium/Legends|thousand]] [[Standard year/Legends|years]] after the first [[Human/Legends|Human]] settlers arrived on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]. According to ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'', the settlers arrived around [[3900 BBY]]. This article's date is therefore derived from simple math based on this reference explanation.</ref> the small [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Kaadara]] was founded along a scenic coastline in the northern reaches<ref name="AED" /> of the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]]<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. Early in its history, Kaadara was unique among Naboo cities because the local populace welcomed, and even encouraged, interactions with the native [[Gungan/Legends|Gungans]]. Kaadara's first [[Regent/Legends|regent]], Kallos Sook, actually hired a large contingent of Gungans to serve as the city's [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|security force]]. However, in the [[Standard century/Legends|centuries]] following Sook's regency, the increased presence of outsiders led the suspicious Gungans to abandon their role as protectors of Kaadara. The [[Naboo (people)/Legends|Naboo]] then went on to install a small [[Garrison/Legends|garrison]] of [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Force]] [[Officer/Legends|officers]] in their stead.<ref name="AED" />

name: Hennet Kayn
description: The [[Gotal]] Hennet Kayn<ref name="SWCC">{{SW|url=news/swcc-2019-6-surprises-from-inside-the-mos-eisley-cantina|text=SWCC 2019: 6 Surprises from Inside the Mos Eisley Cantina|archivedate=20190415165818}}</ref> was present in the [[spaceport]] of [[Mos Eisley]] on the [[planet]] [[Tatooine]]<ref name="ANH" /> in the [[Standard year|year]] [[0 BBY]],<ref name="Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']] that occur prior to the [[Battle of Yavin]], which includes Hennet Kayn's [[time]] in [[Mos Eisley]], to [[0 BBY]].</ref> during the [[Galactic Civil War]] between the [[Galactic Empire]] and the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. Shortly before the [[Battle of Yavin]], the Gotal was in [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]] in Mos Eisley when the [[smuggler]] [[Han Solo]] attempted to leave the establishment, only to be forced back into [[Sexes|his]] seat by the [[bounty hunter]] [[Greedo]].<ref name="ANH" />As Solo and Greedo discussed the [[bounty]] on the smuggler's head, Kayn walked from the direction of the [[cantina]]'s main bar into a booth,<ref name="ANH" /> where the [[Abyssin]] [[Myo]] and the [[Talz]] [[Muftak]] were seated.<ref name="Complete locations">''[[Star Wars: Complete Locations]]''</ref> Solo and Greedo then exchanged [[blaster]]fire, with Solo [[Death|killing]] the bounty hunter, which briefly drew the attention of many patrons in the cantina.<ref name="ANH" />

name: Puke
description: {{Quote|We had thirty-two TIE fighters aboard that cruiser-carrier. Thanks to Chass, we're down to thirty-one.|Fadime marks the significance of Puke's death|audio=Puke2.ogg|Alphabet Squadron (novel)}}The [[human]]<ref name="USW" /> [[TIE fighter pilot]] later nicknamed "Puke" served in the [[Galactic Empire]]'s [[204th Imperial Fighter Wing]] during the [[Galactic Civil War]]. Several [[Standard week|weeks]] after the [[Battle of Endor]]<ref name="Alphabet" /> in [[4 ABY]],<ref name="Galactic Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''</ref> Puke was among the two [[TIE/ln space superiority starfighter]] [[squadron]]s aboard the [[Quasar Fire-class cruiser-carrier|''Quasar Fire''-class cruiser-carrier]] [[Aerie (Quasar Fire-class)|''Aerie'']] that pursued the [[New Republic]] [[EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate]] ''[[Hellion's Dare]]'' and its two escort squadrons&mdash;[[Riot Squadron]] and [[Hound Squadron]]. The hunt was part of an effort conducted by the 204th's [[Colonel]] [[Shakara Nuress]] to maintain the secrecy of the [[fighter wing]]'s new base of operations in the [[Pandem Nai system]].<ref name="Alphabet" />[[File:Chass_na_Chadic.png|thumb|left|200px|Puke was killed by the New Republic Hound Squadron pilot Chass na Chadic.]]After driving the ''Hellion's Dare'' and its escort out of the [[Jiruus system]], the ''Aerie'' and its [[TIE line|TIEs]], including Puke, [[Attack on the Hellion's Dare|pursued]] the New Republic [[starship]]s through the [[Oridol Cluster]], picking off a number of New Republic [[Starfighter|fighters]] along the way. During these skirmishes, the [[New Republic pilot]]s of Riot and Hound Squadrons coined Puke's nickname after the enemy [[pilot]] repeatedly sprayed [[laser cannon]] fire. The New Republic pilots also brought up Puke and the other Imperial pilots during conversations at their berths. However, after at least half a dozen [[Naval warfare|engagements]], Puke was [[Death|killed]] by the [[A/SF-01 B-wing starfighter]] pilot [[Chass na Chadic]] of Hound Squadron.<ref name="Alphabet" />Puke's death was celebrated aboard the ''Hellion's Dare'' as the first kill by the New Republic pilots. [[Fadime]], the acting leader of Hound Squadron, remarked that the fallen TIE fighter pilot was never going to spray [[cannon]] fire childishly again and moved Puke's name to the bottom of the list of Imperial pilots on a tactical board. The ''Aerie''{{'s}} TIE fighters continued to pursue the ''Hellion's Dare'' and its escort until the [[frigate]] was destroyed. Only Chadic and another [[Wyl Lark|pilot]] escaped the [[Imperial Military|Imperial forces]], both of which remembered the fighting numerous times after.<ref name="Alphabet" /> While on a [[Scout|reconnaissance]] mission aboard a [[UT-60D U-wing starfighter/support craft]] at the [[planet]] [[Troithe]], at least a [[Standard month|month]] later, Chadic recalled in her mind the Imperial pilots she encountered in the Oridol Cluster, including Puke, flying through the [[Star cluster|cluster's]] clouds.<ref name="Shadow Fall">''[[Shadow Fall]]''</ref>

name: Xion
description: During the [[Imperial Era|time]] of the [[Galactic Empire]], Xion served as a [[TIE fighter pilot]] in the Empire's [[204th Imperial Fighter Wing]].<ref name="Alphabet" /> Shortly after the [[pilot]] [[Yrica Quell]]'s graduation from an [[Imperial Academy]], [[Sexes|she]] had a moment of acute nausea. Xion held her [[helmet]] as she threw up bile. During a mission to the [[Water|icy]] terrestrial body [[Yethra]], Xion guided Quell, warning her of enemies attempting to pursue.<ref name="Shadow Fall">''[[Shadow Fall]]''</ref>Around [[4 ABY]],<ref name="Death" /> the 204th was assigned with the [[Destruction of Nacronis|destruction]] of all civilization on the [[planet]] [[Nacronis]] as part of [[Operation: Cinder]], the contingency plan that was put in place as a result of the [[death]] of the [[Darth Sidious|Galactic Emperor]] two weeks before. Xion participated, flying a [[TIE/ln space superiority starfighter]] as a part of a [[Yrica Quell's squadron|squadron]] led by [[Captain]] [[Nosteen]] with Quell as second-in-command. Xion's [[squadron]] was tasked with defending [[TIE/sa bomber]]s, which were dropping [[vortex detonator]]s to stoke Nacronis's [[siltstorm]]s, from [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|Rebel Alliance]] [[Alliance Military|forces]]. The surface of Nacronis was subsequently devastated by siltstorms, with<ref name="Alphabet" /> Xion<ref name="Death" /> and some of his squadron perishing while instigating this.<ref name="Alphabet" />Quell defected from the Empire following the genocide on Nacronis, coming to fly for the [[New Republic]] as a part of the [[New Republic Intelligence]]'s [[Alphabet Squadron]].<ref name="Alphabet" /> Around [[5 ABY]],<ref name="5 ABY">{{SW|url=news/shadow-fall-author-interview|text=In ''Shadow Fall'', the Dark Secrets of ''Alphabet Squadron'' Revealed|archivedate=20200625180809}} establishes that ''[[Shadow Fall]]'' takes place approximately half a [[Standard year|year]] after the [[Battle of Endor]], while ''[[Before the Awakening]]'' states [[Kes Dameron]] and [[Shara Bey]] moved to [[Yavin 4]] around six [[Standard month|months]] after the Battle of [[Endor]]. Given that ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates their move to [[5 ABY]], the events of ''Shadow Fall'' must also take place around that [[time]].</ref> she mistakenly called one of her squadron mates, [[Nath Tensent]], by Xion's name during the pursuit of an Imperial cargo [[shuttle]]. During a [[Troithe operation|battle]] on the planet [[Troithe]] a short while later, Quell started seeing herself being guided by Xion at Yethra, mistaking the pilot [[Wyl Lark]]'s voice for Xion's. She also saw visions of Xion and other comrades in the 204th while subjected to [[The Force|force energies]] from an [[Unidentified observatory|observatory]].<ref name="Shadow Fall" />

name: Tarsus Valorum
description: Tarsus Valorum was a member of [[House Valorum]]<ref name="RotS" /> who served as the first [[Supreme Chancellor]] of the [[Galactic Republic]], following the [[fall of the Old Republic]], and the Galactic Republic's restructuring. [[The galaxy]] left a dark age under Valorum's rule, in which the [[Sith]] were [[Jedi-Sith War|defeated]] by the [[Jedi Order]]. While presiding as Chancellor, the [[Galactic Senate]] was created, and the [[Republic Military|military]] which previously existed had been disbanded. As a result of the new Republic's creation, the populations of the [[Core Worlds]] became eager to expand their reach into the [[Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="Tarkin" />[[Finis Valorum]], the penultimate Supreme Chancellor of the Republic, was a direct descendant of Tarsus.<ref name="RotS" />

name: Uro (Aqualish)
description: {{Quote|He has a name, y'know. You sound like a child afraid of a bedtime story.''"<br>"''Except he ain't a story.|Uro and Holaq, discussing Darth Vader|Target Vader 1}}Uro was an [[Aqualish]] who had done business with the [[Hidden Hand]] criminal syndicate<ref name="Target Vader 1" /> at some point prior to the [[Battle of Hoth]] in [[3 ABY]].<ref name="Date" /> While residing in the [[Lower Bay Docks]] on the [[Outer Rim Territories|Outer Rim]] world of [[Fikari]], Uro conversed with fellow criminal [[Holaq]], asking if the [[Weequay]] had brought enough firearms. Holaq exclaimed that the [[Dark Lord of the Sith|Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]] had attacked a number of clans that had been in contact with the Hidden Hand and left no survivors. Uro, unfazed, replied that it was the cost of working with the criminal syndicate, but stated that this also provided a benefit to the syndicate's clients as deals with the Hidden Hand and its contacts were kept anonymous.<ref name="Target Vader 1" />[[File:Uro-Holaq-Chat-TargetVader.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Uro converses with Holaq on Fikari, while a guard behind them is pulled back and killed by Darth Vader.]]As the two continued talking while walking, Holaq asserted that the syndicate's [[Standard day|days]] were numbered as Vader was hunting them down. As the Aqualish accused the Weequay of being afraid of the [[Sith Lord]], Uro heard a noise and quickly alerted Holaq. Unbeknownst to the two criminals, Vader, who had arrived at the docks [[Hunt for Vader|searching]] for information on the Hidden Hand, had [[Death|slaughtered]] the docks' guards. Standing behind Holaq, Uro was suddenly [[Telekinesis|pulled]] back by the [[Sith]]'s [[Force power]]s and killed, while Holaq continued scanning the surrounding area, unaware of the Aqualish's demise. Vader then proceeded to interrogate and kill Holaq.<ref name="Target Vader 1" />

name: Xonr
description: {{Quote|They can all take their turns shooting your corpse when I'm finished with&mdash;''"<br />"''I ''led'' them here, Xonr.|Xonr and Beilert Valance|Target Vader 1}}Xonr became a [[bounty hunter]] and joined the [[Bounty Hunters' Guild]], eventually acquiring multiple [[Cybernetics|cybernetic]] replacements.<ref name="Target Vader 1" /> At some point prior to the [[Battle of Hoth]] in [[3 ABY]],<ref name="Date" />  the [[cyborg]] [[bounty]] [[Hunting|hunter]] [[Beilert Valance]] broke the [[Bounty Hunter Code]] and [[Thief|stole]] five bounties from Xonr, leading to the latter tracking Valance down in the crowded [[BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits]] [[cantina]], within [[Level 1313]] on<ref name="Target Vader 1" /> the [[planet]]<ref name="UltimateSW">''[[Ultimate Star Wars]]''</ref> [[Coruscant]].<ref name="Target Vader 1" />[[File:Xonr_Valance_Target_Vader.jpg|thumb|left|245px|Xonr planned to kill fellow hunter Beilert Valance in retribution for violating the Bounty Hunter Code.]]Finding Valance drunk and slouched over a table, Xonr condemned him for stealing bounties and breaking the Code. Xonr then sat down across from Valance and aimed a [[blaster pistol]] at him, declaring that it was [[time]] for him to [[Death|die]]. As a final insult to Valance, Xonr took his [[Alcohol|beverage]] and downed it when Valance asked for one last drink. At that moment, Valance revealed that he had allowed Xonr to find him, having also lured several other hunters to the same cantina. While initially alarmed by this revelation, Xonr remained confident about surviving the encounter, but Valance quickly killed his confronter by blowing Xonr's head off with his [[palm blaster]], which started a [[Shootout at BG-RT's Tavern and Spirits|shootout]] that left all of Valance's other nemeses dead as well.<ref name="Target Vader 1" />

name: Darth Krist-Ov
description: [[Darth]] Krist-Ov was the name of a [[Sith Lord]] and was portrayed by a [[human]] [[Sexes|male]] with [[Color|red]] [[tattoo]]s during the [[Clone Wars]] in a play conducted by the [[Actor|actress]] [[Risha Synata]]. After the [[Senate hostage crisis]], [[Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala]] and [[Jedi General]] [[Anakin Skywalker]] travelled to [[Risha Synata's ship]] located near [[Caamas]] in the [[Cirius system]] for a small vacation and to attend Synata's plays.<ref name="Intermission 1" />Before they arrived, Synata conducted the play in front of a large audience and portrayed a [[Jedi]] who had a romantic relationship with Darth Krist-Ov, although they eventually dueled and Krist-Ov was [[Death|killed]] in the play.<ref name="Intermission 1" />

name: Anolo
description: [[File:AnoloDeath.png|thumb|left|300px|Anolo lies unconscious and dies after being shot by Greedo]]On [[Mygeeto]], [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure|Jabba the Hutt]] [[Mission to Mygeeto|sent troops]] to capture a [[Givin]] [[codebreaker]] whose brain was able to decode Imperial security codes. Anolo attempted to flee with the codebreaker, but was caught by [[Greedo]] and [[Takvaa]], two of Jabba's enforcers. In the ensuing fight, Anolo was shot in the chest and killed by Greedo.<ref name="Galaxy's Edge 2" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Darth Wrend
description: [[File:Qui-Gon_Jinn_Headshot_TPM.jpg|thumb|right|200px|As a Padawan, Qui-Gon Jinn believed that a prophecy of the Sith might have referred to Darth Wrend.]][[Darth]] Wrend was a [[Sith Lord]]<ref name="Darth note">''[[Star Wars Made Easy]]'' establishes that the moniker of [[Darth]] translates to "Dark [[Lord]]" and was given to the [[Sith Lord]]s. Since ''[[Master & Apprentice]]'' suggests that Darth Wrend bore the title of Darth, it can be inferred that Darth Wrend was a [[Sith]] Lord.</ref> who fought against the [[Jedi]]. Eventually, Wrend was believed to be [[Death|dead]], but then returned to wage war against the Jedi once again.<ref name="Master & Apprentice" /> Sometime between the [[Standard year|years]] [[68 BBY]] and [[66 BBY]],<ref name="Date note">{{MasterApprenticedate}} ''Master & Apprentice'' also establishes that [[Qui-Gon Jinn]] is forty years old, which places his birth in [[80 BBY]]. As Jinn became the [[Padawan]] of [[Dooku]] when he was twelve, was still his Padawan when he was fourteen, and used the [[holocron of prophecy]] during that time, it means he was Dooku's Padawan in the years [[68 BBY]] and [[66 BBY]].</ref> when [[Qui-Gon Jinn]] was the [[Padawan]] of [[Jedi Master]] [[Dooku]], Darth Wrend was thought of as legendary by Jinn, who opened the [[holocron of prophecy]], which contained numerous prophecies of which several dated ten thousand years prior. One such prophecy was that evil would disappear yet appear again once the righteous had lost its light, with most notes stating that the [[Sith]] were going to be potentially reincarnated.<ref name="Master & Apprentice" />Jinn eventually returned the [[holocron]] to the [[Jedi Archives]], although after reading the prophecy of the potential Sith reincarnation, Jinn believed that the prophecy might have actually been referring to Wrend and had already passed. After many years, when [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] was the Padawan of Jinn, Kenobi mentioned the prophecy to Jinn, and complained about its vagueness.<ref name="Master & Apprentice" /> Eventually, the Sith were exposed to still be active with the discovery of [[Maul|Darth Maul]], who killed Jinn in a [[lightsaber duel]] during the [[Battle of Naboo]]<ref name="Episode I">[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'']]</ref> in [[32 BBY]].<ref name="Atlas">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''</ref>

name: Pride Aully
description: {{Quote|Finally! I'll send Kasif a transmission and let him know I'll pick it up when he gets back. Thanks for the help. Here's your payment.|Pride Aully, to the visitor on Batuu|Star Wars: Datapad}}[[File:NumidianPrimeGamblers.png|thumb|left|280px|Pride Aully participated in a sabacc game on Numidian Prime.]]In [[10 BBY]],<ref name="Solo Date">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide]]'' dates the events of ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story]]'' to nine [[Standard year|years]] after the [[Proclamation of the New Order|formation]] of the [[Galactic Empire]], which ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates to [[19 BBY]]. Therefore, the events of ''Solo'', including Pride Aully's appearance, are set in [[10 BBY]].</ref> Aully was present at<ref name="Solo" /> a [[jungle outpost]] on the [[planet]] [[Numidian Prime]],<ref name="Solo Expanded Edition">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story: Expanded Edition]]''</ref> taking part in a game of [[sabacc]] alongside the [[gambler]] [[Landonis Balthazar Calrissian|Lando Calrissian]]. During the game, the scoundrels [[Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca]], who had previously hired the gambler and [[Sexes|his]] [[starship]], the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]'', as part of a [[Raid on Kessel|heist]], entered the outpost in search of Calrissian.<ref name="Solo" />Calrissian left the table to greet his former associates, who challenged the gambler to a game of sabacc. Aully spectated the sabacc game, during which Solo won the ''Millenium Falcon'' from Calrissian.<ref name="Solo" /> Following the game, Aully and the other gamblers that had been present later told different accounts of the events, with each spectator emphasizing different details, though their accounts all agreed on the game's final moments.<ref name="Solo Junior">''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story: A Junior Novel]]''</ref>Around [[34 ABY|forty-four]] [[Standard year|years]] later,<ref name="Galaxy's Edge Date">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]'' dates the [[Battle of Batuu|mission to Batuu]], which includes the [[First Order]]'s occupation of [[Batuu]], to six [[Standard month|months]] after the [[Hosnian Cataclysm]], which ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates to [[34 ABY]]. As such, the events depicted in {{DatapadCite|Need Jetpack. Have Credits.|PrideAullyMission-GEDatapad.jpg|PrideAullyConv-GEDatapad.png|PrideAullyConv2-GEDatapad.jpg|PrideAullyConv3-GEDatapad.jpg|PrideAullyComplete-GEDatapad.jpg}} must take place around that year.</ref> during the [[First Order–Resistance war|war]] between the [[First Order]] and the [[Resistance]], Aully wished to acquire a [[Z-6 jetpack]], having heard that one could be found at the business [[Outer Rim Expedition and Supply]] in the [[City|town]] of [[Black Spire Outpost]] on the planet [[Batuu]]. Wanting to verify that the [[jetpack]] was available before flying to Batuu, Aully contacted a visitor to Black Spire Outpost, requesting confirmation. The visitor investigated the business' supply of crates and determined that Aully's information was correct. Aully thanked the visitor with a transfer of one hundred [[credit]]s, intending to contact the business owner [[Kasif]] about collecting the jetpack.<ref name="Datapad">{{DatapadCite|Need Jetpack. Have Credits.|PrideAullyMission-GEDatapad.jpg|PrideAullyConv-GEDatapad.png|PrideAullyConv2-GEDatapad.jpg|PrideAullyConv3-GEDatapad.jpg|PrideAullyComplete-GEDatapad.jpg}}</ref>

name: Beau
description: In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], they were stationed onboard the [[Mon Calamari Star Cruiser]] [[Liberty/Legends|''Liberty'']] after suffering minor injuries from a battle to capture new experimental [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighter]] prototypes, and [[Ace Azzameen]] brought them [[Veromulan candies]] at the medical bay. They eventually recovered from the injuries and continued active service against the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. [[4 ABY/Legends|A year later]], Beau participated in the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] and was killed during the firefight against enemy fighters.

name: Shaak Ti's Padawan
description: In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], the Padawan was dispatched to rescue and protect [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] when it came under attack, and to uncover the one responsible for the plot.<ref name="DYD" /> The Padawan served alongside their master Ti as protectors for the [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] during the crisis.The Padawan would later join [[Clone trooper commander|Commander]] [[CC-1010/Legends|Fox]] and the [[Coruscant Guard/Legends|Coruscant Guard]] to investigate the plot in the [[Coruscant underworld/Legends|lower levels]] on Coruscant, and would learn that the [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] Vogg Barakk was in Shack Town.<ref name="DYD" /> The team captured and interrogated him before learning that [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] hired him which prompted the Padawan to go to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] to meet with the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. It was there that the Jedi discovered that [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] had lied to the Hutt that the Jedi had come to kill him, but the Padawan manages to persuade Jabba otherwise while Ventress fled the planet.<ref name="DYD" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Plo Koon's Padawan
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], becoming a good friend of fellow [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] [[Ringoot]]. Summoned before the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] in [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], several months into the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the Initiate was dispatched to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dorin/Legends|Dorin]] where [[Kel Dor/Legends|Kel Dor]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] accepted the student as his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]].<ref name="DYD" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Senin Vant
description: The [[Utai]] [[Sexes|male]] Senin Vant was a [[pilot]]<ref name="Complete Vehicles 2018" /> and [[Engineer|mechanic]]<ref name="Character Encyclopedia">''[[Star Wars Character Encyclopedia: Updated and Expanded]]''</ref> who served as the [[Air Commodore|air commodore]] of the [[Utapau Skyforce]] during the [[Clone Wars]] between the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and the [[Galactic Republic]]. The Skyforce was responsible for the security of Utapau within the wider [[Tarabba sector]], but was forced into hiding when the Separatist [[General]] [[Grievous]] successfully took control of the [[planet]] in order to use it as his new headquarters.<ref name="Complete Vehicles 2018" />[[File:Utai-trio.png|thumb|left|250px|Vant (right) helped refuel Kenobi's starfighter.]]In the [[Standard year|year]] [[19 BBY]],<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']], which include Vant's appearance, to [[19 BBY]]</ref> Vant was present on one of the landing platforms of Utapau's [[capital]], [[Pau City]], when [[Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] landed there in his [[Obi-Wan Kenobi's Eta-2 Actis-class interceptor|Eta-2 ''Actis''-class light interceptor]] in order to start searching for Grievous. The [[Jedi]] was greeted by the [[city]]'s [[Port Administrator]] [[Tion Medon]], who ordered Vant and two other Utai to re-[[fuel]] the visitor's [[Eta-2 Actis-class light interceptor|interceptor]] and informed Kenobi that Grievous and his [[Separatist Droid Army|forces]] were on the city's higher levels. The trio of Utai attended to the [[starship]] quickly, after which Kenobi had his [[astromech droid]] [[R4-G9]] pilot the [[Starfighter|ship]] away, while he remained behind and confronted Grievous, starting the [[Battle of Utapau]].<ref name="ROTS" />

name: Miktrull
description: [[File:Miktrull.png|thumb|left|200px|The inscription of Miktrull with an astrium.]]Described by legend as having unending power in the Force, Miktrull was a venerated [[Zeffo Sage|Sage]] of his people and a student of the [[The Force|Life Wind]]. In life, Miktrull demanded offerings in the form of candles encased in metal.<ref name="Jedi Fallen Order" />After Miktrull's [[death]], his sarcophagus was placed hanging in the air in a vast [[Tomb of Miktrull|tomb]] on [[Zeffo]] Special torches called [[votive candle]]s were placed in his tomb not only to honor him, but to represent his legendary power. A symbol of his pride, the temple complex contained magnetic motifs reminiscent of the planet's gravity.<ref name="Jedi Fallen Order" />[[Jedi Master]] [[Eno Cordova]] initially believed that the votive candles which adorned Miktrull's tomb were a gift to the [[The Force|Life Wind]]; however, he eventually began to think otherwise. Many statues in the tomb held a similarly round object, and were the targets of vandalism. Through further research, Cordova reached the conclusion that the symbols associated with Miktrull represented [[astrium]]s, sacred artifacts that could open the [[Bogano Vault|Vault]] on [[Bogano]].<ref name="Jedi Fallen Order" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Eilram
description: Eilram was a Sage revered in Zeffo culture for being of great wisdom and insight. A master of the [[The Force|Life Wind]], Eilram held a place of high honor within a proving ground and academy on the planet [[Zeffo]]. Eilram was the first Zeffo to establish a relationship with the [[Wookiee]]s of [[Kashyyyk]] and loved the [[planet]]'s [[plant]]s.Sometime long before [[14 BBY]],<ref name="Date" /> Eilram [[Death|died]] and was [[Burial|buried]] within the [[Tomb of Eilram|halls]] of the great school on Zeffo. The burial chamber was adorned with wind chimes, and its domed roof was carved in the image of a mighty [[wroshyr tree]]. Eilram's sarcophagus was interred under the [[stone]] roots of the tree, a symbol of his mighty love for Kashyyyk.<ref name="Jedi Fallen Order" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Darth Tanis
description: [[Darth]] Tanis was an ancient [[Sith Lord]] who created the [[Malachor superweapon|superweapon]] within the [[Malachor Sith Temple|Sith Temple]] on the [[Sith]] [[planet]] of [[Malachor]]. Ancient [[Sith]] accounts from [[3966 BBY]] described [[Kyber crystal|kyber]] weaponry developed by [[Darth]] Tanis on the [[planet]] [[Malachor]]. This was the<ref name="TROS VD" /> [[Malachor superweapon]],<ref name="VE">''[[Star Wars: The Visual Encyclopedia]]''</ref> a deadly machinery that laid at the heart of the [[Malachor Sith Temple]],<ref name="Twilight Trivia">{{SW|url=series/episodes/twilight-of-the-apprentice-trivia-gallery|text=Twilight of the Apprentice Trivia Gallery|archivedate=20200531051234}}</ref> a [[battle station]] and site of contest with the [[Jedi]]<ref name="TOTA">{{Rebels|Twilight of the Apprentice}}</ref> which ultimately led to the [[Great Scourge of Malachor]],<ref name="TFA VD">''[[Star Wars: The Force Awakens: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref> where all [[Lightsaber combat|combatants]] perished at the activation of the [[superweapon]]<ref name="TOTA" /> after [[Unidentified Sith witch|a Sith witch]] from the [[Sith Empire]] activated it.<ref name="Note">''[[Dawn of Rebellion]]'' establishes that the [[Great Scourge of Malachor]] was fought between the [[Jedi]] and the forces of the [[Sith]] [[witch]]. [[Darth Maul (2017) 2|''Darth Maul'' 2]] establishes that the Sith forces were part of the [[Sith Empire]], so it can be deduced that the Sith witch was affiliated with the Sith Empire, as well.</ref>

name: HF-3311
description: {{Quote|Take it to interrogation six.''"<br />"''Move it.|Enric Pryde gives orders to HF-3311|Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker}}HFF-3311 was the designation of a [[human]]<ref name="TROS VD" /> [[Sexes|female]]<ref name="TROS" /> who was born on [[Gannaria]]<ref name="TROS VD" /> in around [[10 ABY]].<ref name="Birthdate" /> She served in the [[First Order]]'s [[Stormtrooper Corps (First Order)|Stormtrooper Corps]] as an [[electroprod trooper]] during the [[First Order–Resistance war|war]] against the [[Resistance]].<ref name="TROS VD" /> In [[35 ABY]],<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]'' states that the events of [[Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker|''Star Wars'': Episode IX ''The Rise of Skywalker'']] occur thirty five [[Standard year|years]] after the [[Battle of Yavin]]. As ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the Battle of [[Yavin Prime|Yavin]] to [[0 BBY]], the events of ''The Rise of Skywalker'', which includes HF-3311's appearance, must occur in [[35 ABY]].</ref> she was amongst a [[division]] of First Order forces deployed on the [[planet]] [[Pasaana]] after [[Supreme Leader]] [[Ben Solo|Kylo Ren]] learned that the [[scavenger]] [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] was on a [[Mission to Pasaana (Resistance)|mission]] there.<ref name="TROS" />When the [[Knights of Ren]] [[Ap'lek]] and [[Kuruk]] spotted the [[Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca]] alone in the [[desert]] on Pasaana, HF-3311 was amongst the [[stormtrooper]]s who aided them in capturing him. After a [[First Order officer|stormtrooper officer]] finished searching through the Wookiee's possessions, HF-3311 used her electroprod to force Chewbacca up a ramp into a [[AAL-1971/9.1 Troop Transport]]. The transport then carried them up to the [[Resurgent-class Star Destroyer|''Resurgent''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Steadfast (Resurgent-class)|''Steadfast'']] where [[General]] [[Armitage Hux]] presented the prisoner to [[Allegiant General]] [[Enric Pryde]]. After the Wookiee roared at Hux, Pryde ordered HF-3311 and the other troopers present to take the prisoner to interrogation six. Chewbacca later [[Mission to Kijimi|escaped]] from the [[Star Destroyer]], after which it was destroyed at the [[Battle of Exegol]].<ref name="TROS" />

name: Phenlass Sur
description: Phenlass Sur was a [[Reesarian]] who formed a bonded pair with fellow Reesarian [[Odla Sur]] and swore a vow of companionship as part of their [[marriage]]. The pair then joined the [[Resistance]] together and took part in its [[First Order–Resistance war|war]] against the [[First Order]] as [[soldier]]s and [[scout]]s. They were part of the Resistance forces stationed at a [[Resistance base (Ajan Kloss)|base]] on the [[jungle]] [[moon]] [[Ajan Kloss]], where they carried out reconnaissance on the outlying jungle beyond the perimeter of the base. Using only sound and sent, the couple detected [[Water|freshwater]] springs and by examination of the underbrush they were able to plot migratory routes of local fauna.<ref name="TROS VD" />[[File:Surs_at_Meeting.png|thumb|left|250px|Phenlass and Odla Sur were stationed at the Ajan Kloss Resistance base.]]In [[35 ABY]],<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]'' states that the events of [[Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker|''Star Wars'': Episode IX ''The Rise of Skywalker'']] occur thirty five [[Standard year|years]] after the [[Battle of Yavin]]. As ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the Battle of [[Yavin Prime|Yavin]] to [[0 BBY]], the events of ''The Rise of Skywalker'', which includes Phenlass Sur's appearance, must occur in [[35 ABY]].</ref> the pair stood under the [[cockpit]] of the [[CR90 corvette]] ''[[Tantive IV]]'' while attending a meeting at the base in which [[Resistance pilot]] [[Poe Dameron]] revealed that the [[Sith Lord]] [[Darth Sidious]] had returned and created a [[Final Order|fleet]] on the [[planet]] [[Exegol]] that would allow the First Order to take control of [[the galaxy]]. During the meeting Odla placed a hand on Phenlass's shoulder and lent in to speak to the Reesarian.<ref name="TROS">[[Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker|''Star Wars'': Episode IX ''The Rise of Skywalker'']]</ref>

name: CS-9147
description: {{Dialogue|C-3PO|They fly now!|Finn|They fly now?|Dameron|They fly now.|attr=C-3PO, Finn and Poe Dameron spot the two jet troopers|src=Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker}}CS-9147 was a [[human]] born in the [[Otomok system]]<ref name="TROS VD" /> in [[10 ABY]]<ref name="Birthdate" /> who served in the [[Stormtrooper Corps (First Order)|Stormtrooper Corps]] of the [[First Order]] as a [[First Order jet trooper|jet trooper]].<ref name="TROS VD" /> In [[35 ABY]],<ref name="Date" /> CS-9147 and another jet trooper were amongst a [[division]] of [[First Order military|First Order forces]] deployed to the [[planet]] [[Pasaana]] to search for the [[scavenger]] [[Rey Skywalker|Rey]] and her allies in the [[Resistance]]. One of the two jet troopers spotted their targets fleeing on [[skimmer]]s from the [[Festival of the Ancestors]] in the [[Forbidden Valley]] and alerted the other First Order forces.<ref name="TROS" />CS-9147 and the other jet trooper gave chase on the back of two [[Stormtrooper (First Order)|stormtroopers']] respective [[125-Z treadspeeder bike]]s, launching from the vehicles and opening fire on the skimmers. Their targets split up, with Resistance members [[Finn]], [[Poe Dameron]] and [[C-3PO]] heading down a narrow valley in their [[HS-19 cargo loading transport skimmer]]. One treadbike followed them down the valley, but the two jet troopers and remaining treadspeeder continued chasing Rey and her allies [[Chewbacca]] and [[BB-8]] as they remained in the open [[desert]] on an [[Arunskin 75D skimmer]].<ref name="TROS" />After the treadspeeder was destroyed, Chewbacca managed to shoot down one of the two jet troopers with [[Sexes|his]] [[bowcaster]]. After the two skimmers reunited, the second jet trooper managed to destroy both vehicles, but was [[Death|killed]] when the skimmers' occupants survived and returned fire.<ref name="TROS" />

name: Unidentified humanoid Jedi Master
description: A [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] served the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]<ref name="Sabotage" /> around [[4000 BBY|4,000 years]] before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. When the [[Jedi academy|Jedi enclave]] of [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]] and its [[Great Jedi Library]] were [[Battle of Ossus (Great Sith War)|brought to the ground]]<ref name="SW:CL" /> by the [[Brotherhood of the Sith]],<ref name="TSW5">''[[Tales of the Jedi: The Sith War 5: Brother Against Brother]]''</ref> that Jedi Master and three other colleagues were tasked with the construction of new headquarters for the Order. Together, the [[Four Masters/Legends|Four Masters]] established a new [[Jedi Temple]] on the site of the [[Sacred spire|Sacred Spire]], a natural peak located on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], where earlier generations of Jedi had already erected small meditative chapels. The humanoid Master and his fellow founders were remembered through a series of four engraved pylons that ornated the formal entrance to their Temple.<ref name="SW:CL" /> Those statues, however, were either toppled or destroyed at the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] during "[[Operation: Knightfall]]," when the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] stormed the Temple with a detachment of the [[501st Legion/Legends|501st Legion's]] [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]].<ref name="ROS">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref>

name: Holaq
description: {{Quote|He has a name, y'know. You sound like a child afraid of a bedtime story.''"<br>"''Except he ain't a story.|Uro and Holaq, discussing Darth Vader|Target Vader 1}}Holaq was a [[Weequay]] who worked with the [[Hidden Hand]] criminal syndicate<ref name="Target Vader 1" /> sometime prior to the [[Battle of Hoth]] in [[3 ABY]].<ref name="Date" /> While in the [[Lower Bay Docks]] located in the [[Outer Rim Territories|Outer Rim]] world [[Fikari]], Holaq chatted with the [[Aqualish]] [[Uro (Aqualish)|Uro]], exclaiming that the [[Dark Lord of the Sith|Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker|Darth Vader]] had attacked a number of clans and left no survivors. Uro stated that while it was the cost of working for the Hidden Hand, it came with the benefit of remaining anonymous to the syndicate. Holaq replied the syndicate's [[Standard day|days]] were limited as Vader was actively hunting the Hidden Hand down.<ref name="Target Vader 1" />[[File:Holaq-Near-Death.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Holaq, moments before death.]]While conversing with the Aqualish, Vader, who was on a mission to [[Hunt for Vader|hunt]] down the Hidden Hand, arrived at the docks and began slaughtering the guards, unbeknownst to both Uro and Holaq. Immediately afterwards, Uro was suddenly pulled back and [[Death|killed]]. Noticing the Aqualish's disappearance, Holaq pulled out his [[blaster pistol]] and was immediately alerted to Vader's presence when the [[Sith Lord]] crushed the [[blaster]] using his [[The Force|Force powers]]. Holaq was then questioned about the Hidden Hand's location, and pleaded with the Sith Lord, claiming that the syndicate never revealed themselves and only paid [[credit]]s to buy their loyalty. Vader, unsatisfied with the Weequay's response, caused an explosion using the Force, which engulfed and killed Holaq.<ref name="Target Vader 1" />

name: CSL Danenberger
description: CSL Danenberger had always dreamed of becoming a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], though the youth was thought of as crazy by other Kyrouaquians. When the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] sent diplomats to Kyrouac in an attempt to get them to supply them with food supplies, it was Danenberger who warned them of the treachery of one of the [[Kyrouaquian High Council]] members. After Danenberger informed them of this, they agreed to take the youth off the planet.

name: Krex Alto
description: Krex Alto was a [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] and [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] for hire, selling their services to the highest bidder. During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Alto was contracted by the [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Zelto Sliteye]] at the [[Ord Mynock Freeport]]. Sliteye wanted [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Precipitator]] [[Minas-Coth Cray]] dead to send a message to the Empire that Ord Mynock Freeport was his to rule.

name: Ooris
description: {{Quote|I hope you die better than Dr. Genzhor did, Solo.|Ooris|Galaxy's Edge 1}}Ooris was the assistant of [[Doctor]] [[Genzhor]], who was [[the galaxy]]'s leading expert on [[sarlacc]]s. While working with [[Sexes|him]] on the [[Outer Rim Territories|Outer Rim]] [[planet]] [[I'vorcia Prime]] sometime during the [[Imperial Era]], Ooris betrayed the doctor, resulting in Genzhor's [[death]]. When the [[smuggler]]s [[Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca]] arrived on a job from the [[Ithorian]] [[collector]] [[Dok-Ondar]], Ooris greeted the duo and brought them to [[Genzhor's research outpost]], along the way explaining that the visible damage to the local ecosystem was the result of the [[Battle of I'vorcia Prime]] and that the area was now a [[I'vorcia Prime Preserve|preserve]] used by [[Imperial officer]]s as a [[hunting]] ground.<ref name="Galaxy's Edge 1" />[[File:Solo_and_Chewie_escape_Ivorcia_Prime.png|thumb|left|250px|Ooris is used as bait in order to capture an infant sarlacc.]]Upon reaching the edge of the pit where the outpost was located, Ooris and the [[Dowutin]]s working the outpost betrayed the smugglers by pushing Solo into the pit, which housed two infant and two adolescent sarlaccs. The assistant then revealed their plan to use the smugglers' [[freighter]], the ''[[Millennium Falcon]]'', and the codes their employer had given them, to  escape the [[quarantine]] [[blockade]] that [[orbit]]ed the planet with the frozen sarlacc spores they had stolen from the base, hoping to sell them and gain immense [[Currency|wealth]]. The smugglers managed to foil Ooris's plan, however, with Chewbacca finding them aboard the ''Falcon'' and hanging him from the underbelly of the [[Starship|ship]], using them as bait to catch an [[Simpi|infant sarlacc]] as he rescued Solo from the edge of a cliff.<ref name="Galaxy's Edge 1" />During the [[First Order]] occupation of the planet [[Batuu]], Dok-Ondar recounted the events on I'vorcia Prime to the [[Kendoh Gang]] as they attempted to broker a deal with the shopkeeper.<ref name="Galaxy's Edge 1" />

name: Tanus Spijek
description: The [[Elom]]<ref name="SWVE" /> Tanus Spijek was hired by the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic]] to act as a [[spy]] and messenger for them during the [[Galactic Civil War]] against the [[Galactic Empire]]. Spijek ferried messages between the [[planet]] [[Alderaan]]&mdash;where founding Alliance [[Bail Organa]] lived, and the [[moon]] [[Yavin 4]],<ref name="SWFC" /> where the [[Alliance High Command]] were based for part of the war in the [[Great Temple (Yavin 4)|Great Temple]]. In the [[Standard year|year]] [[0 BBY]],<ref name="SWGA">''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''</ref> the Empire [[The Disaster|destroyed]] Alderaan and soon after in [[0 ABY]]<ref name="SWGA" /> the Alliance was forced to evacuated Yavin 4 following the [[Battle of Yavin]].<ref name="SWPL1">[[Princess Leia 1|''Princess Leia'' 1]]</ref>[[File:Tanus Spijek Jabbas palace.png|thumb|left|250px|Tanus Spijek watched Luke Skywalker sentenced to death.]]In the year [[4 ABY]],<ref name="SWGA" /> Spijek was on the [[planet]] [[Tatooine]] and spent time in the [[Jabba's Palace|palace]] of the [[Hutt]] [[crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. During a performance in Jabba's throne room<ref name="ROTJ" /> by the [[Max Rebo Band]]<ref name="USW">''[[Ultimate Star Wars]]''</ref> Spijek sat in one of the room's booths in front<ref name="ROTJ" /> of the [[Whiphid]] [[J'Quille]]<ref name="CEUE">''[[Star Wars Character Encyclopedia: Updated and Expanded]]''</ref> in order to watch. The performance ended<ref name="ROTJ" /> with the [[Twi'lek]] dancer [[Oola]]<ref name="USW" /> being dropped through a trapdoor into the [[rancor]] pit below the throne room and devoured.<ref name="ROTJ" />Immediately after the performance, [[Prince]]ss [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] disguised as the [[bounty hunter]] [[Boushh]] made a commotion while entering the throne room with the [[Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca]], causing Spijek to recoil in fear as she stood in front of him to face Jabba. Organa&mdash;whose plan was in fact to try and [[Rescue of Han Solo|rescue]] her lover [[Han Solo]] from Jabba&mdash;haggled with Jabba over the [[bounty]] price for bringing him the Wookiee, activating a [[Thermal detonator]] in order to scare the Hutt into increasing his offer. Spijek and many others present in the room to cowered in fear at the explosive, but much to their relief of Organa deactivated the [[grenade]] once Jabba compromised with her on the amount. Organa was caught later that night attempting to free Solo from [[carbonite]] and imprisoned by Jabba.<ref name="ROTJ" />After Organa had been redressed as Jabba's [[Slavery|slave]], Spijek was then spending a night in the palace, resting on the floor up against a wall alongside many members of Jabba's court in the throne room. He was awoken when the [[Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker]] arrived demanding audience with Jabba. The [[Jedi]] sought to persuade Jabba to release Solo, Organa and Chewbacca. Spijek stood to watch the two speak, and witnessed Skywalker threaten the Hutt<ref name="ROTJ" /> with a [[DL-18 blaster pistol]]<ref name="USW" /> taken from the guard<ref name="ROTJ" /> [[Nizuc Bek]]<ref name="SWCT">{{SWCT|Sy Snootles & Nizuc Bek - Base Series 4|Sy Snootles & Nizuc Bek - ''Base Series 4''}}</ref> before being dropped into the [[rancor]] pit below the throne room.<ref name="ROTJ" />After Jabba's pet rancor<ref name="ROTJ" /> [[Pateesa]]<ref name="ALD">''[[Aftermath: Life Debt]]''</ref> ate the [[Gamorrean]]<ref name="ROTJ" /> [[Jubnuk]],<ref name="SWCL">''[[Star Wars: Complete Locations]]''</ref> who had fallen in with Skywalker, was killed by the Jedi, much to the horror of the Hutt and his court. Spijek and the crowd then watched as Skywalker and his friend [[Han Solo]] were dragged before Jabba and sentenced to death through being eaten by the [[sarlacc]] at the [[Great Pit of Carkoon]]. The Elom then boarded the Hutt's [[sail barge]]<ref name="ROTJ" /> ''[[Khetanna]]''<ref name="USW" /> in order to travel to the pit and witness the executions. While traveling across the [[Dune Sea]] on the barge, Spijek spoke with<ref name="ROTJ" /> the [[Ugnaught]] [[Yoxgit]].<ref name="CEUE" /> Once above the pit, Skywalker managed to free himself and board the barge<ref name="ROTJ" /> from the [[Bantha-II cargo skiff]]<ref name="USW" /> he had been transported on. Skywalker's ally [[Prince]]ss [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] then killed Jabba by strangling him to death and together Skywalker and his allies destroyed the sail barge and escaped Tatooine.<ref name="ROTJ" />

name: Unidentified bartender (Eriadu)
description: {{Quote|Let me go&hellip;there are ''stormtroopers'' after me!''"<br>"''I'll blast you ''myself'' for bringing trouble to my bar, you little gwerp&mdash;|The thief and the bartender|Bounty Hunters 2}}During the [[Imperial Era|reign]] of the [[Galactic Empire]], the [[bartender]] worked at a [[Cantina|bar]] within the settlement of [[Phelar Port]] on<ref name="Bounty Hunters 2" /> the [[planet]]<ref name="Eriadu">{{Databank|grand-moff-tarkin|Grand Moff Tarkin|archivedate=20190909200024}}</ref> [[Eriadu]].<ref name="Bounty Hunters 2" /> At some point after [[10 BBY]],<ref name="Date">The events of the flashback in [[Bounty Hunters 2|''Bounty Hunters'' 2]] take place after [[Beilert Valance]] was discharged from the [[Galactic Empire]]. [[Target Vader 5|''Target Vader'' 5]] establishes that Valance was discharged after  receiving severe injuries during the [[Mimban campaign]], which ''[[Solo: A Star Wars Story The Official Guide]]'' dates to nine [[Standard year|years]] after the [[Proclamation of the New Order|formation]] of the Empire. ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates the Empire's formation to [[19 BBY]], meaning that the [[Mimban]] campaign and Valance's discharge from the Empire take place in [[10 BBY]], and the events of the flashback in ''Bounty Hunters'' 2, including the [[bartender]]'s appearance, must have occurred sometime afterward.</ref> the bartender caught a young [[Unidentified thief|thief]] who was attempting to escape from Imperial [[stormtrooper]]s after stealing [[ration pack]]s from an Imperial [[speeder]]. The thief pleaded for help from the patrons of the bar, but the bartender held onto the young boy to prevent his escape, threatening to [[Death|kill]] him for leading trouble into the bar.<ref name="Bounty Hunters 2" />The stormtroopers pursued the thief into the bar, demanding that the boy be handed over to them. However, the [[cyborg]] [[Beilert Valance]], a former Imperial [[soldier]]<ref name="Bounty Hunters 2" /> who was discharged after receiving severe injuries,<ref name="Target Vader 5">[[Target Vader 5|''Target Vader'' 5]]</ref> attacked the stormtroopers to defend the boy, angered by what his Imperial service had done to him. After shooting down several [[trooper]]s, Valance threw the bartender into a stormtrooper, knocking both through the bar's entrance and onto the ground. Ultimately, the [[bounty hunter]] [[Nakano Lash]] stepped in to assist Valance, killing the remaining stormtroopers.<ref name="Bounty Hunters 2" />

name: Darth Zannah
description: Approximately [[Millennium|one thousand years]] prior to the [[Invasion of Naboo]], the [[Sith Lord]] [[Darth Bane]] enacted the [[Rule of Two]]. This teaching mandated that there would only be two [[Sith]] at any given [[time]]; a [[Sith Master|master]] to embody power, and an [[Sith apprentice|apprentice]] to crave it.<ref name="BaneDB">{{Databank|darth-bane|Darth Bane|archivedate=20191016050833}}</ref> As part of the Rule of Two, Bane took on an apprentice,<ref name="Sacrifice" /> [[Darth]] Zannah,<ref name="HC 2">{{HelmetCollectionCite|2|Databank A-Z|Alzoc III&mdash;Antilles}}</ref> upon whom [[Sexes|he]] passed his teachings.<ref name="Sacrifice" />Zannah escaped the notice of the [[Jedi Order]]. After Bane's defeat, his apprentice carried on the Rule of Two, which allowed the Sith to survive in secret while the [[Jedi]] falsely believed that the Sith had become extinct.<ref name="SWEBane">{{SWE|characters|darth-bane|Darth Bane|archivedate=20140614023011}}</ref> Although the historical records were not accurate about the identity of Bane's apprentice or how Bane [[Death|died]],<ref name="SW:TDS">''[[Star Wars: The Dark Side]]''</ref> he supposedly died in a [[Lightsaber duel|duel]] with Zannah on the [[Inner Rim]] world of [[Ambria]], a pattern which would be repeated by almost all Sith thereafter.<ref name="HC 2" />

name: Kritz Drassarb
description: Kritz Drassarb was born during the waning [[Time/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and joined the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After becoming a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Drassarb [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] under the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vhiin Thorla]]. In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], Drassarb and Thorla were sent by the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] to investigate a band of [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] that were operating in the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]] region of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. They came into conflict with the pirates and two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] later, the pirate band had been dismantled and Drassarb was [[Death/Legends|dead]].<ref name="TS" />The Jedi Council absolved Thorla of any responsibility for causing Drassarb's death, but the Twi'lek still blamed himself for it. He returned to his [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], where he meditated on how he could have saved Drassarb. Thorla soon found a new purpose and began rescuing Twi'leks that had been captured by [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]]. He established [[The Enclave|a settlement]] on Ryloth to serve as a safe haven for liberated slaves, and was very protective of the settlement's inhabitants, because he still felt guilt for Drassarb's death.<ref name="TS" />

name: Vraker Orde
description: {{Cutstart}}

name: User:Eddiebox28/Workbench
description: {{Quote|Status report.''"<br />"''There's too many of them!|Koth demands a status report from Lock.|Grievous Intrigue}}[[File:LockUnderAttack-GI.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Eeth Koth communicates with Lock via hologram, as the latter battles a Separatist boarding party.]]The [[clone trooper]] who adopted the nickname Lock<ref name="Episode Guide">{{SWArchive|url=theclonewars/guide/episode209.html|text=''The Clone Wars'' Episode Guide: Grievous Intrigue|archivedate=20110618103518}}</ref> was born on the remote [[planet]] [[Kamino]] as a [[Cloning|clone]] of the [[human]] [[Sexes|male]] [[bounty hunter]] [[Jango Fett]].<ref name="Clone troopers" /> Raised to serve the [[Grand Army of the Republic]] during the [[Clone Wars]], Lock acquired the [[Military rank|rank]] of [[Clone Captain]]. In the year [[21 BBY]], Lock was stationed aboard the [[Venator-class Star Destroyer|''Venator''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Steadfast (Venator-class)|''Steadfast'']], under the command of [[Jedi General]] and [[Jedi High Council|council-member]] [[Eeth Koth]]. Whilst the ''Steadfast'' was in the [[Saleucami system]], a [[Confederacy of Independent Systems|Separatist]] [[fleet]] [[Capture of Eeth Koth|attacked]] the [[Starship|ship]]. Led by [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Army|Supreme Commander]] [[General]] [[Grievous]] aboard [[Grievous's Recusant-class warship|his]] [[Recusant-class light destroyer|''Recusant''-class Commerce Guild destroyer]], Separatist forces boarded the ship using [[cofferdam]]s.<ref name="Grievous Intrigue" />The ensuing battle saw Lock and his clone troopers forced to defend the ship's [[airlock]]s against oncoming [[B2-series super battle droid]]s. Koth contacted Lock and requested an urgent report on the situation, to which the captain replied that the number of [[droid]]s was too large to counter. Koth proceeded to order Lock and his troops to evacuate the vessel in [[escape pod]]s, exclaiming that he would handle Grievous on the [[Bridge (starship)|bridge]]. Lock protested, stressing that the droid general's forces included [[BX-series droid commando]]s, but Koth downplayed their importance and again ordered him to evacuate. Moments later, Koth and his troops were greeted by Grievous and a squad of commando droids on the bridge. The [[Jedi]] engaged Grievous in a desperate [[lightsaber duel]], but Grievous ordered his droid escort to assist and Koth was ultimately defeated and captured.<ref name="Grievous Intrigue" />

name: Unidentified Mirialan ensign
description: {{Quote|Get to your stations.|Brand, to the ensigns|Battlefront: Twilight Company}}During the [[Galactic Civil War]], the [[Mirialan]] served as an [[ensign]] in the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic|Rebel Alliance's]] [[61st Mobile Infantry]], better known as Twilight [[Company]]. [[Sexes|He]] was stationed aboard the [[Bridge (starship)|bridge]] of the company's [[CR90 corvette]], the ''[[Thunderstrike]]'', serving under [[Commander]] [[Paonu]], who led [[Starship|ship]] operations.<ref name="TC" /> In [[3 ABY]],<ref name="Date">The section of ''[[Battlefront: Twilight Company]]'' where the [[Mirialan]] [[ensign]] appears takes place is set twenty-two [[Standard year|years]] after the [[Clone Wars]], which [[Mission to Mustafar|ended]] in [[19 BBY]], according to ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]''. The ensign must have therefore appeared in [[3 ABY]].</ref> the ''Thunderstrike'' and its escort, the [[Braha'tok-class gunship|''Braha'tok''-class gunship]] ''[[Apailana's Promise]]'', rendezvoused with an Alliance [[flotilla]] in the [[Elochar sector]] for repairs. However, some [[Galactic Empire|Imperial]] [[Spy|spies]] were able to [[Infiltration of the Thunderstrike|infiltrate]] the [[corvette]] by posing as survivors from a damaged [[Trumpet's Call|freighter]].<ref name="TC" />[[Lieutenant]] [[Sairgon]] attempted to contain them from the bridge by locking the ''Thunderstrike'' down, and when the spies reached the bridge, the lieutenant prompted the rest of the flotilla to flee before being [[Death|killed]]. The Mirialan ensign and four others were then captured by the infiltrators. After the [[Rebel trooper|rebel soldier]] [[Brand]] entered the bridge and fired at the spies, the ensign and the other surviving bridge crew wrestled their captors. The bridge crew defeated multiple infiltrators, who fired back at her, while Brand killed the others. By this time, the Mirialan and another ensign were the only remaining crew.<ref name="TC" />Brand, assuming command as Paonu had been killed, ordered the pair to get to their stations and one of them reported that the<ref name="TC" /> [[Imperial II-class Star Destroyer|''Imperial II''-class Star Destroyer]]<ref name="Rebel Files">''[[Star Wars: The Rebel Files]]''</ref> ''[[Herald]]'', which had since arrived to deal with Twilight Company, was firing at the ''Thunderstrike'' and ''Apailana's Promise''. Brand told the ensigns to get ready to jump the ''Thunderstrike'' into [[hyperspace]]. The Mirialan, while focusing on his control panel, argued that they needed to activate the corvette's [[Deflector shield|shields]]. Brand overruled the ensign, insisted that the ''Thunderstrike'' could take a hit to escape immediately. She also sent coordinates to the ''Promise'' and the two vessels fled into hyperspace under fire.<ref name="TC" />

name: Sadow
description: Sadow was an ancient [[Sith Lord]]<ref name="TROS Junior Novel" /> who, according to the quasi-historical [[Qel-Droma Epics]] series of poems, was known as Naga Sadow and was active [[Millennium|thousands]] of [[Standard year|years]] before the [[time]] of [[Jedi Knight]] [[Ulic Qel-Droma/Canon|Ulic Qel-Droma]]. During that period, the [[Sith Empire]] conducted an [[Invasion of Empress Teta|invasion]], which began the [[Great Hyperspace War/Canon|Great Hyperspace War]]. [[Emperor|Empress]] [[Teta/Canon|Teta]] allied [[Sexes|herself]] with the [[Jedi Order]] and defeated [[Naga Sadow's forces|Sadow's forces]], scattering them across [[the galaxy]]. The Qel-Droma Epics also claimed that Naga Sadow triggered [[star]]s in the [[Cron Cluster/Canon|Cron Cluster]] to form the [[Cron Supernova/Canon|Cron Supernova]], subsequently leaving the nearby [[Jedi]] retreat [[planet]] [[Ossus]] barren and scarred.<ref name="Nexus" />Sadow's likeness was chiseled into the rock walls of the [[Sith Citadel]] on the hidden [[Sith]] planet of [[Exegol]], located in the [[Unknown Regions]],<ref name="TROS Junior Novel" /> by [[35 ABY]].<ref name="Date">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]'' dates the events of [[Star Wars: Episode IX The Rise of Skywalker|''Star Wars'': Episode IX ''The Rise of Skywalker'']] as taking place one [[Standard year|year]] after the [[Hosnian Cataclysm|Starkiller Incident]], which ''[[Star Wars: Galactic Atlas]]'' dates to [[34 ABY]]. Therefore, the events of the film ''The Rise of Skywalker'', and its [[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: A Junior Novel|junior novelization]], must take place in [[35 ABY]].</ref> When the [[Supreme Leader]] of the [[First Order]] and [[master of the Knights of Ren]], [[Ben Solo|Kylo Ren]], arrived on Exegol to confront the [[Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Sidious]], the Supreme Leader maneuvered through the Sith Citadel and recognized a number of statues of Sith Lords from his studies that were etched into the walls.<ref name="TROS Junior Novel" />Of those he recognized were the Sith Lords [[Locphet]], [[Mindran]], [[Sissiri]], [[Felkor]], and Sadow. While there, Ren also heard their unintelligible whispers, along with the familiar voice of Sidious, which Ren had been hearing since [[Youngling|childhood]].<ref name="TROS Junior Novel" /> Sadow's name was shared with the [[Sadow escarpment]], a location on Exegol.<ref name="TROS VD">''[[Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref>

name: Elzian
description: {{Quote|General Solo, it looks as though our victory is complete. The Imperial forces are clearly trapped in an untenable position.|Elzian speaks to Han Solo|Crimson Empire III: Empire Lost 3}}An [[Ishi Tib/Legends|Ishi Tib]] who held the rank of [[Colonel/Legends|colonel]] in the [[New Republic Defense Fleet/Legends|New Republic Defense Fleet]], Elzian was aboard [[General/Legends|General]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo's]]<ref name="Empire Lost 3" /> [[Unidentified MC80 Liberty type Star Cruiser (Pallaxides)|MC80 ''Liberty'' type Star Cruiser]]<ref name="Liberty">[[Star Wars: Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook|''Star Wars: Age of Rebellion'' Core Rulebook]]</ref> during the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic's]] [[Battle of Pallaxides|battle]] against [[Imperial Remnant]] forces over the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Pallaxides]]<ref name="Empire Lost 3" /> in [[13 ABY/Legends|13 ABY]].<ref name="Date">The events of ''[[Crimson Empire III: Empire Lost 3]]'' are set approximately thirteen [[Standard year/Legends|years]] after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], which marks the beginning of [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], according to ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. Therefore, the events of ''Empire Lost'' 3 must have taken place around [[13 ABY/Legends|13 ABY]].</ref> As Solo, who had stood watch over the battle for over forty-eight [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]], remained fixated on the contested world through a [[Viewport/Legends|viewport]] on [[Sexes/Legends|his]] [[Star Cruiser/Legends|Star Cruiser]]'s [[Bridge (starship)/Legends|bridge]], Colonel Elzian reported to the [[Commanding officer/Legends|commanding officer]] of their apparent victory, giving a brief assessment of the battle; Elzian was certain of their opponent's defeat, remarking that their forces were evidently and decisively trapped. Han Solo agreed, although he was unsatisfied of the Imperials' intent of fighting to their [[Death/Legends|deaths]], stating his aversion of having to create unnecessary casualties.<ref name="Empire Lost 3" />[[File:MC80_bridge.jpg|thumb|left|330px|Elzian (right) participated at the battle of Pallaxides.]]Turning to the colonel, Han Solo ordered the naval forces' retreat and the deployment of ground forces. Colonel Elzian then noted General Solo's lack of rest during his tireless watch over the battle before being interrupted by Solo, who acknowledged the colonel's concern and relinquished command of the Republic's forces to the Ishi Tib. For [[Sleep/Legends|sleep]], the general proceeded to his living quarters. Before he could rest, however, Solo was contacted via [[Viewscreen/Legends|viewscreen]] by a Republic [[Officer/Legends|officer]] who exclaimed that the general was needed in the [[Starship/Legends|ship's]] command center, eliminating Solo's chance for rest.<ref name="Empire Lost 3" /> Nevertheless, the battle over Pallaxides was won by the New Republic as enemy forces eventually capitulated.<ref name="Empire Lost 4">''[[Crimson Empire III: Empire Lost 4]]''</ref>

name: Rystáll Sant/Legends
description: [[File:Rystallfull.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Rystáll as a dancer in [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba's]] [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Palace]]]]Rystáll never knew her biological father. Her mother, [[Cyl Sant]], abandoned her as a baby after they moved from [[New Bornalex]] to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. There she was adopted by an [[Ortolan/Legends|Ortolan]] couple who worked as musicians. Rystáll became a dancer in their performances.In her younger days, Rystáll was a patron of the [[Galaxies Opera House/Legends|Galaxies Opera House]], seen wearing only the finest [[Body glove/Legends|attire]]. Following the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Rystáll and her adoptive parents were enslaved by the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]] who had apparently become infatuated with the young dancer, though since he later put up the Sant family for a wager in a heated [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] game, he seemed to care little for his slaves. Fortunately for Rystáll and her parents, a young [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] won them in that very sabacc game.{{Fact}} Lando despised slavery and set the trio free.<ref name="SWCE" /> The Ortolans then contacted their friend [[Max Rebo/Legends|Max Rebo]], who agreed to hire Rystáll as a dancer and backup singer for his band.Rystáll performed in [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] during [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] attempt to rescue his friend [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]. Rystáll's graceful form and beautiful, exotic features, accentuated by her luxurious szona body glove, managed to attract the attention of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], who engaged in conversation with the dancer prior to [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa's]] arrival at the palace.Rystáll, along with [[Greeata Jendowanian/Legends|Greeata Jendowanian]] (who had danced with her at Jabba's Palace), later joined a band known as [[The Palpatones]]. Although Greeata served as lead singer, as part of the band, Rystáll still gained fame for her musical ability. Her tenure with The Palpatones eventually brought her to [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], where she met fellow [[Theelin/Legends|Theelin]] [[Shug Ninx]]. While on Nar Shaddaa, Rystáll discovered that her father was among the last of the Theelin species. She then left The Palpatones in order to locate information on who her father was.

name: Greeata Jendowanian/Legends
description: Born on the Rodian [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Rodia/Legends|Rodia]], Greeata was considered an outcast by the violent Rodian society for her love of [[Music/Legends|music]] and dance. The name “Greeata” was a common name for female Rodians meaning “talented.” Rather than focus on hunting, Greeata absorbed any information she could find on the music and dance of many intergalactic cultures. Having rejected the values of Rodian culture, Greeata left her homeworld to perform as a [[Kloo horn/Legends|Kloo horn]] player aboard the intergalactic cruiseliner [[Kuari Princess/Legends|''Kuari Princess'']]. At one point, she visited [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and was present at the [[Squid Lake/Legends|Squid Lake]] performance at the [[Galaxies Opera House/Legends|Galaxies Opera House]].[[File:Faytonni.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Greeata present at the [[Galaxies Opera House/Legends|Galaxies Opera House]], in the background, center.]]Greeata developed a friendship with [[Sy Snootles/Legends|Sy Snootles]], lead singer for ''Kuari Princess''{{'s}} house band. After forcefully rejecting the sexual advances of a male Rodian, Greeata and Sy left the house band to perform as a duo. [[Evar Orbus]] discovered the pair performing in the [[Green Planet]] nightclub on [[Tothis]]. Mesmerized by Snootles' voice, Orbus asked her to audition for his band. While excited, Snootles said that she would only join if Orbus offered Greeata a spot. After learning that Greeata could sing, dance, and play the Kloo horn, Evar signed her on as a dancer on a per diem rate.<div style="float:right">[[File:Greeata shocked.jpg|thumb|120px|Greeata's reaction to [[Oola/Legends|Oola's]] execution.]]</div>After fifteen [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of dancing with [[Lyn Me/Legends|Lyn Me]] and [[Rystáll Sant/Legends|Rystáll Sant]], Greeata was first accepted as a full member when [[Max Rebo/Legends|Max Rebo]] founded his own [[Max Rebo Band/Legends|band]]. During her tenure in [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|palace]], the Rodian wore bracelets that suppressed her [[Pheromone/Legends|pheromones]].<ref name="SWCE" /> When fellow dancer Oola was fed to the rancor, Greeata was horrified and covered her face with her hands, unable to look. However, it was not long after Greeata began singing with the Max Rebo Band that Jabba was killed and his sail barge destroyed. In the chaos that followed, Greeata's Rodian survival instincts saved the band from a pack of [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]].Greeata and Rystáll later joined [[The Palpatones]], where they were reunited with [[Joh Yowza/Legends|Joh Yowza]]. Greeata attained popularity as the band's lead singer. Notably, she gained fame with her hit song "[[Kick the Ranat]]."

name: Areta Bell
description: [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] Areta Bell was given command of the [[GR-75 medium transport/Legends|GR-75 medium transport]] [[Dutyfree/Legends|''Dutyfree'']], and participated in the evacuation of [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]]. Escorted by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]], Captain Bell's transport ran the Imperial blockade and made it to the [[Haven (rendezvous point)|rendezvous point]].Following the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], Areta Bell rose through the ranks of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and its successor, the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. Under the new galactic government, Areta was promoted to the rank of [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]], and commanded the [[Victory II-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Victory II''-class Star Destroyer]] ''[[Swift Liberty]]''. She and her ship participated in the [[Hegemony theater|campaign]] against [[Prince-Admiral/Legends|Prince-Admiral]] [[Delak Krennel]], notably in the [[Battle of Liinade III]], where, under her command, the ''Swift Liberty'' helped the [[Moonshadow (Imperial II-class)|''Moonshadow'']] to disable the [[Ciutric Hegemony]]'s ''[[Direption]]''. During the battle, the ''Swift Liberty'' was the home to [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]].By [[12 ABY/Legends|12 ABY]], Areta Bell was assigned command of the [[Endurance-class fleet carrier|''Endurance''-class fleet carrier]] [[Endurance (Endurance-class)|''Endurance'']], assisting [[General/Legends|General]] Wedge Antilles in the [[Battle of Orinda]]. Despite Antilles' orders to launch her squadrons of [[E-wing escort starfighter|E-wing starfighters]] against the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|''Executor''-class Star Dreadnought]] [[Reaper (Executor-class)|''Reaper'']], Bell hesitated, knowing that they were no match for the larger ship. Soon afterward, the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|''Executor''-class Star Dreadnought]] [[Dominion (Star Dreadnought)|''Dominion'']] arrived in system and joined in the attack on both ''Endurance'' and Antilles' command ship, ''[[Lusankya]]''. ''Lusankya'' was able to retreat, but ''Endurance'' was destroyed, killing all onboard, including Bell.

name: Aaida
description: When [[Saul Karath]] led a fleet of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] warships through the Republic defenses to begin orbital bombardment, Aaida was separated from her husband [[Lootra]] while being evacuated. She was on one of the few civilian ships which managed to escape. She believed it to happen because the Sith wanted living witnesses to the attack. Her ship jumped from system to system, barely ahead of the Sith warships. Eventually, she was shuttled to the [[Refugee Sector]] on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]].Lootra came to Nar Shaddaa in search of her. He was just about to give up hope when [[Meetra Surik]] came through his door and told him what he needed to hear. Surik removed the obstacle presented by the guards to the Refugee Sector, allowing Aaida to escape and reunite with Lootra.

name: Ada
description: [[Ada's father]] owed money to [[Davik Kang]]. As he was unable to make ends meet Davik had him killed and sold Ada into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] to cover the debt. She ended up in servitude to the [[Black Vulkars/Legends|Black Vulkars]]. She was gravely mistreated by them. She described being "pawed and groped and kicked and spit on" to [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] when he fought his way through the Vulkar base in search of [[Bastila Shan]], encountered Ada, and declared her free. Delighted but nonetheless frightened, Ada fled the compound into the streets. Her good fortune was cut short when [[Darth Malak]] gave his order to [[Destruction of Taris|bombard]] [[Taris/Legends|Taris]].<ref name="kotor" />

name: Adana (Human)
description: {{Quote|I've taken care of the squid head. You can go back to your mother now.''"<br />"''Aww&hellip; I wanted to see you thrash him. Well, thanks!|Meetra Surik and Adana|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}In [[3951 BBY]],<ref name="CAMP">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Adana lived as a [[Refugee/Legends|refugee]] with her [[Parent/Legends|mother]], [[Nadaa]], in the [[Refugee Sector]] of [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]] covered entirely by a single [[City/Legends|city]]. Adana and Nadaa were refugees of the [[Mandalorian Wars]] and the [[Jedi Civil War]]. At some point during this [[Time/Legends|time]], Adana was kidnapped by the [[Sector/Legends|sector's]] [[Exchange]] crime boss and overseer, a male [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] named [[Saquesh]].
