Saquesh took Adana due to Nadaa's inability to pay a tribute of 600 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to him and planned to sell Adana to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]] to recoup the debt.<ref name="KOTOR2" />{{GameLSmechanics|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}While visiting the moon in search of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Zez-Kai Ell]], [[Meetra Surik]], a former [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], spoke with Adana's mother, Nadaa. She told Surik that Adana was being held by the Exchange and begged Surik to help her. Surik agreed to help Nadaa rescue Adana and went to meet with Saquesh.<ref name="KOTOR2" /> Surik attempted to intimidate Saquesh into releasing Adana, but Saquesh was not swayed and immediately attacked Surik. The former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knight [[Death/Legends|slew]] the Quarren and his guards and released Adana from her [[Prison/Legends|cell]].<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|127|Saquesh}}</ref> Adana thanked her rescuer and ran off to reunite with her mother. Surik returned to Nadaa, who thanked Surik profusely for her help.<ref name="KOTOR2" />{{Endgame}}

name: Alani
description: Alani was born in [[57 BBY/Legends|57 BBY]] on [[New Apsolon/Legends|New Apsolon]]. At this time a totalitarian system of government ruled the planet. [[Civilized|The Civilized]] received all the benefits, while [[Workers|the Workers]] lived in poverty. Alani's father, Ewane, was a leader of the resistance against this social system. Due to this activity he spent many years in the prison and saw his daughters rarely. Alani and Eritha were raised mostly by friends of their father, since their mother had died around the time they were born. One of those friends was [[Lenz]].With the first elections after the fall of the regime in the year [[47 BBY/Legends|47 BBY]], their father was selected to be [[Supreme Governor]] of New Apsolon. At that time, the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] were sent to supervise the election, and they were represented by [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Tahl]], who developed a bond with Alani and her twin sister [[Eritha]].Ewane held the office for five years, but was murdered shortly into his second term. [[Roan]], a close friend of their father and his successor, adopted them. At that time, Alani and Eritha conceived a plan to gain the power on New Apsolon. That plan included killing Roan and kidnapping Tahl, who died as a result of the injuries suffered. However, the plan failed with no small part due to the actions of Qui-Gon Jinn and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] who came to New Apsolon looking for the missing Tahl. Because Alani wasn't as clever as Eritha, she had bragged to Obi-Wan that Qui-Gon would die in a trap elaborated by her sister, leading Obi-Wan to rescue Qui-Gon. After the failed plan, both Alani and Eritha, along with their associate [[Balog (Human)|Balog]] were arrested.

name: Allya/Legends
description: {{Quote|Allya held the favor of the spirits, and her daughters became the first crafters of spirit-willed magicks.|[[Mother (title)/Legends|Clan Mother]] [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]]|Book of Sith: Secrets from the Dark Side}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Allya was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] in the early [[Standard century/Legends|centuries]]<ref name="COPL" /> of an era known to later [[Historian/Legends|historians]] as the [[Great Peace of the Republic]].<ref name="CSWEgpr">{{CSWECite|I|363|Great Peace of the Republic}}</ref> She was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|keenly attuned]] to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]],<ref name="COPL" /> a natural yet mystical energy field that bound [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] together.<ref name="AGTSWU2">''[[A Guide to the Star Wars Universe, Second Edition, Revised and Expanded]]''</ref> She attracted the attention of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]],<ref name="COPL" /> the members of which [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the use of the Force and acted as the guardians of justice and peace in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="AGTSWU2" /> Allya eventually attained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. However, around [[600 BBY/Legends|600 BBY]], she was seduced by the "[[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]]" of the Force,<ref name="COPL" /> which granted quicker access to power and strength but was filled with aggression, fear, and anger.<ref name="AGTSWU2" /> By turning away from the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side]], Allya had become a [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]], and her fate fell into the hands of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], the primary organizational body of the Order.<ref name="NEC" /> Because the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] prescribed to respect all life,<ref>''[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace Scrapbook]]''</ref> the Council members were reluctant to execute offenders. Therefore, they decided to [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]] the rogue Allya, hoping that primitive isolation would force her to reflect on her [[Jedi Master/Legends|Masters']] teachings and return to the light.<ref name="NEC" /> Since the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], with its savage and rugged forests, had long served as a [[Prison/Legends|penal colony]] for some of the Galactic Republic's worst criminals, the Council chose to banish her there.<ref name="EPM" /><ref name="EC" /><ref name="NEC" /><ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref>Upon her arrival at Dathomir, Allya discovered the planet's inhabitants who were the descendants of [[Human/Legends|Human]] warriors and [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[Engineer/Legends|engineers]] incarcerated by the extinct [[Paecian Empire]].<ref name="TEA" /><ref name="COPL" /> Allya used the Force to tame feral [[Rancor/Legends|rancors]] and subjugate the [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]], as well as any other desperate life forms.<ref name="NEC" /><ref name="JVS">[[Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force (real-life book)|''Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force'']]</ref> Once in command, she established a matriarchal society with a genetic Force component and where men had little to no power.<ref name="TEA" /><ref name="JVS" /> In time, Allya had many daughters and taught each one, along with other women, the ways of the Force.This new society filled with clans of female rancor tamers who used totems and incantations to generate their "[[Allyan Magic|magic]]" became known as the Witches of Dathomir.<ref name="TEA" /> It was not until the birth of her granddaughters that Allya saw the error of her ways: she had turned her own sons into slaves and taught her daughters how to use the Force to achieve power. Using her strong influence over her offsprings, she spent the rest of her days instructing her daughters in the ways of the light side.<ref name="CTD">''[[Cracken's Threat Dossier]]''</ref> Before her [[Death/Legends|death]], to ensure her daughters practiced their magic in a safe and sane manner, Allya wrote [[Book of Law|''The Book of Law'']], which she based off of the Jedi Code.<ref name="JVS" /> The Witches of Dathomir never learned that the magic they used was actually the Force.

name: Alurali
description: Born in the late [[Republic Classic era]], Alurali was discovered by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and entered into their experimental [[Jedi academy|academy]] on the planet [[Almas]] as opposed to the main [[Jedi Temple|Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Passing through her early education, Alurali was selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] to become a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. Serving and learning from her master, Alurali became good friends with fellow Padawan [[Lora Nadad]]. Together, they set a philanthropic group of Jedi who worked to bring to light the harsh reality that plagued the [[Cularin system]]: some two thousand homeless orphans roamed the streets on several worlds. This group of children, collectively known as "[[The Lost (children)|the Lost]]," had been overlooked for many years but was given more attention through the Jedi's work. Alurali's master suggested that she take the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], which she passed; the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] acknowledged her success and allowed the [[Almas Council]] to [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|knight]] her.<ref name="TL" />

name: Amee/Legends
description: [[File:Amee and Anakin.png|thumb|left|220px|Amee and Anakin Skywalker]]Amee was born into a slave family owned by [[Yor Millto]], though her mother [[Hala]] was lost to the slaver pirate [[Krayn]] when Amee was four. Amee continued to live on Tatooine with her father. She worked as a house slave for a rich [[Toong/Legends|Toong]] couple in [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] from a very young age. Her employers gave her one afternoon off each month. On the eve of the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]] [[Podracing/Legends|Podrace]], Amee visited Anakin and his friends in his backyard, where [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|young Skywalker]] was testing his [[Podracer/Legends|Podracer]] ahead of the contest. Amee mocked Anakin's efforts, and left to play ball with [[Seek/Legends|Seek]] and [[Melee/Legends|Melee]].Amee was surprised to learn that Anakin went on not only to win the Boonta race, but also to leave Tatooine shortly afterward. After Anakin's departure, Amee remained friends with Anakin's mother [[Shmi Skywalker Lars/Legends|Shmi]]. She told the older woman that she planned to marry Anakin and leave Tatooine with him. Shmi noted that as she grew older, Amee would swoon at the sight of every handsome young man she met. She later attended the wedding of Shmi and Cliegg Lars.<ref name="DB" />

name: Anda
description: In [[3951 BBY]], she offered [[Meetra Surik]] twenty-five hundred [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for each of three [[Onderon Royalist|Royalist]] [[Captain/Legends|captains]] that could be convinced to leave their stations, allowing Vaklu's forces to attack the [[Iziz Royal Palace]] with less resistance when fighting broke out. The three captains were [[Gelesi]], [[Riiken]], and [[Bostuco]].

name: Andra (Telos IV)
description: She was the founder and sole member of the [[Preserve Our Wild Endangered Resources Party]], and with the aide of the criminal [[Denetrus]], she helped [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] foil [[Xanatos]]' plot to bring [[Offworld Mining Corporation]] onto Telos. She later married Denetrus and, with the [[Chun family]], helped develop the ''[[BioCruiser]]''.{{Char-stub}}

name: Aryzah
description: Aryzah was caught in the [[Gravity/Legends|gravity]] [[Gravity well/Legends|well]] of the [[Tyus Cluster]] [[Black hole/Legends|black holes]]. Although she was killed, her [[Force ghost|spirit]] remained distinct, and later rescued the [[Gambling/Legends|gambler]] [[Kinnin Vo-Shay]] from the Cluster. Vo-Shay had no interest in becoming a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], but Aryzah continued counseling him. Eventually, the two traveled to [[Morado]], where Vo-Shay met [[Nyo]], a young man who wanted to buy a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] despite the fact that they were illegal under [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] law. After a series of events, Vo-Shay was able to help Nyo acquire the lightsaber. He then introduced Nyo to Aryzah, who agreed to [[Jedi training/Legends|train]] him as a Jedi.{{Char-stub}}

name: Asha
description: {{Quote|Ewoks. We are Ewoks, remember?''"<br />"''I...remember.|[[Kneesaa a Jari Kintaka|Princess Kneesaa]] and Asha|Asha (Ewoks episode)}}When Asha was still a child, a [[hanadak]] attacked the [[Kintaka family|Chirpa family]]. Asha's mother, [[Ra-Lee/Legends|Ra-Lee]], died while trying to save her daughter. Asha disappeared during the confrontation, leaving behind only traces of fur and clothing. After an unsuccessful extended search of the area, her family gave her up for dead. Asha was named after a spirit or character in the Ewoks' mythology.<ref name="GCG">''[[Galactic Campaign Guide]]''</ref>Asha was found by a clan of [[korrina]]s, who accepted her and raised her as one of their own. Asha spent her early adulthood tracking down [[Dulok/Legends|Dulok]] fur traders under the name the '''Red Ghost'''. Many years later, [[Wicket Wystri Warrick|Wicket]] and his friends saw her and told [[Kneesaa a Jari Kintaka|Kneesaa]], who began to cry. Wicket went to see Kneesaa, who was holding Asha's ripped hood. Wicket and Kneesaa went looking for Asha. They eventually found her, and together they stopped the [[Dulok/Legends|dulok]] fur traders. Then Kneesaa took Asha back to Bright Tree Village.{{Char-stub}}

name: Ashana
description: In [[3956 BBY]], Ashana's sister Elinda was a rising star as the singer of the Twisted Rancor Trio band founded by [[Gilthos Uksaris]]. Elinda's fans admired her voice, and the band at last attracted the attention of the local, powerful businessman [[Davik Kang]], who invited them to play at his [[Davik Kang's estate|estate]]. Kang, however, was actually the head of the criminal organization the [[Exchange]], and Elinda feared the consequences should Kang somehow be malcontent with her performance or should she even have dealings with him at all. Such was her apprehension that in spite of Uksaris's conviction that Kang's sponsorship was too grand of an opportunity to reject, Elinda abandoned the band altogether.Without a singer, the Twisted Rancor Trio seemed to be at its end, but on the eve of the scheduled performance, Uksaris recruited Ashana as a replacement for her sister. By Uksaris's own admission, the plan was risky given Ashana's untested singing and the last minute recruitment without prior rehearsals, and should Ashana fail to live up to Elinda's reputation, the band could incur the notorious wrath of Kang, putting their lives in jeopardy. Uksaris, however, believed that the scheme was still worth the risks, hoping that should they succeed, Kang would sign them up on a great touring contract.<ref name="KOTOR" />

name: Atril Tabanne
description: In [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], Tabanne held the rank of [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]], and was assigned as [[Executive officer/Legends|executive officer]] of the captured [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] [[Ession Strike|''Night Caller'']]. As [[Wraith Squadron]] had a limited number of pilots qualified in TIE fighters, Atril's experience in that regard meant that she was used as a pilot as well as a bridge officer. When [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Choday Hrakness]] was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the [[Battle of Talasea]], Tabanne took command of the ''Night Caller'' and was promoted to Captain. She temporarily relinquished command to [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] during the [[Battle of Ession]], in which she led Wraith Squadron's TIE fighter contingent in his place, but resumed command afterward.

name: Aubrie Wyn
description: {{Quote|Since I was a baby, someone else has made all of my choices for me. Today, I get to make my first real decision, on my own. And I'm not going to make the wrong one.|Aubrie Wyn|Star Wars: Republic: The Battle of Jabiim}}Aubrie was one of the best [[Jedi healer|healers]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] and had been marked for advanced training with [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]]. Some said she was destined for service on the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi Council]]. However, before this could come to pass, she and her Master were sent to fight on [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]]. Sirrus was killed shortly after they were deployed, and she became one of the orphaned Jedi Commanders who comprised the [[Padawan Pack]].[[File:Alto and Aubrie death.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Aubrie dies just after she kills [[Alto Stratus]].]]On the forty-third day of the [[Battle of Jabiim|battle]], the battle had finally reached [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Commander/Legends|commander]] [[Alto Stratus]]'s stronghold. As the battle raged, the Padawans fell one by one, sometimes together. Aubrie was the last Jedi to stay alive. Taking up the [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] of her fallen comrade [[Vaabesh]], she confronted Alto Stratus face-to-face. Wounded from an earlier hit, Stratus had to defend himself from a grounded position. As Aubrie moved in for the kill, Stratus hit her square in the chest with a blaster at point-blank range. As she fell forward, her lightsabers plunged into Stratus' chest, killing him as well. In the end, however, her sacrifice proved to be in vain: the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] was forced to retreat, leaving the [[Loyalist/Legends|Loyalists]] on the planet behind cursing at the retreating forces.

name: Aunuanna
description: A poor, if not senile, old woman, she was reduced to selling her home-brewed [[Gizer ale]] on the street. After selling her wares on [[Kyood Vurd]]'s turf one too many times, he decided to have the old woman killed. Luckily for her, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and [[Depa Billaba/Legends|Depa Billaba]] arrived in time to save her. She had seen the Jedi Master [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]] before they had arrived claiming, "So many Jedi! Three in one day!" Grateful, she gave the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] her most prized possession, her child's [[Aurra Sing's father|father's]] [[Swoop/Legends|swoop bike]].Aunuanna was extremely grateful to the Jedi for saving her life and because the Jedi had taken her baby away from her, and in turn, away from the slums of Nar Shaddaa. She referred to her child only as "My Angel," but it was later revealed that her child was none other than the infamous Jedi hunter [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]].

name: Axkva Min
description: {{Quote|So, you have come here to free me?|Axkva Min|Champions of the Force (SWGTCG)}}She was imprisoned in the [[Chamber of Banishment]] near the Stronghold because of her practice of draining the life from her pupils in order to increase her own power. She possessed a fragment of the [[Codex of Tython]], an ancient [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Holocron/Legends|Holocron]]. An [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] agent seeking to reassemble the holocron came looking for Min, using the [[Key of Exile]] provided by [[Sarguillo]], to access the Chamber. There, he found several [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]] guarding a large crystal which contained the essence of Axkva Min trapped within. The Codex, possessed by the Rebel, then launched a bolt of energy to the crystal, destroying it and freeing Axkva Min. She attacked the intruder, but was defeated and offered him to take her life, seeing it as a preferable fate to eternal imprisonment. The Rebel, however, was only looking for a crystal on a chain around the witch's neck. When this fragment installed back into the Code, another arc of energy jumped from the Codex to the banishment crystal. The figure of Axkva Min was transported inside again, and the scattered pieces of the crystal reformed themselves with her essence inside. Once again, the Queen of the Nightsisters was trapped within.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=Champions of the Force (SWGTCG)|text=Champions of the Force|scenario=Light Side scenario campaign}}</ref>Later she was killed by a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] as she attempted to escape.A [[Portrait of Axkva Min|portrait]] of the former Nightsister Queen managed to survive her death.

name: Azoora
description: {{Quote|Why don't we take a walk and swap life-stories, star-hopper? You tell me yours... and I'll tell you mine.|Azoora, to Han Solo|Star Wars 7: New Planets, New Perils!}}A [[Wroonian]], Azoora was a native of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Aduba-3/Legends|Aduba-3]]. Well known among the local [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]], Azoora earned a reputation as "trouble"&mdash;and also earned the attention of [[Warto]], a hulking [[Boltrunian]] who styled himself as Azoora's boyfriend.<ref name="starhoppers" /> Warto was known to threaten any other men whom he saw talking to Azoora.<ref name="marvel7" />Azoora frequented [[Locru's Central Saloon]] in the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] of [[Tun Aduban]], where in [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]] she encountered notorious [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] and [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] hero [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]. Solo approached Azoora at the bar, and after a short flirtation, Solo accepted Azoora's offer to leave with her and take a walk. However, Solo was quickly interrupted by [[Ramiz|a stranger]] and Azoora slipped away in the crowd.<ref name="marvel7" />Solo soon found himself accosted by Warto, who attacked him for flirting with his "girlfriend," although Warto was sent packing in a barroom brawl by Solo's [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] friend [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]].<ref name="marvel8">''[[Star Wars 8: Eight for Aduba-3]]''</ref> Two years later, Azoora met with Rebel historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]], who was trying to piece together the story of Solo's travels after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. Azoora gave Na'al information about the local [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]] [[Swoop gang/Legends|gangs]] before threats from her current boyfriend forced Na'al to cut the interview short.<ref name="starhoppers" />

name: Baritha
description: Baritha was exiled from Dathomir's Singing Mountain Clan along with Gethzerion after the pair attempted to assassinate the Clan mother, [[Augwynne Djo|Augwynne]]. While traveling Dathomir, the outcasts met a small group of former clan sisters who tried to kill them. The exiles defeated them, but spared one's life in return for a pledge of servitude. This was the beginning of the Nightsisters.<ref name="Cracken's Threat Dossier">''[[Cracken's Threat Dossier]]''</ref>[[File:Nightsister SWGTCG-AoD.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Nightsister Baritha.]]Baritha was in the [[Nightsister Stronghold]] on Dathomir during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], during which she recruited an explorer to help deliver two Imperial officers to her for her own amusement, and then capture a reformed Nightsister.<ref name="Star Wars Galaxies">''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]''</ref>Four years after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] arrived on Dathomir. Baritha used a mind trick on Solo, attempting to have him divulge the location of the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']].<ref name="Cracken's Threat Dossier" /> She said that he looked "tasty" from behind, and even tried to claim him as her slave.<ref name="CSWE" /> Soon after, Baritha was presumed killed during the Battle of Dathomir, though some members of [[New Republic Intelligence Service|New Republic Intelligence]] believe otherwise, since her body was never found.<ref name="Cracken's Threat Dossier" />Baritha was also [[Damaya]]'s aunt.

name: Bene/Legends
description: [[File:CinDrallig.png|thumb|left|250px|Bene is strangled by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]].]]A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Bene was discovered by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and inducted into their ranks, [[Jedi training/Legends|learning]] the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. Selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] at the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Bene constructed a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="ROTS" />In the final days of the war, Padawan Bene was stationed at the Temple when [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] betrayed the Jedi Order and issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the Grand Army which, in essence, made it illegal to be a Jedi. As the [[501st Legion/Legends|501st Legion]] marched into the Temple and opened fire indiscriminately on the Order's members, Bene joined fellow Padawans in protecting the [[Jedi Initiate|youngest Initiates]]. Backed into the [[Room of a Thousand Fountains/Legends|Room of a Thousand Fountains]], Padawans Bene and [[Whie Malreaux/Legends|Whie Malreaux]] stood with [[Jedi Battlemaster|Temple battlemaster]] [[Cin Drallig/Legends|Cin Drallig]] as [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] descended on the group. As Vader slew young Malreaux, the former Jedi reached out with the Force and [[Telekinesis/Legends|strangled]] Bene while cleaving through Master Drallig's shoulder with his lightsaber. Her death, as well as the deaths of the younglings she had died protecting, was recorded on [[TR4-121|a security camera]], and was viewed by Masters [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] when they searched the ruins of the Temple.<ref name="ROTS" />Decades later, after the fall of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] and the resurrection of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]], Master [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] viewed the same [[Holorecorder/Legends|holorecord]] as it was preserved in the memory banks of [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]] [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]].<ref>''[[Dark Nest II: The Unseen Queen]]''</ref>

name: Berri (Twi'lek)
description: She and her mother [[Mazie]] were [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] in the [[Spice/Legends|spice]]-processing facilities on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]]. They helped [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] to provoke Krayn's slaves into revolting, resulting in their freedom.Berri herself, in her kitchen role, was able to retrieve [[Siri Tachi]] and Anakin Skywalker's [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] from Tachi's quarters (where the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] had hidden them beneath her [[Sleeper (furniture)|sleep-couch]]), slipping the weapons through a food-delivery panel in the door of the high-security cell in which Berri's master had incarcerated the Jedi. Her courageous action allowed Tachi and Skywalker to escape their imprisonment by Krayn, but also to then initiate the slave revolt, which ultimately secured freedom for the slaves of Nar Shaddaa and ended with Skywalker's killing of the infamous [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] and crime-lord.{{Char-stub}}

name: Bol Chatak
description: Born on [[Iridonia/Legends|Iridonia]], Bol Chatak was discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and was turned over to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|education]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Constructing a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and completing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Bol Chatak was elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Developing her skills with a lightsaber and enhancing her knowledge of the Force, after many years of study, Jedi Chatak achieved the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]].<ref name="DL" />On a mission for the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], Master Chatak found herself introduced to [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Olee Starstone]], the aspiring young apprentice of [[Chief Librarian/Legends|Chief Librarian]] of the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Temple Archives]], [[Jocasta Nu/Legends|Jocasta Nu]]. While the two parted, their first meeting left a lasting impression. When the crisis between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] escalated into the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Master Chatak took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and began leading [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] on fronts across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. As the war machine drummed on, the High Council wished to step up the training of several senior Padawans stationed at the Temple. Because of Chatak and Starstone's good relations, the [[Council of Reassignment/Legends|Council of Reassignment]] tasked Chatak with the training of Starstone, pulling the girl from her studies in the Archives and forcing her into the role of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the Grand Army.<ref name="DL" />In the [[19 BBY/Legends|third year]] of war, Chatak was dispatched to the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] world of [[Murkhana/Legends|Murkhana]] and was tasked with leading the defense of the planet from the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]]. Aided by Master [[Roan Shryne]] and [[32nd Air Combat Wing]], she led the [[Battle of Murkhana (Clone Wars)|campaign]] valiantly, eventually calling in reinforcements. Led by Master [[Saras Loorne]], the additional troops saw the arrival of two Knights and Padawan Starstone. Serving alongside the [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commando]] unit of [[Ion Team]], Chatak, Shryne and Starstone fought live soldiers of the [[Vibroblade Brigade/Legends|Vibroblade Brigade]] as well as droids. As the Jedi reconnoitered a [[Medcenter/Legends|medcenter]], the clones received a message from the [[Office of the Supreme Chancellor]]. All Jedi were to be killed in compliance with [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]]. While [[Clone trooper commander|Commander]] [[Salvo]] prepared to ambush the Jedi, the commandos of Ion Team distracted their clone brothers enough to allow the Jedi to flee, unwilling to kill the Force-wielders without confirmation of the order.<ref name="DL" />Going to ground, Chatak and her two companions felt Master Loorne and the other Knights die as the clones turned their weapons on their former generals. Hiding out in the hilly areas surrounding the [[Murkhana City/Legends|Murkhana City]], the trio disguised themselves as [[Koorivar/Legends|Koorivar]] and camped out in an abandoned warehouse near [[Argente Tower/Legends|Argente Tower]]. Regarding their [[Jedi beacon transceiver|beacon transceivers]], the Jedi were bewildered when they discovered the High Council was requesting that all Jedi return to Coruscant. Attempting to get off planet to comply with the High Council's order, the Jedi observed the battle was over and the Republic was victorious. When the droids around them were suddenly powered down, the group was arrested by several clone troopers who believed them to be mercenaries.<ref name="DL" />Spending four weeks in a crowded holding facility, the Jedi were eventually marched out, along with the other prisoners, onto a red-clay landing field that had been notched into one of the hillsides surrounding the city to see the arrival of [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. Conversing with Commander Salvo, Vader was in the middle of admonishing Ion squad for disobeying a direct order when Master Chatak removed her disguise and leapt up to confront the Sith. Racing at the black armored figure with her blue-bladed lightsaber ablaze, Chatak met Vader's red blade in an intense battle. Landing a blow on his forearm, Chatak fought valiantly until the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] [[Cho sun|removed her weapon arm]] with his blade. Dropping to her knees and letting out a scream, Chatak looked up at the Sith as he raised his lightsaber and [[Sai cha|decapitated]] her in a sweeping arc.<ref name="DL" />

name: Caryn (Jedi)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Caryn had received a good deal of formal [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and implied to her future apprentice that she was a follower of "the old ways".<ref name="TRG" />During the reign of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Caryn had found her way to a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] where she became known as a local storyteller. Popular amongst the village's children, she would regale them with tales of brave heroes and epic adventures underneath the [[takka]] trees. One day, she approached a local girl of sixteen or seventeen [[Galactic Standard Calendar|years]], named [[Ana Tathis]]. Caryn had sensed that Tathis was strong in the Force, and wished for Tathis to become her [[Padawan/Legends|apprentice]]. Tathis eagerly took to Caryn's training, and labored in her master's tropical gardens, making them lush with beauty. Through her physical labors, Tathis learned focus and concentration. Over the course of three years, Caryn taught her the skills of [[Force power/Legends|controlling her body]], [[Force healing/Legends|Force healing]], [[Force sense|seeking out knowledge]] and [[Farsight/Legends|Farsight]]. Though Tathis became quite skilled, she was never able to read Caryn's mind. After a time, Caryn felt that she had taught Tathis all she was able, and bid her farewell.<ref name="TRG" />

name: Cat Miin/Legends
description: [[File:CatMiin AotC Res.png|thumb|left|150px|Cat Miin while on Geonosis]]A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Gossam/Legends|Gossam]], Cat Miin hailed from a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] also named [[Castell/Legends|Castell]],<ref name="DB" /> although it was not the [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of the [[Species/Legends|species]].<ref name="DB2">{{DB|character|shumai|Mai, Shu|archivedate=20100328104608}} states that [[Castell/Legends|Castell]] is the [[Gossam/Legends|Gossam]] [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]]</ref> Miin began working for the [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild]], where she worked her way up the company ladder until she became the administratress of the guild [[President]]e, [[Shu Mai/Legends|Shu Mai]],<ref name="DB" /> another female Gossam.<ref name="DB3">{{DB|character|shumai|Mai, Shu|archivedate=20100328104608}}</ref> As chief [[Aide/Legends|aide]], Miin worked closely with Mai.<ref name="DB" /> During the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Mai was invited to the planet of [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], located in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. Miin traveled with the Commerce Guild leader, where they secretly conversed with the recently formed [[Separatist Council/Legends|Separatist Council]], led by the fallen [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], which was made up of several conglomerate leaders professing their dissatisfaction with the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], which dominated [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. Although Mai knew that siding with the Separatists would be an act of [[Treason/Legends|treason]] against the Republic, she ultimately pledged the support of the Commerce Guild. Ultimately, the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] was formed, and an event known as the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted only a little while later when an [[Geonosis strike team|army]] of Jedi arrived at a [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Geonosis arena]] and [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|engaged]] [[Droid/Legends|droid]] forces. Both Miin and Mai were able to escape from Geonosis.<ref name="AotC">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>Miin was eventually assigned to overlook the handling of raw materials that were being used to sustain the droid armies of the Separatists, and continued to travel with Mai to many secret meetings and confederate gatherings.<ref name="DB" /> By [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Mai was involved in a propaganda project known as the [[CIS Shadowfeed]], which spread news and information to worlds controlled by the Separatists. Miin was at Mai's side when the Gossam Presidente made an official statement about a [[Battle of Bassadro|battle]] that occured on the planet of [[Bassadro]], stating that the confederate [[Major/Legends|major]] in charge, [[Domb Treetor]], only surrendered to Republic [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|forces]] in order to preserve the lives of civilians. In reality, Treetor had killed numerous civilians in an attempt to wipe out the Republic troops.During the final year of the war, [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], the Separatist Council was eventually ordered to hide on the planet of [[Utapau/Legends|Utapau]], where they were to await further instruction from the mysterious confederate leader, [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]]. Eventually, the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]], who had been leading the droid armies throughout the war, arrived on Utapau after the unsuccessful kidnapping of the Republic [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]]. Grievous was immediately contacted by Sidious upon arrival, and ordered that the Separatist leaders move to the [[Fire/Legends|fiery]] world of [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]], which would be safer for them. Grievous relayed the information, much to the frustration of certain council [[Nute Gunray/Legends|members]].<ref name="RotS" />Miin and Mai, along with the rest of the leaders, obeyed. The [[Battle of Utapau/Legends|Battle of Utapau]] occurred shortly after, in which Grievous was [[Death/Legends|killed]]. Sidious, who was actually the Republic chancellor, Palpatine, then issued [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], a directive that ordered all Republic [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] to execute their Jedi generals. Sidious then ordered his new pupil, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], to attend to Mustafar. Sidious explained that with the onset of confederate victory, Vader would protect them as the war finally ended. However, when Vader [[Mission to Mustafar/Legends|arrived]], he began to execute the council members, under Sidious' orders.<ref name="RotS" /> Miin was killed by Vader,<ref name="DB" /> while Mai was [[Sai cha|decapitated]].

name: Cerasi
description: During the civil war, Cerasi met a Daan youth, [[Nield]], and together, the two decided to unite the Daan and the Melida orphans. They created an organization which would fight for peace, and were known as the Young. During the war, the group helped the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], to rescue their fellow Jedi, [[Tahl]]. Later, Kenobi chose to stay and fight with the Young. Cerasi became very close friends with Kenobi during his stay on Melida/Daan; Kenobi would later say to [[Bant Eerin/Legends|Bant Eerin]] that he had loved her.Under Nield and Cerasi's leadership, the group won the war and formed a government. Nield was elected as Melida/Daan's Governor, and established a new history squad that began to tear-down the [[Hall of Evidence|Halls of Evidence]]. Cerasi and Kenobi began to doubt the wisdom of destroying Melida/Daan's history, and moved to stop the destruction. Nield felt they had turned against him. The tension came to a peak when the elders and Nield's followers, both armed, converged on the halls of evidence. Kenobi and Cerasi arrived to try and stop the violence, but Cerasi, who was unarmed, was shot and killed by one of [[Mawat]]'s sharpshooters positioned on a nearby roof.

name: Christya
description: {{Quote|You know, you're my kind of guy; rich and handsome&mdash;just the way I like them. Why don't we slip away to the tap room together? If you play your cards right Pazaak might not be the only game you get lucky at tonight.|Christya|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}Christya was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Jedi Civil War]]. She was present on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Taris/Legends|Taris]]<ref name="KotOR" /> when the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Destruction of Taris|invaded]] the planet in [[3956 BBY]].<ref name="CG">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref>{{Gamemechanics|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}During her time on Taris, Christya conversed with the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Republic soldier|soldiers]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] and [[Carth Onasi]] in the [[Upper City Cantina]], telling them about her interest in [[Pazaak/Legends|pazaak]]. Christya was impressed when Revan defeated [[Niklos]], a local pazaak champion, in a match, praising Revan's wealth and good looks. She suggested that they go to the bar and buy some drinks for twenty [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. Revan handed her the money eagerly, and Christya began to move to the bar, telling him not to take too long. However, on her way through the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], Christya met a [[Unidentified Tarisian noble|Tarisian noble]], and ignoring her deal with Revan, she began flirting with him. Although Revan attempted to interrupt, she eventually left the cantina with the noble to go to his mansion, leaving Revan twenty credits short.<ref name="KotOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Civé Rashon
description: The [[Human/Legends|Human]]<ref name="SWG" /> [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Civé Rashon served as a [[TIE pilot]] in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]], and was designated as '''OS-72-1'''.<ref name="CCG1" />{{Gamemechanics}}Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Civé Rashon partook in a skirmish against at least one [[Rebel pilot/Legends|Rebel pilot]]. Civé was defeated in the fight, but managed to escape alive in her crippled TIE/LN starfighter. Civé also participated in battles between Rebel and Imperial forces in the [[Naboo system/Legends|Naboo]], [[Tatoo system/Legends|Tatoo]], [[Corellian system|Corellian]], [[Dantooine system/Legends|Dantooine]], and [[Karthakk system]]s during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. These battles involved an Imperial [[Lancer-class frigate/Legends|Lancer-class frigate]] being pitted against a Rebel [[EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate/Legends|EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate]], with numerous starfighters aiding in the defense or offense of the system.<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}[[File:Howlrunner-XWMG.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Civé Rashon's ''Obsidian 1'']]By the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]],<ref name="CSWE2">{{CSWECite|II|402|Obsidian Squadron}}</ref> Rashon flew the TIE fighter ''[[Obsidian 1]]'', the lead [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Obsidian Squadron]], an elite TIE [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]] that served aboard the [[Imperial II-class Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Avenger/Legends|''Avenger'']]. During her service, Rashon attained the [[call sign]] "Howlrunner."<ref name="CCG1" /> Rashon's [[Wingmate/Legends|wingman]] was [[Dodson Makraven]], who flew [[Obsidian 2]].<ref name="CCG2">{{CCG|set=Special Edition Limited|link=http://starwarsccg.org/cards/SE/ds/os722inobsidian2.gif|cardname=OS-72-2 In Obsidian 2}}</ref>In 3 ABY, Civé Rashon and her squadron participated in the Imperial [[Occupation of Bespin|occupation]] of [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]] on the [[Gas giant/Legends|gas giant]] [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]]<ref name="CCG1" /> and the pursuit of a [[Starship/Legends|starship]], the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']],<ref name="CSWE2" /> containing the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] fugitives [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]].<ref name="ESB">[[Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back|''Star Wars'': Episode V ''The Empire Strikes Back'']]</ref> When the ''Falcon'' escaped the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] to avoid capture by the Empire, Rashon and her squadron chased the ship through space,<ref name="CSWE2" /> accompanied by [[Supreme Commander (Empire)/Legends|Supreme Commander]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader's]] [[Command ship/Legends|command ship]], the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|Super Star Destroyer]] [[Executor/Legends|''Executor'']]. The ''Executor'' attempted to capture the ''Falcon'' by absorbing the ship in its [[Tractor beam/Legends|tractor beam]], having previously deactivated the fugitive ship's [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] on Bespin. However, [[Standard second|seconds]] away from capture, the ''Falcon'' unexpectedly escaped into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]], and Obsidian Squadron and the ''Executor'' failed their mission.<ref name="ESB" /> [[4 ABY/Legends|One year later]], Rashon led Obsidian Squadron during the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]],<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|81|Rashon, Civé}}</ref> during which the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Alliance Fleet]] attacked the Imperial [[Death Star II/Legends|Death Star II]] [[battlestation]]. The battle ended with an Imperial defeat and the [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star's]] destruction.<ref name="RotJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref>

name: Clat'Ha
description: In [[44 BBY/Legends|44 BBY]], Clat'Ha and the corporation miners left [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to set out to [[Bandomeer/Legends|Bandomeer]] and oversee the extraction of minerals that were on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. While boarding the [[Monument (freighter)|''Monument'']], she saw a young boy who was severely beaten by [[Grelb]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. The boy was revealed to be [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Clat'Ha immediately saved his life and took the unconscious Initiate on board the ship. When Obi-Wan woke up, Clat'Ha was impressed by his courage and offered him a job in the corporation. She explained to him about the war between both corporations and added that one of the managers of [[Offworld Mining Corporation|Offworld Mining]], a Hutt named [[Jemba]], hindered this task to increase the price of his employees. Obi-Wan suggested that both companies should reach an agreement, but Clat'Ha firmly refused since she couldn't risk everything for her employees.When the ''Monument'' was under attack by pirates, Clat'Ha saved the life of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] when a [[Togorian/Legends|Togorian]] pirate attempted to kill him, and failed to notice the presence of the young woman who shot him in the head. Qui-Gon was wounded, and Clat'Ha refused to leave him while the pirates were overwhelmed by Jemba's employees. After the pirates fled, the ''Monument'' had to make an emergency landing on an island of an [[Unidentified blue marble planet|unknown planet]] with five moons. Before landing, Clat'Ha, accompanied by Kenobi and Jinn, went to meet Jemba, who was enticing a number of employees from Clat'Ha's corporation to join his. A number of miners began to move towards the Hutt, but Clat'Ha was able to prevent that from happening.Sometime later, when the ''Monument'' landed on an island, Clat'Ha and the rest of the crew prepared to evacuate when the transport began to flood. She was surprised to learn that Qui-Gon reported that he had discovered the location of the dactyl which Jemba and his thugs stole from the transport. Together with the crew, Clat'Ha and Qui-Gon moved to one of the caves that were on the island until they were attacked by the [[draigon]]s. She helped defend the caves and contacted [[Aggaba]]. She offered to let the Hutt join her corporation. Aggaba and his staff agreed, and the fight between the two companies came to an end. After the fight ended, the engineers were able to repair the ''Monument'', and the companies withdrew from the planet. Clat'Ha remained on site and directed her activities of both companies until her [[Death/Legends|death]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Curi
description: {{Quote|You brought me into this business ... I made weapons to destroy beings and planets. I found money to fund your research into the terrible, cunning ways beings can kill other beings ... I helped bring these things into the galaxy and I will never get the smell of death out of my nostrils. No matter what I do now, no matter where I go."<br />Galen turned furious eyes on the Jedi. "You see what you've done? You've poisoned her against me!"<br />Obi-Wan shook his head. "Your planet is in ruins. Your family is destroyed. Thousands are dead. And still you blame others. You have not learned anything.|Obi-Wan Kenobi and Curi, to Galen, her criminal brother in custody at Tacto.|Jedi Quest: The Way of the Apprentice}}Along with her brother [[Galen (Radnoran)|Galen]], Curi worked in a weapons factory, handling business deals, while Galen was developing deadly new weapons for [[Radnor/Legends|Radnor]]. After creating a particularly dangerous [[Poison/Legends|toxin]], [[Dol Heep]], an ambassador from the neighboring [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Avon]], demanded that his world have exclusive rights to it, offering large sums of money to have it.Galen seemed eager to sell it to the [[Avoni]] and collect payment, however due to the Radnoran's longstanding distrust for the Avoni, Curi convinced him to refuse the offer. All seemed well until somehow their toxin was released into the air and devastated Radnor. Millions of Radnorans were killed or near [[Death/Legends|death]]. Curi believing that it was her own fault, made it her duty to help get the sick medical attention and worked in the [[Isolation Sector]].When a team of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] was [[Mission to Radnor|sent]] by the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] to help evacuate survivors, Curi met with the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Masters]] and had them patrol the Isolation Sector. She also introduced them to Dol Heep, whom she believed was on ambassadorial duty for Avon and became stranded on Radnor. Heep offered a fleet of Avoni [[Starship/Legends|ships]] to help with the evacuation.After it was discovered that the toxin had a short half-life and was soon harmless, Curi began to wonder why Galen did not know this. Along with proof the Jedi uncovered, it was revealed that Galen was helping the Avoni evacuate Radnor for them to conquer it. He would then be rewarded with vast riches on another world.After Galen was brought into custody, Curi was infuriated with him. She held a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] to his head in rage for nearly two hours. Despite Galen's pleas for forgiveness she let her brother rot in [[Prison/Legends|prison]].

name: Dané
description: Dané, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], had once hoped to become a [[Music/Legends|musical]] performer, and she trained on several [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] instruments in her early teens. When she was 16, the untimely [[Death/Legends|death]] of her [[Parent/Legends|parents]] left her with a struggling [[Farm/Legends|farm]] and a great deal of debt. Out of options, she let her debtors take ownership of the property, and then journeyed to the nearest large [[City/Legends|city]], [[Keren/Legends|Keren]], bidding farewell to the home that had been in her family for generations. Using the last of her personal savings, she volunteered for the [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Forces]]. After training for a year with the [[Queen/Legends|Queen's]] [[handmaidens]] in [[Theed/Legends|Theed]], she impressed [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Quarsh Panaka/Legends|Quarsh Panaka]] with her keen mind, sharp wits, and natural mimicry skills. Dané did not take well to authority, however, and she requested a transfer from the program. Panaka recommended she look into the Customs Security division, where she soon found a new home on the undercover investigations unit, which allowed her to operate more or less on her own.In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], she became a member of the [[Naboo Underground]] and played a minor role in defending Naboo from [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] forces.Later, she found that her role in Customs Security was not big enough for her ambitions, and she left the division after less than three [[Standard year/Legends|years]]. Dané had learned much in that time, and developed into a sharp shot with a [[Blaster pistol/Legends|blaster]], as well as a persuasive negotiator. She had also developed a somewhat flexible morality that was out of place on pastoral Naboo, so she decided the time was ripe to go into business for herself.Loaning out her skills to those with the most [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], her reputation grew with each successful contract. She worked as personal [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] for a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Noble/Legends|noble]], as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] for a rival family in the household of a wealthy [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]], and several times was contracted to [[Assassin/Legends|assassinate]] unfortunate targets. Her initial reservations over becoming a contract killer soon fell by the wayside as the credits continued to roll in. Dané believed that as long as she dealt fairly with those who employed her, she had every right to a clear conscience.

name: Daraala
description: According to her, she had been on Dantooine the longest of all the remaining salvagers.At some point, when [[Suulru]]'s [[Moisture vaporator/Legends|moisture vaporator]] was abandoned, Daraala and [[Jorran]] then found it. According to Jorran, she got to it first but only took the modulator from it because she was loaded with other items. After Jorran sold the damaged vaporator to Suulru he won the modulator from Daraala in a game of stones.When [[Meetra Surik]] arrived at the salvager's camp, Daraala asked Surik to find the corpses of two salvagers, offering Surik 500 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for each of them, claiming she wished to give them a proper burial. In reality, however, Jorran knew that all she wanted from the salvager's corpses was to get an extremely good load of salvage that the two salvagers as well as two others had managed to acquire from the ruined [[Jedi Enclave]]. The reason for her plot was that the four salvagers had the biggest haul of salvage found inside the ruins of the Jedi Enclave. They then attempted another salvage run but only two of them came out alive and the third died from his wounds. The surviving person then picked a fight with [[Gerevick]] after losing against him in a [[Pazaak/Legends|pazaak]] game. With all four dead, their salvage was left inside the [[Khoonda]] [[Khoonda Militia|Militia's]] headquarters.Salvagers had been attempting to claim the salvage with false claims that they were owed by the salvagers, or were related, but [[Zherron]] wasn't fooled and the only thing he would believe is a will. One of the dead salvagers in the Enclave had a badly spelled will that stated that his possessions would be given to another salvager should the latter die, which meant that the will was useless since the other salvager was also dead. Daraala hoped to trick Zherron by using the bodies and a conveniently faked will so she would make a large profit out of this. Surik most likely gave the bodies to Zherron with the will as she found it. This meant that Zherron would still have to keep the salvage.

name: Darlen
description: Before its destruction, she had been a friend of the [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] [[Prince/Legends|Princess]], [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]]. She was later suspected by Leia to be an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] spy, but this later turned out to be false. Darlen married another Alderaanian survivor, [[Tolok]], and had a baby.

name: Deleta
description: As Telos fell to corruption the second time, Deleta was one of those that lost hope. When she heard about the ''[[BioCruiser]]'', Deleta decided to be one of the first to leave the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] and find a new settled home. Fifteen years later, she joined the ideology of [[Kad Chun]] and boarded the ''BioCruiser'', which would become her home.

name: Denira
description: Lorac's platform staunchly opposed the oppression of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and a mob of citizens loyal to the Empire raided the royal palace at [[Den Velmor]] and murdered the king and queen. The regent, [[Zelor]], took control of the throne. The older son, Prince Denid was later forced to flee from Velmor with his consort, Lady [[Loren (noble)|Loren]]. The younger son, Prince Anod, remained behind – a puppet of the Empire, patiently waiting for the day when he was old enough to be crowned rightful ruler of Velmor.{{Char-stub}}

name: Dia
description: {{Quote|That wench tried to cut me with her vibroblade!|Holdan|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}In [[3956 BBY]], Dia was working as a waitress at [[Javyar's Cantina]] in the [[Lower City]]. One day, she caught the attention of a man named [[Holdan]], a henchman for the local crime syndicate, the [[Exchange]]. When the drunk man attempted to force himself upon her, Dia defended herself with a [[Vibroblade/Legends|vibroblade]], scarring him. The incident infuriated Holdan as it humiliated him in front of his friends. His wrath materialized itself in a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on Dia's head worth 300 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], and the woman was reduced to hiding in an Upper City apartment amongst illegal aliens. Because of Holdan's connections to [[Davik Kang]], crime lord of the Exchange, the local authorities turned a blind eye to her plight. Too afraid for her life to leave the apartment, Dia soon lost touch with the political affairs of the outside world.<ref name="kotor" />{{GameLS|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}By chance, Dia met the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], who was hiding out in the apartment next-door. Meeting him turned out to be a twist of fate for her. The former [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] was able to convince Holdan to withdraw the bounty he had placed on Dia's head. When Revan returned to Dia to deliver the good news, the grateful waitress offered her family heirloom, an [[Energy cell (vibroblade)|energy projector]] for a vibroblade, as a reward but Revan refused, telling her that to help her was thanks enough. She was able to return to her normal life just before the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]] [[Destruction of Taris|bombarded the planet]].<ref name="kotor" /><ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref>{{Endgame}}

name: Dillan
description: [[File:DillanBattleDress.png|thumb|left|125px|Dillan, during the battle for Khoonda]]{{Quote|The only recent visitors we've had on Dantooine have been salvagers. And a slew of mercenaries. We get a lot of that here, too. Ever since the Enclave got slagged, seems half the people that visit are smugglers or worse.|Dillan|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Dillan lived on Dantooine her entire life. She received firsthand experience with the planet's rocky history since the start of the [[Mandalorian Wars]]. Dillan had little regard for the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] that had once maintained an [[Jedi Enclave|enclave]] not far from the [[Khoonda]] outpost, blaming them for the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire's]] [[Attack on Dantooine (Jedi Civil War)|invasion]] and occupation of her world as well as the problems with [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] raiders prior to that conflict. In [[3954 BBY]], she greeted a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|Exile]] named [[Meetra Surik]], who visited Dantooine with an entourage of companions. Curious at first as to who Surik and her companions were, Dillan eventually warned her that she would find little welcome within the Khoonda outpost that was the seat of government for the struggling colony, stating that many citizens also held the Jedi in a dim light. She went on to explain the general situation on Dantooine, informing Surik of the situation between the settlers of Khoonda, the [[Scavenger/Legends|salvagers]] who hoped to plunder the ruins of the [[Jedi Enclave]], and the problems that both groups had with the [[Sith trooper (Sith Empire)|Sith trooper]] [[Azkul]]'s [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]].{{Gamemechanics}}Sometime later, Dillan joined the [[Khoonda Militia]] at the behest of Surik, reasoning that she would have had a far worse job than the one she currently held if the mercenaries took over Dantooine. When Azkul and his men finally [[Battle of Khoonda|attacked]] the Khoonda outpost, she fought alongside Surik, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vrook Lamar]] and the rest of the militia.{{Endgame}}

name: Dree-Tekes
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Gran/Legends|Gran]], Dree-Tekes was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] where she received [[Jedi training/Legends|instruction]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], eventually being selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. During her apprenticeship, Dree-Tekes was dispatched to the Gran colony world, [[Stend IV]], in order to prevent the [[Army of Life]] from releasing [[clodhopper]]s on the planet.<ref name="OCH" />Upon her arrival on the planet, Dree-Tekes recruited four local Gran militiamen to help her in her attempt to board the terrorist group's delivery ship, the ''[[Majestic Gundark]]''. As the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] touched down on the planet to deliver its cargo of clodhoppers which were intended to be used in restoring the natural order of the planet, Padawan Dree-Tekes led her allies in a raid on the ship, hoping to destroy the cargo before it could be unloaded.<ref name="OCH" />

name: Dynba Tesc
description: When she began opposing the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], [[Corran Horn]] helped her escape offworld where she met a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] named [[Dromath]], an officer in the [[Combined Defense Forces of the New Republic|New Republic Defense Force]]. The pair eventually married and had a son, [[Rade Dromath]]. Her husband was killed in the [[Thrawn campaign]] and she later moved back to Garqi.Paranoid about an invasion from the [[Imperial Remnant]], she had escape plans and stockpiles stored up. However, it all came to nothing when she was killed in the [[Yuuzhan Vong]] invasion of Garqi in [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]]. However, the supplies were used to great effect by her young son Rade.

name: Ekria
description: [[File:ZonderOrder66.jpg|thumb|left|225px|Ekria witnessing the death of Aayla Secura.]]

name: Elinda
description: Elinda was originally hired as the lead singer of the new band The Twisted Rancor Trio as part of a ploy by the band's manager [[Gilthos Uksaris]] to convince her to date him. Aside from Elinda, the band consisted of the [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] [[Ujaa]] as musical director and his brother [[Ujii]]. Elinda, however, threatened to leave the band when she found Ujaa to be a terrible musician. In order not to lose her, Gilthos dismissed Ujaa immediately and hired [[Loopa]] as his replacement. As Ujaa's brother, Ujii was upset by this development and retired from the band, resulting in another Bith [[Fodo]] taking his place.The band became increasingly successful following this, and Elinda's voice was especially popular her homeworld. During the [[Jedi Civil War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]], the band gained enough renown to attract the attention of the local businessman named [[Davik Kang]], who invited them to perform at his [[Davik Kang's estate|estate]]. Thrilled at the prospect of performing for such a powerful man, Uksaris saw this as the band's big break. Elinda did not share in his excitement. Having heard valid rumors concerning Kang's connections to the crime syndicate the [[Exchange]], she feared for her life should she have any dealings with Davik Kang. Unable to persuade her to accept the invitation, Uksaris hired her sister [[Ashana]] on the eve of their scheduled performance, a plan that was risky given Ashana's untested singing.{{Gamemechanics}}While visiting the [[Lower City Apartments]] during the Sith quarantine of Taris, [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] discovered a security crate delivered to Gilthos Uksaris protected by a [[Holo-Sec Corp]] [[Holo-Sec Corp anti-theft explosive|anti-theft explosive]]. In unlocking the crate, he was required to activate the [[Holoprojector/Legends|holoprojectors]] of each member of The Twisted Rancor Trio in order of their recruitment to it. Through a [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]] nearby within which held the contents of [[Guts and Glory: A Chronicle of The Amazing Story of The Twisted Rancor Trio|brief history of the band]], Revan learned of the story of Elinda and the other members of the band and used this as a guide to safely unlock the footlocker.{{Endgame}}

name: Elora
description: When Elora discovered the affair that [[Sunry]] had been having with the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Elassa Huros]], she convinced him to abandon it, and the two attempted to work things out. When Sunry was accused of murdering Elassa, she tried to contact anyone who could help, including Sunry's old friend [[Jolee Bindo]], who was traveling with [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] at the time. When the party arrived in [[Ahto City]], she asked Revan, whom she recognized as being a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], to become Sunry's [[Arbiter/Legends|arbiter]] in the hopes of proving the man innocent.

name: Ensa
description: During one of her regular check-ups on their antiquated [[Moisture vaporator/Legends|moisture vaporators]] with her [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[L-23]], Ensa was attacked by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Lycan]]. Due to Lycan's state of health and mind at the time of his attack, Ensa was able to escape with no injuries. Fearful of another attack, Ensa's husband mined the majority of their fields.One day, her husband returned with a stranger after his regular patrol on their borders. Ensa and Byrom fed and sheltered the strange [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] named [[Darca Nyl]]. That night while conversing with Darca, Ensa recognized a familiar thread that ran through her husband and the Jedi. The next day, Ensa and Byrom's kindness was repaid when Darca assisted the moisture farmers in dealing with local gangsters threatening them with death.

name: Eritha
description: Eritha was born in [[57 BBY/Legends|57 BBY]] on [[New Apsolon/Legends|New Apsolon]]. At this time a totalitarian system of government ruled the planet. The [[Civilized]] received all the benefits, while the [[Workers]] lived in poverty. Alani's father, Ewane, was a leader of the resistance against this social system. Due to this activity he spent many years in the prison and saw his daughters rarely. Alani and Eritha were raised mostly by friends of their father, since their mother had died around the time they were born. One of those friends was [[Lenz]]With the first elections after the fall of the regime in the year [[47 BBY/Legends|47 BBY]] their father was selected to be [[Supreme Governor]] of New Apsolon. At that time the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] were sent to supervise the election, and they were represented by [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Tahl]], who developed a bond with Eritha and his sister Alani.Ewane held the office for five years, but was murdered shortly into his second term. [[Roan]], a close friend of their father and his successor, adopted them. At that time Alani and Eritha conceived a plan to gain the power on New Apsolon. That plan included killing Roan and kidnapping Tahl, who die as a result of the injuries suffered. However, the plan failed with no small part due to the actions of Qui-Gon Jinn and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] who came to New Apsolon looking for the missing Tahl. After the failed plan, both Alani and Eritha, along with their associate [[Balog (Human)|Balog]] were arrested.

name: Esala
description: She was the village healer. Lacking any serum, she was forced to keep the victims infected with the [[rakghoul]] disease in a pen until they had mutated and destroyed each other. She was very impressed when [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] managed to procure some serum from a dead [[Sith trooper (Sith Empire)|Sith trooper]] and cure two of the victims before their mutation, allowing them to return to society.She, like all the Outcasts, left the village for the [[Promised Land]].

name: Feleema
description: Erel broke the rules of [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] marrying an [[ekster]] (a non-Corellian person). Erel left his home planet for Feleema. Unfortunately, six [[Standard year/Legends|years]] later, Feleema died in a [[Hovertrain/Legends|Maglev train]] accident on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].

name: Femon
description: Femon's family was killed in the crossfire when the ''[[Eye of Palpatine]]'' came to [[Almania/Legends|Almania]] as they tried to save others being lured to the [[dreadnaught]].She had long black hair, an unnaturally pale complexion, dark blue eyes, and blood red lips. She withdrew her support from [[Kueller]] when she discovered that he had the same weakness as the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], in that he was unwilling to move to rule with an iron fist and crush his opponents when necessary. Kueller broke her neck with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].She was known to have a death mask collection. She was also known to have her face covered with makeup, designed to look like a less-permanent death mask. She scrubbed it off to show Kueller that she was taking control, and the Dark Jedi killed her by Force-choking her and snapping her neck.

name: Fenig Nabon
description: Born on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], Fen was adopted by the compassionate smuggler [[Jett Nabon]], who found her living in the streets of [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet]] making her living as a pickpocket. He took her under his wing and taught her the trade of smuggling. Before she was fifteen, she had been to [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] on several occasions.In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], Nabon and Dogder teamed up with the [[Mistryl Shadow Guard|Mistryls]] [[Shada D'ukal]] and [[Dunc T'racen]] to deliver a troupe of [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] female dancers from the [[Clan Shak]] on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] to [[Durga Besadii Tai|Durga]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] on [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]]. Along the way they ran into the [[Karazak Slavers Cooperative]] in the [[Naps Fral Cluster]]. During this time Ghitsa speculated that Fenig nursed a secret crush for fellow Corellian and former smuggler [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], even going so far as to suggest why the ''Star Lady'' had a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]]-sized bed on board.Fenig often regretted having taken on such a partner, but when Dogder was abducted sometime around [[12 ABY/Legends|12 ABY]] while the pair was on the planet [[Prishardia]] by [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] operatives seeking information she might have about a rival Hutt's operations, Nabon was able to rescue her with the aid of the self-exiled [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Kyp Durron]] who, in the aftermath of his destruction of the [[Carida/Legends|Carida]] system, was going by the alias of [[Zeth Fost]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Feylis Ardele
description: Hailing from [[Commenor/Legends|Commenor]], Ardele was recruited into [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] by [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Ackbar]] because of her expertise on the [[TIE Series]] fighters, following a recommendation from Ackbar's aide [[Rekush]]. Her [[Ardele family|family]] was executed by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] under suspect of being rebels. She soon fell in love with fellow Rogue [[Avan Beruss]], but they hid their relationship from public knowledge.{{Char-stub}}

name: Fy-Tor-Ana
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]],<ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref> Fy-Tor-Ana was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] after crafting a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and completing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]]. While a respected Jedi she was known as reclusive, rarely interacting with her fellow instructors and refusing to take a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] for herself. Renowned for her split-second reflexes, her grace, and her agility, Master Ana was appointed as an [[Jedi instructor|instructor]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Teaching the technique known as the [[Art of Movement]] to [[Jedi Initiate]]s at the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]], Master Ana's classes occupied the [[Jedi Temple Obstacle Course|obstacle course]]. During her time as an instructor, Master Ana instructed countless Initiates, including a young [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]].<ref>''[[Jedi Quest: The Dangerous Games]]''</ref>A survivor of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a bloody conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Master Ana was forced into hiding when [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], effectively disbanding the Jedi Order. Fleeing the slaughter of the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]], Master Ana took shelter on the Jedi-world [[Ilum/Legends|Ilum]] with fellow Master [[Garen Muln]]. Hiding amongst the frozen wastelands' [[Crystal Caves]], Ana was not able to remain ignorant of the state of the Republic for long and soon departed Ilum alone for Coruscant. When Ana did not return, Master Muln feared that she was dead. Muln relayed his information on Fy-Tor-Ana's plans to former Jedi [[Ferus Olin]] who had visited Ilum in search of survivors; Olin then left for Coruscant to find the missing Jedi.<ref name="LOTJU" />In fact, Master Ana had made it to Coruscant and, finding the Jedi Temple in ruins, was forced underground. Delving deep into the crust of the [[Ecumenopolis/Legends|ecumenopolis]], Master Ana assumed control of a settlement established above an expansive subterranean ocean. Taking the name of ''Solace'', Master Ana's existence became mythical, leaving the Jedi behind her and striving to assist those fleeing persecution by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. When Ferus Olin arrived on Coruscant, he heard rumors that Ana was held in the bowels of the Temple. Finding the Temple occupied by [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] but vacant of all Jedi, he followed rumors down to the crust and began seeking what he believed to be a settlement known as ''Solace''. A guide met him at the mouth of the subterranean passage and led Olin down to the hidden city, only then revealing her identity as the former Jedi Master.<ref name="LOTJU" />Rather derisive when Olin attempted to get her to return to the Temple, Ana was finally convinced when Olin explained that Imperial [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitor]] [[Malorum]] had planted a spy in her midst. Agreeing to help Olin and his associate [[Trever Flume]] infiltrate the Jedi Temple and eliminate Malorum's chances of locating them, she led them into the Temple's heart only to find themselves trapped by Imperials. When they were ambushed, Ana was forced to abandon Olin while escorting the young Flume back out of the Temple, returning to her settlement in the midst of an attack. With her new world burning, she was able to [[Erased|rally survivors]] and flee to the surface.<ref name="LOTJU" /> Master Ana and Flume, joined by the [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Oryon]] and former reporter [[Keets Freely]] journeyed to [[Dexter Jettster/Legends|Dexter Jettster's]] hideout and asked him for help finding Olin. They located him on a ship with his friend [[Clive Flax]], escaping the prison world of [[Dontamo]]. They followed Malorum to the planet of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] and were aided by [[Boss/Legends|Boss]] [[Rugor Nass/Legends|Rugor Nass]] and the [[Gungan/Legends|Gungans]] in their attempt to take back Naboo.<ref>''[[The Last of the Jedi: Death on Naboo]]''</ref>Later, when Olin had to help [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] Palpatine on the planet [[Samaria]], Master Ana went to [[Bellassa/Legends|Bellassa]] to rescue [[Roan Lands]] and [[Dona Telamark]], two of Olin's friends, from execution. She went with Oryon and Flume and got help from [[The Eleven]], and was able to succeed. They went to Samaria to help Olin save [[Astri Oddo Divinian|Astri Oddo]] and her son [[Lune Divinian|Lune]] from stormtroopers. They all escaped except Olin, who stayed on the planet, knowing that Palpatine would have more things for him to do. In their down time, the Jedi and their crew of misfits based themselves on a [[Jedi asteroid|hidden asteroid]] near to Bellassa, preparing it for Olin's dream to locate Jedi survivors there.<ref>''[[The Last of the Jedi: Return of the Dark Side]]''</ref>When the asteroid was finally discovered by the Empire, Masters Ana and Muln assured that the young Lune Divinian made it off before the Imperials unleashed the fury of their secret [[Superweapon/Legends|superweapon]], destroying the asteroid and the Jedi. Before her death, Master Ana was at peace with the Force and her allies, proud to die as a Jedi amongst friends.<ref name="LOTJR" />

name: Gemmy
description: She was the wife of a member of the militia of [[Pelek Baw]] and mother of two children. During the [[Summertime War]] she was pregnant.

name: Ghitsa Dogder
description: Ghitsa spent several years working as a [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Hutt counselor|counselor]] for the [[Besadii/Legends|Besadii]] [[Kajidic/Legends|kajidic]], negotiating multimillion [[Galactic Credit Standard|credit]] deals on behalf of the clan.Growing tired of service to the Hutts and wishing to avoid the lethal end that claimed most counselors, she devised an elaborate scheme in [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]] involving [[Mistryl Shadow Guard|Mistryls]] [[Shada D'ukal]] and [[Dunc T'racen]] by which she maneuvered [[Durga Besadii Tai|Durga the Hutt]] into dismissing her from his employ, while collecting a hefty payoff in the process. Although no longer officially connected to the [[Hutt Empire]], she still had an insider's knowledge of the organization.While posing as a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] (a recurring con in Ghitsa's repertoire) in [[12 ABY/Legends|12 ABY]] on the planet [[Prishardia]], she was kidnapped by [[Desilijic/Legends|Desilijic]] representatives seeking information about one of Durga's operations. She was beaten and questioned, but having been several years since her service to the Hutts, she had no knowledge of this recent venture.
