A timely rescue from the kidnappers' ship, the [[Rook (Class 720 freighter)|''Rook'']], by Fen and the young [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Kyp Durron]] (acting under the name [[Zeth Fost]]) prevented her demise.Ghits and Fen returned Kyp to the [[Jedi Praxeum]] on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]], where Kyp, who had earlier indicated that [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] had directed him to Prishardia, hinting that Ghitsa may have Force sensitivity. Ghitsa, acting uncharacteristically timid, declined to leave the ship, but later destroyed her Jedi disguise, possibly showing a newfound respect for the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After departing the planet, Ghitsa produced a datacard she acquired from the ''Rook'', which contained information on [[Orko SkyMine Asteroid Processing Corporation|Orko SkyMine]], Durga's mysterious operation. Suspecting the importance, and credit value, of the datacard, Ghitsa decided to sell it to [[Talon Karrde]], to which she had earned the distrust of, and his information network. It would later lead to the discovery of the [[Darksaber (superweapon)|Darksaber]] project.

name: Glynn-Beti
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]], Glynn-Beti was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Taking on the young [[Ulu Ulix]] as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], both were called upon to take up ranks in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] when the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] went to  [[Clone Wars/Legends|war]].<ref name="BFC" />Master Glynn-Beti and her Padawan joined [[CT-4/619]] in [[Conquest of Raxus Prime|battling]] for [[Raxus Prime/Legends|Raxus Prime]]. There, the Jedi discovered [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], leader of the CIS, attempting to harness the powers of a construct known as the [[Force Harvester]]. While the Jedi were unable to capture Dooku, they destroyed the potential weapon and sabotaged the [[Dark Reaper campaign]]. Discovering the orphaned [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] during the battle, Master Glynn-Beti failed to recognize the dangerous child and had him shipped to [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]] to be placed with a local family there. However, Fett managed to [[Escape from Bespin|escape]], joining forces with the notorious [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]], a failed Jedi Glynn-Beti detested.<ref name="BFC" />Master Glynn-Beti was present on Bespin to [[Battle of Bespin (Clone Wars)|defend]] it from Separatist invasion. However, the best she could do was assist with an evacuation of [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]].<ref>''[[The Clone Wars: Decide Your Destiny: Tethan Battle Adventure]]''</ref>Glynn-Beti and Boba Fett would once more cross paths when she led the campaign known as the [[Battle of Xagobah (Clone Wars)|Battle of Xagobah]]. During the battle she thanked the mysterious Fett when he saved the life of Padawan Ulix, stating she was in his debt. In payment of that debt, Master Glynn-Beti assisted Fett in infiltrating the [[Mazariyan|Mazariyan Citadel]] as part of the overall mission to capture one of the Confederacy's leaders, [[Wat Tambor/Legends|Wat Tambor]].<ref>''[[Boba Fett: A New Threat]]''</ref>

name: Gondara
description: Gondara was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Aqualish/Legends|Aqualish]]<ref name="Shroud" /> [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] between [[17 BBY/Legends|17 BBY]] and [[13 BBY/Legends|13 BBY]]<ref name="G-age" /> on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ando/Legends|Ando]]. Her [[Parent/Legends|parents]] were [[Death/Legends|killed]] by [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]], leaving her to be raised by her elder brother, [[Karlon]]. Several [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the death of their parents, Karlon joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], an insurgent movement dedicated to overthrowing the Empire. Gondara was sent to live on an Alliance [[Safe world/Legends|safe world]] so that she would be protected from any Imperial attempt to use her to get to Karlon while he served with the Alliance during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]].<ref name="Shroud" />Sometime after [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], when Gondara was seventeen, Karlon was killed in the line of duty [[Battle of Bresnia|fighting]] Imperial forces on the planet [[Bresnia]]; Gondara chose to enter active service with the Alliance following her brother's death. Karlon's best friend, the [[Carosite]] [[Medic/Legends|medic]] [[Tamo Lan]], took responsibility for Gondara, taking her under his wing as his charge. Lan was serving under the [[Jin]] [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Dutra Zeneta]] as part of [[Shroud Team]], a unit of [[Foster Agent]]s responsible for helping stranded operatives return to the Alliance, in [[Corint City]] on the planet [[Pirik]]. Despite not being a veteran [[Agent/Legends|agent]], Gondara was a skilled [[Thief/Legends|thief]] when she joined the unit. She served as a Foster Agent alongside the rest of the team, which also included the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Dheendo]] and the [[Ishi Tib/Legends|Ishi Tib]] [[Thilis-Brin]].<ref name="Shroud" />Gondara's assignment was one of the most dangerous roles in the entire Alliance; Foster Agents were constantly threatened with exposure from Imperial forces, as their names and locations were common knowledge to Alliance operatives in the field who may have need of their services. If an operative was to be captured and reveal the name of the Foster Agent under interrogation, the Agent was compromised.<ref name="GG9">''[[Galaxy Guide 9: Fragments from the Rim]]''</ref> Gondara also assisted Lan in his medical duties, and she began to develop the skills needed to operate as his assistant.<ref name="Shroud" />

name: Gormaanda/Legends
description: {{Quote|Don't forget to tip your FA droids while on Coruscant. They are programmed to blacklist the stingy.|An excerpt from ''Travels with Gormaanda: Cooking in the Core''|The New Essential Guide to Droids}}[[File:Gormaanda.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Gormaanda displays a dish of Glowblue Noodles and Chav.]]Gormaanda, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] member of a four-[[Limb/Legends|armed]] [[Species/Legends|species]], worked as a [[Chef/Legends|chef]] during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="HNN" /> During her lifetime, she traveled throughout [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy's]] [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] on a cooking-related journey. One of the stops on her itinerary was the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], where she became familiar with the [[Programmer/Legends|programmed]] tendency of [[FA-5 valet droid/Legends|FA-5 valet droids]] to blacklist non-tipping customers from their places of employment. Gormaanda wrote a [[Book/Legends|book]] about her experiences entitled ''[[Travels with Gormaanda: Cooking in the Core]]''.<ref name="NEGTD">''[[The New Essential Guide to Droids]]''</ref> Prior to [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], she won the [[Orto Culinary Academy Award for Engorgable Excellence]] on three occasions, and by that year, she had become a four-star-rated chef.<ref name="HNN" />Also by 22 BBY, Gormaanda [[author]]ed "[[Gormaanda's Culinary Corner]]," a lifestyle column that appeared in [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] [[Holofeed|newsfeeds]] throughout the Republic. When the availability of fresh ingredients in Republic [[Realspace/Legends|space]] grew scarce due to the ongoing [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], she reacted by writing a column that detailed the preparation of [[Glowblue Noodles and Chav]], a dish that could be prepared using any one of a wide variety of meats, or even with no meat at all.<ref name="HNN" /> In addition to writing her [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] News column, Gormaanda recorded [[Instruction cassette|instructional cooking cassettes]]; one such cassette, featuring the chef preparing a [[Bantha rump|bantha surprise]] dish, was viewed on the planet [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]]<ref name="Holiday Special" /> in [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]]<ref name="Leland Holiday">{{SWBoards|url=thread.jspa?threadID=152583&start=870|thread=Holocron continuity database questions|user=Leland Y Chee|date=2006-10-12|time=6:13 PM|archiveurl=http://www.tm-travolta.net/archives/forums.sw.com/message.jspa%3fmessageID=15778940.1.html|quote=Wookiee Life Day occurs every 3 years, one of which fell at ~1.5 ABY.}}</ref> by the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Mallatobuck/Legends|Mallatobuck]], who was preparing a feast for the Wookiee [[holiday]] [[Life Day/Legends|Life Day]].<ref name="Holiday Special" />

name: Gragra/Legends
description: [[File:Gragra full body shot.png|thumb|left|upright|Gragra in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY.]]]]In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Gragra demanded that [[Jar Jar Binks/Legends|Jar Jar Binks]] pay the seven [[Wupiupi/Legends|wupiupi]] for a [[Gorg/Legends|gorg]] he ate from her market stall. [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]] then started to bully Jar Jar as revenge for the latter inadvertently ruining his meal by spitting it out into his bowl of soup, and Gragra left the issue unattended.Gragra regretted her harsh behavior, and on later reflection realizing that perhaps it had been caused by trouble at home. She spoke to her husband, [[Grognak]], only to discover that he was as emotionally distant as he had always been.This encouraged her to sell enough gorgs, including [[Gorg dipping sauce|sauces]] created from them, to buy her own [[Starship/Legends|ship]], so that she could leave her husband and her life of quiet domestic oppression behind, becoming a symbol to Gorgmongers everywhere.She eventually left Mos Espa to work elsewhere, which caused the [[Gorg/Legends|gorg]] population in the sewers to grow considerably over the following years. Homeless people often fed on these gorgs.<ref name="Star Wars Galaxies - mission terminals">''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]'' - information from mission terminals</ref>

name: Grake
description: {{Quote|A joke? Sand-in ''my'' food?|Grake|The Crystal Star}}Once, angered by the ill manners of the [[Proctor (Empire Reborn)|Proctors]] stationed there who complained of sand in their food, Grake used her spatula to hit the heads of several Proctors before throwing out fruit to the younger and lower ranking captive children who were starved. Luckily, she was not killed since she quickly went back to her duties in the kitchen. Later, when [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[Chief of State (New Republic|Chief of State]] [[Leia Organa Solo]] arrived on the Worldcraft to reclaim her children and liberate the captive children, Leia freed Grake from her slavery.

name: Gunn Yage
description: {{Quote|He was expecting a boy and instead he got me! And then my mother&hellip;|Gunn Yage on her [[Rulf Yage|father]] and [[Morrigan Corde|mother]].|Legacy 14: Claws of the Dragon, Part 1}}[[File:Gunn Yage (pilot).jpg|thumb|left|180px|Captain Yage chasing [[Cade Skywalker]] in a [[Predator-class fighter|''Predator''-class fighter]] over [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].]]Gunn Yage was the [[Yage family|daughter]] of [[Moff/Legends|Moffs]] [[Morrigan Corde|Nyna Calixte]] and [[Rulf Yage]], the latter of whom raised her like the son he wished he had. Growing up despising her mother for abandoning them to pursue a relationship with [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Morlish Veed]], Gunn eventually gained her father's respect after climbing through the ranks with no preferential treatment. She served in the [[181st Imperial Fighter Wing]], eventually reaching the rank of [[Captain/Legends|captain]] and earning command of Skull [[Squadron/Legends|Squadron]].

name: Hala
description: After being taken in a slave raid by the [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] [[Krayn]], Hala showed defiance to the slavelord, who, because of that defiance, murdered her and took a small silver-bell necklace off her body to wear as a trophy. Anakin would later recognize this bell when he himself was taken by Krayn as a prisoner-slave in [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]]; that the crime-lord wore the trinket on his belt betrayed the grave meaning behind it, and it enraged the boy.Hala was avenged by Skywalker when he confronted Krayn in battle as he fled the rebellious uprising of his own slaves: the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] impaled the pirate with his recently constructed [[Anakin Skywalker's first lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].

name: Herat
description: After Jabba's death, Herat and her tribe were freed from servitude, and roamed the deserts of [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] for many years. When they discovered [[Kitster Chanchani Banai]] in the deep desert, Herat agreed to transport him to [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]]. The tribe was struck by two almost simultaneous attacks, one by an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] search party that was looking for the [[Killik Twilight]] moss painting, and then by a group of [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Sand people]]. Many of the tribe were killed, but Herat and Kitster managed to survive. Kitster was taken by the Sand people, and Herat was left for dead. She agreed to help [[Leia Organa Solo]] and her husband, [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], locate Kitster and the moss-painting before the Imperials could, since her hatred of the Imperials had grown immeasurably after their attack. However, she was badly injured by in the attacks, and was forced to negotiate in return for treatment of her broken leg. She later came to understand the Solos' need to recover the painting, and agreed to let herself be "hijacked" in order to draw off Imperial pursuit. With the Solos' help, Herat got her [[Sandcrawler/Legends|sandcrawler]] working again, then locked herself in a toolbox while the sandcrawler was put in gear. The [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] pursuing them took the bait, and believed Herat's story of being captured and locked up after the Solos stole her cargo.

name: Hester
description: Hester's husband, [[Hendar]], left the [[Undercity (Taris)|Undercity]] village to go into the [[rakghoul]]-infested lands. Upon his return, he was being pursued by a rakghoul. She asked [[Trewin]] the gatekeeper to open the gate and let him in. Trewin refused, believing the danger of the rakghoul entering the village too great, until [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] volunteered to help Hendar combat the rakghoul. When the beast was defeated, Hendar was reunited with his Hester, much to her relief.<ref name="kotor" />Like all the other Outcasts, she left for the [[Promised Land]].<ref name="kotor" />

name: Honi
description: {{Quote|You did well, children. The Force was with you.''"<br />"''And Ali-Alann was there, too. He told us stories.|Mace Windu and Honi, following Honi's rescue from the turbolift|Jedi Apprentice: The Captive Temple}}Born around [[47 BBY/Legends|47 BBY]],<ref name="Birth" /> Honi was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] whose [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitivity]] was detected at an early age, which led to her acceptance into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]]. She began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Honi was sorted into a [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|clan]] with nine other Initiates under the stewardship of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ali-Alann]]. In [[44 BBY/Legends|44 BBY]], when Honi was nearly three [[Standard year/Legends|years]] old, [[Unidentified Jedi clan|her clan]] got into an accident as Ali-Alann was escorting them in a [[Turbolift/Legends|turbolift]] that connected the [[Jedi Temple accommodation sector|nursery]] to the [[Jedi Temple Refectory|dining halls]]. During the ride, all save one of the turbolift car's [[Repulsorlift/Legends|repulsorlifts]] failed and the horizontal shaft collapsed, leaving the car teetering over the [[Jedi Temple Lake Level|Lake Level]] several hundred [[Imperial standard meter|meters]] below. In order to keep the children calm while waiting for rescue, Ali-Alann told them stories.<ref name="TCT" />The accident was witnessed by [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Initiate [[Bant Eerin/Legends|Bant Eerin]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], a former [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] hoping to re-enter the Jedi Order. Recognizing the danger the students were in, Eerin rushed to call for help. Meanwhile, Kenobi climbed up to the shattered shaft and assisted Ali-Alann in removing the Initiates from the car, Honi being the first to be taken out. By then, members of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] had arrived to the scene, as had Master [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]]. The Council members used the Force to hold the car steady while Kenobi took out the [[Youngling/Legends|younglings]] one by one and handed them to Jinn. When all of the children were safe, Master [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] commended them on doing well in the scary situation, saying that the Force had been with them&mdash;to which Honi earnestly replied that Ali-Alann had been there as well. The Jedi later found out that the accident had been arranged by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Xanatos]], the failed former apprentice of Jinn who had [[Incident at the Jedi Temple|planned]] to bring down the Jedi Temple.<ref name="TCT" />

name: Ice (duelist)
description: {{Quote|Ice? Eh, she's not much for personality, but she's a hell of a fighter&mdash;confident, steady. Popular with the crowd, too. If you go up against her you know you're in for a tough match.|Marl describing Ice|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}

name: Ilsa
description: In [[3956 BBY]], she was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]]. Her father called upon the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] to seek revenge for his daughter's murder, and the call was answered by [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], at that time studying as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] under his programmed identity. Revan helped avenge her [[Death/Legends|death]] by [[Confrontation on Dantooine|killing]] all Mandalorians in the area, and their [[Sherruk|leader]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Ilum (Jedi)
description: A female [[Shard]] from [[Orax]], Ilum and her 12 children dwelt in the bodies of [[Juggernaut war droid]]s, [[FLTCH-series battle droid]]s, and [[Uulshos justice droid]]s. They were trained in the ways of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] on [[Dweem]] by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Aqinos]], without the approval of the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]], beginning in [[60 BBY/Legends|60 BBY]]. Nonetheless, under the name "the [[Iron Knight]]s," they fought valiantly in the [[Arkanian Revolution]] alongside [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] in [[50 BBY/Legends|50 BBY]]. Afterwards, they were excommunicated from the Jedi Order by the Jedi Council but made [[High Marshal]]s by the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]]. Ilum and most of the Iron Knights retreated to Dweem with Aqinos; she remained in hiding on [[Dweem]].[[Callista Ming]] provided [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] with clues as to the location of the hiding Iron Knights. Around [[13 ABY/Legends|13 ABY]], a group of Jedi students found them on Dweem, and they joined the [[New Jedi Order]]. They defeated the [[Red Knights of Life]] on [[Osarian]] and [[Uffel]] and saved [[Kligson's Moon]] from the [[Yuuzhan Vong]]. They fought in defense of [[Hosk Station/Legends|Hosk Station]], during which one of Ilum's children, [[Luxum (Jedi)|Luxum]], fell to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] and led a group of [[Assassin droid/Legends|assassin droids]] against the Yuuzhan Vong.

name: Iran Ryad
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], [[Count/Legends|Countess]] Iran Ryad forged a career as a [[Politics/Legends|politician]] in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], giving her a position of wealth and influence. Throughout her life, she developed a fascination not only for military politics, but also for the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] and [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]]. The latter obsession encouraged Ryad to seek training as a starfighter [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]], a hobby enabled by her political connections and prodigious wealth.<ref name="Wizards" />{{Gamemechanics}}Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Iran Ryad partook in a skirmish against at least one [[Rebel pilot/Legends|Rebel pilot]]. Ryad was defeated in the fight, but managed to escape alive in her crippled [[TIE Oppressor]].<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}Around [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], the Empire developed the [[TIE/D Defender]],<ref name="3ABY">In ''[[Star Wars: TIE Fighter]]'', the TIE Defender enters service between the battles of [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] and [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Endor]], placing it in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]] per ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''.</ref> a radical departure for the [[TIE Series]] which featured many systems absent from most Imperial starfighters, including both [[Deflector shield/Legends|deflector shields]] and a [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]]. The high cost of the starfighter, together with its departure from standard Imperial tactics, made it unpopular and Ryad was one of the few experienced and influential politicians to argue in favor of the new starfighter.<ref name="Wizards" />[[File:CountessRyadTieDefender.png|thumb|left|230px|Ryad's fighter, the ''Red Star 1'', was a modified TIE Defender.]]In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], the Galactic Empire suffered a major defeat at the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] at the hands of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] himself was [[Death/Legends|killed]], as was his [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. Furthermore, the Imperial Navy suffered heavy losses, including the destruction of the [[Death Star II/Legends|second Death Star]]<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> and many of its most skilled [[TIE pilot]]s.<ref name="Wizards" /> The death of Palpatine saw the Empire begin to fragment, with rival military figures declaring themselves [[Warlord/Legends|warlords]] and attempting to establish their own dominions.<ref name="NEC" />With the Empire running short of skilled pilots, Ryad abandoned her career as a politician and became an Imperial pilot, in time utilizing her connections to requisition a TIE Defender to serve as her personal starfighter, the ''[[Red Star 1]]''. Ryad had the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] modified<ref name="Wizards" /> at a cost of 62,500 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]],<ref name="Cost">''[[More Starships!]]'' lists the cost of the ''Red Star 1'' as 262,500 credits, 62,500 credits higher than that of an unmodified TIE Defender.</ref> fitting it with an enhanced [[Deflector shield generator/Legends|shield generator]], an improved [[ion drive]] for greater maneuverability and advanced [[Targeting computer/Legends|fire control]] systems.<ref name="Wizards" />The Countess spent over a year leading a [[Flight/Legends|flight group]] of four TIE Defenders on patrols of the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Coreward]] borders of what remained of Imperial [[Realspace/Legends|space]]. After a dozen successful patrols, Ryad had scored a high number of kills and became a starfighter [[Ace/Legends|ace]]. Her achievements resulted in her gaining command of her own [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]]. Ryad filled [[Red Star Squadron]] with like-minded pilots who shared her idea of a zero-tolerance border policy. With Ryad leading the squadron from the ''Red Star 1'', the Imperial pilots relentlessly pursued any starships that entered Imperial space without permission.<ref name="Wizards" />Throughout her career, Ryad had gained rivals within the Empire, foremost among them being another notable Imperial pilot, [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Soontir Fel]],<ref name="Wizards" /> a veteran of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] who had remained loyal to the Empire under the rule of [[Ysanne Isard]], the former [[Director of Imperial Intelligence|Director]] of [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] who served as the steward of the Empire following Palpatine's death.<ref name="NEGC">''[[The New Essential Guide to Characters]]''</ref> Around [[5 ABY/Legends|5 ABY]],<ref name="Death" /> Ryad's actions led her to be accused of [[Treason/Legends|treason]] and she was hunted down and killed by Fel.<ref name="Wizards" />

name: Izrina
description: Izrina was a peaceful being. During a severe drought, however, the [[Tulgah]] witch [[Morag]] captured the queen. Using evil magic to change Izrina into a being of literal fire, Morag unleashed the queen on the Wistie folk. The spell proved contagious, and soon the flammable creatures caused a large section of forest to catch fire. As the flames encroached on the [[Ewok/Legends|Ewoks]] of [[Bright Tree Village/Legends|Bright Tree Village]], threatening their [[Soul Tree]]s, [[Wicket Wystri Warrick]] doused Izrina with water and discovered that this cured her of her fiery affliction. The Ewoks then doused the other infected Wisties and squelched the flames with a special foam made by [[Logray/Legends|Logray]], the Ewok shaman while Izrina volunteers her people to guide the airdropping gliders around the dangerous convection currents.A short while before the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Izrina joined a party of Ewoks in their search for [[Catarine Towani|Catarine]] and [[Jeremitt Towani]], who had crash landed on Endor and became separated from their children, [[Cindel Towani|Cindel]] and [[Mace Towani|Mace]].Izrina was attracted by a [[Candle of Pure Light|magical candle]] that Logray had presented to Cindel Towani. When the caravan discovered the adult Humans captured by a monstrous [[Gorax/Legends|Gorax]], Izrina distracted the creature and allowed the others to free the captives. After the Gorax had been killed by Mace, Izrina led her friends out of the fortress. Mace told Izrina that their mission couldn't have been a success without her, and after saying farewell to her, Queen Izrina flitted off into the night sky.

name: Jade (mercenary)
description: Jade was stationed on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Gellefon]] when [[Deep Ear]] received the [[Death Star II/Legends|Death Star II]] plans and was the only contact between them and the Rebel Alliance. As soon as she found out the details of the information she was carrying, she contacted the [[Alliance High Command/Legends|Alliance High Command]], asking for immediate evacuation as the agents were in trouble and [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] entanglements were inevitable. Unfortunately the message arrived garbled, and so the Alliance didn't know to expect trouble, so they only sent a small group of rebels.The rebels met up with Jade in the [[Ravaging Wardog Cantina]], where they were to order seven [[Green Galaxy]] drinks in order to make contact. To test the rebels fighting ability, Jade started a bar fight which the group were quick to put out. When she finally sat down with the group, [[Borsk Fey'lya]] pushed his way into the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] and over to their table. He informed her that everything had gone wrong, and at least two dozen members of Deep Ear had been killed, the rest held prisoner in the Imperial detention center, [[Pinnacle Keep]]. Jade and the group of rebels agreed to help him free the captured [[Bothan/Legends|Bothans]].While the group were scouting out Pinnacle Keep, they met up with several members of the [[Gellefon Freedom Fighters]] atop [[Gellbeast]]s and managed to convince them to escort them to [[Aran Starfire]]'s hidden base. While there, Jade and Borsk arranged to create a distraction with the Freedom Fighters while the group of rebels freed the captured Bothans. Eventually the group managed to free them, and met up with Jade and Borsk again at their ship. Unfortunately, [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Schennt]] was not willing to let the prisoners go that easily, and sent a [[system patrol craft]] after the group. Luckily they managed to escape, and delivered the members of Deep Ear to the Alliance High Command base in the [[Sullust system/Legends|Sullust system]]. What happened to Jade after this is unknown.

name: Jess
description: [[File:JessAndBib-SWRPG2E.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Jess, Bib Fortuna and Salacious B. Crumb]]In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Jess worked as a [[Musician/Legends|musician]] in [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]], hoping to eventually leave the establishment by joining a [[Band/Legends|band]]. Jess was often seen in the company of [[Bib Fortuna/Legends|Bib Fortuna]]<ref name="CCG">{{CCG|set=Jabba's Palace Limited|link=JabbasPalace-Light/large/jess.gif|cardname=Jess}}</ref> stroking his [[Lekku/Legends|lekku]]. He reciprocated the gesture, often leading her around the throne room by hand, and letting her sit nestled to him. Though he still reminded her what she was, dragging her to the sight of the dancing girl [[Oola/Legends|Oola]] being fed to the [[Rancor/Legends|rancor]]. Later, she was left to slumber alone on [[Jabba's dais]] with two other patrons as Fortuna lay in wait with his [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|master]], ready to spring the trap as [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], disguised as [[Boushh/Legends|Boushh]], released [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] from [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]].<ref name="rotj" /> Whether she went on Jabba's sailbarge with the others is unknown.

name: Jira/Legends
description: [[File:Jira.png|thumb|left|250px|Jira tending her food cart.]]Jira depended on a cooling unit to keep her foods fresh, especially in the Tatooine heat. When she suffered from a broken cooling unit, it was [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] who came to rescue, by giving her the money to purchase a new one.She was known for telling the tale of the mysterious wandering "[[Nobot]]" to those with two [[Peggat/Legends|peggats]] to spare.In 32 BBY, only a week before the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]], Jira helped Anakin and his friends [[Kitster Banai|Kitster]] and [[Dorn (slave)|Dorn]] to rescue [[Pala Kwi'teksa|Pala]] and several kidnapped [[Ghostling|Ghostling children]] from captivity. With her own slave-smuggling knowledge and connections, she advised the brave little rescuers as to the required costs of their alruistic plans within the walls of her humble pour-stone apartment. Between their secret meetings at Jira's place, each of them gathered and gave what they could of their saved and solicited credits to meet the costs of smugglers' payment. Jira's bare abode was located down a shaded alleyway near Jira's fruit stand in the Mos Espa marketplace.<ref>''[[Episode I Adventures 6: The Hunt for Anakin Skywalker]]''</ref>Before departing Tatooine with [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], Anakin gave Jira a portion of the money he made from selling his [[Podracer/Legends|podracer]]. He hugged her goodbye and she called him the kindest boy in the world.

name: Jude Rozess
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at a young age, Jude Rozess was taken to the the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] where she began [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] to learn the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side]]. After passing through the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]], Rozess was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by one of the Order's [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]]. Training one-on-one for nearly a decade and crafting for herself a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], Rozess passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] herself.<ref name="TCSWE" />Pursuing the path of the [[Jedi Guardian]], Rozess focused her independent studies on becoming a [[Jedi Peacekeeper|Peacekeeper]]; specifically working with the [[Temple Security Force]]. In [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], Rozess was stationed at the [[Council Spire Atrium|entrance]] to the [[High Council Tower/Legends|High Council Tower]] of the Jedi Temple when a group of [[Yinchorri]] [[Raid on the Jedi Temple (Yinchorri Uprising)|attacked]] the Temple. While putting up a valiant defense after having been surprised by the assault, Rozess was overcome by the sheer number of attackers and was slain by a Yinchorri commando. As she lay dying, her murderer gloated that she was his first kill just as she managed to impale him with her weapon, being the first and last time she would take a life.<ref name="TCSWE" />Rozess was not the only Jedi to die in this raid. [[Tieren Nie-Tan]] would join her in becoming one with the Force.<ref name="AoW 2">''[[Jedi Council: Acts of War 2]]''</ref>

name: Kabe/Legends
description: [[File:Kabe-hd.png|thumb|left|180px|Kabe reaches for a cup of [[Juri juice/Legends|Juri juice]].]]Kabe was the adopted daughter of [[Muftak/Legends|Muftak]], a [[Talz/Legends|Talz]]. Muftak found her on the streets of Mos Eisley, apparently abandoned by slavers who thought she was too small to sell. Muftak took her in and taught her the ways of the street. Kabe lived with him in in a section of abandoned tunnels beneath Docking Bay 83.<ref name="GG1">''[[Galaxy Guide 1: A New Hope, Second Edition]]''</ref>Whenever Muftak and Kabe went to the [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] cantina, Kabe would drink too much juri juice, and Muftak would have to carry her home. Despite his rough look, Muftak was a good guardian and cared about Kabe, although he was obsessed with finding out what species he was. Kabe worried that when he did, he would leave her and travel to his home planet.Kabe was an associate of [[Greedo/Legends|Greedo]], and knew information that many others did not. She helped Greedo find [[Temo Dionisio]] when the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] sympathizer went missing.<ref name="THoTS">{{Tales|6|The Hovel on Terk Street}}</ref>Kabe and Muftak made their living through thievery. Kabe was a petty thief and would often pick the pockets of other bar patrons. The pair sometimes robbed, or attempted to rob, [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] establishments. Desiring for more, Kabe would occasionally pester Muftak about robbing [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure's]] [[Desilijic Complex/Legends|town house]] in Mos Eisley. Muftak and Kabe eventually did. Aided by Jabba's droid [[K-8LR]] after they removed his restraining bolt, they managed to steal many treasures from the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. In the mansion, they came across a Rebel operative being tortured by a nerve disruptor. Kabe freed him and he gave them a datachip and told them to give it to a [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] to earn 30,000 credits. As they made their way down the hallway they were discovered by two [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]] guards. A large blaster fight erupted as they made their way to the main audience chamber. There a fire broke out. Muftak told Kabe to run, saying he would be right behind her. When Kabe got outside, she realized he had no intention of saving his life as well. Kabe dropped her sack of treasure and ran back in to help Muftak get away. They managed to escape, but found that to their great dismay the sack was gone. However, they still had the datachip. They delivered it, and were given 15,000 credits by the Mon Calamari. They also received several letters of transit signed by [[Grand Moff/Legends|Grand Moff]] [[Wilhuff Tarkin/Legends|Wilhuff Tarkin]], enabling them to travel anywhere. With these, Muftak was finally able to travel to his home planet of [[Alzoc III/Legends|Alzoc III]] and brought Kabe to her home planet, Chad.

name: Kaevee
description: By the [[Attack on Dantooine (Jedi Civil War)|Attack on Dantooine]] in [[3956 BBY]], Kaevee was at an early training stage, not yet knowing all of the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] and unable to distinguish the two sides of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. When the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] assaulted the [[Jedi Enclave]], seeking [[Revan/Legends|Revan]]&mdash;and asking questions only about Revan&mdash;Kaevee was outside the Enclave. She tried hiding in the [[Matale family|Matale]] [[Matale estate|estate]], only to see [[Shen Matale]] and other Matales die and their house burn.She took residence in the Enclave sublevel, summoning [[laigrek]]s and ordering them to kill any intruders, calling them her "pets," as she felt her mission was to protect the Enclave at all costs. Eventually, she was discovered by [[Meetra Surik]].

name: Kahranna
description: {{Quote|Oh. We were expecting one of the pilots from the docks sometime soon to come and get us off Nar Shaddaa. He is late&mdash;I don't know where he is.|Kahranna, to Meetra Surik|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Kahranna was a [[Refugee/Legends|refugee]] displaced by the conflicts of the [[Mandalorian Wars]] and [[Jedi Civil War]]. She and her family lived in the [[Refugee Sector]] of [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], the largest [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]],<ref name="KOTOR2" /> during the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3951 BBY]].<ref name="CAMP">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> They had been abandoned on the so-called "Smuggler's Moon" by a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] they had paid to [[Transport/Legends|transport]] them.<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|192|Kahranna}}</ref> Kahranna later spoke with a [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] named [[Planore]], who offered to refer her and her family to a pilot friend of his for {{Cr}}50. Planore said that his friend would transport Kahranna and her family off-world for {{Cr}}500, but he had yet to come through on his offer.<ref name="KOTOR2" />{{GameLSmechanics}}During that [[Time/Legends|time]], a former [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Meetra Surik]] was visiting the moon in search of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Zez-Kai Ell]]. She spoke with Kahranna, who asked Surik if she was the [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] she was expecting. She was not, and Kahranna explained the situation with Planore to her, which Surik automatically expected was a scam and told Kahranna so. Upset by the news, she asked Surik for help, which the former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knight agreed to. Sometime later, Surik was able to convince an [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] [[courier]] named [[Lasavvou]] to provide Kahranna and her family with transportation to [[Telos IV]] in exchange for helping him pay his departure fee.<ref name="KOTOR2" /><ref name="CSWE" />{{Endgame}}

name: Karia Ver Seryan
description: Karia lived in a stately five-story mansion of gray stone surrounded by gardens of exotic flowers in an elegant neighborhood. The townsfolk treated her with respect and awe and more than a little fear; the houses on either side of hers were abandoned.Lando had narrowed his list of potential brides to five, based mostly on wealth and availability, and Karia was the first on his list. He visited Leria Kerlsil, accompanied by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], neither realizing the truth about Karia, or even what a life-bearer was. Luke began to sense something was amiss without knowing exactly what it was and urged Lando to stop, but Lando was determined. Meanwhile, [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]], left back in the [[Lady Luck/Legends|''Lady Luck'']] without ever being told what planet they had landed on, was informed by [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] that they were on Leria Kerlsil and took the opportunity to search his database for information on the planet related to mating rituals. Terrified, he and R2 escaped the ship, hired a taxi with great difficulty, and arrived just in the nick of time to tell Lando the truth and save him from a greatly abbreviated lifespan.Karia had married, sustained, and outlived 49 husbands; Lando would have been her fiftieth. Her forty-ninth husband was Lando's friend [[Chantu Solk]]. Karia was able to sustain her husbands for around three to five years and then recover for around the same length of time. Her Support had granted her unnatural long life. Upon meeting Lando for the first time, she was 312 years old, though her physical appearance remained that of a mature young woman.

name: Kendalina
description: The [[Jedi Princess]] Kendalina fell in love with an [[Prisoner/Legends|inmate]] named [[Triclops]] on [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]] and [[Reproduction/Legends|conceived]] a [[Parent/Legends|child]] with [[Sexes/Legends|him]]. After that she was forced to work as a nurse in an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] insane asylum on [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]]. When Kendalina was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the Galactic Empire, the child, named [[Ken]], was hidden in the [[Lost City of the Jedi]].

name: Laseema
description: She was at first scared when [[Delta Squad/Legends|Delta Squad]], [[Omega Squad]] and [[Ordo Skirata|Ordo]] came to the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]]. Soon though, she took an interest in [[Atin Skirata|Atin]]. It is not known for certain if she continued working in Qibbu's Hut but it seems likely that, after [[Kal Skirata]] rented her an [[Laseema's apartment|apartment]], she would have left her old job. During this time she was still very wary of unexpected visitors, prompting Kal to advise [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Bardan Jusik]] to call ahead before arriving.When Jedi Knight [[Etain Tur-Mukan]] gave birth to [[Venku Skirata]], she acted as the baby's caretaker along with [[Besany Wennen]] and Jusik. She quit her job at Qibbu's and worked as a waitress in the [[Kragget]], the cantina located below her apartment. Though in no need of [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], she insisted on earning her keep.During the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]], she married Atin via [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]]. After the battle she along with Kal's [[Clan Skirata|clan]] moved to Kal's home in [[Kyrimorut]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]], where she attended Etain's [[Funeral of Etain Tur-Mukan|funeral]]. Being a waitress, and the only one with experience in preparing food, Laseema took charge of the clan's kitchen, taking on the major task of feeding at least twenty individuals at a time.

name: Leonie
description: Chosen for her skills in combat, art, science and love, Leonie was exceedingly charismatic and intelligent, even in comparison with other [[Zeltron/Legends|Zeltrons]]. She enjoyed collecting erotic sculptures, expensive hats, and shoes (which she was reputed to own 1.2 million pairs of), and could play the [[Zeltron lute]] and [[Kloo horn/Legends|kloo horn]]. She often said that what pleased her people pleased her.Following the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Leonie and Arno hosted a celebration for visitors from the [[Alliance of Free Planets]]. This happy event came to an end when Zeltros found itself the target of the [[Nagai]], the [[Hiromi]] and the [[Tof]]s.

name: Leska
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Leska was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After crafting for herself a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], Leska was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Jedi Leska was hastily made a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and was assigned the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and expected to lead [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]].<ref name="R56" />[[File:LeskaDeath.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Leska is shot and killed during the fighting on Jabiim.]]Though young and inexperienced, Master Leska was one of the Generals assigned to lead Republic forces on the dreary world of [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]]. Along with fellow Masters [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Norcuna]], Master Leska assisted in leading the [[Battle of Jabiim|massive effort]] on the planet. She became the task force's leader after [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Norcuna]] was killed. As her fellow Jedi and her troops died, Leska soon found herself the most senior member in the Grand Army on planet. On the thirty-seventh day of battle, Master Leska fought on the soaked, battle-torn landscape when the clouds parted to reveal sunlight for the first time in a month. Distracted by the light, Master Leska let down her guard and was killed by blasterfire from the ruthless forces of local Separatist General [[Alto Stratus]].<ref name="R57" />

name: Leyli
description: {{Quote|If the Emperor &mdash; or, even worse, Darth Vader &mdash; still survives, they will bring death to these tunnels.''"<br />"''Lady Leyli, you can assure your queen that Vader is dead.''"<br />"''Vader has been thought dead more than once before. How can you be certain it is true this time?''"<br />"''Because I watched him die and built his funeral pyre myself.''"<br />"''Very well&hellip; Our scouts will lead you to the Imperial forces.|Lady Leyli and Luke Skywalker|X-Wing: Rogue Leader 3}}[[File:Leylicloseupreloaded.png|thumb|left|Leyli explains her position to Luke Skywalker and Wedge Antilles]]During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] Leyli was the [[Aide/Legends|aide]] to the [[Queen of Tralus]].<ref name="CSWE" /> A [[Standard week/Legends|week]] after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]<ref name="RS1">''[[X-Wing: Rogue Leader 1]]''</ref> of [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]],<ref name="TNEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] [[General/Legends|General]] [[Weir]] [[Raid at Coronet|attacked]]<ref name="RS3" /> the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] and abducted [[Rebel pilot/Legends|Rebel pilot]] [[Ten Numb/Legends|Ten Numb]], bringing [[Sexes/Legends|him]] to a [[Weir's base|base]] near the city in which Leyli resided for [[Torture/Legends|interrogation]]. The [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance's]] [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] traveled to the nearby<ref name="RS3" /> planet<ref name="TEA" /> of [[Tralus]] in hot pursuit of Weir; upon landing on Tralus and encountering the [[Selonian/Legends|Selonian]] community there, the [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] of Rogue Squadron met with Leyli. She expressed her fear of the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]; initially doubting [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] reports of Vader's [[Death/Legends|death]] and the Empire's defeat at [[Endor/Legends|Endor]], she was convinced by his assurances.<ref name="RS3" />To avoid fear and panic in the community, Leyli decided to keep her [[Queen/Legends|queen]] uninformed of the situation until the Rebels had defeated Weir. Leyli enlisted several Selonian [[Scout/Legends|scouts]] to lead Skywalker and Rogue [[Squadron/Legends|Squadron]] leader [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] to Weir's base, where the general was holding Numb. Leyli added that Weir was notoriously cruel, and that their comrade would surely be wishing for death by that [[Time/Legends|time]]. Numb would later be found dead by Rogue [[Wes Janson/Legends|Wes Janson]].<ref name="RS3" />

name: Loren (noble)
description: [[17 BBY/Legends|Seventeen years]] before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Denid]] and [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] Loren were forced to flee their native [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Velmor/Legends|Velmor]] as the influence of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] established a permanent stronghold on the planet. Along with their trusted ally [[Jedidiah]], they crash-landed onto the jungle world of [[Tantajoc V]]. Lady Loren was killed in the crash, and Prince Denid buried her in a special commemorative cairn on top of a mountain.[[File:Leia as Loren.jpg|thumb|right|Princess Leia disguised as Lady Loren]]Years later [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and Princess [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], responding to a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress beacon]] coming from Tantajoc V, landed on the planet and discovered Denid and the addle-brained Jedidiah. Princess Leia donned a blonde [[wig]] and impersonated Lady Loren for the sake of helping Denid to confirm his identity and retake his rightful place as heir to Velmor.

name: Lyric
description: Like the rest of her [[Species/Legends|species]], Lyric was hatched from an egg and lived the first twenty years of her life on land. She lived at [[Sistra Mountain|Sistra]], one of the [[Moon/Legends|moon's]] many purple mountains. Due to the dangerous conditions on her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] and that she was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], her parents sent her to [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Jedi Praxeum]] on nearby [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]].<ref name="jjk2" />In [[22 ABY]], Lyric turned twenty and had to undergo the [[Changing Ceremony]], in which young Melodies would change from land-dwellers to water-breathers, making them [[Elder (Melodie)|Elders]] (the adults of Melodie society). Since Yavin 8 was dangerous, her two fellow Jedi trainees [[Anakin Solo]] and [[Tahiri Veila]] accompanied Lyric. Shortly after the trio's arrival, they fell under attack by several native predators including an [[avril]], a [[reel]], a [[purella]] and several [[raith]]s. However, Anakin and Tahiri fought and killed them all.<ref name="jjk2" />Having survived, Lyric participated in the Ceremony which took place at a shallow cove in Sistra which led to a series of pools that dominated much of the mountain. At the end of the ceremony, Lyric's legs were replaced by tail slits and she breathed through gills, making her an Elder. Presumably, this also limited her activities as a Jedi to her homeworld.<ref name="jjk2" />During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], the [[extra-galactic]] [[Yuuzhan Vong]] invaded Yavin 8 and destroyed all life. Lyric was among the dead, killed by a [[voxyn]], a bioengineered beast created to hunt Force-sensitive individuals.<ref name="sbs">''[[The New Jedi Order: Star by Star]]''</ref>

name: Janelle Harcourt
description: After Aron was demoted to a desk job after being scapegoated for the destruction of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] ''[[Anya Karu]]'', she and her husband settled on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], where Aron took a desk job. In [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], more than three years after Janelle's [[Death/Legends|death]], Aron hired [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] to retrieve a holorecording of his late wife from the wreckage of ''Anya Karu''. Failing to pay the bounty hunter upon completion of his mission, Fett killed Aron.{{Char-stub}}

name: Madurrin
description: {{Quote|The kill ratios were very much in our favor.''"<br />"''Yes, they were.|Jaina Solo and Madurrin|The New Jedi Order: Destiny's Way}}Madurrin was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Anx/Legends|Anx]] and was trained as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] at the [[Jedi Praxeum]] on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]],<ref name="CSWE" /> a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and founder of the [[New Jedi Order]].<ref name="JS">''[[Jedi Search]]''</ref> In [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]], Madurrin was a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and served aboard the ''[[Mon Adapyne]]'', an [[MC80B Star Cruiser]], in the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], an invasion by an extragalactic species known as the [[Yuuzhan Vong]]. While onboard the ''Mon Adapyne'', Madurrin was under the command of [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]] [[Keyan Farlander]] and used her abilities to tap into a [[Force meld]] with other Jedi on [[Starship/Legends|starships]] and [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] to relay information on the coordination of battle plans. In this role, she also used [[battle meditation]] to focus and synchronize the attacks of [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] forces. From the bridge of the ''Mon Adapyne'', she served in the [[Second Battle of Obroa-skai]], an attempt to ambush a [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] carrying the Yuuzhan Vong's leader, [[Supreme Overlord]] [[Shimrra Jamaane]]. The attack was a success, soundly defeating the Yuuzhan Vong, despite their use of two [[yammosk]]s, creatures that guided and coordinated the Yuuzhan Vong forces.<ref name="DW4" /> However, Shimrra was not with the fleet, and despite their victory, their goal of killing the Yuuzhan Vong leader failed. Believing that the defeated Yuuzhan Vong forces had signaled for reinforcements, General Farlander ordered the ''Mon Adapyne'' to retreat from the area.<ref name="DW5" />[[File:Madurrin ZS.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Madurrin on Zonama Sekot]]Madurrin was still on board the ''Mon Adapyne'' when it was called to the moon of [[Ebaq 9]].<ref name="DW25">''[[The New Jedi Order: Destiny's Way]]'', Chapter 25</ref> The moon was a [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] dead end ideal for trapping starships, and the New Republic was gathering there to set up [[Battle of Ebaq|an ambush]] of Yuuzhan Vong forces.<ref name="CSWEEbaq">{{CSWECite|I|224|Ebaq 9}}</ref> Madurrin and the ''Mon Adapyne'' stayed in orbit above Ebaq 9 to draw in the Yuuzhan Vong fleet, while other New Republic forces nearby waited to hyperspace jump into the system. The Yuuzhan Vong did as anticipated, drawn into the system by the ''Mon Adapyne'' and its complement. Madurrin coordinated the defense with battle meditation, drawing the Yuuzhan Vong further into the trap. Once the Yuuzhan Vong had spread out, the rest of the New Republic fleet arrived to hit them from behind.<ref name="DW25" /> Having fallen into the trap, the Yuuzhan Vong were completely wiped out, earning a decisive victory for the New Republic.<ref name="DW27">''[[The New Jedi Order: Destiny's Way]]'', Chapter 27</ref>A year later, in [[29 ABY/Legends|29 ABY]], Madurrin was stationed aboard a [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]] defending the world of [[Dac|''Mon Calamari'']]. Desperate Yuuzhan Vong forces, hoping to strike a decisive victory against the newly formed [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] at their capital on Mon Calamari, headed towards the [[Planet/Legends|planet]].<ref name="TUF22" /> However, shortly after beginning their attack, the Yuuzhan Vong called a retreat due to the arrival of [[Zonama Sekot/Legends|Zonama Sekot]], a living planet revered by their people. Madurrin, alongside fellow Jedi, [[Cilghal]], [[Kenth Hamner]], [[Mara Jade Skywalker]], and Luke Skywalker, boarded the starship, ''[[Jade Shadow]]'' and headed to a meeting at the planet [[Contruum Six]], where the Alliance was organizing a plan of attack to [[Battle of Yuuzhan'tar|liberate]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the former capital of the Alliance conquered by the Yuuzhan Vong. Madurrin agreed to continue to serve aboard a capital ship in the attack on Coruscant.<ref name="TUF31">''[[The New Jedi Order: The Unifying Force]]'', Chapter 31</ref> Following the Alliance's victory at Coruscant, Madurrin headed to the [[Conclave on Zonama Sekot]], where [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] Luke Skywalker spoke about a new direction for the Jedi Order. Following this, Madurrin decided to continue to serve with the Alliance military, under [[Supreme Commander]] [[Traest Kre'fey]] and General Keyan Farlander.<ref name="TUF44">''[[The New Jedi Order: The Unifying Force]]'', Chapter 44</ref>

name: Maggie
description: Maggie served as both a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] and a soldier during the [[Nagai–Tof War]]. Shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], she traveled to the planet [[Godo]] to investigate a [[Godoan's disease|strange plague]] that was affecting the [[Godoan/Legends|native inhabitants]]. Later, she was part of a small team sent to infiltrate the [[Tof]] base on [[Saijo/Legends|Saijo]] during the [[Battle of Saijo|last battle]] of the war.{{Char-stub}}

name: Mala Mala
description: Early in her life, Mala Mala was betrayed by the handsome [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Nikk Zavod]] who seduced her, stole her [[Starship/Legends|ship]] and left her body for [[Death/Legends|dead]] after he burned it in the afterburners of her ship.[[File:Mala mala.jpg|thumb|left|Mala Mala before being burned.]]She only managed to survive by her fortuitous encounter with [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], who carried her to the sick bay of a ship in which she received life-saving medical attention from a [[Medical droid/Legends|medical droid]]. From that moment on, she never trusted men again&mdash;only [[Droid/Legends|droids]], and built them as friends. This was also the critical moment in her life where she received her moniker after hearing Chewbacca mumble the name of his wife, [[Mallatobuck/Legends|Mallatobuck]], in bed. She started her new life as Mala Mala.Mala later was a part of a group of bounty hunters, including [[Brazzo]] and [[Selle]], on [[Centares/Legends|Centares]]. She was the only survivor from there who knew the identity of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] as the destroyer of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]] from [[Thurlow Harris]]. She was able to evade Vader long enough to reach [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and provide the name to [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]].Among her droids were [[Fordee]] and [[B6|Beesix]]. The Emperor did allow her to leave Coruscant alive. She was alive as of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] for [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] and [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] to record her memories of Chewbacca following his death.{{Char-stub}}

name: Malya
description: While seeking clues to the location of the [[Promised Land]], she found evidence that Rukil's father and grandfather had entered the lower [[Undercity sewers|sewers]] of Taris and entered the information in her journal. In [[3956 BBY]], she was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by [[rakghoul]]s in the [[Undercity (Taris)|Undercity]] '''surface''' (unlike Rukil's father and grandfather who were killed in the sewers), but her journal and the journals of Rukil's father and grandfather were recovered and taken to Rukil by [[Revan/Legends|Revan]].<ref name="kotor" />Rukil gave the three journals to [[Gendar]], preparing the Outcasts to leave the village for the Promised Land.<ref name="kotor" />

name: Manaroo/Legends
description: [[File:ManarooJumpMaster5000-XWM.png|thumb|left|250px|Manaroo and Dengar fly over the sarlacc in the Pit of Carkoon]]Manaroo was to undergo Imperial processing on her home [[Planet/Legends|planet]], [[Aruza]], under the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire's]] "Redesign" operation. Under [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|COMPNOR]], this process would remove all kindness from her being, effectively making her a vicious servant of Imperial doctrine. The process would be similar to one undergone by the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Dengar/Legends|Dengar]]. Manaroo was rescued by Dengar, who killed [[Sinick Kritkeen]], the [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|COMPNOR]] overseer of Aruza. She made her way to [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]] on [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]] to become a dancer.Soon, Dengar came to Cloud City while hunting [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]. Manaroo told Dengar that Solo had been captured by [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]]. Once Manaroo finished talking to Dengar, Lando announced over the loudspeaker that stormtroopers were invading. She was captured by Imperials, from which Dengar freed her and took her with him to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] to recapture Han Solo. While Dengar was away, Manaroo danced at a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], but a [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]] working for [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]], specifically one with a large pouch in its belly he used to hold her captive in, captured and presented her to the bloated [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] as a slave. While in Jabba's service, she was forced to dance while wearing violet leggings and a revealing top. On the night Dengar and Fett were at the Palace she danced while playing a golden flute. After Jabba's [[Death/Legends|death]] on board the [[Sail barge/Legends|Sail barge]], Manaroo was freed.Afterward, she looked for Dengar, who had been sentenced to "feel [[the Teeth of Tatooine]]", a [[Torture/Legends|torture]] that mainly caused death, where the captives are left out in a valley during a sandstorm, and the sharp rocks impale them either to death, or often mortal injury. She nursed Dengar back to health and traveled with him to scavenge the sail barge wreck. To their surprise, they found the [[Sarlacc/Legends|Sarlacc]] dead and a half-dead [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] lying near it. Manaroo stopped Dengar from killing Boba from anger of his abuse to him and instead treated the wounded bounty hunter. Once Fett recovered, Manaroo settled down with Dengar, who asked Fett to be the best man for their [[Marriage/Legends|wedding]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Mari Amithest/Legends
description: After she was taken by a [[Jedi recruiter|recruiter]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[Acquisition Division]], Amithest was sorted into the [[Bear Clan]] upon her arrival. As she entered the [[Jedi academy|academy]] at the Temple, she received her early education from her clan leader, [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]]. During one of the clan's daily [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] instructional courses on the [[Jedi Temple Veranda|Temple's veranda]], [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] approached Grand Master Yoda with a question. It appeared the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Temple's Archives]] were incomplete and missing [[Kamino system/Legends|a system]]. One of Amithest's peers, [[J. K. Burtola/Legends|J. K. Burtola]], suggested that someone had erased the files, thereby explaining the archives' incompleteness.<ref name="AOTC" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Masla (Human)
description: [[File:IThinkWeShouldSeeOtherPeople-E10.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Sewell and the body of Masla.]]Masla eventually had a romance with the future [[General/Legends|general]] of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. But this romance ended when the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]] burst onto the stage, accusing the actors of being promoters of a subversive, inflammatory and seditious play. However, Sewell refused to stop performing. The [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] opened fire against the actors, and Roons ran to protect Masla, but it was too late. Masla received a lethal [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] shot.In battle, Sewell would yell her name out whenever he fired at an Imperial.

name: Meloria
description: Meloria was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] born and raised on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]. Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] soon after her birth, Meloria was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] to be [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Meloria passed through her training half-heartedly; always resenting the fact that her destiny was supposedly predetermined. During her upbringing within the Order, she came to like the physical aspects of the Force above all else, and her quick reflexes and fighting prowess only grew as she immersed herself in martial studies. After a time, she was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], who was greatly impressed with her extraordinary abilities.<ref name="CCW" />Following the path of a [[Jedi Guardian]], Meloria [[Jedi Trials/Legends|gained]] the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Shortly after her [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|graduation]], however, her trust in her reflexes betrayed her. While attempting to arrest a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]], Meloria accidentally [[Death/Legends|killed]] an innocent bystander. She became distraught and found herself unable to deal with the anguish; she severed all ties with the Jedi Order and vowed to never use the Force again. Meloria fled to the nearby planet of [[Drall/Legends|Drall]], where she made her home within a cave on a small island in the [[Boiling Sea]]. She lived on the island alone for quite a while, farming the land to survive and becoming forgotten by the rest of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. Her isolation only served to deepen her sense of loss, and soon she settled upon a drastic decision.<ref name="CCW" />Now thirty [[Standard year/Legends|years]] old, Meloria used the last of her [[Galactic Credit Standard|savings]] to purchase a [[cryogenic hibernation capsule]]. Safe inside her cave, she then froze herself within the unit. Meloria knew that if the Force willed it, she would be free, but until that time, she'd remain in stasis.<ref name="CCW" />

name: Mermeia
description: {{Quote|I don't need to ask how you find me. You see, I am your fantasy. I am your experience. So experience me. I am your pleasure. So enjoy me. This is our moment together in time. And we might turn this moment into an eternity.|Mermeia, to Attichitcuk|audio=MermeiaExperience-SWHS.ogg|The Star Wars Holiday Special}}[[File:Mermeia-SWGTCG.JPG|thumb|left|150px|Mermeia dances for an entranced Twi'lek.]]Mermeia was a [[Hologram/Legends|holographic]] [[Sexes/Legends|woman]]<ref name="Bad Feeling" /> and a private [[entertainer]]<ref name="Holiday Special" /> who existed within [[virtual reality]].<ref name="Insider 23">{{InsiderCite|23|The Star Wars Holiday Special (article)|The Star Wars Holiday Special}}</ref> Interactions with and performances by her were accessible to users of both [[Mind evaporator/Legends|mind evaporators]]<ref name="Holiday Special" /> and [[Holoprojector/Legends|holoprojectors]].<ref name="Thought as Action">{{SWGTCG|set=Threat of the Conqueror|cardname=Thought as Action}}</ref> When a user inserted a certain [[cassette]] into a [[Brain/Legends|mind evaporator]] and interfaced with the machine<ref name="Holiday Special" /> for erotic purposes,<ref name="Insider 23" /> a fantasy of theirs would be conjured from their deepest desires and appear before them. Mermeia was one such fantasy.<ref name="Holiday Special" /> Also accessible via holoprojectors, Mermeia appeared as a hologram to a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]]<ref name="Thought as Action" /> shortly after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]],<ref name="Star Wars Galaxies">''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]''</ref> an engagement fought in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]].<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> The Twi'lek accessed a portable holoprojector in a public [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] and watched intently as Mermeia danced.<ref name="Thought as Action" />{{Gamemechanics}}Around the same time, a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] received a mind evaporator on the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[holiday]] [[Life Day/Legends|Life Day]], and interacted with Mermeia after bringing the device home.<ref name="Galaxies">{{SWG|An Empire Divided}}</ref>{{Endgame}}In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="Leland Holiday">{{SWBoards|url=message.jspa%3fmessageID=15778940.1.html|thread=Holocron continuity database questions|user=[[Leland Chee|Leland Y Chee]]|date=October 12, 2006|time=6:13 PM|archiveurl=http://www.tm-travolta.net/archives/forums.sw.com/message.jspa%3fmessageID=15778940.1.html}}</ref> Mermeia appeared before a [[Color/Legends|colorful]] kaleidoscopic background to the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Attichitcuk/Legends|Attichitcuk]], who inserted her cassette into a mind evaporator while in the living room of [[Chewbacca's home|his home]], a [[Tree/Legends|treetop]] dwelling<ref name="Holiday Special" /> located in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Rwookrrorro/Legends|Rwookrrorro]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]].<ref name="Tyrant's Test">''[[Tyrant's Test]]''</ref> Mermeia flirted with Attichitcuk, who viewed her through his mind evaporator's helmet, and she told him that she was a creation of his desires, which heavily excited the Wookiee. She then sang the [[Music/Legends|song]] "[[This Minute]]," which spoke of a longing for her [[Time/Legends|time]] with Attichitcuk to last forever. After the song concluded, the satisfied Wookiee removed the helmet and returned to his [[Attichitcuk's family|family's]] preparations for a celebration of Life Day.<ref name="Holiday Special" />

name: Mira (Near-Human)
description: [[File:BvV.jpg|thumb|left|Mira witnessing the mock battle between her master and Asajj Ventress just before her death.]]Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] early in life, Mira was taken to the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. After [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduating]] from the [[Jedi academy|Temple's academy]], the respected [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Sora Bulq/Legends|Sora Bulq]] selected Mira as his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and together they traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] for several years. While Bulq was a famed [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|lightsaber duelist]], Mira did not demonstrate any prowess with the [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], instead focusing her energies into maintaining her Jedi calm and her skill in peacekeeping. Eventually, Mira passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="JMW" />When the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] erupted in the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Jedi Mira invoked the [[Right of Denial]], refusing to return to Coruscant to receive the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the newly formed [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Mira met with like-minded Jedi shortly after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|Battle]] of [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] and was selected to represent them when a meeting was called on [[Ruul (moon)|Ruul]]. The meeting, called by Master Bulq and Master [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]], was meant to open negotiations between the High Council and the dissident Jedi in hopes of preventing another [[Jedi Schism|schism]] within the Order. Arriving at her former master's estate, Mira joined fellow dissenters Master [[K'Kruhk]], [[Sian Jeisel]], and Jedi [[Rhad Tarn]] while Masters Windu and Bulq prepared for the meeting.<ref name="JMW" />Walking amongst the moon's gardens, Mira felt a disturbance in the Force and rushed to a cliff side to see her former master under attack by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]]. Unaware that her master was indeed in league with Ventress, for he had fallen to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] in the weeks leading up to the meeting, Mira leaped down to assist her former mentor. While Ventress and Bulq were in league, the [[Dathomirian/Legends|Dathomirian]] woman did not take orders from the [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]] and easily overpowered Mira before killing her. Shocked by her sudden death, Bulq carried his former Padawan's corpse up to his estate and mourned over her body. While there, Master Windu confronted Bulq about his betrayal and revealed the Weequay to be in league with Ventress and the Confederacy.<ref name="JMW" />

name: Mrrov
description: Seeking meaning in her life, Mrrov partook in a religious revival presented by [[t'landa Til]] priests visiting [[Togoria/Legends|Togoria]]. Consumed by the pleasurable [[Exultation]], Mrrov joined the pilgrims bound for [[Ylesia/Legends|Ylesia]]. Little did she know that, like all the others, she had been deceived into slavery in the [[Spice/Legends|spice]] refineries on that [[Planet/Legends|world]]. However she soon figured out that the Ylesian operation was a sham; when she asked to leave the priests showed her Muuurgh's picture and threatened to kill him if she tried to escape.Mrrov was rescued by Muuurgh when he made his escape from Ylesia with [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Bria Tharen]]. She and Muuurgh, along with the two [[Human/Legends|Human]] escapees, returned to Togoria and were married. Their relationship would continue, with Mrrov bearing three female kits. She later returned to Ylesia as part of a small Togorian contingent working with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] force that [[Battle of Ylesia|conquered]] Ylesia; during the battle she lost an eye and possibly a paw from a [[Force pike/Legends|Force pike]] wound inflicted by one of the [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]] guards.

name: Nadaa
description: {{Quote|The Overseer&hellip; Saquesh&hellip; he took my daughter to sell to the Hutts. He took my daughter to sell to the Hutts. All because I told him I could not pay his tribute.|Nadaa|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}Near the end of the [[Dark Wars]] in [[3951 BBY]],<ref name="CAMP">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Nadaa was a [[Refugee/Legends|refugee]] who lived with her daughter, [[Adana (Human)|Adana]], in the [[Refugee Sector]] on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]], [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]]. At some point during this [[Time/Legends|time]], Adana was kidnapped by the local [[Exchange]] crime boss, a [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] named [[Saquesh]], due to Nadaa's unpaid tribute of 600 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to the Exchange. Saqueesh planned to sell Adana to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]] to pay the debt.<ref name="KOTOR2" />{{GameLSmechanics|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}While visiting the moon in search of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Zez-Kai Ell]], [[Meetra Surik]], a former [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], spoke with Nadaa. She told Surik that her daughter was being held by the Exchange, and she begged Surik to help her. Surik agreed to help Nadaa rescue Adana, and she went to meet with Saquesh.<ref name="KOTOR2" /> Surik attempted to intimidate Saquesh to release Adana, but Saquesh was not swayed and immediately attacked Surik. The former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knight [[Death/Legends|slew]] the Quarren and his guards and released Adana from her [[Prison/Legends|cell]].<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|127|Saquesh}}</ref> Surik returned to Nadaa, who thanked Surik profusely for her help.<ref name="KOTOR2" />{{Endgame}}

name: Naeshahn
description: Brought to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] at an early age after being identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Naeshahn entered the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]] to begin [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. When she was old enough, Naeshahn was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and she began one-on-one training that would last for over a decade before taking and passing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="AOW" />Accepting missions and assignments from the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], Naeshahn was an active Jedi in the decade before the reemergence of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. While she would never learn of the Sith's machinations, she would suffer the ripple effects of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark sider's]] manipulation of events. After taking on young [[Ebor Taulk]] as her Padawan, the pair was dispatched by [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] to investigate the disturbance in the [[Yinchorri system]]. Upon their arrival, the Sith-incited violence on [[Yinchorr/Legends|Yinchorr]] overwhelmed Naeshahn and Padawan Taulk and they were killed by the war-like [[Yinchorri]]. At the behest of [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], the architect of the uprising, [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]] and [[Kinman Doriana]] arranged for the bodies of the Jedi to be shipped to the [[Presidential Tower]] of the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]] on Coruscant. [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Finis Valorum/Legends|Finis Valorum]] then contacted the High Council in hopes that they would send a larger strike force to deal with the [[Yinchorri Uprising]].<ref name="AOW" />

name: Narek-Ag
description: In [[23 ABY/Legends|23 ABY]], Nareg-Ag and Trebor departed from [[Coruscant One]] with a full load of cargo destined for [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]]. While accelerating to [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]], the ''Moon Dash'' collided with the upper docking tower of the ''[[Shadow Academy]]'', which had been [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaked]] at the time and thus undetectable.The impact of the collision had caused a breach in the ''Moon Dash''{{'s}} hull, but that would turn out to be the least of their worries for the impact had also damaged the small shuttle's hyperdrive engines. A chain reaction built up inside the chambers of the engines, which would result in the destruction of ''Moon Dash'' and the deaths of Trebor and Narek-Ag.

name: Neela
description: After her husband was murdered by [[Navik|Navik the Red]] during the clan purges, Neela fled [[Rodia/Legends|Rodia]] with her then-two-year-old son, along with other members of her family and [[Tetsu clan]], for the safety of the [[Jungle/Legends|jungle]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[U-Tendik]]. There, she gave birth to her second son, [[Pqweeduk]], and raised the boys in the more peaceful ways of their clan. She tried to shelter Greedo and Pqweeduk from their violent past, but thirteen years later Greedo discovered one of the hidden colony ships and wanted to know more. Soon afterward, Navik and other [[Chattza Clan]] hunters found the refugees, slaughtering them. Neela, her sons, her brothers, and a few remnants of the clan barely got away, relocating to [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]].
