Neela hoped to eventually move them into the protection of [[Avaro Sookcool]].<ref name="New Essential Guide to Characters">''[[The New Essential Guide to Characters]]''</ref>

name: Nevana
description: Nevana met a drunk [[Jal Te Gniev]], who mentioned that [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] was on [[Jazbina/Legends|Jazbina]]. A secret [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] supporter, Nevana nevertheless gave the name to the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Sarma]] in exchange for canceling a debt owed by her [[Nevana's father|father]], as she did not recognize it and figured him to be a criminal. Sarma betrayed Nevana to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]], and she fled to the [[Unidentified bar (Dubrava)|cantina]] to ask Gniev what she had done. She was horrified to realize that she had turned in one of the Rebellion's greatest heroes, but did not have time to dwell long on it, as Imperial [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]], tipped off by Sarma, [[Attack on a Dubravan bar|stormed]] in and shot her in the back.

name: Nyiestra
description: Growing up on the pacifistic [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], Nyiestra knew [[Tycho Celchu]] through her entire childhood, and the two became close friends. By the time they reached adolescence, he was certain he wanted to marry her, and she reciprocated his love. They spent as much time as possible together, eager to enjoy each other's company.<ref name="The Bacta War" /> Celchu proposed as soon as he was of age, and Nyiestra agreed to both marry him and wait until he had graduated from the [[Imperial Naval Academy|Imperial Academy]], made it through his first year as a [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]], and been moved into fleet operations where his life would be secure enough professionally to begin a family.<ref name="The Bacta War" /><ref>''[[X-Wing Rogue Squadron 9: Battleground: Tatooine, Part 1]]''</ref> Celchu was tremendously certain in his relationship with Nyiestra, sure that she provided an unshakable future for him.<ref name="The Bacta War" />However, Nyiestra died in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] when the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star]] [[Destruction of Alderaan|destroyed]] Alderaan and, in so doing, eliminated that certain future. Celchu was traumatized, throwing himself into battle against the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] that had taken his family and fiancée from him, dedicating himself to making sure no one else suffered their fate. However, in so doing, Celchu became a hardened warrior, someone the pacifistic Nyiestra would not have understood. He realized that, by taking the action he felt was necessary and opposing the Empire, he had become someone fundamentally unsuitable for Nyiestra&mdash;a loss which cut him deeply, though he accepted it as inevitable.<ref name="The Bacta War" />

name: Oola/Legends
description: {{Quote|Oola keeps Jabba happy. Jabba keeps Oola alive.|Bib Fortuna|The Nightsister's Revenge}}[[File:Oola.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Oola in her dancing outfit.]]By no later than [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]],<ref name="The Essential Atlas">''[[The Essential Atlas]]'' sets [[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Return of the Jedi'']] at the start of [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], so Oola last saw her father four months before the end of [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]].</ref> [[Oola's father/Legends|Oola's father]] became the renowned chief of his [[Ryloth Clan|eight hundred–person clan]], granting both himself and his family considerable power and influence. Despite this, he provided Oola with little or no formal education, as Twi'lek society held that educating women was a threat to male authority. She instead devoted herself to dancing, which won her dozens of admirers, including the visiting Twi'lek criminal, Bib Fortuna.<ref name="FF" /> Clan custom gave Oola's [[Parent/Legends|father]] the right to sell her, but Fortuna had doubts that the chief would agree to this, so he abducted the girl during the night.<ref name="A Time to Mourn, a Time to Dance: Oola's Tale">''[[A Time to Mourn, a Time to Dance: Oola's Tale]]''</ref>She and [[Sienn'rha]], another Twi'lek, were trained together as dancers at one of the greatest dance schools on Ryloth. As they were in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] on their way to [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]], [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] ran into them and attempted to set them free. He killed Rudd and rescued Sienn, but Oola wanted to see what Palace life was like, naively thinking she would be able to leave at any time. Little did she know that it wouldn't be what she expected. Fortuna took Oola, and succeeded in giving her to Jabba.<ref name="RotJ" />Rather than the customary dancing veils, Oola was given only a flimsy net costume to wear, loosely held together by narrow leather strips. Jabba was immediately enamored with her, and chained her by the neck to his throne as his personal property and [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] girl. Oola was forced to dance for him, as well as give pleasure when the depraved [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] beckoned, but she was determined to escape from her horrible existence, one way or another.Defiled and miserable, fed only scraps, she could not decide if it was better to keep enduring the Hutt's carnal embrace until escape was possible, or to die cleanly and well, and escape that way. Oola chose to refuse Jabba's advances at least once before her final dance, and was thoroughly beaten by his [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]] guards for this act of defiance. This beating was conducted "scientifically", so as not to leave her with any disfiguring bruises.<ref name="RotJ" /> She even got to witness Jabba execute a prisoner by feeding him to [[Jabba's rancor|his rancor]], which terrified Oola.<ref name="A Time to Mourn, a Time to Dance: Oola's Tale" />[[File:Oola defies Jabba.jpg|thumb|right|180px|Oola defies Jabba.]]Later that day, Oola was able to speak briefly with [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]], who told her that Luke was indeed going to return to rescue them, and her hope was renewed. Her spirits high for the first time since her imprisonment, Oola performed the best dance of her life, which unfortunately would also be her last.<ref name="RotJ" />Enticed by her performance, Jabba pulled on her chain, wanting more than dance from her. Having suffered such invitations before, Oola refused, grabbing her end of the the leash. As she hauled back on her chain and pleaded with Jabba, he became angry and tugged harder, bringing her over the trapdoor in front of his throne. Once Oola was standing above the trapdoor, Jabba dropped her into a pit to suffer the same fate of those who resisted him. She was eaten alive by the rancor after Jabba dropped her into the rancor's pit.<ref name="LUP">''[[Let Us Prey: The Whiphid's Tale]]''</ref> Her legend, however, would live on in the form of impersonator [[Dame Needa]], who put on a nightly Oola tribute show at the [[Gardulla Oola]] hotel and casino in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]].<ref name="RotJ" />

name: Opula Deget/Legends
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], she was a rising singing star who gave scandalous stories to the media to hurt her competitors and boost her own career.

name: Paleel
description: In [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]], she survived the attack of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] forces against the medical center, and the [[Republic Mobile Surgical Unit/Legends|RMSU]] was moved to a new location. When the Republic forces discovered that the [[Bota]] had no use any more, Paleel and the whole personnel left Drongar.{{Char-stub}}

name: Politrix
description: Politrix was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived in the final [[Standard year/Legends|years]]<ref name="DR" /> of the [[Republic Classic era]].<ref>{{CSWECite|I|363|Great Peace of the Republic}}</ref> Raised at the [[Jedi Temple]] on the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] after having been discovered to be sensitive to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], Politrix was a contemporary of fellow [[Jedi academy|academy]] [[Jedi Initiate|initiates]] [[Jang Li-Li]] and [[Jai Maruk]]. During their [[Time/Legends|time]] at the Temple, Politrix and Maruk harbored secret feelings for each other, but they stayed true to the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]], and their relationship never blossomed. Eventually, Politrix achieved the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] after completing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]].<ref name="DR" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|erupted]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] on the planet [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]]<ref name="DR" /> in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> Politrix received the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the newly-formed [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the start of the war, Politrix was leading [[Trooper/Legends|troops]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] when she was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by a [[Plasma grenade/Legends|plasma grenade]] during an ambush. Maruk remembered his dead friend nearly [[19 BBY/Legends|three years later]] on a [[Mission to Vjun (Clone Wars)|mission]] to [[Vjun/Legends|Vjun]].<ref name="DR" />

name: Puroth
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Eirrauc]], Puroth received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] before ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Having constructed a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], which she wielded in one of her four hands, Master Puroth selected the [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] [[Nystammall]] as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. Training him to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Master Puroth worked with him well after his leaving her tutelage.<ref name="US" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Master Puroth took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Leading [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] in the war, Puroth continued to work with her former Padawan on many missions. Together, the pair were dispatched to the planet [[Tovarskl]] where they were assigned to [[Battle of Tovarskl|defend]] the Republic from the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]]. Encountering the [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies|leader]] of the Separatist army, [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]], Master Puroth engaged the [[Kaleesh/Legends|Kaleesh]] [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] in a [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|lightsaber duel]]; because she could match Grievous while wielding four lightsabers at once, she proved to be one of the General's most challenging opponents. However, Grievous eventually [[Dismemberment/Legends|dismembered]] and killed Puroth. He then took her lightsaber as a prize, adding it to his collection of Jedi weapons.<ref name="US" />

name: Quatra
description: Juhani, a [[Cathar (species)|Cathar]], had much trouble controlling her emotions and finding peace within herself. Master Quatra devised an unorthodox plan to test her Padawan's spirit. During a [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber training]] duel, Juhani failed her master's test. She lashed out in anger during their training session and struck Quatra down. Though Quatra only received minor wounds, she feigned [[Death/Legends|death]] in order to test Juhani even more. Filled with fear and guilt at the 'death' of her master by her own hands, Juhani fell to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and fled the Enclave, intent on never returning.Juhani was later found by a redeemed [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], meditating in an [[Ancient Grove|ancient grove]] near the old [[Rakatan ruins (Dantooine)|Rakatan ruins]]. After a brief duel, Revan proved to be the stronger of the two and was able to convince Juhani to forsake the dark side. Juhani returned to the Enclave seeking forgiveness from the [[Dantooine Jedi Enclave Council]]. The Council was exceedingly grateful to see Juhani come back to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and praised Revan for his assistance. They also informed Juhani that Master Quatra was not dead after all, but had only been injured in their duel, and that the duel itself was Quatra's last trial for her Padawan.

name: Rachott
description: In [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]], she was stationed in the [[Republic Mobile Surgical Unit 12]]. She was in charge of the analysis of the [[Bota]] harvest and discovered that the plant was losing its medical application. The boss of the xenobotanists should have made public these results, but the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] agent [[Kaird]] bribed him and the information remained as a secret. Rachott was in love with a [[Ugnaught/Legends|Ugnaught]] stationed on the [[RMSU-7]], [[Rorand Zuzz]], and told him this important event. Then, Rorand shared this information with the journalist [[Den Dhur]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Releqy A'Kla
description: Releqy replaced her father in the [[New Republic Senate]] after his [[Death/Legends|death]] at the hands of [[Shedao Shai]], a [[Yuuzhan Vong]] [[Commander/Legends|commander]]. Even after her father's murder, she advocated a peaceful solution to the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], though she had few allies in this. After the [[Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Coruscant]], she went to [[Dac|Mon Calamari]] with the majority of the Senate, and supported [[Cal Omas]] in his bid to become [[Chief of State (New Republic)|Chief of State]]. After winning the [[New Republic Presidential election, 28 ABY|election]], Omas appointed Releqy [[Minister of State]], and made her a member of the [[High Council (Galactic Alliance)|High Council]], where she voted against the use of the biological weapon [[Alpha Red (pathogen)|Alpha Red]]. She was also related to the [[Caamasi]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Ylenic It'kla]]{{Char-stub}}

name: Robetheri
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] from [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], [[Sister]] Robetheri was born to a [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] coven. She grew up learning the secrets of [[Dathomir Magic|Shadow Magic]] as well as fighting techniques. Thanks to her success on the battlefield, Robetheri eventually attained the rank of [[War Chief]] and rose to power in her clan.<ref name="GATORW" />During the wake of the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Robetheri controlled the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Prison/Legends|prison]] outpost located north of the [[Great Canyon (Dathomir)|Great Canyon]]. The witch had turned the prison's defenders into her puppets and set up a throne room in the late warden's office. She ruled over her people with an iron fist and had plans of conquering the entire planet, but she was overthrown by a group of [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side]] Witches.<ref name="GATORW" />

name: Rozatta
description: For years, Rozatta owned the [[Outland Station]] and would assist the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]] in finding bounties and sometimes even tell him where they were for her own small finder's fee.<ref>"Bounty Hunter: Prima's Official Strategy Guide"</ref>Rozatta would call Fett back to her station to secure the bounty of the [[Muttani]], [[Meeko Ghintee]], for various crimes. Ghintee was on her station, cheating at the pit fighting games using a remote device to control his beast.<ref name="BH">''[[Star Wars: Bounty Hunter]]''</ref>However, Ghintee wasn't the only reason why Roz had called Fett back to Outland Station. A transmission had come for the infamous bounty hunter from a man named [[Dooku/Legends|Tyranus]]. Tyranus made the proposition of giving Fett five million Republic [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to locate and capture [[Komari Vosa]], the leader of the [[Bando Gora/Legends|Bando Gora]], dead or alive.<ref name="BH" />Rozatta asked Fett not to take the bounty, explaining that it was too risky for him and could either "make" him or "break" him. She hoped that Fett would stop bounty hunting and just "meet a nice girl, settle down and have a kid". Fett ignored her warnings and Roz still gave Fett a lead to multiple bounties that might lead Fett to Vosa.<ref name="BH" />Rozatta's hopes for Fett would spring back when he took on a partner named [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]]. Commenting that she was "such a looker", Roz was disappointed later on when Wesell betrayed Fett to [[Gardulla Besadii the Elder/Legends|Gardulla the Hutt]]. She'd commented to Fett that she'd hoped they would "get together".

name: Sannah
description: In [[22 ABY]], Sannah was saved by the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] trainees [[Anakin Solo]] and [[Tahiri Veila]] during a trip to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Yavin 8]] to escort [[Lyric]], a [[Melodie]] who was to undergo an important [[Changing Ceremony|form-changing ceremony]]. Sannah was discovered by the pair to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] after she fought a [[raith]]. Back at the [[Jedi Praxeum]] on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]], she was accepted as a trainee by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]]. Sannah also taught Anakin and Tahiri how to read [[Massassi/Legends|Massassi]] inscriptions and break the curse of the [[Golden Globe]].Sannah became a cadet of the [[New Jedi Order]] and trained alongside [[Valin Horn]]. Along with Valin, she stayed behind in the [[Great Temple (Yavin 4)/Legends|Great Temple]] with Anakin Solo, Tahiri Veila and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Ikrit]] to fight off the [[Peace Brigade]], much to Anakin's chagrin. While trying to escape Yavin 4, Sannah laughed when Valin caused a group of [[Insect/Legends|insects]] to attack [[Remis Vehn]], forcing Anakin to chastise them for their actions. Sannah later went on to survive the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] and was present on [[Zonama Sekot/Legends|Zonama Sekot]] when Luke Skywalker [[Conclave on Zonama Sekot|called all Jedi there]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Selestrine
description: Selestrine was a psychic [[Icarii]] with precognitive powers. As the leader of her tribe, she was captured by [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Abal Karda]], who hoped that the threat of her execution would convince the Icarii to surrender. When this strategy proved ineffective, Karda authorised the use of a bio-agent which wiped out the entire species. Realizing that she was now the last of her kind, Selestrine acquired poison and tried to kill herself, but Colonel Karda, who wanted to profit from Selestrine's prophecies, decapitated her and developed technology allowing her head to survive in a plain, [[Kneeb]]-hide casket.Furious that she had been denied her death, Selestrine tricked Karda with a prophecy suggesting that his hated superior, [[General/Legends|General]] [[Nim]], would soon die, and that Karda would soon receive a significant promotion. However, when Nim arrived to take possession the casket from Karda on the orders of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], Karda became enraged, killing his commander and ensuring his promotion to the status of Enemy of the Empire. He fled with Selestrine and claimed sanctuary in the hermitage of the [[Ancient Order of Pessimists]] on [[Maryx Minor/Legends|Maryx Minor]].[[File:Selstrinebox.jpg|thumb|left|Selestrine's head.]]

name: Shadday Potkin/Legends
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Shadday Potkin was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], Potkin had constructed a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to wield during her services to the Order. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Master Potkin took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and began sitting in on strategy reports at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]].<ref name="ROTS" />When the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] of the Republic, [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the Grand Army, the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] dutifully turned their [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] on the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] leaders. Potkin managed to evade execution and returned to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] where she saw the Temple in ruins and her [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] comrades slain. While on the capital world, Master Potkin discovered that [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], the man who ordered the dissolution of the Order and the new [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]], was indeed the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] the Order had been hunting.<ref name="R80">''[[Republic 80: Into the Unknown, Part 2]]''</ref>[[File:PotkinDeath.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Potkin is killed by Darth Vader.]]Leaving [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and going to ground, Master Potkin concocted a scheme to entrap Palpatine's [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. Calling a [[Jedi conclave|conclave]] on the planet [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]], Master Potkin's [[Conclave on Kessel|meeting]] would be held in an abandoned [[Spice/Legends|spice]] [[Mining/Legends|mine]]. As her peers showed up under the pretense that they would discuss the future of the Order, it became quite clear to all that Master Potkin was actually manipulating them for her own obsessive purpose. As her target, Darth Vader, stormed the complex and headed to Potkin's planned ambush, the other [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] ignited their [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] in preparation of the surprise attack.<ref name="SWP" />Numbering eight, Potkin and her allies attacked Vader. Armed with a rare [[cortosis blade]], Potkin was able to deactivate the Sith Lord's crimson-bladed weapon after he cut down [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Sia-Lan Wezz]]. Believing that she had the upper hand, Potkin's victory was quickly cut short when Vader simply grabbed her by the neck and snapped the woman's spine. Caught up in Potkin's plan, all six of the other [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] present were killed.<ref name="SWP" />

name: Shaleena
description: Shaleena was born and raised in the [[Undercity (Taris)|Undercity]], and had never seen the sky. As a child, she was enchanted with the tales of [[Rukil]], but eventually became disillusioned with his beliefs in the [[Promised Land]]. She still respected him though, as she did [[Gendar]]. She tried to maintain a decent standard of behavior amongst her fellow villagers, and chided those who resorted to begging and mugging. She was friendly to strangers, longing to hear tales of the Upper City especially.<ref name="kotor" />She, along with the other Outcasts; left the village for the Promised Land when its location was discovered in 3956 BBY.<ref name="kotor" />

name: Shyla Merricope
description: In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], in the months leading up to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Shyla Merricope and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Garm Bel Iblis|Iblis]] withdrew the [[Corellian sector/Legends|Corellian sector]] from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in protest of the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]]. Since the Corellians proved to be one of the harshest critics against the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army]] that the Republic established. After the announcement of Corellia's withdrawal, Shyla stated at a press conference since she couldn't allow other worlds to use their own security units to battle against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. She was later replaced by [[Dupas Thomree]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Shylar
description: {{Quote|I will ''die'' before I talk, Dooku.''"<br />"''No. You will talk and ''then'' you will die. All of the mind tricks you know to control pain are known to me as well. And, I know to ''circumvent'' them. You will suffer, you will tell me what you learned while you were sneaking around my camps, and you will die. Painfully. Increase the power, Kadrian.|Shylar and Dooku|Jedi: Count Dooku}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Shylar lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]].<ref name="JCD" /> At some point during her youth, Shylar had a relationship with fellow [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]]. However, as the Order [[Jedi Code/Legends|forbade]] romantic attachment of its members, both eventually ended their relationship.<ref name="SWR71,R3" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] broke out between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], the latter led by Jedi-turned-[[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]].<ref name="TNEC" />[[File:ShylarQuinlan.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Padawans Shylar and Quinlan Vos]]Six [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the beginning of the war,<ref name="TNEC" /> Shylar volunteered to infiltrate Dooku's [[Dooku's Antar 4 headquarters|headquarters]] on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Antar 4/Legends|Antar 4]]<ref name="JCD" /> as one of the agents of Jedi Master [[Tholme/Legends|Tholme]].<ref name="SWR71,R3" /> However, she was captured and soon became the subject of intensive [[Torture/Legends|torture]] by Dooku and [[Dark Acolyte]] [[Kadrian Sey]], who held her in a [[Containment field/Legends|containment field]]. Shylar refused to reveal any information about her mission, although Dooku was unimpressed and simply continued interrogating her. During one of these torture sessions, Shylar's old friend Vos&mdash;similarly on assignment to infiltrate Dooku's inner circle&mdash;returned from a mission for the Count. Shylar was furious upon seeing Vos,<ref name="JCD" /> cursing him<ref name="SWR71,R3" /> and calling him a traitor to the Order. Vos, unable to help his friend unless he wanted his cover exposed, was forced to let her anguish continue.<ref name="JCD" /> Shylar was eventually [[Death/Legends|killed]] during another torture session.<ref name="SWR71,R3" />After eventually withdrawing from the Confederacy in<ref name="SWR71,R3" /> [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> Vos reported back to Tholme and the [[Council of Reconciliation/Legends|Council of Reconciliation]], the Jedi Order's body that passed judgment over fallen Jedi. Detailing his interaction with Shylar in Dooku's retreat, he cleared her name of any suspicion of being a possible traitor, as the Order had no information about her status. Vos revealed his relationship with Shylar to the Council<ref name="SWR71,R3" /> and would fight the rest of the war hoping to one [[Standard day/Legends|day]] atone for the death of his old friend.<ref name="SWR75,SoS2">''[[Republic 75: Siege of Saleucami, Part 2]]''</ref>

name: Simms
description: A [[Chalactan/Legends|Chalactan]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Simms was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Embracing her Chalactan heritage, Master Simms had obtained the rank of [[Chalactan Adepts/Legends|Adept]] amongst the [[Convocation of Adepts]] as she wore both the [[Greater Mark of Illumination|Greater]] and [[Lesser Mark of Illumination|Lesser Mark]] of Illumination.<ref name="R79" />Wielding a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] of her own making, Master Simms selected [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] [[Noirah Na]] as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. Both Master and apprentice were forced into military roles as the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]; Master Simms was appointed as a [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] while Padawan Na took up the title [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]].<ref name="R79" />Surviving three years of war, Master and apprentice were assigned to the [[Battle of Toola|campaign]] on [[Toola/Legends|Toola]], both joined by [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] Master [[Kai Hudorra]] in the fight. Leading their [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] from atop [[Mastmot/Legends|motmots]], Simms was successful in repelling the Separatist Army, until her clone troopers betrayed her. Unknown to the Jedi at the time, [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] was the alter-ego of the mysterious [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]]. Sidious, under the guise of Palpatine, issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the Grand Army and they began to follow its directive: execute all Jedi. Directing Master Hudorra to take Padawan Na and flee, Master Simms laid down her life to allow the others to escape execution.<ref name="R79" />

name: Slatka
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Slatka and her brother [[Sladak]] were native to a seafaring world without forests of trees. In [[1000 BBY]], the siblings were [[Jedi recruiter|recruited]] into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[Army of Light]] by [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Torr Snapit]] to augment the Army's forces on [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]]. While descending through Ruusan's atmosphere Snappit's ship was attacked by [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Buzzard (starfighter)|buzzards]] of the [[Brotherhood of Darkness]] and ultimately destroyed. As the ship broke apart, both Sladak and Slatka were killed before ever receiving anything more than rudimentary training.{{Char-stub}}

name: Sylvn (Cerean)
description: Born in [[49 BBY/Legends|49 BBY]], Sylvn became impulsive and rebellious at an early age. At the age of six, Sylvn drew a picture in the classroom with an angry face in which the teacher showed to her parents. Mundi and Mawin were worried about Sylvn's development and huge opposition to them. In her pride, she told herself that she was inadequately treated, which reflected her frustration.Around [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], Sylvn unknowingly became involved in a smuggling ring involving [[Ephant Mon/Legends|Ephant Mon]], one of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt's]] agents, and one of the [[Cerean Elders]]. When this deal went sour, Sylvn, her boyfriend [[Maj-Odo-Nomor]], and her friend [[Twin (Cerean)|Twin]] were trapped on a freighter carrying 2,000 adult [[divvik]]s along with Ephant Mon. When her father, [[Ki-Adi-Mundi/Legends|Ki-Adi-Mundi]], came to her rescue, Mon threatened to blow them all up. Maj-Odo-Nomor tried to stop Mon, but was shot. Manually opening the outside hatch, Ki-Adi-Mundi managed to save his daughter. Unfortunately, Mon was saved as well, and Jabba proceeded to enslave both Sylvn and her friend, [[Twin (Cerean)|Twin]]. [[Ki-Adi-Mundi/Legends|Ki-Adi-Mundi]] eventually rescued the duo from being executed during an electrical storm.In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" /> Sylvn, together with the rest of Ki-Adi-Mundi's family, was killed in [[Battle of Cerea|a devastating battle]] on her home planet between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].

name: Tilenna
description: Living on [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]], Tilenna was separated from Teroenza for years while he led the [[Besadii/Legends|Besadii]] [[Spice/Legends|spice]] operation on [[Ylesia/Legends|Ylesia]]. As a way for keeping the t'landa Til priests in line [[Aruk Besadii Aora]], and later [[Durga Besadii Tai]], made it a rule that no t'landa Til females could be present on Ylesia. But when the simpleton [[Kibbick]] became the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] overlord of Ylesia, Teroenza was able to smuggle Tilenna and the other female t'landa Til to the planet without the Hutts knowing.Tilenna was killed when [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] sent assassins to Ylesia to kill all the priests in preparation for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] invasion known as the [[Battle of Ylesia]]. She was relaxing in a mudpool with Teroenza and [[Veratil]] when armed mercenaries burst from the cover of the forests and fired on them. She was shot and then suffocated in the mud when she could not raise her head up to get air.

name: Tinté Vos
description: Tinté began her career as a [[Kiffu Guardians|Kiffu Guardian]], rising in rank to be their leader, while Kiffu and Kiffex were under the more benevolent rule of her brother Sheyf [[Kurlin Vos]]. Motivated by greed for power, she sacrificed [[Pethros Vos|Pethros]] and [[Quian Vos]], father and mother of [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]], to the [[Anzat (species)|Anzati]] who were on Kiffex to worship "The Dreaming One", Anzati [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Volfe Karkko]].She then gave the guardian badges of his parents to young Quinlan, hoping to turn him to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and mold him into an heir for herself. This enraged Kurlin, who gave the [[Jedi Watchman]] [[Tholme/Legends|Tholme]] permission to take Quinlan to the [[Jedi Temple]] for training. In response, Tinté poisoned her brother and assumed his mantle as Sheyf.

name: Toryn Farr/Legends
description: [[File:Toryn-farr.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Toryn in the command center of [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]].]]Toryn Farr and her sister [[Samoc Farr|Samoc]] were raised on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrila]] within a [[Farr family|family]] that was loyal to [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]]. Opposed to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Farr's family enlisted the help of Chandrilan authorities and staged a [[Transport/Legends|transport]] crash, in which a number of children were supposedly killed, including the Farr sisters. The [[Sexes/Legends|girls]] were taken offworld and they joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]]. Farr's sister, Samoc, became a skilled [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] and the two were stationed in [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]].<ref name="TEGTW" /> As Chief Controller of Echo Command, Farr's primary duties included monitoring [[Realspace/Legends|space]] surrounding [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] and relaying orders to [[Troop/Legends|troops]] and vessels in the field.During the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], she commanded the base's [[V-150 Planet Defender/Legends|ion cannon]] when to fire on Imperial [[Starship/Legends|ships]] in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]]. Most notably, she gave the command which disabled the [[Imperial I-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial I''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Rebel Dream|''Tyrant'']], allowing the first [[GR-75 medium transport/Legends|GR-75 medium transport]], the [[Quantum Storm/Legends|''Quantum Storm'']], to escape through the blockade, which served as the opening shots of the engagement.Toryn was among the last Rebels to abandon Echo Base, leaving her station only after [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] ordered the final evacuation. After broadcasting the evacuation code signal to the surviving soldiers and pilots still engaging the Imperial assault force, she was the final person to leave the command center. Toryn escaped on the last transport to leave Hoth, the [[Bright Hope/Legends|''Bright Hope'']].Prior to boarding the transport, Toryn was stunned to see a large number of badly wounded soldiers still lying on the flight deck before the ship. Among the wounded was her sister, Samoc Farr, a talented [[T-47 airspeeder/Legends|snowspeeder]] pilot. Knowing her sister had been shot down led her to the realization of how truly horrific the battle outside had been.Toryn was instrumental in buying the wounded just enough time to board the transport before invading [[Cold assault stormtrooper|snowtroopers]] descended on the hangar. However, the time it took to load all the wounded onto the ship would prove to be the undoing of the ''Bright Hope'', as it was quickly disabled during its blockade run before being able to make the jump to [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]].Crippled and drifting through space with little hope of escape, Toryn assumed command of the survivors and implemented a plan to save as many Rebel lives as possible. Three [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pods]] holding eighteen of the most valuable personnel to the Rebel cause were launched back to Hoth, in the hopes they might survive.[[File:Of Possible Futures.jpg|thumb|right|230px|Farr and the bounty hunters]]Before the Imperials were able to capture the survivors of the ''Bright Hope'', the ship was boarded by the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] [[Zuckuss/Legends|Zuckuss]] and [[4-LOM/Legends|4-LOM]]. They masqueraded as rescuers, when they were actually responsible for firing on the ''Bright Hope'' and preventing its escape. The truth behind their facade was to take the Rebels and use them as bait to capture Han Solo, and later, turn him in to [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]].Following a brief melee, Toryn convinced the bounty hunters to take all ninety remaining Rebels on board and deliver them to the Rebel underground on [[Darlyn Boda/Legends|Darlyn Boda]]. Before evacuating the ship, she dutifully erased all [[Computer/Legends|computer]] records on board, preventing vital information from falling into Imperial hands, including the names of many personnel who served at Echo Base.After spending a month on Darlyn Boda following her escape from Hoth, Toryn finally rejoined the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Rebel fleet]] at the secret [[Haven (rendezvous point)|rendezvous point]]. For her brave efforts in assuming command to rescue the survivors of the ''Bright Hope'', she was promoted to the rank of [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] in a ceremony led by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Carlist Rieekan/Legends|Carlist Rieekan]] aboard the [[EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate/Legends|EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate]] [[Redemption/Legends|''Redemption'']].She was also given command of a group of [[Alliance Special Forces/Legends|Alliance Special Forces]], with her first mission being to rescue the eighteen members of the ''Bright Hope'' who were jettisoned back to Hoth.

name: Tray
description: Like all Freelies, she sabotaged the factories of [[Vorzyd IV]], to make the people realize that the job was not the main thing in a perfect society that the [[Vorzydiak]]s tried to built. [[Flip]] and her opposed the leader [[Grath (Vorzydiak)|Grath]], disagreeing with many of his ways. However, Flip actually wanted to keep the attention of his leader, in order to make Grath rely on him. He destroyed a building, killing many beings, including himself. Tray and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] tried to rescue him but it was too late.

name: Trevael
description: Trevael was the leader of a clan on the northern hemisphere of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Sevarcos II]]. Her clan operated [[Spice/Legends|spice]] mines. Her people were rugged and preferred to mine the spice themselves in order to avoid interference by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] that wanted her to use prison labor to mine.<ref name="FTS" />

name: Tu'ala
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Tu'ala was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], studying at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. Selected to train as the [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Zuth]], Tu'ala constructing a [[Color/Legends|blue]]-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to wield on her missions with her master. One of Zuth's most important lessons he taught to Tu'ala was his explanation that sometimes the death of a single individual was necessary to ensure others could fulfill their destiny; a lesson Tu'ala had trouble understanding. She lost her Master some time prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], when he died saving some politicians from attempted assassination.<ref name="TL" />Obtaining the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Tu'ala was part of [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu's]] [[Geonosis strike team|Jedi strike team]] sent to [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] to rescue Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] from the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Separatist Council/Legends|leaders]] just prior to the start of the Clone Wars in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. At the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], she finally gained comprehension of Zuth's meaning and laid down her own life, taking a shot from a [[Geonosian/Legends|Geonosian]] soldier that was meant for Anakin Skywalker. Her effort went unnoticed and unappreciated; nevertheless, her deed allowed Skywalker to live on and, eventually, to destroy [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]] and return balance to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].<ref name="TL" />

name: Twin (Cerean)
description: In [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], Twin supported a movement by [[Bron (Human)|Bron]] and stood up for the development of advanced technologies on [[Cerea/Legends|Cerea]]. She and her friend Skeel joined the Techrats and went on a dangerous race they fought out within the Outsider Citadel.After Skeel crashed and died in the swoop race, Twin sought affection from Maj. Twin and her close friend [[Sylvn (Cerean)|Sylvn]] were once captured by [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]], and suffered the humiliation and disgust of serving as his [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] girls. She and Sylvn were later rescued by Sylvn's father, [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Ki-Adi-Mundi/Legends|Ki-Adi-Mundi]], during a lightning storm, in which the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] tried to execute them.

name: Vula
description: {{GameLSmechanics|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}One day, [[Koobis (First Jedi Purge)|Koobis]] paged her and said that [[Meetra Surik]] was coming to see [[Loppak Slusk]]. When she came in, Vula told her she didn't have an appointment. Despite that, Surik got in. On her way out, after her [[Skirmishes on Citadel Station|encounter]] with Slusk and [[Luxa]], she asked Surik not to kill her. Surik told her to leave the Exchange Suites if she wanted to live. She quickly did so.{{Endgame}}

name: Wioslea/Legends
description: {{Dialogue|Luke Skywalker|I want to sell this speeder.|Obi-Wan Kenobi|If we can get a fair price.|Luke Skywalker|Yeah. I paid twenty-four hundred for it, and I put a lot of work into it. I think it's worth a lot more.|Wioslea|Fifteen hundred is all I can offer you, human.|Luke Skywalker|Fifteen hundred? Look, this landspeeder's in great shape, even if it's not very pretty.|Obi-Wan Kenobi|We can accept no less than two thousand.|Wioslea|Your grip on reality is fragile, humans. It's the newer models that are in demand now, not these old ones. I shall probably have to sell it at a loss.|Obi-Wan Kenobi|But it's still not a fair price.|Wioslea|You touch a responsive chord in my&hellip; charitable nature, humans. Sixteen hundred.|attr=Wiosela negotiating the sale of Luke's landspeeder|src=Star Wars (radio)}}[[File:CZ-3 1.png|thumb|left|250px|Wioslea purchases Luke Skywalker's landspeeder]]Wioslea lived on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] and wore simple robes very similar to a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight's]]. She was once even accused of being a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. She never spoke about her past, however.She bought [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder]] for [[Spaceport Speeders/Legends|Spaceport Speeders]], a local [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] company that bought and sold [[Landspeeder/Legends|landspeeders]] and other vehicles.<ref name="Episode IV">[[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']]</ref> In order to finance the negotiated upfront fee for passage aboard the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] used a Jedi [[Mind trick/Legends|mind trick]] to persuade Wioslea into paying 2,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for the speeder, much more than it was worth.<ref name="SWJ">''[[Star Wars Journal: The Fight for Justice]]''</ref>[[0 ABY/Legends|Seven months]] after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Wioslea sold a landspeeder to [[Senior Anthropologist]] [[Mammon Hoole]].Wioslea was also a [[Gambling/Legends|gambler]]. Due to outstanding gambling debts, at the [[Time/Legends|time]] of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure's]] [[Death/Legends|death]], she owed him 1,000 credits. Wioslea was also able to speak many languages, including [[Bocce/Legends|Bocce]], [[Jawaese/Legends|Jawaese]], and [[Talz (language)|Talz]].

name: Xora
description: [[File:XoraDeath.jpg|thumb|left|Darth Vader chokes Xora to death.]]Shortly after the [[Evacuation of Yavin]], she, along with several of her Falleen co-workers (including [[Zuur]]), attempted to assassinate [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] during his visit to [[Void Station]] in revenge for his decimation of their species. They were no match for the mighty [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]], and were quickly slain. Before Xora's life expired, Vader told her he didn't like being reminded of his [[Time/Legends|past]], but Xora used her last words to tell the Sith Lord that he couldn't escape his past.{{Char-stub}}

name: Yané/Legends
description: [[File:YaneTraining-QiD.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Yané, shooting a training droid during her handmaiden training]]Yané and the other [[handmaiden]]s were trained in self-defense and marksmanship by [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala's]] head of security, [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Quarsh Panaka/Legends|Panaka]].<ref>''[[Queen in Disguise]]''</ref> She was also a musician.<ref name="CCGCL">{{CCG|set=Coruscant Limited|link=Coruscant-Light/large/yane.gif|cardname=Yané}}</ref>The youngest of all the handmaidens,<ref>{{Blog|teekay-421|32|Handmaiden ID Roster|Sompeetalay's Source Blog|Tim Veekhoven|archivedate=20060505000548}}</ref> Yané remained behind with [[Saché/Legends|Saché]] during the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Trade Federation Crisis]] when the [[Queen/Legends|Queen]], [[Sabé/Legends|Sabé]], [[Rabé/Legends|Rabé]] and [[Eirtaé/Legends|Eirtaé]] fled the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] with the help of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]].<ref name="TPM" />Yané was later reunited with Queen Amidala and her fellow handmaidens after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Battle of Naboo]], and attended both [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn's]] [[Funeral of Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|funeral]] and the Celebration [[Parade/Legends|Parade]].<ref name="TPM" />

name: Ymile
description: [[File:YmileLando.jpg|thumb|left|Ymile with Lando Calrissian]]During [[Dominic Raynor]]'s tenure as [[Baron Administrator/Legends|Baron Administrator]] of [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]], Ymile frequented the bars and casinos of the elaborate getaway. However, Ymile was unhappy with her residence at Cloud City, and longed to explore [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], but with Raynor's duties as Administrator, she was forced to stay.Luckily for Ymile, a savvy gambler named [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] began to frequent [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]]. Conspiring with [[Lobot/Legends|Lobot]], who wanted the corrupt Raynor out of office, Ymile devised a plan to make Dominic lose ownership of Cloud City so that they could see the rest of the galaxy. In a high-stakes [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] game with [[Barpotomous Drebble/Legends|Barpotomous Drebble]], another patron of the Cloud City casino, Ymile used a [[Skifter/Legends|skifter]] placed inside a pendant on her neck to allow Calrissian to win. As Ymile left the casino, a thief named [[Zlato]] stole her pendant and began to flee before Calrissian trapped the robber in his cape. In a brief discussion, Lando returned the pendant to Ymile and dubbed her his "Lady Luck."Calrissian's extraordinary luck caused Raynor to take interest, and he challenged Calrissian to a game. However, his luck ran out, as Drebble, seeking his revenge, used another skifter within the dealer's deck to give the game to Raynor. Lando prepared to leave, but suddenly an unexpected gift of five million [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] was placed in his lap. Ymile was overjoyed at this turn of events, and used her skifter once more to help Calrissian win an easy victory and claim ownership of Cloud City. Ymile thanked the gambler for his hospitality and left the city with Raynor.

name: Sena Leikvold Midanyl
description: During the time of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Midanyl became chief aide of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Garm Bel Iblis]] of Corellia, and continued in this role after he joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. After Bel Iblis' split from [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]], she helped Bel Iblis and [[Irenez (Human)|Irenez]] plan their attacks against [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] forces. Although Midanyl harbored no love for Mothma, she eventually realized the [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrilan]] woman did not desire to be a new [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], and was the one who suggested that [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] request Bel Iblis to rejoin his old counterpart, knowing that he would never go back on his own.At some point in her life, she bore two sons, Peter and Dayvid; their father is at present unidentified. As of 9 ABY, they served aboard the Bel Iblis-aligned Dreadnought ''Harrier''.

name: Lanah Malo
description: She accompanied her friend, [[Bria Tharen]] on a mission to [[Devaron/Legends|Devaron]] to make contact with the local resistance and to assassinate the [[t'landa Til]] priest, [[Veratil]], who was conducting a revival there to recruit pilgrims to work as slaves in the spice processing factories of [[Ylesia/Legends|Ylesia]]. The plan failed when Veratil caught sight of [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] in the crowd and alerted his guards.She later disappeared when the Empire raided a resistance meeting on Corellia's eastern continent.

name: Marina Stele
description: Marina Stele's husband was a famous [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] who was abducted by the [[Bordal]]i during their war with [[Kuan]], in the hopes of making him serve them. When he proved uncooperative, they decided to abduct his family, too, in order to persuade him. Marina and Maarek fought their attackers but were both captured and taken to a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] for transport to [[Bordal]].During the flight, the ship was captured by the [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Vengeance II|''Vengeance'']], which was taking part in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire's]] invasion of the [[Taroon system]]. After some time spent as prisoners on the ''Vengeance'', Maarek agreed to serve aboard the ship, while Marina returned to Kuan to help with the transition to Imperial control and continue the search for her husband.

name: Teers/Legends
description: Teers was named after a local species of [[Teers (coral)|coral]]. She was responsible for monitoring [[Otoh Gunga/Legends|Otoh Gunga's]] power requirements, particularly those required to maintain its [[Hydrostatic field/Legends|hydrostatic fields]]. She communicated with the Gungan engineers who managed the [[Locap plant|locap]] roots that gave Otoh Gunga its power, making sure that the plant could handle the requirements of new additions to the city. Teers guarded the ancient records of the Gungan culture and knew many secrets of existed long forgotten Gungan hideouts.

name: Reina March
description: Reina March was the leader of anarchist organization called [[Edge-9]]. Edge-9 claims the destruction of the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] government and abolition of aristocracy and was known for appealing its political demands with violent means. Of course, not all members actively supported violence, but the behavior of Edge-9 also included bombing terrorism against multipurpose facilities such as police. The anarchist of Edge 9 planned the blast of the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]] in the past, and secretly plotted a [[Bomb/Legends|bomb]] along the pipeline extending from the extreme point, but this plan failed.March was a particularly radical faction within the organization, involved in the planning and execution of numerous violent acts. Even after the new order was enforced, the organization had survived, but the members gradually became less and, on the other hand, changed into a more fanatic group.

name: Kadrian Sey
description: [[File:KadrianSey-tattoos.jpg|thumb|left|120px|Kadrian Sey's facial [[Tattoo/Legends|tattoos]].]]Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at an early age, Kadrian Sey was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]] to become strong in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Constructing a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] for herself and adopting the traditional facial tattoos of her species, Sey was selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] for further training. After completing her apprenticeship as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Sey was elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and assigned long-term missions in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. As a result, she was abroad during much of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] which engulfed the Republic in the years leading up to the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|first battle of Geonosis]] and the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="Jedi: Count Dooku" />When the High Council recalled all Jedi and ordered them to take up military positions in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], Sey defied their summons, never returning to Coruscant. Abandoning her Jedi heritage, the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Dooku/Legends|Darth Tyranus]] corrupted Sey to the dark side and invited her to join him as a [[Dark Acolyte]]. Part of Tyranus' personal guard, Sey crafted for herself a [[Synthetic lightsaber crystal|red-bladed]] lightsaber, which she wielded well beside fellow acolyte [[Tol Skorr]].<ref name="Jedi: Count Dooku" />Tyranus, under his alter ego [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], leader of the Confederacy, led Sey, Skorr, [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]], and [[Sora Bulq/Legends|Sora Bulq]] on a diplomatic mission to liberate [[Tibrin/Legends|Tibrin]]. Marching into the royal palace, the group confronted the planetary ruler, [[Suribran Tu]], who quickly offered to betray the Republic and join Dooku's cause. The elderly Sith Lord asked his compatriots what their course of action should be: Sey arguing in favor of accepting the offer, reasoning that it would provide for continuity of government and allow for a smoother transition to the Confederacy. Fellow acolyte Vos immediately countered by stating that since Tu was a hated butcher, leaving him in power would only convince people that the Confederacy was no better than the Republic. Dooku opted for Vos' argument and [[Sai cha|beheaded]] Tu without further discussion.<ref name="Jedi: Count Dooku" />[[File:KadrianSeyDeath.jpg|thumb|left|300px|Sey's death at the hands of [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]].]]Sey also accompanied Dooku to [[Kiffu/Legends|Kiffu]], where the Count was meeting with [[Sheyf]] [[Tinté Vos]], along with Tol Skorr and Quinlan Vos. When the negotiations turned sour, Dooku ordered the acolytes present to assassinate the Sheyf and kill her guard. At this moment, Vos revealed his identity as a Republic agent, engaging Sey with his lightsaber and [[Sai tok|bisecting]] her at the waist in order to protect the legitimate leader of the world.<ref name="Jedi: Count Dooku" />

name: Aleco Stusea
description: {{Quote|Officially, yes, Duron, the Hunt is over. However, there is still ''one planet'' left to cleanse&hellip;|Aleco Stusea, to Duron Qel-Droma|Shadows and Light}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Near-Human]], Aleco Stusea was, by [[3993 BBY]], a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and a member of the [[Dantooine Jedi Enclave Council|Jedi Council]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine's]] [[Jedi Enclave]]. In the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] after the [[Great Sith War]], the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] launched the [[Great Hunt (Jedi)|Great Hunt]], aimed to eradicate the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-created monstrosities that still inhabited a number of worlds across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. In 3993 BBY, three years after the end of the war, the Great Hunt was declared officially over. However, shortly afterward, Stusea and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Enclave Council were told by [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] that there was still one remaining mission to complete. According to the High Council's wishes, Stusea and the Enclave Council called three [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]]&mdash;[[Human/Legends|Humans]] [[Duron Qel-Droma]] and [[Shaela Nuur]], and [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Guun Han Saresh]], together believed to be the very best [[Hunting/Legends|hunters]] in the entire Order&mdash;and informed them that they had been chosen to [[Cleansing of Korriban|cleanse]] the Sith [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Korriban]], a planet deeply steeped in the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]], of the vicious and highly dangerous [[Terentatek/Legends|terentatek]] [[Species/Legends|beast]]. Stusea was the one who directly broke the news to the three Jedi, and the Knights were sent away on their mission.<ref name="shadows" />[[File:Jediassembly.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Aleco Stusea sits on the Jedi Enclave Council.]]After Qel-Droma, Nuur, and Saresh left, Stusea discussed the matter in the council chambers with the other Masters of the Enclave Council, including Humans [[Vrook Lamar]] and [[Bala Nisi]], and the [[Selkath/Legends|Selkath]] [[Qual]]. Despite the decree of the Jedi High Council, Lamar and Nisi disagreed with the Council ordering only the three Jedi to Korriban. Although acknowledging that sending the Jedi to Korriban was risky due to the strong dark side temptation of the world, Stusea expressed faith in the Jedi High Council's wisdom, believing that together the three hunters could resist the pull of the dark side. However, despite their reputations, Qel-Droma, Nuur, and Saresh would all [[Death/Legends|perish]] battling terentateks&mdash;Qel-Droma and Nuur on Korriban, and Saresh on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], after a dispute that ended in the Twi'lek leaving the group.<ref name="shadows" /> Stusea went on to serve on the Jedi Enclave Council for many more years, finally leaving the august body after the outbreak of the [[Jedi Civil War]] in [[3959 BBY]]. It was believed that Stusea was killed at some point in the war, which ended with the [[Battle of Rakata Prime]] in [[3956 BBY]].<ref name="cswe" />

name: Bera Kazan
description: {{Quote|I hate to imagine what effect Dooku's Force Harvester is going to have on you.|Bera Kazan, to Anakin Skywalker|Star Wars: The Clone Wars (video game)}}Prior to the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] in late [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Bera Kazan was a criminal who engaged in illegal activities in order to gain [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. In addition to [[Sexes/Legends|her]] occupation as a [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]], Kazan also worked as a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] which she found to be a hazardous occupation, given the damage sustained to her personal [[Starship/Legends|starship]]&mdash;the ''[[Sarpazian Rose]]''&mdash;after numerous close encounters with [[Death/Legends|death]].<ref name="Clone Wars" />[[File:Force Harvester.JPG|thumb|left|250px|The Force Harvester, an ancient power source excavated by Kazan and Prax]]Bera Kazan joined the war on the side of the Separatists when [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] hired her tracking services in order to locate the [[Force Harvester]], an [[Great Hyperspace War|ancient]] power source that could be used to [[Force drain/Legends|drain]] the [[The Force/Legends|life energies]] of all living beings within close proximity. Paired with a fellow mercenary named [[Cydon Prax]], the two discovered the Harvester on the junk [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Raxus Prime/Legends|Raxus Prime]]. In the [[Standard month/Legends|month]] that followed the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|first battle]] of the Clone Wars, the Separatists excavated the device, although their activities raised the suspicions of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. A [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Republic task force]], led by [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Jedi Commander]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], was deployed to Raxus Prime where they engaged the Separatists' in [[Conquest of Raxus Prime|battle]]. Skywalker pursued the fleeing Count, but was soon captured and transported to [[Alaris Prime/Legends|Alaris Prime]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] located in the [[Alaris Expanse]] of the [[Kashyyyk system/Legends|Kashyyyk system]].<ref name="Clone Wars" />At the same time, Bera Kazan had been betrayed and also imprisoned along with Skywalker and a group of [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]]. After she informed Skywalker about the existence of the Force Harvester and Dooku's intention to test its power on them both, Kazan formed an alliance with the young [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] in order to survive the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord's]] machinations. Moments after Cydon Prax activated the Harvester, Skywalker used his [[Telekinesis/Legends|powers]] to break open the cage he shared with Kazan. At Kazan's insistence, he also freed the Wookiees from their cages. The two then stole a pair of [[Single Trooper Aerial Platform/Legends|STAPs]] and escaped the proximity of the life-draining energy wave that emanated from the Harvester. Along the way, they quickly warned a group of Wookiees to vacate their village in order to avoid the deadly effects of the Harvester.<ref name="Clone Wars" />Having earned the gratitude of the local Wookiee population on Alaris Prime, Bera Kazan arranged for two [[maru]] beasts to serve as transport for her and Skywalker. Using stealth, they discreetly infiltrated a Separatist outpost where they stole an [[Armored Assault Tank/Legends|Armored Assault Tank]], which they then used to infiltrate the enemy's base. After destroying several other [[Tank (vehicle)/Legends|tanks]] and dozens of [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]], Skywalker used the Separatists' communications tower and contacted the Republic for military assistance. Afterward, Kazan and Skywalker withdrew to a Wookiee village where they prepared for a Separatist attack and the arrival of Republic reinforcements.<ref name="Clone Wars" />When the Confederacy launched a ruthless assault on the village, Bera Kazan and Anakin Skywalker assisted a group of Wookiee [[Soldier/Legends|warriors]] in the defense of their homes. They managed to repel several waves of [[Droid/Legends|droid]] attacks, preventing the Separatists from overwhelming their position, until a Republic [[Acclamator-class assault ship|''Acclamator''-class assault ship]] landed nearby and offloaded a contingent of [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] and several [[TX-130 Saber-class fighter tank/Legends|TX-130 Saber-class fighter tanks]] led by [[General/Legends|General]] Kenobi. Taking control of one of the tanks, Skywalker and his [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] engaged the remaining enemy units while Kazan remained behind to secure the village with the Wookiees and [[Cloning/Legends|clones]]. The destruction of the [[Harbinger (landing ship)|''Harbinger'']], destroyed by Kenobi and Skywalker, signaled the Republic's victory as the remaining Separatists fully withdrew from Alaris Prime.<ref name="Clone Wars" />Bera Kazan's assistance to Anakin Skywalker enabled the young Jedi to report his findings to the Jedi Council regarding the Force Harvester and its greater purpose as the power source of the [[Dark Reaper]] [[Superweapon/Legends|superweapon]]. The information proved critical in the Jedi's efforts to destroy Count Dooku's new weapon of mass destruction, leading to a [[Battle of Thule|preemptive strike]] on the planet [[Thule/Legends|Thule]]. As the Republic invasion culminated with a direct assault on the ancient [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Kessiak]], Skywalker confronted and destroyed the Dark Reaper, ending the [[Dark Reaper Crisis|crisis]] that began with the superweapon's reconstruction.<ref name="Clone Wars" />

name: Lyshaa
description: Lyshaa claimed she killed the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] apprentice to gain prestige in the underworld, though this was not the first time the Zeltron had committed murder: years earlier, Lyshaa had killed her own family in a fit of rage. For her part in the murder of Fe Sun, Lyshaa was imprisoned on [[Brentaal IV/Legends|Brentaal IV]], where she befriended the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] warrior [[Ryyk (Wookiee)|Ryyk]]. When [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Shogar Tok]] assumed control of Brentaal IV during the Clone Wars, Lyshaa joined Ryyk and fellow prisoner [[Sagoro Autem]] in staging a prisoner revolt.[[File:Lyshaa rage.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Lyshaa in a rage against [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]].]]At the time, the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] was staging an assault on Shogar Tok's fortress&mdash;the former prison&mdash;and General Shaak Ti led her troops inside the structure. Ti and Lyshaa came face-to-face, though the Jedi Master was able to restrain her emotions and enlist Lyshaa's group to assist in bringing down Shogar Tok. While Autem, Ryyk and [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]] set out to disable the fortress defenses, Shaak Ti and Lyshaa embarked on a mission to capture Tok, culminating in a confrontation in the Commander's control room.Lyshaa used the natural charms of her species to seduce Shogar Tok, whereupon Shaak Ti arrived to force Tok's surrender. However, still distrustful of the Jedi, Lyshaa pulled a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] on Shaak Ti, shooting the [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] in the stomach, and pledged her allegiance to Shogar Tok. Shaak Ti managed to recover from her wound, and killed Tok after a fierce duel. Realizing the Jedi would again try to get her, Lyshaa fled, finding herself standing in a [[lightstorm chamber]]. Rather than hand herself over to the Jedi, suspecting that Ti would kill her as soon as she was within striking range, Lyshaa tripped the chamber's sensors, activating hundreds of laser beams. She was killed instantly.

name: Niebur Boton
description: Niebur Boton was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Zeltron/Legends|Zeltron]] [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After some time, Boton completed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|elevated]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="EAP" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Boton fought as a [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]]. In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], as the war came to an end, the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the Army's [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]], a command ordering them to kill their Jedi leaders. Boton survived at first, but was eventually found by the newly risen [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. [[Torture/Legends|Tortured]] by [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitor]] [[Antinnis Tremayne]], Boton succumbed to the intense interrogation and revealed the names of several of her surviving comrades. Boton died soon after and her body was transported to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] by several Imperial [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]. Meeting the body at its landing site, the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] took up the fallen Jedi's [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and mutilated her body with it.<ref name="EAP" />

name: Luxa
description: When [[Meetra Surik]] arrived on Citadel Station with [[Atton Rand]] and [[Kreia]] and made her way to the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] there, she was introduced to Luxa and [[Benok]], who was something of a rival of the Zeltron within the criminal group there as he was in charge of Slusk's "muscle". Later, after the party discovered the disappearance of the ''[[Ebon Hawk]]'' while collecting their possessions at the [[Telos Security Force]]'s station, Luxa offered to introduce Surik and her party to Slusk. In a not-so-subtle manner, Luxa let on to Surik that she found her to be "quite attractive". She would only assist Surik if she removed the [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] crime boss, thus allowing her to assume his position. In return, Luxa offered to assist in helping Surik find the ''Ebon Hawk''. However, the alliance was short-lived, as Luxa betrayed Surik in an attempt to cash in on [[G0-T0|Goto's]] [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on live Jedi, and was killed in the ensuing [[Skirmishes on Citadel Station|battle]].

name: Resa Greenbark
description: {{Quote|Mesa, my love, take good care care of our Resa.|Bomo Greenbark bids farewell to Mesa and Resa|Dark Times 1: The Path to Nowhere, Part 1}}Resa Greenbark was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Nosaurian/Legends|Nosaurian]] from the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[New Plympto/Legends|New Plympto]]. She was an only [[Youngling/Legends|child]]<ref name="BH4">''[[Dark Times 16: Blue Harvest, Part 4]]''</ref> and the daughter of [[Mesa Greenbark|Mesa]] and [[Bomo Greenbark]].<ref name="TPTN1" /> Her father Bomo was a [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[New Plympto resistance (Imperial Period)|Nosaurian resistance]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] and [[Cleansing of New Plympto|fought]] against the newly&ndash;[[Declaration of a New Order|formed]] [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]].<ref name="ITU1">''[[Republic 79: Into the Unknown, Part 1]]''</ref> The resistance made a last stand at [[Half-Axe Pass]] and held off the Imperial forces while those Nosaurians not involved in the fighting were evacuated. Bomo oversaw the evacuation of Resa and Mesa on the last of the [[Transport/Legends|transports]] but, having a duty to return to the fighting, was unable to join them despite Resa's pleas. The evacuees were taken to [[Cadgel Meadows]] where Mesa and Resa hoped to take a [[Starship/Legends|ship]] to [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]], but Imperial forces at the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] captured all of the evacuees.<ref name="TPTN1" /> Deeming them inadequate to add to the workforce, the Empire took them to [[Orvax IV]] to be sold for a profit as [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]].<ref name="TPTN2">''[[Dark Times 2: The Path to Nowhere, Part 2]]''</ref>On Orvax IV, Resa was taken to be sold by a [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] slaver, [[Orso Meeto]]. This resulted in Mesa being [[Death/Legends|killed]] when she attempted to stop a number of slavers from subsequently taking her daughter. Meeto sold the Nosaurian youngling to [[Dezono Qua]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Noble/Legends|noble]] on [[Esseles/Legends|Esseles]]. Bomo and the crew of the ''[[Uhumele]]'', who had rescued him and his companion [[Dass Jennir]] from New Plympto, [[Mission to Orvax IV|arrived]] on Orvax IV mere [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] later, too late to find Resa.<ref name="TPTN4">''[[Dark Times 4: The Path to Nowhere, Part 4]]''</ref>In Qua's fortified [[Qua family's villa|villa]] on Esseles, Resa was killed for [[E-10]]&mdash;Qua's [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]]&mdash;to prepare her as a meal for the noble, as was always done with the young slaves he purchased. However, unbeknownst to him, the crew of the ''Uhumele'' had located Resa's buyer and [[Assault on Dezono Qua's villa|attacked]] the villa soon after Resa had been eaten. Jennir confronted Qua as he attempted to escape, with Bomo and the other crewmembers arriving shortly before Qua revealed that he had eaten Resa. Jennir then shot and killed the noble with his [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] to spare Bomo from suffering the after-effects of killing Qua himself.<ref name="TPTN5" />

name: Mesa Greenbark
description: Mesa Greenbark lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[New Plympto/Legends|New Plympto]] in the [[Corellian sector/Legends|Corellian sector]] of the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]], the [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of her [[Species/Legends|species]]. Mesa married another Nosaurian named [[Bomo Greenbark]] and with him had a female child, who they named [[Resa Greenbark|Resa]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] began between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], the Nosaurians came to side with the Confederacy, and fought against Republic forces on their [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]]. After the defeat of the Confederacy in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], the [[New Plympto resistance (Imperial Period)|New Plympto resistance]] was left as one of the [[Separatist holdouts/Legends|Separatist holdouts]] and continued to fight against the newly formed [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in a conflict that became known as the [[Cleansing of New Plympto]].A [[Standard month/Legends|month]] after the declaration of the [[New Order/Legends|New Order]], the [[Politics/Legends|political]] regime of the Empire, the Nosaurians begun evacuating their women and children from New Plympto including Resa and Mesa. While the other male Nosaurians continued fighting the Empire in an area known as [[Half-Axe Pass]], Bomo personally saw his family and other evacuees to the transports they were using to escape. Before boarding the transport, Mesa and Resa asked Bomo to leave with them, but when he refused, they said a final farewell and boarded the final vehicle available. With the final passengers aboard the transports, the journey to the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] in the area known as [[Cadgel Meadows]] began, where Mesa and Resa intended to find transport to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]] in the [[Brema sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].The transports never reached Cadgel Meadows and were instead stopped by Imperial forces. All Nosaurians on board, including Mesa and her daughter, were then captured and moved off world to be sold as slaves. The Imperials brought them to the world of [[Orvax IV]], a well known slave world, where they hoped to sell them to the highest bidder. When the slavers came to take Resa for sale however Mesa attempted to prevent her daughter being separated from her and fought the slavers. Her attempts were in vain however and Mesa was killed in the attempt to save her daughter.

name: Chankar Kim
description: {{Quote|I don't know what Chankar saw in her.''"<br />"''We'll never know now.|Mace Windu and Jai Maruk, on Kim and Enwandung-Esterhazy|Yoda: Dark Rendezvous}}Chankar Kim was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived during the last [[Standard year/Legends|decades]] before the end of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. After being accepted and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Kim eventually reached the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and later that of a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Three [[Standard month/Legends|months]] before the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|outbreak]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]<ref name="DR" /> in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> she took [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy]], nicknamed "Scout," as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], although even [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] member [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and other [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] failed to see what potential Kim saw in the [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-weak girl.<ref name="DR" />Three months after Kim took Scout as her Padawan,<ref name="DR" /> Jedi Knight [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] was captured by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] during a mission on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]]. Windu assembled a [[Geonosis strike team|group of Jedi]] to free them,<ref name="AOTC">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref> and Kim was part of the task force. Before leaving, she told Scout that her Padawan would accompany her on the "next mission."
