However, the rescue mission turned into a full-scale battle against the Confederate [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid army]], and Kim [[Death/Legends|fell]] in the fight<ref name="DR" /> in the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]],<ref name="Arena">{{CSWECite|II|217|Kim, Chankar}} states Chankar Kim was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] arena, which ''[[Geonosis and the Outer Rim Worlds]]'' identifies as the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]].</ref> leaving Scout an orphaned Padawan with a case of survivor's guilt. [[19 BBY/Legends|Three years later]], her Padawan found another Master, [[Jai Maruk]]. However, on their [[Mission to Vjun (Clone Wars)|first mission together]], Maruk was killed too, leaving Scout once again without a Master.<ref name="DR" />

name: Elke Vetter
description: [[File:VetterTalon.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Vetter engaging Darth Talon]]{{Quote|Kill me if you will, Sith! The Princess has escaped!|Elke Vetter, to Darth Talon|Legacy 2: Broken, Part 2}}The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Elke Vetter was an [[Imperial Knight]] who served the [[Fel Empire]] during the [[Sith&ndash;Imperial War]] before [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Krayt]] [[Attack on Emperor Fel|overthrew]] [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]]. During the ensuing [[Second Imperial Civil War]], Vetter served as the [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] of Fel's daughter, [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Marasiah Fel]], as she acted as her father's emissary, and infiltrated planets in secret to discover which [[Imperial officer/Legends|Imperial officers]] remained loyal to him.<ref name="leg2" /> More than just Fel's bodyguard, Vetter was also the princess's master and friend, instructing her in the ways of the Imperial Knights.<ref name="cswe">{{CSWECite|III|304|Vetter, Elke}}</ref>In [[137 ABY]], Vetter was with Marasiah and the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Imperial Mission]]ary [[Astraal Vao]], as they infiltrated the world of [[Socorro/Legends|Socorro]]. Krayt ordered one of his [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]], the Twi'lek [[Darth Talon]]&mdash;who, as one of Krayt's most able servants, had recently been promoted to the position of [[Hand (One Sith)|Hand]]&mdash;to locate and kill [[Empire-in-exile|Emperor-in-exile]] Roan Fel. Planning to use the princess to find her father, Talon traveled to Socorro where the princess was hiding in the Imperial Mission's [[Imperial Mission temple|temple]]. Arriving on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]], Talon razed the temple, setting it on fire. However, Vetter prevented the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] from getting to Princess Fel by engaging Talon in a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] [[Duel on Socorro|duel]] in order to give the princess and Astraal Vao enough time to escape the planet.<ref name="leg2" />The duel ended when Vetter [[Cho mai/Legends|lost]] her left hand and was [[Shiak|stabbed]] through the right leg by Talon, before being kicked off a ledge. Defeated, Vetter told Talon that she could kill her, but the princess had escaped. Talon used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to interrogate Vetter, [[Drain Knowledge|pulling information from her mind]]. Talon used this information to develop a plan: she would let Marasiah lead her to her father or he would come to save her, and then Talon would kill both. Considering Vetter of no more interest, Talon unleashed a burst of [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]], killing the Imperial Knight.<ref name="leg2" />While escaping, Princess Fel felt Vetter's [[Death/Legends|death]] in the Force, and instantly wanted revenge. Vao told the princess not to dishonor Vetter's sacrifice, managing to convince the princess that duty came first, and that their duty was to survive. The two then made their escape to the planet [[Vendaxa/Legends|Vendaxa]].<ref name="leg2" />

name: Aidel Saxan
description: Several years after the end of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], she had become the first [[Five World Prime Minister]] of the [[Corellian system]]. She married fellow politician [[Denjax Teppler]], but they divorced amicably some years later. At the start of the [[Second Galactic Civil War]], she was middle aged.Saxan was assassinated by the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lady]] [[Lumiya]] in [[40 ABY]] during negotiations with [[Supreme Commander (Alliance/Republic)|Supreme Commander]] [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]] of the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]], the victim of a high-powered blaster shot to the chest. [[Thrackan Sal-Solo]], the [[Head of State/Legends|Head of State]] of [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], was suspected of involvement, which was proven afterward by Jacen and Lumiya.

name: Aleema Finn
description: Aleema and her husband, [[Kodo Finn]], were attacked by the [[Nashtah Gang]] who worked indirectly for [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]], shortly after leaving a dining establishment on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Kodo offered [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] but the leader of the gang, a [[Duros/Legends|Duros]], still expressed a desire to cause harm to the two [[Omwati/Legends|Omwati]] as a message to Kodo from Xizor for he and his wife to keep silent. [[Ekria]], [[Zonder]] and [[Drake Lo'gaan]] came to their rescue, however not before the Duros was able to hit Kodo once. The punch resulted in fourth-stage burns in the shape of the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] symbol. Kodo was branded.{{Char-stub}}

name: Ameesa Darys
description: After being identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at an early age, Ameesa Darys was taken to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] and inducted into the [[Jedi academy|academy]] housed within. After years of training, Darys [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] and was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec]]. The two traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] together on missions for many years before she was ready to take her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]]; which she passed. Made a Jedi Knight herself, Darys continued to study independently of her master, taking on the role of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="TEP" />At the end of the Clone Wars in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Darys managed to escape [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], the [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency Order]] used to wipe out the Jedi Order by [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]]. Instead of fleeing from the newly formed and Sith controlled [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Darys followed in her former master's footsteps and joined the Empire, disavowing her Jedi heritage and falling to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]. Becoming a member of the Imperial [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitorius]], Inquisitor Darys hunted down her brother and sister Jedi per the [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor's]] orders. While making a sweep over [[Belsavis/Legends|Belsavis]] during the hunt for Jedi Master [[Plett]], Darys' agents captured the young [[Lagan Ismaren|Lagan]] and [[Roganda Ismaren]] after the siblings had evacuated the planet with the so-called [[Children of the Jedi]]. When they were brought before Darys, the ruthless Inquisitor ignited her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] in Lagan's heart and let him die before his sister's eyes. Playing on this, Darys was able to turn the horrified Roganda Ismaren to the dark side.<ref name="TEP" />Several years later in [[4 BBY/Legends|4 BBY]]<ref name="EA158" />, Inquisitor Darys joined [[Grand Inquisitor/Legends|Grand Inquisitor]] [[Laddinare Torbin|Torbin]] and Inquisitor [[Antinnis Tremayne]] in the hunt for the recently discovered [[Arden Lyn]], an ancient threat reawakened from a millennia long slumber. When the team tracked Lyn down, the powerful Force-wielder seriously injured Tremayne and killed Darys before Torbin was able to [[Sai cha|remove]] Lyn's right arm with his lightsaber and disarm her.<ref name="TEP" />

name: Annora Calandra
description: She spent most of her time traveling to members of the Mining guild to collect their membership fee. Prior to the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]] Annora was a short slight women in her mid-thirties. Although she looked frail she was more than capable of holding her own in a brawl, being adept at a number of self-defense martial arts.Annora was involved in a plot to blow up an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Unidentified Torpedo Sphere (Tallaan)|Torpedo Sphere]] docked at the [[Tallaani Shipyards]] for maintenance. Her co-conspirators in this endeavor were Lord [[Vaskel Savill]] of [[House Melantha]] and Doctor Arkeld of the [[Justice Action Network]]. The Expanse Mining companies were forced to pay crippling tariffs to transport their ore through the [[Freeworlds Territory]]. Annora, frustrated by her superiors who did not want to be implicated in a scheme to bring the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] into the [[Tapani sector/Legends|Tapani sector]], hoped that destroying the Torpedo sphere would hasten the Imperial subjugation of the Freeworlds and lead to the lifting of the tariffs. Her primary purpose in this conspiracy was to assemble a coalition of Mining Guild members who would be willing to deal with House Melantha when the Empire took control of the Freeworlds. Her second task was to contact the [[Nok Cartel]] and arrange for them to attack shipping convoys in [[Cadriaan Province]] so to draw Imperial ordnance away from Tallaan.Annora was a participant in the annual [[Vor-cal]] prior to the events of the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]]. [[Derel Volk]] was originally scheduled to represent the Mining Guild at this event but Annora and her fellow plotters arranged for Derel to be sent elsewhere. It was at this event that the three main conspirators met to finalize the operation to destroy the Torpedo sphere. Unknown to Annora, it was Lord Savill's intention to kill the mining guild official once she had served her purpose.

name: Areilla Nastascha
description: Areilla grew up with Lady Bathos, but instead of focusing on gaining experience of the political infrastructure of the house she concentrated on sports and eventually joined the [[House Guard]] as a pilot, where she served with distinction for twelve years. When Lady Bathos ascended to the position of [[High Lady]], Areilla was appointed to her privy council. Prior to the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], Lady Nastascha was in her late thirties. She typically wore specially tailored outfit where she could conceal weapons, most commonly a blaster strapped to her left thigh. Even following her retirement from active military duties, Areilla still kept herself physically fit and still practiced her piloting skills. She was a thrill-seeking adventurer by nature but had been forced to live a more sedentary life since she gained more political responsibilities.

name: Arista Kabul
description: When Lorn was killed by his [[Seth Kabul|evil brother]] who, conspiring with the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Harsh]], wanted to take over the mining operations, Arista joined forces with the strong and unusually noble [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]], [[Grissom (Gamorrean)|Grissom]], and the technically-minded [[Jawa/Legends|Jawa]], [[Tek]], who was a [[Bounty/Legends|wanted]] man.Tek managed to remove the [[Homing beacon/Legends|tracking device]] such that Arista's uncle would not be able to track them down, and together the trio managed to sabotage the mining operation, ruining everything for her uncle and make it off-[[Planet/Legends|planet]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Aryn Dro Thul
description: Aryn was dating Bornan some time around [[11 BBY/Legends|11 BBY]], when she sang in a restaurant on her home world of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]]. She caught the eye of a very young smuggler, [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], who had just escaped an ambush and was repairing his ship. Bornan was behaving like a jealous boyfriend and Solo contemplated trying to steal Aryn away, but decided she was too much of a classy lady.After her husband's untimely death in [[24 ABY/Legends|24 ABY]], Aryn ran Bornaryn alone, but had some assistance from her brother-in-law [[Tyko Thul|Tyko]].Her reaction to the disappearance of her son [[Raynar Thul|Raynar]] while on the [[Mission to Myrkr|Myrkr mission]] went unrecorded, as did her activities during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]]. However, in [[35 ABY/Legends|35 ABY]], she was informed by [[Tesar Sebatyne]] that Raynar was alive, but fainted when she was told what had become of him. Nevertheless, she did send out the supply ships that Raynar had requested through Tesar.In [[36 ABY]], Aryn bought out the popular [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] restaurant [[Yuza Bre]] to spite [[Cal Omas]]. After an exchange with [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Mara Jade Skywalker]] over Raynar's fate while dining at Yuza Bre, she provided them with a R-series prototype [[Droid/Legends|droid]]. The prototype was useful in that in had an [[OmniGate]] that could be used to override [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2's]] sequestered memory sectors.

name: Asanté Vos
description: She was part of the plot to wipe the memories of Quinlan Vos and his [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]]. To this end she personally stunned Aayla, and along with [[Pol Secura]] fed the two captives [[glitteryll]]. Asanté hoped that her part in this plot would give her the money and opportunities necessary to become something other than a [[Kiffu Guardians|Kiffu Guardian]]. Asanté met with Quinlan on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] as he searched for his Padawan, and once again betrayed him. She was preparing to shoot Quinlan when she was killed by a [[Energy spider|spice spider]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Atresh Pikil
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Atresh Pikil was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Pikil was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="YDR" />In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Padawan Pikil was stationed at the Temple and participated in the annual [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|Apprentice Tournament]] overseen by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ilena Xan]]. During the competition, Pikil faced off against Padawan [[Gumbrak Hoxz]] in the first round. Apprentice [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy]], who was watching from the side-lines, thought that she wasn't a calculating fighter due to her overconfidence.<ref name="YDR" />

name: Ann Gella/Legends
description: Ann and her twin sister [[Tann Gella/Legends|Tann]] were [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] owned by [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]], who purchased the pair at a party hosted by [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. Her beauty garnered the attention of [[Podracer (profession)/Legends|podracers]] [[Mars Guo/Legends|Mars Guo]] and [[Teemto Pagalies/Legends|Teemto Pagalies]], but she never seemed to notice them, regardless of their efforts surrounding the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]] [[Podracing/Legends|podrace]]. When [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] needed [[Peggat/Legends|peggats]] to make a bet with junk dealer [[Watto/Legends|Watto]], Ann introduced herself to Jinn and offered to arrange a meeting with Jabba so the Jedi Master could secure a money loan from him. Jinn agreed, and Ann led him to [[Jabba's private box]] where Jinn was forced to engage [[Jabba's champion]] in combat in exchange for the money he needed. Shortly afterwards, Ann and her sister gave Sebulba a pre-race massage.

name: Cherith Fel
description: {{Quote|Only two survived. Jagged and Wyn. Chak, Davin, and Cherith are all dead.|[[Chaf'orm'bintrano]], to [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]]|Dark Nest I: The Joiner King}}Cherith Fel was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="Dark Journey">''[[The New Jedi Order: Dark Journey]]''</ref> [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] between [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]] and [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]]<ref name="Ruin" /> to [[General/Legends|General]] [[Baron of the Empire|Baron]] [[Soontir Fel]] and [[Syal Antilles Fel]], a former [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Ace/Legends|ace]] and [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Actor/Legends|actress]], respectively, who moved to the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]] before her birth in order to serve [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Mitth'raw'nuruodo's]] [[Empire of the Hand]]. There they battled the myriad threats found in the Unknown Regions, protecting both the known [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]] and the [[Chiss Ascendancy/Legends|Chiss Ascendancy]], Mitth'raw'nuruodo's people.<ref name="Vision of the Future">''[[Vision of the Future]]''</ref> Fel had three older siblings&mdash;brothers [[Chak Fel|Chak]], [[Davin Fel|Davin]], and [[Jagged Fel|Jagged]]&mdash;as well as a younger sister, [[Wynssa Fel|Wynssa]]. Fel's brother [[Cem Fel|Cem]] was kept hidden, a [[shadow child]] who could preserve the family line in the event of attack, a [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] custom.<ref name="The Joiner King">''[[Dark Nest I: The Joiner King]]''</ref>Like all her elder brothers, Fel went into the Empire of the Hand's military.<ref name="Ruin" /> She was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in battle against one of the Empire of the Hand's foes between [[22 ABY]] and [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]] and after her brother Davin had already died in the conflict; she was not yet eighteen.<ref name="Ruin" /><ref name="Dark Journey" /> Her death weighed heavily upon her [[Parent/Legends|father]], who had been her military superior.<ref name="Dark Journey" />

name: Marit Dice
description: {{Quote|How would the kidnapping disgrace Senator Tarturi if he wasn't implicated in something terrible?" Gillam said to Marit.<br />"And we get a very large bonus from Rana Halion, too," Rolai said.<br />"Think about what it will do for the countermovement, Marit ... The Senator kidnaps his own son to throw suspicion on the Ierians. And then something goes wrong, and his son dies—"<br />"And it's his fault," Rolai chortled. "He sacrificed his own son so he could keep his power!"<br />"And Senator Tarturi will not only be disgraced among his own people, he'll have a war on his hands. He won't be able to investigate, even if he wants to ... Which he won't, because he won't care ... He'll just care about his Senatorial privileges being threatened.|Gillam Tarturi and Rolai Frac reveal their vicious scheme against Gillam's father—requiring the murder of Anakin Skywalker—to a stunned Marit Dice.|Jedi Quest: The School of Fear}}Marit was the [[Galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Politics/Legends|politics]] and history expert of a squad of student [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] that trained secretly at the school. She also researched proposals that were submitted by individuals and groups in the galaxy soliciting the squad's services. The proposals were then voted upon. Other squad members included [[Gillam Tarturi]], [[Rolai Frac]], [[Tulah]], [[Hurana]], and [[Ze]].Marit befriended [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], who was there to investigate the students and their possible connection to the kidnapping of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Berm Tarturi]]'s son, Gillam. She had originally piqued Anakin's interest when she mischievously stole his cherished [[river stone]], which he later retrieved from her. Marit then invited the undercover "transfer student" to engage in a friendly on-campus swoop-bike competition, so that the group could test him and his abilities for possible induction as a mercenary comrade.During a group mission on Ieria, Gillam and the rest of the band pretended to let Skywalker join the squad, though Marit thought he was really being inducted. Gillam, against Marit's objections, then attempted to murder Skywalker, but Anakin single-handedly defeated all six mercenaries. Marit convinced Tulah, Hurana, and Ze that Gillam had betrayed them and was using them for revenge, not justice. The squad was taken to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] by Anakin, [[Siri Tachi]], [[Ferus Olin]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] for questioning, to sort out the lies, betrayals, and criminal activity that had occurred within the group.On one mission, before she had met Anakin, Marit accidentally killed the leader of [[Tierell]] while the group was battling a [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|security force]]. She later lamented to Skywalker that she had unexpectedly had to take part in bloodshed.

name: Jula Shryne
description: Jula was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], but her parents deliberately hid her from the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. Her son, [[Roan Shryne]], was likewise Force-sensitive, and Jula's husband [[Jen Shryne]] gave Roan to the Jedi against her will during one of her business trips. As a result, she left Jen.In [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]], Jula was one of many freelancers contacted by [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], under his Sith alias Tyranus, to run communications gear to a complex on [[Jaguada's moon]]. Not knowing Tyranus's true identity, or the true intent of the base, she took up the job.Following [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], Jula was briefly reunited with Roan, taking him and other Jedi survivors aboard the ''Drunk Dancer''. During a mission on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], she was injured by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader's]] [[Telekinesis/Legends#Saber throw|thrown]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] as she and her crew was helping [[Fang Zar/Legends|Fang Zar]] to escape to his [[Sern Prime/Legends|home planet]] aboard their vessel. She survived her injuries and tried convincing Roan to join her crew. Roan, in the end, stayed true to his Jedi nature, giving his life on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] to distract Vader long enough for Jula and others to escape the system.

name: Sar Labooda/Legends
eye_color: ''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones''
description: Sometime after Sar Labooda's birth, her family left their homeworld, [[Chalacta/Legends|Chalacta]], in order to search the stars for a new home. While traveling, the family's transport was attacked and boarded by a band of [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]]. With both her parents dead, Labooda and her sister<ref name="Encyclopedia" /> were at the mercy of the scoundrels until, by chance, the esteemed [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] appeared and slew the attackers. Discovering the two infants to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Windu took them to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], where they were given new names and placed into a [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|clan]] with other [[Jedi Initiate]]s. Growing up separately from each other, both girls passed through the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]] after completing their [[Jedi Initiate Trials|Trials]]. Ready to become an apprentice, Labooda was selected by a Master to become an apprentice and travel [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] as she continued to study the ways of the Jedi. Crafting for her own use a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and excelling in [[Form VI/Legends|Form VI]] of lightsaber technique, she eventually passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|High Council]].When the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] threatened to tear the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in two, Jedi Labooda decided to stand with [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Yudrish Sedran/Legends|Yudrish Sedran]] of her homeworld in opposition to the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]] that proposed the creation of a [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] to combat the threat of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. As the act went before the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] for a vote, the Confederacy's leaders captured Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and the senator of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]], [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], on [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] and sentenced them to death by execution. Answering Master Windu's call to form a massive [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] to rescue the Jedi and Senator, Labooda was one of 200 Jedi to storm the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]] and engage the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]]. However, her Form VI technique proved insufficient, and she did not survive the ensuing battle.<ref name="Fightsaber" />

name: Shae Polikex
description: Polikex helped [[Biggs Darklighter/Legends|Biggs Darklighter]] and [[Nera Dantels]] find the strange organism that had developed natural defenses against the cause of [[Derek Klivian/Legends|Derek Klivian's]] infection, in order to cure Hobbie's disease. After a complicated research through the dangerous jungles of the forest moon, Shae found a plant capable of generating the appropriate medicine.

name: Jessica Meade
description: She loved traveling, and hauled freight across many starlanes. Her cumbersome flight suit earned her the nickname "Old Iron Pants."One day at [[Doodnik's Café]] on the mining world of [[Tyne's Horky]], her attention was drawn by a sudden brawl that erupted between the local crime lord's hired goons and a handsome young miner named [[Jann Tosh]]. Meade stepped in to help by stunning the larger thugs with a miniature handheld stunner.When Jann Tosh was looking for transport to [[Tammuz-an/Legends|Tammuz-an]], Meade took the job. She was caught up in the intrigue surrounding the ascendancy of [[Mon Julpa]], the rightful heir to the Tammuz-an throne. She was even captured by the would-be King, an evil vizier named [[Ko Zatec-Cha]], but she escaped and helped in the efforts to restore Julpa as king of Tammuz-an. In gratitude, she was rewarded with a new ship, which she named the [[King's Ransom (transport)|''King's Ransom'']].Meade next transported a cargo of fuel to Tammuz-an when her ship was raided by [[Gir Kybo Ren-Cha|Kybo Ren's]] pirates. Kybo Ren became enamored with her fiery spirit, and made her his "personal guest." She was taken captive to his island headquarters on the watery world of Tarnoonga. There, Jessica was able to outwit the single-minded pirates. Jessica Meade served as advisor to Mon Julpa for a time before returning to the life of a trader. She had dark skin, and short black hair.

name: Plikk
description: Attaining her rank some time before the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], Plikk would dutifully lead her forces through a few battles, though never gaining much fame or glory. Her unorthodox dress did not seem to follow standard [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] regulations, thus hinting at a lack of discipline following years of neglect from higher ups.A short time after the Battle of Hoth, her fleet would investigate a curious dimensional rift found along their route, hoping that the discovery of inter-dimensional travel would earn them great favor with the [[Palpatine/Legends|Emperor]].[[File:Plikk and Nizzon.jpg|thumb|left|Captain Plikk and Lieutenant Nizzon.]]Discovering [[Cody Sunn-Childe]]'s floating city inside the rift, she tried to destroy it by using the combined firepower of her battlecruisers and [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|destroyers]]. Sunn-Childe's anger manifested itself as demons moving through the ethereal realm and he used them in his counterattack, crippling the Imperial fleet. Regretting the use of violence which he had previously sworn off, Sunn-Childe and his majordomo [[Ansible Beelyard|Beelyard]] decided to sacrifice their own lives for the sake of peace.With the ships badly damaged, Sunn-Childe called off the demon attack. This enabled Captain Plikk to re-organize her fleet and continue her assault on the city. Using all available energy from her ships' hyperdrives, Plikk destroyed the floating city, but in return, her fleet was stranded in the interdimensional realm and presumably lost forever.

name: Bassi Vobah
description: Vobah's parents immigrated to the [[Oseon system]] from parts unknown to work as [[Merchant/Legends|merchants]]. They did not find success, however, and Bassi was forced to join the [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|police]] in order to support them. Eventually her parents passed away, but by then Vobah had gotten used to the job and stayed with it.When Lando killed [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Kenow]] in self-defense, violating the Oseon's strict no-weapons statute, Vobah became angry as now she would be swamped with paperwork; the only bright spot, aside from arresting Lando, was that she could keep his [[Stingbeam/Legends|stingbeam]] in the Oseon police's "museum" and have another story to tell. Bassi Vobah was even more angry when she found out that Calrissian was avoiding punishment, and that she would accompany him, his [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[Vuffi Raa]], and [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] narcotics officer [[Waywa Fybot]] to arrest the "richest man in the galaxy"&mdash;and ''[[lesai]]'' addict&mdash;[[Bohhuah Mutdah]].After several close calls, the group arrived at Mutdah's private estate, and the idealistic young Peacekeeper declared that Mutdah was under arrest. In the next moment, Waywa Fybot&mdash;who was corrupt and secretly working for Mutdah&mdash;used his [[Service Special]] to blow her head off.

name: Bolabo Hujaan
description: A gifted technician from a young age, Hujaan left [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]] as soon as she could find a starship that would take her. Bolabo was an associate of [[Timma Briss]] and [[Kn'ik Th'ronik]].[[File:Bolabo Hujaan2.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Bolabo Hujaan, [[Starship/Legends|starship]] technician.]]Drifting from ship to ship, Hujaan learned first hand the operations of hundreds of starships, and eventually settled down on [[Byblos/Legends|Byblos]] to establish her own facility, [[Bolabo's Garage]]. To maintain security and secrecy, Hujaan paid off a number of contacts in [[Byblos Starport Security]]. Hujaan earned a reputation for expert repairs and creative modifications, particularly amongst [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] and [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] agents, but she never did anything for free and demanded payment up front. When parts were unavailable, Hujaan called on her skills as a smuggler to acquire them. Some of Hujaan's most impressive work was on [[Dash Rendar/Legends|Dash Rendar's]] [[Outrider/Legends|''Outrider'']], although if any modification proved a failure, she claimed it was Rendar's work.

name: Brigta Hejaran
description: She was the niece of [[Galemus Hejaran]] and a potential beneficiary of the will of her cousin Baron [[Lucian Hejaran]]. Brigta, however, received nothing from her cousin's will and it directed her to be exiled from the [[Hejaran Castle]] and the family moon, [[Nightsinger's Orb]]. The majority of the Baron's wealth and his title were bestowed to a remote member of the family. It was subsequently revealed that Lucian had been murdered by Brigta because the Baron had sensed her descent into darkness and association with [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] and the [[New Order/Legends|New Order]]. Following the reading of the will she also murdered Lucian's loyal servant [[Pershon]], using her dark side powers, to prevent him from revealing his master's journals. In order to regain her status within the family Brigta manipulated Lucian's brother, [[Themion Hejaran]], into challenging the new Baron to a duel where she used her dark side powers to influence the fight. She was eventually discovered and released her grip on Themion. She was chased and in an attempt to escape fell from the walls of Hejaran Castle.

name: Camelle Barje
description: Camelle was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]. She married [[Conil Barje|Conil]]<ref name="SW7" /> and the pair lived in the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]]. At some point, Camelle worked as a [[Nurse/Legends|nurse]]. Camelle and Conil decided to settle on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]<ref name="GG1-2">[[Galaxy Guide 1: A New Hope (Second Edition)|''Galaxy Guide 1: A New Hope'', Second Edition]]</ref> to raise their newborn son, [[Tekil Barje|Tekil]].<ref name="SW7" />Camelle and Conil sold everything to move to Tatooine, purchasing land from [[Zygian's Banking Concern]]. Arriving on Tatooine, Camelle and Conil established a [[Moisture farm/Legends|moisture farm]]. Ever since arriving on the planet, Camelle and Conil heard rumors of [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raider]] attacks, mainly from people at [[Tosche Station/Legends|Tosche Station]]. Conil was determined to get some weapons to be on the safe side, so they traveled to the ancient trading site [[Mochot Steep/Legends|Mochot Steep]]. Conil told Camelle to stay with Tekil in the cart while he purchased some guns.<ref name="SW7" />During the visit to Mochot Steep, a Tusken Raider war-band led by [[Sharad Hett]] attacked the settlement. During the attack, Conil told Camelle to ride away and save Tekil. While trying to help another moisture farmer, Conil was killed by one of the Tuskens. Camelle tried to escape, but a Tusken killed the [[Dewback/Legends|dewback]] pulling her cart.<ref name="SW7" />Sprawled on the ground, a Tusken took Tekil from her arms while another aimed a rifle at her head. Hett saw the commotion and saw the Tusken holding Tekil brandishing a knife. Igniting his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], Hett cut off the Tusken's hand. Camelle begged for her life, and Hett returned Tekil to her and blessed her leaving.<ref name="SW7" />By the time of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Barje lived in [[Wayfar]] and ran the motel on the edge of town.<ref name="GG1-2" />

name: Casandra Mateil
description: In [[3956 BBY]], [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] met her in [[Ahto City]]. Mateil was often considered to be somewhat egotistical; she would refuse to sign personal [[autoprint]]s, instead the autoprints would be created, and fans had to pay for them. She held second place at the [[Ahto City swoop track]] until Revan helped [[Queedle Molto]] enhance his [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]] to become Sector Champion. Mateil's time fell to third place, and [[Hukta Jax]] was moved to second. Mateil was bumped down to fourth place once Revan became Sector Champion.{{Char-stub}}

name: Cassa Veila
description: In [[16 ABY/Legends|16 ABY]], she and Tryst befriended an injured [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raider]] named [[Sliven]]. They became friends quickly despite the hosility between the settlers and the Tusken Raiders. Sliven would help her with chores after he recovered and play with her daughter Tahiri. However, she and Tryst were killed by Sliven's tribe who mistook them for enemies.Out of pity and in return for the kindness shown to him by them, Sliven adopted a then three-year-old Tahiri and raised her as a Tusken Raider until she turned nine in [[22 ABY]], when she was discovered to be Force-sensitive by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Tionne Solusar]] during a trip to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. She would only learn about it during a return trip to Tatooine from the [[Jedi Praxeum]] in 22 ABY.

name: Cilia Dil
description: Cilia Dil was a political dissident who aided in a rebellion against the [[Guardians]] of her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]]. After being imprisoned by the Guardians, a force set up by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku's]] old rival, [[Lorian Nod]] she escaped with the help of [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Cilia eventually ended the Annihilator conspiracy set up by Lorian and was proclaimed as a hero.{{Char-stub}}

name: Clee Rhara
description: {{Quote|Clee Rhara, you know. Charismatic, she is. A following among the young pilots, she has.|[[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] to [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]]|Jedi Apprentice Special Edition: Deceptions}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Clee Rhara was a contemporary of [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Tahl]], receiving [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. After years of training as a [[Jedi Guardian|Guardian]] and specializing as an [[Jedi ace|ace]] in the [[Jedi Starfighter Corps]], Clee Rhara attained the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]].<ref name="JASE" />Selecting the young [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] [[Garen Muln]] as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Rhara worked with the Starfighter Corps to establish a piloting academy on [[Centax-2]], one of Coruscant's [[Moon/Legends|moons]]. While Rhara worked to see the academy open, many members of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] opposed funding for the Starfighter Corps' academy. Rumors were propagated in the Senate that Rhara had sabotaged the project herself in order to prompt further funding. The Order saw the funding bill come to a vote where it was undermined through the secret machinations of the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]]. The facility became too expensive to maintain and was eventually shut down.<ref name="JASE" />Despite the project's failure, Rhara and Muln were kept busy with assignments from the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Training Muln to [[Jedi Knight/Legends|knighthood]], the pair continued to work with each other on missions. In [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]], Rhara and Muln accompanied Master [[Siri Tachi]] and her Padawan [[Ferus Olin]] to the [[Xanlanner system]] on an assignment. En route, the Jedi received a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress signal]] from Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] on [[TY44]]. They picked up Kenobi and his Padawan [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] on [[Vanqor/Legends|Vanqor]], where they had crash-landed. The team then traveled to [[Typha-Dor]] to help them thwart the Vanqor invasion.<ref>''[[Jedi Quest: The Moment of Truth]]''</ref>

name: Cray Mingla
description: [[File:Cray mingla.jpg|thumb|left|Mingla accepted to Jedi Academy]][[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] Mingla was one of the galaxy's foremost innovators in [[Artificial intelligence/Legends|artificial intelligence]] and had been a student of [[Stinna Draesinge Sha]]. She was romantically involved with her partner, [[Nichos Marr]]. Cray was very cultured and remained impeccably groomed and updated on the latest fashion trends.In [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]], Nichos actively sought to be tested for [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force sensitivity]] and intended that Cray came with him. They both arrived at [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Jedi academy]] and Luke confirmed they were indeed Force-sensitive. They went through Jedi training and became Jedi Knights.Cray soon learned that Nichos had been diagnosed with [[Quannot's Syndrome]]. She continued her Jedi training, practicing hard in the mornings. During the night, she used hypnosis and drug therapies to stay awake and did research to save her lover's life. Her expertise in the field had earned her a doctorate at the prestigious [[Magrody Institute of Programmable Intelligence|Magrody Institute]] and she managed to transfer her lover's consciousness into a [[Droid/Legends|droid]] body using forbidden [[Ssi-ruu]]k technology.Both Jedi Knights accompanied Luke Skywalker on his mission to sabotage the ''[[Eye of Palpatine]]''. The three Jedi were forced to split up and Cray was captured by servants of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. While she was brutally beaten, Nichos was forced to watch her suffer. He had a [[Restraining bolt/Legends|restraining bolt]] placed on his body and&mdash;being partially a droid&mdash;could do nothing to save her. Cray realized that Nichos' spirit had never been transferred to the droid body. The droid Nichos, though resembling her lover, was only a droid and nothing could be done to change this. After Nichos died on board the ''[[Eye of Palpatine]]'', Cray gave her own body to the spirit of [[Callista Ming|Callista]], as she wanted to die to be with her dead lover.Cray Mingla was one of the first students of the restored Jedi Academy to die.In [[13 ABY/Legends|13 ABY]] Callista would use Cray's name as an alias while she was on [[Nam Chorios/Legends|Nam Chorios]].

name: Dama Whitesun Brunk
description: She was the younger sister of [[Beru Whitesun Lars/Legends|Beru Whitesun Lars]]. Her brother was [[Haro Whitesun]], and she may have had another sister called [[Coolie]]&mdash;though this may have been [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] nickname for Dama herself.Dama owned and operated the [[Sidi Driss Inn]], in [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]], during the early days of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. She assisted [[Leia Organa Solo]] in attempting to recover the ''[[Killik Twilight]]''.<ref name="Tatooine Ghost" />

name: Dana Galvason
description: A brash woman, she was among the select few who were allowed to travel through the [[Deep Core Security Zone/Legends|Deep Core Security Zone]] and make cargo runs to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Byss/Legends|Byss]]. Although she was paid well by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] for her work, she was as likely to run from the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Starfleet]] as she was to work for it, and was not above [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] as long as she could get away with it and was well [[Galactic Credit Standard|compensated]] for her trouble.Her personal starship was the [[Corellian Engineering Corporation/Legends|CEC]] [[YT-2000 light freighter]] ''[[Bakuran Blade]]''.

name: Danielle Kieran
description: Growing up without a father, the young Dani discovered that her mother had been close with the young [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], and she became quietly convinced that she had found the truth about her parentage. All [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] looked and acted somewhat alike, and Dani deliberately imitated her supposed father's style of dress and behavior; but the strange sense of recognition strangers sometimes felt when they encountered her may have hinted that there was something more than self-belief and hero-worship behind her posturing.As soon as she was old enough, Dani borrowed money from [[Talon Karrde]] to buy herself a [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300]] freighter of her own, the ''[[Century Hawk]]''. By the time she was seventeen, she was flying her ship out of [[Crystal Web Station]], looking for a chance to prove herself as a pilot. Although she had told no-one of her suspicions about her parentage, she wanted to be a daughter Han Solo would be proud of. To this end, she had planned to fly the [[Kessel Run/Legends|Kessel Run]], not to beat Solo's time (as that would be impossible as far as she was concerned) but to prove herself as his daughter.

name: Delva Racine/Legends
description: In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], she was one of the many patrons seen milling about the [[Galaxies Opera House/Legends|Galaxies Opera House]] during the [[Squid Lake/Legends|Squid Lake]] performance. Her scandalous designs were based on [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] cultures. As a result, her summer [[Kubaz/Legends|Kubaz]] collection was heavily criticized by the media.{{Char-stub}}

name: Deran Nalual
description: Deran Nalual, a [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Siadem Forte]]'s [[Padawan/Legends|Jedi apprentice]] during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], which branded the Jedi as enemies of the Republic. When her clone troopers turned their [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] on the Jedi pair, Forte and Nalual fought and killed their troops before issuing a [[Emergency Code Nine Thirteen/Legends|distress call]] from [[Dellalt/Legends|Dellalt]]. Blind from the attack by her troops, Nalual felt some comfort when eight other Jedi arrived on planet. Forte led the fugitive Jedi in hijacking an [[SX troop transport|SX troop shuttle]] from the newly formed [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], making their way offworld. While they were pursued by a group of [[Aggressive ReConnaissance-170 starfighter/Legends|ARC-170s]] and a light cruiser, losing four of their company, Nalual and the others escaped pursuit and were given sanctuary by the crew of the ''[[Drunk Dancer]]''. In the company of [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Jula Shryne]], the group was eventually joined by Master [[Roan Shryne]] and Padawan [[Olee Starstone]]. Given knew hope by Starstone's enthusiasm and determination, Nalual and her companions agreed to search for [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]].<ref name="DL" />Once there, Kashyyyk came under [[Battle of Kashyyyk (19 BBY)|invasion]] by the Empire for housing Jedi. Led by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], the Empire searched for the Jedi fugitives, eventually confronting them. Padawan Nalual remained on watch at the landing pad in [[Kachirho/Legends|Kachirho]], while her master and the others went into the city to discuss strategy with the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] chieftains. While her master died in a confrontation with Vader, Nalual dutifully waited for her companions before they took off and fled into space. With her friends support, Nalual decided to work on construction sites, or in an agricultural projects within the Empire, and intended to undo the Sith in more subtle ways than with a lightsaber.<ref name="DL" />

name: Devan For'deschel
description: [[Jedi training/Legends|Trained]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], For'deschel was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] educated in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Having constructed a teal-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]<ref>''[[The Heart]]''</ref> for herself and training independently as a [[Jedi Guardian|Guardian]], Master For'deschel was asked to teach as a [[Jedi instructor|lightsaber instructor]] at the experimental [[Almas Academy|academy]] on [[Almas]]. After being approved to teach by the [[Jedi Battlemaster|Temple battlemaster]], For'deschel was eventually appointed as the [[Mistress of Lightsabers]] at the Academy, replacing the late Battlemaster [[Kirlocca]].<ref name="Coruscani Dawn" />Joining the [[Almas Council]] as a leader of the Academy, she sat on the body when the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Opposing the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on Coruscant when they demanded all Jedi report to take up arms in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], For'deschel refused to allow Jedi [[Darrus Jeht]] to take the Academy's Padawans to the galactic capital.<ref name="Coruscani Dawn" /> Continuing her work in the [[Cularin system]], Master For'deschel was attacked by a [[JK-13 security droid|''Jedi Killer'' droid]], losing an arm to the mechanical menace. Replacing her arm with a prosthetic, she continued to lead lightsaber instruction at the academy despite her injury.<ref name="Coruscani Dawn" />Considered on par with the power of Academy Headmaster [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]], For'deschal was selected as a part of one of the search teams that explored the insides of the [[Almas Sith fortress]] looking for three missing Jedi. Discovering that the Jedi's Force-essences had been trapped by the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] cult, the [[Believers]]. Returning to the Academy as a rescue missions was established, she was present for the celebration which honored the heroes of that successful mission.<ref>''[[A Mon Alone]]''</ref>Near the end of the Clone Wars, For'deschel was present in the Academy when it was [[Destruction of the Almas Academy|attacked]] by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] under the command of the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]]. Ezzar engaged her in personal combat and killed her, although she was able to injure him before she fell.<ref name="Destruction" />

name: Diva Funquita/Legends
description: Funquita was originally one of many [[Theelin/Legends|Theelin]] [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] owned by [[Ingoda]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. Ingoda was a business rival of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]; becoming indebted to Jabba, Ingoda had to sell him two of his slaves, [[Diva Shaliqua/Legends|Diva Shaliqua]] and Diva Funquita. Jabba then presented Funquita to Gardulla as a gift, keeping Shaliqua for his own house band. Before the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]], Gardulla ordered Diva Funquita to ensure that [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] would not be able to compete. She enlisted the aid of [[Ark Roose/Legends|Ark "Bumpy" Roose]] to sabotage Skywalker's [[Podracer/Legends|podracer]], but the [[Nuknog/Legends|Nuknog]] did not know which pod was Anakin's and erroneously sabotaged another podracer instead.{{Char-stub}}

name: Diva Shaliqua/Legends
description: {{Quote|A gift from Ingoda, in place of credits owed to me. She and Diva Funquita came as a pair, but I made Funquita a present to Gardulla in the hope of smoothing over our lingering rivalry. My first mistake. The second: introducing Shaliqua to Romeo Treblanc, who would move worlds to possess her.|Jabba the Hutt, on Diva Shaliqua|Darth Plagueis (novel)}}Diva Shaliqua was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Theelin halfbreed who was born to a pair of [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] in the custody of [[Ingoda]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] during the [[Republic Classic era]]. One of the slaves was of the rare [[Theelin/Legends|Theelin]] [[Species/Legends|species]], which the Hutt tended to "collect". However, he forbade fraternization between slaves. Shaliqua was named "[[Diva]]" in honor of the religious order of Theelin [[Musician/Legends|singers]]. The name was also bequeathed to her in the hopes that she would live up to it, and develop great singing talents. Ingoda discovered the child and the fact that the slaves had been fraternizing, but decided to let Diva live, should she bear the fabled Theelin operatic skills. In that case, Ingoda decided that it would be financially wise to keep Shaliqua as a singer. Ingoda, however, became indebted to his rival, the [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]-based [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]], and was forced to sell both Shaliqua and [[Diva Funquita/Legends|Diva Funquita]] to the other Hutt.<ref name="db" />Jabba gave Funquita away to fellow Hutt, [[Gardulla Besadii the Elder/Legends|Gardulla]], but he kept Shaliqua for his personal band. He would take her to the [[Podracing/Legends|podraces]], where, in [[Jabba's private box|his private box]] in the [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] [[Mos Espa Grand Arena/Legends|Grand Arena]], she would meet Jabba's fellow [[Gambling/Legends|gamblers]], such as [[Watto/Legends|Watto]], [[Graxol Kelvyyn/Legends|Graxol Kelvyyn]], and [[Romeo Treblanc]]. Treblanc, being the owner of the [[Galaxies Opera House/Legends|Galaxies Opera House]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], took particular interest in Shaliqua. The half-Theelin took note of the fact that Treblanc's interests in her were not of the carnal type, but far more sophisticated.<ref name="db" /> In about [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], Shaliqua traveled with Jabba, his [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Majordomo/Legends|majordomo]] [[Bib Fortuna/Legends|Bib Fortuna]] and his [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] security chief [[Ephant Mon/Legends|Ephant Mon]] to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Sojourn]], where the Hutt held a business meeting with the influential [[Muun/Legends|Muun]] industrialist [[Magister]] [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Hego Damask]].<ref name="Darth Plagueis">[[Darth Plagueis (novel)|''Darth Plagueis'']]</ref> Shaliqua later accompanied Jabba to the [[Boonta Eve Classic/Legends|Boonta Eve Classic]] podrace of [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] and Romeo Treblanc suffered a huge financial loss during the event, after he bet on the [[Podracer (profession)/Legends|podracer]] [[Gasgano/Legends|Gasgano]]. The [[Xexto/Legends|Xexto]] racer was soundly beaten by young [[Human/Legends|Human]] competitor [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], forcing Treblanc to leave Tatooine and return to Coruscant. He promised, however, to return to Shaliqua [[Standard year/Legends|year]] later.<ref name="db" />In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Treblanc stayed true to his promise and purchased, and freed Shaliqua from Jabba, who did not recognize her true talent and had lost interest in the half-Theelin. Treblanc had recovered from his losses in the previous year, and hoped to cast Shaliqua in a small role for an upcoming musical to be played at Galaxies. He brought her back to Coruscant to study and perform at the Opera House, but mere hours after debarking, Shaliqua fled the Coruscanti's custody, taking her emancipation datawork and some of Treblanc's minor valuables. Adopting a stage name, she worked in Coruscant's more seedy locales, singing at nightclubs and [[Casino/Legends|casinos]] in Coruscant's mid-levels. It was a legitimate career, but likely a far cry from the success she would have enjoyed in Treblanc's custody.<ref name="db" />

name: Djulla Tyerell
description: When Djulla's uncle sold her to [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]], her brother [[Deland Tyerell]] tried to free her by beating Sebulba's son [[Hekula]] in a celebrated though illegal podrace at the [[Great Dordon Caves]] on the outskirts of [[Eusebus|Euceron City]] during the [[Galactic Games/Legends|Galactic Games]] of [[26 BBY/Legends|26 BBY]].Unfortunately, Sebulba broke Deland's arm before the race, and all Djulla's hopes seemed lost. But to help them, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] raced Deland's podracer in his stead, beating Hekula and thereby gaining Djulla's freedom.<ref name="JQ">''[[Jedi Quest: The Dangerous Games]]''</ref>

name: Drakka Judarrl
description: It is unknown who Judarrl's Jedi Master was&mdash;all she ever said was that "[[Drakka Judarrl's Master|he]] became one with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] long ago," that she was only a Padawan at the time, and that he saved her from the murder of the other Jedi during the Great Purge. Presumably her ordeal during her escape and her subsequent survival served as her ''de facto'' [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]], because she claimed to be a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], and indeed feared that she was the only one of her kind, though she claimed that she "sensed the presence of a few others." However, her master had told her never to use her [[Force power/Legends|Force powers]], for fear that [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] agents would discover her hiding place.[[File:Contention SWGTCG.jpg|thumb|left|Drakka Judarrl on Dantooine.]]Unfortunately for Judarrl, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] himself caught up with her Master and slew him. Judarrl managed to escape, however, with the help of a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] who had been aiding her Master. She came to Dantooine when the [[Dantooine/Legends#Galactic_Civil_War|Rebel base]] was first established, and hid in the ruins of the [[Jedi Enclave]], making her home in a deep cave behind the falls close to the ruin. Her hope in coming to Dantooine was to make contact with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] base hidden there, to discover the state of the resistance, and aid the rebellion in any way she could. She took charge of guerrilla activities among the native Dantari tribes, disrupting the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire's]] activities on Dantooine as best she could.While there, she did meet with a Rebel operative, informing them of her past before tasking them with intercepting a squad of [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] to stop them from slaughtering dozens of natives. The individual managed to perform the task and, upon returning to Judarrl, was given another; to rescue the daughter of the Dantari chieftain, [[Aroho Preni]], who had been assisting Judarrl from the Imperials. The individual accepted this challenge and, after defeating the chieftain's Imperial guards, brought him to Judarrl where they were once again informed of another task.Judarrl had been informed that an Imperial by the name of [[Luthik Uwyr]] had arrived on the planet and was organizing some of the natives into a deadly strike force by teaching them to use the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. She decided that he had to be stopped before such agents of evil could spread their practices offworld. The individual accepted this task also, and managed to slay a group of [[darksider]]s (though Hydra himself remained unharmed), and so was rewarded by Judarrl with a blue [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]].At some point she also helped a Rebel agent to escape from [[Captain/Legends|captain]] [[Adrick]] and his troopers by clouding their minds. The Rebel had previously found the [[Codex of Tython]], an ancient Jedi [[Holocron/Legends|Holocron]], for which Judarrl's father had looked for many years. The Holocron, however, was missing several fragments. Judarrl herself had one, which she gave to the agent, before sending him on a mission to complete the Holocron.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=Champions of the Force (SWGTCG)|text=Champions of the Force|scenario=Light Side scenario campaign}}</ref> After completing the mission, the Rebels returned the Holocron to Drakka for study. After studying the ancient artifact, several Alliance agents stayed with her to protect it from enemy hands. However, she was [[Death/Legends|killed]] when the [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]] organized an attack on the cave and the holocron was reclaimed by an Imperial agent.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=Champions of the Force (SWGTCG)|text=Champions of the Force|scenario=Dark Side scenario campaign}}</ref>

name: Dree Vandap
description: Apprenticed to [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Crian Maru]], Vandap undertook the mission of tracking down one of the Brotherhood of Darkness' most ferocious warriors, [[Kaox Krul]]&mdash;the Madman, the Marauder, the Dark Killer. Traveling to the [[Balowa system]] from the planet [[Harpori]], Dree and her Master believed they had a lock on Krul. However, the Marauder was able to get the jump on Dree and Crian and blasted their ship, damaging it beyond repair and sending it on a doomsday decline to the forested planet below. However, Dree and her Master were also able to damage Krul's ship, sending it plunging to the planet as well.Dree and her Master survived the crash, but were now at the mercy of the planet&mdash;and worst of all, at the mercy of Kaox Krul, who had survived his landing as well. Dree and Crian surmised that they needed to put some forest between them and the Madman so as to keep ahead of him. However, as Crian was preparing the ship's [[Speeder bike/Legends|speeder bike]] that had survived the crash, Krul was upon them. Dree was forced to engage him in battle but was rescued by Crian who snatched Dree up onto the bike as she sped past the fray.Zooming into the forest, the two Jedi thought the bike would help them put some distance between them and Krul. However, Krul opened himself up to the power of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]], using it to give him incredible speed and allowing him to keep up with the bike. Slashing out with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], Krul cut cable lines causing the bike to slowly lose power. However, Krul's swipe also caused him to lose his footing, sending him crashing into the ground and allowing Dree and Crian to escape, at least for the moment.For two days afterward, Dree and Crian were able to elude Krul, but eventually he caught up with them. The showdown came one night when Dree awoke alone in a makeshift hideaway in a forest cave. Following her senses to a lake located in the middle of the forest, Dree found her Master standing at the shore. Without warning, Krul appeared and attacked Dree's Master. Dree watched as Crian traded strikes with the Dark Killer, and Dree watched and saw her Master start to lose ground against him. Feeling her master needed help, Dree joined in the battle and forced Krul into a two-on-one fight.However, Krul was more than up to the challenge and took on the two Jedi. Although Dree and Crian were both strong in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], Krul had fully opened himself up to the powers of the dark side. Sending Crian flying into the lake with a powerful Force blow, Krul launched himself up and over Dree, landing behind her. Before Dree had a chance to react, Krul ran her through with his lightsaber. Before the eyes of her Master, Dree Vandap fell and became [[Force ghost|one with the Force]].

name: Elise Montagne
description: Revan first met her on the plains just outside the Jedi Enclave, where she stopped him and begged his help in finding her "companion". Revan eventually discovered that the dear companion she was searching for was in fact a droid, but despite being a little unnerved by her mannerisms he agreed to find it for her.[[Revan/Legends|Revan]] eventually discovered the run away droid and saved it from a vicious Kath Hound attack, only to discover that it had been intentionally trying to destroy itself. [[C8-42-GE3]] explained to Revan that Elise had become obsessed with him and wanted to treat him like her dead husband, which was making her increasingly isolated and insular.Concerned for her state of mind&mdash;and a little unnerved by her affections&mdash;, he came to the conclusion that she would only get better if he was no longer there.Revan then destroyed C8-42 at his request, so that Elise would move on with her life.When Revan returned and relayed to her what had happened she was grief-stricken and ran back to the Jedi Enclave, where ironically she met a man named [[Samnt]], and the two of them became close very quickly. At their last meeting Elise thanked Revan for his help, finally admitting that she had been using her droid as a way to cope with her husband's death. She apologized for the way she had been behaving before, and she and her new man left.

name: Elora Sund
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]], Elora Sund was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] in the decade marked by the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] which plagued the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] until the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Sund crafted a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Early in the war, Sund lost her master to the war and she became a member of the [[Padawan Pack]] on [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]] during the [[Battle of Jabiim|fighting there]]. In addition to her lightsaber, Sund was trained in the use of a [[vibroknife]], which she was fond of using in battle in conjunction with her lightsaber or a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]].<ref name="R56" />[[File:EloraSundDeath.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Elora Sund dies from psychic backlash.]]Along with the other masterless Padawans, Sund was forced to adjust to the ever-changing battlefield conditions without the instruction of a master. Commandeering a pair of repuslorlift boots to move around with easy over the muddy ground, Sund found herself fond of fellow Padawan [[Tae Diath]] as the group grew closer and closer throughout the fighting. Forming a [[Telepathy/Legends|telepathic]] link with Diath, she encouraged him to find peace within his mind as he mourned the death of his own master, [[Nico Diath]]. During the final battle with rebel leader [[Alto Stratus]], Diath was slain by a group of assassin droids. When Diath died, Sund's mental link betrayed her as she suffered from psychic backlash. Overcome by Diath's death resonating through her mind, Sund died instantly of heart failure.<ref name="R57" /> Like countless other Jedi since the dawn of the Republic, Sund's name was added to the [[Jedi Monument (New Holstice)|Jedi monument]] on [[New Holstice/Legends|New Holstice]] as the survivors of the battle whispered her name into the wings of the immortal [[memory moth]]s flying in the monument.<ref name="R58">''[[Republic 58: The Battle of Jabiim, Part 4]]''</ref>

name: Eppie Belden
description: {{Quote|Who are you, old woman?''"<br />"''Start guessing, youngster. I'm Orn Belden's revenge.''"<br />"''You can't be here, scarring of the neocortex is permanent.''"<br />"''Tell that to Commander Skywalker|[[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Wilek Nereus]] and Eppie Belden|The Truce at Bakura}}[[File:Eppie Belden.png|thumb|left|Eppie Belden]]She [[Marriage/Legends|married]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Orn Belden]] in [[97 BBY]], the same [[Standard year/Legends|year]] as a [[Droid/Legends|droid]] uprising on [[Bakura/Legends|Bakura]]. Sometime afterward, they had their only child, [[Roviden Belden|Roviden]]. She had a personality that was described as "fiery," to match her hair, and was the first adult friend of [[Gaeriel Captison]].Along with her husband and son, Eppie sympathized with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], although Bakura was independent and neutral during the conflict&mdash;until the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] annexed Bakura in [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]]. Roviden, who had become an agent of the Rebellion, was executed on order of Imperial [[Governor/Legends|governor]] [[Wilek Nereus]]; Eppie, who had also aided the Rebellion, was also ordered to be executed. Orn pleaded for her life, and Nereus agreed&mdash;instead of killing her, he merely destroyed her mind using a parasitic insect from the [[Jospro sector]]. The price for Orn, however, was the loss of his voice.Eppie's condition—which resembled advanced senility&mdash;was incurable until the [[Invasion of Bakura]], when [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to reverse the damage. She awoke to find that Nereus had killed her husband and arrested [[Prime Minister (Bakura)|Prime Minister]] [[Yeorg Captison]], and&mdash;using her contacts in the Bakuran underground and her skills as a [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]]&mdash;initiated the Bakuran Revolution.Despite her age, she personally captured Nereus, and like other revolutionaries, was in favor of trying him in a revolutionary tribunal. However, with the surrender of the Imperial garrison and the release of Prime Minister Captison, the revolutionaries deferred authority back to the [[Bakuran Senate]] and handed Nereus over to Skywalker.

name: Eryl Besa
description: Eryl's father had been a space racer, and she had been born in the middle of one of his races, in [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]]. She later participated in many of his races, learning to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Instinctive astrogation|discover where]] in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] she was at any given moment. She later joined the [[New Jedi Order]].During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], Eryl joined the [[Myrkr strike team]]. Due to her ability to know exactly what part of space she was in at any given time, her role in the mission was to let the team know when they were at [[Myrkr/Legends|Myrkr]]. During the mission, she and [[Raynar Thul]] became close, until Eryl died when she was hit in the face with [[razor bug]]s on Myrkr.

name: Evlyn Tabory
description: Evlyn was born on [[The Redoubt/Legends|the Redoubt]] around [[12 ABY/Legends|12 ABY]] and helped her uncle in his duties as [[Guardian of the People]], using her Force powers to manipulate intruders into falling into traps set around the Dreadnaughts. Evlyn was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], a fact that Rosemary and Jorad covered up to prevent her from being exiled to [[Dreadnaught-Three|''D-Three'']]. She did not go when [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] asked her if she wanted to go with him to the [[Jedi Praxeum]] even though she did want to.

name: G'Mai Duris
description: Around [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] encountered her during their mission to undermine the partnership between [[Cestus Cybernetics]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].G'Mai Duris was later a victim of several attempts by her cousin [[Caiza Quill]] who was able to dethrone her from the position of regent. One attempt included Quill's killing of [[Filian]], Duris' lover, in a formal duel before the [[Hive Council]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Galinda Norsh
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Galinda Norsh was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], studying at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]] at the same time as the infamous [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] of [[Serenno/Legends|Serenno]]. During her training, Norsh was assigned to Blue Team during an urban tracking exercise beginning at the Temple and leading into the [[All Planets Market]] to retrieve a specific fruit. Assigned to the same team as Dooku and [[Hran Beling]], Dooku took command of the team and was determined to beat his former friend and leader of Gold Team [[Lorian Nod]]. Deposited in the [[Nova level]] of [[Galactic City]], Norsh suggested using the many alleyways leading to the Market to move about undetected and hide so as not to be tagged by the other team as they all strove to get the fruit first. Suggesting that the Gold Team was most likely staking out Blue Team and awaiting them so as to tag them all and move easily to the Temple, Norsh and Beling aided Dooku in infiltrating the market. Beling was tagged by one of the opposing team members but Norsh was able to grab the fruit without any disruption. Before she could make her way out of the market, Nod appeared from above an awning and tagged her, ending her ability to play in the mission.<ref name="LOTJ" />

name: Hanna Ding
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Arkanian/Legends|Arkanian]], Hanna Ding was a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], living at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. At the [[Jedi academy|academy]] there, Ding was graceful and particularly fond of [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]] as opposed to grappling, but her methods be predictable. After she [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] from the academy, Ding became eligible to become a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] to a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]].<ref name="YDR" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Ding was stationed at the Temple, and by this time had constructed a [[Color/Legends|green]]-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. Throughout the war, Ding secretly feared that one day she would die outside the Temple's walls on the battlefield.<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|I|190|Ding, Hanna}}</ref> In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Ding participated in the [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]], administrated by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ilena Xan]]. Ding was openly critical of fellow Padawan [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy]], claiming that she was using unorthodox trickery and was manipulating the rules. In the second round of the Tournament, Ding was pitted against Enwandung-Esterhazy, fighting the dark. Ding refused to give into her frustration when her opponent repeatedly attempted to deceive her, and ended up being kicked in the chest. Still, Ding managed to gain the upper hand, and believed she had her opponent beaten. At that moment, Enwandung-Esterhazy grabbed her lightsaber blade, which was set at a low setting, and managed to get Ding in a strangle hold, forcing the Arkanian to surrender. Ding was then eliminated from the competition.<ref name="YDR" />

name: Hela Brandes/Legends
description: Brandes served as the [[Music Advisor]] sitting on the [[Naboo Royal Advisory Council/Legends|Royal Advisory Council]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion]] of the peaceful [[Planet/Legends|planet]] by the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]]. She was a noted harpist who attempted to arrange for [[Naboo (people)/Legends|Naboo]] [[Artist/Legends|artists]] and [[Musician/Legends|musicians]] to travel off-planet to demonstrate the talents their society prided. Brandes was also in charge of the funding of Naboo's festivals.<ref name="SoN">''[[Secrets of Naboo]]''</ref>During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Brandes and a coalition of other illustrious musicians coaxed the renowned [[symponik]] master [[Beezar Pert]] out of retirement for a one-off special concert to the benefits of the war orphans.<ref name="Slugthrowers">{{SW|url=news/slugthrowers-an-overview-of-popular-music-and-musicians-in-a-galaxy-far-far-away-part-1|text=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away, Part 1|int=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away|archivedate=20180311051325}}</ref>

name: Larisselle Chatrunis
description: Larisselle stole the show at the Miss Coruscant beauty pageant with her incredible singing voice and her impressive awareness of galactic affairs despite the fact that her homeworld of [[Lowick/Legends|Lowick]] was only recently introduced to the galactic stage. After winning the pageant Larisselle toured the galaxy as her music made her famous. Once [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] rose to power and instituted the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], new xenophobic policies costed aliens such as Larisselle their livelihoods. Finding work was hard and she joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], determined to use her fame and talents in order to help end Palpatine's tyrannical reign and restore freedom to fellow discriminated aliens. Under the guise of a simple singing troupe, Larisselle served the Alliance undercover, stealing Empire secrets and passing them on to key members in the Rebellion. Fueling [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] rumors of a diva feud between herself and [[Sy Snootles/Legends|Sy Snootles]]&mdash;the "other" singing Pa'lowick star&mdash;Larisselle used the staged rivalry to distract the authorities from her true [[Treason/Legends|treasonous]] actions. Larisselle served the Rebellion throughout the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] and was able to see that her efforts paid off when the Empire fell and Palpatine was slain at the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]. Following the restoration of peace to the galaxy, Larisselle retired to Lowick, returning to the peaceful Pa'lowick life, surrounded by loved ones, where she lived out the rest of her days.

name: Hera Tuix
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Hera Tuix received her early [[Jedi training/Legends|education]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]]. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] after the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Tuix was made a [[Jedi Commander|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="YDR" />Stationed at the Temple in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Tuix participated in the [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|Apprentice Tournament]] overseen by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ilena Xan]]. Making it through to the Round of Eight, which was held in one of the Temple [[Jedi Temple Refectory|refectories]], Tuix was defeated by a wrist-lock performed by fellow apprentice [[Whie Malreaux/Legends|Whie Malreaux]].<ref name="YDR" />

name: Ilena Xan
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Ilena Xan received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] by the time of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]]. A colleague of fellow Master [[Jai Maruk]], Xan was appointed as an [[Jedi instructor|instructor]] of [[Broken Gate|unarmed combat]], which she taught at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]].<ref name="YDR" />During her tenure at the academy, Master Xan acquired the nickname "'''Iron Hand'''", referencing her rough teaching skills when it came to hand-to-hand combat. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Master Xan remained at the Temple instead of fighting on the front lines, continuing to train students in order to keep the Order's supply of Knights steady.
