Hosting the [[Jedi academy|academy's]] annual [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|Apprentice tournaments]], Master Xan ensured that the students remained civil and disciplined during the competition.<ref name="YDR" />

name: Jace Forno
description: Jace was called upon to help Greck overtake the ship stolen by [[IG-88]]. The [[Assassin droid/Legends|assassin droid]] used a nearby asteroid to shake the pursuit.Afterward, she became the chief of security on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]]. There she destroyed Unit [[Zed]] and blasted off [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO's]] leg on [[Indobok]], where she was attempting to steal the [[B'rknaa]] crystals. She aided the droid [[B-9D7]] in his plan to topple [[Boonda]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. Forno failed to realize that the droid was in fact [[Movo Brattakin]], the man who had employed her and was believed dead. Eventually, she betrayed Brattakin, decapitating his droid body with a blaster bolt.{{Char-stub}}

name: Jang Li-Li
description: {{Quote|There wasn't much left of the ship, Master. The Force was strong, and I hit the reactor chamber with my first shot.|Asajj Ventress, on Li-Li's ship|Yoda: Dark Rendezvous}}The [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] Jang Li-Li was a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] who lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She underwent [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the [[Jedi Temple]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] during her youth. Her first assigned responsibility as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] was a [[Mission to Sevarcos II|diplomatic mission]] to [[Sevarcos II|Sevarcos]], for which she first sought advice from her mentor, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]]&mdash;considered to be one of the strongest and wisest Jedi of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Order]]&mdash;before going.<ref name="DR" />During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the Jedi were tasked with leading the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], and Li-Li served as a [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]]. Shortly before leaving the Temple on a mission, Li-Li shared kitchen duties with her colleague, [[Maks Leem]]. It was the last [[Time/Legends|time]] Li-Li would ever spend inside the Temple, as she was soon [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederate]]-allied [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]]. While Li-Li was flying her [[Starship/Legends|ship]] deep in [[Realspace/Legends|space]], her ship's reactor chamber was shot by Ventress, causing it to explode. Seeking to collect a trophy from what would be the sixteenth Jedi she had killed, Ventress spent [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] searching the debris field and was able to find Li-Li's severed [[Limb/Legends|hand]] clutching her partially destroyed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] handle. Ventress took the hand and lightsaber to [[Count/Legends|Count]] Dooku, who was now the leader of the Confederacy. Dooku himself was sad when he learned of Li-Li's passing, recollecting her image as a striking woman with a lot of potential,<ref name="DR" /> as well as one of the many students he helped train during his time in the Jedi Order.<ref name="CSWE" /> He sent the remains of Li-Li's lightsaber to the Jedi Order's [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]], Yoda, along with a hidden [[Holorecorder/Legends|holorecording]] asking his former Master to meet with him on the planet [[Vjun/Legends|Vjun]] to discuss a ceasefire to the war.<ref name="DR" />

name: Janice Nall
description: In [[3956 BBY]], when the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]] occupied Taris, Janice Hall had most of her droids confiscated by the Sith. She suspected that the Sith either feared that insurgents would buy the droids to use against them or desired the droids for their own operations. Consequently, when the former [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] visited the shop with his companions, she possessed only two [[utility droid]]s—both of them [[T3-series utility droid|T3-series]]—in stock.<ref name="KOTOR" />{{Gamemechanics}}The cheaper of the two, [[T3-H8]], was purchased by Revan. The droid had recently undergone repairs that quickly proved inadequate when it exploded as soon as it left the store. A disappointed Revan secured the full refund of 50 credits, and possibly more to compensate for the trouble, in accordance with Nall's policy.<ref name="KOTOR" />{{Endgame}}The far more expensive [[T3-M4]], heavily customized for unrivaled expertise at security slicing, was commissioned specifically by the [[Exchange]] crime lord [[Davik Kang]]. When Revan came to purchase the droid, he deceived Nall into believing that he was collecting it for Kang. Unbeknownst to Nall, the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] [[Canderous Ordo]] responsible for setting up the order had conspired with Revan and his companions to use the droid to break into the [[Tarisian military base|Sith military base]] and steal the launch codes needed to [[Rescue of Bastila Shan|bypass the Sith blockade]].<ref name="KOTOR" />

name: Jenica Sonsen
description: Sonsen had an important role in the Centerpoint Crisis guiding around [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], [[Belindi Kalenda]], and [[Gaeriel Captison]]. She even was attracted to Lando and tried to move on her feelings, which Lando refused due to making a previous promise to another [[Tendra Risant Calrissian|person]].She continued in that job as late as [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]], when she was heading the team that was attempting to map the station's interior.

name: Jessa Vandangante
description: Shardra died while Jessa was still young, and was raised by her father. She inherited the leadership skills of both her late mother and her paternal grandmother, [[Carmilla Vandangante]], and she was soon second-in-command of the group, leading it when Doc was called away to negotiate deals or scout new base locations.When her father disappeared, Jessa stepped into the role of leader, keeping the band together despite panicked suggestions that the they should abandon what they had built. Suspecting that her father had been captured by the [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority]], Jessa made a deal with [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] to aide a scholar on [[Orron III]], [[Rekkon]], in locating several missing political prisoners in the Sector. Solo not only found the Authority's secret [[Stars' End/Legends|Stars' End]] prison, but he destroyed it and rescued Doc and the other prisoners. Doc, Jessa, and their outlaw techs next relocated to [[Urdur/Legends|Urdur]]. She and Han enjoyed a brief romance before Han returned to his smuggling ways.

name: Jobal Naberrie/Legends
description: [[File:Jobal Naberrie.jpg|thumb|left|190px|Jobal at dinner with her family]]A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Jobal Naberrie was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] in [[76 BBY/Legends|76 BBY]]<ref name="FF140" /> on the [[Color/Legends|green]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] in the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim Territories]]. Her [[Parent/Legends|mother]] went by the name of [[Ryoo Thule|Ryoo]], after a [[Ryoo|flower]] that grew in the vicinity of the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Keren/Legends|Keren]], but her father's identity was forgotten in the passage of [[Time/Legends|time]]. On her bountiful [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], the young Jobal began with a secure and happy childhood.<ref name="FF80" />When she became a young adult, Jobal met [[Ruwee Naberrie/Legends|Ruwee Naberrie]], a teenaged member of the [[Refugee Relief Movement/Legends|Refugee Relief Movement]], a non-profit resettlement agency. Impressed by Naberrie's social acumen, Jobal fell in love with him shortly after they met.<ref name="FF80" /> Unbeknownst to the young woman, her mother and Ruwee Naberrie's mother [[Winama Naberrie|Winama]] knew each other well and had been plotting for an arranged [[Marriage/Legends|marriage]] between their offsprings. The two mothers were genuinely surprised when they learned that Jobal and Ruwee had actually fallen in love.<ref name="FF140" />After their marriage in [[51 BBY/Legends|51 BBY]], Ruwee and Jobal Naberrie played an instrumental role in the founding of a [[Unidentified Naboo mountain village|new village]] in the [[Mountain/Legends|mountains]] close to [[Theed/Legends|Theed]], the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of Naboo. While Jobal Naberrie and her husband intended to spend the rest of their lives among that new community, they took a new turn when she got pregnant.<ref name="FF80" /> In [[50 BBY/Legends|50 BBY]], Naberrie gave life to a first daughter whom she named [[Sola Naberrie/Legends|Sola]],<ref name="FF80" /> and then [[46 BBY/Legends|four years later]] to another girl named [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé]]. With two other [[Mouth/Legends|mouths]] to feed, Jobal Naberrie and her husband started reconsidering their future.<ref name="FF80" />After Padmé received impressive scores to an aptitude test, Jobal and Ruwee moved to Theed in order to offer their children a chance at a higher education and richer life. Jobal was a very hospitable housewife and offered all her guests lavish meals. In Theed, she voluntarily worked in a variety of social service roles helping the underprivileged. Her way of life instilled very strong compassion and selflessness into their children, which was obvious from Padmé's career.<ref name="FF80" />In [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], Jobal, along with her husband who was the [[President]] of the Refugee Relief Movement at the time, had the surprising visit of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] at the RRM's [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] headquarters. Palpatine had come to try and convince the Naberries to have Padmé run for the [[Throne/Legends|throne]]. Ruwee and Jobal were pretty hesitant at first, not wanting their just-turned-thirteen-year-old daughter to go through all of this and lose.<ref name="SWDP" />After being [[Princess of Theed]] for two [[Standard year/Legends|years]], Padmé was elected [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|Queen of Naboo]] with a landslide victory.<ref name="SD">{{Tales|5|A Summer's Dream}}</ref> During the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation's]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion of Naboo]], Ruwee and Jobal were arrested and sent to [[Prison/Legends|jail]].<ref name="LoE">''[[Labyrinth of Evil]]''</ref> Eight years later, Padmé ended her second term as Queen and, at the request of her successor, Queen [[Jamillia/Legends|Jamillia]], became the new Senatorial representative of the [[Chommell sector/Legends|Chommell sector]].<ref name="AOTC">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], several [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|assassination attempts]] were made on Padmé. Jobal was deeply worried about her daughter's safety and kept reminding her that it was maybe time to think of herself and have a life of her own. In the same period, she had the occasion to meet her future son-in-law, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]].<ref name="AOTCDS" />[[File:Funeral-Naberries.png|thumb|right|240px|Jobal and her husband at Padmé's funeral procession]][[19 BBY/Legends|Three years later]], Jobal, along with the rest of her [[House Naberrie|family]] and thousands of other mourners, attended Padmé's [[Funeral of Padmé Amidala/Legends|funeral]] shortly after the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] had ended.<ref name="Episode III" />In [[18 BBY/Legends|18 BBY]], six [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after Padmé's funeral, Jobal's mother [[Ryoo Thule|Ryoo]] was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitor]] [[Malorum]] after the latter interrogated her about Padmé and her mysterious pregnancy.<ref name="TLofTJDoN">''[[The Last of the Jedi: Death on Naboo]]''</ref>

name: Jodelle Foxtrain
description: The twins were dancers on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]]. A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] businessman named [[Quatrain Pudundruh]] became their manager. After working with them for a [[Standard year/Legends|year]], he sold the sisters into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] to make up for his failing assets.They were purchased by the [[Black Hole Gang/Legends|Black Hole Gang]], a group of [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] from [[Delphon/Legends|Delphon]]. Jodelle was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in an accident during one of the pirates' raids.

name: Jynne Celwik
description: In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], she was in the club when the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]] was captured by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] right before the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Kal'Falnl C'ndros
description: Kal'Falnl C'ndros was a 3.5 meter tall freelance [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]], whose size required her to own a custom-built ship, the ''[[Shelltooth]]'', with corridors tall enough to accommodate her. She was widely regarded as being an overprotective mother, and her maternal instincts included not only her own eggs but also her clients and friends, especially the [[Bimm (Near-Human)|Bimm]] trader [[Rycar Ryjerd/Legends|Rycar Ryjerd]].<ref name="SWCCG" /><ref name="Secrets of the Sisar Run">''[[Secrets of the Sisar Run]]''</ref>For a time after picking him up at a stopover on [[Yuvern]], C'ndros trained the young [[Yuvernian/Legends|Yuvernian]] [[Cane Adiss/Legends|Cane Adiss]] how to pilot starships. They visited dozens of worlds before going their separate ways on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].<ref name="DB Cane Adiss">{{DB|character|caneadiss|Adiss, Cane|archivedate=20110110041535}}</ref>[[File:Kalfalnl-cndros.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Kal'Falnl C'ndros's legs (in silhouette) in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]].]]She was present in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] while [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] were selling Luke's old [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder]] to [[Vuvrian/Legends|Vuvrian]] alien [[Wioslea/Legends|Wioslea]] .<ref name="Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope">[[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']]</ref><ref name="SWCCG" />C'ndros was one of the [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] contacted by [[Mal Biron]] to transport one of several mysterious packages from [[Sriluur/Legends|Sriluur]] to an undisclosed location. As the sole crewmember aboard the ''Shelltooth'', she felt somewhat disadvantaged, seeking out help from several other smugglers also contacted by Biron. Whether they assisted her is unknown, though it is known that C'ndros was one of the earliest arrivals at the first checkpoint, near the [[Novalek Beacon]].<ref name="Secrets of the Sisar Run" />

name: Kass Tod
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]], Kass Tod was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the decade marked by the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]]. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Tod constructed a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] which she wielded in battle. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Tod took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Along with her master, Tod was assigned to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]] where they were to join other Jedi in a [[Battle of Jabiim|months-long battle]] with the Confederacy-backed [[Jabiimi Nationalists]].<ref name="BOJ" />During the fighting, Tod's master was slain and command was turned over to [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] who ordered that her small force remain behind the main battle line until the main Republic force could overrun the main weapons emplacement of the [[Jabiimi Military]]. Along with other masterless apprentices, Tod became known as a member of the so-called [[Padawan Pack]]. [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] Kenobi ordered Tod to ambush the retreating soldiers as they fled along the flanks of the main column of the Republic army. Separated from the rest of her group after the battle, Tod eventually regrouped with the other Padawans as they made for the main outpost of the Grand Army. During the fighting Tod grew extremely fond of fellow Padawan [[Mak Lotor]] and the two formed a romantic bond forbidden by the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]].<ref name="BOJ" />[[File:KassTodd.jpg|thumb|left|Kass Tod defends [[Mak Lotor]].]]As the Padawan Pack made a break for the main Republic outpost they came into open conflict with Jabiimi Nationalist leader [[Alto Stratus]]. Fighting alongside Lotor for four days on the battlefield, they were able to corner Stratus at long last. Using her lightsaber Tod [[Cho mok|removed]] Stratus' right leg, leaving the leader crippled and dying. Before she could finish off her opponent, a [[IG-227 Hailfire-class droid tank/Legends|Hailfire droid]] fired its rockets at the wounded Jedi. Unable to divert the missiles due to fatigue Tod cradled the wounded Lotor and, having decided to die together at peace, were killed in a fiery explosion.<ref name="BOJ" />

name: Klin-Fa Gi
description: [[File:Klin and Cilghal.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Klin-Fa Gi and Cilghal at the Conclave on Zonama Sekot.]]Born on [[Bonadan/Legends|Bonadan]], Gi was glad to escape offworld and join the [[New Jedi Order]], [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] alongside [[Yabeley]] and [[Bey Gandan]], both of whom developed attractions to her. Along with Gandan, she was presumed [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the [[Battle of Gyndine]], though in reality they survived, finding a [[qahsa]] filled with information on a [[Yuuzhan Vong]] plot to create anti-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] weapons and destroy the [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] on [[Thyferra/Legends|Thyferra]].[[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] hired [[Uldir Lochett]] and the crew of the ''[[No Luck Required]]'' to recover Gi, but she discovered the plot and escaped, fleeing to [[Wayland/Legends|Wayland]]. Investigating Yuuzhan Vong activity there, she was captured along with her two male companions, and they were [[Torture/Legends|tortured]], with Yabeley dying. Lochett tracked her and helped free the other Jedi from [[Chom-Vrone]], and were able to flee off world. However, they discovered too late that Gandan had been injected with a poison that, when released, would kill the bacta-producing [[alazhi tree]]s. After a long battle, Gi and Lochett killed Gandan and destroyed the virus.She was one of the survivors of the war that was called to [[Conclave on Zonama Sekot|a meeting]] of the New Jedi Order on [[Zonama Sekot/Legends|Zonama Sekot]] by [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] Skywalker.{{Char-stub}}

name: Klossi Anno
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] near birth on [[Chalacta/Legends|Chalacta]], Klossi Anno was taken to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] and inducted into the [[Jedi academy|academy]] there. Studying the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], Anno eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] after years of study and was selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] for one-on-one training. During her apprenticeship, the tensions between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] came to a breaking point resulting in the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. Reporting to the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], Anno was given the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and leadership of [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]].<ref name="DL" />After years of fighting, the war ended abruptly when the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] disbanded the Jedi Order with the issuance of [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]]. When her clone troopers turned their [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] on her, Anno's master sacrificed herself so that Anno could flee. Making her way to [[Dellalt/Legends|Dellalt]], Anno joined with nine other fugitive Jedi in hijacking an [[SX troop transport|SX troop shuttle]] from the newly formed [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. While they were pursued by a group of [[Aggressive ReConnaissance-170 starfighter/Legends|ARC-170s]] and a light cruiser, losing two of their company, Anno and the others escaped pursuit and were given sanctuary by the crew of the ''[[Drunk Dancer]]''. In the company of [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Jula Shryne]], the group was eventually joined by Master [[Roan Shryne]] and Padawan [[Olee Starstone]]. Given new hope by Starstone's enthusiasm and determination, Anno and her companions agreed to search for [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]]. Giving Master Shryne her fallen master's lightsaber, the group headed out to meet their fate on the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] homeworld.<ref name="DL" />Once there, Kashyyyk came under [[Battle of Kashyyyk (19 BBY)|invasion]] by the Empire for housing Jedi. Led by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], the Empire searched for the Jedi fugitives, eventually confronting them. Padawan Anno attacked the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] after he injured [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Siadem Forte]] and [[Iwo Kulka]], but the powerful [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] merely sidestepped her, slashing her across the back with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. Dragged away from the battle and taken offworld by the other surviving Jedi, Anno was able to recover and decided to sabotage the Empire in a less direct way. With the suggestions of her comrades, Anno planned to work on construction sites, or in an agricultural project, and intended to undo the Sith in more subtle ways than with a lightsaber.<ref name="DL" />

name: Lari Oll
description: {{Quote|If one of our starfighters could get past the Separatist blockade, there might be a way of relaying a message through the HoloNet.''"<br />"''Already considered that, Master Tiin has. Attempt to recall Jedi from Belderone, Tythe, and other worlds, he will.|Lari Oll and Yoda|Labyrinth of Evil}}Lari Oll was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="loe" /> [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] active during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. In the [[19 BBY/Legends|final year]] of the war, Oll was serving as a communications [[Technician/Legends|technician]]<ref name="cswe">{{CSWECite|II|409|Oll, Lari}}</ref> in the [[Jedi Temple]]. She was on duty when the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] launched an [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|attack]] on the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic's]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] wanted to recall all available Jedi to Coruscant; however, due to the attack, the Jedi were unable to communicate over the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]], so they resorted to using the [[Jedi beacon/Legends|Jedi beacon]].<ref name="loe" />In the [[Jedi Temple communication center/Legends|Jedi Temple communication center]], Oll attempted to send a message out using the beacon. Unable to break through the Separatists' intense signal [[Jammer|jamming]], Oll suggested to Yoda that if one of the Jedi [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] could get through the Separatist [[Blockade/Legends|blockade]] around the planet, they might be able to send a message through the HoloNet. Yoda informed Oll that [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Saesee Tiin/Legends|Saesee Tiin]] was already in the process of attempting to get past the enemy [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] to recall Jedi. On Yoda's command, Oll [[Comm unit/Legends|commed]] Master [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]]; however, the connection was unclear due to the defensive [[Planetary shield/Legends|shields]] that had been raised. Oll then attempted to comm Master [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]] to no avail.<ref name="loe" />

name: Leslomy Tacema
description: [[File:Duro aqualish1.jpg|thumb|left|Leslomy Tacema in [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]].]]Tacema helped run the docking facilities in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]]. She was friends with [[Ohwun De Maal/Legends|Ellors Madak]], and like him was an excellent pilot. She approved of all cargo manifests, and was forgiving of minor transgressions.<ref name="Jabba's Palace Limited">{{CCG|set=Jabba's Palace Limited|link=JabbasPalace-Light/large/leslomytacema.gif|cardname=Leslomy Tacema}}</ref>

name: Lissa Autem
description: In the year [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], Lissa accompanied her brother and his girlfriend [[Riao Siao]] at a pit race. While her father went on a mission to solve a murder case, Lissa accompanied her mother to [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] after been separated from her father.After the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] were reformed into the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Lissa started a relationship with a [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Lomina Argo
description: Lomina Argo was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Systems analyst]] on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]], [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], in the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. In that year, Argo was interviewed by a [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] [[Journalist/Legends|journalist]] about the [["Baby Ludi" custody case]], which concerned the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] refusing to return a six-[[Standard month/Legends|month]]-old [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] Human, [[Aris-Del Wari|Ludi]], to her [[Parent/Legends|mother]], [[Jonava Billane]]. After hearing a statement by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Coleman Trebor/Legends|Coleman Trebor]], in which Trebor said that the infant's mind had been opened to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and that returning the [[Youngling/Legends|child]] to her mother might prove dangerous, Argo told the reporter that she did not understand how a six-month-old child could be dangerous.<ref name="Jedi Watch" />

name: Lora Nadad
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] born to a family on [[Forard]], Lora Nadad was orphaned at a young age and eventually became the de facto leader among those orphans of "[[The Lost (children)|The Lost]]" living in the city. At the age of nineteen, Nadad was identified as Forceful and inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] to be [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the experimental [[Almas Academy|Academy]] on [[Almas]], far from the eyes of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].<ref name="AOE" />While there, Nadad befriended fellow apprentice [[Alurali]], and the two worked together to promote the welfare of ''The Lost''.<ref name="TL" /> During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Nadad invoked the [[Right of Denial]] and refused to report to Coruscant to receive military ranking within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Near the end of the war, a [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] named [[Garth Ezzar]] [[Destruction of the Almas Academy|attacked and destroyed]] the academy in a stunning assault upon Almas. Surviving the attack, Nadad fled to a [[Jax Warehouse|warehouse]] on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] where she was able to avoid detection as the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]] was initiated at the end of the war by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].<ref>''[[The Eye]]''</ref>

name: Lufta Shif/Legends
description: Before joining the [[Naboo Royal Advisory Council/Legends|Advisory Council]], Shif had spent many [[Standard year/Legends|years]] working as a [[Teacher/Legends|teacher]]. Well-known for her ability to inspire students, she eventually gained a prestigious position in [[Theed University/Legends|Theed University]]. Thanks to her amazing career in [[Theed/Legends|Theed]], Shif was then elected to be the new [[Education Advisor|Education Regent]]. [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala]] used to be one of her students and thus carefully listened to Shif's opinions.<ref name="FF139">{{FFCite|139|LUF 1-2, ''Lufta Shif''}}</ref>In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Shif was one of [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] Amidala's advisors gathered in the [[Theed Royal Palace/Legends|Theed Royal Palace's]] [[Throne room (Theed Royal Palace)/Legends|throne room]] when the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] launched their [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion of Naboo]].<ref name="TPM">[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'']]</ref>During the invasion, many [[Naboo (people)/Legends|Naboo]] were sent to [[Prison/Legends|jail]], including members of the Advisory Council. Shif spent her time in the prison camps alleviating people's minds and even getting some classes running.<ref name="FF139" />

name: M'iiyoom Onith/Legends
description: {{Quote|Don't you understand that fate has brought us together, fate in the form of a stupid ruling by a venal official?|Feltipern Trevagg, to M'iiyoom Onith|Nightlily: The Lovers' Tale}}The [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[H'nemthe (species)/Legends|H'nemthe]] M'iiyoom Onith was born to an unwealthy family on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[H'nemthe]], the [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of her [[Species/Legends|species]]. She was named for the [[m'iiyoom]], a white [[Plant/Legends|flower]] that blossomed on the planet and that translated from the [[H'nemthe (language)/Legends|H'nemthe]] to [[Galactic Basic Standard|Basic]] as "Nightlily." Onith lived with her mother and sisters and did not bed a male during her youth or young adulthood. As virgins were forbidden to leave H'nemthe, she remained on the planet<ref name="nightlily" /> until she was selected to take part in an experiment to see how well female H'nemthe would fare at finding mates from outside of their native culture.<ref name="negtas">''[[The New Essential Guide to Alien Species]]''</ref> Onith left to visit her sister on [[Cona/Legends|Cona]],<ref name="nightlily" /> and was accompanied by a chaperone during her travels until she boarded the wrong [[Starship/Legends|ship]] during a layover at a [[Space station/Legends|transfer station]]. The [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Mammon Hoole]] later believed that she may have done this intentionally in order to lose her chaperone.<ref name="negtas" />[[File:Drinkup.png|thumb|left|230px|M'iiyoom Onith flirts with Feltipern Trevagg in Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina.]]Before reaching Cona,<ref name="audio">[[Nightlily: The Lovers' Tale (audio)|''Nightlily: The Lovers' Tale'' audio drama]]</ref> Onith ended up in the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], where officials claimed that her travel papers were not in order. Forced to pay a passage tax, she was unable to afford transportation back to her homeworld.<ref name="nightlily" /> Onith lingered in Mos Eisley for several [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]], becoming a regular at [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|a local cantina]].<ref name="blues">''[[Empire Blues: The Devaronian's Tale]]''</ref><ref name="hasbro">{{HasbroCite|set=Star Wars: 30th Anniversary Collection|pack=M'iiyoom Onith (H'nemthe)|link=TAC22Miiyoom.asp|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190811171129/http://www.rebelscum.com/TAC22miiyoom.asp}}</ref> Eventually, she made her way to a tax collector's office in the city and was directed to the male [[Gotal/Legends|Gotal]] [[Feltipern Trevagg/Legends|Feltipern Trevagg]]. When she entered Trevagg's office, the Gotal glimpsed her and immediately fell in love, desiring to have [[Reproduction/Legends|sex]] with her as soon as possible. In order to keep her on Tatooine for the night, he told Onith that he would speak to the captain of the [[passenger liner]] the ''[[Tellivar Lady]]'', but in reality dawdled on his way to [[Docking Bay 9]], allowing the ship to lift off. Trevagg then took Onith to lunch at [[Court of the Fountain/Legends|Court of the Fountain]], an expensive restaurant owned by the [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]].<ref name="nightlily" /> While walking there from the tax office, he offered many compliments on her appearance, flattering her and winning some affection in return.<ref name="audio" />Jabba the Hutt's chef [[Porcellus/Legends|Porcellus]] produced four courses of [[Fruit/Legends|fruits]] and vegetables for Onith, as H'nemthe virgins were not permitted to eat meat. Over the meal and a bottle of [[Wine/Legends|wine]], Trevagg expressed his love for her, and Onith interpreted the declaration as a proposal of [[Marriage/Legends|marriage]].<ref name="nightlily" /> The Gotal played along, kissing Onith, and promising her a union of body and soul.<ref name="audio" /> Hoping to rid himself of Onith after a single night of pleasure, Trevagg brought her back to his office and booked her passage from Tatooine on the passenger liner the ''[[Starswan]]'', telling her that he would be joining her within the coming days. He then brought her to the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] she had visited several weeks before, hoping to further [[Alcohol/Legends|inebriate]] her and secure his night of intercourse. Onith was excited at the prospect of marriage and happily followed Trevagg to the bar,<ref name="nightlily" /> where he identified various species to her astonished [[Eye/Legends|eyes]].<ref name="audio" />The two sat at a booth with the [[Givin/Legends|Givin]] [[Elis Helrot/Legends|Elis Helrot]],<ref name="givin">{{DB|species|givin|Givin|archivedate=20100306095511}}</ref> but paid him little mind.<ref name="audio" /> Over several drinks, they began to discuss the idea of consummating their marriage before it actually happened. The [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and the young [[Moisture farmer/Legends|moisture farmer]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] then entered the cantina, and Onith became frightened when the two skirmished with the [[Aqualish/Legends|Aqualish]] [[Ponda Baba/Legends|Ponda Baba]] and his companion [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] [[Cornelius Evazan/Legends|Cornelius Evazan]]. Trevagg used the opportunity to fetch her another drink, and, eager to get her into bed, slipped a [[Love-Wallop pill]] into it. When the [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] [[Death/Legends|killed]] the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Greedo/Legends|Greedo]], Onith again grew frightened<ref name="nightlily" /> and asked if they could leave.<ref name="audio" />Trevagg brought her to the [[Mos Eisley Inn]].<ref name="nightlily" /> Onith had fallen madly in love with him,<ref name="negtas" /> and they began to physically demonstrate their passion for one another.<ref name="audio" /> After sex occurred, Onith used her razor-sharp tongue to gut Trevagg, as was [[H'nemthe mating ritual|customary]] for H'nemthe females to do. She left his corpse at the inn<ref name="nightlily" /> and returned to her homeworld, where she gained notoriety for being the first female of her species to attempt mating with a non-H'nemthe. No longer a virgin, she became free to travel offworld, but preferred to remain on the planet and speak publicly about her experience.<ref name="negtas" />

name: Magda Keto
description: {{Quote|Its nothing, mother, really. Korus just has a little ''indigestion''.|Aleema Keto to Magda Keto|Tales of the Jedi: Dark Lords of the Sith 1: Masters and Students of the Force}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]],<ref name="darklords1" /> [[Queen Mother]]<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|275|Magda}}</ref> Magda Keto was, along with her brother, [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Keto]], the ruler of the [[Empress Teta system/Legends|Empress Teta system]] around four thousand years before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. Keto and her brother were descendants of [[Emperor/Legends|Empress]] [[Teta]], the famous woman warrior who [[Unification Wars (Koros)|unified]] the seven [[Planet/Legends|worlds]] of the then-Koros [[Star system/Legends|system]] [[5000 BBY/Legends|a thousand years previous]]. The Empress Teta system was a major source of raw [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]], and the Ketos were forced to share their power with the commercial interests that ran carbonite [[Mining/Legends|mines]] in the system. Eventually, Magda had a daughter named [[Aleema Keto|Aleema]]. Along with Lord Keto's son, [[Satal Keto|Satal]], Aleema was the heir to the [[Tetan Monarchy|Tetan throne]]. The younger Ketos, filled with anger and resentment toward their elders and with much free time on their hands, formed a [[darksider]] organization called the [[Krath/Legends|Krath]], and learned to wield [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Sith magic]]. The Krath launched a [[Political uprising of the Empress Teta system|rebellion]] in [[3997 BBY]], while Magda and Lord Keto were on an inspection tour of an [[Orbit/Legends|orbiting]] [[Tetan carbonite smelter]] over the planet [[Empress Teta/Legends|Empress Teta]].<ref name="darklords1" />Magda Keto and her brother met with [[Bearus]], the [[Chairman/Legends|chairman]] of the [[Carbonite Guild]]. As they exchanged pleasantries, Aleema and Satal, along with their royal tutor [[Korus]], arrived in a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]]. There, Satal and Aleema revealed that they had turned Korus' tongue into an [[Adegan eel]] with Sith magic, and attacked Magda Keto, her brother, and the mining executives. Lord Keto ordered his [[Royal Protector]]s to apprehend Satal and Aleema, to Magda's horror; she was outraged that her brother would arrest their own children, but Keto responded that he had no choice. However, Aleema's Sith [[Mind trick/Legends#Illusion|illusions]] overpowered the Royal Protectors, leaving Magda Keto and her brother defenseless. They were led by Satal and Aleema toward a vat of molten carbonite, where they were [[Carbon-freezing/Legends|frozen]], [[Death/Legends|killing]] them. The frozen bodies of Magda and Lord Keto went on display as wall decorations in their former palace, the [[Iron Citadel]].<ref name="darklords1" />

name: Maks Leem
description: Maks Leem, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Gran/Legends|Gran]] from the [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Malastare/Legends|Malastare]] was trained in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], achieving the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] before the start of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], a political schism in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]]. Appointed as an [[Jedi instructor|instructor]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], Master Leem [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] two [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] before the civil unrest engulfed [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Jedi [[Rees Alrix]] and [[Eremin Tarn]]. An expert in [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] navigation, Master Leem instructed classes at the Temple, as well as working in the Temple's [[Jedi Temple Refectory|refectory]]. The Gran Master, while not a fan of lightsaber combat, had crafted for herself a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="YDR" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Master Leem was one of nearly [[Geonosis strike team|two hundred Jedi]] who fought in the opening [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|battle]] on [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], a conflict which introduced the Jedi to the newly formed [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Returning to a nearly empty Temple, Master Leem remained on Coruscant for much of the war as an instructor while most of her peers were scattered around [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] fighting. Early in the war, Master Leem's last Padawan, Jedi Eremin Tarn, willingly left the Order, joining Jedi [[Sian Jeisel]]'s schismatic movement of Jedi refusing to fight. At this time, Master Leem began the training of her third Padawan, the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Whie Malreaux/Legends|Whie Malreaux]]. One of the Temple's most promising students, the pair remained on Coruscant as Leem continued to teach and Malreaux serving at the [[Jedi Temple#Layout and architecture|Temple's main entrance]] as part of the [[Temple Security Force]].<ref name="YDR" />In the days leading up to the [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|annual Apprentice Tournament]], A [[Troxan]] [[Diplomat/Legends|diplomat]] delivered an [[incendiary packet]] for [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] into the hands of Master Leem, who in turn rushed the packet to the [[Room of a Thousand Fountains/Legends|Room of a Thousand Fountains]]. There, Master Yoda safely opened the package to reveal the damaged [[lightsaber hilt]] of Jedi [[Jang Li-Li]]. Saddened by Li-li's inevitable death, Yoda and Leem talked for a time, with the old Master jokingly assigning Leem the task of locating a new home for the Temple. In the following weeks, Master Leem and her Padawan were assigned to a [[Mission to Vjun (Clone Wars)|mission]], accompanied by Masters Yoda, [[Jai Maruk]] and his Padawan, [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy]]. Leaving by way of the [[Chancellor Palpatine Spaceport]], the Jedi smuggled Yoda offworld in a hollowed out [[R2-series astromech droid]] aboard the ''[[Reasonable Doubt]]'' and headed for [[Vjun/Legends|Vjun]] where Yoda was to meet with [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], leader of the Confederacy.<ref name="YDR" />When the ''Reasonable Doubt'' stopped to refuel at [[Phindar Station]], the Jedi were [[Battle of the Phindar Spaceport|ambushed]] by several [[A-series assassin droid|assassin droids]] armed with an eclectic array of weaponry. Activating two [[hard-sound gun]]s, the droids crippled Masters Maruk and Leem; both dropped to their knees as the hard-sound ruptured their eardrums. Master Leem, having dropped her lightsaber and covering her ears as she screamed in pain, fought through her agony and retrieved her lightsaber. Cutting loose a chunk of [[Durasteel/Legends|durasteel]], she hurled it with the Force and destroyed one of the auditory-assault weapons. Allowing years of practice to take over, the two Masters rushed the droids, two against eighteen.<ref name="YDR" />Master Leem, trained in the art of [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]] as were all Jedi, realized that her aversion to war had led her to avoid combat training, and that her skills as a fighter were diminished. Quickly receiving a leg wound due to one of the droid's [[flechette launcher]]s, she lost her lightsaber once more when her sword arm was badly damaged by more shards of metal. Destroying two droids with her mastery of the Force, Master Leem was in the midst of looking for Master Yoda and the Padawans when [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] arrived on the concourse and began to mock the Jedi. Engaging Master Maruk as Leem struggled to remain conscious, Ventress was faster than the Human Jedi and quickly subdued him. As Maruk struggled to remain in the light of the Force, Ventress taunted him by pouncing on Master Leem, slashing the dying Gran in the chest. Disregarding the wound, Master Leem focused on her struggling companion, begging him to stay on the Jedi Path. As Leem struggled to maintain her position on the ground as a large hole in the station began to slowly vent oxygen and drag her from the room, Master Maruk, determined to stay in the light, denied the dark side. Master Leem, unable to hear or look at the man as she focused on sealing the breach in the hull, felt his resolve in the Force and was content, knowing that both would die as Jedi. Managing to patch the breach as Maruk was cut in half by Ventress, Leem lay helpless on the ground as the [[Dathomirian/Legends|Dathomirian]] approached the Gran and stabbed her in the chest, killing the Jedi Master.<ref name="YDR" />

name: Matta Tremayne
description: [[File:Watery Ossus.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Ossus, where Matta Tremayne taught the Jedi arts]]

name: Mellona Gantrolo
description: Prior to the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] Mellona was a beautiful [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] in her early twenties, a dedicated socialite who treated [[Procopia/Legends|Procopia]] as her personal playground. She was totally dedicated to her true house and was willing to sacrifice everything to achieve her objectives.Baroness Gantrolo was particularly attuned at detecting the political sympathies of others and was an expert at echoing the sentiments back. She was also known to be quite manipulative.

name: Naat Reath
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Naat Reath and her brother, [[Stam Reath|Stam]], were given to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by their parents. Studying together at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] which would plague the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] for nearly a decade, Reath remained at the Temple when her brother and his tutor, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Echuu Shen-Jon]], were called to [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|fight]] on [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] for the opening salvo of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. During the fighting, Stam Reath confronted the [[Dark Acolyte]] [[Sev'rance Tann]] and was slain leaving Shen-Jon and Reath in great emotional pain.<ref name="GGCC" />[[File:Naat Reath captured.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Naat Reath captured during the [[Battle of Krant]].]]In an attempt to help the pair grieve, the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] assigned Reath to Shen-Jon as his new Padawan. Taking up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], Reath was placed in command of [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] who would follow her orders in battle. Eager to prove herself a worthy apprentice, Reath also longed to avenge her brother despite the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code's]] negative view on vengeance. Hunting [[General/Legends|General]] Taan across the galaxy, the pair hoped to rob the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] of one of their most aspiring generals, but their actions brought them dangerously close to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]. When they finally tracked Tann to the planet [[Krant]], Reath was captured by the Acolyte and held prisoner. Challenging Shen-Jon to a [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|lightsaber duel]] for the prize of keeping Reath alive, Shen-Jon fell to the dark side and was able to defeat Taan in combat. When he set out to mutilate the [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] woman's body, Reath stopped her master, begging him to abandon his hate and return to Coruscant with her. Upon his refusal, Reath returned to the Temple and reported to the High Council that Shen-Jon had killed Tann but died from wounds suffered in battle. However, Reath's testimony to the High Council was met with mixed reception. Mace Windu in particular did not fully believe Reath, and wondered for the rest of his life what happened on Krant. Windu asked Reath about the subject on at least one other occasion, but she spoke evasively, leaving the truth unclear to Windu and the High Council.Reath's ultimate fate into the Rise of the Empire remained unknown, but when her Master Echuu Shen-Jon resurfaced decades later, she did not.<ref name="GGCC" />

name: Naradan D'ulin
description: After the coup in the royal house of Ootoola were executed by a group of insurgent Ootoolaner purists, Naradan was able to survive along with [[Foolookoola]] and [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Sabon]]. [[Vilmarh Grahrk]], [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] was hired to protect her for her destination. D'Ulin had serious reservations about Grahrk since she doesn't trust his species that much.While operating, Naradan and Vilmarh were found by the purists and taken as prisoners, but they were released after Vilmarh feigned his betrayal and brought them to safety on Dur Sabon. D'Ulin remained after the trip on the side of the [[Prince/Legends|princess]], to protect her further.{{Char-stub}}

name: Nella Bold
description: Nella lived alone with her father on his moisture farm since her early youth, when her mother was murdered by [[Mantellian Savrip/Legends|Savrips]]. Running the farm was hard on her and her father, since the tyrannical land [[Baron/Legends|baron]] [[Taxer Sundown]], who wanted to take over their enterprise, scared away both customers and their hired help. What time her work did not require, Nella spent modifying and improving her [[T-24 airspeeder]], which her father had given her after finding it left behind by a miner in the province.In [[37 BBY]], Nella met the two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], who were investigating a mysterious freighter from [[Vena/Legends|Vena]] shipping Mantellian Savrips. When they also decided to investigate Sundown, she decided to help them and fly them to the city at [[Ten Mile Plateau]] where his headquarters were located. On the way, they passed a band of Savrips. Nella, who naturally had wanted revenge on these creatures ever since her mother's murder, tried to strafe them with the airspeeder's inbuilt [[Blaster cannon/Legends|heavy blaster]], but was forcibly restrained by the Jedi, causing her to resent them.When they arrived in the city, malicious eyes were already watching for them. Nella suddenly felt very ill. Moments later, she was mind-controlled by Sundown's mysterious powers and led the Jedi into a trap. In a back alley, Sundown revealed himself to the Jedi through a hologram. Immediately thereafter, they were attacked by more of Sundown's mind-controlled servitors, [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] armed with [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]]. While the Jedi were thus occupied, Sundown's elite cadre abducted Nella and left.Nella was brought to Sundown's mountain retreat, far out in the desert, where she was held while the criminals deliberated. In the end, they decided to take her out into the desert and kill her. However, at this point Savrips led by [[Mawkran]], the same Savrips she had tried to kill earlier, attacked the base and killed Sundown's goons. Nella expected to be killed or worse, but much to her surprise the Savrips spared her, capturing her but treating her better than the mercenaries had.Eventually, the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] Qui-Gon Jinn managed to track down the Savrips and free her. He also opened talks with the savrips, who proved much more civilized and intelligent than anyone had ever suspected. Mawkran, who was able to speak accented [[Galactic Basic Standard|Basic]], revealed that it was Sundown, not them, who was behind many of the murders that had plagued the countryside, including that of Nella's mother. For some reason, he seemed to want the Savrips hated, and by now they had been driven into near-extinction. His clan were the last, and now there where going to fight back - or die. Nella then agreed to help Qui-Gon and the Savrips to fight Sundown.The Savrips thus attacked his main headquarters at the Ten Mile Plateau. Sundown himself was killed by Obi-Wan Kenobi, and his mistress, the Baroness [[Omnino]], by Master Jinn. However, a militia of moisture farmers, who had observed the battle, thought the Savrips had launched a general attack on Ord Mantell's [[Human/Legends|Human]] community, with Nella as their hostage. Sneaking up on the victorious heroes, they shot Mawkran, who stood the closest to Nella, in the back, killing him. The misunderstanding was eventually resolved, but that did not bring him back.Nella, very touched by the Savrips' sacrifice, vowed to spend her life trying to undo the wrongs that had been committed against them. However, she was powerless to prevent their later decline.

name: Obs Kaj
description: Lunis and Kaj went to [[Katanos VII]] to investigate rumored illegal [[Cloning/Legends|cloning]], and discovered the rumor to be true. The local [[Mining/Legends|miners]] attempted to capture the Lunis and his padawan, using [[Cortosis/Legends|cortosis]]-[[Armor/Legends|armored]] [[Gundark/Legends|gundarks]], in order to hand them over to [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] for [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]].The two Jedi defended themselves, and Linus attempted to connect with Kaj through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. However, he could not form a mental link with her, as she had grown so disillusioned with the Jedi Order's seeming hypocrisy during the Clone Wars that she had effectively cut herself off from the Force and her master. Lunis was killed by the miners before Obs Kaj's [[Eye/Legends|eyes]]. She escaped from the miners in one of their short-range pods, and tried to hail any nearby [[Starship/Legends|ships]], soon finding one in range. Unfortunately, the ship belonged to Count Dooku, who had his ship fire upon the pod, destroying it and killing Kaj.

name: Olee Starstone
description: Olee Starstone was accepted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and grew up in the [[Jedi Temple]], where she was selected as a Padawan of the [[Chief Librarian/Legends|Chief Librarian]], [[Jocasta Nu/Legends|Jocasta Nu]]. Starstone hoped to one day succeed Nu in her position amongst the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Jedi Archives]]. Shortly before the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], in an attempt to broaden her horizons, Starstone went on a mission to [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]]. It was there that she first met [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Bol Chatak]].

name: Pirt Neer
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Pirt Neer was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received her [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Neer remained at the Temple and participated in the [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament]]. Administrated by Master [[Ilena Xan]], Neer faced off against fellow Initiate [[Enver Hoxha]] and defeated him during the Round of Eight. Despite her apparent victory, Neer was forced to yield when [[Lena Missa]] placed her in an arm bar.<ref name="YDR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Rahasia Sandral
description: Rahasia was born in the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] on the planet of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to [[Nurik Sandral]]. The name and history of her mother is unknown, only that she died giving birth to Rahasia. Rahasia was the youngest of two children, and had an older brother named [[Casus Sandral|Casus]]. By the end of the Mandalorian Wars, Nurik decided to move his small family away from the destruction and corruption of the [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]]. He chose a quaint planet in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] named [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]] and invested in the construction of a large estate on the peaceful plains of the planet.To Nurik's dismay, the peace that he had sought on [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]] only lasted for a few short years. It wasn't death; it wasn't politics; and it wasn't disease; it was [[Ahlan Matale]]. Not many know what the real cause of the Sandral/Matale feud was. Perhaps it was the border dispute between the two men; or when Nurik's droid shipment went missing; or the random acts of vandalism on Ahlan's estate. Either way, the two men hated each other almost to the point of going to war.Nurik barred Rahasia and Casus from interacting with any member of the [[Matale family]], especially Ahlan's only son, [[Shen Matale]]. But Nurik could not keep his kids caged for long. Rahasia frequently accompanied her brother Casus on his exploration of the plains of Dantooine, as he was an amateur archaeologist. One day, Casus and Rahasia met Shen. It wasn't long before Shen became friends with Casus and fell in love with his younger sister, Rahasia.But all was not to last. Casus went missing, and distraught with grief, Nurik turned to the man he despised, [[Ahlan Matale]]. Nurik blamed Ahlan for Casus' disappearance, and it wasn't long before he kidnapped [[Shen Matale]]. When Rahasia found out about her father's actions, she became hysterical. What would Nurik do to Shen? Kill him? Torture him? She didn't know what to do, until [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] showed up.[[Revan/Legends|Revan]] came into the courtyard of the Sandral's estate and questioned Nurik about Shen's disappearance. Nurik denied that he knew anything about Shen's disappearance but brought up that his son, Casus, had also gone missing. [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] gave Nurik a datapad and told him that Casus had been killed by [[Kath hound/Legends|kath hounds]] out on the plains. Nurik, tortured with grief, took the datapad and left the courtyard, saying he knew nothing of Shen's disappearance. Rahasia had eavesdropped on all of this, and once Nurik had left, she went out in the courtyard and told [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] everything. Everything from her and Shen's love to Nurik kidnapping Shen. [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] told her that he would have to confront Nurik, but she begged him not to judge Nurik too harshly. Rahasia gave [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] a pass key to the back of the house, telling him that Shen was in one of the holding cells. [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] left, and Rahasia went to her room, praying that the Jedi would save Shen.Ten minutes after Rahasia went into her room, [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] came in and told her that Shen would not leave unless she met him outside of the Sandral Estate. A smile played at Rahasia's lips as she told [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] that she would meet them just beyond the Sandral estate. [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] left, and Rahasia quickly made her way to the borders of the Sandral estate.When Rahasia saw Shen come out and meet him, she ran up to him and held him in a fierce embrace. Shen and Rahasia both thanked [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] for all he had done. Before they could leave, Ahlan came up to them with two assault droids flanking him. He soon began to shout obscenities at [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], Shen, and Rahasia. Soon after, Nurik came out of his estate with his own two battle droids. Ahlan and Nurik engaged in an intense debate filled with sneering, mocking, and arguing. Shen and Rahasia both pleaded with them to stop the fighting, but it wasn't until [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] stepped in that the two old men actually listened. [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], backed up by Shen and Rahasia, reasoned with Nurik and Ahlan to stop the fighting and let Shen and Rahasia get married. The two began to talk to each other about it and finally decided that they would build Rahasia and Shen their own estate. Rahasia and Shen both thanked [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] for what he did for them.

name: Rallcema Bylissura
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Rallcema Bylissura was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Over time, Bylissura attained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="BOJ" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Bylissura accepted her role as a [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] to counter the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid army]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. During the war, Bylissura was assigned to assist in the massive [[Battle of Jabiim|defense]] of [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]]. During the fighting, Bylissura was stationed at [[Shelter Base]] with fellow Jedi [[Dalnus Cam]] and [[Sana-Jis Ilowa]]. The Separatists ambushed the Jedi there and Bylissura was killed in the fighting.<ref name="BOJ" />

name: Riao Siao
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Felacatian]], Riao Siao was an orphan who lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], Siao began dating [[Reymet Autem]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] and the son of a [[Senate Guard/Legends|Senate Guard]] named [[Sagoro Autem]]. Reymet's father was a stern man, and didn't care for his son dating someone of a different species and social class. Reymet, however, having recently been suspended from the [[Senate Guard Academy]]&mdash;a fact unknown to his [[Parent/Legends|father]]&mdash;was seeking to do all he could to shirk Autem's rules and continued to date Siao. The two young lovers had plans to leave the planet together, and head to Siao's [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Felacat]].Siao and Reymet were both [[Pit racing|pit racers]], participating in the illegal sport without caution. The sport was practiced in the [[garbage pit]]s of the [[Lower City]]. Contestants competed in unique, individually-made [[pit racer]]s, gliders in which they descended the garbage pits to the lowest levels, where they collected scales from the backs of [[garbage worm]]s. Since garbage canisters, regularly ejected from the pits into orbit, could kill the competitors, the races were subject to [[Judicial/Legends|Judicial]] raids.[[File:Garbagepitracing.jpg|thumb|left|280px|Reymet Autem competing in a pit race]]One day, Siao, Reymet, and Reymet's little sister [[Lissa Autem]] attended one of the races, where Reymet competed. While they were there, however, [[Judicial Forces/Legends|Judicial Forces]] raided the garbage pit, and Siao resisted arrest. She was [[Stun/Legends|stunned]] by an [[Officer/Legends|officer]], and Reymet assaulted the man in response. Unknown to Siao and Autem's children, Sagoro Autem and his partner [[Isaru Omin]] had previously infiltrated the crowd, seeking to rescue his his son and daughter from the raid. Just as all three children were being arrested, Autem and Omin revealed themselves to the Judicial officers. Autem used his authority to have Reymet and Lissa released, but allowed the Judicials to take Siao away, not caring what happened to her.After [[Venco Autem]], Sagoro's brother and an ex-convict, was released from prison and attempted to reunite with his [[Autem family|family]], Reymet was shocked to witness his father's cold treatment of his uncle and ended up running away from their home. He located Siao where she was being held in [[Prison/Legends|custody]], and she tearfully shouted through the bars for him to help her. Reymet brashly confronted one of the [[guard]]s, who then threatened to place Reymet in jail alongside Siao. Suddenly, his uncle Venco appeared and skillfully bribed the guards to release Siao, who was overjoyed to be set free. The pair immediately began to make plans once more to move to Felacat, and Venco himself said that he would foot the bill for their departure. First, however, Venco asked Reymet to repay him for his kindness with a small favor&mdash;the access codes known only to Senate Guards. Reymet, not fully aware of his uncle's past, was impressed by Venco's generosity, and agreed to his stipulations. As Reymet's codes had been invalidated due to his suspension from the Academy, he gave Venco his father's access codes, which Autem was unaware that his son knew.Soon, Reymet was confronted by his father while packing to leave with Siao, and he was made aware of the full breadth of Venco's sins; the planning of two [[Assassin/Legends|assassinations]], one [[Jheramahd Greyshade|completed]] and one still in [[Simon Greyshade/Legends|motion]], in order to bench the [[Financial Reform Act]] that sought to prevent the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] from [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|tearing apart]]. Autem allowed his son to leave, and he and Siao finally managed to make their way offworld.

name: Ryoo Naberrie/Legends
description: [[File:Ryoo pooja.jpg|thumb|left|190px|Ryoo (right) in 22 BBY with her younger sister, Pooja (left).]]Ryoo was named after her [[Parent/Legends|mother]] Sola's maternal grandmother, [[Ryoo Thule]], as well as a [[Color/Legends|blue]] and yellow [[Ryoo|flower]] that grew in the outlying hills near the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Keren/Legends|Keren]]. Of her and her younger sister [[Pooja Naberrie/Legends|Pooja]], Ryoo was the more temperamental sister. Ryoo and her sister would often accompany their mother on visits to their grandparents, and would visit with [[Jev Nerran]], a neighbor and friend of the [[House Naberrie|family]].<ref name="DB" />During her childhood, Ryoo attended the best [[school]]s where she learned classic [[Futhork/Legends|futhork]] calligraphy, a subject she disliked. As a young girl, she owned a pet [[Voorpak/Legends|voorpak]] named [[Sanani]], which she often dressed up to share many of her imaginary adventures.<ref name="DB" />In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Ryoo and the rest of the family met [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] when her aunt, [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], brought him to the Naberrie family home in Naboo's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] city of [[Theed/Legends|Theed]].<ref name="AOTCDS" /> [[19 BBY/Legends|Three years later]], at the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Ryoo, along with her family and thousands of other mourners, attended her aunt's [[Funeral of Padmé Amidala/Legends|funeral]] in the streets of Theed.<ref name="ROTS">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref>

name: Sera Tharen
description: Sera had been pushing Bria towards a marriage to [[Dael Levare]], who was from one of the richest families on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]. When Bria dumped him for being unfaithful, Sera was furious with her for ruining the wedding plans. The falling out led to Bria leaving home and becoming a pilgrim on [[Ylesia/Legends|Ylesia]].When Bria returned to Corellia with [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] after escaping Ylesia, Sera and Pavik were disgusted by Bria's companion. With the arrival of the authorities investigating Solo &mdash; who had a [[Death mark/Legends|death mark]] on his head from [[Teroenza]] &mdash; Bria and her mother had a falling out and never met or spoke again.

name: Serifa Altunen
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Arkanian/Legends|Arkanian]], Serifa Altunen was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] after completing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Altunen went on to become well respected within the Order. When negotiations between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] broke down and the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Altunen dutifully took on the role of [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]] as she led [[Clone trooper/Legends|troops]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="YDR" />As the war dragged on, Altunen became disenchanted with the Order's role in the war and the corruption in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]]. Departing [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Altunen returned to her homeworld of [[Arkania/Legends|Arkania]]<ref name="TCSWE" /> where she began encouraging the Arkanian government to declare neutrality during the Clone Wars. When the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] heard of this, Jedi Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and Jedi Knight [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] were dispatched to persuade her to return to the Order and the war. Rendezvousing with Altunen on a watery tundra plain thirty months after the start of the war, Master Kenobi pleaded with the woman to return to the [[Jedi Temple]]. Taking off her [[Jedi apparel|Jedi robe]] and folding it, Altunen officially resigned from the Order, citing that she served the Force, and that she believed that the Jedi no longer did. With the conversation over, Altunen departed the company of her fellow Jedi and returned to her people.<ref name="YDR" />

name: Shasa Tiel/Legends
description: Tiel left SoroSuub after being blackmailed and fell to crime, ending up in the employ of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. She continued her accounting profession there under [[Mosep Binneed/Legends|Mosep Binneed]] alongside [[Tessek/Legends|Tessek]] and [[Loje Nella/Legends|Loje Nella]]. Like them, she came to despise her employer and sought to regain her freedom.Tiel was present in [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]], asleep on [[Jabba's dais]], when [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] disguised as [[Boushh/Legends|Boushh]], attempted to free [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] from carbonite. She later witnessed [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] encounter with the [[Rancor/Legends|rancor]] and was aboard the [[Khetanna/Legends|''Khetanna'']] when the [[Battle of the Great Pit of Carkoon]] broke out. Tiel rejoiced from Jabba never returning from the expedition, which ended with the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] [[Death/Legends|death]] and the ''Khetanna''{{'s}} destruction.

name: Sia-Lan Wezz
description: [[File:WookieeToss.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Rorworr, Vor'en Kurn, and Sia-Lan Wezz deal with a [[T4 turret droid]] ambush in close quarters.]]Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] during infancy, Sia-Lan Wezz was taken to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|formal training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Jedi academy|Temple's academy]]. After years of training, Wezz was selected by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Lo-Jad]] as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and was destined to travel [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] with him to continue her studies down the Jedi Path. A year after her thirteenth birthday, Wezz was assigned to investigate the Coruscant-based terrorist organization known as [[the Flail]]. Teaming with a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]], Wezz was forced to engage members of the group and went on to complete her mission.<ref name="SOC">''[[Shadows of Coruscant]]''</ref> In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Master Lo-Jad assigned Wezz to [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] where she was to study for a semester at the [[Royal House of Learning]] in [[Theed/Legends|Theed]]. Becoming close with [[Headmaster/Legends|headmaster]] [[Lucos Dannt]], Wezz was on planet when the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] [[Blockade/Legends|blockaded]] the planet. During the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion]], Wezz joined the [[Naboo Underground]], a resistance movement that attempted to topple Federation control. During her time in the resistance, Wezz became well acquainted with the likes of [[Deel Surool]], [[Rorworr (Naboo)|Rorworr]], and fellow Padawan [[Rann I-Kanu]]. While Wezz would leave Naboo shortly after the Federation was defeated, she kept in touch with her new comrades and would involve them in several missions in her future career.<ref name="Invasion of Theed" />During her time as a Padawan, Wezz either crafted several [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] or possessed several [[lightsaber crystal]]s as she was seen with blue, pink, yellow, and green-bladed weapons throughout her service to the Order. Following the election of [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] as [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]], Wezz was assigned a mission to the snow-covered world of [[Puloorn]] with her comrades Rorworr, [[Vor'en Kurn]], and Deel Surool to uncover a hidden [[Sith temple (Puloorn)|Sith Temple]]. The team found the temple ruins, possibly inhabited by [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] beasts or cultists, and reported the findings to Palpatine and the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Over the course of the next decade, Wezz would study and prepare for her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], a series of tests she would pass before being elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="SWRG">''[[Star Wars Roleplaying Game]]''</ref>Just before the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Wezz and her comrades journeyed to [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] where the four foiled a Separatist assassination attempt on a [[Corulag/Legends|Corulag]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]], [[Alastar Treen]].<ref name="RPGRCRB">''[[Star Wars Roleplaying Game Revised Core Rulebook]]'' '''0''': Rodian cantina fight pg 151. '''1''': Mission to Corann, pg 145-147.</ref> Following this, the four frequently worked together. The team faced a variety of opponents and situations, such as attacks on battle droid commanders, the investigation of a bounty hunter operating out of the [[Royal Hutt Hotel]], assaults on crime bosses, encounters with [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], cantina brawls with [[Aqualish/Legends|Aqualish]]<ref name="RPGCRB">''[[Star Wars Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook]]'' '''0''': Aqualish cantina fight pg 133. '''1''': Search for Arsenal Ship, pg 127-129</ref> and Rodian gangs,<ref name="RPGRCRB" /> an escape from a battle droid [[Garrison/Legends|garrison]],<ref name="RPGRCRB" /> an escape from a [[Colicoid/Legends|Colicoid]]-run prison in the [[Spice Mines of Kessel]],<ref name="GOI">''[[Galaxy of Intrigue]]''</ref> a [[Jawa/Legends|Jawa]] ambush in an abandoned armory, and even [[E-Web heavy repeating blaster|mounted blasters]] in the darkened corridors of the [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[Grumbog]]'s [[Space station/Legends|space station]] [[Grumbog's space station fortress|fortress]].<ref name="RPGRCRB" />[[File:Sia-Lan-Wezzdeath.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Sia-Lan Wezz [[Shiak|impaled]] by Darth Vader]]The team was so successful that they continued to receive orders directly from the office of the Chancellor and the High Council. One such mission had the group investigating the disappearance of a Republic arsenal ship that had been tasked with decommissioning the Trade Federation Army defeated at Naboo. The investigation led the team to [[Kwenn Space Station]], where they defeated several re-activated battle droids.<ref name="RPGCRB" /> Another mission to which the team was assigned involved preventing [[Corann]] from being the first of the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] to withdraw from the Republic. Rorworr's team investigated rumors of Separatist activity on the small industrial planet and discovered a droid manufacturing plant.<ref name="RPGRCRB" />An accomplished Guardian by the end of the war, Wezz was able to avoid the execution of [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] at the end of the war; an order issued by the [[Treason/Legends|treasonous]] Chancellor Palpatine ordering the death of all Jedi. Fleeing from the Grand Army, Wezz came into contact with fellow survivor Master [[Shadday Potkin/Legends|Shadday Potkin]] and agreed to meet her on [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]]. A month after the birth of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Wezz [[Conclave on Kessel|met]] with Jedi Potkin, [[Ma'kis'shaalas/Legends|Ma'kis'shaalas]], [[Roblio Darté]], [[Tsui Choi]], [[Bultar Swan/Legends|Bultar Swan]], [[Koffi Arana]], and [[Jastus Farr]] to discuss their next move against Palpatine, who was indeed a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]]. Unbeknownst to all present, Potkin had arrogantly lured [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] to the meeting in hopes that the team could overwhelm the Sith and end the Empire. Sia-Lan Wezz was the first to attack Vader, charging toward him with her lightsaber poised high. She was no match for the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] though, who easily extended his lightsaber through her chest, and sliced off her hand before her [[Death/Legends|dead]] body hit the floor.<ref name="Purge" />

name: Sola Naberrie/Legends
description: [[File:SolaNaberrie1.jpg|thumb|left|190px|Sola, at dinner with her family]]Sola met her future husband [[Darred Janren Naberrie|Darred Janren]], a young [[Architect/Legends|architect]], while studying at a [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] [[University/Legends|university]]. Shortly after her [[Marriage/Legends|marriage]], she had two daughters, [[Ryoo Naberrie/Legends|Ryoo]] and [[Pooja Naberrie/Legends|Pooja]].
