Sola and Darred recognized the fact that the [[House Naberrie|Naberrie name]] was well-known within the social and [[Politics/Legends|political]] circles of Naboo, and therefore decided to keep it as the family name.<ref name="DB" />Having settled happily into a domestic life, Sola worried about [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé's]] choice of life, wondering if her "little baby sister" would ever settle down and have [[Youngling/Legends|children]] of her own.<ref name="AOTCN">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones (novelization)|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'' novelization]]</ref> She also greatly enjoyed teasing Padmé about [[Sexes/Legends|men]] who would make likely suitors for her, much to her sister's exasperation.<ref name="DB" /> Sola even told [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], her future brother-in-law, that he was "the first boyfriend" Padmé had ever brought home to the family.<ref name="AOTCDS" />Shortly after the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] had ended, Sola, along with her family and thousands of other mourners, attended her sister's [[Funeral of Padmé Amidala/Legends|funeral]].<ref name="Episode III" />Her youngest daughter Pooja later became Naboo's [[Senator/Legends|representative]] in the [[Imperial Senate/Legends|Imperial Senate]].<ref name="SWG">{{SWG|An Empire Divided}}</ref>

name: Sula Autem
description: Like her husband, Sula descended from generations of [[Senate Guard/Legends|Senate Guards]]. She lived with her husband and children in an apartment on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. After her husband went to work as a [[Senate Guard/Legends|Guard]] for the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]], Sula spent so much time alone with her children. She suffered so much from her husband's absence and aggression towards her son since he was not interested in his father's work.After the events surrounding Sagoro's case with [[Simon Greyshade/Legends|Simon Greyshade]], she separated from Sagoro and eventually moved with her children to [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]].Near the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Sula never got over the separation with her husband and was eventually reunited with him several weeks after the Republic was reformed into the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] under the rule of [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Sana-Jis Ilowa
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Sana-Jis Ilowa was a member of [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the laste [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. After [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], Ilowa eventually became a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref>''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref>When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Ilowa dutifully accepted her role as a [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] to counter the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid army]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. During the war, Ilowa was assigned to assist in the massive [[Battle of Jabiim|defense]] of [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]]. During the fighting, Ilowa was stationed at [[Shelter Base]] with fellow Jedi [[Dalnus Cam]] and [[Rallcema Bylissura]]. The Separatists laid waste to the base, ending Ilowa's life.<ref name="BOJ" />

name: Teela Panjarra
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Teela Panjarra was born on [[Corulag/Legends|Corulag]] to scholars of the planet's [[Corulag Academy/Legends|academy]] before the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] invasion of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]]. When she was six months old her Force-sensitivity was discovered by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] and tagged for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. However, before she could be transported to the [[Jedi academy|academy]], the [[Corulag Academy/Legends|Corulag Academy's]] Science Services' Chief Scientist [[Frexton]] kidnapped her, wishing to use her to scientifically study [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].<ref name="EIA4" />Discovering that the girl had been abducted, the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] dispatched Jedi [[Vel Ardox]], [[Noro Zak]], [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]], [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] to rescue her. As the Jedi were stationed at the Order's [[Jedi chapter house (Rhinnal)|chapter house]] on [[Rhinnal]], they were able to arrive at Corulag quickly, but were soon foiled by [[Bartokk]] [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]]. Master Jinn and his fellow team members held off the assassins while [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] Yoda himself rescued Panjarra from Chief Frexton and destroyed the Bartokk and their [[Bartokk Queen|queen]]. With the girl safe, the Jedi were able to take Panjarra to the [[Jedi Temple|Coruscant Temple]] where she would begin her training.<ref name="EIA4" />

name: Timar Daragon
description: {{Quote|Too dangerous, kids.|Timar Daragon, refusing her children's request to accompany her to Kirrek|Tales of the Jedi: The Golden Age of the Sith 0: Conquest and Unification}}Timar Daragon, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was [[Marriage/Legends|married]] to [[Hok Daragon]]. Together, they had two children, [[Gav Daragon|Gav]] and [[Jori Daragon]]. In [[5000 BBY/Legends|5000 BBY]], during the [[Unification Wars (Koros)|First Unification Wars]] in the [[Empress Teta system/Legends|Koros system]], the political leader known as [[Emperor/Legends|Empress]] [[Teta]] attempted to unify the seven [[Planet/Legends|worlds]] of the [[Star system/Legends|system]]. During this time, the Daragons worked as supply runners to Teta's forces in their ship, the ''[[Shadow Runner]]''. Teta's forces managed to unify six of the Koros system's seven worlds into one union. The only planet in the system yet to be unified with the others was [[Kirrek]], where a man named [[Llaban]] had put together an [[Army/Legends|army]] of rebels and [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]]. Teta's forces were surprised by the ferocity of Llaban's army, and found themselves besieged in a citadel. The Daragons then went to [[Aarrba]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]], who ran a [[Aarrba's Repair Dock|service dock]] in the Koros system [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Cinnagar]], to get the ''Shadow Runner'' spaceworthy so as to bring relief supplies to the soldiers on Kirrek. The Daragons were grateful for Aarrba's services, and in exchange, the Hutt decided to keep the Daragons' other ship, the ''[[Starbreaker 12]]'', as a collateral until they returned. Although Gav and Jori asked their parents if they could assist them on their mission, both Timar and Hok believed that their upcoming mission was too dangerous, so Gav and Jori were forced to stay behind.<ref name="totj" />Meanwhile, the [[Battle of Kirrek (Unification Wars)|battle]] on Kirrek continued, with the Tetan forces receiving aid from two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in Teta's service, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Memit Nadill]] and the [[Draethos (species)|Draethos]] scholar [[Odan-Urr/Legends|Odan-Urr]]. On Odan-Urr's suggestion, the two made use of an exotic [[Force power/Legends|Force power]] known as [[battle meditation]], which allowed the Jedi to demoralize the pirate forces and lift the spirits of the Tetan fighters. Desperate, the pirates began to [[Laser/Legends|fire]] on the weakest incoming targets, hoping to eliminate as many as they could before they were defeated. The ''Shadow Runner'' reached Kirrek soon after this order was given, and the ship was promptly set upon by the pirate gun turrets. The Daragons decided to fly in low and fast so as to drop their cargo and get out of the war zone as quickly as possible, but the ''Shadow Runner''{{'s}} evasive action was hindered by the cargo's weight. Caught in a crossfire, the ''Shadow Runner'' was destroyed, and both of the Daragons were [[Death/Legends|killed]]. The Tetan forces ultimately won the battle, and Teta succeeded in unifying the whole of the Koros system. After the Daragons' death, Aarrba gave Gav and Jori the ''Starbreaker 12'', and the two vowed to honor their parents by exploring the galaxy.<ref name="totj" /> This proved to be a pivotal moment in [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Timeline of galactic history/Legends|history]], as Gav and Jori eventually took a blind [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] jump and discovered the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], sparking the [[Great Hyperspace War]].<ref name="nec">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref>

name: Sarrissa Jeng
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at a young age, Sarrissa Jeng was given to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] for induction within the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[Jedi academy|academy]]. [[Jedi training/Legends|Trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], Jeng eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] and was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Eventually building herself a blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and passing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Jeng was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="DBSJ" />Active during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], a growing division between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Jedi Jeng was dispatched as the leader of a six-member Jedi task force to the [[Gotal/Legends|Gotal]] colony world [[Atzerri/Legends|Atzerri]]. There, Jeng and her team of [[Jedi Diplomat|diplomats]] were to negotiate the release of Emissary [[Nathanjo Nirrelz]], a Gotal representative [[Gotal hostage standoff|taken hostage]] by the [[Roshu Sune/Legends|Roshu Sune]] during the [[Battle of Antar 4|battle]] of [[Antar 4/Legends|Antar 4]]. During the negotiations, a group of unaffiliated vigilantes opened fire on the Roshu Shone guerrillas. This attack panicked the Gotal Roshu Shone, who opened fire on their captives. Leaping to defend the unarmed hostages, Jeng and her fellow Jedi managed to subdue the guerrillas on their [[commuter hopper]], but not before Jedi [[Kaloor Cofi]] and [[Antyard-Wo Shissan]] lost their lives. Emerging from the firefight, Jedi Jeng and [[Kerrshnek]] escorted Emissary Nirrelz to safety while the other Jedi helped transport the surviving hostages to [[Medcenter/Legends|medcenters]] in the nearby cities of [[Skreeka]] and [[Talos]].<ref name="HNN">{{Hnn|53|jediwatch/13425_1.html|Gotal Standoff Ends Violently|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728113423/http://www.holonetnews.com/53/jediwatch/13425_1.html}}</ref>[[File:Sarrissa.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Sarrissa Jeng on Atzerri.]]After the fighting ended, the surviving Jedi departed for [[Aleen Minor/Legends|Aleen Minor]] and the [[Jedi chapter house (Aleen Minor)|Order's chapter house]] there for the [[Jedi funeral/Legends|funerals]] of Jedi Cofi and Shissan. Meanwhile across the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] network, the Jedi were heavily criticized by [[Gotal Foreign Affairs Commune]] leader [[Shagrad Loset]] for what he saw as meddling in an internal affair. Rebuffing this assault on the Order, Jedi Master and High Council member [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]] commended the Jedi effort on Atzerri.<ref name="DBSJ" />It wasn't long before tensions between the Confederacy and the Republic came to a head. When the Confederacy captured Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], and [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] assembled all available Jedi in a massive [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]]. Stationed at the Coruscant Temple at the time, Jeng answered Master Windu's call and departed for the Separatist foundry world, Geonosis, with 200 of her colleagues. Landing on the dusty plains of Geonosis, Jeng and her comrades stormed the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]] and engaged the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] on the arena floor, with Jeng herself dispatching a Geonosian warrior with a loud battle cry. Unfortunately, Jeng was ultimately overwhelmed and killed, her name being amongst the 170 Jedi who perished in the battle.<ref name="DBSJ" /><ref name="Fightsaber">{{SWArchive|url=games/videogames/news20080728.html?page=7|text=Fightsaber: Mastering the Art of Lightsaber Combat|archivedate=20110424114906}}</ref>

name: Vana Sage
description: Sage left her home [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] at fifteen to become a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]. She served for a time with the [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Security Forces]], but left in disgust after her attempts to get the Naboo to increase their weak defenses were rebuffed. As she grew older, Sage became a mercenary and took a job as a "troubleshooter" for the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]], testing the abilities of new Trade Federation equipment. It was around this time that she contracted a rogue [[Xi Char/Legends|Xi Char]] [[Engineer/Legends|Engineer]] to create the ''[[Guardian Mantis]]''. She was also successful in obtaining the [[Bomber/Legends|bomber]] of the [[Feeorin/Legends|Feeorin]] pirate, [[Nym/Legends|Nym]].[[File:VanaSage.png|thumb|left|Vana Sage, [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]]]]While testing the [[Scarab-class droid starfighter|Scarab]] craft, she intercepted an incriminating transmission sent to the Trade Federation. The federation then attempted to have her terminated. She soon teamed up with [[Bravo Flight/Legends|Bravo Pilot]] [[Rhys Dallows]] and [[Nym/Legends|Nym]] to stop the Federation's invasion of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]].Following the battle, Sage accepted a pardon from the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] and a position in the [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Forces]]. In [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]], at the request of [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], she put together a compilation of information on Nym to be sent to [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]].[[22 BBY/Legends|Two years later]], Sage reunited with Nym in time to assist the [[Lok Revenants/Legends|Lok Revenants]] reclaim their base on [[Lok/Legends|Lok]] from [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] forces under [[Cavik Toth]]'s command. Following that battle, Sage departed to track down [[Reti]], last seen fleeing the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]] to regions unknown.{{Char-stub}}

name: Varin Arabella
description: Arabella ascended to head of her house when she was only 17 years old, after her parents mysteriously fell ill and died. Some suspect that their deaths were part of a plot by [[House Mecetti]] to destabilize House Barnaba. Lady Arabella was the natural successor to her parents, although the house high council was concerned that her age would weaken Barnaba's position. They appointed her confident that they could control her from behind the scenes. Varin, however, was not content to be a puppet of the council. This brought her into conflict with them on many issues since they had quite different political views.She was popular with the people and her age did not detrimentally affect her house. Varin was a formidable diplomat; she strengthened ties with [[House Melantha]] and secretly began to make moves towards an alliance with [[House Cadriaan]].Lady Arabella was an attractive woman with long golden hair. Before she was called to leadership, Varin served in the [[House Guard]]. Even as head of House Barnaba, she kept herself in top physical condition and practiced often with a variety of weapons. She had a kind nature and a strict moral code, although she was headstrong and shared her house's passion for opulence.

name: Vel Ardox
description: Brought into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] after being discovered to be a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] during infancy, Ardox entered into the [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]] to begin her [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. After [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduating]] and being selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|master]], Ardox traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] with her teacher on missions from the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. After passing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Ardox was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|elevated]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and began accepting solo missions.<ref name="SFTLJ" />During her service to the Order, Councilor [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]] went missing during an [[Episode I Adventures 1: Search for the Lost Jedi|assignment]] on [[Esseles/Legends|Esseles]]. Under the leadership of Master [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], Ardox joined Padawan [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and fellow Knight [[Noro Zak]] in the search for the High Councilor. While investigating a company called [[Trinkatta Starships]], the Jedi team was ambushed by [[Security droid/Legends|security droids]] stationed there. During the commotion, Master Jinn slipped away to locate Gallia while Ardox aided in defeating the droids. As they fought, Master Jinn managed to find Gallia and shut down the [[Droid control program|droid control center]], disabling the Jedi's opponents. Jinn soon picked up his fellow Jedi in a [[T-16 skyhopper/Legends|T-16 skyhopper]] and assigned Ardox and Zak the task of taking Gallia to the [[Jedi chapter house (Rhinnal)|Jedi medical academy]] on [[Rhinnal]].<ref name="SFTLJ" />Leaving the Master/Padawan team on Esseles, Ardox and Zak flew to Rhinnal with Gallia and were greeted by the [[Jedi healer|healers]] there. During their stay at the academy, communications were knocked out by a storm, causing the Jedi on Esseles to believe Rhinnal was under attack. Rushing to aid Rhinnal, Jinn and Kenobi found all to be well, with Gallia healing quickly.While on the planet, Jinn informed Ardox and Zak that a group of [[Bartokk]] [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]] had stolen several [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]]-equipped [[Variable Geometry Self-Propelled Battle Droid, Mark I/Legends|''Vulture''-class droid starfighters]], modified by Trinkatta, to attack the [[Corulag Academy/Legends|Academy]] of [[Corulag/Legends|Corulag]]. With Gallia completely healed, the group agreed to meet [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] and [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] on Corulag. Their mission was to rescue the [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] infant [[Teela Panjarra]] from the Chief Scientist of the Academy's Science Services, [[Frexton]]. Like the scientist [[Jenna Zan Arbor]], who had [[Jedi Apprentice: The Evil Experiment|held Jinn ten years before]], Frexton hoped to unlock the secrets of the Force with the child. While their initial rescue mission was foiled by the Bartokk assassins, Grand Master Yoda found Panjarra and defeated the Bartokk. With Panjarra safe, the Jedi returned to [[Coruscant]].

name: Verinia Paddox
description: Verinia (aged 10) and her brother [[Trad Paddox]] (aged 8) disappeared during the [[House Mecetti]] purge of their House. They were discovered 20 year later, frozen in stasis, onboard the [[Regal Destiny]] by the crew of the ''[[Bright Seeker]]''. The children's governess was Mistress [[Winslo]].

name: Vici Ramunee
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Vici Ramunee was the third of eight children born to an [[Alderaanian/Legends|Alderaanian]] family on their [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] in the decade preceding the [[Great Sith War]]. Like her younger brother [[Veni Ramunee|Veni]], her Forcefulness was detected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] visiting the planet in search of candidates for [[Jedi training/Legends|Jedi training]]. Finding them at their family's estate near [[Lir Lake]] Master [[Tannis (Jedi)|Tannis]] selected the Forceful siblings to train with the Jedi ; though she deemed the younger Ramunee too young to begin the training and assured him that she would return in two years time to retrieve him upon his ninth birthday.<ref name="TMDF" />Ramunee began her training under Master Tannis at the [[Teyan Praxeum|Jedi Praxeum]] on [[Teya IV]], constructing her own [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and excelling in her comprehension of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Her brother was brought to the praxeum upon reaching his ninth birthday and in [[4000 BBY]], the 16-year-old Ramunee reached the end of her training as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] under Mistress Tannis. As her final test, she was tasked with traveling alone to the [[Cave of Truth]] and to face her "greatest foe" with only the Force as her companion. She set out, but soon sensed someone approaching; indeed her brother had attempted to follow her with her smuggled lightsaber in his robes. She refused her weapon, knowing she must follow her instructions if she was to pass her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] and become a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Ordering her younger brother back to the praxeum, he claimed he did not know the way back and would have to accompany her into the cave.<ref name="TMDF" />With no choice, the older Ramunee allowed her brother to join with her and they successfully reached the mountains hours later. There, she sensed a large creature approaching and, with no obvious place to hide or flee, activated her lightsaber to protect her and her brother. The large, monstrous creature, however, turned out to be a [[Duinuogwuin]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] called [[Willm Lywin]]. Lywin, amused by Ramunee's attempt to "protect" her brother, escorted the pair the rest of the way to Cave of Truth, where Vici Ramunee entered alone and emerged successful in her trials.<ref name="TMDF" />

name: Wildis Jiklip
description: Around the same age as [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], Jiklip was born on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] parents, which, to her benefit, allowed her to travel [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and be educated on both worlds. Once she was in her early twenties, Jiklip was eligible to become a university professor. However, she soon disappeared and over the next twenty years she became a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] under the alias of Red Stepla, and was known for her unusual efficiency to get all of her jobs accomplished. Stepla and her crew eventually retired, shortly before the onset of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], and soon Wildis Jiklip reappeared to the public's eye. She became a professor of interplanetary economics and other similar fields at universities on Coruscant and [[Lorrd/Legends|Lorrd]].Jiklip knew Han Solo and trusted him and his wife [[Leia Organa Solo]] enough to reveal the secret of her smuggling life. At the start of the [[Second Galactic Civil War]], Han was interested in hearing her opinions on the possible war, however he was unable to get in touch with her.

name: Ydra Kilwallen Sibwarra
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Ydra Kilwallen was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. As a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], the [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]] issued a warrant for her arrest, and she left the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]].<ref name="16:5:24" /> Kilwallen eventually [[Marriage/Legends|married]] a [[Ydra Sibwarra's husband|man]], and they had a son named [[Dev Sibwarra|Dev]].<ref name="TAB source" />Ydra fled [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrila]] after hearing that one of her fellow [[Force Adept]]s disappeared. Without contacting her husband, she took Dev and moved to the small, distant colony world [[G'rho]]. There, her brother [[Trig Kilwallen|Trig]] lived in [[Boku Settlement]], with his new wife [[Seni Kilwallen|Seni]]. Trig was able to get her a job as a historian from the leader of the [[G'rho Defense Force]], an [[Ilwizzt]] named [[Brco]]. Sibwarra recognized [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] potential in her son, and began teaching him what rudimentary Jedi skills she knew.<ref name="Sweets">{{WEGCite|book=The Truce at Bakura Sourcebook|story=Strangers with Sweets|stext=''Strangers with Sweets''}}</ref>G'rho was [[Battle of G'rho|attacked]] by the [[Ssi-ruu]] in [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]], and Dev was [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]]. Sibwarra was [[Entechment|enteched]], and her son sensed her life diminish through the Force and knew that she would forever be lost to him.<ref name="Sweets" />

name: Ylanda Captison
description: Like the rest of her family, she was a follower of the [[Cosmic Balance|Religion of the Cosmic Balance]] that dictated for every good, there had to be an equal bad (or vice-versa), lest the universe fall out of alignment.As such, when in [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]] Gaeriel was chosen to attend the [[Bakur Senatorial Academy]] and eventually join the [[Bakuran Senate]], Dol and Marga gave Ylanda a golden alms bowl&mdash;since her sister would become a senator, to preserve the Cosmic Balance, Ylanda was to become a beggar.Ylanda carried out the dictate of her parents and religion.

name: Z'meer Bothu
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Z'meer Bothu was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Bothu held the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], and when the conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] erupted into the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Master Bothu stayed at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. [[20 BBY/Legends|Twenty four months]] after the war began she accepted the responsibility of training the orphaned [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] of Master [[T'chooka D'oon]], the young [[Flynn Kybo]]. Encouraging him to calm his rebellious nature and his thirst for vengeance against his Master's murderer, [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]], Bothu and Kybo spent hours deep in meditation within the Temple's expansive rooftop gardens.<ref name="Grievous 1">''[[General Grievous 1]]''</ref>Soon, however, while Bothu was deep in a trance, Master [[B'dard Tone]] approached Kybo and offered him a place on his unsanctioned mission to [[Assassin/Legends|assassinate]] Grievous. Agreeing to Tone's offer, Kybo was surprised to find that Bothu had overheard the entire conversation and his plan. Reminding the young Human that she was meditating, not asleep, Bothu stated she would not inform the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] of his plan; similarly, she would not come to his defense should the mission be a failure and the Council wish to expel him. Departing the Temple together aboard a cruiser carrying several Jedi to the [[Battle of Alderaan (Clone Wars)|battle]] on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], Bothu turned a blind eye as her Padawan stole a small ship from the hangar bay, effectively severing his ties with the Jedi Order.<ref name="Grievous 1" />

name: Zena Antilles
description: Zena was killed a few years before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], when a group of criminals attempting to escape [[Corellian Security Force|CorSec]] forgot to release their docking clamps, and the resulting explosion destroyed most of the spaceport, taking Zena and her [[Jagged Antilles|husband]] with it.Both her children went on to become famous across the galaxy. Her son Wedge became a famous fighter pilot for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and later a general in the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] and her daughter [[Syal Antilles Fel|Syal]] was a famous holodrama star in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].

name: Jaren
description: When her brother had been rightfully convicted of killing thirty-one innocent people, Jaren conspired to free her kind and gentle brother. Six years from that moment the pair was able to escape into an isolated area of [[Jaren's planet|their planet]]. Chased by the local law enforcement deeper into the countryside, the escapees were stricken by a bout of luck when the lost Darca Nyl heard their screams for help. After Darca scared off the pursuing police [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]] rider, Jaren lied to Nyl about their situation by telling him they were scorned diplomats. With this lie Jaren was able to secure the elite [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] as a bodyguard. During the night after the trio were attacked by a beast, their elite bodyguard saw the ferocity of Jaren's angered brother and became suspicious of their story. Unknown to Jaren, Darca approached Ament and asked for a confession. The next day Nyl arrested them and gave them over to the local police. Ament gave in peacefully; Jaren was also arrested and fought her conviction all the way.

name: Lynia Delline
description: {{Quote|There's no other task you think you could perform for the Alliance? Nothing other than flying one of those death traps?''"<br />"''You wouldn't understand.''"<br />"''Wouldn't I? If you're still around in a few weeks, come ask me about my brother.|Lynia Delline and Keyan Farlander|X-Wing: The Official Strategy Guide}}Lynia Delline was born in the years surrounding the fall of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and grew up during the reign of [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]. She had a brother who became a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] and was either injured or killed while flying, some time prior to [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]]. However, like much of her early life, Delline rarely spoke of what happened. She joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] at some point before the [[Battle of Turkana]] and became an [[Aide/Legends|aide]] to the Alliance's [[Chief of State (Alliance)|Chief of State]], [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]]. She would later describe her job as "observing things" for the Rebel leader.<ref name="XW:OSG" />[[File:Monmothma.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Delline served as an aide to Rebel Chief of State Mon Mothma during the Galactic Civil War.]]In 0 BBY, Delline accompanied Mothma to the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]] aboard the [[Mon Calamari Star Cruiser]] [[Independence/Legends|''Independence'']]. On Agamar, Mothma addressed members of the [[Agamar Resistance]], hoping to persuade them to join the Rebel Alliance. After the Chief of State gave her speech, Delline moved among the assembled crowd, distributing copies of the Rebel pamphlet ''[[A Call to Reason]]'', before assisting the other Rebels present with removing all evidence that the meeting had taken place. One of the [[Agamarian]]s, [[Keyan Farlander]], approached her and announced that he had decided to join the Alliance as a starfighter pilot, and Delline made sure he understood the commitment he was making before introducing him to a recruiter.<ref name="XW:OSG" />Delline flew back to the ''Independence'' aboard the same [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] as Farlander and, worried that the young Rebel would suffer the same fate as her brother, attempted to persuade him to serve the Alliance in a less dangerous way. Farlander, however, was determined to join the [[Alliance Starfighter Corps]], and she respected his decision, wishing him luck before leaving him in the [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] of the ''Independence''.<ref name="XW:OSG" />Mon Mothma left the ''Independence'' soon after and Delline accompanied her, only returning to the Alliance [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] toward the end of [[Operation Strike Fear]], a major [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] offensive against the Rebellion. The day Delline arrived, she learned that Farlander was due to be promoted to [[Captain/Legends|captain]] and attended a small promotion ceremony conducted by [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Lagrane]]. After the ceremony, Farlander approached her and the two spoke briefly before Farlander left to attend a party being held by [[Red Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Red Squadron]] in his honor. Delline declined an invitation to join them, saying she had to get back to work, but gave Farlander a kiss on the cheek when she saw his disappointment. The two were quickly becoming friends and saw each other twice more before Delline's duties with Mothma took her off the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] once more.<ref name="XW:OSG" />She returned to the ''Independence'' again while the Alliance searched for information on a [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|new Imperial weapon]]. There, she attended an [[Alliance High Command/Legends|Alliance High Command]] meeting with Mothma, [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Gial Ackbar]], [[General/Legends|General]] [[Jan Dodonna/Legends|Jan Dodonna]] and General [[Crix Madine/Legends|Crix Madine]], during which the group planned an [[Battle of Orron III|operation]] to steal some Imperial [[communications satellite]]s and use them to eavesdrop on Imperial transmissions in the [[Cron Drift/Legends|Cron Drift]]. Farlander was waiting for Delline as she left the meeting, and the two conversed with Mothma before dining together in the ship's executive dining room. Delline's duties took her off the ''Independence'' the next day but, after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], she promised to spend more time with Farlander.<ref name="XW:OSG" />

name: Kitha Farlander
description: [[File:Farlander.svg|thumb|left|200px|Farlander's brother, Keyan]]{{Quote|People of Tondatha, on the planet of Agamar, in the Lahara sector &hellip; You have been found guilty of sedition against the Empire, and of plotting against the great Emperor Palpatine. Your punishment will be imposed without delay.|An Imperial commander pronounces sentence on Tondatha|X-Wing: The Official Strategy Guide}}The [[Human/Legends|Human]]<ref name="species-note" /> [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Kitha Farlander grew up on the [[Agriworld/Legends|agricultural]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]] in the [[Lahara sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. She lived, along with her [[Keyan Farlander's mother|mother]], [[Keyan Farlander's father|father]] and brother [[Keyan Farlander|Keyan]],<ref name="XW:OSG" /> on a struggling [[mugruebe]] ranch<ref name="EPM">''[[The Essential Guide to Planets and Moons]]''</ref> in the small town of [[Tondatha]].<ref name="XW:OSG" />Early in the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], believing that the people of Tondatha had been plotting against [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], dispatched an [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial''-class Star Destroyer]] to make an example of the town. The Imperials launched an assault craft into the [[Atmosphere/Legends|atmosphere]], from where it launched an [[Orbital bombardment/Legends|orbital bombardment]] which left Tondatha in ruins. During the [[Destruction of Tondatha|assault]], a direct [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] strike on the Farlander family resulted in the young [[Agamarian]] suffering severe burns that left her disfigured. Though her brother survived with only minor burns, both of their parents were killed in the attack.<ref name="XW:OSG" />In the aftermath of the Imperial attack, Keyan decided to move to the Agamarian [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Calna Muun]] and join the fledgling [[Agamar Resistance]]. Keyan sent Kitha to live with their aunt [[Mimya]] and uncle [[Trinn]] on [[Oorn Tchis]], where he hoped she would be able to receive treatment. Mimya and Trinn ensured that Farlander was cared for at all times and arranged for [[Doctor/Legends|doctors]] to treat her injuries. Though she did not initially respond to treatment, the physicians advised the family not to give up hope. Some time later, after Keyan had joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], his aunt and uncle wrote to update him of Kitha's progress. However, her status was unknown to him at the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]].<ref name="XW:OSG" />

name: Sheltay Retrac/Legends
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Sheltay Retrac came from [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] whose [[Alderaanian/Legends|inhabitants]] had been among the founders of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Like many Alderaanian of note, Retrac chose to pursue a public service career. In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], the [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail]] of the [[House of Organa/Legends|House of Organa]] became [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] of the [[Alderaan system/Legends|Alderaan system]] to the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]], the main decision-making body of the Republic.<ref name="dbAnt">{{DB|character|bailantilles|Antilles, Bail|archivedate=20100209183544}}</ref> Eleven [[Standard year/Legends|years]] later,<ref name="ROSV">''[[Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith: The Visual Dictionary]]''</ref> while the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] had already begun, Organa appointed Retrac head of his senatorial [[Senatorial aide|support staff]].<ref name="CSWE" />[[File:TotallyPracticalSpyOutfits-CWA7.png|thumb|left|180px|Padmé Amidala and Sheltay Retrac teamed up to retrieve critical evidence]]By the end of the Clone Wars in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Retrac was [[Marriage/Legends|married]] to a [[Sheltay Retrac's husband|mysterious artist]] living in the [[Castle Lands]] of Alderaan<ref name="SWC" />&mdash;a [[Grass/Legends|grassy]] area covered with millenary [[Killik]] hive-mounds.<ref name="ISWU">''[[The Illustrated Star Wars Universe]]''</ref> At the beginning of that year, she had just returned from maternity leave, having recently [[Reproduction/Legends|given birth]] to a baby girl named [[Winter Celchu|Winter]].<ref name="SWC" /> She [[Mission to Metalorn (Bail Organa)|accompanied]] Bail Organa on the planet [[Metalorn/Legends|Metalorn]] to meet with [[Wat Tambor/Legends|Wat Tambor]], [[Foreman/Legends|Foreman]] of the [[Techno Union/Legends|Techno Union]]. Under the pretext of signing a treaty with the Confederacy of Independent Systems, Organa wanted to free the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]], who was held [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoner]] on Metalorn. Retrac remained close to the Senator throughout the mission, although she did not take part in the fighting itself, taking cover behind Organa.<ref name="CW:BO">{{CWACite|5|Bailed Out}}</ref>Shortly afterwards, Retrac joined [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] Senator [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] in acquiring proof that Senator [[Bezz Drexx]] was taking bribes from the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] by [[Infiltration of Bezz Drexx's tower|infiltrating]] his [[Bezz Drexx's tower|personal tower]]. Amidala and Sheltay Retrac decide to investigate in secret during a gala, separating from the rest of the hosts and infiltrating private areas of the building to gain more information into the matter. Disposing of their dresses, the two women revealed combat bodysuits. They fought their way to Drexx's tower and split up when they found a split end. Eventually, Amidala caught Drexx on the act of accepting a case of [[Gold/Legends|gold]] from the [[Passel Argente's uncle|uncle]] of [[Passel Argente/Legends|Passel Argente]], a Separatist leader. However, the Senator's hidden [[holocamera]] was noticed by the two corrupt bureaucrats, who sent their guards after her. Amidala escaped the tower while Retrac waited for her outside at the controls of a speeder ready to streak off and vacate the premises.<ref name="SG">{{CWACite|7|Spy Girls}}</ref>On the fifth month of 19 BBY,<ref>{{InsiderCite|84|Republic HoloNet News Special Inaugural Edition 16:5:241}}</ref> the Clone Wars were brought to an end. However, the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], leader of the Republic, refuse to relinquish his emergency powers. Instead, he [[Declaration of a New Order|announced]] the transformation of the Republic into the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|First Galactic Empire]] and ordered the elimination of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Subsequently, Sheltay Retrac followed Bail Organa on his consular [[Starship/Legends|starship]], the ''[[Sundered Heart]]'', in an attempt to locate survivors of the [[Order 66/Legends|massacre]].<ref name="ROS">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref>[[File:Winter_like_mother.png|thumb|150px|Winter, on the left, dressed very much like her mother]]Soon after those events, Retrac accompanied Organa to the [[Aldera Royal Palace|Royal Palace]] of [[Aldera/Legends|Aldera]], where the Senator lived with his wife, the [[Monarch of Alderaan|Queen]] [[Breha Organa/Legends|Breha Organa]], and his newly adopted daughter [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia]]. The senator of the [[Sern sector]], [[Fang Zar/Legends|Fang Zar]], was branded a traitor to the Empire, and took refuge in the Palace. When the Emperor sent his dreaded second-in-command [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] to investigate the presence of Fang Zar on Alderaan, Sheltay Retrac was tasked with getting the Queen to safety.<ref name="RoDV">''[[Dark Lord: The Rise of Darth Vader]]''</ref>[[18 BBY/Legends|A year after]] the Empire's establishment, Sheltay and her husband [[Death/Legends|were killed]] shortly thereafter.<ref name="SWC" /> The orphaned Winter was subsequently adopted by the Senator Organa, who integrated her to his household in the [[Aldera Royal Palace|Royal Palace]] of [[Aldera/Legends|Aldera]].<ref name="TPLD">{{Tales|11|The Princess Leia Diaries}}</ref> More than a decade later, in [[3 BBY/Legends|3 BBY]], Winter wore a [[Color/Legends|white]] [[Clothing/Legends|robe]] and sported a [[Hair/Legends|hairstyle]]<ref name="AotE6">''[[Agent of the Empire—Hard Targets, Part 1]]''</ref> very reminiscent to that of her [[Parent/Legends|mother]]<ref name="SWC" /> on the occasion of the [[25th anniversary of the settling of the Alderaan Ascendancy Contention|25th anniversary]] of the [[Alderaan Ascendancy Contention]].<ref name="AotE6" />

name: Mazicia Organa
description: [[File:Interrupt Bail Organa.png|thumb|left|150px|Viceroy Bail Organa, Queen Mazicia's son]]A [[Human/Legends|Human]]<ref name="Species" /> [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Mazicia Organa came from [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]],<ref name="SWI90" /> a pristine [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of refined culture,<ref name="ISWU">''[[The Illustrated Star Wars Universe]]''</ref> in the waning [[Time/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="SWI90" /> She was one of several [[Youngling/Legends|children]], the youngest of which became the renowned [[agricultural expert]] [[Tayvor Mandirly]].<ref name="Wild Space">''[[The Clone Wars: Wild Space]]''</ref> Later in life, Mazicia joined the [[House of Organa/Legends|House of Organa]],<ref name="Organa">According to ''[[Star Wars Blueprints: Rebel Edition]]'', [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa's]][[Parent/Legends|mother]] bore the name of "[[House of Organa/Legends|Organa]]" herself. In the novel ''[[The Clone Wars: Wild Space]]'', the Queen's brother [[Tayvor Mandirly|Mandirly]] had the last name "Mandirly." This implies that Mazicia took the name of "Organa" by [[Marriage/Legends|marrying]] Bail's father.</ref> one of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy's]] most respected [[Ancient Houses]],<ref name="Children of the Jedi">[[Children of the Jedi (novel)|''Children of the Jedi'']]</ref> by [[Marriage/Legends|marrying]] the [[Viceroy/Legends|Viceroy]] [[Organa (viceroy)|Organa]].<ref name="DFR">''[[Dark Force Rising]]''</ref> Eventually, Mazicia Organa was [[Crown/Legends|crowned]] [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] of Alderaan.<ref name="SWI90" /> In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[67 BBY]],<ref name="FF140">{{FFCite|140|FAM1-2, ''Skywalker Family Tree''}}</ref> she [[Reproduction/Legends|gave birth]] to a baby boy, the [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Bail Prestor Organa]].<ref name="SWB:RE">''[[Star Wars Blueprints: Rebel Edition]]''</ref> Together, the Queen and the Viceroy Organa became dedicated and loving [[Parent/Legends|parents]], but they never spoiled their son, even though his [[Noble/Legends|patrician]] education came with many privileges.<ref name="Wild Space" />In [[38 BBY/Legends|38 BBY]],<ref name="Dates" /> Mazicia's brother Tayvor was [[Death/Legends|murdered]] on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Antar 4/Legends|Antar 4]] by [[Raxis]] and [[Nolid]], two members of a local [[Unidentified criminal organization|criminal organization]], during a [[colfillini]] plantation dispute on the planet. Mandirly's charred body was found nailed to a stake by the [[Padawan/Legends|Jedi apprentice]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. That traumatic event was devastating for the Queen of Alderaan, and from then on, sorrow began to take over her life.<ref name="Wild Space" />Sometime before [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]],<ref name="Agrippa">The reference book ''[[Star Wars Blueprints: Rebel Edition]]'' states that the construction of the [[Tantive IV/Legends|''Star of Alderaan'']] took place when [[Agrippa Aldrete/Legends|Agrippa Aldrete]] was still a [[Senator/Legends|Senator]]. According to the novel ''[[Cloak of Deception]]'', Aldrete had already been replaced by [[Bail Antilles/Legends|Bail Antilles]] for an indeterminate period of [[Time/Legends|time]] as of [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]]. Therefore, the construction must have happened before that [[Standard year/Legends|year]].</ref> the Queen ordered the construction of the [[Tantive IV/Legends|''Star of Alderaan'']], a [[Corellian Engineering Corporation/Legends|Corellian]] [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] the use of which was reserved to [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Agrippa Aldrete/Legends|Agrippa Aldrete]],<ref name="SWI90" /> who represented the [[Alderaan sector/Legends|Alderaan sector]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]].<ref name="db">{{DB|character|aldrete|Aldrete, Agrippa|archivedate=20100115192141}}</ref> Organa allowed the ship to serve the House of Alderaan without granting it the status of [[Royal Alderaan Civil Fleet|royal vessel]] so that it could have additional defensive systems and weapons added, predicting that her family might someday need more protection in dangerous situations.<ref name="SWI90" /> As years went by, Mazicia never managed to get over her brother's death, which eventually led to her own demise. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist Confederacy]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Queen Mazicia Organa had been dead for some [[Time/Legends|time]], and the throne had been passed to [[Breha Organa/Legends|Breha Antilles]], who was the wife of Bail Organa.<ref name="Wild Space" />

name: Ana Blue
description: The [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] Ana Blue was considered very beautiful. [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] won a large amount of money from her on several occasions. She first met Han when he was learning the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] trade. She rebuffed his advances, saying he wasn't seasoned enough for her.Ana also participated in the [[Battle of Nar Shaddaa]] by piloting [[Jiliac Desilijic Tiron|Jiliac the Hutt's]] personal yacht, the ''[[Dragon Pearl]]'', which was also the flagship of the smuggler fleet.In [[17 ABY/Legends|17 ABY]], Ana later got involved in an operation smuggling former Imperial goods to [[Kueller]] in his campaign against the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. When a man she loved, [[Davis]], was killed by one of Kueller's bombs, she revealed all she knew about the operation to Solo. However, Kueller later revealed to his assistant that Blue had done her job well, and ordered a doubling of her pay in accordance with their promise, thus implying that Blue had been an agent for Kueller all along.

name: Tura Raftican
description: Tura Raftican, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], worked as an investigative [[Journalist/Legends|reporter]] for the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNews Network]]<ref name="A" /><ref name="R" /> and other news services from the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]]. In this occupation, she covered the activities of several collectives seeking recognition through their work<ref name="A" /> and developed a vast network of contacts while doing this.<ref name="R" />Raftican joined [[Alliance Intelligence|the Intelligence branch]] of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] in [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]]; her main job in the Alliance was to provide intelligence to Rebel forces,<ref name="A" /> using many of her contacts from her days as a journalist.<ref name="R" /> Among her main contacts in the Rebel Alliance were [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Arhul Hextrophon/Legends|Arhul Hextrophon]] and [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]]. After reaching the rank of lieutenant herself, Raftican worked with a team of Rebel [[Officer/Legends|officers]] that included [[Lieutenant Commander/Legends|Lieutenant Commanders]] [[Deeve]] and [[Bakki Sourthol]], Lieutenant [[Anson Blazer]], and Special Agent [[Tay Vanis]].<ref name="A" />Raftican wrote a report for the [[Task Force on Alliance Security]] about the [[Zulirian Swordmasters]]. In it, she noted that the Swordmasters had been simple lovers of [[Datafile/Legends|datafiles]] before turning to fencing and that their move to swordplay was calculated to garner attention. Nevertheless, she cautioned that they deserved to be considered a threat, even though that was exactly what they were looking for.<ref name="A" />

name: Norba Nuum
description: [[File:Norba_death.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Norba Nuum’s demise as [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba]] devours her whole.]]When Rusk had [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] locked in the dungeon for refusing to kill family enemy [[Vu Chusker]], Norba freed him on the condition that he kill her brother for her, thereby making her the sole heir to the Nuum family's criminal empire. However after Jabba killed Rusk, Norba betrayed him, ordering her guards to take Jabba back to the dungeon for murdering her brother.Later, Norba came down to Jabba's cell and offered to set him free if he promised to kill Vu Chusker, even showing him the key that would unlock the door of the cell. Sick and tired of this back and forth business, Jabba told Norba he would whisper his answer to her. When Norba leaned in close to listen, Jabba's prehensile tongue extended out and grabbed Norba, pulling her through the window in the cell door and into his mouth. He proceeded to eat her alive, and she was powerless to do anything to stop him. After a valiant but brief struggle, Jabba devoured her whole and alive, her quest for power and riches never to be fulfilled. In her final moments as her mouth filled with Jabba's slime and her nose with the stench of Jabba's rancid breath, she dropped the key right into Jabba's hand, allowing the Hutt to escape the dungeon. She was the last of the Nuum House to be killed, after her father and brother.

name: Derrida/Legends
description: Based on the [[Kwenn Space Station]], Derrida was considered a sly, cunning adversary of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance]] operatives working there. Derrida earned a living by reporting [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] authorities (such as [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Alexander Julstan IV]] of [[Arkanis/Legends|Arkanis]] and other Imperial bureaucrats) about suspected Rebel activities. She has also worked as a spy for other people.<ref name="a" />Derrida foiled five separate Alliance missions on the station and earned the personal enmity of Alliance operative [[Kassar Kosciusko]]. Among her work, Derrida framed [[Lieutenant Commander/Legends|Lieutenant Commander]] [[Zhir-Khan]], falsifying records to implicate him in a betrayal of the Alliance, although her scheme eventually failed.<ref name="a" />Rebel operative [[Lak Sivrak/Legends|Lak Sivrak]] wrote a report about Derrida, with the contribution of Kosciusko. He decided that Derrida was a clear suspect on an attempt of the life of Rebel-aligned financier Director [[Meyser Kayson]], and he was afraid of Kayson's Rebel links being discovered if Derrida was not dealt with.<ref name="a" />Derrida was an associate of another well-known spy, the [[Kubaz/Legends|Kubaz]] [[Garindan]], whom she worked with on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], as reported by Kayson's son.<ref name="a" />Derrida was finally apprehended by a team composed of [[Kyle Katarn]] and a [[Max (bunny)|pint-sized lagomorph]], who almost razed Kwenn station capturing her.<ref name="w">{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/article/sw20050407a|text=The Dark Forces Saga, Part 1|int=The Dark Forces Saga|archivedate=20100501063232}}</ref>

name: Raabakyysh
description: Raabakyysh (Raaba for short) was the best friend of [[Sirrakuk]], sister to Jedi Knight [[Lowbacca]]. Raaba was known for her rebellious style and attitude, often shaving her fur into unusual patterns in order to stand out - a trait which she passed on to Sirrakuk. As they grew older, it became apparent that there was an attraction between Lowbacca and the younger Raaba. In other ways, however, Raaba often showed a disdain for Wookiee traditions and often dreamed of leaving the planet to strike out on her own.Growing up, Raaba had always admired Lowbacca for his bravery, and therefore attempted to duplicate his [[Hrrtayyk ceremony/Legends|Hrrtayyk ceremony]] by sneaking alone into the lower levels of [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] to capture fibers of the dangerous syren plant. Unlike Lowbaaca, however, Raaba never returned from her trip. Upon finding her bloody pack, her friends and family assumed she had died - an event which caused much grief for Lowbacca and his sister. Lowie and his friends traveled to Kashyyyk so that he could be with Sirra during her period of mourning.Unbeknownst to her friends, Raaba had miraculously survived her dangerous adventure. After being attacked and wounded by a jungle predator, Raaba had made her way back to the city and stowed away aboard a departing freighter. The captain of the freighter introduced her to the recently-formed [[Diversity Alliance]] organization, which she ended up joining. Working under the personal command of [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Nolaa Tarkona]], Raaba found herself in a position of some influence within the group. Two years later, she would again meet Lowbacca while he and his friends searched for [[Bornan Thul]] on the planet Kuar.Deciding to reveal herself to family and friends, Raaba returned to Kashyyyk with Lowbacca and completed her Rite of Passage. She then invited both Lowbacca and Sirra to join her on [[Ryloth]] where she hoped to recruit them into the Diversity Alliance. When the [[Solo twins]] and their friends arrived to check up on Lowie, Raaba helped Nolaa Tarkona to keep them away from Lowie & Sirra. Although she didn't trust the humans, she truly feared that she would again lose her friends - this time to the Solo's concerns over the Diversity Alliance.Later, Raaba participated in the Diversity Alliance attack on the secret storeroom of the late [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]. The storage facility - where the Emperor had kept his biological weapons - was the primary goal of Nolaa Tarkona, who wished to use one of the plagues in committing genocide of the human species. Commanding the Alliance fleet in space while Nolaa explored the facility, Raaba sighted a ship circling the asteroid and was dismayed to recognize it as the Rock Dragon, [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka's]] personal ship. Raaba knew that Lowie and his friends were also at the facility, and found herself conflicted between duty to Nolaa Tarkona and her concern for Lowbacca. When a New Republic fleet arrived to destroy the asteroid, Raaba personally descended to the facility to save Nolaa Tarkona. The pair ended up fleeing the battle in Raaba's personal ship, The Rising Star, although Nolaa - and possibly Raaba as well - had been exposed to multiple biological weapons on the asteroid. Before fleeing the system, Raaba sent a short coded message to Lowbacca: "If I survive, I'll find you."Refusing to risk the spread of whatever diseases they had been exposed to, Raaba took herself and Nolaa to an uninhabited moon deep in the Outer Rim territories. Although both beings had been exposed to the plagues, Raaba recovered around the same time that Nolaa succumbed to her illness. Raaba vowed to return to the galaxy, but not until she was certain she wouldn't spread the plague to others.

name: Tor Skylow
description: A former member of the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]], Tor persuaded the crew of her customs craft to rebel against the Empire. Those among her crew that disagreed were sealed in [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pods]] and left in space. The Imperial base in [[Travnin]] was alerted of their location for pick-up, although the Imperial propaganda instead claimed they were left to die.Hiding in the [[Yelsain system]], Skylow and her crew outfitted and modified their ship, renaming her ''[[Counter-Puncher]]''. Skylow's crew targeted mostly Imperial shipments, although private ship aiding the Empire were also fair game. Many of the goods stolen were then sold on [[Yelsain/Legends|Yelsain]], ensuring good relations with the local authorities, who occasionally hid the crew.

name: Vega Sepen
description: Born around [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], Vega Sepen was orphaned on [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]] at the age of twelve and forced to fend for herself on that [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] harsh streets for the next three [[Standard year/Legends|years]]. At fifteen she stowed away aboard a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] vessel and secured her place in the crew by defeating the [[Nikto/Legends|Nikto]] first mate in a knife fight. Over the next few years, Sepen had moved from one fringe crew to another, and by [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]] she was a junior tactician aboard [[Urias Xhaxin]]'s [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]], the ''[[Free Lance]]''.When the ''Free Lance'' was attacked by the [[Yuuzhan Vong]], Sepen decided that the invaders had to be stopped, reasoning that the situation offered a stark choice between [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] or [[Death/Legends|death]] and fighting back. She joined the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] military&mdash;or attempted to&mdash;but she washed out quickly due to her inability to submit to military discipline, and she found herself a niche in the [[Space Rescue Corps]] instead. By this time Sepen had become an experienced [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]], [[Engineer/Legends|engineer]], sensor operator and fighter, but her ability was borne of a survivor's instinctive wariness and a tough, unsentimental approach to problem-solving. In the crew of the ''No Luck Required'', her abilities and personality secured her the post as Uldir's second-in-command. But beneath her hard-bitten exterior, she seemed to have concealed stronger feelings for her "Boss-boy" than he realized.As a result, Sepen reacted with hostility to the growing closeness between Uldir and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Klin-Fa Gi]], but she put aside her suspicions and worked with them to defeat the rogue Jedi [[Bey Gandan]] and a Yuuzhan Vong plot to poison the [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] supply on [[Thyferra/Legends|Thyferra]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Vongerella
description: Most of the activities of this [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] were unknown, but it was known that she corrupted the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Daye Azur-Jamin]]. Hiding in the [[The Cloak of the Sith|Cloak of the Sith]] region, she then managed to capture [[Kyle Katarn]] who was investigating rumors of a reemergence of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]].[[Kyle Katarn]] was rescued by a team put together by [[Jan Ors]], [[Mara Jade Skywalker]] and [[Jaden Korr]]. The [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] Daye was subsequently turned back to the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light]]. He then revealed not only the presence of this [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Yuuzhan Vong]], but also that she had a [[Sith Master/Legends|master]].

name: Shayla Paige-Tarkin
description: {{Quote|When word came that Senator Shayla Paige-Tarkin was in danger, I mobilized my men immediately. Dooku wasn't the only one with spies: I knew about the Trandoshan's plot before his ship even landed at the space port.|Commander Fox|Out Foxed}}Shayla Paige-Tarkin was a member of the [[Tarkin family/Legends|Tarkin family]],<ref name="JT" /> a powerful clan of [[Human/Legends|Humans]] from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]], an important [[Merchant/Legends|trade]] center of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> At some point after the [[Eriadu Trade Summit]] in [[33 BBY/Legends|32.5 BBY]],<ref name="CoD-sen">In the novel ''[[Cloak of Deception]]'', [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]] was represented by a [[Unidentified Eriaduan senator|dark-skinned male senator]] immediately before the [[Eriadu Trade Summit]]. According to ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'', the Summit took place in [[33 BBY/Legends|32.5 BBY]].</ref> Paige-Tarkin ascended to the position of [[Senator/Legends|senator]] of her native [[Seswenna sector/Legends|Seswenna sector]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]],<ref name="JT" /> succeeding a dark-complexioned [[Unidentified Eriaduan senator|Eriaduan male]].<ref name="CoD">''[[Cloak of Deception]]''</ref>Around the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] faced new [[Politics/Legends|political]] turmoil with the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]]. A loose affiliation of planets and conglomerates who wished to leave the Republic had formed the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]&mdash;or CIS for short&mdash;under the guidance of the former [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]].<ref name="NEC" /> In the third [[Standard month/Legends|month]] of the year, the [[Sluissi]] Senator [[Corlissi Ludar]] announced the secession of [[Sluis sector/Legends|his sector]] from the Republic. In reaction, Paige-Tarkin was quick to assert Seswenna's loyalty to the government. In her statements, she made clear her contempt for the lawlessness of other Outer Rim worlds that had joined the CIS. She even added that her people would not hesitate to take arms if Seswenna's worlds became the front line in a hypothetical war. Paige-Tarkin's strong words were published in [[HoloNet News CoCo District Edition|CoCo District's edition]] of the [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]].<ref name="HNN">{{Hnn|49|news/13328_4.html|Sluis Sector Secedes; Seswenna Restates Loyalty|https://web.archive.org/web/20050220193909/http://www.holonetnews.com:80/49/news/13328_4.html}}</ref>Two months later, the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted, with the brand new [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] fighting the Separatists.<ref name="NEC" /> As an unabashed follower of [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], leader of the Republic, Senator Paige-Takin sided with the [[Loyalist/Legends|Loyalists]] during the conflict. Totally unaware of the Chancellor's [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith]] alter ego as [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Sidious, she considered him a savior of the Republic and a role model. As the war dragged on, Paige-Tarkin became worried about Palpatine's health. She was delighted when the Chancellor called upon her, along with Senator [[Jannie Ha'Nook]] from [[Glithnos]] and others, to support him during the [[Battle of Praesitlyn|conflict]] on [[Praesitlyn]], a world close to the border of the Seswenna [[Sector/Legends|sector]].<ref name="JT" />Later during the Clone Wars, Dooku offered a generous live [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on each Republican senator captured, and Paige-Tarkin was nearly caught in the nets of [[T'doshok (bounty hunter)|T'doshok]], a [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] who tried to abduct her on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. However, the bounty hunter was arrested by [[Clone trooper commander|Commander]] [[CC-1010/Legends|Fox]], who was the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone trooper]] in charge of the [[Coruscant Guard/Legends|Coruscant Guard]] at the [[Time/Legends|time]], and Paige-Tarkin remained safe.<ref name="OF">''[[Out Foxed]]''</ref>

name: Cel
description: When Cel was ten, [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] was [[Siege of Coruscant|besieged]] by [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]].In [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]], she served as a communications officer in the fleet of the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]] and was stationed on the [[Mon Mothma (Imperial-class)|''Mon Mothma'']], under the command of [[General/Legends|General]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]]. She participated in the [[Battle of Duro (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Duro]] in the [[Bilbringi system]] and always informed Antilles about the progress of the battle.[[29 ABY/Legends|A year later]], she assisted Wedge in the [[Battle of Corulag (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Corulag]] and announced that the holo-connections to [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] and [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Traest Kre'fey]] were received by new orders.{{Char-stub}}

name: Dia Passik
description: Passik was kept as a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] for most of her youth, deprived of her homeworld of [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]]. Her "owner" operated a yacht known as the [[Violet Hem]], where Passik spent a significant portion of her early years. Later, she would confide to squadron mates that she partially resented other Twi'leks for betraying her to slavers.Fiercely intelligent and cunning, Passik learned to fly [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] and other spacegoing craft by enticing mercenary pilots to instruct her. After sufficient practice, Passik stole a shuttlecraft and (after overriding the shield controls) shot down the Violet Hem- her first combat action.[[File:Dia Passik.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Dia Passik.]]She eventually made her way to [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] space, joining Wraith Squadron in [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]]. She replaced [[Falynn Sandskimmer]] as the Wraiths' vehicle specialist, and was very knowledgeable of various criminal organizations. During the Wraith's infiltration of Zsinj's operations, Passik posed as the pirate Captain [[Seku]] of the [[Hawk-bat Independent Space Force]], alongside [[Kell Tainer]], [[Garik Loran]], and [[Shalla Nelprin]]. As a test of loyalty, Zsinj requested the ersatz pirates execute Wraith [[Castin Donn]], who had sneaked aboard. Passik shot Donn's already-deceased body with a blaster, allowing the group to complete their infiltration. She later flew into a rage of grief and self-loathing over the action, nearly killing herself before being talked down by [[Garik Loran]], who convinced her she saved his life in doing so.Passik served honorably with the Wraiths and the [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]-led task force through the Zsinj campaign. During her time in the squadron, she had a romantic relationship with fellow member [[Garik Loran|Garik "Face" Loran]] and helped him recover from the death of his close friend [[Ton Phanan]].She later fought in the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] where she still remained in Wraith Squadron during the end of the war.In [[44 ABY]], Passik was married to Loran and had even started a family with the human pilot with whom she raised their daughter. At this time, Passik worked as a pilot for a commercial air-and-space service where she was a partner.

name: Damara Decrilla
description: She has represented her house in the [[Vor-cal]] but was not particularly enthusiastic about it.

name: Arani Korden
description: Arani was always in pursuit of adventure and excitement, and had a habit of getting herself into trouble. She was sneaky and confident, and had a great sense of humor. She attended the Theed [[Royal House of Learning]].<ref name="SP">{{WizardsCite|url=starwars/article.asp?x=sketchGallery_1|text=Sneak Preview: ''Star Wars Invasion of Theed Adventure Game''|int=Free Sneak Preview!|archivedate=20090603000554}}</ref> Korden, [[Galak]], [[Rorworr (Naboo)|Rorworr]], and [[Rann I-Kanu]] were tasked by Rann's master to seek out a rumored group of smugglers hiding in a base near Theed. One of Arani's contacts came up with the location of the group after a couple of days. There, they found a hidden smuggler's base led by [[Saidle Frex]]. They defeat Frex and his gang and rescued the abducted archeology professor [[Tasrah Boh]] in the process.<ref name="SoN">{{GamerCite|2|The Predators}} and {{WizardsCite|url=starwars/article.asp?x=rpg_fastPlay_intro|text=Smugglers of Naboo Fast-Play Game|int=Smugglers of Naboo Fast-Play Game|archivedate=20090902233104}}</ref>At the age of 16, she played a role in defending Naboo from [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] forces in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] as a member of the [[Naboo Underground]],<ref name="IoTAG">''[[Star Wars: Invasion of Theed Adventure Game]]''</ref> and the [[Naboo Resistance]].<ref name="FF91">{{FFCite|91|TRA17-18, ''The Trade Federation Attack''}}</ref> A decade later, Arani found herself in the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], watching a holographic representation of a battle, while [[Kelko]] surveyed the action with a pair of [[Electrobinoculars/Legends|electrobinoculars]].<ref name="CWCG">''[[The Clone Wars Campaign Guide]]''</ref> After the fall of the Republic, she and Kelko were seen on an Imperial city, trying to distract an Imperial while her [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] companion tried to get away.<ref name="TFUCG">''[[The Force Unleashed Campaign Guide]]''</ref>During the reign of the Empire, Arani's previous experience with Jedi with the Naboo underground and the academy lead her to help a number of Jedi escape the initial portions of the Jedi purge. Her time with the Naboo Resistance also lead to her relative, [[Tavin Korden|Tavin]], to place her in charge of the security of the family business: [[Korden Outfitting and Surveying]]. Arani used her position during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] to allow the Rebellion to steal needed supplies from warehouses.<ref name="GOI">''[[Galaxy of Intrigue]]'', House Korden</ref>After becoming a [[Battle of Skorrupon|hero of Skorrupon]], Arani returned to her homeworld,<ref name="GCG">''[[Galactic Campaign Guide]]'' '''The Final Adventure''': pg 159. '''The Journey Home''': pg 160.</ref> Naboo,<ref name="IoTAG" /> and became the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] senator of the planet.<ref name="GCG" />In later years, Arani became the CEO of the Korden Outfitting and Surveying, and continued to use its resources to aid those fighting oppression. As the New Republic began to fall into a dictatorship, Arani used the company to found out-of-the-way settlements in which she let those who needed to keep a low profile escape in to.<ref name="GOI" />

name: Isplourrdacartha Estillo
description: {{Quote|Plourr, try to remember that we're supposed to keep a ''low profile''.''"<br />"''I'm not exactly ''little miss wallflower'', Wes, but I'll make you a deal. I won't beat on any of the ''resident scum'' unless they hit me first&mdash;or they pick on my ''friends''&mdash;or I ''feel'' like it!|[[Wes Janson/Legends|Wes Janson]] and Plourr Ilo|X-Wing Rogue Squadron 9: Battleground: Tatooine, Part 1}}[[File:Plourr Ilo as little girl.jpg|246x246px|left|thumb|Plour as a little girl]]Plourr grew up as one of the three daughters of the reigning monarch, [[Uthorrferrell Cartha]], but under her father and grandfather, the monarchy was forced to concede much of its honor in their accommodation with the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], and when she was still a young girl, the royal family were overthrown by the Eiattuan aristocracy, who preferred to negotiate directly with the Empire on their own terms.The initial coup was bloodless, but a faction of the nobility subsequently had the dynasty extinguished with savage, sadistic violence. In the chaos, Plourr was the only member of the royal house to escape; although in fact, it was Plourr herself, and not the [[Priamsta]], who killed arguably the most important member of the ruling dynasty: her vicious, psychotic brother [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Harrandatha Estillo|Harran]], who had become [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader's]] protégé, and who attempted to stop her escaping so he could watch her die.Not much is known about the first years of Plourr's exile, except that she seems to have picked up a great deal of engineering knowledge and some piloting skills. The muscular, shaven-headed mechanic who eventually found her way into the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] was hardly recognizable as a princess of ancient lineage. By the time of the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], she was serving as a non-commissioned technician aboard [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Ackbar's]] flagship [[Home One/Legends|''Home One'']], and after Endor, she transferred to fly [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wings]]; although her attitude caused her problems in her early units, her reputation as a tough, brilliant pilot led [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] to bring her into [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]], where she quickly earned a [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant's]] rank.Highly skilled in hand-to-hand combat, Plourr combined her great physical strength and athletic appearance with a rather short temper and an almost eternally suspicious attitude; especially towards incompetent [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] mechanics, many of whom fell victim to the combination of strength and mood. She also excelled in black humor, not passing the opportunity to let go of a wry comment or two, even in the heat of battle. A warrior, she took great pride in military action and preferred head-to-head combat to covert operations, even though her service with the Rogues meant that she had to participate in more undercover missions than the average fighter pilot.[[File:Plourr ibitsam.jpg|250px|thumb|Plourr Ilo and fellow [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue]] [[Ibtisam]] shake hands.]]Understandably, given her upbringing, Plourr hated the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and everything that it stood for. Some months into her service with the Rogues, however, she was recalled to her homeworld, where the ruling council of the nobility, the Priamsta, hoped that she could become the figurehead of a unity regime, ending both the tyranny of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Leonia Tavira]] and the terrorism of the [[People's Liberation Battalion]], led by [[Harrandatha Estillo (impostor)|an impostor]] who claimed to be Prince Harran. With the help of the Rogues Plourr successfully exposed the false Harran as a fraud&mdash;and, moreover, an agent of Tavira's. Taking power as [[Princess of the Realm]] and [[Princess of the Realm|Empress Apparent-Heir]], Plourr subsequently remained on Eiattu to lead her people once the Imperials had been expelled, insisting on ruling with the cooperation of the people and not simply the Priamsta, and was reunited with her father's cousin, to whom she was betrothed to as a child, [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Rial Pernon]].This did not, however, end her association with the Rogues: she brought Eiattuan starfighter forces to support the Rogues on [[Malrev IV]], and Wedge allowed her to return to serve with them when she was able to, as she did in helping to [[Mission to Corellia (Rogue Squadron)|retrieve]] [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] defector [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Soontir Fel]]'s family on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] from the clutches of Imperial agent [[Ilir Post]]. However, her duties on Eiattu demanded much of her time, and with Rial by her side, she grew rapidly into the role of planetary leader. She even began to grow her hair out again. Her instincts in conflict situations were still often for direct military intervention, however, as was seen not just at [[Battle of Malrev IV (Galactic Civil War)|Malrev IV]], but later when she offered to lead her fleet to rescue the captured Princess [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], actually a disguised [[Winter Celchu|Winter]], who had been [[Mission to Eiattu 6|kidnapped]] by the pirate gang now led by the ousted Leonia Tavira.

name: Reina Faleur
description: Several months after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] Faleur was a [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] in the [[New Republic Defense Fleet/Legends|New Republic Defense Fleet's]] [[Quartermaster/Legends|Quartermaster]] Corps, and charged with supplying [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] the equipment it needed. Reina liked to swim, and would often skip lunch to do so on her breaks. She briefly had a romantic liaison with [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Xarcce Huwla
