description: In the aftermath of the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Huwla volunteered to join [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]].<ref>''[[X-Wing: Rogue Leader]]''</ref> Her first request upon being made a member of the squadron, was to request a transfer to another squadron, arguing that the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance]] leaders had always thrown the Rogues at situations that she considered "impossible problems".<ref name="X-Wing Rogue Squadron: In the Empire's Service" />[[File:Recruits.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Xarcce and three other new recruits report in for duty.]]Despite her tall, muscular, grim appearance with horns protruding from her chin, Xarcce was polite, sociable and well spoken. However, her [[Galactic Basic Standard|Basic]] was somewhat influenced by her own native language &mdash;and possessed a much appreciated self-ironic sense of humor, joking that "even [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiees]] let the Tunroth win". With knowledge about antique artifacts, she saved her fellow Rogues from embarrassing bargains many a time.<ref name="X-Wing Rogue Squadron: In the Empire's Service" /> She was also very capable with hand-to-hand combat. She and [[Isplourrdacartha Estillo|Plourr Ilo]] often trained with one another to improve their fighting skills.<ref>''[[Star Wars: X-Wing Rogue Squadron: Masquerade]]''</ref>Xarcce was also a skilled pilot, saving several of her fellow Rogues during the crisis of [[Brentaal IV/Legends|Brentaal IV]],<ref name="X-Wing Rogue Squadron: In the Empire's Service" /> in which the Rogues were pitted against [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Soontir Fel]]'s [[181st Imperial Fighter Wing|181st Imperial Fighter Group]]. After the battle of Brentaal IV was over, she withdrew her request to withdraw, as her squadronmates had become a team.<ref name="X-Wing Rogue Squadron: In the Empire's Service" /> Continuing to fly with the Rogues, she went with them to investigate the disappearance of [[Syal Antilles Fel]] and then to investigate [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] activity on [[Axxila/Legends|Axxila]]. When it turns out the pirates on Axxila were pawns of [[Ysanne Isard]], she joined with [[Commando Team One]] in rescuing [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]].<ref>''[[Star Wars: X-Wing Rogue Squadron: Mandatory Retirement]]''</ref>When Rogue Squadron was disbanded and reformed before the New Republic [[Liberation of Coruscant (Galactic Civil War)|assaulted]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], she left the squadron.<ref>''[[X-Wing: Rogue Squadron]]''</ref>

name: Herian I'ngre
description: I'ngre served as a member of the elite starfighter unit after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]. As a Bith, she went against her species' noted pacifistic tendencies to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]], specifically due to the species diversity of the organization compared to the [[Humanocentrism|Humanocentric]] chauvinism of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Due to her species characteristic short-sightedness, Herian wore corrective flight goggles while flying.She joined the Squadron in time for the mission to [[Eiattu 6]]. In an odd occurrence Herian spent all of her fighting on the ground instead of in an X-wing, as did most of the Rogues fighting the forces of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Leonia Tavira]]. She was captured along with several of her comrades, but was rescued thanks to the efforts of [[Nrin Vakil]].Herian's second mission with Rogue Squadron took her to [[Malrev IV]] in an effort to rescue the [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] ''[[Starfaring]]''. Upon arriving on the planet the Rogues were [[Battle of Malrev IV (Galactic Civil War)|attacked]] by [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighters]] piloted by primitive [[Irrukiine]], who were under the control of [[Cartariun]]'s [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] magic.That proved to be Herian's only true fighter engagement with the squadron, as she was gravely wounded the next day during a ground battle with Carturian's forces. She suffered brain damage, and the goggles she used to fly were destroyed, grounding her.But when her squadron was in danger of being swamped by the enemy Herian stole [[Feylis Ardele]]'s damaged fighter and, with [[Dllr Nep]]'s guidance, flew the ship into the Sith temple responsible for the carnage on the planet. Herian and Dllr sacrificed themselves to destroy the temple and save the lives of their fellow pilots.Herian was known to possess an interest in music, often discussing the techniques of different bands with Dllr, the Squadron's other music fan.

name: Karie Neth
description: [[File:Kariecolor.JPG|thumb|left|Karie takes her seat at the pre-Endor briefing.]]Before the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], Neth was captured and taken to a prison near [[the Maw]]. She led the Alliance prisoners held there in a revolt and escape attempt after Rogue Squadron, led by [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]], flying [[BTL Y-wing starfighter/Legends|Y-wings]], managed to help free them.After replacing a [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] pilot during a secret mission, she attended the Rebel briefing on [[Home One/Legends|''Home One'']]. She was wearing an orange [[X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot's]] flight suit, as she was at the time an X-wing pilot.<ref name="Databank">{{DB|character|karieneth|Neth, Karie|archivedate=20100318123340}}</ref>During the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], she was assigned to [[Gray Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Gray Squadron]], serving as gunner aboard [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Telsij/Legends|Telsij's]] Y-wing.

name: Rhysati Ynr
description: Ynr fled her homeworld during the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] occupation of [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]] and made her way to the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], serving under the call sign Rogue Seven when the squad reformed in [[6 ABY/Legends|6 ABY]]. She flew with distinction throughout the Isard campaign and, with the rest of her squadmates, resigned her commission to wage an insurgency against an Isard-led junta on [[Thyferra/Legends|Thyferra]].She became friends with [[Corran Horn]] and later married fellow Rogue [[Nawara Ven]], a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] attorney who joined Rogue Squadron at the same time as she did. She resigned her commission permanently shortly before the resurgence of the Empire under [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]].During [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian's]] [[mission to save Kessel]], Ynr piloted an [[Eta-5 interceptor]] acquired under illicit circumstances in a bid to stop [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]] from being destroyed by a mysterious force. She loaned the fighter to [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] during the mission after he expressed an interest in flying it.<ref name="FOTJ1">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Outcast]]''</ref>

name: Dorovio Bold/Legends
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] from an unknown [[Planet/Legends|planet]] and [[Star system/Legends|system]], Dorovio Bold served in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] during the [[Imperial Period]] and was known to be one of the best cadets at the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]]. During the time of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|First Galactic Civil War]], Bold learned of what happened to [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] and how it was [[Destruction of Alderaan|destroyed]] by the Empire. She viewed the Empire to be tyrannical and decided to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]].<ref name="SWCVD" />In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Bold was one of many pilots that gathered to meet with the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Alliance Fleet]] over [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]] in preparing for a dangerous mission to destroy the Empire's [[Death Star II/Legends|second Death Star]] that was been constructed over the forest moon of [[Endor/Legends|Endor]]. Present with many pilots at Ackbar and Madine's briefing on the mission, Bold flew a [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighter]] and participated in the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|battle of Endor]], in which she was shot down when her fighter suffered fatal stabilizer damage.<ref name="SWCVD" /><ref name="Celebration Europe Footage" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Kina Margath
description: {{Quote|Captain Yonka made his rounds, visited his mistress on Elshandruu Pica&mdash;he's seeing the Moff's wife, though the Moff believes he's bedding the owner of a local resort.|Fliry Vorru, to Ysanne Isard|X-Wing: The Bacta War}}Kina Margath was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who resided on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Elshandruu Pica]], the [[Sector/Legends|sector]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of the [[Quence sector]],<ref name="GG9" /> in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="TEA-OC">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> She was the owner of [[Margath's on Elshandruu Pica]], an expansive entertainment complex<ref name="GG9" /> in [[Picavil]], the planet's capital [[City/Legends|city]].<ref name="CSWE-EP">{{CSWECite|I|230|Elshandruu Pica}}</ref> The sprawling facility included [[bar]]s, [[nightclub]]s, five-star [[Hotel/Legends|hotels]], and [[Casino/Legends|casinos]], with the centerpiece being the [[27th Hour Social Club]]. Margath inherited control of Margath's from her [[Parent/Legends|parents]]<ref name="GG9" /> some [[Time/Legends|time]] between [[14 BBY/Legends|14 BBY]] and [[10 BBY/Legends|10 BBY]]<ref name="Margath's date">''[[Galaxy Guide 9: Fragments from the Rim]]'' establishes that Margath gained control of [[Margath's on Elshandruu Pica|Margath's]] fourteen [[Standard year/Legends|years]] prior. ''Galaxy Guide 9'' is set during the four-year [[Time/Legends|time]] period between the end of [[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']] and [[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']], meaning that an exact date cannot be determined.</ref> and turned the complex into a thriving success with a [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]-wide reputation for quality service and excellence, employing over 1,500 full-time and around 4,500 part-time workers. Customer numbers in the complex ranged from 10,000 on a quiet [[Standard day/Legends|day]] to around 100,000 at its peak. Margath kept track of the customer turnover, and was reputedly the only one able to keep an accurate tally.<ref name="GG9" />Margath spent much of her free time at the 27th Hour Social Club; the club's reputation and its location at the front of the Margath's complex meant that it was usually the first place that visiting customers encountered. Margath found the diverse mix of [[Species/Legends|species]] and cultures entertaining, and enjoyed watching people having a good time. The 27th Hour Social Club pledged that if they did not stock or know how to create a patron's [[Alcohol/Legends|drink]] order, then the customer's tab was on the house. An informal contest arose from the declaration, as new and old customers tried their luck in getting a free bar tab for the night by trying to find new or obscure drinks from throughout the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. The offer cost Margath thousands of [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] over the [[Standard year/Legends|years]], but did result in a drinks library of over fourteen million concoctions.<ref name="GG9" />Opposed to the stance that the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] took on [[Free-trader|trade]] restrictions and prohibition, Margath was also an [[Agent/Legends|operative]] for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], working as a [[Foster Agent]]. Foster Agents were individuals whose mission was to collect orphaned Alliance operatives&mdash;agents who had conducted missions, but missed their scheduled extraction&mdash;and see them safely returned to the Alliance. Margath enjoyed allowing Alliance operatives to use her businesses as safehouses as long as they attracted no Imperial attention. The position was a dangerous one, as Alliance operatives who had been given Margath's name as a point of contact could have potentially revealed her name if captured by Imperial [[Imperial Military/Legends|forces]].<ref name="GG9" />In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], on [[Great ReSynchronization|35:9:15]], Margath's was raided by the intergalactic [[Gemstone/Legends|jewel]] [[Scoundrel|thief]] known only as the "[[Tanda Marelle|Tombat]]." The master thief penetrated the security vaults of the complex and stole gems and settings belonging to the resort's guests. The total cost of the stolen goods was six million credits, with over two million of those credits being accounted for in a necklace of [[Corusca gem/Legends|Corusca stones]] in a [[Mythra/Legends|mythra]] setting belonging to [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Landric (Lady)|Landric]], [[Marriage/Legends|wife]] of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Landric]] of the [[Emmo sector]]. In their place, the Tombat left a single [[quella stone]], which was the thief's trademark. Margath was upset at the heist, which endangered the reputation that Margath's had established for being a high-security business resort. In response to the theft, Lady Landric announced that a full investigation of the complex would be launched. Two days later, the staff at Margath's discovered that all of the stolen jewelery had been returned to the security vaults, along with another quella stone. [[Inspector/Legends|Inspector]] [[Toorka]], who was leading the investigation of the initial theft, stated that he believed that the Tombat had simply changed their mind about the theft, and dismissed the notion of another exceptionally skilled thief returning them after outwitting the Tombat to obtain the jewels in the first place.<ref name="Journal8">{{Journal|8|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref>In [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], Imperial [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Sair Yonka]] of the [[Imperial II-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial II''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Freedom|''Avarice'']] embarked upon an affair with [[Aellyn Jandi]], the wife of the local Imperial Moff, [[Riit Jandi]]. Margath found out about the affair and befriended Aellyn, agreeing to keep the affair secret from the Moff. Yonka and Aellyn used Margath's for their liaisons, and Margath allowed rumors to spread that Yonka was romancing her. In return, Aellyn secured favorable treatment for Margath's business operations from Moff Jandi, and Yonka supplied her with exotic drinks from the worlds he visited, which helped the 27th Hour Social Club to keep its promise that it could supply any known drink to a patron.<ref name="BW" /> Around the same time, Margath acquired a small supply of good-quality [[Skannbult Likker]], a drink whose quality varied greatly. Considered to be the most potent [[Alcohol/Legends|fire-water]] in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and unique to the planet [[Skann]] in the [[Astal sector]], Skannbult Likker was created locally by the world's [[Farmer/Legends|farmers]]. Low-quality, quickly brewed [[rotgut]] was readily available, but the high quality product was rarely seen off-world. Margath refused to reveal her supplier, selling double measures for between fifteen and twenty-five credits, although the fast turnover and limited quantity of the liquor made her consider raising the price to twenty credits per single measure.<ref name="GG9" />In [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] and [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] resigned their commissions from the [[Combined Defense Forces of the New Republic|Defense Force]] of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]&mdash;the successor state to the Alliance to Restore the Republic&mdash;in the wake of the [[Liberation of Coruscant (Galactic Civil War)|liberation]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the galactic capital. The former [[Director/Legends|Director]] of [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]], [[Ysanne Isard]], had seized control of the planet [[Thyferra/Legends|Thyferra]] and the [[Bacta Cartel]]s by allying herself with the [[Xucphra Corporation]], but the New Republic was hesitant to embroil themselves in what was technically a Thyferran internal affair, so Antilles and his compatriots fought a [[Bacta War|private campaign]] against her. Looking to learn more about the forces under Isard's command, Antilles put out requests for information on her [[Starship/Legends|starships]] and commanders, including Captain Sair Yonka. Margath responded with a full report of Yonka's affair. Using that information, Antilles and the Rogues ambushed Yonka while he was visiting his mistress, and offered him a deal to defect to their cause, which he took.<ref name="BW" />Sometime in 7 ABY, Margath bought three [[GAT-12 Skipray Blastboat]]s, which were housed at the [[Spaceport/Legends|starport]] on Elshandruu Pica. In a brazen move, the [[Saurton]] [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] [[Miktiss]] stole the three ships as a low-level criminal in his employ created a distraction. Miktiss and his [[Des'maric Pirates|pirates]] absconded with the ships before the planetary [[System patrol craft|patrol vessels]] could react. Margath vowed to find out who had stolen the Blastboats.<ref name="DarkStryder">''[[The DarkStryder Campaign]]''</ref> By [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]], Margath's was being regularly supplied with drink concoctions and recipes by the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Booster Terrik]]. Terrik's son-in-law, [[Corran Horn]], believed Terrik had an attraction to Margath, and found her charming, but Horn's wife, [[Mirax Terrik Horn|Mirax]], believed that Margath was too young for her father.<ref name="IJ">''[[I, Jedi]]''</ref>

name: Dana (Rebel Alliance)
description: Dana was partnered with the [[Tarro]] operative [[Kassar Kosciusko]], and the pair operated on [[Kwenn Space Station]].<ref name="CRO">''[[Cracken's Rebel Operatives]]''</ref> Some [[Standard month/Legends|months]] prior to the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Dana infiltrated the [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Relentless (Dorja)|''Relentless'']], working undercover as an [[Ensign/Legends|ensign]] in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]]. After three months aboard, Dana was assigned to the warship's [[Captain/Legends|Captain]], [[Parlan]], as an assistant. In this capacity, Dana gathered information for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="TM" />Soon after the destruction of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star]], Captain Parlan captured a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] named [[Quist (pirate)|Quist]] during an operation in the [[Dalchon system]]. The prisoner, in order to avoid execution, bargained for his life by offering to reveal information pertaining to the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] tactician [[Adar Tallon]]. Though many people believed that Tallon had [[Death/Legends|died]] battling pirates in the Dalchon system [[Standard year/Legends|years]] prior, Quist knew that Tallon was alive and hiding out on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].<ref name="TM" />The Rebels remembered and respected Tallon as a hero of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and his tactics were used by Rebel pilots. However, the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] wanted to capture Tallon. To achieve this, Parlan called upon a number of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]], including [[Jodo Kast]], and offered a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]], designation [[82,471]], for the capture of Tallon.<ref name="TM" />Upon learning of this, Dana jumped ship at [[Kwenn Space Station]] several [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] before the mission was due to be completed to report her discoveries. She issued a [[Code Green]]&mdash;Agent in trouble, pick up immediately&mdash;which was responded to by the crew of the [[Starship/Legends|starship]] ''[[Alabak's Gold]]''. Unfortunately, another of Parlan's officers, [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Voor (lieutenant)|Voor]], discovered her disappearance. Jodo Kast tracked down Dana and killed her with one of his [[Poison dart/Legends|poison darts]] laced with [[Sennari/Legends|Sennari]]. The crew of the ''Alabak's Gold'' managed to retrieve Dana's body, and found the information she intended to pass on concerning Tallon encrypted on a [[Datapad/Legends|data storage pad]].<ref name="TM" />

name: Rasha Bex
description: [[File:RashaBex2.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Rasha before spending the night with [[BoShek/Legends|BoShek]].]]She infiltrated the six [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] cells loyal to [[Garm Bel Iblis]] on [[Stoga]], before being discovered. She hired the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[BoShek/Legends|BoShek]] to get her to safety from the Rebel leaders [[Karn]] and [[Lhira]], letting him think that she was no more than another individual turned off by the extremism of the Rebellion.Once BoShek delivered her to safety, Bex allowed him to be arrested by Imperial officers after he turned down her offer of Imperial employment, even though she had grown attracted to him during their night together and had kissed him passionately only moments before. A few months later, she would come to the aid of the [[Ahakistan rebels]] looking to sabotage an Imperial [[The Hub (computer)|computer hub]] at [[Pyramid One]], in the hopes that her new allies could help reunite her with the imprisoned BoShek. She met the rebels at the [[Daystar Casino/Legends|Daystar Casino]] whose owner had brought with himself a motley group who he had claimed were members of the Rebel Alliance.At first, the Rebel cell members were suspicious of her presence but welcomed her at the behest of [[Sardoth]] who also told [[Tarson]] that she was looking for BoShek. During the meeting, Sardoth informed the cell members that the Empire had been using Ahakista as a base for [[The Hub (computer)|the Hub]], a supercomputer housed inside [[Pyramid One|the pyramid]] at the center of the city. The Hub was of great importance to the Empire, since it purpose was to coordinate the vast [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]].Part of the plot for infiltrating the Hub involved using an ancient series of tunnels under the pyramid which housed the Hub. However, these tunnels were blocked by a [[Blast door/Legends|blast door]] blocked by a protective [[Force field/Legends|energy field]] and guarded by [[Stormtrooper/Legends|Stormtroopers]]. Due to her knowledge of the building, Bex was assigned the job of disabling the energy field. The only way was to destroy its power source which was the grid's power control station on the tenth floor. Sardoth then came to the reason for why he had contacted Dunlan: He wanted Dunlan's group of rebels to destroy the pyramid's power control station so that the off-worlders could infiltrate and destroy the Hub itself.However, this plan sparked division among the Rebel cell members particularly Dunlan who argued that a frontal assault on the pyramid was suicidal, resulting in heavy casualties. Enraged, Dunlan and other members of the local Ahakistan resistance stormed out of the meeting. Amidst the uproar, Rasha commented that without Dunlan attacking the power station, the plan would fall apart. Discouraged, Bex attempted to back-out of the plot but was stopped by Tarson who ordered her to find a way to shut down the power generator or she would never see Boshek again. He then reiterated that they were taking the Hub and they were doing it now despite Dunlan's withdrawal.[[File:Rasha bex imp johdpurs.jpg|thumb|right|Bex in an Imperial uniform.]]Arriving at the power control station on the tenth floor of [[Pyramid One]], Captain Bex was confronted by an inquisitive [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Tregor]] who was suspicious of her presence in a maximum-security area. Rasha claimed that she was there to appraise his security arrangements as part of a new security initiative brought in by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. She reiterated that any lack of compliance would be reported. As Bex approached the power generator controls, she attempted to find away to shut them down but was cornered by Tregor.Burning with rage and taking note of her suspicious behavior, Tregor attempted to expose her. With her cover exposed, Bex pushed away his hands and kicked him in the lips. Taking advantage of his bigger size, Tregor quickly regained the upper hand and wrestled her to the floor. He was about to kill her on the spot when he was caught in an explosion that incapacitated him. On the run from Vader's troops, a wounded Dunlan had fired a surface-to-air missile at the power generator. With the power generator destroyed and Tregor incapacitated, a shocked Bex made her way out of the station.

name: Kaiya Adrimetrum
description: [[File:Kaiyaadrimetrum.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Kaiya Adrimetrum.]]

name: Irenez (Human)
description: Irenez's association with [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Garm Bel Iblis|Bel Iblis]] began when he financed her education at the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]]. Following her graduation, she refused to join the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]], instead she formed her own platoon of [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] and soldiers, remaining neutral between the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] and the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]]. However, after Bel Iblis went into hiding following an Imperial assassination attempt on [[Anchoron]], Irenez would join [[Garm Bel Iblis's movement|his movement]] to lead his ground forces.In [[9 ABY/Legends|9 ABY]] she was responsible for securing the secret meetings of [[Tav Breil'lya]] and Garm Bel Iblis on [[New Cov/Legends|New Cov]]. Due to her picket lines Han Solo was intercepted when he tried to tail Breil'lya, as did [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] when he arrived on New Cov to meet Solo. When Imperial forces [[Raid on New Cov|raided]] Ilic to obtain drugs and medicines&mdash;a cover for the city's clandestine payments to the Empire&mdash;Irenez was ordered to help them return to their ships.When Solo and Calrissian came to ''Peregrine's Nest'', Irenez asked them to try to engineer a request from [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]] for a formal invitation to join the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], as she knew that Mothma was not seeking power for herself, and that Bel Iblis was too proud to go asking for an invitation. Irenez joined the New Republic with the rest of Bel Iblis' former forces.

name: Stinna Draesinge Sha
description: Sha was taught by [[Professor/Legends|Professor]] [[Nasdra Magrody]] himself and she in turn instructed future [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], [[Cray Mingla]]. Sha studied [[Ssi-ruu]]vi [[Droid/Legends|droid]] starfighters and the [[entechment]] process, trying to discover how the [[Alien/Legends|aliens]] were able to capture a person's life energy.After retiring, Sha was [[Assassin/Legends|assassinated]] in [[12 ABY/Legends|12 ABY]], apparently by [[Phlygas Grynne]], just before [[Han Solo/Legends|Han]] and [[Chief of State (New Republic)|Chief of State]] [[Leia Organa Solo]] went to [[Ithor/Legends|Ithor]] to attend a [[Herd Meet]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Feebee Desnand
description: A plump woman who wore false [[Eye/Legends|eyelashes]], Feebee had been promised a lizard-skin gown by her husband. He planned to make good on his promise by skinning [[Bossk/Legends|Bossk]] alive, but Bossk escaped from [[Prison/Legends|prison]] before the skinning could take place.

name: Crowley (Human)
description: After the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] ended in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], she settled on [[Sulon]] during the [[Declaration of a New Order|declaration]] of the [[New Order/Legends|New Order]]. By [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]], she eventually joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] to battle against the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. She was one of the twenty-six Rebel resistance soldiers who fought and died under [[Morgan Katarn]] during [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec's]] attack.

name: Josta Cracken
description: She eventually moved to [[Contruum/Legends|Contruum]] and [[Marriage/Legends|married]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] in the days before the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]]. They had two children, [[Pash Cracken|Pash]] and [[Dena Cracken|Dena]].

name: Mora
description: Mora's family was killed when the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] took control of M'haeli. Mora was orphaned and adopted by a kind-hearted [[H'drachi]] seer named [[Ch'no]] who raised her as his own, and Mora became quite adept at scrounging for and repairing junk, eventually gaining a reputation as a skilled [[Technician/Legends|mechanic]].When Mora turned eighteen, she was working as a mechanic when she caught the [[Eye/Legends|eye]] of a young Imperial Officer, [[Ranulf Trommer]] who had been sent to her by governor [[Grigor (governor)|Grigor]] with a damaged [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] in need of repair. Grigor, suspecting Trommer was sent to [[Spy/Legends|spy]] on him, intended to eliminate Trommer as a rebel operative in a raid on Mora's shop. However, real rebels, including [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], whom Mora (unaware that she's Padmé's daughter) recognized her from her wanted posters, had already approached Mora for her technical skills in order to have her modify a number of [[Asteroid-3 Swoop Racer|Asteroid-3]] swoops. When [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] swept in to arrest Trommer, Mora fought back, with the nearby rebels joining in. Afterward, Trommer and Mora fled her shop with the rebels, and together they sabotaged Grigor's [[dragite crystal]] mine and left to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Jalose
description: In [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], Jalose fought alongside [[Merrik]] and other Rebel soldiers in a campaign against [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Grigor (governor)|Grigor]] to rid the planet of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] occupation on the planet [[M'haeli/Legends|M'haeli]]. She became increasingly resentful of [[Mora]], who she saw as competing with her for the attentions of Merrik as well as causing complications for the rebellion, and betrayed her to the Empire.Later, when she realized Mora was the descendant of the planets murdered royal family, she was distraught at where her jealousy had led her. Jalose redeemed herself by throwing herself in the path of a shot fired at Mora by the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Glott]]. She slowly passed away from her wound.{{Char-stub}}

name: Travia Chan/Legends
description: Travia Chan was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] on [[Fest/Legends|Fest]], a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] in the distant [[Atrivis sector/Legends|Atrivis sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. As a child, she suffered from an illness that left her confined to a [[Power chair|repulsorchair]] for the rest of her life. As the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] began to oppress her [[Sector/Legends|sector]] and [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], Chan became one of the original founders of the [[Fest Resistance Group]] (FRG). Following the [[Battle of Mantooine|massacre]] of independent resistance fighters on neighboring [[Mantooine/Legends|Mantooine]], Chan orchestrated the union of the FRG with the [[Mantooine Liberators]] into the [[Atrivis Resistance Group/Legends|Atrivis Resistance Group]] (ARG) and became its first and only military [[Commander/Legends|commander]]. Later the ARG was approached by [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]], a resistance leader who masterminded the creation of the [[The galaxy/Legends|pan-galactic]] [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], who urged them to join this wider union. After some deliberation, the ARG signed the [[Treaty of Generis]], becoming an official ally of the Rebellion; Chan maintained her leadership throughout this transition, becoming the Atrivis sector [[Commander-in-Chief/Legends|Commander-in-Chief]]. While in this role, her disability kept her mainly confined to the [[Generis/Legends|Generis]] command base and its medical facilities; to compensate, her [[Chief of Staff/Legends|Chief of Staff]], [[Loom Carplin]], frequently acted as her eyes and ears off-world. When Carplin was off-world, Chan was aided by the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Busurra]], an able administrator.<ref name="RASB" />When the Rebel Alliance transitioned into the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], Chan remained on Generis, working at the [[Outer Rim Communications Center]] there. In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], Generis was [[Fall of Generis|conquered]] by the resurgent Imperial forces under the command of [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. In this instance, he had personally planned the assault. While the entire communications facility was lost to the Imperials, Chan and those under her command were able to escape the planet with the aid of New Republic [[General/Legends|General]] [[Kryll]] after Commander [[Pash Cracken]] provided a distraction.<ref name="TLC" />

name: Raleigh Dawn
description: Kestrel was meant to make a rendezvous with [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] operative codenamed [[Tay Vanis|Tiree]]. Tiree trusted her with his life, though the nature and history of their relationship was unknown. She was to become a new recruit for the Rebel Alliance.However, an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on her head complicated things. [[Bounty hunter/Legends|Bounty hunters]] [[Skorr]], [[Furlag]], [[4-LOM/Legends|4-LOM]], and [[Zuckuss/Legends|Zuckuss]] failed in an attempt to capture her on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]], though they did succeed in flushing her out of her last safe hiding place. Skorr's pursuit of Kestrel seemed to be of a more personal nature rather than just for the money.Kestrel visited her friend, the slicer [[Skivvers]], to find out who had posted the bounty on Raleigh Dawn, though Skivvers was unable to retrieve the information due to it being a private posting. However Skivvers had something else for Kestrel—a datapad containing a rendezvous point with Tiree. They met in an alley, where Tiree gave her another datapad with a new off-planet rendezvous.Kestrel found a ship and pilot that would take to the coordinates.

name: Ghia
description: They were both extremely skilled [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]], and were a great acquisition to the Rebellion. Around [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], she and Tia met the newly joined [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], and they both fell in love with the charming ace. Therefore, they were devastated when they heard that Solo was captured by the Empire and delivered to [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] by [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]]. Determined to rescue Solo, they stole a [[T-47 airspeeder/Legends|snowspeeder]] and abandoned the Rebellion to rescue him from Jabba, but were captured and enslaved. During their enslavement they were forced to wear skimpy slave outfits very similar to [[Slave Leia costume|Leia's]], They were also forced to feed and massage him. When Jabba found out that she and her sister were Rebel pilots, he let them fight in his [[Jabba's demolition games|"Demolition"]] games.During these Demolition Games, it is unknown what the fate of the twins were. Records were lost along with [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire]]. It is rumored that either the two were freed with the help of [[Leia Organa Solo|Princess Leia Organa]] disguised as [[Boushh/Legends|Boushh]] or alternatively doomed to remain as [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]].

name: Grindol Maal
description: Maal was a close friend with the [[Revwien/Legends|Revwien]] [[Wuwuhuul]]. Together, they volunteered to aid the Rebellion on a mission to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Goratak III]]. The Rebellion was trying to capture a [[I2-CG]] [[Droid/Legends|droid]] that had crashed on the planet. The droid contained highly sensitive information on a Rebel [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] manufacturing plant on [[Tar Morden]].Maal was joined by the [[Red Smoke]], [[Safari One]] and [[Buzz Boys]] squads. The 30 troops in total fought against 15 Imperial troops and a group of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] led by [[Feskitt Bobb]]. They clashed in the middle of a [[Crystal Forests|crystal forest]], with the outcome of the [[Mission to Goratak III|battle]] unknown.Maal was always eager to fight against the Empire, and was often armed with a [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifle]] and a [[Vibrocutlass/Legends|vibrocutlass]].

name: Selnia Harbright
description: With [[Salliche/Legends|Salliche]] held tight in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] grip, the Harbright family came to realize that [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] was a tyrant, and that the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] was justified. Following the dissolution of the [[Imperial Senate/Legends|Imperial Senate]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Selnia served the Alliance in several covert operations, including a supply-gathering mission to [[Droecil]] which culminated in a heated confrontation with pirate [[Black Jack]], deep in [[Keller's Void]].

name: Lhira
description: During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she was a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] loyal to [[Garm Bel Iblis]]. She helped [[Karn]] in running Iblis' six Rebel cells on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Stoga]]. She and Karn tried to apprehend [[Rasha Bex]] when [[BoShek/Legends|BoShek]] helped her return to her [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] overseers, but failed.

name: Lieda Mothma
description: She was born during the early years of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]]. Mon Mothma often wished she could retire from service and devote herself to her. At some point after [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] death, Lieda recovered from some unspecified ailment or injury on [[New Alderaan/Legends|New Alderaan]].During her time on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]], she was the only person who saw behind a confident face of her mother and how much she had added for years. After the uprising on [[Almas]], she and her mother traveled to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and spent several [[Standard year/Legends|years]] together.

name: Dusque Mistflier
description: Dusque Mistflier grew up on the [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Talus/Legends|Talus]]. She was the youngest of five children, and the only [[Sexes/Legends|female]]. Her father was employed at a small firm manufacturing [[Starship/Legends|starship]] components, while her mother remained at home raising Dusque and her four brothers. When Dusque was a young girl, her father's employer began accepting contracts for the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. The simple line worker quickly grew disenfranchised with his work, notably when he discovered what his equipment was being used for. This resulted in numerous dinnertime arguments with his wife. Dusque would often sneak out of her room and eavesdrop on her parents during one of their many arguments. Before long however, Dusque's father suffered a convenient [[Heart/Legends|heart]] attack at work and died soon after. Dusque's mother became completely despondent from his [[Death/Legends|death]] and grew into a mere shell of the woman she once was.As Dusque grew older, she witnessed her brothers taking up her father's old position at the starship manufacturers. Her family's close connection with the Galactic Empire left a sour taste in her mouth, but she realized that life on Talus offered very little in the way of an alternative. One brother even enlisted in the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]]. His military career was short lived however, as he was killed during a training exercise shortly after joining up. With the death of the brother, Dusque's mother's condition worsened.Dusque eventually attended college and graduated with honors at the top of her class. She specialized in [[xenobiology]] and soon joined the [[Imperial Corps of Bioengineers/Legends|Imperial Corps of Bioengineers]]. She left Talus forever and never looked back.As part of the ICB, Dusque traveled all across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], studying animal life from dozens of different planets. She developed her skills in the fields of hunting, trapping and exploration, and became one of the most accomplished scientists working for the Empire. Her superiors however, never gave Dusque her due recognition. She was consistently held back from advancement and lost several viable promotions to her fellow male colleagues.Dusque had a colleague and friend [[Tendau Nandon]] who was killed by the Empire, inspiring her to join the Rebel Alliance. Following Tendau's death, Dusque joined forces with [[Finn Darktrin]], an undercover Imperial spy within the Rebel Alliance, on a mission to find a holocron containing the identities of Rebel sympathizers in order for it not to fall into Imperial hands. After obtaining the holocron on Dantooine, Dusque was betrayed and almost killed by Finn, had [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] not saved her soon after Finn made his escape. Dusque survived the incident and continued on with the Rebel Alliance.

name: Cee Norley
description: In [[5 ABY/Legends|5 ABY]], she accompanied [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qu Rahn]] to [[Dorlo]]. When [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec's]] forces intervened, she agreed to stay behind and create a diversion while Rahn and his party tried to escape. After destroying an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Skimmer/Legends|skimmer]] with a missile launcher, she was killed by a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] shot through her chest while being held in a [[Telekinesis/Legends#Choking powers|Force choke]] by one of Jerec's [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]]. [[Duno Dree]] felt attracted to her.{{Char-stub}}

name: Neena
description: Neena grew up in the household of [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]], and when she began to show musical talent, Organa sent her to an offworld school<ref name="GG6-1" /> to master the [[string oscillator]].<ref name="GG6-2">[[Galaxy Guide 6: Tramp Freighters (Second Edition)|''Galaxy Guide 6: Tramp Freighters'', Second Edition]]</ref> She was there when the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]] destroyed [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]]. Shocked by this development, Neena tried to contact her old friend [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], but without funds provided by the [[House of Organa/Legends|Organa household]], she was stranded.<ref name="GG6-1" />Without an alternative, Neena began performing on space liners, trying to pick ships heading toward anyone she knew but without much success. After several months, she gave up, and soon was making a decent but boring living entertaining the decadent beings of the planet [[Adarlon/Legends|Adarlon]] in the Minos Cluster. There, she was approached by [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] agent [[Drun Cairnwick]], who recruited her to the cause of the Rebellion and sent her to the [[Sector/Legends|sector]] headquarters of [[Travnin]].<ref name="GG6-1" />Neena built a solid reputation playing at [[The Grand Design]] spacer's bar on Travnin, attempting to get a job performing aboard the [[Victory-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Victory''-class Star Destroyer]] ''[[The Chariot]]'' to gather information on the sector [[Moff/Legends|Moff]]. She arranged for free traders visiting the bar to deliver supplies to local Rebels on behalf of underworld figure [[Tecknel Shnick]]. She was successful in gathering information on ''The Chariot'', passing it on to Rebel agents during the revolt in the Cluster.<ref name="GG6-2" />{{Unlicensedstart}}She was also known to deal with [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] and other such lowlifes, and once hired a down-on-their-luck smuggling crew to steal a batch of prototype [[Holorecorder/Legends|holocorders]] from the [[Nadir Corporation]]. When they returned with the holocorders, she got [[LREED]] to offload them and paid the group 4,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] then offered them the job of delivering a [[holocrystal]] and business card to her friend in [[Pwosson Pictures]] on Adarlon. She informed the group to look her up whenever they were back on Travnin.<ref name="Challenge68">''[[Challenge 68]]''</ref>{{Unlicensedend}}

name: Mia Ikova
description: [[1 BBY/Legends|A year before]] the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Ikova welcomed Princess Leia Organa during her stay at Kattada. While the princess searched refuge she was found by stormtroopers and captured alongside Mia Ikova.[[File:First shots fired.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Mia Ikova is shot.]]She was shot by [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Karg]] and his [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] and passed away in Leia's [[Starship/Legends|starship]]. Before passing away, she reminded a mourning Leia of her mission to help free [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and that Leia was not guilty for her [[Death/Legends|death]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Mika (Farghul)
description: [[File:Mika.jpg|thumb|left|Mika.]]{{Quote|This guild is mine!|Mika|Republic 66: Show of Force, Part 2}}Long ago, Mika's parents ran into [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] trouble when she was very young. Rather than let their business be shut down and submit to capture, her parents tried to [[Death/Legends|kill]] the Jedi and went down fighting. Mika held a grudge against the Jedi for the rest of her life. Eventually, she was brought into the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunting]] business by [[Stroth]]. Over the years she rose to power in [[Crimson Nova]], and became the group's leader. She developed a romantic bond with fellow [[Farghul]] [[Harll]].During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Mika accepted a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] for several Jedi from [[Kh'aris Fenn]]. Officially she was in it for the [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] but unofficially she was out for revenge. [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]], [[Agen Kolar/Legends|Agen Kolar]], [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]], and [[Saesee Tiin/Legends|Saesee Tiin]] came to her hideout to stop this contract, which led to Harll's death. Mika was stunned by Stroth when she refused to surrender to the Jedi, and was then arrested by the Jedi.Mika's daughter, [[Breela]], became a bounty hunter around the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. Like her mother, she specialized in hunting Jedi, whom she had a personal reason to loathe, and attempted to bring down [[Kai Justiss]].

name: Mirith Sinn
description: {{Quote|No Empire--no Government--has the right to exist at the expense of its people.|Mirith Sinn}}From a young age, Sinn found herself attracted to men of "greatness." However, Mirith eventually [[Marriage/Legends|married]] a farmer named [[Jahren Sinn]] on [[Nez Peron/Legends|Nez Peron]] during the early days of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Jahren had business dealings with [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Ragez D'Asta]], and Mirith ended up befriending the Baron's daughter, [[Feena D'Asta|Feena]].There was talk among the citizens of a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]] and an end to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. However, Nez Peron remained an Imperial world despite its starving population. Jahren sought reform and justice and was elected to speak on behalf of Nez Peron's farmers. Jahren decided not to hand over their produce to the Empire. This was a doomed plan, as [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] came to Nez Peron and smashed the blossoming resistance. Vader murdered Jahren Sinn himself, and his wife, Mirith, vowed her allegiance to the Rebel Alliance then and there, promising herself that she would keep fighting the Empire until it was no more.[[File:Mirith-torture.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Mirith being tortured by Imperial Guard Carnor Jax's men]]For the remainder of the war, Sinn served with the Alliance through the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] and the creation of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. She served as a soldier in the New Republic's [[Battle of Mokk IX|liberation]] of [[Mokk IX]], where she cared for an injured [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] named [[Sish Sadeet]]. After he recovered, Sadeet joined the New Republic and served as her second-in-command, forming a strong loyalty to her.Sinn&mdash;now a [[Commander/Legends|commander]]&mdash;led New Republic forces still actively fighting against the Empire. She had been found to be a natural-born leader, and would willingly lay her life down for the soldiers under her command. When [[Carnor Jax]] usurped the [[Imperial Ruling Council/Legends|Imperial Interim Ruling Council]], Sinn was stationed on [[Phaeda/Legends|Phaeda]], leading an underground resistance force. It was then that Kir Kanos arrived.Kanos, the former [[Emperor's Royal Guard/Legends|Imperial Royal Guard]] who sought revenge for the death of [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] against Carnor Jax and the Interim Ruling Council, found his way to Phaeda and was given sanctuary by [[Tem Merkon]]. Sinn was initially very skeptical of Kanos's intentions. Kanos would gain the trust of Sinn and her [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]], [[Sish Sadeet]], upon [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Xexus Shev]]'s attack. Kanos nearly single-handedly saved the New Republic base from Shev's forces.Meanwhile, Carnor Jax was en route to Phaeda to apprehend Kanos. Sinn and Sadeet learned that Tem Markon had revealed Kanos's presence to Jax, who began proactively searching Phaeda. In disguise, Sinn attempted to retrieve Kanos's ship, but was captured by Jax's [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]], believing her to be Kanos. Jax [[Torture/Legends|tortured]] Sinn, seeking the whereabouts of Kanos. As carefully planned by Kanos and Sinn, she revealed his location to be [[Yinchorr/Legends|Yinchorr]]. Jax released Sinn and set out for Yinchorr. Along with Sadeet, Sinn followed.Upon her arrival on Yinchorr, Kanos and Jax were locked in mortal combat on [[The Squall]]. When Kanos nearly killed Jax, Sinn and Sadeet demanded to take him alive&mdash;something Kanos refused to allow. In attempting to wrest Kanos away from Jax, Sadeet was impaled and killed. Sinn was outraged and swore her revenge against Kanos, who left shortly thereafter, leaving Jax dead.Sinn went on to seek out Kanos in revenge for the death of Sadeet. However, she also became involved in the search for Feena D'Asta and found her way to the den of [[Grappa (Hutt)|Grappa]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] on [[Genon]]. Meanwhile, Kanos had infiltrated Grappa's entourage as the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Kenix Kil]], as part of his own agenda to eliminate the members of the Interim Ruling Council. Sinn soon discovered Feena D'Asta and uncovered a [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] plot to replace Council members with [[Cloning/Legends|clones]]. However, Sinn was found out by Grappa by a former subordinate of hers, [[Massimo]]. Massimo told Grappa what she was really up to, and he had them both sent to [[Xo]], homeworld of the terrifying [[Zanibar]].[[File:Kanos8.JPG|thumb|right|140px|Kir Kanos and Mirith kiss.]]Kir Kanos stole an [[RZ-1 A-wing interceptor/Legends|A-wing]] and followed, intent on rescuing Sinn. Sure enough, he found her just in time&mdash;Massimo had already been sacrificed in the Zanibars' horrific ceremony. Kanos and Sinn fled from the Zanibar and crashed into the jungle, far from the Zanibar settlement. Together, they made their way through the jungle, fending off carnivorous plants and animals. Using an overcharged [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] to provide warmth, the two spoke with each other into the night. Sinn revealed to Kanos the story of her husband's death and asked whether the Empire Kanos believed in even existed. Despite their differences, they began to fall in love.The next morning, they were attacked by the Zanibar. Sinn, however, was rescued by [[Tav Kennede|a friend]] of Kanos's, leaving him behind and leaving Sinn distraught. Having lost Kanos, Sinn returned to New Republic space and learned that Kanos would be brought to Grappa on Genon. Sinn geared up and led a direct assault on Grappa's base and infiltrated it to rescue Kanos. Reunited, Sinn and Kanos moved on to their final task.On [[Ord Cantrell/Legends|Ord Cantrell]], Sinn and Kanos revealed Black Sun's cloning plot to [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Ragez D'Asta]], who had also been reunited&mdash;with his daughter Feena. Kanos nearly killed Feena for her part in the Ruling Council, but Sinn stayed his hand, demanding to be even for Sadeet's death. Along came [[Xandel Carivus]], ''de facto'' [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] and the final target of Kanos's vendetta. He ordered his personal guards to kill Sinn and Kanos, who made short work of them. Kanos then pursued Carivus and killed him. Even though a number of Council members were still at large, Kanos decided he had done enough killing and ended his crusade.Sinn and Kanos returned to the New Republic battle fleet following the defeat of Xandel Carivus. Sinn had come to realize that Kanos had the same qualities of personality that had attracted her to Jahren. Despite Sinn's plea that Kanos remain with the New Republic&mdash;and with her&mdash;Kanos remained loyal to Palpatine's Empire. Before leaving in a borrowed [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]], Kanos and Sinn shared one long, passionate, and final kiss.

name: Moteé/Legends
description: [[File:Moteepromofull.jpg|thumb|left|165px|Moteé, at the declaration of the Galactic Empire]]Moteé was one of the few who were aware of Padmé's pregnancy and her secret [[Wedding of Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala/Legends|marriage]] to [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], both secrets that she would never let loose. Moteé would tend to Padmé in whatever ways possible and stand in for her whenever the [[Senator/Legends|senator]] wished to meet up with her husband.<ref name="DB" />After the [[Battle of Rendili]], Skywalker went to the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]] to meet with Padmé. He was instead greeted by Moteé who told him that Senator Amidala "was called away on urgent Senate business." She then gave the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] a [[holodisc]] that his wife had left for him.<ref>''[[Republic 71: Dreadnaughts of Rendili, Part 3]]''</ref>Moteé was present in the [[Grand Convocation Chamber|Senate rotunda]] the [[Standard day/Legends|day]] that [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] [[Declaration of a New Order|declared]] the formation of a [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Like Amidala herself, Moteé was dismayed at the "thunderous applause" the new [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] received.<ref name="ROTS" />

name: Bana Breemu/Legends
description: {{Quote|I know a Jedi I feel we should consult.''"<br />"''That would be dangerous.''"<br />"''We don't know how the Jedi fit into all this.|Padmé Amidala, Bana Breemu and Mon Mothma|audio=HowDoJediFit.ogg|Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith}}Due to their importance as industrious [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]], the [[Planet/Legends|planets]] in the [[Humbarine sector/Legends|Humbarine sector]] became targets of heavy [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] attacks during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. Worlds that were not sundered, were often infiltrated by Separatist forces, and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] Breemu soon felt the effects. The [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] deemed her besieged [[Sector/Legends|sector]] a lost cause, and Breemu found her political voice slipping in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]].<ref name="DB" /> Following the [[Battle of Humbarine|destruction]] of [[Humbarine/Legends|Humbarine]] itself, she befriended one of her constituents who had escaped, [[Barrow Oicunn/Legends|Barrow Oicunn]].<ref name="DB2">{{DB|character|ltoicunn|Oicunn, Lieutenant|archivedate=20100209181545}}</ref>She remained a trusted and valued member of the Republic, serving as a member of the [[Loyalist Committee/Legends|Loyalist Committee]] by the end of the Clone Wars <ref name="LoE" />, and was invited to join the [[Delegation of 2000]] in the final days of the war. While Senators such as [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]] and [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]] wanted to force the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] to give up his wartime emergency powers, Bana advised caution. She also recommended that involving the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in their plans was risky, instead wishing for a diplomatic solution to the problem. Breemu was one of the Senators who presented the [[Petition of 2000]] to [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]].<ref name="Revenge of the Sith">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']] {{C|deleted scenes}}</ref>

name: Nee Alavar/Legends
description: [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] Alavar was there when [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] presented the [[Petition of 2000]] to the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]]. Prior to this, she was present to greet [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] after his rescue by the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] during the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]].<ref name="ROTS" />Following the [[Declaration of a New Order]] which formed the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] as the successor state to the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]], Palpatine became [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]] and gained even more powers.<ref name="ROTS" /> In retaliation, Alavar was arrested by Imperial authorities and brutally [[Death/Legends|executed]]. Her entire family was separated and deported to labor camps. This led to the formation of dissident groups on [[Lorrd/Legends|Lorrd]] loosely affiliated with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] during the [[Imperial Period|Imperial era]].<ref name="ditspol" />

name: Darial Anglethorn
description: During the time of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] Darial ran the largest [[Anglethorn moisture farm|moisture farm]] on the [[Desert/Legends|desert]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Beheboth]], and she was a well-respected member in the local community.

name: Janna Tammok
description: A lean, military-looking woman who often wore her dark hair pulled back in a bun, Janna Tammok was known as a highly professional leader, but she had no discernible personality, and her attitude earned her the ironic nickname "Officer Sunshine." True, she would occasionally be spotted off-duty with her senior aides, relaxing a little&mdash;but only a little. In truth, she was frustrated by what she saw as a meaningless posting in [[Drev'starn]], and held onto the forlorn hope that Consul-General Pring would notice her diligence, and recommend her for promotion.Tammok's primary duties were twofold: she had to ensure the security of the diplomatic compound at all times, and protect the mission's computer systems; and to these ends, her command was divided between a military detachment and a cadre of [[Slicer/Legends|slicers]]. Generally, they were successful in their duties&mdash;no mean feat on Bothawui. But they were frustrated by the fact that enemy agents among Pring's aides could simply pull information out of the computers under their security clearance&mdash;people like the young [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] spy who had fallen in love with the Consul-General's daughter [[Praleena Pring]].Those enemy agents who were compromised, however, were generally left in place, and used by the Consul-General to pass on false intelligence to the Empire's enemies. Although she obeyed her orders diligently, implementing this strategy was the only aspect of her duties that Janna Tammok found genuinely distasteful. To her way of thinking, such people should simply have been seized by the Empire and interrogated until they died.It is known that Tammok remained on Bothawui shortly before the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], but it is not certain what became of her after that&mdash;although her failure to prevent the defection of Praleena and her lover probably lost her an opportunity to really catch the eye of her superiors and get herself of Bothawui to a more meaningful command.

name: T'ra Saa
description: [[File:TraSaaandBarriss2.JPG|thumb|left|120px|T'ra Saa.]]

name: Dormé/Legends
description: {{Quote|It's not me, M'Lady. I worry about you. What if they realize you've left the capital?|Dormé, to Padmé Amidala|Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones}}[[File:Dormesenate.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Dormé]]While on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] with [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] in the leadup to voting on the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]], Dormé noticed the growing affection between the [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] as she watched from the sidelines.<ref name="DB" />When Senator Amidala was forced to flee the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] with Skywalker and [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]], Dormé remained behind, along with [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Gregar Typho/Legends|Gregar Typho]], in order to maintain the illusion that Padmé was still on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] and thus throw off further [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] attempts.<ref name="AOTC" />Though fellow [[handmaiden]]s [[Cordé/Legends|Cordé]] and [[Versé/Legends|Versé]] had [[Death/Legends|perished]] during an [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|earlier attempt]] on the Senator's life, Dormé was willing to put her duty before her own safety in order to act as a decoy for the former [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|monarch]] during the last [[Standard day/Legends|days]] of peace before the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="AOTC" />

name: Sheel Odala
description: Six months after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Sheel Odala encountered [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] on [[Void Station]]. She went to Void Station hoping to change her luck. She owed a large sum of credits to [[Jib Kopatha]], the owner of the station, but did not tell Han. Sheel decided that she could sell information on Han's relationship to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] to Jib as payment for her debt. She met Han in the halls of the station, ostensibly for a tryst, but a group of Kopatha's [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] thugs accompanied her to ensure Han did not try to run. After Kopatha's interrogators threatened to kill Han, Sheel decided that she had better leave while she could. She tried to reach her ship, the ''[[Emerald Twilight]]'', but was intercepted by [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]]. Sheel realized that she couldn't leave Han to be tortured, and worked with Chewbacca to free him. After the escape, Han asked Sheel to join the Alliance, but she refused the offer.{{Char-stub}}

name: Shea Sadashassa/Legends
description: As the Senator from the peaceful and prosperous world of Herdessa, Sadashassa joined the Delegation of 2000. Like many of her colleagues, she grew more and more worried about [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] growing power over the Senate.Shortly after the formation of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Sadashassa and sixty-two other Senators of the Delegation (including [[Tanner Cadaman/Legends|Tanner Cadaman]], [[Ivor Drake/Legends|Ivor Drake]], [[Streamdrinker/Legends|Streamdrinker]], [[Fang Zar/Legends|Fang Zar]] and [[Grebleips/Legends|Grebleips]]) were [[Senatorial arrests/Legends|arrested]] by the new [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]].

name: Belaya
description: When the amnesiac [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] escaped from [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] and returned to the [[Jedi Enclave]], Belaya felt the strength of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] within him and stopped him on his way to talk to the Council. She berated him for not wearing [[Jedi apparel|proper robes]], under the assumption he was actually a Padawan. After explaining himself, Belaya apologized, and she later offered insight for Revan on the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] when he began his training again. Despite her relationship with Juhani, or rather because of it, the Council believed that if Belaya attempted to bring her distraught companion back it would cause more harm than good. She could not speak of it to Revan, who had been given the task of "cleansing the tainted grove" as part of his last test to become a Padawan. Belaya's patience was rewarded when Revan succeeded in his task and managed to convince Juhani to turn away from the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and return to the Enclave. She expressed her deep felt gratitude.

name: Buula Nen
description: Nen was the leader of a gang known as [[Buula's Raiders]] that operated out of a fortified [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid base]] called [[Buula's Rocky Home]] located in the [[Vessar Asteroid Field]]. He was involved in [[Spice/Legends|spice]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]], [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]], and many other criminal activities. He had connections throughout the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] and used them to find targets for his raids. The pirate chieftain had a group of [[Chev]]s that had been enslaved to his family for generations.<ref name="H&S" />

name: Beda Ies
description: After her husband was targeted by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], [[Emperor's Hand]] [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]] was dispatched to assassinate him for stealing from the Empire. While searching through Dexar's desk for a list of bank accounts in which he had placed two billion [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] of the [[Palpatine/Legends|Emperor's]] funds into, Jade was interrupted by the Ies family. Shooting Dexar dead, she told Beda and Eremay to disappear forever, where they eventually became [[Joiner]]s. [[Raynar Thul|UnuThul]] would later inform Jade and her husband [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], that the Ies' fear of discovery led to the corruption of the [[Gorog]] nest on [[Woteba]], unknowingly creating the Dark Nest. Known as '''BedaGorog''' UnuThul believed that Skywalker had killed her on [[Kr]]. It was than that the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] discovered the tale to be false, because it was [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Welk]] who died on Skywalker's blade.

name: Betl Oxtroe
description: Betl Oxtroe was an [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] of the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], one<ref name="des" /> of few high-[[Military rank/Legends|ranking]] [[Sexes/Legends|women]] in the armed forces of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].<ref name="negtc">''[[The New Essential Guide to Characters]]''</ref> In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] during the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]. The Empire fell to pieces, with swaths of Imperials turning [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] and establishing their own dominions in various parts of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. Meanwhile on [[Coruscant/Legends|Imperial Center]], Palpatine's successors advocated the continuation of the war with the Rebels, who had reformed into the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].<ref name="nec">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> Despite the fragmentation, Oxtroe and her forces remained loyal to the Empire proper under the command of [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]], alongside other officers such as [[Uther Kermen]] and [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]], and she was responsible for the defense of several [[fortress world]]s in the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core]] and [[Colonies/Legends|Colonies]].<ref name="EGTW">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref>Admiral Oxtroe was one of the few Imperial proponents for a peace process with the New Republic, espousing a parliamentary monarchy that would unite both sides of the conflict. In [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], Oxtroe made secret entreaties to the New Republic, hoping to open talks of establishing such a system. Palpatine had a distant grand-niece, [[Ederlathh Pallopides]],<ref name="des" /> who Oxtroe proposed as a possible heir to the late [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]].<ref name="cswe" /> Pallopides was just eleven years old, so she would act as a mere figurehead; the [[New Republic Provisional Council]] would have control, playing a similar role to the [[Imperial Advisor]]s under Palpatine. In return for what Oxtroe saw as Imperial concessions, the Provisional Council would give amnesty to the [[Imperial Military/Legends|Imperial Military]]. The New Republic was open to negotiations, and talks began in earnest.<ref name="des" />Many Imperials did not want peace accords. The reborn Emperor Palpatine was preparing an Imperial reunification, while [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]] was hiding in the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]], waiting for the right time to [[Thrawn campaign|strike]] at the New Republic.<ref name="des" /> Thrawn commanded a [[Species/Legends|species]] of fierce warriors known as the [[Noghri/Legends|Noghri]]; a Noghri [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] killed Oxtroe before the first round of talks had concluded,<ref name="cswe" /> and the idea was not pursued. New Republic [[Historian/Legends|historian]] [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]] suspected Thrawn's hand in the Admiral's death, but had no evidence.<ref name="des" /> Ultimately, the Empire and New Republic continued to wage war for over a decade, until [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]] and [[Ponc Gavrisom]] signed [[Pellaeon&ndash;Gavrisom Treaty|accords]] in [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]].<ref name="nec" />

name: Zalin Bey
description: During her career, Zalin was very loyal to the Galactic Republic and was once partners with [[Sagoro Autem]], but was promoted instead of him due to his desire to keep away from a desk job. She got the popularity and thus increased from active duty to the future to take on various administrative tasks.In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], Zalin later commanded the Guard unit that Autem and his new partner, [[Isaru Omin]], were assigned to. Her unit was assigned the task of investigating the murder of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Jheramahd Greyshade]]. While Sagoro and Isaru went on the search for the bomber, Zalin investigated inside a laboratory where she searched for evidence. She soon discovered that [[Venco Autem]] was responsible for the murder.{{Char-stub}}

name: Selven
description: Selven began her career as a mere killer in the employ of [[Davik Kang]], the local crime lord of the [[Exchange]] on Taris. Eventually, she abandoned her service to him to work as a freelance [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] for the highest bidder.Sometime during or prior to [[3956 BBY]], possibly under the employ of [[House of Organa/Legends|House Organa]], Selven murdered six civilians—an entire family of [[House Ulgo]]—along with all their bodyguards. This massacre was only the first of a chain of killings that would lead to the extinction of the entire house on Taris. Day after day, more and more Ulgos fell at the hands of Selven, whether gunned down on the streets, [[Poison/Legends|poisoned]] in their own homes, or a variety of other methods. In spite of the level of security stacked against her, Selven was always able to elude the authorities, proving herself unstoppable to all the guards and [[droid]]s that the Ulgos could muster for their protection. By the end of her killing spree, no Ulgo remained alive on Taris, and she had earned a reputation as the best assassin on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]].<ref name="kotor" />In the aftermath, House Organa fiercely pressured government authorities to place a contract on Selven's head, arguing that for this mass murderer to run loose threatened the lives of countless innocents. Despite this, the bitter rivalry that had existed between House Organa and House Ulgo was well-known, and there were many in the public that speculated that it was the Organas that had hired Selven to eliminate the Ulgos, and that they hoped her death would keep this secret from being exposed.<ref name="kotor" />In 3956 BBY, her bounty was posted by [[Zax]], the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] in charge of the [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] office at [[Javyar's Cantina]] in the [[Lower City]]. Numerous bounty hunters attempted to collect the bounty, but every last one of them were killed by Selven. When the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]] occupied the planet during the [[Jedi Civil War]], the assassin was not intimidated by the [[Sith trooper (Sith Empire)|Sith troopers]] that confronted her, slaying any that treated her as a hostile.<ref name="kotor" />{{Gamemechanics}}The amnesiac, former [[Sith Lord/Legends|Revan]], stranded on Taris for the time being due to the Sith quarantine, decided to undertake this bounty after meeting with Zax. With his companions, he managed to locate Selven hiding out at an [[Lower City Apartments|apartment]] in the Lower City, and at his hands the assassin finally met her demise.Revan would go on to claim the bounty on her before his [[Rescue of Bastila Shan|escape from Taris]].<ref name="kotor" />{{Endgame}}

name: Cai
description: In [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], she was part of the six-person team led by [[Manda D'ulin]], which was ambushed by the Imperial forces guarding the [[Hammertong/Legends|Hammertong]] project.Along with her [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]] [[D4|Deefour]], she piloted one of the team's two ships, the heavy fighter [[Mirage (starship)|''Mirage'']]. She was the last of the group to join the battle with the Imperial security around the Hammertong facility, but she subsequently provided an escort to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] for the [[Strike-class medium cruiser|Strike Cruiser]] which [[Shada D'ukal]] and [[Karoly D'ulin]] had stolen.On Tatooine, Cai remained with the ships while Shada and Karoly traveled into [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] to find a transport for the [[Superlaser/Legends|superlaser]] prototype which the cruiser had been carrying. She subsequently flew the ''Mirage'' out of Tatooine alongside the freighter which they had acquired from [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] agent [[Riij Winward]], although Winward 'borrowed' Deefour to ensure that the Hammertong's technical readouts reached the Alliance.

name: Alysun Celz
description: {{Quote|We were ''friends'' before the dark side seduced her. Alysun made it look like ''I'' was responsible for the blood on ''her'' hands.|Et Rex, regarding Celz|Star Wars: Poison Moon}}[[File:Etrex.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Alysun Celz was friends with Et Rex before falling to the dark side and framing him for her crimes.]]Alysun Celz, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] during the final [[Standard decade/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She was [[Jedi training/Legends|instructed]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually [[Jedi Trials/Legends|rising]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|I|115|Celz, Alysun}}</ref> During that [[Time/Legends|time]], she befriended fellow [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Et Rex]]. However, in [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]], Celz succumbed to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] and began to commit various crimes. When Celz invited Rex to join her, he refused, and she subsequently framed her former friend. The [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] took Rex [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoner]] and attempted to bring him to the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]], [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], [[Pilot/Legends|piloting]] the [[Consular-class cruiser|''Consular''-class cruiser]] ''[[Radiant IX]]''. En route to Coruscant, the [[Starship/Legends|starship's]] [[Power coupling/Legends|power couplings]] failed due to a flock of [[Mynock/Legends|mynocks]], forcing Celz to crash on the surface of the [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] [[Poison Moon]], which was located in the [[Hoth system/Legends|Hoth system's]] [[Hoth asteroid field|asteroid field]]. Celz proceeded to [[Death/Legends|kill]] the crew with [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]], although Rex escaped to the surface.<ref name="PM" />When the ''Radiant IX'' failed to reach the Temple, the High Council dispatched Jedi Knight [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], to find and detain Rex. As they searched the [[Cruiser/Legends|cruiser]] for signs of life, Celz attacked the two Jedi with a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]]; however, they disarmed her and questioned her involvement with the deaths of the crew. She deceived Kenobi by affirming that Rex slew the ''Radiant IX''{{'s}} crew, and she was left with Skywalker while Kenobi went out on the asteroid's surface to search for Rex.<ref name="PM" />Shortly thereafter, Celz attempted to convince Skywalker to take Kenobi's vessel and leave, but when the Padawan refused, she began [[Torture/Legends|torturing]] him with Force lightning. However, Kenobi, who had encountered Rex and discovered the truth about Celz, [[Skirmish on the Poison Moon|attempted to stop her]] from attacking his Padawan. Celz caught Kenobi with the lightning, however, and proceeded to torture them both. She was interrupted by Rex, who had thrown a mynock at her so that it would attack and distract her from Kenobi and Skywalker. After he threw a second mynock at her, she attempted to get them off her, which resulted in Celz [[Stun/Legends|stunning]] herself until she was incapacitated. Celz was detained by the Jedi and brought back to the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] to stand trial.<ref name="PM" />

name: Cordé/Legends
