description: While [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala]] was [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|Queen of Naboo]], the role of decoy was mainly filled by [[Sabé/Legends|Sabé]].<ref name="TPM">[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'']]</ref> Cordé replaced her when Amidala stepped down from the [[Throne/Legends|throne]] and became the [[Senator/Legends|Senatorial representative]] of the [[Chommell sector/Legends|Chommell sector]]. Like Sabé, Cordé worked closely with Padmé, and the two [[Sexes/Legends|women]] became close friends.<ref name="SWOSVC28">''[[Star Wars: The Official Starships & Vehicles Collection 28]]''</ref>In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Cordé was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in an [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|assassination attempt]] on Amidala when the Senator returned to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] vote on the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]]. A [[Clawdite/Legends|Clawdite]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]] was responsible for the attack. One of Amidala's other [[handmaiden]]s, [[Versé/Legends|Versé]], and five [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Naboo guards]] were also killed in the blast.<ref name="AOTC" />[[File:Corde.jpg|thumb|left|185px|Cordé, shortly before dying]]Cordé died apologizing to Amidala, disheartened in thinking she had failed her duty to her mistress. On the contrary, the Senator was heartbroken by Cordé's sacrifice, regrettably accepting that she had performed her duty. At [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Gregar Typho/Legends|Typho's]] insistence, Amidala reluctantly left the bodies of Cordé and the other victims behind, promising herself that their sacrifice would not be in vain.<ref name="AOTC" />

name: Pav D'armon
description: [[Shada D'ukal]] considered Pav to be chatty on the comm, but she was the Mistryl detailed to watch the gates of the Hammertong base when Dr. [[Kellering]] took Team Prime [[Manda D'ulin]] to talk with project head Dr. [[Eloy]]. After Kellering's groundcar was ambushed at the gates, the [[Stormtrooper/Legends|Stormtroopers]] turned on Pav, and quickly gunned her down.It seems almost certain that both Manda D'ulin and Pav D'armon were killed in the attack, but the ambush prompted Shada and the rest of the team to launch an unplanned but very effective counterattack, determined to show the Empire that Mistryl could not be simply shot in cold blood.

name: Paloma D'asima
description: On [[Karoly D'ulin]]'s recommendation, D'asima met with [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Vilim Disra|Disra]] and [[Grodin Tierce]] to discuss a [[Mistryl Shadow Guard]]/[[Imperial Remnant]] alliance on [[Yaga Minor/Legends|Yaga Minor]]. The con-artist [[Flim]], disguised as [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]], was also involved in the negotiations, providing the appearance of confident leadership necessary to make Paloma consider the otherwise unthinkable alliance. Disra and Tierce were aware that [[Garm Bel Iblis]] planned an information raid on the [[Ubiqtorate/Legends|Ubiqtorate]] base on Yaga Minor for a copy of the Caamas Document, and timed the meeting to occur just as his assault commenced, in the hopes that it would prove to D'asima that the Remnant was a serious contender for ultimate controller of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. Ultimately, however, the meeting was interrupted by the timely arrival of [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]], who revealed Disra's shady financial connections, Tierce's [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] heritage, and "Grand Admiral Thrawn's" true identity, destroying the alliance before it even began.Seeing how close she had come to allying the Eleven, and the Mistryl, with a con man, D'asima reluctantly acknowledged [[Shada D'ukal]]'s role in averting the disaster, and agreed to lift the death warrant issued against her, although Shada's exile from [[Emberlene]] remained permanent.

name: Karoly D'ulin
description: In [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], when a mission to transport the [[Hammertong/Legends|Hammertong]] prototype ended in a [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] ambush, Karoly found herself on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], and she was in the [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Mos Eisley Cantina]] with her friend and comrade [[Shada D'ukal]] when [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] first met [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]].[[File:Tonnika1.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Karoly (left) in [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]].]]As part of their attempt to hire a freighter to transport a stolen Hammertong module, the two Mistryl were masquerading as the [[Tonnika sisters/Legends|Tonnika sisters]]: Karoly was disguised as [[Senni Tonnika/Legends|Senni Tonnika]] while Shada posed as [[Brea Tonnika/Legends|Brea Tonnika]]. Their choice of disguise got them briefly arrested by [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Parq]] before being freed by [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] agent [[Riij Winward]]&mdash;although a subsequent disagreement on who should get the Hammertong information saw the Mistryl stealing his freighter to transport the [[Superlaser/Legends|superlaser]] component, while he made off with their astromech, [[D4]], and a technical readout of the weapon.During the Hammertong mission, Shada had regarded Karoly as keen but somewhat inexperienced; by [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]], however, Karoly had become a veteran warrior, and she was dispatched by the [[Eleven Elders of the People|Eleven Elders of Emberlene]] to "recover" Shada on [[Borcorash]] as the Mistryl made steps to break their ties with [[Mazzic]]. Shada escaped, and Karoly's pursuit brought her to [[Bastion/Legends|Bastion]], where she allied herself with [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Grodin Tierce]] against her old enemy [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Zothip]] of the [[Cavrilhu Pirates]].Subsequently, Karoly agreed to bring [[Paloma D'asima]] to [[Yaga Minor/Legends|Yaga Minor]], to discuss an alliance between the Mistryl and the [[Imperial Remnant]]; however, when the schemes of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Vilim Disra]] were exposed, and the false [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]] was revealed as the actor [[Flim]], Karoly returned to [[Emberlene]] with her leader.Karoly was probably related to [[Team Prime]] [[Manda D'ulin]], gunned down in the ambush at the Hammertong base, and also to an earlier Mistryl, [[Naradan D'ulin]].

name: Manda D'ulin
description: She was contacted in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] by a [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] named [[Kellering]], who claimed that he was looking for additional security to protect the [[Hammertong/Legends|Hammertong]] project on behalf of Dr. [[Eloy]].However, when she traveled with Kellering to the base to meet Eloy, she was attacked and gunned down by Imperial troops, followed soon after by her comrade [[Pav D'armon]]. In reprisal, the rest of the Mistryl team attacked the base, and stole the [[Strike-class medium cruiser|Strike Cruiser]] carrying the Hammertong prototype.

name: Thrynka Padaunete
description: Thrynka Padaunete believed that the Jedi were manipulating the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in their own push for power, so she founded the group People's Inquest and became its first president. She was often interviewed for articles pertaining to Jedi controversies on the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]]. Since the people of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] financed the Jedi Order, she believed that the people should be able to hold them accountable for their actions - though she found them at fault more often than not.In [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], a groundquake on [[Ord Thoden]] left the one-year old [[Ludi Billane]] orphaned, and she was rescued by the Jedi on the scene. As she was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], they took her to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to begin her [[Jedi training/Legends|Jedi training]]. When it was discovered that her mother, [[Jonava Billane]], was alive and wanted her daughter back, the Jedi refused, claiming it would be dangerous since the child - now called Aris-Del Wari - had been introduced to the ways of the Force. Padaunete lent her group's support to Billane, and held this incident as evidence the Jedi should be scrutinized closer than they had been.After the Jedi failed to prevent the [[Battle of Antar 4]], public support for the Order dropped and the People's Inquest gained momentum.When the Jedi Order unveiled their new starfighter, the [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor]], the People's Inquest demanded that the Order release their budgetary information, so the people of the Republic could see how much was being spent for the Jedi's needs. After the [[Judicial Department/Legends|Judicial Department]] denied their requests based on security concerns, Padaunete held a rally in front of the [[Jedi Temple]]. She called the new starfighter a "shiny toy", that shouldn't take precedence when the people of the Republic were having trouble making ends meet. She claimed their petition had garnered several million signatures.Eight weeks after Aris-Del Wari was taken by the Jedi Order, Padaunete had taken on the role of Billane's appearance manager. She and Billane appeared on the [[holoprogram]], [[Essence]]. Billane appealed to the Jedi Order yet again to let her take her child back, but refused to discuss the new [[Untitled Baby Ludi Project]] holo feature, which was reported to be worth over 100 million [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. Padaunete changed the subject back to the Jedi, claiming they were nothing better than a cult that only sought to further their own agenda. She also claimed that they had decided that "a mother's love is wrong". A copy of the holoprogram was then put up for sale, with some of the proceeds going to People's Inquest.When twenty university students stormed the Jedi Temple in support for Billane and overwhelmed two young [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]], [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] was forced to use a [[Mind trick/Legends|mind trick]] to convince the students to disperse quietly. After the students were arrested, the HoloNet News tried to reach Billane for a comment, but she was too busy reviewing the script for the holo feature. Padaunete, now Billane's spokeswoman and agent, responded quickly, but was busy herself fielding other calls.She soon became too busy to engage in the activities of her group, and instead went to [[Kassido]] to review casting auditions with Billane. She was immediately succeeded by [[Firris Palbert]] as President of People's Inquest, who held a rally outside the Jedi Temple after Wari was moved to the [[Kamparas Jedi Training Center]].In the wake of [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], her group aided the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] by compiling a list of all known Jedi that were still at large, along with information on other Force-using sects.

name: Dargulli Dark Jedi
description: {{Quote|I apologize for the ruse which led you here. I killed those drones... I knew you'd come to investigate ''this''.|The Dark Jedi displaying her lightsaber to Darth Vader|Empire 4: Betrayal, Part 4}}Several weeks before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], she was on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dargulli/Legends|Dargulli]], where she [[Death/Legends|killed]] [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] sent to collect taxes, hoping to attract the attention of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. She had foreseen that Vader [[Battle of Endor/Legends|would kill]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], and sensed that he could bring order to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and rule [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. She also could sense that Vader was missing something in his life. To this end, she wished to become his [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]]. Vader, although tempted, killed her after only a moment's hesitation.Though the woman did not wield a traditional [[Synthetic lightsaber crystal|dark side crystal]] lightsaber, she claimed not to be a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], and Vader sensed no Jedi teachings in her, leaving her origins a mystery.

name: Dera Darklighter
description: During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Dera Darklighter secretly joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] after the death of Biggs Darklighter at the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. She was not enough skilled to become a pilot but her charisma and enthusiasm made her a very good speaker.<ref name="Insider65" /> She thus encouraged people from Tatooine to join the Rebellion.<ref name="TCSWE"/> Dera also tried, unsuccessfully, to convince her father to stop working with [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]], in order to limit criminality and corruption on Tatooine. Therefore, she decided to use her father's connections with Jabba's henchmen to learn how to fight the Hutt, and possibly help the Rebellion. She managed to provide smuggled items and information about Imperial forces for the Alliance.<ref name="Insider65" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> she had an obsession with [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]]. She employed a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to eradicate a tribe of dangerous Sand Peoples dwelling within a [[Tusken Cave|cave]] near their [[Darklighter estate|home]].<ref name="SWG:DE" />

name: Rasca Darklighter
description: Her husband had been an officer in the [[Combined Defense Forces of the New Republic|New Republic Defense Force]] who died fighting the [[Yevetha]] in the [[Black Fleet Crisis]]. After this tragedy her brother Gavin Darklighter and his wife [[Sera Faleur Darklighter|Sera Darklighter]] insisted that Rasca and her children move in with them. The temporary situation eventually became more permanent. Rasca often felt guilty and believed herself to be a burden on her brother however Gavin insisted that her and her children stay.

name: Anii Degarienne
description: Anii Degarienne was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] and the wife of [[Matt Turhaya]], son of the [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] hero [[Arada Turhaya]]. Degarienne encouraged Turhaya to follow his dreams of serving in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]]; Turhaya attended the [[Imperial Naval Academy]] and graduated at the top of his class. A few [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] after his graduation, Degarienne was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in a freak accident at the weapons manufacturing plant she worked at. Turhaya took their daughter, [[Alexandra Winger|Alexandra]], to live with relatives on [[Janara III]] while he served the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Turhaya quickly became disillusioned with the Empire, and despised its methods and actions, eventually deserting from the service. He made his way to Janara III a [[Standard year/Legends|year]] later, only to find that the planet had been [[Raid on Janara III|raided]] by Imperial forces<ref name="P" /> commanded by [[High Inquisitor]] [[Adalric Cessius Brandl]].<ref name="Betrayal">{{Journal|12|Betrayal by Knight}}</ref> Turhaya found no survivors of the raid, and believed Alexandra killed.<ref name="P" /> She had survived, however, and was taken to the planet [[Garos IV]], where she was fostered with the planet's Imperial [[Governor/Legends|governor]], [[Tork Winger]] and his wife, [[Sali Winger|Sali]].<ref name="TP">{{Journal|5|Turning Point}}</ref> Alexandra held some memories of her mother, although she believed her name was "Ana."<ref name="GH">{{Journal|1|A Glimmer of Hope}}</ref>

name: Vydel Dir'Nul
description: {{Quote|Dark. Me.|Dir'Nul, under the Kardem personality|Dark Journey (comic)}}[[File:Ash B'risko1.jpg|thumb|left|Ash B'risko, the man with whom Dir'Nul fell in love]]Vydel Dir'Nul, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] who served during the final [[Time/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Dir'Nul was assigned by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] to serve as a [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] for an individual. During the mission, she fell in love with a [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] named [[Ash B'risko]]. She entered a romantic relationship with the pilot, going against the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]]. However, she eventually discovered B'risko in the arms of a [[Unidentified Twi'lek female (Kardem's first Twi'lek victim)|female Twi'lek]] dancer. Dir'Nul [[Death/Legends|murdered]] both B'risko and the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], and in doing so, created the personality of a male [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] named Kardem,<ref name="Dark Journey" /> whom she believed was a different individual.<ref name="CSWE: Dir'Nul, Vydel">{{CSWECite|I|190|Dir'Nul, Vydel}}</ref> After the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]&mdash;the Republic's conflict with the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]&mdash;began at the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], Dir'Nul refused to return to the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and become a [[Jedi General/Legends|general]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Republic Army]]. Dir'Nul buried B'risko and began tracking Kardem in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]], killing two more Twi'lek females while acting as the Dark Jedi. By the time she arrived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Perilious]]&mdash;which was known for its Twi'lek [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] tradings&mdash;Dir'Nul had slain three more Twi'lek females as Kardem.<ref name="Dark Journey" />[[File:DirNulDuel.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Dir'Nul duels a Jedi sent by the Council to apprehend her on Perilious.]]Six [[Standard month/Legends|months]] later, while Dir'Nul was investigating the murders of the three Twi'leks, a [[Unidentified Jedi (Kardem's victim)|robed man]] with a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] revealed himself to her, and she attacked him, assuming he was Kardem. After a brief [[Duel on Perilious|lightsaber duel]], the man gained the upper hand and defeated Dir'Nul. As he informed her that he was going to bring her back to the Jedi Council, Dir'Nul reverted to the Kardem personality&mdash;who was unaware that he was Dir'Nul&mdash;and unleashed bolts of [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]] against her attacker. After the Jedi used Dir'Nul's name while pleading with her to stop attacking him, Kardem told the man he was going to kill him. The man revealed that he was a Jedi and that he had been tracking Dir'Nul for six months. The Jedi ignited his lightsaber and used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Telekinesis/Legends|throw]] it at Dir'Nul, determined to bring her to the Council dead or alive. However, Dir'Nul, who was still mentally Kardem, used the Force to stop the lightsaber midflight and attacked the Jedi with more lightning. As Kardem was [[Torture/Legends|torturing]] the Jedi, he claimed that he did not know Dir'Nul and threw the lightsaber back at the Jedi, [[Sai tok|cutting him in half]].<ref name="Dark Journey" />Dir'Nul reverted to her original personality following her attacker's death and was shocked to learn that Kardem had killed a Jedi. She vowed to stop Kardem no matter what it took, unaware that she was the one who had actually committed the crime.<ref name="Dark Journey" /> A [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] was eventually placed on Dir'Nul's split personality of Kardem. The serial killer was captured by the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Feskitt Bobb]].<ref name="THotM">{{InsiderCite|80|The History of the Mandalorians}}</ref>

name: Domisari
description: Domisari pretended to be one of the many treasure hunters searching for a hidden treasure said to be on [[Space City]]. She was tasked with killing the [[Shi'ido]] anthropologist [[Mammon Hoole]] and his two charges, [[Tash Arranda|Tash]] and [[Zak Arranda]], and was offered a hefty reward if she were to succeed. [[Dannik Jerriko]] killed her before she could get to the Arranda children and Hoole.She was valued as an assassin by the Empire because she had no qualms with murdering children and women. Her matronly and grandmother-like nature and false kindness often allowed her to gain the trust of her victims, so that she could move in for the kill with her target off-guard.

name: Kannen Doom
description: [[File:Kannendiner.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Kannen on a date with [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]] in [[Dex's Diner/Legends|Dex's Diner]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]]]In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], she assisted [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]] in getting the job as the [[prime clone]] for the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], and she was apparently dating him ten years later, just before the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|Battle of Geonosis]], when they shared a lunch in [[Dex's Diner/Legends|Dex's Diner]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].Decades afterwards, she dated Jango's son, [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba]]. Her liaison with Fett was a sore point, as he broke off the relationship without warning, and later insisted that she had mistaken him for one of the many [[Clone trooper/Legends|clones]] produced from his father's template. She harbored something of a blood-feud with him as a result.By [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Kannen had fallen in with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. In this capacity, she escorted [[Manuel Both-Hanz]] to a meeting on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] with [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], [[Tag Greenley/Legends|Tag Greenley]], and [[Bink Otauna/Legends|Bink Otauna]], intended to bring vital intelligence on the [[Death Star II/Legends|new Death Star]] to the Alliance. After her initial rendezvous was botched, she thought that she had gained some compensation by capturing Fett, although it was actually Tag inside the bounty hunter's armor. The arrival of the real Fett complicated matters, and in the ensuing firefight, Manny was killed by a shot through the chest.She was last seen fighting Fett in a [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] docking bay, while Tag and Bink blasted their way off-[[Planet/Legends|planet]] aboard what may have been her own ship&mdash;a [[Lambda-class T-4a shuttle/Legends|''Lambda''-class shuttle]] with a powerful [[Holocomm/Legends|holocomm]].

name: Dorset Konnair
description: When the [[Zsinj]] [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Implacable (Imperial-class)|''Implacable'']] [[Battle of Folor|attacked]] the base, Konnair and her wingman [[Tetengo Noor]] along with Wraiths [[Kell Tainer]] and [[Hohass Ekwesh]] were sent to scout out [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Apwar Trigit]]'s forces before the full squadron attack. Although overly confident of the speed of their A-Wings Konnair as [[Blue Nine/Legends|Blue Nine]] and her [[Wingmate/Legends|wingman]] [[Tetengo Noor]] ([[Blue Ten/Legends|Blue Ten]]) lost the race to their assigned scouting point to the Wraith's [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-Wings]], claiming they had to go back to the base to retrieve Noor's dinner. Konnair subsequently helped fleeing transports buy time to escape by impersonating the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] through flying in close to her wingman while continually shifting shield strength to hide the sensor profile of their A-wings.Later she played the role of [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia]] using an encryption which was known that Zsinj's forces had already cracked. This ploy succeeded in luring away the capital ship. Later in the hunt for Zsinj, Konnair was [[Polearm Squadron|Polearm]] Seven in the A-Wing Squadron assigned to the ''[[Mon Remonda]]''.Konnair was from Coruscant, and had multiple tattoos in shades of blue, most noticeably a starflare [[Tattoo/Legends|tattoo]] covering one eye. She was often quiet at pilot gatherings due to perceived mistrust from other New Republic pilots towards Coruscant natives. She survived the final battle against [[Iron Fist (Executor-class)|''Iron Fist'']] and received a commendation at the end of the campaign, after which she and the remnants of her squadron were reassigned to Coruscant for rebuilding.

name: Drayneen
description: With her charm and beauty, Drayneen was able to learn countless secrets and excelled at pulling information from captured [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoners]] by making them believe that she was on their side. She was also well known for being disliked by her counterparts in [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]]. Most operatives from the organization were afraid of her ability to easily coerce almost anyone.Drayneen was not a powerful [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-[[Force-sensitive/Legends|user]], but she made the most of her [[Force power/Legends|Force powers]] in the interrogation room. Drayneen's whereabouts after the fall of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] are unknown.

name: Kitik Keed'kak
description: In [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] she was in [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]] during [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi's]] visit, and followed [[Kal'Falnl C'ndros]] outside, hoping she would lead her to her nest. Keed'kak was friends with [[Swilla Corey]] during those visits.

name: Amie Antin
description: Amie met [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] when he was searching for her patient, [[Roan Lands]]. She helped him hide from the [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitor]] [[Malorum]], and then revealed to him that she was a secret member of the rebel organization [[The Eleven]]. She helped Kenobi and Lands escape her [[Medcenter/Legends|hospital]] and reach a base of The Eleven.After Lands and [[Dona Telamark]], members of the Eleven, were arrested on charges of conspiracy against the government of [[Bellassa/Legends|Bellassa]], Amie and [[Wil Asani]] met with [[Fy-Tor-Ana|Solace]], [[Oryon]] and [[Trever Flume]] and aided them in rescuing Lands and Telamark from captivity. However, their plan was interrupted by stormtroopers that raided the hidden base. As they moved through a tunnel, Amie and Asani took Flume, Solace and Oryon to a landing platform in order to escape the [[Planet/Legends|planet]].Later, Antin accompanied Olin and Lands on a mission to infiltrate the offices of [[Wilhuff Tarkin/Legends|Wilhuff Tarkin]] in the city of [[Ussa]]. However, their plan failed when they confronted [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. After watching Lands die from Vader's wrath, Antin was arrested while Olin escaped the trap. Olin went to warn the other members of the Eleven, Anton was scheduled to be sent to a penal colony until she was rescued by Solace and [[Ry-Gaul]]. While the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] attacked [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]], Antin escaped with [[Clive Flax]] to the lakeside and disguised herself as a priestess in order to avoid detection. Back in the safety house, Amie was able to treat Flume after he was badly injured during a fight against stormtroopers.After the rescue, she aided Olin by going through medical records from the [[Emperor Palpatine Surgical Reconstruction Center|EmPal SuRecon Center]] to discover Vader's true identity. Antin was able to analyze the data and came to the conclusion that the Vader had suffered severe burns and a high metal contamination from volcanic eruptions. During her search, Antin received help from Oryon, and discovered that Vader was on [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]], the place where he fought against his former master, Kenobi.

name: Teehl
description: Teehl started her career as the favorite mistress of a powerful [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]], and worked and saved until the day she could buy her own ship. That ship was the ''[[Grasp]]'', and she went solo as soon as she could afford it. She became a freelance mercenary who was known to work for [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]] as an enforcer. She was ordered by Jabba to recover a [[Gravity well projector/Legends|gravity-well projector]] controlled by the [[Ugor/Legends|Ugors]], some time after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. The Alliance and the [[Squib/Legends|Squibs]] were after the same projector, hoping to use the device to pull the [[Elusive (transport)|''Elusive'']] out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] before it could deliver Alliance datapacks to the Empire.

name: Shawnkyr Nuruodo
description: Shawnkyr was born to the influential [[Nuruodo family]], and by the age of twelve standard years, she was [[Cadet/Legends|cadet]] [[Commander/Legends|commander]] at the military academy in the [[Rata Nebula]]. There, she first met the [[Human/Legends|Human]] trainee [[Jagged Fel]], two years her senior, and after repulsing a [[Battle of Rhigar|raid]] by the [[Cavrilhu Pirates]], she ceded leadership of the cadets to him.At some point in the next few years, Shawnkyr joined the [[Household Phalanx]]. By [[26 ABY]], during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], she was Fel's executive officer in [[Force Spike]], in which capacity she served under him at the [[Battle of Ithor]]. In [[27 ABY/Legends|27 ABY]], she was the only pilot to accompany him on his scouting mission to former [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] space. On [[Hapes/Legends|Hapes]], in spite of their orders not to get involved in the conflict, she assisted him in recruiting the unit of volunteer pilots that became [[Vanguard Squadron (Hapes)|Vanguard Squadron]].She later took over the squadron when Fel joined [[Twin Suns Squadron]]. It is not known whether she remained with the Vanguards when a full squadron of [[Nssis-class Clawcraft|Clawcraft]] arrived to serve alongside the New Republic, and after the [[Battle of Ebaq|major victory]] over the [[Yuuzhan Vong]] at [[Ebaq 9]] in 28 ABY, she returned to Chiss space to report on developments in the war. She returned to the front line in the final stages of the war, however, and when the surviving Clawcraft of the Chiss squadron were amalgamated into Twin Suns Squadron, she flew as Twin Suns Four during the [[Battle of Yuuzhan'tar]].

name: Ellé/Legends
description: In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Ellé served with her fellow [[handmaiden]], [[Moteé/Legends|Moteé]]. She was one of the select few who knew of [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala's]] secret [[Wedding of Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala/Legends|marriage]] to the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]].<ref name="DB" />

name: Eremay Ies
description: When Eremay and her mother returned home one day, they found [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]], who at that time was serving as [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] [[Emperor's Hand|Hand]], searching through Dexar's desk for a list of bank accounts which he had placed two billion [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] of the Emperor's personal funds into. Mara told Beda and Eremay to disappear forever, and they left for the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]] and became [[Joiner]]s.

name: Cyra Felix
description: The two had produced a daughter which they named [[Tine Felix]], and whenever he had the two near Vazan was always cheerful. Unfortunately, [[Zhen Mirat]] needed Vazan's help for his criminal organization, [[The Fatal Visionaries]]. Knowing that he would not help willingly, Merit captured Cyra and her daughter Tine to use as leverage to gain Vazans help. While Vezan immediately handed over his ship, the ''[[The Fatal Vision]]'', Merit in fact had no intention of giving him back his family. Cyra and Tine were held for over six months until eventually a group of rebels located and freed the two, returning them to Vazan.

name: Tine Felix
description: She was captured along with her mother by [[Zhen Mirat]], leader of [[The Fatal Visionaries]], as ransom to get both [[The Fatal Vision|''Tine's Future'']] and to ensure that her father would continue to fly the ship under Mirat's command. She was held prisoner by Mirat for at least six months, he had had no intention to give either her or her mother back to Vazan once he had agreed to help, until a group of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|rebels]] helped free her and her mother from Mirat's clutches. The family were then re-united.

name: Floria
description: {{Quote|You know how to use a hydrospanner?''"<br />"''I didn't have a real weapon.''"<br />"''Were you threatening to kill me, or fix my speeder?|[[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] confronts Floria for the first time on [[Ragoon VI]]|Jedi Quest: The Trail of the Jedi}}Floria and her brother, [[Dane (bounty hunter)|Dane]], were orphaned when their mother's tribe burned down their house, because their family intermarried.The siblings found work at a café, though their employer treated them cruelly. When they found out that he was wanted on a nearby planet, they tricked him into getting caught. Realizing that manhunting was a more profitable industry than food service, Floria and Dane took up careers in bounty hunting. [[Granta Omega]] later hired them, along with four other bounty hunters, to capture [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] during training on [[Ragoon VI]], but Floria and Dane found themselves assisting the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], instead.Years later, they became bodyguards for [[Samish Kash]], and Floria found herself falling in love with the Delalunan leader. When Samish was shot on [[Null/Legends|Null]], Dane and Floria were accused of the attempted assassination. Samish survived, though, and his friend, [[Lorian Nod]], informed Floria that he was alive. She and Dane reunited with Kenobi and Skywalker during the events on Null, and the two Jedi were able to prove that the siblings were innocent of the attempted murder charges.

name: Condren Foreck
description: Independently wealthy in addition to her trust funds, Condren was also an accomplished athlete. She spoke in an unusual high-pitched, squeaky voice. Though flattered by Lando's proposal, she assumed he would never actually show up. She had forgotten the offer, and by the time Lando arrived on Azbrian, she had just returned from a week-long honeymoon with her new husband [[Frang Colgter]]. The unfortunate chain of events led Lando, in his subsequent nuptial visits, to call first rather than arrive unannounced.{{Char-stub}}

name: Trillot
description: During the [[Mission to Ord Cestus|Bio-Droid crisis]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Trillot was selling in information to the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], but unbeknownst to Kenobi, the X'Ting was also passing information to [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] and [[Dark Acolyte]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]]. After the mission of Ord Cestus, Trillot was murdered by Ventress failing to search for a fatal access.

name: Tia Organa
description: A member of House Organa, Tia Organa grew up on Alderaan with her brother and sisters. Several years before the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] began, Organa was set to marry a nobleman of [[House Vandron]]. Despite this, Organa had begun having an affair with her brother [[Bail Prestor Organa|Prestor Organa's]] friend and companion, [[Halagad Ventor]]. During the affair, Organa joined her brother and Ventor on a [[manka cat]] hunting expedition at the [[Okonomo Retreat]] when the mad geneticist [[Zeta Magnus]] infiltrated the Retreat building and infected all of the revelers, including Ventor's parents, with a [[hive virus]]. Driven mad by the virus, the partygoers were held under a cannibalistic sway and began a mad frenzy of devouring each other before ultimately being consumed by Magnus. When the hunting party received word of the [[Okonomo Tragedy|tragedy]], Ventor abandoned Organa and left her pregnant and alone. The scandal rocked the political world in [[Aldera/Legends|Aldera]] City, and the alliance between House Organa and House Vandron came to an end. She later gave birth to a son, whom she named [[Nial Organa]].<ref>''[[SkyeWalkers: A Clone Wars Story]]''</ref>Organa had a number of [[pittin]]s whom she spoiled, treating them like they were her own children. They included [[All-Terrain Attack Vehicle]], [[Taffy]], [[Winkie]], and [[Fluffy (pittin)|Fluffy]].Tia Organa was present on Alderaan in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] when [[Grand Moff/Legends|Grand Moff]] [[Wilhuff Tarkin/Legends|Wilhuff Tarkin]] ordered the [[Destruction of Alderaan|destruction]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. When the [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star]] fired on Alderaan and destroyed it within seconds, Organa perished along with her son and all other Alderaanians present on the world.{{Char-stub}}

name: Toonbuck Toora/Legends
description: A [[Sy Myrthian/Legends|Sy Myrthian]] politician, Toonbuck Toora served in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] as the representative of her people and all of [[Sy Myrth/Legends|Sy Myrth]]. An idealist who had hoped to end corruption within her administration, Toora became jaded and cynical as time progressed and ultimately she embraced the culture of greed that permeated the elite on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Over her time in galactic politics, Toora became one of the most corrupt Republic politicians of the time. Dressing herself in fine linens and adorning her arm with an ever-present [[Toonbuck Toora's consort|consort]], Toora's wealth was beyond any she could have imagined and gladly made herself comfortable throughout her career.<ref name="db" />Profiting greatly from investment in the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]], Toora became one of the Federations more vocal supporter's in the Senate at the time surrounding their [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]. While most of the Senate was divided, belonging either to the [[Core faction]] or to the [[Rim faction]], Toora was autonomous and still influential, being a political ally of figures such as [[Orn Free Taa/Legends|Orn Free Taa]] of [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], [[Edcel Bar Gane/Legends|Edcel Bar Gane]] of [[Roona/Legends|Roona]] and [[Passel Argente/Legends|Passel Argente]], the Magistrate of the [[Corporate Alliance/Legends|Corporate Alliance]]. This group was a partidary of Senator [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] of Naboo, a relative newcomer to the political scene of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] who, nevertheless, had managed to grasp [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Finis Valorum/Legends|Finis Valorum's]] attention.<ref name="cod">''[[Cloak of Deception]]''</ref>[[File:Toonbuck Toora.png|thumb|left|Toonbuck Toora in the Galactic Senate.]]Noticing that Valorum favored Palpatine, Toora questioned Palpatine about the advice he had been giving to the Chancellor. The Naboo was noncommittal, suggesting that he had only helped the Chancellor to grasp the bigger picture. By saying this, he surprised the Sy Myrthian and perked her interest, but he excused himself before answering any further inquiry.<ref name="cod" />In [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], Chancellor Valorum proposed the taxation of the until-then free trade zones. Toora visited the [[Coruscant Opera/Legends|Coruscant Opera]], like many other politicians of the time where she met with Palpatine to discuss politics. Attending a reproduction of ''[[The Brief Reign of Future Wraiths]]'', performed by a [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] company, she shared a balcony with her political allies when she learned from Senator Palpatine that he had suggested to the Chancellor that a part of the collected money could be invested in the growth of planetary systems in the affected areas. While senators of that region supported the idea, Toora and other delegates including [[Po Nudo/Legends|Po Nudo]] and [[Wat Tambor/Legends|Wat Tambor]] openly opposed to it. She was in luck when Palpatine proposed that the matter be resolved at a [[Eriadu Trade Summit|Trade Summit]] on [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]] and, once the Eriadu delegate accepted the idea, Toora was quick to second the motion.<ref name="cod" />Following Palpatine's accession to the Chancellorship, Toora continued to be a vocal opponent of his policies over the next decade, criticizing his attempts to regulate the [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild's]] operations in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. As a major [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|secessionist movement]] plagued the Senate, Toora was absent from the Senate for over a month before submitting her world's resignation from the galactic government via a [[Droid/Legends|droid]] proxy.<ref name="HNN45" /> Toora publicly gave her support to the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] after being won over by [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku's]] promises of power. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] broke out, Toora remained faithful to the Confederate cause throughout the three year conflict.<ref name="EGTW" />When the war came to a crashing end in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Toora escaped with a small fleet as the Republic and the Confederacy collapsed and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] assumed absolute control over the galaxy. One of the last Confederate holdouts, the former senator had managed to reactivate a significant number of droids. Aboard her flagship, the ''[[Defiance's Banner]]'', Toora fought against the Empire on many fronts, losing ground at [[Charros IV]], [[Diado]], and [[Metalorn/Legends|Metalorn]] before eventually being cornered over the planet [[Trasemene]]. She was killed when the [[Sy Myrthian Insurrection|insurrection]] ended in the [[Battle of Trasemene]], where the Imperial [[Praetor-class battlecruiser|''Praetor''-class Star battlecruiser]] [[Battalion (Praetor-class)|''Battalion'']] destroyed the cruiser.<ref name="EGTW" />

name: Addath Gadan
description: During the [[Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Coruscant]], [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] Gadan fled the [[Planet/Legends|planet]], eventually turning up again on [[Vannix]] in the middle of a power vacuum left when [[Presider]] [[Sakins]] heard news of the fall of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] at the hands of the [[Yuuzhan Vong]], fleeing the planet with his family, mistresses, and most of the treasury. An election was held for the vacant post of planetary Presider between Senator Gadan and [[Apelben Werl]], a naval officer. In the campaign, Addath Gadan ran on a policy of appeasement and capitulation with the Yuuzhan Vong, while [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] Werl advocated resistance.[[Leia Organa Solo]] visited the planet to set up a resistance movement after the fall of Coruscant. Though Senator Gadan was ahead in the polls at time of Leia's arrival, Leia worked behind the scenes to shift public opinion in favor of Admiral Werl. She planted a recording in [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] and then took him in for repairs, in such a way so that the recording would be sure to fall into the hands of Gadan's political operatives. The recording strongly implied that a backroom deal had been made between Leia and Werl, promising [[Starship/Legends|starships]] for the war effort in exchange for political support. In Gadan's eagerness to outbid Werl's purported bribe, she exposed a counter-bribe of her own in front of [[holojournalist]] [[Fasald Ghem]]. Rather than endure the scandal, she followed former Presider Sakins into self-imposed [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]].

name: Golanda
description: {{Quote|I'm not sure we addressed that contingency when we wrote the manual.|Golanda expresses her concern for destroying the computer backups during the Battle of the Maw|Champions of the Force}}She was a constant complainer and [[Tol Sivron]] thought she was "about as beautiful as a [[Gundark/Legends|gundark]]". She died when Tol Sivron flew the [[Death Star prototype]] into a [[Black hole/Legends|black hole]] while trying to escape during the [[Battle of the Maw]] in [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]].<ref name="Champions of the Force" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Grania (Brentaali)
description: Grania was one of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Lon Isoto]]'s concubines. On one occasion shortly before the [[Battle of Brentaal IV (Galactic Civil War)|Battle of Brentaal IV]], he offered her to [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Soontir Fel]], who politely refused.In reality, she was one of [[Ysanne Isard]]'s spies, and killed Isoto on her orders as part of [[Project Ambition]] following the Battle of Brentaal IV. As part of her disguise, she gave herself up to the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] afterwards, who believed her to be no more than Isoto's plaything.

name: Lanyss Gutierrace
description: She was [[Director of Personnel|Personnel Director]] of the Department prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], until a complaint from an [[Ishi Tib/Legends|Ishi Tib]] whom she rejected after he applied for a clerical job. After a four-month investigation turned up 36 similar cases, Gutierrace was suspended on charges of [[Humanocentrism]] and replaced with [[Tanu Aphidale]].

name: Tisha Rostek
description: She served in the [[Dantooine base/Legends|Rebel base]] of [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]] during the first days of the Rebel Alliance. There, she met and fell in love with fellow Rebel [[Harovan Toth]]. They married and had a daughter, [[Samona]]; after that, Toth became an [[Infiltrator/Legends|infiltrator]] for the [[Alliance Special Forces/Legends|Rebel SpecForces]].Tisha died during the [[Battle of Thovinack]]. After that, Toth sent his daughter to the Rebel safeworld [[Isis]], to live with dissenters from Toth's native planet [[Reynon]].

name: Mici Shabandar
description: Mici Shabandar accompanied Organa and Skywalker on a mission to steal the ''[[Staraker]]'' prototype starship from [[Foundry/Legends|Foundry]]. A skilled computer techno and droid mechanic, Mici used forged systech level 7 passes to get her and [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] close to the docking bay containing the ''Staraker''. Once there the [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]] pretended to malfunction and spray foam at the [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] guarding the entrance.[[File:Mici2.jpg|thumb|left|Mici Shabandar on [[Alashan]].]]Mici was injured when the ''Staraker'' crash-landed on [[Alashan]]. Due to her injuries, she had to remain behind aboard the crashed [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] prototype with R2-D2 and [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] while Luke and Leia and Imperial commandos scouted the planet.She was one of the few people Artoo-Detoo trusted to perform service modifications on him besides Luke.Mici wore tech coveralls and kept her hair up with a bandanna, preferring to maintain a nondescript, utilitarian appearance when on duty.

name: Syayna
description: [[File:RaolSyayna-VQ.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Syayna and Raol]]Syayna's father, [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Prepredenko]], sought the aid of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] in rescuing her from "bandits." The bandits, however, were really local [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] fighters with whom Syayna wished to join, including [[Raol]]. Skywalker led Prepredenko's soldiers directly to her, and she was put under house arrest. She was released, however, upon the [[Mission to Jazbina|arrival]] of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], who imprisoned Prepredenko for supposedly executing Skywalker. With the help of Skywalker and of [[Jal Te Gniev]], Syayna defeated the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] forces with minimal bloodshed and drove Vader away.

name: Rith Tar'ak
description: As a child, Rith Tar'ak saw the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] subjugate her native world of [[Ebra]]. Rith and her sisters, [[Nyik]] and [[Tor'ara]], from the [[Rull]] were enslaved.They managed to escape from Ebra by hijacking an Imperial shuttle. The Tar'aks forced the pilot to take them to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. The Tar'aks became the first Ebranites to serve as soldiers for the Rebel Alliance.They joined the 28-member [[Scandium Team]], based on [[Tharin sector]]. The operations of the Scandiums were noticed throughout all the galaxy. The Tar'aks also created [[Sandstorm Unit]], specializing in desert infiltration. Rith was considered the best desert infiltrator of the Tar'aks, although she rejected the use of [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] preferring other, more primitive weapons.During the [[Wellte-ir Massacre]], Scandium Team was defeated, with 22 of the 28 members dying on the [[Bresnan]] plains. Rith was the only surviving Ebranite.She was then transferred to [[Yntrann]], a desert planet.Rith rejected a promotion to [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] so she could return to Ebra as a recruiter. She was then assigned a modified [[5DS Ebranite Relations Droid|5DS]] [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]], [[A-5DS]], which was reprogrammed by Rith herself. She used A-5DS to contact with Ebranite slaves forced to work on mines of [[Grythsorin]] canyon.

name: Tia (pilot)
description: They were both extremely skilled [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]], and they were a great acquisition to the Rebellion. Around [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], she and Ghia met the newly joined [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and they fell both in love with the charming ace. Therefore, they were devastated when they heard that Solo was captured by the Empire and delivered to [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]] by [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]]. Determined to rescue Solo, they stole a [[T-47 airspeeder/Legends|snowspeeder]] and abandoned the Rebellion to rescue him from Jabba, but were captured and enslaved. During their enslavement they were forced to wear skimpy slave outfits very similar to [[Slave Leia costume|Princess Leia's]]. They were also forced to feed and massage him. When Jabba found out that she and her sister were Rebel pilots, he let them fight in his [[Jabba's demolition games|"Demolition"]] games. Now that they were fighting for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]], Jabba appointed [[Oola/Legends|Oola]] as his personal masseuse.During these Demolition Games, it is unknown what the fate of the twins were. Records were lost along with [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire]]. It is rumored that either the two were freed with the help of [[Leia Organa Solo|Princess Leia Organa]] disguised as [[Boushh/Legends|Boushh]] or alternatively doomed to remain as [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]].

name: Thilis-Brin
description: Thilis-Brin was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Ishi Tib/Legends|Ishi Tib]]<ref name="Shroud" /> [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] sometime between [[36 BBY/Legends|36 BBY]] and [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]].<ref name="T-age" /> During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she joined the insurgent [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] and underwent recruit training, placing first in her class. She also placed fourth in the [[Desert/Legends|desert]] training seminar, an impressive achievement given the [[Water/Legends|aquatic]] physiology of the Ishi Tib. Upon graduation from her training, Thilis-Brin was regarded as [[Alliance Special Forces/Legends|SpecForce]] material, but she was assigned to the [[Mon Calamari Shipyards/Legends|Mon Calamari Shipyards]], working as a [[Technician/Legends|technical troubleshooter]]. However, she longed to take a more active role in the Alliance. Two [[Standard year/Legends|years]] after enlisting, Thilis-Brin received the opportunity she desired. She was selected by the [[Jin]] [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Dutra Zeneta]] to serve as part of [[Shroud Team]], an all-[[Alien/Legends|alien]] unit of [[Foster Agent]]s.<ref name="Shroud" /> A posting as a Foster Agent was one of the most dangerous assignments in the Alliance; they were the point of contact for [[operative]]s stranded in the field who were attempting to rejoin the Alliance. The names and locations of the Foster Agents were provided to those operatives who may have need of their services; if the operatives were captured and interrogated, the Foster Agent was in danger of being compromised.<ref name="GG9">''[[Galaxy Guide 9: Fragments from the Rim]]''</ref>Shroud Team was inserted into [[Corint City]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Pirik]] in the [[Divis Arm]]; in addition to Thilis-Brin and Zeneta, the team also consisted of the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Dheendo]], the [[Carosite]] [[Tamo Lan]], and the [[Aqualish/Legends|Aqualish]] [[Gondara]]. The unit's composition blended well with the inhabitants of Corint [[City/Legends|City]], as non-[[Human/Legends|Humans]] made up 95 percent of the local population. Thilis-Brin served as the team's chief technician and [[Quartermaster/Legends|procurement specialist]], who would obtain needed supplies, such as vehicles and [[Ration pack/Legends|rations]]. She was also Shroud Team's secondary Foster Agent, with Dheendo operating as the primary. However, her Ishi Tib physiology meant that she needed to immerse herself in a [[Salt/Legends|brine]] solution every [[Standard day/Legends|day]]. The closest available source to Corint City was the [[Uloitir Sea]], located fourteen [[Kilometer/Legends|kilometers]] from the settlement, and Thilis-Brin had to find the necessary [[Time/Legends|time]] in the day to attend to her physiological needs while also performing her duties with Shroud Team. At some point during her assignment on Pirik, Thilis-Brin was involved in a high-speed [[Speeder bike/Legends|speeder bike]] chase through the [[Talamp Industrial Sector]]. Riding her modified [[Ikas-Adno/Legends|Ikas-Adno]] [[Sunwolf speeder bike]], she evaded a [[Squad/Legends|squad]] of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Scout trooper/Legends|scout troopers]] while transporting a high-[[Military rank/Legends|ranking]] [[Unidentified Alliance officer (Pirik)|Alliance officer]]. Evading pursuit and positive identification, she ensured her charge was safely delivered to their destination.<ref name="Shroud" />

name: Vila
description: Vila was born on [[Naldar]] to the ruling family at the time. Her father was the [[King/Legends|King]] of Naldar, and her brother [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Denin]] was in line to assume the throne. Unfortunately, in [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]] arrived on Naldar to subjugate the world. Naldar resisted Imperial presence, and in one of the first armed [[Subjugation of Naldar|conflicts]] between Imperials and the people of Naldar, Vila's brother Denin was [[Death/Legends|killed]]. To mask the fact that the king's only son had died, Vila disguised herself as Denin and continued the fight against the Empire.Vila continued to lead the Naldar resistance until the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]]. The [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebels]] victory and the death of the [[Palpatine/Legends|Emperor]] was a huge blow to the Empire, and the Imperials were forced to use drastic tactics to keep their remaining worlds in line. On Naldar, the Imperials devastated the planet with an orbital bombardment which also resulted in the death of the King of Naldar, Vila's father.The death of her father caused Vila to realize that she would need to take more drastic measure to liberate Naldar. Taking a small [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]], she fled Naldar to seek out the Rebellion. She found the Alliance on their temporary base on [[Endor/Legends|Endor]]. Still disguised as Denin, she appealed to [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] for help. The Rebels were unable to provide any substantial assistance, but a small task force was sent with Vila back to Naldar to assess the situation.[[File:Netherworld of the Force.png|thumb|left|200px|Vila with [[Denin]] and [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] in the [[Netherworld of the Force/Legends|Netherworld of the Force]].]]Part of this task force included the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], and Vila was reminded of how much Denin had wished that he were a Jedi. To honor her brother's memory, Vila appealed to the Jedi to train her in the ways of the Force. Luke was still hesitant to accept any Jedi student and refused to train her. After arriving on Naldar, Leia discovered that Denin had died two years earlier. Vila was forced to reveal that she had disguised herself as Denin after her brother's death.Vila and the rest of the task force eventually confronted the leader of the Imperials on Naldar, the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord]] [[Flint]]. Flint's former friend [[Barney]], a member of the Rebel task force, was eventually able to convince Flint to leave the Empire and its evil ways behind. In an ensuing firefight between the Rebels and the Imperials, Vila threw herself in front of Flint to protect him from oncoming blaster fire. Vila died from the [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] wound, but she was reunited with her dead brother through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].

name: Jenn
description: The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Jenn was born around [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]], during the final years of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="age" /> At some point before [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]],<ref name="NEC" /> Jenn joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] as a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]<ref name="RAII" /> and rose to the rank of [[Commander/Legends|commander]].<ref name="LA">{{LucasArtsCite|url=products/rebel2/reb_stry.htm|text=''Rebel Assault II'' - Original Story|archivedate=20070126231850}}</ref>Following the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]] in 3 ABY,<ref name="NEC" /> the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] entered the final stages of development for the [[TIE/ph phantom|TIE Phantom]], a new starfighter which was fitted with a [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaking device]] that rendered it invisible to other [[Starship/Legends|vessels]]. As the project neared completion, the Empire began a series of tests in the region of [[Realspace/Legends|space]] known as the [[Dreighton Triangle]], using reports of unexplained events in the region ever since the [[Battle of Dreighton]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] as a cover for their operations. Around this time, Jenn was tasked to lead a [[Flight/Legends|flight group]] of three [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighters]], including one flown by [[Ensign/Legends|Ensign]] [[Till]], on a patrol mission around the [[Dreighton Nebula]]. At first the group's [[Sensor/Legends|sensors]] failed to detect any signs of activity but Jenn ordered one more pass before returning to base. Moments later, a TIE Phantom decloaked behind her X-wing and opened fire, tearing the starboard [[S-foils/Legends|S-foils]] from the fuselage and disabling her [[Stabilizer/Legends|stabilizer]]. Unable to control her fighter, Jenn drifted to port and collided with Till's X-wing, destroying both fighters and [[Death/Legends|killing]] both pilots.<ref name="RAII" />

name: Vinna Jiss
description: In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Vinna met with a [[Falleen/Legends|Falleen]] and made a deal to exchange illegal goods in a warehouse-block between two freighters. However, she was captured by [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commandos]] [[Fi Skirata|Fi]] and [[RC-1207|Sev]], who interrogated her for information. After explaining everything to them, she was ultimately executed by [[Walon Vau]]. [[Jinart]] the [[Gurlanin]] later impersonated her form, not knowing that the real Vinna Jiss had been killed by Vau.{{Char-stub}}

name: Sayer Mon Neela
description: In the days before [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] became [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]], Neela befriended [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Polo Se'lab]]. She vocally opposed Palpatine's policies, and quickly went underground after the formation of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].She, her sons, and her aide [[Raan Stasheff]] eventually joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. Neela became a tactician, and her sons were soldiers that died in combat. Neela and Stasheff hid on the Alliance base on the planet [[Horob]], which was working on a prototype sensor. However, the Empire tracked them to Horob and destroyed the base, capturing Neela and Stasheff aboard the ''[[Imperial Hazard]]''. Neela eventually managed to [[Evacuation of Horob|escape]] to the ''[[Starcrossed]]'' and return to the Alliance with a version of the sensor, but Stasheff was injured in the attempt.She later became the tactical officer for the Alliance base on [[Carosi XII]], where she was reunited with her friend Se'lab.

name: Ovolot Qail Uthan
description: Doctor Uthan led the research on a [[Cloning/Legends|clone]]-killing nanovirus, [[FG36]], stationed on [[Qiilura]]. After the [[Mission to Qiilura|attack]] by [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Etain Tur-Mukan]] and [[Omega Squad]], she was abducted and her research facility destroyed.As of 18 months after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|Battle of Geonosis]], Dr. Uthan was reportedly held in a Republic maximum-security prison. During her incarceration, she wondered whether or not the cloaked man who had commissioned her research tried to contact her. The man was most likely the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]], [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], who kept her work as an insurance policy against the clones if they ever turned against him.In order to not lose her sanity, Dr. Uthan bred [[Soka fly|Soka flies]] inside her cell even without proper laboratory facilities. During the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]], she was rescued from the madhouse at [[Valorum Center]] by [[Kal Skirata]], [[Bardan Jusik]], [[Ordo Skirata|Ordo]] and [[Fi Skirata|Fi]]. She was brought to [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]] where she agreed to Kal's offer of finding a cure to the clone's accelerated aging.While living on Mandalore, Uthan became romantically involved with [[Mij Gilamar]], and bonded with [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy]], a Jedi survivor living in [[Kyrimorut]], making the young Jedi her lab assistant.Sometime after [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] formerly known as [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] used her [[FG36]] virus on her home planet of [[Gibad/Legends|Gibad]] who was rebelling against the new [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. The virus was not clone specific at the time it was [[Devastation of Gibad|released]] on her homeworld, killing every humanoid on the planet. Crushed by virtually destroying her whole home planet and the people she loved, she decided to retaliate by recreating the virus to release personally on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. [[Kal Skirata]] reasoned with her before she could to create a antivirus first, as a different way to fight Palpatine and protect themselves. The antivirus was then tested on herself to see if it worked, then it was spread all through [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]]. It is assumed that she began work on returning the aging gene in clones to normal after FG36 was finished. It is unknown if she ever spread the virus to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].

name: Reija Momen
description: When Momen was young, her father took out a loan from the [[InterGalactic Banking Clan/Legends|InterGalactic Banking Clan]] to help the mortgage on the family farm. When bad harvests made him unable to pay it back, the Clan confiscated their holdings, requiring the family to move to the [[City/Legends|city]]. This led to her father's depression and eventual [[Death/Legends|death]], and left Reija with a lasting hatred of [[Muun/Legends|Muuns]].In [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]], Reija was made chief administrator of the [[Intergalactic Communications Center]], due to the fact she liked the job as opposed to the large salary. The workers at the Communications Center referred to her as "Momma Momen." She considered eventually retiring to start a family on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]].After being taken hostage by [[Pors Tonith/Legends|Pors Tonith]] during the [[Battle of Praesitlyn]], Tonith used Momen to send a message to the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]], demanding Republic forces evacuate Praesitlyn or the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] would start killing hostages. Momen read the message, but against orders, she ordered the Republic to attack. She was rescued by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], only to be shot by a [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droid]] and die in his arms, having shielded him from the blast.Because of her physical resemblance to [[Shmi Skywalker Lars/Legends|Shmi Skywalker]], Anakin found himself reliving his mother's death. Momentarily tapping into the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], he proceeded to cut a swath of destruction through Tonith's security forces and nearly killed the Separatist [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] before being stopped by the spirit of [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]].

name: Joi Eicroth
description: During the [[Black Fleet Crisis]], Joi was hired to work on the [[Qella]] remains found on [[Brath Qella]]. An exobiologist, she was a member of [[Alpha Blue]] and in [[25 ABY/Legends|25.5 ABY]] was a member of a xenobiology team analyzing the [[Yuuzhan Vong]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Sayn Ta
description: Sayn Ta was the scientist who was given the duty to create [[Kaminoan nano-virus vaccine|a vaccine]] against the deadly [[Kaminoan nano-virus]], a virus created to decimate the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] when the first clones died a few months after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]]. Just after the two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] and [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] left her laboratory, she was killed by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] Kaminoan [[Kuma Nai]] that had developed the nano-virus with an overdose of the substance.

name: Zindra Daine
description: Daine first acted as the third member of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Corran Horn]]'s [[shield trio]] in [[Twin Suns Squadron]] as Twin Suns Three. She later served in the squadron under [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]].

name: Miranda Doni
description: Assigned to the [[New Republic Fifth Fleet|Fifth Battle Group]] as a [[BTL-S8 K-wing assault starfighter|K-wing]] pilot, she relished their role as "heavy hitters" and was a competitor for the position of [[Commander/Legends|commander]] within her [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]]. At some point, she and her K-Wing managed to enter combat with a TIE fighter over a forested planet, where she managed to destroy the TIE pursuing her via the K-Wing's turrets shooting behind. During the failed [[Battle of Doornik-319|blockade of Doornik-319]], Doni pulled out of her bombing run when she heard the pleas of [[Yevetha]]n prisoners that had been broadcast on an open channel. In the subsequent counterattack, Doni and a number of other exposed K-wing pilots were [[Death/Legends|killed]] when their craft were shot down.

name: Kandji
description: Kandji was close friends with [[Biggs Darklighter/Legends|Biggs Darklighter]], who had romantic feelings for her. She was kidnapped by [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]] and was [[Death/Legends|killed]] before a rescue party could save her. Biggs kept a [[Hologram/Legends|holo image]] of her in his quarters on the [[Rand Ecliptic/Legends|''Rand Ecliptic'']].

name: Patricia Katarn
description: Morgan fell in love with her, and they were married towards the end of the reign of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].She was killed when the family's [[BT-16 perimeter droid|BT-16]] perimeter security droid's sensors malfunctioned. Mistaking Patricia for a hostile target, it opened fire, killing her instantly.It was [[Jan Ors]]'s opinion that Kyle had his mother's eyes.{{Char-stub}}

name: Shynne
description: Shynne was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived during the reign of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Raised by the [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitorius]], an order of [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] who served the Empire, Shynne was brought up in the [[Citadel Inquisitorius]]&mdash;the headquarters of the order&mdash;which was situated on the [[Deep Core/Legends|Deep Core]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Prakith/Legends|Prakith]]. The Inquisitorius trained her to utilize the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], and she built herself a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. Shynne eventually became a fully-fledged Inquisitor, and she chose to operate within the Deep Core region so that she could remain close to the Citadel.<ref name="Byss and the Deep Core" />{{RPGseed}}Following the [[Death/Legends|death]] of the Imperial leader, [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], and the [[Declaration of a New Republic/Legends|formation]] of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], the Empire fragmented and was gradually displaced.<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> Shynne continued to reside in the Citadel Inquisitorius along with remnants of the Inquisitorius. At some point, the Inquisitors captured a [[Unidentified Jedi (Prakith)|Jedi]] of the [[New Jedi Order]] who had ventured to Prakith on a [[Scout/Legends|reconnaissance]] mission. The Inquisitors began slowly turning the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] to the dark side as a rescue party was dispatched to Prakith to free the Jedi. Shynne greeted the rescuers when they arrived on the world, but she planned to force the captured Jedi to fight the rescue party, which she hoped would be the final act that would push the Jedi into the dark side's grip.<ref name="Byss and the Deep Core" />{{Endgame}}

name: Auben
description: Auben was a well-known supplier of illegal goods on Korriban when [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Ferus Olin]] purchased a pair of [[handwarmers]] from her while on a mission as an excuse to obtain information about [[Granta Omega]] and [[Jenna Zan Arbor]] from her outside of [[Dreshdae]]. As they were about to make a deal with her they were attacked by a [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild]] army. Auben led Anakin and Ferus into the [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] in exchange for them having saved her life under the impression that the army would not enter the ruins.When the army did not stop she led the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] deeper into the ruins and into an ancient hangar which was being used by a mysterious [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] as a temporary base. A small group of [[B2 super battle droid/Legends|B2 super battle droids]] were being stored in the hangar, when Auben, Ferus and Anakin entered they attacked. During the fight between the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and the droids, Auben tried to sneak aboard a ship docked in the hangar to steal several valuable items she had intended to collect earlier. When she was discovered by [[Dooku/Legends|the Sith Lord]] in the hangar, he stopped her heart, instantly killing her.

name: Incavi Larado
description: Larado reported [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo's]] visit to [[Jubilar/Legends|Jubilar]] in [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]] to [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], using a 25-[[Standard year/Legends|year]]-old encryption code that amazed Fett, after she offered Solo a job [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] [[Jandarra]] [[Vegetable/Legends|vegetables]] to [[Shalam]]. Fett arrived on Jubilar intent on killing Solo. Unfortunately for Larado, Fett's shot at Solo missed him and hit her instead, the first time in Fett's entire career that he killed the wrong target. Fett knelt beside Larado's body and held her hand until she died.

name: At'raoth
description: She was one of Nom Anor's select agents to attempt to infiltrate [[Supreme Overlord]] [[Shimrra Jamaane|Shimrra's]] inner sanctum. She succeeded in reaching the antechamber with a [[villip]] disguised as a [[k'snell vase]], but made it no further. Upon her failure, she triggered the [[irksh poison]] hidden in a false tooth at the back of her mouth. Against Nom Anor's plan and in defiance of Shimrra, Ai'traoth screamed [[Jeedai]] along with [[Ganner Rhysode]]'s name as the poison quickly killed her. This served to show Shimrra just how quickly the Message of the Shamed Ones was growing.{{Char-stub}}

name: Entora Zar
description: Entora Zar was unwittingly involved in the [[Heritage Council]]'s plot to overthrow [[Queen Mother]] [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka]]. A squat, stunted woman, Zar was left behind by her mistress, Ducha Galney, to act as a decoy for [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]] and [[Zekk]]. Galney was in fact one of the ringleaders of the plot, and knew she could not meet the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in person, so she aimed to have them killed. Unfortunately for Zar, Galney was willing to go to any length to murder the two Jedi.When the Jedi Knights arrived, Zar did not open the gates to the villa. When they began to cut through with their [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]], she hastily opened the gate, and engaged them in a discussion about piloting skills in an attempt to keep them occupied. Zar revealed she could fly on her [[holosimulator]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] [[N-1 starfighter/Legends|N-1 starfighters]], [[Z-95mk1 Headhunter|Mark One Headhunters]] and the [[Xi Char/Legends|Xi Char]] [[Variable Geometry Self-Propelled Battle Droid, Mark I|DFS]], but was cut off by the Jedi, searching for the Ducha. She informed them that the Ducha left shortly after their arrival and proceeded to order them to leave the premises. When Jaina and Zekk began to search for the Ducha, Zar was unable to stop them; they drew too close to the underground [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] where Galney was hiding, and Zar's mistress left in her luxury yacht.Entora Zar then stopped the Jedi from killing the precious hunting [[murg]]s she cared for, but did not survive the trap left by Galney. Two [[YVH-Series battle droid|YVH]] droids confronted the group. Entora stepped in the [[2-20|lead droid's]] path, attempting to reason with it, but was fatally wounded by the emotionless YVH. Her lifeless body was dragged off by one of her faithful murgs.

name: Beta Ioli
description: She was part of the the crew of the [[Rover (skiff)|''Rover'']], under the command of Jedi apprentice [[Ben Skywalker]], that was sent to [[Terephon]] to find out what had become of [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]] and [[Zekk]] after their mission to Terephon. She was killed when the ''Rover'' was destroyed in the [[Battle of Hapes (Second Galactic Civil War)|Battle of Hapes]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Uran Lavint
description: Lavint owed money to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Blatta]] and he became her co-pilot during a large smuggling operation consisting of a small fleet. They were captured by the [[Anakin Solo (Imperial II-class)|''Anakin Solo'']] after Uran sold them out to the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]] to pay her debts. Later she would ask [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] for any other assignments, which he refused. She then asked for her ship to be given back to her, which request was also refused and she was saddled instead with a [[YV-666 light freighter/Legends|YV-666 light freighter]] called the ''[[Duracrud]]''. She resented this and didn't know that Solo had ordered her [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] to be sabotaged after she had insulted him so that her hyperdrive would only work once.After she jumped to an empty place, she failed to repair the hyperdrive. However, [[Alema Rar]] had stowed away in the hold and helped her repair the hyperdrive in exchange for Lavint helping Alema to find the Solos. Uran brought Alema to the ''[[Errant Venture]]'' to find the Solos, while there, Lavint gambled, sometimes with the aid of Alema, and drank often. Once while drunk, Jacen approached her again in order to smuggle him to a secret meeting of the [[Confederation]] at [[Gilatter VIII]]. She agreed after Jacen gave her a new ship, a [[Gallofree Yards, Inc./Legends|Gallofree Yards]] medium transport. Later Alema would steal the ''Duracrud'' to escape the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]].

name: Todra Mayn
description: During the [[Hunt for Zsinj|hunt]] for [[Warlord/Legends|Warlord]] [[Zsinj]], Todra was the leader of [[Polearm Squadron]], a veteran unit of [[A-wing]]s assigned to the ''[[Mon Remonda]]''. She participated in many of the key engagements against Zsinj, including the [[Battle of Selaggis]]. During the battle, Todra discovered the [[Iron Fist (Executor-class)|''Iron Fist'']] hiding in a debris ring during her reconnaissance run.A little over three years into the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], Todra became [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the modified [[Lancer-class frigate/Legends|''Lancer''-class frigate]] [[Pride of Selonia (Lancer-class)|''Pride of Selonia'']]. She had received some injuries during the [[Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Coruscant]] and been relegated to a reserve role. However, she was assigned to escort the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] during its journey to sectors of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] that had lost communications with the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]]. She successfully oversaw engagements at [[Galantos]], [[Bakura/Legends|Bakura]], and [[Esfandia/Legends|Esfandia]].

name: Tarla Limpan
description: During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], she was a [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] in the New Republic. As of [[40 ABY]], Limpan was an admiral in the [[Galactic Alliance Defense Fleet]], though she had become somewhat relaxed after years of peacetime. She served as captain of the [[Dodonna (Galactic-class)|''Dodonna'']], as well as commander of the [[Galactic Alliance Second Fleet|Second Fleet]] task force within the [[Corellian system]] following the removal of [[Matric Klauskin]], who was deemed to be insane. She led the Galactic Alliance forces during the [[Battle of Tralus (Second Galactic Civil War)|Battle of Tralus]] with the supposed aid of [[Leia Organa Solo]].Months later, during the blockade of the Corellian System, Limpan was forced to retreat when forces from [[Commenor/Legends|Commenor]] and [[Bothan sector|Bothan Space]] forces launched a surprise assault to break the [[Blockade of Corellia]]. At this point Limpan transferred her flag from ''Dodonna'' to the ''[[Blue Diver]]''.
