Limpan ordered her forces to attempt to disable [[Centerpoint Station]] before leaping out of the system, to regroup at [[Point Bleak]].Limpan led the Second Fleet once again during a meeting between the Corellian forces and co-Chief of State [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] in an isolated star system, three months later. The Duros Admiral was ordered to support Solo in case the meeting was a trap; when the Confederation forces engaged Solo with antiquated vessels, Limpan entered the battle, leading the Second Fleet aboard the ''Blue Diver''. However, the trap was not one which would be fought conventionally; from the [[Corellian system]], the Corellian leadership fired [[Centerpoint Station]], unleashing a torrent of gravitic energy which wiped out the Second Fleet. Admiral Limpan perished along with the vast majority of her command.

name: Thalia May
description: Thalia May and a group of fellow students from the [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] on [[Korriban]] refused to execute a group of civilians from the nearby [[Dreshdae]] colony on the orders of [[Headmaster]] [[Uthar Wynn]]. In response, Uthar ordered the students executed as punishment. Before the sentence could be carried out, May and her companions escaped into the nearby [[shyrack cave]]. No one from the Academy was willing to brave the dangers of the caves to find them and carry out Master Uthar's order.{{Gamemechanics|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}This was the case until [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] arrived on Korriban during his quest to locate the [[Star Forge]]. Revan killed the resident [[Terentatek/Legends|terentatek]] in the cave, allowing May and her friends to escape off-[[Planet/Legends|planet]] via a passage to the surface. Before leaving, May expressed her thanks to Revan and her wishes to seek guidance in the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side]].{{Endgame}}

name: Melina Carniss
description: Melina Carniss served as a dancer and later a dance choreographer for [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] at his [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|palace]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. She was also a secret security officer at the palace. In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], she attempted to arrest [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]], disguised as a dancer named [[Arica]], when Jade tried to grab a blaster from one of the palace guards. Carniss thought Jade was part of an [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] attempt on Jabba by one of his rivals, [[Valarian/Legends|Lady Valarian]]. However, Jade was not trying to [[Death/Legends|kill]] Jabba, but instead [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], who was meeting with the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]].<ref name="SOF" />Carniss took Jade into custody and led her out of the throne room to the dungeons. However, as she turned Jade over to the [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]] guards, Jade used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to turn Carniss's [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] muzzle, causing her to shoot one of the Gamorreans. The guards turned on Carniss with their [[Force pike/Legends|force pikes]], giving Jade time to escape.<ref name="SOF" />Two years after the death of Jabba, she was recruited by [[Talon Karrde]], but she became a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] of [[Ysanne Isard]] during the [[Bacta War]] of [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]]. Carniss provided information regarding a smuggling shipment in the Alderaan system, leading to an [[Second ambush in the Graveyard|ambush]] by Captain [[Ait Convarion]]'s [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Corrupter (Victory II-class)|''Corrupter'']]. Fortunately, the attack was repulsed successfully by [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]]' group. Karrde discovered her treachery and wanted to eliminate her immediately. However, [[Booster Terrik]] managed, with difficulty and at great expense, to persuade Karrde to leave her alive long enough to use her to feed misinformation to Isard and ultimately set the stage for the [[Battle of Thyferra]]. She captained the [[YT-1210 light freighter/Legends|YT-1210]] freighter ''[[Empress' Diadem]]'' during the Bacta War.Two years later, Karrde would encounter a woman named [[Celina Marniss]] (an anagram of Melina Carniss) who would, in fact, turn out to be Mara Jade. He hired her soon after he discovered this.

name: Sora Mobari
description: {{Quote|She is dying. We have tried every treatment imaginable, and still she will not recover.|Jedi Knight A'Sharad Hett, on the injured Sora Mobari|Republic 58: The Battle of Jabiim, Part 4}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Sora Mobari was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and selecting<ref name="R58" /> [[Evan-Ott]]<ref name="CSWEEO" /> as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] learner.<ref name="R58" /> In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC" /> during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Mobari and her student were sent on a mission to<ref name="R58" /> the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ithor/Legends|Ithor]]<ref name="CSWESM">{{CSWECite|II|321|Mobari, Sora}}</ref> to lead an attack against [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] [[Terrorist/Legends|terrorists]]. However, Evan-Ott betrayed Mobari and tried to [[Death/Legends|murder]] her in an explosion. The blast killed Evan-Ott but also grievously injured Mobari, taking her [[Eye/Legends|eyesight]].<ref name="R58" />The [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Master was brought to a [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Medcenter/Legends|medcenter]] on the planet [[New Holstice/Legends|New Holstice]], where one of the Jedi stationed there, [[Darth Krayt|A'Sharad Hett]], tried every imaginable treatment to save Mobari's life. However, nothing worked, and Hett was sure that she would not recover. He asked the Jedi Padawan [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] to ease Mobari's pain during her ordeal, but Skywalker, who had [[Battle of Jabiim|recently lost]] a [[Padawan Pack|great number of fellow Jedi]] on the planet [[Jabiim/Legends|Jabiim]], could not accept another death. The Padawan tried to stabilize Mobari's [[Heart/Legends|heart]] by [[Telekinesis/Legends|using]] [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] but only succeeded in making her convulse violently. Mobari died soon afterward, and Hett released a [[memory moth]] that would eternally whisper her name at the [[Jedi Monument (New Holstice)|Jedi memorial]] on New Holstice.<ref name="R58" />

name: Pooja Naberrie/Legends
description: [[File:Pooja.jpg|thumb|left|140px|Four-year-old Pooja]]Similarly to her sister [[Ryoo Naberrie/Legends|Ryoo]], who was named after their [[Parent/Legends|mother's]] [[Ryoo Thule|maternal grandmother]], Pooja received the name of her father's [[Pooja|maternal grandmother]]. As a [[Youngling/Legends|child]], she was considered to be very talkative and like many other young children, she seemed to have a new idea for what she wanted to be when she grew up every [[Standard week/Legends|week]] and often spoke of being a [[Senator/Legends|senator]], a [[Teacher/Legends|teacher]], a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]], a [[tusk cat]] trainer, and even an [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]].<ref name="FF" /> It is said that she, like her sister, had a crush on [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], the future [[Marriage/Legends|husband]] of their [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|aunt]], when he visited and she also liked playing games with him and asked a lot of questions.<ref name="Jedi vs. Sith">[[Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force (real-life book)|''Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force'']]</ref>In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Amidala had been compelled to miss Pooja's fifth [[Birthday/Legends|birthday]] celebrations because of her work in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]]. She had sent a gift to Pooja and commed her beloved niece on the [[Standard day/Legends|day]], but she still felt guilty for not being able to be there in person.<ref name="Gambit-Stealth">''[[Clone Wars Gambit: Stealth]]''</ref>[[19 BBY/Legends|Two years later]], Pooja, along with the rest of the [[House Naberrie|Naberrie family]] and thousands of other mourners, attended her aunt Padmé's [[Funeral of Padmé Amidala/Legends|funeral]] shortly after the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] ended.<ref name="Episode III" /><div style="float:right">[[File:PoojaNaberrie.png|thumb|130px|Senator Pooja Naberrie]]</div>In [[6 BBY/Legends|6 BBY]], at age 20, Pooja was appointed representative of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo's]] [[Chommell sector/Legends|sector]] in the [[Imperial Senate/Legends|Imperial Senate]] by [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|Queen]] [[Kylantha]], succeeding Senator [[Jar Jar Binks/Legends|Jar Jar Binks]]. This made her a colleague of her cousin, [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], the senator of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], and the two became good friends, completely unaware of their familial relationship.<ref name="Jedi vs. Sith" /> She would hold the position of senator until the Imperial Senate's [[Dissolution of the Imperial Senate/Legends|dissolution]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]].<ref name="SWG" />During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Pooja was a secret [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] sympathizer, but also a great supporter of the [[Queen/Legends|queen]]. In order to ensure Senator Naberrie's security, a woman named [[Kima Nazith]] served as Pooja's [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]].<ref name="SWG" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Pooja Naberrie recruited RSF agents who had previously worked for [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Gregar Typho/Legends|Typho]]. She first tasked them to help [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Harvin Franchels|Franchels]] during a [[terrorist attack in Theed]].<ref name="SWG:HwtaotTa">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Help with the aftermath of the Terrorist attack" on Naboo</ref> This finally led to the RSF [[raid on the Mummer bunker]].<ref name="SWG:BTttT">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Bring Terror to the Terrorists" on Naboo</ref> Naberrie also requested the RSF agents to help [[Hugo Eckener/Legends|Hugo Eckener]] whose son had been kidnapped. The agents [[Rescue of Karl Eckener|rescued]] [[Karl Eckener]] who was held captive in the [[Darkwalker Cave (Theed)|Darkwalker Cave]].<ref name="SWG:RKE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Rescue Karl Eckner" on Naboo</ref> Eventually, Pooja Naberrie tasked the RSF agents to assist [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Sundria Khartoor|Khartoor]] in hunting the escaped murderer [[Hunnos Jarkey]].<ref name="SWG:CtEM">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Catch the Escaped Murderer" on Naboo</ref>Around [[36 ABY]], Leia met with Pooja and told her about her discovery that Padmé was her mother and that the two of them were first cousins. Pooja subsequently recounted to Leia her recollections of Anakin Skywalker.<ref name="Jedi vs. Sith" />

name: Yith Ganar
description: Ganar worked on [[Dorin/Legends|Dorin]] as a tech specialist, notable because of her determination and skill. She was, however, an introverted person, in part because she had no patience for criticism, and in part because she had an energetic mood. She had an aggressive tone in her voice, as if she was insulting whenever she spoke.When Ganar was rejected for a promotion, she decided to quit her job and become a trader. She had no savings or reputation, and her family and her few friends tried to convince her not to do it, but she had made her choice.She then tried to build her own [[BTL Y-wing starfighter/Legends|BTL Y-wing starfighter]] with tools and [[Starship/Legends|ship]] parts. The project was considered impossible, but Ganar managed to succeed. Immediately after that, she left Dorin and all the people who had ever doubted of her skills as a [[Technician/Legends|mechanic]], or as a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]].Ganar then began working as an escort, a mechanic and a [[Scout/Legends|scout]]. It is said that a [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] [[Captain/Legends|captain]] hired her to re-build damaged engines. However, the captain commented about her "debatable technical experience". Three weeks after that, his ship simply dismantled when entering [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]]. Ganar denied nothing and only turned her attention to the task at hand.Ganar had a hidden inferiority complex. She was insecure and thus tried to constantly prove her worth, which is why she worked so hard without ever fraternizing with other pilots or mechanics.

name: Soron Hegerty
description: Soron Hegerty was raised in the [[Apgar system]] by her father, a member of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. With the coming of the [[New Order/Legends|New Order]], her father was ordered to take control of the system from the elected leadership. With his influence, Soron gained employment with the [[Imperial Species Identification Bureau]]. Her career was short lived however, as her recommendations were frequently ignored, largely due to the [[Human High Culture]] policy of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Becoming disillusioned, she began to cooperate with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. After discovering the [[Ssither]], she faked her own death in a crash, to work with the species, later spearheading the effort to relocate them from [[Jatee]] to [[Butler's Cove]].During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], on the urging of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Crowal]], she helped the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in their search for [[Zonama Sekot/Legends|Zonama Sekot]] and was on board the ''[[Jade Shadow]]'' when the planet was located. She was almost kidnapped by a group [[Ferroan]]s unwelcome to the Jedi.{{Char-stub}}

name: Marcha
description: Marcha lived in a magnificent and sprawling [[Marcha's Estate|estate]] on Drall on the edge of a river. She helped [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] escape from his cousin, [[Thrackan Sal-Solo|Thrackan]], during the [[Corellian Crisis]]. As a result, when [[Governor-General]] [[Micamberlecto]] was killed in the fighting, [[Chief of State (New Republic)|Chief of State]] [[Leia Organa Solo]] appointed Marcha to be the new Governor-General of the [[Corellian sector/Legends|Corellian sector]].During the early years of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], she reluctantly allowed the [[New Republic Defense Fleet/Legends|New Republic Defense Fleet]] to use [[Centerpoint Station]] as a weapon against the [[Yuuzhan Vong]]. Her allowance led to the disastrous [[Battle of Fondor (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Fondor]]; following the battle, she was kicked out of office, the [[Centerpoint Party]] came to power, and Thrackan Sal-Solo reclaimed his position of power.

name: Roget Jiriss
description: [[File:G11jiriss.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Roget Jiriss, 10 ABY]]The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Roget Jiriss<ref name="Galaxy Guide 11" /> was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]].<ref name="Date" /> As a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]], she used her contacts deep within several large crime syndicates<ref name="Star Wars: Rebellion" /> to garner a certain amount of personal freedom, even in [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Realspace/Legends|space]].<ref name="Rebellion Guide">''[[Star Wars: Rebellion: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref> Jiriss thus served as an excellent source of information for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]].<ref name="Star Wars: Rebellion" />Jiriss was later one of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy's]] most successful smugglers in the early [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], and her fees were priced to match<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|166|Jiriss, Roget}}</ref> her high delivery rate. Although Jiriss refused to deal directly with various syndicates, she would quickly accept cargo from a known [[black marketeer]] if the opportunity presented itself in order to hurriedly get out of a [[Star system/Legends|system]].<ref name="Galaxy Guide 11" />By [[10 ABY/Legends|10 ABY]],<ref name="Date" /> the Empire had charged Jiriss with illegal [[Transport/Legends|transportation]] of weapons and contraband goods, violations of customs ordinances, and assault on [[Planet/Legends|planetary]] [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|police]]. She was categorized in Imperial records as criminal [[TracSheet]] Subject 66436335-UQFC-244869.<ref name="Galaxy Guide 11" />

name: Lakwii Varrscha
description: Early in her career, Varrscha had been assigned to [[Imperial Office of Customs/Legends|Imperial Customs]], where she served as the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of a [[light corvette]]. Subsequently, she transferred to the line forces of the Navy, and for several years, she served aboard the [[Imperial II-class Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Errant Venture|''Virulence'']] under the command of [[Joak Drysso]], where she achieved the post of executive officer with the rank of [[Captain/Legends|Captain]]. When Drysso was transferred to command the [[Super Star Destroyer/Legends|Super Star Destroyer]] ''[[Lusankya]]'', she was advanced to replace him, and she commanded the ''Virulence'' during the [[Bacta War]], until [[Booster Terrik]] bluffed her into surrendering at [[Yag-prime|Yag'Dhul Station]].Most people who encountered Captain Varrscha were left with the impression that she was somewhat uninspired. [[Mirax Terrik Horn|Mirax Terrik]], who had outrun her corvette once, recalled her tactics as completely conventional, while [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Sair Yonka]] of the Star Destroyer [[Freedom|''Avarice'']] noted that the performance of ''Virulence'' under her command was unimpressive: in particular, she had failed to improve her [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighters]]' performance when she knew that she would be faced with [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]]. [[Fliry Vorru]] thought that she had risen as far as she had simply by standing at Drysso's side, and was concerned that command of a Star Destroyer taxed her to the limits of her ability. But considering her willingness to surrender the ''Virulence'' at Yag'Dhul, another interpretation of her lack of zeal is also possible&mdash;Lakwii Varrscha was simply not fully committed to the Imperial service.

name: Ederlathh Pallopides
description: Ederlath Pallopides was born in [[4 BBY/Legends|4 BBY]], roughly four [[Standard year/Legends|years]] [[Galactic Standard Calendar|before]] the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. At the age of eleven, Pallopides was presented to the [[New Republic Provisional Council]] as the great-niece of the [[Death/Legends|late]] [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] in [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]] by [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Betl Oxtroe]], a [[Imperial officer/Legends|high-ranking officer]] in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]]. By this time, the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] had been going badly for the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]<ref name="des" /> since the loss of its leader in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]].<ref name="EpisodeVI">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref>With the Empire in [[Imperial Civil War|decline]] and the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]&mdash;the successor state of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]&mdash;in the ascent, Admiral Oxtroe attempted to end the war through diplomacy before the Empire lost [[Imperial Military/Legends|what remained of its ability]] to negotiate an outcome other than unconditional surrender. Hence, Oxtroe made overtures to the [[New Republic Provisional Council]] and proposed to reform the Empire into a constitutional [[King/Legends|monarchy]].<ref name="des" />Thus, she intended to install Pallopides on the vacant [[Imperial throne]] as the first [[Emperor/Legends|Empress]] of the Galactic Empire. As a child, however, Pallopides could only rule as a symbolic figurehead while actual governmental authority was wielded by more experienced officials. As such, Admiral Oxtroe offered the position of [[Imperial Advisor]] to the members of the Provisional [[Council]]. This arrangement would then place the Empire under joint Imperial-Republic rule, although actual leadership of the new government would be controlled by the Council in its [[Advisor/Legends|advisory]] role to Empress Pallopides.<ref name="des" />Ultimately, the Admiral's vision for the New Galactic Empire was never realized. Before her negotiations could be taken any further with the Council, she was killed by unidentified [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]], although later New Republic accounts implicated the [[Noghri/Legends|Noghri]] for the assassination of Betl Oxtroe. As a result, Pallopides did not succeed her alleged great-uncle as the next ruler of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].<ref name="des" /> The Empire itself continued to decline at an accelerated rate, dwindling into a [[Imperial Remnant|small remnant of its former glory]]. By [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]], the Empire&mdash;what little remained of it&mdash;[[Pellaeon–Gavrisom Treaty|effectively surrendered]] to the New Republic, thus concluding the [[civil war]] that engulfed the galaxy for roughly two decades.<ref name="nec">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref>

name: Rana
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at an early age, Rana was delivered to the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and began to [[Jedi training/Legends|learn]] the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side]]. A [[Jedi Initiate|student]] at the [[Jedi academy|Temple's academy]], Rana went on to [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduate]] and was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] apprentice by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. After years of one-on-one travel and study, Rana was ready to face the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]]; which she passed, ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. As a Knight, Rana pursued the path of the [[Jedi Guardian]] as part of her independent study focus. Specializing as a [[Jedi ace|ace pilot]], Rana joined the [[Jedi Starfighter Corps|Starfighter Corps]] and became a noted member amongst its ranks.<ref name="SWJS" />In [[41 BBY/Legends|41 BBY]], Rana was still flying out of the Coruscant Temple on missions for the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. At one point, Rana carried fellow Jedi [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] as passengers, leaving them on the isolated world of [[Ragoon VI]] where they hoped to deal with the growing distance they felt between one another out in the wilderness.<ref>''[[Jedi Apprentice: The Ties That Bind]]''</ref> Two decades later, Rana was still an active member of the Starfighter Corps, piloting one of the Order's new [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Delta-7 ''Aethersprite'']] interceptors. Stationed at the Temple during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], Rana answered [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu's]] rallying cry and followed him to the planet [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] as part of a massive [[Geonosis strike team|rescue team]] to save Jedi Kenobi, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] from execution by the [[Separatist Council/Legends|Separatist Council]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. While many of her comrades stormed the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]] on the ground, Rana joined the [[Battle of Geonosis (disambiguation)|battle]] in orbit under the leadership of Jedi Councilor [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]].<ref name="SWJS" />

name: Ina Rece
description: {{Quote|Okay. We've broken through the outer perimeter, but the party's not over yet.''"<br />"''Well, don't look now, but here comes the entertainment.|Merrick and Rece, before a TIE interceptor attack|audio=InaRece2-RAII.ogg|Star Wars: Rebel Assault II: The Hidden Empire}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|woman]]<ref name="RAII" /> [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] during the final [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]],<ref name="DOB">Rece was in her early thirties ({{LucasArtsCite|url=products/rebel2/reb_stry.htm|text=''Rebel Assault II'' - Original Story|archivedate=20070126231850}}) during the events of ''[[Star Wars: Rebel Assault II: The Hidden Empire]]'', which takes place in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]] (''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''). This places her date of birth approximately ten years before the end of the Galactic Republic in [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]] (''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'').</ref> Ina Rece joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], serving as a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] in [[Rascal Squadron]] alongside<ref name="RAII" /> her cousin and friend [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Ace Merrick]].<ref name="LA">{{LucasArtsCite|url=products/rebel2/reb_stry.htm|text=''Rebel Assault II'' - Original Story|archivedate=20070126231850}}</ref>[[File:ReceShootsTIE-RAII.png|thumb|left|250px|Rece's X-wing destroys a TIE interceptor.]]In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]]<ref name="NEC" />&mdash;by which [[Time/Legends|time]] Rece was in her early thirties<ref name="LA" />&mdash;the Alliance learned that the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] was processing [[oridium]] [[Ore/Legends|ore]] at a [[Arah mining facility|hidden mining facility]] in the [[Arah asteroid belt|Belt of Arah]] to [[Fuel/Legends|fuel]] the [[TIE/ph phantom|TIE Phantom]], a new [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaking device]]-equipped starfighter which the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] intended to use to eliminate the Rebellion. In order to learn more about the new threat, [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Gial Ackbar]] dispatched Rece, Merrick and [[Rookie One]] in [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighters]] to the [[Dreighton Nebula]] to [[Battle of Arah|investigate]] the Belt of Arah and disable the [[Mining/Legends|mining]] facility.<ref name="RAII" />Rascal Squadron arrived at the Belt of Arah to find [[derillium mine]]s scattered around the perimeter. Merrick led the Rebels through the [[Asteroid belt|asteroid field]], destroying any mines they encountered along the way. The [[Flight/Legends|group]] cleared the outer perimeter but soon came under attack from numerous [[TIE/IN interceptor/Legends|TIE interceptors]]. Rece scored multiple [[Death/Legends|kills]] as the Rebels fought their way through the Imperial starfighters, including destroying one [[Interceptor/Legends|interceptor]] that Rookie One was unable to shake from his tail. The Rebels eventually reached the mining facility, built into one of the larger [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroids]]. The group entered the facility through a transport corridor designed for [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttles]] and cargo [[Drone/Legends|drones]], in which Rookie One destroyed the [[Deflector shield generator/Legends|shield emitters]] at an exchange junction, providing access to the [[Reactor/Legends|reactor core]]. Evading fire from sentry guns&mdash;which mistook the X-wings for floating debris&mdash;the Rebels destroyed the reactor's cooling system and escaped through an [[Thermal exhaust port/Legends|exhaust vent]] moments before the reactor went critical, destroying the facility.<ref name="RAII" />Their mission complete, Rascal Squadron prepared to return to the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Alliance Fleet]]. Moments before jumping to [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]], however, three TIE Phantoms decloaked behind them and opened fire, killing Merrick with their opening salvo. Taken by surprise, Rece was unable to evade and was killed when the TIE Phantoms destroyed her X-wing. Rookie One escaped and later proved instrumental in [[Mission to Imdaar|ending]] the threat of the TIE Phantoms.<ref name="RAII" />

name: Unidentified female Jedi Master
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] sometime circa [[800 BBY]]. Attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], she eventually came to possess [[Vima-Da-Boda's lightsaber|a lightsaber]] uncovered on the abandoned world of [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]]. While she never revealed how she retrieved the ancient artifact, she passed it down to [[Vima-Da-Boda's Master|her Padawan]] before she trained her [[Padawan/Legends|apprentice]] to [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Knighthood]].<ref name="DEE" />

name: Chawkroft
description: Chawkroft began her rise within the [[Imperial Correctional Facilities Ministry]] after the death of her superior, [[Gervruche]]. As a [[Special Projects Consultant]], Chawkroft received a message from [[Ilm Vaz-Weplinn]], an [[Assistant-Deputy Viceprex]] of the [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority's]] [[Security Division]]. Vaz-Weplinn proposed the joint development of an advanced prison facility in the [[Corporate Sector/Legends|Corporate Sector]]. Chawcroft was pleased with this proposal: her ministry welcomed the chance to share costs of prison development with the CSA, and [[Grand Vizier/Legends|Grand Vizier]] [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]] had blocked the budget requests of the [[Admiralty (Imperial)/Legends|Admiralty]] for their own prison facilities.<ref name="HSCS" />Shortly after she signed on, Viceprex [[Mirkovig Hirken]] took control of the project, code-named "Stars' End." Hirken and Chawkroft continued working together on Stars' End, corresponding and visiting frequently. Chawcroft was apparently befriended by Hirken's [[Marriage/Legends|wife]] [[Neera Opatajji-Hirken|Neera]], who shared her recipe for [[oonberry pie]] with Chawcroft at the Hirken's anniversary banquet. While working on the project, Chawcroft's career prospered. She continued to rise through the Ministry bureaucracy, first to [[Assistant-Minister of Corrections]] and then to [[Minister of Corrections]] by [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]].<ref name="HSCS" />After [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], and their associates destroyed Stars' End, resulting in the deaths of the Hirkens, Chawcroft sent her condolences to Viceprex Hirken's department. Newly appointed Viceprex Vaz-Weplinn sent a reply, arguing for continued collaboration between her ministry and the CSA despite recent setbacks.<ref name="HSCS" />

name: Sanda
description: When Sanda got stuck with the other gang members on planet [[Arcan IV]] in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], she expressed her regret that her former partner [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] had fallen into the hands of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]]. However, she only felt sorry for this, because she herself would have liked to receive the premium that had been released on Solo. At that time, Sanda, Lemo, and their people were planning a very lucrative raid, to which, however, they needed the [[Dancing Goddess/Legends|''Dancing Goddess'']] and the ''[[Mistrel]]''. After months of searching for these two statues in vain, frustration spread through them. A solution to their problem appeared to emerge when a man introduced himself as Captain [[Drebble]], claiming that Han Solo might be helpful in finding the two figures. In reality, however, he was Lando Calrissian, who posed for his old enemy Barpotomous Drebble and wanted to elicit information from the criminals about the whereabouts of his lost friend. He also succeeded, but he also accidentally revealed his true relationship with Solo. Sanda, Lemo and their people then tried to assassinate [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], who escorted him, but the two could seize a glider and flee. This was ended by a traffic accident. So they were asked by a gang member named Dafi. It turned out that Calrissian had the Mistrel with him. In fact, he had won both statues some time earlier in a card game. When Sanda, Lemo and the others arrived, Dafi turned and opened the fire on them, because she did not want to share the Mistrel with anyone. Sanda and Lemo got away with their lives and could bring the Mistrel, but Calrissian and Chewbacca managed to escape in the meantime.Shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|battle of]] [[Endor/Legends|Endor]], Sanda, Lemo and their gang, still searching for the ''Dancing Goddess'', met on the planet Keyorin on Han Solo, Lando Calrissian, Chewbacca and the real Drebble. Sanda and Lemo managed to catch Solos and Chewbaccas. In their hiding place, they interrogated their prisoners to find out where the Dancing Goddess was. Solo claimed that Drebble was the one who owned the coveted statue. Sanda, Lemo, and most of their people went to the spaceport, because Drebble was staying aboard his ship, Cobra, with his men and his old enemy Calrissian. However, they fell into a trap that Drebble and Calrissian had put together. In the meantime, he had succeeded in persuading him to cooperate. When she realized that she and yours had been encircled by Drebble's people and there was no escape for them, Sanda decided to surrender. In the end, she and Lemo watched Calrissian Drebble hand over the Dancing Goddess.

name: Sariss
description: Sariss did not know that she was the daughter of [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Cronal]], one of the [[Prophets of the Dark Side]] who raised her in the ways of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] on [[Dromund Kaas]]. There, Sariss first met her later master, [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec]] of the [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitorius]] in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].<ref name="TDFS3" /> Because Cronal held to a creed of dark nihilism, the mere existence of his daughter constituted a shocking offense, as it was tribute to creation instead of destruction. Consequently, Sariss was disavowed by her father in a most horrid way possible. Cronal not only allowed his fellow Prophets to freely engage her in [[Reproduction/Legends#Non-reproductive mating|carnal relations]], but he also partook in the repeated rape himself.<ref name="Blog3">{{SW|url=news/the-imperial-warlords-despoilers-of-an-empire-part-3|text=The Imperial Warlords: Despoilers of an Empire, Part 3|int=The Imperial Warlords: Despoilers of an Empire|archivedate=20170909121115}}</ref>"Prophetess" was the alter ego assumed by Sariss on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], where, working in cooperation with local [[Governor/Legends|governor]] [[Tour Aryon]],<ref name="CCG">{{CCG|set=Premiere Limited|link=Premiere-Dark/large/prophetess.gif|cardname=Prophetess}}</ref> she posed as a local fortune teller as cover for her true job as a spy for the Secret Order of the Empire.<ref name="TDFS3" /> As a fortune teller, she claimed that [[Wuher/Legends|Wuher]] was the reincarnated soul of [[Cedo Partu]]. Wuher never allowed the Prophetess to enter [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]].<ref name="SWI91">{{InsiderCite|91|Refresher Reading}}</ref>[[File:SarissSandtroopers-ANH.png|thumb|left|250px|Sariss as the "Prophetess" makes room for the troopers of Desert Sands]]Right before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], as part of her espionage, she trailed [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] and his bodyguards to [[Docking Bay 94/Legends|Docking Bay 94]] in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]].<ref name="CCG" /> Shortly thereafter, Sariss had to quickly make room for a group of [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] rushing to the docking bay in a vain attempt to prevent the escape of the droid [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]], holder of [[datatape]]s containing the stolen plans of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]].<ref name="ANH">[[Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope|''Star Wars'': Episode IV ''A New Hope'']]</ref>During the [[Liberation of Tatooine|rebellion]] on Tatooine that followed the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Sariss abandoned her post to become a [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] apprenticed to Jerec, although outwardly she claimed devotion to the Empire's [[Church of the Dark Side]]. In her role as a disciple of the quasi-religion, she seduced a wealthy [[Epicanthix]] mineral baron on [[Panatha]], to whom she became engaged. She then seduced his son, [[Yun]], whom she taught her "faith." She convinced Yun to kill his own father. She then gave the baron's wealth to Jerec and also gave Yun to Jerec as an apprentice.<ref name="TDFS3" />[[File:Kyle sariss.jpg|thumb|150px|Sariss dueling [[Kyle Katarn]].]]With the death of Emperor [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Sariss assisted Jerec to rebuild the collapsing Empire and search for the [[Valley of the Jedi]], a [[Force nexus]] formed in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[New Sith Wars]] more than [[1000 BBY|a thousand years ago]]. After learning that [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qu Rahn]] might have known the location of the valley, Sariss, Yun, and Maw led the landing party, which consisted of two [[Skimmer/Legends|skimmers]]. They were able to capture Rahn and his rebel companions and took them over to Jerec's [[Super Star Destroyer/Legends|Super Star Destroyer]], the [[Vengeance (Vengeance-class)|''Vengeance'']]. The rebels were already executed, and Jerec was able to probe Rahn's mind and discovered that although Qu Rahn did not know the location of the valley, his friend [[Morgan Katarn]], killed by Jerec several years ago, did and had kept the map leading to it in his home on the planet [[Sulon]]. Eventually, Qu Rahn broke free and fought against the Seven Dark Jedi. Sariss, Boc, and Yun engaged him, but they were no match until Jerec intervened and killed Rahn.<ref name="SW:JK:DFII" /><ref name="Rebel Agent">''[[Star Wars: Dark Forces: Rebel Agent]]''</ref>After killing Rahn, Sariss, Boc, and Yun traveled to Sulon to gather the pieces of the map and use [[8t88]] to decode the map. She ordered her apprentice to travel to the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Barons Hed]] while she returned to the ''Vengeance'' to inform the success on searching the map.<ref name="SW:JK:DFII" /><ref name="Rebel Agent" /> They were able to find the location where the Valley of the Jedi was hidden, and the planet was known to be [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]].<ref name="SW:JK:DFII" /><ref name="SW:JK:DF">''[[Star Wars: Dark Forces: Jedi Knight]]''</ref>A short time later, Sariss spoke with Yun, who told him that Jerec acknowledged that Yun did well with the rock. She gave him his next assignment—to find out what happened to [[Patrol 341|Patrol Zulu, Able, Mary 341]], which was long overdue. Sariss later accompanied Jerec when the Dark Jedi Master confronted Katarn, who was furious after killing [[Maw (Dark Jedi)|Maw]] on a landing pad near Jerec's personal cargo ship, the Sulon Star. Jerec tried to turn Katarn to the dark side by persuading him to kill his partner and love, [[Jan Ors]], whom Jerec's men had captured earlier. Katarn managed to hold off his anger and stay with the light, and Yun watched as his Master pushed the Jedi into the Sulon Star and then sent the doomed ship towards the surface.<ref name="SW:JK:DFII" /><ref name="SW:JK:DF" />Katarn managed to escape from the Sulon Star in his own ship, the ''[[Moldy Crow]]'', though he crashed the vessel in the process. He was later found unconscious by Sariss, Boc, and Yun and took him over to the caves where he would be executed. Sariss then attempted to execute Katarn with her lightsaber, but Yun, whose body seemed to act on its own, blocked Sariss's blow, which accidentally deflected against him, inflicting a mortal wound. With a few tears coming down her eyes, she didn't know why Yun would turn against her. Yun eventually told her that Kyle was a true Jedi, and that he shouldn't die, and he deserved a better battle. Watching her apprentice die, Sariss chose to spare Kyle and engage him in a duel.<ref name="SW:JK:DFII" />Enraged with the loss of Yun, she was determined to destroy the self-trained [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. Sariss fought against Katarn and initially had the upper hand while trying to killing him, but she underestimated Kyle who used a countering technique known as the [[Flowing Water|Flowing Water Cut]]. Sariss quickly found she couldn't defeat him and that she underestimated his power in the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side of the Force]]. She came to realize the point of what Yun said to her before his death; that Kyle was a true Jedi of the light side. Sariss was ultimately killed in the confrontation, and Kyle went on to rescue Jan and defeat Boc and Jerec once and for all.<ref name="SW:JK:DFII" />

name: Elena Shelvay
description: After the murder of the Shelvay family at the hands of [[High Inquisitor]] [[Antinnis Tremayne]], Elena was kidnapped and re-educated by the [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|ISB]]. As a result of her re-education she was brainwashed to believe her brother was to blame for her family's murder due to his [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] teaching. She became emotionally unstable as a result, but regardless of this, she was a competent and dedicated ISB agent. Her loyalty to the Empire saw her rapid ascension through the Imperial hierarchy, and she eventually became the aide of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Abran Balfour/Legends|Abran Balfour]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Aralina Silk
description: [[File:Jinzu Razor SWGTCG.png|left|thumb|Silk wielding her Jinsu Razor saber]]She was present in [[Restuss]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Rori/Legends|Rori]] at the time of the [[Battle of Restuss]], where she was presumably killed by an unknown squad of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]]. It was not known what exactly her mission was, but she had no qualms with killing [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]] as well as [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebels]] in her efforts to accomplish it. Her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], a [[Jinsu Razor]], was taken by a Force-sensitive member of that squad.

name: Isolde Siro
description: Recruited into [[Lando's Commandos]], Siro opposed the use of [[Air Marshal]] [[Von Asch]] in their mission to stop the [[Eiattu pirates|TIE Pirates]]. In the ambush sprung by [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Kine (pirate)|Kine]], Asch took a lightsaber bolt meant for Siro, who in turn killed Kine.Asch survived the blast, and expressed his belief that Siro was to play an important role in the future.

name: Eron Stonefield
description: Despite the fact that Eron grew up while the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] was in power, she did not always agree with the [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] and his [[New Order/Legends|New Order]].Eron was among a group of bounty hunters who were hired by [[Eugene Talmont]] to track down [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] shortly after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. This was in fact simply to allow Talmont to claim the prestige awarded to one who could capture Solo in order for him to achieve a better posting than he currently had on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. She, along with the other hunters, [[Dengar/Legends|Dengar]] and [[Udin]], tracked down Solo, but were unable to apprehend him, and instead kidnapped [[Grubba Desilijic Aarrpo|Grubba]] the Hutt.

name: Odie Subu
description: During the [[Battle of Praesitlyn]], she and H'Arman fought against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Battle droid/Legends|droid]] army with [[Sons and Daughters of Freedom|Freedom's Sons]] and a task force commanded by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Nejaa Halcyon]] and future [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] Anakin Skywalker. After returning from her mission with H'Arman, she was startled by the returning reconnaissance crew she accidentally blasted a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] named [[Grudo]], believing he was the enemy. He died later that day. After their victory, Subu and H'Arman were married and, at Subu's request, Skywalker agreed to preside over the ceremony.{{Char-stub}}

name: Syla Tors
description: {{Dialogue|Judder Page|Nice job, Tors.|Syla Tors|Thank you, Lieutenant. You weren't wanting this thing to fly again, were you?|Judder Page|Apparently not. Anyone hurt?|Keleman Ciro|No, sir. I wish you'd teach Tors how to land these things.|Syla Tors|I've never been good with loaners. Booby-trap is set.|attr=Judder Page, Syla Tors, and Keleman Ciro|src=The Saga Begins}}Syla Tors was a [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who operated as a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]]. She later joined the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[New Republic Special Forces/Legends|Special Forces]] and was selected to join the elite [[Katarn Commandos]] under the command of [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Judder Page/Legends|Judder Page]]. Tors served as the team's [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] and communications specialist.<ref name="HESB" />During the New Republic's [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|mission to liberate]] the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]], elements of the Katarn Commandos were assigned to infiltrate the [[Imperial Government Complex]] and deactivate the [[Deflector shield/Legends|deflector shieldcovering]] the world's only continent. Tors piloted a [[Ghtroc Industries/Legends|Ghtroc]] [[Class 720 freighter]] carrying Lieutenant Page, [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Keleman Ciro]], [[Kaiya Adrimetrum]], [[Gottu]], and [[Vandro]]. Posing as a nondescript [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]], Tors intended to try and blend in with the civilian traffic fleeing the [[New Republic task force (Kal'Shebbol)|New Republic task force]] assault the planet. As the rest of the freighters were directed to designated landing fields, Tors piloted the vessel towards a pre-determined target to rendezvous with the team's [[Pathfinders/Legends|Pathfinder]], [[Lilla Dade]], who had been on the planet for three [[Standard day/Legends|days]].<ref name="TSB">{{DarkStryder|The Saga Begins|The DarkStryder Campaign}}</ref>Tors almost managed to get the freighter down when it was targeted by an [[Atgar SpaceDefense Corporation/Legends|Atgar]] [[1.4 FD P-Tower/Legends|1.4 FD P-Tower]] on the Imperial Government Complex. The [[Laser/Legends|laser]] blast destroyed the ship's starboard [[Repulsorlift/Legends|repulsorlift]], sending the freighter crashing to the ground. The ship skidded through grassland and decorative shrubberies before punching through the perimeter [[death fence]]. Despite crashing, Tors managed to put the vessel in between two hills that put it out of sight of any of the Complex's weapon emplacements. After setting an explosive booby-trap on the freighter, Tors joined the rest of the commando team in waiting for [[Pathfinders/Legends|Pathfinder]] [[Lilla Dade]] to make contact.<ref name="TSB" />Dade sent a local contact, the [[Defel/Legends|Defel]] [[Kl'aal]], to rendezvous with the command team and he lead them to the Pathfinder. Dade had found an access into the Complex, allowing the commandos to infiltrate Sarne's command center. Splitting his force, Page led Tors, Ciro, and Vandro to cut off the Moff's escape while Adrimetrum, Dade, Gottu, and Kl'aal headed to Sarne's detention level. Before reaching Sarne's escape vessel, a hidden [[Carrack-class light cruiser/Legends|''Carrack''-class light cruiser]], the four commandos were incapacitated by Sarne using a piece of [[Mindwarper module|exotic technology]]. The mind-numbing field laid the team low, allowing the Moff to reach his ship. Despite Ciro destroying the module, the [[Ambition|cruiser]] launched before the commandos could recover. Ciro managed to use a [[beamdrill]] to freeze the Complex's shields in the off position when the ship launched, completing the commando's primary mission. With the shields down, Page ordered Tors to contact the [[Unidentified New Republic admiral|admiral]] in command of the New Republic fleet and inform him of the situation.<ref name="TSB" />Tors flew an [[Assault shuttle/Legends|assault shuttle]] to extract [[Gottu]] and [[Idow]] from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Jendorn]]. The pair had infiltrated a [[Prison/Legends|prison]] compound in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Bruzion]] where they rescued six New Republic pilots from [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] captivity.<ref name="Gottu">{{WEGCite|book=Dark Force Rising Sourcebook|story=Gottu and His Vibro-ax}}</ref>

name: Yfra
description: In [[23 ABY/Legends|23 ABY]], Yfra was the [[Hapan]] [[matriarch]] [[Ta'a Chume]]'s personal [[Ambassador/Legends|ambassador]]. During that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], when the [[Prince/Legends|princess]] of [[Hapes/Legends|Hapes]], [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka]], was attending [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Jedi Praxeum]] on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]], Ta'a Chume, who was Tenel Ka's grandmother, ordered Yfra to observe Tenel Ka in her place of study. Tenel Ka disliked the idea of Yfra visiting her while she was at the Praxeum not only because she had a low opinion of the denizens of her grandmother's court, but also because she did not want her status as the heir to the [[Throne/Legends|throne]] of the [[Hapes Consortium/Legends|Hapes Consortium]] to be made public. Skywalker realized this and tried to help the young princess keep Yfra from coming to the [[Jedi academy]]. When Tenel Ka's friends [[Jedi Initiate|Jedi trainees]] [[Darth Caedus|Jacen]] and [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]] were kidnapped and taken to the [[Shadow Academy]], the secret training center of the [[Second Imperium]], Tenel Ka went with Skywalker to rescue them and in the process escaped being being visited by Yfra.<ref name="Shadow">''[[Young Jedi Knights: Shadow Academy]]''</ref>Following a disastrous [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] exercise with Jacen which left Tenel Ka's left [[Limb/Legends|arm]] severed, Yfra brought the young heir to Hapes. It was then that Yfra attempted to assassinate Ta'a Chume along with Tenel Ka and her [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] classmates while they were residing at [[Reef Fortress]]. Yfra arranged for their [[Hapan Water Dragon|wavespeeder]] to be sabotaged, a patch of [[carnivorous seaweed]] to ambush them, and for a squad of deadly [[Bartokk]] mercenaries to attack them.<ref name="Lightsabers" />Tenel Ka and her companions succeeded in foiling Yfra's plot with their budding Jedi skills. In the end, Yfra was arrested.<ref name="Lightsabers" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Veda (Galacian)
description: Veda had been married to [[King/Legends|King]] [[Cana]] who had died, and she was the only ruler of [[Galu]] and the rest of Gala. Veda was being poisoned by [[Jono Dunn]], Beju, and [[Lonnag Giba|Giba]], who served the family in the palace. [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] told the queen that she was being poisoned, and she understood because she had been dying. Her night-time tea was being poisoned. When Beju learned that [[Elan Tallah|Elan]] had the Mark of the Crown, and not him, he stepped out of the election. [[Wila Prammi]] was elected Governor, and Veda went on with her life with her son.

name: Vleen Argoe
description: She purchased [[Shvash gas]] from harvesters at 50 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] per ton and sold to traders for 75 to 120 credits per ton (plus 25 credit deposit per pressurized container). Vleen was a terrible businesswomen and barely managed to earn a living from Shvash gas trading.She had an obsession with the fire that the Shvash gas produced and would often sit in her office all day setting light to small objects and smoking hand-rolled [[Cigarra/Legends|cigarras]]. Vleen carried a small [[mini-flamer]] with her to light her cigarras and would often be distracted by the fire that it produced.

name: Dunc T'racen
description: Dunc shared [[Shada D'ukal|Shada's]] air of professional competence and carried a similar arsenal of personal weaponry, including several [[Vibroblade/Legends|vibroblades]] and [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]], but she seemed less battle-hardened, and still believed that the [[Mistryl Shadow Guard|Shadow Guard]] were more than mercenaries, although her air of youthful idealism was perhaps emphasized by her fair complexion and delicate features.At around the time that [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] abducted [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] to [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], ''[[The Fury]]'' was contracted for 20,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to transport [[Fenig Nabon]] and [[Ghitsa Dogder]] with a cargo from [[Leb'Reen]] on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] to [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]]. Dunc expected the cargo to be [[ryll kor]] for medical use, and was horrified to discover that it was actually a troupe of [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] dancers indentured to the [[Clan Shak|Shak clan]], being sold into virtual slavery to [[Durga Besadii Tai|Durga]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]].Throughout the voyage, Dunc was continually baited by Ghitsa, and the situation was not improved when the [[Karazak Slavers Cooperative]] ship ''[[Indenture]]'' tried to attack ''The Fury'' and appropriate their living cargo. Shada and Dunc decided to liberate the slaves, and unceremoniously offloaded Fenig and Ghitsa in an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]]&mdash;only to discover that that had been the plan all along, and they had been unwittingly manipulated into aiding their passengers in a complex con.

name: Terr Taneel/Legends
description: [[File:TaneelandHalliikeenovich.png|thumb|left|Taneel and her failing suitor, [[Són Halliikeenovich]].]]Taneel was a member of the powerful [[House Taneel]], and was surprisingly forward-thinking compared to isolationist Senex aristocrats. She was one of the [[Loyalist Committee/Legends|Loyalist]] [[Senator/Legends|senators]] to greet the rescued [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] on the landing platform after the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]].[[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]] and [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]] noted her idealism and invited her to take part in their quiet resistance. Taneel also became close friends with [[Chi Eekway Papanoida/Legends|Chi Eekway Papanoida]], another senator that she felt was too impetuous and naïve for such harsh times. However, she developed a suspicion that Eekway held a secret ambition to rise above her politically, and kept a close and wary eye on Eekway's meeting with [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Notluwiski Papanoida]] at the [[Galaxies Opera House/Legends|Galaxies Opera House]].[[Són Halliikeenovich]] of [[House Halliikeenovich]], an unimportant noble house in [[Juvex sector/Legends|Juvex sector]], hoped to gain his House prestige by marrying Taneel and joining their Houses. If she returned his interest, it was not obvious to the public.

name: Dona Telamark
description: Dona sheltered former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Ferus Olin]] when he was on the run from the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. She escaped during an attack from the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] and [[D'harhan]].In [[18 BBY/Legends|18 BBY]], Telamark was arrested along with [[Roan Lands]] by the Empire on charges of conspiracy against the government of [[Bellassa/Legends|Bellassa]] and plotting to [[Assassin/Legends|assassinate]] the Bellassan Imperial [[Advisor/Legends|advisor]]. The two prisoners were held aboard the ''[[True Justice]]'' in an effort to coerce Olin to work for the Empire. Scheduled for a speedy trial by Judge [[Bellican]], [[Lawyer/Legends|Attorney]] [[Oryon|Tomay Alcorn]], and law clerk [[Sam Weller]], the duo was unexpectedly set free when [[Fy-Tor-Ana|Solace]], Oryon, and [[Trever Flume]], impersonating the Imperial judicial team, hijacked the retrofitted [[YT-series/Legends|YT-series]] [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Transport/Legends|transport]].

name: Haum Do
description: An orphan on [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]], Do grew up in the information-rich [[Datum District]] and became a reporter. She was quite curious for a Kaminoan and had the uncanny knack of appearing wherever and whenever important stories broke, whether she was invited or not.She began working as [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] correspondent for [[TriNebulon News/Legends|TriNebulon News]], usually based on [[Foamwander City]]. Natives dealing with her were unsure about what species she was. Haum Do was among the people investigating the [[planetary repulsor]] chamber found on the greatest of the [[Mkbuto Islands]], an event attracting great attention from the media, which was later revealed to be a fake.

name: Frija Torlock
description: Frija was secretly dating [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Droon]] and was able to convince him to help her seize control of Corulag. Their plan was to incriminate [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] Torlock as a traitor so that he would be removed from power. The removal of Torlock would allow Droon to take the Governor's seat.[[File:FrijaTorlock2-FF127.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Torlock wielding an E-11 blaster rifle]]However, the plan was found out by Governor Torlock and he made plans to flee Corulag. He was able to escape but not before he activated two [[Human replica droid]]s disguised as [[Lexhannen Torlock (droid)|himself]] and his [[Frija Torlock (droid)|daughter]]. Admiral Droon's men eventually captured the droid replica of Torlock, but quickly realized that the real Torlock had escaped. Interrogating the droid, they also learned of the droid copy of Frija. Frija was concerned about her droid counterpart and ordered that Droon dismantle the droid. To do this, Droon hired [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]] to destroy both droids and make it appear as though the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]] was to blame. Droon believed that the ruse would throw off all suspicion as to the whereabouts of the real Torlock and leave him free to take the Governor's spot.However, Frija and Droon did not count on the interference of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and his agent, [[Wrenga Jixton]]. Jix infiltrated the base and discovered the plan. After a runabout in which Droon tried to destroy all evidence and Jix as well, Jix escaped Imperial clutches and confronted the traitorous pair. In the final showdown, Droon tried to blame the entire plan on Frija. In retaliation Frija grabbed a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] and tried to shoot her backstabbing lover. Jix was too fast for her and shot her in the chest. Jix captured Droon and presented him to Vader. Meanwhile, Frija's replica droid escaped with her "father" and the two made their way to the remote [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]].After the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], the [[Mind-witch]] [[S'ybll]] used an [[Mind trick/Legends|illusion]] of Frija to trap [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] on the planet [[Tarnoonga]]. Skywalker eventually realized the truth and the illusion was dropped. The mind-witch wanted to propose an alliance with the nascent [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] to overthrow the [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]]. When Skywalker refused, he was forced to kill the witch.

name: Adela Tyché
description: {{Quote|Nice knowing you, soldier boy. Open fire!|Tyché taunting Sykes before giving orders to other mercenaries|Star Wars: Episode I: Battle for Naboo}}During her early [[Standard year/Legends|years]], she traveled extensively, strengthening her [[Pilot/Legends|piloting]] and fighting abilities. She also learned to speak many different [[Language/Legends|languages]], including [[Galactic Basic Standard|Basic]] and [[Huttese/Legends|Huttese]]. Those skills as a translator and advisor impressed [[Borvo]], who soon [[Nal Raka Criminal Empire|employed]] her as his personal pilot and bodyguard.During the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]] in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Borvo allied with the [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Naboo Security Forces]] after they [[Mission to the Naboo mountains|rescued him]] from [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] forces. Tyché was on hand to translate Borvo's gratitude to the [[Officer/Legends|officers]]. She went on to fly [[Disruption of Comm 4|several]] [[Attack on disabled base|missions]] alongside [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Kael (officer)|Kael]] and [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Gavyn Sykes]], using an [[N-1 starfighter/Legends|N-1]] against the [[Trade Federation Droid Army/Legends|droid army]] and helped [[Liberation of slave camps|free captured slaves]]. Borvo then betrayed the Security Forces by selling the rescued [[Naboo (people)/Legends|Naboo]] [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] in secret and [[Search for Captain Kael|shot down]] Kael to cover his tracks. Tyché joined the Hutt in his base on [[Porso Hill]], and took control of his [[Borvo the Hutt's freighter|personal transport]]. Sykes [[Attack on Porso Hill|attacked]] Borvo's freighter in revenge and she taunted the Naboo pilot. Tyché subsequently escaped with Borvo back to [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]] in the cockpit module when Sykes destroyed the ship.

name: Versé/Legends
description: Like all the other [[handmaiden]]s, Versé was trained in self-defense and marksmanship. Her rigorous training was supervised by [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala's]] head of security, [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Gregar Typho/Legends|Typho]].<ref>''[[Star Wars: The Official Starships & Vehicles Collection 28]]''</ref>In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Amidala was en route to the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] for the vote on the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]], which she was firmly opposed to. Versé accompanied her fellow handmaiden, [[Cordé/Legends|Cordé]], to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] while the latter was impersonating Amidala and their mistress was posing as a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] flying escort for the [[J-type diplomatic barge/Legends|Naboo Royal Cruiser]]. Upon their arrival, Versé, Cordé, and five [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Naboo guards]] were [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|assassination attempt]] meant for Amidala, courtesy of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]].<ref name="AOTC" />

name: Arrianya Bel Iblis
description: The daughter of a well off Core family, Bel Iblis supported [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] for the stabilization he brought to the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]]. This drove a wedge between the married couple, who often argued over Palpatine's use of power. She, along with the Bel Iblis children, perished on [[Anchoron]] when a bomb meant for her husband detonated at the [[Treitamma Political Center]].It was this deliberate act of assassination that drove Garm Bel Iblis into fully backing the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], and even becoming one of the Rebellion's more prominent leaders.{{Char-stub}}

name: Besany Wennen
description: She posed as a [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] (GAR) Logistics worker on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], in order to investigate [[Vinna Jiss]], who was suspected of misappropriating supplies. While undercover, she developed a friendship with [[RC-5108/8843|Corr]], a [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone trooper]] who lost his hands while disarming a bomb and was transferred to a civilian post until he received higher-quality prosthetics that would allow him to return to the front. Corr's prosthetic hands caused her to feel sorry for the clone troopers; she felt that the government used the clones as a "slave army." After Jiss was covertly eliminated, she helped with [[Kal Skirata]]'s [[Mission to Coruscant (Clone Wars)|classified mission]] to uncover terrorists in Coruscant's [[The Works/Legends|The Works]]. By the end of Skirata's mission, she and the [[Null ARC trooper]] [[Ordo Skirata|Ordo]] began showing interest in each other.In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]] Skirata asked her to acquire some information from the Republic and had [[Mereel Skirata|Mereel]] supply her with a small [[Merr-Sonn Munitions, Inc./Legends|Merr-Sonn]] blaster for her protection. She was able to acquire the information and began investigating further but was warned by an unknown [[Gurlanin]] that she was being watched and should not dig any deeper.<ref name="TZ" /> When [[Fi Skirata|RC-8015 (Fi)]] was injured on [[Gaftikar]], Kal Skirata asked Wennen to keep an eye on him while he was being treated in a private hospital. When she arrived, the medical droid had diagnosed him as brain dead and was about to euthanize him. She drew her blaster and locked herself in the room with Fi. [[CSF]] officer [[Jaller Obrim]] arrived shortly after and took her and Fi to safety. Besany joined Kal Skirata's team, regularly supplying them with Treasury information, and looking after [[Darman Skirata]]'s son, young [[Venku Skirata]].One day on her way home, she saw a man stalking her in the [[Transparisteel/Legends|transparisteel]] walls of [[Galos Mall]]. Certain that he was a Republic Intel agent, the Chancellors "Hands," she tried to shake him off. However, she made a mistake and instead of sticking with the crowds, she inadvertently walked into a deserted location of the city. As she was about to confront the agent, another man following him grabbed him from behind, who turned out to be Captain Ordo. Following that incident, Ordo proposed to her in [[Besany Wennen's apartment|her apartment]] in the middle of supper, offering her a multimillion-[[Galactic Credit Standard|credit]] Sharoni sapphire pin since he didn't have a ring. She accepted the proposal. She later had a section of the sapphire put into a wedding ring, and the rest of the sapphire was sold to add to Kal Skirata's clone research funding. Also after this she left her apartment and moved into the slums, into [[Laseema's apartment]], the secret Skirata safehouse.Skirata assigned two of his Null adopted sons, Mereel and [[Jaing Skirata]], as "fundraisers" for his research into stopping the clone rapid aging, to give his boys a natural life. Agent Besany Wennen, now [[Ordo Skirata]]'s new wife, had previously given Kal and the Nulls her national Republic Treasury access codes, so they could research where new clones were coming from to get new cloning research material and to see where the war was going. Upon Jaing's data-mining worm virus being discovered, the Republic Treasury launched a full investigation. The Republic special investigators brought in were Mereel and Jaing, their involvement in the actions that caused the investigations unknown to the GAR. Jaing and Mereel's investigations revealed no results, as they had erased their and Besany's tracks in the system as they went along, and they would have to check Army databases in addition to treasury databases to see how far this "mystery program" went. The Republic agreed to give the Nulls full access to all GAR records. While the Null investigation found nothing, the droid investigation revealed questionable access made by one of Besany's co-workers, [[Jilka Zan Zentis]], investigating a government shell company on Besany's request. Besany felt awful that her friend Jilka was imprisoned because of her. Later a [[Gurlanin]] [[Spy/Legends|spy]] told Besany that Jilka was framed, and the actions made on Jilka's terminal were made obvious by the Gurlanins so the GAR wouldn't see any of Besany or Skirata's sons' actions. Besany was upset her friend was going to prison in her place, but Ordo and Skirata didn't understand why. Skirata ordered Jilka to be broken out of jail, her prison transport hijacked by Ordo and [[Wad'e Tay'haai]].Besany evacuated Coruscant and moved to Mandalore with the Skirata clan. Much later, when [[Kal Skirata]] was forced to abandon Darman and [[RC-1309|Niner]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] directly after [[Etain Tur-Mukan]] was killed, she was instrumental in helping Kal overcome his grief. She related to Kal often on the subject of remembering their fathers, and how Kal was her new father.<ref name="O66" />

name: Shal'mak
description: Shal'mak's heritage consists of a long line of crime lords. Shal'mak's position was inherited from her uncle who inherited it from his second cousin, she later passed on the position of [[Vigo/Legends|Vigo]] to her son [[Kreet'ah]].Shal'mak possessed inate empathic abilities which aided her criminal activities making her a very dangerous foe. The [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] employed Shal'mak mostly for money laundering and other financial operations. On a mission to [[Ralltiir/Legends|Ralltiir]] Shal'mak had been directed by the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] to reclaim the fortress of [[Alexi Garyn]] after it had been overran by a local syndicate. Shal'mak also worked under the direction of [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Skahtul
description: [[File:SkahtulStalksSkywalker-ShadowSyndicate.jpg|left|thumb|Skahtul, following [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]].]]{{Quote|At last, Skywalker, we meet.|Skahtul|The Shadow Syndicate}}When the [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]] of the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] posted bounty on [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] head, Skahtul had accepted the contract. She tracked Skywalker to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] where, in a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], met an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] operative, who would provide her with backup. The two planned to ambush Skywalker when he would approach Xizor, observing the [[Mos Espa Circuit|Mos Espa Race]]. [[Xizor Transport Company]] had provided several large luxury sand barges from which spectators could watch the race; Skahtul was allowed onto Xizor's personal barge, where she waited for Skywalker to arrive.<ref name="DS" />After finally spotting the young [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], Skahtul stepped in front of him, armed with a heavy blaster pistol. However, Skywalker was more then ready for the encounter, because he had lured the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] into his trap, and not the other way around. During the battle an errant blaster bolt hit the steering vane for the sail barge, and it began to careen out of control. Following the barge's crash into sand, Skahtul saw no sign of the Jedi, but was determined to continue her pursuit.<ref name="DS" />In [[3 ABY/Legends|3.5 ABY]], Skahtul led a [[Skahtul's coalition|coalition]] of bounty hunters to [[Kothlis/Legends|Kothlis]], where they finally captured Luke Skywalker. Skywalker was wanted dead by Xizor, but alive by Vader. As such, Skahtul kept Skywalker in a compound on Kothlis while she tried to get the highest price out of them. This backfired, as Skywalker escaped the compound with the help of [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]].<ref name="sote">[[Shadows of the Empire (novel)|''Shadows of the Empire'']]</ref>[[4 ABY/Legends|A year later]], Skahtul was on [[Hurd's Moon]] and met with [[Savan]], the niece of Xizor, who was on a mission to capture the [[Human replica droid]] [[Guri]]. Guri was under the protection of her creator, the droid scientist [[Massad Thrumble]]. Skahtul advised Savan to wait until Guri left before launching her attack, though Savan ignored her.<ref name="Evolution">''[[Shadows of the Empire: Evolution]]''</ref>

name: Tamith Kai
description: When the [[Great Canyon Clan]] on [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] allied with [[Brakiss]]'s [[Shadow Academy]], Tamith Kai volunteered herself to be Brakiss's liaison and eventually became the Shadow Academy's assistant instuctor. She was responsible for recruiting, combat training and discipline.Tamith Kai trained her students and bided her time until the order was given in [[23 ABY/Legends|23 ABY]] to start taking more students by force. She spearheaded the raid on [[GemDiver Station]] and engineered the kidnapping the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] trainees [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]], [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]] and [[Lowbacca]]. She and Brakiss split the new recruits among themselves.After Lowbacca and Jaina disrupted one of Brakiss's lectures, Brakiss decided that the training of the new recruits would be split between himself and Tamith Kai. She would train Lowbacca, who had demonstrated that he was quick to anger when Brakiss punished Jaina for her insubordination. Tamith Kai planned to use the young Wookiee's short temper to lure him to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]], resorting to [[Torture/Legends|torture]]. When Lowbacca gave in to his anger, smashing a [[sonic generator]] beyond repair, Tamith Kai rewarded him by giving a reprogrammed [[M-TD|Em Teedee]] back to him. The little translator [[Droid/Legends|droid's]] increased level of capacity for annoyance and newfound loyalty to the Second Imperium had the opposite of the intended effect on Lowbacca, however.[[File:Tamith Kai JATM.jpg|thumb|left|Tamith Kai wielding a lightsaber.]]Brakiss and Tamith Kai's efforts were in vain, as the plot was foiled by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka]]. As the twins and Lowbacca made their escape, Tamith Kai confronted Tenel Ka, promising to turn her to the dark side after killing the young warrior girl's friends. Tenel Ka responded by wounding Tamith Kai's knee. This confrontation created a strong sense animosity between the two [[Witches of Dathomir|Dathomiri]].In the wake of that debacle, Brakiss decided that capturing such high profile candidates would only lead to unwanted attention. The Shadow Academy would instead rely on the disadvantaged youths of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and other worlds to fill the ranks of the [[Second Imperium]]. If they were [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], then they could be trained as [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] and if not, they could still be useful as [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] or [[TIE pilot]]s.Along with [[Garowyn]], Tamith Kai took her new apprentice, [[Vilas]], down to the [[Coruscant underworld/Legends|undercity of Coruscant]] to do their work. More often than not, they used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to simply convince their quarry to go with them, but some like [[Zekk]] proved more of a trouble and thus needed to be stunned before being taken to the Shadow Academy. However, he didn't cause any more trouble once he was aboard the [[Space station/Legends|space station]].Tamith Kai took a disliking to Zekk, mainly because he became more proficient in the dark side than her own apprentice Vilas. After Zekk had slain Vilas in a contest to determine who was to be the Shadow Academy's [[Darkest Knight]], Tamith Kai became outright hostile towards Zekk. Later, when Brakiss paired them up for a raid on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], Tamith Kai expressed her distrust of the Darkest Knight, not thinking that he was loyal enough. When she found out that Jacen, Jaina, Tenel Ka and Lowbacca were on Kashyyyk, she tried to make Zekk prove his loyalty. She reasoned that if he was loyal, Zekk would kill his former friends without a doubt in his mind. When he failed to do so, her distrust of him went even deeper.Shortly thereafter, both Zekk and Tamith Kai were selected to lead the [[Third Battle of Yavin|assault on the Jedi Praxeum]]. While Zekk chose to lead the Dark Jedi forces on ground, Tamith Kai chose to lead from a floating platform. After a duel with Tenel Ka, the floating platform she was on was sabotaged by the warrior girl. The platform then crashed into a river, killing Tamith Kai.

name: Cathea
description: During the [[Battle of Ylesia]], which took place during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Cathea and other children such as [[Kryss P'teska]], [[Aeron]] and [[Tym]] were abandoned by their parents who have been enthralled by the [[Exultation]]. Cathea and the children hid together in a basement and were eventually found by [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] after the raid.Since the building was set to explode through demolition bombs in only a matter of minutes, the rescuers had no other option but to take them with themselves.Whereas [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] intended to drop the children off at the next [[spaceport]], [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] advocated for taking them to [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]].Having been tasked by the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] to bring a load of [[Spice/Legends|spice]] from [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]] to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], they were discovered by an [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial patrol]]. Cathea and three other children helped [[Han Solo/Legends|Han]] to jettison the illegal cargo in order to evade arrest. The [[Smuggler/Legends|Smuggler]] convinced the [[Imperials]] that he was taking the children to [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]. Since the Captain [[Tybert Capucot]] insisted to escort them, the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|Millennium Falcon]] dropped the children off at [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], thus returning Cathea back to her homeplanet.

name: Kee (Devaronian)
description: {{Quote|Flattery gets you exactly nothing, Imp.|Kee|Legacy 16: Claws of the Dragon, Part 3}}[[File:Keeandchak23.jpg|thumb|left|150px|[[Chak (Wookiee)|Chak]] with Kee.]]When [[Cade Skywalker]] visited [[Rik's Cantina]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in [[137 ABY]], she threatened him with a [[Blaster pistol/Legends|blaster pistol]], hoping he could reveal where her former crew members, [[Jariah Syn]] and [[Deliah Blue]] had absconded with the ''[[Grinning Liar]]'', which they had rented after leaving Cade's employ. Unfortunately, Cade was unable to help her or [[Chak (Wookiee)|Chak]], though he made a joking pass at her.After Cade became enthralled to the [[One Sith|Sith]], Kee along with Chak joined the crew of the Mynock in Cade's rescue as a necessary step to reaquiring the ''Grinning Liar'' which had somehow ended up in the hands of [[Rav]].Kee, along with Chak, Deliah Blue, and Jariah Syn, were later hired by [[Morrigan Corde]] to help rescue Cade, who was her son. She assisted Syn in attaching miniature cameras to [[Yuuzhan Vong]] bugs Corde obtained from the Empire. After three weeks, when they finally managed to locate Cade and his attempt to escape the [[Temple of the Sith]], Kee commented on how he is "chucking [[Darth Talon|Darth Hottie]] out the [[Airlock/Legends|airlock]].Kee flew with Chak, Corde, Blue and Syn in the ''Mynock'' over the Temple. She made a sarcastic joke about one of the craziest things Syn has ever done. The mission ended in Cade's escape from the Sith.She later accompanied Chak, Cade, and Syn in an attempt to get the ''Grinning Liar'' back from Rav. After retrieving the ship, she wished Cade well and asked him to say goodbye to Blue for her.
