When he told her that the two weren't interacting, the Devaronian called him a [[Nerf herder/Legends|nerfherder]] and encouraged him to talk to her.

name: Ar'alani/Legends
description: Shortly before [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]], Ar'alani commanded the force that [[Battle between the Chiss and Yuuzhan Vong|defeated]] a scouting party of [[Yuuzhan Vong]]. Shortly afterward, she arrived at [[Crustai]] to intervene in the actions of [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Mitth'raw'nuruodo]] against the [[Vagaari]], and to investigate the appearance of the Human smugglers [[Dubrak Qennto]], [[Maris Ferasi]] and [[Jorj Car'das]]. The Chiss were concerned that the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the Yuuzhan Vong might be in league and coordinating attacks against the [[Chiss Ascendancy/Legends|Chiss Ascendancy]].Despite her frequent clashes with Thrawn over the morality of his tactics, her duplicitous aid enabled the Force Commander to lure the Vagaari into a trap. After Mitth'raw'nuruodo successfully captured a Vagaari 'treasure' ship, she backed him in opposing the [[Chaf family/Legends|Chaf family]], who sought the spoils of war for their own ends. Syndic Mitth'ras'safis 'requested' her to look into the activities of Thrawn after the apparent loss of the ''Whirlwind'', yet she covertly allied herself with Thrawn again, lying to various members of the CEDF about Jorj Car'das when she 'forgave' Thrawn for allowing the 'spy' to escape. In this instance her concern for the safety of the Chiss overrode the strict codes of war forbidding preemptive strikes, as Car'das's escape was a lure designed by Thrawn for the purpose of capturing both the Vagaari and [[Outbound Flight Project]]. Ar'alani was even actively involved in the next phase of the operation; liberating the [[Geroon]] home world. While this may have been an entirely innocent gesture on her part, this is doubtful, as her absence allowed Thrawn to provide data on the Vong to [[Kinman Doriana]], in exchange for his loyalty and assistance in eliminating the Vagaari and the Outbound Flight.

name: Hess'irolia'nuruodo
description: {{Quote|As an officer of the Expansionary Defense Force, I believe it is my duty to ensure the safety and security of the Chiss realm. That directive, as you are well aware, supersedes all others.|[[Commander/Legends|Commander]] Irolia|The New Jedi Order: Force Heretic II: Refugee}}In [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]], Irolia was in command of the [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]] that intercepted the ''[[Jade Shadow]]'' during its mission to the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]], and escorted it to [[Csilla/Legends|Csilla]]. To the eyes of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], she seemed no older than his niece [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina]], then twenty [[Standard year/Legends|years]] old&mdash;she may even have been younger.Irolia claimed to be an [[Officer/Legends|officer]] of the [[Chiss Expansionary Defense Force]], but instead of the predominantly black jumpsuits of most CEDF officers, she wore a burgundy uniform with black flashes, a color-scheme previously only seen among troops from [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn's]] rogue [[Household Phalanx]]. Also, her ship was escorted by [[Nssis-class Clawcraft|''Nssis''-class Clawcraft]], hybrid TIE-series starfighters that had previously only been seen in combat with House Phalanx forces.

name: Kambrea
description: Kambrea had recruited many Devaronians into the Diversity Alliance through skilled promotion of its beliefs including punishing the [[Human/Legends|Human]] species for their atrocities under the [[Humanocentrism|Humanocentric]] [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] [[New Order/Legends|New Order]].Following reports of Diversity Alliance atrocities on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], including keeping Humans slaves at the [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]] mines and stockpiling weapons, a [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] inspection team was sent to the planet. Kambrea then took them on a propaganda tour of a large city on Ryloth. However, after the tour, [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] - the leader of the inspection team - insisted on visiting the ryll mine where it had been alleged that the Diversity Alliance was keeping Human slaves. Unfortunately, the Humans had been replaced by zealous [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] workers from the surrounding cities. Despite this, the other members of the inspection team [[Lusa]], [[Sirrakuk]] and [[Cilghal]] insisted on visiting the loading dock.There, Kambrea claimed that the crates there were food and medicinal supplies for alien colonies which she claimed that the New Republic had abandoned. Knowing they were actually storing weapons, and in frustration, Sirraluk smashed open a crate marked "food", exposing the weapons inside. In response, Kambrea ordered her troops to open fire and a gunbattle ensued. During the [[Battle of Ryloth (Diversity Alliance Crisis)|battle]], Kambrea was crushed by a wall of crates, thus killing her.

name: Vien'sai'Malloc
description: Vien'sai'Malloc was known as one of the incorruptible senators in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]]. However, this was not so; after the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she disagreed with [[President]] [[Aven'sai'Ulrahk]]'s policy of siding with the Republic, and secretly began establishing a [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] base on the [[Blue Mountains]], allowing the [[Confederate Navy]] to disrupt Republic resupply missions along the [[Corellian Trade Spine/Legends|Corellian Trade Spine]].[[File:Aurra_Vien-sai-Malloc.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Aurra Sing makes her point to Vien.]]Six months after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], Elsah discovered what her colleague was doing, and planned to tell the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. Vien hired [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]] to assassinate Elsah, as well as take care of the Jedi task force that had been sent to Devaron to investigate. When [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[An'ya Kuro]] and [[Tholme/Legends|Tholme]] went undercover, Vien revealed the coordinates of the Separatist base to Secura and was later arrested. Despite her wish for a trial by her peers in the Senate, President Aven'sai'Ulrahk sentenced her to [[Death/Legends|death]].

name: Dagga Marl
description: In exchange for one kilogram of [[Glitterstim/Legends|glitterstim]]&mdash;which had virtually replaced other currency on [[Ylesia/Legends|Ylesia]]&mdash;every week, plus a bonus if he required her to kill someone, Marl kept a close eye on Sal-Solo, which she considered a challenge. Earlier in her career, she had worked as an [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] for the Ylesian Senate, and as a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]].<ref name="NJOY">''[[The New Jedi Order: Ylesia]]''</ref>

name: Klis Joo
description: Born to [[Duros/Legends|Duros]] parents on the world of [[Duro/Legends|Duro]], even as a child Klis Joo demonstrated a general aptitude in the use of technology that was common to her species. During her very early years of childhood, Joo was identified to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and sent to the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. At the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]], Joo befriended fellow [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] [[Nerra Ziveri]], and the pair eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] the academy and were selected as [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]] by two [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]]. Under her tutor, Joo traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], learning to temper her emotions and using her persistent nature to eventually pass the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]]. Made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Knight of the Republic]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], Joo went onto to pursue individual studies in the ways of the [[Jedi Consular]].<ref name="g" />Traveling around the galaxy on solo missions for the High Council, Joo returned to her homeworld in an attempt to learn more about her people's struggles and aid them in whatever way she could. However, it wasn't long before Joo became uncomfortable when confronted with her people's deference and she soon returned to Coruscant. Around this time, Joo met [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] mechanic [[Bran Isken]], appreciating his skills and commending him for aiding a Duros couple in need.<ref name="g" /> After working out of Coruscant for a time, Joo's old friend and peer Master Ziveri invited the Duros to teach at the experimental [[Almas Academy|academy]] on [[Almas]]. Accepting the invitation, Joo arrived in [[53 BBY/Legends|53 BBY]] only to find that Ziveri had mysteriously left the academy. Again growing uncomfortable with her situation, Joo found teaching dull and often grew impatient with her students.<ref name="g" />Making frequent visits to the nearby settlement of [[Forard]], a small town servicing the academy's needs, Joo quickly accepted the office of [[Governor/Legends|governor]] when the position was left vacant after her predecessor passed away. Striving to improve conditions in the small town, Joo raised funding to expand and upgrade the local [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]], bring the facility up to high standards with twenty berthing bays. To fill the empty position of mechanic magister, Joo contacted her old friend Bran Isken, offering him the job which he accepted.<ref name="g" />

name: Zeami
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Near-Human]], Zeami was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. A member of a [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|Initiate clan]] under the instruction of [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]], Zeami befriended fellow [[Jedi Initiate]] [[Iguni]] at a young age. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], Zeami constructed a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] which she would wield in battle.<ref name="EE" />When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Zeami took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. During the final year of the war, Zeami was stationed on Coruscant when [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] launched a [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|surprise attack]] on the capital world. Alongside Padawans Iguni and [[Zoi]], Zeami rushed out to join in the fray despite orders to remain at the Temple after being convinced by Iguni it was the right thing to do. Together with her peers, Zeami helped take out several [[B2 super battle droid/Legends|B2 super battle droids]], [[Octuptarra combat tri-droid]]s and at least one [[DSD1 dwarf spider droid/Legends|DSD1 dwarf spider droid]] before both she and Zoi were injured. Upon seeing his friend injured, Iguni took hold of her limp body and created a [[Telekinesis/Legends|whirlwind]] in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] which surrounded the two of them and damaged everything nearby, including Zoi.<ref name="EE" />[[File:Zeami Hurt.jpg|thumb|left|Zeami, injured during the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]].]]It was at this point that Iguni's [[Jedi Master/Legends|master]], [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]], arrived and ordered Iguni to return to the Temple and take his friends with him, as he was causing more harm than good. Zeami was then taken to the [[Halls of Healing]], where she was treated for her wounds. Iguni soon visited her to apologize for his actions and, though she forgave him, he vowed to grow stronger in the Force so that he could protect his friends. Zeami went back to her training along with her friends, where both she and Zoi would often check up on Iguni as he practiced his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] techniques with Master Windu. It was soon after this that Iguni had a [[Force vision/Legends|vision]] of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] killing many Jedi and turning to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]].<ref name="EE" />

name: Maris Ferasi
description: Maris Ferasi was born on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] during the last decades of [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She was idealistic and believed the galactic government to be corrupted. To protest against the corruption, Ferasi hooked up with small-time [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Dubrak Qennto]], a fellow Corellian. During her time on board Qennto's [[Starship/Legends|ship]] ''[[Bargain Hunter]]'', Ferasi became accustomed to Qennto's temperament. Around [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]] Ferasi and Qennto were joined by third member of the crew, [[Jorj Car'das]], who acted as a [[Navigator/Legends|navigator]].<ref name="OBF" />When the group was transporting furs and hidden [[firegem]]s to a [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] gangster named [[Drixo]], [[Progga]]&mdash;Drixo's rival&mdash;ambushed the ''Bargain Hunter''. To escape the Hutt, the smuggling group made a risky jump into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]], but their [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] [[Engine/Legends|engine]] was damaged, stranding them far into the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]] of the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. Progga had followed their jump and moved to attack them again, but instead both ships fell under attack from a [[Picket Force Two|local patrol]]. ''Bargain Hunter'' was captured in a [[Conner net|shock net]], which disabled the ship's electronic systems, while Progga's ship was destroyed. The leader of the patrol, [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Mitth'raw'nuruodo]] of the [[Chiss Expansionary Defense Force]], captured Ferasi and her two companions, taking them and their ship to his [[Crustai base|base]] in [[Crustai system]].<ref name="OBF" />During her stay at the base, Ferasi became fascinated by the [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] commander, which caused friction between her and Qennto. Together with Car'das, Ferasi attended language lessons with Thrawn&mdash;the two Humans teaching [[Galactic Basic Standard|basic]] to the commander, who taught them Chiss language [[Cheunh/Legends|Cheunh]] and local trade-language [[Minnisiat]], in return.<ref name="OBF" />Maris asked to accompany Thrawn and Car'das when they went to investigate the [[Battle of the Geroon homeworld|Vagaari attack]]. Thrawn decided to accommodate her, and she and Car'das accompanied him on the ''[[Springhawk/Legends|Springhawk]]''. Maris supported Thrawn even when he attempted capture of one of the Vagaari's [[Gravity well projector/Legends|Gravity-well projectors]]; a dangerous task. At one point during the battle Thrawn called for a close-up on the [[Hull/Legends|hull]] of one of the opposing [[Vagaari warship|warships]] and discovered that in each of the [[Zero-g plastic bubble]]s a slave was held. When Maris saw this she ordered Thrawn to find a way to destroy the warships without hurting the slaves, and then got mad at him when he said he could not. She soon forgot about it, however, when there appeared a sudden flash of light and subsequent disintegration of part of the canopy. When the dust cleared, she saw Thrawn laying on the floor, wounded, with a tear in his [[Enviro-suit|Vacc suit]]. She and Car'das rushed to him and tried to fix the rip with a [[Sealant patch]], but it would not stick to the material. Maris went chest-to-chest with Thrawn to stop the air from leaking out of his suit with her hands clasped behind his back. She stayed this way until two Chiss came with a bigger patch and transported him to a medical room. One of them declared that she had saved Thrawn's life, and Thrawn himself expressed his gratitude to her when he was better.When they returned to base, they discovered Qennto's aggressive behavior had gotten him thrown in the brig. She convinced them to release him, but Qennto knew about Maris's 'esteem' for Thrawn and became so hostile that both he and Mavis were assigned escorts whenever they tried to leave their room.When Maris and [[Dubrak Qennto]] returned to Republic space after the destruction of ''[[Outbound Flight]]'', they managed to pay back their debt to Drixo and continue their smuggling activities. It is unknown what happened to her after that, but at one point Zahn had planned to let her join the Rebellion.<blockquote>"''I thought about doing a trilogy before [the] Legends [changeover] was done—I’ve forgotten her name, but the young woman in Outbound Flight who becomes very close to Thrawn. I had an idea where she would eventually work with the Rebel Alliance using some of Thrawn’s techniques and details and such. That will never come to pass now. But I would like to see—she has some good possibilities. Bringing her back would be interesting." ''<ref>Interview with Timothy Zahn: https://www.dailydot.com/parsec/star-wars-timothy-zahn-expanded-universe-awesome-con-interview/</ref></blockquote>Ferasi, along with [[Jorj Car'das]], would later be known to the Chiss as [[The Visitors]] due to their teaching Basic to the Chiss while they were guests/captives of Commander Thrawn.

name: Nima'tar
description: Nima'tar was the lead singer in a band, which had toured [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and ended up playing for [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. She toured with the band to pay for her tuition and the time to share her thesis.During their performance, she witnessed [[Unidentified Twi'lek slave girl|another twi'lek girl]] defy Jabba and being fed to [[Jabba's rancor|his pet rancor]].Her band sold her into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] to get off-world and Nima'tar remained Jabba's slave, working on her thesis. When [[Oola/Legends|Oola]] first arrived at the [[Jabba's Palace|palace]], Nima'tar began to fear for her own life, knowing that Jabba was going to replace her. She managed to escape with many of the notes she had taken, with the help of [[Tamtel Skreej/Legends|Tamtel Skreej]].

name: Bogg Tyrell/Legends
description: [[File:Seboca Bogg.png|thumb|left|220px|Bogg and Seboca during the chase between Anakin Skywalker, Obi-Wan Kenobi and Zam Wesell]]Bogg was known to enjoy wealth and the high life during her time on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. She even dated [[Dug/Legends|Dug]] holostar [[Seboca/Legends|Seboca]]; the two were joyriding in an [[Airspeeder/Legends|airspeeder]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]] when they were almost hit by [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] dangling from [[ASN-121/Legends|ASN-121]], after the failed attempt to assassinate [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala]]. Afterwards, Bogg went to get a drink at [[Dex's Diner/Legends|Dex's Diner]], coincidentally leaving the café&mdash;apparently inebriated&mdash;shortly after Obi-Wan entered the establishment looking for information on the weapon that had killed [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]].

name: Tannis (Jedi)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Omwati/Legends|Omwati]], Tannis was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] after being located on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], Tannis was appointed as [[Headmaster/Legends|Headmistress]] of the [[Teyan Praxeum]], a [[Jedi academy]] on the planet [[Teya IV]]. A proponent of initiating all Forceful [[Sentience/Legends|sentients]] within the Order, Tannis served as a [[Jedi recruiter|recruiter]] and often traveled the galaxy to find new students to train with her on Teya IV. During her travels to [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] in [[4000 BBY]], Tannis discovered a family with two Forceful children living near [[Lir Lake]]. Testing both [[Vici Ramunee|Vici]] and [[Veni Ramunee]], she deemed them eligible for Jedi training and took them to the Teyan Academy to learn the ways of the Jedi.<ref name="TMDF" />

name: Brusela
description: [[Renn Tharen]], wanting to honor his mother and mother-in-law both, yet not wanting his daughter to be stuck with either of their names, combined the first syllables of their names, Brusela and [[Iaphagena]], to make Bria.

name: Tyresi Gurtt
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Gurtt was a [[Eyttyrmin Batiiv]] [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] serving along [[Jacob Nive]]. She later became a [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] and became a crew member of the ''[[Invidious]]'' after the [[Second Battle of Xa Fel]], under the command of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Leonia Tavira]]. When [[Corran Horn]] and a group of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] attack the [[Starship/Legends|ship]], Gurtt was offered immunity with her cooperation.{{Char-stub}}

name: Caet Shrovl
description: She was raised on [[Uvena III]], her mother's home, although she was not from that planet. As a result, she was largely alone in her upbringing. She joined the [[Khuiumin Survivors]] in search of her mate. Her rare condition made her extremely sensitive to sunlight to the point she wore a heavy cloak and darkened goggles during the day to protect herself. However, this made her particularly skilled in [[Starfighter combat/Legends|dogfights]] that took place in areas of [[Realspace/Legends|realspace]] that were devoid of natural light, referred to as "[[voidfight]]s".[[Corran Horn]] met her while he masqueraded as [[Jenos Idanian]], a pilot that flew for the Survivors. Their first meeting came while Corran was trying to portray himself as a bully and threw his neighbor out of the nicer apartment next to him. Her fang-filled snarl when she answered his pounding announcement at her door evoked a "nice to meet you" from Corran who quickly went on his way.Their next encounter was after he flew a pirate mission with her. They crossed, as Corran forced her to allow a crippled opponent to escape, and Corran received a scar and a little respect for his efforts. The two of them, along with [[Timmser]] &mdash; another Survivor pilot, ended up becoming good friends and spending much of their free time together. The pair shared their plights and reasons for being among the [[Invids]], though out of necessity, Jenos' reason for being there was slightly different from that of Horn's. Under Horn's tutelage she became a much better pilot; he was even able to get her to open up about her reclusiveness and found out that she had been taken advantage of by [[Remart Sasyru]], yet another Survivor pilot and nemesis of Idanian.Caet, along with Timmser, taunted Corran/Jenos about the fact that he was jealous about Leonia Tavira's favoring Sasyru instead of him, a point which Corran at first flatly denied. These taunts, however, coupled with the wise statements of the [[Caamasi]] [[Elegos A'Kla]] forced Corran into introspection, and ultimately allowed him to steer clear of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|Dark Side's]] temptations that Tavira embodied.When Corran terrorized the [[Courkrus]]'s hive of Invid pirate crews, she along with Timmser fled the planet in a [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]]-equipped [[Clutch (fighter)|Tri-fighter]].

name: Marfa Thorbin
description: Born on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], Marfa Thorbin attended an off-[[Planet/Legends|world]] [[University/Legends|university]], studying to become an aquatic [[xenologist]] with the intention of exploring [[Ocean/Legends|oceanic]] planets. While at university, she met and fell in love with [[Kane Griggs]]. After several years they agreed to become married, and she went home to inform her parents. While there, she and her family were [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the [[destruction of Alderaan]] by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire's]] [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Rillao
description: Upon witnessing Hethrir sentencing their [[Planet/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Firrerre/Legends|Firrerre]] to death and learning about Darth Vader's plans to turn their unborn child to the dark side, Rillao fled to a remote planet. She evaded capture for years and raised her son, [[Tigris]], who had been born without a connection to the Force. Eventually, Hethrir caught up with Rillao, putting her into a [[Torture/Legends|torture]] net on one of his [[Sleeper ship/Legends|sleeper ships]] and kidnapping Tigris. Fourteen years after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], [[Leia Organa Solo]] came upon Rillao while searching for her own missing children, convincing her to help her deal with Hethrir.After being reunited with Tigris, who Hethrir brainwashed into thinking his mother was a traitor who stole any Force potential Tigris may have had, and the defeat of Hethrir, mother and son chose to reacquaint themselves with each other, though the boy was hostile at first.

name: Halla
description: The eccentric, Force-sensitive, old woman Halla lived on [[Mimban/Legends|Mimban]] where she was popular with the mining community. The [[Temple of Pomojema]] was known to hold the legendary [[Kaiburr crystal]], which she much sought; she spent seven years searching, often asking natives in return for [[Alcohol/Legends|alcoholic]] beverages.Claiming to be a master of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], she struck a deal with [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] for them to help her find the crystal; if they did, Halla would help them get off the planet [[Mimban/Legends|Mimban]] on which they were stranded. She soon had to rescue Luke and Leia from a prison cell by using the Force to guide a food tray over to open the cell, and she later joined Luke and Leia to speed through the swampy lands of Mimban in a stolen craft, only to be encountered by a fearsome [[wandrella]].Halla escaped, and found Luke and Leia in a [[Thrella]] well. She instructed them to make their way through a tunnel in the well to meet up with her on the other side. Halla made her way to the opposite end of the tunnel, went down in it, but was then captured by the [[Coway]]. She was tied up and forced to watch Luke battle a Coway. When Luke won, Halla was released.She feasted with the Coway, but soon Luke sensed the Dark Lord's approach. The Coway and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]] fought a fierce underground battle until the Coway won, and Halla traveled with Luke and Leia to find the crystal at the temple. There she took it and gave it to Luke, who, after defeating [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and healing Leia's wounds, gave it back to her. She then left Mimban with Luke and Leia to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], though not before admitting to Luke that rather than being a master of the Force, she was really a faker and a charlatan, capable of doing "parlor tricks" but little more.

name: Zan Pike
description: [[File:Zanpike.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Zan Pike]]Zan and Zu were born in [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], the daughters of famous [[Teräs Käsi/Legends|Teräs Käsi]] fighter [[Dux Pike]]. He died when they were infants, just before the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. [[Dux Pike's wife|Their mother]] was a [[Bunduki/Legends|Bunduki]] [[Noble/Legends|noble]], who arranged for their education by the [[Followers of Palawa]].Zan and Zu went on to become Teräs Käsi masters themselves, and criminals for the highest bidder. She fought beside her sister in illegal fighting matches across the [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]] had them hired to work for [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]]. Following his death, they signed on to work with [[Spinda Caveel]], who sent them to acquire [[A-OIC]] and, later, to re-acquire him and the [[Human replica droid]] [[Guri]]. On this latter expedition, they encountered the [[Heroes of Yavin/Legends|Heroes of Yavin]], and decided to cut their losses, quitting their employment with Caveel. When he drew his blaster to keep them on task, they killed him.She co-owned the ''[[Steel Hand]]'', a two-person starfighter, with her sister, though Zu was its pilot.

name: Umolly Darm
description: She was one of the people that found [[Tsil]]s to sell to [[Loronar Corporation]]. When she learned of their sentience, she gladly gave up searching for them and joined the [[Theran Listener]] [[Be]] in search of [[Rock ivory]] and other minerals to sell in small quantities offworld. She also gave [[Callista Ming]] a ride off of Nam Chorios.{{Char-stub}}

name: Jonava Billane
description: Presuming the child's parents to be dead in the groundquake of [[Ord Thoden]], a team of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] rescue workers found the child in the ruins of the Ord Thoden capital [[Domitree]]. The Jedi found the child to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and decided to train her in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].When Jonava had recovered and learned that the child had survived, she traveled to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in order to reunite with her beloved daughter. However, the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] rejected her petition arguing that they would not give her back her child, now named "Aris-Del Wari", because it was too dangerous now that her mind had been opened to the Force.The case went public, gaining her many supporters [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxywide]]. She would eventually appear on the [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]]-based talkshow ''[[Essence]]'' to tell her story. Her particular episode was seen by over 25 billion [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] viewers and gained her much support. During the show she broke into tears four times, gaining even more sympathy galaxywide than before. She thanked all her supporters and also revealed that she had authorized a full-length holo feature based on her story.Notable supporters of Jonava's cause were the [[People's Inquest]], [[Garox Tronten]], and thousands of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscanti]] university students. The latter even tried to invade the [[Jedi Temple]].When Ludi was moved to the [[Jedi academy]] on [[Kamparas]], Jonava was too busy reviewing casting auditions for holo feature that would tell the story of her and "Baby Ludi" to comment on it publicly.

name: Myrette Davani
description: Davani was born on [[Beheboth]] to a veteran of the Clone Wars.<ref name="EGWCut10">''[http://www.starwars.com/news/star-wars-the-essential-guide-to-warfare-authors-cut-part-10-the-rise-of-the-empire Star Wars: The Essential Guide to Warfare Author’s Cut, Part 10: The Rise of the Empire]''</ref> She enrolled in the [[Coruscani Pilot Institute]] training to become a [[TIE pilot]], and became best friends with her classmate [[Lumiya|Shira Brie]]. In [[0 ABY/Legends|0.5 ABY]] she left CPI, second in her class behind Shira, and they transferred to the [[Academy of Carida]] for their final year, where they remained bunkmates and close friends.In one training battle with [[Mountain Terrain Scout Transport|MT-STs]], Brie's vehicle was armed with fully-operational weapons, which killed a dozen enemy cadets. Horrified, Davani informed her parents. Unbeknownst to her, Brie had been selected by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] for training in the dark side of the force.Davani graduated salutatorian from the [[Naval Academy]] and served with the 722nd "Copperheads" and served in flight ops on the ''[[Attaintor]]''. She attained the rank of [[Flight Captain]] and flew as [[Soontir Fel]]'s wingman in the [[181st Imperial Fighter Wing]].<ref name="EGWCut10" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Nubyl
description: Nubyl was restored to full functionality by the same [[Unidentified Outer Rim cyberneticist|doctor]] who enhanced [[Durge]] and [[Jaing]]. Her cybernetic enhancements included a powered wheelchair, a pair of robotic arms, a mind-machine neural interface, her mouth covered with a breather, and her left eye replaced with a droid sensor.After the surgery of Durge and Jaing was complete, she underwent ever further cyborgization. Only her shoulders and head remained intact, fitted to the upper body of the doctor's enhanced [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]]. While in this body, Nubyl would spar with the other patients to test the capabilities of their combat enhancements.She was battling Durge and Jaing in this manner when the doctor's surgical center was attacked by [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]]. When driving them out of the lab, she was hit by the blast from a [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonator]] and was thrown to the floor. Though her injuries appeared severe, the doctor seemed confident that he could repair her.

name: Jinart
description: During [[Omega Squad]]'s mission on Qiilura, Jinart helped a great deal. She helped [[Etain Tur-Mukan]] obtain shelter, and guided [[Darman Skirata|Darman]] towards the rest of [[Omega Squad]]. She also scouted areas needed to be explored by the Omegas. Jinart would later go to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in an attempt to force the Republic into moving the settlers and [[Clone trooper/Legends|Clone troopers]] off of Qiilura. During her attempt, she took the form of [[Vinna Jiss]] who, unbeknownst to her, had been killed by [[Walon Vau]] causing confusion in ARC trooper [[Ordo Skirata|Ordo]] who fired on her, severely wounding her as she followed [[Besany Wennen]]. She was brought back to [[Qibbu's Hut]] for healing from Etain and [[Bardan Jusik]] and was bitter about being shot. Jinart provided much needed information to Omega and [[Delta Squad/Legends|Delta Squads]] during their black op on Coruscant on the one condition that the Republic would remove the Clone troopers and settlers from Qiilura, even after being threatened that Qiilura would be reduced to molten slag if she didn't cooperate by [[Kal Skirata]]. Kal would later call on Jinart for aid after learning of Etain's pregnancy, and had Jinart hide Etain on Qiilura long enough for her to have her and Darman's [[Venku Skirata|child]].Like Etain, Jinart was generally afraid of Skirata and believed him when he said he would turn Qiilura to slag if she didn't cooperate. She believed Etain should have told the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] of her pregnancy and leave the order as she believed it would be better for her child, something Etain refused. She was also greatly against letting Skirata raise the child. During the removal of the colonists from Qiilura, Jinart was partly responsible for the deaths of over ten thousand clones after Etain gave them a few more hours to leave the planet, something Jinart told Etain she could have prevented.{{Char-stub}}

name: Morgana Onasi
description: Carth served in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] military during the [[Mandalorian Wars]], leaving Morgana and Dustil on their own. At the end of the war, Carth came back to [[Telos IV|Telos]] with the intention of forever being with his [[Onasi family|family]]. However, at the outset of the [[Jedi Civil War]] Carth reenlisted, feeling that the Republic needed him. Morgana hated this choice, but accepted it.During the war, Telos came under [[Bombing of Telos IV|attack]] by the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith]] fleet. [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Saul Karath]], ordered by [[Darth Malak]], bombarded the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] from orbit as proof of his change of allegiance. Carth arrived with a Republic contingent soon after the bombing to find Morgana near death and Dustil missing. He held her and screamed for the medics, but she died before they arrived.When Carth and Dustil met two years later in the Sith Academy on Korriban, Dustil cited the failure of the Republic in general, and Carth in specific, to protect Morgana as a reason for his turn to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]].

name: Charis Enasteri
description: After the foundation of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], she and her husband hid on [[Rhamalai]] to escape the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]]. While on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]], they had a daughter named [[Nadra Enasteri|Nadra]]. When Nadra was only a [[Standard year/Legends|year]] old, Neth was forced to flee Rhamalai to avoid being caught, leaving his family behind.When the Empire came to Rhamalai in [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], they had no use for the infirm Charis, so they scheduled her for termination.<ref name="TOoR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Nadra Enasteri
description: When she was only a year old, her father was forced to flee [[Rhamalai]] to avoid being caught by [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]], leaving his family behind. Nadra grew up believing her father was dead.She wanted to train as a medic and healer at the [[Bellorin Medical Academy]] on [[Seitia Prime]], but stayed with her ill mother. Nadra mastered [[Zimchai]], and found work as a civilian medic in the local governmental offices.<ref name="TOoR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Nampi
description: [[File:NampiDeath.jpg|thumb|left|The death of Nampi.]]Nampi trapped [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] and his crew aboard a [[Nuffin]] [[Nuffin freighter|freighter]] she owned. Nampi ate Jabba's top aide, [[Scuppa]], to take him as her husband, as Orooturooan mating rituals involved the female eating the male. However, Jabba had put an explosive inside Scuppa's head to use if he betrayed Jabba. When Nampi ate Scuppa, Jabba set off the explosive, which caused Nampi to gruesomely explode. After Nampi's death, Jabba took her [[Freighter/Legends|starship]] to [[Cabrool Nuum]] and tried to give it to him.{{Char-stub}}

name: Elan
description: [[File:PriestessElan.JPG|thumb|left|150px|Priestess Elan]]The youngest daughter of [[High Priest/Legends|High Priest]] [[Jakan]], Elan was a member of the [[Deception sect]], the followers of [[Yun-Harla]]. After the [[Yuuzhan Vong]]'s victory at [[Obroa-skai/Legends|Obroa-skai]], Elan was asked by [[Harrar]] and [[Nom Anor]] to undertake a mission to infiltrate the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] and [[Assassin/Legends|assassinate]] as many of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] as possible.Elan observed a demonstration of the [[bo'tous]] [[Bioweapon/Legends|bioweapon]], an airborne [[Blood/Legends|blood]] agent carried in an assassin's [[Lung/Legends|lungs]], in which an apprentice assassin used it to kill a number of captives before succumbing to it himself. Hoping to bring glory upon herself and her [[domain]], Elan accepted the mission. She and her familiar, [[Vergere]], would pose as defectors seeking political asylum, request a meeting with the Jedi, and then Elan would unleash the bioweapon. Elan even hoped her actions could result in her father being promoted to the rank of [[Mosthigh priest]].The Yuuzhan Vong staged a small [[Battle near Exodo II|defeat]] close to [[Exodo II]] in which Elan and Vergere jettisoned from a ship in a small [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]] and were subsequently apprehended by the light cruiser ''[[Soothfast]]'', where they requested [[Politics/Legends|political]] asylum.The defectors were transferred to [[Bagsho]] on [[Nim Drovis]] where they were taken into custody by Major [[Showolter]] of New Republic Intelligence. Although Showolter believed their defection was highly likely to be a ruse, they were nonetheless transported to [[Wayland/Legends|Wayland]] for debriefing by NRI operatives. Elan was able to relay their destination to Harrar using a [[villip]].On Wayland, Elan was questioned by [[Belindi Kalenda]], [[Joi Eicroth]] and Doctor [[Yintal]]. Elan claimed that as her sect worked closely with the warrior caste by reading auguries and advising which tactics to employ, she would be able to provide valuable information to the New Republic. The interrogation was [[Raid on Wayland (25 ABY)|interrupted]] however when a Yuuzhan Vong assassin burst into the safehouse and attempted to kill Elan before being shot down by Major Showolter. Elan sustained minor injuries but was otherwise unharmed, and Vergere later used her tears to help heal her wounds.The assassination attempt having increased their plausibility, Elan and Vergere were transferred to [[Myrkr/Legends|Myrkr]] with a view to eventually bringing them to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Showolter arranged to take them on to [[Bilbringi system|Bilbringi]] posing as refugees aboard the ''[[Queen of Empire]]'', and helped her pass for [[Human/Legends|Human]].Unfortunately, the [[Peace Brigade]], mercenaries working for the Yuuzhan Vong who were unaware of Elan's true objective, learned of their defection and hatched a plot to retrieve them before their ship reached Bilbringi. They attacked the ''Queen of Empire'' and Showolter was injured. He was forced to hand Elan and Vergere over into the custody of [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], whom he begged to help hide them.[[File:Elan.jpg|thumb|Elan]]Elan was apprehended by the Peace Brigade with the help of a Yuuzhan Vong [[unmasker]] handler. She was taken aboard their shuttle, and they attempted to return her to a nearby Yuuzhan Vong ship. In desperation to prevent the failure of her mission, Elan used the bo'tous to kill everyone in the shuttle, while she and Vergere took refuge in a cabin at the rear. Han boarded the shuttle to find everyone but the two of them dead. Elan suggested the Peace Brigade must have accidentally released the bioweapon themselves. Han grew progressively more suspicious as they escaped in the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']], and decided to load them into an escape pod and return them to their own people. Knowing her deception had failed, Elan attempted to use the bo'tous on him, but inadvertently became trapped in the escape pod with him. Han survived thanks to a [[Survival tool|portable breathing apparatus]] given to him by his youngest son, [[Anakin Solo]], and Elan herself was killed by the toxin.After her death, Nom Anor blamed the mission's failure on Elan and Harrar's inability to improvise.

name: Reiva Carrick
description: {{Quote|But is the order a safe place for a child? Those ''dark'' Jedi&mdash;are they gone for good?|Reiva Carrick, to Vandar Tokare|Knights of the Old Republic 2: Commencement, Part 2}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Reiva Carrick was a native of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Phaeda/Legends|Phaeda]],<ref name="handbook" /> located in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="tea">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> A gardener,<ref name="kotor8">''[[Knights of the Old Republic 8: Flashpoint, Part 2]]''</ref> she [[Marriage/Legends|married]] a [[Banker/Legends|banker]] named [[Arvan Carrick]], with whom she [[Reproduction/Legends|bore]] five children&mdash;[[Zayne Carrick|Zayne]], their only son, was born in [[3982 BBY]]. [[3977 BBY|Just after]] Zayne's fifth [[Birthday/Legends|birthday]], the child, discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], was referred to the [[Jedi Enclave]] on the planet [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]].<ref name="handbook" /> The [[Unidentified Jedi Knight (Zayne Carrick)|Jedi Knight]] who suggested Zayne be taken to Dantooine told Reiva that the boy only had a marginal proclivity to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Although this was confirmed on Dantooine by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vandar Tokare]], the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] were impressed by Zayne's ability to form kinships with the other [[Youngling/Legends|younglings]] at the Enclave. The Jedi's examination of young Zayne took a full morning&mdash;after it was over, Reiva sought Tokare out, hoping to learn more about her son's prospects. Although Reiva was unsure whether the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] was a safe place for her child, remembering the events of the [[Great Sith War]] some [[Time/Legends|time]] before, Tokare assured her that Zayne would be free from danger with the Jedi.<ref name="kotor2" />In [[3964 BBY]], Zayne, now a Jedi [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] in [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] on the planet [[Taris/Legends|Taris]], was accused of [[Padawan Massacre|murdering]] four of his classmates.<ref name="kotor2" /> Zayne went on the run, and word of his alleged crimes eventually reached the [[Carrick family]]. Reiva and her husband did not believe that their son would do such a thing, although it became difficult at home. A few [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] later, Arvan was transferred to the major corporate world of [[Telerath/Legends|Telerath]]&mdash;Reiva and Arvan believed that the opportunity had to do with the news about their son, and they moved to Telerath along with their four daughters. In [[3963 BBY]], Arvan was kidnapped by the [[Moomo Brothers]], a pair of [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]], but was saved by Zayne, who happened to be on Telerath at the time. After the ordeal, Reiva, Arvan and their daughters left Telerath and moved to Dantooine, where Tokare welcomed them with open arms at the Jedi Enclave.<ref name="kotor12">''[[Knights of the Old Republic 12: Reunion, Part 2]]''</ref>

name: Augara Jowil
description: Augara Jowil, or "Augie" as she was known, had been raised in [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo's]] [[Lianorm Swamp/Legends|Lianorm Swamp]] region. She demonstrated significant talent as a [[musikagung]] at an early age, and was hailed as a prodigy. Jowil was sent by her parents to [[Otoh Gunga/Legends|Otoh Gunga]], where she studied<ref name="db" /> for many [[Standard year/Legends|years]]<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|175|Jowil, Augarra "Augie"}}</ref> under [[Great Municipal Band]] leader [[Beezar Pert]], composer of the famed "[[Symponika Crunchen-Grand]]," which chronicled the original formation of the [[Gungan Grand Army/Legends|Gungan Grand Army]].<ref name="db" /> Jowil was among the first to hear the Symponika Crunchen-Grand.<ref name="CSWE" /> After finishing Jowil's instruction, Pert retired, and the members of the Band unanimously voted in his young pupil as his successor, despite her youth and inexperience.<ref name="db" />[[File:Gunganfemale.jpg|thumb|left|Augara witnesses the summit at the Sacred Place.]]In her new role, Jowil never believed that she would be given the opportunity to chronicle anything as significant as the formation of the Gungan Grand Army.<ref name="db" /> In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> Naboo was invaded by the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]], forcing [[Boss/Legends|Boss]] [[Rugor Nass/Legends|Rugor Nass]] to evacuate Otoh Gunga. Jowil joined Nass and the [[Rep/Legends|Reps]] at the [[Gungan Sacred Place|Sacred Place]] some time after the evacuation, and was there to witness [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], leader of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] population on Naboo, present herself before Nass in a bid to forge an alliance against the Federation. Nass agreed, and prepared to send the Gungan Grand Army to fight the invaders.<ref name="tpm" /> Jowil was stunned by the humility and respect of Amidala and her Human entourage, and she realized that what she had just seen would be a watershed moment in Naboo's history.<ref name="db" />With a fitting subject now at hand, Jowil set about composing, in her head, a piece that would chronicle what she had just seen. In a matter of days, she had composed the "[[Symponik Nabooalla]]," an epic for all of Naboo's denizens<ref name="db" /> chronicling the Gungans' and Humans' collaborative efforts at restoring their freedom.<ref name="CSWE" /> The first movement of the piece debuted during a large parade in [[Theed/Legends|Theed]] following the [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|Battle of Naboo]], in which Humans and Gungans alike had been able to overcome the armies of the Federation. Among those present were [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] and members of the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]], in addition to Queen Amidala and Boss Nass.<ref name="tpm" /> The exposure that the piece received was unprecedented, and so Jowil's place in history was cemented, as one of the Great Municipal Band's most significant leaders.<ref name="db" />During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the rebelling [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Jowil, along with several other prominent Naboo musicians, coaxed Beezar Pert out of retirement for a special concert in the [[Palace Plaza/Legends|Palace Plaza]] of Theed to honor the orphans of both Republic and Separatist forces.<ref name="blog">{{SW|url=news/slugthrowers-an-overview-of-popular-music-and-musicians-in-a-galaxy-far-far-away-part-1|text=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away, Part 1|int=Slugthrowers: An Overview of Popular Music and Musicians in a Galaxy Far, Far Away|archivedate=20180311051325}}</ref>

name: Kleyvits
description: Kleyvits was a diplomat and representative of her faction and sought to unify all of [[Selonia/Legends|Selonia]], including the renegade [[Hunchuzuc Den]] and its allies, under their banner of independence from the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. The movement named itself the [[Absolutists]] and desired to rid the planet of non-Selonian influences.The Overden concealed a terrible secret, however, that they had allied themselves with the Selonians of the [[Sacorrian Triad]], a group of offworlders descended from a dishonored den exiled generations earlier. Such was the extent of their dishonor that they formed a new den under a new name, since the old name had become an obscenity. Kleyvits strove to conceal this in order to achieve consensus among all Selonians. Selonians as a race are honest, or are at least unacquainted with deceit and confused by it. Kleyvits was unable to lie about their alliance, and even her keeping it secret brought with it great dishonor.When [[Dracmus]], acting as a Hunchuzuc Den representative, arrived on Selonia along with [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], [[Leia Organa Solo]], and [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]], negotiations began in earnest between the Overden and its opponents. Each side sought to prove that its point of view was inevitable and guide the other side into falling in line. Kleyvits gained the upper hand: her faction was larger, possessed the [[planetary repulsor]] on Selonia, and their call for independence from the New Republic resonated better with the Selonian psyche.Han, Leia, and Mara were kept as captives and questioned for a time, but together they reasoned that the Overden must have had outside help to control the repulsor. During an interrogation, Han Solo asked Kleyvits who was operating the planetary repulsor on Selonia, and Kleyvits found herself in the uncomfortable position of being unable to answer. Dracmus seized upon the opportunity and demanded to know, and the balance of power tipped as Kleyvits, exposed as fraudulent, cowered and admitted that her allies were the Selonians of the Triad. From that point, the Overden and the Absolutists had lost their psychological edge, and the supporters of the New Republic ascended to power.

name: Laudica
description: The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Laudica was born on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]<ref name="db" /> at some point before [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]].<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she was employed as a [[Smuggler/Legends|gun-runner]] and had developed a reputation for her skills as a [[Sniper/Legends|markswoman]].<ref name="ccg">{{CCG|set=Jabba's Palace Limited|link=JabbasPalace-Light/large/laudica.gif|cardname=Laudica}}</ref> Laudica was good friends with many other female criminals,<ref name="btm">''[[Star Wars: Behind the Magic]]''</ref> including<ref name="ccg" /> fellow [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] smuggler<ref name="Brindy DB">{{DB|character|brindytruchong|Truchong, Brindy|archivedate=20100918105107}}</ref> [[Brindy Truchong]] and the<ref name="ccg" /> [[Kiffar/Legends|Kiffar]] [[Con artist/Legends|con artist]]<ref name="Tonnikas' DB">{{DB|character|tonnikasisters|Tonnika, Brea & Senni|archivedate=20110913184426}}</ref> [[Tonnika sisters/Legends|Tonnika sisters]]. Despite her better judgment, she was romantically involved with the [[Bimm (Near-Human)|Bimm]] [[Rayc Ryjerd]].<ref name="ccg" />During the war, Laudica became a frequent visitor of [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|the palace]] of<ref name="db" /> the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]]<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|130|Jabba the Hutt (Jabba Desilijic Tiure)}}</ref> [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]<ref name="db" /> on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. She was in the palace in<ref name="rotj" /> 4 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|ABY]]<ref name="NEC" /> when [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] and [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]], [[Droid/Legends|droids]] belonging to the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], [[Mission to Jabba's Palace (Galactic Civil War)|arrived]] in order to bargain for the life of [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], a friend of Skywalker's who was frozen in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]] and who hung on the wall of the palace's courtroom. Shortly after the droids' arrival, Laudica watched as Jabba dropped his [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] dancer [[Oola/Legends|Oola]] into the pit of [[Jabba's rancor|his rancor]].<ref name="rotj" />Laudica was in the courtroom shortly thereafter when Solo's friend [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], disguised as the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Boushh/Legends|Boushh]], arrived with the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] and threatened to destroy the palace with a [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonator]]. Organa stayed her hand and thus won Jabba's favor, but she later [[Rescue of Han Solo/Legends|freed]] Solo from carbonite and attempted to escape the palace with him. When Jabba caught and [[Prisoner/Legends|imprisoned]] them, Skywalker came to the palace to demand their release, and was dropped into the [[Rancor/Legends|rancor]] pit himself. He [[Death/Legends|killed]] the rancor, however, prompting Jabba to sentence him, Solo, and Chewbacca to die in Tatooine's [[Great Pit of Carkoon/Legends|Great Pit of Carkoon]]. Laudica and many other members of Jabba's entourage followed Skywalker and Solo as they were dragged out of the courtroom.<ref name="rotj" />

name: Risha Sinan
description: Sinan was fascinated with the local giant [[bark mite]]s. But as these creatures constantly destroyed the greenery, she searched for a chemical solution to repel them. Shortly before the [[Battle of Restuss]], Sinan found a mutant variant of giant bark mites and hired a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to travel to their hive and collect specimens of the different variants.

name: Jari'kyn
description: Jari'kyn was involved in the project to design a dress for [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade's]] wedding, but Vanar became disgusted with her designs as he followed the reasoning that "[[minimal is maximal]]". Vanar laughed at Jari'kyn's designs and threw her out of his business, causing a sudden breakdown for Jari'kyn. Mara Jade eventually stumbled upon Jari'kyn, having rejected Vanar's inappropriate dress.[[File:Jari'kyn1.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Jari'kyn meets Mara Jade for the first time.]]Mara looked over Jari'kyn's designs and immediately hired her as head designer for her dress. Jari'kyn was overjoyed and immediately set up shop to finish the wedding garment. However, when Mara came in for her fitting, they were attacked by the [[Emperor's Royal Guard/Legends|royal guard]] [[Chik Apla]]. Although Jari'kyn quickly called security, Mara easily dispatched the attacker before they could arrive. The rest of the design process went through as planned, and Jari'kyn prepared to present the dress to Mara right before the wedding.However, just as Jari'kyn prepared to leave, [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]] led by [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Derran Takkar]] prepared to steal the dress and murder Jari'kyn. Luckily for the Twi'lek designer, one of the Imperials didn't have the stomach to execute an innocent bystander and turned on his commander. With the distraction, the rogue Imperial, [[Banner Sumptor]], and Jari'kyn incapacitated the rest of the Imperials and secured the dress. Sumpter and Jari'kyn then brought the dress directly to Mara, just in time for the wedding.

name: Anlys Takkar
description: [[File:AnlysTakkarNails Union.png|thumb|left|170px]]Takkar participated in her husband's plot to sabotage the wedding of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]], along with Apla and her husband's other remaining associates, [[Iry Danta]], [[Chala Venan]], and [[Banner Sumptor]].When Banner and the others failed to kill Skywalker (Banner actually saved him), Anlys stepped up with a plan of her own: find the wedding dress maker and send Chik to kill Mara during the fitting. Using her skills at information gathering Anlys discovered that the dress maker was [[Jari'kyn]]. Chik was sent out to her address, but Mara soundly defeated him and he was captured.During the final attempt to disrupt the wedding, Anlys lead Banner and two mercenaries to intercept the dress on the way to the wedding. The plan went well, until Anlys ordered Banner to kill Jari'Kyn. Banner refused to murder an innocent and turned on the mercenaries, killing them. Anlys attacked Banner, clawing his face with her nails and drawing a knife, but was knocked out with a blow from behind by Jari'kyn. Anlys's part in the plot, just like the rest of it, was a failure.[[File:AnlysTakkarPlots_Union.png|thumb|170px]]

name: Kateel of Kuhlvult
description: Neelah worked as a dancing girl under [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]]. After his [[Death/Legends|death]], Neelah escaped from the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|palace]], earning herself a cut down her cheek from a [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]] guard. During her trek away from the place of her bondage, Neelah stumbled across two medical droids on their way to a secret base where Dengar was treating the half-digested form of [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], his armor and skin almost all consumed by the [[Sarlacc/Legends|sarlacc's]] stomach acid. Knowing somehow that Boba Fett was connected to her past, she left him to recuperate, with strict orders that the droids not tell anyone that she had been there.Neelah knew nothing of her past due to a [[Memory wipe/Legends|mind-wipe]] which was ordered by her sister, [[Kodir of Kuhlvult]]. Her only semblance of self that she retained was her mindset that she had not always been a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] to another being, but rather the other way around. Her haughty attitude made her believe that she had been born someone of higher stature. These thoughts she kept to herself during her enslavement. Though she watched other girls around her being cruelly mistreated by their bloated master, even occasionally used as [[Jabba's rancor|rancor]] food, her own health was kept intact. She felt that this treatment came from a bounty hunter who seemed to watch over and had caught her gaze a number of [[Time/Legends|times]]&mdash;Boba Fett. His gaze always made fear crawl through her, but for a separate reason than his infamous reputation.When Dengar took in Boba Fett and started nursing him back to health, Neelah demanded that she be included in his recuperation, with Dengar reluctantly agreeing. When [[Kuat of Kuat]] discovered that Fett was still alive, he sent [[Bomb/Legends|bombers]] to [[Bombing of the Dune Sea|strafe]] the surface of [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], hoping to eliminate the bounty hunter once and for all. After the bombing, Fett knew that it was time to leave. Boba Fett took Dengar with him as a partner and also Neelah. She knew that she wasn't there beyond the fact that she had some part to play in Fett's mercenary schemes. During their flight in the [[Slave I/Legends|''Slave I'']] to an undisclosed location, Neelah persuaded Dengar to tell her the history of what had previously been happening with Boba Fett and his recent dealings. These happened to coincide with her erased past.During her flight, Neelah [[Slicer/Legends|hacked]] into Boba Fett's files and discovered a picture of an ancient symbol from [[Kuat/Legends|Kuat]]. That symbol brought the memories of her past flooding back. She knew her true name; Kateel of Kuhlvult, a member of the Kuat high lineage. She hid the fact that she knew who she was from both bounty hunters, unsure of what they would do if they found out.Their [[Starship/Legends|ship]] was eventually tracked down by Kateel's sister, Kodir of Kuhlvult, who took Kateel away from both Dengar and Boba Fett, and they put up no fight as Kateel left willingly. Kodir didn't realize that her sister knew who she was and the circumstances behind why her sister wanted her dead. When Kodir of Kuhlvult discovered that Kateel remembered everything from her past, she pulled out a blaster and was prepared to kill Kateel in order to silence her forever. Kateel, however, was far too quick. Kateel swiftly disarmed her sister, overwhelming Kodir's meager defense, and sent Kodir of Kuhlvult back to stand trial on Kuat. Kateel then reconnected with her heritage and, when Fett tracked her down, he threw out the idea to her that she could take control of [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]] because of the [[Bombing of the Kuat shipyards (4 ABY)|former leader's death]].As the [[Chairman/Legends|chairman]] of KDY in [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], she was forced to surrender Kuat and its shipyards to the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] during the [[Taking of Kuat]].<ref name="TEGTW" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Kirst (pilot)
description: {{Quote|I have a shot. Repeat, Three has a clean shot.''"<br />"''Negative, Three. That fighter's short-range. I want to see where it's headed.|Kirst and Wedge Antilles, while chasing a TIE Advanced x1|A Day in the Life}}Kirst was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who served the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]<ref name="A Day in the Life" /> in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]]<ref name="NEC 124">{{CSWECite|II|220|Kirst}} confirms that Kirst flew in the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], which is dated to [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]] on p. 124 of ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''.</ref> as a member of [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]],<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|220|Kirst}}</ref> an elite group of twelve [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Rebel pilot/Legends|pilots]].<ref name="CSWE Rogue Squadron">{{CSWECite|III|106|Rogue Squadron}}</ref> In that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], as the Alliance's [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|war]] with the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] raged, the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Alliance Fleet]] massed near the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]] in preparation for a major attack on the Empire's unfinished [[Death Star II/Legends|Death Star II]] [[battlestation]], which was [[Orbit/Legends|orbiting]] the [[Tree/Legends|forested]] [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Endor/Legends|Endor]].<ref name="Return of the Jedi">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref> [[Rogue Leader/Legends|Rogue Leader]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] temporarily rechristened the Rogues [[Red Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|Red Squadron]] prior to the battle, in honor of a [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]] in which he had once served. Red Squadron was attached directly to the [[MC80 Home One type Star Cruiser|MC80 Star Cruiser]] [[Home One/Legends|''Home One'']], the [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] of the entire [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]].<ref name="Galaxy Guide 5 Wedge" />[[File:Adayinthecanyon.jpg|thumb|left|350px|Kirst, Wister, and Wedge Antilles pursue a TIE Advanced x1 through the canyons of Endor.]]The fleet was not scheduled to arrive in the [[Endor system/Legends|Endor system]] until a [[Endor strike team/Legends|strike team]] on Endor's surface disabled the [[SLD-26 planetary shield generator/Legends|shield generator]] that protected the Death Star,<ref name="Return of the Jedi" /> and before the battle, Red Squadron met in a briefing room, where Antilles told them that they would be entering the [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star's]] superstructure and firing on its [[Reactor/Legends|reactor core]].<ref name="The Briefing of Red Group">{{WEGCite|book=Galaxy Guide 5: Return of the Jedi|story=The Briefing of Red Group|stext=''The Briefing of Red Group''}}</ref> Kirst and her squadron,<ref name="CSWE" /> flying [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|T-65 X-wing starfighters]], were with the fleet as it flew through [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] to Endor, and upon reaching their target, they discovered that the [[Deflector shield/Legends|deflector shield]] was still operational. Additionally, the Empire had anticipated their arrival, and the Rebels were forced to fend off attacking Imperial starfighters as they waited for the strike team to succeed.<ref name="Return of the Jedi" /> Although several Alliance squadrons were devastated by the [[Space warfare|onslaught]], Red Squadron [[Starfighter combat/Legends|scored]] a large number of [[Death/Legends|kills]] and remained mostly intact.<ref name="Galaxy Guide 5 Wedge" />The Death Star itself joined in the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] when its [[Superlaser/Legends|superlaser]] began taking out Rebel [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ships]], and the Alliance Fleet consequently began to attack Imperial [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyers]] at point-blank range in order to avoid the [[Space station/Legends|battlestation's]] powerful [[Laser/Legends|laser]]. Several of the Imperial [[Warship/Legends|warships]] were destroyed, among them the [[Super Star Destroyer/Legends|Super Star Destroyer]] [[Executor/Legends|''Executor'']]. When the strike team finally destroyed the [[Endor shield generator bunker|shield generator]], Antilles and several other [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] entered the unfinished Death Star and knocked out the reactor core, which set off a chain reaction that ultimately destroyed the entire station. [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] was one of the Imperials killed aboard the Death Star,<ref name="Return of the Jedi" /> but the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] fought on for nearly four more [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]]<ref name="TAB Sourcebook 8">''[[The Truce at Bakura Sourcebook]]'', p. 8</ref> before retreating,<ref name="TAB Sourcebook 9">''[[The Truce at Bakura Sourcebook]]'', p. 9</ref> and the Rebels celebrated their victory on the surface of the forest moon.<ref name="Return of the Jedi" /> The Alliance maintained a presence at Endor for some [[Time/Legends|time]],<ref name="Marvel 100">''[[Star Wars 100: First Strike]]''</ref> and Kirst flew with Rogue Squadron during post-battle cleanup operations.<ref name="CSWE" />Kirst had grown close with fellow Rogue [[Wister]] during their time together in the squadron, and during one cleanup operation, the two of them flew as Antilles's [[Wingmate/Legends|wingmates]], respectively holding the [[call sign]]s of [[Rogue Three/Legends|Rogue Three]] and [[Rogue Two/Legends|Rogue Two]]. The three Rogues pursued several Imperial fighters that remained in the [[Star system/Legends|system]], and after Antilles destroyed a [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE Fighter]], the trio pursued a [[TIE Advanced x1/Legends|TIE Advanced x1]] toward Endor's surface. Although Kirst had a clean shot at their last enemy, Antilles told her to hold her fire, as he wanted to see where the fighter was going. After they entered the moon's [[Atmosphere/Legends|atmosphere]], the [[TIE Series|TIE]] led the trio through a series of rocky canyons and into a clearing, where the remains of the downed ''Executor'' laid. The [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|massive vessel's]] [[Turbolaser/Legends|turbolasers]] were still operational, and their sudden fire destroyed Wister's [[X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]]. Antilles told a stunned Kirst to hold together and transmitted attack coordinates to her fighter; the two then fired [[Proton torpedo/Legends|proton torpedoes]] at a canyon cliff, and the resulting avalanche finished off the ''Executor''. When their [[Sensor/Legends|sensors]] detected no further hostiles, they returned to the ''Home One'', where a tearful Kirst hugged Antilles before leaving the [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] with no words spoken.<ref name="A Day in the Life" />

name: Halla Ettyk
description: Ettyk rose through [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken's]] [[Alliance Intelligence|intelligence organizations]] to the rank of [[Commander/Legends|Commander]]. Circa [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], the Ettyk was working on the [[Liberation of Coruscant (Galactic Civil War)|recently liberated]] capital planet [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and upon being offered the job of prosecutor on behalf of the [[Combined Defense Forces of the New Republic|New Republic Armed Forces]] in the [[Trial of Tycho Celchu]], immediately signed on, despite having not prosecuted a case in seven years.The commander presented seemingly overwhelming evidence that [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Tycho Celchu]] was guilty of the murder of [[Corran Horn]], and of [[Treason/Legends|treason]] against the New Government. The politically-motivated case (being used by the government to show they could be as hard on Human criminals as they could on aliens in the face of the [[Krytos virus]]) seemed almost impossible for defense attorney [[Flight officer]] [[Nawara Ven]] to win, even with Ettyk using mostly circumstancial evidence, a testament to her legal skills.Ettyk, however, dropped the charges when Corran Horn escaped from ''[[Lusankya]]'' and [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] revealed his own knowledge of Celchu's innocence. The commander made her apologies to Celchu.

name: Doman Beruss (Corellian)
description: {{Quote|Ah, to have cases before we have a Judiciary, now that is civilization!|Doman Beruss|X-Wing: The Krytos Trap}}[[File:Doman Beruss signature.png|thumb|left|200px|Doman Beruss' signature.]]Doman Beruss was a member of the [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] branch of the well-known [[Clan Beruss|Beruss family]] of [[Illodia]]<ref name="IES" /> and, out of respect, was named after an [[Doman Beruss (elder)|older relative]].<ref name="CSWE" /> She was an aunt of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Doman Beruss (Illodian)|Doman Beruss]] and a great-aunt of his son, [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Avan Beruss]].<ref name="IES">''[[Star Wars: X-Wing Rogue Squadron: In the Empire's Service]]''</ref> As a representative of Corellia, Beruss became one of the nine signatories of the [[Declaration of the Alliance of Free Planets]]. Four [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] later,<ref name="TBSB:37" /> Beruss signed the [[Declaration of a New Republic/Legends|Declaration of a New Republic]].<ref name="HESB:9">''[[Heir to the Empire Sourcebook]]'', p. 9</ref> She subsequently served as a representative of the Corellian exiles on the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[New Republic Provisional Council|Provisional Council]].<ref name="WG:4" />Approximately [[5 ABY/Legends|one year]] after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]],<ref name="OV3">''[[Star Wars Omnibus: X-Wing Rogue Squadron Volume 3]]''</ref> [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] informed Beruss and the rest of the Council of reports that [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] leader [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]] had been charged with [[Treason/Legends|treason]] and fled [[Coruscant/Legends|Imperial Center]]. Beruss advocated for a New Republic [[Evacuation of Ciutric|mission]] to rescue Pestage, arguing that successfully doing so would render other Imperials more willing to defect from the declining Empire. A New Republic team secured Pestage on [[Ciutric IV|Ciutric]], only to be trapped there by Imperial forces. Although her great-nephew Avan was a participant in the endangered mission, Beruss recommended not sending reinforcements, believing any escalation of the situation would be detrimental to theRepublic. At the same time, Avan worried that his great-aunt was holding back reinforcements to avoid the appearance of favoritism toward him. Despite the lack of support, Avan survived the mission, which ultimately failed to keep Pestage in Republic custody.<ref name="MR" />In [[6 ABY/Legends|6 ABY]], as the New Republic was preparing for an attempt to seize Coruscant, Doman Beruss attended a meeting of the Provisional Council. There, she pointed out to the other councilors that whoever was able to claim Coruscant would be seen as the legitimate government of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], and that the [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[Zsinj]] had likely taken notice of the Republic's recent push toward the capital.<ref name="WG:4" /> Beruss was present at another meeting the following day, in which the debate over how to approach Coruscant continued. In response to [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Gial Ackbar's]] proposal to send a team of military specialists to Coruscant prior to the main attack, Beruss asked Airen Cracken, who specialized in such matters, if he felt prepared to handle the operation. She also expressed approval of Councilor [[Borsk Fey'lya]]'s plan to distract Imperial forces by freeing [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] operatives from [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]] and releasing them on Coruscant.<ref name="WG:8">''[[X-Wing: Wedge's Gamble]]'', chapter 8</ref>After the New Republic [[Liberation of Coruscant (Galactic Civil War)|liberated]] Coruscant, Beruss and other members of the Provisional Council convened on the world in what had once been a [[Imperial Senate/Legends|Senatorial]] apartment area. There, Beruss sat beside [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]] as she heard [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] argue in defense of [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Tycho Celchu]], who faced accusations of treason against the New Republic. While she claimed to respect Antilles' convictions, Beruss stated that the evidence against Celchu was sufficient to warrant a [[Trial of Tycho Celchu|trial]].<ref name="KT:3">''[[X-Wing: The Krytos Trap]]'', chapter 3</ref> At a later meeting on Coruscant, the Council debated how the Republic's [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] supply should be used to deal with an outbreak of the [[Krytos virus]], and Beruss objected when Fey'lya accused Councilor [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] of anti-[[Alien/Legends|alien]] bias for her opposition to Fey'lya's proposed strategy for bacta distribution.<ref name="KT:11">''[[X-Wing: The Krytos Trap]]'', chapter 11</ref>The Council would be active until [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], to be replaced by the first [[New Republic Senate]]. In [[10 ABY/Legends|10 ABY]] she was one of the signatories of ''[[Why Do We Fight the Empire?]]''. Beruss retained her position until at least [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]] and the beginnings of the [[Natasi Daala|Daala]] crisis.

name: Osae Meilea
description: Following the destruction of the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]] she was sent to the jungle moon [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] to oversee the illegal salvage operation of the [[Hutt Expeditionary Force]]. While there, she met with a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] whom she paid 1,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to get [[Nagem Dr'Lar]], a contractor in charge of Imperial salvage operations, to stop her operations on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]]. After the individual defeated Nagem's bodyguard, [[Yakasoba]], Nagem agreed to do whatever Osae said.<ref name="AED" />After this, Osae again hired the individual for 5,000 credits; this time to wipe out [[Ewosa Soci]]'s two businesses, first his grave robbers who were his source for [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] and [[Massassi/Legends|Massassi]] artifacts, and then his [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] at his [[Smuggler Camp|smuggler camp]] who were supplying him with [[Spice/Legends|spice]]. This was all done to get Soci on her payroll, as he had access to very valuable information which she wanted. The individual managed to accomplish these feats, and afterward convinced Soci to work for Osae, as he was a creditless and broken man.<ref name="AED" />Some time after this, Soci contacted the individual and informed them that the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] were attempting to smuggle out a cargo of Death Star salvage. Osae once again turned to this individual, tasking them with capturing the cargo and forcing the ship to return to the moon. After the spacer managed to capture the medium freighter ''[[Lupus Maroo]]'', it was attacked four times on the way to the rendezvous. When it finally got there, Osae agreed to ship the cargo to whomever the individual requested, and rewarded them with 10,000 credits.<ref name="AED" />

name: Ona Shai
description: Ona, a member of [[Domain Shai]], was born with a slight stoop in her spine. Though [[Yuuzhan Vong]] born physically deformed were usually [[Death/Legends|killed]] at birth, Shai was allowed to live, as it did not impede her abilities. Because of the problems facing ''Baanu Miir'', she was quite furious that they were not receiving any help. Ona Shai was also younger than [[Nen Yim]].{{Char-stub}}

name: J'an Ane Jinder
description: Jinder traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], seeking out ancient or rare artifacts that might be of some interest to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].On one such quest for an artifact from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Malastare/Legends|Malastare]], J'an Ane wound up on [[Mrlsst]], homeworld of the [[Mrlssi]]. In a Mrlssi [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]], while attempting to charter a [[Starship/Legends|starship]], she was offered a discount on the ship if she could solve the Mrlssi steward's riddle. The riddle involved the Mrlssi ship designers, their starships and three offworld clients. Using just a few pieces of information, J'an Ane was required to figure out which Mrlssi designed which starship for which client.

name: Pampy/Legends
description: Pampy, a [[Rutian/Legends|Rutian]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], was working in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] alongside [[Orn Free Taa's Twi'lek aide|another Lethan Twi'lek]] as [[Aide/Legends|aides]] to [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Orn Free Taa/Legends|Orn Free Taa]]. Between the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]] and the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the Lethan aide was replaced by [[Supi/Legends|Supi]]. Both were present at a [[Loyalist/Legends|Loyalist]] meeting that determined the protection of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] following an assassination attempt that delayed the vote on an army for the Republic.{{Char-stub}}

name: Hurlo Holowan
