description: {{Quote|[[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] armor. Very rare, extremely durable. You make a nice-looking couple. Can I assume you're both bounty hunters?"<br />"Assume what you want. I'm going to ask you one question. If you lie, I'll know, and you'll be dead."<br />"How do I know you won't kill me even if I tell the truth?"<br />"That's your problem. Where's Groodo the Hutt?"<br />"[[Balmorra/Legends|Balmorra]]. Before he dropped me off on Kuat, I overheard him having a [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] conversation with his brother on Balmorra, a factory world. That's where Groodo was headed. His name's [[Rigorra]], and he's the Warlord of Balmorra.|Hurlo Holowan is persuaded by Zam Wesell, Jango Fett and his [[WESTAR-34 blaster pistol/Legends|Westar-34 blaster]] to tell the truth.|Star Wars Adventures 6: The Warlords of Balmorra}}Holowan was the creator of the sophisticated [[Droid/Legends|droids]] that piloted [[Groodo]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] [[False Sun Runner|counterfeit]] ''Sun Runner,'' a replica of the [[Sun Runner|ancient colonial transport]] from the [[Darpa sector]]. She also was the engineer and controller of the Hutt's [[Droid Control Army]] that attempted the takeover and destruction of the [[Fondor Spaceport]] and the planet's major surface facilities.<ref name="SWA3:THP">''[[Star Wars Adventures 3: The Hostage Princess]]''</ref>Soon thereafter, Holowan was hunted down by both [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]], the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] who was hired by [[Dooku/Legends|Darth Tyranus]] to take the droid engineer alive, and hunters [[Cradossk/Legends|Cradossk]] and his son [[Bossk/Legends|Bossk]], who were simultaneously hired for the job (but to bring in her head) by [[Wat Tambor/Legends|Wat Tambor]], [[Foreman/Legends|Foreman]] of the [[Techno Union/Legends|Techno Union]] and a member of the [[Separatist Council/Legends|Separatist Council]]. Fett, in the end, was the one to achieve the task, by subcontracting the job to fellow hunter [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]], and he turned Holowan over to Darth Tyranus alive. The [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]], impressed with the concept of the ''Sun Runner'' scheme hatched by Groodo, Senator [[Rodd]] and Holowan—and with the ingenuity, ambition, talent, and secrecy they demonstrated—wished to recruit them to [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|his cause]].<ref name="SWA4:JFVTRE">''[[Star Wars Adventures 4: Jango Fett vs. the Razor Eaters]]''</ref><ref name="SWA5:TSSS">''[[Star Wars Adventures 5: The Shape-Shifter Strikes]]''</ref><ref name="SWA6:TWOB">''[[Star Wars Adventures 6: The Warlords of Balmorra]]''</ref>

name: Cligot
description: While onboard she was ''examined'' by her commanding officer, [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Ors Dogot]]. She was [[Death/Legends|killed]] along with the rest of the crew of the ''Bloodprice'' when it attacked the [[Teljkon Vagabond]].

name: Tonnika sisters/Legends
description: The best-known source of information on the Tonnika sisters is a biographical entry written by [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]]. However, his account contains a number of inadvertent inaccuracies, and it is unclear how far it can be trusted.

name: Shasheva Astopone
description: She was recruited by [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]] and used her considerable wealth to fund Rebel spying and smuggling operations on Coruscant. More daringly, she used her position to attend and arrange dinners and glamorous balls with Imperial [[Moff/Legends|Moffs]] and admirals, discreetly probing for sensitive information. Her method for sharing this information was to store it on a datadot hidden in her [[firegem]] ring, then hand it to a Rebel contact. She often met her contacts at the [[Coruscant Opera/Legends|Coruscant Opera House]], for which she had a private box.

name: Ahleazah
description: Captured during the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] occupation of [[Dac]], Ahleazah's skills as a healer earned her work with medical staff, while her family was put to forced labor. Ahleazah put her skills to use helping whomever she could as the occupation authority moved her from camp to camp. Her actions in saving a low level [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Starfleet]] officer earned her escape from the enslaved world. She was placed aboard his starship where she was able to make use of and learn from the advanced Imperial medical technologies.While aboard the Imperial vessel, Ahleazah tended to a captured [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] who was slated to undergo interrogation. Ahleazah aided the pilot and seized the opportunity to escape the Empire. Together the pair stowed away in an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]] and launched just as the ship exited the [[Anoat system/Legends|Anoat system]]. An Alliance convoy picked up the drifting pod, and Ahleazah went on to serve the Alliance and [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] as a healer.

name: Shenir Rix
description: [[File:G11rix.jpg|thumb|left|140px|Shenir Rix, 10 ABY]][[Reproduction/Legends|Born]] in [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="Date1" /> Shenir Rix was once a highly placed member of [[Fergriss Pharmaceuticals]], until the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] enacted a devastating assault on the company's [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], putting it out of business and effectively ending Rix's professional career. In turn, Rix utilized [[Sexes/Legends|her]] business savvy to embark upon a life of [[Information broker/Legends|information brokering]]. By the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Rix was reputed to be one of the best and most reliable information dealers in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]<ref name="Star Wars: Rebellion" />&mdash;but at the expense of turning on her own people by working for the Empire.<ref name="Rebellion Guide">''[[Star Wars: Rebellion: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref>Rix continued to ply her trade as an informant<ref name="Galaxy Guide 11" /> by [[10 ABY/Legends|10 ABY]],<ref name="Date1" /> working some of the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy's]] most high-class [[Gambling/Legends|gambling]] establishments, where she routinely bought and sold information. Playing the role of the unlucky gambler's best friend, Rix obtained much of her inside information from wealthy and influential yet habitually losing gamblers. By virtue of her charm and honest reputation, Rix had yet to attract the antagonism of some of her more seedier competitors. Nevertheless, the Empire charged her with illegal dissemination of classified data, categorizing Rix as criminal [[TracSheet]] Subject 55735573-QUUB-468835.<ref name="Galaxy Guide 11" />

name: Apted Squelsh
description: {{Quote|I have a new assignment for you. I assume you are prepared?''"<br />"''One hundred percent, ma'am.''"<br />"''You will accompany and assist two Jedi to a planet called Ord Cestus. Do you know it?''"<br />"''No, ma'am. But I'll get up to speed immediately. My support?''"<br />"''Four men.|Squelsh and CT-96/298|The Cestus Deception}}Apted Squelsh was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] who lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Squelsh served in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and held the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Major/Legends|major]]. In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Squelsh oversaw the actions of [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] at the training camp on [[Vandor-3]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of the Republic's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].<ref name="TCD" />During her [[Time/Legends|time]] at Vandor-3, Squelsh ordered [[Advanced Recon Commando/Legends|Advanced Recon Commando]] [[Clone trooper captain|Captain]] [[CT-96/298]], nicknamed "Nate," to visit her at her office for an administrative review. When Nate arrived, Squelsh congratulated him on the success of his unit during their recent training exercise and informed him that he had a new assignment&mdash;to assist two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] on a [[Mission to Ord Cestus|mission]] to the planet [[Ord Cestus/Legends|Ord Cestus]]. After the briefing, Nate asked Squelsh if [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Arikakon Baraka]], the overseer of the training camp, had mentioned anything about the achievement of his unit during their recent training exercise. Squelsh replied that Baraka was satisfied with the performance of his [[Troop/Legends|troops]] before she dismissed the ARC [[Trooper/Legends|trooper]].<ref name="TCD" />

name: Krai H'voc
description: Krai was a scout for the Nagi sent out to find the legendary "Skyriver". Instead of searching and observing the galaxy, Krai settled down on Corellia, where she fell in love with a [[Bey's father|human male]] and gave birth to a child, [[Bey]]. When it was discovered by Nagai commanders that Krai was not doing her job, she was ordered to leave her family and continue her mission elsewhere. She left her family with little explanation. After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Krai suggested to the Nagai commanders that the invasion of the galaxy should wait until the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|war]] was over.{{Char-stub}}

name: Sirenas Firil
description: Firil had been a professional bounty hunter for only a year before getting an assignment from the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] to track a rebel agent. She worked with another novice bounty hunter named [[Chandrex Grenn]]. They tracked the Rebel to a [[Pallas's base camp|secret camp]] in the foothills on [[Kallistas]]. After a brief firefight they were able to disarm the rebel, wounding him in the process. They turned their captive over to [[Imperial Prefect|Prefect]] [[Dengless Rinn]] and divided their thousand [[Galactic Credit Standard|credit]] prize between them. Rinn then hired Firil and Grenn, along with another bounty hunter, [[Demos Traxen]], to hunt the pirate [[Jondrell Inx]].

name: Lalu Morwan
description: During the [[Second Galactic Civil War]], Morwan was an operative for the [[Heritage Council|Hapan independence movement]] allied with the [[Five Worlds|Corellian Confederation]] and had contracted [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]] to kill [[Queen Mother]] [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka]]. However, Morwan's plans backfired once the Solos interfered with their operations. Seeing nowhere else to go, she boarded the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] with the Solos and their droid, [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]], whom she found quite annoying. After fixing [[Han Solo/Legends|Han's]] arm, Morwan attempted to force the Solos into the battle between [[Galney (Ducha of Terephon)|Ducha Galney]] of [[Terephon]] and the Heritage Council and the [[Hapan Royal Navy]] fleet still loyal to Tenel Ka by threatening to shoot Han if [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia]] did not return to the battle. However, her plan failed when Han disarmed her, breaking her nose.

name: Gawynn Karastee
description: At some point, perhaps around the beginning of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], Karastee analyzed the psyche of the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Zuckuss/Legends|Zuckuss]], who had been incarcerated in the penal facility. Through several interviews with Zuckuss, she discovered that the [[Gand/Legends|Gand]] had a severe case of [[schizophrenia]] and [[multiple personality disorder]]. At the end of her diagnosis, she remarked that Zuckuss was dangerous to himself and others. Karastee's analysis gave little hope that Zuckuss would be released from the facility&mdash;at least willingly. Karastee's report was eventually compiled in a [[The Essential Guide to Alien Species (book)|guide]] to the [[Alien/Legends|alien]] [[Species/Legends|species]] of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].

name: JillJoo Jab
description: [[File:JillJooJabEspa.jpg|thumb|left|JillJoo Jab, during her time in the Mos Espa cantina.]]While serving in a [[Mos Zabu/Legends|Mos Zabu]] [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], she helped the [[Nerf herder/Legends|nerf herder]] [[Domo Jones]], the [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[UR-1]] and the [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] musician [[Blerx]] sabotage an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] purchase of [[Proton torpedo/Legends|proton torpedoes]].Later, during [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], she became involved in a plot to help [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] escape [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. While in the [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] cantina, she encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] willing to help her with her mission. JillJoo learned that a Twi'lek slave named [[Sadelli]] escaped before being shipped off to [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]]. She tasked the spacer with finding her and bringing her back to Mos Espa, so that she could be sent safely off world. JillJoo encouraged the spacer by offering [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for successfully carrying out her tasks. The space agreed, and went out to find Sadellli. Though the spacer was ambushed by two thugs, they were dispatched, and the escaped slave was safely brought back to the [[City/Legends|city]].<ref name="SWG" />However, Sadelli would not leave Tatooine without her younger sister, [[Soolami]]. JillJoo informed the spacer who had helped her before that [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] wanted Soolami at his side. She also learned that the gang of slavers responsible for all this activity was led by an individual named [[Woff B'tar]], who she described as a horrible man. The spacer agreed to once again help JillJoo, and sought out to find Soolami. Once again, the spacer was attacked, this time by a thug and a [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] slaver. Fortunately, Soolami was brought back to Mos Espa, so that both she and her sister could leave the [[Planet/Legends|planet]].<ref name="SWG" />However, JillJoo had one final task for the spacer. She managed to find the whereabouts of the slaver Woff B'tar. He was traveling to [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]] to explain the shortage of slaves caused by the spacer's actions. She told the spacer that if he could intercept and "convince" Woff that the slaving business was not tolerated, she would be forever in the spacer's debt. Fortunately for her, and perhaps the spacer, the spacer agreed to find and kill Woff. JillJoo was happy to hear this, but warned the spacer that killing Woff and his gang could attract the attention of the local authorities. She suggest that the spacer leave immediately after carrying out the task. Fortunately for JillJoo, the spacer once again failed to let her down. The spacer managed to kill B'tar, the Trandoshan, and two cronies who were escorting him. When the spacer returned, JillJoo was quite thankful, and claimed that [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] needed more heroes like the spacer who had helped her. Though she gave yet another, greater reward for the spacer's efforts, she admitted that it was not much, because the slave liberation was only funded by the donations of concerned citizens.<ref name="SWG" />

name: Iona Retter
description: Born to staunch military parents, Iona grew up a "navy brat" and followed her mother and father from one assignment to the next. As she was growing up, she was taught her of her families' illustrious naval history, as well as instilling a sense of duty to the Empire in her mind. It was only fitting that, when she came of age, she joined the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] ranks and eventually became an [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] agent. Iona grew to be a quietly idealistic woman who was professional but friendly, and was often accused of being too serious.Her belief in the Empire was shattered, however, when they arrested her brother and slaughtered his friends. She soon joined the growing [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and made it her mission to track down her brother or find any information related to him or what he was involved in; a task which she was still unable to perform as of the birth of the New Republic. Her task was made all the more difficult when [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Arundel]] ousted her as a spy causing her to flee. Because of this, she made it her personal mission to get revenge against him.

name: Ariela
description: Ariela supported [[Ariq Joanson]]'s idea to make peace with the [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]] and the [[Jawa/Legends|Jawas]]. She was in love with [[Eyvind/Legends|Eyvind]], who, at their wedding, was killed by Tuskens. She was then captured by the Sand People, but later saved by [[Ariq Joanson]] and [[Wimateeka]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Bradan
description: Bradan was a combat specialist who was originally assigned the point position of the intrusion team assigned to capture the ''[[Razor's Kiss]]''. Her job, however, was given to [[Shalla Nelprin]] in the guise of [[Qatya Nassin]], as the other woman was smaller and ''seemed'' less intimidating.Bradan accompanied the rest of the team to the bridge of the ''Razor's Kiss'' and almost caught "Qatya" downloading a tracking program into the ship's main computer, but was fooled by the other's nonchalance. After authorizing the smaller woman to attack a "security detail," Bradan stayed in the bridge and was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the attacks on the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|ship]].

name: Marka
description: {{Quote|She's still following us, Master."''<br />"''I know. Perhaps she is why we came to this dreadful place. There is no such thing as coincidence."''<br />"''I must deal with her."''<br />"''Yes. Deal with her.|The male Sith apprentice and Finn, regarding Marka|The Apprentice (comic)}}[[File:TheApprentice1.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Finn's Sith apprentice kills Marka's slave master, Lod.]]Marka, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] by the [[Toydarian/Legends|Toydarian]] [[Lod]]<ref name="The Apprentice" /> during the final [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[New Sith Wars]].<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|290|Marka}}</ref> She and Lod encountered the [[Sith Master/Legends|Sith Master]] [[Finn (Sith)|Finn]] and [[Finn's Sith apprentice|his apprentice]] on a [[Unidentified planet (Finn)|planet]] shortly after they destroyed a building. Lod ordered Marka to impress the men by showing them her [[Tooth/Legends|teeth]]; however, she refused. Lod struck her, and Finn's apprentice helped Marka to her feet, swearing that Lod would not hit her again. As Lod conversed with Finn, the young man [[Death/Legends|killed]] the Toydarian, freeing Marka.<ref name="The Apprentice" />After Finn rebuked him for helping Marka, she thanked the man and used a [[Mind trick/Legends|mind trick]] on the apprentice in an attempt to convince him to take her with the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. She followed the apprentice as he went to tell Finn that she was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], and the Sith Master ordered his pupil to deal with Marka. However, she and the apprentice pursued Finn up the [[Turbolift/Legends|turbolift]] which led to the docking pad where the Sith's [[Starship/Legends|starship]] was. Marka begged Finn to allow her to accompany them, saying that she could learn the Sith ways, but Finn refused, citing that he already had an apprentice and had no use for a slave. In order to overcome this obstacle, Marka seized the apprentice's lightsaber and threw him off the docking pad, sending him plummeting to his death. Marka then assumed the role of Finn's new Sith apprentice.<ref name="The Apprentice" />

name: Alfreda Goot
description: [[File:Alfreda Goot.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Alfreda Goot attacking [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]].]]Goot managed to acquire a complete set of [[Mandalorian Supercommando|supercommando]] armor from her time with the [[Mandalorian Protectors/Legends|Mandalorian Protectors]] before being kicked out from them, which led her to installing new upgrades on it such as climbing claws. She eventually become a mediocre [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] briefly in the employ of a minor crime lord, [[Slag Flats]].After working several jobs for Flats, Goot tried to establish a reputation by attempting to collect on the lucrative bounty for [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]. She captured Han's lover [[Leia Skywalker Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] and Goot successfully baited Solo into the [[Dockside Cafe]] in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]], forcing him to race there as the winner would get Leia. But Solo's legendary luck proved to be more than Goot's rudimentary skills could handle as he showed up with an Imperial squadron lead by Imperial Captain [[Sodarra]], forcing her into action.Alfreda fought both Han and Sodarra in an attempt to kill them both. But Han was able to shoot her in the chest, killing her in the process.{{Char-stub}}

name: Lekket
description: Lekket and her egg-mate, [[Tallet]], used to run a smuggling operation on behalf of several [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] gangsters. An ambitious Quarren named [[Tikkes/Legends|Tikkes]] learned of their illicit affairs and informed the Republic authorities. A [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] known as the [[An'ya Kuro|Dark Woman]] led a raid on the undersea cartel and devastated their operations. Lekket and Tallet's bodyguards opened fire on the Republic forces as the two of them dove into an access tube hoping to escape. The Dark Woman deflected some stray blaster fire which summarily struck a nearby fuel cell. The cell exploded leaking toxic acid into the escape tubes. Tallet was doused with the acid, and Lekket was barely able to pull him to safety.The two Quarrens escaped from Calamari and fled to the planet of [[Balmorra/Legends|Balmorra]]. There, [[Colicoid/Legends|Colicoid]] scientists treated Tallet to a [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] chemical bath. They were able to save his life, but his face was permanently scarred. Leaving Balmorra, they both swore vengeance against Tikkes for betraying them.The Quarren refugees established a new home for themselves on the dry, volcanic world known as [[Talas]]. As time passed, they established a small army of [[Droideka/Legends|droideka]] destroyer droids. They sent a message requesting the service of the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]], [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]]. Aurra arrived on Talas and the Quarrens sent their droidekas after her in order to test her ability. Aurra exceeded all of their expectations. Lekket explained their history to Aurra and asked her to assassinate Tikkes (who was by this point a senator for the Republic). Aurra had absolutely no interest in killing Tikkes, but she accepted the mission anyway, because she knew that this would create the opportunity for her to kill her old mentor, the Dark Woman.

name: Noma Sommos
description: {{Quote|Admiral Noma Sommos, inactive since her injuries following the collapse of the line on the Outer Rim, filed an official complaint from her field hospital on Wayland over the growing presence of fringers, or freelance tradespeople, in naval groups.|An article in ''[[The Admiral's List]]''|The Admiral's List: Jimas Veltraa Memorial Edition}}Noma Sommos was an [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] in the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] who served in the era following the [[Great Sith War]]. After becoming an admiral, Sommos and [[Sexes/Legends|her]] staff employed a young [[Naval Academy]] graduate named [[Dallan Morvis]] as a junior liaison with a [[Vanjervalis Systems]] design team.<ref name="handbook">''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic Handbook]]''</ref> Although the epic battles with the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] had long past by [[3964 BBY]], the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] faced a new threat at the edge of its borders&mdash;the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] warrior clans, which had carved out a sizable empire of their own before encroaching upon Republic [[Realspace/Legends|space]]. As the Mandalorians threatened resource [[Planet/Legends|worlds]] near the valuable [[Ecumenopolis/Legends|ecumenopolis]] of [[Taris/Legends|Taris]],<ref name="tea">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> the Republic [[Navy/Legends|Navy]] set up a defensive cordon known as the [[Jebble-Vanquo-Tarnith line]]. Sommos was serving along this border by the [[Time/Legends|time]] the Mandalorians finally began their advance, [[Battle of Vanquo|attacking]] the planet [[Vanquo]] in a diversionary tactic to open up a path to Taris.<ref name="kotor8" />The line soon collapsed&mdash;Sommos and Admiral [[Jimas Veltraa]] responded by reforming what was left of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Fleet/Legends|fleets]] into a makeshift force meant to protect Taris. Veltraa was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the Mandalorian [[Taris Siege|siege]], while Sommos was wounded and sent to recover in a [[Medcenter/Legends|hospital]] on the planet [[Wayland/Legends|Wayland]]. Sommos was inactive for some time following her injury over Taris and, while at her field hospital on Wayland, filed an official complaint over the growing presence of freelance tradespeople, or "[[fringer]]s," in Republic naval groups. Sommos complained that irregular and unaffiliated units provided logistical complications and provisioning problems, while their protection was inconsistent with the combat and spacelift duties of the Republic Navy&mdash;Republic defense official [[Catronus Steffans]], responding to the issue, was noncommittal on a course of action.<ref name="jimas" />

name: Zuud
description: In [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], Zuud was assigned to the Imperial base on [[Kalist VI/Legends|Kalist VI]].Charged with the interrogation and torture of Rebel agent [[Jorin Sol]], Lieutenant Zuud used a scan grid to interrogate Sol. Lieutenant Zuud performed the interrogation with such enthusiasm and zeal that would plague the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]] far more than what an ordinary breaking would have done. Although she was joined in the [[Torture/Legends|torture]] sessions by another Intelligence officer with the rank of [[Captain/Legends|captain]], he appeared to defer to her judgment.{{Char-stub}}

name: Sundria Khartoor
description: {{Quote|Report to Lieutenant Sundria Khartoor of the RSF violent Crimes Division for more details.|[[Pooja Naberrie/Legends|Pooja Naberrie]], to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Sundria Khartoor was in charge of the hunt for the escaped murderer [[Hunnos Jarkey]].<ref name="SWG:FaEM" /> She employed RSF agents who had previously worked under [[Pooja Naberrie/Legends|Pooja Naberrie]], and had recently carried out a successful [[Rescue of Karl Eckener|rescue mission]].<ref name="SWG:RKE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Rescue Karl Eckner" on Naboo</ref> She tasked them first to investigate the criminals known as the [[Peddlers]], then [[Nal Raka Criminal Empire|Borvo's thug]] [[Derm Worrit]], and finally [[Ados Jarkey|Jarkey's father]] himself.<ref name="SWG:FaEM" /> They then found that Jarkey briefly took refuge among different criminal organization, namely the [[Muskegs]], the [[Skaak Tippers]] and the [[Mummers]].<ref name="SWG:CaEM">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Chase an Escaped Murderer" on Naboo</ref> The spacers eventually discovered that Jarkey had recruited a small army of [[Naboo pirates]] and fortified a [[Hunnos Jarkey's Ranch|ranch]] near [[Theed/Legends|Theed]]. Lieutenant Sundria Khartoor planned the assault in which Hunnos Jarkey and all pirates were finally killed.<ref name="SWG:CtEM">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Catch the Escaped Murderer" on Naboo</ref>

name: Sanya Tagge
description: When more and more systems were leaving the [[Galactic Republic]] shortly before the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Sanya reassured the people of her homeworld [[Tepasi/Legends|Tepasi]] that her family would continue to be loyal to the Republic. She pointed out that House Tagge was aware of the heritage of its ancestral ancestor, one of the original founders of the Republic, and continued to support her family's attachment to the Republic, her belief in the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]], and her willingness to continue serving her faith in the Republic.The Baroness, while expressing her loyalty to the Republic unequivocally, withheld promises of concrete assistance to the government. At that time, House Tagge had a fleet of over five thousand armed ships and a private army of over one million soldiers. Nonetheless, Sanya's manifestation of loyalty to a corporation like that of her family was unusual, as most large corporations remained neutral during the crisis. In [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]], the title of House Tagge, with all the privileges, duties, and duties associated with it, fell to Sanya's then seventeen-year-old son Orman. The new Baron Tagge continued the republic-friendly policy of his mother.

name: Nikki Idd
description: {{Quote|Vik! You got my signal!''"<br />"''Loud and clear, sis. Come on!!''"<br />"''Right behind you, bro&hellip;|Nikki and Vik Idd|Star Wars Droids 2: The Ultimate Weapon}}[[File:Nikskicksvlix.png|thumb|left|180px|Nikki Idd prepares to kick her captor, Vlix Oncard.]]Nikki Idd was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived<ref name="Droids 2" /> during the reign of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].<ref name="Droids 5">''[[Star Wars Droids 5: Separated]]''</ref> She was the daughter of renowned [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[Engineer/Legends|designer]] [[Lonn Idd]], and both Nikki Idd and her brother, [[Vik Idd|Vik]], worked for their [[Parent/Legends|father]] out of his [[Lonn Idd's repair station|droid repair space station]]<ref name="Droids 2" /> at some point between [[19 BBY/Legends|19]]<ref name="After 19 BBY">''[[Star Wars Droids 5: Separated]]'', the fifth issue of [[Star Wars: Droids (Marvel)|''Star Wars: Droids'']], mentions the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], whose [[Declaration of a New Order|inception]] is dated to [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] on p. 84 of ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''.</ref> and [[15 BBY/Legends|15 BBY]].<ref name="Before 15 BBY">[[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO's]] entry in ''[[The New Essential Guide to Characters]]'' notes that the [[Star Wars: Droids (Marvel)|''Star Wars: Droids'']] [[Star Wars comic books|comics]] occur prior to the [[Star Wars: Droids: The Adventures of R2-D2 and C-3PO|''Star Wars: Droids'']] cartoon, which is dated to [[15 BBY/Legends|15 BBY]] on p. 78 of {{PolyhedronCite|170|Star Wars Droids: The Adventures of R2-D2 and C-3PO}}.</ref> When the two [[Youngling/Legends|young]] [[Idd family|siblings]] were dispatched in an [[Intergalactic Droid Agency shuttle]]<ref name="Reanimated">{{SW|url=news/the-droids-re-animated-part-1|text=The Droids Re-Animated, Part 1|int=The Droids Re-Animated|archivedate=20190910031316}}</ref> to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dodz]] to collect various droids who were in need of maintenance,<ref name="Droids 1">''[[Star Wars Droids 1: The Destroyer]]''</ref> Idd's brother was forced to intervene in a brawl between several of the droids during the return leg of the trip. The skirmish saw the [[3PO-series protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] tossed into his malfunctioning [[Counterpart/Legends|counterpart]], the [[R2-series astromech droid|astromech droid]] [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]], who began to overload. Idd quickly inserted an [[Energy shield (droid inhibitor)|energy shield]] into the [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech]], which halted the overload but also limited him to his basic functions. C-3PO lamented the fact that he and his counterpart were a masterless pair, and happily agreed when Vik offered that the Idd siblings serve as their masters until R2-D2 could be repaired by Lonn.<ref name="Droids 2" />Upon their arrival at the [[Space station/Legends|space station]], Idd was surprised at the absence of the welcome their father usually gave them, and she rushed through the station's corridors while Vik assigned the droids to various repair stations. When she located her father, she found him tied up and being interrogated by the [[Annoo-dat Blue]] [[Gangster/Legends|gangster]] [[Tig Fromm]], who was demanding that Lonn install a powerful [[Laser/Legends|laser]] on the gangster's [[Tig Fromm's starship|starship]]. When Idd rushed to her father's side, she was grabbed by Fromm's [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]], [[Vlix Oncard]], but she broke free via a kick to Oncard's [[Limb/Legends|shin]] and managed to covertly turn on a [[Computer monitor/Legends|computer monitor's]] [[Camera/Legends|camera]]. Vik and C-3PO, still in the [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]], were thus able to see Lonn agree to Fromm's demands in exchange for his daughter's safety. Idd was locked in a supply shed, which Vik soon infiltrated while R2-D2 and C-3PO distracted the [[Fromm Gang]]'s guards. The siblings' escape was blocked by a robotic [[hover guard]], however, that blasted R2-D2 and freed the guards to apprehend Vik and Nikki Idd.<ref name="Droids 2" />The siblings were held [[Prisoner/Legends|captive]] while their father finished his work. Upon his completion, he was informed by Fromm that the space station would be the laser's first target; however, the gangster was interrupted by the sudden arrival of an ancient [[HK Guardian Droid|guardian droid]]. Hoping to sell it on the [[Black market/Legends|black market]], Fromm demanded that Idd turn over its [[control disk]], but she instead produced a disc-shaped vial of [[Nova Starlight]] [[Perfume/Legends|perfume]] and sprayed it in his face. The guardian droid then advanced on the gangsters and fought off attacking hover guards with its powerful punches; cornered, the gangsters were ensnared in a [[packing net]] dropped by Vik. The Idds' savior was revealed to be C-3PO, wearing the empty shell of a guardian droid he had found aboard the station, and Lonn gratefully repaired the damaged R2-D2. When the astromech was fixed,<ref name="Droids 2" /> the children returned both droids to the [[Intergalactic Droid Agency]] to allow them to find new masters.<ref name="Reanimated" />

name: Chrysalla
description: During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she was a peasant living in the slums of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. When the last Satab came to power, he took notice of her and brought her back to his palace as his favored consort. After this, she enjoyed the lap of luxury and the benefits of being the chosen ward of the ruler of the planet. At some point, Chrysalla was being paraded through the streets of [[Goyoikin]] when an explosive flew through the air in an attempted [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]]. However, [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], who was in the general vicinity, was able to shoot the explosive out of the air. Chrysalla declared Solo a hero and brought him back to the palace to meet the [[Satab]].After a celebratory banquet in Solo's honor, the Satab insisted that Solo stay the night in the palace. However, Solo tried to escape the very same night, and it was only through Chrysalla's interference that Solo wasn't caught by the [[palace]] guard. Solo and Chrysalla spent the night together where she explained that the Satab had supernatural powers gifted to him by his possession of the [[shadeshine]].The next morning, Chrysalla followed the Satab and Solo to a [[Sansanna spice/Legends|sansanna spice]] [[Mining/Legends|mine]] where she overheard the Satab's intention to make Solo the next Satab. Knowing that the shadeshine had the ability to burn out and destroy a person's body, Chrysalla feared for Solo's safety. During the ceremony to "promote" Solo, Chrysalla intervened and kept him from touching the shadeshine and receiving its powers. In the ensuing chaos, the Satab attempted to force Solo to become the next Satab. However Chrysalla touched the stone before he could bend Solo to his will, and she became imbued with the powers of the shadeshine. The Satab and his mistress began to have a duel of the minds, but the effects of the shadeshine were quickly burning out the Satab's body. Running away from the battle, the Satab attempted to enter the [[Hall of Satabs]] to halt the deadly effects of the shadeshine. However, Solo was able to trip the powerful ruler, and he was unable to make it to his destination, incinerated by the power of the shadeshine.With the Satab defeated, Chrysalla was the only person to left with the powers of the shadeshine. To end the rule of the Satabs and the shadeshine, Chrysalla knew that she could not continue to wield their power. After sharing a parting kiss with Han Solo, she willingly brought herself and the stone into the Hall of Satabs where she was placed in suspended animation, ending the royal line. Around [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], the Hall of Satabs was still being maintained as a historic landmark by the [[Rov]] [[Vetter Piin]]. [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] witnessed Chrysalla's body still perfectly preserved in the [[nullification chamber]] when they visited Ventooine during the search for [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]].

name: Vareth
description: Vareth worked with the male [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] [[Garron]]. Garron used his recently deceased parents' life insurance in the purchase of the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] ''[[Startled Circuit]]''. They made their way to Tatooine, and Jabba's [[Majordomo/Legends|majordomo]] [[Bib Fortuna/Legends|Bib Fortuna]] was impressed enough with Vareth and Garron's skills that he offered them employment as spacers in the Hutt's criminal organization.

name: Odanni
description: Odanni worked tirelessly to build [[Fathoms]] restaurant from a small operation into a first-rate entertainment complex. She expanded Fathoms to include three other businesses: the [[HyperDive Cantina]], [[Wave Works]] and the [[Seabed Lodge]].[[File:OdanniPoisoner.png|thumb|left|250px|Odanni watches as Geffa chokes on poisoned food. Nollo Kanx, her enforcer, watches from the shadows.]]Behind the glittery exterior, Odanni had set up a large criminal empire that used her operations as fronts. She employed the [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] [[Nollo Kanx]] as her chief enforcer. They typically used poison as a way to deal with those that tried to cross them. When [[Geffa]], a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Spice/Legends|spice]] dealer tried to change a deal at the last minute and charge an extra ten percent markup, Odanni and Kanx poisoned him through the food at her restaurant. Her criminal empire included spice dealing, [[Black market/Legends|black market]] sales, money laundering, and fencing stolen goods.

name: Malak (Rodian)
description: Malak was a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] in [[26 BBY/Legends|26 BBY]].<ref name="g11" /> She worked as a [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], both leading up to<ref name="air">''[[Alliance Intelligence Reports]]''</ref> and after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] of [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], which saw the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] suffer a major defeat. She was the [[Commander/Legends|commander]] of her own [[Malak's slavers|gang of raiders]], leading them in incursions against unsuspecting, unprotected villages. During these raids Malak used a modified [[snare gun]] to capture living prey.<ref name="g11" />Circa [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]], Malak was still a petty criminal. She attacked<ref name="air" /> the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]]<ref name="atlas">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> [[Byss (Outer Rim Territories)|Byss]], which was inhabited by [[Abyssin/Legends|Abyssins]], who were a common target for slavers by that point.<ref name="gg4">''[[Galaxy Guide 4: Alien Races]]''</ref> She captured at least one Abyssin, [[Myo/Legends|Myo]], and took him aboard her [[Malak's starship|starship]]. She then left Byss and made a stop at [[Kinun Depot]] to [[Fuel/Legends|refuel]] her [[Starship/Legends|ship]]. Myo took the opportunity to escape from Malak.<ref name="air" />The Empire listed her as the subject of one of their [[TracSheet]]s, which were used to record charges against criminals. Malak was filed under number 11706900-AGTY-233476. She was accused with several charges, including the activities of a slaver and the possession of illegal weapons. She was also suspected of [[Pirate/Legends|piracy]]. Although the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], which was established shortly after the Battle of [[Endor/Legends|Endor]], had executed several campaigns to end slavery from 4 ABY onward, Malak was still at large and active as of [[10 ABY/Legends|10 ABY]].<ref name="g11" />

name: Hari Seldona
description: {{Unlicensedstart}}As a young [[Poet/Legends|poetess]], Hari Seldona studied ancient literature at the [[Byron College]] of [[Aldera/Legends|Aldera]]. She lived in the university campus, which overlooked the [[Aldera lake|lake]] to the south of the city. She was the girlfriend of [[Soltan Wostikian]], the founder of the rebellious [[Band/Legends|band]] ''[[Red Line]]''. This band became the voice of the oppressed, drawing attention to the poor and the marginalized. This was not well received in the upper reaches of power, and Wostikian was murdered a few month before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]].<ref name="Prelude to ANH">{{CasusBelliCite|103|Prélude à un Nouvel Espoir}}</ref>After the death of her boyfriend, Seldona and other surviving members of ''Red Line'' became involved with the Alderaanian Resistance movement.<ref name="Prelude to ANH" />{{Unlicensedend}}After the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] erupted, Hari Seldona would venture off Alderaan and read her poems to the passerby. She was doing so in the [[Corellian sector/Legends|Corellian sector]] when the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]] destroyed Alderaan. She immediately dropped out of sight to avoid [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] reprisal, though would occasionally appear unannounced, read her poetry and speak out against the [[New Order/Legends|New Order]], disappearing before [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] could arrive.<ref name="FFDEA6">{{FFCite|24|DEA6, ''The Destruction of Alderaan''}}</ref>

name: Soara Antana/Legends
description: {{Quote|So glad you could join us," Soara said.<br />"Thought you might have missed us," Darra said with a grin. Then she noted Soara's injury. "Master, you're hurt!"<br />"Just a minor inconvenience...|Darra Thel-Tanis and her Master Soara Antana in the midst of a rescue operation by Darra and her fellow Padawans, to free their battle-droid besieged Masters in the "ground canyons" of Radnor.|Jedi Quest: The Way of the Apprentice}}A graceful [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Soara Antana was a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. A noted [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] virtuoso—described even as "a legend"<ref>''[[Jedi Quest: The Way of the Apprentice]]''</ref>—Antana was stationed at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] where she served as a lightsaber instructor. At the request of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], Antana (who had also recently just become a Knight) began training Kenobi's [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], in specialized [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]]. Circa [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]], Antana took on [[Darra Thel-Tanis]] as her Padawan.<ref name="TWA" />On their first [[Mission to Radnor|mission]] together, Antana and Thel-Tanis accompanied Jedi Master [[Ry-Gaul]] and his Padawan [[Tru Veld]], Master [[Siri Tachi]] and her Padawan [[Ferus Olin]], as well as Kenobi and Skywalker to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Radnor/Legends|Radnor]] to help with the evacuation of that world. The evacuation was due to a deadly toxin that had spread throughout the planet because of a weapons chemical leak. Antana and the other Jedi later discovered that the toxic leak was connected with the local [[Avoni]] raiders. The evidence ultimately led to [[Galen (Radnoran)|Galen]], a traitorous [[Radnoran]], who was taken into custody for his crimes. The Avoni, however, escaped prosecution. During the mission, Antana was injured by a [[Multi-Troop Transport/Legends|Multi-Troop Transport]], but soon recovered.Around [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]], Antana and Thel-Tanis continued to undertake assignments together, including an escort mission to [[Nuralee]]. After [[Granta Omega]] and [[Jenna Zan Arbor]], both enemies of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], were tracked, Antana accompanied Kenobi, Skywalker, Olin, Ry-Gaul, and Veld on a [[Mission to Korriban (23 BBY)|mission]] to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Korriban]], the ancient birthplace of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. During the mission, the Jedi entered the [[Valley of the Dark Lords/Legends|Valley of the Dark Lords]], where they sensed how strong the dark side was. They were ambushed by [[Korriban zombie]]s, which led to the death of Antana's Padawan at the hands of Granta Omega.As the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] started, Soara participated alongside Kenobi and Skywalker in several missions against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. As the wars ended in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Soara was killed during the [[Operation: Knightfall|assault]] at the [[Jedi Temple]]—the beginning of the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]].<ref name="TWA" />

name: Rynalla
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Rynalla was a scholar affiliated with the department of ancient history of the prestigious [[University of Sanbra]]. She was an expert in [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] history, archaeology, and the lore of several traditions of [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-users, including the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], in addition to bygone organizations. Secretly, Rynalla researched the Sith and traditions of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] to increase her own [[Force power/Legends|powerss]] of the Force.While researching in the University records, Rynalla discovered that a missing [[Sith artifact/Legends|Sith treasure]], the [[Bracers of Najus]], had been lost in a Sith starship which had crash-landed on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Leritor/Legends|Leritor]]. The Bracers could be used to increase the power of the dark side, and she coveted the relic. She hired two dozen [[Klatooinian/Legends|Klatooinian]] [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]] and went to Leritor in her bulk freighter, with her two [[PTR-3 Vedette]] snub fighters in tow. On arrival, Rynalla found the Sith starship half-buried in the local mountain range known as the [[Bleaks]]; she quickly organized a dig site using prefabricated buildings. Noticing two main groups in the planet, the Human settlers who farmed the inland prairies and the native [[Sauvax]] living the coast, she decided to capture strong individuals from each group and use them as slave miners to uncover the ship.Rynalla's forces raided one of the massive harvester machines used by the farmers, the nearby ''[[Nellist]]''. The stronger colonists were captured and the weaker ones were murdered with the traditional Sauvax weapon, the [[gruush]], so that other on-world Humans would blame the Sauvax, even if a more detailed analysis would have proved otherwise. Similarly, the Klatooinians also assaulted a Sauvax community, called a [[kuuvan]], again executing the feeble and conscripting the powerful. They used [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]], so that the Sauvax in other kuuvans would suspect that the Human farmers were behind the incursion. Thus Rynalla manufactured a war among the Sauvax and the farmers, keeping them busy while she plundered her prize.In all, fifty Human and Sauvax prisoners were captured. They were put to work, with the amphibious Sauvax in the deepest submerged decks of the ship, and always watched by armed Klatooinians. Rynalla did not tell the captives what she was looking for, but every two [[Standard day/Legends|days]], she evicted the exhausted laborers while she looked for the Bracers and the Klatooinians looked for any attempt to create an escape tunnel. Rynalla's disposal of waste polluted a nearby river, a change that was being noticed by several local Sauvax. She was certain, however, that nobody would imagine that she'd created a slave camp. More worried about fugitives than intruders, Rynalla organized a second, smaller camp near the edge of the mountain, to stop and execute any runaways; five such individuals met their end there.A Sauvax kuuvan led by [[Unidentified tevelor|their tevelor]], mistakenly believing that the farmers intended to [[Speciecide|exterminate]] their [[Species/Legends|species]], surrounded the combine-reaper ''[[Gevion]]'' and demanded an explanation. As the farmers believed that the Sauvax were an aggressive, murderous species, they were too wary to send an envoy; in a stalemate, the Sauvax refused to allow the ''Gevion'' collect its crop. This situation would have escalated into war, but a group of offworlders heard a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress call]] from the ''Gevion'' and offered to mediate. These individuals began investigating and soon found a trail to Rynalla's camp. Rynalla found the Bracers of Najus just in time to face the intruders. She was eventually defeated, however, and peace was restored to Leritor.

name: Asyr Sei'lar
description: As a youth, Sei'lar enrolled in the [[Bothan Martial Academy]] against her parents' wishes. She was trained in flight combat along with [[Peshk Vri'syk]], another future Rogue Squadron pilot. The two were equals during training, but because he graduated one year ahead of her, he was able to join the elite squadron first.[[File:AsyrSeilar-Insider59.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Asyr Sei'lar]]She later ended up on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], where she joined the [[Anti-Humanism|anti-Human]] [[Alien Combine]] organization. There she met [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooinian]] [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] pilot Gavin Darklighter. At first, she took him for an [[Humanocentrism|anti-Alien]] bigot and turned him over to the Combine for execution, but later reconsidered and joined the Rogues. She took part in the [[Liberation of Coruscant (Galactic Civil War)|liberation of Coruscant]] on their side, and she and Gavin also soon fell in love.She continued to fly with Rogue Squadron for several years, flying during the [[Krytos virus|Krytos]] threat and later resigning with the rest of the Rogues to wage the [[Bacta War]] against [[Ysanne Isard]]'s [[Thyferra/Legends|Thyferra]]. She survived [[Thrawn campaign|Thrawn's campaign]] against the New Republic and was a source of great pride for her home world of [[Bothawui/Legends|Bothawui]].Her relationship with Gavin Darklighter later caused problems, as fellow Bothan and [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Borsk Fey'lya]] opposed it due to Darklighter being [[Human/Legends|Human]]. During Ysanne Isard's return, Sei'lar was presumed dead in the [[Battle of Distna]] of the campaign aimed at ousting Prince-[[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Delak Krennel]] in the [[Ciutric Hegemony]]. She in fact survived and, with the help of [[Booster Terrik]], decided to go undercover and work toward changes in Bothan society. However, as late as [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]], Gavin still believed her to be dead. Sei'lar kept in contact with Iella Wessiri for a few years, until the reborn Emperor's appearance.

name: Tann Gella/Legends
description: The pair escorted [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]] in the years surrounding [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], after being bought from the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]. As Sebulba's [[yobana]]s, they had the unfortunate task of delivering a pre- and post-race massage to their [[Dug/Legends|Dug]] [[Podracing/Legends|podracing]] owner. Also, she was an acquaintance of Hutt [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]] along with her sister, and was one of Jabba's guests during the death match between the Hutt's [[Jabba's champion|champion]] and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], the latter of whom was lured to Jabba's arena by her sister on behalf of Jabba, who was hoping for "worthy entertainment" from the Jedi Master.

name: Selene
description: Selene was born at the time of the [[Mandalorian Wars]] and decided to join the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] during the start of the [[Jedi Civil War]]. She met a young man named [[Dustil Onasi]], the son of [[Carth Onasi]]. The two grew close and she felt sorry when Dustil's homeworld, [[Telos IV]], had been bombed by the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Malak]]. Believing that the Sith could help Dustil, she convinced him to go with her to Korriban and attend the Sith Academy. They arrived at the Academy, which was under the leadership of [[Headmaster/Legends|Headmaster]] [[Uthar Wynn]].During her training at the academy, Selene had encountered problems in dealing with the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and felt that being a Sith was the worst mistake of her life. She decided to use her relationship with Dustil to hinder his progress at the academy. Dustil genuinely loved Selene and remained close to her. However, Uthar discovered their relationship, and found that while Dustil was talented and showed promise, Selene was a mediocre student who was only a hindrance to Dustil's training. The ruthless ruler of the Academy decided to get rid of Selene, and sent her on a mission into the [[Valley of the Dark Lords/Legends|Valley of the Dark Lords]], and Selene was killed by the Headmaster. Dustil was concerned of her disappearance, but Uthar lied that Selene was killed during a mission. Dustil was heartbroken, but he continued his training in the Academy.The true circumstances behind Selene's death were revealed to Dustil by his father, Carth Onasi and a redeemed [[Revan/Legends|Revan]]. Dustil was angry and upset that Uthar lied to him, and saw the deception of the dark side. He agreed to leave the Academy and warn other students to convince them to leave with him.

name: Zardra
description: [[File:Zardra.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Zardra the bounty hunter]]Zardra had partnered herself with a fellow bounty hunter named [[Jodo Kast]], and together they decided to stake a claim on a bounty for two [[Spice/Legends|spice]]-jackers known as the [[Thig Brothers]]. They tracked the Thigs to a bistro called the [[Red Shadow]] on the grime-filled streets of [[Taboon]] in the [[Stenness system]]. Four [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]] servants passed through carrying a [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] known as [[Mageye]] on top of a palanquin. Mageye was en route to cut a deal with another Hutt named [[BolBol]]. The entourage made the mistake of getting into the middle of the firefight at the Red Shadows. Zardra and Jodo hemmed the Thig Brothers into a crossfire and opened fire on them. During the excitement, the Weequay servants dropped Mageye's litter, allowing the Hutt to slide down on top of Zardra. Unable to muscle her way out from beneath the Hutt on her own, Zardra shoved a gauge six [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonator]] into his mouth, blowing him to bits. The death of Mageye soon reached the ears of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]]. After losing favor with Jabba the Hutt, [[Gorm (cyborg)|Gorm the Dissolver]] accepted a 50,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credit]] [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] to bring Zardra to heel.Circa [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Zardra tried to collect a 40,000-credit bounty posted by the Empire on [[Dharus]], a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] [[Privateer/Legends|privateer]]. Understanding that Dharus could easily attack the [[Jesoni-class liner|''Jesoni''-class liner]] ''[[Culroon Minstrel]]'', Zardra boarded the ship. Dharus' intelligence was restricted to Imperial activities, and as such the pirate was unaware of the independent bounty hunter ambushing him &mdash; his contacts mistakenly believed Zardra to be a harmless Imperial aristocrat. Dharus and his crew attacked the ''Minstrel'' and, once they had boarded the ship, Zardra defeated them and captured Dharus.<ref name="GG9">''[[Galaxy Guide 9: Fragments from the Rim]]'', page 62+</ref> The Empire gave Zardra the bounty.<ref name="PP">''[[Pirates & Privateers]]''</ref>

name: Sienn'rha
description: Sienn'rha was another [[Slavery/Legends|slave girl]] kidnapped by [[Bib Fortuna/Legends|Bib Fortuna]] and trained to be a dancer for [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. While being transported to [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|Jabba's Palace]], [[Jerris Rudd]] hid both girls that later were discovered by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]]. Luke tried to help them both to escape, but Oola was suspicious. Rudd came and a fight began. Luke deflected all bolts from Rudd's blaster and killed him, providing the dancers a chance to escape. Oola then distracted the recently arrived Fortuna and urged Sienn to flee, naively thinking to thus ensure Jabba's patronage for only herself.<ref name="Oola's Tale" />She would later return to Ryloth and would remain grateful to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] for her rescue for years afterward. During [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron's]] mission to [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] to obtain [[Ryll kor]], Sienn'rha was one of the dancers who entertained the [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]]. She passed a message to [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] that she would entertain him with a private dance if he wished, an offer he politely declined.<ref name="X-Wing: The Krytos Trap">''[[X-Wing: The Krytos Trap]]''</ref>Sienn was a name commonly attributed to Twi'lek females, and meant ''maiden'' in the [[Twi'leki/Legends|Twi'leki]] language.<ref name="Galactic Campaign Guide">''[[Galactic Campaign Guide]]''</ref>

name: Celia Durasha
description: She planned to follow her brothers into the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] but was prevented from joining the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]] by [[Reise Durasha|her father]], a [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] who believed it was no place for a woman. Celia resented him for it and was forced to find a career elsewhere.Until the [[destruction of Alderaan]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Celia was the [[Navigator/Legends|navigator]] aboard the [[Kuari Princess/Legends|''Kuari Princess'']]. She was thrown into confusion when she discovered that her brother [[Raine Durasha|Raine]], an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]], had been [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] on [[Ralltiir/Legends|Ralltiir]], while at the same time a close friend aboard the ''Kuari Princess'' was revealed to be a Rebel operative. After her friend was killed by the [[Imperial officer/Legends|Imperial officer]] [[Adion Lang]], a former lover of hers, Celia escaped the ship in a passenger barge. Due to the death of her brother at the hands of the Rebellion and the loss of her best friend to the Empire, she had no love for either.Crimson then became a [[free-trader]] and [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] who owned the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] the ''[[Starlight Red]]''. She had a tendency to get involved in what her [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] considered "heroic antics," and she also had a tendency to talk&mdash;too much, according to the droid&mdash;during [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] travels.[[File:Crimson-under-arrest.jpg|thumb|left|100px|"Crimson" arrested]]When she was arrested by [[Imperial Office of Customs/Legends|Imperial Customs]] in [[Byblos/Legends|Byblos]] [[Byblos Starport Tower 214|Starport Tower 214]], her protocol droid [[U-THR]] assumed the role of the unlikely hero and came to her rescue.Crimson eventually fell in love with [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] smuggler [[Kaj Nedmak]] and ran several missions with him for underworld kingpins [[Bwahl]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] and [[Rass M'Guy]]. When a smuggling deal went sour, however, Bwahl hired the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Thune (bounty hunter)|Thune]] to capture them. Chasing them to [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]], Thune almost managed to do just that, and nearly killed Kaj in the process, but the smugglers turned the tables on her and escaped, stealing both her ship and her droid, U-THR.

name: Domina Tagge/Legends
description: Domina was once a member of the [[Order of the Sacred Circle]] and became its leader. She wore the traditional yellow gown of the order, even after she left them. Tagge began an uneasy alliance with [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and showed romantic interest in the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord's]] son [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] as part of a plot to avenge her brothers, Orman and Silas, whom Vader falsely claimed Skywalker murdered. During this [[Time/Legends|time]], Vader trained her in the use of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], including [[Animal bond|animal control]].In her later plans to destroy Skywalker, Domina fell prey to her own plotting and her men betrayed her for [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Bounty/Legends|bounties]].Domina clashed with [[Leia Organa Solo]] and [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] during the time when they were seeking a cure for the [[Crimson Forever]] disease that had infected Luke Skywalker. Leia recognized Domina on sight, and it was clear there was a long-standing mutual dislike between them. Leia and Lando trapped Domina on her [[Mining Explorer|ship]] with a group of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] she had hired, [[Bossk/Legends|Bossk]], [[IG-88B|IG-88]], [[Dengar/Legends|Dengar]], and [[Zuckuss/Legends|Zuckuss]] leaving them unable to leave the compartment they were in without being exposed to the virus themselves.Eventually, Domina used the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] IG-88 to neutralize the disease, since he was mechanical and thus immune, and Skywalker was cured. Domina was granted safe passage, although Calrissian suggested to the bounty hunters that they might claim a bounty on Domina herself.{{Char-stub}}

name: Seenlu Kir
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at a young age, Seenlu Kir was taken to the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Studying for years as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] in the [[Jedi academy|Temple's academy]], Kir eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] and was taken as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. After years of traveling together, Kir passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Continuing her studies independently, Kir followed the path of the [[Jedi Consular]] in order to help bring peace to worlds throughout [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].<ref name="LFC" />On an assignment for the High Council, Kir's hands were scarred when she failed her mission. Donning gloves to hide her hands, Kir began to wear pants and vests as opposed to the traditional [[Jedi apparel|robes]] of the Order. Soon after this failure, Jedi Kir traveled to the [[Cularin system]] and began working out of the [[Almas Academy|academy]] on [[Almas]]. Taking on a teaching position, Kir trained students at all levels before being assigned to oversee the dormitories of the youngest Initiates.<ref name="LFC" />

name: Elassa Huros
description: Young, beautiful and charismatic, Elassa Huros was very seductive in her appearance during her time in the academy. After completing her trials and was selected as an apprentice to a [[Unidentified Dark Jedi Master (Manaan)|Dark Jedi Master]], she showed so much charm to men that she saw. Her master didn't find her very wise in the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and would be talented as a true [[Sith/Legends|Sith]].Elassa tried to prove her loyalty as a Sith, and was stationed on [[Manaan/Legends|Manaan]] in [[3956 BBY]] while her master was in charge of the [[Sith Embassy]]. While she was moving through [[Ahto City]], she set her eyes on a former [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] agent named [[Sunry]] and was engaged in an illicit affair. The two of them began meeting secretly in a hotel. Seeing that he held secrets from the Republic, Elassa decided to feign the retired soldier in order to discover what secrets he carried, so she could deliver it to her master, then to [[Darth Malak]]. This was when Sunry soon discovered her true purpose in secret and didn't give any information to her. Elassa tried her best, but her efforts were thwarted when her master told her that she already failed him. The next day when Elassa was in the hotel room, Sunry killed her with a single blaster shot.{{GameLS|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}In a twist of fate, [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] was appointed Sunry's arbiter while visiting Ahto City. He discovered the truth behind the case and murder of Elassa, and his discovery weighed heavily upon his defense of Sunry for the murder he had in fact committed.{{Endgame}}

name: Telsij Cayr
description: The battle at [[Brentaal IV/Legends|Brentaal IV]] was her first battle, and she held the rank of [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]], serving in [[Aggressor Wing]] where she was the pilot for [[Aggressor Seven]] with [[Kin Kian (Sullustan)|Kin Kian]].During the battle she was shot down by [[Soontir Fel]], and lost her left eye and left leg, which were replaced with prosthetics. Despite that, she eventually made her peace with Fel.

name: Tere Metallo
description: Before becoming a freighter captain, Tere was sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] by a jealous sister. She was rescued by the [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Bek Nataal]], who she worked for afterward.After Bek was killed by [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] inspectors, Tere escaped and began working to eventually buy her own ship. She later bought the [[Suwantek Systems]] [[TL-1800 freighter]] ''[[Star Quest]]''.Following a successful [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] game on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], she took on [[Matt Turhaya]] as her co-pilot and mechanic.

name: Zarfeen
description: Employed by the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] crime syndicate's [[Clezo]], she was sent by the group to retrieve [[Celis Mott]]'s lost treasure when word got out that [[Marka Durn]] had discovered the horde. Sadly, it was too little too late, and the treasure eluded her.

name: Mazie
description: Mazie and her daughter, [[Berri (Twi'lek)|Berri]], were slaves under the crime-lord [[Krayn]] laboring in the [[Spice/Legends|spice]]-processing facilities on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]]. She befriended [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and made it her business to relieve the discomforts of (and dangers to) her fellow slaves. Mazie helped Skywalker to persuade the slaves to revolt against Krayn, resulting ultimately in their freedom.Ironically, Mazie and her family had moved to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] from [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] in [[39 BBY/Legends|39 BBY]], in order to avoid slavery, only to be seized and cast into slavery later by Krayn. Mazie's destiny was a sad one, however, as she later died in a tragic shootout.{{Char-stub}}

name: Tagdel
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Tagdel worked for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] [[Ministry of Finance (Galactic Republic)|Ministry of Finance]] during the last decade of the government's existence. A wealthy woman, Tagdel loved her orphaned nephew, [[Joram Kithe]], and ensured that he attended the best institutes of learning at her expense. Despite her greatest efforts, Tagdel was disappointed with Kithe and his apparent lack of focus and unemployment. Insisting that he find employment, Tagdel used her connections within the government to get him an accounting position within the [[Department of Cost Accounting]].<ref name="TPT" />

name: Vhonte Tervho
description: {{Quote|You're the best in your field—the best soldiers, tacticians, sappers, communicators, survival experts. I picked you personally because I want you to train the best commandos in the galaxy. You'll have everything you need, whatever you want, except one thing—home. This is a top-secret project. You'll not tell anyone where you're going and you'll not leave Kamino, ever. As far as your friends and family are concerned, you're already dead.|[[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]], recruiting Vhonte Tervho and the other members of the ''[[Cuy'val Dar]]''|Republic Commando: Hard Contact}}Vhonte Tervho was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]],<ref name="TMPaC" /> who lived during the final [[Standard decade/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="TC" /> Trained in combat by Mandalorian [[Verd'goten|tradition]], Tervho became a skilled [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] and [[Hunting/Legends|huntress]]. She worked as a [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] for a [[Time/Legends|time]], on at least one occasion working together with a group of other Mandalorian soldiers. Tervho was known to have [[Death/Legends|hunted]] a large, horned, [[Color/Legends|white]]-[[Hair/Legends|furred]] [[Species/Legends|creature]] through nighttime [[Water/Legends|snow]].<ref name="TMPaC" />[[File:Mand-Group_small.jpg|thumb|left|225px|Vhonte Tervho leads a band of [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] in combat]]After being recruited by the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]]<ref name="LoE">''[[Labyrinth of Evil]]''</ref> [[Dooku/Legends|Darth Tyranus]] to serve as the [[Prime clone|template]] for an [[Army/Legends|army]] of [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] soldiers to be born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]],<ref name="BH">''[[Star Wars: Bounty Hunter]]''</ref> [[Mandalore (title)|''Mand'alor'']] [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]]<ref name="O66">''[[Order 66: A Republic Commando Novel]]''</ref> [[Limb/Legends|hand]]-picked a total of one hundred beings from across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] to train the [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commandos]] that would make up the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army's]] [[Special forces/Legends|special forces]].<ref name="HC">''[[Republic Commando: Hard Contact]]''</ref> Vhonte Tervho was selected by Fett and she accepted his offer, joining the ranks of seventy-five Mandalorians and twenty-five beings of other assorted backgrounds known collectively as the ''[[Cuy'val Dar]]'', a term which meant "Those Who No Longer Exist" in the Mandalorian [[Language/Legends|language]] of [[Mando'a/Legends|''Mando'a'']].<ref name="TC" /> Like the other members of the ''Cuy'val Dar'', Tervho became a training [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]], in charge of a total of one hundred and four [[Clone cadet/Legends|young clones]] whom she trained to adulthood and efficiency over the course of close to ten [[Standard year/Legends|years]].<ref name="TZ">''[[Republic Commando: Triple Zero]]''</ref> She was also among a number of Mandalorian members of the ''Cuy'val Dar'' to join Jango Fett in the combat education of his young son, [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]].<ref name="Gunslingers">{{SW|url=news/so-uncivilized-great-gunslingers-in-star-wars-part-1|text=So Uncivilized: Great Gunslingers in ''Star Wars'', Part 1|int=So Uncivilized: Great Gunslingers in Star Wars|archivedate=20170908055512}}</ref> Due to the top-secret nature of the clone army project, neither Tervho nor any other member of the ''Cuy'val Dar'' were allowed to leave Kamino<ref name="HC" /> before they were deployed with the rest of the army against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid forces]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] on behalf of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|Battle of Geonosis]], the first battle of the emerging [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="TZ" /> At some point in [[Time/Legends|time]], Tervho incurred a debt to her ''Cuy'val Dar'' colleague and fellow Mandalorian, [[Kal Skirata]].<ref name="TC" />With her contract to train the [[Commando/Legends|commandos]] completed after [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], Tervho departed Kamino with a wealth of [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for services rendered,<ref name="TZ" /> and like many of the ''Cuy'val Dar''{{'s}} Mandalorian members<ref name="O66" /> she traveled back to [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]],<ref name="TC" /> the Mandalorians cultural [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] located in the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy's]] [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]].<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> However, Tervho later returned to Kamino to again [[ARC training program|train clone troops]], imparting her skills with dual [[DC-17]] [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] to more than a thousand up and coming [[Clone trooper commander|clone commanders]].<ref name="Gunslingers" /> Later in the war, during his quest to halt the accelerated aging the Republic's [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] had been subjected to by the [[Kaminoan/Legends|Kaminoan]] [[Clone Master]]s, Kal Skirata kidnapped Kaminoan [[Chief Scientist]] [[Ko Sai/Legends|Ko Sai]], and considered calling in the favor Tervho owed to him to house Ko Sai on Mandalore, though he instead settled on taking the [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] to his own Mandalore [[Kyrimorut|homestead]] with the aid of their fellow former ''Cuy'val Dar'' trainer, [[Rav Bralor]].<ref name="TC" />

name: Valles Santhe
description: Valles was the granddaughter of the [[Lianna/Legends|Liann]] industrialist [[Kerred Santhe]], who acquired a controlling share in [[Sienar Technologies]] and its subsidiary [[Republic Sienar Systems/Legends|Republic Sienar Systems]] c. [[99 BBY]]. Sienar Technologies was renamed [[Santhe/Sienar Technologies]] and Republic Sienar Systems eventually became [[Sienar Fleet Systems/Legends|Sienar Fleet Systems]], manufacturer of the [[TIE Series]] of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] fighters.Lady Santhe was a small woman with black hair and flashing dark eyes whose presence commanded an unmistakable air of authority. She was an arrogant woman who was used to almost unlimited wealth and power. Her companies factories employed a large percentage of the population of [[Lianna/Legends|Lianna]]. She openly supported the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] but in reality she was a firm believer in Liann independence and did not particularly care for the Empire or the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]].When Santhe/Sienar Technologies received an Imperial defense contract (Codename [[NOVA]]) to develop an improvement of the [[Energy Emittance Baffler]], a key component of a [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaking device]], the [[Imperial Advisor]] [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Rodin Hlian Verpalion]] was assigned to oversee the project. Valles treated Lord Verpalion with caution but secretly hated him. She manipulated his visits carefully so as to ensure good reports to [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]].Following the Emperor's death she was able to attain a degree of independence for her homeworld, despite the pro-Imperial attempts of Lord Verpalion. When the CEO of Santhe/Sienar Technologies, [[Raith Sienar/Legends|Raith Sienar]], was assassinated Lady Santhe took direct control of the company. She created [[Sienar Army Systems]] which manufactured the [[Century tank]] and other ground vehicles for the Empire under the Reborn Emperor. However, she also used the weapons as a threat to prevent an Imperial occupation of Lianna by [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Gronn]].

name: Eriann Strathmore
description: Lady Strathmore believed that her only vice was her penchant for [[Gambling/Legends|gambling]]. She only frequented the more distinguished establishments in the galaxy such as the [[Ace of Sabres]] where she tried to get membership into the exclusive [[Sabre Club]].

name: Nikki Vul
description: Vul reported on the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]] in a HoloNet item broadcast across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], in which she revealed the outcome of the battle and praised its heroes, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]]. [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] learned of developments on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] through Vul's report.

name: Genna Delpin
description: She took the post of [[Supreme Commander of the Corellian forces|Supreme Commander]] of the Corellian military when [[Dur Gejjen]] forcibly removed [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] from the post. She was later in charge of firing [[Centerpoint Station]] when it destroyed the Alliance Second Fleet and would later form an alliance with [[Denjax Teppler]] following the death of [[Sadras Koyan]]. Teppler later became co-Chief of State of Corellia.{{Char-stub}}

name: Dyoh
description: She was present when a party was held for the arrival of the representatives of the [[Alliance of Free Planets]]. She was accompanied by a male Human.

name: Jaizen Suel
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at an early age, Jaizen Suel was inducted into the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]] where she was taught the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Suel began independent studies on the path of the [[Jedi Guardian]], studying to become a member of the [[Jedi Starfighter Corps]]. Becoming a well respected [[Jedi ace|pilot ace]], Jedi Suel was considered to be a [[Gray Jedi|maverick]] among the Jedi, involving herself in local matters such as [[Pirate/Legends|piracy]] and [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]], while ignoring the advice of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="SG" />Despite this reputation, Jedi Suel responded to [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu's]] rallying cry at the height of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] and piloted her [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor]] above [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], supporting the newly unveiled [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].
