Piloting her starfighter through Geonosis' asteroid belt, Suel flew under the command of High Councilors [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]] and [[Oppo Rancisis/Legends|Oppo Rancisis]] during the [[Battle of Geonosis (disambiguation)|battle]].<ref name="JS">''[[Star Wars: Jedi Starfighter]]''</ref>Taking up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] within the army, Suel spent much of her time on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]], participating in what came to be known as the [[Outer Rim Sieges/Legends|Outer Rim Sieges]] throughout the war. During the final days of war, Suel traded her traditional Jedi starfighter in for a modified [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]] named ''[[Dawn Raider]]''.<ref name="SG" />

name: Ereen Agar
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]], Ereen Agar spent the early part of her life on the Zabrak colony [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Anobis]], which was located in the [[Anobis system]]. At some point she worked as a hired guard for a [[Unidentified Mid Rim transport company|transport company]] in the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]]. While she worked for the company, Agar fought to protect cargo from both [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and law enforcement [[Agent/Legends|agents]]. During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]],<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|I|14|Agar, Ereen}}</ref> a conflict between the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]],<ref name="EGW">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref> Agar was in a relatively small [[Unidentified spaceport (Tatooine)|spaceport]] when it was [[Attack on Tatooine spaceport|attacked]] by pirates looking for easy prey. The pirates went after Agar and opened fire, but Agar fought back, [[Death/Legends|killing]] two of the pirates with her [[Heavy blaster pistol/Legends|heavy blaster pistol]] and three more with her [[Vibroblade/Legends|vibroblade]]. After killing the pirates, Ereen Agar was approached by another individual who had been present during the attack, a [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] named [[Vurrha Chur]] who ran a criminal organization named [[Vurrha's Blood]]. Due to Agar display of combat prowess, Chur offered her a position in his organization as an enforcer.<ref name="UA" />After some [[Time/Legends|time]] working for Vurrha Chur's organization, Agar had become a more ambitious individual and began acquiring wealth and favors from individuals who bribed her to leave them alone when she was assigned to come after them. She carefully built up her strength and kept individuals alive who she believed might become useful later. During her time working for Vurrha Chur, he considered her his top enforcer. She kept apart from the rest of Chur's employees, including [[Sevv Sunb]], the Quarren crime lord's book keeper, who Agar disliked. While working for Chur, Agar slowly prepared for departing Vurrha's organization.<ref name="UA" />

name: Seib Nod
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Near-Human]] [[Lorrdian/Legends|Lorrdian]] from [[Lorrd/Legends|Lorrd]], Seib Nod was a lifelong member of the [[Sisterhood of the Beatific Countenance]]. As such, she was forced to live in a cloistered fashion, which soon bored her. With no funds whatsoever, she realized that in order to start a new life for herself, she would have to procure them from somewhere. Not caring how she went about it, Nod stole several valuable artifacts from her temple, and departed Lorrd post haste, for the galactic capital of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. There, she continued to wear her religious fatigues to mask her criminal intentions.<ref name="db" />Intending to pawn the stolen relics, she was contacted by [[Artuo Pratuhr]], an archeologist who wanted to buy them for the [[Galactic Museum]]. Nod met with Pratuhr and his assistant, [[Zey Nep]], at the [[Uscru Entertainment District/Legends|Uscru Entertainment District's]] [[Outlander Club/Legends|Outlander Club]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], at the height of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]].<ref name="db" /><ref name="Oakie Dokes DB">{{DB|character|oakiedokes|Dokes, Oakie|archivedate=20100611105135}}</ref><ref name="aotc">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref> Initially, the archeologist was suspicious of Nod's intentions, but she claimed that the Sisterhood was selling the items to raise desperately needed funds. The clandestine nature of the sale was to conceal the fact that the Sisterhood was in such financial trouble that it needed to sell the relics in the first place.<ref name="db" />Pratuhr agreed to the deal, but the criminal atmosphere of [[Galactic City]] caused Nod to make a snap judgment&mdash;drawing a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] on the archeologist, she took his money, and fled the Outlander Club for an outbound flight.<ref name="db" /> A few days later,<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|386|Nod, Seib}}</ref> while waiting at the dock, Nod was confronted by Pratuhr, who caught up to her. She did not feel threatened, however&mdash;she was armed, he was not. What Nod had not accounted for was the presence of Nep, who, standing behind her and disguised as a [[Refugee/Legends|refugee]], had her own blaster trained on her. Realizing that her plans were thwarted, she returned the money. Pratuhr then took her to the local authorities, and returned the relics to the Sisterhood. Nod was then incarcerated in [[CoCo Penitentiary]] for a considerable amount of time, during which she was pardoned by the Sisterhood for her crimes.<ref name="db" />

name: Granakk
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] member of the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Granakk hailed from her species' [[Homeworld/Legends|home]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]]. At some point, she committed an act that caused her people to [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]] her, at which [[Time/Legends|time]] she left the planet and entered the greater [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. The circumstances of her banishment were the subject of many rumors, including ones in which she was said to have [[Death/Legends|killed]] her [[Youngling/Legends|children]] to get revenge on her [[Marriage/Legends|mate]] or to have become a [[madclaw]] by using her claws to attack and kill her mate in jealousy. Another rumor said that she was a traitor to her [[Wookiee honor family|honor family]],<ref name="UA" /> which would have included her closest friends,<ref name="AGTTSWE">''[[A Guide to the Star Wars Universe]]''</ref> and allowed them to die in order to obtain wealth.<ref name="UA" />At some point following her exile, Granakk became a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] and eventually gained a reputation as one of the most feared in the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. While working as a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] [[Hunting/Legends|hunter]], she flew a heavily modified [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]] named [[Reckoning (YT-1300 light freighter)|''Reckoning'']]. In at least one instance, Granakk was captured while pursuing a bounty, but she was still able to claim it after escaping. Due to her exile from Kashyyyk, Granakk was hated and avoided by other Wookiees, who viewed her as a blemish upon the reputation of their species.<ref name="UA" />

name: Iris Snow
description: Iris Snow grew up with the Corellian Slavers Guild knew the business of trading and owning [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] from an early age. Her father and grandmother trained her to one day take over the business. At the age of thirteen she was put in charge of training and punishing the Guild's child slaves, a duty she greatly enjoyed. Her duties increased when she got older until she eventually became the seventh-generation owner of the Guild.<ref name="UA18" />With her at the top of the Guild, Iris Snow became known as "Lady Snow" by her subordinates.<ref name="UA18" /> She planned to expand the guild, forging it into a financial empire, which meant she had to find new sources for slaves, but also create higher demands for them. That included expanding her territory, but Snow preferred to make [[Planet/Legends|planets]] that formed her regular market more slaver-friendly.<ref name="UA19">''Ultimate Adversaries'', p. 19</ref>

name: Seely
description: Originally a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] girl dancer hailing from [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Seely used her innate guile to escape from her masters and to travel from [[Planet/Legends|planet]] to planet, biding her time in various [[Casino/Legends|casinos]] and other, similar seedy locales. Her most successful tools were her beauty, her feminine wits, and the knowledge of how to manipulate males of many [[Species/Legends|species]], which she had accumulated during her years as an exotic dancer.While residing in an orbital [[Casino/Legends|casino]] in the [[Darlonn sector]], she met the flamboyant pirate [[Captain/Legends|captain]] [[Drek Drednar]], with whom she fell in love. Fascinated with his swashbuckling stories of epic battles and endless riches, she sneaked aboard Drednar's [[Starship/Legends|starship]], the ''[[Sable III]]''. When she was found by Drednar's men, the captain decided to integrate her as part of his crew, figuring that her daring and ability to sneak into places where she didn't belong might come in handy in future 'business ventures' and operations.Seely learned the art of fighting while living aboard the ''Sable III'', becoming an appreciated member of the crew. She would participate in boarding raids, however she preferred to stay toward the rear rather than jumping directly into danger. Her primary force, however, was the power she held over males, particularly those of other species. She would flirt with and manipulate them, using her beauty to have her way with them. Seely usually wore her [[Lekku/Legends|lekku]] draped over her shoulders and decorated them with traditional [[Rylothean]] makeup. She preferred to wear flashy and seductive clothes and decorated herself with jewelry that had been plundered from other starships.

name: O-Melie
description: V-Nen and O-Melie subvertly contacted the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]], which then sent [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]] and their [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Siri Tachi]], to Kegan. However, the leading members of Kegan's government, known as the [[Benevolent Guide]]s, were [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and could see into the future.<ref name="TFFT" /> They saw Kegan being taken over by [[Masked Soldiers]]<ref name="TFFT" /> and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].<ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref> They kidnapped Olana and sent her to the [[Re-Learning Circle]] to enforce upon her the ways of [[The Learning]]. However, the Jedi were able to rescue Olana after Kenobi and Tachi managed to get captured and sent to the [[Learning Circle]]. After finding Olana Force-sensitive, the Jedi brought her back to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for training, while V-Nen and O-Melie adopted a young orphaned boy by the name of [[V-Davi]] who had escaped with Kenobi and Tachi from the Re-Learning Circle. O-Melie and her husband were part of a covert resistance against their leaders, and after the Jedi exposed what was going on at the Re-Learning Circle, the city's populace peacefully ousted their Benevolent Guides.<ref name="TFFT" />

name: Candice Ondi
description: In [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]], Candice Ondi was a member of [[Alliance Intelligence]] responsible for making anti-[[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] propaganda news reports. She reminded [[Morgan Katarn]] of his [[Patricia Katarn|dead wife]], and Katarn and Ondi felt an attraction toward each other. Due to the perils of their situation, Candace was one of the rebels that fought alongside [[Morgan Katarn]] during the [[Subjugation of Sulon|subjugation]] on [[Sulon]], perishing in the fight.{{Char-stub}}

name: Tyanna Tymb
description: Tyanna moved through the [[SoroSuub Business Academy]] at [[Lightspeed/Legends|lightspeed]], and graduated at the top of her class with a bright career ahead of her. Early on she had displayed qualities that would make her the scourge of the corporate community: She used every dirty trick and scare tactic in the SoroSuub datajournal to discredit and eliminate fellow students that were possible competitors, though she made sure that everything she did was perfectly legal and was considered fair by the Academy's hierarchy.However, there was one student which Tyanna just couldn't shake, and she haunted the Sullustan through every semester. They remained in a dead heat as they were coming up to the final tests for graduation, and it was anyone's guess who would win the battle for position and the department placement. What Tyanna found worse, however, was the fact that her opponent, [[Alara Fax]], was not even a Sullustan but a [[Human/Legends|Human]]. To lose to a Human in the theater of Sullustan business would be a major disgrace in her mind. So rather than use her traditional methods which had already failed to out Fax, Tyanna instead befriended her and learned everything she could about the Human, then waited to make her move until there were only a few days left at the Academy.She had found out about the one weakness she had that frustrated Alara to no end; despite being able to negotiate a multi-digit deal better than almost anyone, the intricacies of the Sullustan "marketing tri-icosahedra" theory eluded her no matter how much she studied the textdocs. Tyanna, pretending to want to help her with this problem, offered Alara a data card study aid shortly before the final test came. Hidden in the programming of the card, however, were the actual answers to the tests questions. When the exam started, the hidden programming kicked in and the answers started scrolling across the data pad. Caught supposedly cheating, Alara was expelled from the Academy on the eve of her graduation, and Tyanna's primary opponent was effectively removed from the playing field.Since her graduation, Tyanna continued to advance quickly. When she was a junior executive, she started striking major deals for SoroSuub and earning them major amounts of [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] almost immediately. It wasn't long before the home office decided to use her in the field. In [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], in the height of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she was assigned the Top OpEx position to handle the SoroSuub facilities in the [[Varada system]].Though her people threw their support into the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], Tyanna herself had always favored the methods and vast resources held by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. She continued to trade with the remnants of the Empire after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], simply in a less-visible fashion than before. She had an especially close relationship with [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Poliff]] of the [[Tunka sector]] and with [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Fessix]] of the [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Discord (Star Destroyer)|''Discord'']]. She regularly provided these two individuals with details concerning her Republic customers.A rival from her past, Alara Fax, returned to compete with her in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]]. When Tyanna purchased the resource and trade rights to the seventh system in the Varada sector, she found one planet and the neighboring [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] field already under contract to the company which Fax had created, [[Fax Ventures]]. For the sake of completeness, and to again beat her rival, Tyanna wanted the corporate rights to the entire system, never mind the rich deposits of [[Aluminite]] and [[Corax Ore]] waiting to be extracted from the asteroids or the lush jungles of [[Bestal Three]] ripe for exploitation. Her goal was to take away Alara's new toy, no matter what methods she had to use. She immediately began scanning textdocs and sending spies to infiltrate Alara's headquarters, though it is not known if she succeeded or not.

name: Deli Barl
description: She and her sister dreamed of becoming rich, and her plan nearly succeeded when she married the vice president of fleets for [[CorDuro Shipping]]. However, when he divorced her and took everything, Roxi killed him.

name: Tanis Mothma
description: Tanis Mothma was a [[Human/Legends|Human]]<ref name="Species" /> [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who resided on [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrila]]. She was [[Marriage/Legends|married]] to a [[Mon Mothma's father/Legends|man]] who served as an [[Arbiter-general/Legends|arbiter-general]] for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], and the pair had a daughter, [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]]. Mothma served as [[Governor/Legends|governor]]<ref name="SWS">''[[The Star Wars Sourcebook]]''</ref> of [[Hanna City/Legends|Hanna City]] in the lead up to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="HNN" /> She taught her daughter how to administer, organize, and lead.<ref name="SWS" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Mothma commented on the walk-out by the planet's [[Public Safety Commission]]&mdash;protesting over the vote to create a [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]&mdash;noting that they had done everything possible to ensure that their strike had not endangered others by programming [[Droid/Legends|droids]] to cover the increased workload.<ref name="HNN" /> Eventually, Mothma was replaced as governor of Hanna City by [[Jovive Centi]].<ref name="CCW" />

name: Nib Maroon
description: Maroon was a singer who traveled with a group of itinerant musicians in her early career, but later she was hired by [[Rava Teb'lya]] to work at the [[Rose Nebula]]. She worked at the Nebula as a singer and a member of the nebula's undercover security team.<ref name="UA" />

name: Risi Lenoan
description: In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Lenoan was present at the unveiling ceremony of the [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|''Aethersprite''-class interceptor]] at the [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]], where she symbolically cut a tether tied to the prototype's landing gear. During the test run, she lauded its performance, alongside [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] and [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]] and the project's Lead Engineer, [[Walex Blissex/Legends|Walex Blissex]].<ref name="HNN" />She was removed from office by the Kuati nobility when it was discovered she might have pilfered Kuat Drive Yards funding. Lenoan was replaced by [[Giddean Danu/Legends|Giddean Danu]] at the suggestion of [[Onara Kuat]].<ref name="DB" />

name: Adrianna Nyras
description: Answering directly to [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Skere Kaan]], [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] Nyras served as field commander of the [[Sith fleet (New Sith Wars)|Sith fleet]] in his absence. She liked to maintain an air of military professionalism when dealing with the Sith hierarchy.However, although she remained deferential to the chain of command represented by Kaan and the other Sith Lords, her actual understanding of their powers was very limited. What little she was able to work out about it came from hearsay, and from her empirical experience of serving under Sith leadership.During the [[Ruusan campaign]], Kaan focused his energies on the surface campaign against [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Hoth (Jedi Lord)|Hoth]] and the [[Army of Light]], while Admiral Nyras, stationed aboard ''[[Nightfall]]'', commanded the naval forces in orbit&mdash;the majority of the entire Sith fleet.The Admiral's primary role was to keep the smaller [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi]] fleet led by [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]] away from the planet, and thus to prevent any reinforcements reaching the Jedi on the surface. As a measure of her importance&mdash;and of Kaan's desire for direct control&mdash;she wore a wrist-mounted comlink, directly linked to Kaan's personal transceiver in the main Sith surface base, from which she took his orders.

name: Peragus Mining Facility Medical Officer
description: When the skirmishes began with the arrival of [[Meetra Surik]] and the ''[[Ebon Hawk]]'' at the facility, the medical officer placed the unconscious Surik in a [[Kolto|kolto tank]] and put the other passenger&mdash;[[Kreia]], whom she believed to be dead&mdash;in the morgue. She also put two droids on board: [[T3-M4]] and an [[HK-50 series assassin droid|HK-50]] [[Assassin droid/Legends|assassin droid]], who were under the care of the [[Peragus Mining Facility Maintenance Officer|maintenance officer]].As the subtle sabotage of the facility by HK-50 intensified, the medical officer became in charge of not only Surik but the growing number of miners who had been injured or killed by explosions or mining droid attacks. When HK-50 triggered a fuel detonation in the mining tunnels that caused an emergency lockdown, she, along with other crew at the facility such as the [[Peragus Mining Facility Administration Officer|administration officer]] and the [[Peragus Mining Facility Dock Officer|dock officer]], retreated to the Peragus dormitories.Once there, she suggested that the surviving miners use their holo-transmitter to contact Surik in her kolto tank&mdash;an idea that was quickly shot down because the medical computer had already been severed from the main hub. The medical officer, like all the miners with her, was killed when toxic fumes built up in the dormitory ventilation system.Surik, who would go on to escape the facility, later learned the fate of the medical officer and the other miners when she visited the dormitories herself.

name: Liana Merian/Legends
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Liana Merian came from [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]],<ref name="db" /> a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] renowned throughout [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] for its natural beauty,<ref name="UVG">''[[Star Wars: The Ultimate Visual Guide]]''</ref> in the decades leading up to the fall of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="db" /> At seventeen, Merian reached the [[age of responsibility]], becoming a fully responsible adult in the eyes of the local legislation.<ref name="Age of responsibility">It was established in ''[[Rebel Dawn]]'' that the "age of responsibility" on both Alderaan and Corellia was set at seventeen.</ref> She chose to pursue a [[Politics/Legends|political]] career, and she eventually attained the position of [[senatorial aide]]. During the rule of [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Finis Valorum/Legends|Finis Valorum]], Merian joined the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] as part of the [[Alderaanian/Legends|Alderaanian]] [[Alderaan Senatorial Delegation|delegation]] led by [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Bail Antilles/Legends|Bail Antilles]]. At the [[Time/Legends|time]], she shared her duties with [[Agrippa Aldrete/Legends|Agrippa Aldrete]],<ref name="db" /> an older gentleman who had been the current senator's immediate predecessor.<ref name="dbALD">{{DB|character|aldrete|Aldrete, Agrippa|archivedate=20100115192141}}</ref> In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> Liana Merian was serving under Antilles<ref name="db" /> when the peaceful planet [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] was [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|besieged]] by the [[Trade Federation Droid Army/Legends|droid army]] of the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]], an event that led to the removal of Chancellor Valorum and the [[Galactic Republic Chancery election, 32 BBY|election]] of [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] of Naboo.<ref name="TPM">[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'']]</ref>By [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] before the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]],<ref name="NEC" /> Merian had returned to her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]]. There, she helped the local branch of the [[Refugee Relief Movement/Legends|Refugee Relief Movement]]&mdash;or RMM for short&mdash;settle a new [[City/Legends|village]] at [[Chianar]], a 100-[[Hectare/Legends|hectare]] plot on the [[Color/Legends|green]] plains of Alderaan. During her involvement with the project at Chianar, Liana Merian worked alongside prestigious personalities such as [[Celly Organa]], [[Chairman/Legends|Chairwoman]] of the RRM, and the former Chancellor Valorum. She attended the sod-turning ceremony of the new settlement along with Finis Valorum, and her presence was immortalized in a [[HoloNet News/Legends|HoloNet News]] report.<ref name="HN9N" />

name: Asha (Naboo)
description: Asha was one of many of [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|Queen]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala's]] palace servants at the time of the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Naboo Crisis]] by the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]]. She was being pursued by [[B1 battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] in the palace kitchen when the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], who was trying to [[Fall of Theed|rescue]] the Queen before the Trade Federation could take her to [[Camp Four/Legends|Camp Four]] arrived and saved her. Kenobi sensed something special about her, indicating a possible [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force sensitivity]]. In return, Asha helped Kenobi reach the throne room as she was able to [[Slicer/Legends|crack]] into the security doors. However, Kenobi had arrived too late to save the Queen at the throne room. Nevertheless, he and his [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] were able to rescue her as she was escorted to Camp 4.During the Queen's absence, Asha became one of the leaders of the [[Naboo Resistance]]. When the Queen decided to [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|reclaim]] Naboo, Asha met up with Kenobi again. She assigned the Jedi to [[Rescue mission in Theed|free]] [[Naboo Royal Space Fighter Corps/Legends|Naboo starfighter's]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] who were held hostage by the Trade Federation's battle droids; Kenobi escorted the pilots to join up with Asha and the Resistance, who were fighting battle droids. She then sent Kenobi to [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|destroy]] the [[Quad turbolaser cannon (Trade Federation)|turbolaser cannon]] so that the pilots could take off safely.

name: Danalis
description: Danalis was one of many street children Shrike used to beg and steal for him as he traveled from world to world in the [[Liberator (Liberator-class)|''Trader's Luck'']] on smuggling runs. Her face had been gnawed by [[vrelt]]s, leaving her with no ears or nose and pitiable. Shrike exploited her disfigurement by using her as a beggar. He originally lured Danalis into his service by promising that he would have her face repaired when she earned enough. She trained with the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[F8GN]]. By the [[Time/Legends|time]] she was fourteen [[Standard year/Legends|years]] old, Danalis realized Shrike would never live up to this promise and committed [[Suicide/Legends|suicide]] by cycling an [[Airlock/Legends|airlock]].

name: Maxa Jandovar
description: Jandovar was a famous [[Musician/Legends|musician]] whose song "[[Does Anyone Weep?]]" reached the fifth rank in the top selling [[sound slug]]s in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. However, during the days of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], artists like Jandover who opposed it found themselves persecuted. Although not actively hunted, if their whereabouts were known they would certainly be arrested. Jandovar traveled constantly, and over the last five years of her career was closely followed by [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] fugitive [[Kardue'sai'Malloc/Legends|Kardue'sai'Malloc]], a great lover of music. The Devaronian kept missing her due to her frantic schedule, but continued to try. He missed her on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], and then heard that she would be on [[Morvogodine]].Unluckily for both, Jandovar was arrested by the Galactic Empire while on Morvogodine, and died in Imperial custody. Kardue'sai'Malloc was crushed, but following the death of the musician he may well have been, as he proclaimed to [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], the sole owner of the last surviving recordings of the legendary star.

name: Shandria L'hnnar
description: Like so many other fellow [[Corellia/Legends|Corellians]], L'hnnar aspired to entering the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]]. Given the fact that she had always been an excellent student who possessed the ability to learn and retain information easily, the prospect of her entering the Academy and graduating at the top of her class was very realistic.However, she became disillusioned with the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] when one of her close friends at the [[Imperial Institute of Higher Studies]] on [[Ferrhast]], [[Celida Noerr]] joined the Rebel Alliance, revealing the brutal truth about the Empire by breaking into the Institute's computer banks. As a result of the break-in, Celinda Noerr was arrested as a traitor and never seen or heard from again.Shandira joined the Alliance and worked as an operative, drawing largely upon her skills with handling of information. When the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] was formed, she continued to serve in the same capacity.

name: Zu Pike
description: [[File:Zupike.JPG|thumb|left|180px|Zu Pike]]The Pike sisters were born in [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]], the daughters of famous [[Teräs Käsi/Legends|Teräs Käsi]] fighter [[Dux Pike]]. He died when they were infants, just before the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. [[Dux Pike's wife|Their mother]] was a [[Noble/Legends|noblewoman]] of [[Bunduki/Legends|Bunduki]]. She placed the twins, as children, in the hands of [[Followers of Palawa]] for their education.Zan and Zu went on to become Teräs Käsi masters themselves, and criminals for the highest bidder. They competed in illegal fighting matches across the [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]] had them hired to work for [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]]. Following his death, they signed on to work with [[Spinda Caveel]], who sent them to acquire [[A-OIC]] and, later, to re-acquire him and the [[Human replica droid]] [[Guri]]. On this latter expedition, they encountered the [[Heroes of Yavin/Legends|Heroes of Yavin]], and decided to cut their losses, quitting their employment with Caveel. When he drew his blaster to keep them on task, they killed him.Zu flew the ''[[Steel Hand]]'', a two-person starfighter, with her sister as a passenger.

name: Cyl Sant
description: Shortly after Rystáll's birth, Cyl moved to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to start a new life. But things didn't go as planned. Not having any [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] left, she couldn't afford to raise a child and had to abandon her baby daughter. Desperate, she put Rystáll into the [[Speeder/Legends|speeder]] of an [[Ortolan/Legends|Ortolan]] couple that was parked in the streets of [[Galactic City]]. She also left a note in which she asked them to take care of her child.

name: Lana
description: Lana was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived in the [[Upper City]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Taris/Legends|Taris]]<ref name="KotOR" /> by [[3956 BBY]].<ref name="CG">The events of ''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic]]'' are dated to [[3956 BBY]] by the ''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> During this [[Time/Legends|time]], she visited the [[Upper City Cantina]], where she met a Human named [[Jergan]]. Asking about her opinion on the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina's]] [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] [[Band/Legends|band]], Jergan offered Lana the chance to meet the band after the show, claiming that he had a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] who could arrange a backstage meeting for a sum of twenty [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. Lana agreed and gave him the money, which Jergan ran off with, promising to set up the meeting with his contact and return. When he did not come back, Lana began to suspect a trick and went backstage in search for Jergan; however, nobody backstage knew him. Realizing that she had been [[Con artist/Legends|conned]], Lana started looking for Jergan, hoping to reclaim her money, with interest.<ref name="KotOR" />

name: Maoi Madakor/Legends
description: {{Quote|Shields up!|Maoi Madakor's last words|Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace}}In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Madakor was the captain of the [[Radiant VII/Legends|''Radiant VII'']], and flew it during the [[Battle of Galidraan]]. The purpose of this mission was to transport [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. It was during this mission she met and befriended [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Antidar Williams/Legends|Antidar Williams]], a pilot of the ''[[Acceptance]]''. Together, they flew together again at the [[Battle of Uhanayih]], where Williams' ship was destroyed, and he was reduced to flying [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttles]] for [[Senator/Legends|senators]].The next year, recalling their friendship and previous mission to [[Galidraan/Legends|Galidraan]], she specifically chose Williams to be her copilot in a mission taking [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] to the [[Naboo system/Legends|Naboo system]] so they could negotiate with the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] due to their [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Blockade]] of the planet [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]. Upon arriving at the system, she then made contact with the [[Neimoidian/Legends|Neimoidian]] head of the Trade Federation, [[Nute Gunray/Legends|Nute Gunray]], requesting that the Jedi, identified as ambassadors to Supreme Chancellor Finis Valorum, be allowed to board the [[Saak'ak/Legends|''Saak'ak'']] immediately, with Gunray heeding the request. Although they succeeded in delivering them, they were ultimately forced to wait until the Jedi returned. However, they then discovered a turbolaser turret descend from the ceiling, poised to fire at the ''Radiant VII''. Unable to escape, she was killed when the Trade Federation's turbolaser fire destroyed her ship. Her last words were to raise the [[Deflector shield/Legends|deflector shield]], but it was too late.

name: Uwlla Iillor
description: Through her [[Force-sensitive/Legends|forceful]] personality, Uwlla was able to rise through the ranks in the pre-Endor Empire, despite an Imperial bigotry against [[Alien/Legends|aliens]], [[Sexes/Legends|females]] and other designated [[Non-huMan|non-humans]].Uwlla also displayed exceptional resourcefulness and a tendency to think outside the box, such as her tactic of flying the ''Asp'' to the fringe of a system, then traveling through [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] to another point in that same system in order to surprise her target. While this technique of intra-system jumping was an unusual tactic for the Empire, she put it to use after witnessing its successful use in the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]].While some of her superiors remained biased against her due to her gender, she earned the respect of others, including [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] Agent [[Kirtan Loor]], due to her personality and abilities.

name: Shaina Kreen
description: Before joining the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] Shaina worked as a model for many notable clothing designers. After joining the Rebels, she posed as a naive waitress in the Ace of Sabre's VIP club where she used her beauty and charm to discover secrets that could be useful to the Rebellion.

name: Aleas Rans'ery
description: {{Quote|So... ya think yer ready for the Bright Jewel Ribbon Quadrant, hm? I'll believe it when I see it. Ya don't look like pilot material t'me.|Aleas Rans'ery, to a Car'das pilot|Star Wars Galaxies}}Aleas Rans'ery was a well-trained pilot for the [[Car'das]] based on [[Tansarii Point Station]], along with [[Serissu]], [[Laetin A'shera]] and [[Dartas Pytin]].<ref name="SWG:PBJR" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> she oversaw all Car'das operations in the [[Bright Jewel Ribbon]] quadrant of the [[Bright Jewel system/Legends|Bright Jewel system]].<ref name="SWG:PBJR" />During the [[Battle of Tansarii Point Station]] between Car'das and [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] forces, Aleas Rans'ery dispatched pilots to attacks Black Sun ships in the area.<ref name="SWG:PBJR" /> During the battle, Rans'ery also tasked the Kallor brothers [[Sulale Kallor|Sulale]] and [[Waris Kallor|Waris]] to scout enemy territory and find weaknesses in the [[Salient Trinity]] bases. The brothers succeed in their mission but were attacked by Black Sun starfighters in the Bright Jewel Ribbon. Car'das starfighters dispatched by Rans'ery finally rescued the brothers.<ref name="SWG:KBR">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Kallor Brothers Rescue" on Tansarii Point Station</ref> Rans'ery's pilots later rescued [[Executive officer/Legends|First Officer]] [[Atris (officer)|Atris]] of the [[Dynath Miners]] from Black Sun attacks.<ref name="SWG:BSA">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Black Sun Attacks" on Tansarii Point Station</ref> Aleas Rans'ery eventually tasked her pilots to eliminate the [[Ace/Legends|ace]] and Black Sun hero [[Arlem Demonhunter]].<ref name="SWG:CA">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Counter Attack" on Tansarii Point Station</ref>

name: Persha
description: [[File:Fia.jpg|thumb|right|125px|A Fian, Persha's species]]{{Quote|We have made our finest diplomatic facilities available and will strive to fulfill your every request.|Persha|The New Jedi Order: Force Heretic I: Remnant}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Fian]] from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Galantos]] near the [[Koornacht Cluster/Legends|Koornacht Cluster]], Persha<ref name="Remnant" /> achieved the rank of [[Primate (Yevethan rank)|Primate]] of [[Al'solib'minet'ri City]]<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|III|21|Persha}}</ref> by the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]]. At that [[Time/Legends|time]], [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy's]] most prominent government, the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], had fallen during an [[Yuuzhan Vong War|invasion]] by the [[Yuuzhan Vong galaxy|extra-galactic]] [[Yuuzhan Vong]], and the New Republic's successor, the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]], was still engaged with the invaders. That year, the Fia decided to make a deal with the Yuuzhan Vong to eliminate the threat of the nearby [[Speciesism|xenophobic]] [[Yevetha]] [[Species/Legends|species]], and the Yuuzhan Vong [[Battle of N'zoth (Yuuzhan Vong War)|fulfilled]] their part of the deal. Because of the Fia's pact with the invaders, communications with the Galactic Alliance were taken down, leaving the other government no idea as to what had transpired on Galantos.<ref name="Remnant" />Due to the communication blackout in the area of Galantos and a tip from the information-collecting [[Ryn Network]], a small Galactic Alliance task force, headed primarily by former New Republic [[Chief of State (New Republic)|Chief of State]] [[Leia Organa Solo]] and her [[Marriage/Legends|husband]], [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], arrived at Galantos to check on the problem. Fian Councilor [[Jobath Knox]] panicked when he learned that representatives from the Galactic Alliance were coming to Galantos, and, fearing that their pact with the Yuuzhan Vong might be discovered, Knox had Persha deal with greeting the guests on their [[Government of Galantos|government's]] behalf instead. Along with a crowd of other Fia, Persha received the members of the Galactic Alliance entourage&mdash;consisting of Organa Solo, her husband, [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Tahiri Veila]], [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Jagged Fel]], and the [[3PO-series protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]]&mdash;when they landed in Al'solib'menit'ri [[City/Legends|City]] in the [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|freighter]] [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] and a [[Nssis-class Clawcraft|clawcraft]] [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]].<ref name="Remnant" />Covering Knox's absence with an excuse of other engagements, Persha led the Galactic Alliance representatives to their [[Al'solib'minet'ri City diplomatic suites|guest suites]] while giving them all of the necessary information about their visit. After leaving the group, Persha also panicked and had [[Assistant Primate]] [[Thrum]] deal with the representatives instead. In the end, however, the Galactic Alliance group learned that the Fia had made a deal with the Yuuzhan Vong, though the Fia's allies turned on them soon after the arrival of the Galactic Alliance task force. [[Twin Suns Squadron]] and the [[Lancer-class frigate/Legends|''Lancer''-class frigate]] [[Pride of Selonia (Lancer-class)|''Pride of Selonia'']], both of the Galactic Alliance, helped [[Battle of Galantos|defeat]] a Yuuzhan Vong [[Battle group/Legends|battle group]] that had been sent to [[Slavery/Legends|enslave]] the Fia, and the population of Galantos was saved.<ref name="Remnant" />

name: Lacy Devist
description: It was unlikely that Lacy knew her husband was in actuality a [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] of [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Soontir Fel]], and was also an [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] agent planted on [[Pakrik Minor]] by [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. She had a son and a daughter with Carib, who were named [[Daberin Devist|Daberin]] and [[Keena Devist]] respectively.{{Char-stub}}

name: Lissarkh
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]], Lissarkh was a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. After a time, Lissarkh was selected by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] to be his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. After years of training one-on-one with Koon, Lissarkh was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|elevated]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] shortly before the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]] in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]].<ref name="I87" />

name: Yanci
description: In [[41 BBY/Legends|41 BBY]], Yanci and her companions, [[Kevta]] and [[Bini (miner)|Bini]] met [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. However, they mistook them for their enemies, [[Absolutes]] and attacked them. Obi-Wan was injured in the attack, but after realizing their mistake, Yanci used her medical knowledge to heal Obi-Wan's leg. After he was healed, and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], along with [[Eritha]] had left the mining facility, the Absolutes attacked the mine. Yanci ran for the Jedi, but when they came back, the Absolutes had already finished their massacre. Yanci's friends, Bini as well as Kevta, whom she was in love with, were killed.{{Char-stub}}

name: Onnelly Praji
description: The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Onnelly Praji was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] to [[Tannon Praji|Tannon]] and [[Maree Praji]], members of the influential [[House Praji/Legends|House Praji]]; Tannon, in particular, was the [[First Minister (Coruscant Ministry of Ingress)|First Minister]] of the [[Coruscant Ministry of Ingress/Legends|Coruscant Ministry of Ingress]], the agency that monitored [[The galaxy/Legends|the galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant's]] immigration and emigration. In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], when the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] came to power, Tannon took leave of his job to help relocate Onnelly and Maree to the "[[Emerald Splendor Estates]]" on the [[Deep Core/Legends|Deep Core]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Byss/Legends|Byss]]. The relocation was part of a much broader "recolonization effort," intended to attract the wealthy and powerful.<ref name="ttsp" /> Despite this, Onnelly believed they would only be there for approximately a [[Standard month/Legends|month]]. Before departure, Onnelly traveled to [[Transport/Legends|transport]] platform [[DN6-4435]] to help load her family's luggage on board the [[Starship/Legends|craft]] bound for "Emerald Splendor."<ref name="ea:r" />Onnelly was having difficulty with the bag [[Repulsorlift/Legends|repulsors]] and asked for help from a young boy in the [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|Commission for the Preservation of the New Order]] [[Sub-Adult Group/Legends|Sub-Adult Group]] who was passing by. The boy obliged and began carrying all the bags by himself at once. The two began conversing, and Onnelly asked the boy about his family, only to discover that they had died in the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. The boy claimed that he had joined COMPNOR for the [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], and that he hoped to find out if any of his family had survived. When he had finished loading the bags, Onnelly introduced herself, and the boy identified himself as [[Drake Lo'gaan|Jodd Sonta]], although he was hesitant to do so. Onnelly noticed this, but let it pass, giving Sonta a kiss on the cheek before departing.<ref name="ea:r" />When the transport finally prepared to depart, Onnelly was approached by Sonta once again&mdash;this time, the boy was wearing battle armor. He quickly explained to her that the possessions of the non-[[Human/Legends|Humans]] aboard the transport were being destroyed, and that the Imperials were not going to let anyone off the transport. Sonta attempted to lead her off the transport, but Onnelly resisted, as she did not understand. He explained the situation to her bluntly&mdash;the transport was a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] ship, and Onnelly was unlikely to ever return from "Emerald Splendor." At that moment, [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitor]] [[Antinnis Tremayne]]&mdash;flanked by [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]&mdash;entered the room, intending to arrest Sonta. The boy was in fact a Jedi, Drake Lo'gaan, who had escaped the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Jedi purge]] of [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] some time prior and was acting undercover. In response to Tremayne's arrival, Lo'gaan used his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to break open a nearby window and jumped off the transport.<ref name="ea:r" />Despite Lo'gaan's warning, Onnelly accompanied her family to "Emerald Splendor." In reality, the world was [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] private retreat. While there, Onnelly, Maree, and others like them were kept entertained, but unknown to them, Palpatine was secretly sapping away at their [[The Force/Legends|Force]] energy in order to keep himself sustained.<ref name="ttsp" />

name: Laynara
description: Because she was extremely clever, [[Raze]] was proud that Laynara was in his employ and made her his top lieutenant. For five years, Laynara worked alongside [[Wyl Tarson]], another of Raze's lieutenants and the two of them became friends, though Laynara cared about him more than she let on.Despite their friendship, Tarson never told her that he was secretly [[Spy/Legends|spying]] on Raze's organization for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. After Raze discovered Tarson's espionage, Raze sent him on what he considered a [[Mission to Ahakista|suicide mission]] to [[Ahakista/Legends|Ahakista]] and had Laynara accompany Tarson.Tarson stopped on a couple of planets before proceeding to Ahakista to gather members for the team that he would need for the mission. At their first stop, Tarson "introduced" Laynara to his first new "recruit": [[Baco Par]]. She looked on, perplexed as Tarson kidnapped the passed-out and drunk lock-breaker to their ship.After landing on another planet a few days later, Tarson, Laynara, and Par made their way through a rain storm to an opening in a defunct transport. When they entered, they were greeted by the sight of many carvings, all of them of either the same [[Teril Nyl|woman]] or [[Neas Nyl|boy]]. As Laynara took a closer look at one of the carvings of the woman, she and Par found themselves at the wrong end of a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], which was held by their unwilling host.Laynara and Par were saved by Tarson, who tried to disarm the their assailant. When Tarson found himself about to be killed by the other man, Laynara diverted the attacker's attention by breaking a bust of the woman. Correctly guessing that the statues and carvings meant something to him, Laynara threatened to break the others if he didn't agree to let Tarson talk to him.Tarson then revealed that their attacker was a man named [[Darca Nyl]]. After an hour of talking, Tarson was unable to convince Nyl to join him on the mission and decided that it was time for them to leave. Before departing for the ship, Laynara asked Nyl if the woman who was depicted in the bust would have wanted him to live like he was now. Nyl would not answer the question and told her that it would be best if she left. However, Nyl decided to come along after all. Par asked Laynara how she convinced him, but Laynara said that she had nothing to do with it. She suspected that Nyl simply "realized that he wanted to hurt someone again."Following her orders from Raze, Laynara delivered a package to an associate of Raze named [[Sardoth]] when they arrived on Ahakista. In spite of Raze's orders to return to [[Per Lupelo]], and the fact that Tarson all but insulted her for her loyalty to Raze, Laynara remained on Ahakista to help him with his mission to destroy [[The Hub (computer)|The Hub]].

name: Yevra
description: At some point, Yevra, a [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]], and her brother [[Llokay]] were found and recognized as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] by the [[Brotherhood of Darkness]]. They were considered strong enough to train at the [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] on the ancient [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Korriban]], where only those with the potential to become [[Sith Master/Legends|Sith Masters]] were enrolled. There, they met the strongest of the apprentices, a fellow Zabrak known as [[Sirak]]. The siblings became completely loyal to Sirak and were still in training there by the year [[1000 BBY]]. In that year, a fellow apprentice named [[Darth Bane/Legends|Bane]] challenged Sirak to a battle during their combat training lesson presided over by [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Kas'im]], a Sith Master. Upon the issuance of Bane's challenge, Yevra and Llokay pushed their way to the front if the crowd of students that encircled the dueling ring, both of them showing conspicuous eagerness at the fight to come. Sirak, wielding a [[Double-bladed lightsaber/Legends|double-bladed]] [[Sith training saber]], quickly and easily defeated and injured Bane.<ref name="pod" />Some time later, after training in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] with fellow Sith [[Githany]], combat training with Lord Kas'im, and many hours reading the ancient tomes in the Sith academy's library, Bane challenged Sirak once again. Before the duel commenced, Sirak handed Yevra his training saber as he removed his cloak, and she promptly gave it back to him when he was ready. This time Bane defeated and disfigured Sirak, yet hesitated when he had the opportunity to land a killing blow. Sirak spent time in a [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] tank, and was approached by Githany, who plotted with him to kill Bane. At the time Bane was on an excursion to the [[Valley of the Dark Lords/Legends|Valley of the Dark Lords]] to investigate the ancient Sith tombs there, and the two agreed to attack Bane once he returned. During the period in between, one of the Sith Masters in charge of the [[New Sith Wars|war effort]] against the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], Lord [[Skere Kaan|Kaan]], ordered all the students on Korriban to report to the front lines on the planet of [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]] and promoted them all to the title of [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]]. Yevra, suddenly a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]], was given a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="pod" />Bane finally returned from his journey to the Valley of the Dark Lords before the Sith students were to leave for Ruusan, and the trap was set. Yevra, along with Sirak and Llokay waited in the library upon hearing of his return. Githany lured Bane, who had left his lightsaber in his personal chamber, into the archives where the Zabraks waited. Yevra, Llokay, and Sirak moved to [[Duel in the Korriban Academy|attack]] Bane, but found themselves betrayed by Githany, who supplied Bane with his lightsaber. Githany herself was armed with a [[Lightwhip/Legends|lightwhip]], which she quickly used to kill Yevra. Llokay, overwhelmed by the grief and rage caused by his sister's death, ferociously attacked Bane, driving him back several steps while Githany cracked her lightwhip at Llokay's eyes and face. Ultimately, Llokay fell to Githany's whip, and Sirak was killed shortly after by Bane after pleading for mercy.<ref name="pod" />

name: Bini (miner)
description: When Bini and her companions [[Yanci]] and [[Kevta]] first met [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Eritha]], they erroneously thought that they were members of their enemies the [[Absolutes]], and so attacked them. Obi-Wan was injured in the attack. When they realized that they had been mistaken, Yanci offered her medical knowledge to heal Kenobi's injured leg. Once the Padawan had been healed, he and his companions left the [[Mining/Legends|mining]] facility. Some time later the Absolutes attacked the mine, killing Bini in the process.

name: Zazana Renkel
description: Around [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Zazana fell in love with a former Republic agent named [[Edbit Teeks]] until he was kidnapped by [[Tarhassan Planetary Security]]. After serving her support with the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]], she was kidnapped by [[Joram Kithe]] and a special team from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Republic Intelligence/Legends|Republic Intelligence]] in order to question her about Teek's disappearance. After providing all the intel, Joram and the team were able to find the location.{{Char-stub}}

name: Tinian Hanther
description: Employed by [[Republic Intelligence/Legends|Republic Intelligence]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she operated out of [[Tarhassan]] following the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]]. A former member of the [[Department of Health]], she was part of a specialized team to rescue [[Edbit Teeks]] from prison. Along with [[Mapper Gann]], [[Joram Kithe]], [[Livintius Sazet]], and [[Cherek Tuhm]], they kidnapped a [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] agent named [[Zazana Renkel]] who knew about Edbit's location. After receiving the intel, Tinian disguised herself as a guard and assisted in transferring a prisoner to the [[Nehass]] [[Nehass Prison|prison]]. During that phase of the operation, Kithe proudly welcomed her into intelligence service.{{Char-stub}}

name: Fema Baab/Legends
description: Baab attempted to enter into circles of [[Senator/Legends|Senators]] presumed to be against [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] policies during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. However, many Senators presumed Baab—who was outwardly very supportive of the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]]—to be working as his informant. As such, Baab's attempts to infiltrate Senators such as [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]], [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] or [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]] were not successful.

name: Augusta I'att
description: In her later years Augusta contracted a rare degenerative condition incurable on [[Druckenwell/Legends|Druckenwell]] which, without expensive treatment, was slowly killing her and made traveling impractical. As this was contrary to [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Eisen Kerioth|Kerioth's]] plans to move the weapon developers to [[Doldur]] and hijack their technology, he had Augusta and Strephan executed.<ref name="TOT" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Aemele
description: While on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]] she managed to steal a [[Chu-Gon Dar cube]] from the [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] [[Ithes Olok]], as well as his notebook on how to operate it, by seducing him. She went to meet with her contact on the planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] in a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] where [[Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes/Legends|Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes]] were playing to give him the cube and receive her reward. Unfortunately for her, her contact had been captured by a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] who sat in his place. Not wanting to give up on the chance of being paid, she met with this smuggler who proceeded to steal the cube from her to deliver to his own contact in [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet]] on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]

name: Zo'Tannath
description: Zo'Tannath kept most of her origins a mystery with few individuals ever seeing her face. She wore pieces of [[Ubese raider armor|Ubese armor]] scavenged from an [[Ubese/Legends|Ubese]] warrior she killed. Although proficient with a [[Blaster carbine/Legends|blaster carbine]] or [[Grenade/Legends|grenades]], Zo'Tannath's preferred weapon was the [[Force pike/Legends|Force pike]], with which she could easily subdue most opponents.<ref name="psg" />Zo'Tannath picked up most of her bounties from [[Boztrok]] starport, which she frequented. She was merciless in carrying out her hunts, taking special pleasure in "dead-or-alive" bounties. This ensured her plenty of assignments from ruthless individuals from the fringe. She often made use of their [[Starship/Legends|starships]] when tracking her prey, and on occasion hired [[Klatooinian/Legends|Klatooinian]] [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] to aid her. She frequently used them to channel her prey into clever traps. Zo'Tannath never brooked any bargaining from her prey, remaining loyal to her employer despite hefty bribes.<ref name="psg" />On one occasion, Zo'Tannath was hired by the [[Nimbanel/Legends|Nimbanel]] [[Pok Nar-Ten]] to capture the smuggler [[Platt Okeefe/Legends|Platt Okeefe]], who had reneged on some ship payments. Zo'Tannath eventually tracked her down on the planet [[Wroona/Legends|Wroona]] and easily disarmed her. Zo'Tannath then took her into custody, giving Okeefe's [[Gruvian]] [[Gruvian Tovash|Tovash]] as a gift to the Nimbanel. Okeefe was later sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]].<ref name="psg" />

name: Vonnda Ra
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Dathomirian/Legends|Dathomirian]], Vonnda Ra was a member of the progressive [[Great Canyon Clan]] which believed that men were the equals of the women in the tribe. Despite this stance, Ra disagreed and believed that most men were naturally inferior when it came to control of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Training as a [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]], Ra came to possess significant knowledge of the Force and, despite her prejudices, took on a male acolyte named [[Vilas]]. Together with her student, Ra was dispatched on recruiting missions across [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] to find eligible Dathomiri to join the Great Canyon Clan and train in the dark arts of the Nightsisters as taught to them from the ancient [[Book of Shadows]].<ref name="YJK:SA" />When the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Brakiss]] came to the [[Dathomir system/Legends|Dathomir system]] in search of students for his [[Shadow Academy]], the Great Canyon Clan threw their support behind his [[Second Imperium]] and Ra enthusiastically sought out young [[Witches of Dathomir|witches]] to join in learning the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]. Tall and muscular, Ra resided in a tent where she sat upon a chair made of a stuffed [[Rancor/Legends|rancor]] head. When the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] visited the camp as part of his intelligence gathering mission during the [[Second Imperium Crisis]], Ra was unimpressed with the male until he used the Force to launch her seat up and out of her tent far into the atmosphere. Cowed by Skywalker's demonstration of power, she realized she would not successful in bringing Skywalker's companion, Dathomiri [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka]], into the clan. After Skywalker departed the [[Great Canyon (Dathomir)|Great Canyon]], Ra gathered several members of the [[Singing Mountain Clan]] and departed for the Shadow Academy where she would remain for sometime.<ref name="YJK:SA" />When it came time to launch an [[Battle of Kashyyyk (Second Imperium Crisis)|assault]] on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], Ra followed the command of General [[Zekk]] as their task force stole large quantities of [[Starship/Legends|starship]] equipment and supplies. As they struggled to return to their ship the group was forced to engage in battle with members of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]] and [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] resistance fighters. Engaging Jedi [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]], Tenel Ka, [[Lowbacca]] and the Wookiee [[Sirrakuk]], the Nightsisters and their commander were forced into the lowest levels of the Kashyyyk forests. During a struggle with the Wookiee Sirrakuk, Ra lost her balance and fell into the deadly maw of a [[Syren plant/Legends|syren plant]]. While Sirrakuk escaped the voracious plant, Ra was consumed by Kashyyyk's deadly flora.<ref name="YJK:DK" />

name: Meeka Reen
description: Upon learning of the [[Eternity Crystal]] supposedly hidden near [[Adony Station]], Reen and her troops helped [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] take [[Mission to Jerne|control]] of the station, so they could search. When she thought the pair had found the [[Crystal/Legends|crystal's]] location, she betrayed them, desiring it for herself. Unfortunately, there was no crystal, merely a [[Bomb/Legends|bomb]] planted by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. It exploded, killing Meeka and the remnants of her guerrillas.

name: Chirita
description: [[File:Ashachiritapaploo.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Chirita with Asha and Paploo]]One day, Chirita won the [[Ewok Warrior Games]], defeating [[Wicket Wystri Warrick|Wicket]] and all the other [[Sexes/Legends|male]] warriors. Shortly after this, she became the love interest of [[Weechee Warrick]].Soon after that, she helped the other warriors defend their village against the attack of [[Doctor/Legends|Dr.]] [[Raygar]] and his [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Pendor Gyrr
description: {{Quote|Pendor seems to have profited immensely from the economic instability the galaxy now faces.|Airen Cracken|Wanted by Cracken}}Born on her [[Species/Legends|species]]' [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Yag'Dhul/Legends|Yag'Dhul]]<ref name="WBC 33" /> in [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]],<ref name="WBC 4" /> the [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Givin/Legends|Givin]] Pendor Gyrr found herself ill at ease among her own people. She instead left the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] and made a name for herself as a [[Counterfeiter|currency forger]]. After the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] destabilized [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Gyrr capitalized on the economic turmoil to create vast amounts of false currency, including both [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] and [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. Gyr played the [[Galactic economy|financial markets]] by waiting until the value of a particular currency was high, then using her fake credits to make purchases.<ref name="WBC 33" /> One of her employees was [[Qan Gindoch]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]], until he was captured on the planet [[Mantooine/Legends|Mantooine]] by agents of the New Republic, who suspected him of involvement in the counterfeiting operation. Gindoch confessed all he knew and was released<ref name="WBC 30">''[[Wanted by Cracken]]'', p. 30.</ref> in [[6 ABY/Legends|6 ABY]]. Gindoch's testimony helped the Republic link confiscated counterfeit money to Gyrr's organization, and thus detect telltale imperfections in her forgeries.<ref name="WBC 33" />Gyrr supplemented her operations by selling stolen items on the [[Black market/Legends|black market]] and smuggling [[Spice/Legends|spice]]. The New Republic [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] believed that Gyrr had bases at several [[Merchant/Legends|trading]] planets and [[Star system/Legends|systems]], including [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]], [[Celanon/Legends|Celanon]], the [[Corellian system]], [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], and [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]].<ref name="WBC 33" />Although Gyrr's forgery racket was small enough to spare the New Republic devaluation of its currency, the [[Galaxy/Legends|galactic]] government's inability to stop her operation worried Cracken that other criminals would follow her example and compound the problem. In [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], Cracken accordingly put out a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] of {{Cr}}15,000 for the Givin's capture. Cracken noted unconfirmed reports that suggested the Givin's whereabouts at the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the posting were on Ord Mantell.<ref name="WBC 33" />

name: Elta Besk
description: Shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Besk was invited to the [[Pentastar Talks]] aboard the [[Reaper (Executor-class)|''Reaper'']]. Imperial [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Ardus Kaine]], the convenor of the talks, was proposing the formation of the [[Pentastar Alignment]]. Besk agreed with his proposals out of concern that the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic's]] focus on freedom could lead to a revolt among the largely [[Entymal]] slave labor used by her corporation.

name: Norrion Glidamir
description: Glidamir studied in the [[Galactic Outdoor Survival School/Legends|Galactic Outdoor Survival School]] and was a member of the [[Twilight Class]]. She excelled at the school, breaking the record of a previous class, and then went on to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]].<ref name="air" />An expert in urban survival, Glidamir became a major in the Rebel Alliance Army. She knew that her dean at the school, [[Barosa Warren]], had became a threat to the Rebel Alliance and wrote a report about him.<ref name="air" />During the [[Battle of Archais]], Glidamir's maneuvers were essential in rescuing [[Akul Witig]]'s unit (probably [[Midnight Squadron]] or [[Storm Squadron (Rebel)|Storm Squadron]]) when they were trapped on [[Tylerin Enbankment]].<ref name="air" />Glidamir took part in the [[attacks on Corint City]], and behaved heroically, for which she was decorated.<ref name="air" />Soon afterwards, however, Glidamir died in service to the Rebel Alliance during the early battles of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]].<ref name="air" />

name: Atin Attan
description: A pilot since her childhood, Attan studied Sullustan geology from [[SoroSuub Extension]] programs. After graduating, she joined the [[Galactic Outdoor Survival School/Legends|Galactic Outdoor Survival School]], and was a member of the prestigious [[Twilight Class]]. Attan led one of the most dangerous parts of the final trek that led to the impressive graduation of the Twilight Class around [[12 BBY/Legends|12 BBY]].After that, Attan joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] alongside most of the other members of the Twilight Class. She became a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Instructor/Legends|instructor]] for the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Alliance Fleet]]. Around [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], Attan was assigned to the [[Roche Asteroid Field]], where she helped in some minor modifications to the prototype [[A/SF-01 B-wing starfighter/Legends|B-wing starfighter]].

name: Casti Tholon
description: A native of [[Sardoran]], Casti Tholon was raised on one of the [[Duro/Legends|Duro]] space cities on Duro, the foster child of [[Duros/Legends|Duros]] parents. As a child, she only knew Duros and their culture, even considering herself a Duros instead of a [[Human/Legends|Human]]. However, unlike most Duros, she was contentious and overbearing, and commonly took the role of a leader.<ref name="AIR" />A natural scout, Casti Tholon worked for the [[Rim Commercial Mining]], locating and charting planets in the Unknown Regions and the Wild Space. The first planet she ever discovered, and also the most important, was named [[Tholon]] after her.<ref name="AIR" />During a trek through the forests of [[Kur Minor|Kur]], she was cut and poisoned by thorn vines across her arms and lower legs, which left her with [[Color/Legends|black]] scars. She also had scars on her head, visible because of she always kept her head clean-shaven.<ref name="AIR" />A former student at Galactic Outdoor Survival School, she later joined the staff of the School. She was devoted to her work and loyal to her boss and close friend, [[Barosa Warren]].<ref name="AIR" /> Warren's animosity towards ex-alumni who have joined the Rebellion was well-known; apparently, Tholon was politically neutral, but her loyalty to Warren led to ex-alumni and Rebel officer Major [[Sisquoc]] to consider her a major threat to himself and his team.

name: Randle Clanse
description: Randle Clanse was a natural born Brosin, born between [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]] and [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]].She was born in the rural areas north of the [[Shoengen Shores]], in a small village near the [[Talbot Ridges]]. However, there are no official records of her birth.<ref name="AIR" />When the [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority]] decided to build three [[Zinsian]] processing plants on Brosi, displacing thousands of Brosins and "hiring" many young Brosins for dangerous mining work, Clanse decided to create the [[Brosin Underground]]: A paramilitary force using guerrilla tactics to harass the CSA facilities and [[Security Police|troops]] on Brosi, attempting to force them off the planet.<ref name="AIR" />The Underground began operating soon after the opening of the first plant, achieving instant popular support by the oppressed Brosins, due to Clanse's personal charisma and her decision to share with the people the profits stolen from the CSA.<ref name="AIR" />An athletic young woman with a shoulder-length mane, Clanse decided to personally lead the smallest of the four teams in the Underground: Thirty warriors who would travel through the [[Shoengen Coast]] riding [[staplarint]]s&mdash;her team, nevertheless, soon became the most infamous. The other three teams would be mobile, with the largest one led by Clanse's trusted lieutenant [[Vuraj Marn]].<ref name="AIR" />

name: Zayl Braith
description: Braith was born in the [[Asamin system]], child of a prosperous family who traded through the [[Essien Run]], particularly with the Asamin system. Braith was [[Callandri]]'s older cousin, and was physically similar to her.Braith made friends with different [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]], and she began working with one of them, Captain [[Thi Sawrtin]], in many smuggling runs.During a "routine" run through the [[Noonian sector/Legends|Noonian sector]], Sawrtin and Braith found the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Immobilizer 418 cruiser/Legends|Interdictor cruiser]], the ''[[Tory's Catcher]]''. Sawrtin found that Imperial Captain [[Gresia Vleen]] was not a friend of bribes, but he nevertheless tried to discuss with her. Vleen shot Sawrtin, impounded his ship and imprisoned Braith for many weeks before transferring her to [[Rol Two]].Braith managed to escape during the transfer, but she became an Imperial fugitive, on the run since.Trying to get money working as a smuggler, she contacted with [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] gangster [[Tiron Til]]. Til was a good manager for Braith, but he eventually decided to deal with some [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] smugglers who wanted to monopolize the spice trade in Asamin. Braith, who still felt loyalty towards her native system, did not want to have anything to do with it, and was expelled from Til's syndicate.Braith then met her cousin Callandri, who had became a freelance bounty hunter specialized in Rebel bounties. They began a partnership, and both of them worked together in a plot to kill Rebel lieutenant [[Alton Lochner]]. They found him in a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]], they entered the bar guns blazing, unfortunately for them Lochner had company, [[Adazian Liebke]] and a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] named [[Tirranna]]. Tirranna and Lochner were nevertheless injured; Liebke noticed that Tirranna would not mind tasting the blood of either Callandri or Braith should they found her again.Soon afterward, Callandri founded the [[Granse Confederacy]] with some other [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] and Braith. The Granse Confederacy became a threat to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], calling the attention of [[Crix Madine/Legends|Crix Madine]].Rebel Lieutenant Commander [[Zhir-Khan]] wrote an article on the threat posed by Braith. He also managed to see Braith during a mission on Ord Mantell; fortunately for him, she was alone. Zhir-Khan, wondering why would she have come back after her first attack, assigned [[Shofeld]] to watch her until she left the [[Planet/Legends|planet]].

name: Callandri
description: Born in [[Tilam City]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Pendal]], Callandri had led a life of crime since she was a little [[Sexes/Legends|girl]]. She worked for different criminal groups on Pendal and eventually left her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] to roam the [[Star/Legends|stars]]. Even then, she chose to use the simple technology of her native world, particularly the [[Slugthrower/Legends|slugthrower]] [[machine gun]].<ref name="AIR" />She found work as an "[[Advisor/Legends|advisor]]" to a high executive of [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]]. Her exact work included [[Assassin/Legends|assassinating]] her employer's enemies, including people inside and outside the corporation. However, she chose to end her relation with Kuat Drive Yards; rumor stated that she resigned during a "hunt," in order to become a freelance [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] with her older cousin, [[Zayl Braith]]. In the wake of her resignation, the high executive sent five renowned bounty hunters to bring her back. Callandri defeated the hunters and sent them back to him, albeit in pieces.<ref name="AIR" />She then performed her first attempt on the life of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] [[Alton Lochner]]. She found him on the [[Brawl and Grill]] establishment, in [[Trader's Quarter]], [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]], and entered the bar shooting. Although Lochner's life was saved by his friends, including the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Tirranna]] and [[Adazian Liebke]], he spent weeks in the infirmary. Tirranna respected Callandri's skills, but also intensely hated her.<ref name="AIR" />Wanting to get even on Lochner and Tirranna, Callandri and Brayth attacked them again on [[Triewahl Docking Station]], but they were again saved by their partners.<ref name="AIR" />She then recruited six alien bounty hunters to form the [[Granse Confederacy]] under her command. She met [[Arcuse]], who had formed a partnership with [[Kiran Tatch]] and traveled by [[Rodick Tag]]; Arcuse decided that it would be a good team to join and the others followed him. She also met [[Milacass]], [[Vadon Lenitor]], and [[Lu'daal-ud]], who joined the Confederacy forfeiting their respective pasts. Soon, Callandri was good friends with Lenitor.<ref name="AIR" />At this point of her life, Callandri was a muscled, attractive young woman with dark long [[Hair/Legends|hair]] braided into aconlins&mdash;a common hairstyle in Tilam City. She usually dressed in gray or black, using her clothes to hide weapons.<ref name="AIR" />Callandri managed to acquire a [[Q-6100|Jadai Q-6100]] land vehicle. She also killed [[Karu Nelbin]] and stole Nelbin's [[Starship/Legends|ship]], the ''[[Nightcast]]''. She heavily modified the ship to adjust it to the Confederacy's needs.<ref name="AIR" />In only months, Callandri made the Granse Confederacy a renowned force, and the Rebel Alliance became afraid of it. [[Vanden Willard/Legends|Vanden Willard]] wrote an extensive report on Callandri's activities, consulting Lochner and other survivors of her attacks.<ref name="AIR" />

name: Cene Gilvent
description: A pupilless-[[Eye/Legends|eyed]] [[Near-Human]] from the [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Saclas]], Gilvent harvested native gelatinous slimes to be exported as pets for [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorrean]] youths. She eventually earned enough money to pay a ticket to the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]]. There, she showed an interest in fencing.Gilvent was hired by the [[Zuliria Museum of Antiquities]] to maintain properties, and for the following seven [[Standard year/Legends|years]] she learned (often by reading) dozens of fencing styles, from the [[Teelar two-handed method]] from the long-extinct [[Lar warriors]], to the [[Kartranin method]]s of the then-recently-founded [[Murra Orders]].Gilvent was by this point a middle-aged blonde [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] with white skin, with a strong complexion for an Ocsinin, but slender for a [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]]. Gilvent met [[Ther-das]] and attempted to join the [[Zulirian Swordmasters]], but the Swordmasters rejected her because of her unorthodox&mdash;although efficient&mdash;fighting techniques. However, the Swordmasters came to understand her love and mastery of her abilities, and allowed her to join.Fellow Swordsmaster [[Mlatar Thon Gra]] also built Gilvent's customized weapon, the [[Soknar]], by combining a [[Somreth tri-blade]] of the [[Drevun Six]], the [[Barnax]] [["Twenchok" foil]] and the [[Coynite]] [[sat'skar]]. Gilvent kept a friendly rivalry with Swordmaster [[Kaltor Naklian]], as neither of them had ever lost a duel.Gilvent was one of the Swordmasters who participated in the skirmish of [[Teloc Ol-sen]], where Naklian killed an agent of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], leading to a massacre of the entire Rebel cell by the Swordmasters. Since then, the Swordmasters were considered a threat to the Rebel Alliance.Gilvent later fought a team of new Rebel recruits under the orders of [[Bren Derlin/Legends|Bren Derlin]] in [[Fislan]].
