Apparently, the soldiers were battered but survived; however, Derlin was so convinced of the threat Gilvent supposed, that he wrote a report on her, suggesting the use of a sharpshooter to neutralize her.

name: Tir'uh
description: Tir'uh was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Noehon]] who earned a living as a [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]]<ref name="air" /> &mdash; something infrequent among female Noehons, who were mostly considered slaves in their native [[Planet/Legends|planet]].<ref name="GG">''[[Galaxy Guide 12: Aliens — Enemies and Allies]]''</ref> For decades during the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Tir'uh worked in criminal affairs, usually related to slavery. She traveled from [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]] to [[Bnar VII]], and was said to know all of the locales selling slaves among those two planets.<ref name="air" />Tir'uh joined the [[Mytaranor Slaving Council]] and was so important that the [[Task Force on Alliance Security]] thought for a long time that Tir'uh was the leader. The discovery of a different leader, [[Talas Piran]], led the Task Force to reevaluate Tir'uh's responsibilities; they eventually decided that she was serving as "elder statesbeing", providing insight and advice.<ref name="air" /> She was nonetheless clearly identified as a high-ranking member of the Council<ref name="GG" />Tir'uh and Piran hooked up with a failed [[Krish (species)/Legends|Krish]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] by the name of [[Karalan]]. Kalaran managed to get their sympathies and they hired him as a part of the [[Vanquisher (Kiltirin-class)|''Vanquisher'']] security team.<ref name="air" />

name: C'ar L'andara
description: She began her career as a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] to [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Alexander Julstan IV]] of the [[Arkanis sector/Legends|Arkanis sector]], until she ran away. In a matter of hours, she was re-captured by [[Talas Piran]], leader of the [[Mytaranor Slaving Council]]. Piran, however, decided to keep her instead of returning her, thinking that the resourceful fugitive could be a useful addition to the Council. L'andara began helping the Council in business transactions with Twi'lek slavers; she usually behaved seductively with male Twi'leks before they became stubborn. Although new in the business, she showed a natural skill in a short [[Time/Legends|time]].

name: Yurdak Fav
description: Yurdak Fav was born in the [[Uvena system]], particularly in [[Inner Uvena]] as could be shown by her bright yellow eyes. She was the youngest of a long family of Republic scouts who could be traced to her great-great-grandmother. Following her steps, Fav served in the [[Republic Survey Corps/Legends|Republic Survey Corps]].The declaration of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] led many Shistavanens to leave the Corps. Fav was one of those newly unemployed scouts.Sometime before [[11 BBY/Legends|11 BBY]], Fav and [[Lak Sivrak/Legends|Lak Sivrak]] were contacted by the [[Uvena System Constabulary]]. They were asked to search missing [[Alpha Premier]] [[Korta Sarc]], who was eventually found murdered inside the [[Jenet/Legends|Jenet]] embassy. Afterward, Fav and Sivrak spent a time together and with other scouts before returning to their respective warrens. Sivrak kept a good impression on Fav.She was then seen following [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] scouts, always with a new ship (including the ''[[Zol-Uvena]]''). As those scouts were looking for potential safeworlds, Fav's presence made them rule out those worlds as unsafe, which eventually led to a dearth of Rebel safeworlds.She never attacked any Rebel, and the Rebel Alliance never could proof any Imperial forces in the safeworlds identified by Fav. However, the Alliance considered her a potential threat to be dealt with; and old acquaintance Lak Sivrak wanted to question her.The following time she was identified, a team of Rebels tried to meet with her and discuss an agreement. She was captured by slavers, probably the [[Mytaranor Slaving Council]], and the Rebels tried to rescue her due to her knowledge.

name: Tynan Ryln Mei
description: A native of [[Togoria/Legends|Togoria]] and an aficionado watcher of [[sc'rath]] duel, she eventually left her world and became a Rebel-aligned privateer and smuggler. Mei provided Rebel cells in [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] worlds with supplies and weapons. During this time, she was also revealed to be an excellent fighter.<ref name="air" />On [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]], she joined [[Alliance Intelligence]]; and in [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]] she became a member of [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] unit [[Storm Squadron (Rebel)|Storm Squadron]]. She was also a member of the Rebel Alliance [[Task Force on Alliance Security]]; in that role, she wrote a report on [[Mlatar Thon Gra]], a Togorian who was a threat to the Rebel Alliance. Mei specified that Gra was a great weaponsmith and swordmaster, and that he would attack unprepared enemies.<ref name="air" />

name: Tirranna
description: Respected because of her contacts and her knowledge of the underworld, she was chosen for the Rebel Alliance Intelligence. She was eager to join the team, because she wanted a chance to manage military forces to liberate her native [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]].<ref name="air" />Tirranna crossed paths twice with pirates [[Dorin Venithon|Dorin]] and [[Denuab Venithon]]. Each time, they escaped "like a [[scur]] from the jaws of a [[nightdweller]]". She respected the team, although she noticed that they fought without any honor.<ref name="air" />In [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]], Tirranna was captured by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in [[Pa'hir'al City]], and interrogated by [[High Inquisitor]] [[Mox Slosin]]. She survived the interrogation, but she would keep physical and psychological scars for the rest of her life, as well as an important hatred towards Slosin.<ref name="air" />A partner of fellow Rebel officers [[Alton Lochner]] and [[Adazian Liebke]], she was having drinks with them on the [[Brawl and Grill]] establishment, in [[Trader's Quarter]], [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]]. Suddenly, assassin [[Callandri]] entered the bar shooting, trying to kill Lochner. As Tirranna and Liebke were unaware of a good reason for Lochner to die, they worked together saving Lochner's life. Tirranna's actions were essential in the rescue.<ref name="air" />Tirranna was later consulted by [[Vanden Willard/Legends|Vanden Willard]], who wanted to write a report on Callandri. Tirranna wrote of her respect to Callandri's skills, comparing her to a [[Katarn/Legends|Katarn]]. However, she also specified that she hated Callandri and wanted a chance to kill her or her cousin and associate [[Zayl Braith]].<ref name="air" />As a member of the [[Task Force on Alliance Security]], Tirranna wrote reports on potential threats to the Rebel Alliance, including former enemies Venithon Twins and Mox Slosin. She also wrote about the [[Mytaranor Slaving Council]]: As a Wookiee, she despised all of the slavers and wanted to kill hundreds of them with her bare hands.<ref name="air" />

name: Nandi
description: [[File:Teckla2.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Teckla Minnau, Nandi's half-sister]]Nandi and her half-sister, [[Teckla Minnau/Legends|Teckla Minnau]], were born in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Parrlay]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] to a middle-class [[Merchant/Legends|merchant]] family. They later lived with their older brother, [[Rehtul Minnau]], in the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] city of [[Theed/Legends|Theed]], where the two girls attended a private [[school]] to learn etiquette, hospitality, history, and the arts. When the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invaded]] Naboo in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Nandi went into hiding in the [[Swamp/Legends|swamps]] with Teckla and several [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Forces]] members, but she was soon separated from her sister by the growing conflict, only to be reunited with her at the [[Freedom of Naboo/Legends|Celebration Parade]]. Nandi and Teckla then finished their schooling and went on to work for [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] as servants at [[Varykino/Legends|Varykino]], Amidala's [[House Naberrie|family]] retreat.<ref name="DB" />[[File:Lake Retreat 2.png|thumb|right|260px|Varykino, House Naberrie's lake retreat]]In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Amidala and her [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], used Varykino as a sanctuary after two failed [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|assassination attempts]] on the Senator's life. Nandi and Teckla [[Waiter/Legends|served]] them their meal, including [[shuura]] [[Fruit/Legends|fruit]] as dessert.<ref name="AOTCn">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones (novelization)|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'' novelization]]</ref> At the end of the [[Standard day/Legends|day]], they said goodbye to the young couple and left the two alone.<ref name="FF96">{{FFCite|96|AMI 23-24, ''Dinner for Two''}}</ref>During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Nandi was separated from Teckla once again when the latter left for [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to act as one of Amidala's [[handmaiden]]s.<ref name="Pursuit of Peace">{{TCW|Pursuit of Peace}}</ref> Later in the war, Nandi's sister was [[Assassin/Legends|assassinated]] by the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Embo/Legends|Embo]] on the planet [[Scipio/Legends|Scipio]].<ref name="An Old Friend">{{TCW|An Old Friend}}</ref>

name: Saren Llalik
description: {{Quote|While the Empire holds an advantage in manufacturing capability, the Alliance has teams of tremendously innovative specialist, technicians and engineers &mdash; people like General Jan Dodonna, General Airen Cracken and Doctor Saren Llalik &mdash; who have been able to create new devices or re-engineer existing items to give the Alliance's soldiers an edge in combat.|[[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]], soon after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]].|The Truce at Bakura Sourcebook}}Born on the humid [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Plavin 6]], Saren Llalik was the third child and only daughter of [[Doctor/Legends|Doctors]] [[Nash Llalik|Nash]] and [[Loran Llalik]]. Her elder brother and middle child of the family, [[Nashiak Llalik]], interested in [[Armor/Legends|armors]] from a young age, entertained Saren during their childhood by telling her tales about the [[Death Watch/Legends|Death Watch]] and the [[Sun Guard]], and their respective armors. Saren and her [[Unidentified Llalik child|oldest brother]] joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] around the same time that Nashiak joined [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|COMPNOR]], an umbrella organization of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].<ref name="air" /> Saren, however, hid her affiliation so she could work as a secret agent.<ref name="CRO" /> Both Saren and Nashiak became gurus in their respective fields of expertise: Saren as a [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] technology expert, and Nashiak as an armor technology expert.<ref name="air" />By [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Llalik had become the [[Director of Prosthetic Design]] for [[BioTech Industries/Legends|BioTech Industries]], a corporation dealing in medical and cyborg technologies. As a [[Cybernetics/Legends|cybernetic]] specialist working in different experimental designs, she was reputable for the high quality design projects she directed and managed, including the cybernetic implant [[Borg Construct Aj^6]] unit. Llalik worked from a [[Laboratory/Legends|laboratory]] in a restricted area of BioTech's headquarters in the [[Corellian system]], and she also developed a system to provide top-secret information to the [[Alliance High Command/Legends|Rebel command]], including military designs for the Empire, using an unwitting [[2-1B surgical droid]] at her lab. Llalik had included an [[Espionage droid|espionage module]] in the [[Droid/Legends|droid]], using it to store files about new cybernetic designs. Medical [[Technician/Legends|technician]] [[Kena Shont]], also a Rebel agent, later downloaded the files onto her personal [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]] and gave the information to the Rebel command. As BioTech maintenance could not detect the [[Saboteur/Legends|sabotage]] unless they performed an analysis that only the Director of Prosthetic Design&mdash;Llalik herself&mdash;could request, her work remained undiscovered. Through her work for the Alliance, mostly by providing the Alliance with secret information and useful new technological designs, Llalik saved many lives and earned the respect of Alliance [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]], who considered himself to be in debt to her and even included her in his own contact list.<ref name="CRO" />In [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], while Llalik was on an extended paid vacation, she helped the [[Task Force on Alliance Security]] as a consultant on medical and cyborg advances that could be used against the Empire. In that role, she wrote a report on the threat posed by Doctor [[Cinto Alaras]], an [[Engineer/Legends|engineer]] with no known [[Politics/Legends|political]] affiliation, and on Rebel agent [[Sommen]], who was working undercover for the same corporation as Alaras. Llalik also wrote a report on her own brother Nashiak, who had become an armor designer for Imperial military projects.<ref name="air" />In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Llalik was still active as a member of the soon-to-be [[Alliance of Free Planets]]. At that point, she was well-respected because of her engineering work that provided the [[Rebel trooper/Legends|soldiers]] of the Alliance with new technologies. Alliance historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]] compared the importance of her work with that of Generals [[Jan Dodonna/Legends|Jan Dodonna]] and Airen Cracken.<ref name="tbsb">''[[The Truce at Bakura Sourcebook]]'', page 133</ref>

name: Brixie Ergo
description: [[File:Brixie Ergo2.png|thumb|left|200px| Brixie Ergo]]She served as the field [[Medic/Legends|medic]] for Red Moon's mission to [[Gabredor III]] in order to save the children of a businessman inside the Alignment who wanted to join the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. At first she didn't understand the traded insults between Kempo, [[Sully Tigereye]] and [[Hugo Cutter]] until she figured it was just how the old friends worked together, she also believed that Hugo should have been in a psychotrauma ward. While on Gabredor III she killed a large reptoid mount after it threatened to kill her. While they attacked the base of the [[Karazak Slavers Cooperative]], Kempo ran a repulsorcart full of explosives at their command center and tried to jump getting his foot stuck in the process. He was killed in the explosion which greatly affected Brixie.

name: Sabran
description: Sabran was well known within the Imperial Navy for her fluency in over 300 alien languages. However, she was sent to an Imperial prison after being framed for leaking information to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. [[Janq Paramexor]], a leading bounty hunter, had heard of her skills and arranged for her to be freed in return for Sabran joining his [[House Paramexor|guild]]. She agreed and put her training and skills to work for Paramexor's organization.

name: Lexi Dio/Legends
description: [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] Dio represented the [[Agriworld/Legends|agricultural world]] of [[Uyter/Legends|Uyter]], and was a member of the [[Loyalist Committee/Legends|Loyalist Committee]].<ref>{{Hnn|49|news/13328_1.html|Palpatine forms Loyalist Committee|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728124856/http://www.holonetnews.com/49/news/13328_1.html}}</ref> She was surrounded by a group of Uyter-born [[Advisor/Legends|advisors]], including [[Half'Pel Sen]], [[Benet Pryer]], [[Tavah Whey Term]] and [[Mages Jink]].<ref name="FF130">{{FFCite|130|DIO 1-2, ''Lexi Dio''}}</ref>In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], shortly before the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Senator Dio attended a [[Alsakan RRM fundraiser|fundraiser]] in favor of the [[Refugee Relief Movement/Legends|Refugee Relief Movement]] held at the [[Xenvaer Civic Auditorium]] on [[Alsakan/Legends|Alsakan]]. The [[Journalist/Legends|journalist]] [[Dyslogia Twang]] described her look as "atrocious" and "''infra''tacky".<ref>{{Hnn|53|life/13425_1.html|SPECIAL FEATURE: Sightings by Twang|https://web.archive.org/web/20130908225748/http://www.holonetnews.com:80/53/life/13425_1.html}}</ref>She was strongly opposed to the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]], as the people she represented were apprehensive about giving so much power to the central government.<ref name="FF130" />Dio was in [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] [[Chancellor's Suite|office]] when [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] retransmitted a message sent by [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] to warn the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] that the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] had built an [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|army]] of [[Droid/Legends|droids]] on [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]].<ref>[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>During the Clone Wars, Senator Dio continued to oppose limiting the power of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]], especially in the crisis following the [[Battle of Duro (Clone Wars)|Battle of Duro]] in [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].<ref name="HNN 15:3:29" /> Sometime later, she was [[Death/Legends|assassinated]] and replaced by [[Malé-Dee/Legends|Malé-Dee]].<ref name="db" />

name: Lilit Twoseas
description: While Lilit Twoseas' early life is ambiguous, it is most likely that she was discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] by doctors on her homeworld, who then would have notified the [[Jedi Temple]] of their discovery. Dispatching [[Jedi recruiter|Jedi]] to bring her to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], she would have entered into the [[Jedi academy|academy]] there as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]]. After [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduating]] from the academy, Twoseas was chosen as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and, after years of one-on-one study, passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="AOW" />A skilled swordsman and an adept in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], Twoseas undertook specialized study in the Force on her own time. Eventually Twoseas came across the young [[Whiphid/Legends|Whiphid]] Initiate [[K'Kruhk]] and selected him to be her own Padawan. Following many years of training the boy, Twoseas and her student volunteered to accompany the [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]], [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]], on a perilous journey to the [[Yinchorri system]] to quell the [[Yinchorri Uprising|pan-galactic uprising]] plaguing the region. The Jedi separated into three teams, with Twoseas joining [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Councilors]] [[Micah Giiett]] and [[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] to located the rumored [[Yinchorri command center|command center]] on the planet [[Yibikkoror]]. When their ship came under fire, the Jedi crash-landed on a lone [[Yibikkoror floating city|floating city]] and began to spread out in search of the command center. Deducing that it was not located on Yibikkoror, the Jedi called for Master [[Eeth Koth/Legends|Eeth Koth's]] team to rescue them, as they came under [[Mission to Yibikkoror|siege]] by [[Yinchorri]] warriors.<ref name="AOW" />[[File:LillitDead.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Twoseas' corpse is cradled by her Padawan, [[K'Kruhk]] and Master [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]].]]Safely aboard Koth's shuttle, the Jedi team headed to [[Yinchorr/Legends|Yinchorr]] to assist Master Windu's team. On the ground, Twoseas and her Padawan [[Battle of Yinchorr (Yinchorri Uprising)|engaged]] the enemy, fighting their way to their besieged comrades. As they regrouped and headed back to their escape shuttle, K'Kruhk was surrounded by Yinchorri and would have soon been overwhelmed. Unable to standby and do nothing, Twoseas dove into the conflict and jumped in front of a blade meant for the Whiphid's heart. The blade pierced her shoulder, as a second impaled her chest. Picking up her blood-covered form, K'Kruhk and the other Jedi fled to the ship and departed the world.<ref name="AOW" />After the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] destroyed the control center and silenced the rebels, the Jedi returned with their fallen comrades to the Temple of Coruscant. Escorting Twoseas' body on a hover-gurney, K'Kruhk took his deceased Master into the Temple where it would lie in state until being [[Jedi funeral/Legends|cremated]] on the [[Jedi Temple Pyre room|Temple's pyre]].<ref name="AOW" />

name: Maranne Darmic
description: Together with [[Haber Trell]], the two [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] and their ship unknowingly got involved in a devious [[Capture of Zekka Thyne|scheme]] devised by none other than [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. Their [[Starship/Legends|ship]] was called the ''[[Hopskip]]''. Together with Thrawn they go on a mission, without knowing how he really was. Both, Trell and Maranne, thought Thrawn was the bounty hunter Jodo Kast.Maranne has long, dark blonde hair and dark blue eyes and was considered pretty."Shipping with her can't be too rough. She's pretty easy on the eyes."She also seems to be a good shot.{{Char-stub}}

name: Zadawi's grandmother
description: Despite her situation, she had great respect for [[Arkoh Adasca]] and [[The Adasca BioMechanical Corporation of Arkania|Adascorp]] and was convinced things would get better soon.

name: Ia
description: Ia was a middle-aged Human female with a husky, monotonic voice, white hair, and no-nonsense manner. She took her job very seriously of policing the skylanes in her armored [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]], CS-117, and frequently tossed impolite traffic violators in the police lockup. Her strict attitudes brought her to consider [[Rybet/Legends|Rybet]] [[Air taxi/Legends|air taxi]] driver [[Nibber Swoo]] as her professional nemesis.<ref name="core" />

name: Jovive Centi
description: When not working, she would often stroll through the streets of Hanna, striking up conversations with the citizens and joining the impromptu political discussions that frequently cropped up near the debate rotunda. Whenever she appeared in public, she would always be accompanied by [[Tristan Pex]], her administrative aide and personal bodyguard. Tristan would later die at the hands of the [[Malkite Poisoners|Malkite Poisoner]] [[Ratambo Gale]], whom Pex believed had been attempting to assassinate Centi during a public rally. In truth, Gale had been gunning for Pex all along, but that didn't stop Centi from receiving a tremendous sympathy vote and winning reelection in a landslide victory.

name: Zesi Phinx
description: It is unknown exactly when Zesi Phinx was born, but evidence suggests that the Anzati killer had haunted the seedier entertainment districts of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for centuries if not millennia, feeding on sentient beings at least twice per month and perpetrating murders numbering in the hundreds of thousands.

name: Wila Prammi
description: Prammi had more political experience than her candidates, [[Deca Brun]] and [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Beju]], having served in the government of the now deceased [[King/Legends|King]] [[Cana]]. It was thought by many that her position within the monarchy seemed to distance her from the majority of the people. However, due to revelations about Brun's abuses of campaign funds, and after Beju withdrew and supported Prammi's campaign, she was elected to succeed Veda.{{Char-stub}}

name: Danlea Lochner
description: Tara Warren was the daughter of [[Morellian]] scoutmaster [[Barosa Warren]] and an unidentified mother. She was on bad terms with her father, especially since Tara joined the Rebel Alliance, opposing Barosa's wishes. Angry at Barosa, Tara even changed her legal name.Tara Warren's siblings were [[Roland Warren]], [[Tole Warren]], [[Alton Lochner]] (who changed his surname because of his relation with Barosa). All of them were half-Morellian and probably came from different mothers, and they all eventually joined the Rebel Alliance.Danlea Lochner was a contact for the Alliance smuggling operations along the [[Ison Corridor]].

name: Fal Tivvik
description: Fal Tivvik was a member of the [[Intendant caste]], those Yuuzhan Vong who oversaw the administration and the bureaucracy of the [[Species/Legends|species]]. When she was still young, Tivvik became an adviser to a superior intendant, [[High Prefect]] [[Yoog Skell]], and proved herself in his service as one of his most talented protégés, to the extent that she was marked for [[Escalation]]. During the [[escalation]] ceremony, however, the [[Shaper caste|shaper]] in charge of the process, [[Ch'Gang Hool]]&mdash;later responsible during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] for the terraforming of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]&mdash;was suspected by High Prefect Skell of having made errors in the Escalation process. Tivvik's implants were rejected and she became [[Shamed Ones|Shamed]], and Yoog Skell's suspicions of [[Master Shaper]] Ch'Gang Hool's talents never truly abated.

name: Naia Sendar
description: Naia Sendar was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] Human who received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After constructing a yellow-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] for herself, she eventually went on to attain the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Continuing her studies independently, she strove to become a [[Jedi Guardian|Guardian]], one of the Order's three fields of study for Knights. Becoming recognized as a Guardian, Jedi Sendar had the look of a young, innocent girl; though a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] scar across her cheek revealed her true nature as a warrior. Sometime during her knighthood, for reasons unknown, Jedi Sendar felt betrayed by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], leaving her supercilious.<ref name="DH" />

name: Unidentified female Jedi (Sarlacc)
description: Earlier in her life, she had previously "talked" with a sarlacc through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] while on an unidentified [[Moon/Legends|moon]].When she was sixty years old, she was walking through [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine's]] [[Dune Sea/Legends|Dune Sea]] when she accidentally fell into the gaping mouth of a young sarlacc. She tried escaping by cutting the sarlacc's tentacles with her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and leaping to safety, but she was caught mid-leap by a tentacle and dragged back down.While in the belly of the sarlacc, she passed the time trading stories with [[Susejo]], a [[Choi (species)|Choi]] [[Sexes/Legends|male]] who had been captured by the creature shortly before the unidentified Jedi. Despite her situation, the unidentified Jedi said she felt sorry for the young sarlacc, since it had taken root on such an inhospitable world.

name: Hurana
description: Hurana was the being placed in charge of transportation for a squad of young [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] that studied at the school. During the time that they accepted a mission from the ruler of [[Ieria]], [[Rana Halion]], Hurana was shopping the market for a couple of [[A-6 Interceptor]]s. The other members of the band were [[Gillam Tarturi]], [[Rolai Frac]], [[Tulah]], [[Marit Dice]], and [[Ze]].During the mission on [[Ieria]], Gillam and the rest of the band pretended to let the young [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] join the squad. Gillam then attempted to murder Skywalker, but Anakin single-handedly defeated all six mercenaries. Marit convinced Hurana, Tulah, and Ze that Gillam had betrayed them and was using them for revenge, not justice. The squad was later taken to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] by Anakin, [[Siri Tachi]], [[Ferus Olin]], and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], to sort out the lies, betrayals, and criminal activity that had occurred within the group.

name: Fae Kalena
description: Kalena was born somewhere within the Brak sector where she eventually became a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] involved in a localized [[Transport/Legends|transport]] service. However, she eventually left the company to pursue a dream of starting her own company. In this fashion, Kalena founded the Starlines transport company using the knowledge from her former job. The small-time corporation started out transporting patrons from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genesia]] to the nearby [[Bacrana/Legends|Bacrana]], but soon had chance to expand after increased business made StarLines mildly successful. Kalena used the profits to buy more ships, and expanded the business to service throughout the [[Brak sector]]. With the increased arc of influence, Kalena had built the company into the largest and most successful passenger service in the sector.As a successful businesswoman, Kalena eventually became associated with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] sympathizing [[Bacrana System Defense Force]] headed by [[Trep Reskan]]. Kalena eventually contacted the Rebellion to work as a Rebel operative after her brother [[Har Kalena]] was apprehended by Imperial forces on Bacrana for unspecified reasons. Kalena allowed Rebel agents to travel through the Brak sector aboard her starships so long as the Alliance paid for the fares. She tried to get Trep Reskan to help her search for Har and rescue him, but the search proved fruitless.

name: Zam Ghanol
description: She was one of the pirates who followed [[Erli Prann]] in the [[Bilbringi system]] during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] aboard a [[Golan II Space Defense SpaceGun|Golan II]] [[Space station/Legends|space station]]. When caught between the [[Mon Mothma (Imperial-class)|''Mon Mothma'']] and the [[Yuuzhan Vong]], Ghanol demanded that Prann turn the ship over to the Alliance. Prann initially refused, though after his crew mutinied and subdued him, [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]] was permitted to take the [[Starship/Legends|ship]].

name: Shiri'ani
description: In [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Shiri'ani was taken to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] by [[Slaver/Legends|slavers]] and sold to [[Bib Fortuna/Legends|Bib Fortuna]] as a child. But the chaos following [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure's]] death meant she never actually remained his property for long. Shiri'ani became a street urchin, and tried to accumulate enough credits through begging to pay for a ticket back to her homeworld.As a young adult, she became a dancer for Lady [[Valarian/Legends|Valarian]] at the ''[[Lucky Despot]]''. Valarian hoped that the Twi'lek knew something about Jabba's treasure vaults, though this turned out to be an error. Regardless, Shiri'ari's acumen, ambition and psychological skills made her a valued employee. She was promoted to bartender, and then to assistant manager.When Shiri'ari reached her majority, it was apparent to all of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] that she was going to inherit Valarian's criminal empire. She purchased the future [[Lucky Star (Mos Entha)|''Lucky Star'']], deliberately modeling her new establishment on Valarian's. Valarian gave her assistant financial backing and muscle so she could get started.Shiri'ani by this time had established a large number of potential suitors, most of whom she kept just at arms length, finding it profitable to attract and manipulate a variety of humanoid males.Shiri'ani did not realize that her newest lover and investment, the Twi'lek [[Firith Olan]], was none other than her hated former owner, Bib Fortuna, who had schemed to transfer his brain into one of his enemies. Olan/Fortuna began to be more influential in her life than her mentor, and it would be soon that Shiri'ani and Valarian would no longer be allies.

name: Unidentified tree-like Jedi
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Tree/Legends|treelike]] Jedi was a member of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Jedi Praxeum]] on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] by [[23 ABY/Legends|23 ABY]]. Despite being able to move at a slow pace, she would often stand still in the sunlight, contemplating [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and her place in the [[Known Universe|universe]]. During the [[Second Imperium Crisis]], the treelike Jedi was tasked with protecting the academy from potential invaders. She once stopped two [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] intruders from the [[Shadow Academy]] by crashing a dying [[Massassi tree/Legends|Massassi tree]] trunk on them. However, this single feat had drained many [[Standard month/Legends|months]] of her energy reserves, and it took a long time to recover from this intervention.<ref name="YJKJUS" />

name: Monjai
description: In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], the [[Elomin/Legends|Elomin]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Monjai was serving the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], and was installed as the new [[Governor/Legends|governor]] of [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]], a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] located in the [[Kathol sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], after the world was successfully [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|liberated]]. The planet had been under the control of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]], who had quietly removed the Kathol [[Sector/Legends|sector]] from the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]<ref name="TSB">{{DarkStryder|The Saga Begins|The DarkStryder Campaign}}</ref> following the [[Death/Legends|death]] of [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] during the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] [[4 ABY/Legends|four years]] previously.<ref name="ROTJ">[[Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi|''Star Wars'': Episode VI ''Return of the Jedi'']]</ref> A New Republic [[New Republic task force (Kal'Shebbol)|task force]] was dispatched to the planet, along with elements of [[Katarn Commandos|Page's Commandos]], to free the world and capture the Moff. Despite their efforts, Sarne was able to escape from the New Republic along with the majority of his [[Moff Sarne's forces|forces]] and flee into the Kathol sector.<ref name="TSB" />Monjai's first order of business was to stop Kal'Shebbol from descending into chaos following the battle to free the planet. During his time on the planet, Moff Sarne had alienated the large non-[[Human/Legends|Human]] population by not respecting their traditional clan and [[City/Legends|city]]-state societal structure, and installed [[Imperial Prefect]]s over local community leaders. As a result, most of the non-Human population was ill-disposed toward Humans in general. It was hoped that Monjai, as an Elomin, would serve to reassure the various [[Alien/Legends|alien]] [[Species/Legends|species]] that called Kal'Shebbol home of the New Republic's good intentions. The decision proved to be a worthwhile one, and the alien communities accepted her appointment, allowing her to spend time building good will among the population.<ref name="TDC" />The New Republic [[Task force/Legends|task force]] that had been assigned to assault Kal'Shebbol left the planet three [[Standard day/Legends|days]] after the liberation, heading to [[Bozhnee sector]] to join up with another [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] group under the [[Commander/Legends|command]] of [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Sarin Virgilio]].<ref name="TSB" /> This left the planet virtually undefended, although the New Republic had promised to deploy a defense force to the planet inside three [[Standard month/Legends|months]]. In the meantime, Monjai was forced to scour the planet and attempt to cobble together a military force out of whatever had not been destroyed during the battle for the world.<ref name="TDC" />Shortly after the New Republic task force left the planet, the New Republic [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'', in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] of Kal'Shebbol preparing to set out into the Kathol sector to [[DarkStryder Campaign|track down]] Moff Sarne, intercepted a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress signal]] from the nearby planet of [[Kolatill]]. In the wake of the New Republic's liberation of Kal'Shebbol, the people of Kolatill had followed suit and overthrown their Imperial governor. In retaliation, Moff Sarne had ordered an [[Bombing of Domaz|attack]] on the planet's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] city of [[Domaz]], which had been conducted by the [[Ton-Falk-class escort carrier|''Ton-Falk''-class escort carrier]] ''[[Kathol Protector]]''. While the ''FarStar'' headed to the planet to assist in recovery operations, Monjai promised to send medical relief [[Starship/Legends|ships]] as soon as she could, although it would take two days to prep them.<ref name="O">{{DarkStryder|Omens|The DarkStryder Campaign}}</ref>Several months after the ''FarStar'' left Kal'Shebbol, a New Republic force departed from the planet to assist the [[Corvette/Legends|corvette]] after receiving progress updates through the [[Lifeline Project]].<ref name="E">''[[Endgame]]''</ref> The Lifeline Project was a communications link set up by the ''FarStar''{{'s}} crew to maintain contact with the New Republic as they passed through the volatile and unstable [[Kathol Rift/Legends|Kathol Rift]].<ref name="TKR">''[[The Kathol Rift]]''</ref> However, due to the distance between Kal'Shebbol and the ''FarStar''{{'s}} location at the planet [[Kathol (planet)|Kathol]], it would take several [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] for the force to get there, and several weeks to return. When the force returned with the victorious survivors of the ''FarStar''{{'s}} crew&mdash;the corvette had been lost during the [[Battle of Kathol System|Battle of Kathol]], but Moff Sarne had been defeated&mdash;Monjai greeted them enthusiastically.<ref name="E" />

name: Thella
description: She led her six team members on a mission to [[Kelada/Legends|Kelada]] to steal the sector fleet plans. While they successfully extracted the encrypted information, their activity was detected by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]], and one of her team members was injured during the escape. The further Imperials responded by locking down Thella's transport with two squads of [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]], and scouring the [[Spaceport/Legends|starport]] for her team members.After all the trouble her team had gone through, Thella was determined to find a way off [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. She heard of a local [[Information broker/Legends|infochant]] known as "The Finder" whom she hoped could aid them. While the rest of her team laid low in a hiding place, Thella took her first officer [[Huffreys]], and approached the infochant in the renowned [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], [[Lorana's Labyrinth]]. The infochant was actually a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] called [[Loh'khar]], and to Thella's surprise, he already knew her predicament. In exchange for a copy of the data she had acquired, Loh'khar provided her with an [[MD-series medical specialist droid|Emdee medical droid]], a decrypt unit for the coded information, and put her in contact with the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Platt Okeefe/Legends|Platt Okeefe]] who owed him a favor. Okeefe flew Thella and her team through the Imperial blockade of Kelada and onto the backwater planet [[Gelgelar/Legends|Gelgelar]] in her ship the [[Last Chance (YT-1300 light freighter)|''Last Chance'']].

name: Shella Motti
description: Shella Motti was part of the [[Motti family]], an influental [[Human/Legends|Human]] clan centralized on [[Phelarion]], in the [[Seswenna sector/Legends|Seswenna sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. She was a cousin of then-Commander [[Conan Antonio Motti/Legends|Conan Antonio Motti]], and the niece of [[Thalassa Tarkin]], nee Motti, who had [[Marriage/Legends|married]] the governor [[Wilhuff Tarkin/Legends|Wilhuff Tarkin]]. At an unknown point during the early [[Imperial Period]], Motti was kidnapped by agents of a criminal organization known as the [[Nebula Front/Legends|Nebula Front]], and Tarkin hired several beings to rescue her. Though the Nebula Front's hideout was located and Shella found, she surprised her would-be rescuers by refusing to return to her family. Worse, she had already hired a second team of agents to prevent her return, led by a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] that Tarkin's hired men had already crossed paths with.

name: Jannie Ha'Nook
description: {{Quote|Tipoca City has promised us a large batch of reinforcements.''"<br />"''When will they be ready?''"<br />"''Two or three months.|Armand Isard and Senator Jannie Ha'Nook|Jedi Trial}}Known for seeing everything in terms of how it might affect her, Ha'Nook was a ranking member of the [[Security and Intelligence Council]]. Despite her independent bent, she voted in favor of the [[Emergency Powers Act/Legends|Emergency Powers Act]] near the end of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]]. Before the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] begun, she became one of [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] advisors in the [[Office of the Supreme Chancellor]].In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], she voted to send aid to [[Praesitlyn]] after the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Battle of Praesitlyn|attack]] there.In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], the final [[Standard year/Legends|year]] of the war, Senator Jannie, along with [[Janus Greejatus/Legends|Janus Greejatus]], [[Sly Moore/Legends|Sly Moore]], [[Sate Pestage/Legends|Sate Pestage]], [[Sim Aloo/Legends|Sim Aloo]], [[Armand Isard/Legends|Armand Isard]], and Vice Chair [[Mas Amedda/Legends|Mas Amedda]], attended a meeting in Palpatine's office.<ref name="Labyrinth">''[[Labyrinth of Evil]]''</ref>

name: Shirlee Faughn
description: She joined Gillespee as a teenager and worked as a communications specialist. She worked her way up to eventually become his second-in-command.<ref name="TLCSB" /> When [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]] captured [[Ukio/Legends|Ukio]], she and [[Rappapor]] helped their boss escape.<ref name="TLC">''[[The Last Command]]''</ref>When Gillespee merged his organization into [[Talon Karrde]]'s [[Smugglers' Alliance]], Faughn transferred to him and became the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the ''[[Starry Ice]]'', under command of [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]]. She piloted the ''Starry Ice'' when the former [[Emperor's Hand]] [[Mission to the Kauron asteroid field|rescued]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] in the [[Kauron asteroid field]] and later conducted her to [[Nirauan/Legends|Nirauan]]. When Mara disappeared on this planet, Faughn was forced to abandon her to report to Talon Karrde.<ref name="SotP">''[[Specter of the Past]]''</ref>

name: Tour Aryon
description: {{Quote|The capitol has been very active recently with the news of the new election. I have a new project that I'm heading and have chosen two eligible candidates to work with me. However, to avoid the show of unfair favoritism, I have left it to the people of Bestine to select the politician who best represents them.|Tour Aryon|Star Wars Galaxies}}Tour [[Marriage/Legends|married]] [[Kant Aryon]] in [[4 BBY/Legends|4 BBY]]. She was a fashionable [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] and made many cultural contributions to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. [[Bestine (city)/Legends|Bestine]], the only habitation on Tatooine with a [[Museum/Legends|museum]], was where she imported all of her expensive entertainment goods. She mostly stayed in the Bestine Settlement, avoiding [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]], which she despised. She compared the residents of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] to beings of lower class like barbarians and [[Farmer/Legends|farmers]]. Tour was a very intelligent woman.After [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Prefect]] [[Orun Depp]] was assassinated by the [[Assassin droid/Legends|assassin droid]] [[IG-72]], [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] Tour replaced him with [[Eugene Talmont]].<ref name="GG7" />Tour was apparently affiliated with the [[Prophets of the Dark Side|Secret Order of the Empire]]. She cooperated with [[Sariss]], who worked for the Order as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] codenamed "Prophetess" while on Tatooine.{{Fact}}When [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] sent his own [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] to the surface of Tatooine to [[Battle of Tatooine (Galactic Civil War)|search]] for [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] and [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]], Tour objected, insisting that her own [[Troop/Legends|troops]] could handle it. When Vader was informed of her objections, he did not care.<ref name="ANH">''[[Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope (novel)|''Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope'' novel]]''</ref>

name: Ko Sai/Legends
description: Ko Sai was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Kaminoan/Legends|Kaminoan]], born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]] and genetic engineer. She once met with [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Hego Damask]], a [[Muun/Legends|Muun]] individual. Damask brought a [[Yinchorri]] subject to Kamino to inquire about using the Yinchorri as the template for a [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] [[Army/Legends|army]]. Ultimately, she and two other Kaminoan scientists were unable to use their [[Scientist/Legends|science]] to take out the Yinchorri's natural aggression, and the [[Species/Legends|species]] was abandoned in favor of [[Human/Legends|Humans]].<ref>[[Darth Plagueis (novel)|''Darth Plagueis'']]</ref>By the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Ko Sai became [[Chief Scientist]] of the creation of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. It was her responsibility to ensure that the clones were of the highest quality, overseeing all the biological aspects of the project. She also directed the "processing" of the clones that failed to meet her expectations.Following the [[First Battle of Kamino]], Ko Sai told [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] more about the source of funding for the army&mdash;a man called [[Dooku/Legends|Tyranus]], who happened to be [[Count/Legends|Count]] Dooku, a former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. At some point, she met with the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], who wanted her research to extend his life indefinitely. She noted that he disturbed her.A [[Standard year/Legends|year]] and a half into the war, Ko Sai defected to the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] and soon, [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commandos]] and [[Advanced Recon Commando/Legends|ARC troopers]] were deployed to find the [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] before she could reveal any cloning information to the Confederacy. However, she quickly abandoned the Separatists as well and became independent, fleeing both the Separatists and the Republic to continue her work in secrecy.[[Kal Skirata]], his [[Null-class Advanced Recon Commando|Null-ARCs]], [[Ordo Skirata|Ordo]], [[Mereel Skirata|Mereel]], along with [[Walon Vau]] also took up the search for the scientist in the hopes that Ko Sai would be able to engineer a full life span for the clone army. After a prolonged search, they found her on [[Dorumaa]], hiding in an underground laboratory.[[File:Ko-sai.jpg|thumb|left|Ko Sai.]]Sai was unwilling to help them, believing that Skirata would sell her research for to the highest bidder. Ordo, seemingly in a fit of rage, destroyed her research in front of her, leaving the devastated Sai without a legacy. Unknown to her, Ordo and Mereel had made a backup copy of her research, in case Ko Sai never gave them the information they wanted. Without her, they could bring the research to other cloners, such as [[Arkanian Microtechnologies]] or the [[Khommite]]s. Ko Sai, however, was kept ignorant of this fact, in order to leave her broken and more willing to cooperate, hoping for an opportunity to start over with her beloved work.In exchange for blood samples and multipotent stem cells from [[Etain Tur-Mukan]] and [[Venku Skirata|Venku's]] umbilical cord, Ko Sai surrendered some of the gene sequences that would allow for the age reversal to take place. After studying Venku's genome, Ko Sai committed suicide by hanging herself from a rafter, leaving Etain a note thanking her for the opportunity to study such a fascinating genome. Mereel, along with [[Jaing Skirata|Jaing]] and Ordo, prepared her for transport to Kamino, last seen moving her corpse into a barn with vibroblades drawn. Skirata later delivered Ko Sai's head to Delta Squad, who were to offer it as proof of her death to convince the Republic and Palpatine to give up searching for Sai and her research.

name: Genna Seedar
description: Genna Seeder was a young medical student at the [[University of Byblos]]. While visiting friends on Kal'Shebbol, she was trapped on the planet when [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]] imposed severe travel restrictions on the population.When her friends started a small resistance group to oppose Sarne, Genna joined them. She trained herself to use a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]], and her medical skills would come in useful. Operating out of a series of rooms underneath the Kal'Shebbol starport, the group had some early successes, but they were eventually beaten back by Sarne's forces. Time and time again, Genna dragged her wounded comrades back to their base. She sat by the bedside of the last member as they died of their wounds. Genna was the only survivor.When the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] liberated Kal'Shebbol, she signed onto the crew of the ''FarStar''. Genna wanted to keep helping people with her medical skills, and likely wanted to get some measure of justice against Sarne for the deaths of her friends.

name: Scoryn
description: As a young woman, Scoryn and her family were abducted by [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]]. Alongside other slaves, she fought her way out of the slaver's palace. Her exploits impressed a crimelord, who offered her a position as head of his palace security force. Unfortunately, a minor mistake offended him, and the crimelord ordered her execution. Leading her security force in a mutiny, she wounded the crimelord and his courtiers, and destroyed a large part of his palace.Now with a price on her head, Scoryn fled into the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], eventually settling on [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]]. She worked as a guard for several merchant warehouses, but was worried that she had no means of transport in case a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] tracked her down.When the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] liberated Kal'Shebbol, she signed onto the ''FarStar'' as a way to keep mobile. Her abilities made her a natural security officer, and Security Officer [[Gorak Khzam]] used her to keep order among the close-quartered crew. She was also used in ground-side combat operations and boarding actions.

name: Dariana
description: Though she dreamed of it as a child, being the Mother of the Hiironi, or spiritual leader (a rank bestowed to the eldest woman in the tribe), was not a task she wanted, at least not as early as she got it. She desired the role of Irstat-Kes, or chief of the tribe (a rank bestowed to the ''second'' eldest woman in the tribe), and she looked forward to taking on the role.<ref name="LFC" />But the day after the previous Mother was killed by a [[kilassin]], when her sister [[Meirana]] became Mother, Meirana died of a strange disease, thrusting Dariana immediately into the position of Mother. Dariana tried her best in her new job, but she was prone to tantrum when her "wisdom" was not listened<ref name="LFC" />Dariana believed in using offworld technology in certain cases. She carried a blaster to deal with predators<ref name="LFC" /> and recorded her memoirs on electronic media instead of relying solely on her people's oral tradition. She often worked for her own good as much as for the good of her irstat.Dariana trained some of the young [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] members of the irstat in her people's ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], some of whom, such as [[Constanten (Tarasin)|Constanten]], went on to the [[Almas Academy]] to train to become [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]].<ref name="AMA">''[[A Mon Alone]]''</ref>Towards the end of her life, her skin could no longer shift colors, but she still stood tall and had an impressive stance with the traditional Mother robe. She rarely left the irstat, but was present at any important meetings between the Hiironi and offworlders: Knowing her death was approaching, she decided to committ herself more with life.<ref name="LFC" />About a year after the [[Trade Wars]] of [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], a trusted offworlder friend of the irstat (probably [[Nim'Ri]], [[Shayne Gerrare]] or [[Gerta Haman]]) came to Dariana asking for a suitable location for a sanctuary, and Dariana pointed them to [[Cloud Mountain]]. Soon afterward, a group of individuals looking for the people who had disappeared themselves to join the [[Cularin resistance]] came to the irstat following clues left by the missing people. Dariana sensed a disturbance to the balance of nature around Cloud Mountain, and pointed them in the same direction as she had the irstat's friend. At this point, the [[Metatheran Cartel]] was secretly cutting down [[ch'hala tree]]s and, although Dariana's friend knew it, he or she did not tell Dariana because the Tarasin would start a violent bloodshed.<ref name="TRW">''[[The Resistance Within]]''</ref>Later, another of Dariana's sisters, [[Liriana]], turned up leading a group of Tarasin [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]] calling themselves the [[Wyrd]]. Dariana had had her own brush with the dark side when, as a child, she used it to kill a young kilassin before it could eat her.

name: Meirana
description: Slightly older and more capable than Dariana, she served as Irstat-Kes of the [[Hiironi irstat]] for years. When the Mother of the Hiironi was killed by a [[kilassin]], Meirana was ready to move on to that position, but she was struck down by a strange disease within a day. The other adepts of the irstat said she had been called to be one with the [[Cularin/Legends|world]]. Following the succession line, a reluctant Dariana succeeded Meirana as Mother

name: Cryalira
description: Cryalira spent most of her life as a hunter. She was surprised when the previous Irstat-Kes, [[Meirana]], died shortly after the previous Mother did, making her Irstat-Kes instead of [[Dariana]]. She would have preferred roaming the jungle to her duties leading the irstat.<ref name="cg" />She had difficulty making decisions for the tribe, believing that she had not been trained nor had talent for the role; but she was still growing into her position, and many believe she would made an excellent Irstat-Kes with time. Certain discontent elements of the irstat were conspiring against her in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]].<ref name="cg" />Cryalira had the tendency to raise her crest when presiding, leading many to believe she was always angry.<ref name="cg" />Her known relatives included her grandson, [[Fisonna]].<ref name="cg" />

name: Rizzal
description: The sister of [[Nizzal]] and [[Vizzal]], Rizzal's speciality was knowing who had information that was useful, and what they would want in exchange for it. She was also adept at breaking into computer systems to retrieve needed data. She joined the crew of the ''[[FarStar]]'' alongside her master and sisters.

name: Nizzal
description: The unofficial leader of the three sisters who worked for Loh'khar, Nizzal was treated better than the other two. Loh'khar entrusted her to deal with his clients and sources, and maintaining the Twi'lek's large amount of connections. She also concocted schemes of her own and negotiated side deals without Loh'khar's knowledge. She joined the crew of the ''[[FarStar]]'' alongside her master in [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]]. Under Loh'khar's orders, she assisted in [[Gorak Khzam]]'s defection as part of a wider scheme.

name: Vizzal
description: The sister of [[Nizzal]] and [[Rizzal]], Vizzal's job for Loh'khar was to locate whatever he or his clients needed, then discovering what they would cost, or what the owner would want to part with it. She was also adept at scavenging, stealing, or cannabilizing needed items. She had a knack for reprogamming droids to do what she wanted, or to forget their current master. Vizzal joined the crew of the ''[[FarStar]]'' alongside her master and her sisters.

name: Zethe Raskin
description: Zethe Raskin was a self-centered and greedy politician, rising through the ranks of galactic government for over twenty years. She built contacts across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], and became highly influential, able to shift the course of policy with a simple smile.<ref name="UA" />

name: Essenton
description: Described as being somewhat "cranky" and perhaps in advance age,<ref>''[[The New Jedi Order: Force Heretic I: Remnant]]'', 344.</ref> her competence appeared to be enough to overcome the long-rooted Imperial female prejudice as by at least [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]] she was known to command the [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Defiant (Imperial-class)|''Defiant'']]. During the [[Battle of Borosk (Yuuzhan Vong War)|Battle of Borosk]], she was instructed by [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Pellaeon]] to assist a certain [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Arber]] subsequent to her Star Destroyer being fitted with a [[gravitic amplitude modulator]] (GAM), a device capable of jamming [[yammosk]] war-coordinating messages among [[Yuuzhan Vong]] forces.<ref>''Force Heretic I: Remnant'', 344.</ref> When ordered to engage, Essenton commanded the ''Defiant'' into the heart of the enemy formation, attacking the yammosk-bearing warship-analog and rendering debris.<ref>''Force Heretic I: Remnant'', 345-47.</ref> Almost immediately a second yammosk was located among the enemy fleet and Essenton led the ''Defiant'' in engaging it as well,<ref>''Force Heretic I: Remnant'', 348.</ref> though it would prove unnecessary as the Yuuzhan Vong forces withdrew soon after.<ref>''Force Heretic I: Remnant'', 350-351</ref> Following the battle, Essenton was ordered to take ''Defiant'' to [[Yaga Minor/Legends|Yaga Minor]] in order to assist in the [[Battle of Yaga Minor (Yuuzhan Vong War)|defense]] of that planet.<ref>''Force Heretic I: Remnant'', 352.</ref>

name: Freia Kallea
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] living around [[3700 BBY]], Kallea was one of the first female pilots who decided to map out a part of the galaxy. She managed to blaze a trail beginning at the [[Corporate Sector/Legends|Corporate Sector]] and continuing through the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core]] to the other side, effectively passing through the whole galaxy. Sewing together the [[Dustig Trace]], the [[Sprizen End Run]] and dozens other one-hop routes, she formed a larger hyperway, called the [[Hydian Way/Legends|Hydian Way]].<ref>''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> Opening the galaxy beyond [[The Slice/Legends|The Slice]] and joining its northern and southern quadrants, the scale of [[Galactic community|galactic civilization]] changed forever.<ref name="IDC" /> In a local level, Brentaal became the only system to be at the intersection of two major hyper-routes (the other being the [[Perlemian Trade Route/Legends|Perlemian Trade Route]])After that, Kallea became a symbol of Brentaal's cultural strength and endurance, and her name would pass to posterity. She then retired from the life of a pilot to marry into a Brentaal family.<ref name="IDC" />Now a noblewoman, Kallea (who retained her maiden name) would work to turn her new family into a major trading enterprise, the [[Kallean League]]. Even years after her death, the Kallean League would still remain a large consortium of representatives of different trading houses.

name: Viera Cheran
description: [[File:Viera_Cheran_and_Wedge.jpg|thumb|left|Chief Cheran (right) reports to Wedge Antilles]]During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], [[Dark Prince|Prince]] [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor]] of [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] intended to discredit [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] before [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] eyes. For that end he used his underground connections to bribe [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] and anyone else who could track down and kill [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]].Shortly before the [[Battle of Gall]], a weary Cheran was offered 10,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] by an operative who wanted [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] dead. She saw killing Skywalker as a means to get enough money to buy her own [[Light freighter/Legends|light freighter]] and become a [[Free-trader]], working only for herself. Cheran decided to take the bribe. [[Guri]] paid her through a net of dummy corporations, which would be traced to [[Saber Enterprises]].At the Rogues' temporary base on [[Kile]], she tampered with the [[Unidentified R2 unit (Wes Janson)|R2 unit]] of [[Wes Janson/Legends|Wes Janson's]] [[X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing fighter]] so that it would take control and fire on Skywalker's. As the battle concluded, Janson's R2 took control of the X-wing and started to hunt and shoot Luke's. However Luke managed to get behind him and shoot a precise hit to his R2.Investigating on the aftermath, Luke and [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge]] found that Janson's droid had been programmed by their technician. When they went to interrogate her, she attempted to shoot Luke, before being shot by Wedge.After that incident, they investigated her account and tracked down the bribe to Saber Enterprises. Xizor's plan was foiled, however as he intended, everyone believed that Vader was behind the attempt.

name: Brandy MacMillian
description: A native of [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], Brandy MacMillian was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] who plied her trade as a [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] [[Captain/Legends|captain]]. At some point during her life, she earned the [[Corellian Bloodstripe]] and joined the [[Corellian Merchants' Guild/Legends|Corellian Merchants' Guild]]. After many years as a freighter captain, MacMillian eventually decided to retire; she chose to settle on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Gandle Ott]], a remote world located in the [[Kathol sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. On Gandle Ott, MacMillian maintained a small Corellian Merchants' Guild [[Corellian Merchants' Guild Guildhouse (Gandle Ott)|Guildhouse]].<ref name="DIRP" />During her time as head of the Guildhouse, MacMillian amassed a large amount of navigational information regarding the Kathol [[Sector/Legends|sector]] and was willing to copy it for members of the Corellian Merchants' Guild for a fee of 100 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'' stopped over at Gandle Ott while on a mission to track down the rogue [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]]. The crew of the ''FarStar'' was in need of navigational charts of the sector, as Moff Sarne had wiped the records on the sector [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]] clean during his [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|withdrawal]], and the crew only had access to partial maps that did not show details beyond Gandle Ott. During their layover, MacMillian was one of the potential sources from which they considered obtaining the information.<ref name="DIRP" />

name: Teela Kaarz
description: {{Quote| I can see why you were sent to prison. Political delicacy is not one of your strong points, is it?| [[Benits Stinex]] to Teela Kaarz.|Death Star (novel)}}In her former life, Teela was an influential and well-to-do professional on [[Mirial/Legends|Mirial]]. She was an [[Architect/Legends|architect]], specializing in [[encapsulated arcology]] design, and had designed the [[Ralthhok Encapsulization]] on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] and the [[Blackstar wheelworld]] in the [[Sagar system]]. As such, she was much celebrated and moved in the higher echelons of Mirial society, as a guest to an assortment of monarchs, [[Senator/Legends|senators]], heads of industry and starfleet admirals.During [[Planet/Legends|planet]]-wide elections on Mirial, Teela had supported a political candidate who was deemed a traitor by the [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]], and by extension, so were his most influential supporters. Teela was rounded up along with a score of other well-to-do Mirialans and convicted of [[Treason/Legends|treason]] in hastily conducted trials. She was spared an equally expedient execution due to the public outrage that arose over the events. However, she was instead transported for life to the prison planet [[Despayre]].Teela managed to survive for about a year in the harsh environs of the prison planet, thanks largely to the woodcraft taught to her by her father as a young girl. She cultivated an aura of disquieting menace which also held off the more dangerous criminal predators of [[Dungeontown]], the shanty town where she dwelt. She was eventually recruited by [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]] seeking additional labor for the construction of the Death Star in orbit above the planet and finally left Despayre on board the prisoner transport ship ''[[GLTB-3181]]''.[[File:Death Star.jpg|thumb|right|300px|The group of defectors escapes the Death Star destruction.]]Given her qualifications, Teela was selected to work for [[Benits Stinex]], chief architect and head of interior design and construction on the Death Star. She moved to the Death Star, residing in [[Cube 24556]], [[Resiplex 19]], [[Sprawl 20]]. During this time, she briefly attracted the attention of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] when she managed to 'block' his attempt to probe her mind when he was examining the crew of the Death Star despite her lack of Force sensitivity or any training, her strength of mind briefly reminding Vader of his [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|wife]] before he crushed the thought.She later was assaulted by a drunk worker in the Hard Heart in the cantina, but was rescued by [[Villian Dance|Villian Dance.]] She later became the girlfriend of Dance, and soon witnessed the destruction of Despayre. She was horrified by this action, which was only to be outdone when Alderaan, a peaceful planet with billions of innocent lives, was destroyed as well. Teela became disgusted with the Empire and, along with Dance, [[Nova Stihl]], [[Rodo]], [[Atour Riten]], [[Celot Ratua Dil]], [[Memah Roothes]], and [[Kornell Divini]], decided to leave the Death Star and the Empire behind. During the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], the group began to escape, although Riten was forced to stay behind in order to trick the landing bay controller to open the doors. He informed Teela of this when he ordered her to leave, and she revealed to him that she knew how the Rebels planned to destroy the station. Although Stihl and Rodo were forced to stay behind also, the others escaped from the Death Star with Dance shortly before its [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|destruction]]. After the destruction of the Death Star, Teela decided to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] with her fellow defectors and Vil asked for her hand in marriage, something she said she would think about.{{Char-stub}}

name: Vonya
description: Vonya was involved in the plot to reopen the [[Infinity Gate]] that lay under the [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomiri]] surface. This plot was complicated by the arrival of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]], who was investigating the disappearance of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Ova]]. During this time, she and her fellow witches ridiculed Zalem's misshapen daughter, [[Ros Lai|"the Rancor"]]. During a raid led by another Nightsister princess, [[Yongti]], Vonya was able to kill her with a [[Subterine]] and then executed her followers.<ref name="Republic 23">''[[Star Wars 23: Infinity's End, Part 1]]''</ref>As she and Zalem approached the Star chamber, they came under attack by a giant [[whuffa worm]] that guarding the chamber. She brought Vos before Zalem, and punished Ros Lai for not guarding slaves against Yongti.<ref name="Republic 24">''[[Star Wars 24: Infinity's End, Part 2]]''</ref> Vonya then discovered Ros Lai's true form and tried to match her power with her own, but was stopped by Vos. She then vanished and informed Zalem of this. They than captured Vos and tortured him with [[artery worm]]s until Ros Lai freed him and escaped.<ref name="Republic 25">''[[Star Wars 25: Infinity's End, Part 3]]''</ref>Vonya then pursued Vos, Ros Lai, and [[Yag Shushin]] to the star chamber, and appeared to be destroyed by them. Vonya was then [[Death/Legends|killed]] when Quin destroyed her ship after she killed his friend Yag.<ref name="Republic 26">''[[Star Wars 26: Infinity's End, Part 4]]''</ref>

name: Kisa Shaki
description: Kisa Shaki, a former employee of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]], killed the pit boss of the Depot as soon as she confirmed the death of the [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]], taking over the business. She and six other thugs then attempted to seize a portion of Jabba's [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] business, but found themselves faced with formidable competition in the person of [[Qes Dollis]], the manager of the [[Sandstorm Shipping Concern]].The gang war that resulted drew the attention of the local [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance]] cell and Rebel agents attempted to resolve the situation. However, Kisa was confident in her abilities and merely threatened or attempted to suborn the operatives.

name: Tawn Porew
description: Porew joined the Rebellion after [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] killed her parents who refused to surrender their farm property to the local [[Governor/Legends|governor]].She swore to avenge her parents and managed to blow up the governor's [[Landspeeder/Legends|landspeeder]]. She also attempted to blow up his house, but was captured and imprisoned. Eventually, she was liberated by the local underground Rebel cell. Tawn was talented when it came to demolitions, and the Rebels were so impressed by her skills that they offered her a place in the Rebel Alliance. She accepted and received training at a secret Rebel base. Once the training was complete she was assigned to [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Brion Peck]]'s unit on [[Rafft]] where she met and befriended the [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] [[Dannen Lifehold]] and [[Purr]].

name: Hella Brün
description: Hella Brün was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was employed as the chief [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] and aide for [[Bequesh]], the [[Administrator/Legends|administrator]] of the [[Tanquilla Beach/Legends|''Tanquilla Beach'']] [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowport]]. She began her employment in [[12 BBY/Legends|12 BBY]], and served Bequesh capably, accompanying him as he went about his business on the [[Space station/Legends|station]] and saving his life on several occasions. By [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], Brün had served in the position for two decades.<ref name="SD" />

name: Fia (engineer)
description: Fia, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was the granddaughter of [[Spang]], a [[Starship/Legends|starship]] [[Engineer/Legends|engineer]] who operated out of the [[Tanquilla Beach/Legends|''Tanquilla Beach'']] [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowport]] in the [[Kathol sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. [[Reproduction/Legends|Born]] in [[11 BBY/Legends|11 BBY]], Fia was a natural [[hypernautics]] engineer who attended [[Corellia University]]'s [[School of Starship Engineering]], graduating in [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]] at the age of nineteen. She immediately traveled to ''Tanquilla Beach'' to intern with her grandfather in his repair bay, [[Spang's]], which was the largest on the [[Space station/Legends|station]], and the only bay capable of repairing [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]]&ndash;sized vessels.<ref name="SD" />Several [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after Fia arrived on ''Tanquilla Beach'', the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'' arrived at the station, seeking repairs to its [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]], which had been damaged by [[Saboteur/Legends|sabotage]] and [[Skirmish at Shintel|combat]] in the nearby [[Shintel system]]. Spang's was the only bay on the station capable of undertaking the needed repairs, but Spang was extremely busy and refused to undertake the work, even going as far as refusing to even meet with the command crew of the [[Corvette/Legends|corvette]]. However, the [[Commander/Legends|commanding]] [[Officer/Legends|officer]] of the ''FarStar'', [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Kaiya Adrimetrum]], encountered [[ConJob]], a [[florist]] and [[Information broker/Legends|information broker]] who was good friends with the engineer. ConJob, who had resided on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Siluria III]] recognized Adrimetrum's from her [[Time/Legends|time]] leading the [[Siluria III resistance]]. [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] forces had [[Death/Legends|killed]] Conjob's family during their occupation of the world, and in return for Adrimetrum's retaliation against them, he persuaded Spang to help the New Republic delegation. Spang relented, and allowed Fia to conduct and oversee the work.<ref name="SD" />Fia arranged for a portable [[drydock]] to be positioned next to the ''FarStar'', and proceeded to repair the corvette's [[Engine/Legends|engines]], stripping them out a level at a time to overhaul them over the course of two [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]]. While running diagnostics on the engines, Fia detected traces of trapdoor circuitry embedded into the machinery. The ''FarStar'' had previously been part of the [[Moff Sarne's forces|forces]] allied to [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]], former Imperial [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] of the Kathol [[Sector/Legends|sector]], and Sarne had intended the vessel to undertake special missions for him. To that end, he had extensively modified the vessel with trapdoor [[Computer/Legends|computer]] programming to ensure that any officer he assigned to command of the vessel would not be able to abscond with the corvette or subvert his authority. That trapdoor circuitry had allowed one of Sarne's agents&mdash;[[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Palme]]&mdash;to upload a computer program into the ''FarStar''{{'s}} systems while the vessel was on [[Shintel]]. The program caused an overload in the ship's engines that burned out the hyperdrive when the ''FarStar'' attempted to jump to lightspeed.<ref name="SD" />Showing her findings to Captain Adrimetrum, Fia was confident that she could remove the trapdoors in the engines, but admitted she did not have the technical knowledge to search for other trapdoors throughout the ship, and she was certain there would be more embedded in the vessel's other systems. Spang, who had stopped by to see how Fia was faring, mentioned that the work was similar to some he had seen done by [[Slicer/Legends|slicers]] based out of [[Pembric II]]. He advised Adrimetrum to find a man named [[Breslin Drake]] on the planet; Drake had connections all over Pembric II, and he would be able to locate individuals that would be able to help Adrimetrum remove the trapdoors.<ref name="SD" />After completing work on the ''FarStar''{{'s}} engines, Fia accompanied the ship on a trial run through neighboring [[Star system/Legends|star systems]] to test her work and proclaimed them fully functional. In addition to repairing the engines on the ''FarStar'', Fia managed to upgrade them<ref name="SD" /> from a Class Two hyperdrive<ref name="TDC">''[[The DarkStryder Campaign]]''</ref> to a Class One.<ref name="SD" />

name: Angela Krin
description: Krin was the commander of the [[Resolute (Invincible-class)|''Resolute'']], an [[Invincible-class Dreadnaught Heavy Cruiser|''Invincible''-class Dreadnaught]] which enforced the quarantine of [[Endregaad]], in the [[Tion Cluster/Legends|Tion Cluster]]. Shortly thereafter she received a promotion to [[Captain/Legends|Captain]]. She later played a major role in confounding the schemes of [[Mika Anjiliac Chiera]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Rav Bralor
description: [[File:FullArmorRavBralor.jpg|thumb|left|Rav Bralor in full armor]]Rav Bralor was one of seventy-five [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Cuy'val Dar]] training [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeants]] for the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic's]] [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commandos]], personally recruited by [[Jango Fett/Legends|Jango Fett]]. After the completion of the duties of the Cuy'val Dar, [[Sexes/Legends|she]] presumably returned to [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]]. Midway through the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] she was asked by Sergeant [[Kal Skirata]] to maintain [[Kyrimorut]], his future home and bastion of the [[Clan Skirata|Skirata clan]], in the northern forests of Mandalore. Skirata returned to Mandalore 480 [[Standard day/Legends|days]] after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]] with a very pregnant [[Etain Tur-Mukan]] after deciding that Mandalore was the safest place for Tur-Mukan, a [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]], to give birth in secret. Bralor had the home ready for them and helped them settle into their surroundings.[[File:RavBralorHelmetOff.jpg|thumb|Right|Rav Bralor.]]Bralor and her niece [[Parja Bralor|Parja]] were present for the birth of [[Venku Skirata]] and for the arrival of [[Fi Skirata]] after he suffered [[Brain/Legends|brain]] trauma at the [[Battle of Gaftikar]]. Bralor trained a full company of [[Clone commando/Legends|Republic commandos]], including [[Vevut Squad]] and [[Yayax Squad]]. The Commandos of Yayax deserted the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] after [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] and came to Mandalore to live with [[Clan Bralor|Bralor]] and the Skirata clan. Later she was present when the body of Tur-Mukan was brought to Mandalore and prepared Tur-Mukan's body for [[Cremation/Legends|cremation]].

name: Darth Wyyrlok (II)
description: {{Quote|For three generations, my family has served you, Lord Krayt.|Darth Wyyrlok (III)|Legacy 30: Vector, Part 11}}The [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="Legacy 14" />
