[[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]]<ref name="Legacy 0" /><ref name="Legacy War 1" /> [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Wyyrlok served the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Krayt]] as a [[Sith Master/Legends|Sith Master]] of his [[One Sith]].<ref name="Legacy 14" /><ref name="Legacy 0.5">''[[Star Wars: Legacy 0½]]''</ref> Her [[Parent/Legends|father]] was also called [[Darth Wyyrlok (I)|Darth Wyyrlok]]<ref name="Legacy 0" /><ref name="Legacy 14" /> and was Krayt's top [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] and closest advisor<ref name="Legacy 14" /> as early as [[41 ABY]].<ref name="Crosscurrent">''[[Crosscurrent]]''</ref> His duties were eventually passed down to his daughter, who became Krayt's most trusted advisor and acted as the guardian of the One [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] while her Master rested in [[Suspended animation/Legends|stasis]].<ref name="Legacy 14" /><ref name="Legacy 31">''[[Legacy 31: Vector, Part 12]]''</ref> The Sith remained hidden on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Korriban]] for a century, and as Krayt's order and his plans to conquer [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] developed and grew,<ref name="Legacy 0" /> he often retired to stasis for [[Standard year/Legends|years]] at a time.<ref name="Legacy 18">''[[Legacy 18: Claws of the Dragon, Part 5]]''</ref> Like her father before her, Wyyrlok became Krayt's [[voice]] and the [[Regent/Legends|Regent]] of the One Sith during these periods.<ref name="Legacy 34">''[[Legacy 34: Storms, Part 1]]''</ref> She had [[Darth Wyyrlok (III)|a son]] at some point, and he eventually assumed her name and responsibilities.<ref name="Legacy 0" /><ref name="Legacy 14" /> The third Darth Wyyrlok was serving Darth Krayt by [[130 ABY]] when Krayt [[Attack on Emperor Fel|seized]] control of the galaxy.<ref name="Legacy 1">''[[Legacy 1: Broken, Part 1]]''</ref>

name: Harlan
description: She may have been one of the original twelve students at [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Jedi Praxeum]] on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]].

name: Gerta Haman
description: Gerta was concerned about the actions of the [[Metatheran Cartel]] under [[Velin Wir]], and organized the [[Cularin resistance]] to gather proof of their illegal activities. She saw the Cartel cutting down [[ch'hala tree]]s with her own eyes and even got hold of a holorecording of their crime - but she knew that, should she try to make it public, the Cartel would say it was a doctored image. She considered the Cartel to be as bad as the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]], although she had never seen the Federation in action.<ref name="TRW" />Gerta decided to disappear with a few other people from [[Gadrin]] and Hedrett, and form a [[Cularin resistance]] to oppose the Cartel. She emptied her house and traveled to their new base, the [[Cloud Mountain mines]]. Many people, including Wahl, "disappeared" like her in the following days, enough to cause a disturbance in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] that was detected by Jedi Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]].<ref name="TRW" />Gerta became the informal leader of the resistance, with [[Nim'Ri]] and [[Broof Yurdel]] as her chief advisers. She wanted to avoid bloodshed, and was adamant that the resistance would not be the first to initiate deadly force.<ref name="TRW" />Independent gents sent by Master Qel-Bertuk eventually found the resistance base. Haman, Nim'Ri and Yurdel met with them and tried to convince them not to reveal anything about the resistance.<ref name="TRW" />One month later, Haman decided to look for some secret files of the Cartel, specifically reports on how they get their charter for Cularin and their account records of that time, which would specify which Cularin officers were bribed. She obtained speeders for the escape and an advanced, highly-modified datapad (probably a work by famed slicer [[Baylan]]) to extract information from the Cartel's computers, but she also needed someone from outside the resistance to approach the local [[Metatheran Cartel operations office]] in Gadrin. She then asked one of the members of the resistance, [[Corporal/Legends|Corporal]] [[Ortin]] from [[OPS]], to organize a secret meeting with those independent agents at the [[OPS third sector precinct house]]. Haman returned to the secret base of Cloud Mountain mines using a secret way.<ref name="ARv">''[[A Revelation]]''</ref>The operation was a success and the agents went to the mines to give Haman the information. However, some verification file codes were missing, but she discovered they were only available in the well-protected [[Metatheran Cartel jungle base]]. She asked Broof Yurdel and his troops to prepare a raid, and offered the independent agents to cooperate with Yurdel. Noticing that Yurdel was too happy with the assignment, she specifically ordered him to set the weapons in stun. She also asked Kris Wahl to question the independent agents to obtain any information they might have about the jungle base, as they had been previously there.<ref name="ARv" />However, the Cartel was tracking the stolen data, and a Cartel-aligned [[Caarite]] force attacked the resistance's secret headquarters. Haman was trapped in the crossfire, but she nevertheless tried to reach her companions. She was then shot in her back and severely wounded. Only the quick actions of some allies of the resistance saved her life.<ref name="ARv" />Due to Haman's critical state, Yurdel was even less prone to use non-lethal force; nevertheless he ordered his troops to set weapons in stun, as it was what Haman would have wanted. Haman did not take part in the following raid against the jungle base, which was a success and led to the Cartel retiring from Cualrin. Soon afterward, governor [[Barnab Chistor]] of Gadrin decorated Haman and the other resistance leaders for their success.<ref name="ARv" />Later, Haman traveled to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to meet with Senator [[Lavinia Wren]]. She was being escorted by Jedi General [[Ish-Bel Tur]]. Nevertheless, the ship was destroyed and both she and Tur were killed.<ref name="TINYF">''[[Thaere Is Not Your Friend]]''</ref><ref name="AMA">''[[A Mon Alone]]''</ref>

name: Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren
description: When the recently rediscovered ([[232 BBY/Legends|232 BBY]]) Cularin system joined the Republic in 32 BBY, Wren was elected Senator. One of her first actions was a request for an active, galactic military presence in her system, to react against the constant [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] raids on transport ships. Wren firmly believed that the military would discourage the pirates. However, the Republic (which lacked an army at that point) sent a fleet and two divisions of the [[Thaereian military]], under infamous [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Jir Tramsig]], which proved ineffective for a short-term solution. Senator Wren, the native [[Tarasin]]s and some idealists were the only ones impressed by the military presence in the system.<ref name="LFC" />At some point following an assassination attempt in [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], she fell in love with [[Jarid DeBell]],<ref name="AOE">''[[An Official Engagement]]''</ref> and the two went on to have a daughter [[28 BBY/Legends|three years later]], whom they named [[Night Forael Wren]].In about [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], during the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Senator Wren sent her Senior assistant [[Sa'arli]] to [[Almas]], to award the local heroes with the [[Hero of Cularin|Order of Cularin]].<ref name="AMA">''[[A Mon Alone]]''</ref>Later in the Clone Wars, she was arrested on spurious charges of collaboration with the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], which led to Cularin's occupation by [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Tas Kee
description: Tas Kee started working as one of the gangster [[Hat Lo/Legends|Hat Lo]]'s bodyguards. Lo used a group of bodyguards to protect him against the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]. Kee was strong in hiding weapons, even for sensors installed in Coruscant's lower regions. She was often employed in the vicinity of the [[Outlander Club/Legends|Outlander Club]] and other [[Gambling/Legends|gambling]] clubs to defend Lo's interests.Unlike most female [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]], Kee did not shave her head [[Hair/Legends|hair]].

name: Hesh Verbon
description: As a younger woman and criminal, Hesh Verbon was apprehended by the [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Force]] and convicted. She was given the choice of a [[Prison/Legends|prison]] sentence or off-[[Planet/Legends|world]] indentured labor. She chose to enlist in the militia of [[Dorvalla/Legends|Dorvalla]], an [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] world. It was on that world that she developed an affectation for [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core]] fashions and a taste for luxury.When she finished her tour, she returned to her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] and volunteered for the [[Naboo Royal Space Fighter Corps/Legends|Naboo Royal Space Fighter Corps]], eventually becoming a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]. Sometime later, she became a protege of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], who arranged for her to be appointed [[Portmaster]].Verbon's administrative style was simple: total loyalty in exchange for "bonuses." She profited from the judicious use of a blind eye to [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]], while carefully avoiding any activities that might draw the attention of the [[Bureau of Ships and Services/Legends|Bureau of Ships and Services]]. She took a small cut, as well as samples of Core luxury products, as a price for her noninterference.While she allowed the avoidance of import fees and licenses for restricted goods, making [[Kwilaan Starport]] a minor [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowport]], she refused to condone [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] and other activities explicitly illegal under [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] law. She was unconcerned about the laws of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], however.Law enforcement failed to link Verbon to any criminal activities, and she maintained a working relationship with [[Republic Intelligence/Legends|Republic Intelligence]] by gathering information on Rim worlds and criminal activities.Hesh Verbon was bilingual, and spoke [[Sullustese/Legends|Sullustese]] in addition to [[Galactic Basic Standard]].<ref name="Secrets of Naboo" />

name: Arissa Fawn
description: Fawn was part of the [[Sub-Adult Group/Legends|Sub-Adult Group]] and was an idealistic young member that supported the [[Palpatine/Legends|Emperor's]] [[New Order/Legends|New Order]]. She later joined the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] by enlisting with the [[Imperial Army/Legends|Imperial Army]]. She was unable to rise up very far or fast within the ranks and ended up with an assignment to a dead end post, as [[Imperial Liaison]] to [[Starlyte Station]].She was given only a single [[Battalion/Legends|battalion]] of [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] and a poor battalion at that. The [[105th Stormtrooper Platoon|Emperor's Irregulars]] were an incredibly loyal and disciplined yet completely incompetent group that was assigned as far away from the front lines as was possible.Over time Fawn became disillusioned upon realizing that the Empire was not all that the Sub-Adult Group and conditioned her to believe it was and ended up losing faith in the Emperor and his Empire. She began taking hefty bribes from station owner [[Talandro Starlyte]] to ignore his sizable [[Black market/Legends|black market]] on the station.

name: Isabet Reau
description: Isabet Reau was eager to train the clones in the ways of the [[Death Watch/Legends|Death Watch's]] ideal Mandalorian, from their battle tactics to their cultural beliefs, so that the greatness of the Mandalorian people could once again sweep across the galaxy with all its power and glory. Along with her boyfriend, [[Dred Priest]], she hosted a fight club in secret on Kamino. When clones started dying, Jango Fett put an end to it by badly injuring Priest.[[File:FullArmorIsabetReau.jpg|left|thumb|Isabet Reau in full armor.]]In [[18 BBY/Legends|18 BBY]], a year after the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] was transformed into the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Priest and Reau were stationed on Mandalore where they were seen aiding the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] garrison there. They were soon noticed by [[Kal Skirata]] and his [[Clan Skirata|clan]]. After noticing the Death Watch insignia on their armor, an enraged [[Mij Gilamar]] attacked Priest above the river outside [[Keldabe/Legends|Keldabe]] and severed his femoral artery. Knowing Reau would be looking for Priest, Gilamar tossed his body into the river, hoping to delay her wrath.

name: Ros Lai
description: {{Quote|It has been many years since Ros Lai was brought to Coruscant. She may not even be alive.|[[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] to [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]], discussing the alliance with the Nightsisters and the Separatists|Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Jedi Alliance}}Ros Lai was the daughter of [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Zalem]] and an unknown [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. When she was very young, her mother killed her father, beginning a resentment which would last the rest of her life. Quietly plotting her revenge, Ros used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Metamorphosis|transform her appearance]]. Because of her disguise as a hideously deformed old hag, the other women of the clan called her "'''the [[Rancor/Legends|Rancor]]'''". All the Nightsisters on Dathomir believed that Ros Lai was crippled and therefore abused her. Even her mother would mock her. Later, however, she came out when she was watched by [[Vonya]], [[Yani]] and [[Leela]], as she transformed back into her true form. Ros Lai killed Leela when she asked for forgiveness, but she declared that none of them could ever forgive. Yani fled and left Vonya alone with Ros Lai. Ros wasn't strong enough to face Vonya who almost killed her in a fight. It was in this capacity that she discovered [[Quinlan Vos/Legends|Quinlan Vos]], who was posing as a slave to investigate a plot by Lai's mother to reawaken the ancient power of the [[Infinity Gate]].[[File:Rosa lai metamorphosis.png|left|thumb|220x220px|Ros Lai metamorphsises to her true form.]]Ros Lai ran towards the [[Yag Shushin's star cruiser|star cruiser]] that belonged to [[Yag Shushin]]. She persuaded him to fly the ship to Quinlan to rescue him. Although the plan was successfully put into action, Quinlan was poisoned during his imprisonment with arterial worms. Therefore, Ros Lai infused him with some of her witch's blood due to having [[Force healing/Legends|healing properties]]. Then they flew in the direction of the Infinity Gate, where Zalem was already using the super weapon to destroy the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] capital world of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. During their journey, they were discovered and shot by Vonya. Yag intercepted the shot that was supposed to kill Ros Lai and Quinlan Vos and died. Subsequently, their ship fired on Vonya and destroyed it, so they could go to Zalem to the stellar control station of the gate.In order to gain Zalem's confidence, Lai stabbed Quinlan Vos with her fire blade, but in reality, it was just an illusion so that Quinlan was not killed. Instead, Lai was successful in killing Zalem, thus fulfilling her quest in avenging her father's death. With Zalem out of the picture, Ros Lai assumed the mantle as leader of the Nightsisters and ordered them to kill Quinlan for good. However, this triggered a mechanism and killed the Nightsisters, only leaving Ros Lai to be stunned. Quinlan reversed the weapon, destroying the Infinity Gate itself. He fled with Ros Lai in Yag's starship to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] where she was taken into custody. His reason to have Ros Lai alive was that he felt that there was good in her.In [[28 BBY/Legends|28 BBY]] she self-published her memoirs, though people didn't believe her story at the time.<ref>[[Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force (real-life book)|''Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force'']]</ref>[[File:RosLai-TCWJA.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Ros Lai during the Clone Wars]]During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Ros Lai left the Jedi important information that helped the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in their fight against the Nightsister's alliance with [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], leader of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. She also intended to ensure that [[Ziro Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Ziro]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] made good on a debt he owed her. Thanks to Ros Lai's assistance, she received a reward from the Republic.

name: Gyla Petro
description: Gyla Petro was a born into the aristocratic family [[House Petro]]. At some point she became a member of [[New Worlds]] as a biologist. Some of these biologists along with some imperial soldiers traveled to the planet [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] in order to obtain some roots of the [[Orga/Legends|Orga]] plant. When the soldiers started to destroy plants to make a pathway through the forest, the plants got upset and started killing all the imperials. Gyla was the only survivor due to the intervention of [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]]. After being saved, Gyla was taken to a [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] city on the back of a [[Sureggi/Legends|Sureggi]] and participated in the celebration of [[Life Day/Legends|Life Day]]. However, shortly afterwards, Solo ended up captured by Imperials and forced to descend to the lowest and foulest level of Kashyyyk, which led to suspicion of Petro being an Imperial spy.Sometime later, Gyla was traveling aboard the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] with Han Solo and Chewbacca. Han received as SOS message from [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and found the droids [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] and [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] in the wreckage of Luke's ship. Upset at the detour, Gyla noted that she didn't ask to join a mission of mercy. C-3PO explained Luke's mission to Han and Gyla became more upset. She thought Han was just a smuggler and not a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. Gyla wanted to leave when Han piloted the ship away from imperial forces, though she had no choice but to come along for the ride. As the ''Millennium Falcon'' escaped Imperial forces by going through [[Constancia/Legends|Constancia's]] ring, Gyla continued to beg to be let go. Han escaped from the Imperials and piloted the ship into a hidden base inside the ring. Once landed, Han got off to investigate while Gyla stayed aboard. Luke, [[Gamine]] and [[Sharlee]] were at this base and once it was deemed safe, Gyla came off the ship. Everyone devised a strategy to get Gamine to the surface of the planet. Han would go with Sharlee and hijack a [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE Fighter]] while Gyla, Luke, Gamine, Chewbacca, R2-D2 and C-3PO would fly towards the surface in the ''Millennium Falcon''. The distraction worked and once the Falcon made it to the surface, they were all celebrated as heroes.Petro's suspected status of espionage for the Empire was later included in [[Gyla Petro (file)|her files]] on the planet [[Fusai/Legends|Fusai]], specifically on the Rebel-owned [[BRT supercomputer]] [[Mistress Mnemos]], although Mnemos was unaware of the exact details behind why she was suspected as being a spy.

name: Fandomar Nadon
description: When her husband was exiled from [[Ithor/Legends|Ithor]] for aiding the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in order to protect the life of his [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], Fandomar and her son were heartbroken.Fandomar had had her own brush with the Empire as well, once telling them of the existence of a horrible creature accidentally designed by Ithorian scientists called [[Spore]] which existed on [[Mining Station Alpha]]. Because of her mistake, she made frequent trips to the mining station to monitor any Imperial activity. Later on, she aided [[Tash Arranda]], [[Zak Arranda]], and their uncle [[Mammon Hoole]] in evading [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec]], a [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] who was trying to acquire Spore for himself. She destroyed Mining Station Alpha in an attempt to destroy Spore, but was too late. Fortunately, Spore was destroyed later on during a freak mishap onboard Jerec's [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]].Fandomar and her son were later reunited with Momaw Nadon, who was pardoned for his crimes once he presented his case to his people again years later.

name: Por'Ten (Lady)
description: The Families of Cestus Cybernetics aspired to overthrow the Regent [[G'Mai Duris]] from the government. The [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and the [[Vippit]] [[Doolb Snoil]] managed to make the Regent give up trusting the Families. Then, [[Caiza Quill]], [[Por'Ten (Lord)|Lord]] and Lady Por'Ten, and [[Debbikin the Young]] caught the magcar to move through the subterranean tunnels.During the journey, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] pretended to be one of [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku's]] envoys, Nemonus, and he held back the four leaders to make a negotiation. Then, they were liberated by Kenobi, with a perfect performance. These fact made [[Ord Cestus/Legends|Ord Cestus]] change its position in favor of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. But Quill received a hologram where was revealed the Jedi sham. So, Regent Duris had to depend on the Cestus Cybernetics again.Then, the [[Five Families]], allied with [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]], used the [[JK-13 security droid]]s against the [[Desert Wind]]. When the conflict was acquiring importance the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] decided to send the cruiser [[Nexu (starship)|''Nexu'']]. When the ship achieved the orbit of Ord Cestus, the Five Families, including Lord and Lady Por'Ten, took refuge in a secret bunker, that finally was discovered by [[Advanced Recon Commando/Legends|ARC trooper]] [[Alpha-98|Jangotat]]. Jangotat went on search of the leaders of Cestus Cybernetics but got trapped next to the bunker. He eventually sent a code ordering the Nexu to bomb over him. Everybody died.

name: Mistress Mnemos
description: A strict and proper machine, Mistress Mnemos originally served the [[Obroa-skai/Legends|Obroa-skai]] branch library on Fusai, where she was housed in an underground chamber and plugged into a wall of storage drives over a kilometer long. When funding was cut for the library, Mnemos' data vault was maintained by local volunteers. Sometime prior to the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] took custody of the supercomputer when they established Fusai as a safeworld.[[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] visited Mistress Mnemos to create a record of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and his friends' early activities for the Alliance. However, his interactions with her were lukewarm at best, as they at least once argued over disseminating of information before 3PO could get the chance at explaining the details of any of Luke's early activities.

name: Kendle
description: Kendle was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Iskalon/Legends|Iskalon]], and she eventually fell in love with and married [[Mone]], a fellow [[Iskalonian]] and the son of [[Primor (Inleshat)|Primor]], the leader of the School. Kendle cared deeply for her husband and father-in-law and resolved to keep them safe no matter the cost. When the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] came to the [[Iskalon system]] and began to subjugate the neighboring worlds of [[Gamandar]] and [[Telfrey]], Kendle feared for the fate of her world and decided to aide the Empire in order to protect her family from the same type of destruction. When the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] heroes [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], and [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] arrived on Iskalon to open negotiations with the School, Kendle subsequently opened communication with [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Griggor Tower]], the head of the Imperial operation on Gamandar.Kendle told Tower of the presence of the Rebels, and then manipulated the Rebels by dropping hints that what they sought was located on Gamandar. Calrissian and Chewbacca decided to follow up on the tip, but they also brought Kendle's husband, Mone with them. Kendle must have believed that the Imperials would not harm her beloved when the Rebels were in their grasp, and so she made no attempt to stop Mone from going with them. After watching the Rebels depart, Kendle contacted Tower again and told him about the two remaining Rebels that had decided to explore the underwater city of [[Pavillion]]. Unfortunately for Kendle, during this communication, another Iskalonian, [[Kiro]] overheard her selling the Rebels out to the Empire. Kiro was a firm supporter of rebellion against the Empire after they had slaughtered a delegation of Iskalonians who had tried to sue for peace.Kiro grappled with Kendle, trying to kill the traitor, but the attempt ended up smashing both of their [[Water tank|water helmets]] which allowed them to enter Pavillion. Kiro was forced to abandon his attempt so that he could rush back to the ocean, but Kendle was badly hurt and unable to move. As Kendle began to suffocate without her water helmet, Luke, Leia, and Primor happened to spot Kendle's plight. Luke and Leia rushed to enter the city and aid Kendle while Primor watched anxiously. The two rebels reached the struggling Iskalonian, but it seemed that they would be too late to save her. However, unknown to the group, Kendle's leaked information to Admiral Tower had caused him to make a rash decision. An interplanetary missile had been fired at the city of Pavillion in hopes of killing Leia and Luke.The massive explosion of the missile caused an enormous [[Iskalon effect|tidal wave]] which smashed against Pavillion and destroyed the underwater city. Luckily for Kendle, Pavillion's destruction let in an inrush of water, and she was saved from suffocating. After coming back to her senses, Kendle saw the two Rebels struggling to escape the wreckage of the city to reach the surface. Angry that the Imperials had gone to such measures to see them both destroyed, Kendle tried to lead them astray in an attempt to drown them. However, Kiro once again appeared and tried to execute the traitor. Kendle was forced to flee the scene, allowing the two Rebels to eventually reach the surface.Back on the surface, Kendle witnessed the carnage that had come about because of her actions. Many Iskalonians had died in the attack, including her beloved father-in-law. Kendle tried to pay her respects by grieving over Primor's lifeless body, but Kiro once again appeared in close pursuit. Kendle ran from the scene, but soon returned with members of the School in another attempt to destroy the two Rebels. Kendle declared herself as the new leader of the School following Primor's death and accused the Rebels of bringing this terrible catastrophe to her world. The School began to attack the Rebels and Kiro, but the three were able to fight off the assault. However, the School continued to push and it seemed that Kendle would soon be victorious. Unfortunately for Kendle's plans, just as her group moved in for the kill, a wild [[Chiaki]] arose from the depths. As everyone scattered from the area, the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] arrived and slew the creature. As the monstrous serpent gave its last breath, it began to topple onto the battleground, and its dead body smashed directly on top of Kendle, killing her instantly.The ''Millennium Falcon'' landed immediately afterward, and Mone left the vessel, distraught over his wife's death and betrayal. Mone declared himself the new leader of the School, and bitter over the loss of his family, he declared that the School would no longer deal with air breathers due to the pain that they had caused. The Rebels were forced to leave Iskalon, and the School departed the wreckage of Pavillion.

name: Dara Gion
description: She was a [[Commander/Legends|commander]] in the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and served in the [[Brak sector]] as the Personnel Officer of the [[Oracle Base]]. She also served as the liaison between the Special Ops Mission Groups and Brak sector Command.Prior to joining the Rebellion, she attended the [[Bacrana Educational Institute]] where she met [[Equa Felens]]. The two fell in love and later participated in an anti-[[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] protest on [[Bacrana/Legends|Bacrana]] which was ruined by the thousands of [[Death/Legends|deaths]] that were initiated by [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Lesan Ramier]]. The couple eventually joined the Rebel Alliance with help of [[Trep Reskan]] and the [[Bacrana System Defense Force]] but later drifted apart.

name: Alana Walden
description: {{Quote|A colleague of mine in Tyrena has some open case files that I thought you might be able to help her with. Head over to Tyrena and speak with Major Alana Walden.|[[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Mack Jasper|Jasper]]|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Major Walden was stationed in [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]], where she investigated the surge in the number of missing persons on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]. Via [[Corellia News Service]], she announced [[Bandor Mokk]] and [[Faye Patrick]] as dangerous suspects, and encouraged citizens to contact CorSec if they had any information.<ref>{{SonyCite|url=en_US/players/content.vm?id=66901&resource=features|text=Chapter 1: The Corellian Captives|archivedate=20111124014132}}</ref> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> a spacer finally discovered that all those missing persons were captured and [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] by [[Corellian slavers]]. The spacer managed to infiltrate the [[Corellian Slaver Bunker]] and sliced the bunker's main computer. The spacer broadcasted the slavers' records on the CorSec emergency request channels,<ref name="SWG:IE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Incriminating Evidence" on Corellia</ref> leading dozens of CorSec agents to quickly move to the slaver bunker and free all the slaves.<ref name="SWG:HbtKS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Head back to Kyran Silene" on Corellia</ref>[[File:TacticalResponseTeam-TotC.jpg|thumb|left|Alana Walden in action.]]Later the same year, she received news that the kidnapping case had been solved. [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Mack Jasper|Jasper]] sent her the independent agent who had helped solve the case to help Walden with her backlog of recent cases.<ref name="SWG:SwMW">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Speak with Major Walden" on Corellia</ref> The first case she gave the adventurer was the alleged theft of a [[Corellian Medal of Honor]] from retired CorSec officer [[Wilfred Quelsh]]. The agent found out that Quelsh had taken money from [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] to ignore their activities and framed a fellow officer, [[Kal Braggan]], for the crime. When Braggan confronted Quelsh, Quelsh killed him. Walden was very grateful that the case had been solved and promised that Quelsh would have to pay for his crime.<ref name="SWG:CCFSH">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "CorSec Case Files: Stolen Honor" on Corellia</ref> The next case she gave the independent agent was an attack on the starship captain [[Osto Grissom]] by members of the [[Meatlumps|Meatlump gang]]. The adventurer tracked the Meatlumps to [[Meatlump Cave|a cave]] near Tyrena and found out that Grissom had been attacked because he transported electronics.<ref name="SWG:CCFAaB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "CorSec Case Files: Assault and Battery" on Corellia</ref>Then Walden received a message from her colleague, Lieutenant [[Lon Cope]], that needed the independent agent's help in a murder investigation. So Walden sent the adventurer to Cope in [[Kor Vella/Legends|Kor Vella]].<ref name="SWG:CCFTLM">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "CorSec Case Files: The Lucky Mayor" on Corellia</ref>[[File:Alana Walden - SWGTCG.jpg|thumb|Major Alana Walden.]]When sighting of a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] with a warrant on his arrest on Corellia was reported on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], Major Walden and several CorSec operatives were dispatched to the remote [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] to bring the criminal to justice. They tracked him down and confronted him in a dead-end alley in the [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]]. What the CorSec agents did not know, however, was that the smuggler was in fact an agent of [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]], operating undercover. The ISB agent could not afford to break his cover, so he engaged in a firefight with Walden and her men. Having set his blaster for stun, he put up the fierce defense and knocked all operatives, including Walden, unconscious. After taking Walden's datapad with information about her next contact, the ISB had left her bleeding in the alley.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=Agents of Deception|scenario=Dark Side scenario campaign}}</ref>

name: Sabol
description: During her time in Bestine, Sabol was tasked with the duty of assassinating a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] [[General/Legends|General]] aboard a [[CR90 corvette/Legends|Corellian Corvette]]. Seeing no reason why this Rebel should survive, she tasked a group of Imperials to board the Corvette and eliminate the Rebel General for her. However, before the Imperials could be granted passage to the Corvette, she had to first acquire Rebel documents with important information. After searching various locations, including the [[Dantooine base/Legends|abandoned Rebel base]] on [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]], a crashed [[Star Tours/Legends|Star Tours]] liner on [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], and the [[Afarah]] cave on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], the Imperials finally found the documents Sabol sought. The Imperials were then given a ticket to hand to an Imperial [[TIE pilot]] at the [[Emperor's Retreat]].From here, the Imperials were flown on a [[Lambda-class T-4a shuttle/Legends|''Lambda''-class shuttle]] to the Corvette. After boarding the Corvette, the Imperial fought their way through the corridors, and assassinated the Rebel General. After evacuating the Corvette through the ship's [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pods]], the Imperial returned to Sabol, and were commended for their service. The [[Imperial Medal of Honor]] was awarded to the Imperials for their exemplary work.

name: Raspy-voiced woman
description: When the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Alema Rar]] arrived in [[40 ABY]] seeking guidance for [[Darth Caedus]], the raspy-voiced woman was one of the three prominent participants in her questioning, along with the [[Togorian/Legends|Togorian]] named [[Morto]] and the man Alema nicknamed [[White Eyes]].She played a more understated role in the encounter than either of the others: Morto was expected to fight and best Alema, while White Eyes took the lead in the interrogation, whereas the raspy woman spoke infrequently, and remained no more than one of the several cloaked figures. However, her interjections were always sharp and commanding, restraining Morto's fighting instincts, and adding an extra edge to White Eyes's questions.

name: Valara Saar
description: Saar was a descendant of a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who had crashed on the incommunicado [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Yashuvhu]] sometime during the time of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Old Republic]]. Saar's talents with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] were evident when she was a small child; she also inherited the [[Yashuvhi sacred scroll|sacred scroll]], a weathered document on which her long-dead relative had written a part of the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]].<ref name="MVS" /> In addition, Saar adopted a [[duuvhal]] as a pet, early in her life, naming it "[[Zeev]]."<ref name="MZ">{{WizardsCite|url=starwars/article.asp?x=sw20010517d_duuvhal&c=rpg|text=Meet Zeev, a Pet Duuvhal|int=Meet Zeev, a Pet Duuvhal|archivedate=20090602012859}}</ref>In the years leading up to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]],<ref name="SWRPG">{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/article/sw20020708crpg|text=Star Wars Roleplaying Game Overview|int=Star Wars Roleplaying Game|archivedate=20020911195614}}</ref> the Republic exploratory [[Starship/Legends|vessel]] ''[[Pathfinder III]]'' landed on Yashuvhu in the course of its first-contact mission.<ref name="MVS" /> They discovered that the Human population wanted to talk with the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] among the vessel's crew and learn about them. The first-contact specialists were able to teach the [[Yashuvhi]] some information about the Jedi, which was accepted with religious fervor. It was Valara Saar, however, who was the most interested of the Yashuvhi. Her ability to quickly learn and understand language enabled her to communicate with the explorers, who spoke [[Galactic Basic Standard]] instead of the [[Yashuvhi language|native language]].<ref name="MVS" />[[File:Saar.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Valara Saar alongside [[Arani Korden]] and [[Vor'en Kurn]]]]Saar convinced the ''Pathfinder III'' crew to take her to other worlds, with the hope of following the path of the Jedi. Nevertheless, the Jedi were too restrictive for her free-spirited soul. While she was taught some important skills and worked diligently, she eventually left the Jedi without any hope of joining the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Order]]. Disillusioned, Saar decided instead to look for her destiny elsewhere in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], becoming a wanderer. She exchanged her Force skills for passage to other planets. She helped those in need wherever she found them, and continued to learn more and more of the Force without the guidance of a master as she bartered her skills for passage from [[Planet/Legends|planet]] to planet.<ref name="MVS" /> Saar also made a number of important friends during her travels. During one such mission on [[Aargau/Legends|Aargau]], however, her pet and companion [[duuvhal]], Zeev, was killed.<ref name="MZ" />After years of wandering, Saar eventually returned to her native Yashuvhu, even though her friends had promised to take her anywhere she would need or want to go. She isolated herself, living in a hut ensconced somewhere in the [[Yashaka Mountains]]. The Yashuvhi began referring to her as the "Prophetess" and protector of the people. She became a teacher of the Force, never teaching more than what she felt her students were ready to learn, and learning much at the same time.<ref name="MVS" /> During this period, Saar developed her own philosophical tenets, which she taught to her students. Her teachings were recognizably derived from the Jedi Code and extended philosophies.<ref name="FH2">''[[The New Jedi Order: Force Heretic II: Refugee]]''</ref> She also took a new duuvhal pup to replace Zeev, calling it [[Jedi (duuvhal)|"Jedi."]]<ref name="MVS" /> This pup was her only companion, as she never had a mate.<ref name="FH2" />Although Saar lived in isolation, she was known as a defender of her people, particularly against the [[Chiss Ascendancy/Legends|Chiss Ascendancy]].<ref name="MVS" /> In [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]], [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] discovered a series of documents in the [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] [[Expeditionary Library]] on [[Csilla/Legends|Csilla]] about Valara Saar and her home planet while searching for information regarding [[Zonama Sekot/Legends|Zonama Sekot]]. Contained in the [[Cheunh/Legends|Cheunh]] text was a mention of a Chiss landing party that had "only recently" arrived on Yashuvhu. Saar&mdash;who had become advanced in years, according to the records&mdash;initially did not meet with the Chiss, even though some of her followers had. When the team approached her dwelling, however, she forcibly expelled them from the planet. The Chiss records strongly indicated that she wielded what appeared to be a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] during the encounter.<ref name="FH2" />

name: Maddie Macatten
description: Maddie Macatten was an elderly [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] on [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]], the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of the [[Kathol sector]]. When her [[Maddie Macatten's slave master|master]] was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the [[Aing-Tii/Legends|Aing-Tii]]&mdash;a [[Species/Legends|race]] noted for their hatred of slavers&mdash;Macatten found herself released from her servitude. Taking the ownership papers to one of her master's [[Starship/Legends|ships]], the [[Gymsnor-2 light freighter]] ''[[Scupper Bantoo]]'', she flew the vessel out of its [[Hangar/Legends|docking bay]]. Macatten headed for the [[Kathol Outback]] and set herself up as a [[Merchant/Legends|merchant]], using the ''Scupper Bantoo'' to travel between the worlds of the Outback where she traded replacement machinery parts and luxury items to the various colonies she encountered. Macatten made several modifications to the ''Scupper Bantoo'', but it was an old vessel and could only take so much upgrading.<ref name="ko" />While engaged in her trading endeavors, Macatten sought out any and all information on the Aing-Tii. She hoped to find their hidden [[Aing-Tii homeworld|homeworld]] so that she could personally thank them from freeing her from slavery. While a lot of the data she gained was rumor and speculation, Macatten was considered a good source of information on the Aing-Tii by the residents of the Outback. She also knew that the planet of [[Shatuun]] was home to a pair of mated [[Duinuogwuin|Star Dragons]], a fact that was known to only a few individuals. During her travels, Macatten encountered the crew of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'',<ref name="ko" /> which was on a mission to track down the rogue [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Moff/Legends|Moff]], [[Kentor Sarne]].<ref name="tsb">{{DarkStryder|The Saga Begins|The DarkStryder Campaign}}</ref>

name: Lynnori
description: A typical [[tramp freighter]] [[Captain/Legends|captain]] Lynnori lived her days out among the stars traveling from stop to stop moving cargo and passengers around [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. She was not opposed to the occasional [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] job as well provided the pay was all right. She became romantically entangled with [[Space station/Legends|station]] owner [[Talandro Starlyte]] who repeatedly requested that she to quit her wandering ways but she repeatedly refused. Concerned for her safety, Talandro ended up purchasing a new [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] and having his associate [[Scizzic]] make some custom modifications so that Lynnori would at least be safer in her travels. He bought her a [[YT-1930 transport/Legends|YT-1930 transport]] that she dubbed the ''[[Starbound Misfit]]''.<ref name="WHSV" />

name: Liska Dan'kre
description: Born to a wealthy Bothan family, Dan'kre attended school with [[Asyr Sei'lar]], whom she befriended. Sei'lar, something of a rebel, transferred out of that school to the [[Bothan Martial Academy|Bothan Military Academy]], but the two remained friends.After the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] conquered [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Dan'kre moved to the world. Shortly after its conquest, she hosted a party on a luxurious [[Skyhook/Legends|skyhook]], to which Sei'lar was invited. She was delighted to reunite with Sei'lar, who was making a name for herself in [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]]. She was also impressed by Sei'lar's boyfriend, [[Gavin Darklighter]]. The fact that Darklighter was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] excited mild disapproval among many of the guests, but Dan'kre easily accepted him. Dan'kre eagerly caught up with her old friend at the party, though a slight commotion was made when [[Karka Kre'fey]] challenged Darklighter to a duel after Darklighter honestly answered Kre'fey when asked if the Bothan's grandfather, [[Laryn Kre'fey]], had fouled up at the [[First Battle of Borleias]]. Darklighter declined.

name: Liiria Beldonna
description: Liiria Beldonna was a [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]]<ref name="SotePG" /> woman born sometime around [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]].<ref name="Age" /> As an adult, she was considered attractive and relatively frail-looking, but in actuality she had well-toned muscles and could handle herself well in a fight. She was a confident woman and an inspiring leader, and trained herself in the use of most weapons. Beldonna had long, straight black hair that she usually kept braided when she was working.<ref name="SotePG" />By roughly [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], she had built up an organization of hired mercenaries referred to as "Beldonna's League"<ref name="SWG" /> or "Beldonna's Legion."<ref name="SotePG" /> Elements of the group were stationed on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] and [[Talus/Legends|Talus]].<ref name="SWG" /> Beldonna led the Legion under a strict set of rules and did not tolerate misconduct. Any disputes were often dealt with through hand-to-hand combat. Around [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], the group was hired by [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Consul-General]] [[Gilad Halsek]] of [[Kothlis/Legends|Kothlis]], who was infatuated with Beldonna, to help bolster the [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] security. Beldonna enjoyed her position on Kothlis and frequently took her team hunting in the forest or the planet's [[Water/Legends|ice]] caps. She also enjoyed parading about the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tal'cara]] and going to its most popular nightspots.<ref name="SotePG" />

name: Elsinoré den Tasia
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] from the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core World]] of [[Grizmallt/Legends|Grizmallt]], Elsinoré Den Tasia was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] in the [[Old Sith Wars]] period of the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] history. In [[3951 BBY]], she ascended to the [[Throne/Legends|throne]] of her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] and started a decades-long colonization effort to spread her people to new [[Planet/Legends|planets]]. One of her expeditions led to the colonization of fourteen [[Star system/Legends|systems]], including [[Renatasia system|Renatasia]].<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> Circa [[3900 BBY]], she personally sponsored one of her world's last colonization missions. The fleet for this expedition was led by the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Scout/Legends|scout]] [[Kwilaan/Legends|Kwilaan]] and consisted of three [[Starship/Legends|ships]]: ''[[Beneficent Tasia]]'', ''[[Constant]]'', and ''[[Mother Vima]]''. A long [[Time/Legends|time]] later, Kwilaan and his colonists found a planet named [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]], where they came into conflict with the world's native [[Gungan/Legends|Gungans]].<ref name="NEGC" />

name: Saato
description: During the rise of the [[C-B3 cortosis battle droid]]s, Saato was sent to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] to capture [[Raala Ponchar]], a [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] spy whom had learned more about this new menace to the galaxy. She did this with relative ease, and imprisoned the spy in the dungeons from [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]].With the aid of [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]], she tried to halt the advance of [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] who had been sent to the planet to search for Ponchar. Sing first tried to stop him near [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]], but Saato had to step in to save the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] in front of Jabba the Hutt's palace. She managed to subdue Skywalker by [[Telekinesis/Legends#Force Choke|Force choking]] him. After he had passed out, she left him in the same cell as Ponchar.[[File:Saato vs Anakin.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Saato and Anakin Skywalker duel on Tatooine.]]Unfortunately for Saato, she had severely underestimated the power of the [[Chosen One/Legends|Chosen One]]. Anakin easily managed to escape Jabba's dungeons and had managed to retrieve the information that Ponchar carried. As he escaped by stealing a [[Skiff/Legends|skiff]] from the Hutt, Saato commandeered one of her own, and shot Skywalker down on his way back to his [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Jedi Starfighter]] near the [[Great Pit of Carkoon/Legends|Great Pit of Carkoon]].Deciding to take care of Skywalker once and for all, she engaged in a fierce battle with the Jedi. In the duel that followed, only the Chosen One walked away victoriously, resulting in Saato's death.

name: Denia
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Denia was discovered by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] within the [[Jedi academy|academy]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. Eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] after much study and contemplation of the Force as a [[Jedi Diplomat|diplomat]], Denia became one of the few Jedi to achieve the rank of [[Jedi Sage|Sage Master]]. Taking the Human male [[Valin Draco]] as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], she taught him all she knew of the Force. Denia, middle-aged for a Jedi, reported to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] when the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Already at an advanced age for a Human, Denia dutifully took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and led [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]].<ref name="AWH" />Surviving until the last year of the war, Denia was contacted by Master [[Ashka Boda]] who was searching for Jedi to assist in setting up a secret network that would lead Jedi who survived the Separatist attack on [[Almas]] back to Coruscant.<ref name="EOJ">{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/article/dodcampaign|text=Echoes of the Jedi|int=Echoes of the Jedi|archivedate=20100118064618}}</ref> Denia was assigned to [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]] where she would serve under [[Jedi High Council/Legends|High Council member]] [[Plo Koon/Legends|Plo Koon]] during the [[Battle of Cato Neimoidia (Order 66)|battle]] for the planet. During the fighting, Denia was rendered unconscious on the battlefield after a [[Variable Geometry Self-Propelled Battle Droid, Mark I/Legends|Vulture droid]] crashed in close proximity to her. Her form was discovered by a [[General/Legends|general]] in the Separatist Army, who drugged her and had her body carried to a nearby [[Darga the Hutt's palace|palace]]. Not long after, the Clone Wars ended suddenly, with the slaughter of the [[Separatist Council/Legends|Separatist Council]] and the reorganization of the Republic into the victorious [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. On the losing end of the war, the Separatists fled the palace and Cato Neimoidia, leaving Denia in an artificial coma within its walls.<ref name="AWH" />Soon after the end of the war, the palace that housed Denia was occupied by [[Darga Jiramma Mionne|Darga]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] and his [[Darga's organization|minions]]. Locating Denia, the Hutt decided to keep the middle-aged woman as a bargaining tool should need ever arise and had her moved to the subbasements where [[Igren Demos]] kept her comatose. During the months surrounding Darga's reign in the palace, a band of anti-Imperial freedom fighters infiltrated Darga's palace on assignment for [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]] of the [[Imperial Senate/Legends|Imperial Senate]]. Reaching out to the rebels through the Force, Denia was able to direct them to her location despite being in a coma. Deactivating the machines keeping her in a coma, the rebels woke Denia, who thanked them for their assistance. Filling her in on the fall of the Republic and the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|dissolution]] of the Jedi Order, the group headed upstairs to find that Darga had fled upon news of Denia's escape. Overhearing Demos' conversation with an Imperial [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitorius]] member via the [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]], the group escaped the palace and took Denia to the [[Resurgence (EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate)|''Resurgence'']] to receive medical treatment.<ref name="AWH" />Aboard the ship, Denia was healed and approached by Senator Organa with the proposition of joining his secret movement known as the [[Alderaanian Resistance]]. Accepting the offer, Denia was determined to bring down Darga the Hutt and his devious plot known as the [[Sarlacc Project]]. Going into deep meditation, Denia found the Force muddled and her ability to [[Force vision/Legends|foresee]] diminished. Deciding that a [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]] would boost her abilities, Denia and her allies planned a trek that would take them to the ruins of the [[Almas Academy]] in the [[Cularin system]]. While Denia believed that many of the artifacts were probably stolen, the Force was drawing her to the world and using the coordinates obtained by Senator Organa, Denia dispatched her comrades to the ruins.<ref name="EOJ" />Upon their return with the [[Qornah Holocron]], Denia was disturbed by reports that Valin Draco was alive, now an Inquisitor of the Empire, and responsible for attacking the group. Going into a deep trance, she set her comrades on another mission regarding the Sarlacc Project.<ref>{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/article/dodcampaign|text=Echoes of the Jedi|int=Echoes of the Jedi|archivedate=20100118064618}}</ref> While in meditation, the ''Resurgence'' was [[Battle of the Resurgence|attacked and destroyed]]. Denia, surviving the attack, was taken prisoner by her former Padawan, Valin Draco. Imprisoned on the [[Deep Core/Legends|Deep Core]] world [[Prakith/Legends|Prakith]], Denia was held deep within the [[Citadel Inquisitorius]] by Draco, who quickly drew tired of torturing the old Jedi Master. Refusing to give away any information regarding Organa's organization, Denia was nearly comatose when her rebel allies broke into the Citadel and located her chamber. Strapped to the torture rack, Denia appeared helpless to do anything as Draco attempted to destroy her before taking out her allies. However, she managed to deflect Draco's bursts of [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]] back into him and unleash a powerful Force attack that allowed her companions to escape. Her great strength expended in this encounter cost her life, yet she willingly sacrificed it to save Organa's men and their cause.<ref name="GOA">''[[The Gem of Alderaan]]''</ref>

name: Uunu
description: {{Quote|It's difficult to imagine all of those worlds, each as big or bigger than this one. I grew up on one of the poorest worldships. There was little room. We lived very close together. Here, there is nothing but space.|Uunu|The New Jedi Order: Edge of Victory I: Conquest}}[[File:AnakinSolo_EA.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Anakin Solo, who Uunu knew as Bail Lars]]A [[Yuuzhan Vong]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Uunu grew up on [[Unidentified Koros-Strohna|one]] of the poorer and more cramped [[Koros-Strohna]], a type of worldship that the Yuuzhan Vong employed, as the [[Species/Legends|species]] traveled from [[Yuuzhan Vong galaxy|their galaxy]] to [[The galaxy/Legends|another one]] in order to wage [[Yuuzhan Vong War|war]] upon its inhabitants. At some point in her life, Uunu became one of the [[Shamed Ones]], meaning that her body would not accept alterations that would further her status, and because of this, she was given hard labor as a job. In [[26 ABY]], a young Uunu was one of the many Shamed Ones and Yuuzhan Vong's [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] who were taken to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] after it was [[Invasion of Yavin 4|captured]] from the [[New Jedi Order]], the [[Jedi/Legends|members]] of whom her people knew as the ''Jeedai''; and the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].<ref name="Victory" />While on Yavin 4, Uunu was assigned to work in the fields growing [[lambent]]s, which were [[Crystal/Legends|crystals]] that the Yuuzhan Vong used for various tasks. It was also there that Uunu realized that the [[Warrior caste|Yuuzhan Vong warrior]] [[Vasi]] had an attraction to her. However, although he could technically command her because of her lower rank, Uunu knew that Vasi wanted her to come to him, because she would make Vasi [[Death/Legends|kill]] her if the [[Soldier/Legends|warrior]] commanded Uunu to do anything. One [[Standard day/Legends|day]], while Uunu was working the fields, Vasi assigned her a [[Human/Legends|Human]] slave by the name of [[Anakin Solo|Bail Lars]], whom the Shamed One [[Vua Rapuung]] had brought to the fields, after Vasi saw the slave faint in pain. Although he was supposed to help her fill her quota of lambents, Vasi gave Uunu the slave to hinder rather than help her.<ref name="Victory" />Uunu taught Lars, who was actually the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] Anakin Solo in disguise, how to tend to the lambents. While she attuned the blossoms of the lambents by stroking them, Solo harvested the ones that already had been attuned. By the end of the first day, Solo had fallen quite behind Uunu. At some point in [[Time/Legends|time]], Uunu voiced her fears that Solo was a Jedi to the warriors, as he did not act as a slave should, and because of this, they watched the pair closely. The next day, while it was still dark, Uunu picked up Solo from the [[Yavin 4 slave dormitory|slave houses]] and showed him how the lambents could be used to produce luminescence, and explained how they worked. During the six [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] of work that followed thereafter, in which they did not stop for rest, Uunu warmed up to the slave during their conversations about the Yuuzhan Vong and the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy]], although her people considered Solo an infidel. At lunch, she broached the question about Solo being a Jedi, and after the slave lied that he was not, the pair discussed the New Jedi Order. It was during this chat that Uunu became more inclined towards the ideals of the Jedi.<ref name="Victory" />Solo left Uunu silently that night, and after fixing his [[Anakin Solo's lightsaber|lightsaber]] with a lambent crystal using the knowledge Uunu had taught him, went on to rescue his Human Jedi friend [[Tahiri Veila]], who had been captured by the Yuuzhan Vong&ndash;affiliated [[Peace Brigade]] group on Yavin 4 and was being held by the Yuuzhan Vong [[Shaper caste|shapers]]. Shortly thereafter, Solo, along with forces under the command of the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Talon Karrde]], as well as several Jedi Knights, destroyed the Yuuzhan Vong military forces and landed to free the slaves on Yavin 4. However, after the Jedi&ndash;smuggler strike, [[Warmaster]] [[Tsavong Lah]] had many of the Shamed Ones on the moon killed, because the [[Jeedai heresy|''Jeedai'' heresy]] was created there. The ''Jeedai'' heresy was a belief among Shamed Ones that the Jedi would rescue them because the Jedi Solo had redeemed Rapuung, who then died defending that same Jedi.<ref name="Victory" />

name: Frayne
description: In the wake of the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] Frayne was dispatched to [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] along with [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jyl Somtay]], on a [[Second Mission to Geonosis|mission]] to locate and contain any weapons technology that might remain on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. The Republic's goal was to ensure that such technology was never put to use against the Republic. However, Doctor Frayne had her own agenda, since she was actually a freelance operative looking to steal the technology for herself.She rendered Somtay unconscious with a simple ruse, and then captured the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] who had accompanied them. She set out to escape on her own, but was unprepared for the many traps laid by the [[Geonosian/Legends|Geonosians]]. Somtay and [[Naj Pandoor]] found Frayne &mdash; or at least, her severed head &mdash; in a hidden passageway beneath the surface of the planet. They later discovered that a captive female [[Nexu/Legends|nexu]] had killed her, although they managed to escape from the creature, when it was attacked by [[roga]]s.

name: Du Mahn
description: {{Quote|Can you tell me what's going on with the war, Master Jeisel? We were due back at the temple several days ago&mdash;but after the attack on Coruscant, Master Yoda asked us to remain here until he was certain it was safe&hellip;|Mahn explains the clan's situation to Jeisel|Dark Times 6: Parallels, Part 1}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Du Mahn was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and eventually attained the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] amongst the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Wielding a [[Color/Legends|green]]-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], she was appointed as a [[Jedi instructor]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and oversaw the rearing of the Order's youngest [[Jedi Initiate|Initiates]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Mahn was assigned to protect the [[Soaring Hawkbat Clan]]. By [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Mahn and her charges, along with a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] named [[Chase Piru]], had been stationed on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Bogden 3]], where they lived in the [[Bogden Jedi chapter house|training facility]] built there.<ref name="DT6" />[[File:DuMahnDeath-DT6.jpg|thumb|left|165px|Du Mahn dies during Order 66]]Prior to the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]], Mahn was informed that she and the clan would soon be transported back to the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Temple on the [[Galaxy/Legends|galactic]] capital. The conflict there delayed their return, however, and [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] asked that they remain on Bogden 3 until he was certain it was safe for them to return. Several [[Standard day/Legends|days]] after the clan was due at the temple, Mahn and her charges graciously welcomed Masters [[K'Kruhk]] and [[Sian Jeisel]] when they arrived on Bogden 3 to make repairs to their [[Starship/Legends|ship]]. Entertaining the [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi Generals]] and their [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]], Mahn and the Hawkbats threw a large feast in welcome of their comrades. As the feast concluded, however, the [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] [[Trooper/Legends|troopers]] who had accompanied the [[General/Legends|generals]] to the world received [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] from the [[Office of the Supreme Chancellor]].<ref name="DT6" />The order instructed the clones to open fire on all Jedi, stating that they had betrayed the Republic. As the clones dutifully [[Massacre on Bogden 3|took aim]] at the younglings, the Jedi Masters sprang into action. Mahn urged her students to flee, deflecting all incoming fire as K'kruhk, Jeisel, and Piru defended the younglings. Mahn [[Telekinesis/Legends|Force-pushed]] several troopers away as she attempted to cover the Initiates but was shot in the back by a trooper she had knocked down, [[Death/Legends|dying]] amidst the Hawkbats. Despite her death and that of Jeisel, K'Kruhk and Piru successfully evacuated nine students, flying them offworld.<ref name="DT6" />

name: Lesle Andreya
description: Lesle Andreya served the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] as an [[Agent/Legends|agent]] for [[Alliance Intelligence]] under the leadership of [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. She was trained by the Rebellion's best espionage experts and knew all the "by the book" tricks. She was known to have been one of the top agents of her time, with information provided by Andreya allowing Alliance forces to avoid [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] ambushes. However, around [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], Andreya's loyalties shifted and she began actively working against the Alliance's successor state, the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].Andreya stole sensitive [[Computer/Legends|computer]] files containing defense plans and disappeared in the region surrounding [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]]. The [[New Republic Intelligence Service]] believed that she obtained [[Transport/Legends|transport]] from there to an Imperial-controlled [[Sector/Legends|sector]] where they believed she was planning to sell the information to the highest bidder. The New Republic was curious as to her motives, cautioning agents looking for her that they would have to improvise given her knowledge of standard tactics. It was believed that she had family members in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]]; New Republic Intelligence indicated that beginning there was a good starting point for agents tracking her.

name: Fiula Blay
description: {{Quote|This wasn't necessary. They had a chance to come peacefully.''"<br />"''Did you really think they would?''"<br />"''You never know. Maybe sending their most dangerous and aggressive [[Warrior caste|warriors]] in to be killed by us will eventually reduce the [[gene]] pool, breed a more temperate Yuuzhan Vong.|Gilad Pellaeon and Jacen Solo, lamenting the infiltrators' deaths|The New Jedi Order: Force Heretic I: Remnant}}Fiula Blay was a [[Yuuzhan Vong]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who served as an undercover [[Spy/Legends|operative]] leading a resistance cell within the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]] with at least four other members during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], in which the [[Yuuzhan Vong galaxy|extra-galactic]] Yuuzhan Vong invaded [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. She utilized an [[Cloaker|ooglith masquer]], an organic [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaking device]] that made her appear as a plain-looking [[Human/Legends|Human]] woman with [[Color/Legends|gray]] [[Hair/Legends|hair]] tied up in a bun.<ref name="fh1" />Following the [[Battle of Bastion]]<ref name="fh1" /> in [[28 ABY/Legends|28 ABY]],<ref name="Date" /> modified [[YVH-M|mouse droids]] [[Programmer/Legends|programmed]] to detect disguised Yuuzhan Vong were sent [[Starship/Legends|ship]]-to-ship throughout the [[Imperial Remnant|Imperial]] [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] to uncover infiltrators. The [[MSE-series|droids]] discovered Blay and two other cloaked Yuuzhan Vong and, by analyzing their communications, uncovered more than a dozen sympathizers. In order to avoid alerting them to their discovery, these [[Saboteur/Legends|infiltrators]] and sympathizers were summoned to a staffing meeting arranged by [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]], who intended to bring their spying to an end. Quietly, the Imperial forces transferred the group to the ''[[Right to Rule]]'', an [[Imperial I-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial I''-class Star Destroyer]] stationed above the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Borosk/Legends|Borosk]]. First, the sympathizers were brought in individually to prevent them from recognizing their fellow conspirators. Blay arrived five [[Standard minute/Legends|minutes]] before the final sympathizer, showing no signs of suspicion, followed shortly after by the remaining two Yuuzhan Vong.<ref name="fh1" />As they awaited the arrival of [[Torvin Xyn]], the final infiltrator, Blay and her cloaked comrade remained undeterred by the meeting, though several of the sympathizers began to suspect the meeting's true nature. Upon Xyn's arrival, he realized Solo&mdash;who was present at the meeting&mdash;was a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and immediately removed his masquer and launched an attack, with the other Yuuzhan Vong following suit shortly after. Without their [[vonduun crab]] [[Vonduun Skerr Kyrric|armor]] and wielding only their [[amphistaff]]s, all three infiltrators were quickly [[Death/Legends|killed]], with Blay being cut down by [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] and [[Security droid/Legends|security droids]]. Afterward, Imperial [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]], who witnessed the meeting, lamented the unnecessary deaths of the infiltrators to a skeptical Solo.<ref name="fh1" />

name: Tanda Marelle
description: Tanda Marelle was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] born on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]]<ref name="CRO" /> before the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="HNN52">{{Hnn|52|news/13418_4.html|Greyshade Proposes Gambling as Revenue|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728123342/http://www.holonetnews.com/52/news/13418_4.html}}</ref> A member of a prominent [[Merchant/Legends|trading]] family, she became bored with her life and sought adventure and excitement. Even Marelle became a [[Journalist/Legends|journalist]], working for the ''[[Galactic Resorts]]'' [[holomagazine]]. Traveling the resort worlds of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Marelle used her position to aid in her other career choice; a jewel thief. On assignment, she would use her cover to case targets and individuals.<ref name="CRO" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], just prior to the Clone Wars, Marelle was a senior correspondent with ''Galactic Resorts'', and contributed several opinions regarding the state of the galactic economy and tourism spending while the galaxy appeared to be gearing up for war.<ref name="HNN52" />As a jewel thief, Marelle established an alias for herself, the Tombat. Early in her career as a thief, an incident caused people to believe that the Tombat was male. Marelle did nothing to correct the mistake, and actively encouraged the misconception as it amused her. She found the ruse useful for evading capture and suspicion as authorities were always searching for a man. The Tombat became an infamous figure in the galaxy, known as a superb jewel thief who was invisible and could bypass any defense or security system and take whatever he wanted without a trace. Stories told of his prowess with woman, and his ability to captivate females.<ref name="CRO" /> The Tombat always left behind a single [[quella stone]] in place of the items stolen as a signature.<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|252|"Tombat"}}</ref> By the early part of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], arrest warrants were issued in 30 [[Star system/Legends|star systems]] for the Tombat.<ref name="CRO" /> At some point, Tombat was rumored to have broken into [[Noval Garaint]]'s base in the [[Kheedar system]] and discovered that the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] had rebuilt and reprogrammed the chassis of a half dozen [[F1 exploration droid]]s to serve as bodyguard units.<ref name="CFT-D">''[[Cynabar's Fantastic Technology: Droids]]''</ref>Although Marelle was not concerned with any cause apart from her own, that changed in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] with the [[Destruction of Alderaan|destruction]] of her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Shaken by the destruction&mdash;mainly due to amount of gems she had stashed away on the planet&mdash;Marelle sought out the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] to offer her services. She tracked Alliance [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] down to a safehouse on [[Albecus]], and brought with her a packet of love letters that Cracken had written at the age of sixteen and lost long ago. Her display convinced Cracken that she would be a remarkable asset, although he lamented the fact that her commitment to the Alliance was sporadic at best.<ref name="CRO" />Despite being Alderaanian, Marelle did not get along with her fellow exiles due to her reputation as a thief. During a briefing, Alliance agent [[Winter Celchu|Targeter]] angrily confronted Marelle for wearing a pendant that Targeter insisted belonged to the Alderaanian Royal Family. The pendant was later seen in the possession of [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]].<ref name="CRO" />In [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], Marelle reported on the preparations for the [[2,367th annual Priole Danna Festival]] on [[Lamuir IV]].<ref name="GNN3">{{Journal|3|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> During the festival, Marelle stole a pair of antique [[Slugthrower/Legends|slugthrowers]] created by [[Andel Tanner]] during the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] [[Manderon Period]] which belonged to the [[Jatz/Legends|Jatz]] singer [[Fitz Roi]]. Lifting them from the safe in the singer's [[Hotel/Legends|hotel]] room, Marelle left leaving behind a blue quella stone in the weapon's leather holding case.<ref name="GNN4">{{Journal|4|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> Several [[Standard month/Legends|months]] later, Marelle was on [[Spira/Legends|Spira]], reporting on the annual [[Spira Regatta Open]].<ref name="GNN5">{{Journal|5|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> She pulled the [[Spira Heist]] during the Regatta.<ref name="GNN6">{{Journal|6|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref>In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Marelle was on [[Tinnel IV/Legends|Tinnel IV]] when she raided the personal estate of [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Tiaan Jerjerrod/Legends|Tiaan Jerjerrod]], ruler of the [[Quanta sector]]. She stole several works of art from the Moff's vaults, but left data disks in place.<ref name="GNN6" /> A few [[Standard month/Legends|months]] later, Marelle was on [[Elshandruu Pica]], where she stole gems and setting valued at over six million [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] from [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Landric (Lady)|Landric]] of [[Danteel]] who was staying at [[Margath's on Elshandruu Pica]]. Lady Landric, wife of Moff [[Landric]] announced that a full scale investigation into the theft was to be launched. Two [[Standard day/Legends|days]] later, Marelle returned the gems and settings to the safe where she had looted them from, baffling investigators. Despite this, the [[Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations/Legends|Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations]] assigned [[Special Enforcement Officer/Legends|Special Enforcement Officer]] [[Zanza Gata]] to the Tombat case.<ref name="GNN8">{{Journal|8|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref>In [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]], Maralle reported on the release of Fitz Roi's newest [[sound slug]], ''[[Tymin' Downband]]'' while on [[Arcopola]]. A month later, she looted the art collection of [[Whiphid/Legends|Whiphid]] business tycoon [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Galrowk]] on [[Gambolla]].<ref name="GNN11">{{Journal|11|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> A few months later, Marelle was on [[Brentaal IV/Legends|Brentaal IV]] reporting on the lavish production of [[The Kallea Cycle]]. During a banquet hosted by [[House Brentioch]], Marelle arranged for quella stones to be baked into the bowls of [[shim-bay crispa]] served to the guests, which included [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Jamson Caglio]], [[Imperial Advisor]] [[Alec Pradeux]], and [[Inspector/Legends|Inspector]] [[Zanza Gata]] of the IOCI.<ref name="GNN13">{{Journal|13|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref>

name: Zadawi
description: {{Quote|The purebloods bred the Offshoots to be better miners&mdash;but once the gems ran out, there wasn't much else for us to do. Now, this is one of the places where Offshoots are allowed to live."<br /><nowiki></nowiki>"''Allowed?'' What does that mean? And why wouldn't they let me go to the medcenter in Adascopolis?''"<br />"''Wow. You really did grow up offworld, didn't you? Follow me. It's time you learned something about your people.|Zadawi and Jarael|Knights of the Old Republic 16: Nights of Anger, Part 1}}[[File:ZadawiJarael.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Zadawi became acquainted with Jarael on a shuttlebus in the Adascopolis spaceport.]]An [[Arkanian Offshoot]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Zadawi lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Arkania/Legends|Arkania]] during the era of the [[Mandalorian Wars]]. Zadawi's people, the Offshoots, were a sub-[[Species/Legends|species]] [[Bioengineering/Legends|bioengineered]] by [[Blood/Legends|pureblood]] [[Arkanian/Legends|Arkanians]] to be more efficient [[Mining/Legends|miners]] and faced significant discrimination on Arkania. By [[3963 BBY]], Zadawi lived in a hut on the site of a deserted mining camp on the outskirts of the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Adascopolis]],<ref name="kotor16" /> ancient [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of Arkania,<ref name="cswe">{{CSWECite|I|11|Adascopolis}}</ref> with her [[Zadawi's father|father]] and [[Zadawi's grandmother|grandmother]]. Zadawi, like other Offshoots, was not allowed to enter the city, but over the [[Standard year/Legends|years]], she and her friends made a habit of [[Clothing/Legends|dressing]] up in disguise and sneaking into Adascopolis. The mistreatment of the Offshoots at the hands of the pureblood Arkanians, along with what she saw as a defeated attitude amongst the rest of her people, sometimes drove Zadawi to want to run away. One [[Standard day/Legends|day]] in 3963 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|BBY]], she decided to go to the Adascopolis [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] to perhaps look for a way offplanet. There, she collided with another Offshoot, [[Jarael]], who had come from offworld and was unfamiliar with her surroundings. Jarael's [[Goggles/Legends|goggles]] were knocked off in the collision, leading spaceport security to notice that she was an Offshoot and force her onto the [[shuttlebus]] leading back to Zadawi's settlement outside the city.<ref name="kotor16" />Zadawi became acquainted with Jarael on the shuttlebus&mdash;the offworlder had come to Arkania to obtain a medical diagnosis for her friend, an elderly Offshoot called [[Gorman Vandrayk|Camper]]. Shocked by Jarael's lack of knowledge about the plight of her people, Zadawi brought her back to her home for dinner. Wanting to show Jarael what life was really like for Offshoots on Arkania, Zadawi began arguing with her [[Parent/Legends|grandmother]] when the other woman defended the [[House of Adasca]], the rich and powerful pureblood Arkanian family that ran the biomechanical corporation known as [[The Adasca BioMechanical Corporation of Arkania|Adascorp]], and Arkania's segregationist policies. Frustrated, Zadawi decided to help Jarael sneak into Adascopolis in order to "put one over on the purebloods."
