Zadawi aided Jarael in acquiring a passable pureblood Arkanian disguise, which succeeded in getting her safe passage into Adascopolis.<ref name="kotor16" />

name: Reina Gale
description: As a child, Reina and her parents traveled from an unknown planet to the [[Minavar system]] on a colony expedition. Her family died, along with most of the colony population, a few years after because of a vicious virus, and she was placed in the custody of her uncle, a gambler, who eventually lost his entire fortune to a [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]]. The gambler took everything in the uncle's possession &mdash; including Reina, who the Hutt sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]].Reina remained in the possession of an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] slave master for nearly twelve years till one day she befriended the [[Gigoran/Legends|Gigoran]] Rollos, a new slave sold to the imperial by something as unusual as a [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] slaver. Being the only one in the slave camp who understood the Gigorian language, she befriended Rollos. Displeased with their friendship, the Imperial slavemaster ordered Rollos punished and Reina killed, but Rollos, sensing that his new friend was in danger, ended up single-handedly destroying the entire slave camp, and together Reina and Rollos made it off-planet in a stolen spaceship.[[File:Begas_Tok.jpg|thumb|left|150px|[[Begas Tok]] on [[Entralla/Legends|Entralla]].]]Reina and Rollos were inseparable and the best of friends. Reina was clever and extremely mischievous, having a knack for making deals that she and her friend benefited from greatly.

name: Sami (Human)
description: A [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Sami was stationed on [[Hrakert Station]] in [[3956 BBY]]. Sami was working on manufacuting synthetic kolto when Hrakert Station was overrun by [[Selkath/Legends|Selkath]] driven insane by the [[Progenitor]]. Along with [[Kono Nolan]], she was one of the few survivors found by [[Revan/Legends|Revan]].As Nolan's moral counterpart, she advocated destroying the [[kolto]] [[Mining/Legends|mining]] machinery to tame the [[Progenitor]], which Revan decided to follow, to the great dismay of the amoral Nolan who advocated using an experimental poison to kill the great [[Firaxan shark|firaxa]].

name: Dresk Kist
description: Dresk Kist was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Slith]] who, by [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], had served as [[Shaman/Legends|shaman]] of her clan for six seasons. In her role as shaman, she communicated with other Slith clans, communed with the departed spirits of her ancestors and he desert [[Deity/Legends|gods]] worshipped by the Slith.<ref name="GG2-1" /> Kist also served as the [[First Mate/Legends|First Mate]] of the clan's alpha male, with authority over the other females and youngsters of the clan. She was also a huntress within the clan, hunting game while others were sleeping. It was unusual for shamans to also be huntresses, but Kist excelled in both fields.<ref name="GG2-2">[[Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin (Second Edition)|''Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin'', Second Edition]]</ref>Kist also made contact with an [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] negotiating team,<ref name="GG2-1" /> who were on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] searching for a base of operations.<ref name="GG2-2" />

name: Blendri
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Blendri lived on [[Ossus/Legends|Ossus]], the home of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during its early years. Friends with fellow [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Danzigorro Potts]], Blendri japed with him when she ascended to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] while he remained an apprentice. Taking on a Padawan of her own named [[Cuthallox]], Blendri and her student became enamored by the enigmatic teachings of [[Xendor]], who preached that the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] was too restrictive in their teachings and wished to limit understanding of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. When Xendor parted with the Order to found an [[Legionnaire academy|academy]] on [[Lettow/Legends|Lettow]], Blendri and Cuthallox departed with [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Jook-jook H'broozin]] to learn from Xendor. Calling themselves the [[Legions of Lettow]], the Jedi Renunciates grew strong in the Force as they studied the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|Bogan]] through many different Force-traditions.<ref name="JvS" />When the High Council declared war on the Legions of Lettow, Blendri and Cuthallox took up [[Force-imbued blade|swords]] to protect their rights to study the Force. Meeting the Order in a full-blown conflict called the [[First Great Schism|Great Schism]] by the Order, the Master-[[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] pair jumped from world to world to fight off the Jedi. At the [[Battle of Corulag|battle]] of [[Corulag/Legends|Corulag]] Jedi Padawan Danzigorro Potts killed Master H'broozin and attempted to kill Blendri and Cuthallox but the pair managed to escape. Padawan Potts would continue to hunt the pair throughout the war until he finally met them on the field of [[Battle of Columus|battle]] at [[Columus/Legends|Columus]]. Engaging her old friend, Blendri was outmatched and killed on the field of battle.<ref name="JvS" />

name: Camie Loneozner
description: [[File:Camie2-MOSW.png|thumb|left|180px|Camie]]Camie was involved with Laze Loneozner, whom she eventually married when Luke Skywalker and Biggs Darklighter left Tatooine. Laze Loneozner built an illegal [[Podracer/Legends|podracer]] to sell in order to raise enough funds for a lavish wedding party for her.<ref name="InsideSWT">''[[Inside the Worlds of Star Wars Trilogy]]''</ref>After the deaths of [[Owen Lars/Legends|Owen]] and [[Beru Whitesun Lars/Legends|Beru Lars]], some of the locals believed that their nephew had murdered them. Camie Loneozner, having spent much time with him, didn't believe those rumors at all. After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], she told this to historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]] in an interview.<ref name="GG1">''[[Galaxy Guide 1: A New Hope]]''</ref>When [[Tagge Company|TaggeCo]] decided to test their [[Omega Frost/Legends|Omega Frost]] technology on Tatooine, they bought up a number of the local [[Moisture farm/Legends|moisture farms]]. The Loneozners took over the operations of the old [[Darklighter family|Darklighter]] farm and were hired by the Tagges to take care of all of the local properties.<ref name="MC31">''[[Star Wars 31: Return to Tatooine]]''</ref>The two Loneozners ran into Luke Skywalker when he returned to Tatooine on a mission for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]]. They feared that Skywalker might cause trouble and ruin their relationship with the [[House of Tagge|Tagges]], and so they reported him to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperials]]. However, Fixer Loneozner had second thoughts about turning in his old friend and decided to warn Skywalker about the Imperials, allowing the young Rebel to escape capture.<ref name="MC31" />

name: Reidi Artom
description: Reidi Artom belonged to a long-lived [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]] [[Species/Legends|species]]. Her people generally stayed on their own [[Planet/Legends|planet]], something a young Artom did not understand. She loved excitement, adventure, and the thrill of exploration, so she escaped her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] early in her life. For years, she wandered aimlessly, working whatever jobs would allow her to get from one place to another.<ref name="LFC" />Artom gained her exploring vessel, the ''[[Trailblazer]]'', in a unique manner. After she stowed away on the [[scout vessel]], the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] came under attack. After the [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] was killed, nearly instantly, the ship was left floating in space. She made repairs and, after using the [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] to get to a [[Spaceport/Legends|starport]], [[Transponder code|registered]] the ship in her own name. In an effort to explore new [[Star system/Legends|systems]] and undiscovered space while getting paid for it, Reidi became a [[Scout/Legends|scout]] for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Although many scouts explored the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]] or the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]], Reidi surveyed the [[Exploration Region]] to find planets that had been overlooked. She was credited with the renewed interest that followed her explorations in at least eight systems.<ref name="LFC" />During her first scouting in the Cularin system in 232 BBY, Artom visited the system from the outer to the inner planets. As such, she found the [[Almas Sith fortress]] in [[Almas]]; the [[Crystal Snare]] in the [[Cularin system asteroid belt]], and the mysterious lava-like creature of [[Rennokk]] in her second visit to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]]. She also befriended the [[Tarasin]] native species of [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] to the extent that she was taken to the [[Sacred Ch'hala Tree Grove]] &mdash; a honor that was bestowed to few outworlders since.<ref name="LFC" />Artom spent nearly twenty-five years charting the Cularin system. She and her crew were credited with founding the settlement of [[Gadrin]] on Cularin. She was last seen heading off to explore the Unknown Regions in [[207 BBY]]. Due to the length of her people's lives, as of [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]] it was believed that she could still possibly be alive and exploring.<ref name="LFC" />Reidi Artom's impact was clear within the Cularin system, as time was measured on both [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and [[Almas]] by the A.A. ("[[After Artom]]") time system. This time system measured its starting point at the discovery of the system.<ref name="LFC" />A 60 meter-tall statue of Artom stood in front of a museum dedicated to her in Gadrin; the statue was visible from [[House Hirskaala]],<ref name="TRW">''[[The Resistance Within]]''</ref> and was used for a medal ceremony organized by [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Barnab Chistor]] of Gadrin in 31 BBY.<ref name="ARv">''[[A Revelation]]''</ref>[[Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren|Lavina Wren]], the Republic [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] for Cularin was rumored to be a distant descendant of Artom.<ref>{{WizardsCite|url=rpga/livingforce/article.asp?x=lf/swlf20011206a_oblivion&c=swlfc|text=Cularin's Lady Senator, Lavina Wren|int=Cularin's Lady Senator, Lavina Wren|archivedate=20030803003114}}</ref>

name: Renna (Rodian)
description: In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Renna's Service had several shipments hijacked by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]], as did many of the local trading concerns. Renna started to have issues with her security forces due to this. When one particularly brazen theft occurred in her own compound by thieves wearing her (stolen) security uniforms, one of the pirates, [[Lars]], was captured by a group of strangers. Renna was so impressed with them over her own security forces, she offered them jobs. Those strangers ended up bringing down the pirates and recovering some of the stolen goods.<ref name="ACP">''[[A Cularin Presence]]''</ref>Renna capitalized on the troubles the [[Metatheran Cartel]] experienced a few months later, as the group she had hired proved instrumental in revealing [[Velin Wir]]'s rogue activities.<ref name="ARv">''[[A Revelation]]''</ref>However, Renna was involved in a news investigation soon afterward due to the rapid growth of her business. Renna's Transport Service had grown by 500 percent in a period in which no other local transport concern grew more than 100 percent, which some found suspicious. Although rumors related Renna with [[Nirama]]'s [[Organization|criminal organization]], there were no proofs linking the Service to any smuggling activity.<ref name="RTS">''[[Renna's Transport Service (article)]]''</ref>Renna had a relationship with a part-time [[Transport/Legends|transport]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] who worked for her, [[Teeloo]]. Teeloo was killed by [[Riboga]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] men because he worked for [[Nirama]], leaving Renna heart-broken. Even after his death, Renna continued the transport service.

name: Cira Larutur
description: In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Cira and Joz were on their way to see their first grandchild when they were taken hostage by [[Nuriin-Ar]] for the immediate withdrawal of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] forces on [[Haruun Kal/Legends|Haruun Kal]]. During the hostage, Cira tried to calm her husband down when [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi]] negotiator [[Kaim]] was [[Death/Legends|killed]]. As [[Kal Skirata]], along with [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] and a Special Security Officer of the [[Special Operations Brigade]] arrived and freed the hostages.{{Char-stub}}

name: Armanda Durkin
description: Armanda Durkin was driven to succeed by tragedy. She owned a business with her husband that was destroyed in a fire, injuring her husband. When [[Maltsett Insurance Company]], which held the policy on their business, refused to pay based on a legal technicality, she could not afford the care needed to save her husband's life. This left her with a grudge against Maltsett, and a desire for money and power.Her early years with the [[Notsub Shipping Company]] were not good ones. Due to high risk investments that failed to pay off her company was struggling. Then she noticed that three different shipments through her company were all insured by Maltsett. Realizing that she could save her company and take revenge, she created a disguise for herself, the ''Duchess'', purchased a new freighter, the ''[[Vengeful Sandstorm]]'', and hired a crew of [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] to help her steal her own shipment. The profit from the sale of stolen goods, coupled with the insurance payout from Maltsett, signaled the start of a new double life.Notsub became the largest company on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], and Armanda Durkin became wealthy and powerful. She continued her pirate raids on Maltsett-insured ships, using a series of shell companies to hide her illegal dealings. She maintained a "no-killing" policy for her pirates, but an incident circa [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]] that resulted in twelve deaths made her worry about the future, and consider getting out of the piracy business.<ref name="GG7" />

name: Esa Parna
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]], Esa Parna was employed as an agent of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic's]] [[New Republic Intelligence Service|Intelligence Service]] during the government's early years. As part of her job, Parna served undercover as Liaison officer [[Lon Kinnik]]'s chief aide during his assignment on [[Muunilinst/Legends|Muunilinst]]. Serving the liaison delegation to the [[InterGalactic Banking Clan/Legends|InterGalactic Banking Clan]], she reported back to her superiors at NRI all information of interest. Stationed at [[High Port Space Center]], Parna served her position dutifully during her tenure at the agency.<ref name="GATORW" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Unidentified Czerka Corporation protocol officer
description: When [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] visited Anchorhead during his search for the [[Rakata]]n [[Star Map]] that was located on that planet, the protocol officer offered him a considerable reward if he would eliminate the [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Sand People]] presence from the vicinity of Anchorhead, as they were becoming a serious nuisance to Czerka's mining operations. However, with the translating capabilities of [[HK-47]], Revan managed to negotiate a peaceful resolution to the conflict. Because the protocol officer only demanded the Sand People chieftain's [[Gaderffii|gaffi stick]] to be brought to her as a proof of success, which the latter willingly offered to Revan as a sign of his gratitude, she may have never learned the true fate of the [[Unidentified Tusken Raider tribe (Jedi Civil War)|Sand People tribe]].After some hesitation, she also provided [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] with information regarding [[Mission Vao]]'s brother [[Griff Vao|Griff]]. According to what she had heard from his crew chief, he was not a very good employee. Seemingly he was often faking injuries and complaining to avoid having to do work. Furthermore, he entered false time sheets and slept through his work shifts. Czerka Corporation even suspected him of stealing supplies, although according to the Czerka Corporation Protocol Officer they could never prove such a thing. Some time before Revan arrived to Tatooine, Griff had apparently been abducted by Sand People. The Czerka Corporation Protocol Officer explained to Revan that they had not made any rescue efforts. As she said, all miners working for the Czerka Corporation have to sign a waiver absolving Czerka Corporation of liability in circumstances like the present ones. Literally, she explains, it was just not cost effective to keep searching for him. Since they never found the body of Griff, the Czerka Corporation Protocol Officer assumed he had been taken prisoner.

name: Irtanna
description: Around [[1001 BBY]], she was evacuated from [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]], along with thousands of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], just before [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Skere Kaan]] detonated the [[thought bomb]] in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan]]. She was selected personally by [[Jedi Lord|Lord]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]] to lead the rescue effort on Ruusan, searching for surviving members of the Army of Light.When Farfalla refused to allow [[Johun Othone]], Lord [[Hoth (Jedi Lord)|Hoth's]] former [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], to join the rescue teams, Othone used a [[Mind trick/Legends|mind trick]] on Irtanna to persuade her to let him join the team, against Farfalla's orders. During the rescue missions, Irtanna piloted the ''[[Star-Wake]]'', an [[Envoy-class shuttle|''Envoy''-class shuttle]], which was also crewed by [[Bordon]] and his sons, [[Tallo (Star-Wake)|Tallo]] and [[Wend]]. Finally, they came across a little girl who seemed to be a war orphan. The girl was named Rain, but was actually revealed to be [[Darth Zannah/Legends|Darth Zannah]] who served as the student of the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Bane/Legends|Darth Bane]]. As the ''Star-Wake'' again opened in the direction of the Republica fleet, Irtanna suddenly heard shots from the hold of the shuttle. As she was about to see what was going on, Irtanna and her crew were [[Death/Legends|murdered]] by Zannah who came inside the cockpit. After taking the ''Star-Wake'', she set course to [[Onderon/Legends|Onderon]].

name: Nia
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Nia was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] Nia remained at the [[Jedi academy|academy]] and continued to study under the [[Jedi instructor|instructors]] that remained.<ref name="CW9" />After three years of fighting, the war came to a sudden end when the Republic's [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] betrayed the Order by issuing [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], an order which commanded the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] to execute their Jedi leaders. Able to escape into the shadows when the clones attacked, Nia and several of her peers, including Initiate [[Bon (Jedi)|Bon]], were rescued by a junk salvager named [[Hurd Coyle]]. Aboard his [[Hurd Coyle's ship|salvage ship]], the Initiates remained together as Coyle promised to take them to a safe location.<ref name="CW9" />During their travel, Coyle's ship picked up a damaged [[V-19 Torrent starfighter/Legends|''V-19 Torrent'']] [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]], hoping to salvage some of the ships parts. Coyle was surprised to learn that it held the still alive [[Clone trooper pilot/Legends|clone pilot]] [[HOB-147]]. When the [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] woke up and started to destroy Coyle's reprogrammed [[B1 battle droid/Legends|B1 battle droids]] Coyle shot the clone with an [[electro-dart]] and locked the [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] in a room. When the clone escaped he found the Jedi Initiates hiding in the junk ship's hold. Thinking that the clone was going to kill him and his peers, Nia and the other Initiates knocked the man unconscious. When he awoke, the clone was convinced by Initiate Nia to spare her peers' lives. Later, when Coyle's ship was boarded by [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] of the newly christened [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], who were looking for escaped Jedi, clone HOB-147 lied and said there weren't any Jedi aboard the ship, allowing Nia and her fellow Jedi to escape.<ref name="CW9" />

name: Rajine
description: {{Dialogue|Rajine|What is that?|Windu|A message from the past.|Samuro's holocron|Hello, Rajine. If you are listening to this, it means a Jedi has found you. I alone was not strong enough to destroy the evil that you are. I could only contain you. I was only able to trap you here, but not only you&mdash;''all'' of the victims whose life-forces you have drained. ''All'' of their life-forces are trapped here with you. As a Jedi I cannot seek revenge, but all of these lives are quite vengeful. They are ''lost''. Alone I could only trap you, but with another Jedi to speak the words of banishment your doom is sealed&hellip;the words to awaken the lost&hellip;|attr=Rajine, Mace Windu, and Samuro's holocron|src=No Way Out}}[[File:Samuro.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Jedi Knight Samuro sacrificed himself to imprison Rajine and the victims of her life-draining abilities on a remote planet.]][[Count/Legends|Countess]] Rajine was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who served the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the final [[Time/Legends|centuries]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="CSWE" /> As an [[energy vampire]], she was capable of draining the life-forces of individuals. The [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Samuro]] eventually recognized the threat that Rajine posed and [[Prison/Legends|imprisoned]] the Countess and her victims in a [[Unidentified city (Rajine's planet)|city]] on a [[Rajine's planet|remote world]]. Samuro [[Death/Legends|died]] using [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to raise a [[Force barrier/Legends|barrier]] that ensured that Rajine and her victims would never be able to leave the [[City/Legends|city]]. The deceased Jedi Knight's [[Force power/Legends|Force powers]] kept Rajine and her victims confined in the city over a span of several centuries. During her confinement, Rajine kept Samuro's [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and [[Samuro's Jedi holocron|Jedi holocron]], and additionally claimed Samuro's [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]], [[Z-18]], for herself.<ref name="NWO" /> Over the years, Rajine continued to drain the life-forces out of [[Sentience/Legends|sentients]], turning them into mindless [[Zombie/Legends|zombies]] to do her bidding.<ref name="CSWE" />Hundreds of years later, during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] arrived at Rajine's [[Planet/Legends|planet]] in search of the [[Alpha-2 Squad]] of [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]], whose last transmission had come from the city in which Rajine was imprisoned. When Windu was escorted into the city by Z-18, Rajine began to drain his life-force. While investigating the city, Windu found that the [[Cloning/Legends|clones]] were [[Death/Legends|dead]] and was subsequently captured by Rajine's zombies. After imprisoning him, the Countess confronted Windu and informed him that she had waited centuries for another Jedi to arrive on her world. The Jedi Master found that he was unable to [[Telekinesis/Legends|summon]] his lightsaber to him with the Force, and Rajine informed him that it was because she had been draining his life-force from the instant that he crossed the city's front gate. She revealed that she intended to gather all of Windu's life-force and use it to escape the planet. Rajine tried to convince Windu to succumb to her life-draining abilities, but the Jedi recognized that she was an energy vampire and insulted her. Rajine remarked that she would live longer than he would and took Windu's lightsaber, leaving and ordering Z-18 to follow her.<ref name="NWO" />[[File:Zombies.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Rajine's zombies capture Jedi Master Mace Windu.]]When she later discovered that Windu had escaped, Rajine sent her zombies to look for him throughout the city. After finding him, Rajine punched Windu, knocking the Jedi to the ground. She also destroyed Z-18&mdash;who had freed the Jedi&mdash;using Windu's lightsaber, remarking that she should not have kept the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] after Samuro died. Windu then activated Samuro's [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]], which had been given to him by Z-18. The holocron's image of Samuro spoke to the Countess and revealed that she would be defeated when the image and Windu spoke the "words of banishment." After Samuro's image and Windu recited the incantation,<ref name="NWO" /> the zombies' wills were restored to them.<ref name="CSWE" /> When she ordered them to kill Windu, Rajine's victims turned against her and killed her.<ref name="NWO" />

name: Nalia Adollu
description: The [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] Nalia Adollu was born around [[1010 BBY]]<ref name="RoT-One" /> in the tropical regions of the [[Expansion Region/Legends|Expansion Region]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Corsin/Legends|Corsin]] and was accepted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].<ref name="RoT" /> After the [[Ruusan campaign|Battle of Ruusan]] in [[1000 BBY]], Adollu was chosen as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] learner by the [[Pyn'gani]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Anno Wen-Chii]]. In [[995 BBY]], Adollu accompanied her Master to the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] planet [[Polus]], Wen-Chii's [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], where they spent [[Time/Legends|time]] studying the native [[Species/Legends|species]], hoping to learn more about how life evolved in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].<ref name="TCSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref> In [[990 BBY]], while Adollu was still on Polus, her identity was used by the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Zannah/Legends|Darth Zannah]], who infiltrated the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in order to find information regarding the [[Parasite/Legends|parasitic]] [[orbalisk]] organisms that plagued her [[Sith Master/Legends|Master]], [[Darth Bane/Legends|Darth Bane]]. Zannah carried out her mission successfully, as Adollu had not been seen on Coruscant for five [[Standard year/Legends|years]].<ref name="RoT" />

name: Qiina
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Qiina was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], serving as a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] during the decade following the [[Ruusan Reformation]]s that swept through the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] and the Order. Ten years following the end of the [[New Sith Wars]], Master Qiina resided within the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and enjoyed long days of study in the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Temple Archives]] maintained by [[Chief Librarian/Legends|Chief Librarian]] [[Barra-Rona-Ban]].<ref name="RoT" /> Having studied as a [[Jedi Consular|Consular]], Master Qiina was a learned [[Jedi Lore Keeper|Lore Keeper]] and specialized as a [[Jedi librarian|librarian]].<ref>''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref>During one day in the Archives, Master Qiina unknowingly sat a few meters from one of the two existing [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lords of the Sith]], [[Darth Zannah/Legends|Darth Zannah]]. The Sith, posing as [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Nalia Adollu]], sat at a nearby terminal studying the ways in which to remove the deadly [[orbalisk]]s which plagued her master, [[Darth Bane/Legends|Darth Bane]]. Qiina became openly annoyed when Zannah and her cousin [[Darovit]], who were both trying to look up the [[Hyperlane|hyperspace route]] to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]], started making too much noise in their haste to leave before Darovit could be questioned about his knowledge of Zannah and her master.<ref name="RoT" />Not minutes after the cousins left, Master Qiina, at the request of Master [[Valenthyne Farfalla]], pointed out which terminal the cousins were using. After finding out where they were going, Farfalla organized a group of Jedi to follow them to Tython. There, he and the group were killed by the Sith Lords Bane and Zannah.<ref name="RoT" />

name: Berra Sane
description: She lived in the village of [[Austogie]], where she worked as a geologist and [[Scout/Legends|scout]] for the [[Kieger]] clan. She was unscrupulous in her work and sought to maximize the profitability of future land grabs. She had excellent arctic survival skills and could handle a variety of [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] and vibro weapons.{{Char-stub}}

name: Dom Pricina
description: Sometime before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Pricina was traveling on the [[Kuari Princess/Legends|''Kuari Princess'']]. While on board, she kept carelessly misplacing priceless articles of jewelry. It was her forgetfulness that convinced the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[4-LOM/Legends|4-LOM]]&mdash;who worked as a valet on the [[Luxury liner/Legends|luxury liner]]&mdash; that Humans were incompetent and didn't deserve their valuables. He stole the [[Ankarres Sapphire|sapphire]] from her and began a life of crime.{{Char-stub}}

name: Memah Roothes
description: {{Dialogue|Memah|I think you are trouble, Ratua. It would probably be much better for me if I stayed as far away from you as I could.|Ratua|Probably, but where's the fun in that?|attr=Memah and Ratua in the Hard Heart Cantina aboard the Death Star|src=Death Star (novel)}}Born on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Memah Roothes emigrated to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] at some point before the fall of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Old Republic]]. Shortly thereafter she established a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], which she dubbed the [[Soft Heart Cantina|Soft Heart]], within the [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] [[Coruscant underworld/Legends|underlevels]], employing the [[Ragithian Human]] [[Rodo]] as a [[Bouncer (occupation)/Legends|bouncer]] and security guard. Over the years, the two would become very good friends, though their relationship would never develop into an intimate one due to Rodo's beliefs.During the middle stages of the first [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star's]] construction, she was approached by an agent of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], who offered her a two-year contract to manage a cantina on the massive battle station. The pay and benefits seemed to be an excellent deal, and Memah was tempted to accept, however it was not until the Soft Heart and the entire neighborhood around it was destroyed in a fire under suspicious circumstances, that she took up the offer, as she and Rodo were now without employment options. Memah's only condition was that Rodo would be able to join her there and continue his employment, which the agent readily agreed to.[[File:Death Star.jpg|left|thumb|The group of defectors escapes the Death Star destruction.]]The new cantina, which she named the "Hard Heart" in memory of her previous establishment, soon became a prominent after-duty stop among the many personnel, entertaining such patrons as [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Nova Stihl]]; [[TIE/LN starfighter]] [[TIE pilot|pilot]] [[Villian Dance]]; and the [[Zelosian]] con artist and [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]], [[Celot Ratua Dil]]. Dil, as it turned out, was quite the charmer; drawing her in with his startlingly green eyes, it wasn't long before the two began dating, despite the fact that Dil did not attempt to hide that he was actually a prisoner that had recently escaped from the prison planet of [[Despayre]].As work on the Death Star progressed, Memah and others of her more frequent patrons became disillusioned with the Empire and its practices. When the world that supported the Death Star's construction, Despayre, was [[Destruction of Despayre|destroyed]] in a test of the station's [[Concave Dish Composite Beam Superlaser|superlaser]], she began to realize just what kind of place she was inhabiting&mdash;and indeed helping to prosper. With the [[Destruction of Alderaan|destruction]] of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], this grew into open hostility to Imperial practices. She, along with several of the cantina's patrons, decided to leave the Death Star and the Empire. Eventually, she ended up escaping the Death Star, along with Dance, Dil, [[Teela Kaarz]] and [[Doctor/Legends|Dr.]] [[Kornell Divini]], although Rodo was forced to stay behind to hold off a large group of stormtroopers and was killed in the fight. Upon leaving the station with the help of [[Atour Riten]], the defectors were briefly engaged by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] in his [[Darth Vader's TIE Advanced x1|TIE Advanced x1]] before he was forced to abandon his pursuit of the runaways to [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|engage]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and his [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]] [[Red Squadron (Rebel Alliance)/Legends|wingmen]].Following the Death Star's destruction, Roothes and the other defectors considered their options. Ratua asked her to settle down with him managing his family's lucrative real estate business and informed her that he was in fact very wealthy due to his share in it. While angry at him for not mentioning this to her earlier, Memah agreed to go with him to meet his family.

name: Morna Faenarm
description: Morna Faenarm was born around [[30 BBY/Legends|30 BBY]]. She became a professional athlete and toured the galaxy where she witnessed the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] action enough to become sympathetic to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebellion]]. She used the contacts she gained as an athlete to move into business and in a couple of [[Standard year/Legends|years]] she was an accountant for [[Incom Corporation/Legends|Incom Corporation]]. After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Incom had been taken over by the Galactic Empire but Faenarm realized that by getting inside the power structure of the corporation she could get information on new ships, technology, and Imperial military strategies. She was able to pass this information along to the Rebellion by sending information and [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] through a series of anonymous dummy accounts she had set up.<ref name="CRO" />

name: Myleena Dystra
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Myleena Dystra was born on the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core World]]<ref name="EAOC">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in [[13 BBY/Legends|13 BBY]], during the reign of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Dystra's [[Myleena Dystra's mother|mother]] and [[Myleena Dystra's father|father]] were affluent [[Coruscanti/Legends|Coruscanti]], and Dystra grew up in a [[Dystra estate|palatial estate]] on Coruscant and attended private schools. When [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] [[Dissolution of the Imperial Senate/Legends|disbanded]] the [[Imperial Senate/Legends|Imperial Senate]]<ref name="H&R" /> in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]],<ref name="GNN">{{Journal|3|Galaxywide NewsNets}}</ref> the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]] was taken over by Imperial [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]], who detained hundreds of individuals for questioning and to issue arrest warrants. Dystra's [[Parent/Legends|parents]] were two of those detained. They were never released, and Dystra did not see them again. She later discovered they had an affiliation with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], also known as the Rebel Alliance, which sought to overthrow the Empire. Now effectively an orphan, Dystra was taken under the wing of the Empire's [[Politics/Legends|political]] bureaucracy, the [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|Commission for the Preservation of the New Order]] (COMPNOR), and sent to a [[readjustment camp]] to be [[Imperialization/Legends|indoctrinated]] on Imperial [[New Order/Legends|philosophy]].<ref name="H&R" />Shortly after Dystra entered the COMPNOR camp, a Rebel Alliance [[Alliance Special Operations|Special Operations]] team rescued her, and she was taken to a Rebel [[Safe world/Legends|safeworld]]. There, she was placed in a [[Rebel Alliance foster home]] and was brought up to appreciate her parents' sacrifice. As she grew older, Dystra became determined to join the cause of her parents. After the Rebel Alliance formed the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], which replaced the Empire as the dominate [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] government, Dystra became an [[Agent/Legends|agent]] with the [[New Republic Security Force]] (NRSF). She quickly established herself as a highly effective [[Police officer/Legends|police officer]] with an impressive record of arrests. She also was involved in several major engagements and was wounded in two separate incidents. She narrowly escaped [[Death/Legends|death]] during the second [[Time/Legends|time]] she was wounded in action.<ref name="H&R" />

name: Osira Mavron
description: During the [[Battle of Praadost II]], Mavron was decorated repeatedly for conspicuous bravery, participating in numerous operations. In the final days of the campaign, Osira Mavron stumbled upon the secret that the Rebels were fighting so hard to hide. A small refugee camp was located in an underground cavern she was scouting. Confronted with hundreds of refugees and orphans, Mavron realized what she had been supporting and defected to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Sandrex Olotho
description: Olotho began her spying career sometime prior to the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. When Tarkin died aboard the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|first Death Star]], she remained in Fonada's service, eventually becoming Fonada's [[Adjutant/Legends|adjutant]]. Following the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Fonada went warlord, and the physically attractive and skilled Olotho served as the admiral's eyes and ears on the battlefield.Her career was distinguished by an incident where, while in the field, one of Fonada's trooper detachments defected to the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. Rallying the few remaining loyalists, she dug into a defensive position and planned her escape. By capturing several leathery-winged ''[[deshfinop]]s'', coating them with a slow-burning resin, and releasing them, she sewed confusion among the ranks of the defectors and set fires in their encampment. The disorganization that resulted allowed Olotho and her followers to break through enemy lines and escape, even successfully capturing a few New Republic soldiers in the process.

name: Kerri Lessev/Legends
description: Kerri Lessev was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] around [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]]. Her parents were diplomats and while she was still an infant her parents moved to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. She grew up in the peace and safety of an upper-class family.<ref name="CRO" />As the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] strengthened its rule, Lessev's parents became opponents of [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] methods and they were arrested and presumably executed. Palpatine gathered the children of those he executed and in a carefully staged media event he told them that their parents had been killed by terrorists.<ref name="CRO" />Lessev became a ward of the state and on the insistence of [[Crueya Vandron]] they were integrated into the growing [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|COMPNOR]] [[Sub-Adult Group/Legends|SAGroup]] and received an education in Imperial bureaucracy, culture, military operations, and intelligence.<ref name="CRO" />Through tests Kerri was recommended for [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] and was placed in [[Infiltration]] training. After completing Infiltration training she was assigned to [[Intelligence/Legends|Intelligence]] for indoctrination and double-agent training before finally being transferred to [[Destabilization]]. In this capacity she worked to play out the [[Imperial Advisor]]s and Imperial Nobles against each other and keep them from plotting against the Emperor.<ref name="CRO" />Before she was sent out in the field she reviewed [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] propaganda and became swayed by the speeches of [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]] and [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]] and came to sympathize with the Rebels and their cause.<ref name="CRO" />She carried out an operation in the [[Wyloff sector]] against [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Varnier]]. While other Destab and [[Assassination (Imperial Intelligence)|Assassination]] agents had been working directly for Moff Varnier, Lessev felt loyalty only to the Emperor and tipped off the [[External Communications]] security. This resulted in total upheaval for the sector as corruption was rooted out.<ref name="CRO" />Even though Kerri did not join the Rebel Alliance she tried to help them by destabilizing the Empire from within. She caused internal dissension and conflict and instead of exposing traitors, she worked to remove the Empire's most competent and capable officers.<ref name="CRO" />

name: Helena Shan
description: When [[Bastila Shan]] was a child and [[Bastila Shan's father|her father]] wanted to take her searching for treasure, as he regularly did, it was Helena who prevented him, insisting that it was too dangerous. Bastila thought her mother urged her father to go on hunts. As a result, Bastila grew up resentful of her mother, and the two of them had an uneasy relationship. When Helena sent Bastila to join the Jedi Order to provide her with a better life than that of the daughter of treasure hunters, Bastila took that as a sign that her mother did not want her around.<ref name="KotOR" />Over the following years, Helena and her husband continued their treasure hunting. Helena remembered her daughter with fondness, showing [[Hologram/Legends|holograms]] of her to one of her husband's employees, a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] woman named [[Malare]]. At some point during this time, Helena developed a fatal disease. Her husband, in order to pay for treatments, desperately continued his search for treasure to raise the money. In the course of these hunts he traveled to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] searching for [[Krayt dragon pearl/Legends|krayt dragon pearls]], and was killed by a [[Canyon krayt dragon/Legends|canyon]] [[Dune Sea krayt dragon|krayt dragon]] in the [[Eastern Dune Sea]]. When Helena spoke to Malare again, she was desperate to find her daughter.<ref name="KotOR" />During the [[Jedi Civil War]] in [[3956 BBY]], as Bastila and Jedi [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] traveled to Tatooine during their journey to find a way to stop the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Invasion]], Malare would cross paths with her and her companion, informing them that Helena was on Tatooine looking for Bastila. Helena's attitude had raised the ire of several patrons of the [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], including the [[Duros/Legends|Duros]] [[Maana Demknot]], who stormed out just as Bastila and the amnesiac Revan arrived, and was able to direct them to her. Bastila reluctantly met with Helena, but doubted that she was truly ill, and after a brief argument learned of her father's death. Helena asked Bastila to retrieve a [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]] belonging to Bastila's father from the krayt dragon's lair. After slaying the dragon, the two Jedi retrieved it, but Bastila was reluctant to give it back to her mother. When she learned that Helena truly was dying and righted her misconceptions about her childhood, Bastila reconciled with Helena and gave her 500 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to pay for treatment from a doctor on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Before she left the Cantina, Helena asked Revan to protect and take care of Bastila. He told her that he would do his best.<ref name="KotOR" />

name: Terena Adare
description: [[Darth Malak]]'s [[Attack on Dantooine (Jedi Civil War)|devastation of Dantooine]] in [[3956 BBY]] badly damaged the [[Jedi Enclave]], eliminating the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] presence on the planet. After the attack, Adare worked hard to ensure the survival of what was left of the settlers. She sat upon [[Khoonda]], a government tasked with protecting the settlers and regulating their day-to-day affairs&mdash;a task formerly entrusted to the Jedi&mdash;and was proclaimed the Administrator.Realizing that the [[Khoonda Militia|militia corps]] alone was not enough to ensure Khoonda's safety, Adare secretly maintained contacts with Jedi Master [[Vrook Lamar]], a former member of the [[Dantooine Enclave Council]] and a friend for many years. Unlike most settlers, she trusted the Jedi, remembering the good they had done when the Enclave had stood firmly. However, she understood that the Jedi in general had an extremely bad reputation on Dantooine, and even she could do nothing about it.The opportunity to change that fact came in [[3951 BBY]], the year when relations between the settlers and [[Azkul]]'s [[Exchange]] mercenaries grew especially tense. Unbeknownst to Adare, the mercenaries captured Vrook, preparing to transport him to [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]] to claim [[G0-T0|Goto's]] bounty. It was at this time that [[Meetra Surik]] arrived on Dantooine, looking for Vrook, and the Administrator granted her the permission to search the ruins of the Enclave. In turn, Surik agreed to help the settlers in any way possible.Eventually, the Exile's investigation, during which Master Vrook was freed from the mercenaries, triggered an open conflict between them and Khoonda, leading to the [[Battle of Khoonda]], when the mercenaries attempted to infiltrate Khoonda and kill Adare. During the conflict, Surik significantly contributed to the defenses of Khoonda and, along with Vrook, bravely fought the mercenaries, restoring the settlers' faith in the Jedi.After the battle, as Dantooine's safe and prosperous future was secured, Adare did her best to ensure that the deeds of Vrook and Surik, and the heritage of the Jedi, would not be forgotten.

name: Kossex
description: An uncommon [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Kossex was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Having been raised at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] since early infancy, Master Kossex was not a worshiper of her peoples' deity, the [[Quay]].<ref name="NEGAS" />When the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] went to war, Master Kossex dutifully took up ranks in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]], taking the title of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]]. Early in the fighting known as the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] Master Kossex was dispatched to [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]], the hub of the Republic's [[Cloning/Legends|cloning]] operations to protect it from an attack by the Confederacy. Under the overall command of Masters [[Oppo Rancisis/Legends|Oppo Rancisis]] and [[Shaak Ti/Legends|Shaak Ti]], Kossex served as part of [[Red Squadron (Galactic Republic)|Red Squadron]], a starfighter wing led by Master [[Tsui Choi]]. Piloting a [[Delta-7 Aethersprite-class light interceptor/Legends|Delta-7 interceptor]] over [[Tipoca City/Legends|Tipoca City]], Kossex went head-to-head with several [[Variable Geometry Self-Propelled Battle Droid, Mark I/Legends|droid starfighters]] during the [[First Battle of Kamino|fighting]]. Aiding Jedi [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] evade an enemy fighter, Kossex failed to notice another starfighter on her tail. Before she could react the droid fired and destroyed her interceptor and killed Master Kossex instantly.<ref name="DOK" /> Because of her adherence to the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]], her people did not mourn her loss, viewing her instead as a heretic.<ref name="NEGAS" />

name: Maya
description: Maya, a native from [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], worked for the [[Alderaanian Security]] for a few months after the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. Following the [[Declaration of a New Order|declaration]] of the [[New Order/Legends|New Order]], she was sent, along with [[Sirona Okeefe]] on a mission to [[Brentaal IV/Legends|Brentaal IV]] aboard the [[Banshee (Baudo-class)|''Banshee'']]. On [[Sel Zonn Station]] in orbit above [[Brentaal IV/Legends|Brentaal]], Maya encountered Imperial resistance and was badly wounded during a skirmish. She asked a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] to fight off the Imperials pursuing her. Maya further convinced the spacers to help her retrieve Organa's cargo - an Alderaanian Security agent frozen in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]].

name: Seddwia
description: [[File:Seddwia lumbra.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Seddwia confronting Lumbra.]]Seddwia was a member of the [[Soaring Hawkbat Clan]]. The clan was stationed at the [[Bogden Jedi chapter house|Jedi chapter house]] on [[Bogden 3]]. They were awaiting transport back to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], which had been delayed due to the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|battle]] there. When [[Jedi Master/Legends|Masters]] K'Kruhk and [[Sian Jeisel]] arrived with their clone troopers, [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] was issued. Several of the younglings were [[Massacre on Bogden 3|killed]] as [[Du Mahn]] defended them. Mahn was shot down by the clones, and Jeisel sacrificed herself to cover their escape. K'Kruhk and [[Chase Piru]] ultimately escaped with nine younglings to parts unknown. Two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] afterward, Seddwia was living with the group of younglings in exile under the tutelage of K'Kruhk.Seddwia was present when a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] named [[Lumbra]] and his men came to the younglings' camp. When they noticed that the broken ship had a piece that they needed, Lumbra proceeded to take it. As he approached the ship, Seddwia jumped at him saying that it was their ship and to leave it alone. Lumbra grabbed Seddwia by the arm and pulled her away. Immediately, Piru jumped to her rescue. Unfortunately, Piru was shot by one of Lumbra's men. Lumbra soon realized that the children were Jedi and decided to turn them in to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]]. The children were chained up and taken away. It was only due to the skills of K'Kruhk and Chase Piru that the younglings were freed and Lumbra was killed.Seddwia traveled with the rest of the group to the planet [[Arkinnea]] in search of a new home. She survived the crash landing and was taken into custody by the [[Arkinnea Militia]]. The youngling was present when Master [[Zao]] found them in the refugee camp. After dinner, Seddwia sat down with the rest of the younglings as Zao taught them their daily lesson. When Zao tossed three spice berries in the air and caught one in each hand and the last in his mouth, she responded that the purple spice berry was in his left hand.<ref name="FC1">''[[Dark Times—Fire Carrier 1]]''</ref>She escaped with the rest of the Jedi and made her way into the Arkinnean countryside. Seddwia was present when K'Kruhk showed up with [[Wooly]] and climbed into the back of a wagon hitched to the animal. As they made their way further into the countryside, she took a nap. The group started to climb a hill and Seppwia, along with the other younglings, raced to the top. When they reached the top, they came across the bodies of refugees that had been dumped on the valley floor.<ref name="FC2">''[[Dark Times—Fire Carrier 2]]''</ref> She then watched in horror as an ore carrier flew over the valley and dropped another load of refugees to their deaths. When K'Kruhk realized the group had been spotted, he used the Force to throw Seddwia and the others into the back of the wagon. As K'Kruhk pushed the wagon off the side of the hill, Seddwia asked him if he would be going with them. The wagon reached the bottom of the hill and hit a [[tree/Legends|tree]], throwing Seddwia and the others from it.<ref name="FC3">''[[Dark Times—Fire Carrier 3]]''</ref>After recovering from the crash, Seddwia and the rest of the younglings followed Zao deeper into the forest. She hid with the group when they heard blaster fire. Seddwia was present when the [[Yunu]] found the group of Jedi. The Arkinnea Militia caught up with the two groups and held them at gunpoint.<ref name="FC4">''[[Dark Times—Fire Carrier 4]]''</ref> As the militia opened fire, Zao used to force to raise a boulder out of the ground to give them cover. Seddwia fled with Piru and the other younglings but returned when the blasterfire subsided. After the battle, Seddwia and the rest of the clan followed the Yunu deeper into the forest, and she asked Zao how K'Kruhk would find them. She was present when, several days later, K'Kruhk caught up with the group and discovered [[Hidden Temple (Arkinnea)|their new home]]. Seddwia settled into her new home and continued her training as a Jedi.<ref name="FC5">''[[Dark Times—Fire Carrier 5]]''</ref>

name: Astarta
description: Astarta aided Isolder during his hunt for "pirate king" [[Harravan]].<ref name="Databank">{{DB|character|isolder|Isolder|archivedate=20100712110827}}</ref> After the capture of Harravan, Astarta remained with Isolder as the leader of his security detail. During the [[Battle of Dathomir (Hunt for Zsinj)|Battle of Dathomir]], Astarta commanded a [[Hapan Battle Dragon]]. It was also Astarta's investigation that revealed [[Ta'a Chume]] as the source behind the murder of both Isolder's brother [[Kalen (Hapan)|Kalen]] and [[Lord|Lady]] [[Elliar]], his first love.<ref name="The Courtship of Princess Leia">''[[The Courtship of Princess Leia]]''</ref>During the course of their relationship, Astarta fell in love with Isolder, which made her all the more efficient as his bodyguard. He was aware of her affections, though he did not return them.By [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]], [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] Astarta had retired from her post, but remained a close friend of Isolder's.<ref>''[[The New Jedi Order: Agents of Chaos II: Jedi Eclipse]]''</ref>{{Char-stub}}

name: Nu Toreena
description: In [[130 ABY]], when the Galactic Alliance obtained intel about a meeting on the [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] of [[Caamas/Legends|Caamas]] between [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] and envoys of the [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]] [[Chiss Ascendancy/Legends|Ascendancy]] and the [[Hapes Consortium/Legends|Hapes Consortium]] about a possible alliance, Toreena supported the plans of [[Rear Admiral/Legends|Rear Admiral]] [[Piers Petan]] of performing an attack with the goal of killing or capturing Emperor Fel. Even though the plan was rejected by Gahan, [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gar Stazi]] and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Kol Skywalker]], all of whom suspected a trap, Toreena and Petan convinced the third Triumvir, [[Bail Antilles (Galactic Alliance)|Bail Antilles]] to go ahead with the strike.As it turned out, the information was nothing more than an [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Imperial]] bait to lure the [[Galactic Alliance Defense Fleet]] into a trap. In the resulting [[Battle of Caamas|battle]], the Galactic Alliance was defeated and then surrendered to the Empire, giving it the opportunity to occupy [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].

name: Dafi (criminal)
description: in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], she was present at the gang's [[Lemo and Sanda's den|base]] during the arrival of "[[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Drebble]]", [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] in disguise. Dafi was generally in awe of the man, especially when he killed [[Koruu]] with a [[Knife/Legends|combat knife]]. Dafi joined the group when they brought "Drebble" to dinner at an [[Arcan IV]] restaurant and helped the group get the man drunk on [[Deltron spice wine]] in order to make him spill his plans to find the valuable artifacts, the [[Dancing Goddess/Legends|Dancing Goddess]] and the [[Minstrel]]. After Calrissian accidentally revealed his true identity, the gang pulled their weapons on the "captain". However, he was saved by [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]], who came to his rescue by swinging a bench seat at the pirates. As the two [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] heroes fled back to the [[Arcan IV Spaceport]] in a [[hover car]], the pirates pursued in their own vehicles.Eventually, Calrissian and Chewbacca were their own worst enemies as they inadvertently crashed their ships into one another. Although thrown free from the wreckage, they landed at the feet of Dafi, who recognized them and prepared to kill the pair. However, before she could, she witnessed a small box that had fallen from Calrissian's pocket. Inside the box was the Minstrel. Dafi became immediately obsessed with the artifact, certain that it would lead her to the other statue, the Dancing Goddess. Having become incredibly possessive of the artifact, when her comrades arrived, she began to fire on them, believing that they were there to steal the Minstrel from her. During the ensuing shootout, Calrissian and Chewbacca managed to escape.

name: Veema
description: {{Quote|Five credits on Octa. And if you beat Veema's score by more than three, Octa, I'll throw in Zero-One as a bonus.|Kyp Durron makes a wager before the Battle of Coruscant|The New Jedi Order: Dark Journey}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Veema was nearing her fifties during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], when the [[Yuuzhan Vong galaxy|extra-galactic]] [[Yuuzhan Vong]] [[Species/Legends|species]] [[Invasion/Legends|invaded]] [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] to establish a new home. Veema served as a [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] in the rogue [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Kyp Durron]]'s [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]&ndash;aligned [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]], [[Kyp's Dozen]], which Durron was leading against the forces of the Yuuzhan Vong.<ref name="Dark" /> In [[27 ABY/Legends|27 ABY]],<ref name="ERC" /> the Yuuzhan Vong [[Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War)|overwhelmed]] the New Republic's defenses at the latter's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. In order to protect the [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Danni Quee]], who was bringing with her to Coruscant a new [[Gravitic amplitude modulator|jammer]] meant to disrupt the [[Telepathy/Legends|telepathic]] signals that the Yuuzhan Vong [[yammosk]] creatures produced, Durron took Veema and the rest of Kyp's Dozen on a [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] journey to Coruscant.<ref name="Dark" />During their trek though hyperspace in their [[T-65XJ X-wing starfighter]]s, some of the pilots chatted and made wagers on who would get the most kills, with Veema and the Jedi pilot [[Octa Ramis]] being the favorites. Kyp's Dozen arrived at Coruscant to find the Yuuzhan Vong completing their conquest of the planet, and multiple [[Yorik-et|coralskippers]] engaged Veema and the squadron after Quee's [[Danni Quee's corvette|ship]] and her other escorts arrived nearby. During the fighting, a [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Refugee/Legends|refugee]] [[Unidentified refugee freighter|freighter]] trying to escape the [[Coruscant system/Legends|Coruscant system]] was attacked by coralskippers, with the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] leading its pursuers toward Quee's ship. To protect Quee and save the freighter, Durron ordered Veema and the three pilots under her command to get the freighter out of the fighting. However, while dealing with the coralskippers, Veema's [[X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing starfighter]] lost a wing to enemy fire, causing her [[Starship/Legends|ship]] to spin out of control and crash into the freighter, which [[Death/Legends|killed]] Veema and the occupants of the refugee ship. Kyp's Dozen suffered massive casualties during the fighting, with all but Durron, Ramis, and two other pilots perishing, though Quee and her vessel survived.<ref name="Dark" />

name: Unidentified Twi'lek Jedi (Clone Wars)
description: This [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] fought alongside the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. During battle on an unknown [[Planet/Legends|planet]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], she was assigned to a battlefront under the leadership of Councilor [[Ki-Adi-Mundi/Legends|Ki-Adi-Mundi]]. Joined by recently knighted [[Rivi-Anu]] and [[Eon]], the group fought valiantly to repel the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]]. When a [[Victory-class Star Destroyer/Legends|Victory-class Star Destroyer]] plummeted toward the battlefield, they all believed they would die, until Rivi-Anu [[Telekinesis/Legends|held back]] the warship with an astounding display of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Rivi-Anu waited until all Jedi and clones had fled the field, including this Twi'lek Jedi, and then allowed the ship to crash down upon herself.<ref name="TTVP" />

name: Oakie Dokes/Legends
description: Oakie Dokes was the [[Reproduction/Legends|firstborn]] child to a [[Galactic Credit Standard|wealthy]] family of [[schinga]] breeders on [[Makem Te/Legends|Makem Te]]. During the [[Republic Classic era]], she was sent to [[The galaxy/Legends|the galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], to represent her ranch in the [[Coruscant Livestock Exchange and Exhibition]]. While there, her vanity led her to spend her funds at a dizzying rate, as she went on a shopping spree. Clearing out the family accounts, she purchased troves of [[Gemstone/Legends|gemstones]] which she then implanted into her body. Dokes, however, soon found herself out of resources, and she decided to take refuge in Coruscant's seedier districts.<ref name="db" />[[File:Oakie_Dokes_Club.png|thumb|left|250px|Oakies Dokes spoke to a human in the Outlander Club.]]Now aware of her own folly, Dokes was forced to live in the gutters of the galactic capital. All alone, she discovered that she had a talent for expressing her loneliness through artwork. For both her paints and her canvas, she used the dregs of Coruscant's lower levels, creating an array of disturbing, dark, and macabre artwork. She enjoyed success with her new profession, and rose up through the society of the galactic capital.<ref name="db" />She eventually reached such a level that she came to frequent the [[Outlander Club/Legends|Outlander Club]], in the [[Uscru Entertainment District/Legends|Uscru Entertainment District]].<ref name="db" /> She was present there when [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] arrested [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Zam Wesell/Legends|Zam Wesell]] by slicing off her [[Limb/Legends|arm]] with a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]].<ref name="aotc">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>While there, Dokes met with the [[Judicial/Legends|Judicials]] [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Dannl Faytonni/Legends|Dannl Faytonni]] and his associate, [[Achk Med-Beq/Legends|Achk Med-Beq]]. Faytonni was interested in sponsoring Dokes' future artistic endeavors, but, despite the [[Human/Legends|Human's]] charm, the Swokes Swokes suspected that he was trying to con her. Despite her suspicions, she decided to go along with them, and decided that her new acquaintances would make suitable artistic subjects. In particular, she began to picture a work featuring [[Dismemberment/Legends|dismembered]] extremities clad in tattered Judicial uniforms, but she decided that she needed to wait for proper inspiration. She also came to accept that if pawned, her embedded jewels would be able to help her accumulate a moderate amount of money, should she find herself in financial trouble again.<ref name="db" />

name: Anki Pace
description: Born to parents on [[Carida/Legends|Carida]], Anki Pace attended the [[Mrlsst Trade and Science Academy]] and was studying for her doctorate in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]]. During her studies, members of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic's]] [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] were present during a time that would later be known as the [[Phantom Project|Phantom Affair]]. A close friend of [[Koyi Komad]], Pace attained her doctorate while Komad joined the Rogues and married one of its members, [[Nrin Vakil]]; [[Doctor/Legends|Dr.]] Pace was present at the [[Wedding of Nrin Vakil and Koyi Komad|wedding]].<ref name="DTI" />Years later, Dr. Pace had gotten a job as a [[Professor/Legends|professor]] at the [[University of Agamar]], working in the [[Archaeology/Legends|xenoarchaeology]] department. In [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]], Dr. Pace was sent to [[Bimmiel/Legends|Bimmiel]] with a team including students [[Jens]], [[Vil (student)|Vil]], [[Trista Orlanis]], and [[Denna]]. There, the team uncovered ancient [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Jedi artifact/Legends|artifacts]], suspecting Jedi involvement in the thefts of the artifacts that left their guardians with amnesia. While on Bimmiel, they also [[AR-312|discovered]] something else&mdash;the mummified corpse of [[Mongei Shai]], a [[Warrior caste|warrior]] of the [[Yuuzhan Vong]].<ref>''[[The New Jedi Order Sourcebook]]''</ref>

name: Uta T'Cha
description: During her time with the Sabiador Slavers, T'Cha was a casual acquaintance of [[Gorak Khzam]]. However, she preferred droids to slaving, and left the group some time before Khzam did. In [[6 ABY/Legends|6 ABY]], she arrived in the [[Pitann system]] in the [[Kathol Republic]]. Although she was rumored to have a shadowy past, she was also known to be one of the best droid repair mechanics and programmers in the Kathol Republic. T'cha worked on colony's mining droids, and she was approached by [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Sho'ban Do]] to assist him in his plan to create a remote control program to take over all the droids within the Kathol Republic. T'Cha went to work, and was the driving force behind creating the [[Pitann droid gladiatorial games|droid gladiatorial games]], which she modeled after the games that the [[Sabiador Slavers]] used to set up. She worked from her [[Uta T'Cha's workshop|workshop]] adjacent to the [[Droid gladiatorial arena|gladiatorial arena]].In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], she was approached by members of the crew of the ''[[FarStar]]'' to expose Do's schemes. T'Cha was willing to sell a hologram recording of Senator Do revealing his plan to turn droids into covert assassins for the sum of 50,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. Fortunately for the representatives of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], she was talked down to 8,000 credits, and passage out of the Kathol Republic. After delivering her evidence to the [[Kathol Republic Senatorial Council]], she joined the crew of ''FarStar'' because she recognized Khzam and was sure she could blackmail him while onboard.T'Cha came to like serving onboard the ''FarStar'', and wanted to come clean about her past to the crew. She also attempted to get Khzam to admit to his past, but he refused. The pair argued, and the secret came out in a public area of the ship. As a result, Khzam was confined to quarters and relieved of duty. Strangely, while much of the crew reacted negatively to the revelation of Khzam's past, they did not seem to mind about T'Cha's, possibly because she had not served with them for an extended period.

name: Jacynith
description: Jacynith grew up on the planet Ryloth and was the sister of the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vhiin Thorla]]. The two siblings were separated at a young age when Vhiin was selected for training as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Youngling/Legends|youngling]]. The two were, however, reunited when Vhiin later went into self-imposed exile on their homeworld, eventually establishing [[The Enclave]]. Vhiin asked Jacynith to accompany him at his new Mission, and she readily agreed.Jacynith was one of the few Enclave residents who was not a former [[Slavery/Legends|slave]]. When she was not helping her brother, Jacynith worked at her job as a waitress at the [[Fungus Pit]], a popular [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] in the local town of [[Bashka]].When two Jedi from the [[Almas Academy]] arrived in Bashka looking for Master Thorla, Jacynith agreed to help them by taking them to him at The Enclave. Unknown to either of the Jedi or Jacynith, however, a group of slavers tracked the trio and launched an assault on the unsuspecting Enclave. Master Thorla, along with the Jedi agents and The Enclave's meager security force, managed to repel the slaver attack and protect the integrity of The Enclave's secret location.

name: Lumia'Silbossa
description: Like so many female Twi'leks, Lumia was sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] during her adolescent years. It was not until Lumia was older that the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vhiin Thorla]] rescued her from her life as a slave. Like all the slaves that Master Thorla rescued, he offered Lumia a place at his refuge called [[The Enclave]]. Lumia accepted the offer whole-heartedly and took up residence at Thorla's refuge. She soon became The Enclave's healer, tending to the all manor of wounds sustained by life in the [[Bright Lands]] of Ryloth. Lumia also showed a measure of [[The Force/Legends|Force]] sensitivity which allowed her to better assist those in need.

name: Parton
description: In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Yeoman Parton was present when the Rebel Alliance concealed the fleet within the chromosphere of the star, [[Arbran]] by way of five [[Kerts-Bhrg field generator]]s. Parton accompanied [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia]] back to the Salvation base on the planet, [[Arbra/Legends|Arbra]], aboard a shuttle. Per Leia's orders, Parton attempted to send a comm message to the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] to recall [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] to assist when an accident left the crew of the main Kerts-Bhrg generator unconscious. Skywalker could not be reached, but disaster was nonetheless averted.Yeoman Parton was a young [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] with brown hair.

name: Unidentified prostitute
description: This woman was native to the [[Arcan IV]] and frequented the commercial district of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. During her rounds, she would would eventually make her way near [[Lemo and Sanda's den]]. However, she resented the pirate band for scaring away paying customers, especially since they had brought women with them and so had no need for her services. On one particularly slow night, the woman began to hope for a way to get back at the pirates for hurting her business. When [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], disguised as the pirate "[[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Barpotomous Drebble/Legends|Drebble]]" stopped by her corner in a [[hover car]] to ask her for directions, she seized the chance to get back at the "pirate" for wronging her. Although Calrissian asked for the fastest route to the [[Arcan IV Spaceport]], the prostitute gave him directions to lead him directly into oncoming traffic one of the busiest spacelanes on the planet. As Calrissian and his companion, [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] departed thanking the woman, the prostitute smiled to herself, pleased with the trick she had pulled.However, moments after the "pirates" had left her street corner, the real pirates, [[Lemo and Sanda's gang]], flew past the woman on their own vehicles, intent on murdering Calrissian and Chewbacca. The prostitute was puzzled by the event, having hoped that she was hurting the pirates not helping them capture their quarry. Luckily for Calrissian and Chewbacca, they were able to dodge the oncoming traffic and make their way back to their ship despite the woman's faulty directions.

name: Lunasa
description: Lunasa was one of the group of bounty hunters assembled by [[Magus (bounty hunter)|Magus]] to hunt down a young boy named [[Talesan Fry]], who had discovered their plans for the assassination of twenty galactic leaders at a conference on [[Rondai-2]]. She was able to infiltrate the [[Ulta Center]] by disguising herself. The bounty hunters found themselves pursued by a group of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]]. After confronting the Jedi, she was forced to surrender and was taken into custody.

name: Tyrimm Wyln
description: Along with her sisters, Tyrimm Wyln managed a farm. Wyln met Togorian master smith [[Mlatar Thon Gra]] and began a romantic relationship with him. Tyrimm embarked on a tour, visiting worlds such as [[Ord Klina]] and [[Zuliria]]. On Zuliria, Tyrimm was killed in the crossfire of an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] attack on a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] cell. Eventually, Mlatar left Togoria to search for Wyln. He was devastated to find, with the help of new friend [[Ther-das]], Tyrimm Wyln's fate.

name: Constanten (Tarasin)
description: Born in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]-rich environment of [[Hiironi irstat]] on the planet [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], Constanten was discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and given to the irstat's spiritual leader, Mother [[Dariana]], for training in the mysterious arts. Named after a [[Constanten|Jedi Knight]] who saved her life as an infant, Constanten was a very eager student and appreciated Mother Dariana's teaching methods. At the age of four, Constanten interacted with a Jedi visiting the irstat and became intrigued with the mystery that surrounded him. Following the passage of three years, the Tarasin youth traveled to one of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[Almas Academy|academies]] on nearby [[Almas]] and petitioned for enrollment. When the [[Almas Council|Academy's Council of Masters]] approved of her training, Constanten went straight to work and eventually passed all of the classes the Academy had to offer. Thus graduating, Headmaster [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] approached the girl and gave her the choice of remaining on Almas or continuing her training on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] there. Fearing that her attachments in the [[Cularin system]] would interfere with the training, Constanten chose to travel to Coruscant to become a Jedi Knight.<ref name="AMA" />On Coruscant, Constanten was selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] for training as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and traveled the galaxy on many missions, gaining new experiences and growing in the Force. After two decades, Constanten passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was given the rank of Knight within the Jedi Order. Returning to the Almas Academy where she studied to become a [[Jedi Guardian]], the Tarasin woman befriended the [[Skrilling/Legends|Skrilling]] Jedi [[Valiri]] and the two worked together on many missions. A respected woman among the Jedi at the academy, Constanten was known for her intense courage in battle, like to that of fellow Jedi [[K'kur]]. This fact contributed to the surprise many felt when she refused to respond to the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council's]] call to arms when the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Invoking the [[Right of Denial]], Constanten refused a rank within the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]; instead remaining on Almas performing her usual duties. Assigned to protect the [[Almas Sith fortress|fortress]] of long dead [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Rivan]], Constanten was joined by five other Knights in guarding the structure's entrances while a large research party entered its depths. Standing guard at the fortress' south entrance with Knights K'kur and Valiri beside her, the group prepared to defend against any attacks from the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] sect known as the [[Believers]].<ref name="AMA" />While the group waited outside the fortress, a sandstorm swept across the area, plunging the structure into a dismal gloom. During the storm, [[Dark Side Adept|dark side adept]] [[Phylus Mon]] led a group of raiders, including a giant Force-sensitive [[Wampa/Legends|Wampa]] in an attack on the ancient Sith edifice. While most of the Jedi guards were killed, Constanten and Valiri were merely wounded, and thus taken captive by the dark siders. Deep in the fortress, Adept Mon and his followers preformed a Sith ritual, planning on enslaving the two prisoners and several volunteers and transforming them into [[Sith battlelord]]s. The ritual went wrong however, ripping the participants' very Force-essence from their bodies and bonding them with a crystal that Mon quickly confiscated and took with the fleeing raiders. Long after the ritual had ended, Jedi search teams happened upon the bodies of the sacrificial men and women and took them back to the academy for further analysis. There, [[Jedi Lore Keeper|Jedi librarian]] [[Oden Malksch]] accidentally possessed the body of [[Karae Nalvas]], discovering where Mon's secret headquarters was during the experience. Reporting back to headmaster [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]], the Jedi sent a team to find and destroy the crystal in hopes that the Force-essences would then return to their respective bodies.<ref name="AMA" />

name: Treibeiu
description: {{Quote|Much of the evidence has been wiped out; the tent wasn't put up until after the attackers exited.
