But you will have a chance to search the area, and if you like, I can show you what I found when I arrived from my post&hellip; elsewhere.|Treibeiu, to the Heroes of Cularin|A Mon Alone}}Treibeiu was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who served the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the latter [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Treibeiu attained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], and, amid the strife of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she was stationed at the [[Almas Academy]], a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Jedi academy|training facility]] situated on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Almas]] in the [[Cularin system]].<ref name="AMA" /> Circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> the [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]] [[Phylus Mon]] and a band of his affiliates made an [[Raid on the Almas Sith fortress|incursion]] into a [[Almas Sith fortress|Sith fortress]] located on Almas. Mon and his minions attacked and defeated a band of Jedi who were standing guard next to the [[Fortress/Legends|fortress]], and roughly two and a half [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] after the confrontation, Treibeiu ventured to the north entrance of the fortress and stumbled across the [[Dismemberment/Legends|dismembered]] bodies of the Jedi [[Tresten Agai'i]], [[K'kur]], and [[Milak Sonloam]], who had been [[Death/Legends|killed]] in the confrontation. Treibeiu and several other Jedi quickly put up a [[Tent/Legends|tent]] over the corpses, and they used the camp as a base from which to monitor the area surrounding the fortress while they investigated the raid on the citadel.<ref name="AMA" />The Jedi [[Constanten (Tarasin)|Constanten]], [[Valiri]], and [[Vorlocca]] were reported absent in the aftermath of the attack, and the Almas Academy dispatched several rescue teams to look for the missing Jedi inside the fortress. Treibeiu remained on site next to the fortress to assist with coordinating the search effort. As she waited, a violent [[Sandstorm/Legends|sandstorm]] erupted. When the [[Heroes of Cularin]], a band of freelance agents who had been hired to assist with the investigation, landed in a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] near to the fortress entrance, Treibeiu approached the [[Starship/Legends|vessel]] and hammered on the [[Hull/Legends|hull]] until the agents let her in. She then introduced herself and informed them that she was there to escort them to the fortress. Using [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Telekinesis/Legends|clear a path]] through the sandstorm, Treibeiu led the agents to the tent next to the fortress entrance. When they arrived there, she used the Force to [[Mind trick/Legends|project an illusion]] to show the agents the dismembered bodies that she had found at the site to aid them with their mission. Treibeiu then answered several questions from the freelancers regarding their mission, and she provided them with a map of the portion of the fortress that they had been allocated to search. The agents subsequently entered the fortress.<ref name="AMA" />Several hours later, Treibeiu came back on watch to stand guard outside the fortress once more, and she received orders that the agents were to be retrieved and returned to the Almas Academy as soon as possible. The agents emerged from the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] citadel shortly thereafter, and Treibeiu arranged for them to be transported back to the Academy aboard a shuttle.<ref name="AMA" />

name: Honna
description: In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> as a child, she was captured along with three fellow Tarasin children, [[Li'Iri]], [[Tiscak]] and [[Kaj]], due to their innate Force-sensitivity. Their captor, [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver [[Phylus Mon]], jailed them in a cell in his slave zoo onboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. He also flogged all of the children with his three-tailed barbed whip.Their disappearance did not go unnoticed: Jedi Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] knew of the kidnappings, and even suspected Phylus Mon, but still could do nothing to rescue them.The children were kept in the cell, the only Force-sensitives in the zoo. They instinctively disliked fellow prisoner [[Bin Kohal|Halin Bok]]. Honna also managed to communicate with the [[Mantellian Savrip/Legends|Mantellian Savrips]] in another cell, [[Clu]], [[Taf]] and [[Mev (Savrip)|Mev]]. The Savrip promised to go through the energy bars to rescue the children should anyone try to take them against their will. Honna was scared of that, because the energy bars could easily kill the Savrips should they ever try that.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the [[Heart/Legends|heart]] of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's [[Death/Legends|death]], but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[Ion blaster/Legends|ion weapon]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Zeth Bresque
description: In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> Bresque had been captured by slaver [[Phylus Mon]] and kept in a cell in Mon's slave zoo aboard the ''[[Animiasma]]''. Her cell had a slot and a lever so that Bresque could get a new death stick whenever she wanted. This was apparently an experiment to see how long she could survive with a constant supply of her drugs. As a result, she was ''not'' anxious to leave.Phylus Mon surgically inserted an explosive near the heart of each of his slaves. The explosive would be activated in the case of Phylus Mon's death, but it could also be deactivated with the impact of an [[ion blaster]]. All the slaves in Phylus Mon's zoo were also regularly battered.

name: Alianda
description: By about [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]], Alianda was aged between twenty and twenty-five, and she was a slave to infamous [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] slaver [[Phylus Mon]], who kept her onboard his ship, ''[[Animiasma]]''. At that time, Phylus Mon was trying to repair a Sith artifact known as the [[Darkstaff]], the semi-sentient Darkstaff was modifying the galaxy around it, namely the ship, to its image, and a team sent by Jedi Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] opposed to some of Phylus Mon's activities.<ref name="20 BBY" />The Darkstaff possessed Alianda to negotiate with Qel-Bertuk's team as a physical being. During the possession, Alianda's [[Wikipedia:Sclera|scleras]] turned pitch black and her voice turned raspy, disconcerting her/its opponents. When the Darkstaff decided that the negotiation was over, it simply abandoned Alianda's body. The shock of having had something that horrible inside of her could have been lethal for her, although it is unclear whether she survived or not.<ref name="20 BBY" />

name: Gorak (Trandoshan)
description: Gorak did not recall her first years. She knew she was raised as a slave in a starship and mocked by [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiees]] for being short, pink-eyed and specially for being albino. Apparently she was rented for a week by a huge Wookiee, but she could not recall what happened. At that time, she was also regularly beaten, which served to increase her skin's hardness.After some years, she became a stout, albeit still short, young adult. She was big enough to become a threat. Although she was still a slave, she was no longer mocked.Eventually Gorak was freed, and she met slaver [[Phylus Mon]]. Phylus Mon offered Gorak a job at his zoo, food and clothes, as well as a sense of importance. However, upon hiring her, Phylus Mon injected an explosive near Gorak's heart. The device would kill Gorak should Phylus Mon die for any reason. The bomb could be deactivated if hit by an ion weapon, but Phylus Mon did not allow any ion weapon in his ship, the ''[[Animiasma]]''. This mechanism was a security measure that Phylus Mon used in every one of his slaves. At the same time, Phylus Mon paid his slaves and insisted in calling them employees - but at the same time, all of them knew they could not leave his service or they would die.Phylus Mon was a hunter and he also dealt in huge animals. Gorak's job included handling violent animals, apparently because of her own experience with violence and because of her phylosophical views on the innate violence of the reality. After years working on it, and specializing in [[Acklay/Legends|Acklays]] and [[Rancor/Legends|Rancors]], Gorak developed the ability to identify most non-sentient species by their odor. She also developed claustrophobia.In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> Phylus Mon decided to take Gorak in a mission to the [[Cularin system]] onboard the ''Animiasma'' (which she had never boarded before). Gorak was not informed of the details, but she was introduced the other members of the team. She disliked [[Nalz]] the [[Spiner]] as a useless technician, although she tried to remember that, if he were so useless, Phylus Mon would not have trusted him. He did not like [[Karae Nalvas|the Human]], but she assumed he might have some local contacts. She sexually liked the [[Barabel/Legends|Barabel]] bounty-hunter [[Yerj]], although the feeling was not mutual. However, the last team member was the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Kaarror]], for whom she felt an innate hatred.Gorak and the other minions attacked the [[Almas Sith fortress]] in Cularin system. The fortress entrance was being protected by six Jedi, but Phylus Mon sent no less than thirteen minions, including his [[Wampa/Legends|Wampa]] bodyguard [[Ku-Kak]]. Phylus Mon's team killed four of the Jedi and defeated the other two, even although Gorak and Kaarror spent the whole battle insulting each other from different sides of the field.In the fortress, Phylus Mon performed a Sith ritual to transform Gorak and the others in [[Sith battlelord]]s: After a dangerous, life-threatening process, they were supposed to rise as powerful military commanders that could use Force powers to deal with insubordination of their troops. However, something went wrong with the ritual: Gorak and the other prospective Battlelords were stripped of their Force-essences, which would be stored in a large crystal.Phylus Mon left the fortress with the crystal, but without Kaarror and the other empty bodies. Those bodies would then be found by a search team sent by the Jedi in the [[Almas Academy]]. The bodies were sent to the Academy. There, the Jedi tried their best to recover the lost essences and restore them to their previous state.

name: Constanten
description: Constanten was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] woman who had received formal [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] before passing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] an obtaining the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. During her service to the Republic, Constanten was assigned to the planet [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where on one occasion, she saved the life of a [[Tarasin]]. Her rescue of this woman was such a profound event in the Tarasin's life that she named [[Constanten (Tarasin)|her child]] Constanten in honor of the Jedi's heroism.<ref name="AMA" />

name: Sarna (Sith military)
description: A couple of days after the Sith under [[Darth Malak]] had conquered Taris, Sarna had decided to throw a party in her apartment in order for some of the troopers to blow off some steam. At the party she became drunk on [[Tarisian ale]] despite the warnings from her friend [[Yun Genda]], who had heard of the potency of the beverage.Sarna may have met the amnesiac [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], along with [[Carth Onasi]] in the [[Upper City Cantina]], not realizing that they were in fact [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] officers.Revan and Carth proceeded to steal her armor after she passed out. Her fate is unknown.

name: Cala Worner
description: Cala was a young and attractive covert operative for the Alliance c. [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], operating out of [[Aargonar 3]]. She was obstensibly a trade agent for the [[Outer Rim Trade Consortium]], and recruited a number of Rebels on [[Kwevron]] shortly before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. On Kwevron, her most valuable contact was the [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] [[Idu Taanfaar]] until his death at the hands of [[Falto Dragen]]. She visited [[Duro/Legends|Duro]] shortly thereafter as the Alliance attempted to convince the [[Duro Shipwrights Guild]] and other corporations to increase their secret support for overthrowing the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. During the climactic events at [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] which saw [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] flee that world, Cala was present. After eluding Imperial entanglements, she returned to the base at Aargonar. She was present when the Empire found and destroyed the base.Her ship was the ''[[Midnight Star]]'', a modified [[YV-545 light freighter]].

name: Raala Ponchar
description: In the days following the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], Ponchar sent multiple messages to the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] regarding several attacks on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] citizens by a [[C-B3 cortosis battle droid|new type of battle droid]], but the Council lost contact with her soon after. Ponchar was hunted down by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Saato]]. She was later [[Prisoner/Legends|imprisoned]] in [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure's]] [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|palace]].[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] was dispatched by the Council to Tatooine to find her, but was captured by Saato and placed in Ponchar's cell. Skywalker was able to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to open the cell door, however, and the two escaped together. Ponchar found his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] which had been taken from him after his imprisonment. She told the Padawan that the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] had hired Jabba to transport a metal called [[Cortosis/Legends|cortosis]] for them. Cortosis was resistant to lightsabers, and the Separatists were using it in their new battle droids.After informing Skywalker that there were other prisoners in the dungeons, the two split up, releasing as many prisoners from the dungeons as they could. Skywalker later reported the information provided to him by Ponchar to his [[Jedi Master/Legends|master]] and friend, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. It is unknown what became of Ponchar following these events.

name: CeeCee
description: "CeeCee" was one of the contingent of [[Galactic Alliance Guard]] officers that was stationed aboard the [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] of [[Darth Caedus]] during the [[Battle of Uroro Station]]. When [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]] boarded the vessel in order to kill her brother, she took CeeCee prisoner, exchanging uniforms with her so as to pose as the GAG captain while infiltrating the ship's prison, looking for [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Isolder]]. After making it into the ''Anakin Solo''{{'s}} infirmary, Jaina encountered the wounded [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Mirta Gev]], who asked for a blaster in order to keep CeeCee and a pair of GAG enlistees "quiet".As soon as Jaina left the room, however, Gev shot CeeCee and two GAG guards also being held captive.

name: Livette
description: {{Quote|There ''aren't'' going to be any deals with the Moffs. I hope that's clear.''"<br />"''Ab&mdash;absolutely.|Trista and Livette|Legacy of the Force: Invincible}}In [[40 ABY]], [[Trista Zel]], an officer in [[Hapan Security]], ordered Livette to open a [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]] channel to the [[Hapan Battle Dragon]] in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]], the ''[[Deserving Gem]]'', and have the communications officer put her through to [[Ducha]] [[Requud]], a Ducha third in line for the Hapan royal throne. Livette obeyed and opened the channel. What was heard on the other end was Requud begging for her life. Livette mentioned that she had heard reports of a [[Tahiri Veila|female Jedi]] penetrating the Jedi Coalition's perimeter with a squad of Elite Guard [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]].Trista and her twin sister [[Taryn Zel]] both suspected that Livette had given the [[Imperial Remnant]] the location of a hidden shaft that provided access to an underground hangar, where the [[StealthX|Jedi starfighters]] were refueled and rearmed on Shedu Maad. They also suspected that Livette authorized the penetration of their perimeter.Trista stayed behind to protect Livette in the happenstance that Taryn and [[Ben Skywalker]], [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and son of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], ran into problems with dealing with the Remnant's stormtroopers. She did not want a repeat of Ducha Requud's unfortunate "accident"&mdash;her death because of her betrayal to the [[Tenel Ka Djo|Queen Mother]].Livette subsequently proposed that Taryn and Ben take a squad of Her Majesty's Commandos.

name: Carn'ar
description: The eldest child of an impoverished family, she was subjected to a cruel upbringing, the effects of which she brought to the profession of [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] hunting in order to support her family. Becoming increasingly cruel and uncaring, Carn'ar began to enjoy preying on those who were too weak to protect themselves; her trademark was the use of [[Slugthrower/Legends|slugthrowers]] and other forms of projectile weapons, eschewing [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]]. She was known to send a shell casing engraved with the target's name to that being's family as a reminder of a successful hunt.

name: Helina Dow
description: Helina Dow worked for [[Talesan Fry]] at his [[Fry Industries|surveillance production company]]. Secretly a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] for the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]], she was planted in the complex early on in its development. When Talesan created the codebreaker, she made an attempt to steal it from [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] agents [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], [[Siri Tachi]] and [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]]. The attempt was foiled, however, and Helina was subsequently killed by the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Magus (bounty hunter)|Magus]], due to the fact that having failed to steal the codebreaker she had become a liability.

name: Auren Yomm Baobab
description: A native of [[Umboo]],<ref name="SWD: TRG">{{DroidsCite|The Roon Games}}</ref> a sovereign province on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Roon/Legends|Roon]], the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Auren Yomm was born in the year [[30 BBY/Legends|30 BBY]] to [[Nilz Yomm]], a local [[Doctor/Legends|doctor]], and his wife, [[Bola Yomm|Bola]].<ref name="DB" /> An accomplished athlete by age fifteen, she specialized in the [[drainsweeper]] event, a three-stage relay race performed while riding [[rockhopper]]s, during the [[Roon Colonial Games]] of [[15 BBY/Legends|15 BBY]].<ref name="SWD: TRG" /> While on their way to the Games, Auren and her father Nilz witnessed the crash of a [[cloudcraft]] piloted by [[Mungo Baobab]], a [[Merchant/Legends|merchant]] from the planet [[Manda/Legends|Manda]]. Rescuing Baobab and his two [[Droid/Legends|droids]], [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] and [[C-3PO]], from a pack of meddlesome, albeit benign [[Mudman|mudmen]], Auren invited the off-worlders to accompany her and her father to the Roon Games, where they would be able to find somebody to repair their ship.<ref name="SWD: TRG" />Her [[Umboo Racing Team|original team]] composed of her friend [[Gee Long]] and the droid [[BIX]]. [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Bisad Koong]] of [[Tawntoom]] province attempted to sabotage them by eliminating Long and Bix from the competition, but Mungo Baobab and C-3PO raced in their place and won the championship with Auren.<ref name="SWD: TRG" /> Later, Koong poisoned Umboo province with a chemical agent called [[Rooze Disease|rooze]]. As Auren and her father were accompanying Mungo and his droids to the [[Pinnacles of Felth]], they were not affected by the poisonous chemical, but Auren's mother Bola fell prey to the attack and became ill.<ref name="SWD: TFC">{{DroidsCite|The Frozen Citadel}}</ref> Due to a malfunction on his ship, Koong also fell ill from rooze poisoning and tasked [[Gaff]] with kidnapping Nilz Yomm, who was a doctor, and his daughter in order to create an antidote. Meanwhile, Mungo Baobab, C-3PO, and R2-D2 tracked Governor Koong to the [[Fortress of Tawntoom]], where Auren and her father were being held captive. After their rescue, the Yomms escaped the Tawntoom as Koong's fortress froze and as Koong himself dematerialized as a result of the rooze.<ref name="SWD: TFC" />Sometime after their adventures on Roon, Auren Yomm and Mungo Baobab were [[Marriage/Legends|married]] and took up residence on the planet [[Quilken]].<ref name="IA" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Margo Flarestream
description: Margo "Pepper" Flarestream, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]],<ref name="CRO" /> was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] around the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[35 BBY/Legends|35 BBY]].<ref name="Birth" /> When she was old enough, she enrolled in the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]], but she defected to the fledgling [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] during the early [[Standard day/Legends|days]] of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Enlisting in the [[Alliance Starfighter Corps]], Flarestream qualified to fly [[Z-95 Headhunter/Legends|Z-95 Headhunters]]. Acquiring the nickname "Pepper," Flarestream fought in several [[Starfighter combat/Legends|battles]] and eventually rose to the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Flight Commander/Legends|Flight Commander]]. At some point prior to the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] forces discovered an [[Unidentified Alliance base (Refnar)|Alliance base]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Refnar]],<ref name="CRO" /> in the [[Pakuuni sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]].<ref name="TEA-OC">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> An [[Last Stand at Refnar|evacuation]] was ordered, and Flarestream was placed in [[Commander/Legends|command]] of the [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] charged with defending the fleeing [[Transport/Legends|transports]] and [[Freighter/Legends|freighters]]. It was Flarestream's first [[Time/Legends|time]] in command.<ref name="CRO" />The plan was simple and familiar; Flarestream and her [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] were to [[Space warfare|engage]] and delay the Imperial force&mdash;which consisted of a line [[Cruiser/Legends|cruiser]] and [[TIE/LN starfighter]] support&mdash;long enough for the freighters and [[Troop transport/Legends|troop transports]] to escape into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]]. The starfighters were not expected to defeat the Imperials, but to survive long enough to accomplish the mission and withdraw. Standard tactics were to deploy in a picket line, forcing the enemy fighters to pass through their formation to attack the fleeing [[Starship/Legends|starships]]. However, Flarestream had other ideas. The TIE/LN starfighter had become the standard Imperial fighter, and since its deployment, average Alliance losses during a retreat had risen sharply. Alliance tacticians expected to [[Death/Legends|lose]] between 60 to 70 percent of their starfighter forces and 30 percent of their transports during a withdrawal. Faced with that information, Flarestream decided that she did not like those kind of odds.<ref name="CRO" />Flarestream deployed her starfighters in an [[over-under formation]]. Visually, it looked the same as a picket line to incoming forces but had one crucial difference; one [[Fighter wing/Legends|wing]] of ships would be in advance of the other, allowing the second wing to jump the TIE starfighters while they were engaged with the first wing. The TIEs assaulted the apparent picket line high and hard, striking the first group of Alliance fighters. When the first line began taking evasive action, the second Alliance fighter group struck. The Imperial starfighters, caught in a trap, were systemically destroyed by the older Rebel craft. As Flarestream led her fighters around for a second pass, she watched as the TIEs' [[Unidentified Imperial cruiser (Refnar)|home cruiser]] lurched into action. Usually, during similar engagements, the line cruiser stayed out of range, allowing its starfighter complement to engage the enemy. However, the [[Unidentified Imperial cruiser commander|commander]] of the cruiser was caught off-guard by Flarestream's actions and threw his ship into the battle. Several transports were destroyed by the cruiser before they could retreat into hyperspace.<ref name="CRO" />Despite the cruiser's attack, Flarestream's tactics saved over 70 percent of the fleeing transports and nearly all the starfighters. However, Flarestream was broken by the battle, losing one too many of her friends to enemy fire. The image of the cruiser casually destroying the transports stayed in her mind; the Empire, she realized, had more firepower than it needed to destroy the Alliance, and she began to believe that there was nothing she could do but fight a losing battle. With that in mind, she decided to hang up her [[Flight suit/Legends|flight suit]] and retire from active combat duty, requesting a transfer to a posting that she considered to be "less heroic."<ref name="CRO" />Although removed from combat, Flarestream was assigned to [[Sleeper Cell V-16]], based in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Fabrillan]], [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of the planet [[Malthor]]<ref name="CRO" /> in the [[Tandon sector]] of the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]].<ref name="TEA-OC" /> Flarestream was one of the five core members of the cell&mdash;which included [[Berren Sid Té]], a street [[Merchant/Legends|vendor]] and [[Information broker/Legends|information broker]]; [[Bakku]], a [[Reigat]] enforcer; [[Reginna Bel Typolla]], an information gatherer; and the [[Spek-Man]], a [[Droid/Legends|droid]] expert&mdash;who would occasionally meet to discuss missions and operations that focused on acquiring information and assisting other Alliance operations on the planet. Flarestream, haunted by the guilt she felt over her actions at Refnar, became an [[Alcohol/Legends|alcoholic]] and frequented Fabrillian's [[Cantina/Legends|bars]] as she waited for her orders. Only sober when on a mission, Flarestream descended into a drunken stupor as soon as her tasks were completed. She knew many pilots who were based in Fabrillian and used them to accomplish Sleeper Cell V-16's goals when necessary. When Alliance [[operative]]s not based on Malthor conducted operations on-planet, Flarestream was usually the one to extract them, using her personal [[Ghtroc Industries/Legends|Ghtroc Industries]] freighter, the ''[[Pepper's Hope]]''.<ref name="CRO" />

name: Vansk
description: [[File:VanskBlackguard.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Vansk of the Blackguard]]Vansk was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Near-Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who became a member of the [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-using organization known as the [[Blackguard]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]]. She became one of the most dangerous members of the group and was amongst its leadership<ref name="SoC">{{SWGTCG|set=Squadrons Over Corellia|cardname=Vansk}}</ref> along with the male [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[San'sii]], who was the [[Kursk]] of the Blackguard while she was a member. In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], a [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] [[Archaeologist/Legends|Archaeologist]] called [[Mi Fon Lu]] wished to carry out research in the [[Southern Jedi Ruins]] where the Blackguard were based. Not wanting to be attacked while working there, Fon Lu hired a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] to clear out the ruins and kill all Blackguard inside. Vansk was killed in the ensuing battle along with all other present members of the Blackguard including San'sii, in what became known as the [[Blackguard Purge]].<ref name="SWG:ToO" />

name: Ido Glayyd
description: {{Quote|I'd hoped you might have come to prevent the duel or intervene. None of the other clans will, since they envy us and would like to see us in misfortune. And by the Code, no one else in our clan or its service can take my brother's part. But another outsider may, for the sake of either our interests or his own. That is to say, if it's a matter that directly concerns him.|Ido Glayyd, to Han Solo|Han Solo's Revenge}}The daughter of [[Agmor Glayyd]], the [[Mor]]&mdash;or clan patriarch&mdash;of the powerful [[House Glayyd]] of the [[Corporate Sector/Legends|Corporate Sector]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Ammuud/Legends|Ammuud]], Ido Glayyd grew up being told that she only had one purpose: being a suitable wife for a husband within the clan. But while she was constantly courted by any number of suitors interested in the rich Glayyd holdings&mdash;only [[Kyle Odoon]] stood out as remotely pleasant&mdash;she had little interest in that duty. Her father's sudden [[Death/Legends|death]], due to a mysterious [[Poison/Legends|poisoning]] in [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]], instead gave Ido a chance to take an active role in shaping her family's future. Ineligible to become Mor according to the [[Code of Ammuud/Legends|Code of Ammuud]], Ido instead watched her<ref name="hsc" /> younger<ref name="hsr" /> brother [[Ewwen Glayyd|Ewwen]] take the position, and in turn took her place alongside him as his most trusted advisor.<ref name="hsc" />It was only [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] before Ewwen faced his first major trial as the new Mor of House Glayyd. At a reception, Ido had an encounter with a mysterious offworlder named [[Gallandro/Legends|Gallandro]], who gravely insulted and struck her. Honor dictated that the Mor in turn challenge Gallandro, a famed gunslinger, to a [[death duel]], even though Ido suspected that it was an obvious plot by a rival clan to eliminate the new Mor Glayyd. The scheduled duel was postponed twice in the coming [[Standard day/Legends|days]], just in time for [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] to arrive on Ammuud, claiming to have business with Ewwen. Ido saw an opportunity: although the Code of Ammuud meant that no one in Clan Glayyd or in its service could intervene in the duel, the outsider Solo could step in and allow her brother to save face. Although Ewwen was uncertain at first, Ido begged her brother to accept Solo's intervention as a personal favor, and his assent caused Gallandro to issue an apology and call off the duel.<ref name="hsr" />In the aftermath of the duel, Solo informed the Glayyds of his reasons for coming to Ammuud: he was after a [[Slavery/Legends|slaving]] ring that had cheated him out of 10,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], and through his investigation he had learned that one of the group's leaders, a man named [[Zlarb]], had cleared several of his [[Starship/Legends|starship]]s cleared through House Glayyd's shipping firm&mdash;the Glayyds had kept themselves purposefully unaware of the group's activities, as Zlarb and his associates paid them extremely well. Solo and his partner, [[Hart-and-Parn Gorra-Fiolla|Fiolla]], hoped their hosts could point them towards the ring's connections. Ewwen initially refused, as the provision of the Code of Ammuud known as [[the Silence]] compelled him not to betray their trust, as Zlarb's people had never broken faith with the Glayyds. However, after learning that Zlarb&mdash;a trained [[Malkite Poisoners|Malkite Poisoner]]&mdash;was responsible for the death of the former Mor, Ido and her brother passed on the information that Solo needed.<ref name="hsr" />

name: Yasinda Bardak
description: She was a mainstay of the social life in [[Tasariq City]]'s Paradise Square, doing whatever she wanted to do, whenever she felt like doing it. As the Imperial presence on [[Tasariq]] grew, Yasinda made more and more anti-Imperial remarks during her parties, and even openly questioned the wisdom of the [[Tarkin Doctrine/Legends|Tarkin Doctrine]]. However, few realized that Yasinda was actually an [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] agent who had been recruited by [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] himself for special training. It was planned that she would one day become one of the [[Emperor's Hand]]s, as Yasinda was found to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], but her Imperial upbringing made her refuse to accept the possibility that the Force even existed, let alone was accessible to her. She was removed from the training, but continued her education with the Intelligence agency, and eagerly spent her time on Tasariq searching for [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] cells.The Emperor was curious as to the impact of the native tasar crystals on Force-sensitives, and sent [[Sarcev Quest]] to observe the effect on Bardak. To this end, Quest gave her an amulet containing a tasar crystal, and continued to visit her. Unfortunately for Yasinda, her proximity to the Tasar Crystals re-awakened her Force-sensitivity, and she started to hear voices in her head. This slowly drove her insane, and only her years of training kept her from completely losing her mind. The Emperor refused her transfer requests until his "experiment" was completed.{{Char-stub}}

name: Tuzes-Adaz
description: {{Quote|I don't think you should've done that.|Obi-Wan Kenobi scolds Anakin Skywalker for interrupting Tuzes-Adaz's son's initiation ritual|Clone Wars Chapter 22}}Tuzes-Adaz was a [[Nelvaanian/Legends|Nelvaanian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="CSWEAdaz" /> who had multiple sons<ref name="Databanknote">The [[Nelvaanian/Legends|Nelvaanian]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20110509044345/http://www.starwars.com:80/databank/species/nelvaanian/index.html entry] in the [[StarWars.com]] [[Databank (original)|Databank]] states that the [[Tuzes-Adaz's son|son]] seen in [[Clone Wars Chapter 22|''Clone Wars'' Chapter 22]] was Tuzes-Adaz's eldest, indicating that [[Sexes/Legends|she]] had multiple sons.</ref> and served as the [[Chief/Legends|chieftain]] of the [[Rokrul]] [[City/Legends|village]]<ref name="CSWEAdaz" /> on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]]<ref name="EAOC">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}} &mdash; Based on corresponding data for [[Koobi system|Nelvaan system]]</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Nelvaan/Legends|Nelvaan]] during the final [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic]]. At some point during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]],<ref name="CW22" /> the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]]-aligned [[Techno Union/Legends|Techno Union]] established a [[Techno Union laboratory|facility]] on Nelvaan that [[Siphon generator|siphoned]] the planet's geothermal energy. The chieftain and her warriors interpreted the environmental changes as an illness befalling the [[Great Mother]], a religious [[Deity/Legends|deity]] that the villagers honored.<ref name="CSWEAdaz" /> The village's warriors went off in search of the cause of the drastic shift in climate, but none came home, all having been captured and [[Mutant|mutated]] by the Techno Union.<ref name="CW24">{{CW|24}}</ref>[[File:ShamanBeethoven-SWCWv2.png|thumb|left|250px|Tuzes-Adaz brings the Jedi to the shaman Orvos.]]Near the end of the Clone Wars, in the year [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'' dates the [[Battle of Nelvaan|mission]] to [[Nelvaan/Legends|Nelvaan]] to [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]].</ref> [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] [[Battle of Nelvaan|landed]] on Nelvaan in search of [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]], [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies|leader]] of the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]]. Tuzes-Adaz discovered the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] after they interrupted her [[Tuzes-Adaz's son|eldest son's]] initiation ritual<ref name="Databank">{{DB|species|nelvaanian|Nelvaanian|archivedate=20110509044345}}</ref> by [[Death/Legends|killing]]<ref name="CW22" /> the [[Reptile/Legends|reptilian]] [[Horax/Legends|horax]]<ref name="DBhorax">{{DB|creature|horax|horax|archivedate=20110910194554}}</ref> the young boy had been [[Hunting/Legends|hunting]].<ref name="CW22" /> Remembering a prophecy passed down from the village [[Shaman/Legends|shaman]], [[Orvos]], claiming that an [[Holt Kazed|off-worlder]] would come to Nelvaan and restore the Great Mother to health, she refrained from killing the Jedi and decided to bring them back to Rockrul to meet with Orvos instead.<ref name="CSWEAdaz" />Tuzes-Adaz's decision ultimately saved her people from the Techno Union, as Skywalker went on to destroy the Separatist facility and put Nelvaan back on the path to normalcy.<ref name="CSWEAdaz" /> He then reunited the women and children of Rokrul with their male warrior counterparts, though the chieftain was initially hesitant to welcome them back due to their mutated appearance. However, upon seeing a child approach the mutated warriors without fear, Tuzes-Adaz and the other females had a change of heart.<ref name="CW25">{{CW|25}}</ref>

name: Seer'aa
description: Born on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Seer'aa and Teer'aa were sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] at young age. At some point they killed their master, taking their first steps into the career of [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]].During the aftermath of the [[Jedi Civil War]], the Twin Suns traveled on the ''[[Visionary]]'' with several other [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]]. [[G0-T0|Goto]] instructed them to capture [[Meetra Surik]] alive, informing them that [[Death/Legends|death]] would not be tolerated.They successfully tracked down Surik's companion [[Atton Rand]] while Surik was in the [[Jekk'Jekk Tarr]]. At first, they attempted to get Atton to come with them peacefully, but soon resorted to violence. Atton managed to defeat them and escape. The outcome of the first encounter angered the duo, so they returned to the ''Visionary'', where they waited for Surik and her friends. They finally got their chance just as the ship was falling apart. They tried to kill Surik, but she and two of her companions killed them. Their bodies were destroyed when the ''Visionary'' exploded.

name: Teer'aa
description: Born on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Seer'aa and Teer'aa were sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] at young age. At some point they killed their master, taking their first steps into the career of [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]].During the aftermath of the [[Jedi Civil War]], the Twin Suns traveled on the ''[[Visionary]]'' with several other [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]]. [[G0-T0|Goto]] instructed them to capture [[Meetra Surik]] alive, informing them that [[Death/Legends|death]] would not be tolerated.They successfully tracked down Surik's companion [[Atton Rand]] while Surik was in the [[Jekk'Jekk Tarr]]. At first, they attempted to get Atton to come with them peacefully, but soon resorted to violence. Atton managed to defeat them and escape. The outcome of the first encounter angered the duo, so they returned to the ''Visionary'', where they waited for Surik and her friends. They finally got their chance just as the ship was falling apart. They tried to kill Surik, but she and two of her companions killed them. Their bodies were destroyed when the ''Visionary'' exploded.

name: Harbinger Navigation Officer
description: She served up until her death during [[Darth Sion]]{{'s}} takeover of the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] along with his [[Sith Assassin]]s. [[Meetra Surik]] discovered a series of [[Hologram/Legends|holograms]] of the officer where she spoke with the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] about a mysterious vessel, the [[Ebon Hawk]], and its passengers.<ref name="KOTOR2" />

name: Harbinger Medical Officer
description: {{Quote|We haven't had chance to fully examine it, sir - he looks human, but he's... fractured in several places.|The Harbinger's Chief Medical Officer speaking to The [[Harbinger Captain|Harbinger's Captain]] about the [[Darth Sion|Mysterious Medical Patient]]|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords}}She was another known member of the Crew aboard the [[Harbinger (Hammerhead-class)|Harbinger]] when [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] [[Darth Sion|Sion]] seized control of the [[Hammerhead-class cruiser|Hammerhead Cruiser]]. It has been assumed that she was killed when Sion broke out of his [[Kolto]] tank and said ''"I've come for the [[Meetra Surik|Jedi]]"''.<ref name="KOTOR2" /> A holo recording created by the [[Harbinger Captain|Captain]] contained a recording of Sion's apparent break out.

name: Propti Xaroon
description: Xaroon used to be an [[entertainer]]. When she was young, a conman named [[Andro Hoverdale]] robbed her of everything she owned. She performed for him and Hoverdale stole her family jewels, her [[Identichip/Legends|identity chips]], and all of her money.By [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Xaroon had become a member of the Azure Cabal, a mercenary organization led by [[Loruna Scathe]]. She stayed in the city of [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] where her background as an entertainer enabled her to hang around in the local cantinas and hear things that others could not.In 1.5 ABY, Scathe sent an adventurer to Xaroon that wanted to become a member of the Cabal. But the adventurer needed the endorsements of Scathe's trusted inner circle first, including Xaroon's. Xaroon did her own dirty work and didn't really need any help with her current operations. But then she remembered her belongings that had been stolen by Hoverdale and decided to give the spacer a chance. She gave the spacer the coordinates to [[Hoverdale's Hideout]] and asked the adventurer to bring back as much of her stolen property as possible. Soon the spacer returned and presented Propti's old pouch that contained some of the things that were stolen from her. Xaroon was very thankful and sent her endorsement to Scathe.

name: Gem Sirrom/Legends
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] Sirrom represented the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Dahvil]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]].<ref name="SWSF" />Shortly after the formation of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Sirrom attended the [[Funeral of Padmé Amidala/Legends|funeral]] of Senator [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], who [[Death/Legends|died]] giving birth to her [[Twin/Legends|twins]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke]] and [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Skywalker]].<ref name="db" />Sirrom had a son, [[Jake Sirrom]]. After the [[Declaration of a New Order]] and the dissolution of the Galactic Senate, she took him to [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]] to start a new life. Her son eventually joined the [[Bespin Wing Guard/Legends|Bespin Wing Guard]].<ref name="SWI">{{InsiderCite|148|Rogues Gallery (Star Wars Insider)|Rogues Gallery: The Cloud City Wing Guards}}</ref>

name: Jana Jarel
description: Jana Jarel was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] active during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. She crossed paths with the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]], [[Roark Garnet]], engaging in a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] fight. Jarel managed to wound Garnet in the fight,<ref name="TRG1-13" /> but he evaded another shot from her.<ref name="TRG1-14">[[Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game (first edition)|''Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game'']], p. 14</ref>

name: Hidden Bek lookout
description: She guarded the door of the Beks' base during the [[Bek–Vulkar gang war]], even after the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]] conquered [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] during the [[Jedi Civil War]]. When the amnesiac former [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] along with [[Carth Onasi]] attempted to visit the Hidden Beks' base while [[Rescue of Bastila Shan|searching]] for [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Bastila Shan]], she at first barred them passage. After Revan suggested that he help the Beks in their war, the guard admitted the pair, advising them to watch out for [[Zaerdra]], the [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] of Bek leader [[Gadon Thek]], and to not make any wrong moves.After Bastila was rescued at the [[Tarisian Season Opener]], the guard warned Revan that the [[Black Vulkars/Legends|Black Vulkars]] would be looking for him so they could avenge the death of their leader, [[Brejik]].<ref name="kotor" />

name: Cariaga Sin
description: Cariaga was present during a gathering called by [[Darth Malak|Malak]], around the time [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] decided to involve the Order in the Mandalorian Wars (circa [[3963 BBY]]), along with [[Meetra Surik]] and [[Bastila Shan]], and fellow Jedi [[Talvon Esan]], [[Nisotsa]], and [[Xaset Terep]]. Cariaga herself ultimately elected to defy the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]], and to go to war with Malak and Revan against the [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders]].In the Exile's vision, she wielded a blue [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].

name: Laranth Tarak
description: [[File:JaxPavan SOS.jpg|left|thumb|Laranth Tarak and Jax Pavan]]Born to [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] parents on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Laranth Tarak was identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at an early age and delivered to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|formal instruction]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Jedi academy|Temple academy]]. Meeting fellow [[Jedi Initiate|initiate]] [[Jax Pavan]] during her early training, Tarak was selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and saw very little of Pavan during her apprenticeship, and less and less of her old friend when she was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Studying independently as a Knight, Tarak became fascinated with the teachings espoused by the [[Gray Paladin]]s, a group of Jedi who eschewed the use of the Force and opted to use [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] weapons.<ref name="CNI" />Seeking to aide the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] as a Paladin, Tarak carried two [[DL-44 heavy blaster pistol/Legends|DL-44 heavy blaster pistols]], and her belief in the Grays Paladins' philosophy earned her the disdain of many of her colleagues in the mainstream Order; many of whom considered her blasphemous, sacrilegious, and heterodoxical. Tarak's involvement in the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the massive conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], is unknown, though she was stationed on Coruscant when [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] betrayed the Order by issuing [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. [[Clone trooper/Legends|Clone troopers]] on every front opened fire on their Jedi leaders while members of the [[501st Legion/Legends|501st Legion]] stormed the Jedi Temple as part of [[Operation: Knightfall]]. Aiding in evacuating Initiates, Padawans, and [[Temple employee]]s, Tarak ran into Pavan as he fled the [[Temple district|Temple Precinct]] and into the lower levels of [[Galactic City]].<ref name="CNI" />

name: Jamillia/Legends
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Jamillia came from the southeastern regions of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]],<ref name="dbJ" /> a peaceful [[Planet/Legends|planet]] located in the [[Chommell sector/Legends|Chommell sector]] of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].<ref name="EAWGG">''[[Star Wars: Empire at War: Prima Official Game Guide]]''</ref> Jamillia's [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|predecessor]], after serving two successful four-[[Standard year/Legends|year]] terms as [[Queen/Legends|Queen]], was popular enough that many of the [[Naboo (people)/Legends|Naboo]] wanted to amend their [[Constitution of Naboo|constitution]] to allow Amidala to serve a third term. However, she graciously declined the honor, and Jamillia became Naboo's next elected [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|monarch]]. The new Queen asked her still-popular predecessor to continue her career in public service by becoming Naboo's [[Senator/Legends|Senator]], even though Amidala had reached the normal age for the Naboo to retire from [[Politics/Legends|politics]] and was well within her rights to do so. Padmé agreed and became Naboo's representative in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]].<ref name="AOC" />The membership of the [[Naboo Royal Advisory Council/Legends|Royal Advisory Council]] under Queen Jamillia was apparently different from the membership under Amidala, with the exception of [[Sio Bibble/Legends|Sio Bibble]] and [[Graf Zapalo/Legends|Graf Zapalo]].<ref name="AOC" />[[File:Jamillia.jpg|thumb|left|240px|Queen Jamillia of Naboo]]During the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], Jamillia was one of many planetary rulers who opened up their worlds to aid many [[Refugee/Legends|refugees]] who were fleeing the planets seceding from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref>{{Hnn|52|regional/13418_1.html|Mid Rim Worlds Open Ports to Refugees|https://web.archive.org/web/20130728111133/http://www.holonetnews.com/52/regional/13418_1.html}}</ref> For this she received much criticism, particularly from unions representing Naboo spice miners, such as the [[Naboo Moon Mining Union]], whose main ports became a part of the refugee movement on Naboo.<ref name="HNN" />In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], after surviving a [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]]-backed [[Plot to assassinate Padmé Amidala/Legends|assassination attempt]], Amidala left [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for the safety of Naboo. Jamillia was very worried about the Senator and helped conceal her presence.<ref name="AOC" /> Before Amidala left for the [[Lake Country/Legends|Lake Country]], Jamillia suggested to her that she make contact with her [[House Naberrie|family]], who had also grown very concerned for her safety.<ref name="AOTCn">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones (novelization)|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'' novelization]]</ref> Just after the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], during the run-up to the [[Battle of Ohma-D'un]], Jamillia appointed Amidala's [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]], [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]], as Naboo's [[Ambassador/Legends|ambassador]] to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].<ref>''[[Star Wars: Republic: The New Face of War]]''</ref>In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Jamillia asked Amidala to mediate a dispute between Naboo's Artisans' Guild and the [[Bonadan/Legends|Bonadan]] Silver Sand Consortium. The Queen also offered refugee status to the people of [[Torbel]], a [[City/Legends|village]] on the planet [[Lanteeb/Legends|Lanteeb]] that had been occupied by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]], led by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Lok Durd/Legends|Lok Durd]], and destroyed during a Republic assault.<ref>''[[Clone Wars Gambit: Siege]]''</ref>Shortly afterwards, Jamillia was replaced by Queen [[Neeyutnee/Legends|Neeyutnee]].<ref>''[[The Clone Wars: The Valley]]''</ref>

name: Nayama
description: [[File:JoleeHalfBody.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Jolee Bindo, husband and informal Jedi Master to Nayama]]A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] from [[Ukatis]], Nayama was a member of the [[Ukatis Enforcers]] serving the tyrannical Ukatisian monarch. During her service to the monarch, [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Jolee Bindo]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] traveled to Ukatis on a mercy mission smuggling supplies to the Ukatis citizenry through a blockade set up by the Ukatis government. Opposed to [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] involvement, Nayama was ordered to track Bindo's ship and shoot it down; a mission she succeeded in completing. Bindo was captured and she managed to foil three of his escape attempts while in captivity, though eventually he won her over and they fell in love. Helping him escape offworld, the two were married; although marriage was frowned upon by many Jedi of the time and was deemed unacceptable for a member of the Order. Immediately, Bindo noticed that Nayama was strong in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], which is why she was able to shoot him down. Deciding to train her as a Jedi, Bindo's status as a Padawan and Nayama's age caused the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] to deny his request. Ignoring the High Council's wishes, Bindo began secretly training her in the ways of the Jedi.<ref name="KOTOR" />The joy of Jolee's marriage to Nayama was not to last as the words of fellow Padawan [[Exar Kun/Legends|Exar Kun]] inspired her to join in his dream of heralding in a [[Golden Age of the Sith]]. Urging her husband to abandon what she called "the decrepit trappings of the Jedi" and join her in Kun's war of conquest, Bindo pleaded with her to reconsider and think about what she would become and what she would be throwing away. In her frustration and failure to convince her husband and mentor to join the Sith, she drew her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and attempted to strike him down. The [[Duel with Nayama|battle]] between husband and wife was long and difficult but eventually Bindo gained the upper hand and defeated her; it was at this moment he realized his wife had fallen to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]]. At his mercy, Bindo refused to kill the woman he loved and he let her go. She followed many other fallen Jedi of that time, including [[Oss Wilum]], [[Crado]], and [[Ulic Qel-Droma]] in their attempt to create a new golden age in a conflict which quickly came to be known as the [[Great Sith War]].<ref name="KOTOR" />[[File:Exar Kun Headshot.JPG|thumb|150px|Exar Kun, whom Nayama joined in his dark crusade]]The mistake of sparing the woman would come to haunt Bindo for years to come, as he allowed her to join Exar Kun, going on to kill many Jedi during the war until she herself was slain in the final battle on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]]. The High Council decided to put Bindo on trial for his actions by training Nayama against their wishes and for him allowing her to escape his grasp. Though he was absolved of all responsibility, with the High Council citing mitigating circumstances and that he deserved compassion and he learned wisdom the hard way for all his actions during the war, the High Council decided to raise him to full Jedi status.<ref name="KOTOR" />The decision would come to haunt Bindo because he believed he deserved to be punished and that the Jedi forgave him; however, he could never forgive himself. According to him, that was when the Jedi left him, and that was where they failed him. Filled with sadness for the loss of his wife, he decided to leave the Jedi and head for the uncivilized parts of the galaxy. It was on his way that his ship was damaged in an [[Asteroid belt|asteroid field]] and he ended up in the [[Shadowlands/Legends|Shadowlands]] of [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], where he decided to exile himself.<ref name="KOTOR" />

name: Jeigh Esse
description: Jeigh Esse was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Stellan (species)|Stellan]], who was born with an aggressive temperament. As this was at odds with the passive nature of the Stellan, she was launched off [[Stellan (planet)|her homeworld]] and into [[Realspace/Legends|space]], as was the custom for her people whenever a child proved to be particularly menacing. She was later discovered by [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] and raised by them. Esse eventually became a bounty hunter as well.<ref name="daa" />

name: Tanda Pryl
description: During the period between the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] and the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], Captain Tanda Pryl was an attractive woman in her late thirties. She had blond hair that she wore in a large braid down her back and had brilliant cobalt blue eyes. Tanda came from a privileged family which taught her the subtle art of manipulating and influencing people. Her father's influence ensured that she was accepted into the Naval academy, although it was her ability that allowed for her meteoric rise through the ranks.<ref name="PoG3" />Captain Pryl's Star Destroyer was reasigned to [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader's]] [[Death Squadron/Legends|Death Squadron]] for the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]. Pryl survived the battle but refused to obey the new fleet commander, [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]], after the battle. She decided to return in the Elrood sector with her ship.<ref name="TEGTW">''[[The Essential Guide to Warfare]]''</ref>Tanda was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] in addition to her other gifts and believed that they were often found on backwater [[Planet/Legends|worlds]].<ref name="PoG3" />

name: Palmer (female)
description: {{Quote|The tractors nabbed me. I need help here. I can't escape. Where's my cover? Aaaaah!|Palmer's last words|Star Wars: Episode I: Battle for Naboo}}Palmer was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] individual born on the peaceful [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] and had become an [[Officer/Legends|officer]] in the [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Forces]]<ref name="Star Wars: Battle for Naboo" /> by [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]].<ref name="The New Essential Chronology" /> When the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invaded]] her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], she was captured during the first [[Fall of Theed|stages]] of the [[Invasion/Legends|invasion]]. She was later rescued by fellow officer [[Gavyn Sykes]].<ref name="The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia" /> At the [[Time/Legends|time]] of [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala's]] return from [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]&mdash;the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] planet of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]]&mdash;where the Queen was trying to end the invasion in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]], Palmer was stationed at a Naboo [[Naboo Resistance|resistance]] [[Naboo airbase|base]] on the south ridge of the capital [[City/Legends|city]] of Naboo, [[Theed/Legends|Theed]]. The base came under [[Battle of the south ridge|attack]] by elements of the [[Trade Federation Droid Army/Legends|Trade Federation Droid Army]], and she contacted Sykes for assistance. While Sykes was racing to the base, she repeatedly called for reinforcements. Sykes arrived soon after and destroyed the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] attackers.<ref name="Star Wars: Battle for Naboo" />Palmer later participated in the [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|battle to retake Theed]], leading [[Group 2]], a squad of [[Seraph-class urban landspeeder|Flash Speeders]]. During the battle, Group 3 became pinned down in a plaza, and Palmer was once again saved by Sykes' actions. After the rescue, Palmer and Group 3 helped Sykes escort the [[Naboo commando transport|commando transport]] to the [[Theed Courthouse]]. At the conclusion of the battle, she flew in an [[N-1 starfighter/Legends|N-1 starfighter]] with [[Bravo Flight/Legends|Bravo Flight]] to attack the Trade Federation's [[Vuutun Palaa/Legends|Droid Control Ship]] in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] over Naboo, which was controlling the Droid [[Army/Legends|Army]]. During the space battle, her [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] was caught in a [[Tractor beam/Legends|tractor beam]]. As she called for assistance, she was pulled into range of the control ship's [[Turbolaser/Legends|guns]], which knocked out her fighter's [[Engine/Legends|engines]]. Palmer's ship was then shot down; however she was able to crash land successfully on the planet's surface. She radioed an update on her status to Lt. Sykes.

name: Rachi Sitra
description: [[File:Clash.jpg|left|thumb|Rachi Sitra in a lightsaber duel with Namman Cha]]

name: Janildakara
description: When she was young, Janildakara was captured by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and sold as a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] to the [[Zygerrian Slavers Guild]]. She finally escaped many [[Standard year/Legends|years]] later. As she was unable to track down her parents, she joined House Renliss in the hopes that the guild would be able to help her find her family. While working for House Renliss, Janildakara developed an interest in [[Poison/Legends|poisons]]. House Renliss exploited this interest, and her fragile emotional state, in order to turn Janildakara into an effective weapon for the guild's use.

name: Syal Antilles
description: [[File:SyalDress_Union.png|thumb|left|170px|Syal prepares for the wedding of the Skywalkers.]]

name: Teyora Rekab
description: Teyora Rekab hailed from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ensolica]]&mdash;a cold world covered with tundra and [[Water/Legends|ice]]. Like the rest of her people, she became an expert on the matter of [[Plant/Legends|plant]] [[Hydroponics/Legends|hydroponics]]. During the [[Republic Classic era]], Rekab was the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of a [[Starship/Legends|starship]], crewed by fellow [[Enso]]s. She and her crew made their living by [[Merchant/Legends|selling]] hydroponics equipment and seeds. They regularly visited the arid world of [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], where their customers were the local [[Moisture farmer/Legends|moisture farmers]]. While visiting the world, Rekab and her crew were forced to don rented [[coolth suit]]s&mdash;the biological makeup of the Ensos made them abhorrent to the heat of Tatooine, and if exposed to the planet's [[Binary star/Legends|twin suns]], they would be susceptible to heat stroke.<ref name="db" /> In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Rekab was present in [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of [[Boonta's Eve]].<ref name="tpm">[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'']]</ref>

name: Taki (Soulcalibur)
description: Taki appeared on an [[Unidentified icy planet (duel)|icy planet]] in one of [[Galen Marek|Starkiller's]] [[Force vision/Legends|visions]] and took a [[Crystal/Legends|crystalline]] silver-blue [[Soul Calibur|sword]] from his reach. Taki, using the newly-acquired sword, proceeded to fight Starkiller, and the two eventually entered a deadlock. Starkiller spotted an opening in Taki's defense and struck her down with [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]]. Before walking away and leaving Taki for [[Death/Legends|dead]], Starkiller took the sword as his own.<ref name="Visions" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Serissu
description: {{Quote|We're not sure what they are doing there but it doesn't matter, pirates are not welcome here! I need you to fly out there and chase off any Black Sun Pirates you find.|Serissu, to a Car'das pilot|Star Wars Galaxies}}Serissu was a well-trained pilot for the [[Car'das]]. After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], she was based on [[Tansarii Point Station]], in the [[Bright Jewel system/Legends|Bright Jewel system]], along with [[Laetin A'shera]], [[Aleas Rans'ery]] and [[Dartas Pytin]]. Serissu served as pilot recruiter and trainer.<ref name="SWG:Fpm" />[[File:Serissu miniature.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Serissu in her [[M3-A Scyk fighter]].]]Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Serissu recruiter several spacers to become pilots for Car'das. She provided them [[M3-A Scyk fighter]]s and taught them basic [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] piloting skills. The new pilots performed successful missions, including a patrol near [[Station Gamma]],<ref name="SWG:Fpm" /> a dogfight against [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] around an abandoned space hulk, <ref name="SWG:PfBS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Patrolling for Black Sun" on Tansarii Point Station</ref> and escort of a Car'das officer. The new pilots were finally assigned to fight in the [[Battle of Tansarii Point Station]] under the orders of [[Laetin A'shera]].<ref name="SWG:E">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Escorting" on Tansarii Point Station</ref>

name: Arla Fett
description: [[File:Jango's_mother_and_sister.JPG|thumb|left|Arla Fett with her mother]]Born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Concord Dawn/Legends|Concord Dawn]], Arla spent her youth living on the [[Fett homestead]] with her parents and brother, Jango, who was to later be the father of Boba Fett. In [[58 BBY]], when she was 14,<ref name="501st" /> the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Mandalorian Civil War (True Mandalorians)|Civil War]]&mdash;fought between the [[True Mandalorians]], under [[Jaster Mereel]], and the splinter group known as the [[Death Watch/Legends|Death Watch]], under [[Tor Vizsla]]&mdash;spread to Concord Dawn. When the Death Watch began hunting down members of the True Mandalorians that escaped from a lost battle, Arla's father offered Mereel and his men refuge on their farm. The Death Watch tracked them to the homestead and killed her father as her brother Jango was fleeing. When they turned their attention on Jango, Arla witnessed their mother shoot and kill one of the Death Watch members with a [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifle]], only to be killed herself. While Jango fled and would be later be rescued by the Mandalorians, Vizsla ordered there be no witnesses and Arla was to be "taken care of".<ref name="JFOS">''[[Jango Fett: Open Seasons 1]]''</ref>Thus, Arla was believed to have been killed on Concord Dawn along with her parents. Seemingly unknown to anyone else, was the fact that she was spared by the members of the Death Watch, and was held hostage by them. They viewed her as a prize, and branded their logo onto her back. After a while as their prisoner, Arla joined the Death Watch cause as an [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]], and only left them when she got arrested for a shooting [[32 BBY/Legends|10 years before the end]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. While in custody, Arla was deemed mentally unstable and was ordered to be held in the [[Valorum Center]]&mdash;a mental institution on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]&mdash;for many years.<ref name="501st" /><ref name="O66ARCN">''[[Order 66: A Republic Commando Novel]]''</ref>In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], three years after Jango's [[Death/Legends|death]] on at the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|Battle of]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], the former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]-turned-Mandalorian, [[Bardan Jusik]], visited the center looking for [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]], Dr. [[Ovolot Qail Uthan]]. At the time of his first visit, Jusik had walked passed Arla's cell, hearing words that resembled [[Mando'a/Legends|the Mandalorian language]].<ref name="O66ARCN" /> Later, during the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Separatist invasion of Coruscant]], [[Kal Skirata]] and Jusik returned to the center to free Uthan from her cell and upon doing so, Bardan again heard words that resembled Mando'a. The ex-Jedi acted on impulse and decided to free the prisoner, and when the group was picked up by [[Walon Vau]] afterward by a [[Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry/Legends|LAAT/i]] gunship, Jusik revealed her to be Arla Fett, Jango's lost and supposedly dead sister. Arla would go to [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]] along with Jusik and the rest of the Skirata's rogue band when they fled Coruscant following the issue of [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], taking up residence in an old storage room at their bastion home of [[Kyrimorut]].<ref name="O66ARCN" />At Kyrimorut, attempts were made to regulate Arla's medication from the regimen given at Valorum Center, but the dosages were insufficient and Arla attacked Jusik without any provocation. After hearing Arla's story and her insistence that she forget everything, Jusik offered to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to wipe her memory of the traumatic events in exchange for intel on the Death Watch.<ref name="501st" />

name: A.J.
description: A young woman taught under the experimental regime of the Almas Academy during the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] leading up to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], A.J. was instructed in [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] technique under the renowned [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]] [[Jedi instructor|instructor]] [[Kirlocca]]. Showing an intense desire in studying the techniques of [[Jar'Kai/Legends|dual lightsaber combat]], A.J.'s passion sparked many questions amongst the [[Almas Council|Jedi Council]] stationed at the academy. When it came [[Time/Legends|time]] for her to undergo the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]], the Council questioned the motivations that drove her to study this form of combat. Citing her desire to hone her skills so that she could protect others and that she was not wielding dual blades to inspire fear, the Council was appeased and allowed her to continue on and eventually become a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. A.J. was later mentioned within the [[Jedi training/Legends|Jedi training]] manual ''[[Padawan's Resource Guide]]'', which noted her unusual choice of lightsaber specialism.<ref name="NIATM" />

name: Nyreen Vollen
description: {{Quote|It's an occupational hazard if you haul freight. You find stowaways and illegals in your hold, and you hear their stories, and sometimes you don't feel right dumping them out the air lock, and pretty soon you start trying to do the decent thing in a nasty galaxy.|Nyreen Vollen to Kal Skirata, on finding fugitive Jedi.|Order 66: A Republic Commando Novel}}Little is known about Ny Vollen's life. It is known she married [[Terin Vollen|Terin]], but her husband later disappeared, and sometime in her career as a freight hauler she met [[Null-class Advanced Recon Commando|Null ARC Trooper]] [[A'den Skirata|A'den]]. After [[Alpha-30|Sull]] was captured by [[Darman Skirata|Darman]] and [[Atin Skirata|Atin]] and brought back to their camp on [[Gaftikar]], A'den tasked her with moving Sull offworld.<ref name="RC:TC" /> He later introduced Ny to his family when they were looking for a means to investigate [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]]. She agreed to help them in their investigation in exchange for help in discovering her husband's fate. A'den did find out what had become of her husband, and she was happy to have the closure.<ref name="Order66">''[[Order 66: A Republic Commando Novel]]''</ref>At the culmination of the Clone Wars, Nyreen became involved in transporting refugees to [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]], connecting them with [[Kal Skirata]]. She delivered [[Etain Tur-Mukan]]'s body home, as well as [[Yayax Squad]], [[CC-3388/0021|Levet]] and brought two Jedi who needed refuge. One of the Jedi was [[Tallisibeth Enwandung-Esterhazy]], also known as "Scout". The other was of particular interest to Kal: [[Kina Ha]], a [[Kaminoan/Legends|Kaminoan]] Jedi, who was genetically engineered to have a dramatically increased lifespan. Unbeknownst to Ny, Kal planned to use Kina Ha's DNA in his search for a cure for the clones' rapid aging; she was known to have genuinely loved the [[Strill]] [[Lord Mirdalan]], happily allowing it to slobber all over her and lay in her lap. Against her knowledge, the Jedi underground listed her as a sympathizer, most likely knowing that she had helped return Etain to Mandalore. She also took the Nulls to Coruscant with her on the mission to retrieve Darman and [[Niner Skirata]], and scolded them for disliking the Spaarti grown clones, saying they were all brothers.Because of Ny's work at the close of the Clone Wars, many clones would find a second chance for life on Mandalore, and a few Jedi were transported to safer parts of the galaxy.

name: Mallie Marek
description: Before marrying into the [[House of Marek|Marek family]], Mallie fought for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. [[Jedi training/Legends|Trained]] as a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Knight]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], she and her fellow [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] were commissioned to serve as [[Jedi Commander/Legends|commanders]] and [[Jedi General/Legends|generals]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. While fighting against [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Talus/Legends|Talus]], Mallie became acquainted with a fellow Jedi Knight named [[Kento Marek]].<ref name="Databank" /><ref name="SWDB_Starkiller">{{DB|character|starkiller|Starkiller (Darth Vader's Secret Apprentice)|archivedate=20110913113406}}</ref>Unlike Mallie, who had no interest in fame and glory through war, Marek was a thrill-seeking young Jedi that yearned to make a great name for himself on the battlefield. Regardless of their different views on the war, the two Jedi gradually developed a rapport with each other. Even though infatuation and especially love were expressly forbidden by the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]], Kento and Mallie developed feelings for one another.<ref name="Databank" /> Their mutual attraction culminated into a secret marriage, thus forcing them both into a self-imposed exile as the Order continued to fight on behalf of the Republic.<ref name="SWDB_Starkiller" /> Disguising themselves as a pair of medics, the two former Jedi abandoned the Clone Wars and escaped into the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] in order to forge a new life together.<ref name="Databank" />When the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], the true persona of [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Chancellor]] Palpatine, issued [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]], thousands of Jedi officers were murdered by their own [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]]. Sidious used the opportunity to reorganize the Republic into the first [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Under his [[New Order/Legends|New Order]], every single Jedi&mdash;including ex-Jedi&mdash;were targeted for extermination. In order to escape from the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic-wide]] [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|genocide]], Mallie and Kento Marek hid on [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] where they were protected by the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiees]].<ref name="Databank" />While living together in their [[Kento Marek's hut|new home]] on Kashyyyk, Mallie gave birth to a boy and named him [[Galen Marek]].<ref name="SWDB_Starkiller" /> Due to her respect and admiration for the Marek family's Wookiee allies, Mallie often told stories of the Wookiees' renowned strength and bravery to her son. However, their time together was cut short when a group of [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]] infiltrated Kashyyyk with the intention of capturing Wookiees in order to sell them into slavery.<ref>''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed: Prima Official Game Guide]]''</ref> In the midst of the fighting, Mallie convinced her husband to take Galen to safety while she defended the Wookiees against the slavers.
