Although extremely reluctant to leave his wife behind, Kento agreed that he was the logical choice, due to his greater knowledge of the area's terrain.<ref name="TFUIIn">[[The Force Unleashed II (novel)|''The Force Unleashed II'' novel]]</ref>As Kento took their son to safety, Mallie charged into the fighting and, using her [[Color/Legends|yellow-bladed]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], killed many Trandoshans with her in the process. Her efforts, however, cost Mallie her life. In honor of his wife's sacrifice, Kento became resolved to raise Galen on his own while remaining on Kashyyyk.<ref name="TFUIIn" /> Yet he too would be killed, thus leaving Galen Marek as an orphan to be raised by his father's killer, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. Galen, having lost both parents at very early point in his life, was too young to remember either of them while constantly trying to survive under Vader's [[Sith training|brutal training regimen]]. Under the codename "Starkiller," Mallie's son became the Sith Lord's [[Sith apprentice/Legends|secret apprentice]] and [[Sith assassin/Legends|relentless enforcer]].<ref name="TFUvg" /><ref name="TFUn">[[The Force Unleashed (novel)|''The Force Unleashed'' novel'']]</ref>As Starkiller grew into a young man, devoid of any recollection of his mother and father, he developed a fierce sense of loyalty to his [[Sith Master/Legends|master]]. Despite years of the brutality and virtual torture that defined the training methods of the Sith, Darth Vader was the closest thing that Starkiller had to a father. Thus, he willingly obeyed Vader's will without question, killing many individuals throughout his short life without mercy or hesitation.<ref name="TFUvg" /><ref name="TFUn" />Galen Marek's untimely demise necessitated Darth Vader's attempts to [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] the dead son of Kento and Mallie Marek.<ref name="TFUIIn" /> But due to the inconvenient unreliability of cloning, the project was held back by consistent failures that produced [[Aberrant clone|aberrant monstrosities]].<ref name="TFUIIvg">''[[Star Wars: The Force Unleashed II]]''</ref> The more stable versions of Galen were undermined by the identity crises that resulted as a side effect of the [[Memory flash|memory imprints]].<ref name="TFUIIn" /> Following the [[Assault on Kamino|Battle of]] [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]], the legacy of Mallie and Kento Marek was shared by their late son's between two surviving clones&mdash;[[Starkiller]] and the [[Dark Apprentice]].<ref name="TFUIIvg" /> Although Starkiller inherited Galen's feelings for [[Juno Eclipse]], he spared no feelings for the dead parents of his [[Prime clone|genetic donor]]. As far as he was concerned, neither Kento or Mallie mattered to him at all.<ref name="TFUIIn" /> The Dark Apprentice succeeded where all of his cloned brethren failed by purging himself of Galen's emotions, with the exceptions of anger and hatred.<ref name="TFUIIvg" />

name: Aeran
description: In [[44 BBY/Legends|44 BBY]], she joined a select group, along with her friend Cilia, Stephin, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]], and [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], flew to Delaware Luna to steal plans on the super-weapon, [[Annihilator (Executor-class)|''Annihilator'']]. However, these weapons did not exist and it was just a rumor that [[Lorian Nod]] was using on [[Junction V]]. Aeran took this step in part of the mission, but not because she was exposed to no arrest warrant, but instead returned to the resistance movement.{{Char-stub}}

name: Devidia Vennsiol
description: {{Quote|One standard month ago she broke into a Safidine Industries laboratory with her boyfriend, Dorbus Kyrullus.|Vennsiol's bounty posting describes her crime|Bounties to Die For}}Devidia Vennsiol was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] the daughter of a powerful local [[Devidia Vennsiol's father|official]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Sacorria]]. As a [[Youngling/Legends|child]], [[Sexes/Legends|she]] was spoiled by her [[Parent/Legends|father]], who let her get away with whatever she pleased, and she quickly learned to get men to do what she wanted using her charisma and good looks. When Vennsiol was a teenager, her father placed her in a [[Unidentified military school|military school]] to try and counter the effects of her pampered childhood, but she continued to manipulate men at the school. Apart from learning to use a variety of weapons at the school, Vennsiol's [[Time/Legends|time]] there was not overly productive, and she left with an unimpressive record.<ref name="BTDF" />Following her time at military school, Vennsiol and a male named [[Dorbus Kyrullus]], whom she had begun dating, broke into a [[Unidentified Safidine Industries laboratory|laboratory]] belonging to [[Safidine Industries]], a weapons contractor that worked with the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. The [[Laboratory/Legends|laboratory]] was working on a series of high-powered [[Blaster pistol/Legends|blaster pistol]] prototypes, with several finished items stored in the facility. Vennsiol and Kyrullus managed to get away with a large number of the prototypes, but Kyrullus was later captured, and many of the weapons were recovered with him. Vennsiol, however, evaded capture and escaped with two prototypes, prompting Safidine to place a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on her head. They offered {{Cr}}5,000 to any individual holding an [[Imperial Peace-Keeping Certificate/Legends|Imperial Peace-Keeping Certificate]] who could bring the criminal in [[Death/Legends|dead]] or alive, with an additional {{Cr}}70,000 available if the prototypes were also recovered. One [[Standard month/Legends|month]] after the break in and a [[Standard week/Legends|week]] after Vennsiol had been sighted in the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]], the bounty was posted on the [[Imperial Enforcement DataCore/Legends|Imperial Enforcement DataCore]] by the [[Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations/Legends|Imperial Office of Criminal Investigations]].<ref name="BTDF" />

name: Erran Sif
description: [[File:ErranOffice.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Erran Sif in her bunker]]According to the [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Bothan Spynet|Spynet]], she began her career as a spy for the Empire. She was instructed to infiltrate the Rebel Alliance, but upon doing so, Imperial agents learned that she was selling both Rebel ''and'' Imperial information to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]. In light of this troubling news, the Empire exposed her identity so that she could be hunted down by [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] or other denizens.Realizing that her life was at risk, Erran Sif fled from her homeworld on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] to the [[Double Worlds|Twin World]] of [[Talus/Legends|Talus]]. Here, she holed herself up in a secluded bunker, surrounding herself only with her most trusted associates. Her associates consisted of a ruthless [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] crew, including a number of [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshans]] and two of her very own brothers, [[Hirsch Sif|Hirsch]] and [[Doak Sif|Doak]].It was believed that an unknown [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] located Erran Sif and executed her, though these reports were unverifiable.

name: Unidentified Nautolan darksider
description: She was a practitioner of the second form of [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]], known as [[Form II/Legends|Makashi]], and wielded a red-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name"COTF">[[Champions of the Force (SWGTCG)|''Champions of the Force'']]</ref> She was a [[Darksider|follower]] of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]<ref name="Campaign">She is a Dark Side scenario character in the [[Star Wars Galaxies Trading Card Game|SWG TCG]]''</ref> and at some point during the galaxy-wide conflict, she dueled [[Jedi archaeologist]] [[Rachi Sitra]].<ref name="FW">{{SWGTCG|set=Squadrons Over Corellia|cardname=Flowing Water}}</ref>

name: Parja Bralor
description: When [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commando]] [[Fi Skirata]] was brought to Mandalore following [[Brain/Legends|brain]] damage sustained at the [[Battle of Gaftikar|battle]] of [[Gaftikar]], she took on the job of nursing Fi back to health - caring for him, giving him physical therapy, and eventually falling in love with him. Parja was endlessly patient with Fi's loss of memory and coordination and was fiercely protective of him even after he regained some mobility and speech. Fi and Parja were married in a traditional Mandalorian wedding ceremony 998 days after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|battle]] of [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] with Parja wearing her workshop overalls and Fi wearing [[Mandalorian armor/Legends|Mandalorian armor]]. The wedding - which took less than a minute - occurred right before Fi, now mostly recovered, left on a mission to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] with ARC trooper deserters [[Alpha-30|Sull]], [[Spar]] and former [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]] [[Bardan Jusik]].When [[Clan Skirata]] deserted from the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] after [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], she lived there with them in [[Kyrimorut]].Parja wore armor of a deep scarlet color. Her chestnut braids were often tied with copper beads.Her name is derived from the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] word "parjiir" meaning "victory".{{Char-stub}}

name: Morrina Reugus
description: After her parents were accused of [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] weapons and executed by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], she went to live with relatives on Brentaal. She started working in the spaceport and worked her way up to the position of senior starport traffic controller. Morrina joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and developed an informal code system using specific phrases to identify ships friendly to the Alliance. Using her position of a starport traffic controller, and working with [[Sarchen Snyle/Legends|Sarchen Snyle]], another Rebel sympathizer, she would ensured that ships bound for Alliance bases were not searched.

name: Ultana Anya
description: In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Anya relayed news about a live press conference held by the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]], regarding another attack by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]' [[Malevolence/Legends|mysterious new weapon]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Unidentified female Imperial Knight (sparring session)
description: During the [[Second Imperial Civil War]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] with [[Color/Legends|blonde]] hair and blue [[Eye/Legends|eyes]]<ref name="Legacy 29" /> was a member of the [[Imperial Knight]]s,<ref name="Legacy War 1" /> an order of [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-users]] who served [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] of the [[Empire-in-exile]].<ref name="LECG">''[[Legacy Era Campaign Guide]]''</ref> In [[137 ABY]], she [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|dueled]] the Emperor in a sparring session on the Imperial [[fortress world]] of [[Bastion/Legends|Bastion]]. The session was interrupted by a [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] call from [[Antares Draco]],<ref name="Legacy 29" /> the leader of the Imperial Knights,<ref name="LECG" /> whose [[Hologram/Legends|hologram]] informed Fel of recent developments during a [[Mission to Had Abbadon|mission]] to [[Had Abbadon]]. Fel gave Draco new orders before bidding him farewell and continuing his sparring session with the blue-eyed female.<ref name="Legacy 29" />Later in the [[Standard year/Legends|year]], Fel and a large group of Imperial Knights were [[Operation: Thunderstroke|attacked]] by a [[One Sith|Sith]] strike force while on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]]<ref name="Legacy 46">''[[Legacy 46: Monster, Part 4]]''</ref> [[Mission to Agamar|negotiating]] an alliance with representatives of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]].<ref name="Legacy 45">''[[Legacy 45: Monster, Part 3]]''</ref> Although most of the Imperial Knights and [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] escaped the planet,<ref name="Legacy 46" /> several were [[Death/Legends|slain]] by the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]].<ref name="Legacy 48">''[[Legacy 48: Extremes, Part 1]]''</ref> Early in [[138 ABY]], the Emperor hosted a [[Imperial Knight remembrance ceremony|remembrance ceremony]] on Bastion to pay tribute to the fallen Imperial Knights, as well as to Antares Draco, who had been captured by the Sith during a recent [[Mission to Korriban (Second Imperial Civil War)|mission]] to [[Korriban]]. The blue-eyed female attended the ceremony.<ref name="Legacy War 1" />

name: Myrial
description: With the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] preoccupied with the [[Mandalorian Wars]], Myrial and her followers seceded the [[Kanz sector]] from the Republic and established the totalitarian [[Argazdan Redoubt]] in [[3970 BBY]]. Her military forces occupied many systems within the region and enslaved those that refused to adhere to Myrialite beliefs.In retaliation for their support for the [[Amaltanna]]n resistance, Myrialite forces conquered and [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] the [[Lorrdian/Legends|Lorrdian]] species. Any attempt from the Republic that she made to reign was soon cut short and was later killed during the [[Mandalorian Wars]].

name: Amm Natejeka
description: [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] Amm Natejeka was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] serving the [[Alliance Fleet/Legends|Rebel Alliance Fleet]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. By [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Natejeka was the [[Commanding officer/Legends|commanding officer]] of the [[GR-75 medium transport/Legends|GR-75 medium transport]] ''[[Treasure Trove]]'', one of<ref name="Freedom No More" /> thirty [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] GR-75 [[Transport/Legends|transports]]<ref name="Essential Atlas">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> assigned to [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]], the [[Alliance High Command/Legends|Alliance High Command]] headquarters on the [[Water/Legends|ice]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]].<ref name="Freedom No More" />Amidst the haste of the Rebel evacuation during the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]] of 3 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|ABY]], Echo Base [[Commander/Legends|commander]] [[General/Legends|General]] [[Carlist Rieekan/Legends|Carlist Rieekan]] ordered Natejeka via [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]] message to take the ''Treasure Trove'' to the nearby [[Bespin system/Legends|Bespin system]] to establish contact with the [[Black market/Legends|black market]] of the [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]] [[Mining/Legends|mining]] colony in order to procure a much needed cargo of spin-sealed [[Tibanna/Legends|Tibanna gas]], or [[Blaster gas/Legends|blaster gas]]. She would be required to return with the cargo to the Alliance Fleet's predetermined [[Haven (rendezvous point)|rendezvous point]] beyond the [[Galactic Rim|rim]] of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] within five [[Standard day/Legends|days]], where, due to dire supply shortages, the Fleet's [[Starship/Legends|ships]] desperately needed the [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] gas. Indeed, Natejeka's mission was of great importance, for which Rieekan provided her with a Cloud City landing permit and four identi-sealed [[Credit chip/Legends|credit chip]] cards totaling 12,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to complete.<ref name="Freedom No More" />First, however, Natejeka would need to safely lead the ''Treasure Trove'' past the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Blockade/Legends|blockade]] of Hoth.<ref name="Freedom No More" /> The Rebel evacuation plan called for two [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] to escort each escape transport past the waiting line of [[Imperial-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Imperial''-class Star Destroyers]] under the protective fire of Echo Base's planet-based [[V-150 Planet Defender/Legends|ion cannon]].<ref name="GG3">[[Galaxy Guide 3: The Empire Strikes Back (Second Edition)|''Galaxy Guide 3: The Empire Strikes Back'', Second Edition]]</ref> But the ''Treasure Trove'' never made it out of the [[Hoth system/Legends|Hoth system]].<ref name="Freedom No More" />Natejeka missed the ''Treasure Trove''{{'s}} rendezvous mark at the Alliance Fleet by thirty-six [[Standard hour/Legends|standard hours]], prompting grave concern from Rieekan, who did not know what had become of the missing transport. The ''Treasure Trove''{{'s}} starfighter escort did make it to the rendezvous point, however, reporting that Natejeka's transport may have been lost among the [[Hoth asteroid field]]. Facing the Fleet's grave supply shortages, Rieekan dispatched a team of Rebel agents to search for signs of the missing ''Treasure Trove''.<ref name="Freedom No More" />The agents discovered the badly crippled ''Treasure Trove'' lining the shallow crater of a giant [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] in the Hoth [[Asteroid belt|belt]], with [[Sensor/Legends|sensors]] indicating a lone lifeform remaining aboard. After boarding the transport's command pod, which glowed only with the dim light of emergency power and suffered from very feint [[Gravity/Legends|gravity]] due to a [[Vacuum/Legends|vacuum]] leak, they found a broken Human form lying in a damaged and still-docked [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]]&mdash;Amm Natejeka, the ''Treasure Trove''{{'s}} sole survivor.<ref name="Freedom No More" />Terror-stricken, Natejeka was dressed in an emergency [[Enviro-suit|vacuum suit]], though the legging had been torn, and her [[Blood/Legends|bloody]] wound there had frozen. Weakly clutching a [[Blaster pistol/Legends|blaster pistol]] and a datapad, which contained Rieekan's message on its screen, Natejeka [[Death/Legends|died]] from her wounds and exposure to vacuum just as the Rebel agents approached her. They discerned from the datapad's readout her identity and blaster gas procurement mission from Rieekan.<ref name="Freedom No More" />Although Natejeka failed in her mission to supply the Alliance Fleet with the valuable shipment of blaster gas, and while the ''Treasure Trove'' became one of<ref name="Freedom No More" /> seventeen Rebel GR-75 medium transports destroyed during the Battle of Hoth,<ref name="Essential Atlas" /> the Rebel agents picked up where she had left off. They successfully acquired the blaster gas from Cloud City and delivered it to the Rebels' rendezvous point in her stead.<ref name="Freedom No More" />

name: Kirraa
description: Kirraa was one of the slaves used as insurance by overseer [[Juhm]] at the Shipyards of Gwori, and helped convince the shipyard foreman [[Mirax (slave)|Mirax]] that he made the wrong decision in giving up [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], and [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] to Juhm. She was also overseer Juhm's personal slave to a begrudging extent. Before the bombing of the Shipyard, she stole back her Jedi saviors' [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] and was granted citizenship to the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] along with the other slaves.

name: Nala Noos
description: As of [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Nala Noos was one of [[Vin Tal'benes]]'s employees in the [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] repair station [[Darkside (space station)|Darkside]]. Because of the sudden absence of the security chief of Darkside, Tal'benes promoted Noos to "acting" security chief. Noos was unhappy with her job and wanted to be assigned to any other post, preferably outside Darkside.<ref name="MW">''[[MidWorld]]''</ref>She did not take her job seriously, and mostly rested in her official chair while assigning newcomers to patrol the corridors. Noos had heard about the [[shadow lurker]]s, strange creatures in the corridors, but tried to gave them little thought.<ref name="MW" />Noos had hear vague rumors of [[The Cell]], a criminal faction opposing to Darkside owner [[Nirama]], but she had really not seen them.<ref name="MW" /> As a security chief, however, she was familiar with the damage they had caused, and disliked them.<ref name="UW">''[[UnderWorld]]''</ref>Nala Noos talked with some undercover agents sent by Nirama to root out The Cell.<ref name="MW" /> Although most people could not relate the agents' short-term presence in Darkside with the sudden capture of the local Cell leaders, Noos, using her security chief background, reached the correct conclusion; however, as she was loyal to Nirama, she decided to keep it as a secret.<ref name="UW" />Noos was then transferred to [[Rothe Gate]], the Organization's main weapon storage asteroid, but she was restricted to paperwork duty as the manager of [[the Office of Personnel for Rothe Gate]]. She regretted this new post. As [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshans]] in Rothe Gate were commonly underachievers led to Noos not fraternizing much. Besides, Noos was a fierce supporter of Nirama, and she suspected that fellow Trandoshan [[Gorssk]] could be loyal to The Cell.<ref name="UW" />A team of agents of The Cell who believed to be working for Nirama entered in the Office of Personnel and slipped past Noos to obtain what they believed to be key information on treacherous elements of the Organization. If Noos was to see the results, she would have believed it to be insufficient to convict anyone.<ref name="UW" />

name: Alara Fax
description: Alara was one of only a handful of non-[[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustans]] to be admitted into the [[SoroSuub Business Academy]], and her future as a wheeler-dealer looked assured until she met [[Tyanna Tymb]]. Tyanna considered Alara her primary opponent for the top position of the year and would stop at absolutely nothing to eliminate her legally. At first Tyanna could do nothing to shake Alara no matter how hard she tried. So, instead of her usual means of using tricks and scare tactics, Tyanna befriended Alara in order to learn everything she could.Alara did in fact have one weakness, which Tyanna learned about in her time posing as a friend. No matter how hard she tried, despite the fact that she was better than anyone at negotiating multi-digit deals, Alara simply could not grasp the Sullustan marketing [[tri-icosahedra theory]]. With the pretense of helping Alara, Tymb gave her a [[Datacard/Legends|data card]] as a study aid. Hidden within this datacard, however, were the answers to the final test.When the final test came around, the hidden programming kicked in and the answers started scrolling across the screen. She was immediately accused of cheating and, with no evidence to prove that Tyanna had set her up and knowing that to say so would look like she was simply trying to shift the blame, Alara accepted the ruling of the Academy and left without her certificate of graduation or any hope of finding employment in the massive [[SoroSuub Corporation/Legends|SoroSuub Corporation]].Despite her weakness in the Sullustan marketing theory, Alara learned much in the Business Academy. In addition to the knowledge she gained in her lessons, she also learned that friendship is the safest place to hide deceit. It was a lesson she would not soon forget, and she became determined to excel beyond anything that Tyanna was capable of achieving. While Tyanna was not naturally outgoing and friendly, Alara was charming and engaging without even trying to be. She chose to use friendship as a tool and weapon, wielding it with grace and expertise that Tyanna could only envy.Because she had a disgrace as significant as being expelled from the SoroSuub Academy on her record, few legitimate corporations would even grant her an interview, let alone hire her into a position of responsibility and authority. Instead, Alara chose to enter into the fringe enterprises, working with people such as [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]], [[Talon Karrde]], [[Ploovo Two-For-One/Legends|Ploovo Two-For-One]], and [[Stridus Darkov]] who were more than happy to get someone of her caliber in their organizations. Her longest association was in Stridus's organization, where she used his trust, friendship, and [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] to bankroll her own private endeavors until she had the means to strike out on her own. It was then that she founded [[Fax Ventures]].She owned several successful investments and operations throughout the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]], and started to gather the resources to expand her influence in a new direction. From the moment she left [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]], Alara continued to track Tyanna's progress. She managed to determine where SoroSuub were going to send Tyanna even before the executives committed decisions to data pads. She determined that the only logical place for someone with Tyanna's talents and ambitions were in the field, in a region marginally under SoroSuub control but with much of room for potential expansion. Alara guessed, rightly so, that the place would be the [[Varada system]] and so, six months ahead of when Tyanna got the promotion, Alara began to plan her own expansions into the area.Alara also knew that Tyanna would not be able to settle for simply a single system, but would want to expand her influence throughout the entire [[Varada sector]]. With that in mind, she began to study the [[Sector/Legends|sector's]] seven systems, searching for some credit-making endeavor of galactic proportions to sink her business teeth into. Not only would such an endeavor make her company even more successful, it would also be her first step toward revenge on Tyanna. Luckily, she found just the hidden gold mine she had been looking for in the form of the planet [[Bestal Three]] and its nearby [[Kadal Asteroid Field]]. Before Tyanna and the SoroSuub Corporation could purchase the trade and resource right to them, Fax Ventures stepped in and bought them.To all outward appearances, Fax Ventures were using Bestal Three to process the [[Aluminite]] and [[Corax Ore]] mined from the Kadal Asteroid Field. While this was a good cover, and the mining was certainly earning Alara a substantial amount of credits, the real wealth lay in the jungles of Bestal Three. This was the only known location for the [[Vortal Tree]], the crusty seeds of which could be used for medicinal purposes to create even more effective [[Medpac/Legends|medpacs]]. Alara started the production of these medpacs in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], putting her into direct competition with SoroSuub. She knew that this would hurt Tyanna's pride to no end, and was hoping it would even disgrace her in the eyes of her SoroSuub superiors.

name: Rhya Taloon
description: When [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] established his [[New Order/Legends|New Order]] in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Rhya Taloon refused to serve the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] and managed to flee after the Empire placed a [[Death mark/Legends|death mark]] on her head. Fearful of facing [[Death/Legends|death]] at the hands of Palpatine's agents, she escaped to the depths of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and became a member of the [[Erased]], an organization that remained secret by destroying IDs and data.<ref name="LOTJU" />Shortly afterwards, Taloon and the Erased encountered a former [[Padawan/Legends|Jedi Padawan]] named [[Ferus Olin]] and they agreed to help him and [[Trever Flume]] to find [[Fy-Tor-Ana|Solace]]. However, [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] were able to discover the location and attack one of the Erased's bases in which Taloon was killed.<ref name="LOTJU" />

name: Didina Lippinoss
description: {{Quote|Really, you'd think the woman would understand that her very existence is on the line. Then again, I wonder if she'd say the same about me?|Crev Bombaasa|Star Wars Galaxies}}Operating from an office in a hotel in [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]], on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], Didina Lippinoss was a small-time criminal who performed various services for [[Karrek Flim]], a [[Viceprex/Legends|Viceprex]] of the [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority]], and was romantically linked with Flim. Under Flim's direction, she did "work that he'd prefer not to be seen doing," as it was kindly phrased by [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Crev Bombaasa/Legends|Crev Bombaasa]].<ref name="SWG" />At some point between [[1 ABY/Legends|1.5 ABY]] and [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Lippinoss hired a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to recover some records that implicated Flim in the environmentally unfriendly business practice of leveling several old-growth forests in the [[Corellian system]]. She adamantly proclaimed to the spacer that these records were forged, and directed him to discreetly find [[Bin Huusir]], the [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]] who possessed the files, and return them to her. Huusir made no attempt to speak to the spacer, instead shooting at him on sight. After defeating Huusir, the spacer returned the data to Lippinoss, and received payment and her gratitude.<ref name="SWG" />Lippinoss failed to realize, however, that the spacer was in no way loyal to her, and was willing to take a job from Crev Bombaasa to blackmail her. Bombaasa, in the service of [[Shalera]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]], wished to gather incriminating evidence against Viceprex Flim, and had Lippinoss followed. He then hired the spacer to convey the results of this surveillance from his [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] informant, [[Sli'woon Biul]], who was located outside Tyrena, back to Bombaasa in the [[Tyrena cantina]].<ref name="SWG" />The report, which Biul described as "quite entertaining," was satisfactory to Bombaasa. He believed it would create interesting gossip in the community if he released it on Shalera's orders, which he would do if the Viceprex failed to satisfy the Hutt. In addition, Bombaasa believed that presenting a copy of the report to Lippinoss herself would compel her to give him secret data from the Corporate Sector Authority in order to prevent its release. Bombaasa directed the spacer to a clandestine meeting with [[Meeko]], Lippinoss's servant, on the outskirts of Tyrena. Meeko received the document, but warned the spacer that her employer would not comply with any blackmail attempts.<ref name="SWG" />The warning proved to be accurate, and Lippinoss did not cooperate with Bombaasa's demands. Instead, she hired a [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Morrng]] to kill Bombaasa. Bombaasa paid the spacer to "remove" Morrng, which he accomplished just outside Tyrena. After Morrng was eliminated, Bombaasa expressed his frustration at Lippinoss's actions, and his expectation that only one of them would emerge from their conflict alive.<ref name="SWG" /> Despite the threat posed by Lippinoss, Bombaasa continued to grow in power and survived until at least [[29 ABY/Legends|29 ABY]].<ref name="TUF">''[[The New Jedi Order: The Unifying Force]]''</ref>

name: Ari Melast
description: In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Melast was involved in an operation to weaken Nirama by framing some of his loyal agents in [[Rothe Gate]], his main weapon storage asteroid. To this end, The Cell re-programmed Nirama's former protocol droid [[N3-A2]], deceived Nirama's master of properties [[Jobril]], and forged some proofs linking the loyal employees with The Cell. When Nirama went to Rothe Gate personally, The Cell tried to assassinate him there and then, and staged a distraction using N3-A2 as a walking bomb; Melast was personally involved in the customization of the droid. The attempted coup failed. Nirama discovered Melast's implication and ordered his right-hand man [[Len Markus]] to capture her.

name: Joni Ree
description: Joni Ree was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] who worked for the arms manufacturer [[Czerka Arms/Legends|Czerka Corporation]] during the [[Jedi Civil War]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]]. She was stationed at [[Czerka 431]], a secret Czerka research facility that was located at the edge of the [[The galaxy/Legends|known galaxy]],<ref name="Czerka 421" /> and she acted as the base's chief [[Administrator/Legends|administrator]].<ref name="Permanent Demotion" /> During the war, Czerka engaged in dealings with the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] Empire. The Sith military took direct control of Czerka 431, and Ree was placed in charge of experimenting with [[Juggernaut war droid]]s on behalf of the Sith. Ree soon took a dislike to her new masters, and, to discourage her from escaping, the Sith locked her up and assigned a [[Mark IV assault droid|heavy assault droid]] to guard her quarters while she continued with her work. However, the Sith considered Ree to be so important that the [[Troop/Legends|troops]] stationed at Czerka 431 were ordered not to [[Death/Legends|kill]] her under any circumstances.<ref name="Czerka 421" />Eventually, Ree covertly revealed the location of Czerka 431 to the Republic, then made plans to escape in the event of a Republic attack on the installation. To that end she developed a device that would revive her if she was [[Stun/Legends|stunned]], because she realized that if she tried to flee, the Sith would seek to incapacitate, rather than kill, her. As Ree had hoped, the Republic soon [[Battle of Czerka 431|dispatched]] a [[Squad/Legends|squad]] of troops to Czerka 431 to prevent the Sith from developing a new weapon, by rescuing Ree and denying the Sith of her services. When the Republic troops entered the facility, Ree broke out of her quarters and, with the help of two re-programmed Juggernaut [[Droid/Legends|droids]], attacked her Sith guards. The Republic attack was successful, and Ree departed from the base with the squad.<ref name="Czerka 421" />Ree entered the service of the Republic and was sent to secure some data files from [[AB-343]], a Czerka laboratory that had been captured by the Republic early in the war. However, Czerka and the Sith feared that the information stored in the outpost could reveal to the Republic the full extent of their relationship, so they sent a [[Sith assassin/Legends|Sith assassin]] to the base to kill Ree. The [[GenoHaradan]],<ref name="Permanent Demotion" /> an independent [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] guild,<ref name="KOTOR">''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic]]''</ref> also believed that it did not serve their purposes for the Republic to learn of Czerka's alliance with the Sith, and they independently sent an [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] of their own to silence Ree. The scientist arrived at AB-343's command center, and, with assistance from three Republic guards, she attempted to access the laboratory's damaged [[Computer/Legends|computer]] system. Shortly afterward, the two assassins [[Skirmish in AB-343|infiltrated]] the base and attacked Ree and the guards.<ref name="Permanent Demotion" />

name: Nar Chan
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] named Nar Chan was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] at some point<ref name="Shadows" /> prior to the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[38 BBY/Legends|38 BBY]]. By then,<ref name="Date" /> she was a [[Dreamdancer]] and had lived at an apartment complex known as [[Poloda Place]], which was located on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. While staying at Poloda Place, Chan held bacchanals inside the court of the apartment complex, each of which lasted for a [[Standard week/Legends|week's]] [[Time/Legends|time]]. By [[18 BBY/Legends|18 BBY]],<ref name="TERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> these events were still viewed as infamous, and many considered Chan to be very immoral. Around that year, the [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] [[Journalist/Legends|reporter]] [[Den Dhur]] thought about Chan and her bacchanals while he was in Poloda Place, remembering the [[Artist/Legends|artistic]] individuals who had lived there due to its perceived safety, spacious living areas, and low rent.<ref name="Shadows" />

name: Talia Moonseeker
description: Talia Moonseeker was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Aargauun]] who lived during the last [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. By virtue of her [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitivity]], Moonseeker was accepted by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. She was chosen as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] learner by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Va'too]] and passed the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]]<ref name="WS" /> around [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="TNEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> becoming a full [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="WS" />Four [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after Moonseeker was promoted to the rank of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knight, fellow Knight Obi-Wan Kenobi was captured by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] during a mission on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] and sentenced to [[Death/Legends|death]]. Both Moonseeker and her former Master were part of a [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] assembled by Jedi Master [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] to rescue the trio. However, the rescue mission turned into a [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|full-scale battle]] with the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]], and while Moonseeker survived the engagement&mdash;which marked the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]&mdash;Va'too was killed in action. After the Republic victory in the battle, Moonseeker returned to the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|execution arena]], where the fight began, and mourned her old Master, before ensuring that the body was carried away from the battlefield.<ref name="WS" />

name: Feena Ghel
description: When [[Kaeline Ungasan]] began his project of the [[Ungasan Cross Country]] [[Podracing/Legends|podracing]] course, Ghel was trying to sell an [[Ubrikkian Industries/Legends|Ubrikkian]] [[9000 Z001 landspeeder]], customized to operate in the frozen conditions of Ando Prime.

name: Elsae Sarvool
description: Elsae was born on Romin along with her twin sister, [[Eldewn Sarvool]], to a wealthy merchant. When they were aged nine, a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] named [[Ofar Tan-Doov]] traveled to the planet and noticed their force-sensitivity. He persuaded their parents to let him take them back to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] with him, so that they could be trained and inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. However, as he left the planet with them aboard his ship, a [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonator]] that had been concealed aboard it by a local crimelord exploded. Tan-Doov was killed, but Elsae and her sister were able to escape in an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]]. They made their way home, but the crime lord had burned their house down and killed their parents.The twins were forced to live in the slums of Romin, where they began to develop a hatred of the Jedi for trying to take them away and the crime lord, for killing their parents. Life was not easy for them, as the crime lord had posted a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on them, while the Jedi had also vowed to find them, as Tan-Doov's reports had suggested that they could be very dangerous without proper training.

name: Eldewn Sarvool
description: Eldewn Sarvool was born on [[Romin]] along with her twin sister, [[Elsae Sarvool]], to a wealthy merchant. When they were nine [[Standard year/Legends|years]] old, a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] named [[Ofar Tan-Doov]] traveled to the planet and noticed their [[Force-sensitive/Legends|affinity]] for [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Tan-Doov persuaded their parents to let him take them back to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], so that they could be trained and inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. However, as he left the planet with them aboard his ship, a [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonator]] that had been concealed aboard it by a local crimelord exploded. Tan-Doov was killed, but Eldewn and her sister were able to survive in an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]]. They made their way home, but the crime lord had burned their house down and killed their parents.The twins were forced to live in the slums of Romin, where they began to develop a hatred of the Jedi for trying to take them away, and the crime lord for killing their parents. Life was not easy for them, as the crime lord had posted a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on them, while the Jedi had also vowed to find them, as Tan-Doov's reports had suggested that they could be very dangerous without proper training.

name: Halle
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], when Acherin joined sides with the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Halle, along with her husband and many civilians refused to support the Separatists and fought for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. However, when the war ended in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], the Republic was reorganized into the first [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] under the rule of [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]. Halla and the people of Acherin fought against the Empire which led to a civil war.In [[18 BBY/Legends|18 BBY]], Halle and her husband were visited by [[Clive Flax]] when he arrived on the planet after the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], looking for information on the rebel known as [[Flame]]. Saying at first that he was looking for Alder's sister, [[Vira]], who had died in the fighting that engulfed the planet's population, he gained their trust. Halle told Clive what she knew about Flame, whom she believed had grown up in the city of [[Sood]].

name: Sunchoo
description: {{Quote|Crovan Dane? He calls himself a bounty hunter, but he is really nothing more than a slaver. That black-hearted cur is the one who stole me from my village!|Sunchoo|The Clone Wars: Decide Your Destiny: The Way of the Jedi}}[[File:Kasyyykunleashed.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Kashyyyk, where Sunchoo was kidnapped and sold into a life of slavery]]Sunchoo was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]]<ref name="Jedi" /> born around [[64 BBY/Legends|64 BBY]]<ref name="age" /> who lived on the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]]<ref name="db">{{DB|location|kashyyyk|Kashyyyk|archivedate=20110910202745}}</ref> jungle [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] before and during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]-wide conflict fought between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. At some point, Sunchoo was kidnapped from [[Sunchoo's village|her village]] by [[Crovan Dane]], a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]]. She was eventually sold as a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] to the [[Diplomat/Legends|diplomat]] [[Gama Bankor]], a [[Neimoidian/Legends|Neimoidian]] member of the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]].<ref name="Jedi" /> In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="Annual 2011">''[[Star Wars Annual 2011]]''</ref> she was already in Bankor's possession, and the Neimoidian's [[IG-100 MagnaGuard/Legends|IG-100 MagnaGuards]] attempted to force Sunchoo onto [[Crovan Dane's starship|his starship]].<ref name="Jedi" />{{RPG}}Also at the [[Kashyyyk Royal City]] [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] while Sunchoo was being taken away were [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Bant Eerin/Legends|Bant Eerin's]] [[Bant Eerin's Padawan|Padawan]] and his [[Jedi Initiate|youngling]] friend [[Jaylen Kos]]. Noticing the captive Wookiee, they confronted Bankor about his [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoner]], and he begrudgingly let Sunchoo go free. Sunchoo then aided the young [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] pair with their search for Crovan Dane in order to pay off the [[Life debt/Legends|life debt]] she now owed them for saving her.<ref name="Jedi" />{{Endgame}}

name: Regera Girawn
description: Growing up on the remote and forgotten [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Kruskan]], Girawn lived in relative tranquility until she came into contact with a [[Sith holocron (Kruskan)|Sith holocron]] found by her servants. Being burnt by the device as it destroyed itself, she became mad, haunted by [[Force vision/Legends|visions]] and terrifying her subjects. She was deposed, fled to the opposite side of the planet, and lived in secrecy, honing her [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-skills.<ref name="RGFW" />Foreseeing the first contact between her people and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Girawn made her way to the contact site, and enslaved the Republic exploration team. She used the ship to flee the planet, and went on a [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy-wide]] exploration, searching for other [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitives]] to join her.<ref name="RGFW" />After [[Death/Legends|killing]] two [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]], their [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]], and many civilians on several dozens of worlds, she gained the attention of both local planetary governments and the Republic and was targeted by the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]].<ref name="RGFW" />Despite being pursued by [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]], Girawn enjoyed battling them, and often laid traps for her pursuers.<ref name="RGFW" />Following her transformation, Girawn still enjoyed a pampered life, and retained acolytes and bounty hunters that saw to her every need.<ref name="RGFW" />

name: Noy Waglla
description: Waglla successfully sneaked through the defenses of [[Colony Four]] on [[Ylesia/Legends|Ylesia]] and made it to the dormitories where a few of the [[t'landa Til]] priests resided. There she placed small drops of the poison [[srejptan]] on the lips of the sleeping priests, killing the large sentients before they could awake from their slumber. She was only one of many of Jabba the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] assassins that would prepare the world for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] invasion that would later be called the [[Battle of Ylesia]].

name: Kiara Olvidan
description: Kiara Olvidan was born in about 34 ABY to Faskus Olvidan and an unknown mother, probably on Drewwa. When she was approximately six, her father, a small time criminal, was hired by Lumiya to steal the Amulet of Kalara and take it to the planet Ziost. Faskus was instructed to go alone, but took Kiara with him. They flew there in a YT-2400 freighter. When they arrived Faskus went into the forest, leaving Kiara in the ship. A TIE fighter flew in and blew up the ship, but Faskus was able to rescue her. Unfortunately he suffered a fatal chest wound from flying wreckage. They had been sent to Ziost and attacked as part of an elaborate plot to test whether Ben Skywalker was capable of being a Sith, set up by Lumiya and Jacen Solo, soon to be Darth Caedus. Ben, under the impression that Kiara's father was a Sith Acolyte, attacked him and exacerbated his wounds. He died after asking Ben to take care of Kiara. Ben, reasoning that Kiara would hinder his mission to return the Amulet to [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]], initially left her to die; however, after viewing a prerecorded message from his parents wishing him a happy fourteenth [[Birthday/Legends|birthday]], Ben returned to Kiara's encampment for her. They then covered her father's remains in rocks, as a kind of burial, before departing to coordinates that Ben had found on Faskus's datapad. In their journey across Ziost, accompanied by an [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech]] [[Droid/Legends|droid]] named [[Shaker]], the two were under the constant threat from the TIE fighter that had blown up Faskus's transport, flown by one of Dyur's pilots, vicious wild [[Nek/Legends|neks]], and starvation. The two eventually escaped Ziost aboard a [[Sith Meditation Sphere]] piloted by Ben, who returned Kiara to her homeworld of [[Drewwa]].Ben believed that she might be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]].

name: Ke Len
description: Ke Len belonged to [[Chevin/Legends|Chevin]] [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]] [[Phylus Mon]]. Along with [[Ku-Kak]], [[Mischa Vorfren]] and other slaves, Ke Len was a part of Phylus Mon's security entourage. Lacking any [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitivity]], Ke Len was a gunner, protecting Phylus Mon with a [[Light repeating blaster/Legends|light repeating blaster]]. In close combat, she would maneuver to stealthily attack with a [[Vibroblade/Legends|vibroblade]] or a [[Heavy blaster pistol/Legends|heavy blaster pistol]].Like all of Phylus Mon's slaves, Ke Len had an inserted explosive that would [[Death/Legends|kill]] her should Phylus Mon die for any reason. Ke Len knew that the explosive in her chest could be deactivated if hit by an ion weapon, but Phylus Mon did not allow any ion weapon in his [[Starship/Legends|ship]], the ''[[Animiasma]]''. Ke Len hated Phylus Mon, but did not dare to turn against him.In around [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="20 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], and the adventure ''[[Night's Homecoming]]'' established that by Year 4 of the campaign over a year had elapsed since the events of ''Philology'', ''[[A Mon Alone]]'' can therefore be dated to circa [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]].</ref> the ''Animiasma'' traveled to the [[Cularin system]] as a part of Phylus Mon's plan to repair the damaged [[Sith artifact/Legends|Sith artifact]] known as the [[Darkstaff]]. Phylus Mon was analyzing the Staff when it suddenly disappeared. Seconds later, a team opposed to Phylus Mon's interests burst in the throne room. At her master's signal, Ke Len tried to barrage the enemies.

name: Myda Forge
description: Myda was an inmate on Kessel, the infamous prison world, when she met [[Kassar Forge]], a teacher who instructed the inmates with the hopes of preventing them from returning to a life of crime upon their release.Although specifics about her past crimes are unclear, Myda was reformed and fell in love with Kassar. The two were married and, although Kessel was not where she would have chosen to live otherwise, she remained with her husband and also began teaching there.The two spent the rest of their lives on the planet, rejecting all opportunities to leave, including an offer by [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]] in [[6 ABY/Legends|6.5 ABY]], who was freeing high-profile prisoners to help disrupt [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] operations on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in the months leading up to its [[Liberation of Coruscant (Galactic Civil War)|liberation]].Kassar and Myda had multiple sons and daughters, most of whom continued to live on the planet with them. Among their children were Lujayne and Inyri, who both went on to become pilots in Rogue Squadron, the elite group of starfighter pilots for the [[Combined Defense Forces of the New Republic|New Republic Defense Force]].In 6.5 ABY, Myda and her family were devastated by the loss of her daughter, Lujayne, who was killed in her sleep by [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] during a surprise covert assault on [[Talasea]].She was only slightly less troubled when her younger daughter, Inyri, became the "[[Glitterstim/Legends|glitterstim]] [[cutter]]" and lover to [[Zekka Thyne]], a dangerous [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] criminal, who she insisted upon leaving Kessel with when he was selected by Wedge to be taken to Coruscant.Myda was more adamant than her husband regarding her disapproval of the relationship, and she implored Wedge to separate the two when he took Zekka, claiming she had seen people end up prisoners for making such bad decisions. Kassar, however, insisted that Inyri had to be left to make those decisions on her own, much like the inmates he instructed were left to make their own paths after being released.

name: Neeka Sot
description: {{Quote|Now go. Neeka Sot would be most displeased if she thought that my gift was unappreciated.|Harrar threatens Brenwick Chell with Neeka Sot to make him leave|The New Jedi Order: Dark Journey}}A [[Yuuzhan Vong]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Neeka Sot was part of an [[assassin sect]], which trained her from [[Reproduction/Legends|birth]] to be proficient at quick attacks. In [[27 ABY/Legends|27 ABY]], at the [[Time/Legends|time]] when the Yuuzhan Vong were [[Yuuzhan Vong War|invading]] a [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]] other than their [[Yuuzhan Vong galaxy|own]], Sot served as a [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] to the [[Priest caste|priest]] [[Harrar]] aboard his [[priestship]], disguised as a common [[Warrior caste|warrior]]. That [[Standard year/Legends|year]], Sot and Harrar were near the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Myrkr/Legends|Myrkr]] in the priestship, as [[Warmaster]] [[Tsavong Lah]] had tasked Harrar and the warrior [[Khalee Lah]] with arranging the sacrifice of the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Twin/Legends|twins]] [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] and [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]]. The Solo twins had been a part of a [[Myrkr strike team|strike team]] composed mainly of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], which had been sent to the ''[[Baanu Rass]]'' [[Koros-Strohna|worldship]] in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] of Myrkr to destroy the threat of the [[voxyn]], who were able to hunt Jedi through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]; the team was successful, though the Yuuzhan Vong forces under [[Executor (Yuuzhan Vong rank)|Executor]] [[Nom Anor]] captured Jacen.<ref name="Dark" />Aboard the priestship, Sot brought Harrar a communications [[villip]], which he used to contact Anor about the status of the twins. From Anor, Harrar learned that Jacen had been captured, though Jaina and some of the strike force survivors had managed to escape aboard Anor's personal [[Starship/Legends|ship]], the [[Trickster|''Ksstarr'']]. After deducing that the survivors would head for the area of [[Realspace/Legends|space]] controlled by the [[Hapes Consortium/Legends|Hapes Consortium]], which was aligned with the remnants of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] in the war, Harrar and Lah directed the priestship to that area, and Sot accompanied them. [[Benwick Chell]] and [[Vonce]], deserters from the [[Hapan Royal Navy]] who had become [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and had also joined the [[Peace Brigade]], met up with the Yuuzhan Vong there in order the help them capture Jaina, and it was Sot who escorted the pair to her masters. Soon after the meeting's commencement, Lah became angered by the fact that the pair deserted, as desertion went against his beliefs, and he struck Chell in the throat, causing him to start choking. Lah would have then [[Death/Legends|killed]] the man, but at Harrar's signal, Sot prevented that from happening by quickly bringing the larger warrior to the ground.<ref name="Dark" />The [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] then knelt and offered her throat to Lah, so that he could kill her for the offense. However, Harrar saved her by convincing Lah, who was livid that he did not control all of the warriors, that the priest had ordered it. The pair of Yuuzhan Vong then listened as Vonce told them certain facts about the [[House of Solo|Solo family]] and their involvement with the [[Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War)|fall]] of the world [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to the [[Invasion/Legends|invaders]], while Chell continued to choke. When Vonce was finished, Harrar had Sot kill the man by jumping on his back and breaking his neck. The assassin then cleared Chell's throat for him, before Harrar placed a [[tizowyrm]] in the deserter's ear to aid communication between the pirate and the Yuuzhan Vong. Upon Chell's departure after Harrar and Lah tasked him with capturing Jaina, Sot knelt before Lah because of the offense that she had committed against him, though Lah let her leave.<ref name="Dark" />

name: Pala Kwi'teksa
description: At the Charm Academy, Kwi'teksa was trained in the arts of etiquette and formality, as well as espionage and assassination. She became friends with [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Kitster Chanchani Banai]] at an early age.<ref name="The Hunt For Anakin Skywalker">''[[Episode I Adventures 6: The Hunt for Anakin Skywalker]]''</ref>In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Kwi'teksa was sold to [[Tantos]], a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] who was interested in using her as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]]. At the same time, [[Sebulba/Legends|Sebulba]] arrived on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] to take part in a [[Podracing/Legends|podrace]]. Additionally, he had brought with him several young [[Ghostling]]s that he planned to sell to [[Gardulla Besadii the Elder/Legends|Gardulla]].<ref name="Capture Arawynne">''[[Episode I Adventures 7: Capture Arawynne]]''</ref>Kwi'teksa and her friends freed the children and tried to transport them to safety. However, a group of trackers including Sebulba, [[Khiss (Dug)|Khiss]], [[Djas Puhr/Legends|Djas Puhr]] and [[Gondry]], pursued them. Kwi'teksa and the children were eventually chased through Gardulla's gardens. Although Khiss was killed, they were captured and sentenced to death by Gardulla.<ref name="Capture Arawynne" /><ref name="Trouble on Tatooine">''[[Episode I Adventures 8: Trouble on Tatooine]]''</ref>Due to the efforts of [[Dorn/Legends|Dorn]] and [[Jira/Legends|Jira]], the children managed to escape and Pala Kwi'teksa and the ghostlings escaped the planet.<ref name="Trouble on Tatooine" />

name: Patra Tebut
description: {{Quote|Sir...can't...loyal..."<br />"LOYAL?!  How dare you use that word?!  You may not say that word ever again.  Loyal officers do not betray their command, their comrades, their oaths!|Darth Caedus berates Patra Tebut, just seconds before killing her|Legacy of the Force: Fury}}Shortly after the [[Battle of Gilatter VIII|battle of]] [[Gilatter VIII]], Patra Tebut was working on the ''Anakin Solo'' when [[Ben Skywalker]] docked the [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Sith Meditation Sphere]] he had recovered while on his mission to [[Ziost/Legends|Ziost]] in the Anakin Solo's hangar bay. [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] ordered her to remove all traces of the ship from the records, and that nobody had seen it, it hadn't docked, and for most purposes, the sphere did not exist. She complied quickly and effectively, leading Solo to muse that like [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Lon Shevu]], Tebut was utterly reliable.Following the escape of the ''Anakin Solo'' from [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] after their [[Battle of Kashyyyk (Second Galactic Civil War)|attack]] on that world, Tebut became an executive officer candidate, and began training on all of the bridge stations present on the ''Anakin Solo''. It was Tebut who discovered that the Jedi had placed a tracking beacon on the cloak that Darth Caedus, once Jacen Solo, had been wearing. While upset that he had allowed the Jedi to plant a tracer on his cloak, Caedus was pleased with Tebut's performance, and ordered the ship's Captain [[Kral Nevil]] to place a commendation in her permanent record.A short time later, the ''Anakin Solo'' encountered General [[Tycho Celchu]]'s shuttle, apparently being chased by a squadron of [[Confederation]] X-Wings. The shuttle broadcast all the correct identification codes and passwords, and Tebut allowed the shuttle to land. What she did not know was that General Celchu was not on board the shuttle, instead a strike team consisting of Jedi and their allies were on board. The Jedi infiltrated the ''Anakin Solo'', and were able to successfully rescue [[Tenel Ka Djo|Tenel Ka's]] daughter [[Allana Solo|Allana]] from the ship.After the Jedi had departed, Darth Caedus returned to the bridge and demanded to know who had allowed the shuttle to dock. Tebut admitted that she had allowed the shuttle to dock, but that the shuttle had broadcasted all the correct codes and passwords. Caedus, however, disagreed and began [[Telekinesis/Legends#Force Choke|choking]] her with the Force. Captain Nevil attempted to stop him, only to be telekinetically hurled against a bulkhead. In her last moments, Tebut protested her loyalty to Caedus, but only succeeded in enraging him to the point where he was literally seeing red. Finally, after vociferously accosting her for her failure, Caedus snapped her neck and unceremoniously slammed her down onto the deck and stormed off the bridge. This act, committed in such anger, truly bound Caedus to the ways of his grandfather, Darth Vader.<ref name="Fury">''[[Legacy of the Force: Fury]]''</ref>Caedus's Co-Chief of State, Admiral [[Cha Niathal]], was alarmed at Tebut's murder and began considering having Caedus removed from power. However at this point Niathal was still unwilling to overtly oppose Caedus, and refused to have Caedus taken out immediately. Niathal later informed [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] of the nature of Tebut's death and that his nephew was responsible; Skywalker was not particularly surprised that this had happened. Caedus himself would later regret his outburst, having deprived himself of a valuable officer and in turn harming his reputation amongst the ranks.<ref name="Revelation">''[[Legacy of the Force: Revelation]]''</ref>

name: Sena Pakkallo
description: Pakallo was a medical supervisor. She served on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Agriworld/Legends|agriworld]] [[Reuss VIII]] for a short time, providing hygiene instructions to locals.{{Char-stub}}

name: Serra Hailey
description: Serra Hailey was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Holovid/Legends|holovid]] [[Actor/Legends|actress]] during the time of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|6|Hailey, Serra}}</ref> In [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Hailey was attempting to revive her holovid career, which made the [[NewsNet]] headlines.<ref name="GNN3" /> By [[10 ABY/Legends|10 ABY]], she had achieved her goal, starring in a number of maxi-series although some did consider her to be a little over the hill and a diva.<ref name="RFC">{{Journal|7|Retreat from Coruscant}}</ref>

name: Tresten Agai'i
description: Brought into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at an unknown age, Agai'i was trained under the experimental curriculum of the [[Almas Academy]], which allowed older students into its ranks. Eventually passing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] put forth by the [[Almas Council]] and acknowledged by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on Coruscant, Agai'i was elevated to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="AMA" />Well respected by her peers, Agai'i was an expert with a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and notorious for her fighting courage. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] engulfed [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], the High Council on Coruscant issued an order to the academy's Masters, demanding that all non-essential personnel be sent to the [[Jedi Temple]] to receive assignment within the ranks of the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Outraged by the High Council's decision to engage the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] in all out war, Agai'i refused the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|General]] and remained in the [[Cularin system]], performing missions solely from the Almas Council.<ref name="AMA" />Giving the Knight a hefty assignment, the Council ordered her to the abandoned [[Almas Sith fortress|fortress]] of [[Darth Rivan]] with a research team of fourteen Jedi. The fortress had been captured by the Jedi but had not been completely explored as the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] was imbued in the very stones of the structure. The Jedi were not the only ones who wanted to explore the fortress, the dark side cultists known as the [[Believers]] wished to possess the ancient knowledge within the structure for their malevolent uses. Accompanied by five of her fellow Knights, Agai'i took to protect the structure from imminent attack. Taking up a defensive position on the southern entrance to the fortress, Agai'i and the other guards waited as the research team explored the edifice.<ref name="AMA" />While the team was inside, a sandstorm provided cover for [[Phylus Mon]], his nine adepts, and their giant [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Wampa/Legends|Wampa]]. The ambush was successful, Agai'i and the other Jedi guarding the fortress were overwhelmed and slain, leaving the fortress and the research team vulnerable. Performing a ritual in the heart of the fortress, the adepts avoided the research team which were occupied trying to raise the academy through the storm. By the time Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] organized search teams to investigate the deaths, the raiders were long gone.<ref name="AMA" />

name: Faniel
description: {{Quote|Tanquar, he's right. You have your duties. My duty&mdash;the duty of all of us who do not fight&mdash;is to not make your work more difficult.|Faniel|Legacy 32: Fight Another Day, Part 1}}Following [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Darth Krayt]]'s decree that the [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] of [[Dac]] were to be exterminated, Faniel and a group of Mon Calamari descended into the depths of their world's oceans to avoid being killed. The group set up a refugee camp in an isolated area, hoping to avoid the Empire. Faniel had a young child at the time, and she cared for the baby during the flight from the Imperials. During this time, she was watched over by another male Mon Calamari, perhaps her husband, who tried to protect her from the dangers of the deep. Eventually, Faniel and the refugee group she was with were discovered by an [[Acklay-class mobile fortress|Acklay Battle Fortress]], the ''[[Sea Lion]]'', and its squadron of [[Shark underwater fighter|Shark]] subfighters, [[Shark Squadron]]. Faniel's male protector was the first to see the incoming Sharks, and he warned Faniel, telling her to flee immediately. As Faniel tried to escape the Sharks, her male protector was killed by the Imperial fighters and they then began to slaughter the settlement. However, Daniel was saved by the arrival of the [[Mon Calamari Rangers]], who [[Skirmish on Dac|attacked]] the Imperials with their [[Krakana underwater fighter|Krakana fighters]]. The attack was successful, and the Imperials retreated when the ''Sea Lion'' was damaged.The Mon Calamari Rangers brought the surviving refugees back to the [[Ranger Grotto]], their secret base, to recover. Faniel questioned the Rangers' leader, [[Tanquar]], whether they would be able to stay at the base so that she and her baby could be safe. Tanquar initially agreed to allow Faniel to stay, but he was interrupted by [[Imperial Knight]] [[Treis Sinde]], who was aiding the Rangers. Sinde would not allow the refugees to stay at the base, as they had no extra food for them and the increased presence of Mon Calamari might inadvertently reveal the secret base to the Empire. Faniel agreed with Sinde's decision, taking her baby and making her way out of the base. Before her departure, Sinde suggested that she make her way towards [[Soheras Trench]], a crevasse that the Rangers had used to hide their presence when tracking the ''Sea Lion''. Several of the Rangers agreed to escort her and the rest of the refugees, as there had been readings of [[demonsquid]] in the area. Faniel thanked the soldiers for their hospitality, and the group left the base.However, unknown to Faniel and the Rangers, the readings from the Soheras Trench were not demonsquid. The trench actually contained a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Sithspawn|creature]], the [[Sea Leviathan]], that had been created to help exterminate the Mon Calamari.

name: Troax
description: {{Quote|The fight/flight deck is flooding, commander.|Lieutenant Troax to Commander Sturves|Legacy 32: Fight Another Day, Part 1}}Following [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Darth Krayt]]'s decree that all the [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] on [[Dac]] were to be [[Genocide on Dac|exterminated]], Troax and the crew of the ''[[Sea Lion]]'' were dispatched to hunt down Mon Calamari civilians that had fled into the depths of the planet's oceans. The Imperial group eventually came upon a settlement of Mon Calamari refugees, and they dispatched [[Shark Squadron]], a unit of [[Shark underwater fighter|Shark]] subfighters, to destroy the camp. However, [[Mon Calamari Rangers]] under the command of [[Tanquar]], attacked the squadron with their [[Krakana underwater fighter|Krakana fighter craft]]. As the squadron began to take casualties, [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Sturves]] ordered Troax to get a group of [[Aquatic assault stormtrooper|seatroopers]] into the water. Troax sent [[Alpha Squadron (seatrooper)|Alpha Squadron]] to deal with the threat, but they were ambushed by [[Imperial Knight]] [[Treis Sinde]] upon leaving the ''Sea Lion''; none of the squad survived.Sinde infiltrated the ''Sea Lion'', badly damaging the [[Hangar/Legends|docking bay]] and causing the ship to flood. Troax notified Commander Sturves of the ship taking on water, and Sturves immediately sounded the retreat. Troax recalled Shark Squadron to cover their departure, and the Imperials left the battlefield.

name: Aeona Cantor
description: Sometime around [[5 ABY/Legends|5 ABY]], Aeona grew worried when her lover, Nick disappeared. She formed a group of resistance fighters to help in her search for Rostu. She eventually seized control of the famous [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] in an attempt to rescue her lover. Rostu had become the servant of [[Imperial Agent]] [[Cronal|Blackhole]], prompting Aeona to form a rebellion against Blackhole. She was the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the people on Mindor. She had a very hot temper when scouting near the smoking volcano on [[Mindor/Legends|Mindor]].<ref name="LSSM" />After [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] freed Rostu from Blackhole's control, she was reunited with her lover. When she next met with [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]], Skywalker forced her to apologize and explain why she had needed and thus stolen the ''Falcon''. Cantor and Rostu later commandeered Cronal's personal modified [[Lambda-class T-4a shuttle/Legends|''Lambda''-class]] shuttle to track down the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial's]] true body. After getting a message from [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] they rescued Luke and [[Kar Vastor]], another one of Blackhole's [[pawn]]s, from the drifting remains of Blackhole's [[Shadow Base]]. Together with Rostu and Vastor she went on to hunt down Cronal, who Rostu believed had survived.<ref name="LSSM" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Shilaea Motacc
description: Born in [[60 BBY/Legends|60 BBY]], Shilaea Motacc became a scientist and a recognized expert and researcher in her specialized field, large-scale propulsion for both planets and planetary platforms, before she was three decades old. As she had always been fascinated by the unrelated field of archaeology, Motacc also found time to work in archaeological probing projects, getting some field experience. She had already worked as an independent researcher in propulsion for a number of years before [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]].<ref name="hitc" /><ref name="itsc" />Motacc was then approached by [[Karae Nalvas|Fesvk Wefos]], a manager of [[Usable Resource Location, Recovery, and Development Corporation]], with a job offer. Wefos told Motacc that U.R.L.R.D. wanted to expand their operations to the [[Gas giant/Legends|gas giant]] [[Genarius]], in the [[Cularin system]], and wanted to hire her for the development of a new propulsion system for flying cities.<ref name="hitc" /> However, Wefos was really a dark Jedi, [[Karae Nalvas]], who aimed to build a flying fortress with which he could attack and destroy the cities of Genarius. Nalvas used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and his personal charm to convince Motacc without revealing his identity or scheme.<ref name="cp">''[[Clouded Paths]]''</ref>Motacc joined U.R.L.R.D., and was given a vacation in [[Rorkee]], a resort city of Genarius, as a bonus. Rorkee featured simulated archaeological digs with supposed proofs of [[Pre-Republic era|pre-Republic]] aliens inhabiting Dorumaa, and Motacc was eager to visit them. U.R.L.R.D. wanted to send some college students later, to join Dr. Motacc and research with her.<ref name="hitc" />During her vacation, Motacc visited the [[Sanads of Rorkee]] hotel, befriended [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] ringer [[Kli-Klu Niib]] and repeatedly visited the [[Cabana Bar]] to enjoy barman [[Hurrwarr]]'s [[Double-Dip Outer Rim Rumdrop]]s.<ref name="hitc" />Some of Nalvas's business partners were looking for a less-than-licit way to profit from Motacc's abilities, and were ready to obtain her help forcefully.<ref name="itsc" /> They organized a kidnapping to take place during a caused cave-in, with local archaeologist and guide [[Blibbie]] helping them ensure that nobody would be harmed in the disaster. The conspirators, who found jobs in the dig site, would take Motacc to a work area under the Sanads building and retain her there in a prepared [[cage]]. The only access to their lair was through a tunnel ending in the hotel's kitchen.<ref name="hitc" />The capture was a success, even if Motacc had a chance to kick several of the sentients grabbing her. Motacc was secretly confined, and Rorkee's authorities notified her accidental decease.<ref name="hitc" />Motacc's wardens did not want to reveal their identities or any information leading to them. She was kept in a cage with weight-sensitive alarms, and watched by two guards. She was visited by an unidentified hooded male sentient, who said that his master would be satisfied to use Motacc's knowledge to finish his job. Beyond that, she only heard partial conversations with no useful information.<ref name="hitc" />Motacc's kidnappers took her personal effects from the hotel to the dig site, apparently to avoid the kitchen entrance. They also bought all the available Double-Dip Outer Rim Rumdrops from the Cantina Bar, paying in cash but forgetting there the [[Spectacles|glasses]] of one of them. Some of them visited local masseur [[Ulo Enan]] because of their injuries during the capture. Several of the involved dig workers, including Bibble, began behaving strangely. Although Rorkee's authorities refused to answer any question about the happening, or to return Mottac's corpse to her relatives, many locals such as the bellsentients [[Ta'Sen]] and [[Trago Smusch]], believed that Dr. Motacc was still alive.<ref name="hitc" />Karae Nalvas, wanting to recover his minion, pretended to be worried boss Wefos and hired some independent adventurers. Nalvas sent them to Rorkee, where they pretended to be college students sent by U.R.L.R.D. The adventurers eventually found and rescue Motacc, although the guilty people's identities were still unknown.<ref name="hitc" />Motacc and her rescuers traveled to the planet [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where they met the false Wefos again. Wefos paid the adventurers a bonus and partied with them and Motacc in a local bistro, [[Bath Rabbud's]].<ref name="hitc" />Soon afterward, Nalvas's old enemy [[Alec (Jedi)|Alec]], a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], discovered Wefos's secret identity and began hoarding contacts and resources to fight him. Alec stole the blueprints of the flying city Nalvas had been building, ''[[Conkesta]]'' and copied them in case Nalvas could recover his originals. Nalvas unsuccessfully took measures to kill Alec.<ref name="cp" />At the same time, Motacc discovered that some of her new workmates were involved in her previous kidnapping in Rorkee. Scared, Motacc looked for a way to escape. She found or was found by Alec and some contacts of his, who were eager to help Motacc. After discovering Nalvas's true plans, Motacc agreed to assist Alec and his friends in their own plan to stop Nalvas.<ref name="itsc" />Motacc told Alec that the ''Conkesta'' had an important, still-unsolved deffect in its propulsion software: The correct string of commands could disable the controls and sent the city to space, where it would surely explode as it was not spaceworthy. Motacc and several of Alec's [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]] friends worked together to develop a computer virus to cause that effect once uploaded in the propulsion system main control. However, unbeknownst to them, their obviously-untested program would really cause the opposite effect: Instead of catapulting the city away from the planet core, it would make it fall ''to'' the core.<ref name="itsc" />Alec and Motacc met with the [[heroes of Cularin]] in the Bath Rabbud's. Alec wanted the so-called heroes to perform an individual raid in the ''Conkesta'' with the specific purpose of accessing the main computer and loading the virus. Motacc explained the workings of her code, the data she knew about the ''Conkesta'' and her personal motivations in the same briefing. Motacc, who was not a fighter, would not participate in the raid; and Alec vainly tried to stop Nalvas elsewhere while the heroes of Cularin were busy with their mission.<ref name="itsc" /> The ''Conkesta'' was destroyed when it fell to the planet core.<ref name="tons">{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/livingforce/swlf20040408|text=Tales of Nub Saar|int=Tales of Nub Saar|archivedate=20091016004323}}</ref>

name: Tilotny
description: {{Quote|Everything has edges! And&hellip;and things happen one after another! Time! Tilotny has invented time! This is a novelty. This is a first thing!|Tilotny|Tilotny Throws a Shape}}[[File:Tilotny-CSWD2.png|thumb|left|150px|Tilotny takes physical form.]]The omnipotent, transdimensional being known as Tilotny was one of the [[Bedlam Spirits]] who existed in the stark whiteness that digested [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] near the [[Bedlam Pulsar]].<ref name="TEA" /> Generally abstract beings, Tilotny and her cohorts began experimenting with [[Time/Legends|time]], matter, and [[Realspace/Legends|space]]<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|248|Tilotny}}</ref> and, at some point during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Tilotny took on a shape for the first time, materializing on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Bedlam/Legends|Bedlam]] in a form resembling a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]. Although Tilotny was the first of her kind to take on a form, it was not long before other Bedlam Spirits replicated her achievement and Tilotny was soon joined on the planet by [[Horliss-Horliss]], [[Cold Danda Sine]] and [[Splendid Ap]].
