Believing herself to have invented form, Tilotny gladly took credit for creating the world around them when asked by Cold Danda Sine, though Horliss-Horliss wondered if it had already taken shape before their arrival.<ref name="TTaS" />As the group discussed their new forms and surroundings, they met [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Leia Organa Solo|Leia Organa]], a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] who had been forced to land on the planet and was being [[Mission to Bedlam|pursued]] by three [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]. Tilotny claimed to have created Organa too, but when the stormtroopers arrived moments later, she was mocked by Cold Danda Sine for repeating a shape. Hoping to correct her apparent mistake, Tilotny used her powers to alter the form of one of the stormtroopers, crystallizing the [[Trooper/Legends|trooper]] and inadvertently [[Death/Legends|killing]] him. Horliss-Horliss was unimpressed by Tilotny's lack of subtlety and tried his own modification, killing Organa in a less obvious way by turning her [[Heart/Legends|heart]] into [[Diamond/Legends|diamond]] while leaving the rest of her the same. Tilotny attempted once more to modify the beings, merging the two remaining stormtroopers into a single mass of writhing [[Limb/Legends|limbs]] that did not live long. Cold Danda Sine soon tired of the activity, however, and suggested that it was time to leave. Tilotny agreed, but Horliss-Horliss felt that, since Tilotny was the first to take shape, she should clean up the mess they had made of Organa and the stormtroopers. Tilotny refused, however, and instead instructed Splendid Ap to do so while she departed with the others. Splendid Ap restored the beings to life and their original forms, but unwittingly [[Time travel/Legends|sent]] the stormtroopers 8,000 [[Standard year/Legends|years]] into the past.<ref name="TTaS" />

name: Talia (Onderon)
description: Talia was a direct descendant of the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord]] [[Freedon Nadd]]. However, the death of her grandparents broke the sway of the dark side over their descendants, as evidenced by her being one of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic's]] and the Jedi's staunchest allies in the Post-Jedi Civil War era.Before the [[Mandalorian Wars]], Talia made an alliance with the Republic, eventually gaining Republic citizenship for Onderon. This would later cause much suffering and conflict for her people.

name: Darva
description: When an Imperial [[Starship/Legends|starship]] arrived, bringing the [[Great Heep]] to establish a [[Mining/Legends|mining]] operation, she fled as the Imperials triggered a large storm which uprooted [[Tree/Legends|trees]] and sucked all water from the nearby river. With the construction of the "[[moisture eater]]", a tower that drained all moisture from the [[Atmosphere/Legends|atmosphere]], Darva was forced to live through a drought which threatened the lives of all the natives. However, they were eventually saved due to the actions of [[Mungo Baobab]] and the [[Droid/Legends|droids]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] and [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]].

name: Numa/Legends
description: [[File:Numa leads Waxer and Boil.png|thumb|left|200px|Numa leads Waxer and Boil through Nabat]]Numa was a young [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|girl]] who lived in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Nabat/Legends|Nabat]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="IOR Guide" /> One day in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Numa was playing with her friend [[Lubo]] in Nabat's market place while her [[Numa's mother/Legends|mother]] was shopping, when [[Tronda]], a friend of her mother, said that she sensed a storm coming, even though the skies were clear. When Numa and her mother returned home, [[Numa's father/Legends|Numa's father]] asked her why he had found her [[Tooka doll/Legends|tooka doll]] in the tunnel system underneath Nabat, which the Twi'lek's used as shelter during storms. Numa said that tooka had followed a "bright eye" down into the tunnels last night. Later that night, Numa again saw the "bright eye"&mdash;which actually was a [[Separatist probe droid/Legends|Separatist recon droid]]&mdash;and began to follow it. As Numa followed the recon droid into the tunnels system, she heard several loud explosions, scaring the young Twi'lek. Numa climbed out of the tunnels, and saw a large [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] invasion force landing on Ryloth, with the [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] already on the ground taking away the surviving Twi'leks. The Confederacy of Independent Systems had invaded Ryloth and enslaved most of its Twi'lek populace. The Republic soon mounted a bold offensive to invade and [[Battle of Ryloth/Legends|liberate]] the planet.[[File:Waxer and Boil comfort Numa.png|thumb|right|200px|[[Waxer/Legends|Waxer]] and [[Boil/Legends|Boil]] comfort Numa]]While scouting ahead, [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] [[Waxer/Legends|Waxer]] and [[Boil/Legends|Boil]] of [[Ghost Company/Legends|Ghost Company]] met Numa in an alley. Initially thinking them to be enemy droids, Numa was rather fearful of them, even going so far as to bite Boil's finger. However, after the two took off their helmets, she relaxed, even calling the two "Nerra!", and she accepted a [[Ration bar/Legends|ration bar]] from the clones. Boil was initially against helping her, but Waxer, who had developed a little compassion for the girl, worried about her well-being. Numa led the clones to her home, which was now wrecked and practically empty. After Waxer gave her a [[Tooka doll/Legends|tooka doll]], she began to cry, and the two clones comforted her. However, after Waxer and Boil received a transmission from [[Clone trooper commander|Commander]] [[CC-2224/Legends|Cody]], they realized that they were late and had disobeyed orders.As the two clones began to leave, a group of [[Gutkurr/Legends|gutkurrs]] appeared, and they were forced back into the house. Numa showed the two clones an underground passage beneath a carpet in her house, and they entered it, eventually re-emerging near Obi-Wan, Cody and Ghost Company, who had just encountered the gutkurrs themselves. Cody was initially displeased with the clones, but once Obi-Wan saw Numa, he understood what had "sidetracked" the two. Obi-Wan conversed to Numa in Twi'leki, and learned that she could take them to the prisoners via the tunnels. Cody created a diversion, and Obi-Wan was able to free the Twi'lek prisoners, and Numa was reunited with her uncle, [[Nilim Bril/Legends|Nilim Bril]].[[File:TX-20 targets Obi-Wan and Numa.png|thumb|left|200px|[[TX-20/Legends|TX-20]] targets Obi-Wan and Numa]]After Obi-Wan, Waxer and Boil destroyed the [[Proton cannon/Legends|proton cannons]], [[T-series tactical droid|tactical droid]] [[Commander/Legends|commander]] [[TX-20/Legends|TX-20]] appeared in his [[Armored Assault Tank/Legends|tank]] and blasted the three aside. Numa, fearing for her friends, ran over to Waxer and Boil, demonstating her bravery and compassion for her friends. Once they had recovered, she returned to Obi-Wan. TX-20 targeted the two, but before he could destroy them, the Twi'leks, inspired by her courage, attacked the tactical droid and forcefully dismantled him, while Obi-Wan attempted, unsuccessfully, to shield her eyes from the violence.As the Republic forces prepared to march to the capital city of [[Lessu/Legends|Lessu]] and retake it to free the planet, Waxer and Boil said goodbye to her, promising that they would be back. Numa called out "Nerra!" one last time, and Obi-Wan translated its meaning: brother.

name: Valik Kodank
description: Kodank lived during the time of the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]] and was the consort of the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Janton Belos]]. Her spirit was trapped inside the [[Temple of Pain]] and during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she took [[Thaum Rystra]] as her apprentice.{{Char-stub}}

name: Mariineh
description: Mariineh was born on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] and became the [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Silmis Vey]]. During the early stages of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she was on the verge of becoming a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and volunteered to go to [[Argul]] to [[Battle of Argul|battle]] [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]].

name: Binalu
description: In [[25 BBY/Legends|25 BBY]], during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], Binalu supported the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] and fought against an imminent invasion of her world by the fleet of [[Vanqor/Legends|Vanqor]], a neighboring [[Planet/Legends|planet]] in the [[Uziel system]].As leader of the [[Typha-Dor High Council]], Binalu petitioned the Senate that it rush Jedi diplomats to her planet's aid and was intimately involved in the high-security and strategic planning meetings preparatory to Vanqor's imminent attempt to invade. She approved a preemptive countermeasure, based on secret intelligence, to trap the Vanqor fleet in a [[Satellite/Legends|satellite]]-[[Moon/Legends|moon]] corridor through which the enemy made its approach.Binalu worked not only with [[High General]] [[Bycha]] and her lesser [[General/Legends|generals]], but also with [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], [[Clee Rhara]], [[Siri Tachi]], and the other [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] envoys sent at the behest of the Senate, to negotiate a ceasefire and an enduring peace between Typha-Dor and Vanqor's ruler, [[Van-Ith]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Reeayah
description: Reeayah was born on the Twi'lek [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] and did not wish to become a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] like many of her species, so she fell in with a group of dark side Twi'lek witches, who taught her the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. She later joined the [[Cularin Pirates]] and she immediately became obsessed with it's leader [[Dorel-Kan]] and they had a very close working relationship. During the [[Confederation Rock Rush]] in c. [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Reeayah used the dark side to track a ship to an [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] in the [[Cularin system asteroid belt]]. She and the rest of the pirates landed their ship there and attacked the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who had been crewing the ship that they had been tracking.

name: Lyda Skims
description: Skims was born in [[23 BBY/Legends|23 BBY]] to [[Lynn Skims|Lynn]] and [[Doyle Skims]] and had a brother, [[Athon Skims|Athon]]. Her job working at her mother's textile factory on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] gave her a knowledge of clothing design, engineering and [[Droid/Legends|droid]] repair. Her other interests included arts and modern dance. After the deaths of her father and brother while serving the Alliance, Lyda was devastated and decided to continue their tradition of service.Though she lacked significant combat skills, she served on undercover missions for the Alliance such as the investigation of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Project Dead Eye]] in about [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]]. On that mission, Lyda recovered secret plans related to the project but was captured at an Imperial installation and charged with trespassing. When the Imperial transport carrying her broke down, she escaped in to the wilderness with the data disk carrying the plans. She hid there until she encountered an operative sent by the Alliance to find her.

name: Femi
description: {{Quote|Unidentified vessel, this is Coruscant Security. We weren't expecting&hellip; Do you have a ''clearance'' code?|Femi's communication to the Sith fleet|The Old Republic, Threat of Peace Act 1: Treaty of Coruscant}}Serving aboard [[Orbital Security Station Six]] over [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the capital of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] government, Femi, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Rutian/Legends|Rutian]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] who lived in the year [[3653 BBY]], worked with a [[Femi's co-worker|co-worker]] for [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security]] monitoring the traffic to and from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. She checked into [[Coruscant Control]], reporting that there was nothing in her vicinity, and shared a brief conversation with the dispatcher, saying that she was going planetside as her rotation aboard the satellite was complete. She then noticed [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] ships in her area and asked the [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]] for clearance codes.The [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]] and the Republic were meeting at [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] to discuss terms for ending the [[Great Galactic War]], a [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]-wide conflict that had been taking place between them for decades, and the unexpected arrival of their fleet caught Femi off-guard. Rather than transmit a response back to her, Femi and her partner were killed after [[Darth Angral|Angral]], a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] from the Empire and leader of the assault, ordered his ship to fire on the satellite. This began the [[Sacking of Coruscant]], a battle between the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire. The conflict ended with the [[Treaty of Coruscant]], an agreement that forced the Republic to abandon long-time allies and give many outlying worlds over to the Sith, putting an end to the Great Galactic War in favor of the Sith Empire.

name: Shonmai
description: {{Quote|Sithspit! Shonmai, what ''is'' that?''"<br />"''Not native to Dac!|[[Adriphar]] and Shonmai, upon first seeing the [[Sea Leviathan]].|Legacy 33: Fight Another Day, Part 2}}Shonmai and her fellow ranger [[Adriphar]] were scouting the area near the [[Devil's Crevasse]] when they spotted something abnormal on their scopes. Recognizing it to be too big to be an [[Acklay-class mobile fortress|Acklay]] and not a native creature of [[Dac]], the two Mon Cals approached the massive creature on a reconnaissance run. As they scouted the creature, they felt certain that [[Imperial Knight|Master]] [[Treis Sinde]] and [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Tanquar]] should be informed of this new devilry. When they got closer, they were noticed by the [[Aquatic Terrain Armored Transport]] riding herd beside the beast. Shonmai told Adriphar to get out of there, but his [[Krakana underwater fighter|Krakana]] was shot down by the vessel. He crashed into the monster and warned Shonmai to get back to the [[Ranger Grotto]], before his life-force was sucked out by the beast.Shocked by Adriphar's sudden death, Shonmai rushed back to the Grotto and told the other Rangers of the encounter. Tanquar began preparing for an attack against the beast in order to save the Mon Calamari refugees being attacked. Sinde, however, tried to dissuade the Rangers from performing a suicidal attack on the creature, which he revealed to be a [[One Sith|Sith]]-created [[Sea Leviathan]]. He told them the creature had been specifically designed to kill them, but the Rangers were unwilling to let their people die as they waited in safety. Changing his mind about the attack, Sinde came up with a plan: The Rangers would attack and destroy the AT-AT swimmer, while he would use [[Animal bond|the Force]] to command a legion of [[Devilsquid]] to attack the Leviathan. Two extra Rangers would then use the empty crevasse to shelter the fleeing Mon Calamari.

name: Gille Narvis
description: Gille [[Marriage/Legends|married]] [[Jarl Narvis]] and together they had a daughter, [[Kalee Narvis]]. She had joint ownership of the company [[Legal Arms Ltd.]] with her husband and served as its accountant. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she traveled aboard the company's [[Barloz-class medium freighter|''Barloz''-class freighter]] ''[[Aggressive Negotiation]]'', of which her husband was [[Captain/Legends|captain]], to deliver weapons to the [[Cularin Militia]] in the [[Cularin system]]. However, the ship was boarded by a [[Thaereian military]] patrol, who killed Jarl and all of the crew except Gille and Kalee. They planned to kill them last, but were called away, so Gille and Kalee were left in the ship, which was dead in space. Gille broadcast a distress call and the [[Heroes of Cularin]] came to rescue them. She later continued to run Legal Arms Ltd., now as the sole owner.

name: Kalee Narvis
description: Kalee was the daughter of [[Jarl Narvis]] and [[Gille Narvis]], the owners of the company [[Legal Arms Ltd.]] During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Kalee traveled with the company's [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] ''[[Aggressive Negotiation]]'' to the [[Cularin system]], where it was going to deliver weapons to the [[Cularin Militia]]. However, before it could do so, it was boarded by members of the [[Thaereian military]], who murdered most of the crew, including Kalee's father. Kalee and Gille were the only crewmembers left alive, as the Thaereians were called away before they could finish them off. The ''Negotiation'' was left dead in space, but the [[Heroes of Cularin]] soon arrived and rescued Kalee and Gille.

name: Tohri Challon
description: {{Quote|This is Admiral Tohri Challon, in command of His Imperial Majesty's Star Destroyer Dauntless, to all fighters -- the Sith have obviously learned of our rendezvous with the Jedi.|Admiral Tohri Challon|Legacy 45: Monster, Part 3}}[[File:Challon dauntless.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Admiral Challon on the bridge of the ''Dauntless'']]In [[137 ABY]] Imperial Adjunct Tohri Challon was present at the Imperial headquarters in [[Bastion/Legends|Bastion]], the seat of power of the deposed Emperor Roan Fel. She personally welcomed [[Vikar Dorn]], [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] of [[Munto Codru/Legends|Munto Codru]], during the supposed defection of the entire crew of the [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Imperial]] [[Pellaeon-class Star Destroyer|Star Destroyer]] [[Dauntless (Pellaeon-class)|''Dauntless'']]. The defection, however, was part of a [[One Sith|Sith]] plot orchestrated by [[Darth Maladi]], a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lady]], to have Emperor Fel [[Duel on Bastion|assassinated]] by a Sith Lord named [[Darth Kruhl]].As the Second Imperial Civil War progressed, Challon was given the rank of [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] and took command of the ''Dauntless'', now part of the Fel loyalist [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Navy]]. The ''Dauntless'' transported Emperor Fel to the agricultural world of [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]], a planet on the edge of Fel-controlled space, for a meeting with members of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[New Jedi Order|Order]]. [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Basile]] was her second in command.[[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Morrigan Corde|Nyna Calixte]], Director of [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]], made her way to Agamar and interrupted the meeting to the Emperor that the Sith had [[Operation: Thunderstroke|had sent]] a [[First Sith Imperial Strikeforce|strike force]] to capture him. At the same time, the Sith-loyalist Star Destroyer ''[[War Hammer]]'', under the command of Moff [[Rulf Yage]], emerged from hyperspace and engaged the ''Dauntless''. Challon ordered her entire crew to engage the Sith forces in order to buy time for Emperor Fel to evacuate the planet.[[File:Dauntless destroyed.jpg|thumb|left|250px|The ''Dauntless'' is destroyed with all hands lost.]]In the course of the battle, the ''Dauntless'' suffered heavy damage and lost its shields. Nonetheless, Admiral Challon ordered her crew to continue attacking the enemy to provide cover for the [[Defender One|Emperor's shuttle]], allowing it to escape to [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]]. As the shuttle took the Emperor to safety, Challon paid her respects to her monarch, reminding him that she had always been loyal to him. The ''Dauntless'' was finally overwhelmed by the ''War Hammer'' and was destroyed. Challon and her entire crew perished in the explosion.

name: Melsa Dor
description: Dor was a crewmember aboard a [[Transport/Legends|transport]] that was involved in evacuating the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Argul]] during the [[Battle of Argul]]. The [[Argullian]] merchant [[Turyit]] attempted to bribe her into letting him bring some barrels of [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] with him aboard the transport. However, she saw that they were being watched by the [[Padawan/Legends|Jedi Padawans]] [[Olge Plavi-Dol]] and [[Wamtra]], so she declined his offer and hurried back to work.

name: Deidre Jocund
description: Jocund was a member of a squad under the command of [[Lorwin Derlynn]] and she was the squad's medic. During the Clone Wars, she and the rest of her squad were sent to occupy an abandoned [[Cularin Militia]] [[Cularin Militia asteroid base|base]] in the [[Cularin system asteroid belt]]. The [[Heroes of Cularin]] arrived there, intending to deliver supplies to the Militia, so the squad tried to make them surrender to them. However, the heroes tried to convince Jocund and her comrades to defect to the Militia instead.

name: Haleen Snowline
description: Snowline was involved in Zeed's criminal activities. Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], she paid a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to deliver a bribe from Zeed to the [[Tralus and Talus Liberation Party]] who had acquired evidence of Zeed's wrongdoings. When the Liberation Party let Snowline know that they still had the evidence and that the Prime Minister could expect to hear from them again, Snowline had the spacer attack the Liberation Party members. She described them as [[Terrorist/Legends|terrorists]] that had stolen valuable state secrets. The spacer retrieved the evidence, leaving no survivors. Now that the spacer had proven to be a valuable asset, he was allowed to meet the prime minister.

name: Misha Vekkian
description: Vekkian was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] who was raised by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] with no knowledge of her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] or her family, and by the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she had become a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. However, after the end of the conflict, she was discovered by the [[Inquisitorius/Legends|Inquisitorius]],<ref name="AROW" /> an order of [[Dark Side Adept]]s who served the newly-formed [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], which was tasked with [[Jedi hunter/Legends|hunting down]] the surviving Jedi.<ref name="TDSS">''[[The Dark Side Sourcebook]]''</ref> The Inquisitorius turned her to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and she agreed to serve the Empire. After undergoing military training, she was commissioned as an [[Imperial officer/Legends|officer]] in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]]. Vekkian attained the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]] and commanded a [[Squad/Legends|squad]] of [[Imperial Navy trooper]]s who, due to her harsh style, became some of the toughest and skilled men in the Imperial Navy.<ref name="AROW" />In circa [[17 BBY/Legends|17 BBY]],<ref name="Date">The ''Dawn of Defiance'' module ''[[Echoes of the Jedi]]'' states that the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vhiin Thorla]] traveled to the [[Almas Academy]] two years after the declaration of [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], which is dated to [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. This thus indicates that ''Dawn of Defiance'' is set in circa [[17 BBY/Legends|17 BBY]].</ref> Imperial [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Gilder Varth]] infiltrated the [[Alderaanian Resistance]], an anti-Imperial resistance group based on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]]. When a team of Resistance agents completed [[Mission to Coruscant (Imperial era)|a mission]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], a Resistance task force was sent to wait for them at a rendezvous point near the [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. Varth betrayed the Resistance task force's location to the Empire and an Imperial task force under the command of Inquisitor [[Valin Draco]] was sent to [[Battle of the Resurgence|eliminate]] the group. Vekkian and her squad accompanied him and they were part of a boarding party that landed aboard the [[Alderaanian/Legends|Alderaanian]] [[Command ship/Legends|command]] [[Starship/Legends|ship]], the [[EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate/Legends|EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate]] [[Resurgence (EF76 Nebulon-B escort frigate)|''Resurgence'']].<ref name="AROW" />Draco captured [[Denia]], a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] who had allied herself with the Resistance, and took her to the ''Resurgence''{{'s}} [[Hangar/Legends|landing bay]]. Vekkian and her squad were present there while he and his [[Prison/Legends|prisoner]] left the ship in his [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]], and afterward, they took up positions near the last Imperial shuttle left on the ship. Soon, a group of Alderaanian Resistance fighters, who had been carrying out assignments for Denia, arrived at the hangar, though too late to rescue her. Vekkian noticed their presence and ordered her squad to open fire on them. She then ignited her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and used [[battle meditation]] to prepare herself for combat. The naval [[Trooper/Legends|troopers]] gave her covering fire, while she tried to attack the Resistance fighters. The battle was a victory for the Empire and the ''Resurgence'' was destroyed shortly afterward, while the surviving Alderaanian ships were forced to flee.<ref name="AROW" />

name: Lalande
description: Lalande was a [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] in the Militia and worked as an aide to [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Xirossk]]. After the [[Battle of Soboll]], she met with the [[Heroes of Cularin]] to thank them for their efforts in helping to bring about the Militia victory.

name: Orla Defra
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Defra lived in the platform [[City/Legends|city]] [[Soboll]] on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and worked as a [[Laboratory/Legends|lab]] technician as part of a [[Thaereian military]] research team. She was an informer for the [[Cularin Militia]] and she was able to provide them with technical readouts about Soboll and Thaereian research. After the Thaereian military withdrew all their forces to Soboll, [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Xirossk]] of the Militia sent the [[Heroes of Cularin]] to find out from Defra the location of the Thaereian commander, [[Kurth San]]. However, before they could meet with her, Defra was arrested by the Thaereians.

name: Unidentified Jedi (Endar Spire)
description: [[File:Endar Spire Duel.jpg|thumb|left|200px|The Jedi duels a Dark Jedi aboard the ''Endar Spire''.]]A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] was a [[Jedi/Legends|member]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]<ref name="Guide">''[[Knights of the Old Republic: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref> by [[3956 BBY]].<ref name="CG" /> In that year, she accompanied [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Bastila Shan]] on the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Hammerhead-class cruiser|''Hammerhead''-class cruiser]] ''[[Endar Spire]]'' when it was [[Interdiction field/Legends|pulled]] out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] over the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Taris/Legends|Taris]], [[Attack on the Endar Spire|ambushed]], and boarded by a [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith]] battle [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] led by [[Darth Bandon]].<ref name="Game" />During the attack, she encountered a [[Unidentified Dark Jedi (Endar Spire)|Dark Jedi]] and engaged him in [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]] aboard the ''Spire''. [[Trask Ulgo]] and [[Revan/Legends|Revan]], two Republic crew members who had just entered the hallway, watched the conclusion of the [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|duel]], which resulted in the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi's]] [[Death/Legends|demise]]. However, the Jedi was also killed, moments later, when the wall section she stood beside sustained heavy damage from the Sith fleet and exploded.<ref name="Game" />

name: Aneesa Dym
description: Raised by her father [[Neeamesh Dym]], the creator and original pilot of the ''Dusty Duck'', Aneesa Dym learned the smuggling trade at an early age. After her father's murder at the hands of an angry customer, she fell in love and partnered with [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Rango Tel]], the man who captured her father's murderer. Aneesa accompanied Tel throughout his short-lived career and was with him when he journeyed to [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] in search of his latest bounty. She was killed in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]] while aboard the ''Dusty Duck'', waiting for Tel to return from the capture of [[Kam Nale]].

name: Reson Nath
description: Some time during the war, [[Imperial Prefect]] [[Adar (Imperial)|Adar]] accused Nath of a variety of crimes and, after a [[Reson Nath v. Imperial Prefect Adar|trial]], she was to be punished according to Guild rules. The trial was overseen by [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Gorliz]] and presided over by [[Janq Paramexor]]. On learning that the trial involved a battle with Nath, Adar quickly dropped the charges. However, Gorliz, who had bet on the outcome with Paramexor, ordered Adar to participate regardless.{{Char-stub}}

name: Tassida Judrelle
description: Judrelle joined [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Stass Allie/Legends|Stass Allie]] and [[Quarmall]] in the capture of the leader of the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] ring, [[Lojrak Shrag]]. The [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] team was led by the smuggler [[Billey]] to the smugglers' secret base, where they engaged the criminals. Shrag's lieutenant, [[Godiban Bakoosta]], was killed in the fight and the smuggling ring was brought to justice.{{Char-stub}}

name: Janna (Sullustan)
description: When she was ten, she was separated from her parents during riots in [[Gadrin]], but she found them again with the help of the [[Heroes of Cularin]]. Shortly afterward, she met with them in a warehouse, to tell them that many children in Gadrin were disappearing.

name: Rievale Creterk
description: In [[Eastport]], [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], a melee erupted between Houk and Weequay immigrants who were placed in adjacent holding rooms while waiting to be processed. Cultural enemies, they verbally assaulted each other before resorting to physical violence.Since [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] were not allowed within the processing area, no shots were fired. However, those involved made use of blades and [[shiv]]s to harm each other. In the end, fifteen were left for [[Death/Legends|dead]] with forty-five wounded.Creterk suffered a broken arm in the incident.

name: Tinya
description: Tinya trained as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] at the [[Almas Academy]], a Jedi academy located on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Almas]]. During her [[Time/Legends|time]] there, she served as a tour guide in [[Remembrance Hall]], a [[Museum/Legends|museum]] located near the Academy. On one occasion, she was assigned to show the [[Heroes of Cularin]] around the Academy. However, while she was showing them a [[holoplacard]] of the [[Battle of Ossus (Great Sith War)|Battle of Ossus]], a [[Bomb/Legends|bomb]] was detonated by terrorists, destroying the holoplacard and injuring Tinya.

name: Alina Impeveri
description: Alina was the daughter of [[Westa Impeveri]], a town counselor in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Hedrett]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. She later became a [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] and joined the [[Believers]], a [[Sith cult]] that operated in the [[Cularin system]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Saarai (Chagrian)
description: {{Quote|Saarai is my daughter and will, some day, be the next Darth Wyyrlok.|Darth Wyyrlok III|Legacy 34: Storms, Part 1}}The [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="Legacy 14" /> [[Saarai]]<ref name="Legacy 34" /> was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] to the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Wyyrlok (III)|Darth Wyyrlok]], the third in a line of Chagrian [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Lord/Legends|Lords]] named Wyyrlok, in the [[Time/Legends|time]] period of the [[Sith&ndash;Imperial War]]. From her [[Youngling/Legends|youth]], Saarai was [[Sith training|instructed]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Korriban]] in the ways of the [[One Sith]] Order, whose leader was the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Krayt]], also the [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] of the [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Galactic Empire]].<ref name="Legacy 14" /> After Wyyrlok secretly [[Battle on Had Abbadon|rendered]] Darth Krayt inactive, Saarai was placed in charge of guarding [[Stasis Room|Krayt's tomb]] within [[XoXaan's Temple]] while her father prepared it.[[File:WyyrlokIV_Stryfe.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Saarai fighting Darth Stryfe with telekinesis.]]When a recently revived [[Darth Stryfe]] demanded entrance to the tomb, she refused to allow him to enter. Stryfe attacked her, and after a protracted unarmed fight, Saarai overpowered the experienced Sith Lord. Using her considerable Force talents, she literally had his body bending to her will. However, her father came out and ordered her to cease before she could kill Stryfe. Then, he had Saarai return to her duty and let Stryfe enter the Stasis Room so they could discuss Krayt's "serious condition."Some time later, Saarai transferred to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. She was present at her father's side when the resurrected Darth Krayt made his presence and will felt by all Sith through the dark side of the Force. However, once word was received that Darth Krayt was on his way to Coruscant, Darth Wyyrlok convinced his hesitant daughter to flee the planet since her powers were not fully realized. Saarai was not present when Lord Krayt [[Assault on the Temple of the Sith|marched]] into the [[Temple of the Sith]] and killed her father in a duel. Months later, after the [[Battle of Coruscant (Second Imperial Civil War)|death]] of Darth Krayt and the collapse of the [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Sith Empire]], Saarai went into hiding among the galactic populace. She was following the orders of Darth Nihl, successor of Lord Krayt, who ordered the Sith to disperse and infiltrate the various governments throughout [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and await the time for their revenge.

name: Nannat
description: Nannat was the child of two soldiers in the [[Thaereian military]] and she was orphaned when they were killed in action. When she was 15, she was appointed to be the nanny of [[Night Forael Wren]], the daughter of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren]], who had been kidnapped by the Thaereian military. Nannat cared for her for a year and during that time, she came to care very much for Night and almost considered her to be her little sister.

name: Zharia Vos
description: {{Quote|Your work is impressive, Rawk. Timely as well. I did not expect such quick results.''"<br />"''Ah, I'd already been foolin' around with some things like it. 'Sides, we owe you for allowing me and my family to move here to Kiffex.|Zharia Vos and "Bantha" Rawk discuss a prototype suit of life-preserving armor|Legacy 34: Storms, Part 1}}Zharia Vos, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Kiffar/Legends|Kiffar]],<ref name="Legacy 34" /><ref name="making of a comic" /> lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kiffex/Legends|Kiffex]] during the [[Second Imperial Civil War]].<ref name="Legacy 35">''[[Legacy 35: Storms, Part 2]]''</ref> She was born into [[Clan Vos]],<ref name="Legacy 34" /> one of the largest clans on Kiffex,<ref name="Legacy 37 letters">''[[Legacy 37: Tatooine, Part 1]]'' letters page</ref> before [[137 ABY]]. By that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], she had ascended to the position of [[Sheyf]],<ref name="Legacy 34" /> the leader of the [[Kiffu Guardians]] and the ruler of Kiffex and [[Kiffu/Legends|Kiffu]].<ref name="Republic 20">''[[Star Wars 20: Twilight, Part 2]]''</ref><ref name="Republic 32">''[[Star Wars 32: Darkness, Part 1]]''</ref> Vos resided in the [[Sheyf's Palace]] on Kiffex. Under her leadership,<ref name="Legacy 35" /> the Kiffu Guardians remained neutral during the war.<ref name="Legacy War 2">''[[Legacy—War 2]]''</ref>During the war, [[Droo Rawk]] of Clan Vos<ref name="Legacy 34" /> had a run-in with forces of [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire]] at her [[Rawk's Nest|home]] on [[Iego/Legends|Iego]].<ref name="Legacy 24">''[[Legacy 24: Loyalties, Part 2]]''</ref> Fearful of his family's safety, her [[Marriage/Legends|husband]], [[Rawk|"Bantha" Rawk]], insisted that they move,<ref name="Legacy 25">''[[Legacy 25: The Hidden Temple, Part 1]]''</ref> and Zharia Vos allowed them to settle on Kiffex. As Rawk was an apt [[Technician/Legends|mechanic]], Vos requested that he develop a suit of life-preserving [[Armor/Legends|armor]] for the Kiffu Guardians. Rawk set to work constructing a prototype suit at his family's new [[Rawk compound|compound]],<ref name="Legacy 34" /> designing a system that pumped [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] around and breathed for the wearer.<ref name="Legacy 35" /> When the project neared completion, he spoke with Vos via [[Hologram/Legends|hologram]] and reported on his progress. Vos thanked and congratulated him before signing off.<ref name="Legacy 34" />Rawk was visited immediately thereafter by his nephew, [[Cade Skywalker]], who demanded that Rawk and Droo heal his friend, the [[Imperial Knight]] [[Azlyn Rae]]. Rae had recently been mortally [[Battle on Had Abbadon|wounded]] and stood on the brink of [[Death/Legends|death]]. She accepted her fate and resisted all of Droo's [[Force healing/Legends|healing]] efforts, however, prompting Rawk and Droo to place her inside the prototype suit of life-preserving armor.<ref name="Legacy 34" /> Rae was furious with her predicament and left the compound, seeking refuge at the Sheyf's Palace. Vos received her and allowed her to stay as a guest. Two days after Rae parted ways with the Rawks, the Imperial Knight [[Ganner Krieg]] arrived at the palace in search of his fellow Knight. Vos directed him to Rae, who returned with Krieg to the [[Empire-in-exile]]'s [[fortress world]] of [[Bastion/Legends|Bastion]].<ref name="Legacy 35" />In [[138 ABY]], [[Darth Krayt]] began a renewed military push against his enemies. [[Imperial Agent|Agents]] of his Empire contacted the Kiffu Guardians and requested that an Imperial base be built on Kiffex or Kiffu, but their request was denied.<ref name="Legacy War 2" /> As a precaution against possible actions by Krayt's forces, Vos contacted Droo and requested that she reactivate her [[General/Legends|general's]] commission within the Kiffu Guardians.<ref name="Legacy War 3">''[[Legacy—War 3]]''</ref>

name: Shiana Trist
description: Trist co-operated with the bounty hunters [[Drokka]] and [[K1-1R]], to try and collect [[Contract AA23]], a bounty that had been placed on the [[Heroes of Cularin]]. They attacked the heroes on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], but failed and Trist was able to escape.<ref name="CAA23">[[Contract AA23 (roleplaying adventure)|''Contract AA23'']]</ref>She later flew her [[Z-95 Headhunter/Legends|Z-95 Headhunter]] to the [[Cularin system]], to try and capture the [[Liana Liberators]]. She put aside her previous grievances with the Heroes of Cularin and they helped her attack the Liberators.<ref name="TR">''[[The Replacements]]''</ref>

name: Misha Quor-Din
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Misha Quor-Din became a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] in the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] at the experimental [[Almas Academy|Academy]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Almas]]. Under the guidance of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and [[Mistress of Lightsabers|Academy battlemaster]] [[Kirlocca]], Quor-Din and a group of other students went on an expedition into the [[Almas Wasteland]] in [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]]. However, some of the Jedi fell under the influence of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and attacked Kirlocca. Quor-Din and the rest of the Jedi tried to defend Kirlocca, but were driven back by their deranged opponents. However, while she fled, she was captured by a group of [[Believers]].<ref name="ADF" />She was taken back to the [[Almas Sith fortress]], where she was made the prisoner of [[Garvin Delquist]], a researcher at the [[Forard research station]] who had been given dark side powers by a [[Sith amulet]]. He had fallen in love with Quor-Din, which was why he had ordered her capture, but she did not reciprocate his feelings and rejected his advances. She was eventually rescued by a group of agents sent by Master [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]] and returned to the Academy unharmed.<ref name="ADF" />

name: Sellot Kell
description: Kell became a member of the [[Believers]], a [[Sith cult]] based in the [[Cularin system]]. In circa [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], she was among a group of Believers who served [[Garvin Delquist]] in the [[Almas Sith fortress]] and she became one of his bodyguards.

name: Ember Chankeli
description: [[File:EmberChankelidress.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Ember Chankeli on Telerath]]She was born and living on [[Telerath/Legends|Telerath]], in a town of [[Noua]] that mostly dealt business in the tourist trade. But the things changed when a gang of [[Slaver/Legends|slavers]] moved in and made the town its headquarters, resulting in most of the businesses failing &ndash; Ember's included. Ember wanted to clear the town of the gang and to restore it to what it once was. To do so, she posted an ad in a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] on [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]], where off-record jobs were posted. Several individuals tried to acquire the job, including a [[Chistori]] thug and a young [[Human/Legends|Human]] male, but it was former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Dass Jennir]] who proved to be able to perform the job. Ember left him some advance [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] and the [[Datachip/Legends|datachip]] with coordinates of the city and agreed to meet him there in two weeks since their first meeting.When Jennir arrived on Telerath he found out that the slavers led by a [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] named [[Musori]] wasn't the only gang in the town &ndash; the second one was a [[Spice/Legends|spice]] running gang led by a couple of [[T'surr (species)|T'surr]] and the two gangs were constantly after each other. After learning about that, Jennir realized that his employer told him only half the truth. In fact, Chankeli hired Jennir to take care of the slavers in order to make space for the spice runners.In the middle of the night, while Jennir was attending to [[Dado]], who lost his right hand attempting to join Musori's gang through their head enforcer [[Mors Demanna]], Ember slipped away to inform the spice gang leader, [[Ken-Kiba]], of her beliefs that Jennir can be easily manipulated; on the side, she also brought Ken-Kiba a sentient slave for him.However, while she was out, Jennir made it to Telerath's second moon, where he freed the slaves from [[Ken-Giree]], Ken-Kiba's brother and pinned his death on the slavers.[[File:Ember Chankeli.jpg|left|thumb|Ember Chankeli on [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]].]]The next morning, Ember returned to her inn to inquire if Jennir had had his breakfast. When [[Tam (female)|Tam]] said that he wasn't in his room the last time she checked, Ember let out her fury at [[Nikollane]], who was more occupied with her son, before she saw Jennir walking with [[Mors Demanna]]; she commented: "This is going better than expected". Ember later guessed that he must have been recruited into Musori's gang. Nikollane voiced her opinion that Jennir shouldn't be running around with the people who harmed her son, which resulted in Ember striking her. She threatened to sell both her to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]] and dump her son into a canal if either of them interfered in her plans.[[File:PrinePirates.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Ember Chankeli is captured by [[Unidentified slaver caravan|slavers]] on [[Prine]].]]Later, Jennir returned to Ember's inn, announcing that the gang problems would be resolved. Then suddenly, Jennir rushed off after Nikollane informed him that Dado intended to rat him out to Musori. A suspicious Ember then demanded answers from Nikollane. Ember then went to Ken-Kiba, who was in the midst of a gang war with Musori, and brought him and his gang back to her inn, where Jennir was about to urge her slaves to leave. As Ken-Kiba began to avenge himself upon Jennir, Nikollane activated the inn's trapdoor to enable him to escape. Enraged, Ken-Kiba had Ember and all her slaves locked up, determining that it was in fact she was manipulating ''him'', not Jennir.After suffering at the hands of the spicers, Ember was [[Skirmish on Telerath|rescued]] by Jennir after a showdown with Demanna, and she followed Jennir as he made his way to finish the battle with Ken-Kiba and his followers.[[File:H2TakesaBlasterBoltforEmber.jpg|thumb|left|[[H2]] saves Ember Chankeli on [[Prine]].]]The events damaged Chankeli's reputation, so it seemed impossible for her to continue in her old life. She asked Jennir that she would be allowed to accompany him on his travels. After this was agreed, the two broke into the direction on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Vondarc/Legends|Vondarc]] where Chankeli wanted to visit her family. During the flight, they were attacked by Imperials, after which they crashed on the barren wasteland of the planet [[Prine]]. In search of civilization, Chankeli confessed to her Jedi companion that she had no family at all on Vondarc, but this merely was a pretext to accompany him on his journeys. When they were both separated, Chankeli was kidnapped by a group of slave traders.While Jennir was following the caravan of slavers, he was being followed by [[Falco Sang]], a bounty hunter hired by the family of [[Dezono Qua]] to avenge his death at Jennir's hand. Eventually, both Jennir and Sang caught up with the slavers, and while the Jedi attempted to rescue Ember, the bounty hunter watched for a chance to kill him. He shot the repulsor on the transport carrying Ember and a young girl named [[Maddie]], causing Ember to fall off. She told Jennir to leave, and after he left with Maddie, the bounty hunter apprehended her and let the surviving slavers leave.Ember suggested that they work together to capture the Jedi, but Sang saw through her attempt at subterfuge and instead used her as bait to draw Jennir into a trap. Ember was tied to a pole and gagged; if she tried to warn Jennir, she would be shot by his droid [[Izee]]. However, Jennir was more cunning than Sang had anticipated; he sent in H2 disguised as himself to make Sang reveal his location, then using telekinesis brought him out into the open. Sang ordered Izee to shoot Ember, but H2's chassis partially blocked the shot, leaving her wounded but not dead. Izee then attempted to shoot Jennir, but the Jedi deflected the shot with his lightsaber, causing it to rebound and destroy the droid. After Sang fled, Jennir attempted to heal Ember, but with uncertain results due to his emotional state and limited gifts in Force healing, and passed out.[[File:Dass Jennir Ember Chankeli first kiss.jpg|thumb|250px|Dass Jennir and Ember Chankeli first kiss]]Thankfully, the pair were rescued by the crew of the ''[[Uhumele]]'', who were searching for Jennir, and were given medical attention. When Jennir walked into the room, the two unexpectedly kissed, prompting the crew to give them some privacy. Jennir then broke off the kiss, reminding himself that as a Jedi he should be mindful of his emotion. However, Ember didn't mind. She then remembered that Maddie was left unaccounted for. Jennir went to talk with Captain [[Schurk-Heren]] to return to Prine. In the meantime, [[Meekerdin-maa]] provided Ember with new clothes that previously belonged to [[Crys Taanzer]], albeit not in her size. Sadly, Heren refused to return to Prine, as an Imperial battlecruiser was searching the planet. After the crew adjourned, Jennir told Ember that the mount he used during the rescue was helping guide Maddie back home, but he worries that he may have destroyed her hope of ever seeing them again. The pair then embrace as Jennir lamented how dangerous the galaxy is becoming.

name: Helen Goldenfield
description: {{Quote|Wait a second. I guess you don't look like a pirate or thug. I'm sorry. I'm so riled up I can hardly think straight. Look, I could use your help with this. My husband has left to contact the authorities. I need to go calm down or I may do something drastic. Please, go down the stairs and keep an eye on those thugs for me. It would really help me out.|Helen Goldenfield, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Helen Goldenfield lived in a  [[The Ranch|ranch]] near the city of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] with her husband [[Roric Goldenfield]].<ref name="SWG:TMotH" />[[File:Tatooine ranch.jpg|thumb|left|250px|[[The Ranch]].]]Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Helen and her husband had raised the ire of a local band of [[Sand slum pirates|pirates]] who had established a [[Pirate Base|hideout]] near their home. Roric had managed to capture and imprison some of the pirates in the basement of their home and had left to find an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Garrison/Legends|garrison]] to have them arrested. He left Helen to watch the pirates. While he was away, a [[Hero of Tatooine|spacer]], who was on a [[Quest of the Hero of Tatooine|quest]] for the [[Mark of Honor]], arrived at their house. Being a gracious host, Helen let the spacer in. She asked if they would watch the prisoners for her while she took a break. The spacer agreed. During this time, the pirates pleaded with the spacer to let them out, but they refused and informed Helen of their intent to escape. At this time, Roric had finally returned with two Imperial [[Exogen-class dark trooper|dark troopers]]. The troopers arrested the pirates and led them out of the house. Helen and her husband thanked the spacer for their assistance, and the spacer left.<ref name="SWG:TMotH" />

name: Minder of Weak Wills
description: The Minder of Weak Wills was a former student at [[Corellia University]]. The Minder was enslaved after a archaeological dig on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] in [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]] she was involved in had unknowingly tunneled into the burial chamber of the [[Temple of Exar Kun]] and released the ancient Sith Lord's spirit. The entire team was subsequently enslaved by the malevolent spirit and were ordered into the [[Cult of Exar Kun]]. Later, a [[Corellia University research outpost]] on [[Talus/Legends|Talus]] was invaded by the Cult and all its students and researchers were enslaved as well, afterward most were brought back to Yavin 4. Fearing why he had lost contact with the outpost, [[Cornelius Wagglehorn|Professor Cornelius Wagglehorn]] hired a group of spacers to travel to Talus and investigate. The spacers learned what had transpired and informed the professor.[[File:Minder.JPG|thumb|left|One possible depiction of the Minder from the ''Star Wars Galaxies'']]He provided them with the coordinates to the tomb and implored them to destroy the evil [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord's]] spirit within. The Minder was the second major obstacle the spacers encountered within the tomb, having just triumphed over [[Open Hand of Hate]]. The Minder had been empowered with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by Kun's spirit, and she used it to bend various creatures to her will. Commanding an army of tomb flier bats and skreegs, she ordered them to attack the spacers. The spacers eventually killed her pets and she was forced to take matters into her own hands. After a relatively short fight, she was killed by the combined might of the group, her spirit freed from the grasp of the evil [[Exar Kun/Legends|Exar Kun]]. Afterward, the spacers continued deeper into the tomb, eventually coming upon the [[Caretaker of the Lost Souls]].

name: Caretaker of the Lost Souls
description: Before becoming an unwilling follower of Exar Kun, the Caretaker of Lost Souls was a student at [[Corellia University]], and may have been a member of an archeological expedition on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] in [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]] that unknowingly tunneled into the tombs below the [[Temple of Exar Kun]] and released the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord's]] spirit. The evil spirit proceeded to bind the students and researchers to his will, and induct them into the [[Cult of Exar Kun]]. Afterward, he sent them to [[Talus/Legends|Talus]], to the [[Corellia University research outpost]] they had originally come from to enslave the rest of the people there. The majority of them were then sent back to Yavin 4. After losing contact with the outpost and fearing the worst, [[Cornelius Wagglehorn|Professor Cornelius Wagglehorn]] hired a group of spacers to travel to Talus and investigate.[[File:Caretakerlost.JPG|left|thumb|One possible depiction of the Caretaker in ''Star Wars Galaxies'']]After arriving at the research outpost and discovering what had happened, the spacers informed the professor. He sent them the location of the tomb and implored them to travel there and destroy the malevolent spirit. The Caretaker was the third major enemy the spacers faced within the tomb, having previously defeated the [[Open Hand of Hate]] and the [[Minder of Weak Wills]]. Once she noticed the group, the Caretaker sealed the chamber and sent her minions after them, three at a time. During the battle, a few of the Caretaker's prisoners, fellow students who had yet to succumb to Exar Kun's will, managed to assist in weakening the Caretaker, until she was forced to take matters into her own hands. She surrounded the room in a thick green fog and proceeded to deliver bolts of [[Force lightning/Legends|force lightning]] to the bodies of the spacers from the middle of the room, while shielding herself from any direct melee attacks. After a long and arduous battle, with the spacers trying desperately to both escape the fog and kill the woman electrocuting them, the spacers stood triumphant over the Caretaker's corpse, her spirit finally free of Kun's wretched grasp. The spacers then continued on through the tomb, until they met the [[Clenched Fist of Hate]].

name: Yurka Aggel
description: Aggel lived on [[Nizon]], where she was a healer and considered a "wise woman" by the other Nazren. When the Empire came to Nizon, she witnessed her people becoming [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]], so she was pleased when they [[Battle of Nizon|rose up]] against the Empire. During the battle, she gave a group of [[Alderaanian Resistance]] agents shelter in her house, after they were cornered by the advancing Imperial forces. However, some [[LM-432 crab droid/Legends|LM-432 crab droids]] that were working for [[Vril Vrakth]], a [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]], burrowed into her house to attack the agents.<ref name="The First to Strike" />

name: Linna Naltree
description: After [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] was proclaimed by [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], she and her husband [[Tobin Gantor]] hid [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ry-Gaul]] into their home planet and gave him a new identity. They were later abducted by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and were forced to work for its purposes while Ry-Gaul had been looking for them ever since. [[18 BBY/Legends|A year]] after the Empire replaced the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] in the wake of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Linna was in [[Ussa]], the capital of the planet [[Bellassa/Legends|Bellassa]], with many other scientists, most of whom worked against their will for the Empire because their families were being held as hostages as a way for them to be controlled. During a conference, they received instructions from Lord [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] and [[Grand Moff/Legends|Grand Moff]] [[Wilhuff Tarkin/Legends|Wilhuff Tarkin]] to work on a secret project, in which they did not even know what it was. A short time later, [[Ferus Olin]], [[Roan Lands]], [[Amie Antin]], and the boy [[Trever Flume]] broke into an Imperial facility to find out more about this secret project that Tarkin had been in charge of. However, they were discovered, and Roan was killed by Darth Vader, and Ferus and Amie captured, leaving Trever the only one to escape and hide from the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]]. That was when Linna discovered Flume and helped him escape with a plan that was supposed to be hers. That was when a few weeks later, she was assigned as an assistant to the barbaric doctor [[Jenna Zan Arbor]] and worked at the ImPal OpRek when Ferus Olin broke in and wanted to free [[Astri Oddo]]'s son [[Lune Oddo Divinian|Lune]]. She asked Ferus to take her too, which he did. When it turned out that the three of them couldn't escape, she returned to allow Ferus and Lune to escape.A few days after the unsuccessful liberation operation, Trever went to Zan Arbor's apartment in the noble apartment tower [[500 Republica/Legends|500 Republica]], as she lived there with the doctor. He broke into the apartment to save her because she had enabled him to escape in Ussa and because Ferus asked him to look around there so that he could really free her this time. In the apartment Trever met Ry-Gaul, who also wanted to free her, thanking her and her husband Tobin for saving his life. Meanwhile, Tobin had escaped the Empire and contacted Master Ry-Gaul. That Zan Arbor would most likely be the first to test her memory-erasing drug on Linna, led Trever and Ry-Gaul to rescue her that same day. They lurked on the landing pad until Zan Arbor arrived with her. Then they lurked them in the turbolift and while Ry-Gaul fended off the blaster shots of Zan Arbor, Linna managed to give her the reminder drug so that she forgot all about her experiments. In the apartment she took all the notes for security. Later, after a long time, she met her husband Tobin again. Ry-Gaul had laid out new identity cards for them and after saying goodbye to him and Trever, she went to [[Mila (planet)|Mila]] with her husband in order to be able to live there undisturbed.

name: Gin Lesl
description: {{Quote|To tell you...you should have used something stronger than concussive ordnance|[[Braden]] shooting Gin Lesl|The Old Republic, Threat of Peace Act 2: New Galactic Order}}As captain of the Republic warship [[Envoy (Republic transport ship)|''Envoy'']], Gin ordered an orbital bombardment of the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Braden]]'s because he refused her order to pull out of [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]] under the terms of the [[Treaty of Coruscant]] which made an unequal peace between the Republic and the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]]. While she obeyed orders from Coruscant to withdraw from Dantooine, her troops refused to stand down their operations and continue engaging Sith forces on the planet. After Braden escaped from Sith captivity, he made his way to the galactic capital [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] with the intentions of informing the Jedi and Republic authorities of the true nature of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Dar'Nala]]'s murder.However, he also intended to seek revenge against both the Sith-aligned [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Dalborra]] and Lesl for betraying him into the hands of the Sith. He dispatched a message to both the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Zym]] and Gin Lesl, telling each other to meet at the ruins of the [[Jedi Temple]] with an important message. When they arrived, Lesl was baffled when the [[Kel Dor/Legends|Kel Dor]] Jedi told her that he had received her message.They were then interrupted by the arrival of Braden who informed them that he had the important message. He asked her if she remembered who he was and if she remembered that she had wounded him on Dantooine. Lesl responded that Braden was the bounty hunter she had made the mistake of hiring on Dantooine. Still mystified, she asked why he had followed her all the way to Coruscant. Braden replied that she should have used something stronger than concussion ordnance before shooting her dead with his [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]].Facing Zym, he told him that he had a message from one of his former colleagues&mdash;the [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] Master Dar'nala. However, Zym responded by telling Braden he was only willing to converse with him if he put down his weapon and submitted to Jedi custody. Braden killed Zym in self defense, and the Grand Master's opportunity of finding out that an unknown Sith Lord had ordered the attack on the ''Envoy'' had been wasted. Meanwhile, a bomb planted by Sith agents damaged a significant part of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Forn Dodonna
description: {{Quote|Hit that Star Forge with everything we've got!|Forn Dodonna during the [[Battle of Rakata Prime]]|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}As an [[Admiral/Legends|admiral]] serving with the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Republic Navy/Legends|Navy]], Admiral Dodonna led Republic forces against the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]] during the [[Jedi Civil War]] from her [[Admiral Dodonna's flagship|flagship]]. Towards the end of the war, Admiral Dodonna was contacted by another naval officer, [[Carth Onasi]], informing her of the location of a massive orbital factory called the [[Star Forge]], an ancient relic of the [[Infinite Empire]]. The Star Forge was being used to churn out all the starships and war droids that powered the Sith fleet. Dodonna realized that this was the opportunity she desperately needed to put an end to the war. Gathering a fleet together, Admiral Dodonna set out for the [[Lehon system|Star Forge system]]. En route, Admiral Dodonna's fleet was reunited with many survivors of the Sith attack on the [[Jedi Enclave]] on [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]]. Led by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Vandar Tokare]], the group joined the fleet in its endeavor to destroy the Star Forge.<ref name="KOTOR" />[[File:Dodonnahologram.jpg|thumb|left|200px|[[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] Dodonna as a [[Hologram/Legends|hologram]], communicating with the ''[[Ebon Hawk]]''.]]Upon arriving in the system, Admiral Dodonna's fleet was confronted with a sizeable defense fleet, which guarded the Star Forge itself. Dodonna was contacted by Carth Onasi once more, from the ''Ebon Hawk'', whose crew deactivated a massive interdictor field being generated from the nearby planet [[Lehon]], which would have otherwise destroyed the fleet. Admiral Dodonna was suffering heavy losses in space and suggested a retreat, but Carth insisted that the Republic probably wouldn't get another chance to strike at the Star Forge again. Dodonna conceded, and the ''Ebon Hawk''{{'s}} crew, at the advice of Master Vandar, resolved to lead a Jedi strike team onto the Star Forge, to find and kill [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] [[Darth Malak|Malak]], the leader of the Sith Empire.<ref name="KOTOR" />Meanwhile, Dodonna was facing troubles of her own. Her entire fleet was faced with an impenetrable defensive line, preventing her from ordering a bombardment of the Star Forge. Carth attributed this to [[Bastila Shan]], a fallen [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who was very adept at using [[battle meditation]], a [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Force power/Legends|ability]] that allowed her to inspire allied troops and demoralize enemies, influencing an entire battle. Bastila's battle meditation was allowing the Sith to quickly counter every strategy Admiral Dodonna devised. Nevertheless, Admiral Dodonna pressed on.<ref name="KOTOR" />[[File:Kotorships copy.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Dodonna's [[Hammerhead-class cruiser|capital ships]] reinforce the positions of [[Red Squadron (Galactic Republic)|Red]] and [[Green Wing (squadron)|Green Squadrons]].]]Conditions soon changed after Bastila stopped using her battle meditation against the Republic fleet. Soon Dodonna's relentless press against the Sith ranks finally punctured a breach in the fleet's formation, splitting it into two groups. Admiral Dodonna quickly exploited this development, sending [[Red Squadron (Galactic Republic)|Red Squadron]] in with [[Green Wing (squadron)|Green Squadron]] to widen the gap. She then ordered her capital ships to reinforce their positions.<ref name="KOTOR" />[[File:Sf-battle.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Dodonna's fleet moves to attack the [[Star Forge]] directly.]]Once in range, Admiral Dodonna's fleet commenced a concentrated assault on the Star Forge. Realizing that the Star Forge was too well reinforced to be destroyed directly by the fleet, Dodonna proposed a precision strike against the Star Forge's main orbital stabilizers. With these out of commission, the Star Forge would fall out of orbit and crash into the star below. This strategy was quickly implemented. After Admiral Dodonna's capital ships destroyed the stabilizers, she ordered the fleet to pull back away from the Star Forge, unwilling to risk any of her ships being destroyed during the Star Forge's descent.The Star Forge was finished, colliding with a solar flare which caused the Star Forge to incinerate from within. With the Star Forge destroyed and Malak dead, the Sith fleet was thrown into disarray, allowing the Republic to sweep through Sith space and recover their losses.<ref name="KOTOR" />Returning to Lehon, the fleet celebrated their victory. Dodonna herself awarded the crew of the ''Ebon Hawk'' with the [[Cross of Glory]], the Republic's most prestigious medal, on the steps of the [[Temple of the Ancients]] (the very place that the crew had disabled the disruptor field generator at), thus commemorating them for their invaluable support during the [[Battle of Rakata Prime|battle]]; even the crew's droids were given medals.<ref name="KOTOR" />The remainder of the war was short; the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] and [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]] on the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] homeworld of [[Korriban]] quickly tore each other apart as each attempted to seize the title of Dark Lord of the Sith, a title held by Malak until his death, in a quick yet brutal civil war. This was the final blow to the Sith war effort, and the Jedi Civil War was over, though the Republic still had to recover from the destruction caused by the war. It can be speculated that Dodonna had Carth promoted to admiral during this time. Admiral Onasi would play an important role during the [[Dark Wars]].<ref name="KOTOR II">''[[Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic II: The Sith Lords]]''</ref>

name: Aeron Azzameen
description: Aeron Azzameen was the lone daughter of [[Tomaas Azzameen]] and the third of the four [[Azzameen family|Azzameen children]]. She, along with the rest of the Azzameen household, lived in [[Azzameen Station]], a [[Space station/Legends|space station]]<ref name="XWA" /> in orbit around the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Syned I]].<ref name="Atlas">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> When she came of age, she began working for [[Twin Suns Transport Services/Legends|Twin Suns Transport Services]], a [[Merchant/Legends|trading]] company owned by her father and his brother, [[Antan Azzameen|Antan]]. There, she typically [[Pilot/Legends|flew]] one of the family's [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300]] [[Light freighter/Legends|light freighters]] during delivery runs, but also knew how to pilot a [[YT-2000 light freighter]] if the need arose.<ref name="XWA" /> A skilled [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]], Aeron managed the family's data storage on her off [[Time/Legends|time]].<ref name="XWAPrima">''[[Star Wars: X-Wing Alliance: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref>While working for her father and uncle, Aeron met [[Olin Garn]], a freelance [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] pilot contracted by Twin Suns Transport Services. The two formed such a bond that Garn was soon considered a member of the Azzameen household. Though he eventually left the employment of Twin Suns Transport Services to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], Garn maintained contact with Aeron and the rest of the Azzameen family throughout his Alliance tenure.<ref name="XWA" />

name: Bhindi Drayson
description: {{Quote|Bhindi is one of our two tactics experts, along with Piggy, and she's been learning whatever she can about Yuuzhan Vong tactics.|Garik Loran on Bhindi Drayson|The New Jedi Order: Enemy Lines I: Rebel Dream}}[[File:Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War).jpg|thumb|left|200px|The Fall of Coruscant in 27 ABY.]]Bhindi Drayson was the daughter of [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Hiram Drayson]], a high-ranking [[New Republic Intelligence Service|New Republic Intelligence]] director, who long-operated the [[Alpha Blue]] agency. In her adult life, Bhindi Drayson eventually followed in her father's footsteps and entered a career in New Republic Intelligence.<ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref>During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], Drayson was part of the NRI unit [[Wraith Squadron]], specializing in tactics and analysis of [[Yuuzhan Vong]] strategems. In [[27 ABY/Legends|27 ABY]], after the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Battle of Coruscant (Yuuzhan Vong War)|fell]] to the Yuuzhan Vong invaders, Drayson and the rest of their Wraiths made their way to the newly secured garrison on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Borleias/Legends|Borleias]], which was commanded by [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[General/Legends|General]] [[Wedge Antilles/Legends|Wedge Antilles]]. While on Borleias serving in its [[Battle of Borleias (Yuuzhan Vong War; Second)|defense]], part of the Wraiths' duties included analyzing a recording for [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Danni Quee]], which later helped expose a civilian named [[Tam Elgrin]] as a Yuuzhan Vong agent.<ref name="RD" />When [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] assembled an expedition to infiltrate Coruscant, Drayson was assigned to it, along with several other members of the Wraiths. The initial plan for the intelligence-gathering part of the mission was for Drayson to remain behind on Coruscant after the rest of the group&mdash;which also included Quee and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Mara Jade Skywalker]] and [[Tahiri Veila]]&mdash;departed. After she was left behind, Drayson's objective was to help organize resistance movements among the Coruscanti survivors to combat the Yuuzhan Vong, as well as continued passing of information to the New Republic to assist in the eventual recapture of the capital. One type of equipment that Drayson brought on the mission was a series of surveillance [[Droid/Legends|droids]] disguised as [[Fungus/Legends|fungi]] to unobtrusively wander Coruscant while collecting and transmitting data. Drayson claimed that such information would be vital for future military engagements on Coruscant. Preliminary reports from Coruscant suggested that the Yuuzhan Vong had destroyed much of the city and were releasing worldshaping toxins into the [[Atmosphere/Legends|atmosphere]], so the New Republic wanted to learned more information about the alterations.<ref name="RD" />The Wraiths, three Jedi, and Quee were transported to Coruscant by former general [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] in the freighter ''[[Record Time]]''. Once in orbit, they were jettisoned from the ship, and descended in pods disguised as debris and the remnants of [[Yorik-et|Yuuzhan Vong coralskippers]]. The expeditionary force landed safely on Coruscant without being detected by the Yuuzhan Vong.<ref name="RD" />

name: Sai Sircu
description: {{Quote|We need not fear these Jedi, as always they are always too far behind.|Sai Sircu to [[Yansu Grjak]] and [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]]|Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Jedi Alliance}}[[File:Sairu.png|thumb|left|200px|Sai Sircu alongside Count Dooku and Asajj Ventress.]]She and her fellow sister [[Yansu Grjak]] led an [[Army/Legends|army]] of [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]] during the war between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. At that time, they formed an alliance with [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] and the Separatists in order to bring about the downfall of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. She first attacked the ''Sedawan'' with her sister. It was later revealed on Dathomir that she had more sinister intentions in mind&mdash;the subjugation of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].

name: Unidentified Human bounty hunter (Valin Horn)
description: {{Quote|Two maladjusted want-to-be bounty hunters and their dressed-up protocol droid.|Horn, referring to the female bounty hunter, Nyz, and Vaxx|Fate of the Jedi: Outcast}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] took part in the manhunt for [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Valin Horn]] in [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]]. Horn, who had recently developed an [[Force psychosis|enigmatic madness]] which caused him to believe that everybody he knew had been replaced with an impostor, had been taken to the [[New Jedi Temple|Jedi Temple]] to be studied. However, he had quickly escaped and embarked on a destructive rampage through the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. The [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] issued a warrant for his arrest, and several beings&mdash;including [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], bounty hunters, and [[Galactic Alliance Security]] agents&mdash;joined the chase. The Human bounty hunter was among the many hunters hired by [[Chief of State (Galactic Alliance)|Chief of State]] [[Natasi Daala]] to be a part of the Chief of State's [[Daala's special-missions force|special-missions force]]. She was partnered with the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] [[Vrannin Vaxx]] and the [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] bounty hunter [[Dhidal Nyz]]. The three hunters rode in the bed of a [[Cargo hauler/Legends|cargo hauler]], which was [[Pilot/Legends|piloted]] by [[Unidentified pilot (Valin Horn)|another being]].<ref name="Outcast" />During the chase, Horn, who had been flying in an antique [[T-65 X-wing starfighter/Legends|X-wing]] [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]], was attacked by Jedi [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and forced to eject from the fighter. The cargo hauler maneuvered underneath the falling Horn and caught him in the cargo bed. The bounty hunters trained their weapons on the fugitive, but as Nyz ordered Horn to surrender, Jedi Knight [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]]&mdash;also hoping to capture Horn&mdash;leapt down towards the cargo bed from a [[Airspeeder/Legends|speeder]] above them. While the three hunters were distracted by Solo, Horn grabbed his [[Ejector seat/Legends|ejector seat]] and jumped off the side of the hauler, rocketing away.<ref name="Outcast" />Solo landed in the cargo bed, and Nyz fired his electric net gun at her. The net caught her and disabled her, causing her to fall over the edge of the hauler. Annoyed by his rash action, the female bounty hunter began to criticize Nyz. Her denigration was cut short, however, as a racing speeder shot by them, causing the hauler's pilot to veer to one side. The cargo bed tilted sharply, and Nyz was thrown off of the vehicle. The female hunter fell, but she quickly went into an acrobatic roll and came to a safe stop at the cargo bed's low railing. As they began to accelerate back up to speed, they were [[Laser/Legends|fired]] upon by former [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and his wife, [[Leia Organa Solo]], in their [[Starship/Legends|starship]], the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']]. Vaxx was hit, and the cyborg was sent flying into the control cab of the hauler. Smoke began streaming out from the cab, and, with their vehicle disabled, the bounty hunters were forced to give up the chase.<ref name="Outcast" />

name: Tila Mong
description: Around [[34 ABY/Legends|34 ABY]], Tila Mong served as a Baran Do Sage under [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Koro Ziil]], residing within the [[Baran Do temple]] in [[Dor'shan]]. Around this time, [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] visited [[Dorin/Legends|Dorin]] with hopes of learning the [[Force power/Legends|Force techniques]] specific to the sages of the Baran Do. Feeling that Solo was a good man, Master Ziil did not hesitate to train him in the art of ''[[hassat-durr]]'' and its sub-techniques. Mastering it within three days, Solo was thankful to the Masters and departed.<ref name="Outcast" />In 43.5 ABY when Luke Skywalker and his son [[Ben Skywalker|Ben]] appeared at the Temple, she had ascended to the rank of Mistress of the Baran Do. She was sympathetic to Skywalker's [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]] from the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]] and their [[New Jedi Temple|Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and was willing to teach the former [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] the techniques her predecessor had taught Jedi Solo. With Ben promised to neutralize his father should Luke contract the same ideas that caused Jacen Solo to turn to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], Mong brought the former Grand Master to her chambers to begin the training. Devoid of learning rituals, Mong began with the ''[[ayna-seff]]'' technique, the ''dead-brain'' technique of scrambling brain scans. Using a small [[Durasteel/Legends|durasteel]] sphere and a flat metal plate with an electrical lead embedded within, she set the plate in front of Skywalker and placed the ball in a depression on top of it. Handing the Jedi the electrical cord leading into the plate, Luke cycled through the different mind-states used in applying the Force, searching for one that would activate the electromagnetic energy that would lift the ball. Deciding upon the state-of-mind that enabled the [[Force-flash]], Luke was able to lift the ball and after another day, cause it to stop the ball from spinning. The techniques took Luke two days to master, as opposed to Jacen's three.<ref name="Outcast" />During the training, Luke noted that Mong guarded her thoughts more closely when she discussed the death of Master Ziil. When [[Chara|Charsae Saal]] publicly "died" at his [[Dying ceremony|passing ceremony]] at the Temple, Luke knew that the sages were lying; that Saal had not died at all. He confronted Mong and discovered that he was right&mdash;and not only Saal was still alive, but Ziil was still alive as well. They had joined a secret sect of the sages known as the [[Hidden Ones]], who were in hiding below the surface of [[Dorin/Legends|Dorin]].
