In an underground chamber, Mong, Saal, and two other sages permitted the two Skywalkers to descend into the [[Caverns of the Hidden One]].<ref name="Outcast" />After the Skywalkers [[Confrontation in the Caverns of the Hidden One|dealt]] with Ziil, they made an unprecedented return to the surface and departed Dorin, leaving Mong to lead the Sages on the surface.<ref name="Outcast" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Helr'ven
description: When the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] came to [[Prakith/Legends|Prakith]], the [[Thaarke Corporation]] took control of the [[Geddis mine]] and secretly captured a number of Stereb, to work there as [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]]. After the Stereb sealed off their tunnels, Helr'ven was stranded in the mine and was among those captured. She was given the job of caring for eight wounded Stereb, as there was no-one else available to do so.

name: Eldr'har
description: Eldr'har was the leader of a group of Stereb who lived underground near to [[Prak City]]. When a group of [[Alderaanian Resistance]] agents traveled to Prakith, they rescued the missing Stereb [[Herdr'tui]] and brought him back to Eldr'har's community. She was very pleased by this and thanked the agents.

name: Asora
description: Asora owned a shop in [[Hedrett]] called [[Asora's Sweet Surprise]], that specialized in selling cooking ingredients. A group of [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronians]] working for [[Melo Centris]] traveled to her shop and purchased some cooking ingredients from her. Shortly afterward, Asora witnessed them shooting [[Carilla]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] who owned a nearby shop.{{Char-stub}}

name: Melo Centris
description: Centris was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|force-sensitive]] and used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to enhance her bounty hunting skills. She took a bounty from the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]] to kill [[Jarid DeBell]], a former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who had incurred their wrath. DeBell was going to be marrying [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], so Centris traveled to the [[Cularin system]]. She arrived in [[Tolea Biqua]] on the gas planet [[Genarius]], where a group of [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronians]] persuaded her to let them work for her. She sent the Devaronians to acquire some cake baking materials, which she used to bake a poisoned cake. She then infiltrated the wedding in disguise as an usher and planned for DeBell to consume the cake. However, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] realized what she was planning to do and they thwarted her plans.<ref name="AOE" />During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Centris attempted to release a virus into the atmosphere of the planet [[Caarimon]], in an attempt to kill off its native species, the [[Caarite]]s.<ref name="BotB">''[[Belly of the Beaast]]''</ref>

name: Jhara
description: Jhara was born to [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] parents and lived on Dalicron-4 along with them, her brother [[Caeleb]] and her grandfather, [[Gel]], a former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Gel contacted the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and asked them to send [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] to Dalicron-4, as he felt that Caeleb was at risk from the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], because he was strong in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. The Alliance sent a team of its agents instead, and Jhara traveled to the village of [[Dalia (township)|Dalia]] to meet them. She acquired some [[Cracian Thumper]]s from the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Meebo]], and they rode them back to her family's farm. However, upon arrival they found that Gel was dead and Caeleb missing, so they set out to find the missing child.

name: Gruunelda
description: Gruunelda was a [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]] in the [[Office of Peace and Security]], Cularin's law enforcement agency. She liked to wear lipstick and on occasion, she would purchase bootleg Trandoshan music from [[S&N Music]]. In her spare time, she also liked to visit the bar [[Lover's Kiss]], in [[Hedrett]].When [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren|Lavina Wren]] and [[Jarid DeBell]] announced that they were going to get married, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] were sent to investigate a plot to stop the wedding. They asked Gruunelda a few questions about the plot.

name: Athnalu
description: {{Quotetrans|Like threaded knives, I can feel them scrape at my soul. They use little dolls to control me&hellip;control my soul, my mind and fill it with little voices. Little dolls and little voices. Do the dolls speak to me? Will you help me fix my soul? Will you?!|Athnalu, to the spacer|Star Wars Galaxies: Rage of the Wookiees}}[[File:Athnalu Galaxy.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Athnalu after the Battle of Yavin]]A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]], Athnalu lived in [[Kerritamba Village]] near the [[Kkowir Forest]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Shortly after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Athnalu came under the belief that the [[Sayormi]] people&mdash;a mysterious [[Species/Legends|species]] that lived in the [[Dead Forest (Kashyyyk)|Dead Forest]] of the Kkowir [[Forest/Legends|Forest]]&mdash;had placed a spell on her. She thought herself possessed and cursed by the Sayormi. Believing that her very [[soul]] was rotting away, Athnalu lived in constant pain and fear, which caused her to grow increasingly mentally unstable.<ref name="Rage" />{{Gamemechanics}}That same [[Standard year/Legends|year]], Athnalu was approached by a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] who was visiting her village. Athnalu explained her situation and the curse she believed she was under and pleaded for the spacer to help her. The spacer accepted the Wookiee's request for assistance, and Athnalu tasked the traveler with collecting five [[Voodoo/Legends|voodoo dolls]] that she thought the Sayormi were using to possess her. By having the dolls, Athnalu hoped they would help her understand why the Sayormi had placed the curse on her. After the spacer had completed the task and returned to Athnalu, the Wookiee rewarded the being with 1,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]].<ref name="Rage" />However, unsatisfied with the results from the dolls, Athnalu again asked the spacer for assistance. The spacer agreed, and Athnalu told the traveler to find three more items that she thought were needed to cure her: the [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] of a [[shadevale]], [[Snake/Legends|snakes]] that lived in the nearby [[lake]]s and streams; hairs from a [[mouf]], large, woolly creatures that wandered the forest; and finally a [[Mysess blossom]], a [[Plant/Legends|flower]] that grew in the village. The spacer dutifully collected all she requested and brought them to Athnalu, which the Wookiee mixed together into a potion and consumed. Now satisfied that she was free of the curse's influence, she thanked the spacer and rewarded the being with another 1,200 credits and a special [[ceremonial chair]] from the village.<ref name="Rage" />{{Endgame}}

name: Fara Telon
description: When CreedCon began construction of a race track through the jungles of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], Telon was part of a group of construction workers who were tasked with building a bridge for part of the race course. However, they uncovered a [[Cloud Mountain cavern|mysterious cavern]], which was home to an ancient creature, the [[t'salak]], that had been imprisoned there by the [[Tarasin]]. The [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]] traveled there and tried to free the creature, but was unable to do so, so took out her anger by capturing all the workers at the bridge construction site, including Buume.<ref name="Force Concession" />Muun took the captured workers to [[TX-38]], a deserted factory, located on [[Tilnes]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of Cularin. She managed to obtain the t'salak and it touched Telon and the other workers with it's tendrils, causing them all to enter a violent rage. However, they were eventually rescued by the [[Heroes of Cularin]].<ref name="Force Contention">''[[Force Contention]]''</ref>

name: Bur'n Ikle
description: When CreedCon began construction of a race track through the jungles of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], Ikle was part of a group of construction workers who were tasked with building a bridge for part of the race course. However, they uncovered a [[Cloud Mountain cavern|mysterious cavern]], which was home to an ancient creature, the [[t'salak]], that had been imprisoned there by the [[Tarasin]]. The [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]] traveled there and tried to free the creature, but was unable to do so, so took out her anger by capturing all the workers at the bridge construction site, including Buume.<ref name="Force Concession" />Muun took the captured workers to [[TX-38]], a deserted factory, located on [[Tilnes]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of Cularin. She managed to obtain the t'salak and it touched Ikle and the other workers with it's tendrils, causing them all to enter a violent rage. However, they were eventually rescued by the [[Heroes of Cularin]].<ref name="Force Contention">''[[Force Contention]]''</ref>

name: Walda Ceen
description: When CreedCon began construction of a race track through the jungles of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], Ceen was part of a group of construction workers who were tasked with building a bridge for part of the race course. However, they uncovered a [[Cloud Mountain cavern|mysterious cavern]], which was home to an ancient creature, the [[t'salak]], that had been imprisoned there by the [[Tarasin]]. The [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]] traveled there and tried to free the creature, but was unable to do so, so took out her anger by capturing all the workers at the bridge construction site, including Buume.<ref name="Force Concession" />Muun took the captured workers to [[TX-38]], a deserted factory, located on [[Tilnes]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of Cularin. She managed to obtain the t'salak and it touched Ceen and the other workers with its tendrils, causing them all to enter a violent rage. However, they were eventually rescued by the [[Heroes of Cularin]].<ref name="Force Contention">''[[Force Contention]]''</ref>

name: Sh'alla
description: Sh'alla was a member of the [[Jaraana irstat]] and she lived with them in their village in the jungles of Cularin. When the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]] set fire to the village, the flames warped the door of the building that Sh'alla was in, trapping her. However, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] attempted to rescue her.

name: Kills
description: When Riboga decided to retake control of crime in the [[Cularin system]] from [[Nirama]], he sent Kills there, along with a group of thugs under her command, in preparation for his takeover. She made her first move by killing [[Teeloo]], a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] who worked for Nirama, in a restaurant on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. She then left some of her thugs behind to try and take out the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who were dining with Teeloo. Afterwards, she attempted to kill [[Nadin Paal]], Nirama's second-in-command. She then traveled to [[Genarius]], a gas planet located in the system, where she led an attack on [[Riboga's Barge]] and also met with [[Lalo]], a former assassin of Riboga, to try and persuade her to serve the Hutt again.

name: Escra Fey'lya
description: Fey'lya was an [[Inspector/Legends|Inspector]] in the [[Organized Crime Division]] of the OPS. When the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Teeloo]] was assassinated by [[Kills]], an assassin working for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Riboga]], Fey'lya was sent to investigate.

name: Dani (Cularin)
description: Dani lived in the city of [[Hedrett]] and was one of the "watchers", a group of young people who kept an eye on the children of Cularin. When [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren|Lavina Wren]] planned to get married, she hired the [[Heroes of Cularin]] to investigate a plot to stop her wedding. During their investigations, they asked Dani if she knew anything. She told them that none of the children she watched were involved in the plot, although some rowdy children had recently arrived in the city, from [[Tolea Biqua]] on [[Genarius]].She was a friend of [[Lora Nadad]], a former "watcher" who left to train as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] at the [[Almas Academy]].

name: Morad'Ka
description: During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]] visited the village where the Jaraana irtsat lived, in disguise as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. She tried to persuade Moraad'Ka to travel with her to the [[Cloud Mountain cavern]], as she hoped to trick the Tarasin into helping her free to the [[t'salak]], a dangerous creature that was imprisoned there. Morad'Ka refused, as she sensed that something was not right.A short time afterward, Morad'Ka was contacted by the Jedi of the [[Almas Academy]], who asked her if she could give them the t'salak, so that they could study it. Morad'Ka agreed and contacted the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Nek Lawsirk]], telling him that he could come and collect the creature from her. However, Muun had captured Lawsirk and disguised herself as him, so came to collect the creature instead. Morad'Ka gave her the creature, but afterward suffered a number of disturbing visions.

name: Hagrana Memuna
description: Memuna was a student at the [[Blue Star Centre]], a philosophical center that was located in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Gadrin]], on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. In about [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Memuna was arrested after she protested against a decision made by [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Barnab Chistor]], by uprooting all the flowers in his garden and replanting them on the edge of the city.{{Char-stub}}

name: Teraeza Furloti
description: In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], she was stationed undercover in the city of [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]] where she was the first Alliance operative to discover information on the existence of a [[Geonosian Bio-Lab|Geonosian biogenics lab]] that was still operational. The lab was found to be creating mutated [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Kwi]]s and [[Kliknik]]s, which were then provided to the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] as minions.<ref name="AED" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Canduri
description: Canduri was a member of a Believer cell on the floating city of [[Ipsus]], on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]]. She was based in a secret Believer research lab, where the Believers were developing a virus that was fatal to [[Caarite]]s. When a group of Caarites came to destroy the lab, Canduri fled with a sample of the virus. However, just after escaping, she encountered the [[heroes of Cularin]]. On seeing them, she raised her [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] and tried to trigger a security system, so that she could attempt to escape.

name: Kait
description: When Nirama, discovered that the [[Believers]] had a seceret lab of [[Ipsus]], he wished to discuss this with the [[heroes of Cularin]], so he sent Kait to find them on [[Tolea Biqua]] and ask them to meet him a ''[[Riboga's Barge]]''. Kait found the heroes and told them that someone wanted to meet them, but tried to get them to pay her to tell them who it was. Afterwards, she give them a [[recording rod]] with a message from Nirama on.

name: Crymsin Ost
description: Crymsin Ost was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who served the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]],<ref name="Belly of the Beaast" /> and she trained as [[Jedi Guardian]], a combat-oriented [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] specialization.<ref name="SWRGRCR">''[[Star Wars Roleplaying Game Revised Core Rulebook]]''</ref> At some point Ost lost her sanity and fell to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]; she abandoned the Jedi and affiliated herself with the [[Believers]], a [[Sith cult]] that was based in the [[Cularin system]]. She eventually became an important member of the cult and, with help from the [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] Believer [[Force Adept]] [[Disch'l]], constructed a [[Color/Legends|pink]]-colored [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] for herself.<ref name="Belly of the Beaast" />In about [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="21 BBY">The ''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]'' states that the [[Living Force (RPG)|''Living Force'']] campaign is set one [[Standard year/Legends|year]] after the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]], an event that is dated to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] by ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''. As the ''Living Force'' adventure ''[[Philology]]'' [[Cularin's disappearance|moved]] the campaign forward ten years to the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], ''[[Belly of the Beaast]]'' is therefore dated to circa [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]].</ref> during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the Believers embarked upon a plot to [[Death/Legends|wipe out]] most of the [[Caarite]]s&mdash;a [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] [[Species/Legends|species]] that operated the [[Metatheran Cartel]] [[Merchant/Legends|trade]] organization&mdash;by dispersing a [[Anti-Caarite virus|deadly virus]] on the Caarite [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]], [[Caarimon]]. Ost was placed in command of the [[Mission to Caarimon|operation]], and she journeyed to Caarimon aboard a [[Transport/Legends|transport]] that had collected large quantities of the virus from a [[S-Ipsus Believers laboratory|secret Believers laboratory]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]]. On arrival in the [[Caarimoos system]], Ost's transport docked with the research [[Space station/Legends|station]] [[Creautaa-V]] in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] of Caarimon, and she disembarked from the [[Starship/Legends|vessel]] along with the rest of her strike team: Disch'l, the Believer [[Eph]], and [[Melo Centris]], a renowned [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] who had been hired to assist the Believers with their mission. The Believers released a sample of the infection and wiped out all of the installation's Caarite crew, then off-loaded a tank of the virus and ferried it to the lowest level of the station. There, they filled some [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pods]] with the virus and prepared them for launch in the direction of the planet, and they also rigged the pods with explosives, hoping to crash them into fault lines in the [[Desolation]] region of the world and cause a major cataclysm. Meanwhile, another group of Believers landed on Caarimon and rigged a [[Homing beacon/Legends|homing beacon]] in the Desolation region, and Ost and her crew waited to receive a signal from the [[Transmitter/Legends|transmitter]].<ref name="Belly of the Beaast" />A group of freelance [[Agent/Legends|agents]] from the Cularin [[Star system/Legends|system]] known as the "[[Heroes of Cularin]]" traveled to Caarimon to investigate the Believer plot, and, after disabling the homing beacon in the Desolation, they boarded the Creautaa-V and confronted Ost's strike team. Ost ignited her lightsaber and moved to attack the operatives, while Disch'l used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to create an [[Mind trick/Legends|illusory]] version of the fallen Jedi, as a distraction. Despite their efforts, Ost and the other Believers were eventually defeated, and the agents prevented the virus from being dispersed on the planet.<ref name="Belly of the Beaast" />

name: Mari-Elan Nora
description: {{Quote|This time, it was Master Nora herself, and somehow I felt this message was for me alone. She told of the final battle on Lorrd, how the Argazdans had fled to the chambers within the Slave Pits...and vanished.|''Death in the Slave Pits of Lorrd, Or: What I Did On My Inter-Term Break'', by Tash Arranda|Death in the Slave Pits of Lorrd}}Mari-Elan Nora was descended from [[Lorrdian/Legends|Lorrdians]] who had been saved from a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] colony by a team of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]]. A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Lorrdian herself, she joined the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and vowed to bring justice to the home of her ancestors&mdash;[[Lorrd/Legends|Lorrd]]. The [[Planet/Legends|planet]] had been under the oppression of the [[Argazdan Redoubt]] since the beginning of the [[Kanz Disorders]] three hundred [[Time/Legends|years]] prior.<ref name="dspl" /> Despite the emergence of a [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|new Sith Empire]], and the resultant [[Great Galactic War|Great Galactic]] and [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]]s<ref name="t1">''[[Timeline 1: Treaty of Coruscant]]''</ref> threatening the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Nora was able to gain enough support in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] for her cause.<ref name="dspl" />As a result Nora launched her own crusade to bring a conclusive end to the Kanz Disorders. She teamed up with several other [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], as well as the [[Republic Army]], and waged a bitter campaign against the Argazdan Redoubt. Although the [[Argazdan]]s fought bitterly to hold their territories and their slaves, Nora and her allies emerged victorious in [[3670 BBY]].<ref name="dspl" /><ref name="tea">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> During the [[Liberation of Lorrd|final battle]] on Lorrd, the Argazdans beat a hasty retreat into the gargantuan [[Slave Pits of Lorrd|Slave Pits]], and then mysteriously vanished. Jedi and soldiers were dispatched to flush out the Argazdans, but did not return. Although she could not sense anything, Nora believed that [[Lorrdian Yuuzhan Vong monster|something sinister]] was lurking in the Slave Pits. To contain it, she ordered that the Pits be filled in, and that their existence be hidden.<ref name="dspl" /> The Kanz Disorders were finally over, having claimed over five billion lives.<ref name="tea" />In the wake of the conflict, she became the [[Jedi Watchman]] of the [[Kanz sector]]. Nora was eventually [[Death/Legends|slain]] by slavers on [[Noremac]]. The Jedi Knight's body was brought to Lorrd, where it was buried in the [[Crypt of Martyrs]], located in [[Qatamer]]. The Crypt was reserved for all those who had devoted their lives to combating slavery, and Nora's memorial was accompanied by both a biographical [[Hologram/Legends|hologram]], relaying the events of her life, and a recording of the Jedi Knight herself in the wake of the liberation of Lorrd. Mari-Elan Nora's memorial was visited by the young [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Tash Arranda]], who along with her brother, [[Zak Arranda|Zak]], explored the Slave Pits and discovered what lurked inside&mdash;a gargantuan monster of [[Yuuzhan Vong|alien origin]]. Arranda later profiled Nora in her essay entitled ''[[Death in the Slave Pits of Lorrd, Or: What I Did On My Inter-Term Break]]'', and illustrated the late Jedi as well.<ref name="dspl" />

name: Salla Zend
description: [[File:StalightIntruder.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Salla's ''[[Starlight Intruder]]''.]]Zend was originally a student with a true gift for fixing and modifying machinery, yet she didn't seek training to become an [[Engineer/Legends|engineer]] or a [[Technician/Legends|technician]], preferring to become a [[Starship/Legends|spaceship]] mechanic aboard a corporate vessel. Eventually, she saved up enough money for a loan, with which she bought her own ship.Her first time on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]] was eventful, with her getting into a fight with a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] named "[[Jump]]," who tried to romance her at first, but then tried to be rough; his roughness only got him a dislocated shoulder. Tweaking out her vessel, the [[Rimrunner (Gymsnor-4)|''Rimrunner'']], Zend began repaying the debt by smuggling with [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]].<ref name="The Hutt Gambit">''[[The Hutt Gambit]]''</ref>She was one of the many smugglers who fought in the [[Battle of Nar Shaddaa]] where she and [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] in the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] were partnered up. During the battle, she personally destroyed three [[Guardian-class light cruiser|''Guardian''-class light cruisers]] with her ship's [[Concussion missile/Legends|concussion missiles]].<ref name="The Hutt Gambit" />A race with Solo past a [[neutron star]] almost ended in disaster when her [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] failed and Solo nearly died rescuing her. Disturbed by the narrow miss, Zend wished to marry Solo, but he refused and said goodbye to her.<ref name="Rebel Dawn">''[[Rebel Dawn]]''</ref> She later partnered up with [[Shug Ninx]].<ref name="Dark Empire">''[[Dark Empire]]''</ref>{{Char-stub}}

name: Riga Lanchenzoor
description: Lanchenzoor was the youngest person to become chief manager for the [[Bank of Aargau/Legends|Bank of Aargau]],<ref name="aargau" /> and later came into the employ of the Corporate Sector Authority's Financial Division. Thanks to her shrewdness and ambition, Lanchenzoor was made the Executive Viceprex of that division, a position that she held for the next twenty years&mdash;longer than any other Executive Viceprex. While running the Financial Division, Lanchenzoor showed a considerable intolerance for the duplicity that was prevalent within the Authority's other divisions, as well as a dedication to her work, despite being in her sixties.During her tenure as the head of the Financial Division, Lanchenzoor held the view that the Authority should cease the practice of pegging its currency to that of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], but others in the Authority's leadership who feared that the Empire would not take kindly to such an affront and opposed her plans. Lanchenzoor was undaunted by the opposition she faced and continued to push for the Authority to establish an independent currency, figuring that she would either change the minds of those who opposed her or wait for them to leave their positions of power.

name: Neera Opatajji-Hirken
description: [[File:MirkovigHS.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Mirkovig Hirken, husband of Neera Opatajji-Hirken.]]The fourth daughter of the [[Duke/Legends|Duke]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Opatajji]], Neera Opatajji enjoyed an extremely privileged upbringing of high society functions in her family's mansion. But despite her house's opulent wealth and lavish lifestyle, Opatajji was frequently bored and lonely, and dreamed of finding her way out of the family home. She got her wish when she [[Marriage/Legends|married]] [[Mirkovig Hirken]], a fast-rising executive in the [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority]]. But while the now-Neera Opatajji-Hirken delighted in her husband's fast rise up the Authority's chain of command, eventually becoming [[Viceprex]] of [[Security Division|Corporate Security]], it didn't make her any happier&mdash;much less so when she and her husband moved to the desolate [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]] [[Mytus VII]], where Hirken had accepted a position overseeing a new experimental [[Prison/Legends|prison]] project known as [[Stars' End/Legends|Stars' End]].<ref name="css" />There, the pleasures she had become accustomed to&mdash;the elaborate parties, the affairs with Hirken's subordinates&mdash;became completely inaccessible as the couple moved into living quarters within the prison complex itself.<ref name="css" /> However, in [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]], she seemingly got a reprieve when a troupe of entertainers, "Madam [[Atuarre]]'s Roving Performers," arrived to give a performance on Stars' End. Opatajji-Hirken was thrilled by the promise of a respite from her constant boredom, but in truth, the visitors weren't performers at all: they were in fact a group of friends and loved ones of Stars' End prisoners, who had come to stage a [[Liberation of Stars' End|jailbreak]]. While Hirken, in part at Neera's urging, allowed the performance to go on, he was really more interested in seeing his [[Mark X Executioner]] [[Gladiator droid/Legends|gladiator droid]] do battle against one of the visitors' droids, [[Bollux]].<ref name="starsend" />Although Neera delighted in the acrobatics of the [[Trianii/Legends|Trianii]] Atuarre and her cub [[Pakka]], her impatient husband cut the performance short to go straight to the fighting. From there, matters quickly got out of hand: the diminutive Bollux surprisingly defeated Hirken's [[Droid/Legends|droid]], which led to a confrontation between Hirken and the group's leader, [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]. At Hirken's urging, Solo and Hirken's [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] [[Uul-Rha-Shan]] engaged in a gunfight, which ended with a massive power plant explosion that blasted Stars' End clear off the surface of Mytus VII. In the panic following the blast, Neera attempted to escape the doomed station with her husband. However, Hirken left her behind in order to separately attempt to negotiate a deal with Solo. Furious and betrayed, Neera tracked her husband down through the smoke-filled corridors of Stars' End, and put a hole in his back with a [[Blaster pistol/Legends|blaster pistol]] before she was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the station crashing back into Mytus VII's surface.<ref name="starsend" />

name: Antaria Wellos
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Chiss/Legends|Chiss]], Antaria Wellos was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] before the fall of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Declaration of a New Order]] that marked the end of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the rise of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Retreating into exile, Wellos took refuge on the planet [[Rori/Legends|Rori]] where she survived the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]] initiated by the Empire. During the time of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Wellos was approached by a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] traveling through a [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] on Rori. The spacer presented Wellos with a [[Jinsu Razor]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="AED" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Navari Trik
description: [[File:Navari.jpg|thumb|left|350px|Navari Trik and her paintings]]During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], she was tasked with distributing [[Painting/Legends|paintings]] selected in [[Galactic Empire Painting Contest]], as well as secretly distributing [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] paintings from the [[Rebel Alliance Painting Contest]].She set up shop near the [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Cantina]] for a short time, distributing paintings to a number of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]]. Two paintings of note that she distributed were, [[United in Our Cause|''United in our Cause'']] and ''[[The March to Restuss]]''.She later made a return, distributing two other paintings titled ''[[Imperial Oasis Incident]]'' and ''[[Preparing for the Storm]]'' in front of the [[Spaceport/Legends|Mos Eisley Spaceport]].

name: Mir'Liss
description: Mir'Liss was a member of the [[Jaraana irstat]], a Tarasin tribe and by the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] had became it's [[Irstat-Kes]], or "tribal leader". When the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]] visited the village where the Jaraana istat lived in disguise as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], [[Morad'Ka]], the [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] of the istat, refused to help her in obtaining a [[t'salak]], so Muun returned the next day and set fire to the village. Mir'Liss directed the other Tarasin to get the fire extinguished and because of Muun's disguise, believed that the Jedi were responsible.{{Char-stub}}

name: Yougga
description: Yougga lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and had the ambition to become Cularin's most notorious [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]]. To this end, she formed a smuggling organization. However, her employees were just as inexperienced as she was and they couldn't decide what to smuggle or from where they could obtain a [[Starship/Legends|starship]]. She and her employees visited the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] [[The Chasm|Chasm]] the day after it was attacked by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Raik Muun]], as they wanted to be there in case something else interesting happened.

name: Desha Lor
description: Lor was born into a family friendly with [[Chief of State (Galactic Alliance)|Chief of State]] [[Natasi Daala]]. She was a stellar student with no criminal record. She was thought by [[Wynn Dorvan]] to have been selected by Daala because the chief of state felt that Lor, as a female, may not have the chance later in her career, and because she sympathized with her, having been looked down upon during her Imperial career due to her gender.

name: Shilly
description: During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Shilly was among a group of couriers who traveled to a rendezvous point in the jungles of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], to collect some illicit cargo. Shilly flew there in a custom [[Speeder/Legends|speeder]] that she owned, but she and her fellow couriers found the rendezvous point to be deserted. However, they were then ambushed by enforcers that were working for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Riboga]]. Shilly and [[Gust Toruna]], one of the other couriers, fled in the speeder, but were pursued by gunmen on [[Speeder bike/Legends|speeder bikes]]. The bikers were eventually able to blow up the speeder, killing Shilly.

name: Lahka Khai
description: [[File:GavarKhai-Allies.jpg|thumb|left|145px|Gavar Khai, Lahka's husband]]{{Quote|Sometimes I think she is truly my daughter, a fierce and proud Sith, as I have trained her to be. And sometimes I think she is on the verge of betraying all of us.''"<br />"''Not our Vestara. She knows her duty. To the dark side, to the Sith, to the Lost Tribe, to us. Even if she falters, I have faith she will not truly fall from the path.|Gavar and Lahka, discussing their daughter|Fate of the Jedi: Ascension}}Lahka Khai was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] born on<ref name="Omen" /> the [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]]<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Kesh]]. Despite her lack of [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitivity]], she married a [[Sith Saber]], [[Gavar Khai]]&mdash;a member of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]],<ref name="Omen" /> descendants of a group of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] whose [[Starship/Legends|starship]], the ''[[Omen]]'', crashed onto the planet in [[5000 BBY/Legends|5000 BBY]], during the [[Great Hyperspace War]].<ref>''[[Lost Tribe of the Sith: Precipice]]</ref> Together, the Khais lived in a private [[Khai estate|estate]] on Kesh.<ref name="Ascension" />With Gavar, Lahka gave birth to one daughter in [[27 ABY/Legends|27.5 ABY]], whom they named [[Vestara Khai|Vestara]]. Vestara began [[Sith training|training]] in the ways of the Sith, and shortly after [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]], a [[Sith Meditation Sphere]], arrived on the planet in [[41 ABY]], she was called to meet with the [[Circle of Lords]] in Kesh's [[Circle Chambers]], in the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tahv]]. Gavar and Vestara were worried that she might have gotten in trouble, and, though Lahka could tell that something was wrong, she knew it was not her place to be concerned about Sith business. However, at the meeting, Vestara was chosen to become the [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] of [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Olaris Rhea|Rhea]]. To begin her training, Vestara had to move away from her family and live in the [[Kesh Sith Temple|Sith Temple]] located in the nearby [[Takara Mountains]].<ref name="Omen" />In [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]], Vestara was chosen to be a member of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith strike team|Sith strike team]] sent to [[Skirmish at Sinkhole Station|confront]] the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke]] and [[Ben Skywalker]].<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Abyss]]''</ref> She was the sole survivor of the mission, and went on to recruit a group of [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]] on [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] to the Tribe's cause. Gavar, too, left on a [[Mission to the Maw|mission]] to find Vestara and then make a feigned alliance with the Jedi to attack the dark side entity [[Abeloth]]. Throughout that time, Lahka Khai remained in good health. She missed her daughter's presence, but she was also very proud of Vestara's achievements.<ref name="Allies">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Allies]]''</ref>In [[44 ABY]], Gavar returned to Kesh with Abeloth, who&mdash;after multiple battles between herself, the Sith, and the Jedi&mdash;had proposed an alliance with the Sith to defeat the Jedi. He was able to take some time to meet with Lahka and live with her at their estate for a few days. Lahka then joined Gavar and the majority of the Sith in the Tribe in attending Abeloth's arrival planetside at the [[Tahv spaceport]]. Later that evening Lahka returned to their estate while Gavar attended a masquerade for Abeloth to which Lahka had not been invited. Gavar spent the night on his [[ChaseMaster]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]], the ''[[Black Wave]]'', rather than returning home; and in the night Abeloth unleashed a powerful [[Destruction of Tahv|attack]] on the city, leaving much of Tahv in ruins and [[Death/Legends|destroying]] many of its inhabitants. Despite the fact that Lahka was among those who died, Gavar chose to betray the Tribe and ally with Abeloth.<ref name="Ascension" />

name: Ajuva Vanasterin
description: During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Ajuva resided in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Restuss]] on [[Rori/Legends|Rori]]. She grew so tired of arguments between citizens of [[Restuss]] and [[Narmle (city)|Narmle]] concerning which town was better, so she sought to organize a dinner party for those who wanted to just come together.She tasked a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] with the responsibility of personally giving a dinner invitation to her close friend, [[Jinderliss Prason]]. The spacer carried out the task, and was paid several [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for the trouble.Before the [[Battle of Restuss]] erupted, Ajuva was apparently evacuated from the city by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]].

name: Abagga Creel
description: {{Quote|Go speak with my assistant, Abagga Creel, and get a shipment invoice for the missing shipment. She's at our office building here in Coronet.|[[Ral Mundi]], to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Abagga Creel was the assistant of the businessman [[Ral Mundi]], head of [[Ral Mundi's Starship Emporium]], in [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet City]].<ref name="SWG:GttSotRS" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> an important shipment ordered by Ral Mundi disappeared during its transports, putting the company on the verge of ruin. Creel thus worked with a spacer to find information concerning the missing shipment.<ref name="SWG:GttSotRS" /> The spacer would eventually recover the shipment that was stolen by the [[Ragtags]].<ref name="SWG:RtMSC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Reacquire the Missing Starship Component Shipment" on Corellia</ref>Around the same time, Abagga Creel donated her luxury [[SoroSuub Corporation/Legends|SoroSuub]] [[Personal Luxury Yacht 3000]] named ''[[Spirit of Corellia]]'' to the service of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="SWGTCG">{{SWGTCG|set=Squadrons Over Corellia|cardname=Spitit of Corellia}}</ref>

name: Talia Reede
description: {{Quote|She's so skeptical -- it took a while to convince her she might be Force-sensitive. Can you believe it? Anyone else in the galaxy would give his right arm to be trained as a Jedi, but her we have to talk in to it.|Aaph Koden|Star Wars Galaxies}}Sometime following [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], a female [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Second Lieutenant/Legends|Second Lieutenant]] named [[Aaph Koden]] of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], learned that [[entertainer]] Talia Reede might be a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]]. Knowing the dangers of being a Force-sensitive in an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial-controlled]] [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]], Koden hoped to deliver a warning message to Reede.<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics}}Fortunately, Koden encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] who happened to be a loyal member of the Rebellion. Koden asked the Rebel agent to deliver the warning to Reede, with the hope that she would recognize the danger, and contact the Alliance for help. The Rebel agent agreed, and set off to find Talia Reede. When Reede received the message, she expressed surprise at being a Force-sensitive. However, she told the Rebel that she would check it out.<ref name="SWG" />However the situation grew worse. The Empire had learned of Talia Reede's Force-sensitivity, and were on their way to kill her. Aaph Koden, unable to entrust anyone else with the mission, asked the same Rebel agent to save Reede. When the Rebel asked why Reede could not simply use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to save herself, Koden replied that Reede was not adequately trained. Ultimately, the Rebel agreed to save Reede from an Imperial [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] [[Commander/Legends|commander]] and two other stormtroopers. Fortunately for Reede and the Rebel agent, the stormtroopers proved no match. Koden eventually asked the Rebel to help Reede again, this time by escorting her safely to [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] for [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Jedi training/Legends|training]]. When the Rebel asked why Reede had not started training sooner, Koden answered that Reede was still skeptical she was a Force-sensitive. Koden believed that she simply needed to be convinced. Once again, the Rebel agent agreed to help, and successfully found Reede and brought her back safely to [[City/Legends|town]]. Though she still found the whole idea of Jedi training farfetched, she agreed to give it a try. From then on, Talia Reede would begin her training under the Rebel Alliance.<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}

name: Kutu
description: Kutu, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Ho'Din/Legends|Ho'Din]] medical researcher, traveled to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kirtania]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] to study the flora in the jungle close to [[Kinkosa City]]. She hoped to meet with the noted [[Araquia]]n scientist [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] [[T'Jaleq Kith'Araquia]] and combine her knowledge of medicinal plants with him. Upon arrival, she was horrified to see the rain forest being systematically destroyed by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] for use as a new supply station, and that Doctor Kith'Araquia was wanted for crimes of terrorism against the state of [[Kinkosa]] and the Empire. Afraid to venture into the jungle alone in search of Kith'Araquia, Kutu began searching for a group of individuals to accompany her. She found one such group, who appeared to be interested in the bounty placed on the doctor's head. She reasoned that if they were [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]], she could lead them into some type of trap. Conversely, if their intentions were good, she would be able to ally with them Claiming to know the location of the doctor, she offered to guide the group&mdash;who were secretly [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] agents looking to cure an outbreak of [[Direllian Plague]] at the their [[Tiragga Alliance outpost|base]]&mdash;through the jungle.<ref name="QM" />{{RPG}}The Rebels accepted Kutu as their guide, and she helped them trek through the rain forest. Along the way, they met [[Pierce Mantrell]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Scoundrel|thief]] who had stolen the [[Amber Eye]] from local [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Schnil Hakoon]]. Eventually, the group found the Araquian camp, where Kith'Araquia agreed to help the Rebels after the tribe had attacked a nearby [[Imperial work camp]]. Despite the success of the attack, the Imperial forces started a fire in the forest in an attempt to kill the insurgents. Doctor Kith'Araquia led them to safety, and provided [[Shiarha Root]] to the Rebels to cure their outbreak, and asked them to take the Araquian non-combatants off planet. Kith'Araquia decided to stay to continue the insurgency, and Kutu decided to stay as well, reasoning that the Araquia would need medics.<ref name="QM" />{{Endgame}}

name: Nieve Gromia
description: {{Quote|If you had better skills in managing your staff, perhaps you would still be on Coruscant.|Nyna Calixte|Legacy 37: Tatooine, Part 1}}Originally holding a high-level post on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the capital world of the [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Empire]], Nieve Gromia was assigned as the Moff of the Arkanis sector following a corruption scandal that involved her staff. She avoided arrest by placing the blame on a subordinate [[Imperial officer/Legends|officer]] who, conveniently enough for Gromia, had apparently committed suicide. However, Gromia came to resent being sent to such a backwater position and blamed fellow Moff [[Morrigan Corde|Nyna Calixte]], whom she considered had sent her to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] to further her own career.After a series of failures on Gromia's part to stop the constant pirate attacks from [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] to Imperial convoys, [[Director of Imperial Intelligence|Director]] of [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] Calixte informed Gromia that she was sending two agents to help her deal with the threat. The agents turned out to be Calixte's own daughter [[Gunn Yage]] and [[Morrigan Corde]].Yage arrived first on [[Imperial Station Bravo]], Gromia's headquarters and the former palace of [[Gardulla Besadii the Elder/Legends|Gardulla the Hutt]]. There Yage was briefed by Gromia that the person responsible for the attacks was going by the name of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], in which Yage informed Gromia that the true culprit was [[Cade Skywalker]], not Luke. Afterward, Moff Gromia provided Yage with civilian clothings and a [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder]] to aid in her infiltration of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]].Soon after the meeting, Gromia retired to her living quarters where she contacted the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] [[Vigo/Legends|Vigo]] [[Lun Rask]], whom she secretly had an arrangement with. Together they plotted to kill Cade and Yage on Tatooine, with Rask supplying three [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]]; a [[Blood Carver]] named [[Ku Vrat]], and an [[Anzat (species)|Anzati]] married couple named [[Sint Yoru|Sint]] and [[Nakia Yoru]].Skywalker and Yage, however, managed to [[Mission to Tatooine (Gunn Yage)|defeat]] all three assassins and rendezvous with Agent Corde. Corde informed Yage of Gromia's former charges and sent back to Gromia's quarters. Yage tried to take Gromia under arrest, and Gromia revealed that she gathered proof that Morrigan Corde and Nyna Calixte were the same person, though Yage did not believe her. Unwilling to go to prison, Gromia killed herself by accident during the confrontation with Yage. With her last breath, she urged agent Yage to use the information to ruin her mother.

name: Nakia Yoru
description: Nakia and her husband, as well as the [[Blood Carver]] [[Ku Vrat]], were employed by [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] [[Vigo/Legends|Vigo]] [[Lun Rask]] to kill both former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Cade Skywalker]] and [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Imperial]] agent [[Gunn Yage]] at the behest of [[Nieve Gromia]], [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] of the [[Arkanis sector/Legends|Arkanis sector]].Nakia and Sint tracked Skywalker and Yage to [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], where Nakia killed the drunk [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] [[Bushman Krentz]] by draining his [[Soup (Anzati)|soup]]. The trio then followed their targets into the [[Dune Sea/Legends|Dune Sea]], where they were forced to make a stop due to the sandstorm. The Anzati had found their prey at the abandoned [[Lars homestead]], where a fight ensued, in which Nakia's husband and Vrat were killed and she herself was taken captive. Skywalker, [[Morrigan Corde]] and [[Jariah Syn]] forced her to lead them to vigo Rask's base of operation, which they reached in the Yorus' [[Starship/Legends|starship]], the ''[[Anzat One]]''.On the way Corde had poisoned Nakia and threatened to deny her the antidote in case she refuses to cooperate. After vigo Rask was disposed of, Nakia received her "antidote", but as turned out, the substance was only meant to end her permanently.

name: Guerno
description: {{Quote|Well, ''these'' Jedi are our ''very'' welcomed ''friends'', Guerno!''"<br />"''Yes, Captain!|Piard and Guerno, regarding Cade Skywalker and his companions|Legacy 37: Tatooine, Part 1}}[[File:Guernoandcade.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Guerno encounters Cade Skywalker.]]Guerno, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], served as an [[Imperial officer/Legends|officer]] in [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire]] in [[137 ABY]], during the [[Second Imperial Civil War]] between [[Darth Krayt|Krayt's]] Empire and deposed [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]]'s [[Empire-in-exile]]. She served under [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Piard]] aboard an [[Piard's shipping vessel|Imperial shipping vessel]] that was delivering a cargo of [[M-40 light repeating blaster|Thunderbolt Mark 7 blasters]] via the [[Triellus Trade Route/Legends|Triellus Trade Route]].<ref name="Legacy 37" />Piard's [[Starship/Legends|ship]] stopped at the [[5709-DC Shipping Lane]], a [[Hyperlane|hyperspace route]] in the [[Arkanis sector/Legends|Arkanis sector]], and was [[Black Sun pirate raid|boarded]] by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] affiliated with the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] crime syndicate. Guerno and Piard were threatened by the pirates' [[Cathar (species)|Cathar]] captain, [[Dovrin]], who demanded to know where the [[Blaster/Legends|blasters]] were. The Cathar was interrupted when he heard a noise nearby, and he sent his cronies to investigate. Shortly thereafter, the former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Cade Skywalker]] and his companions, [[Jariah Syn]] and [[Deliah Blue]], revealed themselves after boarding and rescued Guerno and Piard by [[Death/Legends|killing]] Dovrin and neutralizing the remaining pirates.<ref name="Legacy 37" />As Piard thanked Skywalker, Guerno reminded him that the Jedi were enemies of the Empire, but the Captain insisted that Skywalker was not a threat. Guerno was given [[Stun cuffs|binders]] by Skywalker to detain the disabled pirates. Guerno and Piard were [[Mind trick/Legends|influenced]] by a [[Mind trick/Legends|mind trick]] from Skywalker to believe that the Black Sun pirates took their cargo and to forget the encounter. Skywalker and his companions then took the cargo.<ref name="Legacy 37" />

name: Jeswi Ele
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Jeswi Ele was given to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|education]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Sorted into a [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|clan]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]], [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] Ele remained at the Temple as many of her [[Jedi instructor|instructors]] fought and died during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="ROTS" />When [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] betrayed the Order in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] by issuing [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]], Initiate Ele was present with her [[Unidentified Clan|clan]] at the Temple when the [[501st Legion/Legends|501st Legion]] marched up the [[Processional Way/Legends|Processional Way]]. Seeking refuge in the [[High Council Chamber]] high atop one of the [[High Council Tower/Legends|Temple's towers]], she and her peers were pleased when [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] walked into the chamber. Believing the famed hero was there to save them from the attacking [[Clone trooper/Legends|clones]], the children were caught unawares when the Jedi-turned-[[Sith/Legends|Sith]] ignited his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and slew the younglings. Indeed, Skywalker had fallen to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] and was now known as [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]].<ref name="ROTS" />

name: Muura
description: [[File:Vestara.jpg|thumb|left|140px|Vestara Khai, adorned with vor'shandi markings]]{{Quote|There, you look lovely, mistress!|Muura happily praising Sith Tyro Vestara Khai|Fate of the Jedi: Omen}}Muura was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Keshiri]] from the [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Kesh]]. She was a maidservant of the [[Khai family]], a [[Human/Legends|Human]] family in the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], in [[41 ABY]]. She often attended to [[Sith Tyro]] [[Vestara Khai]], the only daughter of [[Sith Saber]] [[Gavar Khai]] and his [[Marriage/Legends|wife]], [[Lahka Khai]]. On the morning that Vestara was to travel to the [[Circle Chambers]] in the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tahv]] for a meeting with the [[Circle of Lords]], the planet's governing council, Muura prepared Vestara with [[vor'shandi]] markings&mdash;which were made from the nectar of the [[S'rai plant]]&mdash;particularly of the [[dalsa flower]], and intricately braided her hair. Afterward, Muura was no longer needed as his daughter's attendant, as Vestara was chosen to be the [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] of [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Olaris Rhea|Rhea]], and would have to live in the [[Kesh Sith Temple|Sith Temple]].<ref name="Omen" /> Gavar informed Muura that the family no longer had need of her at their [[Khai estate|estate]], and he gave her clothing and food to last several days. Gavar also told a few of his friends that Muura had become available for work elsewhere.<ref name="Ascension">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Ascension]]''</ref>

name: Maureen
description: In about [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Maureen got a job working in the [[Space Monkey Café]], a bar that was located in the city of [[Bayonard]], on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. She had worked there two weeks when the [[heroes of Cularin]] visited the bar, while they were investigating the disappearance of [[Selima DeWitt]].

name: Waif
description: Waif lived on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], the Tarasin homeworld, where she was a member of the [[Bark Lovers' Alliance]], a local environmental group. She worked in the Alliance's office in the city of [[Gadrin]] and knew [[Selima DeWitt]].

name: Tearfin
description: Sometime following [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], she received a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] to locate a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] who stole a crate of equipment. The equipment had a [[transponder]], so she easily traced her mark to a [[City/Legends|city]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. Unfortunately, the smuggler realized that she was being tracked, so she turned off the transponder, and blended in with a group of other fellow smugglers within the city.Tearfin located the group of smugglers, but because she didn't know what what the smuggler looked like, she didn't know which one was her mark. She interrogated all of the smugglers, including the head smuggler, [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Himfan]]. Unfortunately, Tearfin failed to find any information, because all of the smugglers simply blamed each other. She did, however, trust the captain.Fortunately for Tearfin, a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] seeking to become a [[Hero of Tatooine]] found Tearfin, and offered to [[Quest of the Hero of Tatooine|help]]. Tearfin stubbornly conceded that she could use some help, and allowed the spacer to interrogate the smugglers, named [[Barosk]], [[D'lonis]], [[Parugga]], [[Klaphini]], [[Rh'klin]], and their captain, Himfan. After a grueling interrogation, the spacer determined that Rh'klin was the smuggler who stole the equipment. The spacer informed Tearfin of this finding, and was awarded the [[Mark of Intellect]] for the successful interrogation.

name: Barosk
description: Some time during [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Barosk traveled to a [[City/Legends|city]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] with a group of fellow smugglers. Not long after, a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Tearfin]] located Barosk and her associates, suspecting her of being a thief who stole some valuable equipment. Tearfin interrogated Barosk, but could not determine whether she was innocent or guilty. A [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] eventually came along to help Tearfin. After interrogating all the smugglers, the spacer cleared Barosk of any suspicions, concluding that [[Rh'klin]] was in fact the thief.{{Char-stub}}

name: Klaphini
description: Some time during [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Klaphini traveled to a [[City/Legends|city]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] with a group of fellow smugglers. Not long after, a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Tearfin]] located Klaphini and her associates, suspecting her of being a thief who stole some valuable equipment.Tearfin interrogated Klaphini, but could not determine whether she was innocent or guilty. A [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] eventually came along to help Tearfin. After interrogating all the smugglers, the spacer cleared Klaphini of any suspicions, concluding that [[Rh'klin]] was in fact the thief.

name: Rh'klin
description: Some time during [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Rh'klin stole a crate of valuable equipment. A [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Tearfin]] tracked Rh'klin, with the help of a [[transponder]] inside the stolen crate. Unfortunately, by the time Rh'klin arrived at a [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooinian]] [[City/Legends|city]], she realized she was being tracked. She immediately turned off the transponder and quickly blended in with a crowd of fellow smugglers.Since Tearfin did not know what her mark looked like, she was not certain which of the smugglers was her mark. She interrogated Rh'klin, but could not determine whether she was innocent or guilty. A [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] eventually came along to help Tearfin. After interrogating all the smugglers, the spacer concluded that Rh'klin was in fact the thief that Tearfin was looking for.

name: Igma Kotos
description: During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Igma Kotos resided in Mos Taike. One of her friends who worked for the [[Corellia Times]] was being roughed up by a local resident. Worried that he and the town would receive bad press, [[Lorne Prestar]] tasked a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to "teach the thug a lesson."{{Char-stub}}

name: Selima DeWitt
description: DeWitt lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and was the daughter of [[Davin DeWitt]], the [[Baron Administrator/Legends|Baron Administrator]] of the [[platform city]] [[Bayonard]]. She often hung around in the [[Space Monkey Café]] and the club [[Tyger Burning Bright]], becoming acquainted with the [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Narask]] and the former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Tyburn Welles]].When [[Percival Vale]] arrived on Cularin, DeWitt began a relationship with him. They went to live in the city [[Gadrin]], where they joined the [[Bark Lovers' Alliance]], a local environmental group, and set up the shop [[Natural]]. However, [[Higgie Sethven]], a [[Cerean/Legends|Cerean]] who worked in the shop, began developing a powerful drug there and the companies [[Culpharm]] and [[Genasys]] both sent corporate security teams to the shop, to try and obtain the drug. In the resulting shoot-out, DeWitt, Vale and Sethven took cover inside the shop and were eventually rescued by a group of [[Heroes of Cularin|freelance agents]] whom DeWitt's father had hired to find her, as she had been out of contact with him.DeWitt returned to Bayonard and with her father's blessing, and married Vale shortly afterward.

name: Natua Wan
description: In [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]], Wan was studying in the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Jedi Archives]] when [[Jysella Horn]] was inflicted with a [[Force psychosis|mysterious illness]] that caused her to believe that everyone around her were impostors. Answering [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Cilghal]]'s call to detain Horn, Wan quickly went to help. However, Horn tossed a bust at the Falleen, causing her to hit one of the stacks and fall unconscious.Later, Wan and Jedi [[Radd Minker]] were assigned to patrol the [[Coruscant Livestock Exchange and Exhibition]] at the [[Grand Event Center]] with [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Leia Organa Solo]] and [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]]. While viewing the Dangerous Animals exhibit, Jedi Wan was overcome by the same psychosis seen in the Horn children and [[Seff Hellin]]. Without notifying the Solo's (who she thought to be impostors), Wan quickly made her way to the control room, powering off the lights in the exhibit and locking all the exits. She than opened all of the exhibits, releasing the vicious and fierce animals unto the panicked crowd. In addition she dropped raw meat from the ceiling on to the walkway, and then began retracting the catwalk as the Jedi frantically attempted to cut open the doors.As Wan was emptying the corrals, she used the Force to throw her voice to distract the "fake" Jedi. The two Solos and Minker eventually found her and engaged in a brief duel which ended when Minker rammed Wan with his head, rendering her unconscious.<ref name="Omen">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Omen]]''</ref>Wan was brought to the [[Jedi Temple Detention Center]], where she was put in a cell located next to that of [[Raynar Thul]]. Natua was visited later by [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Leia Organa Solo]]. The Falleen attempted to use her [[pheromones]] on Han, asking him to free her. However, the [[ysalamir]]i that were positioned in the Asylum Block prevented her efforts from working, and Solo declined her request. Later, Wan and the other infected Jedi were taken to [[Shedu Maad]] by Organa Solo.<ref name="Abyss">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Abyss]]''</ref>In [[44 ABY]], Wan and the other Jedi suffering from the mysterious Force psychosis snapped out of their delusions in the aftermath of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Mission to the Maw|first battle]] with [[Abeloth]] on [[Abeloth's planet]]. They were brought from Shedu Maad to the Jedi Temple by [[Zekk]] and [[Tekli]]. Wan participated in the [[Raid on Detention Center 81|rescue attempt]] of Jysella and [[Valin Horn]] as a member of "Team Saav'etu." Disguised as exterminators, the team used foam coating to mask the cam bubbles of the facility and then breached the outer walls with [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonators]]. Inside, the team discovered thousands of prisoners frozen in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]] alongside the Horn siblings. Despite fierce opposition from [[Galactic Alliance Security]] forces, the Horns were successfully rescued.<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref>Later that year, in an attempt to show her that the Jedi still trusted her, [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and Jaina Solo tasked her with researching information on ancient Sith planets such as [[Korriban]] and [[Dromund Kaas]] in order to find [[Abeloth]] and [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]]. On the last planet the Jedi searched with all their numbers, [[Upekzar]], she was tasked by the Grand Master to explore the lava tunnels under the planet with [[Ben Skywalker]] and [[Vestara Khai]]. When they encountered a mutated [[Rhak-skuri]] and Ben fell unconscious, Vestara wounded Natua so the beast would feed on her instead of Ben. She was then taken by the beast and killed, her corpse being dragged deeper into the tunnels.<ref name="Ascension">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Ascension]]''</ref>

name: Jenny (Artorias)
description: {{Quote|Good morning. Where's Finn?|Jenny, greeting Nina|Invasion: Refugees 1}}Jenny was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] shopkeeper who lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Artorias]]. In addition to having at least two sons, she was a friend of the planet's [[Queen/Legends|queen]], [[Nina Galfridian]],<ref name="InvRef1" /> and Galfridian's stepdaughter,<ref name="InvRes4">''[[Invasion: Rescues 4]]</ref> [[Kaye Galfridian|Kaye]]. The Galfridians were visiting Jenny's shop when the [[extra-galactic]] [[Yuuzhan Vong]] [[Battle of Artorias|invaded]] Artorias in [[25 ABY/Legends|25 ABY]]. After Jenny greeted the Galfridians and inquired about the whereabouts<ref name="InvRef1" /> of Nina's stepson,<ref name="InvRes4" /> [[Finn Galfridian|Finn]], Nina asked how much a pot cost, but before she could finish the question, the pot exploded in Nina's hand. The shrapnel injured Jenny in the chest and mouth, and she collapsed into the Queen's arms.<ref name="InvRef1" />Jenny was captured by the Yuuzhan Vong along with many other Artorians, including Nina and Kaye Galfridian, and was placed on board the [[slaveship]] [[Heart of Artorias|''Tsam P'ah'']] with the other captives. When the invaders attempted to force Nina to serve as a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] to [[Sha'kel|their commander]], she instead requested that they treat Jenny's injuries, but they refused. Soon afterward, Jenny [[Death/Legends|died]] from her wounds.<ref name="InvRef2" />

name: Shrandhnrignh
description: In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Sandi lived in the city of [[Gadrin]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where she owned and ran the tea bar [[Stardust (tea bar)|Stardust]]. She knew the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Selima DeWitt]].

name: Ash Jarvee
description: {{Quote|Jedi Jarvee, Propulsion&mdash;stand by to get us out of here as soon as the transport's inboard and the bay is secure.|Gilad Pellaeon|The Clone Wars: No Prisoners}}[[File:Gilad3.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Gilad Pellaeon, the commander of the Republic warship ''Leveler'']]Ash Jarvee was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Jedi/Legends|member]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] who lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Within the Order, Jarvee became one of the [[Altisian Jedi]], a rogue Jedi sect led by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Djinn Altis]] that was considered by orthodox Jedi to be heretical. Altis [[Jedi training/Legends|taught]] Jarvee a number of [[Force power/Legends|Force techniques]], and by the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]&mdash;a conflict fought between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]&mdash;Jarvee was in her teens. The Altisian Jedi did not join the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] and assist the Republic war effort directly, as had the Jedi Order proper, and instead they unofficially helped the Republic by providing humanitarian relief to worlds affected by the war.<ref name="No Prisoners" /> In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="ERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> a number of the Altisian Jedi were dispatched aboard the [[Vernal-class freighter|''Vernal''-class freighter]] ''[[Wookiee Gunner]]'', on a mission to administer aid to the inhabitants of the war-ravaged [[Planet/Legends|world]] [[Yarille]]. Jarvee accompanied the mission, and she acted as a section commander among the crew of ''Wookiee Gunner''. En route, ''Wookiee Gunner'' detected a [[Distress signal/Legends|distress signal]] that had been sent by the [[Republic Intelligence/Legends|Republic Intelligence]] [[Spy/Legends|agent]] [[Hallena Devis]] from the planet [[JanFathal]], and Altis contacted the nearest Republic [[Warship/Legends|warship]],<ref name="No Prisoners" /> the [[Acclamator-class assault ship|''Acclamator''-class assault ship]]<ref name="Republic 64">''[[Republic 64: Bloodlines]]''</ref> ''[[Leveler]]'', to offer the assistance of his Jedi in extracting Devis. [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]], the [[Commander/Legends|commander]] of ''Leveler'', agreed to the Jedi Master's proposal, and ''Wookiee Gunner'' rendezvoused with ''Leveler''. Altis and the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Callista Ming|Callista Masana]] and [[Geith Eris]] transferred to the Republic [[Starship/Legends|ship]], and in their absence Jarvee was left in command of ''Wookiee Gunner''. The Jedi [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] then departed from the rendezvous point, to resume its course to Yarille.<ref name="No Prisoners" />A short time afterward, Altis, Eris, Masana, and a Republic strike team landed on JanFathal to [[Battle of JanFathal|rescue]] Devis, while ''Leveler'' jumped into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] to evade the Separatist [[Destroyer/Legends|destroyer]] [[Reaper (destroyer)|''Reaper'']]. ''Leveler'' arrived in the [[Poressi system]] and became stranded as a result of technical problems relating to the ship's [[Navigation computer/Legends|navigation computer]]. ''Wookiee Gunner'' tracked ''Leveler'' to the [[Star system/Legends|system]] and approached the Republic warship, and Jarvee contacted Pellaeon to offer him the help of ''Wookiee Gunner''{{'s}} remaining Jedi. Pellaeon informed her that ''Leveler''{{'s}} communications encryption had been breached, so Jarvee contacted the Republic's [[Naval Command (Galactic Republic)|Naval Command]] and obtained a new set communications codes. She then re-opened communications with Pellaeon and volunteered the use of the Jedi's [[The Force/Legends|Force]] abilities, to influence the malfunctioning navicomputer.<ref name="No Prisoners" />Pellaeon agreed to Jarvee's proposal, and she boarded ''Leveler'' with a delegation of Altisian Jedi. After speaking to Altis via a [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]], to inform him that she had made contact with ''Leveler'', Jarvee explained to Pellaeon the details of how the Jedi planned to use an esoteric Force technique to influence the [[Computer/Legends|computer]]. Jarvee and the other Jedi then stood in a circle around the [[Bridge (starship)/Legends|bridge]] with clasped [[Limb/Legends|hands]], and they used the Force to influence the navicomputer into taking ''Leveler'' back to the [[Fath system]]. Altis, Devis, and the strike team landed on ''Leveler'', and Pellaeon told Jarvee that he planned to mention her in dispatches, to commend her for aiding ''Leveler''. Masana then [[Transfer essence|merged]] her consciousness with the ship's computer system and used [[Concussion missile/Legends|concussion missiles]] to destroy the Separatist [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] bearing down on ''Leveler'', and Jarvee and the other Jedi subsequently used their powers to influence the navicomputer again, to help ''Leveler'' to leave the Fath system.<ref name="No Prisoners" />''Leveler'' dropped Jarvee and the other Altisian Jedi off at a [[Kemla Yard|shipyard]] on the planet [[Kemla]], where ''Wookiee Gunner'' was to rendezvous with them. While they waited, Jarvee sat with Masana, and the pair discussed Masana's recent experiences in the Fath system. ''Wookiee Gunner'' eventually arrived and took Jarvee and the other Jedi to Yarille, landing in the planet's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]], [[Yen Bachask]]. There, Altis assigned Jarvee, Masana, and ''Wookiee Gunner''{{'s}} other female section commanders to be the first group of Jedi to disembark from the freighter and make contact with the local population, because he believed that an all-female delegation would make the Jedi seem friendly. The party approached a nearby refugee camp, where they were greeted by a group of the world's inhabitants, who [[Handshake|shook hands]] with Jarvee and her comrades.<ref name="No Prisoners" />

name: Patla Soo
description: By the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Soo had became the [[Operations Manager]] of [[Cartel Central]], the base of operations of the Cartel on [[Caarimon]]. When the [[Believers]] attempted to release a dangerous virus on Caarimon, a group of [[Heroes of Cularin|freelance agents]], who were investigating the plot, asked Soo some questions during the course of their investigations.<ref name="BotB" /> The agents were able to prevent the release of the virus and Soo attended a celebration that was held on [[Dorumaa]] to thank them. During the event, she made a speech where she expressed her gratitude to the agents.<ref name="PO">''[[Paarty On!]]''</ref>

name: Janet Lalasha
description: Janet Lalasha was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Musician/Legends|musician]] who was renowned as an excellent player of the [[Dorenian Beshniquel/Legends|Dorenian Beshniquel]]&mdash;better known as the [[Dorenian Beshniquel/Legends|Fizzz]]&mdash;a single reed wind instrument commonly used in [[Jizz/Legends|jizz]].<ref name="wddwtbt">''[[We Don't Do Weddings: The Band's Tale]]''</ref><ref name="ebtdt">''[[Empire Blues: The Devaronian's Tale]]''</ref> Lalasha lived during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]],<ref name="cswe" /> an authoritarian government that rose to power in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]].<ref name="tnec">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> The Empire was a censorial regime and began systematically hunting down, [[Prisoner/Legends|imprisoning]], and [[Death/Legends|executing]] many musicians and confiscating their [[Music/Legends|music]].<ref name="ebtdt" /><ref name="tlosttobf">''[[The Last One Standing: The Tale of Boba Fett]]''</ref> Lalasha was targeted in one such purge<ref name="cswe" /> by [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]]<ref name="Date" /> as a "questionable" individual, and the musician was subsequently executed.<ref name="cswe" /> Following Lalasha's death, the Empire also purged records of her music.<ref name="tlosttobf" />Despite the Empire's success in suppressing Lalasha's music, recordings of her work eventually came into the possession of the fugitive [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] war criminal [[Kardue'sai'Malloc/Legends|Kardue'sai'Malloc]], who admired Lalasha as a nigh-unparalleled Fizzz player.<ref name="ebtdt" /> Once Malloc was finally caught by the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]]<ref name="tlosttobf" /> in [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]],<ref name="ERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> the Devaronian made his captor promise to sell his music collection&mdash;including the works of Lalasha&mdash;to a contact, in the hope that it could be redistributed across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].

name: Gali
description: Despite not being [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Gali lived and trained with the [[Altisian Jedi]], a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] sect that was led by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Djinn Altis]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="ERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> she traveled with the rest of the sect to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Yarille]], where they carried out relief work.

name: Miraj Scintel/Legends
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Zygerrian/Legends|Zygerrian]], Miraj Scintel took the throne of [[Zygerria/Legends|Zygerria]] sometime before the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. As the Confederacy gained momentum, Queen Scintel saw an opportunity to reestablish Zygerria's ancient [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] [[Zygerrian Slave Empire/Legends|empire]] and concocted a plot to gain allegiance with Separatist leader [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]]. Dispatching [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Darts D'Nar/Legends|Darts D'Nar]] to the [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] colony world of [[Kiros/Legends|Kiros]], Scintel ordered him to capture the colonists and return them to Zygerria so they could be sold to Dooku at auction.<ref name="SOTR" />[[File:AnakinSavesMiraj-SotR.jpg|thumb|left|220px|[[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Skywalker]] saves the queen from an assassination attempt.]]Following the [[Battle of Kiros/Legends|invasion]] of Kiros and the transfer of the slaves to a processing plant on [[Kadavo/Legends|Kadavo]], a group of Jedi infiltrated Zygerria and Scintel's [[Zygerrian Royal Palace|palace]]. Posing as a slaver named [[Lars Quell/Legends|Lars Quell]], [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] proposed to sell his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], who was also disguised as a Togruta slave, to Scintel. The queen, intrigued by Skywalker's offer, accepted the slave and requested "Quell" to remain at her side for a time. During their walk about the palace, a [[Unidentified slave girl/Legends|young slave girl]] attempted to assassinate the queen, only to be stopped by Skywalker. The [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] girl, fearful of remaining a slave and being punished, leaped from the ramparts to her death. While [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone trooper]] [[CT-7567/Legends|Rex]] infiltrated the nearby slave pits, Jedi Skywalker continued to warm up to Scintel in hopes of discovering the locations of the missing Kiros slaves.<ref name="SOTR" />Accompanying Scintel to the auction house, Skywalker witnessed the brutality of Scintel's empire when Master Kenobi, whose cover was blown earlier in the slave pits, was ordered to be beaten on the bidding floor. Scintel ordered Skywalker to show his loyalty to her through beating the Jedi and was shocked when Skywalker revealed his identity as a Jedi. As his comrades leaped to defend him from the throng of guards, Padawan Tano attacked Scintel; the queen had already had the Jedi girl's neck fitted with a shock collar and simply activated it to render her inert. With Tano unconscious and the Jedi subdued, Scintel ordered Skywalker to be taken back to her chambers in the palace and the others separated and imprisoned as slaves. Scintel waited for Skywalker to wake in her chambers, offering him an appointment as her personal bodyguard. While the Jedi resisted at first, using [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Telekinesis/Legends|telekinetically]] strangle her, Scintel persuaded him by threatening to have his friends executed should she die. During their time together, Scintel began to drift closer to Skywalker, deducing that he was once a slave before he became a Jedi.
