Despite her efforts to convince the Jedi to see the galaxy as she saw it, Skywalker rebuffed all her flirtatious advances even when she offered to free his friends if he swore fealty to her.<ref name="SOTR" />[[File:MirajScintelChoked-EFK.png|thumb|right|220px|Scintel [[Telekinesis/Legends|strangled]] through the Force by Count Dooku]]Scintel's affections for Skywalker did not go unnoticed; [[Prime Minister/Legends|Prime Minister]] [[Atai Molec/Legends|Atai Molec]] feared the queen had been weakened by the Jedi and contacted Count Dooku to rectify the problem. Upon Dooku's arrival, Scintel confiscated Skywalker's lightsaber and dismissed him from her court. Scintel received Dooku in her throne room and detailed her plot to enslave the Jedi as she did Kenobi and Skywalker, crushing the Order and then the Republic. Dooku deemed her plan too ambitious, made it plain he was only interested in eradicating the Jedi Order, not enslaving it, and&mdash;seeing through her thinly veiled emotions for Skywalker&mdash;demanded that he be disposed of. Infuriated by Dooku's brash statements and Minister Molec's betrayal, Scintel revealed an [[Shock whip|electro-whip]] clipped to her belt and attempted to attack the Count, but was quickly disarmed and throttled with the Force. As she struggled to breathe against the Count's hold, Skywalker burst into the chamber and, unconcerned by the Count's threat to kill her unless he surrendered, attacked Dooku with the electro-whip, but was quickly disarmed.<ref name="EFK" />No match against Dooku without a weapon, Skywalker was surrounded by palace guards but managed to abscond from the chamber with the queen before being felled. Fleeing the palace and boarding the ship he arrived in, the [[Tecora/Legends|''Tecora'']], Skywalker and his freed Padawan Tano prepared to take off in search of Kenobi and the Togruta colonists. The dying queen revealed the location of the slaves before succumbing to her injuries. With her last breath, she acknowledged that she had become a slave just like Skywalker himself.<ref name="EFK" />

name: Senni Tonnika/Legends
description: The best-known source of information on the Tonnika sisters is a biographical entry written by [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]]. However, his account contains a number of inadvertent inaccuracies, and it is unclear how far it can be trusted.

name: Tysara
description: Tysara lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where she was the [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] of a Tarasin [[irstat]]. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a number of Tarasin were kidnapped by the [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]] [[Haast Aath]], so Tysara hired the [[Heroes of Cularin]] to rescue them.

name: Di'hal'uma
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the [[Talons]] swoop gang entered the [[Cularin Classic]] [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]] race on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], so they hired Di'hal'uma check out the other participating teams. One of the other teams was made up of "Duckonians", a made up species that the [[Togorian/Legends|Togorian]] [[Mebara Jos]] and other members of the [[Fireclaw Horde]] had disguised themselves as. Di'hal'uma discovered the Duckonians' secret, so she arranged a meeting with [[Seng Windrunner]], the leader of the Talons, to report this to him. However, Jos was aware of Di'hal'uma's investigation, so she arranged for the [[Blood Raptors]] to kidnap the Twi'lek from the [[Dancing Flame Tavern]], on Cularin.<ref name="CaV" />

name: Eulyn
description: {{Quote|I knew you'd do something like this. I've always said all that digging around in the filth would do you no good. And arguing with the Neshtovar! Why do you always have to be ''right''?|Eulyn, to Adari Vaal|Lost Tribe of the Sith: Skyborn}}A [[Keshiri]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Eulyn was a native of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]], living during the era of the [[Great Hyperspace War]]. Eulyn had a daughter named [[Adari Vaal|Adari]], a [[geologist]] who [[Marriage/Legends|married]] a member of the planet's ruling [[Neshtovar]], [[Zhari Vaal]]. Eulyn was largely responsible for the [[Marriage/Legends|marriage]]&mdash;seeking to solidify her family's future position, she lobbied for the union for [[Standard year/Legends|years]]. After Vaal's [[Death/Legends|death]] in an accident while riding an [[uvak]] beast, Eulyn and Adari inherited a [[wood]]en house in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tahv]], where Eulyn took care of her grandchildren, [[Tona Vaal|Tona]] and [[Finn Vaal|Finn]]. Through her work in geology, Adari uncovered clues about the natural formation of the Keshiri landscape that contradicted the widely-held religious belief that the planet's continents were formed by the [[Blood/Legends|blood]] of the Keshiri [[Deity/Legends|gods]], the [[Skyborn]], and began teaching these findings to other Keshiri. Generally disapproving of her daughter's profession, and an ardent adherent to the religion, Eulyn was appalled by her daughter's discoveries and believed her to be a heretic.<ref name="skyborn" />In [[5000 BBY/Legends|5000 BBY]], Adari testified about the validity of her findings to the Neshtovar, leading to mobs descending upon Eulyn and Adari's household and pelting it with rocks. The torrent of abuse became so bad, in fact, that Adari sent Eulyn and the children to stay at her [[Adari Vaal's uncle|uncle's]] home. As for Adari, she fled the angry Keshiri on her husband's old uvak, [[Nink (uvak)|Nink]], and stumbled onto the site of a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] crash site high in the [[Takara Mountains|Cetajan Mountains]]. Adari discovered a group of surviving Sith and led them back to society. The Sith, led by [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Yaru Korsin]], proclaimed themselves to be the Skyborn, and Adari was honored for her role.<ref name="skyborn" /> Just as she did not understand her daughter's supposed heresy, Eulyn failed to understand Adari's canonization, and she died sometime before the year [[4975 BBY]].<ref name="savior" /> After her daughter's death, Adari's [[Adari Vaal's personal memoirs|personal memoirs]] were found, written during her [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]] in the far-off continent of [[Alanciar]], and included a few tart passages about Eulyn.<ref name="pandemonium">''[[Lost Tribe of the Sith: Pandemonium]]''</ref>

name: Muuta
description: By [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Muuta was still a child and she lived with her parents in the [[Darkside (sector)|Darkside]] district of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. When the roof of their housing unit collapsed in, Muuta was trapped and the [[Heroes of Cularin]] attempted to rescue her.

name: Jeela Cthon
description: Jeela was married to [[Geo Cthon]] and together, they owned and operated ''[[Lucky You]]'', a service that used amateur actors to allow people to pretend that they had a better life. In [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]] visited ''Lucky You'' and when he left, Cthon saw him putting his helmet on and getting on [[Garth Ezzar's speeder bike|his speeder bike]]. She realized that Ezzar would kill her if he knew that she had seen him, so she kept the knowledge to herself.

name: Carlitina Semla
description: Semla was the head of [[Culpharm Security]] and lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where Culpharm was based. In about [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], some of Culpharm's specimen samples went missing, so Semla hired the [[Heroes of Cularin]].<ref name="Mix and Match" />A short time afterward, Semla lead a Culpharm Security team in an attack on the [[Genasys Security Division]], outside the shop [[Natural]], in [[Gadrin]]. [[Genasys]] was a rival company of Culpharm and Semla had been tasked with preventing Genasys from making a deal with the [[Cerean/Legends|Cerean]] [[biochemist]] [[Higgie Sethven]].<ref name="Find the Lady">''[[Find the Lady]]''</ref>

name: Gelly Farls
description: Farls was married to [[Mambo Farls]], who worked designing corporate uniforms. She herself was a botanist and was employed by the company [[Biotherapy]] in their labs in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Gadrin]], on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. She was also a member of the [[Bark Lovers' Alliance]], a local environmental group.In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Mambo mentioned to Gelly that he was developing a new uniform for security staff at [[Culpharm]], a rival company of Biotherapy. She provided Biotherapy with a set of the uniforms, which she hoped they would use for illegal purposes, which the Bark Lovers' could then expose.

name: Merish Hath
description: In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="ERC" /> she and her boyfriend [[Shil Kaval]] met with an undercover Republic agent [[Hallena Devis]] and later participated, along with the local rebels, in an uprising against the Republic-aligned [[Regent/Legends|Regent]] of the planet. When Devis's position as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] was revealed, Hath, along with [[Varti]] and Kaval took her hostage. When the Republic strike team arrived to rescue Devis, she was killed by Jedi Master [[Djinn Altis]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Xinishia
description: Xinishia was one of the [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenants]] of [[Liriana]], the leader of the [[Wyrd]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Liriana traveled off-[[Planet/Legends|planet]], so Xinishia used her leader's absence as an opportunity to try and make herself leader of the Wyrd. She discovered a [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] artifact that enhanced her Force powers and planned to use it to cause [[Cloud Mountain]], an inert volcano, to erupt and destroy the village [[Kiirloor]]. However, the [[heroes of Cularin]] attempted to stop her.

name: Risstenni
description: {{Quote|I woke up early this morning and there was no sign of my son. It's not like him to go off by himself, so I started searching for him.|Risstenni|From the Trees}}[[File:Starwars livingforce swlfcularin picMain en.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Cularin, the planet on which Risstenni lived]]Risstenni was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] who lived during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. At some point, she mated with [[Risstenni's mate|another Wookiee]] and [[Reproduction/Legends|gave birth]] to a son, [[Chywarra]].<ref name="From the Trees" /> Circa [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="Date" /> the family became residents of [[Kiirloor]], a Wookiee settlement that had been established on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] following the [[Death/Legends|death]] of the Wookiee [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Kirlocca]]. However, the [[Wyrd]], a group of [[Tarasin]] [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]] that lived on Cularin, opposed the presence of the Wookiees at Kiirloor. One morning, two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] after the establishment of Kiirloor, the Wyrd kidnapped Chywarra and planned to draw power from him using a hand-shaped [[Force artifact|Force-imbued statue]] known as the [[Hand artifact]]. The Wyrd hoped this would allow them to cause the inactive [[Volcano/Legends|volcano]] [[Cloud Mountain]] to erupt and destroy Kiirloor.<ref name="From the Trees" />After waking up to find Chywarra missing, Risstenni began looking for him. After a while she found a toy [[Ryyk blade/Legends|ryyk blade]] that belonged to her son, and she left it in a [[Tree/Legends|tree]] near Cloud [[Mountain/Legends|Mountain]] to act as a sign for anyone who tried to follow her and Chywarra. She continued searching and sighted Chywarra being carried up the side of Cloud Mountain by a member of the Wyrd, so she climbed up the volcano and began looking for her son in the tunnels inside the mountain. Eventually, she discovered a large cavern that served as the headquarters of a Wyrd enclave that was located inside the mountain, and she began observing the Tarasin inside the chamber. However, she overheard some Wyrd members talking about how Chywarra had survived a session inside the Hand artifact; angered, Risstenni rushed out to attack the Tarasin. The group's leader, [[Xinishia]], told her that they would kill Chywarra if she tried to fight them, and she then used the Force to [[Mind trick/Legends|compel]] Risstenni to sit down. Xinishia offered to let Risstenni take Chywarra's place inside the statue during the Wyrd's next ritual. Risstenni agreed, as she could not see any other way to save the life of her son.<ref name="From the Trees" />The Tarasin allowed Risstenni to say goodbye to Chywarra and then helped her into the artifact's thumb. The Wookiee scratched at the interior of the device, but she was unable to climb out because it was made of a highly polished smooth material. When the Tarasin began their ritual, Risstenni was overcome with a feeling that something inside her was trying to tear her body apart, which caused her to pass out. The device drained her life force and killed her, transforming her into a [[Force ghost|dark side spirit]]. When Risstenni came to, she discovered that she had changed form and could move through the side of the statue. She thought about going to get help, but she did not want to leave her son, so she decided to remain within the enclave. The Wyrd ignored her in her new form and allowed her to listen to them discussing their plan; thus she learned of the witches' plan to destroy Kiirloor.<ref name="From the Trees" />{{RPG|''[[From the Trees]]''}}When the Wookiees of Kiirloor discovered that Risstenni and Chywarra were missing, they sent representatives to ask [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] [[Dariana]] of the Tarasin [[Hiironi irstat]] if she knew who was responsible for the pair's disappearance. Dariana sent the [[Heroes of Cularin]], a group of freelance agents who operated in the [[Cularin system]], to investigate the matter, and they traveled to the tunnels inside Cloud Mountain. Risstenni approached them while in the guise of a ghostly [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]], then worked out how to manifest herself and appeared to them in the form of a Wookiee. She spoke to the agents and explained to them how she had died. She then begged them to rescue her son and warned the agents that it was dangerous for them to continue traveling through the tunnels. However, while she was talking to them, a Tarasin [[Unidentified Tarasin Force ghost|Force ghost]] attacked the agents, with the aim of preventing them from interfering in the Wyrd's plans. Risstenni responded by entering combat with the spirit and allowed the agents to confront Xinishia and the other members of the Wyrd.<ref name="From the Trees" />{{Endgame}}

name: Delinna
description: Delinna was mated to [[Surracca]] and they lived in the village [[Kiirloor]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. When Kiirloor began to suffer a series of problems that culminated in the disappearance of [[Chywarra|a child]], Delinna traveled with Surracca to [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] [[Dariana]]'s [[naming day]] ceremony, to ask her for help. Surracca was very angry because of the problems at Kiirloor, so Delinna tried to calm him down. The two Wookiees then traveled back to the village with the [[Heroes of Cularin]]. However, while they traveled, there was a groundquake and they arrived at the village to find it very damaged.

name: Teelasin
description: Teelasin lived on the planet Cularin during the waning years of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and worked as a customs officer at [[Hedrett Public Transport Facility|Hedrett Groundport]]. In about [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], while she was at work, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] alerted her to the presence of [[Digby|a thief]] in the port's [[Customs Receiving Area]], a large warehouse that was located on the edge of the port.

name: Jyn N'oram
description: Jyn N'oram worked for [[Hedrett Shipping and Investments]] as the [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] of the ''[[Fricasseed Nerf]]'', a [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she was aboard the ship when it collided with a [[Comet/Legends|comet]] fragment in the [[Cularin system]] and was left drifting in space. However, she and the rest of the crew of the ''Nerf'' were rescued by the [[Heroes of Cularin]].

name: Vicca Drane
description: Vicca Drane worked for [[Hedrett Shipping and Investments]] as a crewmember of the ''[[Fricasseed Nerf]]'', a [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she was aboard the ship when it collided with a [[Comet/Legends|comet]] fragement in the [[Cularin system]] and was left drifting in space. However, she and the rest of the crew of the ''Nerf'' were rescued by the [[Heroes of Cularin]].

name: Rroorgli
description: Rroorgli co-run the [[Comet Broom Service]] along with the male Wookiee [[Mronk]]. The service monitored and destroyed dangerous comets around the [[Cularin comet cloud]] and was based on [[Artom Station]], where the two Wookiees had offices. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Rroorgli and Mronk were hired by the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]], who was in disguise as [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]], to initiate the [[Cometary Water Reclamation Project]], a project that was suposedly to sent a comet into the atmosphere of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Almas]].After the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] ''[[Fricasseed Nerf]]'' was damaged because of faulty data supplied by the Comet Broom Service, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] were hired to investigate and they visited Rroorgli and Mronk on Artom Station. The Wookiees denied any wrong doing and gave the heroes a copy of some of the data that they had supplied to [[Cularin SpaceNav]]. A short time later, Rroorgli and Mronk were murdered by Ezzar, to help cover up the Cometary Project.

name: Tanora
description: Tanora was a member of a Tarasin irstat that lived in a remote location in the jungles of the planet Cularin. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the village where they lived was attacked by the [[Wyrd]], who killed everyone there. Tanora had been out looking for fruit, so was the only person from the village left alive. She knew vaguely where another irstat lived, so she set out to find them and warn them about the Wyrd.After several days alone in the jungle, Tanora became wounded and began to become malnourished. She was discovered by the [[heroes of Cularin]] and ran away from them, as she had never seen any offworlders before. They chased after her, eventually capturing her. After calming her down and giving her medical treatment, she explained to them what had happened to her irstat. The next day, she wished the heroes well and set off back into the jungle, to find to other irstat.

name: Tensa Voll
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Tensa Voll received formal [[Jedi training/Legends|instruction]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at an [[Jedi academy|academy]] of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Having achieved the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Jedi Voll was assigned to [[Almas]] where she accepted missions from the [[Almas Academy|enclave's]] governing [[Almas Council|Council]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]]. When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], Voll invoked the [[Right of Denial]] and elected to remain on Almas throughout the war.<ref name="LFC" />During the war, Voll was selected to join a task force assembled by Academy Headmaster [[Devan For'deschel]] to neutralize the [[Wyrd]] cult prevalent on [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. Meeting with [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Xirossk]] of the [[Cularin Militia]], she and her fellow Jedi were aided by the [[Heroes of Cularin]] in their assignment.<ref name="LFC" />

name: Kasslan
description: Kasslan was the [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] of the [[Vriisan irstat]], a Tarasin tribe. The Vriisan were custodians of a cave where [[Reidi Artom]], the discoverer of the [[Cularin system]], had left a number of writings. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Kasslan showed the writings to a group of explorers.<ref name="RAEM" />Some time afterwards, Kasslan and a number of other Tarasin mothers requested that the Tarasin assist the [[Cularin Militia]] in an operation to combat the [[Wyrd]].<ref name="HTW">''[[Hunting the Wyrd]]''</ref>

name: Jalina
description: Jalina was a member of the [[Hiironi irstat]], a Tarasin tribe that lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Jalina was present at a briefing in the jungles of Cularin, where [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Xirossk]] of the [[Cularin Militia]] sent the [[heroes of Cularin]] on a mission to find the [[Wyrd]].

name: Kimania
description: Kimania was the [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] of the [[Rinajaa irstat]], a Tarasin tribe. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], when Kimania had been the Mother of the irstat for twelve years, it was attacked by the [[Wyrd]], a group of Tarasin [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]]. The Wyrd entered the village where the Rinajaa lived and one of them used the Force to kill Kimania.With the help of the [[heroes of Cularin]], the Rinajaa were able to defeat the Wyrd. Some of the surviving Rinajaa placed some captured Wyrd members inside Kimania's hut and planned to set fire to it with the prisoners inside, to punish them for killing Kimania. The Mother then appeared to them as a [[Force ghost]], through the flames of the burning hut.

name: Naelora
description: Naelora was a member of the [[Wyrd]], a group of Tarasin [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]] that operated on Cularin. The Tarasin [[Kosaa]] was her bodyguard.{{RPG}}During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Naelora was present on Cularin in the central hut of the village where the [[Zhadorii irstat]] lived, when she was attacked by the [[heroes of Cularin]].{{Endgame}}

name: Torunin
description: Torunin was a member of the [[Wyrd]], a group of Tarasin [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]] that operated on Cularin. The Tarasin [[Savina]] was her bodyguard.{{RPG}}During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Torunin was present on Cularin in the central hut of the village where the [[Zhadorii irstat]] lived, when she was attacked by the [[heroes of Cularin]].{{Endgame}}

name: Baeshana
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Tarasin]], Baeshana lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] during the final decades of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. A member of the [[Wyrd]], Baeshana was trained in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the group and eventually was skilled enough to be considered a [[Witch/Legends|witch]]. During her time as a Wyrd sister, Baeshana employed a [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] named [[Veshin]].<ref name="HTW" />{{RPG}}When the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], a conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Baeshana resided the village of the [[Zhadorii irstat]]. Residing in the camp's central tent, she was visit when the village was attacked by a band of mercenaries and freedom fighters known as the [[Heroes of Cularin]].<ref name="HTW" />{{Endgame}}

name: Veshin
description: Veshin served the [[Wyrd]], a group of Tarasin [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]], as a [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]]. She was the personal bodyguard of the Wyrd sister [[Baeshana]].{{RPG}}During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Veshin was present on Cularin in the central hut of the village where the [[Zhadorii irstat]] lived, when she and Baeshana were attacked by the [[heroes of Cularin]].{{Endgame}}

name: Savina
description: Savina served the [[Wyrd]], a group of Tarasin [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]], as a [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]]. She was the personal bodyguard of the Wyrd sister [[Torunin]].{{RPG}}During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Savina was present on Cularin in the central hut of the village where the [[Zhadorii irstat]] lived, when she and Torunin were attacked by the [[heroes of Cularin]].{{Endgame}}

name: Kosaa
description: Kosaa served the [[Wyrd]], a group of Tarasin [[The Force/Legends|Force]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]], as a [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]]. She was the personal bodyguard of the Wyrd sister [[Naelora]].{{RPG}}During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Kosaa was present on Cularin in the central hut of the village where the [[Zhadorii irstat]] lived, when she and Naelora were attacked by the [[heroes of Cularin]].{{Endgame}}

name: Lady Blue
description: {{Quote|I couldn't make it to Lady Blue's funeral. I'm sorry things turned out this way. She was a great gal. It just goes to show you how unpredictable life is while the Empire exists. It's dangerous out there.|Emon Azzameen, in an e-mail to Ace Azzameen|Star Wars: X-Wing Alliance}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Lady Blue joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] as a [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] in the [[Alliance Starfighter Corps]]<ref name="XWA" /> at some point prior to [[2 ABY/Legends|2 ABY]].<ref name="2ABY">Lady Blue is described as winning the [[Miss Liberty|Miss ''Liberty'']] pageant the year before the events of ''[[Star Wars: X-Wing Alliance]]''.</ref> Assigned to the [[Mon Calamari Star Cruiser]] [[Liberty/Legends|''Liberty'']], she entered and won the [[Miss Liberty|Miss ''Liberty'']] pageant in 2 ABY and became known by the [[call sign]] "Lady Blue."<ref name="XWA" /><ref name="2ABY" />Following the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]]<ref name="XWA" /> in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> Lady Blue met the Alliance-allied pilot [[Emon Azzameen]], whose [[Azzameen family|family]] had sought refuge with the Rebels after being declared traitors to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Azzameen told her about his younger brother, [[Ace Azzameen|Ace]], who was also serving as a starfighter pilot aboard the ''Liberty'', and she decided that she would like to meet the young pilot. Lady Blue sent an [[e-mail]] to Ace, asking if he would be interested in a date and saying that she would contact him to arrange a time after returning from a recon mission to the [[Japai system]]. She also sent him a picture of herself.<ref name="XWA" />However, Lady Blue was [[Death/Legends|killed]] near the Japai [[Star system/Legends|system]], along with her fellow pilots [[Tabba]] and [[Kraigg]], before she had the chance to meet Ace in person. A funeral service was held for all three pilots aboard the Mon Calamari Star Cruiser [[Defiance (MC80 Home One type Star Cruiser)|''Defiance'']] shortly after their deaths. Emon later sent an e-mail to his brother apologizing for not being able to attend the funeral and for how the situation had turned out. Ace kept the picture Lady Blue sent him of her on the wall of his room aboard his personal [[YT-2000 light freighter]], the ''[[Otana]]''.<ref name="XWA" />

name: Lanitha
description: Lanitha was employed as a serving girl in the [[Fungus Pit]], a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] that was located in [[Bashka]], on Ryloth. When the [[heroes of Cularin]] visited the cantina during the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Lanitha greeted them and asked them if she could get them anything.

name: Keelin Zaariq
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]], Keelin Zaariq was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at the [[Almas Academy|experimental academy]] on [[Almas]] in the [[Cularin system]]. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], Zaariq took assignments which kept her within the Cularin system.<ref name="TS" />{{RPG}}During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Zaariq and the [[Human/Legends|Human]] Padawan [[Jan-Ira Toru]] were sent by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Devan For'deschel]] to bring the [[heroes of Cularin]] to the Almas Academy. They flew a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] to [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where they met with the heroes and told them that For'deschel wished to meet with them. They then flew back to Almas, with the heroes.<ref name="TS" />{{Endgame}}

name: Jan-Ira Toru
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Jan-Ira Toru was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at their [[Almas Academy|experimental academy]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Almas]] in the [[Cularin system]]. Once selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Toru constructed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and was dispatched to serve the Order throughout the [[Star system/Legends|star system]].<ref name="TS" />{{RPG}}When the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] entered into [[Clone Wars/Legends|all out war]], Toru and the [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] Padawan [[Keelin Zaariq]] were sent by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Devan For'deschel]] to bring the [[heroes of Cularin]] to the Almas Academy. They flew a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] to [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where they met with the heroes and told them that For'deschel wished to meet with them. They then flew back to [[Almas]], with the heroes.<ref name="TS" />{{Endgame}}

name: Ledis
description: Ledis was a friend of the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Lora Nadad]]. Following the end if the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the surviving [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] went into hiding and Nadad hid out in [[Jax Warehouse]] on Cularin. Ledis stayed there with her, along with [[Noelle]] and [[Klide]], some of Nadad's other friends. When the [[heroes of Cularin]] traveled to the warehouse, Ledis tried to give Nadad her her lightsaber, but the Jedi refused to take it. Ledis then held Nadad's [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and threatened to impale herself if the heroes came any closer to her and Nadad.

name: Noelle
description: Noelle was a friend of the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Lora Nadad]]. Following the end if the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the surviving [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] went into hiding and Nadad hid out in [[Jax Warehouse]] on Cularin. Noelle stayed there with her, along with [[Ledis]] and [[Klide]], some of Nadad's other friends. Noelle was present there when the [[heroes of Cularin]] traveled to the warehouse.

name: Emppu Praji-Barck
description: Praji-Barck served as the [[Minister of State]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] for six decades. During that time, she continually filibustered any attempts to bring about Republic intervention in the [[Kaikielius system]], to stop [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] activity there. [[Kaikielius/Legends|Kaikielius]] was home to the [[House Vahali/Legends|House Vahali]], a rival family of the Prajii, and Praji-Barck watched as the planet's problems cost the Vahali most of their money. In [[4225 BBY]], Republic troops were finally sent to Kaikielius and Praji-Barck's great nephew [[Derrica Praji]] accompanied them, although he worried that his actions would anger his aunt. Praji-Barck secretly manipulated the [[Odominic]] kajidic into supplying both sides in the conflict, but Derrica discovered some [[datatape]]s that proved what she had done.

name: Shura (Sith)
description: {{Quote|I am Tyro Vestara Khai. I was summoned.|Vestara Khai, upon meeting Shura and the two other Sabers|Fate of the Jedi: Omen}}Shura was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was born on the remote<ref name="OM" /> [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]]<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]] and lived around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Second Galactic Civil War]]. She was [[Sith training|trained]] by the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]]<ref name="OM" />&mdash;descendants of a group of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] who had been stranded on Kesh during the days of the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]]<ref>''[[Lost Tribe of the Sith: Precipice]]''</ref>&mdash;and,<ref name="OM" /> by [[41 ABY]],<ref name="TERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> had ascended to the rank of [[Sith Saber]]. During that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]], a [[Sith Meditation Sphere]], arrived on Kesh. The Sphere developed a strong connection in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] with the [[Sith Tyro]] [[Vestara Khai]], resulting in Khai being summoned to the [[Circle of Lords]], the governing body of the tribe, in [[Tahv]], the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]] of Kesh.<ref name="OM" />Shura, together with [[Unidentified male Sith Saber (Kesh)|a male]] and [[Unidentified dark-skinned Sith Saber|a female]] Sith Saber, awaited Khai at the [[Kesh capitol building|capitol building]] in Tahv. When Khai arrived, Shura took Khai to the [[Circle Chambers]], the room in which the Circle of [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lords]] convened, via a winding staircase. Upon reaching the top of the stairs, Shura used the Force to [[Telekinesis/Legends|open]] the entrance to the chambers.<ref name="OM" />

name: Salis Kabor
description: Kabor tried to stop [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] from being practiced and was the instigator of the [[Kessel revolts]]. She later joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] and tried to unite the various Alliance groups that operated on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Lorrd/Legends|Lorrd]].

name: Korlana Toryn
description: When Toryn was a child, she became close to [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Lanius Qel-Bertuk]], a good friend of her father. She called him "Uncle Lanni" and thought of him as almost being a second father to her. When the [[Cularin system]] disappeared from [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] for ten years, between [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]] and [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Toryn became very upset, as it meant that she could not contact Qel-Bertuk.During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Toryn was sent by her father to stay on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], which was neutral in the conflict. He hired the [[heroes of Cularin]] to protect her, while she was there. After she arrived on Nar Shaddaa, she stayed at the hotel [[Bespin's Cloud]] and the heroes planned to meet her there. However, she left to visited ''[[Totor's Party Kave]]'', a [[Sail barge/Legends|sail barge]] that was used as a nightclub. The heroes met with her there, but the barge was attacked and destroyed by a group of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]], who wanted to collect [[Contract AA23|a bounty]] that had been posted on the heroes.A short time later, the bounty hunters captured Toryn and the heroes. However, the heroes were able to escape and they freed Toryn. The heroes then flew with Toryn to the [[Cularin system]], where she went to stay under the protection of Master Qel-Bertuk and the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].

name: Valantya
description: Valantya was employed by a holovid station and her works included fictional dramas and documentaries. However, in her spare time, she directed propaganda and new pieces for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. She also allowed the Alliance to convert [[Apartment 25001|her apartment]] into a safehouse.

name: Twin Suns (assassins)
description: Born on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Seer'aa and Teer'aa were sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] at a young age. At some point they killed their master, taking their first steps into their career as [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]].<ref name="kotor2" />In [[3951 BBY]],<ref name="kotorcg" /> during the aftermath of the [[Jedi Civil War]], the Twin Suns traveled on the ''[[Visionary]]'' with several other [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]]. [[G0-T0|Goto]] instructed them to capture the [[Meetra Surik|Jedi Exile]] alive, informing them that her [[Death/Legends|death]] would not be tolerated.<ref name="kotor2" />They successfully tracked down the Exile's companion [[Atton Rand]] while Surik was in the [[Jekk'Jekk Tarr]]. At first, they tried to get Atton to come with them peacefully, but soon resorted to violence. Atton managed to best them and escape. The outcome of the first encounter angered the duo, so they returned to the ''Visionary'', where they waited for the Exile and her friends. They finally got their chance just as the ship was falling apart. They attempted to kill Surik, but she and two of her companions killed the duo. Their bodies were destroyed when the ''Visionary'' exploded.<ref name="kotor2" />

name: Celis Bol
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Bol was assigned to work at secret Cartel base on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Tilnes]], in the [[Cularin system]]. After she had been there four months, a virus was released into the base by the [[Believers]], [[Death/Legends|killing]] Bol. Her [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]] was found by the [[heroes of Cularin]] several days later.

name: Bron Kand'lar
description: Kand'lar worked for [[Alliance Intelligence]] and when she was 22 years old, traveled to [[Bilbringi Shipyards]], where she investigated the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire's]] research into [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaking device]] technology. While she was there, she learned that four of her Bothan clan-brothers had been killed by [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]].

name: Allexia Evlan
description: Evlan lived in the [[Kuat system/Legends|Kuat system]], along with her widowed aunt and her twin sister [[Allandria Evlan]]. The twins spent most of their time in school and many of their classmates were the children of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] officers and workers at [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]]. The twins gained a lot of attention from their male classmates and would both date different boys every few days. They chose dates who had parents in important positions and would try to steer conversation to how Kuat Drive Yards was doing in an attempt to learn information about the shipyards. They often gathered information about naval deployments and shipyard schedules which they passed on to to an old friend of theirs who was a member of a [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance cell]].<ref name="CRO" />

name: Allandria Evlan
description: Evlan lived in the [[Kuat system/Legends|Kuat system]], along with her widowed aunt and her twin sister [[Allexia Evlan]]. The twins spent most of their time in school and many of their classmates were the children of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] officers and workers at [[Kuat Drive Yards/Legends|Kuat Drive Yards]]. The twins gained a lot of attention from their male classmates and would both date different boys every few days. However, they chose dates who had parents in important positions and would try to steer conversation to how Kuat Drive Yards was doing, in an attempt to learn information about the shipyards. They often gathered information about naval deployments and shipyard schedules which they passed on to to an old friend of theirs, who was a member of a Rebel Alliance cell.

name: Unidentified Naboo female
description: In [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Vader]] arrived to Void Station, planning to extract information from Kopatha. After a short battle between two of the Bothan's guards and Vader, Kopatha tried to calm the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] down by offering him various off-world "delicacies", such as food, beverages and women.Among them was a young [[Naboo (people)/Legends|Naboo]] female, offering Vader [[blossom wine]]. He stared at her for a few seconds, which prompted the young woman to ask him if something was wrong. Vader bluntly answered her "no" and quickly turned away, as the woman presumably reminded him of his late wife, [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]].

name: Fionna Flannis
description: Flannis was a reporter for [[Colonial News Nets]] and traveled the [[Colonies/Legends|Colonies]], interviewing socialites, entertainment starlets and [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] officers. She was known to produce some of the raciest stories for Colonial News Net. She was also an operative for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] and would meet with Alliance agents to give them information about Rebel and Imperial activity in the Colonies. Despite working for the same organization she was not aware that [[Pertaal Shenvehr]] was also a Rebel operative.

name: Hallena Devis
description: Hallena joined the intelligence service of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] sometime prior to the Clone Wars. She was sent to [[JanFathal]] during the conflict to help the government there against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]-backed revolutionaries. She was captured and held by Separatist followers on after they learned that she was a Republic spy, but Gilad Pellaeon and several [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] came to extract her.After the [[Battle of JanFathal]], she unofficially stopped working with the Republic, and journeyed with unorthodox [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Djinn Altis]] and his followers. Later she reconnected with Pellaeon, giving birth to a son, [[Mynar Devis|Mynar]], by him. Hallena officially left Republic Intelligence to try to get her life in order, after becoming disillusioned with the Republic government.

name: Darra Thel-Tanis
description: {{Quote|Stay with me until I fall asleep. It's lonely here.|Darra Thel-Tanis' words to Anakin Skywalker, while recuperating from her Haariden wound, rising up again as a cry within him at her tragic death in the Valley of the Dark Lords on Korriban|Jedi Quest: The Final Showdown}}[[File:Darra Thel-Tanis.JPG|thumb|left|120px|Darra Thel-Tanis]]A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Thel-Tanis was taken to the [[Jedi Temple]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] due to her being [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]]. There, she was to be trained to become a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Around [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]], she was taken as an [[Padawan/Legends|apprentice]] by the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Soara Antana/Legends|Soara Antana]], who was famous for her skill with a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="JQ:Apprentice" />With her Master, Darra accompanied [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] on missions to worlds such as [[Radnor/Legends|Radnor]] (her first mission) and [[Haariden]]. On the [[mission to Haariden]], Thel-Tanis was badly injured, after being shot in the thigh with a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]]. During her recovery she developed a friendship with Skywalker.<ref name="JQ:Disguise">''[[Jedi Quest: The Master of Disguise]]''</ref> At some point before [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]], Thel-Tanis was sent together with Skywalker on a mission to [[Norah]], where she was wounded again.<ref name="JQ:Peace">''[[Jedi Quest: The False Peace]]''</ref>[[File:Darra and Tru The Final Showdown Jap cover JQ10.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Darra Thel-Tanis and Tru Veld]]She also served on an escorting mission to [[Nuralee]] in 24 BBY.<ref name="JQ:Peace" /> [[23 BBY/Legends|The next year]],<ref name="ERC" /> Thel-Tanis and her Master once again [[Mission to Korriban (23 BBY)|accompanied]] Skywalker and Kenobi, as well as two other Jedi pairs ([[Siri Tachi]] with [[Ferus Olin]] and [[Ry-Gaul]] with [[Tru Veld]]) to [[Korriban]] to stop [[Granta Omega]] and [[Jenna Zan Arbor]]. During this mission, influenced by the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark-side]] energies of the planet, the apprentices started to argue rather than work as a team. The situation was aggravated when Ferus Olin offered to fix Tru Veld's lightsaber, which Anakin Skywalker had worked on before they left the Temple. Unfortunately, not being aware of Anakin's repairs to Tru's weapon, Ferus' repairs caused the lightsaber to drain power faster. This made the confrontation with Granta Omega deadly. Ferus saw that Tru's lightsaber was shorting out and quickly switched weapons with him, but Granta Omega slipped around and surprised them, coming at them from behind. Seeing that Ferus was in trouble, Darra Thel-Tanis leaped forward to protect him, determined to save her friend, but when the faulty saber failed, Granta Omega's [[KYD-21 blaster pistol|KYD-21 blaster]] bolt sped past Olin and hit Darra in the chest, killing her.<ref name="JQ:Showdown">''[[Jedi Quest: The Final Showdown]]''</ref>[[Soara Antana/Legends|Soara Antana]] gently unwound the ribbon in Darra's [[Padawan braid/Legends|Padawan braid]] as she wept over her beloved apprentice. Darra's [[Death/Legends|death]] deeply saddened her fellow Padawans. Olin blamed himself for her death and left the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] after this mission because of guilt, but not before strengthening the bonds of his friendship with fellow Padawan Tru Veld.<ref name="JQ:Showdown" />

name: Rya Skodhan
description: Rya Skodhan was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Mantooine/Legends|Mantooine]] around [[28 BBY/Legends|28 BBY]]. She worked as a [[Thief/Legends|burglar]] but after she was almost caught while raiding an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] installation, she decided to lie low for a while and she began working as a [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] hustler. She encountered [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] and after he lost three months' pay to her, he persuaded her to join the Alliance.<ref name="CRO" />By [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] Skodhan worked as a sabacc dealer in the [[Imperial Palace Casino Hotel]] on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]], where she spied on Imperial officers who played at her table. She also used her skills as a burglar to break into the rooms of Imperial officers and search for anything that could help the Alliance, disguising the intrusion as petty theft.<ref name="CRO" />

name: Aimi Loto
description: Aimi's mother was called [[M'lay Loto]] and disappeared many years before the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Loto worked as a droid mechanic and along with her partner, [[MdZ-BLK]], she traveled from system to system carrying out acts of sabotage, to destroy [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] equipment and personnel. When [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Nile Owen]] organized a wedding for his daughter, Loto and MdZ-BLK reprogrammed [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droids]] belonging to attendants of the wedding, so that they would explode or attack [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] during the celebration. As short time afterwards, she encountered [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]] on [[Karvoss II]], when his [[R2-series astromech droid|R2 unit]] malfunctioned. Cracken planned to attend the wedding of Owens' daughter, to help aide in the defection of the Moff's assistant, so Loto warned him to stay away from the protocol droids. Somewhen afterwards, she traveled with MdZ-BLK to [[Kwenn Space Station]], to carry out some more sabotage.

name: Darion Seville
description: Seville was the mother of [[Yearo Seville]]. She liked to arrange duels between her [[Droid/Legends|droids]], for amusement. The [[MdZ-BLK]] participated in a series of these duels, but eventually became so fed up that he attempted to kill Seville. However, Yearo stepped in and ionized the droid, saving his mother.

name: Iona Wince
description: When Wince was eleven, the [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] liner ''[[Starlite Cloud]]'' stopped by the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Wroona/Legends|Wroona]] and she stowed away aboard it. She was discovered by the ship's [[Captain/Legends|captain]], who took a liking to her and put her to work as a steward. The young girl joined the Rebel Alliance and made it easier for Alliance operatives to book passage on the ''Cloud'', by keeping watch for [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] and [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] agents. She also listened in on conversations about Imperial actions against the Alliance and could use her steward's pass card to access any part of the ship.

name: Shelta Sune
description: The mother and aunts of the Devaronian [[Lavek Talstin]] arranged for him to marry Sune. However, he considered Sune to be overbearing and obnoxious, so he fled before the marriage could take place. Under Devaronian law, once Sune and Talstin were married, he would have to give her most of her income and Sune didn't want to lose her opportunity for an easy way of getting money, so she got her mother, aunts and sisters to send their husbands to find Talstin.

name: Dordi
description: {{Quote|What if we trade?''"<br />"Trade?'' Trade ''what?"<br />"''Secrets. I'll tell you guys a big secret. That way, Barv and I will ''never'' say anything about your nest to anyone&mdash;because then you could tell ''my'' secret.|Allana Solo and Dordi|Fate of the Jedi: Vortex}}[[File:Njo sabasebatyne.jpg|thumb|left|135px|Barabel Jedi Master Saba Sebatyne]]Dordi was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Barabel/Legends|Barabel]] who [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side of the Force]] with the [[New Jedi Order]]. During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]] she served under [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Saba Sebatyne]] in her all-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]], the [[Wild Knights]]. By [[43 ABY]], Dordi had completed her training and ascended to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Around this time, Dordi and fellow Barabel Jedi Knight [[Zal]] began to consider starting a nest with Sebatyne's son, [[Tesar Sebatyne]]. In 43.5 ABY, a [[Force psychosis|mysterious illness]] began to befall young Jedi Knights, causing them to believe that everyone they knew had been replaced by impostors. The [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] decided to deal with the issue by encasing the affected Jedi in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]]. The Jedi Order resented this, however, and attempted to keep as many of the ill Knights as possible hidden secretly in the [[New Jedi Temple]] on the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to be studied, rather than letting them fall into Galactic Alliance hands.<ref name="Abyss" />To prevent [[Galactic Alliance Security]] forces from discovering and capturing these Jedi, former [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and his wife, [[Leia Organa Solo]], decided to attempt to take the Jedi offworld. Dordi, along with fellow Barabel Jedi Knights Zal and [[Wilyem]], served as [[Gunner/Legends|gunners]] in the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] under Han and his granddaughter, [[Allana Solo|Amelia]], in order to [[Toydarian double-reverse spinner|distract]] Galactic Alliance forces in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] over Coruscant. The ''Falcon'' broke every procedure for departing the planet, and [[Bolt Squadron (Galactic Alliance)|Bolt Squadron]], a Galactic Alliance squadron of [[XJ5 X-wing starfighter]]s, along with the ''[[Fast Death]]'', a [[Nargi-class pursuit frigate|''Nargi''-class pursuit frigate]], began to chase down the ''Falcon''. However, after maneuvering around [[PharmCom Orbital Processing Plant One]]&mdash;a pharmaceutical production facility in orbit&mdash;the ''Fast Death'' stayed behind, and was replaced by another pursuit frigate, the ''[[Quick End]]''. Han then ordered Amelia to alert Master Sebatyne, and proceeded to tell Dordi and Zal to ready their guns and targeting computers as a bluff. Sebatyne soon arrived on the scene with a squadron of [[StealthX]]s and quickly broke up Bolt Squadron. Wilyem then fired a [[Proton torpedo/Legends|proton torpedo]], which detonated a few kilometers off their stern. Solo pretended to corkscrew out of control toward the pursuit frigate, and revealed to the ''Quick End'' command that he had Amelia&mdash;disguised as his adopted daughter&mdash;on board. The frigate maneuvered out of his way, and Amelia reached out in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to Organa Solo, who quickly escaped offworld with the four psychotic Jedi in the ''Gizer Gut''. The Galactic Alliance forces broke off their pursuit, and, their objective complete, the group made the jump into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] to meet up with the Jedi at their destination.<ref name="Abyss" />Later, in [[44 ABY]], Dordi started a nest with Tesar Sebatyne in the underlevels of the [[New Jedi Temple|Jedi Temple]], along with Wilyem and Zal. Amelia stumbled upon them with her friend, Jedi Knight [[Bazel Warv]]&mdash;one of the Jedi that Dordi had helped to sneak offworld, and who had since recovered from the psychosis. The Barabels at first forbade Amelia and Warv from leaving until their eggs hatched two [[Standard month/Legends|months]] later, but Amelia decided to exchange secrets with them so that they would be even. She revealed to them her true identity&mdash;Allana Solo, daughter of the Jedi [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] and [[Tenel Ka Djo]] and heir to the [[Hapan]] [[Queen Mother|throne]]. Dordi and the other Barabels accepted the trade of secrets and allowed the two to leave.<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref>Later, the Jedi deserted Coruscant in an attempt to lure the [[Lost Tribe of Sith emergence|newly-risen]] [[Lost Tribe of Sith]] onto the world, but Dordi and the three other Barabels stayed with their nest. When the Jedi returned and began [[Liberation of Coruscant (Lost Tribe of Sith emergence)|eliminating]] the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], the Sith withdrew into the Jedi Temple. Meanwhile, Allana Solo had a vision of the Barabels' [[Youngling/Legends|younglings]] being [[Death/Legends|murdered]], and she and her [[Parent/Legends|grandparents]] traveled to Coruscant to warn the Barabels. Dordi and the tree other Barabels killed several Sith who attacked their nest before they were met by the Solos&mdash;who were accompanied by Jedi Knight [[Zekk]], the Hapan [[Taryn Zel]], and a contingent of Hapan [[Commando/Legends|commandos]]. Dordi and the others were shocked that Allana had led them there, but Allana told the Barabels of her vision, and that they had originally intended to send just Warv into the Temple, but they had been [[Assault on the New Jedi Temple|ambushed]] by Sith and he had been killed protecting Allana.<ref name="Apoc">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Apocalypse]]''</ref>[[File:Allana Solo.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Allana Solo]]Dordi and the other Barabels quickly returned to their nest to retrieve their younglings. With the help of the Solos, Zekk, Zel, and the Hapan escort, they fought their way through the Temple. The commandos suffered numerous casualties, and a few of the younglings were also killed, although twenty survived. They called for an extraction, and were met by former [[Imperial Remnant]] [[Head of State/Legends|Head of State]] [[Jagged Fel]], who was [[Pilot/Legends|piloting]] the ''[[Parting Gift]]''. The ''Parting Gift'' dropped off Master Saba Sebatyne, former Jedi [[Tahiri Veila]], and [[Void Jumper]] [[Sergeant major/Legends|Sergeant Major]] [[Gef Olazon]] to assist in getting Dordi and the Barabels to safety. The extraction was successful, and the Barabels' younglings were saved.<ref name="Apoc" />

name: Zal
description: {{Quote|<nowiki></nowiki>''Tesar? Dordi?"<br />"''And Wilyem and Zal.|Allana Solo and Zal, as the former stumbles upon the Barabels' nest|Fate of the Jedi: Vortex}}Zal was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Barabel/Legends|Barabel]] who served in the [[New Jedi Order]]. She [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side of the Force]] and served as a member of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Saba Sebatyne]]'s all-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Wild Knights]] [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]] during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]]. By [[43 ABY]], she had attained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Around this time, she and fellow Barabel Jedi Knight [[Dordi]] considered starting a nest with Sebatyne's son, [[Tesar Sebatyne]]. In 43.5 ABY, several young Jedi Knights began to fall prey to a [[Force psychosis|mysterious illness]] that caused them to believe that everyone they knew had been replaced by impostors, and the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] decided to deal with the psychotic Knights by encasing them in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]]. The Jedi Order resisted this, however, and secretly kept as many of the ill Jedi as possible hidden in the [[New Jedi Temple]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to be studied.<ref name="Abyss" />[[File:HanSolo-Vortex.jpg|thumb|left|225px|Captain Han Solo]]To prevent [[Galactic Alliance Security]] forces from finding and capturing these Jedi, [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and his wife, Jedi Knight [[Leia Organa Solo]], decided to smuggle them offworld to the planet [[Shedu Maad]]. Zal, along with fellow Barabel Knights Dordi and [[Wilyem]], served as [[Gunner/Legends|gunners]] in the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] under Han Solo and his granddaughter, [[Allana Solo]]. They were to [[Toydarian double-reverse spinner|distract]] Galactic Alliance forces in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] over Coruscant, allowing Organa Solo to escape with the affected Jedi&mdash;[[Natua Wan]], [[Seff Hellin]], [[Bazel Warv]], and [[Yaqeel Saav'etu]]&mdash;in the ''[[Gizer Gut]]''.<ref name="Abyss" />The ''Millennium Falcon'' broke every procedure for departing the planet; the Galactic Alliance's [[Bolt Squadron (Galactic Alliance)|Bolt Squadron]] and the ''[[Fast Death]]'', a [[Nargi-class pursuit frigate|''Nargi''-class pursuit frigate]], began to chase them down. Solo maneuvered the ''Falcon'' behind [[PharmCom Orbital Processing Plant One]], an orbiting pharmaceutical production plant, and the ''Fast Death'' stayed behind, to be replaced by another pursuit [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]], the ''[[Quick End]]''. Solo then told Allana to alert Master Sebatyne, and proceeded to order Zal and Dordi to pull up their guns and targeting computer systems as a bluff. Sebatyne arrived with a squadron of [[StealthX]]s and quickly scattered Bolt Squadron. Wilyem then fired a [[Proton torpedo/Legends|proton torpedo]], which detonated a few kilometers off their stern. Solo pretended to spin out of control toward the ''Quick End'', and revealed to the Galactic Alliance that he had Allana&mdash;who was disguised as his adopted daughter "Amelia"&mdash;on board. The frigate then maneuvered out of his way, and at Solo's orders, Allana reached out in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to Organa Solo, signaling her to leave. She quickly escaped offworld with the four psychotic Jedi in the ''Gizer Gut''. The Galactic Alliance forces broke off their pursuit, and, their objective complete, Dordi, Zal, Wilyem, and the Solos jumped into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] to meet up with the ''Gizer Gut'' at Shedu Maad.<ref name="Abyss" />In [[44 ABY]], Zal began a nest with Wilyem in the [[New Jedi Temple|Jedi Temple's]] underlevels, along with Dordi and Tesar Sebatyne. They were stumbled upon by Amelia and Jedi Knight Bazel Warv, one of the Jedi they had helped to smuggle offworld, and who had since recovered from the psychosis. The Barabels were outraged at first, and demanded that since they had seen the nest and their eggs, Amelia and Warv would have to stay until the eggs hatched. Amelia, however, suggested that she tell them a secret about herself that was as important as the Barabels' nest, and revealed to them her true identity as Allana, daughter of Jedi [[Darth Caedus|Jacen Solo]] and [[Queen Mother]] [[Tenel Ka Djo]], and thus the rightful heir to the [[Hapes Consortium/Legends|Hapes Consortium]]. Zal and the other Barabels agreed to the terms and allowed Allana and Warv to leave.<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref>[[File:Allana Solo.jpg|thumb|right|175px|Allana Solo]]Upon the [[Lost Tribe of Sith emergence|rise]] of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]] in [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] affairs, the Jedi decided to leave Coruscant in an attempt to lure the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] into a trap, so that the Jedi could effectively eliminate the Tribe in one mission. Zal and the three other Barabrels, however, remained behind in the Temple. When the Jedi returned and began [[Liberation of Coruscant (Lost Tribe of Sith emergence)|hunting down]] the Sith, the Tribe retreated into the Temple. Meanwhile, Allana had a [[Force vision/Legends|vision]] of the Barabels' nest being attacked and their [[Youngling/Legends|younglings]] being [[Death/Legends|slaughtered]], and she&mdash;along with her [[Parent/Legends|grandparents]], the Jedi Knight [[Zekk]], the Hapan [[Taryn Zel]], and several Hapan [[Commando/Legends|commandos]]&mdash;traveled to the Temple and located the nest to warn the Barabels. Zal was the only one of the four Barabels who did not come out to meet with them.<ref name="Apoc">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Apocalypse]]''</ref>They quickly gathered the younglings and fled the nest, [[Assault on the New Jedi Temple|fighting]] the Sith on their way out. They suffered casualties, including numerous Hapan soldiers and some of the younglings, leaving twenty of the newborn Barabels alive. The Barabels and their rescuers were extracted from the Jedi Temple by the former [[Imperial Remnant]] [[Head of State/Legends|Head of State]] [[Jagged Fel]], who piloted the ''[[Parting Gift]]'', along with Master Saba Sebatyne, [[Void Jumper]] [[Sergeant major/Legends|Sergeant Major]] [[Gef Olazon]], and the former Jedi [[Tahiri Veila]].<ref name="Apoc" />

name: Linia
description: Linia was the daughter of [[Daz (Dalicron-4)|Daz]], a [[Sexes/Legends|man]] who operated [[Daz's Tavern]], in [[Dalia (township)|Dalia]] on Dalicron-4. She worked in the tavern and, by the time of the Galactic Civil War, was in her early 20s. When a group of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] agents visited the tavern in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Linia served them.

name: Arabelle Lorteli
description: {{Quote|Were you a Jedi prior to the recent Galactic Civil War?''"<br />"''Yes. ''Before'' I committed the acts for which they want to put me on trial.''"<br />"''I understand that. But in your capacity as a Jedi Knight, you were privy to a great many secrets that the Jedi Order might not want revealed in open court, were you not?''"<br />"''Oh, we ''all'' know where the Emperor buried his treasure, if that's what you're asking. I'll be glad to draw you a map&hellip;|Lorteli and Veila|Fate of the Jedi: Abyss}}The [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Zoolli]] [[judge]] Arabelle Lorteli served the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]]. In [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]], Lorteli was selected by Galactic Alliance [[Chief of State (Galactic Alliance)|Chief of State]] [[Natasi Daala]] to oversee the [[Court of Jedi Affairs]], which Daala formed mainly to deal with the increasingly alarming issue of young [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] falling prey to a [[Force psychosis|strange illness]] that caused them to believe that everyone they knew had been replaced by impostors. Lorteli approved a warrant for the arrest of psychotic [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knights [[Bazel Warv]] and [[Yaqeel Saav'etu]], but [[Galactic Alliance Security]] [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Atar]] was unable to procure the two Jedi. Later, much to the displeasure of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Lorteli oversaw the [[Trial of Tahiri Veila|arraignment]] of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Tahiri Veila]], who had, in years past, been a Jedi as well as a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. Lorteli sided decisively with the Galactic Alliance and even refused to allow the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Nawara Ven]] to serve as Veila's defense attorney for the case.<ref name="Abyss" />Later, however, the [[Jedi High Council (New Jedi Order)|Jedi Council]] tricked Lorteli into getting her to sign a document that granted the Jedi permission to visit<ref name="Abyss" /> [[Galactic Alliance Security Detention Center 81|Detention Center 81]],<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref> a [[Galactic Alliance Security blockhouse]] in which Jedi Knights [[Valin Horn]] and [[Jysella Horn]] were being held captive in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]]. The Horns had been captured by Galactic Alliance Security forces after falling prey to the strange psychosis, and were eventually placed in the facility under the command of [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Wruq Retk]]. A group of Jedi, accompanied by several members of the press, accessed the facility and showed the treatment the Horns were receiving, garnering public sympathy for the Jedi's situation.<ref name="Abyss" /> As a result, Daala publicly dismissed Lorteli from duty, and Judge [[Mavari Zudan]] took over Veila's case.<ref name="Allies">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Allies]]''</ref>

name: Axela Zin
description: {{Quote|I'm sure I don't need to remind you to watch yourselves in this jungle. But if something ''does'' get you, die quietly. Your family will be rewarded if you do&mdash;and punished if you don't.|Lady Rhea to her handpicked search party|Fate of the Jedi: Abyss}}Axela Zin was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] from the remote<ref name="Abyss" /> [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]]<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Kesh]]. She was [[Sith training|trained]] in the ways of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] with the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], a group of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] who had been stranded on Kesh during the days of the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]]. Zin completed her training with the Tribe and rose to the rank of [[Sith Saber]]. She also gave birth to [[Axela Zin's son|a boy]], who became a [[Sith Tyro]] by [[43 ABY]].<ref name="Abyss" />In [[41 ABY]], [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]], a [[Sith Meditation Sphere]], arrived on Kesh and began to assist the Tribe in the creation of a new [[Sith armada (Lost Tribe of the Sith)|Sith armada]]. Two years later in 43 ABY, shortly after [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] presence was felt by the Tribe, Ship abruptly left Kesh to follow a call in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Omen]]''</ref> Zin was chosen by [[Grand Lord]] [[Darish Vol]] and [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Olaris Rhea]] to be a member of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith strike team|strike team]] whose task it was to track Ship and hunt down Skywalker. Zin traveled with the strike team in the [[Warship/Legends|warship]] ''[[Eternal Crusader]]'', and they followed Ship to [[Abeloth's planet|a planet]] in [[the Maw]]. Once there, Zin was chosen to be a part of the search party to go planetside, while the ''Eternal Crusader'' remained in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] under the command of Sith Saber [[Baad Walusari]]. As the search for Ship began, Zin was almost instantly impaled by three thorned boughs. Zin freed herself with her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], but was quickly ensnared by more vines and [[Death/Legends|killed]]. She died without making a sound of pain, however, and the expedition's commanders, Lady Rhea and [[Sith Master/Legends|Sith Master]] [[Yuvar Xal]], decided to commend her son for her bravery.<ref name="Abyss" />

name: Rasher Ke'e
description: {{Quote|The Horns and the Jedi can follow, Rasher. No one else.''"<br />"''Yes, sir.|Atar and Rasher Ke'e|Fate of the Jedi: Abyss}}Rasher Ke'e was a [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who served in [[Galactic Alliance Security]] during the [[Time/Legends|time]] following the [[Second Galactic Civil War]]. By [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]], she had attained the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]], and was stationed at a secret [[Galactic Alliance Security blockhouse]] on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. In that year, several [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] began to develop a [[Force psychosis|psychosis]] which caused them to believe that everyone they knew had been replaced by impostors.<ref name="Abyss" /> The [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] [[The Galactic Federation of Free Alliances versus Valin Horn|decided]] to deal with the matter by [[Carbon-freezing/Legends|encasing]] the afflicted [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]].<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Outcast]]''</ref> Two of these Jedi, [[Jysella Horn|Jysella]] and [[Valin Horn]], were placed in the blockhouse in which Ke'e was stationed.<ref name="Abyss" />Around this time a group of Jedi, led by Jedi Knight [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]], acquired a legal document from [[Judge]] [[Arabelle Lorteli]] granting them visitation rights to the Horns. They arrived at the blockhouse with the Horns' parents and a large contingent of press. Solo presented the document to Security [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Atar]], who was forced to lead them to a [[Turbolift/Legends|turbolift]] that would take them to the carbonite-encased Jedi. Ke'e stood outside the turbolift, and Atar ordered that she allow only the Jedi and the Horns' parents through; as well as to check them all for weapons. Ke'e attempted to carry out her orders, instructing [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Cilghal]] to wait so that she could be searched, but Cilghal disregarded her request to search her for weapons, claiming she hadn't brought any. Frustrated, Ke'e ordered the rest of the present Security [[Trooper/Legends|troopers]] to secure the lobby. She then tried to prevent the press from entering the turbolift, but Solo questioned the lieutenant's ability to stop them and led the reporters into the turbolift. Ke'e then threatened Solo, who disregarded the comment and followed the rest of the Jedi and reporters to the Horns.<ref name="Abyss" />

name: Tara (Human)
description: Tara worked as a waitress in the bar [[Spanner's]], which was located in the city of [[Hedrett]], on Cularin. She had worked there for two years when the [[heroes of Cularin]] visited the bar in about [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]].

name: Karpette
description: {{Quote|Yes, Captain?''"<br />"''The warrant.|Karpette and Atar|Fate of the Jedi: Abyss}}Karpette was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] and a member of [[Galactic Alliance Security]] in [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]]. She served in a security [[Squad/Legends|squad]] under the command of [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Atar]]. Around this [[Time/Legends|time]], several [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] were stricken with a [[Force psychosis|mysterious psychosis]] that caused them to believe that everyone they knew had been replaced by impostors.<ref name="Abyss" /> The [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] [[The Galactic Federation of Free Alliances versus Valin Horn|decided]] to deal with the matter by [[Carbon-freezing/Legends|encasing]] the affected [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]].<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Outcast]]''</ref>When Jedi Knights [[Bazel Warv]] and [[Yaqeel Saav'etu]] developed this psychosis, they were quickly incapacitated by [[Imperial Remnant]] [[Head of State/Legends|Head of State]] [[Jagged Fel]], Jedi Knight [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]], and Solo's parents, [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Leia Organa Solo]], outside of the [[New Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi Temple Docking Complex|speeder entrance]]. Karpette and the rest of Atar's force were nearby, and a warrant was quickly made out for the arrest of Warv and Saav'etu. With Karpette in possession of the warrant, the Security force confronted Fel and the Solos outside the Temple, and Atar requested that the Jedi hand Warv and Saav'etu over. The group was reluctant to comply, however, and Atar ordered Karpette to step forward and hand him the warrant. Faced with no other option, Han and Leia then stalled for time by reentering the Jedi Temple and closing the gate behind them as Fel and Jaina left the scene in Fel's [[limousine]], using Fel's diplomatic immunity to prevent the Security forces from blocking their exit and leaving Karpette and the rest of Atar's force empty-handed.<ref name="Abyss" />

name: Mako (slicer)
description: By the age of 7, Mako was an orphan living on [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]] and already had earned a reputation for having an unnatural affiliation to all things computer related, including slicing. Her skills were such that she managed to teach herself every known programming language, and at the age of eight, managed to crash the bank account of a red light district orphanage in which she lived, which had attempted to sell her. After escaping the orphanage with a large amount of [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] from their account, she found herself working with several of Nar Shaddaa's most notorious slicer gangs. 7 years after her escape, at the age of 15, several of Mako's friends disastrously messed up a job given to them by a [[Hutt Cartel]]. Mako was in some way partially blamed for the incident and ended up wounded in an alley where she was found by a [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] named [[Braden]]. Braden required a tech specialist for his crew and offered her the job, which she accepted, wanting to leave the moon and let the failed job fade from the Hutt's memories. She soon came to see Braden's crew as her first real family and grew to love the code of honor and underground culture of the bounty hunting world. For a short time, the [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] hunter [[Qyzen Fess]] was a bounty hunter who worked for Braden and Mako.

name: Mara Davos
description: Davos served the Republic as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] and in [[3957 BBY]], was among a team of Republic agents who went on a mission to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Sernpidal/Legends|Sernpidal]]. There, they recovered a [[Code cylinder/Legends|code cylinder]] that held the command codes for the sensor systems on [[Darth Revan's flagship]]. Afterward, they traveled to the Republic ship [[Viscount (Galactic Republic starship)|''Viscount'']] and assisted the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Bastila Shan]] in a mission to capture the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Revan/Legends|Darth Revan]]. During the mission, Davos and the other agents encountered the [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]] [[Darth Voren]].

name: Trina
description: Trina worked as a poacher. In about [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], a meteorite crashed onto the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Dorumaa]] and awoke a [[Dorumaan leviathan]], a type of giant sea creature. Trina and some other poachers planned to kill the creature and then loot ivory from its corpse. However, the [[heroes of Cularin]], a group of freelance agents who operated in the [[Cularin system]], attempted to save the leviathan by attacking the poachers. Trina and three other poachers tried to fight the heroes while the poachers [[Harkaan]] and [[Pardo]] attacked the leviathan with a submersible. However, the heroes eventually defeated the poachers and saved the leviathan.

name: Tis Dolan
description: An ambitious [[Wroonian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Tis Dolan fled her enemies on [[Wroona/Legends|Wroona]] to make a name for herself. She briefly worked with a group of [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] thieves, but her opportunity came when she met [[Zietta Anjiliac]] in the [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowport]] [[Point Nadir]]. Zietta was incompetent compared to other [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]] and was a disgrace of her [[Kajidic/Legends|kajidic]]. Dolan decided to make her place in Point Nadir hierarchy through Zietta, and for that she gained Zietta's confidence, even though she despised her. Then she used her last money to engineer the assassination of Zietta's cousin, [[Tirello Anjiliac]], the boss of Point Nadir. Then, Dolan organized Zietta's rise to power, helping her establish control of the Point Nadir. In truth, Zietta remained nothing but a puppet in hands of Tis Dolan, who made the majority of the decisions and manipulated the Hutt to her own ends, fighting to maintain that position.

name: Sina Voosha
description: Voosha was a member of a group of bounty hunters that were led by the [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Koll Jovas]]. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the bounty hunters were hired by a member of the [[Metatheran Cartel]] to find whoever was responsible for some attacks on Cartel shipping in the [[Cularin system]], and stop them. The attacks had been caused by the [[Rock Rogues]], a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] group and when the bounty hunters arrived in the Cularin system in their [[Transport/Legends|transport]], it was shot down by a Rock Rogues [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]]. The transport crash-landed on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and Voosha and the other bounty hunters climbed out of the wreckage, determined to find the pirates.Shortly afterward, the bounty hunters encountered the Heroes of Cularin, a group of freelance agents who were also investigating the Rock Rogues. Jovas, Voosha and the [[Cerean/Legends|Cerean]] [[Ran-Siij]] approached the heroes and Jovas introduced himself, while the other bounty hunters hid nearby.

name: Liinu Oran
description: Oran was a member of a group of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] that were led by the [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Koll Jovas]]. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the bounty hunters were hired by a member of the [[Metatheran Cartel]] to find whoever was responsible for some attacks on Cartel shipping in the [[Cularin system]], and stop them.
