The attacks had been caused by the [[Rock Rogues]], a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] group and when the bounty hunters arrived in the Cularin system in their [[Transport/Legends|transport]], it was shot down by a Rock Rogues [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]]. The transport crash-landed on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and Oran and the other bounty hunters climbed out of the wreckage, determined to find the pirates.Shortly afterward, the bounty hunters encountered the Heroes of Cularin, a group of freelance agents who were also investigating the Rock Rogues. Oran, the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Fir Kashal]], and the [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] [[Jith Zesjoo]] hid nearby, while Jovas and two other bounty hunters approached the heroes.

name: Voli Quana
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Voli Quana was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Having constructed an amber-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to wield against enemies of the Republic, Master Quana traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] enforcing the Republic's laws.<ref name="BM" />During her service to the Republic, she was assigned by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] to lead members of the [[Republican Army]] against the corrupt [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Vrox]] of [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]]. Joined by [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Janx Ferro]] and a group of[[JU-9 Juggernaut War Droid]]s, Governor Vrox led the [[Mandalorian Armed Forces]] against the Republican Army during the costly [[Battle of Mandalore (pre-Naboo)|battle]] there. Master Quana served as support to [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Weirs]] during the battle, helping him communicating his commands to the army by use of her mastery of [[Telepathy/Legends|telepathy]]. While this strategy was extremely effective, Master Quana was forced to take control of the battle following the assassination of Lieutenant Weirs during an ambush. Under Master Quana's command, the Republic's Army were able to win the battle and capture Vrox.<ref name="BM" />

name: Kin Laron
description: Laron flew the ship ''[[Hell's Axe]]'' and made herself a career as an assassin. By assuming the identity of "Shiaer Hifron," a trader who was also secretly her informant, Laron was able to keep her species and sex a secret, by meeting with clients posing as Hifron, who she pretended arranged deals for her.<ref name="WBC" />Laron used seduction and deceit to get close to her targets, so only took contracts to assassinate men. She would then kill her targets aboard their [[Starship/Legends|starships]] while they slept, using capsules of [[RX-8]], a poisonous gas.<ref name="WBC" />During the time of the New Republic, Laron took four [[Bounty/Legends|bounties]] from the [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Gornt Seron]] to kill some men, including one called [[Den Hardon]]. By [[7 ABY/Legends|7 ABY]], the New Republic had posted a bounty of 25,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] on Laron, although they had no idea as to her physical appearance and true identity.<ref name="WBC" />

name: Piit/Legends
description: "Peg Leg" Piit was nicknamed for her purple peg leg in place of her missing right leg. In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], she assisted with the capture of [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] and the drugging of [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who came to claim the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]].[[20 BBY/Legends|Two years later]], Piit was one the pirates that assisted Hondo during the hijacking onboard the [[Crucible/Legends|''Crucible'']]. She shot at, [[Professor/Legends|Professor]] [[Huyang/Legends|Huyang]], but was knocked unconscious. She was serving drinks to two pirates when [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] and his forces stormed the base, and shot dead the pirates she was standing next to. She later fought in a [[Skirmish on Florrum/Legends|skirmish]] after half of Hondo's pirates join [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]] and [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] in their conquest for power. She utilized a blaster pistol during the fight and killed several pirates before being forced to retreat into the ruins of the base with Ohnaka and the rest of his forces, as well as Obi-Wan Kenobi, after Adi Gallia was slain by Opress. She survived the battle and helped to salvage valuables from the Nightbrothers' destroyed starship.

name: Gunda Mabin/Legends
description: Mabin began her career as a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] when she was nine, working for the [[Riders of the Maelstrom]]. After working as a pirate for two [[Standard year/Legends|years]], Mabin had earned the nickname "Gunda the Terrible" and operated a small fleet of heavily-armed [[Freighter/Legends|freighters]]. She would rob her victims of everything they had, before selling any survivors into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]]. As a result, a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] of 50,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] was placed on her head by the authorities in the [[Perrinn sector]] and a number of criminal organizations became angered by actions she had taken against them.

name: Filice Ginzork
description: Around [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Filice Ginzork married [[Peert Ginzork]]. She worked as a private security specialist for [[The Shield]], a group that protected corporate couriers and executives and had recently branched into counter-espionage. She was also secretly a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]], a fact that was hidden from both the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and the corporations that hired her and her company.<ref name="CRO" />

name: Kuuda De Nall
description: De Nall flew a [[YT-1210]] light [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] and once traveled to the [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowport]] [[StarForge Station]], where she became romantically involved with the station's owner, [[Chidee Na Maak]]. Na Maak keep insisting that she let him upgrade her ship and then personally carried out all the modifications for her. The course of their relationship became the subject of number of wagers among the other inhabitants of the station.

name: Numa Nubbu
description: Numa was the sister of [[Nib Nubbu]], and after their parents were killed in an industrial accident, Numa was raised by her brother. Together, they traveled from system to system, carrying out various scams. However, while on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Daimar]], they were arrested by the local authorities after they attempted to scam a merchant. After spending months in prison, Nib was released to assist the local authorities by using his underworld contacts to help aide a mission to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Byrsym]]. In return, both Nib and Numa were freed and the authorities promised to protect Numa from the Galactic Empire.

name: Alinta
description: For many years, Alinta and her allies communicated with [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]] anonymously via a secret comlink by sending coded messages. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Alinta contacted Organa with crucial information regarding the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. The woman claimed that a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] called [[Zigoola]] posed a possible threat to the safety of the Republic. Organa, not knowing what to do with the information, called upon his fellow Senator and friend [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], who was good friends with the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. Padmé convinced Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] to listen to Organa's story. Reluctantly trusting Organa and his source, Kenobi and Organa set off to Zigoola. Alinta sent coordinates one at a time to Organa, as a precaution. When they group arrived at the last pair of coordinates, they found themselves at a [[Space station/Legends|space station]]. at first, it seemed as if the station were abandoned, but they soon found that a battle was in progress between Alinta's allies and the [[Karlarba Pirates]].The [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and their [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] had already eliminated most of Alinta's allies, leaving her the last remaining of her group. Kenobi and Organa entered the fight and managed to defeat the remaining pirates and their droids, although Alinta was mortally wounded during the fray. She was too badly hurt to be saved by Kenobi's limited healing abilities, but the woman managed to give some information to them before she died. Alinta had one request of them before they left: blow up the station so no one would be able to retrieve any information. Organa and Kenobi received a data crystal with Zigoola's coordinates and scuttled the station to preserve the group's secrets.{{Char-stub}}

name: Unidentified Keshiri Sith
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Keshiri]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] was born on<ref name="Abyss" /> the [[Wild Space/Legends|Wild Space]]<ref>{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Kesh]]. She was [[Sith training|trained]] in the ways of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] with the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]]&mdash;descendants of a group of Sith who had crash-landed on Kesh during the days of the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]].<ref name="Abyss" /> In [[41 ABY]], [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]], a [[Sith Meditation Sphere]], arrived on Kesh and began to help them form [[Sith armada (Lost Tribe of the Sith)|a new armada]]. [[43 ABY|Two years later]], after the members of the Tribe felt [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] presence in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] when he touched an [[Aing-Tii/Legends|Aing-Tii]] [[Relics|relic]], the [[Codex]], Ship abruptly left Kesh to follow a call through the Force.<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Omen]]''</ref> The female Keshiri was chosen by [[Grand Lord]] [[Darish Vol]] and [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Olaris Rhea]] to be a member of Rhea's [[Lost Tribe of Sith strike team|strike team]] sent to recover Ship and eliminate Skywalker.<ref name="Abyss" />Aboard the captured [[Warship/Legends|warship]] ''[[Eternal Crusader]]'', the Keshiri Sith served under Rhea as the strike team tracked Ship to [[Abeloth's planet|a planet]] in [[the Maw]]. There, the team encountered [[Abeloth]], a being who was very strong in the Force and controlled the world's deadly [[Plant/Legends|plant]]-life. Still, many of the strike team's members were [[Death/Legends|killed]] before Ship returned to them, but the female Sith was among the approximately fifteen survivors. Meanwhile, Abeloth had discovered Skywalker and his son, [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Ben Skywalker]], at [[Sinkhole Station]], a [[Space station/Legends|space station]] in the Maw. Ship transported the female Keshiri and the other Sith to Sinkhole Station, where they [[Skirmish at Sinkhole Station|ambushed]] the Skywalkers. The Keshiri Sith was part of the initial attack group who cut into the station's control room, where the Skywalkers had just returned from going [[beyond shadows]]&mdash;the state of being Force-sensitives entered after separating their minds from their bodies.<ref name="Abyss" />As the team broke into the control room, the Keshiri Sith threw her [[parang]] at Luke, who, with warning from his son, managed to dodge the blade. She tried to [[Telekinesis/Legends|pull]] the weapon back to her with the Force but also sensed Ben moving to attack her, and attempted to counter him while still catching the parang. The complex move failed, and Ben quickly [[Cho mai/Legends|cut off]] her hand with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. She then slashed her own lightsaber at Ben's neck, but he used the Force to pull her body [[Shiak|onto]] his blade, killing her.<ref name="Abyss" />

name: Farasa Anturi
description: Anturi was a deranged [[Prince/Legends|princess]] from [[House Picutorion|House Anturi]], an aristocratic family that was based in the [[Senex sector/Legends|Senex sector]]. In [[553 BBY]], she married the [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[Osted Picutorion]] and her house was renamed "House Picutorion", after him. Their marriage instigated a conflict known as the [[Crimson Days]] between House Picutorion and the rival Senex houses [[House Vandron]] and [[House Petro]], which was ended when the [[Third Nantama Synod]] accepted Anturi's marriage to Picutorion.

name: Kimmi Chyler
description: {{Quote|Are you the rookie? Try not to get in my way.|Kimmi Chyler|The Shadow Syndicate}}Originally from [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]], Chyler had outraced both [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Dengar/Legends|Dengar]] on [[Agrilat Swamp Circuit]]. Her success on the swoop track led her to develop a certain arrogant attitude regarding her skills.<ref name="LS" /> She owned a silver, red and blue [[Flare-S swoop/Legends|Flare-S]] [[Kimmi Chyler's Flare-S swoop|swoop]] with custom thrusters and steering vanes that were envied by her competitors.<ref name="Chyler's Swoop">{{SWGTCG|set=The Shadow Syndicate|cardname=Chyler's Swoop}}</ref>[[File:Corellian Gambit.jpg|thumb|left|Chyler, playing sabacc with Lonay]]During one of the championships Chyler had hired [[Dash Rendar/Legends|Dash Rendar]], captain of the [[Outrider/Legends|''Outrider'']], to provide transport for herself and her team. The [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] had also contacted Rendar about transporting valuable cargo as he moved from race to race on different planets. After an encounter with an [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]] on [[Lok/Legends|Lok]], where the first race of the season, the [[Lok Marathon]] was being held - Rendar was forced to hire an additional security for himself and his ship.<ref name="LS" />During the travel from Lok to [[Rori/Legends|Rori]] Chyler had shown her [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] skills, when she played - and robbed every [[credit]] of Rendar's bodyguard companion. She had won the [[Narmle Memorial Rally]], but when she and Rendar returned to ''Outrider''{{'s}} landing pad, they witnessed signs of a struggle. Even though Rendar immediately became cautious about who tried to get aboard his ship, Chyler was unconcerned.<ref name="LS" />[[File:Sabacc Revenge.jpg|thumb|right|Chyler, confronted by Lonay's thugs]]On [[Talus/Legends|Talus]], the site of the [[Nashal River Race]], Chyler decided to play sabacc and, taking Rendar's bodyguard with her, headed for the largest [[Casino/Legends|casino]] in the town of [[Nashal]]. She choose to share a table with [[Lonay]], a [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] [[Vigo/Legends|vigo]], and several hands progressed without incident. When the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] had wagered all his credits on a final showdown, Chyler beat him with a pure sabacc and began scooping up her winnings.<ref name="LS" /> Though Chyler knew the vigo was someone very important, she didn't care, because making other people look bad was part of her job description.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=The Shadow Syndicate|cardname=Corellian Gambit}}</ref> The vigo went furious over his defeat and his guards had to hustle him out of the casino. When Chyler and her bodyguard left the casino, Lonay and his thugs confronted them, stating that Chyler had a [[Skifter/Legends|skifter]]. Before they could draw their blasters, Chyler and her companion jumped on a nearby swoop, Lonay and his thugs followed them in a [[XP-38 sport landspeeder]]. After a high-speed chase through the streets of Talus Chyler swung her swoop into a dead-end alley, with Lonay's speeder following just behind. At full speed she stood on the braking vanes and the swoop headed straight up out of the alley, while the speeder hit the wall hard. Chyler hovered for a second to appreciate the wreckage and then took the swoop back to the ''Outrider'', still acting unconcerned about the encounter.<ref name="LS" /> Even though the team had to leave next day, Chyler still found time for more sabacc games. After winning again in another casino, she was about to leave, when Lonay's agents confronted her in the alley. Chyler proved herself to be as good with a hold-out blaster as with a sabacc deck and eventually escaped on her swoop into the night.<ref name="DS">{{SWGTCG|set=The Shadow Syndicate|scenario=Dark Side scenario campaign}}</ref>[[File:Gang Warfare.jpg|thumb|left|Chyler, confronted by Wrenga Jixton]]On Corellia, on her home Agrilat Swamp Circuit track Chyler spent more time than usual getting her swoop ready to race.<ref name="LS" /> This helped her win the race to the great irritation of [[Wrenga Jixton]] who confronted her and her team shortly afterwards.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=The Shadow Syndicate|cardname=Gang Warfare}}</ref>The final swoop race of the season was the [[Mos Espa Circuit|Mos Espa Race]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. Kimmi has won enough races to win the championship if she won Mos Espa. Chyler was invited to a lavish party presented by Prince [[Xizor/Legends|Xizor's]] [[Xizor Transport Systems/Legends|Xizor Transport Company]], who were looking to sponsor a team. During the party she chatted with Xizor and became influenced by his [[Falleen/Legends|Falleen]] pheromones which caused her to develop a short-lived attraction to him. After the party Chyler, Rendar and their bodyguard stopped by a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] in [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]], where Rendar met with [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and handed him a [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]] with important information. Skywalker commented that the files were going to save multiple lives, when Xizor and his [[Human replica droid]] [[Guri]] entered the room. Xizor ordered Guri to take the datapad and kill everybody present. The fight spilled out into the streets of Mos Espa, where Skywalker used his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to protect Chyler and her companions from any blaster bolts. Finally, Xizor ordered Guri to leave, promising to expose all information obtained to the Emperor.<ref name="LS" />[[File:Kimmi Chyler.jpg|thumb|right|Kimmi Chyler in action]]

name: Roo-Roo Page/Legends
description: {{Quote|The Gungan child was screaming.''"<br />"''The future you see, young Skywalker. To Naboo, you must go.|Anakin Skywalker and Yoda, on their vision of Page's kidnapping|Children of the Force}}[[File:RooRoo'sMother-CotF.png|thumb|left|200px|Roo-Roo Page with her mother]]Roo-Roo Page was a [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] born on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]<ref name="Cotf Ep. Guide" /> around the beginning of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]].<ref name="SW Annual 2011" /> Living in the [[Water/Legends|waterfall]]-surrounded [[Jan-gwa city/Legends|Jan-gwa city]] with her [[Roo-Roo Page's mother/Legends|mother]], Page was at some point discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|sensitive]] to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Learning this, the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] entered her identity into the [[Kyber memory crystal/Legends|Kyber crystal]], a [[Memory crystal/Legends|database]] that retained a list of all known Force-sensitive [[Youngling/Legends|younglings]] in [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].<ref name="CotF" /> This list was used to recruit the future members of the Order, and was therefore entrusted to the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Bolla Ropal/Legends|Bolla Ropal]] for protection.<ref name="CoD">{{TCW|Cargo of Doom}}</ref>During the Clone Wars, the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord]] of the [[Order of the Sith Lords|Sith Order]], [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], learned of the information held on the Kyber [[Crystal/Legends|crystal]]. Planning to use the children to create an [[Army/Legends|army]] of [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]]&ndash;talented [[Spy/Legends|spies]] enslaved to his will, Sidious hired the notorious [[Duros/Legends|Duros]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Cad Bane/Legends|Cad Bane]] to [[Mission to the Jedi Temple/Legends|steal the crystal]] from the Jedi Order. After [[Death/Legends|killing]] Ropal, Bane provided Sidious with the crystal's information. Bane was then directed to begin abducting children from the crystal's memory and deliver them to the Dark Lord's [[Damask Holdings Mustafar accounting facility|secret facility]] on the volcanic world of [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]].<ref name="CotF" />Having kidnapped children on [[Glee Anselm/Legends|Glee Anselm]] and [[Rodia/Legends|Rodia]], Bane turned his sights toward Naboo, where he hoped to capture Roo-Roo Page. However, the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] had anticipated Bane's intentions through the Force, having [[Force vision/Legends|foreseen]] Page's abduction during a [[Meditation/Legends|meditation]] session. [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] was [[Mission to Naboo/Legends|dispatched]] to Naboo alongside his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]]. Led by the Gungan [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Lunker/Legends|Lunker]] to Jan-gwa [[City/Legends|city]], the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] prepared [[Mission to Naboo/Legends|a trap]] for the [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] hunter with the assistance of Page's mother. Bane arrived in Jan-gwa shortly after, infiltrating the city and spying on Page's mother as she pretended to put her daughter to rest in her nursery. Once the Gungan mother left the room, Bane sneaked in through an open [[Window/Legends|window]] and approached the infant's bassinet, only to find a [[Tooka doll/Legends|tooka doll]] resting beneath the crib's blanket. After a short struggle with Skywalker and Tano, Bane was apprehended and taken into [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] custody. Once the Duros was safely constrained within [[Stun cuffs|binders]], Page's mother brought her daughter out of hiding, and the cheerful infant was playfully greeted by Tano.<ref name="CotF" />

name: Mahtee Dunn/Legends
description: [[File:MahteeDunnHoldup-CotF.png|thumb|left|200px|Mahtee Dunn holds Obi-Wan Kenobi at blaster point]]After obtaining the [[Kyber memory crystal/Legends|Kyber memory crystal]], [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Cad Bane/Legends|Cad Bane]], acting under the orders of [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Sidious]], infiltrated Mahtee's home in [[Kay-Tap square/Legends|Kay-Tap square]] on [[Rodia/Legends|Rodia]] to take Wee to [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]] to further the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] plot against the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Although Mahtee was hesitant to relinquish Wee, she was hypnotized by Bane and the child was taken from her. When a true [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], arrived in an attempt to stop Bane, Mahtee attempted to attack him, believing Bane's lie that Kenobi was a false Jedi out to kidnap her child. Although Kenobi pursued Bane to his [[Xanadu Blood/Legends|ship]], Wee was already on his way to Mustafar. [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], working with his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], were later able to deduce the location of the captured children and infiltrated Sidious' Mustafar base, rescuing Wee from the Sith's clutches and accepting him into the Jedi Order for the time being.

name: Shasa
description: [[File:Shaelas1.JPG|thumb|left|170px|Shasa's father Shaelas hired the Jedi Revan to locate Shasa during the Jedi Civil War.]]Shasa, a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Selkath/Legends|Selkath]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was born to [[Shaelas]] on the Selkath [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] [[Manaan/Legends|Manaan]]. During her childhood, Shasa befriended a fellow Selkath named [[Galas (Selkath)|Galas]], who gave her a token as a gift.<ref name="KotOR game" /> In [[3956 BBY]],<ref name="KotOR CG">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> during the [[Jedi Civil War]] that was waged against the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] by the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Malak]] and his [[Sith Empire (Jedi Civil War)|Sith Empire]], an [[Iridonian/Legends|Iridonian]] [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] was hired by the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] to lure several of Manaan's youth into the [[Sith Embassy]]. Among these were Shasa and Galas.<ref name="KotOR game" />Shasa, Galas, and several other youths joined the Sith and [[Sith training|learned]] the ways of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] under the Embassy's [[Unidentified Dark Jedi Master (Manaan)|Dark Jedi Master]]. The Sith aimed to corrupt and brainwash the Selkath youth so that they could establish a puppet government on the planet to harvest [[kolto]], a valuable healing agent found exclusively on Manaan.<ref name="KotOR CG" /> The Sith told Shasa and her friends that they could leave the Embassy if they wished. When Galas wanted to leave, however, they [[Torture/Legends|tortured]] him to the point of near-[[Death/Legends|death]] and deceived Shasa into believing that they had let Galas go free.<ref name="KotOR game" />{{GameLSmechanics}}Shasa encountered the [[Jedi training/Legends|retrained]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Revan/Legends|Revan]]&mdash;the former Dark Lord responsible for starting the Jedi Civil War&mdash;during his [[Raid on the Sith Embassy|raid]] on the Sith Embassy. Revan infiltrated the Embassy on behalf of both Shasa's [[Parent/Legends|father]], Shaelas, who was searching for Shasa, and the local Republic [[Ambassador/Legends|ambassador]], [[Roland Wann]]. Upon learning why Shasa and her friends were inside the facility, Revan attempted to convince the wayward Selkath to abandon the Sith. However, Shasa had been brainwashed by the Sith to the point of unwillingness to believe anything ill of them; even when one of her fellow apprentices mentioned the [[destruction of Taris]], Shasa stated that it was merely a Republic lie. Revan convinced Shasa and her friends to provide him the opportunity to locate actual proof of the Sith's treachery. While searching the Embassy, Revan found Galas, who gave the Jedi the token that he had given to Shasa when they were children. Before Galas died, he begged Revan to tell Shasa that the Sith were evil. Revan presented the token to Shasa, who initially refused to believe that the Sith killed Galas. After Revan convinced her to accept the truth, Shasa and her friends immediately left the Embassy and abandoned their dark side teachings.<ref name="KotOR game" />{{Endgame}}

name: Unidentified Neimoidian (drapery painting)
description: She was significant enough to be granted a portrait, which displayed her in regal clothing posed in front of a hanging [[Wikipedia:Drapery|drapery]]. This artwork came to hang in a gallery within [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Lott Dod/Legends|Lott Dod's]] [[Lott Dod's palace|palace]] on [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]].

name: Unidentified Neimoidian (golden painting)
description: She was significant enough to be granted a portrait, which displayed her posed in front of a golden background. This artwork came to hang in a gallery within [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Lott Dod/Legends|Lott Dod's]] [[Lott Dod's palace|palace]] on [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]].

name: Tes Vevec
description: {{Quote|I've tracked that man for almost ten years, and if I've lost him now because of you metal ''dikuts''&hellip;"<br />"Tes! We need to talk!''"<br />"''You need to ''die''!|Vevec and Hondo Karr, amidst fighting security droids|Legacy 41: Rogue's End}}[[File:Tes Vevec Amor.JPG|thumb|left|150px|Tes Vevec in her [[Mandalorian armor/Legends|Mandalorian armor]]]]Tes Vevec was a [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] and the ex-wife of [[Hondo Karr]]. Her father, the Mandalorian warrior [[Vevec]], was killed at the [[Battle of Botajef]]. Following the death of her father, Tes dedicated her life to hunting down her ex-husband, whom she wrongly believed to be responsible. She was deceived by the current [[Mandalore (title)|Mandalore]], [[Yaga Auchs]], who claimed that Hondo was a traitor to the Mandalorian people.<ref name="RoguesEnd" />In [[137 ABY]], she tracked down Hondo on [[Napdu]], where he was on a mission for [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] and the [[Galactic Alliance Remnant]]. The two engaged in a brawl, but eventually Karr was able to disarm her and reveal her the true story of the events surrounding Botajef. Reunited, Tes and Hondo came to an agreement to work together and find proof of Yaga Auchs's treachery.<ref name="RoguesEnd" />

name: Mandalore the Destroyer
description: A [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Ranah Teh Naast was born the [[Parent/Legends|daughter]] of [[Uvhen Chal]]. Over [[Time/Legends|time]], Naast rose to claim the title and position of [[Mandalore (title)|''Mand'alor'']],<ref name="ImpCom" /> the traditional leader of all the Mandalorian [[Soldier/Legends|warrior]] clans.<ref name="TMPaC">{{InsiderCite|86|The Mandalorians: People and Culture}}</ref> Following in the tradition of Mandalores who had come before, Naast adopted a descriptive epithet to set herself apart,<ref name="TCSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref> taking the sobriquet, Mandalore the Destroyer.<ref name="ImpCom" />During her reign as ''Mand'alor'', Naast presided over Mandalorian [[Army/Legends|forces]] during [[Siege of Luon|siege]] of the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Luon]]. She elected to speak with [[Consul of Luon|Luon's consul]] during the engagement, wherein Naast detailed the merits of the Mandalorian [[Soldier/Legends|warrior]] culture, and upon outlining the Mandalorians' capacity for a strong victory, offered the [[Consul/Legends|consul]] a final opportunity to surrender the city.<ref name="ImpCom" />

name: Shara
description: [[File:SharaX2 Yavin.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Shara and X2 on Yavin]]Shara was a bounty hunter before the Galactic Civil War, and was brought into [[Grey Squadron]] by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] Rahm Kota. During the course of the war she aided [[X2]] in the battle of [[Evacuation of Yavin|Yavin 4]], in which she helped Rebel soldiers and personnel to evacuate the planet before the Empire could destroy them in revenge for the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]]. Later on, at some point during the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] era, X2 discovered the location of his twin brother X1 on [[Vjun/Legends|Vjun]].Shara participated in the [[Battle of Vjun]] alongside [[Grey Squadron]], allowing Rebel troops to infiltrate [[Bast Castle]] and to stop the Imperial Remnant. X1, however, escaped the battle, fleeing to his cloning laboratory on [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]]. Shara fought with [[Grey Squadron]] at the [[Battle of Mustafar (Galactic Civil War)|Battle of Mustafar]], while X2 went to rescue the captured [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] before he could be cloned by X1. At the climax of the battle, X2 defeated his twin brother, rescuing Skywalker and ending a threat to the nascent New Republic. Some time later, Shara and X2 became part of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] with Luke Skywalker and the new galactic government.

name: Amyva Va'new
description: In about [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] approached Va'new on the advice of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Hunde Decan]], to try and find out how to repair a [[Corellian Fried Ice Cream Fryer]]. Va'new told the spacer to that [[Mikfa Faaus]], a [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] who lived on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]], might be able to give them more information about the fryer.{{Char-stub}}

name: Da'la Socuna
description: {{Quote|I would like to speak to the Rebellion trainer, Da'la.''"<br />"''I've heard rumors that she is in Mos Espa seeking pilots for some undisclosed mission.|A spacer and [[Mayor/Legends|Mayor]] [[Mikdanyell Guh'rantt]]|Star Wars Galaxies}}Within the Alliance, Socuna attained the rank of [[Commander/Legends|commander]] and served with the [[Crimson Phoenix Squadron]] as a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot trainer]]. Sometime following [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]] she worked in the [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. While there, she recruited a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] sent to her by [[Gendra]]. She issued the novice pilot a [[Z-95 Headhunter/Legends|Z-95 Headhunter]] and gave a mission to patrol a Rebel [[Spy/Legends|spy]] route in the [[Tatoo system/Legends|Tatoo system]]. Though the pilot was ambushed by three [[TIE pilot]] [[Cadet/Legends|cadets]], they were all destroyed, and the pilot returned back safely.<ref name="SWG" />Socuna later gave additional missions, which included hunting down [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighters]], and escorting a crippled refugee [[Transport/Legends|transport]] in the [[Star system/Legends|system]]. All missions were completed successfully, and Socuna awarded the pilot with a Rebel flightsuit. However, Socuna had one final task for her new pilot, which involved eliminated a TIE fighter Veteran Commander and his three escorts. Upon successful completion of the missions, Socuna transferred the pilot to [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Eker]] for additional assignments.<ref name="SWG" />She also became involved in the defense of Mos Espa when [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]], led by the [[Tusken King]], launched an [[Battle of Mos Espa|invasion]] of the [[City/Legends|city]].<ref name="SWG" />

name: Kath Scarlet
description: {{Quote|Permission to come aboard? Oh never mind, I'm already here. I'm Kath Scarlet, captain of the Binayre pirates, and I don't like trouble. Surrender and take me to your cargo hold. Or die. Up to you.|Kath Scarlet|Squadrons Over Corellia}}[[File:KathScarlet.jpg|thumb|left|190px|Kath Scarlet in action]]The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Kath Scarlet operated as a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] during the [[Imperial Period|Imperial era]]. By the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she was the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the [[Binayre Pirates]],<ref name="DS" /> a group of pirates and [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] based out of the [[Double Worlds|twin worlds]] of [[Talus/Legends|Talus]] and [[Tralus/Legends|Tralus]],<ref name="CSD">''[[CorSec Database A-G]]''</ref> who controlled several areas of the [[Corellian sector/Legends|Corellian sector]], including the [[Trifecta Star]] and the [[Rayless Lantern]].<ref name="CotF-BP">{{SWGTCG|set=Champions of the Force (SWGTCG)|text=Champions of the Force|cardname=Binayre Pirate}}</ref> Scarlet preyed upon [[Merchant/Legends|merchant]] vessels passing through the area,<ref name="DS" /> hiding her [[Kuat Systems Engineering/Legends|Kuat Systems Engineering]] [[Kath Scarlet's Firespray-31-class patrol and attack craft|''Firespray-31''-class]] [[Firespray-31-class patrol and attack craft/Legends|patrol and attack craft]] among [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroids]] to ambush and capture unwary [[Starship/Legends|starships]].<ref name="SOC-PT">{{SWGTCG|set=Squadrons Over Corellia|cardname=Pirate Trap}}</ref>During the Galactic Civil War, the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] learned of a secret [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] base on Talus and dispatched several [[Imperial officer/Legends|Imperial officers]] from the [[Raithal Academy/Legends|Raithal Academy]] to seek out and destroy it. Scarlet's Firespray was nearby when the Imperial squad's [[Lambda-class T-4a shuttle/Legends|''Lambda''-class T-4a shuttle]] emerged from [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] in the [[Corellian system]]. Believing the new arrival to be a cargo vessel, Scarlet attacked, using her ship's [[Ion cannon/Legends|ion cannon]] to target the [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle's]] [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]], disabling it and preventing the ship from escaping. The stricken shuttle was then grappled and boarded, with Scarlet personally leading several pirates in a boarding party. Met by the shuttle's crew, Scarlet demanded that they surrender and take her to their cargo hold. However, the Imperials refused and drew their hidden weapons, leading to a vicious firefight in which the Imperials managed to gain the upper hand. Sensing the situation worsening for her side, Scarlet deftly escaped back through the airlock to her Firespray and escaped before the Imperials could repair their hyperdrive to give chase, though several of her pirates ended up in Imperial custody.<ref name="DS" />Around the same [[Time/Legends|time]], the Binayre Pirates learned of a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] who was in the Corellian system to recover the [[Z-95 Headhunter/Legends|Z-95 Headhunter]] ''[[Dire Hound]]'', which had previously belonged to their aunt [[Evgenia]], from a secret [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] on Talus. The Empire too had learned of the Z-95 and dispatched a team led by [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|Imperial Security Bureau]] agent [[Jeffren Brek]] to impound it. Scarlet and a group of Binayres followed the Imperials to the hangar and waited while a shootout developed between Brek's team and the spacer. Only when the Imperials were driven back did the pirates reveal themselves to the spacer. With her [[Heavy blaster pistol/Legends|heavy blaster pistol]] aimed at the spacer, Scarlet demanded that they turn the Z-95 over to her, but the spacer intended to defend their property and put up a short, but brutal firefight. Deciding that the price was not worth the effort, Scarlet and a couple of her pirates escaped, leaving the spacer alone.<ref name="LS" />

name: Brea Tonnika/Legends
description: The best-known source of information on the Tonnika sisters is a biographical entry written by [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]]. However, his account contains a number of inadvertent inaccuracies, and it is unclear how far it can be trusted.

name: Braxus Lyn
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Lyn carried out a number of assignments for the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and following their occupation of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tirahnn/Legends|Tirahnn]], she was sent to work there as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] and keep the world's wealthly elite under control.During the [[Battle of Tirahnn (Clone Wars)|Battle of Tirahnn]], [[Zolghast]], the [[Commander/Legends|commander]] of all CIS forces on Tirahnn was captured by the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], so Lyn was sent to free him and transport him away from the battlezone. The Republic forces were preparing to move Zolghast to the [[Venator-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Venator''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Solidarity (Venator-class)|''Solidarity'']], so Lyn disguised herself as the [[Barabel/Legends|Barabel]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ezar Elasra]] and freed him. She then took him to a landing pad and began preparing a [[Sheathipede-class transport shuttle/Legends|''Sheathipede''-class transport shuttle]] so that they could leave Tirahnn. However, before they could leave, they were attacked by a group of Republic agents who were attempting to recapture Zolghast.

name: Shara-Or
description: Shara-Or originally worked as a [[Police officer/Legends|police officer]] in the [[Tirahnn (city)|capital city]] of Tirahnn. However, during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the planet was occupied by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and Shara-Or lost her job when the building where she worked was taken over by [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Zolghast]], the leader of the Separatist forces on the world. She took a new job, working as a private security officer in a skyscraper that was owned by the [[Tagge Company]].

name: Elodore Vane
description: After her husband was killed in what looked as Republic attack, but was secretly orchestrated by [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], her son [[Tofen Vane]] joined the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] on the side of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Elodore herself at some point even considered marrying Dooku, but after she received proof of his involvement in her husband's death, she resented him and vowed for her son to quit the war. Tofen, however, refused and was soon killed at the [[Battle of the Veil Nebula]]. Following his death, the Valahari stopped supporting both sides of the conflict.{{Char-stub}}

name: Elga Arbo
description: A [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] specialized in high-speed deliveries and courier work, Elga Arbo bought a modified [[Starfeld Industries/Legends|Starfeld Industries]] [[Z-10 Seeker-class scout ship|Z-10 Seeker]], the ''[[Redshift Runner]]'', from an independent [[Scout/Legends|scout]]. She intended to convert it into the fastest possible ship, and to do so she had the help of [[Maceb Joodsen]], a co-pilot and [[Starship/Legends|starship]] mechanic from [[Demar]], and of [[Gydio Lucone]], a usurer who lend Arbo some money to improve the ship's [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]].Lucone had purposefully signed strict conditions so that, should Arbo did not pay monthly, Lucone would then impound the ship. Lucone did hoped this situation would happen, as it would give Lucone the chance to blackmail Arbo and make her [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggle]] for Lucone. However, Arbo systematically paid in time and at the same time she got a reputation as a legal pilot.One day, the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] ordered a shutdown in a stopover starport, which delayed Arbo for three days in her next pay. Lucone moved in to claim the ship, which Arbo attempted to stop and violence ensued. Arbo was seriously injured during the fight, but she eventually escaped on the ''Runner'', with Joodsen piloting.Lucone then issued a 20000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credit]] [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] for the ship. Three months later, the bounty had not been claimed.

name: Cyn Jodu
description: Alongside her superior officer, [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Dal Zorfenn]], Jodu was tasked with securing the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kinooine/Legends|Kinooine]] that it might serve as the primary base of operations for the Nagai fleet's planned [[Nagai–Tof War|invasion]] of [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]].

name: Loza Sil'ban
description: When a large shipment of [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]] went missing on its way to a Rebel medical facility, Sil'ban was among many agents hired by [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] to recover it. She was trailing an [[Imperial Security Bureau/Legends|ISB]] agent [[Jeffren Brek]], who was also looking for the shipment. She reported his movements to Calrissian, as well as Alliance agent trying to recover the ryll, which eventually allowed the Rebel to confront and capture Brek. While the Rebel departed to pursue the trail, Sil'ban volunteered to take care of the Imperial. However, he soon managed to escape after injuring her head and stealing her blaster. Embarrassed, she returned to the Alliance operative and provided him with information about his next target&mdash;a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] named [[BoShek/Legends|BoShek]].

name: Ashla (Jedi)/Legends
description: A [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] from the planet [[Shili/Legends|Shili]], Ashla was identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and given over to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Assigned to the Mighty [[Bear Clan]], an [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|Initiate Clan]] whose members were known for their bravery, Initiate Ashla received her earliest instruction from her clan leader, [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]].During one of the clan's daily [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] instructional courses on the [[Jedi Temple Veranda|Temple's veranda]], [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] approached Grand Master Yoda with a question. It appeared the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Temple's Archives]] were incomplete and missing [[Kamino system/Legends|a system]]. One of Ashla's peers, [[J. K. Burtola/Legends|J. K. Burtola]], suggested that someone had erased the files, therefore explaining the Archives' seeming incompleteness.<ref name="AOTC" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Pleth Juun
description: Juun was born into a wealthy family on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and attended one of the world's most prestigious medical schools. She later joined the military, as a surgeon, and was given the rank of [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]]. While she was in her mid-twenties, she was present on the planet Pleida, where a conflict was being fought, and was attached to a [[Battalion/Legends|battalion]] that was commanded by [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Roff Volane]]. After a number of officers were injured at the base [[Camp Kavel]], a team of agents were assigned by Volane to escort Juun there, so that she could administer treatment to the officers.

name: Ma'ya
description: Identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Ma'ya was serving the Order and the Republic as a Knight by [[980 BBY]]. An agent of the [[Council of First Knowledge/Legends|Council of First Knowledge]], Ma'ya was active in the Council's hunt for [[dark side artifact]]s left over from the [[New Sith Wars]]. Under the leadership of [[Caretaker of First Knowledge/Legends|Caretaker]] [[Restelly Quist/Legends|Restelly Quist]], the agents of the Council were stationed out of the Temple's [[Tower of First Knowledge/Legends|Tower of First Knowledge]] from which they went out across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] in an attempt to purge all memory of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] from the collective memory of the galactic community.<ref name="DoE" />When [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Serra]] of [[Doan]] arrived at the Temple to meet with Councilor [[Obba]], Ma'ya and fellow Knights [[Pendo]] and [[Winnoa]] met the Doan delegation on the landing platform at the base of the tower. Escorting their guests to the greenhouse-like [[Obba's quarters|living quarters]] of the esteemed [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] Master, the three Knights waited in [[Meditation/Legends|meditation]] outside of the chambers while the brief conference took place. When the meeting concluded, Master Obba emerged and dismissed the Jedi, allowing them to return to their duties higher in the tower.<ref name="DoE" />

name: Winnoa
description: Identified as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Winnoa was serving the Order and the Republic as a Knight by [[980 BBY]]. An agent of the [[Council of First Knowledge/Legends|Council of First Knowledge]], Winnoa was active in the Council's hunt for [[dark side artifact]]s left over from the [[New Sith Wars]]. Under the leadership of [[Caretaker of First Knowledge/Legends|Caretaker]] [[Restelly Quist/Legends|Restelly Quist]], the agents of the Council were stationed out of the Temple's [[Tower of First Knowledge/Legends|Tower of First Knowledge]] from which they went out across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] in an attempt to purge all memory of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] from the collective memory of the galactic community.<ref name="DoE" />When [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Serra]] of [[Doan]] arrived at the Temple to meet with Councilor [[Obba]], Pendo and fellow Knights [[Pendo]] and [[Ma'ya]] met the Doan delegation on the landing platform at the base of the tower. Escorting their guests to the greenhouse-like [[Obba's quarters|living quarters]] of the esteemed [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] Master, the three Knights waited in [[Meditation/Legends|meditation]] outside of the chambers while the brief conference took place. When the meeting concluded, Master Obba emerged and dismissed the Jedi, allowing them to return to their duties higher in the tower.<ref name="DoE" />

name: Sapphire (smuggler)
description: Born in approximately [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]<ref name="Birth" /> to two maintenance [[Technician/Legends|technicians]] who specialized in [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighters]], Sapphire spent her childhood in several [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] bases because her parents were forced to travel due to their work. When Sapphire was a teenager, she sought to join the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]]. However, her parents were [[Death/Legends|killed]] in an explosion caused by a blunder made by [[Dane Tizzin]], a young Imperial [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenant]]. As Tizzin's family was well-connected, he was not accused; instead, Sapphire's parents were blamed. From that moment on, Sapphire wanted to exact vengeance on Tizzin.<ref name="cro" />Unable to join the Academy, Sapphire turned to [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] for a living. She happened to be friends with [[Kevas Startron]], an old smuggler and owner of the [[Hyrotii Corporation/Legends|Hyrotil]] [[Crescent-class Transport|''Crescent'' transport]] [[Sapphire's Gem|''New Cov Quasar'']]. Startron was planning to retire after one last smuggling run, and he asked Sapphire to be his partner. With Startron's health declining, Sapphire was forced to do most of the job. Upon conclusion of the run, Sapphire lied about her involvement so that Startron would get the credit for it. Grateful for her support, the [[scoundrel]] gave his [[Starship/Legends|ship]] to Sapphire, who renamed it ''Sapphire's Gem'' and made several customizations to it&mdash;she modified the ship to make it both fast and furtive, adding [[Sensor/Legends|sensor]]-disrupting technology such as special [[Deflector shield/Legends|shields]] that hid power emanations to avoid detection. She also replaced the energy weapons with fire-linked [[Concussion missile/Legends|concussion missile]] systems that, while less aggressive, were easier to hide from enemy sensors. As the ship required a crew of only one, Sapphire [[Pilot/Legends|piloted]] it alone as its [[Captain/Legends|captain]]. Soon, she became a fugitive in several [[Star system/Legends|systems]] on charges of smuggling, bribery, and avoiding arrest.<ref name="cro" />At the beginning of her smuggling career, Sapphire was looking for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]], a clandestine rebel movement that opposed the Empire. She was able to join the Alliance and secretly became a [[courier]] for the group, pretending to be uninvolved in [[Politics/Legends|politics]] in order to hide her affiliation. Sapphire worked alongside Alliance [[General/Legends|General]] [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]], setting up raids on Imperial convoys. For a long time, Sapphire searched for Tizzin, but was unable to find him.<ref name="cro" /> Years later, her connection to the Rebel Alliance was a not-so-well-kept secret. At that time, Tizzin had became a [[Commodore/Legends|commodore]] and [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Naval]] attaché to the staff of the [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] of the [[Kira sector]]. When an [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] attempt was made against the Commodore, a young Imperial officer by the name of [[Lynx Reglis]] impersonated Sapphire to save Tizzin's life.<ref name="ss">''[[Stock Ships]]''</ref>

name: Lynx Reglis
description: [[File:Zafiro.JPG|left|thumb|[[Sapphire (smuggler)|Sapphire]], whom Lynx Reglis impersonated.]]The daughter of [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrilan]] [[Gambling/Legends|gambler]] [[Aelon Reglis]] and his wife, Lynx Reglis went to the [[Corulag Academy/Legends|Corulag Academy]] and graduated as an [[Internal Security Branch|IntSec]] investigator. Her father gave her his ship, the [[Adventurer (Crescent-class)|''Adventurer'']], a [[Crescent-class Transport|''Crescent''-class transport]] Mark II built by [[Hyrotii Corporation/Legends|Hyrotii Corporation]], as a graduation gift, partly because he had almost not used the ship in eighteen years. He hoped she could use the ship more than him.Officer Lynx was then assigned to the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] base on [[Nigel III]], in the [[Kira sector]], and she performed many planetary activities, not using her ship.At a certain point, [[Commodore/Legends|Commodore]] [[Dane Tizzin]], Naval attach to the staff of the sectorial [[Moff/Legends|Moff]], became the target of an assassination plot. Officer Reglis impersonated [[Sapphire (smuggler)|Sapphire]], a smuggler and [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] agent, to save Tizzin.She then decided to replace the ''Adventurer's'' [[sensor package]] with a [[counter-sensor package]] to have a stealthy ship, something she reasoned could be useful. Before she and a technician could finish the customization, Lynx was implicated in an information leak of the Nigel base, and she was forced to flee from the Imperial military justice. She left behind her ship and other personal possessions for the Empire to impound.

name: Winera
description: Winera was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] into the [[Lamont Dynasty of Daimar]], the royal house of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Daimar]], during the last [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Winera was the daughter of [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Erra]] and the granddaughter of [[Mitar]], Daimar's [[King/Legends|king]].<ref name="Flames of Rebellion" />Shortly after the [[Declaration of a New Order|formation]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]<ref name="Flames of Rebellion" /> in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> the Empire established a [[Blockade of Daimar|blockade]] around Daimar. Concerned for Wilena's wellbeing and determined to prevent her from being captured by the Imperial forces or starving due the impact of the [[Blockade/Legends|blockade]], King Mitar sent Winera, along with [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Alet Komain]] and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Shen-Ji Collun]] to seek out Winera's uncle Prince [[Torrin]], who operated an anti-Imperial resistance group on the planet [[Byrsym]].<ref name="Flames of Rebellion" />

name: Finn Ertay/Legends
description: The [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Finn Ertay<ref name="Grievous Intrigue Ep Guide" /> lived during the final [[Standard decade/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Being [[Force-sensitive/Legends|sensitive]] to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]],<ref name="Grievous Intrigue">{{TCW|Grievous Intrigue}}</ref> she received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]<ref name="Grievous Intrigue Ep Guide" /> and became a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] by the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[The galaxy/Legends|intergalactic]] [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], fought between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].<ref name="Grievous Intrigue" /> Around [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], the first [[Standard year/Legends|year]] of the war,<ref name="ERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> Ertay was present at the [[Jedi Temple]] on the [[Galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] when a meeting was called at the [[Jedi Temple communication center/Legends|Temple communication center]]. Attending alongside a number of her colleagues, Ertay witnessed Confederate [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] [[holograph]]ically broadcast his [[Torture/Legends|torture]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Eeth Koth/Legends|Eeth Koth]], a member of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] whom the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] General had captured during a [[Battle near the Arda system|battle]]<ref name="Grievous Intrigue" /> near the [[Arda system]].<ref name="TCW Ultimate Battles">''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Visual Guide Ultimate Battles]]''</ref> When Jedi [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] ordered away the present [[Youngling/Legends|younglings]], Ertay was among those,<ref name="Grievous Intrigue" /> including [[Eekar Oki/Legends|Eekar Oki]],<ref name="Grievous Intrigue Ep Guide" /> who withdrew from the room. Koth was later [[Battle of Saleucami/Legends|freed]] from Grievous's custody thanks to the efforts of a Jedi-led [[Battle group/Legends|task force]] from the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="Grievous Intrigue" />[[File:DuelAtSpaceport-Revival.png|thumb|left|250px|Ertay comes to the aid of her Nikto comrade, shortly before being killed by Darth Maul.]]In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="FF-2014 7">{{FFCite|y=2014|7|KAT1&ndash;2, ''King Katuunko''; HEA1, ''Z-95 Headhunter''}}</ref> when a group of [[Jedi Initiate]]s was rescued from the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Wasskah/Legends|Wasskah]], where they had been [[Skirmish on Wasskah/Legends|hunted]] for sport by [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Hunting/Legends|hunters]], Ertay joined Oki and several [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council]] members in welcoming the younglings back to the Jedi Temple upon their arrival aboard the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Gunship/Legends|gunship]] [[Halo/Legends|''Halo'']]. Ertay spoke with the initiate [[O-Mer/Legends|O-Mer]] on the landing platform before the group proceeded back into the Temple.<ref name="Wookiee Hunt">{{TCW|Wookiee Hunt}}</ref> Later, around the war's [[20 BBY/Legends|third year]],<ref name="Death Sentence 1" /> the [[Nightbrothers/Legends|Nightbrothers]] and self-proclaimed [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lords]] [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]] and [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] began a scourge through the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]], targeting a number of poorly defended outposts in that area of the galaxy.<ref name="Encyclopedia: Maul">{{SWE|characters|darthmaul|Darth Maul|archivedate=20131230151024}}</ref> Ertay teamed up with a [[Unidentified Nikto Jedi/Legends|Nikto Jedi]] to [[Duel at unidentified Outer Rim spaceport/Legends|confront]] the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] brothers at an [[Unidentified Outer Rim spaceport/Legends|Outer Rim spaceport]].<ref name="Revival" />While her [[Nikto/Legends|Nikto]] comrade faced down Opress in [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]], Ertay took on Maul, employing her acrobatic skills in their [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|duel]]. When she saw Opress kick the Nikto to the ground, she ducked between Maul's [[Cybernetics/Legends|cybernetic]] [[Limb/Legends|legs]] and brought her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] up to intercept a strike from Opress's [[Savage Opress's lightsaber/Legends|blade]] that would have [[Death/Legends|killed]] the Nikto. However, that move allowed Maul to assail her from behind. Ertay was struck through the back by Maul's [[Darth Maul's lightsaber|lightsaber]], falling to the Nightbrothers alongside her Nikto companion. Their deaths, in addition to the recent Outer Rim attacks, prompted Jedi Masters [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Adi Gallia/Legends|Adi Gallia]] to track down Maul and Opress, who were forced into a [[Skirmish on Florrum/Legends|showdown]] on the planet [[Florrum/Legends|Florrum]].<ref name="Revival" />

name: Droo Rawk
description: {{Quote|Love you Droo. Always and forever.|"Bantha" Rawk's final words|Legacy—War 4}}Droo was born into the famous [[Clan Vos]] of [[Kiffu/Legends|Kiffu]], and once served as a [[Kiffu Guardians|Kiffu Guardian]] and had a daughter with [[Droo's husband|another guardian]]. Her husband at some point died in service to the guardians. Droo would then marry the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Rawk|Nat Skywalker]].When Skywalker later left the Jedi Order he adopted Droo's daughter Ahnah as his own, and the pair adopted two children, Skeeto and Micah, together. The children were never made aware of their father's former life as a Jedi, and Nat began to live under the alias of "Bantha" Rawk.In [[137 ABY]], Droo's family [[Skirmish on Iego|fought together]] against [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] pirates when [[Cade Skywalker]], Droo's nephew through Nat, and the crew of the ''Mynock'' came to their aid. The crews intervention ultimately saved the families lives. Shortly after this, Nat temporarily left his family to escort Cade and his crew to the [[Hidden Temple]] so he could confer with the [[Jedi High Council (New Jedi Order)|Jedi High Council]] in the hopes of being granted aid against the forces of [[Darth Krayt]].After Cade's proposal to assassinate Krayt was rejected by the Council, and he chose to continue with the plan regardless, Nat reunited with his family on [[Kiffu/Legends|Kiffu]]. During this time, Droo's daughter Ahnah followed in her mothers footsteps by training to become a Kiffu Guardian. Against all odds, Cade's plan ended with the death of Krayt, before he rushed the severely injured [[Azlyn Rae]] to Kiffex, in the hopes that Droo's healing powers could save her life.Cade and his crew eventually reached Kiffex, and Cade handed Azlyn over to Droo. Droo said she could only save Azlyn if she wanted to be saved, and Cade said she did. While Droo and Nat tried their best, Azlyn rejected their attempts to heal her. Nat refused to give up, and decided on a desperate measure: creating a life supporting suit for Azlyn. Droo didn't like the idea, thinking it would make Azlyn the next [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], but she stood behind Nat.The suit allowed Azlyn to live, but she wasn't happy about it. She had been ready to accept death, and didn't want to be saved. When Cade returned, Droo said that Cade had lied to them. She said Cade wouldn't be allowed to come back to them for a while, maybe even ever.[[File:BanthaDrooLastTalk.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Droo talks with her husband for the last time.]]Bantha later left Kiffex for the Hidden Temple once more, per request of the Jedi Council. There he contacted Droo via [[Holoprojector/Legends|holoprojector]] and told her he would be staying for a while, not because of his loyalty to the Order, but because the War needed to be fought by anyone who could. She told him she understood, and that [[Zharia Vos]] had contacted her and requested that she reactivate her [[General/Legends|general's]] commission within the Kiffu Guardians as a precaution against possible actions by Krayt's forces for not allowing an Imperial base to be build on either of the Kiffar homeworlds. When her husband asked about Annah, Droo told him she was off with her unit. Bantha lamented, stating that their daughter was too young for War. Droo, however, stated that she was always fated to become a Guardian, and there was no running from her destiny, just like Bantha. As the pair signed offline, the two said goodbye for the last time.Nat Skywalker was still in the Hidden Temple when the Sith [[Attack on the Hidden Temple|attacked]] there. Bantha gave his life with [[T'ra Saa]] to [[Beam of light|allow]] the other Jedi and their Imperial and Alliance allies to escape. Just before he died, Bantha Rawk uttered his final words, professing his love for Droo one final time.

name: Krin D'bis
description: D'bis was a [[Kel Dor/Legends|Kel Dor]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] during the waning [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She became a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and attended the [[Almas Academy]], a [[Jedi academy]] that was located on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Almas]], in the [[Cularin system]]. While there, she [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] to become a [[Jedi Guardian]],<ref name="Paarty On!" /> a combat-orientated [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] specialization.<ref name="SWRGRCR">''[[Star Wars Roleplaying Game Revised Core Rulebook]]''</ref> During the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], D'bis undertook the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]], which she passed, making her a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="Paarty On!" />A short time after her graduation, D'bis was picked to be an official representative of the Academy at a celebration that was being held on [[Dorumaa]], the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of Almas. The celebration had been organized by the [[Metatheran Cartel]],<ref name="Paarty On!" /> a [[Merchant/Legends|trade]] organization that was jointly run by members of the [[Caarite]] and [[Filordus]] [[Species/Legends|species]].<ref name="LFCG">''[[Living Force Campaign Guide]]''</ref> They had organized the event to thank a group of [[Heroes of Cularin|freelance agents]]<ref name="Paarty On!" /> for preventing the release of a [[Anti-Caarite virus|deadly virus]] on the [[Caarimon|Caarite homeworld]].<ref name="BotB">''[[Belly of the Beaast]]''</ref>The [[Jawa/Legends|Jawa]] [[Jedi Consular]] [[Akial]] was chosen to accompany D'bis. Due to their different specializations within the Order, D'bis and Akial could represent different approaches to being a Jedi and show that the Order was not single-minded. They traveled from Almas to [[Greentree Pointe]] resort on Dorumaa, where the celebration was being held. Upon their arrival, they set up a booth to try and recruit potential students for the Academy. While at the celebration, D'bis and Akial debated the threat posed by the [[Believers]], a [[Sith cult]] that operated in the Cularin [[Star system/Legends|system]]. They both agreed that the Believers were a major problem for the system but disagreed over how to deal with the cult. D'bis suggested that the Believers should be hunted down, but Akial thought that it would be better to investigate the capabilities of the cult, as little was known about what their goals were. They also discussed the Metatheran Cartel, which had committed many past transgressions in the Cularin system, such as destroying the [[sacred ch'hala tree grove]]. D'bis believed that the Cartel should be regarded with suspicion, due to its secretive nature, although she did not think it was prudent to openly denounce it.<ref name="Paarty On!" />

name: Nurla Slinthiss
description: Slinthiss used to be a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] of the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]. After she had gained her freedom, she became a member of the Black Sun and quickly rose to become the local leader of the crime cartel.In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]] Lady Slinthiss recruited an adventurer to help her with her criminal business. The [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] didn't know about Slinthiss's involvement with the Black Sun at first, but soon learned about her criminal activities. Her first task for the spacer was the delivery of a message to a [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the [[Corellian Security Force]]. The [[Datacard/Legends|datadisc]] turned out to be an incriminating [[holo-recording]]. When the spacer handed the recording to the captain, the officer swore that he wouldn't be blackmailed by Slinthiss and threatened the spacer. Shortly thereafter, the CorSec captain arrested one of Slinthiss's underlings and ordered to interrogate the criminal. To save her employee, Slinthiss asked the spacer to free him. The spacer ambushed the renegade CorSec troopers that escorted the employee and killed them. Then he brought the underling back safely to Slinthiss.Soon after, the Lady Vigo discovered that one of her formerly trusted [[accountant]]s had decided to sell her books to the Hutts. Slinthiss had put [[tracker]]s on her records, so she knew exactly where her former accountant was headed. She once again employed the services of the spacer to track down the accountant and kill him and the Hutt enforcers guarding him. It didn't take long before the spacer returned successfully with the stolen books. The Hutt's reaction to this didn't take long either. They hired an [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] to take Slinthiss out. But Slinthiss had done her homework and knew that the Hutts intended to get rid of the assassin after he had done his job. So Slinthiss sent the spacer to meet the assassin and convince him to join with Slinthiss instead. The adventurer once again succeeded and came back with the assassin.

name: Leanna Carella
description: Leanna Carella began her career as a customs officer. She eventually left this job to marry [[Dav Kathis]], an independent [[free-trader]] who operated his [[Kazellis-class light freighter|Kazellis Light Freighter]] ''[[Longrunner]]'' through the [[Enarc Run/Legends|Enarc Run]]. Carella and Kathis lived on their ship along with their son.Kathis suddenly vanished; he had been kidnapped by agents of [[Commission for the Preservation of the New Order/Legends|COMPNOR]] who mistakenly believed him to be an informer to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. Carella began traveling Kathis' usual routes looking for him, while at the same time she tried to earn some money with the business.One of the COMPNOR agents suffered from paranoia: When they could not link Kathis with the Alliance, he decided that Carella was probably the informer they were looking for.

name: Meera Lisso
description: Lisso was 19 when she began her [[Jedi training/Legends|Jedi training]] and she trained under [[Zelice Sturm]].{{RPG|''[[A Hero Seeks Not Vengeance]]''}}Lisso survived the [[destruction of the Almas Academy]], but witnessed Sturm's [[Death/Legends|death]] at the hands of the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]] during it. This drove her close to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] and afterwards, she accompanied the [[Heroes of Cularin]] on a mission to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to find Ezzar.{{Endgame}}

name: Quinlu Naj
description: Naj was born in 56 BBY and worked for her family's organization, the [[Naj Syndicate]], which was headed by her father. However, in [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]], the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]] began to squeeze the Syndicate out of organized crime, so she left it. She traveled to [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and created the Cularin Spacer's Union there. She believed that it could make her a lot of money, if she could gain some influence of the [[Cularin system]]'s hotshot [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] pilots. She ran a stall for the Union at the [[Cularin Trade Show]], to try and gain new members for it.

name: Shen-Ji Collun
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Shen-Ji Collun was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], Collun took up the rank of [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] at the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]].<ref name="FOR" />As the war raged on, Collun's master told her that she was now two months away from undergoing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], and becoming a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. In order to prepare for her trials, Collun was dispatched on a [[Mission to Daimar|mission]] to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Daimar]], in the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]], which her master said would help train her further in [[Diplomat/Legends|diplomacy]]. While on the planet, [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] culminated his plans to eliminate the Jedi Order and issued [[Contingency Orders for the Grand Army of the Republic: Order Initiation, Orders 1 Through 150|Contingency]] [[Order 66/Legends|Order 66]] to the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] of the Grand Army, thus beginning the [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|Great Jedi Purge]]. With the Republic gone and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] arisen in its place, Collun was stranded on Daimar when the Imperials [[Blockade/Legends|blockaded]] the world.<ref name="FOR" />Feeling helpless, Collun strove to keep the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] at bay, not allowing fear or hate to consume her. Appealing to Daimar's [[King/Legends|King]] [[Mitar]] for asylum, the monarch aided her in regaining her focus by giving her an assignment. Collun joined a group escorting [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Alet Komain]] and [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Wilena]] to safety on the planet of [[Byrsym]], where they would meet with a rebel group led by [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Torrin]], Mitar's son. The refugees soon managed to break through the Imperial blockade aboard the [[Starship/Legends|starship]] ''[[Wasaka]]'', and managed to reach Byrsym, in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]]. Soon after, the group met with Agent [[Ballon]], who informed Collun that the prince had fled to the world of [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]] in fear of Imperial imprisonment. Later arriving on Dantooine, the refugees found solace in the company of their prince. Collun, [[Force sense|sensing]] Princess Wilena's latent Force-sensitivity, kept a close eye on the heiress.<ref name="FOR" />

name: Sephani
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] [[Simocadia]] was contested by both the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], despite her wishes to remain neutral. Her son Yojan had joined the CIS and used the planets resources to awaken the [[Ardana Shadex]] atone giant and destroy the [[Agrocite/Legends|agrocite]] mines in order to make both sides of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] lose interest in their planet. Even though Mace Windu saved the Empress from a [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]], she refused him any help in actions against her son. Windu confronted the prince anyway, and Yojan choose to activate the Ardana Shadex, when the Jedi unintentionally destroyed the [[glass key]] - its control module. The giant was awakened and not only crashed the mine, but attempted to destroy the city as well. Windu, Yojan and Demo escaped in a Neimoidian Sheathipede-class transport shuttle and, joining their forces against the threat, managed to destroy the giant, by the costing Yojan his life.

name: Azzenaj
description: {{Quote|How nice of you to come visit me. However, since you have no proper invitation, I cannot allow you to leave.|Azzenaj|The Nightsister's Revenge}}She once sent out an individual to find her initiate who had gone to collect herbs and never came back. She pointed the individual towards the [[Nightspider Cult Cave]]. At some point Azzenaj's old rival, the [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] [[Nandina]], had escaped from the [[Chamber of Banishment]] and, hungering for revenge, decided to settle her score with the Arch Witch. She hired an assassin to take care of Azzenaj and provided him with the proper instructions. The assassin made his move, and the Arch Witch met him with the full arsenal of her [[Force power/Legends|Force powers]]. However, the assassin possessed several lethal weapons, and Azzenaj used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to mask her life signs. The assassin, believing her dead, took her elaborate jewelry as the proof of his job done and left to report to Nandina.<ref>{{SWGTCG|set=The Nightsister's Revenge|scenario=Singing Mountain Assault Promotional scenario}}</ref>

name: Unquenchable Wrath
description: Before becoming an unwilling follower of [[Exar Kun/Legends|Exar Kun]], Unquenchable Wrath was a student at [[Corellia University]], trained in the histories of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. He may have been a member of an archaeological expedition on [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] in [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]] that unknowingly tunneled into the tombs below the [[Temple of Exar Kun]] and released the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord's]] spirit. The evil spirit proceeded to bind the students and researchers to his will, and induct them into the [[Cult of Exar Kun]]. Once a naive adventurer exploring an ancient Sith burial tomb, this Dark Acolyte now lived to serve the will of her master Exar Kun. Afterward, the spirit of Kun sent them to [[Talus/Legends|Talus]], to the [[Corellia University research outpost]] they had originally come from to enslave the rest of the people there. The majority of them were then sent back to Yavin 4. After losing contact with the outpost and fearing the worst, Professor [[Cornelius Wagglehorn]] hired a group of spacers to travel to Talus and investigate. The spacers learned what had transpired and informed the professor. He provided them with the coordinates to the tomb and implored them to destroy the Sith Lord's spirit within. Unquenchable Wrath was among the dark [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-users]] that confronted the spacers before they were able to get to the spirit of Exar Kun. However, the spacers managed to defeat all former students, and then proceed to confront the Dark Lord himself.

name: Ione Marcy/Legends
description: {{Quote|You might have been distraught before, but ever since the intruder left your apartment, you've become even more nervous.''"<br />"''I'm upset. This whole ordeal I've just endured&hellip;it's upsetting.''"<br />"''Or is there a reason you might ''be'' concerned[&hellip;]You weren't afraid because you were in danger, you were afraid we would find your friend, hiding in the other room! You're in ''league'' with the bounty hunter!|Tera Sinube, confronting Ione Marcy|Lightsaber Lost}}[[File:CryarMarcyEscape-LL.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Cryar and Marcy escape with the stolen lightsaber.]]Born on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Ione Marcy was a successful thief and [[Coruscant underworld/Legends|Coruscant underworld]] figure during the waning days of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], and often paired up with fellow thief [[Cassie Cryar]].<ref name="Lightsaber Lost" />Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="SW Annual 2011">''[[Star Wars Annual 2011]]''</ref> Marcy and Cryar were the culprits behind the [[Death/Legends|murder]] of [[Nack Movers/Legends|Nack Movers]], a [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] criminal. After the killing, Marcy looted several rare items from him, among them was [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano's]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], which Movers bought from a merchant named [[Bannamu/Legends|Bannamu]].
