When Tano and [[Cosian/Legends|Cosian]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Tera Sinube/Legends|Tera Sinube]], who was helping her find her lightsaber, arrived at the apartment of [[Cassie Cryar|Movers' girlfriend]], where Movers was living at the time, to search for Tano's missing weapon, Marcy quickly hid Cryar in a nearby room while she tried to pose as an innocent bystander. When Tano and Sinube questioned her about Movers' dead body on the floor, Marcy insisted that the murderers were several [[Sexes/Legends|men]] and that they had escaped to the next building. Unfortunately for Marcy, Tano decided to check a room near them, where Cryar had been hiding. Upon discovering that Tano was the stolen lightsaber's owner, Cryar quickly broke through the window and jumped out.<ref name="Lightsaber Lost" />Meanwhile, Marcy kept up her act and awaited the [[Police droid/Legends|police droids]] with Sinube, believing he assumed she was innocent. However, after he mentioned he had doubts about her made-up story, she summoned her [[Airspeeder/Legends|airspeeder]] and escaped in it. The police arrived merely a few seconds later, but they already were too late to stop her. She then proceeded to pick up her accomplice, who was being chased through the [[Galactic City|city]] by Tano. Unbeknownst to Marcy, Sinube had secretly planted a tracking device on her and was following her with Tano while the two thieves escaped.<ref name="Lightsaber Lost" />[[File:Policedroids.png|thumb|right|250px|Marcy is arrested by police droids.]]Cryar and Marcy traveled to a nearby [[Train station/Legends|train station]] to make their way to a [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] in another district, where they would get a [[Starship/Legends|ship]] and leave Coruscant. However, Tano and Sinube were already there with a [[Squad/Legends|squad]] of police droids, ready to arrest them before they could board. While waiting in line for a spot on the [[Train/Legends|train]], Cryar found the tracking device planted on Marcy and disposed of it, but she was too late to stop them from being found by the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and the police. While Marcy was immediately arrested, her partner's arrest was delayed as she used the stolen lightsaber to destroy the [[Droid/Legends|droids]] holding her captive and escaped, but was ultimately subdued and arrested a few minutes later by Tano and Sinube.<ref name="Lightsaber Lost" />

name: Lolo Purs/Legends
description: {{Quote|He was ''weak''. We needed someone with ''strength'' to stand against this war. I tried to scare him at the docks but he wouldn't go away, so I removed him. And when I heard Deechi knew about that meeting, he had to go too.|Lolo Purs admits to her murders of Farr and Deechi|Senate Murders}}[[File:Padme knocks lolo out.png|thumb|left|200px|Padmé Amidala knocks Lolo Purs out.]]Purs was a relatively young member of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] and a devout supporter of the Republic. This lead her to become the [[Aide/Legends|aide]] of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Onaconda Farr/Legends|Onaconda Farr.]] Like Farr, Purs wanted to see a peaceful resolution to the devastating Clone Wars.<ref name="TVB">[http://programme.tvb.com/kids/starwarstheclonewars2/more/cast The Clone Wars characters on tvb.com]</ref><nowiki> </nowiki>However, she developed a grudge against her mentor for bringing the war to [[Rodia/Legends|Rodia]] in his [[Mission to Rodia/Legends|dealings]] with the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. Her actions culminated in her [[Death/Legends|murder]] of Farr when she attempted to pin the blame on Senator [[Halle Burtoni/Legends|Halle Burtoni]]. Senator [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]], a close friend of Farr's, decided to investigate Farr's murder after believing the [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]] was not doing a good enough job in finding the murderer. Amidala discovered that [[Mee Deechi/Legends|Mee Deechi]] had also been murdered, leading her to believe it was Halle Burtoni.Amidala attempted to arrest Burtoni, but she discovered that it was, in fact, Lolo Purs, Farr's aide. Purs took Amidala hostage at gunpoint, but she was knocked unconscious by a punch from Amidala and arrested by the Coruscant Security Force.

name: Rumi Paramita/Legends
description: {{Quote|I seem to find myself light on company.|Sugi, after Paramita's death|Bounty Hunters (episode)}}[[File:Rumi Paramita blaster.png|thumb|left|220px|Rumi aiming her blaster at Weequay pirates]]In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="ERC" /> Rumi Paramita was a member of [[Sugi (bounty hunter)/Legends|Sugi's]] group of [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] when Casiss hired them to protect his farm against raids by the [[Ohnaka Gang/Legends|Ohnaka Gang]]. She was present when [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] came to the planet, and viewing them as a threat to her clients, was the first to sneak up on them and point her [[IQA-11 blaster rifle|rifle]] at the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. After some deliberation, however, the Jedi convinced the bounty hunters and their clients that they were not in league with the pirates. However, they made it clear that they couldn't help the village farmers.<ref name="BH" />The [[Weequay/Legends|Weequay]] [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] attacked on [[Speeder/Legends|speeder]] bikes shortly afterward, and Kenobi was surprised to find that his prior acquaintance, [[Hondo Ohnaka/Legends|Hondo Ohnaka]], was the leader of the pirate gang. Reneging on their prior decision, the Jedi agreed to help the farmers by teaching them to defend themselves against the next raid. Paramita was not only instrumental in helping the villagers learn to fight, but also assisted with the harvest.When the second attack came, Paramita was positioned on top of a building, giving her a clear line of fire to act as a sniper. During Ohnaka's duel with Skywalker, his pet, [[Pikk Mukmuk/Legends|Pikk Mukmuk]], fired the cannon of Ohnaka's [[WLO-5 speeder tank]] at Paramita, blasting her off the roof and killing her.<ref name="answer" /><ref name="BH" />

name: Mahwi Lihnn
description: In [[42 BBY/Legends|42 BBY]] Mahwi Lihnn was forced to leave her homeworld after killing a corrupt government official. She soon took up bounty hunting. During her ten years of bounty hunting before [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], Mahwi Lihnn pursued [[Bounty/Legends|bounties]] on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]], [[Roon/Legends|Roon]], [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], and other worlds.In 32 BBY, Lihnn was hired by [[Rune Haako/Legends|Rune Haako]] of the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] to rein in and bring back the "traitorous" [[Hath Monchar]]. Monchar had gone missing, much to the displeasure and slight worry of [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]]. Sidious suspected that Monchar, who knew of the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation's]] upcoming [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|blockade of Naboo]], was treacherous and prepared to leak the sensitive plans.Lihnn would track down Hath Monchar, but it would prove to be her last bounty hunt. Visiting [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] for her first&mdash;and last&mdash;time, Lihnn searched Monchar's [[Kaldani Spires Residential Apartments|Kaldani Spires Residential apartment]] before tracking him to the [[Dewback Inn]]. Following the cloaked figure of [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]], who was in turn following Monchar, Lihnn came to the [[Neimoidian/Legends|Neimoidian's]] domicile only to find him already slain by Darth Maul. Maul, apprentice to Darth Sidious, had been dispatched by Sidious to kill Monchar and anybody he talked to. When the two hunters, knowing nothing of the other's parallel mission, encountered each other, Lihnn pulled her [[BlasTech Industries/Legends|BlasTech]] [[DL-44 heavy blaster pistol/Legends|DL-44 heavy blaster pistols]] on Maul. She held the upper hand with Maul backed into a corner, but the Sith used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to distract Lihnn by hurling a fallen [[Gorth (Trandoshan)|bodyguard's]] [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] at her. Lihnn recovered quickly and fired at Maul as he ignited his [[Double-bladed lightsaber/Legends|double-bladed lightsaber]]. With the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] guiding his every move, Maul reflected multiple shots back at the bounty hunter. However, none of the blaster bolts could penetrate Lihnn's [[Shell spider silk|shell]] [[spider silk armor]]. Despite this, Lihnn soon grew desperate and prepared to fire an [[MM9 mini concussion rocket|wrist-mounted rocket]]. Maul, recognizing the devastation such a blast could cause, fled the scene by slicing through the adjacent wall and down through the floor. Lihnn realized as the rocket fired that the Sith had escaped and attempted to jump back into the hallway. Too late, the blast of the explosion slammed Lihnn halfway through the far wall and messily ended the career&mdash;and life&mdash;of the female bounty hunter.

name: Darth Rauder
description: {{Quote|The squadron I am to lead must be able to adapt.|Darth Rauder|Legacy 45: Monster, Part 3}}Darth Rauder was a [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] that was born during the time period of the [[Second Imperial Civil War]] and the [[Sith–Imperial War]]. By [[137 ABY]], she had ascended to the rank of [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lady]] in [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Krayt]]'s [[One Sith|Sith Order]], earning the "[[Darth/Legends|Darth]]" title.<ref name="Legacy 45" /> When the [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Sith-Imperial]] forces learned that deposed [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] was secretly rendezvousing with members of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]] to discuss an alliance on the planet [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]], Rauder and other [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] pilots accompanied the [[First Sith Imperial Strikeforce]] to travel to Agamar and capture Fel. As the fleet was in [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]], Rauder had the [[Predator-class fighter|''Predator''-class fighters]] of the [[1st Imperial Center Core Defense Squadron]], led by [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Gunn Yage]], replaced with [[Sith-Imperial starfighter|Sith-designed ships]]. When Yage questioned Rauder's actions, the Sith warned her to obey her orders or face [[Death/Legends|death]].Rauder forced [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Gunn Yage]]'s [[1st Imperial Center Core Defense Squadron|Squadron]] to switch over to a new design of [[Sith-Imperial starfighter|Sith-designed starfighter]] instead of the Predators they were more familiar with, causing Yage to protest. Rauder threatened to kill Yage if she did not follow her orders.During [[Operation: Thunderstroke]], Lady Rauder flew with Skull Squadron as "'''Skull Leader'''". During the battle, she ordered Captain Yage and the members of Skull Squadron to fire on pilot of the [[Empire-in-exile|Bastion resistance]] who ejected from their starfighters. When Yage refused, the Sith Lady began to torture her using [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and threatened to [[Telekinesis/Legends|telekinetically]] kill her. However, [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Tev Rimon]] shot the pilot instead, sparing Yage the choice of killing an unarmed enemy. Though Rauder spared Yage, the Sith Lady wasn't pleased and threatened to kill Rimon if he went against her orders again.[[File:DeathofRauder.jpg|thumb|left|140px|Gunn Yage shoots down Darth Rauder.]]Lady Rauder was also present during the [[Devastation of Da Soocha|poisoning]] of [[Da Soocha]] and the bombing of [[Napdu]] under the command of Sith Lord [[Darth Azard]], Moff Yage and scientist [[Vul Isen]]. Aboard her [[Fury-class starfighter|Sith Fury]], Rauder labeled the civilian vessels fleeing Napdu as "enemy combatants", despite them being unarmed, and ordered the member of Skull Squadron to destroy them. Though Tev Rimon and [[Jae Akura]] protested, Captain Yage acquiesced and told her subordinates to follow the Sith Lady's command.A few months later, in [[138 ABY]], Lady Rauder lead Skull Squadron during the [[Attack on the Hidden Temple]]. Under her guidance, many allied and Fel loyalist starfighters were taken out. As the battle raged on, Jedi Master [[T'ra Saa]] ordered the ships that formed the Hidden Temple to take flight and escape. Aboard one of these ships, Masters [[Tili Qua]] and [[K'Kruhk]] took a number of Jedi younglings to safety. Sensing their presence aboard the ship, Rauder ordered Skull Squadron to destroy it. However, Captain Yage refused to murder defenseless children, and, fed up with the Sith, obliterated Rauder's starfighter, and with it, Rauder herself. Unwilling to serve the Sith any longer, Yage defected to the Empire-in-exile, followed by her father and many other disillusioned Imperials who were through with the Sith.

name: Knol Ven'nari
description: {{Quote|Let's get this over with&mdash;I'm needed elsewhere, and the chemical factory is already on the move.|Knol Ven'nari|Republic 53: Blast Radius}}[[File:Ven'nari holo.jpg|thumb|left|120px|Ven'nari was considered to be a legend in the Jedi Order.]]Knol Ven'nari, a [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]],<ref name="FF 111" /> was born during the final [[Republic Classic era|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She was taken in by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], eventually achieving the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]].<ref name="SWR 53" /> Ven'nari refused to train a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], however, choosing instead to roam [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and go wherever the Force guided her.<ref name="CSWE: Ven'nari, Knol">{{CSWECite|III|302|Ven'nari, Knol}}</ref> During her time as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], Ven'nari fought [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] bandits in order to save [[Bothan sector|Bothan space]]. Her fellow Bothans nicknamed the Jedi Master "Fire Eater" for her ability to [[Pyrokinesis|manipulate]] fire by using the Force. She rarely visited the [[Jedi Temple]] on the galactic [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. By the time of the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|initiation]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], which was the Galactic Republic's war with the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Ven'nari was regarded as one of the legends of the Jedi Order.<ref name="SWR 53" />[[22 BBY/Legends|Four months]] into the Clone Wars, Ven'nari [[Mission to Queyta|traveled]] to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Queyta/Legends|Queyta]] and met with Jedi Masters [[Jon Antilles]], [[Nico Diath]], and [[Fay]] in order to recover a sample of the antidote for the Separatists' [[Bioweapon/Legends|chemical weapon]] known as [[swamp gas]].<ref name="SWR 53" /> The Separatists had successfully [[Battle of Ohma-D'un|tested]] the airborne gas against the [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] colony on [[Ohma-D'un/Legends|Ohma-D'un]], a [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of the planet [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]].<ref>''[[Republic 51: The New Face of War, Part 1]]''</ref> After this, the Separatists planned on using it against the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] who served the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. When [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] rendezvoused with the Jedi Masters, Ven'nari expressed her impatience to Kenobi regarding his arrival. She also questioned Antilles's involvement in the mission due to the fact that he was not assigned to their team. After conversing with Antilles, Ven'nari and the Masters successfully infiltrated the mobile Separatist [[Separatist Queyta base|base]], which was located on a small island moving through the planet's [[Magma/Legends|lava]] stream. Once the Jedi were inside, both Ven'nari and Diath noted that the base was not guarded by [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]]. The Bothan remarked that the facility was manned and determined that the guards would be easy to deal with. However, Antilles noted that the guards were [[Skakoan/Legends|Skakoans]]&mdash;a [[Species/Legends|species]] that breathed [[Methane/Legends|methane]] and was forced to wear pressurized [[Armor/Legends|armor]]&mdash;and that attacking them with a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] would cause them to explode. Kenobi accessed the facility's schematics and located the [[Laboratory/Legends|laboratory]] housing the antidote.<ref name="SWR 53" />[[File:Ven'nari's death.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Ven'nari dies after sacrificing herself to save her fellow Jedi's lives.]]Ven'nari and the Jedi confronted the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] and the [[Gen'Dai]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Durge]], who notified the team of Jedi that their [[Spy/Legends|spies]] had already informed them of the group's presence in the facility. As Durge shot two of the Skakoans, Ven'nari implored Antilles, Diath, Fay, and Kenobi to stand aside. When the Skakoans exploded, Ven'nari used her pyrokinetic abilities with the Force to pull the fire toward her. After the fire subsided, Diath and the team found Ven'nari with extensive burns, and she told Diath that she was about to [[Death/Legends|die]]. Diath used the Force to ease Ven'nari's suffering as she passed away. After her death, Diath, Antilles, and Fay were also killed. However, Kenobi successfully recovered the antidote and returned to the Jedi Temple on Coruscant. Shortly after Kenobi recovered from his wounds, the Jedi held a [[Hologram/Legends|holographic]] memorial service in honor of Ven'nari and the other deceased Jedi.<ref name="SWR 53" />

name: Milessa Arranda
description: Milessa Arranda was born and raised on Alderaan, and married [[Kalf Arranda]]. Milessa and Kalf eventually raised two children, [[Tash Arranda|Tash]] and [[Zak Arranda|Zak]]. In [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], she and her husband sent their children away from their world for what was intended to be a brief vacation. During the children's absence, Milessa was killed along with every other person on the planet, when [[Wilhuff Tarkin/Legends|Grand Moff Tarkin]] used the [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star]] to [[Destruction of Alderaan|destroy Alderaan]] as an example of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] might.{{Char-stub}}

name: Tria Bartyn
description: Tria Bartyn was the oldest daughter to [[Hugo Bartyn]]. Hugo had been the founder of the fishing town [[Bartyn's Landing]] in [[Lamaredd/Legends|Lamaredd]], the [[Administrator/Legends|Administrator]] to the local mines for [[Outer Rim Oreworks Company|Outer Rim Oreworks]], and a tyrant to the inhabitants of his personal fief, aquatic aliens who were almost [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] at least until the founding of the [[Sailor's Union]]. Hugo also had an oldest son, [[Traggat]].C. [[499 BBY]], both Hugo, Traggat and several others were killed in mysterious circumstances. Tria inherited the Administratorship and the power.Tria decided to not continue her father's policies. She arranged for the working aliens to be free of what Hugo had called "indentured servitude", and she prompted the Sailor's Union to expand and to open at least one hall in each of the towns of Lamaredd. She became very popular for these measures, and earned the nickname of "Benevolent Tria".In time, some people raised Tria to a quasi-religious status, thanking Benevolent Tria for the good times as they also thanked The [[First-Wavers]].In [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]], the local administrator [[Guther Bartyn]], another descendant to Hugo, owned an [[Ubrikkian Industries/Legends|Ubrikkian]] [[Yacht/Legends|yacht]] that he named ''[[Tria Blue]]'' in a vain attempt to impress the locals.

name: Sirrik Olyeg
description: Sirrik Olyeg was a [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] [[Sexes/Legends|woman]]. She was one of the [[First-Wavers]], the original settlers lured with false words to [[Bartyn's Landing]], a new coastal town in [[Lamaredd/Legends|Lamaredd]], around five hundred years before the [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|Battle of Naboo]]. Once there, the Chagrian, [[Iskalonian]], [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]], [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] and [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] settlers became indentured servants, or [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]], to the mayor, [[Hugo Bartyn]], and forced to work either in the food processing plant or in [[222 fishing trawler|trawlers]].Olyeg had a family. All of them except for her died in a random attack performed by a [[Swoop gang/Legends|swoop gang]] made of Quarrens. She then turned to work and excelled in fishing.Although Bartyn was a [[Speciesism|speciesist]], he had to admit that his fishermen were providing him with a good profit through his company of seafood [[Bartyn Gourmet Delicacies]]. As such, Bartyn allowed the sailors much more freedom and commodities than to the plant workers, who commonly died of accidents or of inter-species violence. C. [[517 BBY]], seventeen of the trawlers were under alien captains &mdash; albeit only unofficially. Olyeg, by then an elderly person, was one of these captains. These alien captains created an informal boat-to-boat communication network for security purposes.Understanding that the conditions in Bartyn's Landing were unacceptable, Olyeg was the first to use the network subversively, talking about a rebellion against Bartyn &mdash; an idea that was accepted by other aliens and even some Humans. Knowing that Bartyn would have people monitoring the conversations, Olyeg used metaphors about the oceans that tricked these people. She planned a sudden work stoppage at a certain date.When the date came, the boats disappeared in the open sea, giving no reason for it. Should a boat sink, then the technology would allow Bartyn to know. As the planet was mostly ocean, Bartyn could not assign his then-scarce resources to look for the missing trawlers, but neither could he afford to ignore the situation: He had pending orders from the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]. Rumors grew in Bartyn's Landing, until the truth was discovered. As soon as it was known, the workers in the plant joined the strike, not yielding to Bartyn's threats.Knowing that Bartyn was desperate, Olyeg gave her movement a name, the [[Sailor's Union]] and became officially the "first chair" of it. She then asked Bartyn for a face-to-face meeting to negotiate. Bartyn made several concessions to Olyeg, improving the life of the aliens in several ways: The overcrowded living area of The Ring was increased, aliens could settle in leased farms around the Landing, and Bartyn ceded the second biggest continent of the planet, [[Little Mon Cal]], as an alien homeland. Bartyn also obtain a profit from this negotiation and his profits increased.The Sailor's Union became a powerful organization in Lamaredd, thriving during the next five centuries. However, Bartyn ordered his people to murder Olyeg &mdash; although he admitted that the situation had been so fruitful for him that he almost regretted doing so.

name: Miss Mylla
description: {{Quote|I'll send word I'm seconding you and that you need rooms. [smirk] Of course, I'm only paying for your stay. Until morning, then.|Mix Liddell|Reckonings}}At some point before [[69 BBY/Legends|69 BBY]], the beautiful [[Falleen/Legends|Falleen]] [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] of undetermined age, Miss Mylla, arrived to the planet [[Lamaredd/Legends|Lamaredd]] in a passenger ship. She was in the company of a dozen of pretty Falleen escorts of great skill, and had a good amount of money at her disposal. She then settled in the coastal capital city, [[Bartyn's Landing]]. For as long as anyone could remember, she was also escorted by a burly [[Bouncer (occupation)/Legends|bouncer]], "[[Bantha/Legends|Bantha]]" [[Burloo]], a reserved [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]].<ref name="BL" />Miss Mylla's background was never disclosed and she liked it this way, but this did not stopped the locals from spreading rumors. She was believed to have been the concubine of a member of the Falleen Royal family, having fallen in disfavor in more recent times; or a famous actress of [[Holodrama/Legends|holofilms]] hiding from the jealous wife of another man.<ref name="BL" />At some point, she bought the local tavern, by then a ruined structure, and in little time she transformed it into her own business, [[Miss Mylla's Saloon]], which served as a 24-hour gambling place, drinking bar, disco pub and economic hotel. Miss Mylla's female companions served drinks as scantly-dressed waitresses and performed other kind of services, known euphemistically as "the work", in the private rooms of the top floor. Security was provided in the wider area by Burloo's constant presence at the door, except when he was throwing out an undesirable client; and Miss Mylla ensured that every girl had a hidden knife for an emergency.<ref name="BL" />Miss Mylla's business flourished from the very first moment, to the point that she had to hire more waitresses. Hers was the busiest and more popular business in the Center Sphere District. Her main competitor was [[The Even Cut Sabacc Parlor and Casino]], a gambling business just in front of her main door, managed by the shrewd [[Nyubuna Bulul]] whose skill for business was comparable to Miss Mylla's.<ref name="BL" />Several local celebrities including [[Administrator (ORO)|Administrator]] [[Guther Bartyn]] were regular patrons of the Saloon. The [[Security Chief (ORO)|Security Chief]], a [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] named [[Mix Liddell]], enjoyed Miss Mylla's company more than any other of the offered services and, as she was also fond of him, both of them commonly spent evenings talking with each other.<ref name="BL" />Whenever any of the waitresses wanted to leave, Miss Mylla took care of her future, ensuring that she could have an education or a good job in a different area. Once, she arranged the girl's marriage with a Falleen [[Prince/Legends|Prince]]. Later, c. [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]], a Human girl working for Miss Mylla decided to leave the business and Miss Mylla, agreeing with her decision, decided to take her to a legitimate business partner of hers living in [[Cape Regret]], a remote port in Lamaredd. Miss Mylla hired an independent team to transport the girl as a "special package."<ref name="BL" />Soon afterward, the local [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] species [[Menahuun]], believed to have disappeared centuries before, began performing stealth attacks against Bartyn's Landing and the outskirts. At this point, two of Miss Mylla's girls and their customer disappeared in [[Krakana's Maw|The Maw range]], near the Landing. She had to admit that similar things had happened before, but nonetheless she was worried about her protegees.<ref name="R" />Miss Mylla was also having problems with the customs of the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]]. Security officers working for [[Outer Rim Oreworks Company|Outer Rim Oreworks]] had organized a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] ring and intercepted the shipments of [[Corellian brandy/Legends|Corellian brandy]] that Miss Mylla had bought, for her personal use. Although Miss Mylla suspected the truth, she did not want to call Chief Liddell because that case could make him challenge his bosses of ORO and she worried about that. She decided to hire independent help, offering either one thousand credits or room and board, their choice, for the return of her assets.<ref name="R" />Meanwhile, Liddell hired some outsiders as his new [[Security Chief's Second|Seconds]] and offered to pay for their accommodation &mdash;but not additional services&mdash; at Miss Mylla's Saloon, knowing that his friend Miss Mylla would not refuse.<ref name="R" />

name: Orlenda
description: {{Quote|Go. But hurry. They're arriving.|Seelah Korsin, to Orlenda, before her coup attempt|Lost Tribe of the Sith: Savior}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Orlenda was a member of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] group that, in [[5000 BBY/Legends|5000 BBY]], crashed on the remote [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]] and established dominion over the world's [[Keshiri]] natives. By [[4985 BBY]], Orlenda had taken a job as the [[Aide/Legends|aide]] to [[Seelah Korsin]], [[Marriage/Legends|wife]] of Lost Tribe [[Grand Lord]] [[Yaru Korsin]] and head of the group's [[Medcenter/Legends|sick wards]]. In that capacity, Orlenda helped Korsin in her efforts to assure the Human purity and genetic perfection of future generations of Sith on Kesh, which included gathering Human [[Youngling/Legends|children]] and bringing them to Korsin for examinations. A notorious hedonist, Orlenda began a relationship with a Keshiri laborer named [[Gorem]] around that [[Time/Legends|time]]. Orlenda's flirtation with Gorem ended when he suddenly [[Death/Legends|died]] while working at the crash site of the ''[[Omen]]'', the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] that originally brought the Lost Tribe to Kesh. Saddened by his death, Orlenda was present at Gorem's [[Funeral/Legends|funeral]] and the tossing of his body over a cliff.<ref name="paragon" />By [[4975 BBY]], Orlenda had become aware of her friend Seelah Korsin's plan to overthrow her husband, Yaru, and pave the way for her son, [[Jariad Korsin|Jariad]], to become Grand Lord. Then [[Reproduction/Legends|pregnant]], Orlenda was not able to actively participate but was chosen by Korsin to make sure her policies lived on if her coup attempt went awry. That [[Standard year/Legends|year]], immediately before Seelah planned to [[Duel near the Kesh Sith Temple|ambush]] Yaru, Orlenda was present with Jariad and a group of [[Sith Saber]] warriors near the [[Kesh Sith Temple]] in the [[Takara Mountains]]. Although Korsin briefly considered allowing Orlenda to stay by her side, she instead sent her down the [[Mountain/Legends|mountain]] with a [[cart]] of supplies bound for the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tahv]]. In the end, although Yaru died in the ensuing battle, Seelah Korsin's plot was foiled, and Yaru's daughter, [[Nida Korsin|Nida]], took the throne.<ref name="savior">''[[Lost Tribe of the Sith: Savior]]''</ref>

name: Hira
description: [[File:DeathofHira.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Hira is killed.]]{{Quote|Master Hira!|[[Shado Vao]], upon witnessing Hira's death|Legacy 46: Monster, Part 4}}Following the loss of the [[New Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and the [[Massacre at Ossus]], Hira went into hiding. She was later present during the peace talks on [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]] between the [[New Jedi Order]] and [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] seven years later in [[137 ABY]], alongside [[K'Kruhk]], [[Rasi Tuum]], and [[Shado Vao]]. She was unsure as to why they were attempting to form an alliance with the man who nearly wiped out the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], but K'Kruhk pointed out that [[Marasiah Fel]] had revealed that the attack was actually against the Emperor's orders. During the following [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Sith Imperial]] ambush codenamed [[Operation: Thunderstroke]], Master Hira fought alongside her fellow Jedi and the [[Imperial Knight]]s to defend Roan Fel from warriors of the [[One Sith]]. She was killed by an [[Unidentified Nautolan Sith (Agamar)|unidentified]] [[Nautolan/Legends|Nautolan]] [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]], who electrocuted her with [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Unidentified Codru-Ji clan leader
description: Having seen the strength of the Empire first-hand in her travels, during the clan leaders' meeting she argued that the Empire was too powerful for even the united clans, and that they could not stop its conquest of [[Munto Codru/Legends|Munto Codru]]. Rikkar-Du replied that though they may not be able to stop the conquest, they could interfere with its rule by using the Codru-Ji's well-known abilities to abduct Imperial [[Governor/Legends|governors]].

name: Haydnat Treen
description: During the [[Unification Summit]], she orchestrated a [[Kidnap attempt in the Galactic Empire Embassy Complex|kidnap attempt]] to remove [[Jagged Fel]] as [[Head of State/Legends|head]] of the [[Imperial Remnant]]. The attempt failed as Fel managed to set off the alarm within the embassy and defeated Treen's [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]]. He later told his fiancée, [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]], that he suspected the [[Moff/Legends|Moffs]] but didn't suspect Moff [[Drikl Lecersen]] was behind it, despite his obvious attempts to overthrow Fel.<ref name="Backlash" />Lecersen, who was more a cautious plotter than an opportunist, led his investigation into who was behind the attempt. After removing any thoughts of suspicion on the other Moffs, he tracked several transactions through a [[Borleias/Legends|Borleias]] bank which led him back to Senator Treen. He met Treen and asked her why she had tried to have Fel kidnapped. She revealed that the attempt was only one part of a larger plot to unify the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]] and the Imperial Remnant into a new Galactic Empire with Lecersen as [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]].<ref name="Backlash" />At the [[Kuat Embassy]], Treen revealed her plans to Lecersen. She wanted to have Lecersen replace Fel, even temporarily, as Head of State in time so as to preside over the Imperial reunification with the Galactic Alliance, giving him all the credit and making him the second most powerful being in the galaxy, next to the [[Chief of State (Galactic Alliance)|Chief of State]] of the Galactic Alliance. The next step was to oust Galactic Alliance Chief of State [[Natasi Daala]]. For this she planned to use the [[Emergency Powers Act (Galactic Alliance)|Emergency Powers Act]] that the Senate had set up after the [[Second Galactic Civil War]]. The act declared that the Chief of State could not suspend the Senate and that the [[Appropriations and Disbursements Committee]] could freeze the government budget, therefore blocking the Chief of State's powers. Treen planned to manipulate the political crisis that followed, which she planned to use to force Daala to invoke the act. Treen believed that the public backlash would force her to resign and be replaced by the Imperial leader, whom by then would be Lecersen.<ref name="Backlash" />Senator [[Fost Bramsin]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and the Chiefs of the Alliance [[Galactic Alliance Defense Force|Armed Forces]] already supported Treen's [[Lecersen Conspiracy|conspiracy]]. Lecersen asked her what she wanted in return; she said that she wanted to be made the new [[Grand Moff/Legends|Grand Moff]] of the [[Coruscant sector]] and four dinners with him&mdash;hopefully enough to get him to propose to her which would make her his Empress.The conspirators arranged a staged [[Operation Duusha|assassination attempt]] on Fel as he dined with the [[House of Solo|Solo family]] at the [[Pangalactus]] restaurant. As Lecersen had planned, the attack failed, and the Solos believed that Daala planned the attack.The conspirators continued to plot an overthrow of Daala and were about to execute it when the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] enacted their own coup which was more powerful. By then, Treen knew that their plans would be in complete ruin if they did not adapt. She made a deal with the Jedi, which made the Triumvirate, led by [[Saba Sebatyne]] representing the Jedi, [[General/Legends|General]] Jaxton representing the Galactic Alliance Defense Force, and herself, representing the [[Senate]]. With this adaptation, the plans continued to eventually restore the Empire in her dream.Although Jaxton was later replaced by [[Wynn Dorvan]] as a member of the triumvirate, the conspiracy's plans continued unhindered, and they even brought in a new member in the form of fledgling Senator Kameron Suldar, secretly the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Ivaar Workan]]. However, when Daala, who had escaped prison thanks to [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]], figured out about Lecersen's involvement with the [[Freedom Flight]] and his membership in the conspiracy, she blackmailed him into joining her quest to take over the Imperial Remnant. Later, when Treen realized that something was wrong when Lecersen went missing, she quickly informed another conspiracy member, General [[Stavin Thaal]], that they need to disband what they were doing. So Treen decided to kill a fellow conspiracy member, [[Coruscanti/Legends|Coruscanti]] Senator [[Fost Bramsin]], while making it look like he died of old age before she retired back to Kuat. The rest of the conspiracy fell apart as Thaal later forced Jaxton to commit suicide and Parova was killed by members of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]] in order to frame ex-Jedi fugitive [[Tahiri Veila]].Following the Galactic Alliance and Jedi Order's defeat of [[Abeloth]] and the Sith, Treen's involvement with the conspiracy became publicly known.

name: Henrietya Antilles
description: [[File:Corellia Antilles.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Corellia Antilles]]Henrietya Antilles was educated in several of the finest university programs in the galaxy, earning a doctorate in xenoarcheology and beginning a remarkable career in the discipline. At the height of her career, she had accumulated thousands of hours on archeological digs from the Core to the Outer Rim Territories.

name: Hacina
description: In [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]], during the annual [[Conclave of the Raining Leaves Clan and the Broken Columns Clan|meeting]] of the [[Raining Leaves Clan]] and the [[Broken Columns Clan]], Hacina was part of a group of Nightsisters that tried to sabotage the two clan's union. The Nightsisters sent a large swarm of [[Sparkfly|sparkflies]] against the Raining Leaves and Broken Columns, but [[Carrack]], one of the guides hired by [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Leia Organa Solo]], fired a [[Grenade launcher/Legends|grenade launcher]] in Hacina's position. Hacina and another unidentified Nightsister perished from the grenade blast.

name: Zenn Bien
description: After leaving [[Sullust/Legends|Sullust]] due to her disappointment at [[SoroSuub Corporation/Legends|SoroSuub Corporation's]] support of both the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], she fell in with [[Quip Fargil]], and went to an [[Nilash Imperial Impound Facility|Imperial impound lot]] at [[Nilash III]] to steal a [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]]. With the help of an Imperial, Bien and Fargil stole the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]], and made their way to [[Sriluur/Legends|Sriluur]], where they met with the [[Verpine/Legends|Verpine]] [[Luufkin]], and planned to head out to chop the ship. Luufkin supplied them with crates of fine brand and [[tabac]] sticks, and also provided the ship with a new registry, as the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Gone to Pieces'']]. The three of them headed to the [[Tungra sector/Legends|Tungra sector]], but were pulled out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]].<ref name="MF" />[[File:Falcon NEGVV.png|thumb|left|250px|A [[YT-1300 light freighter/Legends|YT-1300 light freighter]]]]A new [[Sienar Fleet Systems/Legends|Sienar Fleet Systems]] [[Interdictor-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Interdictor''-class Star Destroyer]], and were let go. Their [[Engine/Legends|thrusters]] had malfunctioned, however, and after Fargil offered the brandy and tabac as a bribe, the [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] pulled them aboard with its [[Tractor beam/Legends|tractor beam]] so they could repair the ship. Once the crates were offloaded, the the YT's true purpose was revealed: two [[Chadra-Fan/Legends|Chadra-Fan]], three [[Jawa/Legends|Jawas]], and four [[Squib/Legends|Squibs]] came out of ''Gone to Pieces''{{'s}} smuggling compartments to head onto the ''Interdictor'' and steal [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] parts for ''Gone to Pieces'', and the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. Bien had been unaware of this, but memorized a map of the cruiser to aid in their mission.After the group returned with the parts and started installing them on ''Gone to Pieces'', the Imperials cut their stay short, as they received new orders. The group complied, but as the Imperials prepared to leave, the group's actions were discovered. The group ignored the Imperials order to stay, and as Bien flew ''Gone to Pieces'' out of the [[Hangar/Legends|docking bay]], one of the cruiser's [[Gravity well projector/Legends|gravity well projectors]] cracked, disabling the ship. This allowed the group to continue to the [[Tungra sector/Legends|Tungra sector]].<ref name="MF" />After the run-in with the ''Interdictor'', the Chadra-Fan, Jawas, Squibs, and Bien continued to work together as freelance scavengers. When Bien found out about SoroSuub's control of Sullust, and a resistance on the planet, the scavengers began working with [[Nien Nunb/Legends|Nien Nunb]] and [[Sian Tevv/Legends|Sian Tevv]]. Before the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] the scavengers joined the Rebel Alliance, and went on to destroy the [[Invincible (Zenn Bien)|''Invincible'']], and many other Imperial [[Starship/Legends|ships]]. After the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Bien received a degree from the [[Barbers of Sullust]], and opened a beauty salon, [[The Kindest Cut]], on [[New Balosar]], where she started her own warren-clan with several husbands. In [[43 ABY]], [[Tobb Jadak]] and [[Flitcher Poste]] visited her in The Kindest Cut to ask her about ''Gone to Pieces'' for nostalgic reasons.<ref name="MF" />

name: Aradasa Vurse
description: In [[43 ABY|43.5 ABY]], [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and his son [[Ben Skywalker|Ben]] traveled to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] in search of [[Vestara Khai]], a [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]]. With them was a number of hired trackers and guides, one of which was [[Sha'natrac Tsu]], a Dathomiri Witch who used to be in the [[Blue Coral Divers Clan]]. The Jedi stayed in the company of the Raining Leaves Clan during their [[Conclave of the Raining Leaves Clan and the Broken Columns Clan|annual conclave]] with the Broken Columns Clan. When the clans were attacked by the [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]], who were against the planned merging of the two clans, Tsu was one of the casualties. Ben, however, thought Tsu was more than a random casualty. He theorized that one of the reasons Tsu hired herself as a tracker was because she was searching for her missing daughter stolen by the Nightsisters. Ben started questioning the women of the Raining Leaves Clan who had daughters, and came to suspect that Aradasa was Tsu's missing child.After the [[Attack on Bright Sun Hill|battle]] on [[Bright Sun Hill]], where the two clans managed to repel the Nightsisters and merged into the [[Bright Sun Clan]], Halliava revealed her status as a Nightsister when she accused Khai of complicity against the Bright Sun Clan. The Nightsisters were [[Skirmish in the Dathomir landing meadow|captured]] by the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]] due to Khai's actions, and Halliava was the only one who was left. In response, Khai revealed that it was Halliava who assassinated Tsu. As punishment, Halliava was [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exiled]] from the Bright Sun Clan and Aradasa was adopted by [[Olianne Sihn]], who had lost her own [[Sesara Sihn|daughter]] to a fever a few months previously.

name: Kin Robb/Legends
description: She was inside the Senate Executive Annex Dome when a [[Zillo Beast/Legends|Zillo Beast]] attacked the building in search of Chancellor [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], Robb survived as she was taking shelter in the lower levels of the building with the rest of its residents while the beast continued rampaging outside, though the impact caused her to stumble.<ref name="TZBSB">{{TCW|The Zillo Beast Strikes Back}}</ref>Some time later, Robb was seen having dinner with Senator [[Onaconda Farr/Legends|Onaconda Farr]] at the Senate [[dining commons]], where Senator [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] was dining with Senator [[Rush Clovis/Legends|Rush Clovis]] in order to [[Spy/Legends|spy]] on the [[InterGalactic Banking Clan/Legends|InterGalactic Banking Clan]] Senator.<ref name="SS">{{TCW|Senate Spy}}</ref>Later in the war, she became part of the [[Council of Neutral Systems/Legends|Council of Neutral Systems]] led by [[Duke/Legends|Duchess]] [[Satine Kryze/Legends|Satine Kryze]] of [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]].<ref name="TCWCE" /> She was part of Duchess Satine's court on the starship [[Coronet/Legends|''Coronet'']]. During her time there, she witnessed the assassination attempt on the Duchess's life by several assassin droids. Robb was briefly suspected of having smuggled the droids aboard, since the crate holding them was marked with the Senate stamp, and was subjected to a test of Kenobi's involving the lone surviving droid, which she leaned away from uncomfortably; Kenobi noted the droid's "unusual hostility" towards her as having absolved her of suspicion. The traitor was revealed to be Senator [[Tal Merrik/Legends|Tal Merrik]], who released the droid to attack Onaconda Farr. When Kenobi destroyed the droid, Robb rushed to Farr's aid. She along with the rest of the senators made it safely to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] thanks to [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and Anakin Skywalker's successful handling of the crisis on the ship.<ref name="VOT">{{TCW|Voyage of Temptation}}</ref>[[File:Throw him in.png|thumb|left|250px|Kin present in the lobby during Cad Bane's hostage take over.]]When Amidala put together a party for Senator [[Aang]], Robb was one of those in attendance.Kin Robb was present at a meeting organized by [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Philo/Legends|Philo]] to discuss the blockage of the [[Enhanced Privacy Invasion Bill]] that the [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Chancellor]] wished to bring forward. The meeting, however, was caught in the middle of the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Cad Bane/Legends|Cad Bane's]] [[Senate hostage crisis/Legends|raid on the Senate]], and she was held as hostage by Bane to bargain with the Chancellor for the release of the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Ziro Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Ziro Desilijic Tiure]]; during the crisis, Senator Philo attempted to storm out, only to be callously shot in the back by Cad Bane, much to Robb's horror. The Chancellor was forced to meet Bane's demands if he was to get the senators out alive. However, Bane went back on his word and detonated laser-activated bombs he had placed around the [[Executive Annex Dome East Wing|East Wing]] of the [[Republic Executive Building]] to prevent the senators from escaping. Robb's life, along with that of her fellow senators, was saved by the quick actions of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], who cut through the floor around them seconds before the explosives detonated; though coughing from the dust and a little dazed from the fall, Robb was otherwise unharmed.<ref name="HC" />She was present with two of her aides during a speech given by Senator Amidala to reduce the military budget, which all showed support for. She would later be present at the [[Funeral of Onaconda Farr/Legends|funeral of Onaconda Farr]].<ref name="SM">{{TCW|Senate Murders}}</ref>Robb later presided over the trial of [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] as a member of the jury following the bombing of the Jedi Temple, Tano was on trial for being the bombe rof the jedi temple due to the fact that she was found with the nano droid explosives that were used to bomb the temple; Tano was also put on trial because the bombs were fed to an engineer by his wife [[Letta Turmond/Legends|Letta Turmond]] and Tano was seen to have killed Turmond in her cell. At the climax of the trial, it is unknown whether Robb voted in favour of Tano's execution or against as before the decision of the jury could be revealed [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] burst into the court room with Jedi padawan [[Barriss Offee/Legends|Barriss Offee]] who confessed to the members of the jury that she was killer and the bomber of the temple. To this Robb was shocked.Robb was later present in the Galactic Senate when it was announced that interest rates on the Republic would be raised by the Banking Clan because the Separatists were refusing to pay their loans. Robb was one of the more vocal reactions alongside fellow Senators [[Mot-Not Rab]] and [[Meena Tills]], shouting to the Chancellor that he had been warned that it would happen. When it was announced to the Senate that the CIS had attacked Scipio, Robb immediately called for a counter-invasion in order to seize the banks, supported by Senators Tills, Rab, Stonk and [[Riyo Chuchi]]. The crisis was resolved by the Republic victory at Scipio, home of the Banking Clan, though it resulted in the death of Rush Clovis.

name: Elea Poista
description: Elea Poista was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]].<ref name="GG2-1" /> Originally working for a shipping company on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ralltiir/Legends|Ralltiir]],<ref name="GG2-2">[[Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin (Second Edition)|''Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin'', Second Edition]]</ref> she transferred to [[Bespin Motors/Legends|Bespin Motors]] on [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]], becoming a top [[Exex]] in the company's shipping department.<ref name="GG2-1" /> The move was purely financial; for [[Standard year/Legends|years]], Poista had been operating as an arms dealer named "Kel," and the move to Bespin Motors was to secure shipping resources to serve her clients. The Kel identity was painstakingly created by Poista; Kel had birth records indicating a [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Galltine]], job history in the [[Hammo job corp]], docking passes to multiple [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceports]], and a presence in both [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] and Cloud City records.<ref name="GG2-2" />While working for Bespin Motors, Poista was in charge of contracting [[Molly's Merchants]] to stage a buyout of [[Bespin Motors/Legends|Bespin Motors]] from their parent company, [[Incom Corporation/Legends|Incom Corporation]]. Molly's Merchants transferred funds from Incom to Bespin Motors, allowing them to buy themselves out as an independent company. However, while tracking down Molly's Merchants, Poista learned just how much crime the Empire created. Her realization led her to shift her business dealings to favor the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="GG2-2" /> Poista's new goal was to hurt the Empire and aid the Rebellion in any way possible, and she used her connections to secure weapons to sell to the Alliance. Although rumored to sell to highest bidder, Poista maintained Imperial and criminal connections solely to funnel new Imperial technology to the Rebellion.<ref name="GG2-1" />Following the evacuation of Cloud City in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Poista led a Rebel cell in the metropolis, and sought to protect [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian's]] secrets contained in the [[central computer]]. She was assisted by a [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]], [[Dee Fourpio]], and the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Captain/Legends|captain]] [[Tristos Arctura]].<ref name="GMLA">''[[Gamemaster Toolkit: Live-Action Adventures]]''</ref>

name: Phinea Shantee
description: In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Shantee was accused of cheating in a [[Sabacc/Legends|Sabacc]] game. A local thug was on his way to break her legs, but an unknown [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] intervened to help. The spacer killed the thug, named [[Chalurrekk]], and returned to Phinea. Thankful, Phinea gave the spacer a few [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] and a six-sided [[Chance cube/Legends|die]].However, Phinea's problems were not yet over. She wanted the [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] crime boss killed, so that she could live in peace. The spacer succeeded in killing the Trandoshan, and was awarded with a bottle of [[Wine/Legends|wine]] for his work.

name: Unidentified female Imperial Knight (Agamar)
description: In [[137 ABY]], a [[Color/Legends|brown]]-haired [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] served as a member of the [[Imperial Knight]]s,<ref name="Legacy 46" /> an order of [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-users]] who had pledged loyalty to [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] and his [[Empire-in-exile]].<ref name="LECG">''[[Legacy Era Campaign Guide]]''</ref> In that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], a large group of Knights that included the brown-haired female served as [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguards]] to Fel as he traveled to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]]. The Emperor was [[Mission to Agamar|rendezvousing]] on the planet's surface with representatives of the [[New Jedi Order|Jedi Order]]; the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and Fel had a common enemy in [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire]], and both parties hoped to forge an alliance directed against [[Darth Krayt|Krayt's]] forces.<ref name="Legacy 46" /><ref name="Legacy 45">''[[Legacy 45: Monster, Part 3]]''</ref>On the morning of the peace talks, every Jedi and Imperial Knight disguised themselves as [[Agamarian]] [[Farm/Legends|farmers]], and the brown-haired female joined several other Knights in pretending to tend to a field near to the negotiations. While they exercised their deception,<ref name="Legacy 46" /><ref name="Legacy 45" /> Fel and several Imperial Knight Masters met with four Jedi representatives, led by the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[K'Kruhk]]. An agreement was reached, but the meeting was interrupted immediately thereafter by [[Morrigan Corde|Nyna Calixte]]&mdash;the [[Director of Imperial Intelligence]] for Krayt's Empire&mdash;who was secretly aiding Fel. She rode a [[Agamarian beast|local beast]] into the field where the brown-haired female was stationed, but after two Imperial Knights fired [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifles]] at the animal, she collapsed onto the ground. Calixte hurriedly told the two groups that Krayt's [[One Sith|Sith]] were aware of their meeting and had sent a [[First Sith Imperial Strikeforce|task force]] to capture or [[Death/Legends|kill]] the Emperor.<ref name="Legacy 45" />A [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] strike team then rose from some nearby swamps, and [[Antares Draco]],<ref name="Legacy 46" /> the leader of the Imperial Knights,<ref name="LECG" /> called on his Knights to defend the Emperor. All farmer disguises were jettisoned, and the brown-haired female ignited her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] as the [[Operation: Thunderstroke|battle]] began. The Jedi joined their new allies in fighting off the attacking Sith and protecting the Emperor, and the combat saw at least ten Sith fall to the blades of Jedi and Imperial Knights, as well as to Calixte's [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]].<ref name="Legacy 46" /> Some Jedi and Imperial Knights were slain as well,<ref name="Legacy 48">''[[Legacy 48: Extremes, Part 1]]''</ref> but most of the survivors, including the Emperor, managed to evacuate the fray on the escape [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] ''[[Defender One]]''.<ref name="Legacy 46" />

name: Sionver Boll/Legends
description: {{Quote|I assure you, this weapon will only affect droids.|Sionver Boll assures Palpatine of the electro-proton bomb's effectiveness|The Zillo Beast}}A [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] of an alien [[Species/Legends|species]], Sionver Boll designed and developed the [[Electro-proton bomb/Legends|electro-proton bomb]],<ref name="BF">''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars: New Battlefronts: The Visual Guide]]''</ref> an explosive device that created a massive [[Electromagnetic pulse/Legends|electromagnetic pulse]]. In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="ERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> the first deployment of the bomb during the [[Battle of Malastare/Legends|Battle of Malastare]] deactivated an entire [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Droid/Legends|droid]] invasion force. However it opened a sink hole at the blast site which awakened a gargantuan [[Zillo Beast/Legends|Zillo Beast]]. In the ensuing rampage, the Republic's [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] and [[Dug/Legends|Dug]] allies sustained heavy casualties.<ref name="ZB" />[[File:Doctor Boll.png|left|thumb|Boll during the Clone Wars]]Even [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] failed to penetrate the creature's thick armor,<ref name="ZB" /> which led Boll and [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] to express interest in studying the beast for possible reproduction of its scales as indestructible armor. When the beast was brought to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to be studied, Palpatine suggested that the beast should be killed as the process of removing its scales to study them was difficult and painful for the beast. Boll protested, stating that it was the last of its kind and there was a chance it might be sentient.<ref name="ZBS">{{TCW|The Zillo Beast Strikes Back}}</ref>Palpatine wasn't convinced and told her he'd replace her if she wouldn't kill it, but the beast heard his comments, and expressed its rage,<ref name="ZBS" /> as it recognized him as a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]].<ref name="ZBSC">{{SWArchive|url=video/view/000999.html|text=Episode Commentary #2.22: The Zillo Beast|nobackup=1}}</ref> The Chancellor suggested killing the beast with the toxin produced from the Malastarian [[Fuel/Legends|fuel]] that weakened it. Boll was able to turn the toxin into a[[Gas bomb/Legends|poison gas]], but she did not produce enough and the Zillo Beast escaped, beginning [[Zillo Beast incident/Legends|a rampage]] on Coruscant to find Palpatine, who had ordered him tortured.<ref name="ZBS" />Palpatine contacted Boll, and ordered her to create more toxin to kill the creature. She succeeded, and the toxin was fired by several Republic gunships, killing the Zillo. The next morning, Palpatine ordered Boll to [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] the beast, much to her surprise.<ref name="ZBS" /> However, before Boll had the chance to create a clone the Clone Wars came to an end, and Palpatine no longer had need of Boll's skills.<ref name="FF-2014 7: Boll" />

name: Chilla
description: Soon after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Chilla worked as a [[Bartender/Legends|bartender]] in [[The Rusty Bucket]], a bar in the city of [[Takari]], on [[Iyuta]]. Chilla's affiliation was discovered by the Empire and she was wounded. Chilla hid in the planet's ancient sewer system, eventually [[Death/Legends|dying]] but not before leaving a message on a [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]] [[recorder]].<ref name="Plant" />The Empire then replaced Chilla with [[Chilla (impersonator)|an impersonator]], as part of a plot to discover the Rebel headquarters. However, [[Green squad]] from [[Reekeene's Roughnecks]] discovered the real Chilla's corpse while preparing a mission to eavesdrop on a newly built [[Imperial Communications Center (Iyuta)|Imperial Communications Center]], blowing the impersonator's sham.<ref name="Plant" />

name: Tal Anavere
description: Tal Anavere was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Ho'Din/Legends|Ho'Din]],<ref name="CRO" /> [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] around the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[70 BBY]]. She developed a passion for [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] art, with a particular affinity for artworks from pre-technological civilizations. Under the regime of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Anavere witnessed the artistic traditions of primitive cultures in many [[Star system/Legends|star systems]] curtailed or destroyed by Imperial [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] or domination. Believing the policies of the Empire crushed freedom of expression, Anavere became a [[Con artist/Legends|con artist]], [[Gambling/Legends|gambler]], and [[Scoundrel|thief]], eventually affiliating herself with the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].<ref name="CRO" />As a Rebel operative, Anavere operated as an [[art dealer]] and specialized in trading artworks created by important members of the Imperial bureaucracy&mdash;there being no market in the Empire for her preferred, pre-technological art forms. Many of those Imperials, jaded by the experience of individuals purchasing their art simply to curry favor, came to trust Anavere as she made them feel their works were being purchased by individuals with a genuine interest in the pieces. Anavere used her positions of trust to gather intelligence for the Rebel Alliance, but she also took more direct action to remove [[Bounty/Legends|bounties]] placed on Rebel heads and arrange amnesties. Anavere avoided reprisals from the Empire by utilizing multiple aliases, erasing records of her previous activities and, on occasion, faking reports of her own [[Death/Legends|death]].<ref name="CRO" />In the period between the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]] and the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Anavere established an art gallery, "[[Sophistication]]," on [[Obroa-skai/Legends|Obroa-skai]],<ref name="CRO" /> a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] known for its massive [[Celebratus Archive|library database]].<ref name="HTESB">''[[Heir to the Empire Sourcebook]]'', p. 89</ref> She also began using slightly addictive blends of [[Ho'Din herbal tea]]s on her Imperial marks to increase her influence over them. That technique came to the attention of [[Airen Cracken/Legends|Airen Cracken]],<ref name="CRO" /> a [[General/Legends|general]] and member of [[Alliance Intelligence]].<ref name="CRO 1">''[[Cracken's Rebel Operatives]]'', p. 4</ref> Cracken was one of several high-ranking Alliance members who expressed reservations over Anavere's use of herbal [[Tea/Legends|teas]];<ref name="CRO" /> however, Cracken respected her abilities enough to include a file on the Ho'Din in his [[Datafile/Legends|datafile]] on useful Alliance operatives.<ref name="CRO 1" />

name: Boga/Legends
description: [[File:Kenobiandboga.jpg|thumb|left|175px|Boga and Obi-wan plummet down the ravine.]]Boga was one of the fastest varactyl to be tamed by the [[Utai/Legends|Utai]] beast tamers. She was thirty-nine hands tall at her shoulder, fifteen meters in length, and possessed a magnificent crest of blue, purple and green feathers.During his search for [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] on Utapau, [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] chose Boga as his mount, based on her proud and loyal spirit as he saw through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].{{Fact}} Astride Boga, Obi-Wan reached the tenth level of [[Tion Medon/Legends|Tion Medon's]] [[Pau City/Legends|Pau City]] in record time. Boga proved a worthy match for General Grievous in his [[Tsmeu-6 personal wheel bike|wheel bike]], chasing the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] general through the city and using her clawed feet to climb the sinkhole walls in pursuit. Along the way, she proved valuable to Obi-Wan, disabling Grievous's [[Sheathipede-class transport shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] and picking off several droids. With Boga's help, Obi-Wan confronted and destroyed the General.Unfortunately for Boga, the [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] turned against her [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] rider on the [[Order 66/Legends|orders]] of [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]. Boga and Obi-Wan were caught in an explosion caused by an [[All Terrain Tactical Enforcer/Legends|AT-TE]], sending both plummeting into the water at the bottom of the sinkhole. Obi-Wan had assumed that Boga died, succumbed to her wounds and allowed himself a moment to reflect upon that touching and unexpected sacrifice.

name: Ebya T'dell
description: {{Quote|This is Ebya T'dell, daughter of the miner Nafjan and the bridge cadet Kanika. Eight years old next month by our counting. No ailments.|[[Orlenda]], Seelah Korsin's assistant|Lost Tribe of the Sith: Paragon}}[[Reproduction/Legends|Born]] around [[4992 BBY]], Ebya T'dell was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] native of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]]. She was the daughter of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] crewmembers of the [[Starship/Legends|starship]] ''[[Omen]]''&mdash;[[Nafjan T'dell|Nafjan]] and [[Kanika T'dell]]&mdash;who had survived the<ref name="paragon" /> [[Sith dreadnaught]]'s<ref name="crosscurrent">''[[Crosscurrent]]''</ref> crash on Kesh eight [[Standard year/Legends|years]] [[5000 BBY/Legends|earlier]]. In [[4985 BBY]], T'dell was sent to be examined by [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Seelah Korsin]], who was to determine whether she would be allowed to reproduce in the new Keshiri [[Lost Tribe of Sith|Sith society]]. T'dell was closely examined by Korsin, an acquaintance of her [[Parent/Legends|parents]], who noted her high [[Bone/Legends|cheekbones]] and expressed concern at the child's "florid" [[Color/Legends|coloring]]. Ultimately, Korsin determined that T'dell might be allowed to have a family, if the proper partner was found. Momentarily safe in the knowledge that she might not be a genetic dead-end, T'dell left to play outdoors.<ref name="paragon" />

name: Bethanie Melan
description: Melan originally served in the [[Republic Navy/Legends|Republic Navy]] and attained the rank [[Commander/Legends|commander]]. However, in [[4067 BBY]], she resigned from the navy and was assigned to become the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the [[Starveil (starship)|''Starveil'']], a civilian exploration vessel. Under her command, the starship traveled to the [[Luire system]], as part of the [[Starveil Project]]. Officially, the project was meant to be one of exploration, but in fact, the ''Starveil'' was searching for an experimental Republic naval vessel that had gone missing. The ''Starveil'' began to scan the Luire system, but when it approached the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Nyriaan/Legends|Nyriaan]], the starship's crew discovered that the ship's sensors could not penetrate the planet's atmopshere. Melan decided to land the ''Starveil'' on Nyriaan and communicated her intention to the Republic. However, the ''Starveil'' crash-landed on Nyriaan, leaving the surviving crew stranded there. Melan was one of the survivors, and she and her crew became the planet's first colonists.

name: Dotyk
description: Dotyk was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] to a family known for their dark dealings. As a young child, her very presence brought fear in those around her. This ability occurred as a natural defense mechanism, causing people to feel sick in her presence. Due to this ability, she made few friends and eventually ran from her home. She continued to flee across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] in order to avoid others. However, during her travels she began to gain control over her abilities and, with her newfound powers, Dotyk could attack others and ward off potential threats. While continuing to develop her powers, she was able to paralyze or cripple those that confronted her, causing at least one individual to bleed from her nose. Despite gaining control over her powers, Dotyk continued to attack those around her, believing that it was her destiny to continue her family's evil.

name: Klorma Draill
description: Draill was a [[HoloNet/Legends|HoloNet]] starlet and she also became the mistress of [[Governor/Legends|Governor]] [[Zerex]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Adinorr]]. When Zerex secured a promotion to become the [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] of the [[Meridian sector/Legends|Meridian sector]], Draill attended a celebratory party that he held in his mansion, on Ord Adinorr.

name: Nightsister Matriarch
description: [[File:Matriarch_Rancor.jpg|thumb|left|The Nightsister Matriarch riding a rancor]]The "Nightsister Matriarch" was a title held by a pale-skinned [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Witches of Dathomir|Dathomiri Witch]] of the [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]] sect who lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] during the sovereignty of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. During this [[Time/Legends|time]], the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] [[X1]] established a [[X1's Dathomir base|facility]] on the planet, where he conducted experiments with [[Cloning/Legends|cloning]]. X1 eventually fled the planet, and the Nightsisters, led by the Matriarch, [[Mission to Dathomir (Galactic Civil War)|overran]] the facility. While the Nightsisters fought X1's [[Troop/Legends|troops]] outside the base, the Matriarch, riding a [[Rancor/Legends|rancor]], infiltrated the facility itself.<ref name="Battlefront: Elite Squadron (Nintendo)" />At some point between [[11 ABY/Legends|11 ABY]] and [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]],<ref name="Date" /> the New Republic's [[Grey Squadron]], led by [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[X2]], arrived on the planet in search of X1. Fighting through the Nightsisters, [[Gray|Grey]] [[Squadron/Legends|Squadron]] reached the entrance to the base. [[Force sense|Sensing]] the Matriarch's presence, X2 left his men at the entrance to provide backup and went inside alone. Breaking through a wall, the Matriarch attacked X2, but he was able to [[Death/Legends|kill]] the rancor. She subsequently charged X2 with her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], but the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Knight prevailed and killed her as well.<ref name="Battlefront: Elite Squadron (Nintendo)" />

name: Meren Siefel
description: Siefel carried out a number of killings for [[Zerex]], the [[Governor/Legends|governor]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Adinorr]]. When Zerex was promoted to become the [[Moff/Legends|moff]] of the [[Meridian sector/Legends|Meridian sector]], he held a celebratory party in his mansion on Ord Adinorr and appointed Siefel to serve as his head of security during the event.

name: Rilly Raadun
description: In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Raadun attended the [[SoroSuub Anniversary celebration, 31 BBY|SoroSuub Anniversary celebration]] that was held in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tolea Biqua]], on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]]. During the event, Raadun served as an [[Agent/Legends|agent]] of the Force Adept [[Taleah Novran]], who was trying to pair young Force Adepts with suitable mentors.

name: Taleah Novran
description: In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Novran attended the [[SoroSuub Anniversary celebration, 31 BBY|SoroSuub Anniversary celebration]] that was held in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Tolea Biqua]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]]. During the event, she tried to pair promising young Force Adepts with more experienced mentors, and three other Force Adepts: [[Otee Nom]], [[Dole Happ]] and [[Rilly Raadun]] assisted her in this task.

name: Anoush Rahn
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Cerean/Legends|Cerean]], Anoush Rahn was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], studying independently in the ways of the [[Jedi Consular]] after achieving [[Jedi Knight/Legends|knighthood]]. In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Rahn attended the [[SoroSuub Anniversary celebration, 31 BBY|SoroSuub Anniversary celebration]] in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Tolea Biqua]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]]. She was one of a number of Jedi representing the [[Almas Academy]], an experimental [[Jedi academy]] located on the nearby planet [[Almas]], during the event.<ref name="BA" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Olge Plavi-Dol
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Olge Plavi-Dol was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Commenor/Legends|Commenor]] to a family who quickly discovered she was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]]. Sent to the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Plavi-Dol was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] before being assigned to a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Completing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Plavi-Dol explored the ways of the [[Jedi Consular|Consular]], delving into the art of [[Force healing/Legends|healing with the Force]] becoming a proficient [[Jedi healer]].<ref name="OTF" />At the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Plavi-Dol took up the rank of [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi General]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]]. Early in the war she traveled to [[Argul]], where she participated in a [[Battle of Argul|battle]] against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. She attended the sick and wounded who were awaiting transport offworld alongside Jedi Master [[Ulseh]]. After [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] left the planet to gather reinforcements, Plavi-Dol volunteered to stay behind with Master Ulseh, even though another transport may not have arrived in time, as she believed that her abilities to heal the injured were still needed.<ref name="OTF" />

name: Calvaria
description: When the parents of the child [[Klay Firewell]] were brought to the fortress of the [[Moon/Legends|moon's]] [[Skull Queen]] to be condemned to sacrificial [[Prison/Legends|imprisonment]] within a megalithic [[Force field/Legends|energy-field]], the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] took Calvaria hostage in order to bargain for their release. Skull Queen [[Quenelle]] acquiesced, and after helping Skywalker's Master [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] locate the [[Lost Stars of Nallastia]] to free Klay's parents, Calvaria was released.<ref name="skulls">''[[Star Wars Adventures 2: The Cavern of Screaming Skulls]]''</ref>Calvaria and Quenelle both professed a stated desire to [[Marriage/Legends|wed]] Kenobi, despite the former being betrothed to prince [[Alto]] of the [[Raptor Clan]]. Calvaria was truly in love, however, with a [[Technician/Legends|mechanic]] named Rench, and secretly traveled to nearby [[Fondor/Legends|Fondor]] to meet with him. Brought up as Princess of the Skull Clan, she had always wondered how beings might regard her if they did not know she was royalty. While on a trade mission to Fondor she had met Rench and introduced herself as '''Klara''', an ''aide'' to the Margravine Quenelle, which wasn't so very far from the truth. Calvaria had not expected to fall in love with Rench, and she felt guilty for having deceived him about her true identity.<ref name="hostage">''[[Star Wars Adventures 3: The Hostage Princess]]''</ref>Before Calvaria could tell him the truth after fleeing from [[Skull Queen's fortress|her mother's fortress]], however, the [[Fondor Spaceport|spaceport]] Rench worked at was taken over by [[Groodo]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]]. In the melee, Calvaria was abducted by the last [[FX medical assistant|FX medical assistant droid]] left standing after [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] took [[Mace Windu's lightsaber/Legends|his lightsaber]] to [[Groodo]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt's]] [[Droid Control Army]]. Quenelle and the Jedi [[Bultar Swan/Legends|Bultar Swan]], Windu, and [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] at last liberated the spaceport and Calvaria was rescued by Windu.Back at her mother's fortress, the Princess rested in her chamber on what was to be her wedding day to Prince Alto, when a visitor called—it was her beloved, Rench the mechanic. He immediately disclosed to her that he had no idea that she was the Skull Queen's daughter and she apologized for having deceived him, but he guessed that she had done so with the hope that Rench would fall in love with her ''only'' for her and not her regal position. He, too, then asked for her forgiveness, because his name, he revealed, was not in fact "Rench," but Alto, Prince of the Raptor Clan. There would be ''happy'' wedding that day, after all.<ref name="hostage" />

name: Kalieva K'ntarr
description: Kalieva K'ntarr was the daughter of [[King/Legends|King]] [[Rilvvan K'ntarr]], making her the heiress to both Rydonni Prime's throne and the family-owned [[Rythani Products]] company, which supplied [[Walker/Legends|walkers]], weapons, and electronics to the remnants of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Beautiful and regal, Kalieva also acted much like a spoiled child and carried the typical haughtiness and commanding tone of most royalty. Nevertheless, she was both intelligent and sharp-witted, and was an incredibly skilled [[Politics/Legends|politician]].<ref name="AJ9" />[[File:KalievaSconn.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Kalieva attempts to use her influence to help Sconn gain access to Prototype Lab A]]At some point after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Kalieva encountered a professional [[Scoundrel|thief]] named [[Sienn Sconn]] during one of her father's ceremonies on behalf the [[Sector/Legends|sector's]] [[Moff/Legends|Moff]], [[Caerbellak]]. Sconn, disguised as a servant, professed to have attended the party only to steal a [[Rythani Products prototype|prototype]] weapon Rythani Products was building for the Empire. Kalieva, tired of the life she was living on Rydonni Prime under the strict rule of her father, agreed to help Sconn in exchange for passage off-world. She helped a reluctant Sconn gain access to the [[Prototype Labs]] section of the [[Rythani Products Building]], but was tied up and gagged by the thief, who saw her as a liability and wanted to prevent her from coming to any harm.<ref name="AJ9" />Kalieva was able to escape, however, and guilted Sconn, who had been able to steal the prototype, into letting her escape with him again. They commandeered an [[All Terrain Armored Transport/Legends|All Terrain Armored Transport]] and headed off for the rendezvous point where a [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] was scheduled to pick Sconn up. The next day, the pair found themselves in the middle of royal celebration in honor of Moff Caerbellak. Kalieva and Sconn moved their AT-AT into formation with the other walkers to prevent any suspicion from falling onto them. When they noticed that Caerbellak was threatening King K'ntarr's life after finding out the prototype had been stolen, Sconn fired on the royal reviewing stand. Kalieva and Sconn used the ensuing chaos to attempt escape. After Sconn dispatched Caerbellak's [[Mistryl Shadow Guard]] [[Variise]], Kalieva and the thief abandoned the AT-AT in a [[Speeder bike/Legends|speeder bike]] and were able to make it to the pick-up point.<ref name="AJ9" />Upon arriving there, the two realized they had developed feelings for each other and shared a kiss, but Kalieva decided it was her duty to stay on Rydonni Prime. Ultimately, Kalieva betrayed Sconn. She planted a tracking device on the prototype on behalf of Moff Caerbellak, who had secretly formed a relationship with the princess. Kalieva and Caerbellak assassinated the king, thus instating Kalieva as Rydonni Prime's new [[Queen/Legends|queen]].<ref name="AJ9" />

name: Exal Kressh
