description: Exal Kressh was selected to be the [[Vitiate|Sith Emperor's]] apprentice, a role in which she served until the early years of the [[Great Galactic War]], when she discovered he intended to hollow her mind out and fill it with his own, making her the first of his "[[Children of the Emperor|Children]]." In response, Exal abandoned her duties in the [[Kathol Rift/Legends|Kathol Rift]] and fled toward the fringes of Republic Space, and possibly sending information to the Republic. The Emperor and the [[Dark Council]] responded by assigning the [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]] [[Darth Thanaton|Teneb Kel]] to hunt her down and kill her. Kressh destroyed [[Lenico Colony Blue]] while fighting against Teneb. Teneb barely survived the duel, but was able to escape from the colony and continue his mission to find her.Kressh attempted to destroy the Emperor's project to make his children by assisting the Republic on an assault on [[Korriban]]. Secretly helping the Republic, she intended to sabotage the planet's defenses to allow the Republic to infiltrate the planet. She was met again by Teneb Kel, though she once again held the upper hand against him in combat. However, when Teneb's warrior slave [[Qawohl|Maggot]] intervened, Teneb took his chance by killing Kressh, therefore preventing her from sabotaging the planet's defenses or destroying the Emperor's project. She finally came to the point that her arrogance and superiority undermined her when Teneb used the Force to bring a fallen Sith's [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to stab her from behind.Before dying, she heard the Emperor's voice in her head one last time, giving words of mockery, "You are nothing", the voice said, then she fell to the floor.

name: Thracia Cho Leem
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Thracia Cho Leem was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]; eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. After achieving the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Knight]], Leem undertook independent study as a [[Jedi Consular]], becoming a renowned [[Jedi healer|healer]] and well respected by many of her peers. A contemporary of [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]], she was one of his few close friends who could make him smile heartily. Their friendship was maintained despite Leem's unorthodox lifestyle and her disregard for formality or finesse.<ref name="RP" />Indeed, Master Leem was somewhat of a rogue. Taking predominantly female [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]], the diminutive woman roamed [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]], returning very rarely to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. In fact, Master Leem violated the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code's]] ban on attachments, frequently marrying several times and giving birth to sons and daughters on several worlds. Despite this, Leem never received censure from the High Council; the august body continued to allow her to teach apprentices and carry her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="RP" />One of Master Leem's most prized Padawans was the [[Fosh]] Jedi [[Vergere]]. Having been with Vergere the moment she hatched, Leem took the avian as her apprentice and raised her to the rank of Knight. Therefore, when Vergere did not report back after departing for [[Zonama Sekot/Legends|Zonama Sekot]] in [[29 BBY/Legends|29 BBY]], Master Leem petitioned the High Council to dispatch a rescue team to find her wayward apprentice. Assigning Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and his young Padawan [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], the team searched for evidence of Vergere on the planet. When the two returned to Coruscant, they concluded that Vergere had been taken by beings known as the [[Yuuzhan Vong|Far Outsiders]] and that she was beyond the Order's reach. Not long after, Master Leem left the Order without stating her reasons, this time for good. Maintaining contact with the Temple, Leem no longer served the Republic, but the Force.

name: Jolee
description: {{RPGseed}}Jolee once boarded a [[Merchant/Legends|merchant]] [[Starship/Legends|ship]] that stopped briefly on Volik, so Master Se'ol sent a group of his students to find her and bring her back home. However, their rescue was made more complicated when the merchant ship Jolee was on was attacked by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]].{{Endgame}}

name: Pippa Rosheed
description: The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] Pippa Rosheed grew up with an interest in both exploration, and the study of other life forms. She attended university, and studied to become a [[Xenobiologist/Legends|xenobiologist]], joining [[Fernandin Scouting Expedition]] after graduation. Rosheed began working for them in the early years of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] reign,<ref name="GG2-2">[[Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin (Second Edition)|''Galaxy Guide 2: Yavin and Bespin'', Second Edition]]</ref> working for them for many [[Standard year/Legends|years]].<ref name="GG2-1" />Rosheed participated in the exploration of dozens of [[Star system/Legends|star systems]], until the Empire began to restrict<ref name="GG2-1" /> non-military exploration. Accepting a teaching position at [[Sperinad University]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Esseles/Legends|Esseles]], she became a successful teacher and scholar although she missed field work. Rosheed maintained contact with [[Lexi Fernandin]], head of Fernandin Scouting Company, and jumped at chance to get back into the field when the Empire awarded the company the rights to explore the [[Yavin system/Legends|Yavin system]]. She resigned her position at the university with immediate effect.<ref name="GG2-2" />

name: Turi Altamik
description: In [[44 ABY]], Altamik came down with a [[Force psychosis|psychosis]], brought on by the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] being [[Abeloth]], which made her believe that everyone she knew had been replaced by impostors. Altamik escaped the [[New Jedi Temple|Jedi Temple]], and although she was soon captured by the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], she was caught on [[Holocamera|holocam]] by [[Journalist/Legends|journalist]] [[Javis Tyrr]].<ref name="Allies" />[[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Cilghal]] drew up a report that went into detail about the psychosis in Altamik and fellow Jedi Knight [[Kunor Bann]], believing the rate of Jedi succumbing to the psychosis was accelerating. The [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]], meanwhile, ordered that the Jedi release Altamik and [[Sothais Saar]]&mdash;a [[Chev]] Jedi who had recently succumbed to the same psychosis&mdash;to government custody. Acting [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Kenth Hamner]] refused the directive, which resulted in [[Chief of State (Galactic Alliance)|Chief of State]] [[Natasi Daala]] ordering a [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Siege of the New Jedi Temple|siege]] of the Jedi Temple. When the [[Jedi High Council (New Jedi Order)|Jedi Council]] sent Hamner's [[Aide/Legends|aide]], [[Kani Asari]], out to negotiate with the Mandalorians, [[Belok Rhal]], the [[Commander/Legends|commander]] of the Mandalorian siege, noted that Kani was neither Altamik nor Saar and shot her on sight, [[Death/Legends|killing]] her instantly. Despite the violence, the Jedi still refused to turn over the two psychotic Knights.<ref name="Allies" />Before long, however, [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] completed [[Mission to the Maw|his mission]] to defeat Abeloth, apparently killing her and thus instantly ending Altamik's psychosis.<ref name="Allies" /> However, Luke soon discovered that Abeloth had not been killed and suspected that by being wounded and weakened she had lost her control over the Jedi Knights' minds.<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref>Altamik and Saar were brought out before to the Jedi Temple steps, where Daala's chosen [[Doctor/Legends|doctor]], [[Thalleus Tharn]], examined them. Tharn pronounced them to be cured, and Daala lifted the siege, although she refused to release the Horn siblings from [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]]. Soon thereafter, Altamik was one of many formerly psychosis-afflicted Jedi to participate in the [[Raid on Detention Center 81|rescue]] of [[Valin Horn|Valin]] and [[Jysella Horn]]. She piloted a disguised [[Cygnus-7 armored transport]] which served as "Team Saav'etu"'s and "Team Solo"'s primary escape vehicle. [[Hapan Security]] officer [[Taryn Zel]] used the vehicle's [[Ion cannon/Legends|ion cannon]] to ward off pursuing [[Galactic Alliance Security|GAS]] speeders during the raid.<ref name="Vortex" />

name: Kaara
description: Kaara was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] on the remote [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]] sometime before the [[Second Galactic Civil War]]. Like her brother, [[Vran]], she was a member of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]] and eventually reached the rank of [[Sith Saber]].<ref name="Allies" /> In [[44 ABY]],<ref name="TERC" /> Kaara and Vran were among those selected to join the crew of the [[ChaseMaster]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]] ''[[Starstalker]]'', which would be part of a [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] sent to ally with [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] for a [[Mission to the Maw|mission]] to [[the Maw]]&mdash;an unstable and mostly unnavigable cluster of [[Black hole/Legends|black holes]]&mdash;to neutralize the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Sentience/Legends|being]] [[Abeloth]]. After meeting with Skywalker, the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] fleet ventured to the planet [[Klatooine/Legends|Klatooine]] and waited there for the arrival of one of Skywalker's friends, [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]], who would supply them with a [[Rockhound|ship]] that could help them [[Astrogation/Legends|navigate]] the Maw more easily.<ref name="Allies" />While in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] over Klatooine, [[Vyn Holpur]], the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the ''Starstalker'', received orders from the Sith fleet's leader, [[High Lord]] [[Sarasu Taalon]]. The [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] wanted to obtain some [[wintrium]] samples from a natural formation known as the [[Fountain of Ancients]] that was located on the planet. Kaara, her brother, and fellow Sith Sabers [[Turg]], [[Marjaak]], and [[Anyul]] then took a [[Skiff/Legends|skiff]] and landed it next to the Fountain to begin the process of taking the samples. However, the group was quickly [[Violation|attacked]] by [[Homeworld/Legends|native]] [[Klatooinian/Legends|Klatooinians]] [[Fountain Security|defending]] the Fountain. As modern technology was forbidden within a one-[[Kilometer/Legends|kilometer]] distance of the Fountain, the guards only carried archaic weapons and were not perceived as a threat by Kaara and her companions. That changed when Kaara was hit by an [[Acid/Legends|acid]] [[Missile/Legends|missile]] that began to tear through her [[Armor/Legends|armor]] and skin. Despite the immense pain she suffered, Kaara [[Death/Legends|succumbed]] to her wounds without uttering a word of pain.<ref name="Allies" />

name: Crian Maru
description: Crian Maru was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] during the time of the uprising of the Sith [[Brotherhood of Darkness]]. As an apprentice, Crian had taken on the young Rodian female, Dree Vandap. At the time of Crian's role as a teacher, the Jedi were at war with the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], and Crian had taken on the mission of locating and dealing with the Dark Sider known as the Marauder, the Madman, and the Dark Killer, [[Kaox Krul]]. Traveling across the galaxy in her ship, the ''Golden Song'', Crian and her apprentice had tracked Kaox Krul to the planet [[Harpori]] in the [[Balowa system]]. Following the Madman`s trail of massacres and darkness, Crian and her apprentice finally pinpointed Kaox`s location.However, the Marauder got the jump on the two Jedi and in a daring space battle, Kaox engaged the duo. Although they survived his attack, their ship was greatly damaged. As Kaox attempted to finish them off, the two Jedi crippled the dark sider's own ship sending it to the planet's surface below. Damaged beyond capability of flight, the Jedi brought the ship to a safe landing only made possible by [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], both the Jedi and Madman were able to survive their crash. However, the Jedi were not safe; for Kaox was unwavering in his goal to destroy them. The Jedi managed to salvage a speeder bike from the wreckage of the ''Golden Song'' and began to flee the area; hoping to avoid Krul until they could regroup.Before they were able to flee however, Kaox Krul engaged Dree in battle as Crian readied the speeder bike for take-off. She managed to start it, snatching Dree upon the bike as she drove off into the forest.Empowered with dark side energies, Kaox was able to pursue the fleeing Jedi at amazing speed; catching them and destroying their bike with his blade. The lightsaber strike to the speeder caused Kaox to lose his balance, allowing Crian and Dree an escape on foot. For two days Crian was able to keep her and her apprentice ahead of Krul, but eventually he drew closer.Kaox approached the Jedi Knight at a lake in the forest where she had stopped to rest. Realizing that she could no longer run from the Madman, Crian engaged him in a fierce battle. It took all of Crian's strength in the Force to keep up with Kaox and the two traded blow after blow until Dree jumped into the battle herself, forcing Kaox to fight an adversary on each side. Using the Force to send Crian flying into the lake, Kaox vaulted over Crian's apprentice, landing behind her to deliver a killing blow. Mortified at the loss of her apprentice, Crian gave into the anger that was deep within her. Crian and Krul eventually took their battle over the surface of the lake, using the dark energies to hover above the water. With so much energy pouring into keeping themselves in the air, the two impaled each other simultaneously. Crian's body disappeared, becoming [[Force ghost|one with the Force]] as well as Krul's body.

name: Jella
description: Jella worked as a member of a crew of a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]]. In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], the craft was rented by tourists in the [[Cularin system]], and Jella helped to fly them from the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Tolea Biqua]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]] to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Uffel]]. She spent the journey aboard the shuttle's flight deck, along with her fellow crew member, [[Roya]].

name: Roya
description: In [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Roya worked as a member of a crew of a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] until the craft was rented by tourists in the [[Cularin system]], and she helped to fly them from the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Tolea Biqua]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Genarius]] to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Uffel]]. She spent the journey aboard the shuttle's flight deck, along with her fellow crew member, [[Jella]].

name: Kirasha
description: Kirasha was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and was raised in a foster home in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Hedrett]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], where she was teased by the other children. At some point she murdered her foster family and left the home to become a follower of the [[Wyrd]], a group of [[Tarasin]] [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Witch/Legends|witches]] who lived on Cularin. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the [[Liriana|leader of the Wyrd]] sensed that the followers [[Dariana]], the leader of the Tarasin [[Hiironi irstat]], had lost a lot of power. Kirasha was sent to investigate what was causing the drain in their energies, and the Wyrd leader planned to exploit the phenomena, so as to cause Dariana's demise.For four days, Kirasha searched Tarasin holy sites for any clues, but failed to learn anything and was brought close to despair. Eventually, she found some fresh tracks near to a remote Hiironi irstat ceremony circle, then began to meditate, to try and learn what had occurred there. However, while she meditated, the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Darrus Jeht]] spotted her and approached the circle. Recognizing her as a member of the Wyrd, Jeht planned to kill her and approach her without her noticing him. However, he found himself unable to go through with the deed and could not just murder her, even though he believed that thousands of people could die if she learned about the plans of the Tarasin.Through her meditation, Kirasha sensed a hidden chamber nearby, where Force-sensitive individuals were hiding, and also sensed the love of the people inside the cavern. She eventually noticed Jeht holding his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] at her and asked him to kill her, so he told her that he couldn't. He then offered to take her to the cavern and give her a place there. She accepted, and began casting out the ways of the Wyrd from her mind, redeeming herself from the dark side of the Force.

name: Adria Reyn
description: Adria Reyn was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] who [[Politics/Legends|politically]] maneuvered herself through the ranks of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] to highly favorable positions of authority. After many illicit dealings, she was eventually appointed [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] of the [[Callia sector]] of the [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]], home of the Imperial [[Prison/Legends|prison]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Vaxal]].<ref name="Poly 108" /> Prior to the rise of the Empire, the [[Oubliette (shadowport)|Oubliette]] [[Shadowport/Legends|shadowport]] on Ord Vaxal had been the site of an underground [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] ring<ref name="Poly 105">{{PolyhedronCite|165|Ord Vaxal: Prison Planet of the Empire}}, p. 105</ref> led by the Hutt [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Sassallo]].<ref name="Poly 107">{{PolyhedronCite|165|Ord Vaxal: Prison Planet of the Empire}}, p. 107</ref> Though Sassallo was able to bypass the pre-existing [[Blockade/Legends|blockade]] above Ord Vaxal, her operations came to a halt when [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] declared himself [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]] and increased security measures around the blockade, forcing the Hutt to turn to Moff Reyn.<ref name="Poly 106" />Unbeknown to Reyn, some of the second parties she utilized in her more unlawful dealings were also employed to Sassallo. Shortly after the strengthening of the blockade, Reyn was confronted by Sassallo's [[operative]]s, who used their knowledge of the Moff's private exploits as leverage for negotiations concerning the blockade's tight security. Left with little choice, Reyn reluctantly allowed the slavers to blackmail her<ref name="Poly 108" /> and, within [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]], she secretly rearranged the [[sensor net]] around Ord Vaxal to allow for a narrow access corridor leading to the Oubliette shadowport for the slavers' use.<ref name="Poly 106" /> Despite being unhappy with the arrangement, Reyn was paid well by Sassallo for keeping the route open,<ref name="Poly 108" /> and over the next few years the Moff expanded upon her position of authority within the [[Sector/Legends|sector]].<ref name="Poly 106" />

name: Leeta Poandeu
description: In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Leeta worked in the [[Aggregate Civil Liberties Organization|A.C.L.O]] office, east of [[Dearic]] on [[Talus/Legends|Talus]]. While working with the A.C.L.O, Leeta sliced the personal computer of [[Galiir Ac Yandar]], representative of their rivals, the [[Nightstrike Soldier Hegemony]] or N.S.H. By slicing Galiir's computer, Leeta planted incriminating evidence, which made it seem as though Galiir was putting the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] in a bad light. Fortunately for Galiir, he was cleared of any wrongdoings, but wanted revenge against the person who had sliced his computer.Galiir discussed his plight with a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] who was working for [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Braedic Ekirk]]. He informed the spacer that he was certain the slicer was a member of the A.C.L.O. He did not, however, know which member was responsible for the slicing. Galiir sent the spacer to the A.C.L.O officer, where an undercover operative, [[Mark Hieks]], was working for the N.S.H. The spacer was tasked with finding out more information, so that the culprit could be determined.After killing a number of A.C.L.O members, the spacer discovered a [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]] which indicated that Leeta Poandeu was the slicer. The spacer went to the second floor of the office, and entered the central computer control room. Immediately, the spacer began attacking Leeta, who in turn fired back. However, it was no use. Leeta was being outmatched by the spacer, and she soon feel to the ground lifeless.

name: Borra Setas
description: {{Quote|I shouldn't have told you even that much! I guess at this point, if I'm dead, I'm dead. Fine. I discovered that a major crime figure here is putting political pressure on someone in Mos Eisley. I won't say more than that though.|Borra Setas|Star Wars Galaxies}}During [[1 ABY/Legends|1.5 ABY]], [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] Borra Setas resided in the [[City/Legends|town]] of [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics}}During this time, a female [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[entertainer]] named [[Anetia Kah'ryn]] tasked a novice entertainer with gathering information from [[Crix Yarrow]], [[Dorn Gestros]], and Borra Setas concerning criminal activity in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]]. When the entertainer traveled to Anchorhead and approached Borra Setas, she said it would probably be best not to talk to her. The entertainer asked why, and mentioned that Borra looked sad. Borra then lashed back that she was not sad, but rather scared due to the position she was in. When the entertainer said it could not be that bad, Borra yelled that the entertainer was not the one who upset a major crime boss, later revealed to be [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. The entertainer asked Borra for more information, at which point she grew dismayed at saying too much already. Feel as though her life was already at stake, she decided to may as well divulge more information. She informed the spacer that she discovered a major crime figure was putting political pressure on someone in Mos Eisley. However, she refused to reveal anymore information. Afterwards, the entertainer returned to Anetia Kah'ryn to bring back this information, and await further instructions.{{Endgame}}

name: Carh'la Bastra
description: {{Quote|A shipment that I am interested in has been acquired by three different groups. A Jawa trading party, Valarians and Darklighters.|Carh'la Bastra, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Captain Carh'la Bastra was stationed in [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]], on the planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], where she recruited new members to join the Rebellion's cause.<ref name="SWG:StS" /> Her immediate superior was [[Special Agent]] [[Wilson Tchorshel]].<ref name="SWG:TN">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "To Naboo" on Tatooine</ref> During that time, she worked closely with [[Droma Ordo]], another Rebel Alliance member in Anchorhead.<ref name="SWG:StS" /> She was also associated with the [[White Thranta Shipping Company]], a front for illegal activities of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Jabba the Hutt's criminal organization]].<ref name="SWG:DI">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Digital Infection" on Tatooine</ref> The company [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggled]] most of its goods to the Rebellion.<ref name="TCSWE">{{CSWECite|III|329|White Thranta}}</ref>Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Bastra was tasked with finding a cargo arrived recently from [[Tansarii Point Station]]. The cargo was now lost among the various denizens on Tatooine and both Rebel and [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] were very interested in finding it. Fortunately, a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] agreed to help Bastra, instead of Imperial [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Arlan Barrezz|Barrezz]].<ref name="SWG:StS" />Captain Bastra first tasked the spacer with finding the inventory of the cargo content that was acquired by a [[Sand Crawler 345|group]] of [[Jawa/Legends|Jawa]] traders. The Jawas had recently been spotted at [[Tosche Station/Legends|Tosche Station]], near [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]]. There, the spacer learnt from the manager [[Cuan Talon]] that he should ask his warehouse manager [[Janus]] but the latter had already been killed by [[Desert Demons]].<ref name="SWG:TS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Tosche Station" on Tatooine</ref> From Janus' datapd, the spacer recovered the first part of the cargo data and discovered that the Jawa had also visited the [[Lars homestead]]. At the homestead, [[Zef Ando]] agreed to give the inventory of what he bought from the Jawas.<ref name="SWG:LH">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Lars Homestead" on Tatooine</ref> The spacer finally reached the Jawa sandcrawler in the [[Western Dune Sea/Legends|Western Dune Sea]] but it was under attack from [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]]. The spacer attacked the Tusken Raiders and rescued the Jawas and the droid [[FA-2PO]]. The spacer later recovered Jawa encryption keys from the Tusken Raiders and finally accessed to the sandcrawler database.<ref name="SWG:JT">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Jawa Tracks" on Tatooine</ref>Bastra then tasked the spacer with going to the [[Valarian Depot]] near [[Bestine (city)/Legends|Bestine]]. It turned out that the [[Valarian Syndicate|Valarian]] crime syndicate aquired a portion of the lost cargo. Despite the number of guards patrolling the depot, the spacer did a complete inventory, by checking the manifests on the cargo pallets.<ref name="SWG:VH">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Valarian Haul" on Tatooine</ref> Bastra immediately tasked the spacer with going to the [[Darklighter family|Darklighter]] [[Darklighter cache|cache]] near their [[Darklighter estate|estate]] as it appeared that some of the cargo ended up in their hands. However, the Darklighter guard [[Draci]] informed the spacer that Desert Demon had overrun the cave. The spacer fought his way in the cache and  managed to do a complete inventory.<ref name="SWG:DC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Darklighter Cache" on Tatooine</ref>Carh'la Bastra then requested the spacer to deliver the data to her [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]], [[Jem Lavar]]. The spacer had first to rescue Lavar from a group of [[Smuggler/Legends|gunrunners]]. Jem Lavar analyzed the inventory data from the Jawas, the Darklighter and the Valarians and finally discovered that the [[R2-series astromech droid|R2 unit]] that both the Empire and the Rebellion were looking for was bought by the [[Junk dealer/Legends|junk dealer]] [[Watto/Legends|Watto]].<ref name="SWG:RS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Rebel Spy" on Tatooine</ref>The spacer was tasked by Bastra to retrieve the droids and thus headed to [[Wald's Parts|Watto's Shop]] in [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]]. There, the spacer learnt that the droids was already sold in spare parts. Nevertheless, Watto agreed to re-assemble the droid if the spacer was able to get all the parts.<ref name="SWG:WB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Watto's Bargain" on Tatooine</ref> The spacer obtained the droid body from [[Ji'Ni Sil]] in the [[Jawa Mountain Fortress]],<ref name="SWG:BB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Body Building" on Tatooine</ref> the legs from [[Syndil Na'Marr]] and a [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] pilot,<ref name="SWG:LW">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Leg Work" on Tatooine</ref> the [[Motivator/Legends|motivator]] from one of [[An'Kwee]]'s death [[Podracing/Legends|podracer]] pilot friend,<ref name="SWG:PR">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Pod Retrieval" on Tatooine</ref> the motivator booster controller from [[Hilbrun|Pah]] and his gang,<ref name="SWG:RM">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Repo Man" on Tatooine</ref> the diagnostic controller in the [[Squill Cave]],<ref name="SWG:SD">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Squill Diving" on Tatooine</ref> and finally the head from [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]]'s [[Supervisor droid/Legends|supervisor droid]] [[EV-9D9/Legends|EV-9D9]].<ref name="SWG:TtH">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Tracking the Head" on Tatooine</ref><ref name="SWG:R">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Runaways" on Tatooine</ref> When the spacer returned to the shop with all parts, Watto finally helped re-assemble the droid.<ref name="SWG:PiT">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Putting it Together" on Tatooine</ref> From the reassembled droid, the spacer was able to recover the information both the Empire and the Rebellion were looking for. Carh'la Bastra ordered the spacer to immediately transmit the data to Special Agent Tchorshel on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]].<ref name="SWG:TN" />

name: Lelli Hi
description: Lelli Hi was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] who lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]]. At some point during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], Hi was imprisoned inside the [[Chamber of Banishment]] on Dathomir, where her life essence was trapped inside a large [[Crystal/Legends|crystal]]. Sometime after [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] entered the chamber, causing Hi to be freed from her crystal. She then proceeded to attack them, but was eventually [[Death/Legends|killed]].

name: Neeka Z'all
description: {{Quote|I know her. Her parents escaped recently and left her here.|[[Gordo Zek]], to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Neeka Z'all was a child who lived on Corellia with her parents [[Zorgom Z'all|Zorgom]] and [[Norith Z'all]].<ref name="SWG:FC" /> At some point, Neeka and her family were captured by [[Faye Patrick]] who sold them to the [[Corellian slavers]].<ref name="SWG:TtB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Talk to Bandor" on Corellia</ref> The Z'all family was [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] in the [[Corellian Slaver Bunker]] near [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]].<ref name="SWG:FC" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Zorgom and Norith managed to escape the bunker, along with a group of slaves led by [[Kyran Silene]]. Unfortunately, they lost Neeka in the escape and the girl was catch up. The escaped slaved did not reach Tyrena and established a camp in the wilderness. After her parents escaped, Neeka was removed from general population and put in a disciplinary cell.<ref name="SWG:FC" /> A spacer recruited by Kyran Silene's [[Madison Silene|wife]] later arrived at the camp of the escaped slaves.<ref name="SWG:TtB" /> The spacer planed to infiltrate the bunker to find evidence of the slaver operations for the [[Corellian Security Force]].<ref name="SWG:IE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Incriminating Evidence" on Corellia</ref> The spacer also met Zorgom and Norith Z'all and agreed to rescue their daughter while going to the bunker. With the help of the slave [[Gordo Zek]], the spacer was able to find Neeka Z'all and helped her to escape the bunker. The child later returned to her parents.<ref name="SWG:FC" />

name: Vitala Baize
description: After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Vitala Baize held the [[Police rank|rank]] of [[Captain/Legends|captain]] in the [[Corellian Security Force]] and was stationed in the city of [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]].<ref name="SWG:SwCB" />[[File:VitalaBaizeSWG.jpg|thumb|left|230px|Captain Vitala Baize conducting business in Doaba Guerfel.]]At some point after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]],<ref name="Era">{{SWGTCG|set=Threat of the Conqueror|scenario=Light Side and Dark Side scenario campaigns}}</ref> Baize was tasked with infiltrating the [[Chirq Council]],<ref name="Card">{{SWGTCG|set=Threat of the Conqueror|cardname=Vitala Baize}}</ref> a criminal organization based on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]],<ref name="Galaxies">{{SWG|An Empire Divided}}</ref> and locating its leaders. She was armed with a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] and dressed in a Corellian [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|Security Force]] uniform during the operation.<ref name="Card" /> At some point she was in charge of security in the norther area of the Corellian [[City/Legends|city]] [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]], where she assigned a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] to infiltrate the Council as well.<ref name="Galaxies" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Raptor (Trandoshan)
description: Raptor worked as an enforcer for the [[Human/Legends|Human]] criminal [[Vex (Human)|Vex]]. During the time of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a group of couriers that were sent by Vex to collect some illicit cargo were attacked by thugs working for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Riboga]]. The only courier to survive was the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Gust Toruna]] and when Vex found him, he had Raptor beat up the unfortunate Twi'lek. Toruna claimed that he had been killed and then brought back to life. To test this, Vex ordered Raptor to shoot Toruna and see if he would survive. Raptor complied and Toruna was killed by the shot.

name: Dina Whisper
description: {{Quote|Don't hurt me. I'll go quietly.|Dina Whisper|Star Wars Galaxies}}Sometime following [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] started to suspect that Whisper was selling information about the Empire's operations to the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]]. [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Hume Tarl]] enlisted the help of an Imperial agent to track Whisper down and arrest her. During questioning, Whisper revealed the location of a small [[Black market/Legends|black market]] outpost near [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet]] where information and weapons were sold to the Rebel Alliance.

name: Brantlee Spondoon
description: {{Quote|Brantlee Spondoon, the aide to the Diktat, has personally requested your assistance. You've been summoned to go speak with Brantlee. How exciting!|[[Gallura Handerin]], to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Brantlee Spondoon worked in the [[Coronet Capitol|Capitol building]] of [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet City]] as the aide to the [[Diktat]] [[Daclif Gallamby]].<ref name="SWG:HGtII" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Brantlee Spondoon received word from an informant about a plot in motion to discredit the Diktat and his administration. She thus recruited a spacer who had previously worked for the [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]] government with [[Gallura Handerin]]. She tasked the spacer to meet with the  informant in a [[Warehouse (Coronet City)|warehouse]] in Coronet. However, when the spacer arrived in the warehouse, the informant was assassinated by a group of criminals made of former members of the [[Corellian Security Force]], the [[Rogue CorSec]]. The spacer tried to recover the informant's hidden datadisk but was unable to do so. The spacer then reported the situation to Spondoon who was very disappointed and worried that the information was lost. Brantlee Spondoon ignored that the spacer was in fact working for CorSec [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Mack Jasper]].<ref name="SWG:HGtII" /> Jasper and the spacer decided to investigate the Rogue CorSec,<ref name="SWG:FowtRCAD">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Find out what the Rogue CorSec Are Doing" on Corellia</ref> and were finally able to foil the plot against the Diktat.<ref name="SWG:RtToaGD">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Receive the Thanks of a Grateful Diktat" on Corellia</ref>

name: Gallura Handerin
description: {{Quote|Go see my cousin in the capitol building. Gallura can put you to good use. I'll send word to her to expect you as well as a glowing recommendation.|[[Pol Handerin]], to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Gallura Handerin worked in the [[Coronet Capitol|Capitol building]] of [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet City]] as a high level government aide.<ref name="SWG:WftG" /> She had a cousin who lived on the outskirts of Coronet, the farmer [[Pol Handerin]].<ref name="SWG:HFPH">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Help Farmer Pol Handerin" on Corellia</ref>Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Gallura Handerin recruited a spacer who previously worked with Pol Handerin to fulfill several missions. She first requested the spacer to check all the government drop boxes in Coronet City. She then asked the spacer to recover a [[Stormtrooper armor/Legends|stormtrooper armor]] stolen from an [[Imperial officer/Legends|Imperial officer]] in the Capitol. She was very satisfied when the spacer brought back the armor even before the officer could notice the robbery. Eventually, Handerin tasked the spacer to find a missing government courier. However, the courier was assassinated by the criminal [[Preens B'oola]] in order to steal the government documents that the courier was carrying. B'oola asked for a huge ransom of 1,000,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] but the spacer killed him and recovered the documents. For all those services, Gallura Handerin then recommended the spacer to [[Brantlee Spondoon]], the aide to the [[Diktat]].<ref name="SWG:WftG" />

name: Kippy Martin
description: {{Quote|Do you have a security beacon from Stonewall Labs?''"<br />"''Yes. Yes I do. Well, no actually I don't. I buried it. I was hoping it would grow into a beacon tree. So far, nothing, but I haven't given up hope. It's only been a few years. I still think it'll sprout into something.|A spacer and Kippy Martin|Star Wars Galaxies}}Kippy Martin took up residence on the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of Naboo. By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], she worked as a [[Security officer/Legends|security officer]] at [[Stonewall Labs]], along with [[Walker Luskeske]], under the orders of the [[Chief of Security|Security Chief]] [[Vance Groten]]. However, she had to quit after falling off a [[Speeder/Legends|speeder]] while reaching close to top speed. Kippy was not badly hurt, but she was never the same since the accident.<ref name="SWG:FaSB" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Kippy Martin stayed at a camp in the [[Gallo Mountains/Legends|Gallo Mountains]] near [[Dee'ja Peak/Legends|Dee'ja Peak]]. While there, she was pestered by a swarm of starving [[flewt]]s. A spacer who was looking for a security beacon from Stonewall Labs accepted to kill the creatures to help her.<ref name="SWG:FaSB" />

name: Tanoa Vills
description: {{Quote|My my, Tanoa still does quite good work.|Professor Zanier Hudmasse, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Tanoa Vills was a technician of [[Stonewall Labs]] until the company was closed by the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]].<ref name="SWG:GtTV" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> she met a spacer who was trying to acquire an [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Old Republic]] droid module from Stonewall Labs. She accepted to build a sequencer that can be used in a Stonewall Labs security beacon for [[Professor/Legends|Professor]] [[Zanier Hudmasse]]. She tasked the spacer to find three component: an [[XJ5 circuit board]], some fractal transmitters, and some octave regulators. The spacer first acquired an XJ5 circuit board from [[Mummers|Mummer]] scientists in the [[Mummer Cave]]. The spacer then found fractal transmitters in old data terminals in the Dee'ja Peak junkyard. The spacer finally got octave regulators from [[Skaak Tippers|Skaak Tipper]] machinists in the [[Skaak Tipper Cave]].<ref name="SWG:GtPfaS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Get the Parts for a Sequencer" on Naboo</ref> Tanoa Vills later requested the spacer to investigate a [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] that just crashed in the [[Gallo Mountains/Legends|Gallo Mountains]]. She needed the spacer to eliminate rabid [[Narglatch/Legends|narglatches]], including [[Grizzlefur]], that gathered at the crash site in order to salvage research equipment.<ref name="SWG:StEatCS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Salvage the Equipment at the Crashed Shuttle" on Naboo</ref> However, the [[Darkwalkers]] plundered the crash site before.<ref name="SWG:FowtDtfCS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Find out what the Darkwalkers took from the Crashed Shuttle" on Naboo</ref> Vills thus asked the spacer to raid the [[Darkwalker Cave (Dee'ja Peak)|Darkwalker Cave]] nearby to recover a stolen [[Bioscan/Legends|bio-scanner]]. When the spacer returned to her, Tanoa Vills gave the completed sequencer requested by Professor Hudmasse to the spacer.<ref name="SWG:RtsBS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Recover the stolen Bio-Scanner" on Naboo</ref>

name: Seyda Shae
description: After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Seyda Shae was a member of the [[Chirq Council]] in the city of [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]]. She worked alongside [[Human/Legends|Human]] adjutant [[Genovin Jasha]].<ref name="SWG:TCCAI" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> the [[Corellian Security Force]] started an investigation against the Chirq Council following the increase of [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]] traffic on Corellia.<ref name="SWG:TCCSC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Seek Council" on Corellia</ref> [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vitala Baize]] decided to infiltrate the organization with a CorSec agent using the identity of one of the Chirq Council members: [[Trins Evnar]]. After killing him, the agent also eliminated every Chirq Council criminals who used to know Evnar in order to permit the infiltration mission. The agent thus killed [[Jade McDonagh]] and [[Kazic Pendre]], as well as Seyda Shae and Genovin Jasha in a small camp outside Doaba Guerfel.<ref name="SWG:TCCAI" /> The spacer later assumed Trins Evnar's identity towards the underboss [[Jzoro Quanera]] and managed to infiltrate the organization.<ref name="SWG:TCCMU">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Moving Up" on Corellia</ref> The CorSec operation eventually led to the destruction of the Chirq Council.<ref name="SWG:TCCTEC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: The Elite Council" on Corellia</ref>

name: Ebela Puckett
description: After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Ebela Puckett and the Grey Shroud terrorists were [[Grey Shroud Terrorist Base|based]] in the [[Thaos Mountains]], near the city of [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]].<ref name="SWG:TCCMU" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> [[Corellian Security Force|CorSec]] agents led by [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vitala Baize]] assaulted the base and killed Ebela Puckett. The assault was part of a larger operation which aim was to infiltrate an agent among the criminal organization known as the [[Chirq Council]]. The true objective of the assault against the Grey Shroud was to demonstrate the loyalty of the agent to the Chirq Council. The CorSec agent pretended that Ebela Puckett was an informant tasked by the CorSec to spy the Council. With the support of manufactured evidences, the agent managed to convince the Chirq Council underboss [[Jzoro Quanera]] that this story was real and successfully infiltrated the organization.<ref name="SWG:TCCMU" />

name: Lilea Norith
description: After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Lilea Norith and [[Ventil Tamplin]] were leading a group of Ragtag cudgels in the city of [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]].<ref name="SWG:TCCSC" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> they harassed the small-time thug [[Lilith Laughlin]] because they suspected her to be an informant for the [[Corellian Security Force]]. In fact, they were right and Laughlin was actually working for the CorSec. During the CorSec investigation against the criminal organization known as the [[Chirq Council]], [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vitala Baize]] needed information from Lilith Laughlin. She therefore dispatched an agent to deal with her Ragtag problem. The CorSec agent fought the Ragtag cudgels who bothered the informant and killed some of them, including Lilea Norith.<ref name="SWG:TCCSC" />

name: Xyrias Undea
description: {{Quote|I can't believe you actually took out those rogue CorSec. Okay, I'll tell you what I know.|Gwhirrye Baric, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Xyrias Undea was leading a group of Rogue CorSec criminals in [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]].<ref name="SWG:TCCSC" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> they harassed [[Gwhirrye Baric]], a small-time thug who ran a [[Spice/Legends|spice]] racket out of a small hospital in Doaba Guerfel. A CorSec agent working for [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vitala Baize]] accepted to help Gwhirrye with his problem and killed several Rogue CorSec miscreants, including Xyrias Undea. In return, Gwhirrye Baric agreed with helping the CorSec to investigate the [[Chirq Council]].<ref name="SWG:TCCSC" />

name: Dustrose
description: Discovered at an early age to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Dustrose was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] at the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] largest [[Jedi academy|academy]], the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] Ascending to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], Dustrose was dispatched to [[Baltizaar/Legends|Baltizaar]] with a task force of other Knights assigned to wipe out the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side cult]] known as the [[Bando Gora/Legends|Bando Gora]]. However, the Jedi were outmatched by the dark-siders and most were slain; the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] believed Dustrose to be among the casualties. However, she survived and joined fellow survivor [[Nikkos Tyris]] in falling to the dark side and traveling with the [[Anzat (species)|Anzati]] Jedi's group to [[Susevfi]].<ref name="IJ" />On Susevfi, Tyris led his followers down the path to the dark side, studying an ancient ancient [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] manuscript to learn their dark techniques. The cult, which Tyris dubbed the [[Jensaarai]], would grow into a large enough threat to cause the Jedi High Council and the secret [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lords of the Sith]] concern. As the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] erupted between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Dustrose continued to stay loyal to Tyris. The group was approached by [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], leader of the Confederacy and the alter ego of [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Dooku/Legends|Darth Tyranus]]. Dooku gifted Tyris with a [[Sith holocron/Legends|Sith holocron]] favored by former Anzati Jedi [[Volfe Karkko]] and convinced the cult leader to join the Separatist war effort. Granting the Jensaarai members the title of [[Dark Acolyte]]s within the ranks of the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]], Dustrose was stationed with Tyris on Susevfi during the final days of the war.<ref name="IJ" />A month before the war would end, the Jedi Order dispatched the Knights [[Nejaa Halcyon]], [[Ylenic It'kla]], and ''[[Desertwind]]'' to remove the Jensaarai leadership. Attacking their fortress on Susevfi, the Jedi engaged Tyris, Dustrose, and [[Sukarr|another loyal follower]], in an attempt to remove the Jensaari from the war. Over the course of the fighting, all three Jensaarai fell, with Jedi It'kla delivering the fatal blow to Dustrose.<ref name="IJ" />

name: Jade McDonagh
description: After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Jade McDonagh was a member of the [[Chirq Council]] in the city of [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]] where she also had a small [[Junk dealer/Legends|junk business]].<ref name="SWG:TCCAI" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> the [[Corellian Security Force]] started an investigation against the Chirq Council following the increase of [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]] traffic on Corellia.<ref name="SWG:TCCSC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Seek Council" on Corellia</ref> [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vitala Baize]] decided to infiltrate the organization with a CorSec agent using the identity of one of the Chirq Council members: [[Trins Evnar]]. After killing him, the agent also eliminated every Chirq Council criminals who used to know Evnar in order to permit the infiltration mission. The agent thus killed [[Seyda Shae]], [[Genovin Jasha]] and [[Kazic Pendre]], as well as Jade McDonagh.<ref name="SWG:TCCAI" /> The spacer later assumed Trins Evnar's identity towards the underboss [[Jzoro Quanera]] and managed to infiltrate the organization.<ref name="SWG:TCCMU">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Moving Up" on Corellia</ref> The CorSec operation eventually led to the destruction of the Chirq Council.<ref name="SWG:TCCTEC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: The Elite Council" on Corellia</ref>

name: Anyza Ekull
description: {{Quote|Did he do something to you?''"<br />"''Yes...just kill him. I don't want to talk about it. Just...trust me, he deserves to die.|A spacer and Anyza Ekull, about the slavemaster|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Anyza Ekull was captured by the [[Corellian slavers]] and [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] in the [[Corellian Slaver Bunker]] near [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]]. During her captivity, she was brutally treated and abused by the slavemaster.<ref name="SWG:S" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Anyza finally managed to escape the bunker with a group of slaves led by [[Kyran Silene]]. The escaped slaves did not reach Tyrena and established a camp in the wilderness. Nevertheless, Anyza remained deeply traumatized by the mistreatment and abuse commited by the slavemaster.<ref name="SWG:S" /> A spacer recruited by Kyran Silene's [[Madison Silene|wife]] later arrived at the camp.<ref name="SWG:TtB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Talk to Bandor" on Corellia</ref> The spacer planed to infiltrate the bunker to find evidence of the slaver operations for the [[Corellian Security Force]].<ref name="SWG:IE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Incriminating Evidence" on Corellia</ref> The spacer also met Anyza Ekull. The woman refused to explain what the slavemaster did to her and begged the spacer to kill the slavemaster. Once in the bunker, the spacer fought and eventually killed the slavemaster. Anyza Ekull was very grateful to the spacer and confessed that she might start recovering now.<ref name="SWG:S" />

name: Norith Z'all
description: {{Quote|You're going to find my daughter? Good. Maybe you can be the man my husband isn't.|Norith Z'all, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Norith Z'all lived on Corellia with her husband [[Zorgom Z'all|Zorgom]] and her daughter [[Neeka Z'all|Neeka]].<ref name="SWG:FC" /> At some point, Norith and his family were captured by [[Faye Patrick]] who sold them to the [[Corellian slavers]].<ref name="SWG:TtB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Talk to Bandor" on Corellia</ref> The Z'all family was [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] in the [[Corellian Slaver Bunker]] near [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]].<ref name="SWG:FC" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Zorgom and Norith managed to escape the bunker, along with a group of slaves led by [[Kyran Silene]]. Unfortunately, they lost their child in the escape and Neeka was catch up. The escaped slaved did not reach Tyrena and established a camp in the wilderness.<ref name="SWG:FC" /> A spacer recruited by Kyran Silene's [[Madison Silene|wife]] later arrived at the camp.<ref name="SWG:TtB" /> The spacer planed to infiltrate the bunker to find evidence of the slaver operations for the [[Corellian Security Force]].<ref name="SWG:IE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Incriminating Evidence" on Corellia</ref> The spacer also met Zorgom and Norith Z'all and agreed to rescue their daughter while going to the bunker. With the help of the slave [[Gordo Zek]], the spacer was able to find Neeka Z'all and helped her to escape the bunker. The child later returned to her parents.<ref name="SWG:FC" />

name: Tori Radeen
description: Tori Radeen was a biochemist<ref name="SWGTCGPOGG">''[[Star Wars Galaxies: The Complete Guide: Prima Official Game Guide]]'', p. 85</ref> who operated out of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]].<ref name="SWG:FT" /> She was known among [[Spy/Legends|spies]] for supplying some of the deadliest poisons in the galaxy.<ref name="JDW" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Tori Radeen asked a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] working for [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]] to go into the cave and bring her the poison glands of [[bone gnasher]]s that lived in the [[Krayt Cult Cave]]. She used the glands to create a new poison for use by Jabba.<ref name="SWG:BG">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Bone Gnasher" on Tatooine</ref><ref name="JDW" />

name: Avrey
description: In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], she was present with [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], and [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] onboard the [[Indomitable (Republic cruiser)|''Indomitable'']]. She was instructed by [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Wullf Yularen/Legends|Yularen]] to remain on the ship when the Republic fleet made their way to [[Kothlis/Legends|Kothlis]] and prepare for their defense against the Separatist fleet under the command of [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]]. When the fleet came out of hyperspace, Avrey saw that the internal and external communication systems from the fleet were not working and discovered that it was virus which was activated by Grievous. After proposing a solution, she was able to repair the technology, allowing the fleet to successfully win the battle. After the battle ended, she asked Obi-Wan to secure a connection to the [[Jedi Temple]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Suu Lawquane/Legends
description: [[File:Suufamily.png|thumb|left|200px|Suu Lawquane and her family]]

name: Teilo Monnro
description: {{Quote|Now I'm finally free from Hrath's menace. Such a relief, I cannot tell you.|Teilo Monnro, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Teilo Monnro ran a shop in the city of [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]].<ref name="SWG:HKMD" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> she had trouble with a local member of the technology-hating [[Meatlumps|Meatlump gang]]. The Meatlump [[Hrath Koo]] repeatedly came into her shop and smashed whatever she was working on. After several of these incidents, Monnro was fed up. She tracked Koo to [[Meatlump Cave|a cave]] near Tyrena that the Meatlumps used as their base of operations. She couldn't attack the Meatlumps on her own, but she was lucky and met an adventurer who was working as an independent agent for [[Corellian Security Force|CorSec]].<ref name="SWG:HKMD" /> The adventurer was investigating a Meatlump attack on the [[Captain/Legends#Civilian use|starship captain]] [[Osto Grissom]]<ref name="SWG:CCFAaB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "CorSec Case Files: Assault and Battery" on Corellia</ref> and agreed to help her with her problem. When the adventurer emerged from the cave again, Monnro was reliefed to learn, that Koo would no longer bother her.<ref name="SWG:HKMD" />

name: Dair Coladel
description: In her youth, Dair Coladel enjoyed consuming [[kelsen-briar]] [[Fruit/Legends|fruits]], which [[Dair Coladel's father|her father]] often caught her stealing. She was stationed aboard a Rebel [[Starship/Legends|starship]] orbiting the [[Endor/Legends|Endor]] [[Moon/Legends|moon]] shortly after the pivotal [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]]. While most of the Alliance's personnel were celebrating their victory on the surface of the moon, Coladel was one of the few individuals to remain on duty to monitor the immediate [[Realspace/Legends|space]] around the Alliance [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] and the remnants of the [[Death Star II/Legends|second Death Star]]. Tired and hungry after being on duty for fourteen hours, Coladel soon detected an unidentified energy spike in the low band [[subspace]] range originating from Endor. She initially believed it to be a residual shock wave from the Death Star's destruction, but, following her instincts, she decided to notify her [[Commander/Legends|commander]] about the spike.

name: Abominelle
description: Around [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]], on the eve of her wedding, Abominelle was touring the [[Fire Rings of Fornax]] on Fornax Station when she was interrupted by the smuggler Han Solo and his co-pilot [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]]. During their interaction, Solo insulted Abominelle and walked off, leaving the Royal Margravine speechless.<ref name="FRR" />Later that night, her [[Shimmersilk/Legends|Tyrian shimmersilk]] wedding dress was stolen by the station's security officer, [[Smurdap]], as part of his plot to blackmail Chewbacca and Solo into turning over their contraband. While Solo remained oblivious, he was alerted to the plan after his attention was drawn by Abominelle's screaming. He, again, walked away after insulting her for making a scene.<ref name="FRR" />Her dress was returned after Smurdap was outwitted and under custody. The next time that she saw Solo, she told him that she had called off her wedding because she was in love with someone else, implying that she was attracted to him. He politely took her hand when she offered it, before telling her that Chewbacca wanted to know whether there was a reward for returning her dress. Infuriated, Abominelle began screaming again.<ref name="FRR" />

name: Rixen
description: Around [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Rixen arrived at the [[Kuat Passenger Port]] after attempting to evade the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Spy/Legends|spy]] [[Do'naal]], who had been trailing her when she was at [[Byblos/Legends|Byblos]] earlier. At the port, she consulted a nondescript information [[Droid/Legends|droid]], [[L1V-IN]], who had been programmed by the Rebellion to serve as a drop point for information and secret messages between Alliance agents. Rixen gave the droid the code phrase needed to access the information, and the droid played back three messages for her. The first detailed the capture of Rebel agent [[Vewin]] by Imperial authorities [[Kelada/Legends|Kelada]], and the second informed Rixen that another agent, [[Stabris]], had fled to the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]] because of increased Imperial security in the Core Worlds and [[Colonies/Legends|Colonies]]. Upon hearing this, Rixen decided it would be best for her to flee the Core Worlds as well.<ref name="DED" />Rixen was surprised when the third message, from Do'naal, told her to surrender. Immediately after playing the message, she was surrounded by undercover [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]] agents. Rixen attempted to detonate a device that would [[Death/Legends|kill]] both her and the agents surrounding her, but Do'naal was able to apprehend her first. She was taken away by [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] to be held for interrogation by Do'naal in Imperial lock-up.<ref name="DED" />

name: Krin Vel
description: {{Quote|I had no idea Drik Bandrik was arranging a frame. As soon as I found out, I rushed back here. Please take me to Kitster!|Krin Vel, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Krin Vel was a friend of [[Kitster Chanchani Banai]].<ref name="SWG:KB" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> a [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]] named [[Drik Bandrik]] became upset with Kitster Banai's persistent attempts to improve the lives of slaves on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. In order to ruin Kitster, [[Drik Bandrik]] framed him with the murder of Krin Vel. Drik paid Krin to leave [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] long enough for local vigilante leader [[Sont Toipo]] to amass an angry mob to kill Kitster. At this point, Krin Vel ignored everything of the plot against her friend. This mob of moisture farmers believed Krin Vel to have been murdered.<ref name="SWG:KB" />However, a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] working for Kitster managed to kill Sont Toipo and frighten his mob. The spacer then proceeded to find Krin Vel, so that she could help Kitster clear his name. When the spacer found Krin, she insisted that she did not know she was being used in a frame. She pleaded with the spacer to be brought back to Mos Espa. The spacer brought her back to the [[City/Legends|city]], and Kitster claimed that with the help of Krin, they would see to it that Drik Bandrik went to [[Prison/Legends|prison]]. Fortunately for Kitster, Krin Vel assisted him amassing enough evidence to clear him of all of Drik's fake charges. The spacer was then tasked with delivering the evidence to a [[Kitonak/Legends|Kitonak]] named [[Thermal Det]], so that the information could be made public.<ref name="SWG:KB" />

name: Yuln
description: {{Quote|And many Jedi and Imperial Knights died, Yuln, proving they are ''weaker'' than we Sith."''<br />"''Sith perished as well, Bokar."''<br />"''Weaklings! Better they be culled from the ranks of the One Sith!|Bokar and Yuln|Legacy 48: Extremes, Part 1}}[[File:Rae kills Yuln.jpg|thumb|left|280px|Yuln is impaled by Azlyn Rae's lightsaber on Agamar.]]Yuln, a [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoid]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], served in [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Krayt]]'s [[One Sith|Sith Order]] during the [[Second Imperial Civil War]]. In [[137 ABY]], [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|Sith&ndash;Imperial]] forces traveled to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Agamar/Legends|Agamar]],<ref name="Legacy 48" /> intending to [[Operation: Thunderstroke|capture or kill]] [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exiled]] [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]]. After the battle, Yuln and fellow Sith [[Bokar]] were sent to Agamar's surface to search for Fel and [[Death/Legends|eliminate]] any of his surviving [[Imperial Knight]]s and [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] allies.<ref name="Legacy 48" />Three [[Time/Legends|days]] after the attack on Agamar, as the two Sith were searching for survivors of the battle, Yuln informed Bokar that all the remaining Jedi and Imperial Knights were dead. The two Sith began arguing over the strength of the Sith, Jedi, and Imperial Knights who perished during the battle. They were interrupted by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Rasi Tuum]], who slew Bokar, as Yuln was [[Shiak|impaled]] and killed by Imperial Knight [[Azlyn Rae]]'s [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="Legacy 48" />

name: Bant'ena Fhernan
description: Early in the war, she accompanied a research team to [[Niriktavi Bay]] on [[Taratos IV]], despite the misgivings of her mother, [[Mata Fhernan]]. While there, the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] invaded the planet, and murdered most of her colleagues and took her captive. She was given to [[Lok Durd/Legends|Lok Durd]], who forced her to create a [[Bioweapon/Legends|bioweapon]] that would turn organic matter to mush. She later met the two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Skywalker promised to free her and to save her loved ones that the Confederacy kept under constant surveillance. Durd found out about the arrangement and threatened her nephews, finally convincing Fhernan to give the two Jedi up to Durd. Although the Jedi, informed by Skywalker and Kenobi of Fhernan and her family, managed to rescue all but one of her friends and family, Fhernan remained unaware of their safety and continued to work for Durd, eventually resulting in a terrorist attack on [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrila]] using her weaponry.Fhernan immediately regretted allowing herself to be controlled by her loved ones, constantly thinking about how many mothers and fathers had been lost on Chandrila to innocent civilians. In the midst of this, the Jedi had sent reinforcements to Skywalker and Kenobi, and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Taria Damsin]] was sent to rescue Fhernan and destroy Durd's compound. Once it was discovered that there would be complications in both setting off the explosives and escaping, Fhernan volunteered to stay behind and set them off herself in an attempt to right all of her wrongs. Damsin agreed, and once she had cleared the area, Fhernan detonated the bombs, killing herself and destroying all of Durd's base.{{Char-stub}}

name: Veré
description: [[File:IIWdD015.jpg|thumb|right|125px|Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala marry on Naboo.]]Veré was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] figure from a myth regarding the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo's]] [[Futhork/Legends|Futhork]] script, in which she was the eternal lover of a man named [[Set]]. In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], immediately after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|First Battle of Geonosis]], these names were used as aliases by [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] and [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], respectively. Knowing [[Marriage/Legends|matrimony]] to be contrary to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] belief that such an attachment, [[Jedi Code/Legends|through passion]], brought one close to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], the young lovers used the archaic monikers to [[Wedding of Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala/Legends|anonymously marry]], not even allowing their pastor, [[Pontifex]] [[Maxiron Agolerga]], to know their true identities. "Set" and "Veré" were blissfully wed, and Agolerga was [[Mind trick/Legends|instructed]] to tell no one of the ceremony, ensuring the only record of the short procession would be a scroll in his [[Brotherhood of Cognizance|Brotherhood's]] archives.<ref name="Databank" /> When Agolerga eventually learned who they really were, he informed Amidala's niece, [[Pooja Naberrie/Legends|Pooja Naberrie]], of the union.<ref>[[Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force (real-life book)|''Jedi vs. Sith: The Essential Guide to the Force'']]</ref>

name: Brandeh
description: Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Brandeh assisted [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] [[Sufi]] when the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] was occupied by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] under the command of [[General/Legends|General]] [[Lok Durd/Legends|Lok Durd]], who was developing the newly-constructed bioweapon for the Separatist Alliance. Believing that Durd would promise to offer aid and supplies for the wounded, Brandeh and the villagers agreed to his statement. After some time, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], posing as [[Farmer/Legends|farmers]], arrived to warn the inhabitants about the Separatist's plot until one of the shields of the village threatened to fail, causing the refinery to collapse. When the residents were suffering, Brandeh and [[Greti]] assisted Obi-Wan and Skywalker in healing several of the villagers from the illness. As Durd learned that the two Jedi were hiding in Torbel, he sent an army of [[Battle droid/Legends|Battle droids]] to eliminate them. As the Separatists attacked the village, Brandeh was killed by a swarm of [[Mosquito droid]]s during the [[Battle of Lanteeb|fight]].

name: Kivvaaa
description: {{Quotetrans|The Urnsor'is&hellip;they've been destroying our village, the cavern itself, for many years. Many have died&hellip;many young Myyydril.|Kivvaaa|Star Wars Galaxies: Rage of the Wookiees}}Kivvaaa was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] and a member of the [[Myyydril]]&mdash;a secluded multi-[[Species/Legends|species]] tribe that resided in the [[Myyydril Caverns]] in the [[Kkowir Forest]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]]&mdash;during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Kivvaaa served as the tribe's patrol leader, tasked with guarding the entrance of the caverns from outsiders. During this [[Time/Legends|time]], the Myyydril were being harassed by [[Urnsor'is]] [[Spider/Legends|spiders]] that had infested the caverns, [[Death/Legends|killing]] many Myyydril, especially the youth of the tribe. Kivvaaa lost her entire [[Limb/Legends|right arm]] when it was infected with the flesh-eating [[Poltur Virus]] in one of these Urnsor'is attacks, forcing her to replace her arm with a [[Cybernetics/Legends|cybernetic]] one.<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics}}Shortly after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Kivvaaa was stationed at the entrance to the Myyydril Caverns when she encountered a wandering [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] attempting to enter. Like many of the Myyydril, Kivvaaa was highly suspicious of outsiders, and at first did not permit the being from entering the caverns, demanding to know why the traveler wanted to pass. However, the spacer&mdash;able to understand Kivvaaa's [[Shyriiwook/Legends|Shyriiwook]] [[Language/Legends|language]]&mdash;only wished to explore the area.<ref name="SWG" />Feeling embarrassed for her original rudeness, Kivvaaa apologized and explained that the caverns were extremely dangerous due to the Urnsor'is infestation and that she did not want the spacer to pass just to be killed by the spiders. The spacer offered to assist the Myyydril with ending the Urnsor'is menace, and Kivvaaa&mdash;now trusting the being for the traveler's kindness&mdash;allowed the spacer to enter the caverns and directed the spacer to the Myyydril [[Chief/Legends|chief]], [[Kallaarac]]. The spacer was eventually able to gain Kallaarac and the rest of the tribe's trust and successfully managed to destroy the Urnsor'is infestation.<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}

name: Kaila Min
description: {{Quote|You can tell me about that pilot you saw.''"<br />"''Ah, I know who you are now. I'm glad you came to see me. I was beginning to wonder if you would. Listen carefully, head directly northeast. It's north of some ruins and west of a statue head. Here are coordinates if you prefer that.|Kaila Min and a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] by the name of Kaila Min lived during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], a major conflict fought between the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] and the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. Around this time, she frequented the [[Narmle's Gambling Hall|Gambling Hall]] in [[Narmle (city)|Narmle]], a [[City/Legends|city]] on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo's]] [[Swamp/Legends|swamp]] [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Rori/Legends|Rori]]. Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], she became involved in the search for a missing [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]], a man by the name of [[Cal Handro]] sought by the Galactic Empire, Rebel Alliance, and a friend of Handro named [[Tyla Jinn]]. Jinn, Imperial [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Jevan Monsul]], and [[Alliance Army/Legends|Alliance Army]] Captain [[Veega Madish]] each sought to learn the whereabouts of Handro.<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics|option=1|Star Wars Galaxies}}The search eventually gained a breakthrough when Kaila Min witnessed the missing pilot wandering through the wilderness of Rori. Wishing to aid in Handro's rescue, Min reached out to at least one of the affected parties. In turn, they sent a subordinate to travel to Rori to meet with Min to gain specific information on Handro's last known whereabouts. The [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] tasked with this responsibility met Min between the [[Standard hour/Legends|hours]] of dusk and dawn in Narmle's Gambling Hall, which also doubled as one of Narmle's two major [[Hotel/Legends|hotels]]. After greeting the spacer, whom she was expecting, Kaila Min provided directions to where she had last seen Handro, including exact coordinates which she uploaded to the spacer's [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]]. According to Min, she last witnessed Handro directly northeast of Narmle, north of some ruins and west of a [[Elders (Naboo)/Legends|statue head]].<ref name="SWG" />Unbeknownst to the spacer however, was that the area was being surveilled by multiple members of the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] crime syndicate. When the spacer embarked to investigate the location provided by Min, these Black Sun [[initiate]]s, [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] and minions violently ambushed the spacer. However, they were all defeated by the spacer's superior combat prowess. After [[Death/Legends|killing]] the band of criminals, the spacer recovered one of their datapad's which provided the location of a [[Black Sun bunker]] in the [[Vaydean Marsh]] region of Rori. The spacer ventured toward this base, with the intention of discovering further clues surrounding Cal Handro's whereabouts.{{Endgame}}

name: Leeha Faal
description: The [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Keshiri]] Leeha Faal was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]]. She served in the [[Sith armada (Lost Tribe of the Sith)|Sith armada]], rising up to the rank of [[High Lord (Circle of Lords)|High Lord]] [[Sarasu Taalon]]'s second in command aboard the [[ChaseMaster]] [[Frigate/Legends|frigate]] ''[[Black Wave]]''. In that capacity, she traveled with Taalon and ten other frigates to confront [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] over [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] in order to form a formal alliance with Skywalker and his son, [[Ben Skywalker|Ben]], to eliminate the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] being [[Abeloth]] in [[the Maw]]. In reality, however, the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] hoped to force Abeloth to serve them, and then [[Death/Legends|kill]] the Skywalkers.<ref name="Allies" />Luke Skywalker proposed they meet up with [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] and his [[Colossus I Beta Series asteroid tug|asteroid tug]], the ''[[Rockhound]]'' for assistance in navigating the Maw. The Sith agreed, and they decided to wait for Calrissian at the planet [[Klatooine/Legends|Klatooine]]. There, Faal discovered the existence of the sacred [[Fountain of Ancients|Fountain of the Ancients]], which she showed to Taalon. Taalon, impressed and possessed with a desire for the Fountain, formulated a plan to acquire samples of the Fountain's [[wintrium]]. Eventually, the Sith and Jedi decided to leave, and have Calrissian meet up with them shortly before entering the Maw. Taalon convinced Skywalker to allow him to leave two [[Starship/Legends|ships]] behind, under the premise that they were to wait for Calrissian. Skywalker agreed, and Taalon then gave Faal command of the ''[[Winged Dagger]]'', relieving [[Syndor]] as [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] of the frigate. He then gave her orders to obtain wintrium from the Fountain.<ref name="Allies" />After the Jedi and the rest of the Sith had left the [[Star system/Legends|system]], Faal passed on her orders to the Captain of the other Sith frigate that had been left behind, [[Vyn Holpur]] of the ''[[Starstalker]]''. Holpur carried out the [[Skirmish at the Fountain of the Ancients|attack]], although the Sith were eventually stopped as several [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] ships arrived in-system, attacking the ''Starstalker'' and surrounding the ''Winged Dagger''. Calrissian then arrived, along with [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]], and they were called upon to mediate the crisis. Faal claimed that Holpur and his crew had acted completely upon their own authority, and although Calrissian and Solo knew she was lying, there was no evidence to convict her, as Holpur upheld her story. Holpur and his crew were thus sentenced to death, and Faal and the crew of the ''Winged Dagger'' then traveled with Calrissian and Solo in the ''Rockhound'' to meet up with the rest of the [[Fleet/Legends|fleet]] outside the Maw.<ref name="Allies" />After they discovered that their first stop inside the Maw, [[Sinkhole Station]], had been destroyed, the convoy of Sith and Jedi agreed to travel straight to [[Abeloth's planet]]. There, Luke Skywalker convinced the Sith that they should [[Mind Walkers|Mind Walk]] in order to go [[beyond shadows]] and locate Abeloth. Taalon chose Faal and a [[Sith Saber]], [[Gavar Khai]], to accompany him. With Skywalker serving as their guide, they entered the [[Lake of Apparitions]]. While walking there, Faal slipped, falling to her hands and knees. She attempted to rise, but was suddenly set upon by the hands of her long-dead enemies and rivals. Taalon attempted to help her, but was held back by Khai, who recognized that it was too late as Faal was dragged down into the [[Depths of Eternity]], killing her.<ref name="Allies" />

name: Lina Adonais
description: Lina Adonais was a young [[Qonto]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who worked aboard the [[Luxury liner/Legends|luxury liner]] [[Kuari Princess/Legends|''Kuari Princess'']] while touring [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]]. She was an [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] sympathizer, and considered joining the insurgency. During one voyage aboard the ''Kuari Princess'', Adonais encountered a group of Alliance agents and saw through their disguises but promised not to reveal their identities.<ref name="RM" />

name: Ubbal Fenn
description: {{Quote|Our king says that electronics are the source of evil in the world and must be purged. Only simple machines and combustion engines are acceptable.|Ubbal Fenn, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Fenn was with a group of Meatlumps that were based in [[Meatlump Cave|a cave]] near the city of [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]] from where they carried out their missions to destroy all electronics on the planet.
