When the Meatlumps attacked the [[Captain/Legends#Civilian use|starship captain]] [[Osto Grissom]],<ref name="SWG:CCFAaB" /> circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Alana Walden|Walden]] of the [[Corellian Security Force]] asked an independent agent to investigate the attack. The agent tracked the Meatlumps to their cave and tried to make Fenn talk. When she refused, the agent destroyed most of their supplies and defeated several Meatlumps to convince her. Fenn finally admitted that they had attacked Grissom because he transported electronics into and out of the [[Corellian system]]. The agent was satisfied and didn't harm her.<ref name="SWG:CCFAaB" />

name: Yaqeel Saav'etu
description: As a child, she was safely hidden at the [[Shelter]], a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] base located in [[the Maw]] during the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], where she became good friends with [[Jysella Horn]]. The [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] proved to be loyal and helpful to Horn, who was having way through a hard time because her brother, [[Valin Horn]], had been recently diagnosed with a [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-related [[Force psychosis|illness]] that caused him to think everyone around him were imposters. As a result he was encased in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]]. Saav'etu was part of a [[The Unit|close-knit group of friends]] consisting of [[Bazel Warv]], Valin Horn, and Jysella Horn.<ref name="Omen" />While at a [[Tapcafe/Legends|tapcafe]] across from the [[New Jedi Temple]], Saav'etu and Warv witnessed Jysella Horn [[Telekinesis/Legends|tossing]] civilians across the [[Processional Way/Legends|Processional Way]]. Rushing out to stop her, the two Jedi were [[Skirmish on the Processional Way|attacked]] by Horn, who used the Force to predict their movements. After slashing Warv in the chest, Horn escaped, only to be captured by [[Galactic Alliance Security]] forces shortly thereafter. [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Cilghal]] and several other Jedi rushed onto the scene, escorting Saav'etu and helping Warv to the Temple for [[Force healing/Legends|healing]] and debriefing.<ref name="Omen" />Sometime later, [[Leia Organa Solo]] attempted to have Saav'etu escort [[House of Solo|her family]] to the [[Coruscant Livestock Exchange and Exhibition]], but the Bothan was offworld at the time.<ref name="Omen" />Saav'etu and Warv were wandering back to the Temple by way of [[Fellowship Plaza]] when the Bothan developed the psychosis. Warv, attempting to calm her and lead her into the Temple via the southern [[Jedi Temple|speeder entrance]], was assisted by [[Han Solo/Legends|Han]], Leia, and [[Jaina Solo Fel|Jaina Solo]], along with [[Imperial Remnant]] [[Head of State/Legends|Head of State]] [[Jagged Fel]]. They tranquilized her, but Barv also contracted the psychosis and had to be stunned as well. The two Jedi were then hidden in the Temple as a Security force under the command of [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Atar]] arrived with a warrant to arrest them. They managed to evade being forced to hand over Warv and Saav'etu.<ref name="Abyss">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Abyss]]''</ref>Later, a mission to evacuate Saav'etu and the other psychotic [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Knights]] from the Jedi Temple was undertaken by Han, Leia, [[Jaden Korr]], and [[Avinoam Arelis]]. They were [[Skirmish at the Krabbis Inn|attacked]] by [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorian]] [[Mandalorian Supercommando|Supercommandos]], and with the help of Warv, managed to fight them off. Saav'etu, Warv, and the other psychotic Knights were then loaded into a [[FloatVan]] that took them safety. Soon after, Saav'etu, Warv, [[Natua Wan]], and [[Seff Hellin]] were smuggled offworld by the Solos and taken to [[Shedu Maad]] in the [[Hapes Cluster]] to escape the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]].<ref name="Abyss" />In [[44 ABY]], Saav'etu and the other Jedi suffering from the mysterious Force psychosis snapped out of their delusions in the aftermath of [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Mission to the Maw|first battle]] with [[Abeloth]] on [[Abeloth's planet]]. They were brought from Shedu Maad to the Jedi Temple by [[Zekk]] and [[Tekli]]. Saav'etu participated in the [[Raid on Detention Center 81|rescue attempt]] of Jysella and Valin Horn as the leader of "Team Saav'etu." Disguised as exterminators, the team used foam coating to mask the cam bubbles of the facility and then breached the outer walls with [[Thermal detonator/Legends|thermal detonators]]. Inside, the team discovered thousands of prisoners frozen in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]] alongside the Horn siblings. Despite fierce opposition from Galactic Alliance Security forces, the Horns were successfully rescued.<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref>On Coruscant, Saav'etu and [[Yantahar Bwua'tu]] got themselves into trouble when they were discovered by a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Suhale]], forcing Warv, Hellin, and [[Vaala Razelle]], to pretend to be [[Spice/Legends|spice]] smugglers in order to save their lives. Both the Bothan Knights were able to escape. Later, Saav'etu encountered a [[Darth Krayt|mysterious, tattooed stranger]] at [[Fellowship Plaza]]. She sensed the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] within this man and tried to apprehend him, but the stranger bested the Bothan in [[unarmed combat]]. All he said to her before he left was, ''"Not yet, Jedi. [[Abeloth]] first."''<ref name="Apocalypse">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Apocalypse]]''</ref>

name: Greti
description: During the war, Greti was an only child who lived with her mother [[Bohle]] and 300 residents in the village of [[Torbel]] on [[Lanteeb/Legends|Lanteeb]]. When the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] was occupied by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]], [[General/Legends|General]] [[Lok Durd/Legends|Lok Durd]] ordered the inhabitants to deliver everything in their mine to him. During that day, her mother and several miners caught a terrible illness which they contained from the [[Damotite]]. Greti was very worried when she came to visit them in the hospital camp. This was when she made her first encounter with [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], who were disguised as villagers in order to put an end to the Separatist occupation. As Obi-Wan met her, he was amazed how Greti had a talent for [[Force healing/Legends|Force healing]], in which Greti developed a close friendship with him.The next day, a [[theta storm]] moved over Torbel and damaged one of the shields, causing the village to fall into greater danger until Anakin powered the shield with his technical skills and saved the village. However, there were many casualties, including [[Arrad]], who were suffering a terrible illness. Since the Jedi's cover had been blown, Kenobi asked Greti and [[Sufi]] to help him treat the victims. Greti didn't know what to do, but Kenobi taught her how to control her emotions and managed to heal several villagers, including her mother, while the rest had already died from the illness. In the following days, Greti learned to meditate through the Force since she had trouble sleeping.When Lok Durd learned that the Jedi were hiding in the village, he sent his army to eliminate them. However, Anakin and Obi-Wan planned to deliver themselves to the Separatists in order to protect the villagers. As Greti learned of this, she convinced them to stay and provide refuge. During the siege, a Republic fleet managed to get through the planet and aid the villagers in fighting the Separatists. When [[Taria Damsin]] arrived to the village to warn Kenobi and Skywalker, she was severely injured after destroying Durd's laboratory at [[Lantibba City]]. Greti was able to heal the young [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] in time before the droid army approached the village. She was able to survive the attack, but Torbel was completely burnt down. On the same day, Greti and the surviving villagers were offered refuge by [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Jamillia/Legends|Jamillia]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]]. Before leaving, Greti asked if she could go to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] to become a Jedi, but Kenobi, knowing she was too old, sadly refused. She understood what he meant and said her goodbye as she departs for Naboo.{{Char-stub}}

name: Bohle
description: In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Bohle was present when [[Torbel]] was occupied by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Lok Durd/Legends|Lok Durd]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. After been forced to leave her job along with other miners, she suffered from [[damotite]] [[Poison/Legends|poisoning]] and was afflicted with a terrible fever. When the village was visited by [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], Bohle was nearly close to dying from the poison, but her daughter was able to heal her with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. After recovering from the illness, Bohle traveled to [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] where she and the people of Lanteeb were offered sanctuary by [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Jamillia/Legends|Jamillia]] of [[Theed/Legends|Theed]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Gilsaria
description: Gilsaria was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Dathomirian/Legends|Dathomirian]] who belonged to a group of [[Witches of Dathomir|witches]] known as the [[Singing Mountain Clan]]. Gilsaria worked alongside her clan at their [[Singing Mountain Clan Stronghold|stronghold]] on the [[Singing Mountain]], a geographic feature of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]]. Sometime following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], a treacherous [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] by the name of [[Axkva Min]] attempted to escape from her [[Prison/Legends|prison]] in the [[Chamber of Banishment]], located deep within the [[Rancor Cave]] just nearby the [[Nightsister Stronghold]]. Meanwhile, a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] worked alongside two important residents of a Dathomirian [[City/Legends|township]] known as [[Aurilia]]. They were a [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] named [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Sarguillo]], and the [[Human/Legends|Human]] founder of Aurilia named [[Rohak]]. Rohak and Sarguillo informed the spacer that the only way to stop Axkva Min would be to gain access to her Chamber of Banishment by using the [[Key of Exile]]. However, the key had to be specially created by relying on [[The Force/Legends|The Force]] to fuse four special shards; the [[Shard of Indifference]], [[Shard of Obedience|Obedience]], [[Shard of Pity|Pity]], and [[Shard of Hatred|Hatred]].<ref name="SWG" />As it turned out, Gilsaria possessed the Shard of Hatred, without which the spacer could not succeed in entering Axkva Min's chamber. Because of this, the spacer traveled to the Singing Mountain Clan Stronghold, outside of which existed a large [[gong]]. The spacer sounded the gong, alerting the clan to the existence of the intruder. The spacer was met first by a Singing Mountain clan guardian, [[arch witch]], and [[dragoon]], all of which were defeated. Following their [[Death/Legends|deaths]], Gilsaria engaged the spacer in combat. Despite being skilled in combat, Gilsaria was no match for the spacer, and was killed. The Shard of Hatred was retrieved from her dead body, allowing the spacer to continue their mission to fuse the shards into the Key of Exile.<ref name="SWG" />

name: Dee Skaak
description: Following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Dee Skaak had become a leader of the Skaak Tippers,<ref name="SWG:RtGAsbtST" /> a criminal group of [[Slicer/Legends|slicers]] and [[Information broker/Legends|information brokers]] active on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]].<ref name="CDHZ">[[File:Gal-icon.jpg|14px|link=Sony]] [[CorSec Database H-Z]] on the official ''[[Star Wars Galaxies]]'' website <small>(content now obsolete; [https://web.archive.org/web/20060719111959/http://starwarsgalaxies.station.sony.com/players/guides.vm?id=80113 backup link])</small></ref> Dee Skaak operated from a [[Skaak Tipper Cave|cave]] in the [[Gallo Mountains/Legends|Gallo Mountains]].<ref name="SWG:RtGAsbtST" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> [[Tomi Skaak]]'s group had stolen a valuable [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] artifact and transferred it to Dee Skaak. [[Boss/Legends|Boss]] [[Rugor Nass/Legends|Rugor Nass]] then sent a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to the [[Skaak Tipper Bunker]] in order to retrieve the Gungan artifact. Several Skaak Tippers, including Tomi Skaak were killed during the assault. The spacer later went to the Skaak Tipper Cave and killed Dee Skaak to finally recover the artifact.<ref name="SWG:RtGAsbtST" />

name: Alita Sweetwater
description: [[File:BlixBlaster.jpg|thumb|150px|[[Blix Lanister]]'s [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]], used to murder Alita Sweetwater in [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]].]]{{Quote|Blix Lanister's crew busted him out and left town. I have people out tracking Blix, but you seem to have a knack for finding him and his cohorts. Do you think you can find him again?|Windy Starkiller|Star Wars Galaxies}}Alita Sweetwater was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] individual who lived during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Some time after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|destruction of the first]] [[DS-1 Orbital Battle Station/Legends|Death Star]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Alita was shot and killed by [[Blix Lanister]] in [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. During [[1 ABY/Legends|1.5 ABY]], [[Windy Starkiller]] resided in Anchorhead. While here, he asked a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to find the wanted murderer, after he fled town.<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics}}The spacer agreed to carry out the task, and found Blix shortly thereafter. Blix was brought back to Windy, who paid the spacer 30 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] in thanks. He even said the spacer should consider a career as a security officer. Yet the situation with Blix did not end there. Windy also wanted the spacer to find one of Blix's gang members, a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] named [[Gleezwuq]]. Gleezwuq was the only member of Blix's gang that Windy did not know the location of. He was sure that Gleezwuq would have evidence which would implicate Blix in his murder of Alita Sweetwater.<ref name="SWG" />The spacer managed to find the Rodian gang member, and killed him. On Gleezwuq's person was the same [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] that Blix used in his murder of Alita. The spacer brought the blaster back to an impressed Windy, who was now certain that Blix could be brought to justice. The spacer was once again awarded another 30 credits. Unfortunately, shortly after the evidence was brought to Windy, Blix's cohorts broke into town and helped Blix escape Anchorhead. Windy tasked the spacer with one final task, which was to find Blix and his cronies. Windy did not believe that Blix would let himself be brought back alive again. He told the spacer to do what he had to do. Ultimately, the spacer found Blix, and killed him and the other thugs. Following the successful operation, Windy awarded the spacer 100 credits.<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}

name: Koran Lassk
description: After the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Koran Lassk was one of the nine elite councilors who led the criminal organization known as the [[Chirq Council]]. The eight others were [[Markus Gilder]], [[Braganti Hooge]], [[Zuld Mar-Shayal]], [[Janos Zarbo]], [[Mathazar Zayet]], [[Rallyn Secura]], [[Crale Forte]] and [[Atlan Dubreas]]. Lassk was based in the [[Second Elite Council Bunker]], near the city of [[Doaba Guerfel/Legends|Doaba Guerfel]].<ref name="SWG:TCCTEC" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> the [[Corellian Security Force]] started an investigation against the Chirq Council following the increase of [[Ryll/Legends|ryll]] traffic on Corellia.<ref name="SWG:TCCSC">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Seek Council" on Corellia</ref> [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Vitala Baize]] decided to infiltrate the organization with a CorSec agent using the identity of [[Trins Evnar]], a Chirq Council member in Doaba Guerfel. After killing Evnar, as well as every other Chirq Council criminals who used to know him,<ref name="SWG:TCCAI">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Assumed Identity" on Corellia</ref> the CorSec agent assumed Trins Evnar's identity towards the underboss [[Jzoro Quanera]] and managed to lure him, successfully infiltrating the organization.<ref name="SWG:TCCMU">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "The Chirq Council: Moving Up" on Corellia</ref> From Jzoro Quanera's database, the CorSec obtained the identity of the nine elite councilors and the locations of their secret headquarters. The Corsec eventually assaulted the [[First Elite Council Bunker|First]] and Second Elite Council Bunkers and killed all elite councilors during the attack. After the death of Koran Lassk and the other elite councilors, the Chirq Council splintered.<ref name="SWG:TCCTEC" />

name: Unidentified Gamorrean farmer
description: During the reign of [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]], this Gamorrean farmer was living on [[Gamorr/Legends|Gamorr]] and tending her farm. The crime leader [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]] sent his two favorite smugglers, [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] and [[Chewbacca/Legends|Chewbacca]] to Gamorr to pick up more guards. Their primary point of contact was this farmer, and they required a [[TC-72|translator]] to negotiate. When the smugglers landed, Solo made the mistake of assuming the farmer was male, and insulted her. She was about to kill him when TC-72 apologized on behalf of the uncouth smuggler. After more negotiations, the two smugglers departed with the guards and a package of [[Snoruuk/Legends|snoruuks]].

name: Madison Silene
description: {{Quote|My husband has gone missing. I need help to find him.|Madison Silene, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Madison Silene lived in [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]]. She was the wife of [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Kyran Silene]] and she was friend with [[Angela]].<ref name="SWG:SR" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> her husband disappeared suddenly.<ref name="SWG:SR" /> She ignored that a group of [[Corellian slavers]] operating near Tyrena captured Kyran and [[Slavery/Legends|enslaved]] him.<ref name="SWG:TtB">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Talk to Bandor" on Corellia</ref> Despite [[Major/Legends|Major]] [[Alana Walden]] of the [[Corellian Security Force|CorSec]] was investigating similar disappearances on Corellia,<ref name="web">{{SonyCite|url=en_US/players/content.vm?id=66901&resource=features|text=Chapter 1: The Corellian Captives|archivedate=20111124014132}}</ref> Madison Silene contacted a spacer who had previously helped her friend Angela to find her missing husband.<ref name="SWG:SR" /> The spacer agreed to help Madison and interrogated [[Bandor Mokk]], a new and suspect friend of Kyran Silene. The man revealed that Kyran Silene was captured by slavers but managed to escape.<ref name="SWG:TtB" /> The spacer traveled to a camp outside Tyrena where gathered a group of escaped slave. Kyran explained that he could not come back until the situation was resolved. After the spacer attacked the [[Corellian Slaver Bunker]] and revealed its existence to the CorSec,<ref name="SWG:IE">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Incriminating Evidence" on Corellia</ref> Kyran Silene eventually returned to a normal life with Madison.<ref name="SWG:HbtKS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Legacy Quest: "Head back to Kyran Silene" on Corellia</ref>

name: Vinya Maysor
description: Maysor worked for [[Corporate Sector Authority/Legends|Corporate Sector Authority]] Viceprex Karrek Flim on [[Vreni Island]] on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] during the time of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Her office was in the back of [[Vreni Island cantina|a local cantina]].<ref name="AED" />In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], one of the Viceprex's underlings paid [[Slicer/Legends|data slicers]] to alter shipping documents to make the Viceprex seem incompetent and corrupt. To prevent damage to the Viceprex's reputation, she decided to employ a data slicer herself to alter records that would make the underling look like a fool instead. For this, she hired a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to deliver the [[Datacard/Legends|datadisc]] to the slicer.<ref name="AED" />

name: Silm'an Voueen
description: {{Quote|You may recall that saboteur who said my current boss, Drik Bandrik, is a slaver. I need to know if that's true. I don't like slavers. I'd like you to meet with a Bothan spy who has the truth.|Rakir Banai, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> [[Rakir Banai]] was tasked by his boss [[Drik Bandrik]] to protect his mining business from a saboteur. Banai thus hired a spacer who killed the saboteur [[Triggo Binz]] but the latter pretended before dying that Drik Bandrik was a [[Slavery/Legends|slaver]]. Rakir Banai thus hired Silm'an Voueen to discover the truth. The Bothan spy investigated and was able to confirm this information. Silm'an Voueen later met the spacer who worked for Rakir Banai. After the spacer defeated several thugs who attacked her, Silm'an Voueen delivered a datadisk with data describing Drik Bandrik's slave operation.<ref name="SWG:RB" />

name: Kixiaralu
description: {{Quote|I learned a whole lot more from a girl called Kixi when I arrived here.|Larin Moxla, on her computer slicing training|The Old Republic: Fatal Alliance}}Born on [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], she became a skilled [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]] on [[Computer/Legends|computer]] networks during the time of the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]]. After the [[Treaty of Coruscant]], she taught a disgraced [[Republic trooper]] named [[Larin Moxla]] about the abilities upon Moxla's arrival to Coruscant. When she combined Kixi's training with the basics of slicing she learned in the [[Republic Special Forces Division|Republic Special Forces]]' [[Blackstar Squad]], Moxla became a formidable slicer in her own right, and used those talents while trying to clean up the gang-dominated streets of Coruscant.In [[3645 BBY]], Kixi was later captured by the [[Migrant Merchants' Guild]], a criminal organization on Coruscant, and forced to slice into computer systems for two years before being discovered by [[Voidhound|a smuggler]]. She assisted her rescuer by accessing and sabotaging the personal files of a criminal, the smuggler was pursuing.

name: Ravilan's aide
description: Ravilan's aide was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]],<ref name="LTotS:Pa" /> who had lived in the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]] and was assigned to the ship ''[[Omen]]'' on a mission to [[Mining/Legends|mine]] [[Lignan]] ore for the upcoming [[Battle of Kirrek (Great Hyperspace War)|Battle of Kirrek]] around the time of the [[Great Hyperspace War]]. ''Omen'' had a collision going into [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] with its sister ship [[Harbinger (Sith dreadnaught)|''Harbinger'']] after a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Infiltrator/Legends|starfighter]] [[Skirmish over Phaegon III|attacked]] the ships and forced ''Omen'' into a retreat to protect the Lignan they had mined. Like the rest of the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], she had crash&ndash;landed on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]] aboard the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Sith dreadnaught|dreadnaught]] ''Omen'',<ref name="LTotS:Pr">''[[Lost Tribe of the Sith: Precipice]]''</ref> and become regarded as one of the [[Deity/Legends|god&ndash;like]] [[Skyborn]] of the [[Keshiri|native's]] legends.<ref name="LTotS:S">''[[Lost Tribe of the Sith: Skyborn]]''</ref>Being in her forties after [[4985 BBY|fifteen years]] on Kesh, she had been assigned to go with the [[Sith (species)|Red Sith]] [[Ravilan Wroth]] to the village of [[Tetsubal]] on the [[Ragnos Lakes]] to investigate a fluorescent algae for use in lighting Sith structures. Ravilan and his followers, known as the Fifty&ndash;seven, secretly and purposefully caused a plague there by adding the toxic [[cyanogen silicate]] to the [[Water/Legends|water]] in an attempt to scare the Sith on Kesh into focusing their efforts on leaving the planet. Ravilan's aide was killed by the substance, along with approximately eighteen&ndash;thousand Keshiri natives. When her body was found by [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] who came to investigate the crisis, [[Seelah Korsin]]&mdash;the wife of the leader and [[Grand Lord]] [[Yaru Korsin]]&mdash;identified the swollen, blue features of her tongue as a result of the cyanogen silicate. This led to Seelah deducing Ravilan's involvement in the event, and eventually the [[Red Sith Purge|order]] to [[Death/Legends|kill]] all the Red Sith on Kesh by the Grand Lord&mdash;including Ravilan.<ref name="LTotS:Pa" />

name: Jill Farseeker
description: Jill Farseeker was the [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Youngling/Legends|child]] of [[Roark Garnet]], a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]], and the [[Jackson Farseeker's daughter|daughter]] of [[Jackson Farseeker]], a retired [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Captain/Legends|captain]]. Farseeker had little contact with her father, until she met him during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] while with her grandfather. Garnet, [[Captain/Legends|captain]] of the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]] ''[[Dorion Discus]]'', was transporting the pair off the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Thorgeld I]], along with the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Tantos Dree]] when the [[Imperial Customs Frigate]] [[Assessor (Imperial Customs Frigate)|''Assessor'']] attempted to inspect the ship. Dree convinced Garnet that they had to avoid the Imperials, since he could not be discovered by them. Jill proposed dropping Dree out of the airlock and tethering him to the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] with a rope so the inspection team would not find him, but the bounty hunter refused. Garnet began evasive maneuvers and Dree manned the ship guns, while her grandfather calculated the data for a jump to [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]]. The ''Dorion Discus'' and the ''Assessor'' traded fire, but the freighter managed to enter [[Lightspeed/Legends|lightspeed]].<ref name="TRG1-23" />

name: Gana Lavin
description: {{Quote|Where did you get those clothes&mdash;a trash compactor in the Lower City?|Gana Lavin, to Revan|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}Gana Lavin was a young [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Noble/Legends|noble]] from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Taris/Legends|Taris]]. As a child, she enjoyed many of life's luxuries living in the [[Upper City]]. Lavin would occasionally use [[Bodyguard/Legends|enforcers]] employed by her [[Gana Lavin's father|father]] to harass others, which led many to consider her a spoiled brat.<ref name="CSWE" />{{Gamemechanics|Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic}}In [[3956 BBY]],<ref name="CG">''[[Knights of the Old Republic Campaign Guide]]''</ref> Lavin was present in the [[Upper City Cantina]] buying drinks for herself and a [[Noble/Legends|noble]] when [[Revan/Legends|Revan]] and [[Carth Onasi]], both [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]], approached her. Lavin mistakenly believed them to be [[Bartender/Legends|waiters]], insulting their choice of clothing and demanding to know why her order had not yet arrived. Revan apologized and attempted to explain that he wasn't an employee of the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]], but Lavin refused to listen and threatened to use her father's influence to have Revan dismissed. Revan persuaded her not to become upset and agreed to bring Lavin her order. At that point, a waiter arrived bearing Lavin's and her friend's drinks, defusing the situation and allowing Revan and Onasi to leave.<ref name="KotOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Unidentified Twi'lek bodyguard
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]]<ref name="SWM" /> protected [[Baron Administrator/Legends|Baron Administrator]] [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] in [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]], a [[Tibanna/Legends|Tibanna]] [[Mining/Legends|mining]] colony on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]].<ref name="SLR" /> In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]],<ref name="date">The ''[[Sore Loser's Revenge]]'' scenario does not provide a time frame for Bossk's ambush, in which the Twi'lek was present, but the comic [[Lady Luck (comic)|''Lady Luck'']] states that Calrissian won Cloud City in [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]]. Furthermore, the short story ''[[Lando Calrissian: Idiot's Array]]'', which describes Raynor's last assassination attempt against Calrissian happening around six weeks after the sabacc match, reveals that the ambush happens within these six weeks.</ref> former [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] [[Administrator/Legends|Administrator]] [[Dominic Raynor]], who had [[Gambling/Legends|gambled]] away the [[City/Legends|city]] in a game of [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] against Calrissian, hired the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Bossk/Legends|Bossk]] to hunt down the new Administrator because he believed that Calrissian had cheated in order to win their game.<ref name="SLR" />Bossk brought a band of [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenaries]] and [[Assassin/Legends|cutthroats]]&mdash;a [[Unidentified Twi'lek 1 (Ambush in Cloud City)|Twi'lek scoundrel]], [[Unidentified Twi'lek 2 (Ambush in Cloud City)|another scoundrel]] of the same [[Species/Legends|species]], a [[Unidentified Duros (Ambush in Cloud City)|Duro mercenary]], and a [[Unidentified Quarren (Ambush in Cloud City)|Quarren assassin]]&mdash;to the city and set a trap for Calrissian. Impersonating the city's [[Cloud City chief engineer|chief engineer]], the [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] hunter reported that a primary [[Repulsorlift/Legends|repulsorlift]] pod was about to break down&mdash;a failure that would drop the floating city into the [[Gas giant/Legends|gas giant's]] [[Rethin Sea|molten core]]. In response, Calrissian went to the city's lower levels to check the pod, taking his Twi'lek bodyguard and four [[Bespin Wing Guard/Legends|Bespin guards]] along as a precautionary measure.<ref name="SLR" />After Calrissian's group entered the maintenance level, a [[Blast door/Legends|blast door]] suddenly shut behind them, and the Twi'lek and her companions came under [[Blaster/Legends|fire]] from Bossk's ad hoc bounty hunter group. Calrissian's escorts decided to hold them off while the Baron Administrator escaped through a nearby [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]], and the Twi'lek engaged her opponents with a [[Quarterstaff/Legends|quarterstaff]] in the combat that erupted. Thanks to the distress call sent by a member of Calrissian's party, a quartet of Wing Guards, concerned by the sound of the [[Lightfight|firefight]], arrived to assist the Baron Administrator, who fled the [[Ambush in Cloud City|ambush]] through a nearby [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]].<ref name="SLR" />

name: Kuma Nai
description: [[File:SepKam2.jpg|thumb|left|250px|The death of the Kaminoan spy.]]Nai created the [[Kaminoan nano-virus]] and planned to spread it to all [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]]. The plan failed when [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto]] and [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] arrived to investigate the sickness infecting the clones. As the [[Kaminoan/Legends|Kaminoan]] tried to escape, she became involved in a struggle with Secura. During the melee, she was infected with the nano-virus as she attempted to poison the Jedi and was killed instantly.

name: Siobhan Stern
description: Stern served aboard the [[Cularin 1|''Nimbus'']], a Thaereian [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]] that was based in the deserted city of [[Nub Saar]], on [[Genarius]]. When Nub Saar was attacked by [[Cochlera]], the creatures damaged the ''Nimbus'' and forced the Thaereians to abandon their base in Nub Saar. However, Stern and the rest of the crew survived, by sealing themselves off in one of the ''Nimbus''{{'s}} holds. They were found by the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who tried to persuade Stern and the surviving crew members to defect to the [[Cularin Militia]].<ref name="Storm's Depths" />Stern eventually joined the Militia and when the Heroes of Cularin later became stranded on the planet [[Holador]], Stern accompanied a Militia force that was dispatched to rescue them.<ref name="Strike III" />

name: Unidentified Naboo resistance fighter
description: When the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invaded]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] in [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]],<ref>[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace (novelization)|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'' novelization]]</ref> the [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Royal Naboo Security Forces]] became involved in a desperate battle for the defense of their [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. This [[Naboo Underground|resistance]] fighter joined in the fight. When Naboo's [[Queen/Legends|Queen]], [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Amidala]] returned to the planet after her exile, she rounded up all the surviving [[Officer/Legends|officers]] to plan the [[Battle of Naboo/Legends|end of the war]]. The [[Gungan Grand Army/Legends|Gungan Grand Army]] would draw out the main part of the [[Trade Federation Droid Army/Legends|Trade Federation Droid Army]] while the Queen led a ground assault of the capital [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Theed/Legends|Theed]] to capture the [[Viceroy/Legends|Viceroy]]. This resistance fighter was stationed at a [[resistance outpost]] on the [[Great Grass Plains/Legends|Great Grass Plains]]. The Trade Federation sent the Army B to flank the Plains and attack the [[Gungan/Legends|Gungans]],<ref>''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> but the [[Army/Legends|army]] engaged the outpost instead. The resistance fighter ordered her outpost to get ready to fight. Two [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] allies of the Security Forces, [[Nym/Legends|Nym]] and [[Vana Sage]] were on hand to protect the outpost. The resistance fighter kept up a running commentary while the two spacers engaged Army B. The base was being overrun when [[Rhys Dallows|two]] [[Reti|more]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]] showed up to protect the base. The combined firepower drove off the attacking vehicles and [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]]. The resistance fighter then thanked the pilots as they flew off.<ref name="Star Wars: Battle for Naboo" />

name: Anise I'Zak
description: {{Quote|I'm afraid I ''failed'', Commander. The canister was destroyed. Though the Separatists will have quite the repair bill&hellip;"''<br />"''Don't judge your mission a failure ''too quickly'', Master I'Zak.|Anise I'Zak and Aayla Secura|Chain of Command}}Anise I'Zak, a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] during the final [[Standard year/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. During her youth, she was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. I'Zak possessed an insolent attitude and a habit for causing trouble, traits many [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]] believed would prevent her from [[Jedi Trials/Legends|ascending]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. In [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], shortly after the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|Battle of Geonosis]]<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|126|I'Zak, Anise}}</ref>&mdash;which initiated the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]<ref>[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>&mdash;I'Zak managed to pass the Trials necessary to become a Knight, although she did so through unconventional methods, and was thus granted Knighthood status.<ref name="CSWE" />Shortly after her promotion, I'Zak was dispatched to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Hitaka]], where she met with [[Jedi General/Legends|Jedi Generals]] [[Ki-Adi-Mundi/Legends|Ki-Adi-Mundi]] and [[Aayla Secura/Legends|Aayla Secura]] at a Republic-controlled station. During the meeting, Mundi [[Mission on Hitaka|tasked]] I'Zak with [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] a secret canister across enemy lines to one of the Republic camps on the east side of the world, [[Base "B"]], and she was forewarned about the [[Squadron/Legends|squadrons]] of CIS [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] in the [[Tree/Legends|forests]] and fields. As she was making the trek to the base, I'Zak was attacked by some of the [[B1 battle droid/Legends|droids]] of the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Army]], though she was able to defeat them before coming across an occupied house. She was ambushed once more by [[Droideka/Legends|droidekas]], causing her to crash into the house and interrupt a [[Unidentified Hitaka species|native]] family's dinner. With the aid of the family, I'Zak defeated the droidekas but not before one of them shot and destroyed the canister she was carrying. She was in despair for a moment, but when a group of [[B2 super battle droid/Legends|super battle droids]] arrived, she proceeded to destroy them.<ref name="CoC" />I'Zak arrived at Base "B" by dusk and gave the broken canister to the [[Unidentified clone trooper commander (Hitaka)|clone commander]], remarking that her mission had been a failure. However, Mundi and Secura surprised I'Zak and told her that her mission was a success, in that she provided an adequate distraction for the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[Army/Legends|armies]] while the [[General/Legends|Generals]] carried out the true objective that [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] had given them. Although she disliked being used in that way, she recognized that it was in the best interests of the Republic.<ref name="CoC" />

name: Unidentified female (Anchorhead)
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] lived in the [[City/Legends|settlement]] of [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. She was aged by the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], and she wore a metallic [[sun shawl]] to protect herself from the twin [[Star/Legends|suns]] of the [[Tatoo system/Legends|Tatoo system]].<ref name="EP4NOVEL" />Late in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], the woman was walking on a quiet, deserted street of Anchorhead when she was nearly run over by [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]], the nephew of a local [[Moisture farmer/Legends|moisture farmer]] named [[Owen Lars/Legends|Owen Lars]]. The [[Farmer/Legends|farmboy]] was on his way to the [[Tosche Station/Legends|Tosche]] power station in his [[X-34 landspeeder/Legends|X-34 landspeeder]] to tell his friends about a [[Battle of Tatooine (Galactic Civil War)|battle]] he had spotted over their planet. The woman quickly ran out of Skywalker's way and shouted after him.<ref name="EP4NOVEL" />

name: Neebo/Legends
description: Neebo was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived during the last [[Standard year/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She joined the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and eventually reached the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Sometime before fellow [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Master [[Kit Fisto/Legends|Kit Fisto's]] [[Mission to Vassek's third moon|mission]] to the [[third moon of Vassek]]<ref name="Episode Guide Lair of Grievous" /> in the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]],<ref name="ERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> Neebo went on a [[Mission to the moons of Sanjin/Legends|mission]] to protect refugees on the [[Moon/Legends|moons]] of the<ref name="Episode Guide Lair of Grievous" /> [[Colonies/Legends|Colonies]]<ref name="Companion">{{SW|url=news/star-wars-the-essential-atlas-online-companion|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Atlas'' Online Companion|int=Star Wars: The Essential Atlas Online Companion|archivedate=20200112150120}}</ref> [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Sanjin/Legends|Sanjin]]. Neebo went missing in the conflict, and Fisto later found her [[Neebo's lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] in the trophy room of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederate]] [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]]<ref name="Episode Guide Lair of Grievous" />&mdash;who often collected the weapons of Jedi he had [[Death/Legends|killed]]<ref name="Lair">{{TCW|Lair of Grievous}}</ref>&mdash;during his infiltration of the [[Grievous's castle|General's castle]] on the third moon of [[Vassek/Legends|Vassek]]. Fisto examined Neebo's weapon and then went on to [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|duel]] Grievous.<ref name="Episode Guide Lair of Grievous" />

name: Marny
description: Marny's squadron operated from the [[Planetoid/Legends|planetoid]] [[Annamar]], hidden deep within a massive asteroid field near the [[Corellian Trade Spine/Legends|Corellian Trade Spine]].<ref name="TWODV" />During the [[Battle of Annamar]], she and her squadron were all killed when Vader dropped a [[BTL Y-wing starfighter/Legends|BTL Y-wing starfighter]] on the [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighters]] stationed in the base.<ref name="TWODV" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Kei No Kay
description: Secretly imprisoned by Jund Voon, Kei was the real driving force behind Wave Works' meteoric rise in popularity. She had tremendous skill in art, a talent that Jund discovered and exploited. She spent her time imprisoned in an artificial tidepool tank. Besides crafting jewelry and trinkets, she had a passion for playing the [[hydroharp]]. Although imprisoned she was not treated poorly as long as she continued to produce quality merchandise. Kei had a brother named [[Koll]] who joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]].

name: Mazara
description: {{Quote|Can you get us inside the factory?''"<br />"''That is easy. There are Falleen in the employment office who will help us. I can get you inside as workers. After that, the rest is up to you.|Obi-Wan Kenobi and Mazara|Jedi Quest: The False Peace}}Mazara, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Falleen/Legends|Falleen]], was an environmental and workers' rights activist born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Falleen (planet)/Legends|Falleen]]. She was trained in journalism and worked as a [[Journalist/Legends|journalist]] in Falleen's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]],<ref name="CSWE">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]''</ref> [[Falleen Throne]].<ref name="SG">''[[Shadow Games]]''</ref> During the course of her work, Mazara wrote an article exposing the [[Blackwater Systems]] corporation for breaking many of Falleen's laws. The article was published against the wishes of her editors, and after its publication they forced her to leave her job rather than support her work.<ref name="Jedi Quest: The False Peace" /> Mazara then became the leader of a small [[Workers Rights group|rebel group]] of Falleen founded just before the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. The group attempted to stop large corporations from polluting their [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] while protesting the terrible living conditions that workers endured due to the overdevelopment of Falleen Throne. While leading the group, Mazara staged small rallies in an attempt to show workers the truth.<ref name="CSWE" /> She was targeted for [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]] by Blackwater Systems for leading protests against their business practices, as well as planning to break into their [[Blackwater Systems facility|factory]] to steal information on the products they produced and the illegal experiments being performed in the wing of the facility.<ref name="Jedi Quest: The False Peace" />In [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]], the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Siri Tachi]], along with their [[Padawan/Legends|apprentices]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Ferus Olin]], saved Mazara from an [[Assassination attempt on Mazara|assassination attempt]] after a failed protest in the [[Yellow District]] of Falleen. During the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi's]] search for the criminal [[Granta Omega]], the man who had orchestrated the death of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Yaddle/Legends|Yaddle]] and financed the creation of the [[Zone of Self-Containment]] [[Spice/Legends|drug]], Mazara assisted them by sharing what she knew about Blackwater Systems, its connections to Omega, and its role in producing the drug. She also provided the Jedi with the name of an employment officer, [[Wanuri]], who could give them access to the facility so that they could further investigate for signs of Omega and the Zone of Self-Containment.<ref name="Jedi Quest: The False Peace" />

name: Katya M'Buele
description: {{Quote|Katya and Zeen were real happy, throwing credits around like they were bantha fodder.|Dash Rendar, after the Battle of Ylesia|Rebel Dawn}}A [[Corellian/Legends|Corellian]],<ref name="cswe" /> Katya M'Buele entered into a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] career during the [[Imperial Period]], serving on the crew of a [[Corellian rim-runner]] alongside a young [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]]. The pair became romantically involved, and once narrowly survived an aborted smuggling mission to the restricted [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Skye]], when they were captured and hunted by the [[Magister of Skye|Majestrix of Skye]], [[Kharys]]&mdash;a dangerous [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] who had once been trained by the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]]. Out of 20 Corellians who had traveled to Skye, M'Buele and Solo were the only two survivors.<ref name="hunt" /> However, their relationship eventually ended when Solo left to further pursue his own smuggling career sometime after the two flew together during the [[Battle of Ylesia]].<ref name="aliens">{{Hyperspace|url=hyperspace/member/insideronline/97/indexp4.html|text=Aliens in the Empire, Part 2: To a Traitor Go the Spoils|int=Aliens in the Empire}}</ref>[[File:Kharys3.JPG|thumb|left|200px|Katya M'Buele and Han Solo flee the attacking Kharys on their ill-fated mission to Skye.]]For her participation in the fighting on Ylesia&mdash;where an alliance of [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] forces and a smuggler fleet clashed with the [[Besadii/Legends|Besadii]] [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]&mdash;M'Buele was one of the few smugglers who actually got paid. M'Buele and fellow smuggler [[Zeen Afit]] celebrated lavishly as a result, and passed the news on to acquaintance [[Dash Rendar/Legends|Dash Rendar]].<ref name="dawn">''[[Rebel Dawn]]''</ref> M'Buele briefly re-entered Solo's life in [[0 ABY/Legends|0 ABY]], when the two reunited on the planet [[Tirahnn/Legends|Tirahnn]]&mdash;by this point, Solo had become entangled in the Rebel Alliance himself. After briefly catching up aboard Solo's ''[[Millennium Falcon/Legends|Millennium Falcon]]'', Solo and M'Buele realized that Solo's friend [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] had encountered Kharys, who had hunted Solo since their escape from Skye. Although M'Buele wanted to join her former flame on his search for information that night, she stayed behind on the ''Millennium Falcon'' at his behest. However, the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] proved no safer than the streets of Tirahnn, as M'Buele was [[Death/Legends|killed]] in her bed by a [[Smoke Demon|smoke demon]], a [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] entity summoned by Kharys.<ref name="hunt" />

name: Aven Cholus
description: Aven Cholus was born on [[Pencael IV]], daughter of a rich family. She was on good terms with her brother [[Senn Cholus|Senn]], and both of them trained during their childhood to became pilots. The Cholus family wanted to send both of their children to the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]]. However, Aven was a firm believer in freedom, and could not stand to serve the Empire. She found a chance to join the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]] and rejected her family to do so.Aven became a pilot to infiltrator [[Scandium Team]], under the leadership of lead pilot [[Jouffer Talamiin]]. During the [[battle of Gendrah-Narvin]], Talamiin was injured and had to retire; Aven then replaced him as lead pilot.Aven then fought against the Empire in the [[Battle of Fendry]], and was awarded with the [[Alvace Star]] for leading her squadron out of a dangerous situation while chased by Imperial forces.Aven also fought in the [[Wellte-ir Massacre]], where most of the Scandium Team was killed. Aven rescued the five survivors of the Team from the [[Umber Banks]]. However, the Scandium Team was dismantled after that.The Rebel command assigned Aven to the [[Gale Team]], replacing previous commander [[Ozik Poyiu]]. However, Aven was not comfortable with the Gales, because they were all former smugglers; and they, in turn, were uncomfortable with their new commander because they preferred to have a former smuggler as commander. Besides, Aven blamed herself for the Wellte-ir Massacre. All this caused the Gale Team to decrease their performance. Aven was blamed for that, demoted and retired from this role.During the rest of her career, she was a shuttle pilot, until retirement in the first days of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].

name: Aurora Adasca
description: The niece of [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Arkoh Adasca]], the head of [[The Adasca BioMechanical Corporation of Arkania]], Aurora Adasca was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Arkanian/Legends|Arkanian]] who lived in the period of [[Time/Legends|time]] that followed the [[Great Sith War]]. As she was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Aurora was taken by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]],<ref name="CSWE" /> an action her uncle likened to an abduction. Arkoh Adasca never contacted her after she was taken, nor did [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Lucien Draay]]&mdash;a family friend of the [[House of Adasca|Adascas]]&mdash;ever see her again, either.<ref name="KOTOR 19" /> Aurora eventually became a [[Jedi scout]] and traveled to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Serroco]] to assist the [[Revanchist]] movement, which aimed to involve the whole Order in the ongoing [[Mandalorian Wars]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders/Legends|Mandalorian Neo-Crusaders]].<ref name="DHCb" /> After Serroco was [[Battle of Serroco|razed]] by the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]] in [[3963 BBY]], Aurora was left unaccounted for. As she was the sole remaining heir to the House of Adasca after her uncle was [[First Battle of Omonoth|killed]], her disappearance enabled investors of the [[Draay Trust]] to bid for the takeover of the Adasca Corporation.<ref name="TAL" />

name: Vika Surn
description: Alic and Vika complemented each other well. Vika was a steadying influence on her brother, while Alic helped his sister deal with the emotional disorders that led to her frequent outbursts of anger against friend or foe. Vika's emotional orders likely stemmed from a very early age. While it could not be proven she was responsible for her parents' death, she was hospitalized several times for observation for mental anguish following the deaths of her parents in a [[Speeder/Legends|speeder]] accident.When working with her brother, Vika was responsible for any necessary kills. She constantly trained, trying to reach the peak of physical perfection. Her tall, muscular frame and [[Vibroblade/Legends|vibroblade]] scar down her right cheek was evidence of her hard conditioning. Vika possessed super-Human stamina.The Surns paid the Neuvalis syndicate a five percent gap in exchange for the use of their transport ship, a modified [[Incom Corporation/Legends|Incom]] scout ship named ''[[Widow Maker]]''.

name: Jadonna Veloz
description: {{Quote|That's a beldon! They're really rare. In all the years I've been flying through these clouds, I've never seen one.|Jadonna Veloz, to Han Solo, during their approach to Bespin|Rebel Dawn}}Jadonna Veloz was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who worked as a [[Starship/Legends|starship]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] during the reign of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Veloz operated the vessel ''[[Wayward Girl]]'', and her work took her through the [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]] many [[Time/Legends|times]] during her career.<ref name="Rebel Dawn" /> Circa [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]],<ref name="date">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]'' dates the events of ''[[Rebel Dawn]]'' to c. [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]]&ndash;[[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]]. As Jadonna Veloz's journey to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]] with the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] appears in the opening scene of the first chapter of ''Rebel Dawn'', their voyage can therefore be dated to c. 2 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|BBY]].</ref> Veloz was hired to haul a shipment of prime [[Nerf steak/Legends|nerf tenderloin steaks]] from the planet Alderaan to the [[Yarith Bespin/Legends|Yarith Bespin]], a luxury [[Hotel/Legends|hotel]] situated in [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]] on Bespin. However, she was struck by a malfunctioning<ref name="Rebel Dawn" /> [[Hoversled/Legends|repulsorsled]]<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|III|301|Veloz, Jadonna}}</ref> [[anti-grav loader]] before leaving Alderaan with her cargo, which tore the cartilage and ligaments in her right [[Limb/Legends|arm]] and left her in great pain.<ref name="Rebel Dawn" />Veloz had a tight deadline to meet for delivery of the [[Nerf/Legends|nerf]] tenderloins and so chose not to seek immediate medical treatment for her arm in order not to risk her cargo arriving late. Instead, as a temporary measure, she donned a sling to hold her arm in place. Her injury left her unable to pilot the ''Wayward Girl'' unaided, so she advertised on the [[HoloNet/Legends|spacer nets]] for a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to help her pilot the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] to Cloud [[City/Legends|City]]. The aspiring [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] responded to the ad, and Veloz paid for him to take a fast [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] from the planet [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] to join her on Alderaan.<ref name="Rebel Dawn" />Solo and Veloz departed on the ''Wayward Girl'', with Solo flying the ship supported by Veloz as co-pilot. After a journey lasting two [[Standard day/Legends|days]], they arrived at Bespin and set a course through the [[Atmosphere/Legends|atmosphere]] of the planet to Cloud City. By this stage, Veloz was weary of the pain from her injury and was keen to get to their destination as soon as possible to seek medical attention and have [[Bacta/Legends|bacta]] applied to her arm. On their approach to Cloud City, the ship passed a [[Beldon/Legends|beldon]], a rare [[Species/Legends|species]] of giant flying creature, much to Veloz's excitement. The ''Wayward Girl'' then docked at the Yarith Bespin hotel, and Veloz delivered her cargo on time; she paid Solo for his services, and they said their farewells. Solo used the [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] that he received from the trip to pay for a room and meals while he competed in the [[Cloud City Sabacc Tournament]], a major [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] competition hosted at the Yarith Bespin.<ref name="Rebel Dawn" />

name: Nyrat Agira
description: [[File:Nyratagira.jpg|thumb|left|Agira in the Outlander Club.]]Nyrat Agira was an attractive woman by [[Human/Legends|Human]] standards, with [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] surgically altered to appear turquoise. She wore her [[Hair/Legends|hair]] in an impractically tall [[solloops]] hairstyle, and her soluble [[zoosha fabric]] clothing revealed a [[Tattoo/Legends|tattoo]] marking her as a member of the [[Zealots of Psusan/Legends|Zealots of Psusan]].<ref name="db" />On the night of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi's]] apprehension of Wesell, Nyrat was socializing with fellow Outlander patrons [[Immi Danoo]] and [[Rosha Vess]], and was on the prowl for potential converts to the Zealots.<ref name="Who's Who" /><ref name="Complete Locations">[[Star Wars: Complete Locations (2005)|''Star Wars: Complete Locations'']]</ref> She was approached by a different [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] by the name of [[Kalyn Farnmir/Legends|Kalyn Farnmir]]. Farnmir's partner, [[Cian Shee]], had sold Farnmir out to the corrupt High Priest of the Zealots of Psusan, [[Scri Oscuro]]. Upon seeing Agira's tattoo, Farnmir intimidated and interrogated the young woman, who confirmed that Oscuro was on Coruscant and had met with Shee.<ref name="Kalyn Farnmir">{{DB|character|kalynfarnmir|Farnmir, Kalyn|archivedate=20100210024117}}</ref>

name: Trella Bare'Ah/Legends
description: During the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she met a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Greedo/Legends|Greedo]] and was romantically involved with him.In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Trella was present in the palace with a few Twi'leks when [[Chairman/Legends|Chairman]] [[Notluwiski Papanoida]] and his son, [[Ion Papanoida/Legends|Ion Papanoida]] were searching for Greedo. She went to them and asked what they wanted from Greedo. When the Chairman told her that he was here to hire a bounty hunter, Trella went to find Greedo and told him about the [[Pantoran/Legends|Pantorans]] that were searching for him.{{Char-stub}}

name: Jeremos
description: In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], in the months after the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]],<ref name="CSWE II 157">''[[The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia]]'', Vol. II, p. 156.</ref> Jeremos was hired by the captain of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Star Destroyer/Legends|Star Destroyer]] [[Indomitable (Imperial I-class)|''Indomitable'']], which could not join the rest of the Imperial fleet due to maintenance problems. Jeremos was tasked with scouring the ship's waste bays. In need of some brute strength to lend a hand, the Squib put out a call for workers. After haggling over the pay involved (Jeremos wanted to pay as little as possible), she hired a group of laborers who, unbeknownst to her, were agents of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. Jeremos took them up in her personal shuttle to board the Imperial craft, where they worked more or less independently.<ref name="RESB 102" />Once on board, the Rebels tried to undermine the ''Indomitable'' and further the Alliance agenda. The job was not as smooth as they had hoped, however, as the garbage bays were infested with [[Dianoga/Legends|dianogas]] and [[trash bat]]s.<ref name="RESB 102" /> One compactor even housed a malfunctioning [[Assassin droid/Legends|assassin droid]] that fired on anything within its line of sight. Despite the inherent danger, Jeremos insisted on carrying the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] out of the ship and salvaging it.<ref name="RESB 103">''[[Rebellion Era Sourcebook]]'', p. 103.</ref>

name: Jezzable
description: Born in the final [[Time/Legends|decades]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Old Republic]]<ref name="age" /> on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Celanon/Legends|Celanon]], Jezzable was a twenty-seven-[[Standard year/Legends|year]]-old [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="TRP" /> during the early years of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].<ref name="era">''[[The Politics of Contraband]]''</ref> With long flowing [[Color/Legends|red]] hair and green [[Eye/Legends|eyes]], and possessing a flawless complexion with a captivating silhouette,<ref name="TRP" /> Jezzable was an alluring figure as she flirted with [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] visiting the various [[Cantina/Legends|bars]] in [[Celanon City]].<ref name="CSWE">{{CSWECite|II|161|Jezzable}}</ref> Jezzable's physical attributes, coupled with her provocative demeanor toward the opposite sex, greatly distressed her jealous boyfriend, [[Brooser]].<ref name="TRP" /><ref name="PoC">{{WEGCite|book=The Politics of Contraband|story=The Right Place ...}}</ref>{{RPGseed}}One afternoon, Jezzable was patronizing [[Gularg's Libation Emporium]] when a pair of [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] entered the establishment. Not long after, she had a [[Alcohol/Legends|drink]] delivered to one of the smugglers. When he inquired as to whom had sent the beverage, [[Gularg]], the bar's owner, pointed to Jezzable. Within a few [[Standard minute/Legends|minutes]], she had joined the smuggler's table and pleasantly chatted with him until Brooser noticed and became physically violent. Additional bar occupants became involved in the fray until [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] weapons were drawn. At that point, Gularg&mdash;who did not condone the use of blasters in his bar&mdash;disarmed the opponents and ended the altercation.<ref name="PoC" />{{Endgame}}

name: Tirgee Benyalle
description: Tirgee Benyalle was a crime boss on [[Kaal/Legends|Kaal]] who exercised control of the planet's illegal gambling and entertainment industry. After the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire's]] defeat in the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], Imperial forces withdrew from Kaal. Benyalle used her wealth and influence to move into the power vacuum, becoming Kaal's ruler and keeping the planet independent.<ref name="The Kaal Connection" />She used her funds to build Kaal's aquaculture industry until, in [[6 ABY/Legends|6 ABY]], she realized that she needed outside investment to expand it any further. She solicited outside powers to come to Kaal and negotiate for Kaal's aquacultural exports, and received [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Uther Kermen|Kermen]], representing the Empire; [[Utoxx Prentioch]], a nearby [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]]; [[Talon Karrde]], posing as [[Syndic/Legends|Syndic]] [[Pandis Hart]] of the [[Sif-Uwana Council]]; and a [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] delegation.<ref name="The Kaal Connection" />Benyalle received the group at her [[Grand Imperial]] hotel and casino, hosting a high-stakes [[Sabacc/Legends|sabacc]] game for the negotiators the night before the talks began. The next morning, she took the parties on a tour of a [[harvester factory]] and then began accepting bids aboard her luxury [[Sail barge/Legends|sail barge]]. Kermen, however, revealed a plan to retake Kaal by force, and he, his [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] bodyguards, and the agents with which he had surreptitiously replaced most of the barge's crew attacked Benyalle. She was defended by Karrde, the New Republic delegation, and loyal crew members, but Kermen had bribed her bodyguard [[Sendir]] to betray her. The New Republic agents saved her from Sendir's attack, and escaped with her onto a [[submersible]] summoned by Karrde.<ref name="The Kaal Connection" />Karrde explained that he had only been interested in the wreck of [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine's]] personal yacht, [[Emperor's Shadow (shuttle)|''Emperor's Shadow'']], which he had destroyed to cover their getaway. Benyalle was thus left to make her export deal with the New Republic.<ref name="The Kaal Connection" />

name: Tanith Sorn
description: Tanith Sorn worked as a bridge [[Officer/Legends|officer]] aboard the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|''Executor''-class Star Dreadnought]] [[Executor/Legends|''Executor'']], where she developed a rivalry with her fellow bridge officer Lieutenant [[Ein Truminn]]. In [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], around the time of the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]], Sorn began to suspect that [[Malkor Trel]], a crewman aboard the ship, was a [[Spy/Legends|spy]] for the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. Sorn's suspicions were correct and Trel decided to silence her to prevent his cover from being blown, by programming some of the ships [[ASP-7 labor droid]]s to [[Death/Legends|murder]] her. The [[Droid/Legends|droids]] killed Sorn and afterwards, a group of ''Executor'' crewmen, including [[Suba (lieutenant)/Legends|Suba]], were chosen by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]] to investigate her death.{{Char-stub}}

name: Sando (smuggler)
description: Sando was known for going after easy targets. She and her [[Sando's Boys|gang]] often would board damaged ships, repair them and then take their cargo as payment. They also looted old smuggler bases in the caves of Volik, since these were often deserted after a smuggling group was driven off or eliminated by rivals.Sando and her gang were searching for the [[mask of Darth Nihilus]], which was rumored to be in the wreckage of a [[Dynamic-class freighter|''Dynamic''-class freighter]], the ''[[Nashuaga]]'', that crashed in the canyons of Volik. They came in contact with several other groups also searching for the mask.

name: Becca Westone
description: Becca Westone attended the [[Imperial Academy/Legends|Imperial Academy]] as a [[Journalist/Legends|journalism]] major. Upon graduation, she found work with a news agency which she found had pro-[[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance]] management. Westone wrote an in-depth and highly-specific exposé against them for [[Imperial HoloVision]]. The agency was quickly shut down, and she was offered a position within Imperial HoloVision. Westone accepted the offer, and soon became known as one of the agency's best investigative reporters.{{Char-stub}}

name: Quayce
description: Quayce had no idea what [[Planet/Legends|planet]] she was born on. At the age of ten, she stowed away on a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] [[Starship/Legends|ship]] and left her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]]. The pirates accepted Quayce into their organization, and for six [[Standard year/Legends|years]] she worked long and hard as their [[Steward (occupation)|Steward]]. The jobs she did were, in her opinion, only fit for [[Droid/Legends|droids]] to carry out, but the pirates disagreed since they were more valuable. Quayce quickly developed a hatred of droids. Despite it not being a life of action and adventure, Quayce learned much including how to fight and studied the [[Captain/Legends|captain's]] leadership style.<ref name="SG" />When the vessel made port on [[Shesharile 5]], Quayce jumped ship at [[Gallisport]]. Finding herself in the middle of [[Swoop gang/Legends|swoop gang]] war, she ended up joining the [[Rabid Mynocks]]. Finding a home in the Mynocks, she eventually rose to leader the gang after their current leader was killed. A vote actually chose [[Roy Harlison]] to lead, but he was not interested and recommended Quayce for the role. Under her leadership, the Rabid Mynocks flourished for six years until they were framed for crimes they did not commit. The core Mynocks were arrested, with other members of the gang joining their rivals or going into hiding.<ref name="SG" />Before being sent to the [[Spice Mines of Kessel|Spice Mines]] of [[Kessel/Legends|Kessel]], Quayce and her core members escaped with help from their friends. Running from the law, Quayce shaved one side of her head and began a recruiting compaign to return the Mynocks to their old strength. Shortly after, the Mynocks managed to regain their position as the guardians of [[Zone Three]].

name: Lagos/Legends
description: {{Quote|Something is wrong on Mandalore.''"<br />"''But these problems are bigger than ''us''. Just let the authorities handle it.|Korkie Kryze and Lagos|The Academy}}[[File:CadetsConfideInTheWrongGuy-TA.png|thumb|left|250px|A young Lagos with her friends]]Lagos was one of the students of the [[Royal Academy of Government]] that aided in the exposure of corruption in the [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]] government. Soon after being instructed by [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] on the dangers of corruption in government, Lagos, along with [[Korkie Kryze/Legends|Korkie]], [[Amis/Legends|Amis]], and [[Soniee/Legends|Soniee]] broke into the warehouse where the food rations were being stored. Upon breaking in, it was discovered that a government official had been making deals in order to strengthen the black market on Mandalore. After recording the deal, the students were shortly after discovered, but escaped capture.After unwittingly confessing to Ahsoka what they had done, they soon took the recording to [[Duke/Legends|Duchess]] [[Satine Kryze/Legends|Satine Kryze]], in the hopes that she would fix the problem. However, Satine although assuring them she would do something, also warned them not to get involved. This led the cadets to contact [[Prime Minister/Legends|Prime Minister]] [[Almec/Legends|Almec]] with the information. Unknown to them however, Almec was the one responsible for the dealings. Almec had attempted to capture the students, but the intervention of Ahsoka prevented it from happening.Attempting to warn Satine about Almec, it was discovered she had already been captured. Ahsoka in an attempt to discover Satine's location, handed the students over as prisoners hoping Almec would reveal where Satine was, with no success. After Satine would not sign a confession of [[Treason/Legends|treason]] under pain of torture, Almec had planned on torturing the students in the hopes Satine would cooperate, but Ahsoka managed to escape and along with the students managed to capture Almec and root out the corruption in the Mandalore government.<ref name="The Academy">{{TCW|The Academy}}</ref><div style="float:right">[[File:CadetsAllGrownUp-TL.png|thumb|left|220px|Lagos and her friends breaking Duchess Satine out of prison]]</div>In [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]], the [[Shadow Collective/Legends|Shadow Collective]] took over Mandalore under the leadership of [[Pre Vizsla/Legends|Pre Vizsla]] and [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]]. Lagos assisted Korkie Kryze and [[Bo-Katan Kryze/Legends|Bo-Katan]] and the [[Nite Owls/Legends|Nite Owls]] in rescuing Satine, who had been imprisoned in the [[Sundari prison]]. Lagos flew the speeder used to transport the Duchess as they were chased by [[Mandalorian super commando/Legends|Mandalorian super commandos]]. They were able to get Satine out of [[Sundari/Legends|Sundari]] so that she could send send a message for help to [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Unfortunately, Satine was recaptured, but Lagos and the other students managed to escape the Mandalorian super commandos during the [[Battle of Sundari/Legends|Battle of Sundari]].<ref name="The Lawless">{{TCW|The Lawless}}</ref>

name: Zelice Sturm
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] at birth, Zelice Sturm was taken to [[Almas]] and inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[Almas Academy|experimental academy]] there, where she was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. The [[Jedi academy|academy]], experimental because it allowed older students to enter training and several teaching structures differed from the traditional methods set down by the [[Council of First Knowledge/Legends|Council of First Knowledge]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], was Sturm's home for the first decade of her life, where she became one of the academy's most promising students. As she progressed through the academy and was selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] for one-on-one training as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Sturm was of the opinion that older Force-sensitives should not be trained as Jedi. On a mission, Sturm was paired for the first time with one such "latecomer" Padawan who died accidentally during the assignment.<ref name="The Way of the Force" />Disturbed by her partner's death, Sturm refused to be paired with a "latecomer" again. Petitioning her master and the [[Almas Council|Academy's Council]] for a low-threat solo mission, Sturm was dispatched to the floating city of [[Tolea Biqua]] above [[Genarius]] to investigate a rumored [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling gang]] active there. During her search for evidence, Sturm was attacked by a street gang and seriously outnumbered. While Sturm attempted to intimidate the gang members, her efforts only incited violence. Scared, Sturm exerted herself through the Force as her attackers charged her, killing five members of a gang and one of its leaders. Realizing how under-skilled and under-equipped her attackers were, Sturm was consumed by regret and shame, and she felt that she was no longer fit to be a Jedi. She decided that she was only fit to be a hunted criminal, so she confronted the leader of the smuggling ring and demanded to be made a full partner. The leader responded by attacking her, so she killed him and took over control of the gang.<ref name="The Way of the Force" />Attempting to remain in the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light]] of the Force, Sturm ruled the gang with an iron fist for two years, calling herself the [[Black Queen]]. When the so-called [[Heroes of Cularin]] were said to be involved in the upcoming [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trial of Knighthood]] at the Almas Academy, Sturm began to plot the group's demise as a way to discredit the Jedi on Almas. In order to gauge the group's abilities, Sturm activated a series of [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]] she had reprogrammed to attack the group. The droids, owned by the local academy supplier [[Snem Noonb]], attacked a group of the Heroes while they toured Noonb's factory. Defeating the droids, the group later encountered [[Pindy Streeto]], a thug from the [[Rancor Riders]] gang that Sturm had hired to assassinate the group. Subduing the gang and Streeto, Sturm assisted in smuggling Streeto offworld and into hiding. Posing as Streeto, Sturm tried to manipulate the Jedi who hunted her, but she was eventually captured and taken back to the academy.<ref name="The Dark Side Beckons" />Back at the academy, Sturm underwent therapy with the masters there and was eventually brought back into the Order as a fully ranked [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. Once more an active Jedi, Sturm selected [[Meera Lisso]] as her Padawan, and the pair worked together on many missions from the Council.<ref name="Decision Coruscant" /> Having sat out the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] during her rehabilitation, Jedi Sturm fit well with the other Jedi at the academy, most of whom had invoked the [[Right of Denial]] when the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on Coruscant demanded all Jedi fight in the war. Circa [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]] the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Garth Ezzar]] led an [[Destruction of the Almas Academy|attack]] on the Almas Academy. Defending the academy and its students to her last breath, she died at the hands of Ezzar just as the Heroes of Cularin arrived to help defend the academy.<ref name="Destruction" />

name: Genarra
description: {{Quote|These are not my Knights, Kerra. You know that. They're on loan, more or less. I owe it to Chancellor Genarra not to waste their lives on a ten-percent plan!|Jedi Master Vannar Treece, to Kerra Holt|Star Wars: Knight Errant: Influx}}Genarra was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Jedi Consular]] who served the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]<ref name="Influx" /> during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the tumultuous [[New Sith Wars]],<ref>''[[Star Wars: Knight Errant: Influx]]'' reveals that Genarra was alive in [[1032 BBY]], a [[Standard year/Legends|year]] that falls within the dates given in ''[[The Essential Atlas]]'' for the start and end of the [[New Sith Wars]].</ref> a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[New Sith|resurgent Sith]].<ref name="Essential Atlas">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''</ref> Genarra eventually ascended to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]<ref name="Atlas Extra">{{SW|url=news/essential-atlas-extra-the-knight-errant-gazetter|text=''Essential Atlas'' Extra: The ''Knight Errant'' Gazetteer|int=The Knight Errant Gazetteer|archivedate=20200424153042}}</ref> and, by [[1032 BBY]],<ref name="Influx" /> was appointed as leader of both the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and the Galactic Republic,<ref name="Knight Errant novel">[[Knight Errant (novel)|''Knight Errant'' novel]]</ref> being one of a series of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] to hold the position of [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]].<ref name="Influx" /> During her rule, Genarra chose not to directly sponsor large-scale offensives against the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] because she believed that the majority of the Republic's populace was fearful of Sith attacks and would not support plans to send large groups of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] on campaigns in Sith [[Realspace/Legends|space]], rather than have the Jedi defend the Republic's frontiers.<ref name="Knight Errant novel" />Despite restrictions on such operations, the Jedi Master [[Vannar Treece]] launched numerous expeditions into Sith territories. Genarra did not oppose Treece's activities,<ref name="Knight Errant novel" /> and the Jedi Knight [[Kerra Holt]] regularly sent reports to the Chancellor on Treece's behalf. Circa 1032 BBY,<ref name="Influx" /> Treece began planning [[Operation Influx|a mission]] to take a team of Jedi to raid Sith [[Baradium/Legends|baradium]] production facilities in the [[Grumani sector]], and, in preparation for the operation, he compiled a report for Genarra that outlined the proposed mission and detailed the state of affairs in the Grumani [[Sector/Legends|sector]]. Genarra was also forwarded a copy of a briefing given by Holt to the [[Ministry of Defense|Defense Ministry]] on the detailed tactics that were to be used in the mission.<ref name="Atlas Extra" /> Treece's raid did not go according to plan and resulted in the [[Death/Legends|death]] of his entire strike team, with the exception of Holt, who was left stranded in the Grumani sector. During her stay in the region, Holt learned a lot of information about the [[Calimondra family|family]] of the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Vilia Calimondra]], and she documented her findings. The [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] [[Jarrow Rusher]] agreed to take the information to the Republic; Holt suggested that, on his arrival in Republic space, Rusher would have a chance to meet Genarra because of the value of the information.<ref name="Knight Errant novel" />

name: Fae Coven
description: {{Quote|As a Jedi, you must be faithful to the spirit of the Code. Every day you must ask yourself: Do I understand it?|Fae Coven|The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force (real-life book)}}A pink-skinned Jenet Jedi, Coven had been serving the Order for forty some years before joining in the ferocious [[New Sith Wars]].
