Helping to reorganize the [[Jedi academy]] following the defeat of the [[Brotherhood of Darkness]], Coven was elected as the Grand Master that would lead the Order and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] into its [[Golden Age of the Old Republic|Golden Age]]. Because of inconsistencies in training caused by the war, Coven decided to create a guidebook that set all of the Order's regulations in plain spoken [[Galactic Basic Standard|Basic]] that was available to all Jedi.<ref name="TJP" />In her guidebook, Coven typically began each section, detailing regulations set in place or certain ceremonies to be observed. With the assistance of several fellow Masters, Coven's dream came to fruition and ''The Jedi Path'' became a facet in the Order's traditional readings.<ref name="TJP" />While her date of death is lost to history, one of her future successors, a student of the Force known as [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]], wrote in a volume of her guidebook that he remembered her from his years as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] at the academy. This places her death sometime after the year [[896 BBY/Legends|896 BBY]].<ref name="TJP" />

name: Skarch Vaunk
description: Like most Jedi of the era, Master Vaunk served the Order as a member of the [[Army of Light]] in the crusades against the [[Brotherhood of Darkness]] known as the [[New Sith Wars]]. At some point, Master Vaunk was appointed the [[Jedi Battlemaster|Battlemaster]] of the academy on Coruscant and considered one of the most knowledgeable Jedi in the art of the lightsaber. A companion since the end of the war, Master Vaunk's sparring partner [[Snar Extruct]] helped build on her strengths and weaknesses.<ref name="TJP" />As Battlemaster, Master Vaunk held her students to very high standards; as chief lightsaber instructor Vaunk decided who was admitted to classes where live lightsabers were used in addition to overseeing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]]. Vaunk was given the authority to teach [[Form VII/Legends|Form VII]] to those she felt were capable of handling it, while refusing to allow the Form to be abused as it had been during the Sith Wars. In fact, Vaunk was a staunch supporter of [[Form "Zero"]], the act of solving a problem without a lightsaber. Codifying the lightsaber construction ceremony and the ceremonies of the [[Mid-Year Fete]], Vaunk was confident that the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] had been defeated during the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan]].<ref name="TJP" />When her fellow Masters proposed that a guidebook to the life of the Jedi be written, Master Vaunk agreed to work on the project, contributing three chapters. Penning the chapter on the Third Pillar of the Jedi: Self-Discipline, Master Vaunk described the three main forms of meditation and how knowledge of each was vital to handling lightsaber combat. Additionally, she wrote the "Introduction to the Lightsaber," and a guide to "[[Form I/Legends|Form I Combat]]." The second chapter she contributed was titled "Lightsabers: Their Construction and Use." This chapter described lightsaber variants and countermeasures, and detailed Forms II through VI. She finished off the chapter with a detailed explanation on the Marks of Contact. Her final chapter was on advanced lightsaber techniques, which explained Form VII and additional techniques.<ref name="TJP" />

name: Restelly Quist/Legends
description: A survivor of the [[New Sith Wars]], Quist was made a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and offered the position of [[Caretaker of First Knowledge/Legends|Caretaker of First Knowledge]]. Eager to pass reform and encourage advanced studies at the academy, Quist eagerly accepted the offer, taking her seat at the head of the [[Council of First Knowledge/Legends|Council of First Knowledge]], serving beside such famed Masters as the [[Ithorian/Legends|Ithorian]] [[Obba]].<ref name="TJP" />Upon her appointment as the [[Chief Librarian/Legends|Chief Librarian]] of the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Jedi Archives]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Quist immediately began attempting to bring to light the lack of focus that had plagued the [[Jedi Initiate|students]] at the academy. Replacing [[Barra-Rona-Ban]], Quist swiftly began implementing reform. Believing that the Archives were the source of all wisdom, Quist stated that her colleagues would not be where they were if it weren't for their study in the vast Stacks. Like many [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], Quist was confident that the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] had been defeated during the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan]].<ref name="TJP" />When her fellow Masters proposed that a guidebook to the life of the Jedi be written, Master Quist was quick to pen five chapters in hopes that she could pass down her strict view on the necessity of study to future generations of Jedi. Describing the Second Pillar of the Jedi: Knowledge, Quist urged study in the Archives and throughout the Temple, as the entire complex was filled with history and demonstrations of the [[Living Force/Legends|Living Force]]. Writing down the rules and regulations of the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]] as head of the Academy, Quist pointed out how the tests had evolved over the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] and formalized during the time of peace known as the [[Golden Age of the Old Republic]]. Another contribution was a detailed analysis of other [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-using organizations, which painted clearly Master Quist's belief that all [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-users]] should join the Jedi Order, and if they weren't already a member they should be persuaded to convert through diplomacy.<ref name="TJP" />

name: Unidentified dark-skinned Sith Saber
description: A dark-skinned [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] was born on the remote [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kesh]] around the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Second Galactic Civil War]]. A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], she was [[Sith training|trained]] by the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]], descendants of a group of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] who had been stranded on Kesh thousands of [[Standard year/Legends|years]] previously.<ref name="Omen" /> By [[41 ABY]],<ref name="TERC">''[[The Essential Reader's Companion]]''</ref> she had attained the rank of [[Sith Saber]]. In that year, the [[Sith Meditation Sphere]] [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]] arrived on the world and contacted the [[Sith Tyro]] [[Vestara Khai]].<ref name="Omen" />Khai was then summoned before the Tribe's ruling council, the [[Circle of Lords]], in the [[Kesh capitol building|capitol building]] in the Kesh [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Tahv]]. There, the female [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] Saber awaited Khai alongside two fellow Sabers, [[Shura (Sith)|Shura]] and a [[Unidentified male Sith Saber (Kesh)|male Saber]]. When Khai arrived, the female Saber greeted the Tyro, and then Shura took Khai to the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lords]] in the [[Circle Chambers]].<ref name="Omen" />

name: Violia
description: [[Reproduction/Legends|Born]] sometime prior to [[115 BBY]],<ref name="Birth" /> Violia was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was accepted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at an early age. While [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] on the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], she became friends with fellow student [[Thame Cerulian]],<ref name="TJP" /> a future [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and [[Jedi High Council/Legends|High Council]] member.<ref name="LOTJ">''[[Legacy of the Jedi]]''</ref> Unlike Cerulian, who was chosen as an [[Padawan/Legends|apprentice]] by Master [[Unskette]], Violia did not graduate from Initiate to Padawan. Instead, the [[Council of Reassignment/Legends|Council of Reassignment]] appointed her to the [[Jedi Service Corps/Legends|Jedi Service Corps]] branch known as the [[Agricultural Corps/Legends|Agricultural Corps]], which worked to maintain a healthy [[Planet/Legends|planetary]] biosphere on a number of worlds and aided the growth of crops through the application of the [[Living Force/Legends|Living Force]].<ref name="TJP" /> Violia was dispatched to the [[Agriworld/Legends|agriworld]] of [[Dilonexa XXIII]]<ref name="Dilonexa">Though [[The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force (real-life book)|''The Jedi Path'']] only says "Dilonexa," the planet Violia was assigned to must have been Dilonexa XXIII, since it was the only habitable world in the [[Dilonexa system]]. See {{CSWECite|I|189|Dilonexa XXIII}}.</ref> in the [[Centrality/Legends|Centrality]], a region [[Galactic Rim|Rimward]] of [[Hutt Space/Legends|Hutt Space]].<ref name="TEA">''[[The Essential Atlas]]''<!-- p. 162 --></ref> Following Violia's AgriCorps assignment, Cerulian made a marginal comment about it in his copy of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] trainee [[Book/Legends|guidebook]] ''[[The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force]]'', in which he expressed a wish to visit her if one of Master Unskette's missions brought him to Dilonexa.<ref name="TJP" />

name: Peawp R'dawc
description: {{Quote|So the mayor finally consented to send me some assistance, did he? Better late than never. There's no point in wasting time. Let's take down some of the thugs that plague our city.|Peawp R'dawc, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}By the time of the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], Peawp R'dawc worked in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]], under the orders of [[Mayor/Legends|Mayor]] [[Mikdanyell Guh'rantt]], and was tasked to take care of the thugs who preyed on the city.<ref name="SWG:HHE" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> she managed to get an individual to deal with the problem. While affiliated with [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Jabba the Hutt's criminal organizarion]], the [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] acted on behalf of the Mayor Mikdanyell Guh'rantt. The spacer ridded the outskirts of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] from undesirable [[Swoop gang/Legends|swoopers]], [[Scavenger/Legends|scavengers]], [[Moisture vaporator/Legends|moisture]] thieves, [[Smuggler/Legends|gunrunners]] and malfunctioning [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droids]]. Peawp R'dawc eventually tasked the spacer to defeat [[Vaigon Shinn]]'s [[Shinn muggers|muggers]] in their [[Vaigon Shinn's Hideout|hideout]].<ref name="SWG:HHE" />

name: Ghia Preyssola
description: Preyssola worked for [[Republic Intelligence/Legends|Republic Intelligence]] and was responsible for forming and co-ordinating Republic Intelligence cells in the [[Luire system]]. Following the invasion of the Luire system by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Preyssola took refuge in the village [[Silence]] on [[Nyriaan/Legends|Nyriaan]], a [[Planet/Legends|planet]] in the Luire system. She re-emerged when the Republic regained control of Nyriaan, and later joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]].

name: Koon Odan
description: Following the outbreak of a trade disagreement between [[Iridonia/Legends|Iridonia]] and [[Duro/Legends|Duro]], Odan was sent to [[Cloud City/Legends|Cloud City]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]], to negotiate a treaty with the [[Duros/Legends|Duros]] corporate official [[Belai Kaleeg]]. However, unknown to Odan, the Iridonian government also sent an [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] to Bespin, to kill Kaleeg and prevent the treaty from being signed. However, after the assassination attempt failed, the assassin was ordered to kill Odan instead.

name: Lilit Arranda
description: Lilit Arranda was a native of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] and following the [[Death/Legends|death]] of her husband, she enlisted in the [[Imperial Navy/Legends|Imperial Navy]]. She underwent training as a [[Medic/Legends|medic]] and was eventually assigned to serve aboard the [[Executor-class Star Dreadnought/Legends|''Executor''-class Star Dreadnought]] [[Executor/Legends|''Executor'']]. Shortly after the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]] in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]], Arranda was part of a group of ''Executor'' crewmembers who were tasked with solving the murder of [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Tanith Sorn]].

name: Barratk'l
description: At some point in her life, Barratk'l was badly wounded in her throat. While the damage was being repaired, she requested that her vocal cords be thinned, allowing her speech to be more understandable to other species. A line of white fur marked the scar on her throat.<ref name="Vortex">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Vortex]]''</ref>

name: Night Forael Wren
description: Night was the daughter of [[Lavina Durada-Vashne Wren]] and [[Jarid DeBell]]. Her mother was a [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]], representing the [[Cularin system]], and when Night was seven, she was kidnapped by the [[Thaereian military]], so they could blackmail the Senator into supporting their actions in the system. Night was taken to [[Thaere Privo]], where she lived with [[Colonel/Legends|Colonel]] [[Rast'tul]] and was cared for by [[Nannat]], a nanny. Rast'tul convinced her that her parents didn't love her and that they had sent her to live with him because they didn't have enough time to care for her. After turning eight, she was rescued from Thaere Privo by the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who had been sent by her mother to save her. They took her back to [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]] and she was reunited with her parents.

name: Unidentified Queen of Naboo (New Republic)
description: At some point following the [[Declaration of a New Republic/Legends|establishment]] of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]<ref name="WoSW" /> in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> a young [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] became the [[Monarch of Naboo/Legends|Queen]] of the Human [[Naboo (people)/Legends|people]] living on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]],<ref name="WoSW" /> the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of the [[Chommell sector/Legends|Chommell sector]].<ref name="EAWGG">''[[Star Wars: Empire at War: Prima Official Game Guide]]''</ref> When the famous [[Zoologist/Legends|zoologist]] [[Lyrre T'enna]] came to observe the Nabooian wildlife, the [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] allowed her access to the royal [[twirrling]], [[Hunting/Legends|hunting]], and [[Guarlara/Legends|guarlara]]-riding parties. T'enna made on-the-fly drawings of the Queen with her mounts, pet [[twirrl]]s, [[handmaiden]]s, and [[Royal Naboo Security Forces/Legends|Nabooian Royal Guards]]. The monarch was also depicted holding [[Voorpak/Legends|voorpaks]], diminutive furballs traditionally kept as mascots by [[Noble/Legends|noblewomen]]. T'enna's [[Color/Legends|colored]] renderings eventually appeared in the [[Lyrre T'enna's annotated field guide|published version]] of her field journal.<ref name="WoSW" />

name: Voe Atell/Legends
description: {{Quote|Say it aloud before this gathering, as representative for Chancellor Palpatine that you declare without reservation the Separatist State ''legitimate''.|Voe Atell, to Padmé Amidala, during the peace conference on Mandalore|A Friend in Need}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] member of a [[Voe Atell's species|green-skinned, horned species]], Voe Atell<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides Ep Guide" /> lived during the last [[Standard decade/Legends|decades]] of the rule of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. As a [[Politics/Legends|politician]], she opposed the Republic and joined the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], a breakaway government [[Raxus Address/Legends|formed]]<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" /> in the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[24 BBY/Legends|24 BBY]] and [[Head of State/Legends|headed]] by [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]]. By the [[Time/Legends|time]] the Confederacy waged [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] war on the Republic in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]] in what became known as the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]],<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> Atell became a [[Senator/Legends|senator]] in the [[Separatist Parliament]], being affiliated with the [[Corporate Alliance/Legends|Corporate Alliance]]. As part of her duties, Atell attended Parliament sessions at the [[Separatist Senate Building/Legends|Separatist Senate Building]] on the [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Raxus Secundus/Legends|Raxus]].<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" />[[File:AtellSepVote-HOBS.png|thumb|left|250px|Atell and other Separatist senators vote against Bonteri's bill for peace negotiations.]]In [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], the second year of the war,<ref name="FF-2014 7: Katuunko">{{FFCite|y=2014|7|KAT1&ndash;2, ''King Katuunko''}}</ref> Separatist Senator [[Mina Bonteri/Legends|Mina Bonteri]]<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" /> of [[Onderon/Legends|Onderon]]<ref name="Encyclopedia: Bonteri">{{SWE|characters|minabonteri|Mina Bonteri|archivedate=20131217150913}}</ref>&mdash;collaborating with an old friend, Republic Senator [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]]&mdash;introduced a [[Confederate&ndash;Republic peace initiative/Legends|bill]] to immediately open peace negotiations with [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] and the Republic, as she and Amidala believed that the war had consumed enough lives since its [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|outset]]. Atell took to the floor against Bonteri, swearing that the Corporate Alliance would never support such a bill for peace with the Republic. Her statement was rebutted by<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" /> Senator [[Kerch Kushi/Legends|Kerch Kushi]],<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides Ep Guide" /> who proclaimed that the Parliament was a democracy, uncontrolled by corporate interests like the Corporate Alliance, as the Republic was. When [[Count/Legends|Count]] Dooku called for a voice vote in accordance with the [[Bylaws of Independent Systems/Legends|Bylaws of Independent Systems]], Atell and a number of other senators voted nay, but they were outvoted by Bonteri and other supporters of the peace initiative. Although the proposal for peace negotiations was extended to the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Republic Senate]], Dooku&mdash;who was secretly a [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] and sought to have the war continue to serve the purposes of the [[Order of the Sith Lords|Sith]]&mdash;had the Confederate [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] execute a [[Bombing of Coruscant's central power distribution grid/Legends|sneak attack]] on the Republic capital of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], which portrayed the peace initiative as insincere in the [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] of the Republic Senate.<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" /> Dooku also had Bonteri [[Attack on Confederate territory|murdered]]<ref name="Explore: A Friend in Need">{{SW|url=series/clone-wars/-episode-guidea-friend-in-need|text="A Friend in Need" Episode Guide - ''The Clone Wars''|archivedate=20200429015803}}</ref> and, alleging that she had been [[Death/Legends|killed]] in a Republic attack, cited her death as a reason to formally withdraw the Separatist Parliament's peace bill.<ref name="Pursuit of Peace">{{TCW|Pursuit of Peace}}</ref>Later in the war, Atell agreed to serve with [[Separatist Congress Leader/Legends|Separatist Congress Leader]] [[Bec Lawise/Legends|Bec Lawise]] and Senator [[Amita Fonti/Legends|Amita Fonti]] on a delegation that was to represent the Confederacy at the first-ever [[Confederate–Republic peace conference/Legends|peace conference]] with the Republic. The neutral world of [[Mandalore/Legends|Mandalore]] was selected as a meeting ground, with [[Duke/Legends|Duchess]] [[Satine Kryze/Legends|Satine Kryze]] of the [[New Mandalorians/Legends|New Mandalorians]] hosting the gathering in the capital [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Sundari/Legends|Sundari]]. Bringing a [[C-9979 landing craft/Legends|C-9979 landing craft]] to the Sundari docks, Atell and her colleagues arrived at the [[Sundari Royal Palace/Legends|Sundari Royal Palace]] with a [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] retinue of [[BX-series droid commando/Legends|BX-series droid commandos]], while the delegates from the Republic Senate&mdash;Padmé Amidala, [[Bail Prestor Organa]], and [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]]&mdash;brought [[Senate Guard/Legends|Senate Guards]], along with [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]]. Opening the meeting, Amidala stated that despite the tragedy of war, there was nothing that the Republic could do that would change everything that had already happened since the conflict's beginning. Speaking for her colleagues, Atell wasted no time in demanding that Amidala, being a representative of Chancellor Palpatine<ref name="A Friend in Need">{{TCW|A Friend in Need}}</ref> and the leader of the Republic delegation,<ref name="Explore: A Friend in Need" /> admit to the legitimacy of the Confederacy,<ref name="A Friend in Need" /> an acknowledgement that the Republic had been withholding since the establishment of the Separatist state.<ref name="Heroes on Both Sides" />Amidala hesitated to meet Atell's request, but before she could respond, she was interrupted by an uninvited individual, [[Lux Bonteri/Legends|Lux Bonteri]]. The son of Mina Bonteri, the young Bonteri had replaced his [[Parent/Legends|mother]] in the Separatist Parliament before recently renouncing his ties to the Confederacy. Taking a stand, Bonteri announced before the conference his discovery that Count Dooku had murdered his mother. Lawise immediately lambasted Bonteri's words as lies and had their BX-series [[Droid/Legends|droid]] [[Commando/Legends|commandos]] remove Bonteri from the room. Although Kryze protested, Atell stated that the matter was an internal affair,<ref name="A Friend in Need" /> preventing the Republic or the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]] from intervening as per protocol.<ref name="Explore: A Friend in Need" /> Once Bonteri had been escorted away by the [[Security droid/Legends|security droids]], Lawise apologized for the interruption and resumed the talks. In spite of efforts on both sides, the negotiations on Mandalore soon broke down<ref name="A Friend in Need" /> due to obstructions from covert interests on both sides,<ref name="Encyclopedia: Mothma">{{SWE|characters|mon-mothma|Mon Mothma|archivedate=20140107132910}}</ref> with Atell and her colleagues unable to reach an accord with the Republic senators. In the meantime, Bonteri was rescued from the Confederate [[Landing craft/Legends|landing craft]] by Tano, who was friends with the ex-Separatist and helped him escape from custody.<ref name="A Friend in Need" />

name: Unidentified female Imperial Knight 2
description: {{Quote|They'll expect me&mdash;and a contingent of Imperial Knights&mdash;to appear at the council&hellip;''"<br />"''I'll lead them&mdash;and your double.|Roan and Mohrgan Fel|Legacy 8: Allies}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] with long [[Color/Legends|brown]] hair worn worn in a ponytail was an [[Imperial Knight]] in [[130 ABY]].<ref name="Star Wars: Legacy 8: Allies" /> The Imperial Knights were an order of [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-users]] serving [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor]] [[Roan Fel]] of the [[Fel Empire|Galactic Empire]],<ref name="LECG">''[[Legacy Era Campaign Guide]]''</ref> and in that [[Standard year/Legends|year]], the brown-haired female participated in a ruse devised by Fel against the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Krayt]]. Following [[Battle of Caamas|the conclusion]] of the [[Sith&ndash;Imperial War]], Fel was informed by [[Director of Imperial Intelligence]] [[Morrigan Corde|Nyna Calixte]] that the [[One Sith|Sith]] who had helped his Empire defeat the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]] and win the war were intent on betraying him. [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Krayt planned to [[Death/Legends|murder]] Fel and seize the Imperial throne at an upcoming meeting of the [[Council of Moffs|Moff Council]], and Fel accordingly fled the Imperial [[Planet/Legends|throneworld]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Before doing so, he arranged for [[Roan Fel's double|his double]] to meet with Krayt in the [[Imperial Palace/Legends|Imperial Palace]] and buy him [[Time/Legends|time]] to escape.<ref name="Star Wars: Legacy 8: Allies" />[[Mohrgan Fel]], an Imperial Knight and the [[Emperor/Legends|Emperor's]] cousin, volunteered to lead the brown-haired female and [[Unidentified female Imperial Knight (Attack on Emperor Fel)|two]] [[Unidentified male Imperial Knight (Attack on Emperor Fel)|other]] Knights against Krayt in order to further the deception. The brown-haired female stood with her three brethren and surrounded the decoy Emperor<ref name="Star Wars: Legacy 8: Allies" /> as he and the [[Moff/Legends|Moffs]] discussed the consequences of the war being over. Krayt arrived with [[Darth Maladi|three]] [[Darth Nihl|of]] [[Darth Wyyrlok (III)|his]] fellow [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]] and demanded Fel's life, which prompted Mohrgan to call on the Knights to protect their Emperor. Krayt drew [[Jar'Kai/Legends|two]] [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]] and quickly [[Attack on Emperor Fel|killed]] the four Knights despite their attempts at a defense. He then struck down the decoy Emperor and proclaimed himself the Emperor of a [[Darth Krayt's Galactic Empire|new Empire]]. Fel and the remaining Imperial Knights were forced into [[Empire-in-exile|exile]].<ref name="Star Wars: Legacy 1: Broken, Part 1" /><ref name="Star Wars: Legacy 8: Allies" />

name: Sil Vaturha
description: Sil Vaturha was a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who was orphaned at a young age. She grew up on the streets of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] before being sold into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]]. [[Kaylo NaKuda]], a [[Herglic/Legends|Herglic]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]], purchased Vaturha and forced her to work in his underground [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]] garage, [[Kuda's Compound]], on the planet [[Stend VI]]. Varturha worked for several [[Standard year/Legends|years]] before she became his top [[Technician/Legends|mechanic]] for a year sometime after the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]].<ref name="WHSV" />

name: Vaala Razelle
description: {{Dialogue|Bwua'tu|There are hundreds of Sith running loose in the galaxy, and Chief Daala is preventing us from going to meet them. We have no choice.|Hamner|Son, we ''always'' have a choice. Will you stand aside so I can stop this?|Razelle|I'm sorry, Master Hamner. You should return to your quarters now.|attr=Bwua'tu, Hamner, and Razelle, shortly before Hamner attacks the two|src=Fate of the Jedi: Vortex}}Vaala Razelle was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Arcona/Legends|Arcona]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] who rose to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] in the [[New Jedi Order]] by [[44 ABY]]. At that [[Time/Legends|time]], the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances]] was in conflict with the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Order due to several Jedi Knights falling prey to a [[Force psychosis]]. Meanwhile, [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exiled]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] encountered a new [[Lost Tribe of Sith|Sith Tribe]], and the Jedi decided that they needed to send a strike team of [[StealthX]]s to assist him; however, the [[Galactic Alliance Sixth Fleet]] remained in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] over the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], ready to engage the Jedi [[Starfighter/Legends|fighters]] in fear that the strike would be against the Galactic Alliance.<ref name="Vortex" />[[File:KenthHamner-Vortex.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Kenth Hamner]]Following a fall-out between acting Grand [[Jedi Master/Legends|Master]] [[Kenth Hamner]] and the rest of the [[Jedi High Council (New Jedi Order)|Jedi Council]], Razelle was stationed alongside fellow Jedi Knight [[Yantahar Bwua'tu]] outside of the entrance to the [[Jedi Temple|Operations Hangar]] of the [[New Jedi Temple|Jedi Temple]] while the StealthXs prepared to launch. Hamner had been confined to his quarters following the Council's [[Vote of No Confidence/Legends|vote of no-confidence]] in his leadership, but he escaped and made his way to the [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]], confronting Razelle and Bwua'tu. Razelle began to reach for her [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]], but Hamner used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Telekinesis/Legends|knock aside]] her [[Limb/Legends|hand]]. He insisted that by allowing the StealthXs to launch they were committing an act of treason against the Galactic Alliance, but neither Jedi Knight responded.<ref name="Vortex" />When Hamner neglected to call either Jedi by name, Bwua'tu supplied Razelle's&mdash;Hamner apologized, and after learning that Bwua'tu was a relative of Alliance [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Nek Bwua'tu]], he attempted to play on his relation. When Bwua'tu remained resolute, Hamner requested one last [[Time/Legends|time]] that they step aside, but Razelle suggested that he return to his quarters. Angered, Hamner suddenly [[Unarmed combat|attacked]] them, knocking Razelle unconscious with a punch to the sensitive organ between her [[Eye/Legends|eyes]] and subduing Bwua'tu with a blow to his jaw. Hamner nevertheless [[Skirmish in the Operations Hangar|failed]] to stop the launch and [[Death/Legends|died]] in the attempt.<ref name="Vortex" />The Jedi Order later departed Coruscant in an attempt to lure the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] Tribe into a trap. Razelle was one of the many Jedi who led the efforts to [[Liberation of Coruscant (Lost Tribe of Sith emergence)|liberate]] Coruscant from the Sith. She traveled with Jedi Knights [[Bazel Warv]] and [[Seff Hellin]]&mdash;to get past the Sith agents who had infiltrated the planet, Warv posed as a renowned wrestler, Hellin as his manager, and Razelle as the manager's assistant. As they moved through the immigration inspection line at the [[Galactic Center Spaceport]], however, they noticed that two nearby Jedi, Yantahar Bwua'tu and [[Yaqeel Saav'etu]], had come under suspicion by Sith [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Suhale]].<ref name="Apoc">''[[Fate of the Jedi: Apocalypse]]''</ref>Razelle and Hellin tried to keep Warv moving, but he refused to leave his friends behind. Much to Razelle's dismay, Warv ignored their pleas and took several cases of [[Spice/Legends|spice]] from a group of four [[Ishi Tib/Legends|Ishi Tib]] [[Smuggler/Legends|smugglers]] by pretending to be their contact. Razelle and Hellin quickly caught on to his plan, and helped him take the cases. Warv promised to meet them at the rendezvous point, and he successfully to tricked the Sith into thinking that Saav'etu and Bwua'tu were simply spice smugglers.<ref name="Apoc" />

name: Reginna Bel Typolla
description: Gina was born on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Malthor]] around [[26 BBY/Legends|26 BBY]]. Sometime before [[1 BBY/Legends|1 BBY]] she was a weapon [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] and ran guns during the [[Medepiest Uprising]]. She survived the battle and later joined the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Alliance to Restore the Republic]]. She worked as a docking attendant at the [[Fabrillan]] [[City/Legends|city]] [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] on Malthor but was also part of [[Sleeper Cell V-16]].<ref name="CRO" />As part of her duties to the Rebels she would make copies of shipping manifests, ship registries and other incoming ship data on an apparently damaged [[Datacard/Legends|datadisc]]. She would dispose of the disc and [[Berren Sid Té]] or a member of his information network would retrieve the information for processing. She knew Sid but was unaware that he was also part of Sleeper Cell V-16. He was not told of her identity either but after a year he accidentally discovered her identity.<ref name="CRO" />

name: Hestizo Trace
description: While at the [[Marfa]] agricultural labs, she was kidnapped by [[Whiphid/Legends|Whiphid]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Tulkh]], who was hired by [[Darth Scabrous]], to retrieve the [[Murakami orchid]] and bring it to [[Odacer-Faustin]]. Hestizo had a connection to this orchid and thus could not venture too far away from it, otherwise the [[Plant/Legends|plant]] would wilt. She managed to escape with the orchid after Scabrous used a chemical from it to engineer an immortality formula. The drawback of the formula was that it ravaged the body until there was nothing left but a cannibalistic monstrosity, which quickly spread throughout the academy. Allying herself with Tulkh, Hestizo convinced the orchid to grow the pieces of itself within the zombies to stop them, only to exhaust the orchid. However, Scabrous used the [[Neti]] librarian, [[Dail'Liss]], to lure Hestizo to the library by mimicking the voice of the orchid which was still alive amidst the infection known as the Sickness. Hestizo was alone after she and Tulkh had parted ways, so she made for the library in search of her only remaining ally. Caught in his trap, Scabrous strapped Hestizo down on a sacrificial altar, ready to cut out her heart with a traditional Sith sword and become forever immortal.Hestizo was able to free herself from Scabrous's sacrifice, but before Scabrous could outright kill her, Hestizo's brother, [[Rojo Trace|Rojo]], arrived and briefly dueled the Sith Lord. Scabrous prevailed and killed Rojo, but Hestizo was able to kill him by telepathically convincing the orchid to sprout itself outward from his head, severely weakening him. She was then able to finish off Scabrous, now a complete zombie, using his own Sith sword against him. Hestizo managed to escape infection from the remaining Sith zombies when Tulkh's ship, the ''Mirocaw'', piloted by Sith Academy mechanic [[Pergus Frode]], flew in to save her. After evading the academy's perimeter defenses, Scabrous' HK droid managed to manipulate the turbolasers into destroying the control tower instead of the ''Mirocaw'', taking with it all the zombies.Even then, Hestizo found that the Sickness still had a chance of infecting the rest of the galaxy. Tulkh had become infected and chained himself up against a detachable wall in his ship when he felt the Sickness begin to take over. Tulkh asked Hestizo to open up the wall he chained himself to so that he would be blown out into the vacuum of space. Before she could do so, [[Rance Lussk]], an infected apprentice from the academy who had stowed away on the ''Mirocaw'', revealed himself. He attacked, but Hestizo was able to avoid his lunge, throwing him toward Tulkh and releasing the bulkhead, ejecting Tulkh and Lussk into space. With the final infected dead, Hestizo rested assured that the Sickness was over.Hestizo returned to Marfa where a new black orchid was waiting for her care. However, she instead decided to return to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] where she could resume her Jedi studies.{{Char-stub}}

name: Naa'leth/Legends
description: {{Quote|Karis and Naa'leth are the greatest warriors of our coven.|[[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]]|Nightsisters (episode)}}Naa'leth, along with fellow sister [[Karis/Legends|Karis]], was recognized by her leader [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]] as one of the greatest warriors of her clan.<ref name="nightsisters" /> Circa [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], she and other [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]] defended their clan's village against the approach of [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]], whom she and the others interpreted as an unwelcome stranger, unaware that she was in fact one of their clan. She soon became involved in the [[Mission to Serenno|revenge]] of Ventress on [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]]. The [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]]&mdash;Naa'leth, Karis and Ventress&mdash;initially gained the upper hand, but were overpowered by Dooku and forced to retreat.<ref name="nightsisters" />Naa'leth briefly accompanied fellow sisters Talzin and [[Talia (Nightsister)/Legends|Talia]] to Serenno on a [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Sheathipede-class transport shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] in order to deliver [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] to Count Dooku&mdash;a seemingly innocent gesture which in fact was part of a greater revenge scheme. The three Nightsisters returned to Dathomir shortly afterward.<ref name="Monster">{{TCW|Monster}}</ref>Naa'leth later died during the [[Battle of Dathomir (Clone Wars)|Battle of Dathomir]].<ref name="Massacre" />

name: Otsock
description: The Togorian was a member of the [[Fireclaw Horde]], a Togorian criminal gang, and she accompanied the Horde when they began operating in the [[Cularin system]] during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. While under the alias of Otsock and in disguise as a [[Duckonian]], the Togorian participated as a [[Swoop racing|racer]] in the [[Cularin Classic]], a [[Swoop/Legends|swoop]] racing event that the Horde planned to attack. During the race, the Togorian flew a [[Bespin Motors/Legends|Bespin Motors]] [[JR-4 swoop/Legends|JR-4 swoop]].

name: Chellemi Chuovvick
description: Chellemi Chuovvick, as a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], was trained at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. She eventually [[Jedi Initiate Trials|graduated]] from the [[Jedi academy|academy]] and was selected by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] to train as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]]. After completing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]], Chuovvick was [[Knighting ceremony/Legends|raised]] to the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]].<ref name="TCSWE" />During her time as a Knight, Chuovvick was partnered with fellow Jedi [[Empatojayos Brand]] and [[Bultar Swan/Legends|Bultar Swan]] and dispatched to the war-torn world of [[Sepan]] as part of the third Jedi team sent to negotiate peace in the [[Sepan Civil War|endless civil war]]. Negotiations dragged on for a [[Galactic Standard Calendar|month]], bringing about a short-lived peace. Following the Jedi's departure however, the world erupted back into violence as debate raged on whether to [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|secede]] from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and join the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. A fourth team was expected to replace Chuovvick and the other Jedi in order to end the fighting permanently.<ref name="TCSWE" />

name: Daughter/Legends
description: {{Quote|I am Daughter.|Daughter, introducing herself|Overlords}}[[File:DaughterFull-SWE.png|thumb|left|180px|The Daughter in her humanoid form]]

name: Besaama
description: When Besaama was twelve, she discovered [[the Tree]], a tree that was used as a base by the [[Wyrd]], while walking home through the jungles of Cularin. She entered the tree and two days later, she re-emerged as a member of the Wyrd, having given in the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]. Besaama was later redeemed and she abandoned the dark side.{{Char-stub}}

name: Clargod
description: During the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Clargod and the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] [[Dee'Hars]], [[Kelyan]] and [[Kiimo]] traveled to the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Gadrin]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], planning to capture [[Mattenic]] and [[Kerkum]], two former [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenants]] of the [[Oblee]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Nirama]]. Clargod and the rest of the team claimed to be in the employ of the [[Office of Peace and Security]], a law enforcement body that had placed a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on Mattenic and Kerkum. However, they were also working for [[Riboga]] the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]], who had recently seized control of crime in the [[Cularin system]] from Nirama, and the bounty hunters planned to get paid twice for capturing the pair. However, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] were also looking for Mattenic and Kerkum, and they prevented Clargod and the other bounty hunters from capturing the pair.<ref name="Preemptive Strike" />A short time afterward, the Heroes of Cularin destroyed Riboga's [[Spice/Legends|spice]] [[Mining/Legends|mining]] operation on the planet [[Kemix]],<ref name="Counterstrike">[[Counterstrike (Living Force)|''Counterstrike'']]</ref> so the Hutt hired Clargod, Dee'Hars, Kelyan and Kiimo to bring the heroes into a state of despair, and then [[Death/Legends|kill]] them. The bounty hunters placed explosives aboard a [[Starship/Legends|starship]] that the heroes were traveling on and then detonated the devices, bringing the hero's craft out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] and causing it to crash on the planet [[Holador]]. The bounty hunters landed on the world and Clargod took up a position in a valley, with some [[Sentry droid/Legends|sentry droids]] that were under her command. The heroes eventually made their way into the valley and Clargod offered to make a deal with them, whereby she would fight them all individually in unarmed combat, rather than simply attacking them all at the same time. The heroes engaged her in combat and defeated her, and they eventually made it off Holodor.<ref name="Strike III">''[[Strike III]]''</ref>

name: Kiimo
description: During the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Kiimo and the bounty hunters [[Dee'Hars]], [[Kelyan]] and [[Clargod]] traveled to the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Gadrin]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cularin/Legends|Cularin]], planning to capture [[Mattenic]] and [[Kerkum]], two former [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenants]] of the [[Oblee]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Nirama]]. Clargod and the rest of the team claimed to be in the employ of the [[Office of Peace and Security]], a law enforcement body that had placed a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] on Mattenic and Kerkum. However, they were also working for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Riboga]], who had recently seized control of crime in the [[Cularin system]] from Nirama, and the bounty hunters planned to get paid twice for capturing the pair. However, the [[Heroes of Cularin]] were also looking for Mattenic and Kerkum, and they prevented Clargod and the other bounty hunters from capturing the pair.<ref name="Preemptive Strike" />A short time afterward, the Heroes of Cularin destroyed Riboga's [[Spice/Legends|spice]] [[Mining/Legends|mining]] operation on the planet [[Kemix]],<ref name="Counterstrike">[[Counterstrike (Living Force)|''Counterstrike'']]</ref> so the Hutt hired Kiimo, Clargod, Dee'Hars, and Kelyan to bring the heroes into a state of despair, and then [[Death/Legends|kill]] them. The bounty hunters placed explosives aboard a [[Starship/Legends|starship]] that the heroes were traveling on and then detonated the devices, bringing the heroes' craft out of [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] and causing it to crash on the planet [[Holador]]. The bounty hunters then landed on the world and assembled a mock-up of a starship to distract the heroes, and Kiimo laid in wait for them beneath it. When the heroes approached the fake starship, Kiimo detonated some explosives to try and take then out. However, the heroes survived her trap and subsequently defeated her in combat<ref name="Strike III">''[[Strike III]]''</ref>

name: Xelian
description: {{Quote|When her bid began failing, Xelian&mdash;Odion and Daiman's mother&mdash;declared war on Chagras.|Arkadia Calimondra|Knight Errant (novel)}}[[File:Xelian and family.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Xelian, holding up Daiman for her followers to see]]Xelian, known to some by the sobriquet "Xelian the Destroyer," was a [[Human/Legends|Human]]<ref name="Escape, Part 3" /> [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="Knight Errant" /> [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]]<ref name="Escape, Part 1" /> who lived during the [[Republic Dark Age]].<ref name="Dark Age">The [[StarWars.com]] article [http://www.starwars.com/vault/books/knight_errant_lego/index.html Engineering with LEGOs: Creating the Ships of ''Knight Errant''] states that the ''Knight Errant'' novel is set in [[1032 BBY]], and that Xelian lived during the years preceding the novel. ''[[The New Essential Chronology]]'' identifies this time frame as being part of the Republic Dark Age.</ref> She was one of seven children born to [[Vilia Calimondra]], a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] who had acquired a [[Vilia Calimondra's empire|large empire]] in the [[Grumani sector]], and Xelian claimed the right to become her [[Parent/Legends|mother's]] only heir. However, Xelian's brother [[Chagras]] and their five other siblings all made similar claims, so Calimondra instigated a contest&mdash;the ''[[Charge Matrica]]''<ref name="Knight Errant" />&mdash;in [[1066 BBY]],<ref name="1066 BBY">The ''Knight Errant'' novel mentions that the ''Charge Matrica'' began 34 years before the events of the book. As the StarWars.com article [http://www.starwars.com/vault/books/knight_errant_lego/index.html Engineering with LEGOs: Creating the Ships of ''Knight Errant''] states that ''Knight Errant'' is set in 1032 BBY, this places the start of the contest in 1066 BBY.</ref> to decide which of her children would become her heir. The siblings were tasked with the expansion of Calimondra's holdings, and the Sith Lord planned to appoint as her heir the individual who expanded her territories the farthest. For a [[Time/Legends|time]], Xelian and the other siblings cooperated, but eventually Xelian's bid began to flounder. As a result, she declared war on Chagras, which caused all of the siblings to initiate hostilities against each other.<ref name="Knight Errant" /> To aid her campaign, Xelian had her [[Army/Legends|armies]] adopt a variant of [[the Crucible]] training system, which was first developed by the ancient Sith Lord [[Ieldis]] prior to the [[Great Hyperspace War]].<ref name="Escape, Part 1" /> She also established a headquarters for herself, inside a [[temple]]-like structure.<ref name="Escape, Part 3" />At some point, Xelian gave birth to a son, [[Odion]],<ref name="Knight Errant" /> who became her heir.<ref name="Escape, Part 3" /> In [[1057 BBY]],<ref name="1057 BBY">The ''Knight Errant'' novel mentions that Daiman was born 25 years before the events of the book. As the StarWars.com article [http://www.starwars.com/vault/books/knight_errant_lego/index.html Engineering with LEGOs: Creating the Ships of ''Knight Errant''] states that ''Knight Errant'' is set in 1032 BBY, this dates Daiman's birth to 1057 BBY.</ref> she bore another child, who she named [[Daiman]],<ref name="Knight Errant" /> and following his birth, she stood atop a rocky outcrop next to her temple residence and held up her new baby for her followers to see. Daiman quickly displaced Odion as the subject of Xelian's affections, and a sibling rivalry soon developed between the two brothers.<ref name="Escape, Part 3" /> Xelian also eventually became an aunt to Chagras' children, [[Dromika]], [[Quillan (Sith)|Quillan]], and [[Arkadia Calimondra]].<ref name="Knight Errant" /> During [[1052 BBY]],<ref name="1052 BBY">The ''Knight Errant'' novel mentions that Mandragall died 20 years before the events of the book. As the StarWars.com article [http://www.starwars.com/vault/books/knight_errant_lego/index.html Engineering with LEGOs: Creating the Ships of ''Knight Errant''] states that ''Knight Errant'' is set in 1032 BBY, this dates Mandragall's death to 1052 BBY.</ref> Xelian seduced the aging Sith Lord [[Mandragall]] and subsequently [[Death/Legends|killed]] him during the night.<ref name="Knight Errant" /> By [[1050 BBY]],<ref name="1050 BBY">The ''Knight Errant'' novel mentions that Kerra Holt was born during the period of peace that followed the conclusion of the ''Charge Matrica''. As the StarWars.com article [http://www.starwars.com/vault/books/knight_errant_lego/index.html Engineering with LEGOs: Creating the Ships of ''Knight Errant''] states that ''Knight Errant'' is set in 1032 BBY, and the novel states that Holt was 18 years old during the events of the book, this places the conclusion of the ''Charge Matrica'' at sometime before or during 1050 BBY.</ref> Chagras was the only one of Calimondra's children who remained active in the Grumani sector, and he became their mother's heir.<ref name="Knight Errant" /> Xelian herself eventually died,<ref name="Escape, Part 1" /> at some point prior to [[1032 BBY]].<ref name="Escape, Part 1" /><ref name="1032 BBY" />

name: Seese
description: In [[1038 BBY]], Seese migrated to the [[Arkadianate]] world of [[Syned]] where she settled in the city of [[Calimondretta]] and subsequently became an Arkadianate citizen. Due to [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Arkadia Calimondra]]'s policy of rotating individuals through different jobs in their lives, the Herglic mother had worked in at least five different occupations by [[1032 BBY]] including teaching, algae-processing, metallic reclamation, a tactical officer within the [[Citizen Guard]]&mdash;Arkadia's security force&mdash;who served aboard Arkadia's flagship ''[[New Crucible]]'', and finally as a tour guide on Calimondretta. She was also known to have four children who lived in the Arkadianate as well.In 1032 BBY, the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Kerra Holt]] traveled to Syned, and Arkadia ordered Seese to show Holt around Calimondretta. During the tour, Kerra found Seese to have a friendly and likeable personality. Through Seese, Kerra learnt more about life in the Arkadianate and Arkadia's public policies. Seese also found that she could like Kerra even though the latter was a Jedi Knight while she herself was a loyal subject of the Arkadianate. As with many Arkadianate citizens, Seese had been indoctrinated into believing that Arkadia was a benevolent dictator who cared for people. Seese also believed state propaganda rhetoric that Arkadia would one day rule the [[Galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]. During the [[Siege of Calimondretta]], Kerra would reflect that she was lucky not to have encountered Seese during the fighting since it would have been difficult to kill someone she had befriended merely a few hours earlier.

name: Vi'conya T'ili
description: {{Quote|It's a painful subject, but if you must know: the Tuskens destroyed my family and I have brought it upon myself to rid Tatooine of their worthless existence.|Vi'conya T'ili, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Vi'conya T'ili was native to the planet Tatooine. Prior to the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], her family was killed by the [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tusken Raiders]]. She remained deeply traumatized by the loss of her family and vowed to rid Tatooine of the Tuskens.<ref name="SWG:VT" />Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Vi'conya T'ili resided in the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] named [[Bestine (city)/Legends|Bestine]]. While there, she encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]]. At first, she was suspicious of the spacer, and even accused the individual of allying with the [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Tuskens]]. However, her suspicions and threatening remarks subsided when she learned that the spacer was actually interested in eliminating some Tuskens. She then offered the spacer the whereabouts of two locations on Tatooine, including [[Fort Tusken/Legends|Fort Tusken]], and the [[Tusken Village]] in the [[Western Dune Sea/Legends|Western Dune Sea]].<ref name="SWG:VT" />

name: Lureia
description: Lureia lived on a frontier world that continually changed hands during [[Second Charge Matrica|a conflict]] between the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]] [[Daiman]] and [[Odion]], and as a result of the invasions, all of Lureia's family were [[Death/Legends|killed]], except for her teenage sister. However, in c. [[1032 BBY]], when Lureia was aged about ten, her sister was also killed. For a week Lureia lived in panic, until she was discovered by talent scouts working for the company [[Industrial Heuristics]], who believed that Lureia had the potential to become an expert at [[Repulsorlift/Legends|repulsorlift]] design. Lureia was subsequently sent to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Gazzari]], to serve aboard an [[arxeum]], a type of mobile university dedicated to war sciences, which Daiman had acquired from the [[Quermian/Legends|Quermian]] Sith Lord [[Ayanos Bactra]]. However, the arxeum was destroyed during the [[Battle of Gazzari]], and Lureia and the other prospective students fled the planet with the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Kerra Holt]], aboard the [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] [[Transport/Legends|transport]] [[Diligence (New Sith Wars)|''Diligence'']]. Whilst aboard the craft, Lureia spent all of her time in her bunk, folding and refolding a blue-colored headband that had belonged to her sister

name: Cristina
description: During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], [[L-O53]] tasked a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] with finding a loved one for Cristina. After searching the cities of [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]] and [[Kaadara]] during the Festival of Love, the spacer found a companion who shared similar interests with Cristina.

name: Orqiti Aneofo
description: Sometime after [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Orqiti worked out of a merchant area in [[Bestine (city)/Legends|Bestine]], alongside her [[Jawa/Legends|Jawa]] associate. During the elections in Bestine between [[Sean Trenwell]] and [[Victor Visalis]], Orqiti encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] who she mistook as an individual interested in collecting influx capacitors. After listening to the Jawa for clarification, she learned that the spacer was not the one she was waiting for. Nonetheless, she used the chance to encourage the spacer to vote for Sean Trenwell as Bestine's [[Director of Commerce]] so that the marketplace in the city could thrive.

name: Altapi T'mman
description: In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], she was involved in a plan to gain the Alliance more secrecy. The operation involved the Alliance sacrificing three of its Corellian Corvettes by masquerading them as an expeditionary force trying to retake [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]], where they engaged a [[TIE/LN starfighter]] [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]]. The ships were operating with skeleton crews, and after the battle all their captains were accounted for&mdash;except for T'mman. Her [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]] had crashed, and her leg was injured, leaving her unable to make contact with the Alliance. She was rescued and escorted to safety by a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] sent by [[Mon Mothma/Legends|Mon Mothma]].

name: Alisia (Human)
description: {{Quote|These guys also perform over at Tansarii Point Station, but since I can't go there any more, I'm glad they come here as well.|A Nova Orion Industries employee|Star Wars Galaxies}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] by the name of Alisia participated in a [[Unidentiied Tansarii Point Station band|band]] during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]] along with two other [[Musician/Legends|musicians]], a Human named [[Mako (musician)|Mako]], and a [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] named [[Alitra]]. Her [[Band/Legends|band]] also comprised of two [[Entertainer|dancers]], a [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] named [[Mestral]], and a Zabrak named [[O'choa Detera]]. Following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]] in [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Alisia and her band played [[Music/Legends|music]] and danced for the patrons of the [[Unidentified cantina (Tansarii Point Station)|cantina]] owned by a Twi'lek named [[Tiarsis]] in the [[Tansarii Point Station]], a [[Space station/Legends|space station]] located near the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] in the [[Bright Jewel system/Legends|Bright Jewel system]]. As part of the band, Alisia played the musical instrument known as the [[Bandfill/Legends|bandfill]]. The Twi'lek entertainer [[Mira T'rani]] enjoyed the performance of Alisia's band, which featured two popular songs from [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] played by [[Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes/Legends|Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes]], [[Mad About Me/Legends|"Mad About Me"]] and [[Dune Sea Special/Legends|"Dune Sea Special"]].<ref name="SWG" />Alisia and her band also divided their time at another space station in the Bright Jewel system known as [[Nova Orion Station]]. In addition to the music they played on Tansarii Point Station, Alisia and her band also played two other cover songs belonging to the [[Max Rebo Band/Legends|Max Rebo Band]], including a [[Huttese/Legends|Huttese]] song named [[Lapti Nek/Legends|"Lapti Nek"]]. Despite the band's skill at playing these songs, their lack of original material drew criticism from at least one [[Nova Orion Industries]] employee frequenting the [[Unidentified cantina (Nova Orion Station)|cantina]].<ref name="SWG" />

name: Kalifa/Legends
description: {{Quote|It's ok. I can make it...''"<br />"''Kalifa!|Kalifa and Ahsoka as the former is fatally shot|Padawan Lost}}Entering into the [[Jedi academy|academy]], Kalifa became part of a [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|clan]] of several other [[Jedi Initiate]]s as she attended classes and studied the arts of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. Approaching the end of her training at the academy at the start of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Kalifa was away from Coruscant when she was abducted by [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] slavers and transported to the moon of [[Wasskah/Legends|Wasskah]] along with fellow Initiates [[O-Mer/Legends|O-Mer]] and [[Jinx/Legends|Jinx]].<ref name="PL" />Released into the wilds of [[Island Four/Legends|Island Four]], the three Initiates evaded their captors, who constantly hunted them for sport. Sleeping in caves and tree hollows by night, the group was constantly on the move to avoid being tracked. Over the course of their imprisonment, they encountered at least one captured [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] who eventually got themselves killed by the Trandoshans trying to confront them. Kalifa and her fellows were forced to forsake the Jedi role of protectors. If they tried to help the other prisoners, they would all certainly be killed. It wasn't until the Padawan [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] was captured and brought to the moon that the Initiates began to remember their training and take the offensive.<ref name="PL" />[[File:KalifaShot-PL.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Kalifa shot through the heart]]Searching for the [[Ubrikkian floating fortress|Trandoshan base]], the four Jedi-in-training were ambushed and divided into two groups. As Tano and Kalifa raced into the jungle, they were followed by a young Trandoshan hunter, [[Dar/Legends|Dar]], who managed to send Kalifa tumbling into the underbrush. Dar was then granted the kill opportunity by his father and pursued the two Force-sensitives. After a brief bout of hand-to-hand combat, the two Jedi managed to impale the Trandoshan on a jungle plant. As Tano helped Kalifa to her feet, Kalifa was struck in the back with a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] bolt by a vengeful [[Garnac/Legends|Garnac]] through the heart and collapsed. Taking cover, Tano stood with Kalifa as her life faded, promising to protect the others and lead them off the planet. When Kalifa was dead, Tano raced off, leaving her body on top of the crook of a tree root.<ref name="PL" />

name: Val (Natala Yooms' sister)
description: {{Quote|I told her not to marry a soldier, much less a pilot.|Natala Yooms, on the advice she gave to her sister, Val|The Old Republic: Deceived}}Val was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="ToR:Deceived" /> who was alive around [[3681 BBY]]<ref name="Date2">According to ''[[The Old Republic: Deceived]]'', Val lived during the [[Great Galactic War]], a twenty-eight-year conflict that began in [[3681 BBY]], as established in ''[[Timeline 6: Onslaught of the Sith Empire]]''.</ref> and was the sister to [[Natala Yooms]]. She eventually met and fell in love with [[Zeerid Korr]], a member of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] [[Republic Army|army]] who served as a [[Commando/Legends|commando]] and [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]<ref name="ToR:Deceived" /> for the [[Republic Special Forces Division|Special Forces]] division<ref name="Hope synopsis">{{TORweb|url=info/media/trailers/hope-cinematic-trailer|text=Hope Cinematic Trailer|int=Hope (cinematic trailer)|archivedate=20200222042813}}</ref> known as [[Havoc Squad]]. Natala cautioned her sister not to get involved with a pilot or soldier because of their inherent disregard for their own safety, but Val chose not to listen, instead [[Marriage/Legends|marrying]] Korr and conceiving a daughter, [[Arra Yooms|Arra]] in [[3662 BBY]].<ref name="ToR:Deceived" />The three lived together in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Yinta Lake]] on the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Vulta]]. Although Korr loved both his wife and daughter deeply, his duty as a soldier forced him to leave Vulta and fight for the Republic in the ongoing [[Great Galactic War|galactic war]] against the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Before the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Battle of Alderaan|invasion]] of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], while her husband was away, Val began to develop dizzy spells that impaired her motor abilities. She informed Korr of the situation, but the two overlooked the issue when he was issued a temporary planetside leave of absence. Eager to see her husband, Val traveled to meet Korr with her daughter in tow. During the trip, Val experienced another dizzying episode, causing her to veer her [[Airspeeder/Legends|airspeeder]] from its path and collide with another vehicle. The accident [[Death/Legends|killed]] Val and left Arra crippled; the young girl was nearly killed as well, but instead only lost her [[Limb/Legends|legs]], which were crushed in the impact.<ref name="ToR:Deceived" />Immediately after the incident, Korr resigned from the [[Republic Military/Legends|Republic Military]] to grieve for his wife and care for his daughter. Because the former soldier had no pension to speak of and no other readily available income, he was forced to join [[Exchange|The Exchange]] as a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]]. While he worked to earn [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] for Arra's medical expenses, the young girl was looked after by Val's sister, Natala.<ref name="ToR:Deceived" />

name: Lika/Legends
description: {{Quote|Ooh, look at her run.|Ratter, observing Lika's agility and jumping skills, moments before Sochek kills her|Padawan Lost}}Sometime during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Lika was captured by [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] hunters and along with other prisoners, including [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], she was transported to a [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Moon/Legends|moon]], [[Wasskah/Legends|Wasskah]] where they were to be hunted down for sport. Lika was dumped out of the [[HCT-2001 Dragonboat-class Reugeot 905 freighter|Trandoshan cruiser]] at night and managed to survive the [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] fire, fired by the Trandoshans. However, the next day, she met her fate when she, along with another prisoner [[Katt Mol/Legends|Katt Mol]] were walking along the jungle. Suddenly, a Trandoshan hunter [[Ratter/Legends|Ratter]] fired at them, [[Death/Legends|killing]] [[Katt Mol/Legends|Katt Mol]]. Lika tried to flee, jumping from tree to tree, but she was soon also killed by Ratter's partner, [[Sochek/Legends|Sochek]]. As Ahsoka went to help Lika, [[Kalifa/Legends|Kalifa]] pulled her back to keep cover.

name: Anoura
description: During the reign of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Anoura worked as an information broker for the [[Bothan/Legends|Bothan]] [[Elwis Bontraar]], a wealthy businessman who lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and was best known for the annual [[Galactic Costume Extravaganza]], a costume party where guests would swap information anonymously. Anoura was eventually killed on a routine mission for Elwis which brought much grief to her [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] sister, [[Zascha]].

name: Anim Kahn
description: During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Anim Kahn flew as a pilot for [[Lord/Legends|Lady]] [[Valarian/Legends|Valarian]]. At one point, she could be found outside the [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. While there, she encountered a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]], and explained not to listen to [[Rel Keteris]], the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Hutt]] pilot who was standing next to her. She explained to the spacer that Lady Valarian was much more generous, and could provide a worthwhile ship.<ref name="SWG" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Caryn/Legends
description: During [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]], Caryn kept a low profile in the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Mos Espa/Legends|Mos Espa]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. While there, she would receive shipments of contraband from various smugglers.<ref name="SWG" />

name: Shaeeah Lawquane/Legends
description: During the [[Battle of Saleucami/Legends|Battle of Saleucami]], the [[Lawquane family|Lawquanes]] housed the injured [[Clone trooper captain|Clone Captain]] [[CT-7567/Legends|Rex]], who later helped Cut defend [[Lawquane farmstead|the farm]] against a group of [[BX-series droid commando/Legends|BX-series droid commandos]], which Jek and Shaeeah accidentally activated. As an adult, Lawquane wrote ''[[My Stepfather's Face: A Soldier's Secret]]'' about her childhood, identifying Cut as a clone trooper deserter.<ref name="Author's Cut">{{SW|url=news/the-essential-guide-to-warfare-authors-cut-part-9-battlfields-of-the-clone-wars|int=Star Wars: The Essential Guide to Warfare Author's Cut|text=''Star Wars: The Essential Guide to Warfare'' Author's Cut, Part 9: Battlefields of the Clone Wars|archivedate=20170508022230}}</ref>{{Char-stub}}

name: First
description: {{Quote|The pilots were helping me escape from B'nish. I am&mdash;I was&mdash;a slave.|First|First Blood (short story)}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] girl was a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] from [[B'nish]] for some [[Time/Legends|time]], acquiring several scars at a young age. When a [[Damorian Manufacturing Corporation|Damorian]] [[s18 light freighter]] came to B'nish<ref name="First" /> around [[41 ABY|41.5 ABY]],<ref name="Omendate" /> the girl seized her chance and, with the help of the [[Starship/Legends|starship's]] [[Pilot/Legends|pilots]], stowed away aboard the vessel, wearing just a single tattered garment covering her from her shoulders to her knees.<ref name="First" />[[File:Vestara First.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Vestara Khai stands over the corpse of First]]After departing the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Eriadu/Legends|Eriadu]], however, the ship fell under [[Skirmish near Eriadu|attack]] by the [[Lost Tribe of Sith]] from the planet [[Kesh]] and their [[Sith Meditation Sphere]], [[Ship (Sith Meditation Sphere)|Ship]]. The sphere opened fire with its weapons, and the [[Freighter/Legends|freighter]], heavily damaged, was forced to crash-land on a nearby planet for repairs. In the rough landing, the girl suffered a wound on her head and was knocked unconscious. When she awoke, she encountered [[Vestara Khai]], an [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] of the Lost Tribe. The girl, seeing an activated [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] in the apprentice's hand, begged for her life, and offered Khai the cargo aboard the ship, promising that nobody would ever know if Khai allowed her to escape, as her name was not on any crew roster. Khai, however, told the girl that she would have to [[Death/Legends|kill]] her and offered her a painless death if the girl knelt in cooperation. The girl broke into tears and declared that her life was her own, and that she was no longer anybody's servant. She attempted to escape, but Khai threw her [[Glass/Legends|glass]] [[parang]] at the fleeing girl, killing her instantly. As Khai approached the girl, wondering what her name might have been, Ship told Khai to name the girl herself. After a moment's thought, Khai named the girl "First," as she was the first of many whose lives the Sith apprentice hoped to take.<ref name="First" />

name: Reess Kairn
description: [[File:Reess_Kairn_attacks_Ffib.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Kairn murders four Ffib priests.]]Reess Kairn was a member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], having reached the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], during the waning years of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. On [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], Kairn met a female with whom he fell in love, marrying her against the tenets of the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] and without the knowledge of the High Council. Keeping their love secret, Kairn remained an active Jedi, returning every so often to be with his wife.<ref name="TBHAS" />On one occasion, Kairn returned to his home on Ryloth to find his mate with another man. Enraged, Kairn killed them both in his anger, before burning his home to the ground. Fearful of the punishment the High Council would seek against him, Kairn fled the Jedi Order and began a new life of [[Pirate/Legends|piracy]]. Establishing a pirate crew, Kairn sunk deeper into the grasp of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]] and began raiding mines and trade ships throughout the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]].His last known raid was on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Lorahns/Legends|Lorahns]], where he ransacked the [[Great Temple (Lorahns)|Great Temple]] of the [[Order of the Ffib]], and killed four priests during his departure. Escaping with priceless artifacts, Kairn disbanded his crew as the darkness in his heart lifted. Seeking redemption, Kairn hired three [[Shi'ido]] to simulate his appearance so he could escape the Ffib Inquisitors. As the three Shi'ido dispersed across the galaxy, Kairn went to [[Balmorra/Legends|Balmorra]] where he subjected himself to [[transgenderative surgery]], altering his appearance in both [[Species/Legends|species]] and [[Sexes/Legends|gender]], to become a [[Human/Legends|Human]] or [[Near-Human]] female, in honor of his wife. The results of the surgery were convincing, yet poorly done, and left Kairn with long lopsided scars across her face. She subsequently joined the [[Order of the Ffib]], disguised as a blind [[Daughters of the Ffib|priestess]], in honor of the priests she had killed.<ref name="TBHAS" />To encourage the process of eliminating her doppelgangers, Kairn retreated to the [[Endor/Legends|Sanctuary Moon]] of [[Endor (planet)/Legends|Endor]] in [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]] and contracted the [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]] to hunt down and kill "Reess Kairn". Claiming that the real Kairn had hired two Shi'ido to impersonate him, Kairn hoped that Sing would eliminate all three impersonators and believe that one was indeed the real Kairn. After Sing had traveled to [[Bespin/Legends|Bespin]], [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] and [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] and killed each impersonator, she realized that she had been deceived and returned to Endor. While Kairn hired the [[Thranta Mercenaries]] to eliminate Sing should she discover the treachery, Sing appeared in Kairn's hut and shot her in the back of the head, killing her.<ref name="TBHAS" />

name: Unidentified Human female Jedi Knight
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] lived during the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. She was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and, by [[3653 BBY]], had become a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]]. During the [[Alderaan peace conference]] of that [[Standard year/Legends|year]]&mdash;when the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] feigned a ceasefire to negotiate with the Republic&mdash;a secret [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] strike team led by [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Malgus]] launched an [[Sacking of Coruscant|assault]] on the [[Jedi Temple]] on the Republic [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]].<ref name="Deceived" />[[File:DarthMalgusHS-TOR.jpg|thumb|right|125px|Sith Lord Darth Malgus, who killed the female Jedi]]The female Jedi Knight was in the Temple at the time, and she and the other Jedi there fought against the Sith in the [[Jedi Temple Great Hall|Great Hall]]. During the [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|combat]], Malgus saw the female Jedi among the crowd and shot [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]] at her. The lightning caught two [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]] on its path to the female before it reached her, and the force of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Force power/Legends|power]] lifted her off the ground. The Jedi Knight screamed in pain as the lightning surged through her, causing her skin to briefly become transparent, and Malgus relished in her agony as she [[Death/Legends|died]].<ref name="Deceived" />

name: Liora
description: [[File:Liora.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Liora falling to her death in a vision to Orykan Tamarik]]Liora was a peace-loving [[High Priestess]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Telos IV]] during the buildup to the [[Telosian Civil War]]. In [[53 BBY/Legends|53 BBY]] the priestess was murdered, and her death was mourned by both factions of the planet's divided population. The murder drew the attention of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], who suspected that it might have in fact been a political [[Assassin/Legends|assassination]]. Believing the murder would be the final breaking point of the uneasy peace of Telos, the Council [[First Mission to Telos|sent]] [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Masters]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Tahl]] along with [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]] [[Xanatos]] and [[Orykan Tamarik]] to the [[Telos system|system]].<ref name="Dark Side 1" />

name: Varrak
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Agent Varrak worked for [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Bail Prestor Organa|Bail Organa]], who had full confidence in her abilities. She was sent to help [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], and [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] to forge fake IDs for their mission to [[Lanteeb/Legends|Lanteeb]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Hara
description: As a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|non-force-sensitive]], she served as a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]] and deputy onboard the ''[[Cryptic Warning]]''. Hara turned on as the most likely target, and prepared to land in the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Klatooine/Legends|Klatooine]]. Since the adoption of the Sith proved to be correct, Hara landed near a warehouse until she was involved in a fight between Dei and [[Leia Organa Solo]], who was protecting [[Allana Solo]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Raharra Lapti
description: Raharra was a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Youngling/Legends|Youngling]] brought to [[Klatooine/Legends|Klatooine]] to help seal an agreement between the anti-[[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] movements and the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]]. She was one of four Jedi assigned to a post on Klatooine until the anti-slavery rebels achieved their independence, the other three being [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Kyp Durron]], [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Sothais Saar]], and [[Jedi Apprentice]] [[Bandy Geffer]].

name: Darth Mekhis
description: Darth Mekhis, a [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] and [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] who served on the [[Dark Council]] in the resurgent [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], led the Sith forces in the [[Battle of Rhen Var]], establishing a [[Darth Mekhis' fortress|fortress]] as a command center until [[Satele Shan]] and her Republic forces arrived. Breaking open the door to Mekhis's chamber with the Force, Shan asked the Sith Lord to surrender and offered protection in exchange. However, Mekhis refused, and the two began a fierce duel that resulted in Mekhis being grievously injured before she escaped.<ref name="The Lost Suns 1" />During the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], Darth Mekhis served as a weapon designer working on projects to give the Sith the advantage when hostilities resumed, most of them produced at the [[Sun Razer]] facility she created to provide the resources to construct them. Mekhis designed a new and experimental class of warship called the [[Javelin (Harrower-class)|Javelin Dreadnought]], capable of using its weapons to flash irradiate a [[Planet/Legends|planet's]] surface from [[Realspace/Legends|space]], wiping out all life below within a three [[Kilometer/Legends|kilometer]] radius. She christened the prototype ''Ror'jhan'', which meant "she-whose-leaves-sweat-poison" in the [[Sith (language)|Sith]] language.[[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Mekhis also had in her employ a legion of [[Darth Mekhis' Sith Knights|Sith Knights]], semi-mechanical thralls created from captured [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and corrupted by her power. She was later seen aboard her [[Sun Razer]] in the [[Vesla system]] completing the last modification when the [[Captain/Legends|captain]] [[Eisek]] informed her of the capture of [[Theron Shan]] and Master [[Ngani Zho]] and she immediately ordered the execution of the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Things took an unexpected turn when the two of them escaped. Ngani eventually died, protecting the [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Teff'ith]] from blaster shots. In the same time, Theron made his way to Mekhis, and after revealing his relation to [[Satele Shan]] to throw her off guard, defeated her using a toxicity-ten poison, leaving her on the Sun Razer as it exploded. Her rival, [[Darth Hadra]], took her place on the Dark Council.

name: Thei
description: [[Standard year/Legends|Years]] ago, before the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], Thei started experiencing emotional breaks whenever she smelled [[topato soup]]. She and her mother ate a meal of topato soup and later spent the night on a cave during their trip, but the cave ground wasn't able to support Sparkle's weight and it collapsed, plunging Sparkle into a hole full of [[droch]]s. Thei's mother went to investigate and fell into the hole as well. After they were killed by the drochs, Thei fled into the [[Desert/Legends|desert]], where she lost her memory of the incident.
