Two days later, she was found and adopted by a family of [[Mining/Legends|miners]], but they went through several occasions from the night of the accident.In [[44 ABY]], she underwent a treatment under [[Taru Durn]], a [[Theran Listener]], and her repressed memory of her last moments with her mother was discovered.{{Char-stub}}

name: Mavari Zudan
description: {{Quote|In Alliance case why-oh-four-three-dash-seventeen thousand fourteen, ''The Galactic Federation of Free Alliances versus Luke Skywalker'', we have negotiated a conclusion, agreed to this day by the prosecution, the defense, and myself.|Zudan|Fate of the Jedi: Outcast}}Mavari Zudan was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Falleen/Legends|Falleen]] [[judge]] in the [[Galactic Federation of Free Alliances|Galactic Alliance]] [[Court of Justice]] in [[43 ABY]]. She was the judge during [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[The Galactic Federation of Free Alliances versus Luke Skywalker|trial]] in 43.5 ABY. During Skywalker's case she agreed to his terms for [[Exile (punishment)/Legends|exile]].<ref name="Out" />Later, she was the judge during the [[The Galactic Federation of Free Alliances versus Valin Horn|trial]] of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Valin Horn]], and ruled that he was not competent to stand trial, but that he would be encased in [[Carbonite/Legends|carbonite]], as he was too dangerous to be placed in a conventional [[Prison/Legends|prison]].<ref name="Out" /> She [[44 ABY|later]] judged ex-Jedi Knight [[Tahiri Veila]]'s [[Trial of Tahiri Veila|trial]], and sentenced her to [[Death/Legends|death]].<ref>''[[Fate of the Jedi: Allies]]''</ref>

name: Khaat Qiyn/Legends
description: Like most Jedi of the era, Khaat Qiyn was identified near birth as [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and sent to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] for induction within the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. [[Jedi training/Legends|Trained]] at the [[Jedi academy|academy]] there, Qiyn went on to be selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Trained in the [[Form V/Legends|fifth form]] of [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|lightsaber combat]], Qiyn was one of many students to master the form. After years of study and crafting a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], Qiyn passed her [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]] and was made a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Continuing her studies independently, Qiyn selected to walk the path of the [[Jedi Consular]], excelling as a [[Jedi Diplomat|Diplomat]] for the [[Council of Reconciliation/Legends|Council of Reconciliation]].<ref name="AOTCVD" />While traveling [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] on behalf of the Order Qiyn selected the Human [[Bairdon Jace/Legends|Bairdon Jace]] as her Padawan.<ref name="AOTCVD" /><ref name="SWCTP" /> During the height of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], Jedi Qiyn and Padawan Jace were stationed outside the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] [[Senate Building/Legends|Rotunda]] on the evening of the vote on the [[Military Creation Act/Legends|Military Creation Act]]. After an affirmative vote, both Qiyn and Jace joined [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu's]] massive [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] in flying to the world of [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] to rescue capture Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]], and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]]. Storming the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]], Qiyn and Jace fought valiantly against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid army]] of the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]; Qiyn employed her mastery of Form V to decimate her opponents.<ref name="ITWOAOTC">''[[Inside the Worlds of Star Wars: Attack of the Clones]]''</ref>

name: Kindee Ya
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Quermian/Legends|Quermian]], Kindee Ya was from her [[Species/Legends|species's]] [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Quermia/Legends|Quermia]]. After being inducted into the ranks of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Ya was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], and over time attained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="NEGAS" />A noted [[Telepathy/Legends|telepath]] among the ranks of the Jedi, Ya's influence among the Jedi was dwarfed by fellow Quermian and [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Councilor]], Master [[Yarael Poof/Legends|Yarael Poof]]. Poof served on the Council during the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]], which caused strife among the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]], and in [[27 BBY/Legends|27 BBY]] sacrificed his life to end a threat against Coruscant devised by the terrorist [[Ashaar Khorda]]. Along with [[Vinian Ska]] and [[Loo Raelo]], Ya attended the [[Funeral of Yarael Poof|funeral]] of Master Poof high within the Temple's [[Jedi Temple Pyre room|pyre room]].<ref name="NEGAS" />

name: Bela Kiwiiks
description: {{Quote|Poison in the veins of civilization. The Sith Lords would end everything to win one battle.|Bela Kiwiiks|The Old Republic—The Lost Suns 1}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]], Bela Kiwiiks was discovered by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] by the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ngani Zho]], along with [[Satele Shan]], [[Syo Bakarn]], and [[Jaric Kaedan]].<ref name="Lost Suns 1" /> By the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3663 BBY]],<ref name="Hall Twitter" /> Kiwiiks had achieved the rank of Jedi Master, and she fought alongside other Jedi and the forces of the [[Republic Military/Legends|Republic Military]] in the [[Great Galactic War]] against the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]]. During the course of the conflict, she became friends with her fellow Jedi Masters [[Orgus Din]]<ref name="The Sand Demon" /> and [[Tol Braga]],<ref name="Jedi Commander">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|Jedi Commander|Corellia}}</ref> relationships that would continue throughout her friends' lives.<ref name="The Sand Demon" /><ref name="Jedi Commander" />[[File:Kiwiiks and Kaedan.PNG|thumb|left|160px|Jaric Kaedan and Bela Kiwiiks at the Battle of Rhen Var]]Near the end of the war, she participated in the [[Battle of Rhen Var]] alongside Zho's other former students&mdash;[[Satele Shan]], [[Syo Bakarn]], and [[Jaric Kaedan]]&mdash;where the four aided the [[Forty-fifth Battalion]] in the fight against the [[Imperial Military (Sith Empire)|Imperial military]]. Between the four of them, they had [[Battle on the Ash Plains of Lenico IV|fought]] on the ash plains of [[Lenico IV]] and [[Engagement in the asteroid-hives of Gelpog the Tyrant|against]] [[Gelpog]] the Tyrant on his [[Asteroid/Legends|asteroid]]-hives, and they were all powerful warriors in their own right. Under Shan's leadership, the Republic and Jedi forces were able to drive the Empire off of the icy [[Planet/Legends|planet]], and Shan single-handedly defeated the [[Dark Council]]or [[Darth Mekhis]] in a [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|duel]].<ref name="Lost Suns 1" />In [[3653 BBY]], the Empire attacked the Republic [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in what would become known as the [[Sacking of Coruscant]], and they used the captive world as a bargaining chip to force the Republic to sign the [[Treaty of Coruscant]] and end the war.<ref name="Timeline 1">''[[Timeline 1: Treaty of Coruscant]]''</ref> During the Sacking, six members of the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] were killed,<ref name="Jedi Order">{{Holonet|old=true|allegiances|jedi-order|Jedi Order|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110108041507/http://www.swtor.com/info/holonet/allegiances/jedi-order}}</ref> including [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Zym]].<ref name="Treaty of Coruscant">''[[The Old Republic, Threat of Peace Act 1: Treaty of Coruscant]]''</ref> However, after Shan discovered the Order's ancient homeworld of [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in [[3651 BBY]] and was elevated to the rank of Grand Master as a result,<ref name="Gnost-Dural">[[The Journal of Master Gnost-Dural (real-life book)|''The Journal of Master Gnost-Dural'']]</ref> the remaining Masters decided to appoint Kaedan, Kiwiiks, Bakarn, and Shan as the newest Council members.<ref name="Enemy Force" />The Jedi Order decided to relocate to Tython a year after its discovery when the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] postponed the reconstruction of the [[Jedi Temple]] indefinitely,<ref name="Gnost-Dural" /> and the Council oversaw the construction of a [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|new Temple]] over the next [[3648 BBY|three years]].<ref name="Temple">{{TORcite|type=codex|Jedi Temple (Tython)}}</ref> As the Order began to rebuild their ranks, [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] settled into a tense [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] in which neither the Empire nor the Republic openly engaged the other galactic power.<ref name="Timeline 1" /> In [[3645 BBY]],<ref name="Time">{{TOR dates}}</ref> Kiwiiks traveled to the neutral [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]] on a mission for the Order, and was surprised to find a young [[Human/Legends|Human]] female attempting to steal her ship's [[Hyperdrive/Legends|hyperdrive]] when she returned to the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]].Sensing the power of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] within the eighteen-year-old girl, whose name was [[Kira Carsen]], Kiwiiks decided to take on her on as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] and returned to Tython.<ref name="The Defector">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|The Defector|the Abandoned Mining Facility}}</ref> The headstrong young woman occasionally chafed under her master's more conservative and passive teachings, but the two soon developed a strong bond between master and apprentice.<ref name="Welcome Kira Carsen">{{TORcite|type=Kira Carsen|Welcome Kira Carsen}}</ref> The pair traveled to many planets during their time together, including [[Agriworld/Legends|agriworld]] of [[Uphrades]], but always returned to the Order's homeworld of Tython.<ref name="Uphrades">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|Uphrades|the ''Daybreaker''}}</ref>[[File:Bela Kiwiiks 1.png|thumb|right|240px|Bela Kiwiiks on the Jedi Council]]By [[3643 BBY]], Kiwiiks and her Padawan were on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] during a [[Flesh Raider uprising]]. At the time, a talented [[Hero of Tython|Padawan]], whom Orgus Din chose to take on as his Padawan, had defeated a [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] apprentice named [[Callef]], who was found carrying a Jedi lightsaber. Further investigation discovered that the Flesh Raiders were taught to use the Force, which Kiwiiks assumed they learned from a [[Holocron/Legends|holocron]] the Padawan had found. However, Din realized that the perpetrators behind the attacks was his former Padawan, [[Bengel Morr]], presumed dead in the [[Sacking of Coruscant]]. While Din and his Padawan remained on Tython to stop Morr, Kiwiiks and Carsen journeyed to Coruscant to investigate a dark presence on the Republic capital.Din and his Padawan, now a full-fledged Jedi Knight, went to Coruscant too and met with Kiwiiks and Carsen during a meeting with [[General/Legends|General]] [[Var Suthra]] and Doctor [[Tarnis (Sith Lord)|Eli Tarnis]], regarding the controversial [[Planet Prison]] a superweapon that could ionized a planet's atmosphere, disabling any ships that tried to leave and safely blockading the planet without loss of life. Kiwiiks expressed concern regarding the design files that had been stolen, but Tarnis was seemingly unconcerned about the security risks. Tarnis brushed off her protest, stating that the files were too encrypted for anyone to understand, but Var Suthra informed the Jedi that his agents were searching tirelessly for the files.While Din, Kiwiiks, and Suthra met with [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Dorian Janarus]] aboard the Chancellor's cruiser ''Founder'', Din ordered his former apprentice to aid the Republic agents in recovering the files. Kiwiiks also left her Padawan with the Knight and Tarnis, suggesting that Carsen's security expertise might be useful.Later, when the Knight recovered the stolen files, an SIS agent decrypted them and discovered that they contain information on all of the Republic superweapon projects. Kiwiiks immediately departed for [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] to secure the [[Shock Drum]]. But shortly after her arrival at the Shock drum facility, she was attacked and defeated by [[Darth Angral]]'s apprentice, Lord [[Praven]]. He took her captive and acquired the Shock Drum, but left the facility staff unharmed.<ref name="The Shock Drum">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|The Shock Drum|Tatooine}}</ref> Kiwiiks and the superweapon were taken to a cave in the [[Dune Sea/Legends|Dune Sea]], where Angral ordered the weapon activated and for Kiwiiks to be left near it.<ref name="Desert Duel">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|Desert Duel|Tatooine}}</ref> Kiwiiks put herself into a deep trance to protect herself from the intense vibrations emanating from the weapon. Thankfully, the Knight and Carsen, now the Knight's Padawan, arrived in time to save her, deactivating the Shock Drum with Praven's transmitter. As the Knight ordered the Shock Drum destroyed, Carsen came clean to Kiwiiks about her past as a [[Children of the Emperor|Child of the Emperor]]. Kiwiiks told her former student that her past doesn't matter, but what's important is that she is proud of her.<ref name="The Sand Demon" />Kiwiiks was then returned to Tython to recover from her ordeal. She would've nearly had a shortly recovery when Angral combined all the superweapon projects into the [[Desolator (superweapon)|Desolator]] in an attempt to destroy the Jedi Order. Thankfully, the Knight and Carsen defeated Angral and saved Tython. When the two came before the Jedi Council, Kiwiiks lamented the untimely death of Din, who was killed by Angral before his confrontation with the Knight. Master Shan added that while they lost one of their greatest masters, in his place stands the Knight, a Jedi without equal. She then turned to Carsen, glad that she managed to reject the [[Vitiate|Sith Emperor]] during their confrontation with Angral. On the Knight and Kiwiiks' recommendation, the Council granted Carsen the rank of Jedi Knight.However, Var Suthra informed the Council that they are receiving reports of hostilities across the galaxy. Kiwiiks remarked that even in death, Angral had finally inspired the Sith to violence. Shan added that the Knight, whom she christens as the Hero of Tython, to be their most valuable against the rising darkness and the Force had shown her that the weight of the galaxy rest on their shoulders.About a year later, the Hero and Carsen joined a strike team formed by [[Tol Braga]] in a daring plan to capture the Emperor, bring him to Tython and redeem him to the light side. But before they departed, Masters Shan, Kiwiiks and Kaedan requested a moment of their time. Braga's former team member [[Jomar Chul]] had received a [[Force vision/Legends|Force vision]] revealing that if the Hero joins the mission, it will fail and the Jedi Knight will fall to the dark side and join the Sith. Braga dismissed his concerns, stating that the future is always in motion and that the Council doesn't place judgment solely on visions. Nonetheless, the Hero chose to defer to the decision of the Council. Kiwiiks expressed confidence in the Hero's loyalty, and Shan agreed with her. As Chul stormed out of the Council chamber, frustrated that they won't heed his warning, Kaedan pleaded Braga to reconsider but the [[Kel Dor/Legends|Kel Dor]] was certain his plan would work.When Braga's team never returned from their mission, the Council feared that they had failed. After many months, the Hero and their companions returned, accompanied by Lord [[Scourge (Sith)|Scourge]], the [[Emperor's Wrath]], who had suddenly switched sides. Scourge explained to the Council that centuries ago, he had a vision that the Emperor will destroy the galaxy but the Hero will be the one to stop him. [[Galactic War|Renewed war]] is only a diversion to conceal the Emperor's true plan, threatening the death of all living things. He explained that a thousand years ago, the Emperor used a life-sapping ritual on his home planet of [[Nathema]], consuming all life on the planet and used those life essences to become immortal. Now he plans on recreating the ritual on a galactic scale to become virtually unstoppable. But the ritual requires billions of simultaneous deaths, which he plans on initiating on [[Belsavis/Legends|Belsavis]]. Kiwiiks worried that the Emperor had finally discovered the location of the Republic prison planet, which the Jedi have hidden for decades. Scourge stated that once the sacrifice occurs, the ritual cannot be stopped and insisted they save Belsavis. Kaedan didn't trust the Sith, to the point where he holds his lightsaber to his throat. However, the Hero vouched for Scourge's relative trustworthiness and the Sith insisted that he's better off working against the Emperor than imprisoned. Shan consented to an alliance but warned the Hero not to become too reliant on Scourge.Kiwiiks was later stationed on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] during a [[Battle of Corellia|significant battle]], where she was cornered by two Sith assassins. The Sith showed her a holo of Master Braga, corrupted to the dark side by the Emperor, who ordered them to kill her. Thankfully, the Hero of Tython arrived to her rescue once again. When the Hero explained to Kiwiiks their intent to rally the Jedi to stop Braga from committing mass genocide, the Togruta admitted that she never fully recovered from her ordeal on Tatooine. Instead, she felt that she should help evacuate the wounded, an idea the Hero agreed with.

name: Chelah Voh
description: [[File:Le_Yer.png|thumb|right|Chelah Voh was a resident of Le Yer on Abregado-rae.]]Chelah Voh was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Ho'Din/Legends|Ho'Din]] and a resident of [[Le Yer]], a resort [[City/Legends|town]] on the otherwise shabby manufacturing [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Abregado-rae]]. From childhood, Voh was the closest friend of [[Brinaloy N'Vaari]], a [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] who was the granddaughter of a [[Provincial Governor]] of Le Yer. In the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] prior to the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]] in [[4 ABY/Legends|4 ABY]], Voh maintained an apartment on the outskirts of Le Yer; the house was surrounded by large flowering bushes and shrubs.<ref name="ND" />The town of Le Yer was ensnared in political strife when the [[Death/Legends|death]] of N'Vaari's [[N'Vaari|grandfather]] was ordered by the Devaronian [[A'jidre Skrigatov]], a local criminal leader who had been elected the next Provincial [[Governor/Legends|Governor]]. N'Vaari confided in Voh that she was scared she would be killed next; Skrigatov, however, had subtler plans and instead, after five years had passed, sought to [[Marriage/Legends|marry]] N'Vaari to shore up support for his re-election. Aware that the local [[Law enforcement agency/Legends|constabulary]] were corrupt and supported Skrigatov, N'Vaari went into hiding five days before the ceremony was scheduled to take place.<ref name="ND" />{{RPG|"[[Abregado-Rae Intrigue]]"}}Voh, known to be N'Vaari's best friend, was aggressively questioned by Skrigatov's lackey, [[Friizt]], but provided the [[Herglic/Legends|Herglic]] with no useful information. Skrigatov then pressured several [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunters]] from offworld to search for the missing Devaronian. The [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] hunters approached Voh, but she correctly deduced from their appearance that they were more of Skrigatov's employees and thus refused to cooperate; she slammed her door in their faces. The bounty hunters, however, were able to obtain from within Voh's apartment a [[claim ticket]] for N'Vaari's [[Droid/Legends|droid]], [[MK221]]. With that as a lead, the bounty hunters eventually discovered that N'Vaari had disguised herself as a male [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], and they tracked her to [[Phyrstal Island]].<ref name="ND" />{{Endgame}}

name: Alora (Dark Jedi)
description: {{Quote|Ah, you must be the saber-wielding troublemaker who neutralized our perimeter guard. Are the Jedi stretched so thin that Skywalker sends ''children'' to battle the Disciples of Ragnos?|Alora, when confronting Jaden Korr for the first time|audio=Alora.ogg|Star Wars: Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy}}[[File:JadenVsAlora.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Alora on Hoth, seconds before her first encounter with Jaden Korr]]Alora, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Lethan]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], was a member of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] [[Sith cult|cult]] known as the [[Disciples of Ragnos]].<ref name="JA" /> By [[14 ABY/Legends|14 ABY]],<ref name="JA Opening Crawl" /> she came under the tutelage of the [[Human/Legends|Human]] female [[Tavion Axmis]] during Axmis' effort to resurrect the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Marka Ragnos]] with a powerful dark side artifact called the [[Scepter of Ragnos]]. Alora was her most prized apprentice<ref name="JASG">''[[Star Wars: Jedi Knight: Jedi Academy: Prima's Official Strategy Guide]]''</ref> and was tasked by Axmis to [[Yavin 4 Incursion|infiltrate]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker's]] [[Jedi Praxeum|Jedi Academy]] on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]]. After gaining access to the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Computer/Legends|mainframes]], Alora stole a list of [[Force nexus|locations]] strong in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] so that Axmis could siphon the [[Force energy|Force energies]] from there using the Scepter of Ragnos and then use the energy to resurrect Ragnos.<ref name="JA" />Soon after, Axmis [[Mission to Hoth (Jaden Korr)|sent]] her Twi'lek apprentice to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] along with support from Axmis' allies in the [[Imperial Remnant]] to gather information on the Force energies located there. While they were searching [[Echo Base/Legends|Echo Base]]&mdash;a hideout used by the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] during the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]&mdash;a [[Unidentified Sith cultist|Sith cultist]] managed to determine from flight trajectories that Skywalker had traveled to the planet [[Dagobah/Legends|Dagobah]] following the [[Battle of Hoth/Legends|Battle of Hoth]]. The [[Sith Cultist|cultist]] downloaded the flight information and transmitted the data to Alora before being [[Death/Legends|killed]] by [[Jedi Initiate]] [[Jaden Korr]], who was on Hoth as part of an investigation into the locations mentioned in Skywalker's records. Alora relayed the information to Axmis, who congratulated her apprentice and told Alora to meet her on Dagobah, when she was located by Korr in a [[Hangar/Legends|hangar]] inside the base. Alora engaged Korr in a [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|duel]], but fled when she realized that she couldn't gain the upper hand. Angered, she taunted Korr as she escaped and claimed they would cross paths again.<ref name="JA" />After her defeat on Hoth, Alora trained furiously and adopted a second [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="JASG" /> She would [[Mission to Taspir III|encounter]] Korr again on the planet [[Taspir III]] while he and his Master [[Kyle Katarn]] were searching for [[Rosh Penin]], Katarn's other [[Padawan/Legends|apprentice]] who had renounced the dark side and was being held captive in the cult's large facility. Alora was at the facility to ensure that Penin was secure and unable to escape. She was surprised when Korr, recently granted the title of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], arrived and proceeded to lead him on a chase throughout the facility. Alora taunted the Jedi from various ledges and balconies until she reached the hangar where Penin was being held. Korr confronted Penin, angered by his betrayal. Seeing his anger, Alora encouraged Korr to [[Death/Legends|strike down]] Penin and join her and Axmis in the dark side. With [[Telepathy/Legends|telepathic]] help from Katarn, Korr let his anger dissipate. Realizing that he would not turn, the enraged Alora [[Cho mok|cut off]] Penin's [[Limb/Legends|arm]] with her lightsaber and attacked Korr, who eventually killed the tenacious [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]].<ref name="JA" />

name: Orykan Tamarik
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], Orykan Tamarik was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]]. Selected to become the [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Casieck Akinslesh]], Tamarik crafted her own blue-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] under Akinslesh's tutelage and she was greatly affected by his sudden death in [[53 BBY/Legends|53 BBY]]. After a satisfactory mourning period, the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] decided it was time to assign Tamarik a new master. As Master [[Tahl]] was to join Master [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and his Padawan [[Xanatos]] on a [[First Mission to Telos|mission]] to [[Telos IV]], the High Council decided to test Tamarik's compatibility with the [[Noorian]] Jedi Master.<ref name="TDS1" />While Tamarik was uncomfortable around Xanatos, she was able to defend herself upon their arrival when a group of insurgents attacked the Jedi's ship and forced them to draw their lightsabers. Later Tamarik accompanied Xanatos and his master to the rooftop where [[High Priestess]] [[Liora]] was murdered; Tamarik was able to reach into the Force and sense the actual murder take place while neither Xanatos or Jinn could see it. Collapsing from the shock of feeling the reverberations of the murder through the Force, Tamarik was escorted back to her quarters to recover. Later at a gala for [[Crion]], the ruler of Telos, Tamarik began talking with [[Prince/Legends|Princess]] [[Nason]], Xanatos' sister. While attempting to introduce the two, Xanatos made insensitive anti-alien remarks causing brief tension at the party. Meanwhile, Tahl and Jinn discussed Tamarik's future in private but were overheard by both Padawans; Xanatos' jealousy caused him to interpret Jinn's praise of the girl as meaning that she would eventually replace him as the Jedi's apprentice.<ref>''[[Jedi—The Dark Side 2]]''</ref>When Tahl left for [[Landor]], Tamarik was left behind with Jinn as the mission was deemed too dangerous for the girl. Remaining in her quarters as [[Telosian Civil War|civil war]] erupted across the planet, Tamarik joined Master Jinn in battle as it was revealed that Lord Crion had fabricated the war in order to secure his place as dictator. While Tamarik lost her lightsaber and nearly was slain by Crion, Jinn rushed to her aid and slew the would-be tyrant, throwing his body into the beds of decorative fires within his palace. Xanatos, having just witnessed his master slay his father, attacked Tamarik as his anger rushed over him. Wearing the Twi'lek down easily, Xanatos was distracted by Jinn and was unable to achieve his goal of finishing Tamarik off with his lightsaber. As the fighting erupted over the capital, Jinn and Tamarik were able to escape, while Xanatos disappeared into the fray. While Tamarik returned by shuttle to the Jedi Temple, Jinn refused to return as he had to meditate on his failures with his former apprentice.<ref>''[[Jedi—The Dark Side 5]]''</ref>

name: Unidentified nurse (Coruscant)
description: {{Quote|I know the woman you mean. I can take you to her.|The nurse, to Darth Malgus|The Old Republic: Deceived}}In [[3653 BBY]], the final [[Standard year/Legends|year]] of the [[Great Galactic War]],<ref name="TEA">According to page 134 of ''[[The Essential Atlas]]'', the end of the [[Great Galactic War]], which was in the same year as the [[Sacking of Coruscant]], occurred in [[3653 BBY]].</ref> a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Nurse/Legends|nurse]] worked at a [[Unidentified Coruscant medical facility|medical facility]] on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], which had fallen under control of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] following the [[Sacking of Coruscant]], an assault in which the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] had captured the capital world. Shortly after the battle, a [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] by the name of [[Darth Malgus]], who had participated in the Sith's attack on the [[Jedi Temple]] during the conflict, went to the [[Medcenter/Legends|medical facility]]. Malgus was looking for his lover, the [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Eleena Daru]], who was in the hospital after being seriously injured during the assault on the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] Temple. She had been denied treatment at Imperial hospitals because she was [[Alien/Legends|alien]], as the Imperials [[Speciesism|despised]] non-humans. Malgus demanded that he be taken to his lover, and the nurse volunteered to do so. While the nurse took Malgus to Daru, she told him that she did not realize at first that Daru was Imperial, but that she would have treated Daru even if she knew. When they found Daru, another nurse named [[Tal (nurse)|Tal]] refused to release the Twi'lek to Malgus. However, the female nurse convinced Tal to allow Malgus to take Daru, warning Tal that Malgus was a Sith.<ref name="Deceived" />

name: Dall Thara Dru
description: During the [[Black Fleet Crisis]], she was Chair of the [[Commerce Council]], and was the only female member of the [[New Republic Ruling Council|Ruling Council]] at the time. She supported [[Chief of State (New Republic)|Chief of State]] [[Leia Organa Solo]] when [[Doman Beruss (Illodian)|Doman Beruss]] submitted a [[vote of no confidence]] against her, but this was mostly because she believed [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and the [[New Jedi Order]] were planning to intervene on the side of the New Republic.{{Char-stub}}

name: Nitra Vendallan
description: {{Quote|C'mon, I'm aging rapidly here. Decision?|Nitra Vendallan, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] Nitra Vendallan of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] was stationed in the [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] [[Cantina/Legends|tavern]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. While there, she learned of an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Imperial Army/Legends|Army]] [[Non-commissioned officer|non-com]] named [[Drenn Biktor]] who wished to defect to the Alliance. He knew a great deal about Imperial [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] supply routes, which could be useful for the Rebels in interdicting their shipments. Eager to bring Biktor safely to Anchorhead before he could be found by the Empire, Vendallan asked a Rebel [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to escort him.<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics}}The spacer succeeded in finding Biktor and bringing him back safely to Anchorhead. After returning Biktor, Vendallan made arrangements to get him offworld. However, Vendallan's work did not end there. A friend of hers, named [[Vil Sembian]], son of a famous, deceased [[weaponsmith]] named [[Daw Sembian]], possessed a schematic for a new type of [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]]. Vil was bringing the schematic to Vendallan, but the Empire was on his tail. Vendallan's [[Commander/Legends|commander]] claimed that the weapon could tip the scales in their favor, so she tasked the same spacer who had helped her earlier with finding and escorting Vil Sembian safely. The Rebel spacer agreed, and succeeded in the mission. Vendallan was pleased, and stated that she would send the schematics to [[Alliance High Command/Legends|Alliance High Command]].<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}

name: Mana Veridi
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Mana Veridi was discovered by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] near birth and [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. After constructing her own [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and passing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], Veridi was elevated to the rank of Jedi Knight by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Accepting missions from the august body, Veridi was assigned to investigate a disturbance on the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]] world of [[Kwannot]].<ref name="OB" />[[File:ManaVeridiDeath.jpg|thumb|left|Mana Veridi is killed by [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]].]]While on Kwannot, Veridi felt that the situation had become significantly more dangerous than expected and sent a [[Jedi beacon/Legends|distress call]] to Coruscant. Upon receiving the emergency code, the High Council tasked [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], to locate Veridi and complete her mission. Homing in on her distress beacon, the Jedi located Veridi hiding amidst the shadows of one of the planet's cities. Recognizing the Jedi, Veridi sighed with relief and began to brief them on her situation. However, before she could begin, the [[Jedi hunter/Legends|Jedi hunter]] [[Aurra Sing/Legends|Aurra Sing]] ignited her lightsaber and [[Shiak|impaled]] Veridi in the chest, killing her. Sing confiscated Veridi's lightsaber and [[Duel on Kwannot|engaged]] the Jedi, who were able to drive her off but not capture her.<ref name="OB" />

name: Shaala Doneeta
description: Doneeta was a personal [[Aide/Legends|aide]] of [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] who wore [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-like [[Tattoo/Legends|tattoos]] on her [[Lekku/Legends|lekku]]. She accompanied him when he made his [[Fete Day]] speech.

name: Denaria Kee/Legends
description: A native of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Kooriva/Legends|Kooriva]], Denaria Kee became a member of the [[Corporate Alliance/Legends|Corporate Alliance]] during the final decades of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], earning the position of [[Aide/Legends|Chief Aide]] to [[Magistrate/Legends|Magistrate]] [[Passel Argente/Legends|Passel Argente]] by [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]]. Having given birth to at least a single child and presiding over a family, Kee adorned her head with a matron's hood to signify her venerable position within society.<ref name="NEGAS">''[[The New Essential Guide to Alien Species]]''</ref> Favoring a long, flowing [[Shimmerbird tongue robe|blue robe]] of [[Shimmerbird/Legends|shimmerbird]] tongues, Kee accompanied Magistrate Argente to the planet [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] to attend a meeting between [[Count of Serenno/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] and an assortment of large trade and corporate leaders. During the meeting, Kee listened as Argente pledged the Alliance's support and funding to Dooku's [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] alongside the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]], [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild]], [[InterGalactic Banking Clan/Legends|InterGalactic Banking Clan]], and the [[Techno Union/Legends|Techno Union]]. Within days of the initial meeting, Kee and the Alliance delegation were still on Geonosis when the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|attacked]] the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]] en masse, forcing the Confederacy leaders to flee the ringed planet as the conflict known as the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] began.<ref>[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>Despite Magistrate Argente's wishes to maintain a secondary role in the war and work exclusively on the [[Separatist Council/Legends|Separatist Council]], Dooku forced him to participate on the front lines of the conflict, with Kee by his side. As Argente initiated the [[Battle of Ukio|battle]] on the [[Agriworld/Legends|agriworld]] [[Ukio/Legends|Ukio]] as part of [[Project Instinction]], Kee counseled her superior to trust in the skill of their [[T-series tactical droid|tactical droid]] named [[Doctor (tactical droid)|Doctor]] to oversee strategy and implementation of the project. Despite interference by members of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and the destruction of Doctor, Argente's plan was successful and the planet secured for the Confederacy.<ref>''[[The Clone Wars: Act on Instinct]]''</ref>As the war dragged on, Kooriva fell to the Republic as well as the other home and purseworlds of the Separatist leadership. As their homeworld's would not accept them, the members of the Council were forced to roam about space on their private vessels under the protection of [[Supreme Commander of the Droid Armies|Supreme Commander]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]]. Joining the Council aboard the [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg's]] [[Flagship/Legends|flagship]], the [[Invisible Hand/Legends|''Invisible Hand'']], the leadership of the Confederacy was sent to the sinkhole world [[Utapau/Legends|Utapau]] to await further instructions. Following Dooku's death over [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] at one of the most tumultuous [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|battles]] of the war, Kee attended Magistrate Argente as Grievous ordered them to [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]], a mining planet on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] where they were promised safety. Not long after departing Utapau, Grievous was killed by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], and the Council took full control over the Confederacy.<ref name="ROTS">[[Star Wars: Episode III Revenge of the Sith|''Star Wars'': Episode III ''Revenge of the Sith'']]</ref>[[File:TheDeathofDenariaKee.png|thumb|left|200px|Denaria Kee was eventually slain on [[Mustafar/Legends|Mustafar]] by [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]].]]As the Council arrived on Mustafar, they quickly settled into the dimly lit command center at the mountainside [[Klegger Corp]] [[Klegger Corp Mining Facility|mining facility]]. Kee and the other aides to the high-powered members of the Council scurried around the command center, supervising strategy and battle plans from their remote sanctuary. During their stay, the Council received a communications from the mysterious [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], the Confederacy's shadowy benefactor. Sidious promised that the war was over and that the Republic had crumbled under the Separatist's [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|war machine]]. Advising the Council to remain on the planet, Sidious assured them that he would send his [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Darth Vader]], to watch over them. Relieved by the news of victory, Kee and Magistrate Argente anxiously awaited for Vader's arrival and their eventual departure from the inhospitable world. Upon Vader's arrival, the Council and its aides gathered in the facility's main command center to greet Vader. When Vader entered the chamber and sealed every door with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], it became clear that he was not there to protect them. Igniting his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], Vader savagely cut down the guards and droids flanking the doorway before attacking the unarmed Councilors and their aides. Kee stood by a bank of computer terminals with a pair of Neimoidian aides, helpless to do anything as Vader cut a swath of destruction around the room. As the Human cut down the Neimoidians in front of her, Kee threw up her arms helplessly in an attempt to protect herself, but the effort proved futile as Vader plunged his lightsaber through her heart. Moments after Kee's corpse fell lifeless to the ground, Vader struck down the other members of the Council.<ref name="ROTS" />

name: Shullis Khamarr
description: [[Minister]] Khamarr was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] individual in the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] as the [[Minister of Logistics|leader]] of the [[Ministry of Logistics]]. Khamarr was a favored minister of the [[Dark Council]], the Empire's governing body, and she made it her priority to serve the needs of those on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Dromund Kaas]], the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]]. During the [[Great Galactic War]], the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Malgus]] led an [[Battle of Ord Radama|attack]] on the planet [[Ord Radama/Legends|Ord Radama]], and the Ministry of Logistics was responsible for resupplying his forces. However, the supplies never arrived and Malgus lacked sufficient influence over Khamarr to compel her to help him.Along with her friend [[Ula Vii]], they felt that the Sith Empire was a great civilizing power to lead to peace. After Vii went on a mission to the planet [[Sebaddon]], he contacted Khamarr again and told her that neither the Empire or the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] had possession of the world and they could take it during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|war]].

name: Kindra
description: After the outbreak of the [[Imperial bioweapons Project I71A|Sickness]] at the Academy, Kindra teamed up with fellow students [[Hartwig]], [[Maggs]] and [[Mnah Ra'at]] and the Sith Combat Master [[Xat Hracken]]. However, Hracken, Hartwig and Ra'at died, leaving only Maggs and Kindra. The girl then severed Maggs' Achilles tendons with her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], immobilizing him and leaving him to [[Death/Legends|die]]. On her way back to the [[Darth Scabrous's tower|tower]], Kindra was captured by the [[Zombie/Legends|undead]] students. The zombies forced her to contact the mechanic [[Pergus Frode]] and tell him to open the hatch to the [[Starship/Legends|ship]] he was hiding in. Once it was open, Kindra tried to break free but was devoured.

name: Bera Jeza
description: {{Quote|Bera Jeza was in the middle of selling us some sort of super soldier drug and Jabba is very interested in getting his hands on the chemical makeup.|Bib Fortuna|Star Wars Galaxies}}Bera Jeza had a job as lab assistant for [[Mos Eisley Biolab]], based in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]], on the planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. In addition to that job, she was also secretly working for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|Crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. She was involved in [[Spice/Legends|spice]] manufacturing as well as in the development of a new chemical drug to create super soldiers.<ref name="SWG:SiOW" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> she was [[Assassin/Legends|assassinated]] in a street of Mos Eisley. [[Mos Eisley Police Authority|Mos Eisley Police]] officer [[Happer]] was tasked to investigate the murder. In the meanwhile, [[Bib Fortuna/Legends|Bib Fortuna]] hired a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to investigate whether Jeza's work for Jabba was related to the crime. The spacer would then discover the assassination of Jeza's fellow [[Derg Prantis]], meet [[Slicer/Legends|Slicer]] [[Cale Herron]], and eventually uncover the [[Imperial bioweapons Project I71A|Blackwing]] [[Blackwing virus outbreak on Dathomir|outbreak]] on [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]].<ref name="SWG:SiOW" />

name: Daan (Human)
description: Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Daan was part of the crew of the ''[[Starcrusher]]''. During the infiltration of the [[Starcrusher (decoy)|mock-''Starcrusher'']], Daan was left behind by her crew on board the trap and made to cooperate with the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] in order to survive.She helped the knights locate space suits and determine the coordinates to the reactor core on the real battleship. While the rest of the crew were killed when the ''Starcrusher'' plunged into a star, Daan survived alongside the Jedi.

name: Tessa Wylden
description: In [[1 ABY/Legends|1.5 years ABY]], [[Garm Bel Iblis]]' aide [[Irenez (Twi'lek)|Irenez]] was involved in fighting Black Sun on [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]]. She had identified Wylden as one of Black Sun's accountants on the planet and had her under surveillance for some time. Irenez then paid a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] to track down Wylden and capture her. When the spacer found her, he killed the men guarding her and brought Wylden to Irenez in [[Coronet City/Legends|Coronet]].Wylden was questioned and revealed much information about Black Sun and its money streams. Her information revealed that the [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]] [[Skazz]] had been hired to kill the head of [[Corellian Security Force|CorSec]] and that the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] had been selling weapons to Black Sun.

name: Voria Sergar
description: Voria Sergar was a [[Slavery/Legends|slave]] at a young age when her [[Slaver/Legends|slave master]] abandoned her on the planet [[Lok/Legends|Lok]]. She wandered the barren, dusty planet for several months, surviving many near-[[Death/Legends|death]] situations. When she was finally found by the Rebel officer [[Isnal Roran]], she was battered and bruised.Sergar became a member of the [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel Alliance]] on Lok and quickly ascended the Alliance's ranks. She proved to be a skillful [[Slicer/Legends|slicer]], her abilities and fluidity with slicing and manipulating [[Computer/Legends|computers]] were considered great assets to the Rebellion. She also trained to be a [[Pilot/Legends|pilot]]. and earned her wings.She was killed in the [[Karthakk system]] when her ship was struck by an [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Missile/Legends|missile]]. It was said that each member of the Rebellion, no matter how far away, felt her passing. The fourth quadrant of the Karthakk system was named [[Voria's Ember]] in her honor.

name: Unidentified Human journalist
description: This [[Journalist/Legends|journalist]] wrote for various major news [[HoloStation]]s throughout [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] and was well known for her surprise exposes. In [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]] the journalist asked a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] on the streets of [[Tyrena/Legends|Tyrena]] to visit the [[Imperial Stronghold]] on Corellia. She couldn't visit the base herself, as the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Empire]] was aware of her activities and didn't allow her to get near the stronghold. She uploaded the stronghold's coordinates to the spacer's [[Datapad/Legends|datapad]], hoping that she could use the adventurer's observations in future news stories.

name: Kopri
description: {{Quote|Prepare a cell for the assassin. I'm bringing him in alive.|Kopri|Invasion: Revelations 4}}While guarding the [[Imperial Palace/Legends|Imperial Palace]] Kopri encountered [[Finn Galfridian]] and his droid [[Prowl]] as they attempted to break into the residence of Chief Fey'lya. After Finn, already wanted as an escaped assassin, successfully entered the building and confronted the Chief of State, she gave chase to the Jedi using a [[flutterpack]]. Eventually she captured Finn, but released him when Prowl forced a stalemate. After Finn explained the situation, they sought out the Imperial ambassador, who Finn claimed was a Vong infiltrator and the real assassin.At ambassador [[Yarmond]]'s quarters, the pair confronted the masqued Vong. [[Zakar (Yuuzhan Vong)|Zakar]] grabbed Kopri from behind, as Yarmond attempted to force Finn to go with him to [[Tsalok]]. Kopri was freed when [[Dray|Master Dray]] arrived and killed Zakar. As Dray made his move against Yarmond, Finn and Kopri fled.

name: Meena Tills/Legends
description: Early in the Clone Wars, in [[22 BBY/Legends|22 BBY]], Tills was kidnapped and [[Galactic City spaceport hostage siege|held hostage]] at the [[Galactic City Spaceport]] on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] by a group of [[Korun]]nai [[Terrorist/Legends|terrorists]] from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Haruun Kal/Legends|Haruun Kal]]. After a lengthy stand off with the [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]] and the brutal murder of a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Kaim|negotiator]], Tills and the other hostages at the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]] were rescued by [[Null-class Advanced Recon Commando|Null ARC trooper]] [[Ordo Skirata|N-11]] and the [[Clone commando/Legends|clone commandos]] of [[Omega Squad]].<ref>''[[Omega Squad: Targets]]''</ref>[[File:MeenaTills-WW.jpg|thumb|left|250px|Tills orders Captain [[Gial Ackbar/Legends|Ackbar]] to protect Prince [[Lee-Char/Legends|Lee-Char]]]]Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Tills was present during a [[Battle of Mon Cala/Legends|second battle]] of [[Dac]], as the [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] people sided with the Republic, while the [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]] were backed by the Confederacy of Independent Systems. Tills was caught in the midst of this conflict, advising where she could while under the protection of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and clone troopers.She was later present in the Galactic Senate when it was announced that interest rates on the Republic would be raised by the Banking Clan because the Separatists were refusing to pay their loans. She expressed her concerns along with Senators [[Mot-Not Rab]] and [[Kin Robb]]. When Senator Robb called for a counter-invasion in order to seize the banks, Tills supported her.A staunch [[Loyalist/Legends|Loyalist]], she was one of the leading political figures behind the [[Delegation of 2000]], a movement in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] that opposed [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] staying in power. She was part of the group that presented the [[Petition of 2000]] to Palpatine following the [[Battle of Coruscant/Legends|Battle of Coruscant]]. The document would later be used to incriminate many Loyalists, including Tills, under the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]].After the formation of the Empire, Senator Tills was arrested and her people and planet were enslaved. However, she eventually escaped captivity, and was eventually issued with a bounty on her head sometime prior to the Battle of Yavin.<ref name="STAC">''[[Star Tours: The Adventures Continue]]''</ref>

name: Che Amanwe Papanoida/Legends
description: [[File:CheAmanweBadass-SoI.png|thumb|left|200px|Che Amanwe uses an appropriated blaster to defend her family]]Che and her sister Chi were present on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] when their father and Senator [[Riyo Chuchi/Legends|Riyo Chuchi]] were trying to petition the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] into ending the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation's]] [[Blockade of Pantora/Legends|blockade]] of [[Pantora/Legends|Pantora]]. In the middle of the night, the sisters were kidnapped by [[Greedo/Legends|Greedo]] on behalf of the Separatists, but not before Che was able to hit the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] with an idol, which her father realized was misplaced. Che was separated from her sister and was held captive in a [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] in [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] while Chi was placed in the [[Unidentified Lucrehulk-class Droid Control Ship (Pantora)|Trade Federation ship]] in orbit of Pantora. Che's father and her brother [[Ion Papanoida/Legends|Ion]] were able to track Greedo down by using the blood sample on the idol, before gaining [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt's]] assistance. However, Che accidentally identified her father to Greedo's associates upon seeing him, causing a firefight to ensue. Che saved her father when Greedo's [[Gotal/Legends|Gotal]] [[Unidentified Gotal bounty hunter/Legends|accomplice]] was going to shoot him. The Papanoidas were soon reunited and returned to Coruscant as the Trade Federation lifted the blockade.

name: Reesa Doliq
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Reesa Doliq was educated in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]; Doliq had attained the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] by [[89 BBY]]. Appointed as an [[Jedi academy|academy]] [[Jedi instructor|instructor]], Master Doliq was stationed at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]. At the Temple, a voluntary assignment was open to the Temple's senior [[Jedi Initiate|Initiates]] and younger [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]], which pitted two teams of ten against each other in a fun competition. In 89 BBY, Doliq was assigned to oversee the transport of a group designated as Blue Team, led by a young Padawan named [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], to the [[Senate District]]'s [[All Planets Market]].<ref name="LOTJ" />

name: Orphne/Legends
description: As a resident of the Underworld of Aleen, above ground air was toxic to Orphne. When a seal separating the Underworld from the surface world was removed Orphne and her neighbors, the tree-like [[Kindalo/Legends|Kindalo]], began to suffer from the influx of above ground air. Orphene accused the surface-dwelling [[Aleena/Legends|Aleena]] of causing their suffering and the Kindalo responded to the perceived wrong by causing severe [[Groundquake/Legends|groundquakes]]. The groundquakes caused the death of many Aleena and substantial damage to their infrastructure.[[File:OrphneLounge-SWE.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Orphne lounges in her chair]]Shortly after [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] and [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] arrived on the planet in company with a relief mission launched by the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]] they fell into the underworld due to one of the groundquakes. Orphne followed them in the form of sparkling dust, causing C-3PO to believe he was under attack. The duo then ran into the Kindalo, who directed them to Orphne after being convinced the two [[Droid/Legends|droids]] were there as friends. The Kindalo claimed that Orphne would help them escape from the Underworld. When they arrived at a large circular chamber, it was revealed that she had been following them in the form of purple and white sparkles. She then attempted to eat C-3PO, but was unable. After her failed attempt at consuming C-3PO Orphne decided to explain to the droids that the Aleena and under-dwellers had made a covenant to separate the above and below ground, so that neither would have to breathe the poisonous air of the other. But somehow, the opening to the underworld had been breached, and the under-dwellers resorted to causing groundquakes in an attempt to resolve their dilemma. After giving a riddle to the two droids Orphne left the room, leaving the droids to their contemplation. R2-D2 quickly devised the answer to Orphne's riddle: river. R2-D2 sprayed water on the water elemental symbol imprinted on the floor, which caused a geyser of water to force the droids out the opening and back to the surface. The two droids then shifted the seal back onto the opening, ending the threat to the residents of the Underworld.

name: Unidentified Dulok cub 2
description: {{Quotetrans|Watch it! Get away, little bark eaters! Oh, ''kvark.''|Latara, upon being tackled by Gorneesh and Urgah's children|The Travelling Jindas}}[[File:Don't bite your mom 2 (TTJ).jpg|thumb|left|The Dulok Princess's mischief drove Queen Urgah to demand a babysitter.]]Born to [[Parent/Legends|parents]] [[Gorneesh]] and [[Urgah]], respectively the [[King/Legends|king]] and [[Queen/Legends|queen]] of a [[Gorneesh's tribe|tribe]] of [[Dulok/Legends|Duloks]] on the [[Endor/Legends|Forest Moon]] of [[Endor (planet)/Legends|Endor]], the [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="TTJ" /><ref name="gender" /> Dulok child was a mere toddler in [[3 ABY/Legends|3 ABY]]. One day in that [[Standard year/Legends|year]],<ref name="TTJ" /><ref name="BTM" /> the child, wearing a [[Color/Legends|light-pink]] shawl, joined [[Unidentified Dulok cub 1|her brother]]<ref name="TTJ" /><ref name="gender" /> and [[Unidentified Dulok cub 3|another sibling]] as they terrorized their mother while the Queen tried to do chores in the royal hut in the [[Dulok Swamp]]. For her part in the mischief, the [[Prince/Legends|Princeess]] grasped Urgah's left [[Limb/Legends|leg]] and gnawed on her knee. With children still attached, Urgah ordered her husband to find a babysitter, lest he go hungry at suppertime.<ref name="TTJ" />The King sent out a [[Unidentified Dulok (X)|pair]] of [[Unidentified Dulok (O)|guards]] to nab an [[Ewok/Legends|Ewok]] from [[Bright Tree Village/Legends|Bright Tree Village]], a [[City/Legends|settlement]] in the [[Tree/Legends|forest]] nearby. The [[Scout/Legends|scouts]] later came back with a young, gray-furred Ewok named [[Latara]], tied up and ready to be put to work. Gorneesh initiated what he considered her "[[Torture/Legends|torture]]" by introducing her to the trio of Dulok cubs. The shawl-wearing toddler joined her siblings in welcoming their new babysitter with a body slam and floor wrestling match.<ref name="TTJ" />That evening the Dulok Princess and her two siblings dragged Latara to the front row of a performance by the [[Travelling Jindas]], a band of wandering [[Entertainer|performers]] who had arrived in the swamp that day. The pups stood relatively still for the show, although they did join their peers in heckling certain acts. When [[Trebla]], a [[Jinda]] [[magic]]ian, appeared, the shawl-wearing child was left with her parents and siblings as the performer pulled Latara onto the stage to be his assistant. The Ewok was then spirited away as the Jindas rapidly packed up and left the swamp; indeed, Latara's friends&mdash;the Ewoks [[Paploo/Legends|Paploo]], [[Kneesaa a Jari Kintaka]], [[Teebo/Legends|Teebo]], and [[Wicket Wystri Warrick|Wicket W. Warrick]], all in Jinda costumes&mdash;had organized the show as a cover to save their friend from child-watching [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]].<ref name="TTJ" />

name: Seer (clone)
description: [[File:Shira_Brie_NEGTC.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Lumiya, Seer's genetic "mother".]]Seer was a bald [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] of the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lady]] [[Lumiya]] that was created by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in [[Imperial research facility|a research facility]] on a [[frozen moon]] in the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]], as part of a cloning program that was initiated by [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. Seer was one of a number of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] clones that were bred in the facility and at some point, she was contacted via [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by a [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] entity that resided within a [[Rakata]]n construct. Seer came to refer to the entity as "[[Mother (Rakatan entity)|Mother]]" and the clones began to worship the entity. Seer eventually became the leader of the clones, who began to refer to themselves as the [[Community]], and the clones [[Death/Legends|killed]] and overthrew the Imperial forces that operated the research facility. For many [[Standard year/Legends|years]], the clones resided on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]], and in [[41 ABY|41.5 ABY]], they escaped the facility by stealing a [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]] that had been flown to the moon by the [[Anzat (species)|Anzat]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] agent [[Kell Douro]].Seer and all of the other members of the Community, with the exception of the clone [[Soldier (clone)|Soldier]], suffered from a sickness as a result of their clone heritage and as they escaped from the research facility, the CloakShape passed through the remnants of the [[Lignan]] cargo of the [[Sith dreadnaught]] [[Harbinger (Sith dreadnaught)|''Harbinger'']], which had been destroyed a short time earlier. The Lignan enhanced the clones' perception of the Force and accelerated the effects of their sickness. Seer believed that the illness was a test that had been set for the clones by Mother and she ordered Soldier to fly the CloakShape fighter to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Fhost]], so that the clones could obtain some medication, and planned for the clones to then travel to find Mother. On Fhost, Seer, Soldier and the surviving members of the Community that had not succumbed to the illness deserted the [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] and stole a medical supply [[Starship/Legends|ship]] from the [[Farpoint Medical Center]]. While stealing the ship, Seer encountered the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jaden Korr]] and the clones captured the [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] [[Khedryn Faal]], an associate of Korr.The clones departed from Fhost in the medical ship and headed towards Mother's location. After they had interrogated Faal, Seer stated that the Community no longer had any need for the spacer, so she ordered the clone [[Runner (clone)|Runner]] to kill Faal. However, the [[Umbaran/Legends|Umbaran]] [[Nyss Nenn]], a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] agent who had stowed away aboard the ship, killed Runner and the clone [[Hunter (clone)|Hunter]], and planned to kill the rest of the clones. Seer was knocked unconscious during a fight between Soldier and Nenn and the Umbaran decided not to murder her, because he believed that she might be considered useful by his employers, the resurgent Sith Order [[One Sith]]. Soldier subsequently forced Nenn to flee the ship in an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]] and the clones resumed their journey towards the Rakatan construct.The surviving members of the Community&mdash;Seer, Soldier and the child [[Grace (Human)|Grace]]&mdash;exited [[Hyperspace/Legends|hyperspace]] near to their destination and landed the medical ship inside the Rakatan [[Space station/Legends|station]]. Mother directed Seer to a cylindrical mound inside a large oval-shaped chamber and Seer requested that Mother heal both Grace and Soldier. However, a number of filaments from the mound cocooned themselves around Seer and while the clone screamed for help, Mother transferred her consciousness into Seer's body, killing the Seer. Seer's body became pale, bloated and wrapped in filaments by Mother, and the entity went on a rampage. However, the station exploded a short time afterward, destroying Mother and what remained of Seer's body.

name: Jimba/Legends
description: Jimba, along with fellow scout, [[Tagoo/Legends|Tagoo]], led a hunting party after [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] and [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] crashed landed on their [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Patitite Pattuna/Legends|Patitite Pattuna]]. Jimba was among the ones to lead the attack on the [[Droid/Legends|droids]] and personally jumped on top of R2-D2 to deliver the final blow. After the two droids were overpowered, Jimba called the other Patitites to tell the Big [[Hay-Zu/Legends|Hay-Zu]] for, as the overlord of the Patitite people, he would know what to do. After binding the droids down, Jimba proceeded to explain the power of the Great Hay-Zu and how he sent the "lucky" children off to fight his wars. However, R2 accidentally fell on Hay-Zu, killing him. Jimba and her fellow Patitites cheered and praised the droids as a result of this. With Tagoo, Jimba requested that C-3PO would stay as their new leader, for he was the one to defeat the Great Hay-Zu, to which he refused. After creating the foundations of democracy, the two droids left the Patitites to argue over the future leadership.

name: Vyn Asara
description: Vyn Asara was a female Rutian Twi'lek who lived during the Cold War. She worked her way up through the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] diplomatic circles, eventually becoming an [[Ambassador/Legends|ambassador]] to the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Asara was designated a terrorist and seditionist by the Sith for working from within Imperial space to convince worlds to ally with the Republic. Her work earned the personal ire of [[Grand Moff/Legends|Grand Moff]] [[Rycus Kilran]].Around [[3643 BBY]], she was aboard the cruiser [[Esseles (starship)|''Esseles'']] en route to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] when Kilran [[Assault on the Esseles|tried]] to capture her. Kilran's forces boarded the Esseles, but they were only a diversion to distract a group of potential defenders that were aboard. The real threat was a squad of [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]] led by the veteran [[Ironfist]], who seized the bridge and captured the command crew.{{GameLS}}The Ambassador tried to convince the heroes to gain access to the bridge by resetting the reactor, which would disengage the security locks, but also vent the engineering compartment, killing [[Chief Engineer]] [[Salen]] and his crew trapped within. The group refused, shutting down the secondary conduits instead and achieving the same result.After the allies defeated Ironfist and freed the crew, Asara convinced them to take one of the ''Esseles''{{'}} shuttles over to Kilran's ship and disable the tractor beam holding the cruiser. First Officer [[Haken]] attempted to convince them to leave the ambassador on Kilran's ship to ensure the Imperials would not follow, but they refused. The allies boarded the ship with a group of security forces and Asara, who was familiar with the layout of that type of Imperial warship. Asara and the guards waited in the hangar while the heroes disabled the tractor beam, but the ambassador was attacked the [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]] [[Vokk]] just as they returned. He killed the security forces and choked Asara, but threw her aside as the others entered the hangar. They managed to defeat the Sith and his troops, and informed the ambassador of Haken's proposal as they were about to leave.Asara thanked them for informing her of the officer's treachery, and confronted Haken when they arrived back on the ''Esseles''. The ''Esseles'' continued on its way to Coruscant, where the ambassador could continue her mission.{{Endgame}}

name: Shada D'ukal
description: Shada had come from a family with several uncles. She joined the Shadow Guard in [[3 BBY/Legends|3 BBY]]<ref name="SoP">''[[Specter of the Past]]''</ref>. In [[0 BBY/Legends|0 BBY]], Shada was a member of the six-person Shadow Guard team led by [[Manda D'ulin]], when they were approached by the scientists working on the [[Hammertong/Legends|Hammertong]] project to guard a prototype of the [[Death Star/Legends|Death Star's]] superlaser. When the mission went wrong, Shada and her friend and comrade [[Karoly D'ulin]] stole the [[Strike-class medium cruiser|Strike Cruiser]] being used to transport the prototype, and escaped to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], where they posed as the [[Tonnika sisters/Legends|Tonnika sisters]] in an effort to hire a freighter to help take a section of the device back to [[Emberlene]].[[File:Tonnika1.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Shada disguised as [[Tonnika sisters/Legends|Brea Tonnika]] in [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]].]]By [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], Shada was traveling the galaxy aboard the freighter ''[[The Fury]]'' with Mistryl trainee [[Dunc T'racen]], when the pair of them were caught up in a complex con run by [[Ghitsa Dogder]] and [[Fenig Nabon]]. After this, Shada became bodyguard for the [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] chief [[Mazzic]]. In this job, she appeared with plaited hair and a blank expression&mdash;until trouble started. Then she was all business, throwing enameled [[zenji needle]]s with lethal accuracy and using her more-than-capable combat skills to protect the smuggler chief.She was present at the [[Ambush on Trogan|meeting on Trogan]] where she defended Mazzic and later at the meeting on [[Hijarna]] where she assisted at the formation of the [[Smugglers' Alliance]].[[File:Mazzic_and_Shada.jpg|thumb|right|150px|[[Mazzic]] and his bodyguard Shada D'ukal]]In [[19 ABY/Legends|19 ABY]], Shada prevented Karoly from assassinating Mazzic, and came under punishment from the [[Eleven Elders of the People|Eleven]] who led the Mistryl. She left Mazzic's employment to avoid the Mistryl hunter teams, seeking to join up with the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]]. Instead, [[Leia Organa Solo]] offered Shada's services to [[Talon Karrde]], who was [[Hunt for Jorj Car'das|heading into]] the [[Kathol sector]] to locate a copy of the [[Caamas Document]]. Shada accompanied him, and the two grew fond of each other. When Karrde located information that revealed the truth about the fake [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]], Shada was there to stop the cloned Major [[Grodin Tierce]] from killing [[Gilad Pellaeon/Legends|Gilad Pellaeon]] and a Mistryl leader, [[Paloma D'asima]]. As a result the hunter teams were called off and Shada officially joined Karrde's new joint intelligence organization, taking the role of Karrde's unofficial second in command that had been open since [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]] left the organization.During the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], Shada continued to serve as Karrde's lieutenant and business-partner. She assisted in transporting [[Jedi Initiate]]s from [[Yavin 4/Legends|Yavin 4]] to [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. There were rumors that she had passed on details of the Hammertong device to Karrde, allowing [[Booster Terrik]] to mount a superlaser aboard the ''[[Errant Venture]]''.

name: Darth Nyriss
description: A female Sith Pureblood, Nyriss was an exceptionally powerful and ambitious woman. Darth Nyriss was one of the most talented and influential figures of the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Sith Empire]] in her time. Perhaps her most notable accomplishments were the conquest of [[Drezzi]], the destruction of [[Melldia]], and gaining membership of the Empire's [[Dark Council]] on the basis of her talents. However, the Dark Council in her time was rife with internal power struggles and plotting. Nyriss, in particular, was subjected to several assassination attempts. Due to these occurrences, the [[Vitiate|Sith Emperor]] advised Nyriss to temporarily seclude herself from the Council's politics until the matter was resolved; she resided in a well-protected citadel on the western edge of [[Kaas City]] during this time. The Sith Emperor also suggested Nyriss to hire an agent who would be detached from the Council's politics and help her investigate the matter. However, Nyriss had plans of her own, which she put in to motion once a renowned warrior called Lord [[Scourge (Sith)|Scourge]] arrived in Dromund Kass to assist her.<ref name="Revan">''[[The Old Republic: Revan]]''</ref>By the time Nyriss met Scourge, her physical appearance had degenerated immensely as a result of the powerful dark side rituals that she chose to delve in; she was highly proficient in the arts of [[Sith magic|Sith sorcery]] and strong in the dark side of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. Nyriss was once very beautiful and could easily afford the procedures required to retain her youthful appearance but she chose not to, possibly to flaunt her strength in the dark side or that she didn't care about superficial appearances.<ref name="Revan" />Nyriss's plans went beyond the elimination of her enemies who wanted her dead; she was among the co-conspirators on the Dark Council who planned to destroy the Sith Emperor. When Scourge found about this, he confronted Nyriss to ascertain her true motives. However, Nyriss still deemed his usefulness and revealed some terrible secrets of the Sith Emperor to Scourge to buy his allegiance. She even took Scourge to [[Nathema]]—former homeworld of the Sith Emperor—to prove her claims.<ref name="Revan" />Nyriss was responsible for [[Revan/Legends|Revan's]] capture on Nathema and held him captive for several years in her stronghold, until the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] managed to turn Scourge against her on the basis of his talents and teachings. By this time, Scourge was not just ready to remove Nyriss from the picture but was also willing to help Revan in his plan to assassinate the Sith Emperor. As part of this plan, Scourge revealed Nyriss's treachery to the Sith Emperor, who then decided to eliminate all possible threats to him on urgent basis. Soon after, the Sith Emperor's forces attacked and seized Nyriss's stronghold.<ref name="Revan" />

name: Hunter (clone)
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] created and bred by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in [[Imperial research facility|a research facility]] as part of a cloning program initiated by [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. Later, their group known as the [[Community]], the clones overthrew and killed the Imperial forces that operated the research facility. For many years the clones resided in the lower levels of this facility and during this time, Hunter fell in love with [[Alpha]] and conceived with him two daughters, [[Blessing]] and [[Grace (Human)|Grace]].In [[41 ABY|41.5 ABY]], they escaped the facility by stealing the [[Predator (Kell Douro's ship)|''Predator'']], a [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]], that had been flown to the moon by the [[Anzat (species)|Anzat]] Sith agent, [[Kell Douro]]. Alpha was killed during their escape by [[Jaden Korr]] who had also come there to investigate a [[Force vision]].Hunter and all of the other members of the Community, with the exception of the clone [[Soldier (clone)|Soldier]], suffered from a sickness as a result of their clone heritage. As they escaped from the research facility, they flew through the remnants of the [[Lignan]] cargo of the [[Harbinger (Sith dreadnaught)|''Harbinger'']], which had been destroyed a short time earlier. The Lignan enhanced the clones' perception of the Force but also accelerated the effects of their sickness.At some point in the past, she and the other clones began to worship the entity known as "[[Mother (Rakatan entity)|Mother]]" under the guidance of another clone, [[Seer (clone)|Seer]]. She believed that the illness was a test that had been set for the clones by Mother and ordered Soldier to fly them to a planet called [[Fhost]] so that they could obtain medication and planned for the clones to then travel to find Mother.On Fhost, Seer, Soldier, Hunter and the serving members of the Community that had not succumbed to the illness, deserted the [[Starfighter/Legends|starfighter]] and stole a medical supply [[Starship/Legends|ship]] from the [[Farpoint Medical Center]]. While stealing the ship, Seer encountered the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jaden Korr]] and the clones captured [[Khedryn Faal]], a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] associate of Korr.After their escape from Fhost on the medical ship, the clones headed towards Mother's location. Unfortunately, the [[Nyss Nenn]], an [[Umbaran/Legends|Umbaran]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] agent who had stowed away aboard the ship showed himself and killed both Hunter and [[Runner (clone)|Runner]].

name: Grace (Human)
description: {{Quote|Only Grace will live to see Mother.|Seer|Riptide (novel)}}The [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] Grace was born around [[32 ABY/Legends|32 ABY]] to [[Alpha (clone)|Alpha]] and [[Hunter (clone)|Hunter]], two [[The Force/Legends|Force]]-[[Force-sensitive/Legends|sensitive]] [[Cloning/Legends|clones]] produced in secret by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] under the regime of [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. Alpha and Hunter were bred by [[Doctor/Legends|doctors]] in an [[Imperial research facility]] on a [[frozen moon]] in the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]], where they and several other clones, collectively known as the [[Community]], [[Death/Legends|killed]] the doctors and took control of the facility. The clones suffered from a [[sickness]] that contributed to [[clone madness]] and would eventually kill them if not properly treated with a medicine known as [[Metacycline]]. When Hunter gave birth to Grace and her sister Blessing, she passed the sickness on to her daughters, who suffered its effects worse than the clones.<ref name="Riptide" />The Community waited on the frozen [[Moon/Legends|moon]] for several [[Standard year/Legends|years]] in the hopes of hijacking a [[Starship/Legends|starship]] that could take them to [[Mother (Rakatan entity)|Mother]], an entity that communicated to them through the clone [[Seer (clone)|Seer]].<ref name="Riptide" /> In [[41 ABY]], that wish was granted when the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] named [[Jaden Korr]] arrived on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] after encountering the [[Sith dreadnaught]] [[Harbinger (Sith dreadnaught)|''Harbinger'']]. Korr landed on the moon, stalked by [[One Sith]] [[Agent/Legends|agent]] [[Kell Douro]]. Korr discovered the clones and [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|dueled]] with Alpha, eventually killing him. Douro was later killed by Korr's companion, the [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] [[Khedryn Faal]], and the Community used Douro's [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]] [[Predator (Kell Douro's ship)|''Predator'']] to escape the moon.<ref name="Cross">''[[Crosscurrent]]''</ref> In the moon's [[Atmosphere/Legends|atmosphere]], the [[Starfighter/Legends|fighter]] passed through a cloud of [[Lignan]] [[Ore/Legends|ore]] caused by the destruction of the ''Harbinger''. The ore granted the [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] members of the Community greater power in the use of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], but it also accelerated the effects of the sickness. When the Community fell into agony from the sickness's symptoms, [[Soldier (clone)|Soldier]], a clone of [[Jaden Korr]] and the only member of the Communitywho did not suffer from the sickness, injected Grace and the others with Metacycline. He then suggested the Community head to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Fhost]], where he hoped they could acquire more of the ingredients necessary for Metacycline. Along the way, Blessing died from the sickness, as did [[Gift]], another [[Youngling/Legends|child]] of the Community's clones. Grace and her mother both survived the journey, but were unconscious. After Soldier injected Grace with a shot of [[adrenaline]], he, Seer, and the clone [[Runner (clone)|Runner]] headed to Fhost's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[City/Legends|city]], [[Farpoint]], in a [[Landspeeder/Legends|landspeeder]], taking the unconscious Grace and Hunter with them. The Community went to the [[Farpoint Medical Center]], and, after a [[Skirmish at the Farpoint Medical Center|confrontation]] with Jaden Korr, hijacked a [[Supply ship/Legends|supply ship]] and took Korr's companion Faal hostage after knocking him unconscious.<ref name="Riptide" />Grace reacted well to the medication Soldier gave her, and she regained consciousness aboard the supply ship.
