Faal later awoke inside the ship's [[Cockpit/Legends|cockpit]], where he met Grace. As she smiled at him, he stuck his tongue out at her, causing her to giggle. He was then interrogated by the clones, and, after gleaning what information Faal knew, the clones agreed to kill the spacer. Runner took him to the ship's airlock to eject him into [[Realspace/Legends|space]], but the clone was killed by the [[Umbaran/Legends|Umbaran]] [[Nyss Nenn]], who had sneaked aboard the ship. Nenn allowed Faal to live with the intention of trading him for Korr, and used a pair of [[flexcuff]]s to restrain the spacer to a crossbar in the ship's corridors. Grace, who had sneaked away from the cockpit, later found Faal and helped free him by giving him a [[Knife/Legends|knife]]. She then fled as her Metacycline began to wear off and the symptoms of the sickness worsened, causing her skin to bulge and roil as it distorted her facial features. Faal considered fleeing the ship in an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]], but resolved instead to do everything he could to help Grace.<ref name="Riptide" />Hunter regained consciousness and went out looking for Grace, but she too encountered Nenn, who killed her with his [[Crossbow/Legends|crossbow]]. The Umbaran then went to the cockpit to capture Soldier. As he stood outside the cockpit, hoping to surprise Soldier and Seer, Grace spotted him and screamed, alerting the clones. Nenn tried to throw a [[Vibroblade/Legends|vibroblade]] at her, but she ran away before he could. As Soldier fought with the Umbaran, Grace ran to a [[Turbolift/Legends|turbolift]] and took it down to the floor where she had found Faal. Faal, waiting at the lift several floors down, was prepared to see the Umbaran or a clone inside the lift, and nearly attacked Grace when she emerged. Instead, he comforted the frightened girl, who told him about the situation at the cockpit.<ref name="Riptide" />

name: Scar (clone)
description: Scar was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Cloning/Legends|clone]] of a unknown [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] that was created by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]] in [[Imperial research facility|a research facility]] on a [[frozen moon]] in the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]], as part of a cloning program that was initiated by [[Grand Admiral/Legends|Grand Admiral]] [[Mitth'raw'nuruodo/Legends|Thrawn]]. Scar was one of a number of [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] clones that were bred in the facility, and at some point, she alongside the other clones began to worship the entity "[[Mother (Rakatan entity)|Mother]]" under the guide of [[Seer (clone)|Seer]]. Later the newly constituted [[Community]] [[Death/Legends|killed]] and overthrew the Imperial forces that operated the research facility. For many [[Standard year/Legends|years]], the clones resided on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] and only in [[41 ABY|41.5 ABY]], they escaped the facility by stealing a [[CloakShape fighter/Legends|CloakShape fighter]] that had been flown to the moon by the [[Anzat (species)|Anzat]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] agent [[Kell Douro]] but Alpha was killed by the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Jaden Korr]].Scar and all of the other members of the Community, with the exception of the clone [[Soldier (clone)|Soldier]], suffered from a sickness as a result of their clone heritage and as they escaped from the research facility, the CloakShape passed through the remnants of the [[Lignan]] cargo of the [[Sith dreadnaught]] [[Harbinger (Sith dreadnaught)|''Harbinger'']], which had been destroyed a short time earlier. The Lignan enhanced the clones' perception of the Force and accelerated the effects of their sickness, killing Scar as a result. Seer believed that the illness was a test that had been set for the clones by Mother and she ordered Soldier to fly the CloakShape fighter to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Fhost]], so that the clones could obtain some medication, and planned for the clones to then travel to find Mother.

name: J'uoch
description: She had [[Lanni Troujow]] killed in an attempt to find a data disk which contained information regarding the whereabouts of the treasure ship [[Queen of Ranroon/Legends|''Queen of Ranroon'']]. In her search for the data disk she and her band of outlaws stole the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] from [[Han Solo/Legends|Han Solo]] on [[Dellalt/Legends|Dellalt]]. In [[2 BBY/Legends|2 BBY]] she was pushed from a bridge on [[Dellalt/Legends|Dellalt]] while fighting with [[Hasti Troujow]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Shass (Neimoidian)
description: In [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]], she joined the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] and initially planned to rise through the ranks of the organization. However, when the Federation [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|blockaded]] the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]], and Shass realized that the Trade Federation was corrupt, she refused to progress any further within the organization. In [[17 BBY/Legends|17 BBY]], she later settled in the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Zarra/Legends|Zarra]] on the planet [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]] and by the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the early [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], she had established the business [[Zarran Imports and Exports]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Kessra
description: During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Kessra and the Vipers fought for the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and after the conclusion of the conflict, they were stranded on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Cato Neimoidia/Legends|Cato Neimoidia]]. To avoid arrest by the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]], Kessra and the Vipers went into hiding and reformed themselves into a [[Swoop gang/Legends|swoop gang]], and they subsequently seized control of the streets of the [[City/Legends|city]] [[Zarra/Legends|Zarra]]. Kessra also secretly began to work for the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutt]] [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Darga Jiramma Mionne]] and she used the Vipers as a means by which to achieve Darga's goals in Zarra. In about [[17 BBY/Legends|17 BBY]], a group of [[Alderaanian Resistance]] agents traveled to Zarra and landed their [[Baudo-class star yacht|''Baudo''-class star yacht]] [[Banshee (Baudo-class)|''Banshee'']] in the city's [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]]. Once the agents had disembarked from their [[Starship/Legends|starship]], Kessra and the Vipers surrounded the vessel and claimed that the agents had not paid the Vipers a landing fee, and thus each owed the gang 1,000 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]].

name: Ressa
description: Ressa was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] individual who lived during the [[Standard day/Legends|days]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Old Republic]]. She was the [[Queen/Legends|queen]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Drezzi]] for an amount of [[Time/Legends|time]]<ref name="Revan" /> prior to the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3954 BBY]].<ref name="think">The beginning of ''[[The Old Republic: Revan]]'' occurs during [[3954 BBY]]. Since the story of Ressa was told in the past tense, it can be concluded that the events occurred prior to 3954 BBY.</ref> During Ressa's reign, her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] was [[Conquest of Drezzi|conquered]] by the resurgent [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. After the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] took the planet, [[Ressa's husband]] was [[Death/Legends|executed]]. However, the lives of her and her [[Youngling/Legends|children]] were spared by [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Nyriss]]. In gratitude for Nyriss's actions, Ressa gave her a [[Holoprojector/Legends|holoprojection]] as a gift. Sometime later, [[Sith (species)|Sith Pureblood]] [[Sechel]] told Sith [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Scourge (Sith)|Scourge]] the tale behind the holoprojection as Sechel took the latter to meet with Nyriss in her [[Darth Nyriss's stronghold|stronghold]] on the Sith world [[Dromund Kaas]].<ref name="Revan" />

name: Chai
description: Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]], Chai's sister, the [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Bant'ena Fhernan]], was captured by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and the Confederacy forced Fhernan to work for them by claiming that they would [[Death/Legends|kill]] Chai and Fherman's other family members if she refused to co-operate with them. The CIS put Chai and Bern under surveillance and a Confederacy [[Cam droid/Legends|droidcam]] recorded footage of Chai, Bern and their sons disembarking from a [[Transport/Legends|transport]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] while on their way to their annual camping vacation.

name: Lura Tranor
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Lura Tranor was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] by the time of the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]]. Selecting the young [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]] [[Jyl Somtay]] as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], the Master-Padawan duo trained together for several years until Somtay achieved the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]].<ref name="DITC" />At the height of the Separatist Crisis, the tensions between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] came to a head on [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]] with the arrest and trial of Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]]. When [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] formed a [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] to rescue the Jedi and senator, Jedi Somtay was away but Master Tranor answered the call. Following her fellow Jedi to the dusty world, Master Tranor helped storm the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]] and took up her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] against the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]]. Despite her bravery and skill, Master Tranor lost her life during the [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|bloody battle]].<ref name="DITC" />

name: Bargu
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Clawdite/Legends|Clawdite]], Bargu received her early [[Jedi training/Legends|education]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s [[Jedi academy|academy]]. Selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] after the outbreak of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]], Bargu was made a [[Jedi Commander/Legends|Commander]] in the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="YDR" />Stationed at the Temple in [[19 BBY/Legends|19 BBY]], Bargu participated in the [[Jedi Temple Apprentice Tournament|Apprentice Tournament]] overseen by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Ilena Xan]]. Making it through to the Round of Eight, which was held in one of the Temple [[Jedi Temple Refectory|refectories]], Bargu was defeated in [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|combat]] by a [[Chagrian/Legends|Chagrian]] Padawan, [[Lena Missa]], by a blow to the arm with a [[Training lightsaber/Legends|training lightsaber]].<ref name="YDR" />

name: Winna Di Yuni
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Winna Di Yuni was [[Jedi training/Legends|educated]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Training independently as a [[Jedi Consular|Consular]], Master Yuni perfected her [[Force healing/Legends|Force healing]] abilities and went on to become one of the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]]'s finest [[Jedi healer|diagnosticians]].<ref name="TEE" />In [[43 BBY/Legends|43 BBY]], Master Di Yuni was stationed in the Temple's [[Halls of Healing]] when Master [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] brought his friend, [[Didi Oddo]], for treatment after the man had been poisoned by a chemical agent of unknown source. Upon discovering the agent was created by the deranged [[Scientist/Legends|scientist]] [[Jenna Zan Arbor]], Master Di Yuni was able to apply the proper cure for Oddo's ailment and he made a full recovery.<ref name="TDR">''[[Jedi Apprentice: The Dangerous Rescue]]''</ref>

name: Darth Zhorrid
description: {{Quote|I am Darth Zhorrid, Lord of the Dark Council and successor to Darth Jadus.|Darth Zhorrid|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}Darth Zhorrid was the only known [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] [[Sith training|trained]] by her [[Parent/Legends|father]], [[Darth Jadus]].<ref name="Holonet" /> She had scars running from the edges of her mouth to her ears. In her early years, she found herself being talented at singing, something that even her father acknowledged. Later, Jadus specifically hired a tutor to teach his daughter, who wasn't a Sith back in that time, how to sing. It was when the Sith lord set up an event in [[Kaas City]] for her only, that made overjoyed Zhorrid sing until she made all her subjects cry. Zhorrid sang her first and last opera for hours until she could sing no longer. It was then that Jadus chose to start her apprenticeship, as he know his daughter's love for him shall be reduced to hatred for the rest of her life.After her father's alleged murder at the hands of the terrorist known as the [[Eagle]], she was named a member of the [[Dark Council]] to take his place. She later summoned [[Cipher Nine]] to her offices on [[Korriban]], where she tested the agent's skills by ordering her guards to attack Nine. She then excused the Cipher to hunt down the terrorist cells.Though she demanded respect from her fellow Councilors, they simply laughed at her, viewing her as a child. She wished to seek revenge on Jadus' "killer," the [[Eagle]], or all involved with him.Cipher Nine managed to eradicate those who were a part of the [[Eagle terrorist network]], which gave Zhorrid a chance to achieve more personal power. In [[3641 BBY]] the [[Star Cabal]] nearly brought [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]], one of the organizations operating inside her sphere of influence, to its knees. She disbanded the agency and, along with the Dark Council, established [[Sith Intelligence]], which she headed directly though she was later replaced with [[Lana Beniko]] by [[Darth Marr]].

name: Unidentified medic
description: {{Quote|Sorry. I guess I'm a little disoriented.''"<br />"''Understandable. You've been lying in that bed for a month, after all.''"<br />"''A ''month''?''"<br />"''Well, most of a month. You also spent some time in a bacta tank. Don't worry&mdash;short-term memory problems are common during neural reconstructions, but they nearly always clear up after the treatment.|Mara Jade and the female medic|The Last Command}}In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[9 ABY/Legends|9 ABY]], a light-skinned [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] worked as a [[Medic/Legends|medic]] in the [[Imperial Palace medical wing|medical wing]] of the old [[Imperial Palace/Legends|Imperial Palace]] on the [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. Working alongside other members of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], the medic assisted former [[Emperor's Hand]] [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]] after the latter had awoken from an unconscious state caused by a recent [[Battle for the Katana fleet|battle]]. Assisted by an [[Unidentified 2-1B surgical droid (Imperial Palace)|Emdee droid]], the medic examined Jade's bandaged forehead with a [[Bioscan/Legends|medical scanning device]] since Jade had just awoken from [[Brain/Legends|neural]] reconstruction. As Jade was suffering from short-term memory loss, the medic assisted her by briefly telling the former [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Emperor's]] Hand what had happened during her stay in the [[Medcenter/Legends|hospital]]. The medic noted that Jade had been in a [[Bacta tank/Legends|bacta tank]] and then had lain in a bed for just short of a [[Standard month/Legends|month]]. After the medic informed Jade of what had happened, the former used a [[Comlink/Legends|comlink]] to make certain that Jade's quarters in the palace were prepared for her. Shortly thereafter, Jade was taken to her room by [[Winter Celchu|Winter]], a personal friend of New Republic official [[Leia Organa Solo]].<ref name="TLCn" />

name: Maddie
description: Maddie, a young [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], grew up in a small walled-off town on the barren [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Prine]]. One early morning, she was farming outside the gates of the community with her brother, [[Yan]], when a group of [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]] attacked. Unable to get within the protection of the town's walls, her brother was [[Death/Legends|killed]], while she was captured and put in chains.Sixteen days later, the caravan came across another Human female, [[Ember Chankeli]], who hailed the group, thinking them to be friendly beings. Chankeli was quickly surrounded, captured, and chained beside Maddie. The two did not speak, with Chankeli giving Maddie nothing but angry glares for some time. Soon, Chankeli became tired of her treatment, and decided that her past experiences with slavers would allow her to deal with them. She alerted a [[guard]] that she desired water and blankets, though Maddie begged her not to say anything. Chankeli ignored her and continued to berate the guard, who responded by smacking her in the face with the butt of his [[Blaster rifle/Legends|blaster rifle]]. Chankeli was shocked by the attack, but Maddie begged her not to give up hope. She laid down beside the fallen woman and held her, placing her hand within Chankeli's. Though Chankeli was surprised by such kindness and said nothing, she grasped Maddie's hand for comfort.During the next day, Maddie told Chankeli the story of how she came to be enslaved. Chankeli remarked that her capture coincided with her [[Starship/Legends|ship's]] crash landing, and Maddie excitedly asked her how many were aboard. Chankeli began to tell her about her friend, revealing that if he could find them he'd rescue them, but that they'd surely traveled too far by now. Maddie couldn't believe that one man could stand against all the slavers around them, but Chankeli disagreed, yet didn't reveal the truth behind her words.When the slavers' [[Captain/Legends|captain]] discovered that Chankeli had been struck and bruised, he murdered the offending guard with his [[Blaster pistol/Legends|blaster pistol]]. Just then, a disturbance from the rear of the caravan caused the slavers to regroup and attack. Unknown to both women, Chankeli's friend, the fugitive [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] [[Dass Jennir]], had indeed been following their trail, and now was assaulting the slavers with both his [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] and his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. Maddie asked Chankeli what was happening, and the older woman began to smile, saying that when she'd told Maddie that they were out of Jennir's reach, she had been wrong.

name: Zora
description: Zora was a member of Havoc Squad and second-in-command to [[Harron Tavus]]. She was the team's infiltration and assassination expert. During the war, she was stationed on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] during a [[Separatist War|civil war]], fighting the Imperial backed [[Mantellian Separatist Movement]], where she and her squad, except an [[Meteor (Havoc Squad)|unidentified Republic Trooper]], prepared and carried out their defection to the Sith Empire. Her position in Havoc Squad was filled by Aric Jorgan, soon after she defected.Afterwards, Wraith captured [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Zorin Krasul]] and took him to Port Raga to force him to confess to the Senate abandoning Havoc Squad on [[Ando Prime/Legends|Ando Prime]]. The new Havoc Squad was able to rescue the Senator, though Wraith escaped, and went on to systematically eliminating the individual Havoc traitors' operations on [[Taris/Legends|Taris]], [[Nar Shaddaa/Legends|Nar Shaddaa]], [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] and [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]]. These constant failures annoyed the Empire, forcing [[Harron Tavus]] to call all the Republic traitors to the Imperial warship ''Justice''. Havoc Squad infiltrated the ship, though Wraith caught them attempting to sabotage the hyperdrive. She died in the ensuing firefight.

name: Lexia Ginorra
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Lexia Ginorra was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and received her [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. After being selected as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], Ginorra was stationed on [[Kamparas]]'s [[Kamparas Jedi Training Center|training center]] where she completed her own [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]. On the path to become a [[Jedi Guardian]], Padawan Ginorra was abducted while on a mission by a crime syndicate and gave into her fears, slaughtering her captors.<ref name="CCW" />Realizing that she had violated the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] and fearful of retribution by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] and her master, Ginorra abandoned the Order and fled into jungles of Kamparas. Eventually Ginorra made her way back to Coruscant where she established herself as the leader of a gang of vigilantes that preyed upon the criminal leaders in the [[Coruscant underworld/Legends|Coruscant underworld]]. As many crime lords placed bounties on her head, Ginorra wiped out several criminal organizations, slipping further and further into darkness. Despite the illegality of her actions, her reputation preceded her, becoming the protagonist in many a [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]] officer's tales, gaining the name "the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]."<ref name="CCW" />

name: Yuon Par
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Yuon Par was brought into the Jedi Order at a young age. As a student, Yuon Par went with [[Cin Tykan]], [[Eriz Vossan]], [[Sidonie Garen]], [[Duras Fain]], and [[Parkanas Tark]] during a mission to explore the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Malachor III]]. However, during the mission, they encountered [[Terrak Morrhage]], the [[Force ghost|spirit]] of the ancient [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]] who pulled the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] under his spell. Both Par and Fain succumbed to the influence of the spirit, giving into their passions for one another. Before falling, she and the Jedi expedition managed to escape the planet when her friend Parkanas, the youngest member of the group, was left behind. Over the [[Standard year/Legends|years]] during the [[Great Galactic War]], Yuon rose to the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] at the end of the war.<ref name="TOR" />Training as a [[Jedi Consular|Consular]], Par became a respected scholar, specialized as an [[Jedi archaeologist|archaeologist]] and recognized as responsible for the reclamation of the lost [[Gharnus Texts]] and [[Odan-Urr's holocron|a holocron]] crafted by Master [[Odan-Urr/Legends|Odan-Urr]].<ref name="TOR" />As well as her research into the prehistory of the Jedi Order, Master Par was a skilled [[Jedi Diplomat|diplomat]] and successfully negotiated peace between warring clans of [[Gamorrean/Legends|Gamorreans]] and became the bloodsister of a [[Kaleesh/Legends|Kaleesh]] chieftain, all through her works in the field. When the Jedi Order was forced to relocate to their ancestral homeworld, [[Tython/Legends|Tython]], following the [[Sacking of Coruscant|sacking]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the loss of the [[Jedi Temple]] there, and the signing of the [[Treaty of Coruscant]], Master Par began [[Jedi instructor|teaching]] a class on the history of the Order to [[Jedi Initiate|Initiates]] at the new [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] there.<ref name="TOR" />At one time, during her studies, Par met the [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Qyzen Fess]] on [[Belkadan/Legends|Belkadan]]. He traded whatever he found in some ruins for snake-bite medicine. Since then, they had become close friends, though some of the Jedi put that into question.<ref name="TOR" />{{GameLS}}In [[3643 BBY]], Yuon Par and [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] Member, Master [[Syo Bakarn]] greeted [[The Barsen'thor|a young Padawan]], whose Force powers manifested at a very early age. She apologized to the Padawan for been late since she was working a lot on her archaeological inquiries. After her introducing herself, she explained to her apprentice about an urgent matter: a team of Jedi researchers had recently uncovered several teaching holograms that were made by the founders of the Jedi Order—in the region known as the [[Tythonian Gnarls]]. However, the researchers encountered the native Flesh Raiders that started to rampage through the region and failed to retrieve the hologram projectors of [[Cala Brin]], [[Garon Jard]], [[Ters Sendon]], and [[Rajivari]]. Her apprentice was successful in defeating the attacking Flesh Raiders and retrieved three of the projectors. However, the fourth hologram projector of Rajivari had been stolen. Par was concerned of this, but she knew that Flesh Raiders were not known for stealing artifacts. She instructed her apprentice to meet her back into the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Jedi Temple]].<ref name="TOR" />After her apprentice completed her trials and defeated the Dark Adept, [[Nalen Raloch]], Yuon Par proudly pronounced her pupil a Jedi before the Council. Then suddenly, she collapsed while in mid-sentence. Yuon was transferred to a medical facility on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Tower]]. When the Consular and Qyzen later arrived on the Republic capital, they entered to find Yuon muttered incoherently about [[Parkanas Tark]] and a darkness that was coming, which would slowly turn her to the dark side. Hoping to find a cure to her illness, the Consular sought out the [[Noetikon]]s. After recovering the [[Noetikon of Science]] and [[Noetikon of Light|Light]], the Consular was called back to the Senate Tower, as Yuon had attacked one of her caretakers. Her illness had worsen, as she failed to recognize Qyzen and her own Padawan, the illness convincing her that they fell to [[Flesh Raider]]s, and attacked them as well. The duo managed to subdue her before locating the [[Noetikon of Secrets]]. Bringing the Noetikons to the ruined Jedi Temple, the Consular discovered and learned a shielding ritual, which they used to cure Master Par, causing her insanity to fade. Yuon and her Padawan exchanged words before the Consular was called upon by the Council. Yuon had a short time to rest before her Padawan returned to her side, informing her that the Consular had been assigned by the Council to track down all the Jedi Masters affected by the plague.<ref name="TOR" />Yuon returned to [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] when her Padawan, successful in shielding all the afflicted Masters, was in session with the Council, ditching the Padawans assigned to watch her. She agreed with the Consular's theory that the plaguemaster, Lord Vivicar, was Parkanas Tark, in contrast to the Council's skepticism. She then suggested to her pupil that they drop the shielding ritual on her so she can invert the link between herself and Vivicar in hopes of finding his location. However, this had the result of Vivicar possessing her and attempted to force Yuon to kill her own Padawan. The Consular managed to overcome her, breaking Vivicar's control. Yuon then gave the coordinates and security code for Vivicar's starship before begging her former pupil to end her suffering. The Consular refused, instead restoring the shielding on Yuon.After the Consular managed to redeem Vivicar as Parkanas and end the threat of the madness plague, Yuon and the other afflicted Masters were restored to full health. Yuon watched proudly as her pupil was granted the title of [[Barsen'thor]], Warden of the Order.{{Endgame}}

name: Avitla
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Avitla was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and resided on the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order the following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Exploring the [[Tythonian Gnarls]] with fellow Padawans [[Mennaus]] and [[Jerridan]] in hopes of passing their [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Trials of Knighthood]], the group was slowed when [[Flesh Raider]]s attacked and injured Jerridan. While she and Jerridan sought to take revenge on the raiders for their attack, Mennaus stressed the Jedi philosophy warning against passion and aggression.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Kory
description: {{Quote|Lord Zash has tasked me with sorting through you refuse to find one worthy of being her apprentice, and I intend to do just that.|Harkun, to Kory and her peers|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}Kory was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] alive during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|turbulent period]] of [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] peace between the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]] and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] as established by the [[Treaty of Coruscant]].<ref name="Cold War">{{TORcite|All character class stories begin during the Cold War.}}</ref> She hailed from the [[Planet/Legends|worlds]] of the Sith imperium<ref name="ImperialAccent">{{TORcite|Multiple references throughout the game indicate that individuals from Imperial space speak with English accents, while Republic characters are largely given American accents. Kory speaks with a notable English accent.}}</ref> but was [[Reproduction/Legends|born]] into a low social class. As an Imperial citizen of low birth, Kory was relegated to the status of [[Slavery/Legends|slave]], but she was eventually found to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and so was inducted into the [[Sith/Legends|Sith Order]],<ref name="Of Mind and Matter" /> per [[Force-sensitive training mandate|Imperial law]].<ref name="Secret of Cave 52">{{TORcite|type=faction|Empire|The Secret of Cave 52|Balmorra}}</ref> The young woman began her [[Sith training|training]] as a lowly [[Sith Acolyte|acolyte]],<ref name="Of Mind and Matter" /> but around [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="GameDate" /> she was summoned to the Sith holy world of [[Korriban]] to become a student at the legendary [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] on the planet.<ref name="Of Mind and Matter" />The young Sith was summoned to the world to participate in a series of trials designed to find an [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] for the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] known as [[Darth Zash|Zash]]. Kory and five other former slaves&mdash;[[Balek]], [[Wydr]], [[Gerr]], [[Niloc]], and a [[Darth Nox|sixth acolyte]]<ref name="Of Mind and Matter" />&mdash;were all chosen because of their humble backgrounds; Zash had [[Force vision/Legends|prophesied]] that her apprentice would be of low birth,<ref name="In the Halls of Traitors">{{TORcite|type=class|Sith Inquisitor|In the Halls of Traitors|Dromund Kaas}}</ref> and so commanded the academy's [[Overseer (Sith)|Overseer]] [[Harkun]] to supervise the trials of the six acolytes and weed out the weak and unfit. Harkun, a harsh and bigoted trainer, gathered the hopefuls at the [[Korriban Arrival Port]] overlooking the [[Valley of the Dark Lords/Legends|Valley of the Dark Lords]]. There, he explained that Zash's first trial for them would be to enter the [[Tomb of Ajunta Pall|tomb]] of the ancient [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Ajunta Pall]]. Within, they were to locate and be judged by the hermit Sith [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Spindrall]], whose opinion Zash held in high regard.<ref name="Of Mind and Matter" />After the initiates were given their first task, Harkun singled out the sixth acolyte, who had arrived late, for harassment. Before leaving to find Spindrall, Kory offered her peer some reassuring words of encouragement. She then proceeded into the Valley of the Dark Lords and from there, into the Tomb of Ajunta Pall. Kory succeeded in finding Spindrall within the crypt's Sacrificial Chamber, where she was challenged by the elder Sith and ultimately judged as weak and unworthy. The acolyte left the tomb in order to meet up once more with her fellow students and Overseer Harkun, this [[Time/Legends|time]] within the academy itself. Harkun had received word from Spindrall regarding his judgments of the students, and decided to make an example of Kory. To that end, the overseer called Kory forward during the meeting and announced that Spindrall had declared her to be unfit. Harkun followed up by shooting Kory with a blast of [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]], [[Death/Legends|executing]] the young woman before her gathered peers.<ref name="Of Mind and Matter" />

name: Tyria (Jedi)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Tyria was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Master Tyria returned to the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order and helped rebuild during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], residing at the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] there.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Kalisa Gehnso
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Kalisa Gehnso was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Master Gehnso returned to the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order and helped rebuild during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], residing at the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] there where she was troubled by the repeated attacks by the native [[Flesh Raider]]s.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Fia (Jedi)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Fia was unaware of her Forcefulness and was working as a crew member on a junk hauler on [[Raxus Prime/Legends|Raxus Prime]] when [[Kel Dor/Legends|Kel Dor]] [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Till'in]] came across her in his travels. Fearful of the Kel Dor' appearance, Fia fired her [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] at the Jedi, though he deflected the attack with ease. Embarrassed by her attack, Fia accepted the Jedi's offer of [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] at the [[Tython/Legends|Tythonian]] [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Jedi Temple]]. Inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] apprentice, Fia continued to send letters of apology to Master Till'in, much to his annoyance.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Moracen
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Moracen was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], serving as the [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Silvarte]]. In the wake of the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Moracen studied on the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], residing at the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] there. During her training, Moracen fell in love with fellow apprentice, [[Spanios]], as both were regularly assigned to work with each other. Developing a strong bond with each other, they discovered a rare [[lightsaber crystal]] amidst the ruins of the ancient fortress city of [[Kaleth]]. Despite their attempts at discretion, the pairs' masters became suspicious of their activities and sent another Padawan to discover whether the two apprentices were indeed romantically involved.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Dana Cadwell
description: {{Quote|Are you here to annex Gandle Ott for the New Republic?|Dana Cadwell, to the ''FarStar'' delegation following their arrival on Gandle Ott|Death Is Remotely Possible}}Dana Cadwell was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Journalist/Legends|reporter]] based on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Gandle Ott]] in the [[Kathol sector]] of the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. She worked for the [[NewsNet]] [[KatholNet]], as well as being the planetary correspondent for [[TriNebulon News/Legends|TriNebulon News]]. Cadwell was a popular personality, and influential enough to be invited to notable parties and events, but longed to leave Gandle Ott and break into a larger news bureau outside of the Kathol [[Sector/Legends|sector]].<ref name="dirp" />In [[8 ABY/Legends|8 ABY]], [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]], [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] of the Kathol sector, was forced to [[Battle of Kal'Shebbol|retreat]] from his [[Capital/Legends|capital]] on [[Kal'Shebbol/Legends|Kal'Shebbol]] by [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]] [[New Republic task force (Kal'Shebbol)|forces]]. Sarne fled to Gandle Ott, took on supplies and left with the majority of the planet's Imperial personnel, including the [[Unidentified Imperial Governor (Gandle Ott)|governor]] and [[Gandle Ott system defense force|defense force]]. The resulting power vacuum on Gandle Ott created confusion, with both [[Lieutenant governor|Vice-Governor]] [[Marja Lang]] and [[General/Legends|General]] [[Herron Dade]] vying for control of the remaining government. Cadwell instantly saw that Sarne's retreat and the arrival of the New Republic in the Kathol sector was just the story she needed to get the attention of TriNebulon News.<ref name="dirp" />Shortly after Sarne's departure, the New Republic [[CR90 corvette/Legends|CR90 corvette]] ''[[FarStar]]'' arrived in [[Orbit/Legends|orbit]] in [[DarkStryder Campaign|pursuit]] of Sarne. When the ''FarStar'' landed at [[Montrol Spaceport]], Cadwell was part of a large media presence that witnessed a delegation from the [[Corvette/Legends|corvette]] meet with Acting-Governor Lang, [[Mayor/Legends|Mayor]] [[Stanfeld Duffit]], and [[Olaver Lansel]], Gandle Ott's Imperial liaison. As the ''FarStar'' delegation progressed through the [[Spaceport/Legends|spaceport]], Cadwell attempted to learn of the ''FarStar''{{'s}} mission by asking several questions regarding Moff Sarne, the rumor that he had [[DarkStryder technology|exotic technology]], and the New Republic's intentions toward Gandle Ott. The next [[Standard day/Legends|day]], Cadwell covered the [[Ceremonial Mushroom Cutting]] presided over by [[General/Legends|General]] Herron Dade, where Dade effectively declared their independence from the Empire and encouraged Gandle Ott to take control of its own future once more.<ref name="dirp" />

name: Phyne
description: Considered to be calm and compassionate, Phyne and her partner [[Teeno]] served as [[Sith Acolyte|acolytes]] in Korriban's Sith Academy during the Cold War. They held a hostility toward [[Vemrin]], who was very strong in the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]]. However, Phyne became interested in a [[Empire's Wrath|new acolyte]] upon hearing that they had been summoned to meet with [[Darth Baras]]. Phyne, Teeno and two other acolytes intercepted the Warrior and offered to eliminate Vemrin so that they could avoid suspicion of foul play.{{GameDS}}The Sith Warrior considered their help, hinting that they agreed with their proposal. They obviously failed, since Vemrin returned from his trials gloating over his [[Death/Legends|murder]] of the acolytes sent against him.However, Phyne had survived - crippled for months, but pleased that her survival made her stronger. After waking from a coma, she realized the Sith Warrior's wisdom and sent a note of thanks for the valuable lesson in strength.{{Endgame}}

name: Vadria Tallion
description: Discovered to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]], Vadria Tallion was taken from her parents and became one of the first students that studied the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] in the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]]. With the organization's founders, Tallion stepped down and became a devout follower of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Rajivari]]. Seeing that Master Rajivari believed that the Order was plagued by mediocrity, Tallion and her peers abandoned the Order around circa [[25,783 BBY]]. Taking up residence in the fortress city of [[Kaleth]], the followers of Rajivari encountered an army of [[Flesh Raider]]s. This ended up as a conflict between them; it would cost Tallion her life in the destruction of Kaleth. Tallion and Quane fought together to defend the fortress, but they were outmatched against them. Tallion was badly injured, and her fellow Rajivari's apprentice sacrificed himself to save her.

name: Allia (Twi'lek)
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Allia was one of many [[Pilgrims]] who followed [[Matriarch]] [[Kolovish]] to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in the aftermath of the [[Great Galactic War]] and the [[Slaver/Legends|enslavement]] of [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] by the [[Hutt Cartel]]s. Assisting in the establishment of [[Kalikori village]], Allia was an advocate for [[Nalen Raloch]] and considered him a great hero of the village, defending the pilgrims from the [[Flesh Raider]]s. Allia and [[Keth (Twi'lek)|Keth]] aided Raloch in his hunt for the [[Fount of Rajivari]], but eventually realized that Raloch himself had been corrupted by the knowledge he was seeking.<ref name="TOR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Trea Kobbeth
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Trea Kobbeth and her son, [[Viyo Kobbeth|Viyo]], were among the many [[Pilgrims]] who followed [[Matriarch]] [[Kolovish]] to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in the aftermath of the [[Great Galactic War]] and the [[Slavery/Legends|enslavement]] of [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]] by the [[Hutt Cartel]]s. Assisting in the establishment of [[Kalikori village]], Kobbeth was grieved to discover her son had been abducted by a [[Flesh Raider]] in the [[Tythos Ridge]]. Approaching a young [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] visiting the village, Kobbeth begged the apprentice to find her son. Young Viyo returned not long after, unscathed as the Flesh Raider simply wanted him as a translator.<ref name="TOR" />She was [[Marriage/Legends|married]] to a [[Kobbeth]], a [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]] in the [[Republic Military/Legends|Republic Military]].<ref name="Mail">{{TORcite|type=message|Sergeant Kobbeth|Trea Kobbeth}}</ref> The Twi'lek man encountered an Imperial on Belsavis, who saved him and a member of his squad from an [[Esh-kha]] assault in exchange for a vault key.<ref name="Esh-kha Containment">{{TORcite|type=faction|[[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Empire]]|Esh-kha Containment|[[Belsavis/Legends|Belsavis]]}}</ref>

name: Vederiat Ayon
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Ayon was one of many [[Pilgrims]] who followed [[Matriarch]] [[Kolovish]] to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in the aftermath of the [[Great Galactic War]]. Assisting in the establishment of [[Kalikori village]], Ayon was named the [[Minister of Flesh and Spirit]] among the pilgrims and served as a healer and spiritual leader. As incursions by the native and hostile [[Flesh Raider]]s became more frequent, Ayon came to believe that a rumored [[Flesh Raider elixir|elixir]] was indeed making the natives more aggressive. Unable to go herself, Ayon hired a visiting Padawan to destroy the elixir in hopes it would put an end to the raids. This Padawan was then asked by [[Odumis Mer]] to keep the elixer in hopes that it could be used by the pilgrims to protect from further attacks.<ref name="TOR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Kolovish
description: {{Quote|I am Kolovish, first Matriarch and reader of the ancient texts. I led our people to this planet [...] My teachings angered our rulers. They spurned our lifestyle and refused to recognize the authority of the Matriarchs. On Tython, we found we could practice our ways in peace. Even the Flesh Raiders can't destroy our society&mdash;not forever.|Kolovish|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Kolovish was the [[Matriarch]] of a group of Twi'lek Pilgrims who followed her to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in the aftermath of the [[Great Galactic War]]. Assisting in the establishment of [[Kalikori village]], Kolovish passed down her teachings to her followers, living among them for nearly two decades before retiring from her duties and leaving the village and taking up residence in an ancient stone tower farther up the mountain. [[Padawan/Legends|Padawans]] from the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] neighboring [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] would often seek out the Matriarch and ask her for her blessings before completing their training.<ref name="Steps" />Near the start of the [[Galactic War]], Kolovish was discovered to be a member of the anti-[[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] and [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] organization known as the [[Star Cabal]] by [[Imperial Intelligence (Sith Empire)|Imperial Intelligence]].{{Fact}}

name: Jujuin
description: Jujuin worked in the [[Jedi Temple]] on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]]. While not a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] herself, she came to work there after the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] relocated to Tython during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]]. She worked in the [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] where she sold [[jukebox]] tokens and helped serve the Jedi food and drinks.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Hallen (Jedi)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]], Hallen was discovered during her adolescent years by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and taken to the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Jedi Temple]] on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] to begin [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. She delievered a message from [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Yuon Par]] to [[The Barsen'thor|her Padawan]] telling the apprentice to practice martial arts, pointing him out to Master [[Wettle]], who could train the Padawan in the arts.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Dwitzel
description: {{Quote|On the way children, we now know who has to die...|Dwitzel|Casus Belli 67}}At a very young age, Dwitzel was sold as a slave. She spent several years in a brothel on [[Waliar]], before killing four people with a broken bottle and escaping. She then enlisted herself in the [[Republic Army]] and quickly became the first [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Officer/Legends|officer]] of the spaceborne [[Commando/Legends|commandos]].After [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] [[Declaration of a New Order|became Emperor]], Dwitzel was expelled from the army because of the new [[Humanocentrism|humanocentric]] policy. She came to [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], and lived from agricultural material reparations.However, she didn't forget her military past and, at the same time, founded a [[Mercenary/Legends|mercenary]] unit known as the [[Dwitzel's Rats]]. Her operatives showed her a fanatical devotion, as she was an excellent soldier, competent with both ranged and melee weapons as well as a fantastic leader.

name: Darth Lachris
description: [[File:Lachris.png|thumb|left|Darth Lachris as the newly-appointed Governor of Balmorra]]{{Quote|Balmorra is mine.|Darth Lachris confronting Zenith and the Barsen'thor|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}During the outbreak of the [[Great Galactic War]], a war which was fought between the Sith Empire and the Galactic Republic, Lachris was a talented fighter in the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and became an apprentice of [[Darth Marr]], member of the Dark Council. She finally received the title of Darth and rose to become a powerful Sith Lady.In [[3653 BBY]], Lachris was part of the invasion force of the Sith Empire that [[Sacking of Coruscant|attacked]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the capital [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of the Republic. Following the [[Treaty of Coruscant]], Darth Lachris took [[Lerek Serrus]] as her first apprentice during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|galaxy-wide conflict]], known as the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] that raged on for ten [[Standard year/Legends|years]].During the war, Darth Lachris and her apprentice led their Imperial forces on [[Balmorra/Legends|Balmorra]] under the rule of the Dark Council. After she executed her predecessor, she appointed herself as the local commander in chief. This was where many Balmorrans formed a resistance to strike against Lachris and her Imperial forces.As the Sith Empire had reached the world in progress in [[3643 BBY]], Lachris decided to personally visit and travel to the Sundari flat land, where there was the advanced command base of the Sith Empire. She was informed that Grand Marshal Cheketta had sent a number of [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] reinforcements to support the resistance. She tasked an Imperial strike team to shut down the barricades from the [[Balmorran Arms Factory]] and find solid evidence of official involvement by the Republic. As the Imperials managed to infiltrate the Imperial factory and defeat the Jedi [[Ralon Nys]] along with his Tempest-squad commandos, Lachris sent the Imperials to meet the Grand Marshal. As the last remnants of the resistance formed an army, Lachris tasked the Imperial strike team to break the remaining resistance. The mission was successful and Darth Lachris took control of the world.[[File:Darth Lachris.png|thumb|right|240px|Lachris uses Force Lightning]]The following [[3642 BBY|year]], Lachris managed to capture the Balmorran President [[Retheus Galthe]] to intimidate the Balmorran Resistance. However, this was when [[Tai Cordan]] and Agent [[Zenith]] were able to penetrate a weapons factory, where it was assumed that Lachris held the president. Lachris was aware of the presence of the Jedi and made sure that Galthe remained frozen in carbonite. In the processing room 59, Lachris encountered the [[The Barsen'thor|Barsen'thor]] who allied with Zenith stop the Sith Lady's rule. During the fight, she deflected every blaster shot from Zenith and fought against Barsen'thor in a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] duel. However, the [[Jedi Consular]] took the upper hand and Lachris was badly wounded. Saying her last words, Lachris died from her injuries. With the death of the Sith Lady, Tai Cordan became the new president of Balmorra.

name: Ismar Brengle
description: In [[3646 BBY]], during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], Brengle was tricked into [[Slavery/Legends|slavery]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] by [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Grathan]] with the promise of exciting research projects. Although initially delighted She soon came to realize she had been tricked into working for him. In an attempt to seek revenge against Lord Grathan Ismar Brengle wanted to steal plans for advanced [[Cybernetics/Legends|cybernetic]] limbs, created by another of Lord Grathan's scientists, [[Lanniter Droge]],which she hoped to sell to a contact for a large fee.<ref name="SWTOR" />In [[3643 BBY]], Ismar met an Imperial individual who was attacking [[Lord Grathan's estate]]. Pleased to see the destruction of her captors property Ismar Brengle asked the individual to download the cybernetic's data from Lord Grathan's main computer. Having shut down three separate terminals to allow themselves to access the main computer, the spacer was able to download everything. Ismar was very excited and promised to pay the spacer for there help. The spacer later received a substantial reward for their help.<ref name="SWTOR" />

name: Squire Kinning
description: A member of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], Squire Kinning live on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] in the [[Jedi Temple]] and was taken as a [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] by one of the Order's [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Masters]]. In [[50 BBY/Legends|50 BBY]], Kinning was assigned to accompany Knight [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and Master [[Aqinos]] to [[Arkania/Legends|Arkania]] to assist in ending the [[Arkanian Revolution]] taking place on the world's surface.<ref name="TJP" />While fighting against the [[Arkanian Renegades]], Kinning lost one of her arms during the conflict and was brought back to the Temple for [[Force healing/Legends|healing]]. Equipped with a [[Cybernetics/Legends|cybernetic arm]], Kinning's situation was considered by the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]]. Ultimately, the Council decided to consider her loss evidence of her passing her [[Jedi Trials/Legends#Trial of the Flesh|Trial of the Flesh]], one of the five tests she would face to become a Knight. Continuing her service to the Order, she was an acquaintance of the young [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]].<ref name="TJP" />

name: Philinda
description: In c. [[31 BBY/Legends|31 BBY]], Philinda accompanied a number of tourists that were visiting the [[Droid/Legends|droid]] production plants on the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] [[Uffel]], in the [[Cularin system]]. During the trip, Philinda and some of the other tourists, the Humans [[Nia Reston]], [[San Herrera]], the [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Nikolo]] and the [[Sullustan/Legends|Sullustan]] [[Tret]], were recruited by the droid [[LN-73]] into assisting him at sabotaging the production facilities. LN-73 did this by lying to them by claiming that [[HG-211]], Uffel's head of security, had been corrupted. Philinda and the rest of the group then attacked the [[Heroes of Cularin]], who LN-73 falsely claimed were sabotaging the droid factories.<ref name="SU" />Following the incident, San Herrera developed a romantic interest in Philinda and began to refer to her as "the hot one". He talked about her regularly to his friend Nia Reston and kept suggesting that he and Reston call Philinda and see if she knew about any new jobs that were available. Reston mentioned Herrera's feelings for Philinda to the reporter [[Yara Grugara]] while the pair were being interviewed for [[Eye on Cularin]]. Upon Grugara's inquiry, Herrera claimed that he and Philinda were a couple, while Reston denied that they were.<ref name="TFU">{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/livingforce/swlf20030717trouble|text=Trouble Follows Us|int=Trouble Follows Us|archivedate=20091011155727}}</ref>Philinda later left the Cularin system, to visit her parents on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. During her absence, the conflict in the Cularin system between the [[Thaereian military]] and the [[Cularin Militia]] began to heat up, preventing her from returning to the system.<ref name="CotM">{{WizardsCite|url=default.asp?x=starwars/livingforce/swlf20040819|text=Cause of the Month|int=Cause of the Month|archivedate=20091016005732}}</ref>Grugara later interviewed Reston and Herrera again about their newly-published paper ''[[Droid Rights]]'', and asked them about how Herrera's relationship with Philinda was going. Herrera told the reporter about her departure from the Cularin system and once again claimed that he and Philinda were and item, while Reston once again claimed that they weren't.<ref name="CotM" />

name: Hella Cordoni
description: Hella Cordoni prior to [[32 BBY/Legends|32 BBY]] lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Chandrila/Legends|Chandrila]] in the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core Worlds]] where she worked as a trade delegate and raised a family including her son, [[Pellum Cordoni]]. In 32 BBY the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation]] lead by the [[Neimoidian/Legends|Neimoidian]] [[Nute Gunray/Legends|Nute Gunray]]<ref name="TPM">[[Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace|''Star Wars'': Episode I ''The Phantom Menace'']]</ref> attempted to [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invade]] the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]]<ref name="EAWGG">''[[Star Wars: Empire at War: Prima Official Game Guide]]''</ref> planet of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] unsuccessfully, this still however caused considerable damage to the planet's government and population. Seeing a business opportunity she brought her entire family to Naboo where she planned to set up permanent residence and attempted to petition the recovering government for a trade agreement.Hella however was not the only trade delegate to seize the opportunity and she quickly became rivals with the [[Human/Legends|Human]] trade master [[Van Kellen]] from [[Corellia/Legends|Corellia]] who had also moved to Naboo with his family to petition for trade agreements. Both parties' rivalries however did not extent too their children and Pellum and Kellen's daughter [[Remi Kellen]] soon became romantically involved in secret. When Hella and Kellen found out about this relationship they were both outraged and placed great amounts of pressure on the pair to break up. This instead caused the pair too steal a [[Landspeeder/Legends|landspeeder]] and flee together from their controlling parents. Hella and her rival then quickly hired a group of [[Spacer/Legends|spacers]] visiting Naboo to find their lost children and return them.The spacers discovered the pair had fled to the city of [[Keren/Legends|Keren]] were they had purchased supplies to move into the [[Gungan/Legends|Gungan]] swamps. The outfitter who had sold them said goods however was involved with a number of criminal organizations including a slaver ring that had captured the pair of lovers as they left the city. The spacers, ambushed by the [[Slaver/Legends|slavers]] themselves set out to free the pair and complete their contract. Whether they were successful or not and returned Pellum to Hella is unknown.<ref name="Secrets of Naboo" />

name: Litassa Colay
description: Shortly after the [[Battle of Endor/Legends|Battle of Endor]], [[Emperor's Hand]] [[Mara Jade Skywalker|Mara Jade]] stole her ID [[Datacard/Legends|datacard]] in the [[Chibias]] [[Chibias concert hall|concert hall]] and used her name as an alias to rescue [[Zakarisz Ghent]].

name: Fellion
description: Fellion's early life was largely a mystery, but she was known to have received her initial military training while serving with a private militia in the [[Kathol sector|Kathol Outback]]. She eventually drifted [[Core Worlds/Legends|Coreward]] and joined up with [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] on the trading hub of Brentaal, serving as the organization's secret enforcer whenever a well-protected or otherwise difficult mark had to disappear or die. One such assignment occurred in the years preceding the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], when Black Sun tried to muscle into mainstream commerce on Brentaal by taking over [[House Okeefe]]. The thugs and heavies who tried to carry out the move bungled the assignment after a [[Barthos Okeefe|member]] of House Okeefe hired freelance operatives to handle the 'small-time crooks.' Fellion was tasked with eliminating the meddlers before they could curtail Black Sun operations on Brentaal. Unfortunately, her first attempt on their lives failed, and she ended up tipping her hand. Alerted to the identity of their adversaries, the freelancers staged a daring raid on the Black Sun front at the [[Alfex Cargo Stacks]]. Fellion was killed in the firefight.

name: Demma Moll
description: Demma and Kea lived on the family farm on Annoo, which led to trouble with the gangster [[Sise Fromm]], who wanted to take possession of the property. Demma was opposed to the tyranny of the crime gangs and the Empire and felt that evil had to be fought.When she discovered that the [[Fromm Gang]] were constructing a powerful weapons satellite, ''[[Trigon One]]'', which they intended to use to take over the other gangs, Demma charged Kea with finding and destroying ''Trigon One''. With the assistance of the [[Landspeeder/Legends|speeder]] racers, [[Thall Joben/Legends|Thall Joben]] and [[Jord Dusat]], along with their droids, [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] and [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]], Kea succeeded in breaking into [[Tig Fromm]]'s secret base on [[Ingo/Legends|Ingo]] and stealing ''Trigon One''.While Joben hid the weapons satellite in a forest on Ingo, the Fromm Gang kidnapped Demma and Dusat from the farm. Joben agreed to reveal the location in exchange for their release. Tig Fromm went to retrieve ''Trigon One'', but Joben and R2-D2 had sabotaged the guidance system, causing the ship to collide with and destroy Sise Fromm's base on Annoo.

name: Yadira Ban
description: [[File:Yadira_battle.png|thumb|left|Yadira Ban prepares to defend her charge]]A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], Yadira Ban was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]]. A [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] who had constructed her [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], [[Sexes/Legends|her]] final trial was to face a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] in combat. She was assigned to protect an Imperial defector referred to as "[[The General (individual)|The General]]" while he was aboard the ''[[Brentaal Star]]'', a Republic [[Thranta-class corvette|''Thranta''-class corvette]].<ref name="TOR" />During transit, the Imperial [[Transport/Legends|transport]] ''[[Black Talon]]'' attacked the ''Brentaal Star''. Ban was [[Death/Legends|killed]] when Imperial boarders confronted her on the ''Brentaal Star''{{'s}} engine deck.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Darth Ekkage
description: [[File:Darth Ekkage.png|left|thumb|Ekkage under lock and key.]]During the [[Great Galactic War]] between [[Galactic Republic]] and [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Darth Ekkage and her [[Sith infiltrators|minions]] were imprisoned on [[Belsavis/Legends|Belsavis]]. Ekkage was betrayed and handed over to the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] by one of her own&mdash;[[Unidentified Sith assassin (Darth Ekkage)|a Sith assassin]] who renounced the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and sought refuge among the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Many believe Darth Ekkage was as powerful a weapon as the Sith have ever had, and that their victory over the Republic would have been completed long ago if Ekkage had not been captured by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Nomen Karr]], who earned the hatred of Baras. But there were also many within the Sith who feared her - realizing that they could just as easily be her next target.After learning about Ekkage's survival during the [[Galactic War]], Darth Baras sent Lord [[Melicoste]] to free her, knowing that her return would solidify his claim as the [[Emperor's Voice (Sith Empire)|Voice of the Emperor]]. However, Melicoste was pursued by Baras' former apprentice - now the [[Empire's Wrath|Emperor's Wrath]] - who was on a mission from [[Servant One]] to stop Ekkage's release. The Wrath managed to learn Ekkage's cell number and killed her assassins before they could be sprung. When Melicoste finally reached Ekkage and severed her bonds, she sensed the loss of her assassins and killed Melicoste for his incompetence, taking his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].[[File:Ekkage kills Melicoste.png|left|thumb|Ekkage murders Melicoste shortly after her release]]As Melicoste fell, Baras' apprentice came out of hiding, remarking that Ekkage was much like Baras, betraying someone so loyal to them. Ekkage claimed it to be family trait and then asked who the Sith was. Just then, [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Somminick Timmns]], whom Ekkage recognized as "Nomen Karr's sad little whelp", appeared, claiming that the Sith was with him. Ekkage accused the Sith of being a fool and a traitor for working with a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. In turn, the Sith announced themselves as the [[Emperor's Wrath]], sent by the [[Emperor's Hand (Sith Empire)|Emperor's Hand]] to kill her and stop her brother. Lamenting that the Hand had stooped as low to work with the Jedi, Ekkage engaged the two. Despite being a Dark Councilor, Ekkage was defeated and subsequently executed

name: Deela Quellor
description: {{Quote|Jabba stole these records long ago from a rival Hutt crimelord, Gardulla. Rakir will find them very interesting. Please take me to him.|Deela Quellor, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> Deela Quellor obtained records from a [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]] repository owned by the [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]] [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba the Hutt]]. The records was in fact stolen long ago by Jabba from his rival [[Gardulla Besadii the Elder/Legends|Gardulla Besadii the Elder]]. After the theft, Jabba sent henchmen to kill Deela and retrieve the data.<ref name="SWG:RB" />In the meantime, the man known as [[Rakir Banai]] was looking for information about the [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]] of [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] in order to find his long missing son, [[Kitster Chanchani Banai|Kitster]]. Rakir tasked the spacer to find Deela Quellor and escort her back to him. The spacer finally find Deela and saved her from Jabba's henchmen. The spacer and the woman returned safely to [[Wayfar]] with and Gardulla's records. From the records, Rakir Banai understood that his son was alive and living on Tatooine, an information deliberately concealed by his boss [[Drik Bandrik]].<ref name="SWG:RB" />

name: Laranna Fain
description: During the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], Laranna's father [[Duras Fain]], [[Yuon Par]], [[Sidonie Garen]], [[Eriz Vossan]], [[Cin Tykan]], and [[Parkanas Tark]] encountered the spirit of [[Terrak Morrhage]], a restless [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] who besieged them with its dark powers. They were able to escape, but Parkanas was the only one who was left behind to suffer the Sith Lord's wrath, causing him to turn to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and formulate a dark plague. Duras and the rest of the Jedi that accompanied Parkanas, were infected by the dark plague, which caused them to go insane and corrupt.Onboard the Republic starship [[Carida (starship)|''Carida'']], Laranna was going to see her father when the ship was ambushed by [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Imperial]] forces. She had been seriously injured in the fight and [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Bela Whinn]] put a call for a medic. A [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] soon arrived and healed Laranna. But later, she gone insane and mercilessly attacked the crew. It was revealed that Lord Vivicar was the one who healed her, disguised as that mysterious Jedi Master, and turned her to the dark side, intending for her to become his apprentice. The Jedi Council sent the [[The Barsen'thor|future Barsen'thor of the Order]] to board Carida and face Laranna. The Jedi Consular begged her to stop this, and promised that he would help her fight the darkness that corrupted her. Laranna engaged the Consular in a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] duel, in which she lost. However, Laranna Force pushed the Jedi Consular, and ran to the airlock where she would be sucked into space. The Jedi Consular would heal Laranna from the darkness and told her to remember the Jedi Code and her father. Laranna answered the code, and part of herself was trying to fight its way back. The Jedi Consular was able to cure Laranna, as was her father before her, allowing Vivicar's voice to fade. She then locked herself in the brig for the remainder of the voyage.

name: Sidonie Garen
description: During the [[Great Galactic War]], Sidonie went on a mission to [[Malachor III]] along with [[Eriz Vossan]], [[Yuon Par]], [[Cin Tykan]], [[Duras Fain]], and [[Parkanas Tark]]. However, during their mission on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]], Garen and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] uncovered some terrible evil and were nearly affected by the [[Force ghost|spirit]] of [[Terrak Morrhage]], a long-dead [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] of the [[Sith Empire/Legends|Old Sith Empire]]. Developing a plan to escape from the dark planet, the Jedi when Vossan fell behind until Parkanas saved him, but became trapped in the process and was left behind by the other Jedi. Garen felt responsible for the loss of Tark.In [[3643 BBY]], Master Garen was stationed on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], a former planet that was part of the Republic until it fell into a [[Alderaan Civil War|civil war]] after [[Queen/Legends|Queen]] [[Silara Panteer]] and [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Gaul Panteer]] were [[Death/Legends|killed]], and a corrupt noble named [[Bouris Ulgo]], a descendent of [[Trask Ulgo]], usurped the throne. She had been working hard to organize a peace treaty between the noble houses of Alderaan, in an attempt to stop the war. However, before she could continue her assignment, she fell to [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lord]] Vivicar's plague and raised the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Council's]] suspicions by dropping out of contact for some time.{{GameLS}}As the peace summit was due to occur, Alderaan was visited by Yuon's Padawan, a gift Jedi Consular, who was seeking all the Jedi Masters afflicted by the plague. When called via holo, Sidonie was quick to dismiss the Consular as a mere Padawan and refused to give her location. Somehow learning or anticipating that the Consular would seek out [[House Teral]], the only house lacking a delegate for the summit, and that Teral would endorse the Consular by cementing an alliance between their house and House Organa, Sidonie hired [[House Rist]] to kidnap [[Lew Organa]] before he could meet with the Terals. However, Lord Teral informed the Consular, who went to rescue Lew. Afterwards, they discovered Sidonie's holofrequency on the Rist base's computers and get the Jedi Master on the holo. Discovered, Sidonie quickly excused herself.As the summit began in the [[Sendoth Ruins]], Sidonie ordered the guards to bar anyone else from entering. During the summit, the plague-affected Jedi Master had already proceeded to bring war on Alderaan due to her madness. Clouded by the plague which made her aggressive, she believed that the only future for Alderaan was war, so she brought incriminating evidence on each of the Houses to the summit, reminding them of old grudges, and spurring escalation of the conflict. When the Consular managed to calm the delegates down, the enraged Garen engaged the Jedi, unleashing her Force powers. The Consular bested her in combat and was able to use the shielding technique to save the insane Master. Regaining her senses, Sidonie noted that the Consular seemed weak from shielding her. Apologizing for her actions, Sidonie left handling the summit to the Consular and reported back to the Jedi Council.{{Char-stub}}{{Endgame}}

name: Coralya
description: Born on [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]], Coralya chose the adventurer's life at a young age, which forged her strong nature. During the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], she was chosen as a chief and representative by her colleagues at the [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]] lair of [[Providence]].

name: Vanara Kayl
description: A [[Human/Legends|Human]] politician, Vanara Kayl served in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] around [[3643 BBY]] following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Part of the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]]-era Senate, Kayl represented the interests of the people of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], becoming well-respected and seen as very favorable by her constituents.<ref name="SWTORCiGC" /> She led the Coruscant government and was placed in charge of Coruscant's reconstruction efforts.<ref name="SWTORCiGC" />{{GameLSmechanics}}However, Kayl had used funds from the [[Migrant Merchants' Guild]] in order to win the election in exchange for her promise for housing projects for the refugees whose interests the Guild supposedly represented. The Guild attempted to blackmail Kayl as well as attack the skylane network around the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]]. Kayl responded by sending a contingent of [[Police officer/Legends|police officers]] with the [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]] under the command of CSF [[Chief of Security/Legends|Chief of Security]] [[Captain/Legends|Captain]] [[Winborn]]. With the assistance of an individual, the CSF were able to prevent the attack. However a recording of Kayl arguing with a leader of the Guild was found. The individual who assisted the CSF confronted her and after some debate called a session of the Senate to disclose her actions. After the session, Kayl resigned from her position.<ref name="SWTORCiGC" />{{Endgame}}

name: Shiden
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Shiden was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Master Shiden resided on the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order and helped rebuild during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], stationed at the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] there.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Alvania
description: A [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Alvania lived on the planet [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] where she worked at the [[Senate Commercial District]] below the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]].<ref name="TOR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Sumari
description: {{Quote|I shut down the energy shield. Any word on Master Orgus' mission?''"<br />"''No. My mother&hellip;she found peace during your absence. I'm now Matriarch.|The Padawan and Ranna Tao'Ven|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Sumari joined the [[Pilgrims]], a religious group founded by [[Matriarch]] [[Kolovish]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ryloth/Legends|Ryloth]], during the Pilgrims's travels between Twi'lek colonies during the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]].<ref name="Pilgrims">{{TORcite|type=codex|Twi'lek Pilgrims}}</ref> Sumari and her daughter [[Ranna Tao'Ven]] were among the Pilgrims who settled on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] and refused to depart after the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic's]] denial of their settlement request, establishing [[Kalikori village]] at the base of the [[Matriarch's Summit]] in the [[Tythos Ridge]]. Sumari eventually became the Matriarch of the village when Kolovish retired to an [[Kolovish's tower|ancient stone tower]] atop the summit.<ref name="High-Tech Savages" />[[File:Sumari_illness.png|thumb|left|170px|Sumari's illness sapped her strength and left her exhausted.]]Around [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Time" /> the native [[Flesh Raider]] began to attack the village in greater numbers and with rising frequency. Also around this [[Time/Legends|time]], Sumari fell ill, and was plagued by weakness and feelings of fatigue and exhaustion. Whenever her [[Parent/Legends|mother's]] illness was too much for her, Sumari's daughter, Tao'Ven, would take over her duties as Matriarch,<ref name="High-Tech Savages" /> as she did during the [[Search for the Fount of Rajivari|crisis]] involving [[Nalen Raloch]] and the [[Fount of Rajivari]]. Raloch, a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] villager, discovered the mystical Fount and was corrupted to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and driven insane.<ref name="Pilgrims2">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Consular|Pilgrims|Tython}}</ref> He then attempted to destroy the [[Forge]]<ref name="The Forge">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Consular|The Forge|Tython}}</ref> machine that the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] used to construct [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]],<ref name="Forge Codex">{{TORcite|type=codex|The Forge}}</ref> but was stopped by the [[The Barsen'thor|apprentice]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Yuon Par]] and healed of his insanity. Raloch was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] as a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] as a way of easing tensions between the Order and the village,<ref name="The Forge" /> but the people of Kalikori Village remained resentful of the Jedi for their lack of aid.<ref name="High-Tech Savages" />When a group of Flesh Raiders under the leadership of a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] named [[Callef]] attacked the region known as the [[Tythonian Gnarls]], a [[Hero of Tython|Jedi apprentice]] [[Duel in the Gnarls cave|fought and defeated]] Callef.
