Having witnessed the apprentice's skill,<ref name="Attack of the Flesh Raiders">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|Attack of the Flesh Raiders|Tython}}</ref> Jedi Master [[Orgus Din]] took the young Jedi on as his own [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], and sent the apprentice to Kalikori to see if the villagers had noticed anything strange lately.<ref name="High-Tech Savages" />The apprentice met with Sumari and her daughter, and the Matriarch expressed her anger with the Jedi about their refusal to aid the village before directing the young apprentice to speak with her [[Scout Chief]], [[Moorint]]. Sumari would have continued the conversation, but her illness had taxed her strength too much, and she was forced to retire. Sumari rested while the Padawan [[Raid on the Flesh Raider weapons cache|recovered]] a supply of weapons from the Flesh Raiders for the villagers,<ref name="High-Tech Savages" /> but by the time the Padawan returned to the village after [[Skirmish at the ancient shrine|several]] [[Raid on the Tythos Ridge shield generator|missions]], Sumari had passed away, leaving Tao'Ven as the new Matriarch.<ref name="The Face of the Enemy" />

name: Cala Brin
description: {{Quote|When the Jedi Order was founded, I, Cala Brin, said we should devote ourselves to justice.|Cala Brin|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Cala Brin was one of the founders that formed the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]]. She espoused the ideas that the Jedi should dedicate their lives to upholding justice, setting aside passions and fears to properly decide what is just.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Parvin Willsaam
description: During the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Parvin lived with her husband and daughter as servants to the [[House of Organa/Legends|House of Organa]] on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]]. A few years after the [[Treaty of Coruscant]], it was discovered that her daughter was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|force-sensitive]] and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Nomen Karr]] selected Jaesa as his apprentice. However, it was said that Parvin and Gregor wanted Jaesa to marry the Organas in order for them to be free, but their efforts failed.{{GameDSmechanics}}During the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], [[Darth Baras]] secretly discovered Jaesa Willsaam's power to sense other people's true nature and believed that she was a threat to him and the Empire. He sent his [[Empire's Wrath|apprentice]] to eliminate everyone that stood for Jaesa and lure the young Jedi out of hiding. The apprentice discovered that Jaesa's parents were located in [[Gesselle Organa]]'s castle on Alderaan.Parvin and Gregor were under the protection of Jedi Master [[Volryder]] who was assigned by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Nomen Karr]] to protect them from the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. Volryder quickly realized why the Sith had come for Jaesa's parents and warned Parvin and her husband about the cause of the attack. The Sith apprentice only wanted Parvin and Gregor to deliver a message to their daughter and the message was killing them in order to draw Jaesa out of hiding in order to eliminate her as a threat. Parvin and Gregor were killed by the Sith apprentice by Force-choking them in front Volryder's eyes.{{Endgame}}

name: Liv'trai
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], Liv'trai was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]]. Following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Master Liv'trai returned to the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order and helped rebuild during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]].<ref name="TOR" />Stationed at the training ground in the [[Tythonian Gnarls]], Master Liv'trai was appointed as a [[Jedi Consular]] [[Jedi instructor|instructor]] to the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] stationed there. One of the many Jedi that she was known to have trained was the [[The Barsen'thor|young apprentice]] of Master [[Yuon Par]], a Consular who would eventually become the [[Barsen'thor]] of the Order. Like many Jedi in the region, she fought against the native [[Flesh Raider]]s as they made aggressive attacks on the Order's territories.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Cora (Padawan)
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Cora was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Cora returned to the ancestral Jedi homeworld [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the rest of the Order and helped rebuild during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] where she frequented the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Jedi Temple]].<ref name="TOR" />

name: Urana Kiel
description: In [[3643 BBY]], Urana Kiel was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who lived on [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] as part of the [[Taris Resettlement Initiative|Republic resettlement project]]. A war refugee, she and her mother were part of a group of settlers who were forced out of their settlement by Republic troops because the area was plagued by scavengers. She asked a traveling hero to help recover items from the settlement for her fellow refugees [[Fayem Schall]], [[Vidas Kawats]], [[Semist Bada]], and [[Leisha Vamden]].The hero succeeded, defeating the scavengers and clearing out the settlement long enough to recover the microgenerator, nadu seeds, novel datafile, pazaak decks, and tools that the settlers had requested. When they returned to Olaris, where the settlers were staying, the hero gave the settlers their items and Urana promptly ran off with the nadu seeds to her mother, forgetting to thank the stranger. Leisha told the hero that Urana was just very eager and happy, and sure enough she returned a minute later to thank the hero profusely.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Entha Kandela
description: {{Quote|The public health in Mos Eisely is in danger. If we don't get the vermin under control we will lose this city.|Entha Kandela, to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Entha Kandela served as Animal Control [[Officer/Legends|officer]] for the city of [[Mos Eisley/Legends|Mos Eisley]], under the orders of [[Mayor/Legends|Mayor]] [[Mikdanyell Guh'rantt]]. She was severely under-funded by the time of the Galactic Civil War. Because of this, the vermin outside the city walls became a major health hazard.<ref name="SWG:ACO" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD">{{SWG|The Ruins of Dantooine}}</ref> she managed to get an individual to deal with the problem. While affiliated with [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure's criminal empire/Legends|Jabba the Hutt's criminal organizarion]], the spacer acted on behalf of the Mayor Mikdanyell Guh'rantt. The spacer eliminated a number of [[Womp rat/Legends|womp rats]], [[kreetle]]s, [[Worrt/Legends|worrts]], [[Rill (species)|tempest rills]] and [[rockmite]]s for 2,150 [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]], making Kandela very satisfied.<ref name="SWG:ACO" />

name: Bahlea
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Bahlea was one of many [[Pilgrims]] who followed [[Matriarch]] [[Kolovish]] to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in the aftermath of the [[Great Galactic War]]. Assisting in the establishment of [[Kalikori village]], Bahlea married and bore a child named [[Rusa]].Along with her husband, Bahlea raised their child until she fell ill with a feverish sickness. Setting out to retrieve a medicine derived from [[manka cat]] teeth, Bahlea's husband was killed by [[Flesh Raider]]s during his search. Later, her husband's final mission was completed by a young [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] from the nearby [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Jedi Temple]] who brought Bahlea and Rusa the necessary teeth for the medicine.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Kariya
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Kariya was one of many [[Pilgrims]] who followed [[Matriarch]] [[Kolovish]] to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] in the aftermath of the [[Great Galactic War]]. Assisting in the establishment of [[Kalikori village]], she lived during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] when the village was invaded by [[Flesh Raider]]s.<ref name="TOR" />{{Char-stub}}

name: Tryla/Legends
description: {{Quote|We were kidnapped from a nearby town. We are a simple people. We trust easily, and we were betrayed.|Tryla|A Friend in Need}}[[File:TrylaStabbed-AFIN.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Tryla is stabbed by Pre Vizsla]]Tryla was kidnapped by [[Pre Vizsla/Legends|Pre Vizsla]] and the [[Death Watch/Legends|Death Watch]] when they chose the neutral world of Carlac for their base. She was taken to the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]]' camp and forced to serve the troops as a mere servant. While there, she befriended [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], unaware that she was a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]]. When her grandfather demanded the return of the women of his village, Vizsla agreed to the request, but immediately after returning Tryla to her grandfather, she was [[Shiak|stabbed]] in the back by the [[Darksaber/Legends|Darksaber]].<ref name="AFIN" />

name: Ellin Lah
description: Sometime in [[67 BBY]], Ellin Lah and her crew were on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Bal'demnic]]. The ship, the ''Woebegone'' was holding cargo that belonged to the [[Hutt/Legends|Hutts]]. They noticed there was a temperature change in Cargo 4. Thinking it could be a stowaway, they turned on the vid feed and discovered that the stowaway was an injured [[Muun/Legends|Muun]]. They did not know that this Muun was [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Darth Plagueis]]. The crew asked the Muun a few questions, and Lah offered to get the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] some medical attention. Darth Plagueis asked to talk to the captain alone and asked for her to take him to [[Muunilinst/Legends|Muunilinst]], a trip for which he would pay handsomely. Lah informed the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] that everyone aboard the ''Woebegone'' are equals, so they would decide jointly. The group discussed their options, but decided to contact the authorities on Bal'demnic. Then, Lah informed Plagueis of their decision. The Sith warned her not to make that decision, and when she didn't back down, Plagueis attacked her with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], then went after the rest of the crew. Lah died at the hands of the Sith Lord, his lightsaber almost [[Sai cha|decapitating]] her.

name: Fieler Dan
description: {{GameLSmechanics}}Fieler Dan was sent into the [[Justicar territory|Justicars' Sector]] to try to locate the missing plans for secret tunnels running underneath [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]. When no word came from her to [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]] [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Doorn]], an individual was sent to find her. The individual found the plans and gave a copy to Dan so that she could pass them on to her [[Fieler Dan's daughter|daughter]]. Her daughter would use the plans to help bring in food and supplies for Coruscant's needy.<ref name="TOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Corrin
description: When Zash was killed, Corrin pledged her allegiance to Kallig and acknowledged the latter as her new master. Some time afterwards, Corrin and Kaal narrowly saved Kallig from being disposed of after their new master was nearly killed by [[Darth Thanaton]]. They then returned to Kallig's ship to discuss their next move, knowing that Thanaton would execute them for their defiance. The best bet for Kallig to succeed was to bind more [[Force ghost]]s with the [[Force walk]], as the two Kallig possessed were insufficient to overpower Thanaton. Kallig agreed to check out a lead on [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] while Corrin and Kaal promised to keep an eye on Thanaton.After their master succeeded on Taris, the two apprentices contacted Kallig, revealing that they stole the key to Thanaton's private meditation chamber and now the Dark Lord was out for their blood. Kallig attempted to rendezvous with them on [[Quesh]], but they were both slain by one of Thanaton's minions, Lord [[Cineratus]]. Kallig avenged their deaths by killing Cineratus, even though he stated that he was just following Thanaton's order and didn't want himself killed.{{Char-stub}}

name: Edda Gast
description: The chief of the [[Project Chubar]] was her uncle, Dr. [[Tuzin Gast]], but he began to love his creations and committed suicide with the more violent specimens. Edda then became the main scientist of the project.Gast was captured by Wraith Squadron after their raid of the [[Binring Biomedical Product|Binring facilities]] failed, and promised immunity from prosecution by [[Nawara Ven]] of [[Rogue Squadron/Legends|Rogue Squadron]] after giving all information on [[Warlord/Legends|Warlord]] [[Zsinj]] to the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]].An assassination attempt was made on her by one of Zsinj's own [[Project Minefield]] subjects, but thwarted by Piggy. She was believed dead, but in reality was saved by Nawara Ven, making her new identity seem even more secure.She was arrogant, and [[speciesist]], but believed she would get away without punishment. Nawara offered her a chance to do good with her life, but she took the money. Her reward of half a million Imperial credits, which she picked over New Republic credits, was confiscated on Coruscant and she was arrested on the charge of smuggling. Then Nawara pointed out that under New Republic law, the smuggling of large sums of Imperial credits brought with it the charge of sedition. Her last action was to spit on Nawara Ven, when she thought he set her up.

name: Vorena
description: Shortly after the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], the [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Dorin Se'ol]] traveled to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Volik]] to rebuild the world's colony. While there, he married Vorena and together they had one child, Jolee. The highest [[Mountain/Legends|mountain]] on the planet was also named [[Mount Vorena]], in honor of Vorena.Vorena was eventually [[Death/Legends|killed]] and her death drove Se'ol close to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]], so he climbed to the top of Mount Vorena, to meditate.

name: Unidentified Human barfly
description: {{Quote|This cantina is a bust&hellip;You wanna go to the next one?|The barfly, to Rako Hardeen|Deception}}Around [[21 BBY/Legends|21 BBY]],<ref name="SW Annual 2011">''[[Star Wars Annual 2011]]''</ref> during the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a young [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] noticed as [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Rako Hardeen/Legends|Rako Hardeen]] entered [[Trueping's/Legends|Trueping's]] [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and asked the [[Unidentified Anacondan/Legends|bartender]] for a shot of their finest [[Alcohol/Legends|drink]]. Slipping out of her chair and joining Hardeen at his side, the barfly inquired as to the occasion. The bounty hunter answered that he was celebrating having [[Death/Legends|killed]] a [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]], [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], much to the delight of the bar's patrons. Eventually, she tried to convince Hardeen to go to another cantina with her, but was interrupted by a [[LEP servant droid/Legends|servant droid]], which claimed Hardeen's employer had his payment, and the hunter followed it into the back room&mdash;but not before ordering a round of beverages for all present. She was later present as two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]], entered the bar looking for Hardeen; the Jedi hauled off an individual all present assumed was the bounty hunter, but was actually Kenobi in disguise on an undercover mission to infiltrate the [[Republic Judiciary Central Detention Center/Legends|Republic Judiciary Central Detention Center]] and investigate a kidnapping plot against [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]].<ref name="TCW" />

name: Ria Deleru
description: {{Quote|Nik and I left the homeworld together. His devotion was flattering&hellip; but I grew to realize the difference between love and obsession. Could you please tell Nik I was shipped off Coruscant? If he thinks I'm gone, he might move on.|Ria Deleru, to Nik's messenger|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}Ria Deleru was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] member of the [[Nautolan/Legends|Nautolan]] [[Species/Legends|species]] who lived during the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resulting [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Ria was [[Marriage/Legends|married]] to fellow Nautolan [[Nik Deleru]],<ref name="TOR" /> and at some point prior to [[3653 BBY]],<ref name="immigration">In conversation dialogue with Nik Deleru, it is revealed that their home was destroyed during the war. The codex entry for the [[Old Galactic Market]] reveals that the homes belonging to the alien squatters in the area were destroyed during the [[Sacking of Coruscant]], which occurred in [[3653 BBY]], according to ''[[The Old Republic: Deceived]]'' and ''[[The Essential Atlas]]''.</ref> the two left their species' [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] of [[Glee Anselm/Legends|Glee Anselm]] together. They ultimately settled on the Republic's [[Capital/Legends|capital]] [[Planet/Legends|world]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]]&mdash;a gleaming [[Ecumenopolis/Legends|ecumenopolis]] that, despite housing the center of [[The galaxy/Legends|galactic]] governance and finance, also played host to a huge population of impoverished [[Alien/Legends|aliens]] in its [[Coruscant underworld/Legends|lower levels]]. It was there that the two Nautolans made their lives, much to Ria's chagrin.<ref name="TOR" />In 3653 BBY, as Republic and Imperial delegates [[Alderaan peace conference|negotiated]] an end to the Great Galactic War on the [[Core Worlds/Legends|Core World]] of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] led their [[Imperial Military (Sith Empire)|military]] in a massive [[Invasion/Legends|invasion]] of the Republic's capital that came to be known as the [[Sacking of Coruscant]].<ref name="Deceived">''[[The Old Republic: Deceived]]''</ref> During the assault, Imperial [[Warship/Legends|warships]] dropped numerous bombs into the lower levels of Coruscant's [[Galactic City]], destroying Ria and Nik's home, along with thousands of others.<ref name="TOR" /><ref name="OGM">{{TORcite|type=codex|Old Galactic Market}}</ref> The Empire eventually left the world, but Coruscant remained in ruins and the Republic lacked the supplies to respond and rebuild quickly.<ref name="CIGC">{{TORcite|type=general|Crisis in Galactic City|Coruscant}}</ref> Eventually, Ria, Nik, and many other displaced families ended up settling in the [[Old Galactic Market]], a commerce [[Sector/Legends#Planetary sectors|sector]] which had been widely abandoned after the Sacking. In the decade that followed, the criminal syndicate known as the [[Migrant Merchants' Guild]] moved into the Old Galactic Market as well and began running a protection racket on the [[Refugee/Legends|refugees]] in the area.<ref name="OGM" />{{GameLSmechanics}}During that [[Time/Legends|time]], Ria became fed up with Nik's behavior, which she saw as obsessive and overly protective. When Nik failed to make a protection payment to the guild, Ria saw it as an opportunity to escape her life and her husband. She fled their home and became an erotic dancer in [[Hanera's Dance Troupe]], an entertainment business based out of the [[Migrant Merchants' Guild headquarters]]. [[Hanera]] herself mentioned that she never saw someone with as much potential as Ria. Nik believed her disappearance meant that the Guild had kidnapped her in retribution for his late payment, and so sought help from [[Officer/Legends|Officer]] [[Mal]] of the [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]]. Because Coruscant Security was overwhelmed with battling the Merchant's Guild on other fronts, its [[Police officer/Legends|police officers]] were unable to help the Nautolan. Instead, Nik convinced a Republic war hero to help him find his wife. The war hero succeeded in catching up with Deleru in the Guild's headquarters, but the dancer was unwilling to return to her husband. She instead asked that the Republic combatant tell Nik that she had already been moved off-planet, in the hope that he would move on and leave her to her new life.<ref name="TOR" /> After the war hero returned to Nik with the false information, Ria sent the messenger an electronic message thanking the hero for complying and encouraging the being to return to see her.<ref name="Free and Clear!">{{TORcite|type=message|Free and Clear!|Ria Deleru}}</ref>

name: Kycina
description: {{Quote|Maul, he is called.''"<br />"''Befitting the power you divine in him.|Kycina and Darth Sidious|Darth Plagueis (novel)}}[[File:Darth Maul profile.png|thumb|left|200px|Darth Maul, son of Kycina, was a powerful asset to the [[Order of the Sith Lords]].]]By the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[54 BBY/Legends|54 BBY]], the [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] Kycina was the [[Parent/Legends|mother]] of two [[Dathomirian/Legends|Dathomirian]] [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] infants, one of whom was named [[Darth Maul/Legends|Maul]]. By tradition on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], the [[Maul's father|father]] was [[Death/Legends|killed]] shortly after Maul's conception. Kycina believed that [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]], the leader of the [[Witches of Dathomir]], only knew of [[Savage Opress/Legends|one]] of the two brothers. Thus she kept Maul's existence a secret while waiting for a chance to spirit him away from Dathomir. By doing so, she hoped to save Maul from becoming one of the [[Nightbrothers/Legends|Nightbrothers]], a clan of Zabraks trained to serve the Nightsisters as [[warrior]]s and [[Slavery/Legends|slaves]].<ref name="Plagueis" />Kycina's opportunity came less than a year after young Maul's birth. [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Sidious]], the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] persona of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] [[Ambassador/Legends|Ambassador]] Palpatine, visited Dathomir out of interest in its relation to Sith history. While exploring [[Blue Desert City]], Sidious was approached by Maul's mother. Kycina implored the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] to take her son from her and raise him away from Dathomir, far from Talzin's reach. Though initially reluctant to accept her offer, Sidious was ultimately persuaded by Maul's [[Force-sensitive/Legends|strong sensitivity]] to the [[The Force/Legends|Force]].<ref name="Plagueis" />Unsure of what to do with his new charge, Sidious approached his [[Sith Master/Legends|Master]], [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Darth Plagueis]], with an offer: to [[Sith training|train]] Maul in the ways of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]]. Although such an action technically violated the [[Rule of Two/Legends|Rule of Two]], which allowed for only two Sith Lords to exist at any given time, Plagueis granted his [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] permission to proceed with Maul's indoctrination. However, the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord]] was also clear that the Zabrak was to be an [[Sith assassin/Legends|assassin]] rather than a fully trained Sith Lord. Although Darth Sidious agreed, he did begin Maul's training in secret when his own master was absent and healing from an assassination attempt. Under Sidious' tutelage&mdash;and Plagueis' observation&mdash;Kycina's son grew up to become Darth Maul, a Sith [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] deeply immersed in the dark side.<ref name="Plagueis" />In [[39 BBY/Legends|39 BBY]], [[Talzin/Legends|Mother Talzin]] learned of Kycina's betrayal, and in turn had her locked away and later punished.<ref name="Restraint" /> During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]] in 21 BBY,<ref name="Monster">{{TCW|Monster}}</ref> her other son Savage Opress<ref name="Restraint" /> became secretly apprenticed to the Nightsister [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]], who sought to use the powerful Dathomirian pawn to exact revenge on her former master and betrayer, [[Dooku/Legends|Darth Tyranus]]. As a sign of his immersion in the dark side of the Force at the behest of Ventress, Opress committed fratricide by murdering his brother [[Feral/Legends|Feral]].<ref name="Monster" /> After reuniting with Darth Maul in [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]],<ref name="Brothers">{{TCW|Brothers}}</ref> the two surviving sons of Kycina quickly established themselves as a threat to the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].<ref name="Revenge">{{TCW|Revenge (episode)|Revenge}}</ref>By [[20 BBY/Legends|20 BBY]], her son [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] would die on [[Mandalore (title)|Mandalore]] at the hands of [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], the very man who she gave Maul to.

name: Ragate
description: {{Quote|I administer the Rite of blood and bone; a ritual performed beyond this doorway. It is a rite acolytes have participated in for ten thousand years.|Overseer Ragate|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Ragate was a member of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]]. As an [[Overseer (Sith)|Overseer]] at the [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] of [[Korriban]], Ragate was tasked with instructing multiple [[Sith Acolyte|acolytes]] in the ways of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]]. By the time of the [[Galactic War]], Overseer Ragate had become an old, frail-looking woman. As the administrator of the [[rite of blood and bone]], she supervised the test of many acolytes. During her tenure as administrator of the rite, Ragate supervised the tests of [[Empire's Wrath|a promising Sith warrior]] and of the soon-to-be [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Darth Nox|Kallig]].<ref name="Blood Legacy" /> In [[3638 BBY]], the Republic devised a plan to retrieve a set of data from the [[Dark Council Chambers|chambers]] of the Empire's [[Dark Council]], which were located in the Sith Academy. When a group of four Republic heroes [[Korriban Incursion|broke into]] the Academy, Ragate and her fellow overseers tried to block access to the [[Turbolift/Legends|turbolift]] leading to the Dark Council chambers. However, the old overseer proved unable to stop the enemy strike team, and she [[Death/Legends|died]] defending the Sith Academy.<ref name="Assault Empire" />

name: Unidentified Nightsister (Shira)
description: The [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] later known as "She" was born on [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] and was a member of the [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]],<ref name="Elle" /> a group of [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|women]] who wielded the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].<ref name="copl">''[[The Courtship of Princess Leia]]''</ref> About one hundred [[Standard year/Legends|years]] before the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]], this [[Witch/Legends|witch]] somehow escaped a [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Jedi intervention on Dathomir|intervention]] on her homeworld. She managed to stow away in a [[Starship/Legends|starship]] that was stopping over on the planet. When the navigating crew finally noticed her presence on board, she was forced to use her [[Force power/Legends|powers]] on them. But the ship's [[Captain/Legends|captain]] briefly came back to his senses, and he programmed the [[Navigation computer/Legends|navicomputer]] to hit the ground, hoping to bring the witch to her doom.<ref name="Elle" />The Nightsister survived the crash on planet [[Shira (planet)|Shira]], but she was unable to repair the starship and was condemned to stay on that jungle planet forever. In order to survive, she took advantage of her powers to subjugate the native [[K'aarg]]s, a race of [[Sentience/Legends|sentient]] [[Reptile/Legends|reptiles]]. The lizard-like [[Humanoid/Legends|humanoids]] came to regard the witch as a deity whom they called the Goddess. When she was displeased with one of her new subjects' behavior, the Nightsister would turn them into a brainless servant ready to join the "Chosen of the Goddess". At some point during the Galactic Civil War, when archeologist [[Jonas Tylers]] landed on Shira to explore antique ruins, the Dathomiri witch finally saw a way out.<ref name="Elle" />

name: Lauréna Tylers
description: Lauréna was about seventeen at the time of the [[Galactic Civil War/Legends|Galactic Civil War]]. Her father went missing after a mission on planet [[Shira (planet)|Shira]], so she set up an intervention group to rescue him. With her companions, she got her father out of the clutches of stranded [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] known as "She".

name: Oranda
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] politician, Oranda served in the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Senate]] around [[3643 BBY]] following the [[Great Galactic War]] and the resurgence of the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Part of the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]]-era Senate, Oranda represented the interests of her people, working with the ambassador [[Droid/Legends|droids]] of the [[Gree Enclave/Legends|Gree Enclave]] during efforts to restore [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant's]] hydrosupply systems after the [[Sacking of Coruscant|devastating attack]] by the Empire at the end of the Great War.<ref name="SWTORGHL" />

name: Twazzi/Legends
description: Twazzi became a skilled [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] sometime prior to the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. At one point in her career, her skills earned her praise from [[Finis Valorum/Legends|Chancellor Valorum]]. Eventually, her success as a bounty hunter caught the attention of [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] who wanted her to compete with other bounty hunters in the [[Box/Legends|Box]], a death machine designed by [[Moralo Eval/Legends|Moralo Eval]], on [[Serenno/Legends|Serenno]] to win the honor of kidnapping [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]]. She witnessed [[Cad Bane/Legends|Cad Bane]] murder another bounty hunter [[Bulduga/Legends|Bulduga]] to get his hat. Soon, Dooku briefed everyone on the [[Tournament on Serenno/Legends|challenge]] the bounty hunters had to face including telling them about The Box. They were all deprived of their weapons and soon they entered The Box.Their first challenge was to escape a room that was filling with [[Dioxis/Legends|dioxis]] gas. Platforms began to rise from the ground and all the bounty hunters, including Twazzi, climbed up but was almost crushed by the lowering ceiling so she was forced to hang between two platforms. Another bounty hunter, [[Rako Hardeen/Legends|Rako Hardeen]] who was actually [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] in disguise, found a secret tunnel underneath the ground. All the hunters followed him out of the room into the second challenge, thus surviving the first one.In the second round, ledges began to slide out of the walls with a sword resembling a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] swinging around on its front. Bulduga's brother [[Onca/Legends|Onca]] quickly fell prey to the blades. As before, Hardeen saw an open tunnel on the ceiling. Using the ledges, he and Bane hopped to the top towards the tunnel with the other bounty hunters following behind. Bounty hunters [[Kiera Swan/Legends|Kiera Swan]] and [[Sinrich/Legends|Sinrich]] were killed as well but Twazzi got out of the challenge along with the remaining bounty hunters.The third challenge involved the whole room being [[Ray shield/Legends|ray shielded]] and the walls closing in. The switch to deactivate the shields was located in shaft in the wall behind a smaller ray-shield. Eval provided a special serum that, if injected can provide the person temporary immunity to the ray-shields.Platforms began to rise out of the center of the ground. [[Jakoli/Legends|Jakoli]] was instantly electrocuted as well when the floor he stood became ray-shielded. A hunter, [[Derrown/Legends|Derrown]] was able to inject the serum due to his anatomy of being immune to such serums. During his attempt to get to the button, [[Mantu/Legends|Mantu]] lost his balance and fell to his death. Derrown was eventually able to press the button and the surviving hunters made it to the next and final round.[[File:TwazziTurnedIntoPalpatine-CoN.png|thumb|left|260px|Twazzi in disguise of Chancellor Palpatine]]They found themselves on a platform with the ground below them doused in flames. This challenge involved sharpshooting. A small yellow target zipped across the wall. Next to the them, a sniper rifle appeared in a small machine. [[Sixtat/Legends|Sixtat]] took the rifle and aimed at the target. He shot the first two perfectly but missed the third. As a result, the platform he stood on disappeared into the ground and Sixtat fell into the flames which killed him. Hardeen took another rifle that replaced the empty spot on the machine. He shot all three targets easily but Eval gave him five more targets to shoot. Hardeen shot the first four but that was all the ammo the sniper rifle had. Eval scoffed at Hardeen and by pressing some buttons on his wrist, caused the platform beneath Hardeen to drop. However, Bane saved him, taunting Eval to kill Hardeen like a man to which Dooku agreed. Eval soon dropped to the floor and Twazzi and the other hunters witnessed the two brawl, in which Hardeen won. Dooku then congratulated the survivors and announced Bane to be the leader of the group to kidnap Palpatine.During the [[Festival of Light/Legends|Festival of Light]], the bounty hunters [[Skirmish in Theed/Legends|launched their kidnapping plot]]. Twazzi and [[Embo/Legends|Embo]] were the ones to be disguised as [[Senate Guard/Legends|Senate Guards]], in order to escort Palpatine. Bane handed out a special mapping device to lead them to the meeting point, and a [[Multispectrum disguise suite|holographic disguise matrix]], which gave Embo and Twazzi the appearance of [[Senate Commando/Legends|Senate Commandos]]. After Derrown deactivated the [[Deflector shield generator/Legends|shield generator]] which protected the Chancellor on the festival, the explosion rendered Palpatine unconscious. At that time, the real Palpatine was concealed under the image of a Senate Commando with the help of the disguise matrix, while Twazzi turned into Palpatine. However, [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin]] and [[Mace Windu/Legends|Windu]] managed to stop them from fleeing, and Twazzi and Embo were transformed back. Then Twazzi started throwing punches at Anakin. On the third punch, Anakin used his lightsaber to cut off her right arm. She and Embo were then both arrested, while Bane and Eval escaped with the 'real' Palpatine.

name: Ianna Cel
description: [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] Cel was assigned to [[Tower command station|Waypoint Station Aurek]] on [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] during the [[Taris Resettlement Initiative|reconstruction]], where she was researching the [[rakghoul plague]] and treating Republic personnel who may have been contaminated.<ref name="Pirate" />While stationed at Aurek, Cel was in a meeting with members of her team, consisting of an expert diagnostician, senior virologist, junior biologist, and offworld xenobiologist. A traveling hero caught her attention and she ended the meeting. Speaking with the hero, she hired them to assist in recovering an old sample of the [[rakghoul serum]]. She asked the hero to get a sample of the serum from the [[Death's Claw]] pirates, who had raided the ruins of the privately-owned [[Sepanik Memorial Hospital]].<ref name="Pirate" />When given the anti-virus, she realized it was outdated, and it would only protect a very strong individual temporarily. She asked the hero to take the serum and then get purposely infected with the plague. After doing so the hero was sent to [[Bomber command post|Waypoint Station Draay]] to be analyzed by the medical droid there. The experiment proved to be a success and Doctor Cel told the hero she would begin synthesizing a cure for Republic personnel, and later a version to sell to the civilians of Taris.<ref name="Catalyst">{{TORcite|type=class|Republic|Catalyst|Taris}}</ref>When the Empire invaded Taris, intend to crush Republic's reformation efforts, Cel encountered a new problem in a rogue [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Ki Sazen]]. Sazen fell to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] and killed Cel's colleagues [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] [[Vernon]] and [[Professor/Legends|Professor]] [[Sadus Vraal]] when they proved unable to fix the [[Ultrawave Transmitter]] - a device created by [[Nasan Godera]] that could be used to control the rakghouls. Believing herself to be the last rakghoul expert on Taris, Cel escaped to the ruins of the [[Dynamet General Hospital]] and hid there from Sazen for weeks, until she was contacted and found by [[Republic Strategic Information Service]] agents "Chance" and "Legate". Unknown to her, Legate" was an undercover [[Imperial Agent]] [[Cipher Nine]], who used Cel to get to Sazen and the [[Ultrawave Transmitter]]. Cel trusted the Agent and planned to use herself as a bait to lure Sazen out, before being interrupted by Doctor [[Eckard Lokin]], who offered to go in her place instead.

name: Folaris
description: {{Quote|There's a rumor going around that Black Sun's about to clean house. Snitches, rival gang leaders&mdash;they're all gonna be dead meat. There's a list of these unfortunate individuals sitting on their computers. I need those names.|Agent Folaris|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Folaris lived on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], where she served as a [[Police officer/Legends|police officer]] with the [[Coruscant Security Force/Legends|Coruscant Security Force]]. During the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Folaris was assigned as an undercover [[Agent/Legends|agent]] in the [[Black Sun territory]]. There, Folaris developed a list of contacts and [[Spy/Legends|informants]] to help her get information on the [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] criminal syndicate.<ref name="SWTORpartial" /> Around [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="SWTORdate">{{TOR_dates}}</ref> Folaris discovered that leaders in Black Sun were planning a purge of suspected spies and rival gang leaders. The mass [[Death/Legends|executions]] would cost Folaris her network of informants and the lives of innocent people. Folaris knew that she could [[Slicer/Legends|slice]] the [[Computer/Legends|computers]] of Black Sun and retrieve the list of targeted persons, but she needed to be able to prevent Black Sun from tracing her.<ref name="SWTORpartial" />{{GameLSmechanics}}She was able to convince a Republic individual to assist her by going inside the [[Black Sun Headquarters]] and disabling the tracing equipment. The individual did so and returned to Folaris, who had been able to retrieve the list. At that point, Folaris suggested to the individual that a good amount of money could be made from selling the list to an [[Information broker/Legends|information broker]] named [[Nizkif]] at the [[Dealer's Den]] [[Cantina/Legends|cantina]] on Coruscant, where Folaris was well known. However, the individual convinced Folaris that selling the list would cause more harm than good, and she should turn the names over to her superiors.<ref name="SWTORpartial" />{{Gamemechanics}}

name: Nurls Yorksin
description: Nurls Yorksin was a [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] who lived on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] during the time of the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]]. During this time, Yorksin worked as an undercover [[Agent/Legends|agent]] for the [[Republic Strategic Information Service]], gathering intelligence at the [[Senate Plaza]].<ref name="SWTORTF" />{{GameLSmechanics}}When it came to Yorkin's attention that [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]] thugs were hijacking the cargoes of honest shippers, Yorksin enlisted the help of an independent individual, as she did not wish to blow any of her fellow agents' cover. As the independent agent located Black Sun [[Labor droid/Legends|loader droids]] and downloaded their memories, the agents of Strategic Info Service were able to locate the stolen cargo and infiltrate Black Sun's warehouses.<ref name="SWTORTF" />{{Endgame}}

name: Silara Panteer
description: {{Quote|I failed my queen, and now Alderaan is leaderless. Queen Panteer was killed when her transport crashed in this river. Her body was found, but her crown still lies in the water.|Sir Deris of the Queensguard|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]]<ref name="Human" /> [[Sexes/Legends|female]],<ref name="Holonet" /> Silara Panteer<ref name="Armed">{{TORcite|type=faction|Imperial|Armed Intervention|Alderaan}}</ref> was a member of [[House Panteer]], a [[Noble/Legends|noble]] family and one of the [[Great Houses of Alderaan|Great Houses]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]].<ref name="House Panteer" /> Panteer became [[Monarch of Alderaan|Queen]] of her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] sometime before [[3667 BBY]],<ref name="Journal" /> continuing decades of Panteer rule before her,<ref name="Encyclopedia" /> and she also bore a son named [[Gaul Panteer|Gaul]].<ref name="Holonet" /> During her reign, Queen Panteer was beloved by the [[Alderaanian/Legends|Alderaanian]] populace, and even her adversaries greatly respected the monarch and her undisputed rule.<ref name="House Panteer" /> In 3667 BBY, during the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Alderaan was [[Battle of Alderaan|invaded]] by the Empire, and during the invasion Imperial forces under the command of the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Malgus]] razed [[Castle Panteer]] and captured the royal family. However, the Queen and her family were later rescued by the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] and [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] forces who succeeded in repelling the Imperials.<ref name="Journal" />By [[3653 BBY]], the Queen's son Gaul had become Alderaan's [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] in the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]]. That [[Standard year/Legends|year]], Alderaan hosted [[Alderaan peace conference|peace talks]] between the Galactic Republic and the Sith Empire, but when the Empire [[Sacking of Coruscant|attacked]] the Republic [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], the Republic was forced to sign the [[Treaty of Coruscant]] that ended the war. An enraged Gaul Panteer declared Alderaan's independence and stormed out of the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]] in disgust, returning to his homeworld. Queen Panteer also became ill around this [[Time/Legends|time]], and her health steadily worsened over the next few years as Gaul entered into secret negotiations to return Alderaan to the Republic. However, Gaul was [[Death/Legends|murdered]]<ref name="War">{{TORcite|type=codex|The War For Alderaan's Throne}}</ref> by [[Assassin/Legends|assassins]] of [[House Rist]] on the orders of [[House Ulgo]],<ref name="Red">{{TORcite|type=faction|Republic|Red Handed|Alderaan}}</ref> and Queen Silara's [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] crashed only [[Standard day/Legends|days]] later<ref name="War" /> in the [[Glarus Valley]] after being sabotaged, leading to her death.<ref name="Head" />The Queen's body was recovered from the river, but she had not been wearing the [[Panteer crown|royal crown]], which sank to the bottom of the river in its [[Duralloy/Legends|duralloy]] container.<ref name="Head" /> In the weeks that followed, tensions soon broke out into open war as [[Bouris Ulgo]] declared himself king, and a four-way war between the Republic-backed [[House of Organa/Legends|House Organa]], the Empire-backed [[House of Thul|House Thul]], House Ulgo, and House Panteer erupted as the [[Alderaan Civil War]] began.<ref name="War" />

name: Allania Jakien
description: The daughter of a [[Tibanna/Legends|tibanna]] gas refiner and an employee of the [[Holiday Towers]] restaurant, Jakien had befriended an [[Ugnaught/Legends|Ugnaught]] child and had learned from this companion the layout of the maze of Ugnaught tunnels beneath in the depths of the [[City/Legends|city]]. On the day that [[Baron Administrator/Legends|Baron Administrator]] [[Lando Calrissian/Legends|Lando Calrissian]] ordered the evacuation of Cloud City, several friends and she submitted sick messages to school, and had chosen to play in the Ugnaught tunnels; when they heard the message, they turned to her for guidance. She led them toward her father in the gas refinery, but despite her experience, managed to get lost and encounter a [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] squad.The squad captured her friends, but Jakien managed to slip through their legs and enter a ventilation shaft. Now completely lost, she heard an unusual buzzing and, investigating, discovered two men fighting with [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsabers]]. She followed the two at a distance as they fought, watching in amazement as [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|the larger, armored man]] used [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to throw heavy objects at [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|his opponent]], knocking him through a viewport.Wanting to learn what happened to the fallen hero, she found a shaft with a grating that looked into Cloud City's central wind tunnel. From there, she observed the continuation of the conflict, culminating in the armored man severing the hero's hand with his lightsaber. This brought her to tears, but she still listened to their words that echoed through the tunnel. She was shocked to hear that the armored man had killed the hero's father, but even more shocked when the armored man revealed the truth to the hero&mdash;that ''he'' was the hero's father. At this, the hero jumped, and Jakien lost sight of him; the armored man made a barely noticeable sigh, but then stopped in his tracks and looked directly at Jakien. Panicked, she fled upward, regardless of the threat that the stormtroopers might represent above.Fortunately, upon arriving at the upper plaza, she ran into [[Bent Gavler]], a family friend, who consoled her sobbing and reunited her with her family. The Jakiens left Bespin on a crowded transport, and from its window she spotted a [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|light freighter]] fly past, which, for some reason, calmed her and reassured her that the hero had survived.Eventually, Jakien was interviewed by [[Alliance to Restore the Republic/Legends|Rebel]] historian [[Voren Na'al/Legends|Voren Na'al]], who corroborated her story with other witnesses.

name: Rori Fenn
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Rori Fenn was trained in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Je'daii Order]] on the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]], one of nine planets in the [[Tython system]] which made up the [[Settled Worlds]]. As a [[Je'daii Journeyer|Journeyer]], Fenn had a romantic relationship with fellow Journeyer [[Hawk Ryo]]; the pair ended the relationship after they ascended to the rank of [[Je'daii Ranger]].<ref name="DotJ4">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 4]]''</ref> During her life as a Ranger, Fenn carried a single [[Force-imbued blade]] as a defense against the wilds of Tython.<ref name="DotJ3" />In [[25,793 BBY]], the [[Tau (individual)|Xesh]], a [[Force Hound]] of the [[Infinite Empire]] crashed the [[Rakatan ship]] called the ''[[Devourer]]'' near the [[Rift]] on Tython. The surge of [[Death/Legends|deaths]] associated with the crash alerted all Je'daii to the foreign presence on the world, as well as stirring a [[Force storm (weather)|Force storm]] that would rage across the entire planet. Fenn immediately went to the Temple of Balance, [[Akar Kesh]] to consult with [[Je'daii Temple Master|Temple Master]] [[Ketu]] regarding the anomalies spreading across the world. Dispatched by Master Ketu to the crash site in [[Pteron glider]]s, Fenn accompanied fellow Ranger Hawk Ryo and Temple Master [[Quan-Jang]] to the Rift in search of survivors. Despite being attacked briefly by a pair of [[saarl]], the Je'daii arrived safely at the site where they were able to transmit a vid-feed back to Temple Master [[Kora Ryo]] at the Temple of Knowledge, [[Kaleth]].<ref name="DotJ3" />Discovering the broken hilts of three Je'daii Journeyers' swords, Fenn and Ryo paired up on the back of a bipedal mount and delved deep into the Rift in search of their wayward Je'daii while Master Quan-Jang surveyed the area on the back of a mutated [[rancor-dragon]] named [[Butch]].<ref name="DotJ4" />

name: Miarta Sek
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], Miarta Sek was born into the [[Sek clan]] who agreed to have her trained in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Je'daii Order]] on the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]], one of nine planets in the [[Tython system]] which made up the [[Settled Worlds]]. A trained [[Force healing/Legends|healer]] from the Great Temple of [[Mahara Kesh]], Sek was given the title of [[Je'daii Temple Master]] and oversaw the operations of the Temple of Force Skills, [[Qigong Kesh]]. The maternal grandmother of [[Je'daii Journeyer]] [[Sek'nos Rath]], Sek and the other Temple Masters formed the [[Je'daii Council]], meeting via [[Holocomm/Legends|holocommunication]] at the Temple of Balance, [[Akar Kesh]].<ref>''[[Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 4]]''</ref>

name: Hadiya
description: {{Quote|In her pride, she would not be subject to the Je'daii&mdash;or the "will" of the Force. Her will alone would be supreme. So was born the Despot War.|Je'daii Temple Master Ketu|Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 1}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], Hadiya came to power on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Shikaakwa]] in the [[Tython system]]. She began to unite the [[Nine Houses]] of Shikaakwa, subjugating the Houses' crime [[Baron/Legends|barons]]<ref name="DOTJ 0" /> with the help of her chief advisor [[Bakko]], the [[Iktotchi/Legends|Iktotchi]] [[Ka'un Damm]], and her "fists"&mdash;the [[Devaronian/Legends|Devaronian]] [[Shri-Lan]] and the [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Gav Vannar]].<ref name="DOTJ 9">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: The Prisoner of Bogan 4]]''</ref> When the [[Volnos Ryo's father|current head]] of [[Clan Ryo]] refused to join her, Hadiya [[Death/Legends|killed]] him and his [[Volnos Ryo's elder brother|eldest son]].<ref name="DOTJ 4">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 4]]''</ref> Following the execution of his father and brother, the young [[Volnos Ryo]] pledged fealty to Hadiya. With all Nine Houses of Shikaakwa sworn to her, Hadiya declared herself Queen.<ref name="DOTJ 9">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: The Prisoner of Bogan 5]]''</ref>Having taken control of her homeworld, Hadiya moved on to the other worlds of the Tython system, conquering them and earning the title of "Despot Queen."<ref name="DOTJ 0" /> However, Hadiya refused to submit to the authority of the [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-wielding]] [[Je'daii Order]],<ref name="DOTJ 1" /> and she sparked the [[Despot War]] in [[25,805 BBY]] in order to conquer the entire Tython system.<ref name="DOTJ 0" /> Hadiya's forces, the [[Despot Army]], invaded the Je'daii homeworld of [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the intent of destroying the Je'daii.<ref name="DOTJ 1" /> During the fighting, Hadiya was approached by a [[Je'daii Ranger]] named [[Daegen Lok]] who claimed to have defected from the Order and was willing to pledge his sword to the queen. Agreeing to have Lok by her side, Hadiya was impressed by his ruthlessness and quickly promoted him to [[General/Legends|general]] within her army.<ref name="DOTJ 9" /> Launching her attack on the Je'daii Temple of [[Kaleth]] with Lok by her side,<ref name="DOTJ 9" /> Hadiya fought on the front lines, killing the [[Shae Koda's mother|mother]] and [[Shae Koda's father|father]] of [[Shae Koda]] at the gates of the Temple.<ref name="DOTJ 4" /> Despite her superior numbers, Hadiya's armies were ultimately outmatched by the Je'daii but were still willing to fight to the death. By the time they had reached Kaleth, Hadiya had taken Lok as her lover and allowed him to sleep in her tent beside her during the evenings. Late in the battle, Lok caught Hadiya asleep one evening and drew a small dagger. While Lok hesitated, Hadiya awoke and attacked her assailant, slashing at his right eye and scarring his brow before he grabbed her with the Force and killed her. Without their cruel queen to drive them onward, the Despot Army collapsed in on itself and Je'daii Lok was hailed a hero for his part in her demise.<ref name="DOTJ 9" /> Hadiya was replaced by a weak [[Kral (title)|Kral]], or overlord, who was easily manipulated by the heads of the Nine Houses in the years after the Despot War.<ref name="DOTJ 0" />

name: Darth Gean
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] was [[Force-sensitive/Legends|sensitive]] to [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], eventually becoming the [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentice]] of [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Darth Gravid]] and taking the name [[Darth/Legends|Darth]] Gean. During her tenure as Gravid's pupil, Gean helped her [[Sith Master/Legends|Sith Master]] construct a [[Darth Gravid's fortress|fortress]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Jaguada/Legends|Jaguada]]. However, Gean's Master had begun to lose his sanity, because he attempted to combine [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] philosophies, such as benevolence and empathy, into his [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] teachings.<ref name="DP" />At some point around [[552 BBY]],<ref name="Note">The narration in the novel [[Darth Plagueis (novel)|''Darth Plagueis'']] regarding [[Darth Gravid]]'s background takes place in [[52 BBY/Legends|52 BBY]], shortly after the [[Attack on the Lodge of the Canted Circle|assassination attempt]] on [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Darth Plagueis]], and states that Gravid's reign "elapsed some five [[Standard century/Legends|centuries]] earlier." Thus, this article assumes that Gean [[Death/Legends|killed]] Gravid around [[552 BBY]].</ref> Gravid&mdash;who had concluded that his repository of [[Sith holocron/Legends|Sith holocrons]] and tomes needed to be destroyed so that he could rebuild the organization&mdash;used the Force to raise [[Force barrier/Legends|barriers]] around his fortress and began eradicating the Sith knowledge in his possession. Gean broke through the shields around the fortress and [[Lightsaber combat/Legends|confronted]] her Master in a [[Duel in Darth Gravid's fortress|duel]]. During the fight, Gean was gravely injured after Gravid cleaved off one of her [[Limb/Legends|arms]] and shoulders as well as the left side of the Twi'lek's face and chest. However, Gean gained the upper hand, [[Death/Legends|killing]] Gravid despite being unarmed.<ref name="DP" />After the confrontation, Gean acquired [[Cybernetics/Legends|prosthetics]] to replace the limbs she had lost. She eventually took an [[Darth Gean's Sith apprentice|apprentice]] of her own and continued with the [[Grand Plan]]&mdash;which was instituted by [[Darth Bane/Legends|Darth Bane]], the founder of the [[Order of the Sith Lords]]&mdash;to topple the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. In taking her apprentice, Gean continued the [[Rule of Two/Legends|Rule of Two]], an ordinance also instituted by Bane that restricted the Sith to a single Master and apprentice. [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Darth Plagueis]], recounted her actions to his apprentice, [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]], believing her to be courageous.<ref name="DP" />

name: Synnoran
description: During the Cold War, Synnoran was stationed on Taris by her father [[Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Synnoran (Lord)|Synnoran]] to help recapture an outpost, however it turned out to be a [[rakghoul]] nest and the entire platoon was killed. Additionally someone had activated the outpost's self-destruct but it was stopped when power was lost.<ref name="TOR" />Back at the [[75th Legion forward camp]] within the [[Tularan Marsh]], she met an Imperial spacer whom she asked for their help to reclaim the outpost.<ref name="TOR" />She is the descendant of the "legendary" [[Darth Synn]].

name: Unidentified Iktotchi prophet
description: This prophet, who was native to the [[Inner Rim/Legends|Inner Rim]], settled, around the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[70 BBY]], on Saleucami, where she gathered a large following. She was sought out, without her knowledge, by the [[Bith/Legends|Bith]] [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Sith Lord/Legends|Lord]] [[Darth Venamis]], who kept her name on a list of potential [[Sith apprentice/Legends|Sith apprentices]].Around the year [[67 BBY]], after Venamis was bested in [[Contest on Sojourn|a duel]] by the [[Muun/Legends|Muun]] [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord]] [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Darth Plagueis]], his list came to Plagueis's attention, who decided to seek out Venamis's candidates in order to determine if they would pose a threat to him and to the [[Grand Plan]].Plagueis traveled to Saleucami and came before the prophet among a large crowd. There, the Iktotchi apparently foretold major events of the coming half-century with great accuracy. She told of terrible [[The galaxy/Legends|galaxy]]-spanning [[Clone Wars/Legends|war]] fought between "[[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|machines of alloy]] and [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|machines of flesh]]" that would cause the [[Declaration of a New Order|collapse]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]], [[Great Jedi Purge/Legends|catastrophe]] for the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], and the formation of a [[New Order/Legends|New Order]] under "[[Palpatine/Legends|a ruthless despot]] who serves the forces of entropy." She preached a message of embracing the coming darkness as the only means of survival and called upon the audience members to approach her and be touched by her in order to be set upon the path towards their recreation.When Plagueis approached her, she took his hands in hers and immediately divined that he was a well-educated and wealthy Muun. She sensed that "he wore the darkness of the future" and claimed that he was the one she had sought out. Plagueis, gripping her hands tightly, told the prophet that she posed a threat to his cause, and struck her dead with [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightning]] through his grip. By killing her, the Dark Lord eliminated what he considered to be the preacher of an antiquated and dangerous message, the same message that had doomed the Sith of old, and a threat to the inevitable future.

name: Unidentified female Naboo senator
description: The female Naboo that would eventually become the representative for her [[Homeworld/Legends|homeworld]] started working her way up the political chain succeeding the former senator. The future senator, [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]], [[Supreme Chancellor/Legends|Supreme Chancellor]] and [[Galactic Emperor/Legends|Galactic Emperor]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Palpatine]] criticized her while living on [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] in his younger years. Staying on for a few years, she was succeeded by Vidar Kim.

name: Koblus Sornell
description: She lived the nomadic lifestyle of a Mandalorian with her husband, [[Haarm Sornell]], and three children: an infant son, a teenager daughter, and a boy named [[Gheedor Sornell|Gheedor]]. While on [[Dantooine/Legends|Dantooine]], she revealed that she was expecting a fourth child.During a [[Taris Siege|siege]] on the planet [[Taris/Legends|Taris]], Sornell helped establish a signal and communication post where she and the [[Mandalorian/Legends|Mandalorians]] fought through the technical fields. She decided to coordinate on the planet while she and the Mandalorians were led by [[Cassus Fett]]. He led his troops to reach over the helm comlinks which transfers on the publicly accessible [[Z-band]] from [[Serroco]].{{Char-stub}}

name: Pablo's Twi'lek partner/Legends
description: After the escaped prisoner [[Cad Bane/Legends|Cad Bane]] along with [[Moralo Eval/Legends|Moralo Eval]] and [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], disguised as [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]] [[Rako Hardeen/Legends|Rako Hardeen]], came into Pablo's shop and threatened him, this Twi'lek warned the [[Gardulla Besadii the Elder/Legends|local authorities]] which pursued the prisoners back to their starship.

name: Unidentified female prisoner
description: {{Quote|What are you talking about?''"<br />"''Silence, prisoner! I'm not speaking to you, but the shadows.|The prisoner and Moff Kentor Sarne|Feeding Time}}During the early [[Standard year/Legends|years]] of the [[New Republic/Legends|New Republic]], a [[Sexes/Legends|woman]] was held [[Prisoner/Legends|prisoner]] by [[Moff/Legends|Moff]] [[Kentor Sarne]], [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Warlord/Legends|warlord]] of the [[Kathol sector]] in the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. Subjected to the Moff's "entertainments" during her incarceration, she was eventually deposited in an [[observation cell]]. Too shocked to fight back against her captor, the woman cowered against one of the cell's walls, pleading to be told why she was being punished. In response, Moff Sarne&mdash;watching the interior of the cell from the [[Transparisteel/Legends|transparisteel]] window above&mdash;made strange comments, referencing a "wraith" and the need to test the loyalty of his servants. The woman did not understand Sarne; unknown to her, she was not the only occupant of the cell. A [[Defel/Legends|Defel]] named [[Kl'aal]] was hidden in the shadows opposite her.<ref name="ft" /> Kl'aal was the Moff's personal [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]], who had developed a taste for freshly [[Death/Legends|killed]] meat after crash landing on a remote [[Planet/Legends|planet]]. Kl'aal had struck a deal with Sarne to serve as his assassin in exchange for the chance to indulge his hunger.<ref name="tdc">''[[The DarkStryder Campaign]]''</ref> Sarne was attempting to goad Kl'aal into killing the woman and eating her for his own amusement.<ref name="ft" />The woman, confused by Sarne's words, asked the Moff what he meant. Sarne told her to shut up, and said he was speaking to the shadows, not her. Kl'aal let out a growl directed toward the Moff, and the woman retreated into the far corner and began to sob. As the woman cowered in the corner, Sarne continued to bait his assassin, telling him that he would starve if he did not eat the woman. Kl'aal remained hidden in the shadows, and refused to participate. To him, the woman was not prey, and he would rather starve than kill an innocent.<ref name="ft" />

name: Cindy O'Shaunessy
description: From an early age, O'Shaunessy had an interest in medicine and she joined the Alliance at the behest of a [[Professor/Legends|professor]] of medicine that she had trained under. At some point after the [[Destruction of Alderaan|destruction]] of the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], O'Shaunessy and a team of Rebel [[Agent/Legends|agents]] were [[Mission to Tazan|dispatched]] by the Alliance to the planet [[Tazan]], to destroy an [[Imperial Data Processing Facility]] that was located on the world.After arriving on Tazan, O'Shaunessy and the rest of the team rendezvoused with the Alliance sympathizer [[Willer Clines]] in [[Willer Clines' House|Clines' house]], in the [[Desander Section]] of [[Tazan City]]. However, their conversation with Clines was secretly monitored by a group of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] and once the stormtroopers believed that Rebels had revealed all that they would about their mission, the stormtroopers entered Clines' lounge and attacked O'Shaunessy and the rest of the Rebels. The agents escaped and eventually infiltrated the Data Processing Facility, where they extracted some Imperial [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE Fighter]] communications protocols and then blew up the structure.<ref name="UCD" />

name: Annabel Blaine
description: Blaine was raised by her father, an independent [[Merchant/Legends|trader]] who was considered by some to be a [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]], and as a child she became fascinated with [[Holovid/Legends|holovids]] that depicted members of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. After her father perished in a skirmish against a [[Squadron/Legends|squadron]] of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[TIE/LN starfighter|TIE fighters]], Blaine joined the Rebel Alliance and sought revenge against the Empire. While among the Rebels, Blaine encountered a number of other [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitives]], who trained her to use [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and under their tutelage, she constructed a [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="UCD" />At some point after the [[Destruction of Alderaan|destruction]] of the planet [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]], Blaine and a team of Rebel agents were [[Mission to Tazan|dispatched]] by the Alliance to the planet [[Tazan]], to destroy an [[Imperial Data Processing Facility]] that was located on the world. After arriving on Tazan, Blaine and the rest of the team rendezvoused with the Alliance sympathizer [[Willer Clines]] in [[Willer Clines' House|Clines' house]], in the [[Desander Section]] of [[Tazan City]]. However, their conversation with Clines was secretly monitored by a group of [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Imperial]] [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtroopers]] and once the stormtroopers believed that Rebels had revealed all that they would about their mission, the stormtroopers entered Clines' lounge and attacked Blaine and the rest of the Rebels. The agents escaped and eventually infiltrated the Data Processing Facility, where they extracted some Imperial TIE fighter communications protocols and then blew up the structure.<ref name="UCD" />

name: Amille Razna
description: Amille Razna was in command of a group of [[Republic Security Force/Legends|Republic Security]] [[Agent/Legends|agents]] sent to [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] to put a halt to the violent scavenging that was occurring. During the investigation, Razna attempted to arrest a particular violent scavenger known as [[Locust|The Locust]]. However, she and her team were captured by the gang until they were rescued later by an individual in which the Locust was captured.<ref name="SWTORLocust" />

name: Daka/Legends
description: {{Quote|Daka! As the oldest and wisest of us, I need you to resurrect our fallen Sisters.|[[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]]|Massacre}}The oldest and wisest of the [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]] clan, Old Daka's knowledge of the arcane [[Dathomir Magic|magicks]] was unprecedented. She resided in the [[Nightsister fortress]], the settlement of the united covens under [[Mother (title)/Legends|Clan Mother]] [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]]. Her secret lair was the [[Hidden Cave/Legends|Hidden Cave]], a place that could only be entered with a spell.<ref name="Massacre" />When the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] launched a devastating attack on Dathomir, and the Nightsisters were outnumbered by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous's]] [[Droid/Legends|droid]] forces, Mother Talzin retreated into the depths of the witches' lair and called upon Old Daka for help. Daka used an [[Chant of Resurrection/Legends|ancient incantation]] to summon the [[Army of the Dead/Legends|dead]] from the Nightsisters' graveyard, bolstering their number with [[Zombie/Legends|zombie]] hordes.<ref name="Massacre" />[[File:DeathOldDaka.jpg|thumb|left|220px|Old Daka's death at the hands of General [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]]]]Despite the intervention of Daka's magical aide-de-camp, the Separatist forces ended up outmatching the Sisters. Old Daka was killed by Grievous with a [[Shiak|stab]] through the stomach, resulting in the destruction of every Nightsister [[Zombie/Legends|Zombie]]&mdash;the spell would only last as long as its caster was active. With Daka's [[Death/Legends|death]], the coven had lost one of its most knowledgeable sisters, but [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]] had been able to escape and flee far away on [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], seeking out vengeance.<ref name="Massacre" />

name: Luce/Legends
description: When [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] returned from a failed [[Showdown at Toydaria/Legends|attempt]] on [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]], he sent the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] under the command of [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] to [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]] in revenge. Along with Ventress and her fellow [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsisters]], Luce began a counterattack against the opposition, during the battle she acquired two [[E-5 blaster rifle/Legends|E-5 blaster rifles]] from [[BX-series droid commando/Legends|droid commandos]] after being deprived of her [[Nightsister energy bow/Legends|energy bow]]. General Grievous [[Lightsaber duel/Legends|dueled]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]], but Ventress was defeated and was wounded. Luce retreated to help Ventress from the battlefield, but a [[Blaster/Legends|blaster]] bolt shot from a [[Battle droid/Legends|battle droid]] struck her back. She fell down and [[Death/Legends|died]] shortly after, but Asajj Ventress avenged her death by destroying the [[B1 battle droid/Legends|B1 battle droid]] that killed her.

name: Talia (Nightsister)/Legends
description: [[File:WelcomeHomeAsajj-Nightsisters.png|thumb|left|250px|Talia and her sisters confront a newly returned Asajj Ventress]]Talia was a member of [[Clan mother|Mother]] [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin's]] coven of [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] witches on [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]]. During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], she and several of her fellow sisters confronted the wounded [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]], a former Nightsister who had been betrayed by [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]]. She, along with the other members of her clan, prepared to execute Ventress, only to be stopped by Talzin, who informed them that Ventress was one of their own. Soon afterward, Talia helped prepare the [[Water of Life/Legends|Water of Life]] to revive Ventress. She also helped prepare an invisibility [[magic]] potion for Ventress and her fellow Nightsisters [[Karis/Legends|Karis]] and [[Naa'leth/Legends|Naa'leth]] to use in an infiltration of [[Dooku's palace|Count Dooku's palace]]. After this attempt failed, she was present when Ventress and her sisters returned in their [[Raider (GS-100 salvage ship)|ship]].<ref>[http://www.starwars.com/theclonewars/guide/episode312.html]</ref>Talia attended Count Dooku's arrival at the [[Nightsister fortress]]. Some time later, Talia, Karis, Talzin, and [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] used a [[Sheathipede-class transport shuttle/Legends|Sheathipede-class transport shuttle]] to travel to Dooku's palace on [[Serenno/Legends|Serenno]] to deliver Savage to Dooku as a replacement apprentice. The three Nightsisters then returned to Dathomir.<ref>[http://www.starwars.com/theclonewars/guide/episode313.html]</ref>When Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi arrived at the Nightsister fortress looking for a lead on the location of Savage Opress, Talia and other members of her clan descended from above the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], disarmed them, and brought them to Mother Talzin. She was later present when the wounded Savage Opress returned to Dathomir following his battle with Dooku, Ventress, and the two Jedi above [[Toydaria/Legends|Toydaria]].<ref>[http://www.starwars.com/theclonewars/guide/episode314.html]</ref>

name: Dah'lis Stark
description: With Iaco's death, she became dependent on Iaclyn for 'allowances'. She was interested in [[Jahan Cross]] when he managed to irritate Iaclyn, prompting her to approach him. She proceeded to take him to the Stark Compound giving a short narrative of her life with her husband. Dah'lis mentioned how Iaco liked her for being different.She undressed and went into her pool, beckoning Jahan to come in. All the while, he was asking for information on [[Eclipse station (Reltooine)|Eclipse]]. She stated that Iaco died from an industrial accident where he was beheaded. She mentioned she wished to complete the Eclipse project on behalf of her late husband, but that Iaclyn was preventing her from getting near it. Jahan was promptly stunned by Iaclyn who stated she was saying too much and killed her and framed Cross for it.

name: Elli Stark
description: Elli Stark was the daughter of [[Arris Rossum]] and [[Iaco Stark]], though he was not her biological father. Her mother was having an extramarital affair at the time of her conception.Elli grew up in the shadow of her brother, [[Iaclyn Stark]], who was their father's favorite. Nevertheless, they both got along very well during their childhood until they were forced to be separated in the later years. After her father was presumed to be killed in [[5 BBY/Legends|5 BBY]], Elli and her stepmother, [[Dah'lis Stark|Dah'lis]], had a small portion of the inheritance while Iaclyn took the majority. He planned to have his sister marry a influential and wealthy suitor, which she refused to do.[[File:Elli Stark evening gown.png|thumb|left|125px|Elli Stark in an evening gown at the Imperial Embassy.]]In [[3 BBY/Legends|3 BBY]], she met a secret [[Imperial Agent]] named [[Jahan Cross]] at a ceremony at the [[Imperial Embassy (Etti IV)|Imperial embassy]] on [[Etti IV/Legends|Etti IV]]. Cross noticed she was being harassed by a man named [[Verpel]] so he introduced himself as her fiancé which caused the man to leave. Elli was appreciative for Cross's assistance and talked to him about her family and situation. When she saw her brother coming over, she excused herself and went back to her quarters at the [[Stark Compound]]. Cross later returned to the Compound with Dah'lis and was present when she was murdered. As he was being escorted away by Espos, he came across Elli in the hallway. He attempted to talk to Stark but was assaulted by the Espos. When he retaliated and disabled his escort, Stark suggested he head to the garage to get away. Cross stole a speeder and was forced to try to escape through the house. When [[Myrsk]] attempted to shoot him down, Stark stopped him, warning him of the cost of the damages if he was successful.<ref name="AotE2">''[[Agent of the Empire—Iron Eclipse, Part 2]]''</ref>After faking his death to evade the pursuing Espos, Cross returned to Stark's bedroom in the compound and told her he didn't kill her stepmother. She believed him and helped him find out information about the Iron Eclipse project. Unknown to them, Iaclyn's droid Majordomo was observing them and reported back to his master. Iaclyn ordered the droid to kill Cross but to not injure Elli. Cross was able to destroy the droid and arranged transport on the [[Millennium Falcon/Legends|''Millennium Falcon'']] to the Eclipse space station so he could further investigate. Once they boarded the freighter, Elli expressed her doubts whether the ship was even spaceworthy. Solo assured her it was ok. Once they left Etti IV, Cross and Stark retired to one of the ships cabins so she could attend to his wounds from his encounter with Majordomo. Cross revealed his history to Elli, explaining his devotion to the Empire. They then shared a kiss. Upon reaching the space station, Stark attempted to authorize their landing but was denied, causing the Falcon to be attacked by Vulture droid starfighters. Cross managed to find a landing bay and he and Stark departed the Falcon allowing it to escape and draw off the droid starfighters. She and Cross confronted Iaclyn but were subdued by droids under control of the Iron Eclipse virus. Iaclyn explained to Elli that she put herself in danger by coming to the space station. He revealed that she was not the daughter of Iaco Stark, but rather the result of an affair Arris Rossum had. Therefore, Iaco Stark felt no connection for her and would not hesitate to kill her. Iaclyn explained that his attempts to arrange a marriage were to get Elli safely away from the Starks. Elli witnessed the murder of her brother when Iaco appeared behind Iaclyn and stabbed him through the chest. Iaco greeted her and told her he owed her nothing and was going to kill her. Elli managed to grab a blaster and retreated with Cross to the exit of the room where they were confronted by a reprogrammed IN-GA.<ref name="AotE4">''[[Agent of the Empire—Iron Eclipse, Part 4]]''</ref>Elli was restrained by droids while Iaco watched Cross and IN-GA battle. When IN-GA left to disable the repulsorlift generators, Iaco ordered all the droids to stop here which freed Elli. She fled to the landing pad on Cross's orders and attempted to contact the ''Millennium Falcon'' for retrieval. After Cross disabled Iaco, he and Elli leapt from the sinking space station onto the top of the Falcon where they entered through the dorsal hatch. Elli made her way to the cockpit and asked to jump to hyperspace, but Solo informed here they had to clear the planet's gravity well first. When IN-GA contacted the Falcon and explained she was trapped on the dying space station, Elli asked if they could go back and retrieve her. Solo stated that they couldn't for safety reasons, but there might be a chance to rescue the droid by using the ship's tractor beams. When Cross rejected that plan, stating it was too dangerous, Elli tried to sentimentally persuade Cross. He responded that Inga was "simply a droid. A machine."Once free of Reltooine, Elli and Cross retired to one of the cabins in the Falcon. She reaffirmed Cross's promise to get her out of the Corporate Sector and suggested that she might like to go to Coruscant and become a spy like Cross. They then shared an intimate kiss.<ref name="AotE5">''[[Agent of the Empire—Iron Eclipse, Part 5]]''</ref>

name: Dean
