description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Dean became involved in the criminal organization [[Black Sun/Legends|Black Sun]], eventually rising through the ranks and attaining the title [[Vigo/Legends|vigo]], making her one of the nine [[Lieutenant/Legends|lieutenants]] of the syndicate. To protect herself, Mother Dean employed two [[Barabel/Legends|Barabel]] bodyguards to ensure her safety at all times.<ref name="DM3" />In [[33 BBY/Legends|33 BBY]], the vigos of Black Sun unknowingly became the targets of the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Palpatine/Legends|Darth Sidious]] and his [[Sith Master/Legends|master]], [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Darth Plagueis]]. Due to time restraints, the Sith would not be able to hunt down the vigos separately and kill them; instead the Sith would need to lure them together so they could die at once. Ordering his [[Sith apprentice/Legends|apprentice]] [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]] to hunt down two vigos at first, Sidious anticipated Black Sun leader [[Alexi Garyn]] to order the survivors to a single location.<ref>[[Darth Plagueis (novel)|''Darth Plagueis'']]</ref>Indeed, after the [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] assassin had killed Vigos [[Morn]] and [[Darnada]] Garyn summoned the remaining vigos, including Dean, to his [[Black Sun Fortress|fortress]] on [[Ralltiir/Legends|Ralltiir]]. When the vigos had all gathered, Darth Maul infiltrated the fortress and slaughtered all the guards before making his way into the central chamber the vigos had congregated in. One by one Maul cut down the guards before [[First Mission to Ralltiir|executing]] the vigos, murdering Dean with his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].<ref name="DM4" />

name: Latts Razzi/Legends
description: {{Quote|She's a little rough around the edges, but we need ''six'' hunters. Without her, we got no job.|Latts Razzi, on [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] to [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]]|Bounty (episode)|Bounty}}Latts Razzi was a bounty hunter during the Clone Wars. During that time, Latts joined a team of bounty hunters under the leadership of [[Boba Fett/Legends|Boba Fett]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]]. Razzi, along with fellow team members [[Bossk/Legends|Bossk]] and [[Oked/Legends|Oked]], went to [[Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina/Legends|Chalmun's Spaceport Cantina]]. After seeing Oked killed by [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]], she and Bossk decide to invite her for drink and told her if she didn't join their team to fill in for Oked, they'd turn her to the authorities. Razzi and Bossk then took her to meet Fett and the others to take part in a [[Safe cargo objective/Legends|job]] on [[Quarzite/Legends|Quarzite]].[[File:Latts Razzi XW.png|thumb|left|220px|Razzi accepts a bounty on the Rodian, [[Omar Toggs/Legends|Omar Toggs]]]]The group was tasked with guarding a large wooden chest aboard a [[Subtram/Legends|subtram]], which was to be delivered to the planet's dictator [[Otua Blank/Legends|Otua Blank]]. Though the trip began easily enough, soon the tram was beset by [[Kage Warriors/Legends|Kage Warriors]], who sought the cargo for themselves. One by one, the hunters where tossed from the train by the warriors. Though Razzi was one of the last hunters standing, the Warriors' leader, [[Krismo Sodi/Legends|Krismo Sodi]], was able to dispatch her when she mistakenly [[Grappling boa/Legends|grappled]] [[C-21 Highsinger/Legends|C-21 Highsinger]]. Sodi kicked Highsinger off the train and Razzi was pulled off with him.In their absence, Fett was also bested by Sodi, who soon revealed that the cargo was his sister, [[Pluma Sodi/Legends|Pluma Sodi]], who was to be forcibly wed to Blank. Ventress, having suffered many changes in her recent past, ended up placing Fett within the chest and selling him to Blank, collecting both a [[Bounty/Legends|bounty]] from the warlord as well as from the Kage Warriors for freeing Pluma. She then shared the first bounty with Razzi and the others, telling them that Fett would join them soon enough.<ref name="Bounty" />Razzi was later seen back at Chalmun's sharing a table with Ventress and was worried that her new associate was on edge.<ref name="Brothers">{{TCW|Brothers}}</ref>Sometime later, Razzi was on [[Nal Hutta/Legends|Nal Hutta]] under the employ of [[Jabba Desilijic Tiure/Legends|Jabba Desilijic Tiure]]. When [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lords]] [[Darth Maul/Legends|Darth Maul]] and [[Savage Opress/Legends|Savage Opress]] and [[Death Watch/Legends|Death Watch]] leader [[Pre Vizsla/Legends|Pre Vizsla]] came seeking an alliance, the meeting did not go too well. Jabba summoned his bounty hunters, Razzi included, to attack. Vizsla [[Flamethrower/Legends|set fire]] to the [[Hutt Ruling Council|council]] table in order for Maul's group to escape. The bounty hunters chased them onto the landing platform where they were winning the fight until [[Bo-Katan Kryze/Legends|Bo-Katan]] and more [[Death Watch/Legends|Death Watch]] soldiers showed up, forcing the bounty hunters to retreat back inside.Once inside, the bounty hunters tried to take down Maul, Opress, and Vizsla but the three were too powerful. Defeated, Razzi and [[Dengar/Legends|Dengar]] tossed [[smoke grenade]]s down the hall to cover the escape of their fellow bounty hunters [[Embo/Legends|Embo]], [[Sugi (bounty hunter)/Legends|Sugi]], and [[Marrok/Legends|Marrok]]. Razzi and the others fled the [[Jabba's Palace/Legends|palace]] and Maul allowed them to leave as they were only bounty hunters.<ref name="Eminence (episode)">{{TCW|Eminence (episode)|Eminence}}</ref>

name: Yansu Grjak
description: {{Quote|We will not repeat the mistakes of Shaman Yansu Grjak, who too eagerly sold the services of her clan to Separatist buyers and then could not protect her sisters from the Jedi counterattack.|Mother [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]]|Book of Sith: Secrets from the Dark Side}}[[File:Yansuru.png|thumb|left|200px|Yansu and two of her Nightsisters]]Yansu was a [[shaman of the Nightsisters]] who lived during the waning days of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="Book of Sith">''[[Book of Sith: Secrets from the Dark Side]]''</ref> She and her fellow sister [[Sai Sircu]] led an army of their [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]]-wielding order during the war between the Republic and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]]. At that time, they formed an alliance with [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] in order to bring about the downfall of the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]].<ref name="JA">''[[Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Jedi Alliance]]''</ref>During the conflict, she encountered two [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] who attempted to fight her. Grjak thus sent her fellow Nightsisters against the Jedi, allowing herself to flee in a [[Scimitar/Legends|Sith Infiltrator]] ship.<ref name="Book of Sith" />Later she was sent to [[Rodia/Legends|Rodia]], where she was chased down by a pair of Jedi, and despite her powers, she was killed by the pair, weakened by crystals being thrown at her by the Jedi via [[The Force/Legends|the Force]].<ref name="Book of Sith" />

name: Rora Seake
description: {{Quote|This is horrible. We're not prepared for this.''"<br />"''Then you should not have come back to a world that is not yours.|The colonist [[Yelzrin]] and Rora Seake|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] member of the [[Sith (species)|Sith]] [[Species/Legends|species]], Rora Seake was [[Sith training|trained]] as a [[Sith assassin/Legends|Sith assassin]] by the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] and acquired two [[jurgoran]]s&mdash;large creatures from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Dromund Kaas]]&mdash;that she kept as pets, using [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] to [[Animal bond|control]] them. As a result, she gained a reputation among the Empire as a [[Beast master|master of beasts]].<ref name="A More Immediate Concern" /> In [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Time" /> during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the Empire and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], Seake was sent to the planet [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] and tasked with wiping out one of the Republic's new [[Lake Brell colony|colony settlements]] that it was establishing as part of its [[Taris Resettlement Initiative|resettlement efforts]]. Seake was also alerted to the presence of [[Watcher One]], an [[Agent/Legends|agent]] of the Empire's [[Imperial Intelligence (Sith Empire)|intelligence branch]] who was working for the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Darth Angral]]. Seake brought her two pet jurgorans along with her to Taris and soon located her target&mdash;a bunker built along the shores of [[Lake Brell]].<ref name="A More Immediate Concern" />{{GameLS}}However, Seake was irritated to find that a [[Hero of Tython|young Jedi Knight]] was already in the colony and was attempting to evacuate the colonists before she arrived. The Knight had learned of Seake's mission from the Imperial [[operative]] Watcher One and had rushed to intercept the [[Assassin/Legends|assassin]]. As the presence of Seake and her jurgorans sent the colonists into a panic, the assassin warned the colonists that they should not have returned to Taris, and she questioned the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] as to how her opponent had learned of her supposedly secret mission. Seake then retreated and entered into a [[Meditation/Legends|meditative]] state in order to control her jurgorans, but when the two creatures were [[Death/Legends|killed]] by the [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] and a companion, an enraged Seake drew her own [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] and attacked the Jedi herself&mdash;a [[Duel in the Lake Brell colony bunker|duel]] that ended with her death.<ref name="A More Immediate Concern" />{{Endgame}}

name: Cheriss ke Hanadi
description: A native of the dominating Adumari state of [[Cartann]], Cheriss had long-admired the skill and tenacity of fighter pilots (figures of immense respect in Adumari culture) but Cheriss herself was unable to complete pilot training due to chronic [[vertigo]]. Instead, Cheriss took up the dying art of [[blastsword]] dueling to escape what almost amounted to indentured servitude in Cartann's underground factories. Her [[Cheriss ke Hanadi's mother|mother]] was killed by [[brownlung]], a disease contracted in the factories. Cheriss herself worked in the factories for a season longer, until she could make her living solely through the blastsword, and then through endorsements of blastswords. She ignored most of the normal stylistic conventions of blastsword dueling, favoring the styles from the blastsword's prominence in [[Standard year/Legends|years]] past. This gave her a reputation as a "gutter fighter" and earned the enmity of some nobles, but she nonetheless earned great popularity simply because she almost always won. By the time of the New Republics' rediscovery of Adumar, Cheriss had become the planets' Ground Champion thanks to her blastsword skills. The [[Perator]] [[Pekaelic ke Teldan]] appointed Cheriss the official guide for the New Republics' pilot-ambassador group- which included [[Wedge Antilles/Legends]].{{Quote|"I want to be a pilot. Not for Cartann; not for Adumar. For your New Republic. |Cheriss ke Hanadi to Wedge Antillies|Adumar: Pilots Wanted}}Cheriss developed somewhat of a crush on Wedge Antilles, and was herself crushed when she found he and [[Iella Wessiri Antilles|Iella Wessiri]] became a couple. She then took on blastsword challenge after challenge, until she was on the brink of [[Death/Legends|death]]. Wes Janson stepped in and prevented her opponent from killing her, while [[Hobbie Klivan]] summoned a medical team from the Star Destroyer [[Allegiance (Imperial I-class)]]. While undergoing treatment, Cheriss mentioned her vertigo condition to the doctors- who discovered a chemical imbalance in her bloodstream that could be treated with medication. Cured at last, Cheriss soon apologized to Wedge Antilles and joined his rogue Red Flight to resist the dictatorial onslaught of Perator Pakaelic against the "lesser nations." Cheriss was a member of the ground team '''Holdout Group''' that uncovered the New Republic pilots' stolen [[T-65A3 X-wing starfighter]]s and a secret entrance to the Perators' palace- which led Pakaelic to resign in disgrace upon capture.

name: Kaiya Stas
description: Around [[3641 BBY]]<ref name="Time">{{TOR_dates}}</ref> Kaiya Stas was stationed on [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]], trying to stop a legendary wampa called the [[White Terror]]. The wampa was on the rampage and threatened to devour an entire [[Ortolan/Legends|Ortolan]] colony. Injured during her hunt, Kaiya asked a [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] for help. The hero lured White Terror out of its lair and killed the beast.<ref name="ICIF" />

name: Unidentified air rodeo owner
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] individual was the owner of a [[Unidentified traveling air rodeo|traveling air rodeo]] that featured trained [[Thranta/Legends|thrantas]], a [[Sentience/Legends|non-sentient]] [[Species/Legends|species]] of large, flying creatures. At some point in her life, she and a [[Unidentified individual (rodeo owner's husband)|man]] were [[Marriage/Legends|married]]. Some [[Time/Legends|time]] after she was married, an [[Unidentified animal rights group|animal rights group]] kidnapped the owner with the intent of starving her for a [[Standard week/Legends|week]] to show her how hungry the thrantas became during transportation when they were deprived of the [[Star/Legends|sunlight]] necessary for photosynthesis. The group did not ask for a ransom due to their goal being to stop the operation of traveling [[air rodeo]]s.<ref name="Rodeo" />{{RPGseed}}After the owner was captured, a known group of individuals in the area were asked to rescue her. The owner's husband was willing to pay the group for their efforts in rescuing his wife.<ref name="Rodeo" />{{Endgame}}

name: Spirakris Zarem
description: {{Quote|I was raised there. My father was an admiral and my mother was a Senator, but they were both killed during the war.|Zarem, talking about the Senate Building|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Spirakris Zarem was born to an [[Admiral/Legends|Admiral]] [[Spirakris Zarem's father|father]] and a [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Spirakris Zarem's mother|mother]], living on [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] and growing up in and around the [[Senate Building/Legends|Senate Building]]. Orphaned during the [[Great Galactic War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]], Zarem joined the [[Republic Army]], eventually leaving that career to begin work as a [[Diplomat/Legends|diplomat]]. During the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], Zarem began work independently, joining a group of individuals that supported an ideal they called the [[True Republic]]. Believing the Galactic Republic could only be strong when it was allied with the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and resolutely opposed the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]], Zarem worked on Coruscant to ensure that the group's goals were met.<ref name="SWTORTPOD" />{{GameLSmechanics}}As the Cold War dragged on, some members of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate]] grew weary of the stalemate. While milling around the [[Senate Plaza]]'s taxi pad, Zarem discovered a plot by [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Glearius Parvil]] to introduce legislation that would break the Republic's ties with the Jedi Order and instead offer alliance to the Sith Empire. In order to prevent this, Zarem commissioned an independent agent to enter the Senate Building, sabotage the Senator's courier [[Droid/Legends|droid]], and steal a particular parcel that would serve as evidence against him. Because she was on [[Senate Security]]'s watch list, she could not enter the building herself. However, her agent was persuaded that stealing the package was undemocratic, and delivered a parcel of outdated agricultural documents to her instead.<ref name="SWTORTPOD" />{{Endgame}}

name: Prudy
description: {{Quote|My parents flew all the way from Coruscant for a wedding that never happened. You loathsome cad! I wish I'd never met you!|Prudy|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] [[Capital/Legends|capital]] of [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]], Prudy became a fully trained medical [[Doctor/Legends|doctor]] by the [[Time/Legends|time]] of the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]].<ref name="Best" /> In [[3644 BBY]],<ref name="Time">{{TOR_dates}} Adding two [[Standard year/Legends|years]] to [[3642 BBY]] gives a date of [[3644 BBY]].</ref> Prudy was on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] when she encountered the [[xenopathologist]] and combat [[Medic/Legends|medic]] [[Archiban Frodrick Kimble|Archiban Kimble]], better known as Doc. The two began a relationship and soon became [[Marriage/Legends|engaged]], and Doc purchased Prudy a [[Prudy's hospital|refugee hospital]] on [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] using [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]] that he had stolen from a [[Unidentified criminal gang|gang of criminals]] after scamming them with a false promise of a [[Spice/Legends|spice]] delivery. However, Prudy rushed their relationship and arranged a wedding before Doc was ready, causing him to break off their engagement just before the ceremony even after [[Prudy's mother|her mother]] and [[Prudy's father|father]] arrived from Coruscant.<ref name="Best" />Prudy spent the next two [[Standard year/Legends|years]] running her [[Medcenter/Legends|hospital]] on Alderaan, and Doc did not contact her that entire time until the gang that Doc had scammed tracked down where their funds had gone. Learning that Prudy's hospital had been purchased with their credits, in [[3642 BBY]] the gang took the Twi'lek hostage and burned the hospital to the ground before contacting Doc with a ransom demand: Prudy's life in return for the spice he owed them. Doc was able to secure Prudy's release by taking her place as the gang's hostage, though he managed to escape with the help of the [[Republic Customs Office]] and its hostage negotiators. Prudy later contacted Doc via [[Holocomm/Legends|holocomm]] and expressed her fury to him, and she terminated the transmission in anger after informing him that the [[Gangster/Legends|gangsters]] had destroyed her hospital.<ref name="Best" />

name: Leeha Narezz
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Nautolan/Legends|Nautolan]], Leeha Narezz was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] and obtained the rank of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] during the [[Great Galactic War]], a conflict between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]]. During this time, she created medical droids she nicknamed the [[ME-D1|Meedees]], and theorized that the Force helps evolve droids who have gone without memory wipes to sentience. Gaining the reputation of a warrior who "never knew failure," Narezz was considered remarkable by [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Tol Braga]]. Following the [[Treaty of Coruscant]] and during the ensuing [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], Narezz was selected by Master Braga to join a [[Jedi strike team (capture of the Sith Emperor)|strike team]] intent on capturing the [[Vitiate|Sith Emperor]] and redeeming him. Unknown to Master Braga, the team's informant was actually Narezz's secret lover, [[Jomar Chul]]. Through Chul, the team was able to discover that the [[Emperor's Fortress]] was protected by a powerful [[Cloaking device/Legends|cloaking device]].<ref name="SWTOR" />In an effort to find a way through the shields, Narezz was assigned to the frozen world [[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]] to find a downed Imperial [[Shuttle/Legends|shuttle]] belonging to the only non-Sith to see and modify the systems of the space fortress. Along with the help of a [[Hero of Tython]], his companions and the Republic troopers stationed at the planet led by Sergeant [[Fideltin Rusk]], they found the shuttle in a cave in [[Highmount Ridge]]. Leeha got there first, but was cornered by Imperial forces. When the Hero arrived to save her, they were contacted by [[Imperial Guard]]sman [[Lassicar]], who demanded they surrender, as a second wave of reinforcements appeared. However, Rusk and his men entered from above and rappeled down the walls, assisting the Jedi against the Imperials. They then found a cowardly Imperial engineer named [[Urrisov]], who, under gentle interrogation from the Hero, explained that the [[White Maw]] pirates had stolen the shuttle's databanks. However, they missed the decryption file, which Narezz took from the young tech. Sergeant Rusk had fought the pirates before the Empire arrived on Hoth, and knew that the White Maw kept a depot in a crashed dreadnaught protected by ray shields. The databanks would no doubt pass through the depot, but the ray shields needed to come down before the Jedi and soldiers could do anything to retrieve them.Narezz explained that the Meedees have discovered two generators powering the ray shields and instruct Rusk and the Hero to strike at them separately. Later meeting up at the Republic base just outside the [[Starship Graveyard (Hoth)|Starship Graveyard]], Narezz informed the Hero and Rusk that the Imperials and White Maw are fighting for control of the wreck of the ''[[Star of Coruscant]]''. At the Hero's suggestion, Rusk chose to attack the White Maw, figuring the pirates were undisciplined, while the Hero attacked the Imperials, allowing Narezz to get the databanks. After the Hero had dealt with Lassicar, Narezz instructed her fellow Jedi to meet her and Rusk back at [[Aurek Base]]. By the time, the Hero arrived, Rusk was telling Narezz how he and his squad handled a [[Gen'Dai]]. They are then graced by the presence of General Grayne, who assigned Rusk to serve under the Hero. Narezz left on her own, as her shuttle could only fit herself and the Meedees.<ref name="Position of Power">{{TORcite|type=class|[[Hero of Tython|Jedi Knight]]|Position of Power|[[Hoth/Legends|Hoth]]}}</ref>Narezz returned to the Jedi Order's [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Temple]] on [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] with the data on the fortress. Upon delivering the data, Narezz rejoined the rest of Braga's team in her personal starfighter before departing for the [[Dromund system]]. Passing through the space station's shields without problem, the team entered the station only to be overtaken by Imperial forces. Escorted before the Emperor, who waited for them in his throne room, the Jedi team was placed under the Emperor's control and corrupted to the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side of the Force]].<ref name="SWTOR" />{{GameLS}}During Narezz's forced stay at the station the Emperor assigned her to delivering messages and orders to Imperial elites around the station. During a raid on the station, the Nautolan woman was confronted by [[Hero of Tython]] who quickly defeated her in battle. During the fighting, Narezz was able to break the Emperor's thrall over her mind and escape the space station with her life. Returning to Tython, Narezz debriefed the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] on her experience, revealing that the Emperor had an unsettling and deep-seated hatred for the Hero of Tython.<ref name="SWTOR" />

name: Mtara Vinram
description: {{Quote|Well, I must say that I am very impressed. You not only foiled the plot to discredit the Diktat, but defeated the Rogue CorSec commanders who were apparently behind the whole thing!|[[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Mack Jasper|Jasper]], to a spacer|Star Wars Galaxies}}Mtara Vinram was once an officer of the [[Corellian Security Force]]. However, by the time following the [[Battle of Yavin/Legends|Battle of Yavin]], she was part of the group of CorSec troopers and agents who left CorSec in pursuit of a more criminal lifestyle. Along with [[Hiram Bish]], Mtara Vinram became one of the commanders of the [[Rogue CorSec]].<ref name="SWG:GttSotRS" /> Circa [[1 ABY/Legends|1 ABY]],<ref name="TRoD" /> Bish and Vinram elaborated a plot to discredit the Diktat, [[Daclif Gallamby]], and his government.<ref name="SWG:GttSotRS" /> As part of the plot, they created evidences that the Diktat himself was [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggling]] illegal [[Spice/Legends|spice]] in the [[Coronet Capitol]]. The plot was finally foiled by a spacer recruited by CorSec [[Lieutenant/Legends|Lieutenant]] [[Mack Jasper]].<ref name="SWG:SOtGS">{{SWG|Starter Kit}}—Quest: "Seek Out the Gadget Specialist" on Corellia</ref> The spacer infiltrated the [[Rogue CorSec Base]] to find proof of the Diktat's innocence. Mtara Vinram and Hiram Bish were killed during the assault.<ref name="SWG:GttSotRS" />

name: Lin
description: {{Quote|What he wanted was to make a living and keep a roof over our heads. And you took advantage&mdash;you paid him to get himself killed!|Lin, blaming the Republic for her husband's death|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}[[File:Lin-TOR2.png|thumb|left|180px|Lin after learning of her husband's death]]A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Lin was alive during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] fought between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. At some point, Lin [[Marriage/Legends|married]] a Human named [[Bellis]], and the two of them lived together in a two-story [[Bellis's house|house]] in [[Talloran village]], a small settlement near [[Fort Garnik]] on [[Avilatan]], an island on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]]. Eventually, a conflict<ref name="TOR" /> known as the [[Separatist War]]<ref name="War">{{TORcite|type=message|Date night|Doc}} identfied the war as the "Separatist War."</ref> broke out between the Republic and a group of [[Mantellian Separatist Movement|Separatists]] intent on overthrowing Ord Mantell's [[Ord Mantell Central Authority|government]].<ref name="TOR" /> The couple's home of Talloran village was the first village on Avilatan taken by the Separatists,<ref name="TalloranCodex">{{TORcite|type=codex|Talloran village}}</ref> who barricaded it against Republic attacks. At that [[Time/Legends|time]], Bellis worked for the Republic by [[Spy/Legends|spying]] on the Separatists' activities. Despite the Separatist occupation of their village, Lin and Bellis continued to live at their home, and Bellis frequently risked his life to provide the Republic with intelligence on the Separatists.<ref name="TOR" />In the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Date">{{TOR dates}}</ref> the Republic needed information on the whereabouts of a recently stolen [[ZR-57 orbital strike bomb]], which caused the Republic to call on Bellis for help. After obtaining information on the bomb's whereabouts, Bellis went to [[Mission to Talloran village (Havoc Squad)|meet]] a newly recruited [[Meteor (Havoc Squad)|sergeant]] of [[Havoc Squad]], a [[Republic Special Forces Division|Republic Special Forces]] unit, in Talloran village. However, Bellis was [[Death/Legends|killed]] by Separatists before the [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]] arrived. Upon discovering that Bellis was dead, the Havoc Squad sergeant went to the couple's home to retrieve information about the location of the bomb from Bellis's [[field box]], a type of case used by Republic [[Agent/Legends|agents]] to store valuable information. When Lin found the sergeant inside her home, she first believed that the individual was a Separatist [[Soldier/Legends|soldier]] breaking into her house. However, she soon realized her mistake, and rebuked the sergeant for risking the discovery of her husband's job as a spy. Then the sergeant informed her about the death of Bellis, which upset Lin greatly, and caused her to become enraged at the Republic and the sergeant, both of whom she blamed for the death of Bellis. Due to her anger over her husband's death, Lin initially refused to give the sergeant Bellis's field box.<ref name="TOR" />{{GameLSmechanics}}The sergeant expressed condolences to Lin over the death of the Bellis and attempted to persuade Lin to hand over her husband's field box, saying that Bellis would want the Republic to have the information and that there were many lives at stake. For a short time, Lin continued to conceal the location of the field box despite the sergeant's entreaties. However, Lin eventually showed the sergeant its location in her home at which time the sergeant advised her to leave Talloran before the Separatists attacked her home, then left Lin to grieve for her husband.<ref name="TOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Yael
description: A [[Cathar (species)|Cathar]], Yael lived on [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] in [[Talloran village]] during the [[Great Galactic War]]. But during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], the [[Mantellian Separatist Movement]] began a [[Separatist War|civil war]] in an attempt to secede from the Republic, and separatists stormed Yael's home village of Talloran. The separatists forced the settlers out of the village, destroying many of the buildings and causing them to flee to nearby [[Fort Garnik]].The settlers camped outside of the Republic base, but their lack of supplies forced Yael to steal medical supplies from the Republic. When one of [[Sergeant/Legends|Sergeant]] [[Hurd]]'s men fell asleep guarding Garnik's most recent medical shipment, Yael stole it and fled back to the settler's camp. But a group of separatists stole the shipment from her before she could distribute the supplies. When Hurd asked an agent of the Republic to investigate the missing supplies, they followed the guard's description of a female Cathar to Yael.{{Quote|I'm sorry, Ryso.  I don't have any medicine for you today.''" <br> "''It hurts!|Yael and [[Ryso]], a refugee child.|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}The Cathar forced the agent to agree to bring her back the supplies in exchange for her revealing the location of the separatists. She informed them that the separatists had retreated to Talloran, so the hero traveled to the village and retrieved the medicine from them. They returned to Yael and gave her the supplies, allowing her to treat the injured and sick settlers—including [[Ryso]], a young [[Human/Legends|human]] child who had asked for Yael's help before the hero had arrived.

name: Tweeta
description: Tweeta was a [[Rodian/Legends|Rodian]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who worked as a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], a conflict between the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]] and the Republic. During the war, she helped the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic's]] [[Republic Army|army]] and worked with them on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] in the [[Bright Jewel system/Legends|Bright Jewel system]]<ref name="NEC">''[[The New Essential Chronology]]''</ref> of the [[Mid Rim/Legends|Mid Rim]],<ref name="EGPM">''[[The Essential Guide to Planets and Moons]]''</ref>. While stationed on the planet she and all Republic forces aided the corrupt local government in fighting the [[Mantellian Separatist Movement]].<ref name="TOR" />During the civil war she stayed in [[Fort Garnik]], a Republic stronghold on the planet, where she worked with another Rodian named [[Wentell Pron]]. Pron was looking to make new connections in the smuggling world whilst on the planet and Tweeta would direct anyone she met who she suspected shared her trade to him.<ref name="TOR" />{{Gamemechanics|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}Tweeta at one point in the war directed a [[Voidhound|Smuggler]] who worked with [[Rendia Freight]] to Wentell. The smuggler paid the Rodian at least once to teach them a number of combat and smuggling techniques.<ref name="TOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Unidentified zombie Nightsister
description: Absolutely nothing is known about her life.During the [[Battle of Dathomir (Clone Wars)|Battle of Dathomir]], [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] leader [[Mother (title)/Legends|Mother]] [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]] had [[Daka/Legends|Old Daka]] summon an army of dead Nightsister warriors to fight against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|droid army]] led by [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]]. The undead Nightsisters turned the tide of battle, allowing former [[Dark Acolyte]] [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] to fight Grievous directly.However, when Grievous was overpowered by Ventress, he ordered his droids to begin firing on the Nightsisters. Ventress was injured, but the undead army then began to attack Grievous. This undead Nightsister managed to jump on the general's back, but he managed to grab her and tore off her arms and threw her to the ground. Grievous then stabbed her with one of his [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]], but since she was undead, she rose up again.In the end, once the Separatists killed Old Daka, her spells faded and the undead Nightsisters, including this one, died again.

name: Synoda
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]], [[Doctor/Legends|Doctor]] Synoda joined the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic's]] [[Taris Resettlement Initiative|resettlement project]] on [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] to investigate [[Colu's syndrome]], a rare disease that afflicted only the descendants of the survivors of Taris' [[Destruction of Taris|destruction]]. Her own ancestors had fled Taris [[3956 BBY|three centuries]] ago, meaning that Dr. Synoda was likely afflicted by Colu's syndrome as well.<ref name="TOR" />Synoda based her research in a small camp in the Republic Reconstruction Grounds, near [[Tower command station|Waypoint Station Aurek]]. As that area was rife with [[rakghoul]]s, [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]], and wild [[ferrazid hound]]s, Synoda employed a unit of Republic [[Sentry droid/Legends|sentry droids]].<ref name="TOR" />During the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|reconstituted Sith Empire]], she asked a traveling hero to help her with her research. Synoda asked them to recover the records of the Tarisians who lived before the bombardment from the ruins of [[Dynamet General Hospital]], which was overrun with rakghouls and infected sentients. The hero was able to recover the records, which she believed would greatly aid her research and help alleviate the suffering of the Tarisian descendants.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Butch
description: Butch was created through alchemy at Anil Kesh by [[Je'daii Master|Master]] Quan-Jang and Shae Koda, a [[Je'daii Journeyer]] who was his apprentice. When Quan-Jang and Shae Koda took the rancor-dragon outside from the laboratory of Anil Kesh, Butch was restive and finally broke free, nearly dragging Shae Koda to the deadly [[Chasm]]. The behaviour of the beast was explained by the [[Force Storm (Tython)|Force Storm]], brewing around Tython and affecting all the living things. Finally, Quan-Jang had to intervene and to subdue the rancor using the [[animal bond]] technique.Some time later, Shae Koda rode Butch to the [[Rift]] trying to find a place that she had seen in her vision. She was soon joined by two other Journeyers, [[Sek'nos Rath]] and [[Tasha Ryo]], who had shared the same vision with her. They witnessed the crash of an [[Rakata|alien]] ship and then, coming to see the crash site, found an [[Escape pod/Legends|escape pod]] with an only survivor; that survivor was [[Tau (individual)|Xesh]], a [[Force Hound]] of the [[Infinite Empire]]. Xesh attacked the Je'daii and during their fight threw Butch from the cliff into an acid pool, to Koda's outrage. He then escaped deeper to the [[Abyss of Ruh|Abyss]], and the Journeyers began to chase him. Later Quan-Jang came to investigate the crash site, too, together with two [[Je'daii Ranger]]s, [[Rori Fenn]] and [[Hawk Ryo]]. They found the escape pod and the broken blades of the Journeyers, when suddenly they were attacked by the wounded and furious Butch, who charged at them from the forest. But Quan-Jang managed to calm her down and healed her wounds and acid burns. After that he flew on her back to search for the Journeyers and the alien stranger. But the Force Storm was getting stronger, exhausting the rancor, so finally Quan-Jang had to leave Butch to rest and to continue the search on foot.A year later, when the Infinite Empire invaded the [[Tython system]], Shae Koda fought in many battles riding her rancor-dragon. During the [[Second battle of Tython|final battle]]the leader of the Rakata, [[Skal'nas]], descended to the depth of the Chasm together with Xesh and the captive [[Daegen Lok]] to find the [[Infinity Gate]]. Shae Koda followed them riding Butch.During the battle at the Infinity Gate Butch was chased away by [[Force lightning/Legends|Force lightnings]], Daegen Lok fought Skal'nas, but was badly wounded by him, and Shae Koda fought Xesh and managed to persuade him to return to the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|Light]].He then turned against Skal'nas and killed him.Lok tried to persuade Koda to get away with Xesh using his [[Jetpack/Legends|jetpack]] and to leave him there, as the power of the jetpack was not enough to carry all three of them. At that moment Butch returned to Shae Koda, so all of them could escape from the Chasm riding the rancor-dragon.

name: Dakka Fasser
description: In [[3 BBY/Legends|3 BBY]], she was present at the [[Stark Compound]] to arrest [[Jahan Cross]] for the murder of [[Dah'lis Stark]]. When Cross protested, stating the evidence against him was fake, she told the Imperial agent that he was being prosecuted because [[Iaclyn Stark]] wanted him to be charged. She continued her investigation only to be interrupted when Cross escaped his confinement and stole a [[Speeder bike/Legends|speeder bike]]. She ordered all her troops to stop him.<ref name="AotE2">''[[Agent of the Empire—Iron Eclipse, Part 2]]''</ref> . After Cross was shot down during his escape, Fasser viewed the crash site and demanded that evidence be found that Cross had perished in the wreck. She refused to be held accountable for the damage and promised to place the blame on [[Myrsk]] and [[Dimity]].<ref name="AotE3">''[[Agent of the Empire—Iron Eclipse, Part 3]]''</ref>

name: Unidentified Zabrak Soldier (Farfalla's Knights)
description: A [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], the warrior served [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Valenthyne Farfalla]], a [[Jedi Lord]] who maintained a feudal kingdom on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim Territories]]. During the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order's]] [[New Sith Wars|war]] with the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] [[Skere Kaan]]'s [[Brotherhood of Darkness]], she answered the call of her Lord to join together with a band of [[Farfalla's Knights|three hundred warriors]], made up of [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knights]] and commoners, to reinforce the entrenched forces of the [[Army of Light]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ruusan/Legends|Ruusan]]. Armed with a [[Sword/Legends|sword]], the soldier fought in the [[Seventh Battle of Ruusan|final battle]] of the [[Ruusan campaign|campaign]].<ref name="jvs" />

name: Alma
description: Alma was a [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] who served the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] as part of [[Imperial Intelligence/Legends|Imperial Intelligence]]. During the war Alma was sent to the Republic held [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]] where she acted as a [[Spy/Legends|spy]]. She went under cover as an occupant of [[Talloran village]] and spied on the nearby Republic [[Fort Garnik]]. However a [[Separatist War|Civil war]] broke out on Ord Mantell during her time there. The [[Mantellian Separatist Movement]] opposed the corrupt planetary government which was supported by the Republic. The separatists managed to capture Talloran village and Alma was forced to flee.<ref name="TOR" />Alma ended up in a refugee camp outside of Fort Garnik where she realized in her rush to escape Talloran she had left behind a necklace which she used to communicate with Imperial intelligence.<ref name="TOR" />{{Gamemechanics|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}She asked a [[Smuggler/Legends|smuggler]] named [[Voidhound|Ace]] and a [[Meteor (Havoc Squad)|member]] of [[Havoc Squad]] whom she met in the camp to recover the amulet claiming it was an heirloom that had belonged to her great great Grandmother.<ref name="TOR" />The pair traveled to Taloran to recover it but there encountered a member of the [[Republic Strategic Information Service]] named [[Ebenga]] whom informed them of Alma's true nature as he had been observing her for several months suspecting she was a spy. He asked them to bring the amulet to him instead as he needed it to confirm his suspicions which they did. He thanked them and later arrested Alma using the amulet as evidence against her.<ref name="TOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Airen
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Airen lived on the [[Outer Rim Territories/Legends|Outer Rim]] planet during the [[Great Galactic War]] and subsequent [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|resurgent Sith Empire]]. By [[3643 BBY]], she had begun serving as the mayor of Espelar, a Human settlement near the native [[Jawa/Legends|Jawa]] settlement of [[Camp Karnori]]. Espelar was located in the northern part of the [[Jundland Wastes/Legends|Jundland Wastes]], the region just south of the [[City/Legends|city]] of [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]], and the settlement also had a small trading post to the west.<ref name="TOR" />When the former [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Galen Besk]] asked a Republic-allied individual to stop a group of Imperial [[Saboteur/Legends|saboteurs]] at Espelar's trading post, the individual came to Airen after they eliminated the Imperials. Her settlement was constantly plagued by broken equipment, sandstorms, and attacks by [[Pirate/Legends|pirates]] and the native [[Tusken Raider/Legends|Sand People]], so the individual offered to help out by aiding [[Junter Galt]], the head of the area's branch of the [[Citizens' Militia|Anchorhead Guard]], in training the new recruits.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Kahrin Wek
description: A [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Rutian/Legends|Rutian]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], Kahrin Wek joined the [[Republic Military/Legends|Republic Military]] sometime before [[3643 BBY]]. She served on the ruined [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Taris/Legends|Taris]] during the later stages of the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], where she was stationed at [[Bomber command post|Waypoint Station Draay]].<ref name="Supplies" />Wek served as [[Quartermaster/Legends|quartermaster]] under [[Commander/Legends|Commander]] [[Gardit]], the base's commanding officer. In that role, she ensured that the Republic's forward bases, like [[Border assault post|Waypoint Station Morne]] and [[Lytle Research Outpost]], received the necessary supplies.<ref name="Supplies" /> However, Wek suspected her superior to be corrupt&mdash;the [[Human/Legends|human]] used his position to ensure good rations and benefits for himself, while the rest of the base was forced to survive on meager supplies. When one of the base's supply ships was set to leave for the nearest supply depot, Wek noticed that one of the ship's engines was damaged. Gardit, however, dismissed her concerns and allowed the ship to leave.<ref name="Prove">{{TORcite|type=bonus|Prove Gardit's Corruption}}</ref> The ship had barely lifted off when it crashed in a nearby swamp infested with [[bogstalker]]s.<ref name="Supplies" />{{GameLS}}When Gardit asked a Republic-allied individual to help recover the supplies from the downed craft, he sent them to Wek for the location of the crash.<ref name="Supplies" /> Informing the individual of her suspicions of Gardit, the Twi'lek convinced the individual to help expose her superior. She gave the individual a holocamera along with the ship's location, telling them to record the damaged engine as evidence.<ref name="Prove" />The individual succeeded, recovering all of the supplies that remained,<ref name="Supplies" /> and returned to Wek with the evidence she needed. She and the individual then confronted Gardit, who shamefacedly told the pair that he had not realized the ship was that badly damaged&mdash;he thought it could make it to the nearest refueling station. Regardless, Wek planned to court-martial the commander, and thanked the individual for the help.<ref name="Prove" />She also asked them to investigate the fates of the supply convoy that the base had sent to Waypoint Station Morne a week ago. The convoy's crew had not reported anything, and Morne had not received the supplies. She told the individual how to repair the sonic emitters along the trail, which would drive off much of the aggressive wildlife, and gave them the last known location of the convoy. The individual would eventually find the convoy, who had decided to desert, and aided them in getting off-planet.<ref name="AWOL">{{TORcite|type=faction|Republic|AWOL|Taris}}</ref>{{Endgame}}

name: Wintag
description: A human female, Wintag began working for the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] as an archivist during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. Stationed on [[Taris/Legends|Taris]], Wintag was working on the Republic Tarisian Archival Database, but she was allergic to something in the air. While based at [[Border assault post|Waypoint Station Morne]], her sickness prevented her from exploring actively herself. She hired a Republic-allied individual to investigate for her. She was searching for the Tarisian government's archive, which was lost in the bombardment, but she finally managed to locate it. The area was overrun with rakghouls, however, and the hero was forced to battle their way through to the archive. The individual discovered that the archive was in fact the members of the government themselves, frozen in carbonite. The individual would inform Wintag's assistant [[Tiffan Nye]] in [[Olaris]] of the discovery, who began gathering a team to access the archive.<ref name="TOR" />

name: Kora Ryo
description: {{Quote|There's not much left to work with, but from size alone, I can tell you it is not one of our sleeper ships. Too massive.''"<br />"''What of the crew, Kora?''"<br />"''Nothing. Both ship and crew are unlike anything ever seen before in the Tython system. Be wary, Hawk. Since that ship crashed, all of the temples have been reporting unusual weather.|Kora Ryo and her brother-in-law, Ranger Hawk Ryo|Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 2}}A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]]<ref name="DOTJ 0" /> from the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Shikaakwa]],<ref name="DOTJ 7" /> Kora was found to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] and sent to the planet [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] where she was trained by the [[Je'daii Order]] and became a [[Je'daii Master]]. The [[Je'daii Ranger]] [[Hawk Ryo]] introduced Kora to his older brother [[Volnos Ryo]], a member of Shikaakwa's [[Clan Ryo]], one of the [[Nine Houses]] of Shikaakwa and the two fell in love and were [[Marriage/Legends|married]] not long afterwards. Volnos lived a life of study and travel, and Kora bore him a daughter named [[Tasha Ryo|Tasha]].<ref name="DOTJ 0" /> However, when Volnos became [[Baron/Legends|Baron]] of Clan Ryo after his [[Volnos Ryo's father|father's]] [[Death/Legends|death]] in [[25,805 BBY]] during the [[Despot War]] between the [[Despot Queen]] [[Hadiya]] and the Je'daii, Kora dissolved their marriage according to Je'daii law and moved back to Tython with her daughter, as she was disgusted by her husband's new role as a [[Crime lord/Legends|crime lord]].<ref name="DOTJ 7" /> By the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[25,793 BBY]], Kora Ryo had become the [[Je'daii Temple Master|Temple Master]] of [[Kaleth]], the [[Je'daii Temples|Temple]] of Knowledge.<ref name="DOTJ 0" /> Most nights, Ryo meditated before the setting [[Star/Legends|sun]] [[Tythos]].<ref name="DOTJ 7" />[[File:Kora thinking.png|thumb|left|140px|Kora Ryo in Kaleth]]When an [[Devourer (Rakatan ship)|unknown ship]] crashed on Tython, [[Je'daii Ranger]]s [[Rori Fenn]] and [[Hawk Ryo]] were dispatched with Temple Master [[Quan-Jang]] to investigate the crash, and Master Ryo analyzed their ships's readings as the three scouted the crash site. From the data, Ryo was able to determine that the ship was far larger than any of the [[Tythan]] [[Sleeper ship/Legends|sleeper ships]], and both the crew and the ship were foreign to the [[Tython system]]. Analyzing reports from the other temples, Ryo also realized that a powerful [[Force storm (weather)|Force Storm]] was growing across Tython.<ref name="DOTJ 3" /> As the storm grew in strength, Temple Master [[Ketu]] summoned the other Temple Masters of the [[Je'daii Council]] in a [[Hologram/Legends|holoconference]] across Tython, where Ryo informed the other Temple Masters that her research showed that the current storm was of the same strength as the one that had occurred on the day of the [[Tho Yor Arrival]] thousands of years earlier.<ref name="DotJ4">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 4]]''</ref>When questioned by Master [[Ruhr]], Ryo voiced her belief that the storm had been caused by the crash of the unknown ship. Kora was alarmed to learn that her daughter Tasha was one of three [[Je'daii Journeyer]]s who were pursuing the [[Tau (individual)|lone survivor]] of the crash into the [[Rift]], an enormous ravine on Tython.<ref name="DotJ4" /> Shortly afterward, as the storm continued to grow in strength, Ryo joined with the other Temple Masters through [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and aided Quan-Jang in shifting the balance of the Force on Tython, dissipating the storm's fury. After the threat of the storm had passed, the Council convened to judge the case of the survivor, a powerful [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]] warrior named Xesh, and they decided to exile him to the [[Moon/Legends|moon]] of [[Bogan]] so he could regain his balance.<ref name="DOTJ 5">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: Force Storm 5]]''</ref>Several [[Standard week/Legends|weeks]] later, Kora was attempting to meditate at sunset at Kaleth, but her meditations were interrupted by a holocall from Volnos, who demanded that she forsake the Je'daii and return to Shikaakwa with their daughter as she was still his wife by Shikaakwan law. However, Kora refused, countering that she had dissolved their marriage according to Je'daii law, and she reminded Volnos that his status as a crime lord prevented their family from ever being together. Several days later, after the mad Je'daii [[Daegen Lok]] had been recaptured after his escape from Bogan, Ryo and the other Masters met in conference to sentence Lok. The insane Je'daii demanded that the Masters force his friend [[Hawk Ryo]] to confess what he had seen in the [[Chasm]], a rift in Tython's surface that caused nightmarish hallucinations and was the cause of Lok's insanity.<ref name="DOTJ 10">''[[Dawn of the Jedi: The Prisoner of Bogan 5]]''</ref>

name: Che'nash
description: Che'nash was a part of a mercenary team, hired by the Sith Empire and deployed to the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ilum/Legends|Ilum]] at the end of the Cold War. Her team was tasked with uncovering information on a [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] operation code named "[[Battle of Ilum|Shatterstorm]]", which involved the Republic's [[Talz/Legends|Talz]] commandos. However, they were unable to complete their mission alone, and were forced to seek the help of other Imperial operatives.<ref name="TOR1" />

name: Hilma Kim
description: Kim was a descendant of [[Sélima Kim]] and, with her [[Twin/Legends|twin]] brother [[Sven Kim|Sven]], the heir of the [[Sélima Kim (organization)|familial business]]. As her brother, she was beautiful, arrogant and ruthless.A majority of the Sélima Kim members and residents didn't know who she was, regarding her as a mere [[Pirate/Legends|pirate]]. She always used the spy network of the base to spot the better business and join the raids with the ''[[Bloodthirsty]]'', her starship.Some in the organization thought that Hilma and her brother could have shared more than a fraternal relationship.

name: Urinth
description: She resided in the [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]] on [[Korriban]], and represented the Intelligence Operations of the Sith. Once she told an [[Sith Acolyte|acolyte]] that she had captured a [[Quorian Dorjis|Jedi]] trying to infiltrate the Academy. Through sorcery and drugs, she manipulated his mind so when he returned to the Order he would unknowingly feed false information to the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]]. The information was supposed to lead some Outer Rim colonies to reduce their defenses, so the Sith could destroy them. To bring the information to the Republic, the acolyte had to gain the Jedi's trust and then secretly release him so he'd escape without questioning.

name: Isila Drutch
description: {{Quote|Four years later I walked the edge and earned my white hat&mdash;now I wasn't Drutch anymore but TD-4388, 291st Legion Dalisor.|Isila Drutch on becoming a stormtrooper|The Essential Guide to Warfare}}Isila Drutch, a [[Sexes/Legends|female]], was from the [[New Territories/Legends|New Territories]] [[Planet/Legends|planet]] of [[Parshoone]],<ref name="Warfare" /> and was born prior to [[10 BBY/Legends|10 BBY]].<ref name="Note" /> Her [[Isila Drutch's father|father]] served on the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] [[Tector-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Tector''-class Star Destroyer]] [[Archer (Tector-class)|''Archer'']] at the end of the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], a conflict between the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] and the Republic, which would later be transformed into the [[Galactic Empire/Legends|Galactic Empire]]. Even though her [[Parent/Legends|father]] talked about his [[Navy/Legends|navy]] [[Standard day/Legends|days]], Drutch was one for [[Ground warfare|solid ground]]. She grew up drawing fortifications and arranging skirmish lines instead of playing with [[Tooka doll/Legends|Tooka dolls]].<ref name="Warfare" />As Drutch grew up, she was never idle and worked with the rest of the Parshoone inhabitants. At the age of seventeen, she applied to the Imperial-aligned [[Parshoone Sector Service Academy]] where she trained in an [[Army/Legends|army]] concentration. After her first [[Standard year/Legends|year]] there, Drutch was at the top of her class, which caused the [[Parshoone Service Academy commandant|commandant]] to offer to sponsor her at the prestigious [[Raithal Academy/Legends|Raithal Academy]]. Drutch instead asked for an alternative: the equally prestigious [[Academy of Carida]]. A [[Unidentified Imperial officer (Carida Academy)|major]] was sent out from [[Carida/Legends|Carida]] to assess Drutch, and took her through three [[Standard day/Legends|days]] of very hard training, with Drutch not being able to [[Sleep/Legends|sleep]] during the whole test. The [[Major/Legends|major]], having finished assessing her, approved her transfer to Carida. Drutch later arrived on Carida, and although she had to put up with the strange looks shot at her because she was female, they later subsided because she had proven herself as fit as any of them.<ref name="Warfare" />After four years of training, Drutch became a part of the [[Stormtrooper Corps/Legends|Stormtrooper Corps]] as she joined the [[291st Legion Dalisor]], and was given the designation TD-4388. She became the first female [[Stormtrooper/Legends|stormtrooper]] in her [[Company/Legends|company]], though there were two others in her [[Legion/Legends|legion]]; [[TD-5144]] and [[TD-1123]]. While in the 291st, Drutch shared the [[Barracks/Legends|barracks]] with the men even though she was female. Sometime after becoming a stormtrooper, Drutch was on leave in a low-quality [[Unidentified cantina (Isila Drutch)|cantina]] when some members of her squad pointed out a poster of a female stormtrooper in femtrooper gear, an overly feminized version of stormtrooper armor, to Drutch, and asked why Drutch was not in the right gear. This incident caused Drutch to laugh. In [[33 ABY/Legends|33 ABY]], Drutch was still with the 291st, though the Empire had been replaced with the [[Imperial Remnant]], and she had a set of memoirs documenting her life.<ref name="Warfare" />

name: Kasi Sha'Rhil
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Kasi Sha'Rhil was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Studying at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]], Sha'Rhil ascended to the rank of [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] after the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation's]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] and the reemergence of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. Assigned to a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] to continue training, Sha'Rhil constructed a [[blue]]-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to wield throughout her career.<ref name="KSW" />In response to the Sith's reappearance the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] announced that it would open several [[Jedi outpost|outposts]] across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] for supplemental group training. Assigning Padawan Sha'Rhil to [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], the High Council placed [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mavra Zane]] in command of her and a number of other students to travel to the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] homeworld aboard a [[Unidentified Consular-class cruiser (Mavra Zane)|''Consular''-class cruiser]]. Upon the group's arrival, the students were greeted by [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] the [[Jedi Watchman|Watchman]] of Kashyyyk, along with Masters [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Upon settling in at the new [[Jedi outpost (Kashyyyk)|chapter house]], the classes quickly began and the Padawan's continued on their path to knowledge.<ref name="KSW" />During Sha'Rhil's time on the planet, the armies of the [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild]], combined with [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]], [[Attack on Kashyyyk|attacked]] the planet and the Wookiee village near the chapter house. Rallying behind Masters Yoda and Zane, the apprentices were able to repel the Trandoshans with few casualties. Following Master Yoda's departure, the students were attacked again. This time, Master Zane and several students were captured while the chapter house and most of the apprentices were killed. Sha'Rhil, among the survivors, eventually found herself above [[Felucia/Legends|Felucia]] on the Commerce Guild's [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]], the ''[[Providence]]''. After the Padawans and Zane were freed from captivity, the Jedi managed to escape aboard the ''[[Star Runner]]'' and make an emergency landing on the planet below. Joining with [[Mak Pra]] and the [[Felucian/Legends|Felucian]] [[Rebellion on Felucia|resistance movement]], Sha'Rhil and her companions attempted to capture Commerce Guild Presidente [[Shu Mai/Legends|Shu Mai]] and prevent her from [[Trihexalon attack on Coruscant|attacking]] Coruscant with [[Trihexalon]] missiles. The Jedi rushed to Coruscant and smashed the Commerce Guild's fleet, ending the crisis and saving Coruscant.<ref name="KSW" />

name: Fenella Druce
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Fenella Druce was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Studying at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]], Druce ascended to the rank of [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] after the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation's]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] and the reemergence of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. Assigned to a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] to continue training, Druce constructed a [[Color/Legends|green]]-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to wield throughout her career.<ref name="KSW" />In response to the Sith's reappearance the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] announced that it would open several [[Jedi outpost]]s across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] for supplemental group training. Assigning Padawan Druce to [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], the High Council placed [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mavra Zane]] in command of her and a number of other students to travel to the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] homeworld aboard a [[Unidentified Consular-class cruiser (Mavra Zane)|''Consular''-class cruiser]]. Upon the group's arrival, the students were greeted by [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] the [[Jedi Watchman|Watchman]] of Kashyyyk, along with Masters [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Upon settling in at the new [[Jedi outpost (Kashyyyk)|outpost]], the classes quickly began and the Padawan's continued on their path to knowledge.<ref name="KSW" />During Druce's time on the planet, the armies of the [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild]], combined with [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]], [[Attack on Kashyyyk|attacked]] the planet and the Wookiee village near the outpost. Rallying behind Masters Yoda and Zane, the apprentices were able to repel the Trandoshans with few casualties. Following Master Yoda's departure, the students were attacked again. This time, Master Zane and several students were captured while the chapter house was destroyed and most of the apprentices were killed. Druce, among the survivors, eventually found herself above [[Felucia/Legends|Felucia]] on the Commerce Guild's [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]], the ''[[Providence]]''. After the Padawans and Zane were freed from captivity, the Jedi managed to escape aboard the ''[[Star Runner]]'' and make an emergency landing on the planet below. Joining with [[Mak Pra]] and the [[Felucian/Legends|Felucian]] [[Rebellion on Felucia|resistance movement]], Druce and her companions attempted to capture Commerce Guild President [[Shu Mai/Legends|Shu Mai]] and prevent her from [[Trihexalon attack on Coruscant|attacking]] Coruscant with [[Trihexalon]] missiles. The Jedi rushed to Coruscant and smashed the Commerce Guild's fleet, ending the crisis and saving Coruscant.<ref name="KSW" />

name: Ara Barotta
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]], Ara Barotta was [[Jedi training/Legends|trained]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]]. Studying at the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] as an [[Jedi Initiate|Initiate]], Barotta ascended to the rank of [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] after the [[Trade Federation of Planets|Trade Federation's]] [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|invasion]] of [[Naboo/Legends|Naboo]] and the reemergence of the [[Sith/Legends|Sith]]. Assigned to a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] to continue training, Barotta constructed a [[Color/Legends|blue]]-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]] to wield throughout her career.<ref name="KSW" />In response to the Sith's reappearance the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] announced that it would open several [[Jedi outpost]]s across [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] for supplemental group training. Assigning Padawan Barotta to [[Kashyyyk/Legends|Kashyyyk]], the High Council placed [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Mavra Zane]] in command of her and a number of other students to travel to the [[Wookiee/Legends|Wookiee]] homeworld aboard a [[Unidentified Consular-class cruiser (Mavra Zane)|''Consular''-class cruiser]]. Upon the group's arrival, the students were greeted by [[Grand Master/Legends|Grand Master]] [[Yoda/Legends|Yoda]] the [[Jedi Watchman|Watchman]] of Kashyyyk, along with Masters [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu]] and [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]]. Upon settling in at the new [[Jedi outpost (Kashyyyk)|outpost]], the classes quickly began and the Padawan's continued on their path to knowledge.<ref name="KSW" />During Barotta's time on the planet, the armies of the [[Commerce Guild/Legends|Commerce Guild]], combined with [[Trandoshan/Legends|Trandoshan]] [[Slavery/Legends|slavers]], [[Attack on Kashyyyk|attacked]] the planet and the Wookiee village near the outpost. Rallying behind Masters Yoda and Zane, the apprentices were able to repel the Trandoshans with few casualties. Following Master Yoda's departure, the students were attacked again. This time, Master Zane and several students were captured while the chapter house and most of the apprentices were killed. Barotta, among the survivors, eventually found herself above [[Felucia/Legends|Felucia]] on the Commerce Guild's [[Capital ship/Legends|capital ship]], the ''[[Providence]]''. After the Padawans and Zane were freed from captivity, the Jedi managed to escape aboard the ''[[Star Runner]]'' and make an emergency landing on the planet below. Joining with [[Mak Pra]] and the [[Felucian/Legends|Felucian]] [[Rebellion on Felucia|resistance movement]], Barotta and her companions attempted to capture Commerce Guild President [[Shu Mai/Legends|Shu Mai]] and prevent her from [[Trihexalon attack on Coruscant|attacking]] Coruscant with [[Trihexalon]] missiles. The Jedi rushed to Coruscant and smashed the Commerce Guild's fleet, ending the crisis and saving Coruscant.<ref name="KSW" />

name: Elana Thul
description: {{GameDS}}When [[Darth Nox|Kallig]] visited [[Alderaan/Legends|Alderaan]] in search for an ancient artifact of [[Tulak Hord]], Elana aided Kallig and gave the apprentice much intel of the enemies of House Thul and the Sith Empire. While Kallig was searching for the artifact, Elana asked the Inquisitor to help raid the [[House of Organa/Legends|House of Organa]].{{Endgame}}{{Char-stub}}

name: Sophia Farash
description: A [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]] [[Human/Legends|Human]], Sophia Farash was brought to the [[Vitiate|Sith Emperor]] during her childhood, who impregnated her with his dark essence turning Farash into one of his [[Children of the Emperor]].{{GameLS}}During the war between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]], Sophia was an [[Ambassador/Legends|Ambassador]] of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] on [[Voss]], where she became a noble friend to [[Gaden-Ko]], a [[Voss Mystics|Mystic in training]]. She eventually helped the [[The Barsen'thor|Barsen'thor]] when the young [[Jedi Consular]] arrived on Voss in search of an alliance against the Empire, suggesting that the Barsen'thor help her friend Gaden-Ko in his training to gain the trust of the [[Voss (species)|Voss]]. However, when Gaden-Ko came back with the Barsen'thor to ally with the Republic, Sophia met them with two [[Sith Acolyte]]s by her side and revealed herself to be a child of the Sith Emperor.Gaden-Ko was clueless as to why she betrayed him and the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]], but Sophia told him not to worry, and that his true destiny was just the beginning. She and the acolytes engaged the Barsen'thor, but the Jedi took the upper hand and defeated them in combat. Sophia was wounded and was surprised how the strong the Jedi was in the [[Light side of the Force/Legends|light side]], since as a child she believed that the dark side was the true power. Sophia revealed to Barsen'thor that she was hoping the pilgrimage would test Gaden-Ko's power, and hopefully result in the Barsen'thor's death. She feared that the [[Syo Bakarn|First Son]] would kill her for her failure, but the Barsen'thor believed that they could save her from the First Son's wrath and tried to convince her to let go of the [[Dark side of the Force/Legends|dark side]].Sophia then explained to the Jedi about how the First Son served the Emperor. At this moment, Gaden-Ko said that he was upset that his own friend betrayed him. Sophia apologized for her actions, saying she wanted to save him and allow the people of Voss to serve the Emperor and Sith Empire. She was taken into custody by the Voss officers, who said she would be forced to take the [[Step of Harmony]], a Voss sentence where a criminal would fall off the top of the mountain of [[Voss-Ka]]. Despite the Barsen'thor's argument that the sentence was barbaric, Sophia was taken away.{{Endgame}}However, before her sentence could be carried out, Sophia overpowered the [[Voss commandos]] escorting her and escaped.<ref name="Nathema">{{TORcite|type=flashpoint|The Nathema Conspiracy}}</ref>

name: Unidentified Handmaiden 1
description: She and another handmaiden worked for [[Confederacy of Independent Systems|Separatist]] [[Mina Bonteri/Legends|Mina Bonteri]] and helped [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] get past the droid controls by distracting the [[B1 battle droid/Legends|droid's]] attention. She was later seen traveling with Bonteri to [[Mina Bonteri's house/Legends|her house]].

name: Unidentified Handmaiden 2
description: She and another handmaiden worked for [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatist]] [[Mina Bonteri/Legends|Mina Bonteri]] and helped [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] get past the droid controls by distracting the [[B1 battle droid/Legends|droid's]] attention. She was later seen traveling with Bonteri to [[Mina Bonteri's house/Legends|her house]].

name: Travi Pott
description: {{Quote|Let me put it this way: I've been on Ord Mantell six months. I've lost two fingers, six squad-mates and more credits than I want to think about.|Travi Pott|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}[[File:TraviPott2-TOR.png|thumb|left|180px|Sergeant Pott looking over a potential recruit]]A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Travi Pott was a [[Republic soldier|soldier]] who served in the [[Republic Army]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], a period of unrest between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]].<ref name="Destroy the Beacons" /> By the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Date">{{TOR_dates}}</ref> Pott had attained the [[Military rank/Legends|rank]] of [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]] and had been mistakenly sent to fight in<ref name="Destroy the Beacons" /> the [[Separatist War]]<ref name="War">{{TORcite|type=message|Date night|Doc}} identifies the conflict as the "[[Separatist War]]."</ref> between a [[Mantellian Separatist Movement|Separatist Movement]] and the Republic-backed [[Ord Mantell Central Authority|government]] on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Ord Mantell/Legends|Ord Mantell]].<ref name="Destroy the Beacons" />Pott was eventually stationed on the island of [[Avilatan]] and tasked by her [[Unidentified Republic officer|commanding officer]] with leading a [[Travi Pott's squad|squad]] to destroy several Separatist [[Jammer|jamming beacons]] on [[Savrip Island]], a smaller island just off Avilatan's coast. The beacons were jamming the [[Navigation computer/Legends|navigation systems]] on Republic supply [[Starship/Legends|ships]], which caused many of them to crash upon their approach to the island. Pott and her squad made several efforts to take out the beacons, but their attempts were unsuccessful due to the presence of [[Mine/Legends|mines]], Separatist forces, and dangerous beasts known as [[Mantellian Savrip/Legends|Savrips]]. During the fighting, Pott's squad [[Death/Legends|lost]] six members, while half of the squad received life-threatening burns, and Pott lost two [[Limb/Legends|fingers]] and a large amount of [[Galactic Credit Standard|credits]]. In addition to the heavy losses suffered by her forces, Pott also had difficulties with her equipment, which was not [[Water/Legends|waterproofed]].<ref name="Destroy the Beacons" />At some point during 3643 [[Galactic Standard Calendar|BBY]],<ref name="Date" /> Pott gave up trying to use her squad to destroy the beacons due to the heavy casualties her [[unit]] had suffered. Instead, she took up position near a [[Medical droid/Legends|medical droid]] on the shore of [[Avilatan]] within sight of Savrip Island. By that [[Time/Legends|time]], she had become bitter and sarcastic about her situation and believed that her [[Commanding officer/Legends|commanding officer]] was incompetent. However, Pott had gained access to some discretionary funds and decided that it would be better to hire someone to take out the beacons for her.<ref name="Destroy the Beacons" />{{Gamemechanics}}Eventually, after being on Ord Mantell for six [[Standard month/Legends|months]], Pott enticed at least one individual who was affiliated with the Republic to venture onto the island and take out the jamming beacons using data and maps that she supplied. With the beacons destroyed and the threat to the Republic supply ships ended, Pott expressed surprise at the successful completion of the assignment and distributed the promised rewards to the involved party. Following the destruction of the beacons, she decided to hold her position until the Republic gave her a new assignment.<ref name="Destroy the Beacons" />{{Endgame}}

name: Veshta
description: {{Quote|No Jedi will be able to stand against you.|Veshta, to a Sith acolyte|Star Wars: The Old Republic}}A [[Human/Legends|Human]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Veshta was a [[Sith Warrior]] affiliated with the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]], a period of unrest between the Empire and the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]].<ref name="TOR" /> Around the [[Standard year/Legends|year]] [[3643 BBY]],{{Fact}} she was on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Korriban]] guarding one of the entrances to the [[Tomb of Ajunta Pall|tomb]] of the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Sith Lord]] [[Ajunta Pall]] with a [[Sith Inquisitor]] named [[Gesen]], an [[Imperial soldier]] [[Sergeant/Legends|sergeant]] named [[Cormun (Imperial Army)|Cormun]], and Cormun's [[Trooper/Legends|troops]]. She also provided training to [[Sith Acolyte]]s learning to be [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] Warriors at the nearby [[Sith Academy (Korriban)|Sith Academy]].<ref name="TOR" />{{Gamemechanics}}While in the tomb, Veshta spoke with an [[Empire's Wrath|acolyte]], against whom she believed no [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] would be able to stand. She encouraged the acolyte's pursuit of power and reminded the individual of a portion of the [[Code of the Sith/Legends|Sith Code]].<ref name="TOR" />{{Endgame}}

name: Renata Alde
description: {{GameDS}}In [[3643 BBY]], Lady Renata was confronted in her estate by a [[Empire's Wrath|Sith Warrior]] sent to her by Duke [[Kendoh Thul]]. Kendoh made several advances to Renata in the past and believed she had information concerning her former [[handmaiden]] [[Jaesa Willsaam]], he also requested the Sith to bring Renata to him. The Sith slew her [[Bodyguard/Legends|bodyguard]] [[Windredd]] and threatened Renata, who explained that Jaesa was a handmaiden not to her, but to [[Gesselle Organa]] of [[House of Organa/Legends|House Organa]] and begged not to take her to Kendoh. The Warrior and [[FimmRess]] ignored her pleas and took her to the Duke.{{Endgame}}

name: Gesselle Organa
description: {{GameDS}}During the war against the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]] and the [[House of Thul]], Gesselle Organa and her troops were protecting a tremendously powerful force field, which was powered by siphoning power directly from Alderaan's [[Planet/Legends|planetary]] generator. However, a [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] [[Empire's Wrath|apprentice]] of [[Darth Baras]] managed to get inside and sabotaged the generator to force it into the backup mode&mdash;cutting off any excess power drains, thereby deactivating the Organa force field.After the [[Sith Warrior]] sabotaged the planetary generator and killed numerous [[Soldier/Legends|soldiers]], Organa, along with [[Blenks]], [[Kan'grell]], and [[Prinn]] confronted the Sith, who was looking for information about Jaesa Willsaam, Organa's former handmaiden. Organa decided to make an offer to the Sith, which was refused. The Sith started to torture Blenks, who was Organa's lover. Refusing to watch him [[Death/Legends|die]], Organa revealed that the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Jaesa Willsaam]]'s [[Parent/Legends|parents]] were still servants at [[Castle Organa]]. After getting the information on Willsaam's parents, the Warrior executed Organa and her bodyguards for defying the Empire.{{Endgame}}

name: Eseni
description: A [[Twi'lek/Legends|Twi'lek]] [[Sexes/Legends|female]], Eseni was a member of the religious group known as the [[Pilgrims]], which settled on the [[Planet/Legends|planet]] [[Tython/Legends|Tython]] during the [[Cold War (Galactic Republic&ndash;Sith Empire)|Cold War]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Republic]] and the [[Sith Empire (Post–Great Hyperspace War)|Sith Empire]]. The Pilgrims built [[Kalikori village]] between the [[Jedi Temple (Tython)/Legends|Jedi Temple]] and the [[Tythos Ridge]] [[Mountain/Legends|mountain]] range, in defiance of the [[Galactic Senate/Legends|Galactic Senate's]] refusal of settlement rights, and worked to survive on Tython despite attacks by the native [[Flesh Raider]]s.<ref name="High-Tech Savages">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|High-Tech Savages|Tython}}</ref> In [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Time">{{TOR_dates}}</ref> the Flesh Raiders began moving against both the villagers and the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] in an organized fashion, leading the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] to reach out to the villagers and work to halt the Flesh Raider threat. Eseni witnessed a [[Skirmish in the Kalikori village fields|Flesh Raider incursion]] that saw Flesh Raiders seed the [[City/Legends|village's]] crop fields with [[toxin mine]]s.
