After a [[Scout/Legends|scout]] collapsed from the [[Poison/Legends|toxic]] fumes, Eseni rushed to inform the village's leader, [[Matriarch]] [[Ranna Tao'Ven]].<ref name="The Face of the Enemy" />Tao'Ven was meeting with the [[Hero of Tython|young apprentice]] of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] [[Orgus Din]], and she and Eseni begged the [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] to help them against the Flesh Raiders. The Jedi was successful in destroying the toxin [[Mine/Legends|mines]] and [[Death/Legends|killing]] the [[Saboteur/Legends|saboteurs]], saving the village's [[Foodstuff/Legends|food]] supply.<ref name="The Face of the Enemy" /> However, the [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] [[Bengel Morr]]&mdash;the man responsible for the Flesh Raiders' recent activities&mdash;approached the villagers with an offer: In return for helping him capture Orgus Din, his former teacher, Morr would spare Kalikori from further attacks. The villagers agreed and sent out a false [[Distress signal/Legends|distress signal]], luring Din back to the village, where Morr's Flesh Raiders subdued and captured the Jedi Master. Not long afterward, however, Morr contacted the village and changed the terms of their deal&mdash;he now wanted them to kill Din's Padawan as well. Eseni, [[Scout Chief]] [[Moorint]], and another villager named [[Saylew]] then headed to the Matriarch's building, where the Padawan had just arrived and was talking with Tao'Ven and the [[T7-series astromech droid|astromech droid]] [[T7-O1]].<ref name="Dark Temptations">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|Dark Temptations|Tython}}</ref>[[File:Betrayal.png|thumb|right|200px|The villagers attempt to kill the Padawan.]]{{GameLS}}Moorint shot the Padawan with a [[dart]] coated with a sedative and painkiller, and Saylew shot T7-O1 with an [[Ion blaster/Legends|ion blaster]], but Tao'Ven was outraged and leaped to the Jedi's defense. As the Jedi struggled to remain conscious, Tao'Ven began to argue with Eseni and the other villagers, refusing to let them kill the Padawan. When the apprentice recovered from the dart, Moorint explained that Morr had changed their deal, but the Padawan reached out with [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] and [[Mind trick/Legends|convinced]] the trio to leave the building peacefully.<ref name="Dark Temptations" /> Fortunately for the villagers, they were spared Morr's wrath when Din's apprentice [[Battle of the Forge|defeated]] the Dark Jedi and rescued Din.<ref name="Weapon of the Jedi">{{TORcite|type=class|Jedi Knight|Weapon of the Jedi|Tython}}</ref>{{Endgame}}

name: Unidentified Mon Calamari female
description: This [[Mon Calamari/Legends|Mon Calamari]] first appeared while attempting to discuss a peaceful resolution with the [[Quarren/Legends|Quarren]], however, the Mon Calamari failed in this task.During the [[Battle of Mon Cala/Legends|Battle of Mon Cala]], the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] forces and Mon Calamari along with [[Prince/Legends|Prince]] [[Lee-Char/Legends|Lee-Char]] were overpowered by the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Separatists]] and were forced to retreat in the cavern of the [[Coral City|Mon Calamari capital city]] while all the inhabitants of the city, including this female, were taken prisoners and moved to a prison camp.The prisoner was later visible fighting the Separatist [[Aqua droid/Legends|Aqua droids]] along with Prince Lee-Char and other Mon Calamari after the Quarren rebelled.

name: Unidentified Patitite 2
description: This [[Patitite/Legends|Patitite]] lived on Patitite Pattuna when [[Protocol droid/Legends|protocol droid]] [[C-3PO/Legends|C-3PO]] and [[Astromech droid/Legends|astromech droid]] [[R2-D2/Legends|R2-D2]] crash landed on it during the [[Battle of Patitite Pattuna/Legends|Battle of Patitite Pattuna]]. After the two droids accidentally killed the Patitites leader, [[the Great Hezoo]], the Patitites wanted C-3PO to be their new leader.C-3PO refused and told them to choose a leader from their own [[Species/Legends|species]], and asked them to send forward to three smartest, most intelligent, most understanding and most compassionate individuals. This female was one of those three, but the Patitites could not choose between them and a fight broke out. C-3PO and R2-D2 then quickly left the planet.

name: Unidentified Togruta (Kadavo)
description: The [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] lived on the planet Kiros along with thousands of colonists when the Separatist forces arrived on the planet to move the population to a [[Kadavo slave processing facility/Legends|Kadavo slave processing facility]] on [[Kadavo/Legends|Kadavo]] and establish a base on the planet.Following a [[Battle of Kadavo/Legends|rescue mission]] by the Galactic Republic, a [[Venator-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Venator-class'' Star Destroyer]] along with many other smaller starships and gunships were sent to the planet to free the prisoners. During the ensuing battle, the Keeper of the labor facility, [[Agruss/Legends|Agruss]], decided to kill the prisoners by electrifying the walls of their prison chamber and opening a hatch underneath so they would fall to their deaths.[[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] realized the desperate situation and ordered that the Star Destroyer fly underneath the facility and deploy a squadron of [[Jetpack/Legends|jetpack]] [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] who would attach cables from the facility to the ship, allowing the prisoners to slide down to safety. During the rescue operation, this Togruta tried to reach the cable in front of her but accidentally fell of the ship. She was saved by Ahsoka Tano and transported along with the rest of the colonists back to Kiros.

name: Unidentified Togruta 2 (Kadavo)
description: The [[Togruta/Legends|Togruta]] lived on the planet Kiros along with other millions of colonists when the Separatist forces arrived on the planet to move the population to a [[Kadavo slave processing facility/Legends|Kadavo slave processing facility]] on [[Kadavo/Legends|Kadavo]] and establish a base on the planet.Following a [[Battle of Kadavo/Legends|rescue mission]] by the Galactic Republic, a [[Venator-class Star Destroyer/Legends|''Venator-class'' Star Destroyer]] along with many other smaller starships and gunships were sent to the planet to free the prisoners. During the ensuing battle, the Keeper of the labor facility, [[Agruss/Legends|Agruss]], decided to kill the prisoners by electrifying the walls of their prison chamber and opening a hatch underneath so they would fall to their deaths.[[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Ahsoka Tano/Legends|Ahsoka Tano]] realized the desperate situation and ordered that the Star Destroyed fly underneath the facility and deploy a squadron of [[Jetpack/Legends|jetpack]] [[Clone trooper/Legends|clone troopers]] who would attach cables from the facility to the ship, allowing the prisoners to slide down to safety. During the rescue operation, this Togruta along with another [[Unidentified Togruta 3 (Kadavo)|Togruta male]] tried to reach the cable in front of them but accidentally fell of the ship. She and the other Togruta were saved by a jetpack clone trooper and transported along with the rest of the colonists back to Kiros.

name: Unidentified Nightsister (Dathomir)
description: During the battle of Dathomir, this Nightsister along with a [[Unidentified Nightsister 2|fellow one]] were sent by [[Mother Talsain|Mother Talzin]] to recover an orb containing a lock of hair [[Dooku/Legends|Count Dooku]] so she could use it to create a magical voodoo figurine likeness of Dooku, conducting her magic through it to torment the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] into rescinding his attack or else suffering an agonizing death.The Nightsisters succeeded in doing so, but General Grievous was then informed by Dooku to forget about [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] and focus on Mother Talzin, so he attacked the Nightsisters fortress directly, killing [[Daka/Legends|Old Daka]] and this Nightsister, but failing to kill Talzin who managed to escape.

name: Unidentified Nightsister 2
description: During the battle of Dathomir, this Nightsister along with a [[Unidentified Nightsister (Dathomir)|fellow one]] were sent by [[Mother Talsain|Mother Talzin]] to recover an orb containing a lock of hair [[Dooku/Legends|Count Dooku]] so she could use it to create a magical voodoo figurine likeness of Dooku, conducting her magic through it to torment the [[Dark Lord of the Sith/Legends|Dark Lord of the Sith]] into rescinding his attack or else suffering an agonizing death.The Nightsisters succeeded in doing so, but General Grievous was then informed by Dooku to forget about [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] and focus on Mother Talzin, so he attacked the Nightsisters fortress directly, killing all Nightsisters who opposed him, including this one. He then killed [[Daka/Legends|Old Daka]] but Talzin managed to escape.

name: Karis/Legends
description: {{Quote|Go, and lead us to victory.|Karis, to Ventress, right before her death|Massacre}}[[File:KarisDead-Massacre.png|thumb|left|200px|Karis dies in Ventress' arms]]During the [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]], Karis was recognized by her master [[Talzin/Legends|Talzin]] as one of the greatest warriors of her [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]] clan, alongside fellow sister [[Naa'leth/Legends|Naa'leth]].<ref name="TCW">{{TCW|Nightsisters (episode)|Nightsisters}}</ref> When [[Asajj Ventress/Legends|Asajj Ventress]] returned home to [[Dathomir/Legends|Dathomir]], Karis was ordered to accompany her and Naa'leth to [[Serenno/Legends|Serenno]] in an attempt to [[Assassin/Legends|assassinate]] [[Count/Legends|Count]] [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]] in retribution for his betrayal of Ventress, though they were defeated. Soon after the failed attack on Count Dooku, the Count sent [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]] to the planet of Dathomir and launched an attack. A vulture droid fired a missile that lead a chain reaction of falling statues from the Temple of the Nightsisters.Karis was the first person to suffer a casualty because that was the ambush attack that started the [[Battle of Dathomir (Clone Wars)|Battle of Dathomir]] against the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] when a statue (that fell when shot by a [[Hyena-class bomber/Legends|droid bomber]]) crushed her. Asajj Ventress managed to pull her out, but Karis said her last few words about leading the Nightsisters to victory, and died.<ref name="TCW">{{TCW|Massacre}}</ref>

name: Vaverone Zare
description: {{GameLS}}In [[3643 BBY]],<ref name="Date" /> Zare came to the planet [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]] in search of the [[Darth Nihilus' holocron|holocron]] of [[Darth Nihilus]], which was in the possession of the gangster [[Diago Hixan]]. Zare sought to make contact with Diago by sending [[Geonosian/Legends|Geonosians]] to raid his spice warehouse on the edge of the [[Jundland]]. At the same time, a [[Voidhound|smuggler captain]] seeking a sensor computer from Diago, investigated on behalf of Diago's lieutenant, [[Tookreek]], to claim a [[Krayt dragon/Legends|krayt dragon]] bone. Zare attempted to persuade the smuggler to arrange a meeting with Diago, but was refused, forcing her to disarm her opponent. She spared the smuggler, leaving with a reminder that her offer was still open.<ref name="BO" />Zare later sent Imperial commandos to attack [[Diago Hixan's palace|Diago's summer palace]], where the smuggler was meeting with Tookreek. After the smuggler fended off the attack, Zare contacted them via holo, restating her offer, but again was refused, forcing her to order a renewed attack, but the smuggler survived that too.<ref name="BO" />Zare eventually tracked the smuggler to Diago's oasis, called the [[Lightspring]], where Jedi Knight [[Nariel Pridence]] was waiting. Additionally, Diago's delirium compelled to order his droids to kill on sight, resulting in an all out brawl between all four parties. Zare was killed in the fighting, along with Diago.<ref name="TL" />{{Endgame}}

name: Sabla-Mandibu
description: Like all Jedi of the era, Master Mandibu served the Order during the [[New Sith Wars]] and helped rebuild the [[Jedi academy]] after the [[Ruusan Reformation]]s. Following the war, Master Mandibu was appointed to sit on the [[Council of Reconciliation/Legends|Council of Reconciliation]], working as liaison between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and several different political factions.<ref name="TJP" />When her fellow Masters proposed that a guidebook to the life of the Jedi be written, Master Mandibu agreed to work on the project, contributing three chapters. Hoping to emphasize the virtue of the [[Jedi Consular]]s as well as give a detailed description of the Sense and Alter abilities of the Jedi, Master Mandibu's teachings were passed down in the tome for several generations.<ref name="TJP" />

name: Lomi Plo
description: Lomi Plo was a [[Nightsisters/Legends|Nightsister]], possibly a member of the [[Great Canyon Clan]] under [[Tamith Kai]]. By the time of the [[Yuuzhan Vong War]], she was a member of the [[One Sith|new Sith order]] based on [[Korriban]], acting as [[Sith Master/Legends|Sith Master]] to the [[Togorian/Legends|Togorian]] [[Morto]].Along with an [[Welk|apprentice]], she was sent to escort [[Lumiya]] to join their group at its base. However, they were cut off from their destination by the unexpected speed of the [[Yuuzhan Vong]] advance, and Lomi and her apprentice were captured by the invaders.Lomi subsequently found herself enslaved alongside Welk and other [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitives]] aboard the [[Koros-Strohna|worldship]] ''[[Baanu Rass]]'', as specimens for human experimentation, and especially as live prey for the [[voxyn]]. After being rescued by the [[Myrkr strike team]], she took vengeance on her captors by creating a [[Force net]] and slowly contracting it, ultimately slicing a Yuuzhan Vong [[Shaper caste|shaper]] into pieces. This act greatly unnerved [[Anakin Solo]], but impressed [[Alema Rar]], who was still mourning the death of her [[Numa Rar|sister]]. The members of the strike team were less than pleased to discover that they had rescued two [[Dark Jedi/Legends|Dark Jedi]] &mdash; and would have been even less pleased if they had known at the time that they were [[Sith/Legends|Sith]].Using their knowledge of the worldship, Lomi and Welk guided the strike team, but were perturbed when they discovered the nature of the mission. In order to escape, they stole the ''[[Tachyon Flier]]'', injuring [[Lowbacca]] and abducting [[Raynar Thul]] in the process. The ship eventually crashed in the [[Unknown Regions/Legends|Unknown Regions]], severely burning all three aboard, leaving them scarred and deformed.Lomi and Welk were incorporated into the [[Killik]] nest that rescued them and, through their knowledge of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]], they appear to have created the [[Gorog]] nest. Lomi became known as the Unseen Queen of this Dark Nest. Because Lomi wanted nothing more than to hide, the nest had taken on that characteristic and hid from the other nests. Lomi also gained the ability to render herself invisible to someone who had doubt in their mind. Because of this, the extent of Lomi's injuries were unknown, but in later encounters Lomi was revealed to have had a pair of Killik arms above her Human ones, her eyes were replaced with Killik eyes, her lower jaw was replaced with a Killik mandible, and one of her legs was replaced by a Killik leg.In [[35 ABY/Legends|35 ABY]], the Dark Queen was present with the Dark Nest in the [[Qoribu]] system, at [[Kr]]. She and the [[Night Herald]] Welk worked with Alema Rar to engage [[Luke Skywalker/Legends|Luke Skywalker]] and [[Mara Jade Skywalker]]. Lomi fluttered around the edge of the battle, invisible to the combatants, draining the power cells of the [[Jedi/Legends|Jedi]] whenever she was able to. Luke, wielding Alema Rar's lightsaber and his own, lost both weapons, but still killed Welk. Lomi thrashed out while trying to kill Luke by throwing him into Gorog larvae, but Luke survived, and Lomi chose to retreat as many more Jedi were on their way. Despite this, Luke and the other Jedi believed the Dark Nest to be destroyed.

name: Jocasta Nu/Legends
description: {{Quote|There is more knowledge here than anywhere else in the galaxy.|Jocasta Nu, on the Jedi Archives|Holocron Heist}}[[File:KaiArchives.jpg|thumb|left|180px|Jocasta Nu with [[Kai Justiss]]]]Brought into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] during the final decades of the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]], it is likely Jocasta Nu was discovered by a [[Jedi recruiter|recruiter]] of the [[Acquisition Division]] to be [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] around infancy before being brought to the [[Coruscant/Legends|Coruscant]] [[Jedi Temple]] for [[Jedi training/Legends|training]]. Raised in a [[Jedi Initiate|youngling]] [[Jedi Initiate Clan/Legends|clan]], she passed the [[Jedi Initiate Trials|trials]] of the [[Jedi academy]] and was eventually selected by a Master for one-on-one training. Passing the [[Jedi Trials/Legends|Jedi Trials]], Nu pursued the path of the [[Jedi Consular|Consular]] and became a [[Jedi Researcher|researcher]] specializing in the field of [[Archaeology/Legends|archaeology]]. Attaching herself to the [[Exploration Corps/Legends|Exploration Corps]] after consulting the [[Council of Reassignment/Legends|Council of Reassignment]], Nu traveled [[The galaxy/Legends|the galaxy]] gathering information for the [[Jedi Archives/Legends|Jedi Archives]]. During her journeys, Nu discovered the Force-sensitive [[Miraluka/Legends|Miraluka]], [[Jerec (Inquisitor)|Jerec]], and delivered him to the Temple for entrance into the academy there. Eventually Nu returned to the Temple and selected Jerec as her [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], passing along her own desires to learn all there was to know in the galaxy, which eventually drove him to Knighthood himself. After her padawan completed his training, Nu was made a [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] and began to perform the duties of an [[Jedi Lore Keeper|archivist]] in the Archives. Eventually, Nu was appointed Chief Librarian of the Archives and [[Jedi Temple Library|Library]] and made a member of the [[Librarian's Assembly]].<ref name="db" /> Part of her responsibility as Chief Librarian was oversight of the [[Educational Corps]]; she reported directly to the Reassignment Council on all matters concerning this branch of the [[Jedi Service Corps/Legends|Jedi Service Corps]].<ref name="TJP">[[The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force (real-life book)|''The Jedi Path: A Manual for Students of the Force'']]</ref>During her tenure as Chief Librarian, Nu was appointed to the [[Jedi High Council/Legends|Jedi High Council]] in [[62 BBY/Legends|62 BBY]], serving on the august body before stepping down in [[52 BBY/Legends|ten years later]]. Foregoing the traditional [[Jedi apparel|brown robes]] of the Order, Nu began wearing a tunic and dress imprinted with ancient [[Ansata]] patterns, a type of dress worn by some of the most famed Jedi historians including the ancient Master [[Atris]]. Over the years, Nu came to know most of the Jedi in the Temple, becoming especially fond of Master [[Dooku/Legends|Dooku]]; she personally mourned the loss of his great idealism when he left the Order shortly following the [[Invasion of Naboo/Legends|Invasion of Naboo]]. Using the extensive knowledge gained in the field with the ExplorCorps, Nu continued to gather a very precise and extensive knowledge of the galaxy.<ref name="db" /> Working in cooperation with the [[Jedi Council/Legends|Jedi Councils]], Nu was always advised of upcoming missions so that she could help prep a report for all Jedi about to depart the Temple.<ref name="TOW">''[[Jedi Apprentice: The Only Witness]]''</ref>In [[52 BBY/Legends|52 BBY]], Nu undertook a diplomatic mission to the world of [[Serenno/Legends|Serenno]] with Jedi Masters Dooku, [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and [[Sifo-Dyas/Legends|Sifo-Dyas]]. At the meeting, the Jedi team met [[Damask Holdings]] [[Magister]] [[Darth Plagueis/Legends|Hego Damask]], in reality the [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] Darth Plagueis.<ref name="Darth Plagueis">[[Darth Plagueis (novel)|''Darth Plagueis'']]</ref> Nu took on her last [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]], [[Jin-Lo Rayce]] sometime after the [[Stark Hyperspace War/Legends|Stark Hyperspace War]] around [[44 BBY/Legends|44 BBY]], teaching him all of the secret passage ways in and out of the Temple. In [[39 BBY/Legends|39 BBY]], Jedi Master [[Qui-Gon Jinn/Legends|Qui-Gon Jinn]] and his [[Padawan/Legends|Padawan]] [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]] were sent on a mission to [[Vorzyd IV]]. Nu provided the two Jedi with the information needed for them to complete their assignment.Over the course of her time as director of the Archives her confidence in the data stored in the stacks was whole; claiming that if something was not in the Archives, then it did not exist. This statement was belied when [[Jedi Knight/Legends|Jedi Knight]] Obi-Wan Kenobi was unable to find the aquatic world [[Kamino/Legends|Kamino]] in the Archives and suggested that the Archives were incomplete; somewhat miffed, Madame Nu reiterated her belief that if an item was not in the Archives, it did not exist, and strode away to assist a young Padawan who had just arrived.<ref name="AOTC">[[Star Wars: Episode II Attack of the Clones|''Star Wars'': Episode II ''Attack of the Clones'']]</ref>

name: Ur-Sema Du
description: [[File:Ursemadu.jpg|thumb|left|Ur-Sema Du and [[Kai Justiss]] fight a [[marsh haunt]].]]Ur-Sema Du was a [[Force-sensitive/Legends|Force-sensitive]] [[Human/Legends|Human]] who received [[Jedi training/Legends|training]] in the ways of [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] by the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]], eventually attaining the rank of [[Jedi Master/Legends|Jedi Master]] after constructing a green-bladed [[Lightsaber/Legends|lightsaber]].When the [[Separatist Crisis/Legends|Separatist Crisis]] between the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]] and the [[Confederacy of Independent Systems/Legends|Confederacy of Independent Systems]] erupted into a [[First Battle of Geonosis/Legends|conflict]] on [[Geonosis/Legends|Geonosis]], Master Du answered [[Master of the Order/Legends|Master of the Order]] [[Mace Windu/Legends|Mace Windu's]] call-to-arms by flying to the dust-covered world. As part of Windu's [[Geonosis strike team|strike team]] assembled to rescue Jedi [[Obi-Wan Kenobi/Legends|Obi-Wan Kenobi]], [[Anakin Skywalker/Legends|Anakin Skywalker]] and [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Padmé Amidala/Legends|Padmé Amidala]] from execution by the Confederacy leaders, Du landed on the plains of Geonosis outside the [[Petranaki arena/Legends|Petranaki arena]]. While her comrades attacked the arena from the grandstands, Master Du delved deep into the [[Geonosian catacombs|catacombs]]. Amidst the damp quiet of the insect-constructed facility, was the first Jedi to encounter the monstrous [[General/Legends|General]] [[Grievous/Legends|Grievous]], a [[Kaleesh/Legends|Kaleesh]] [[Cyborg/Legends|cyborg]] who was poised to lead the [[Separatist Droid Army/Legends|Separatist Droid Army]] in the coming [[Clone Wars/Legends|Clone Wars]]. Wielding her lightsaber against Grievous' [[Electrostaff/Legends|electrostaff]], Du fought valiantly but was overpowered and killed by the General. Collecting her lightsaber as a trophy, Grievous left her body where it laid, his existence remaining a secret from the Republic until he was ready to unleash his full might on the [[Grand Army of the Republic/Legends|Grand Army of the Republic]].<ref name="US" />

name: Rhalia Jinsari
description: {{Quote|The bounty hunter's name is Rhalia Jinsari. Stop her from bringing me in to those insane zealots, and I'll gladly reward you.|[[Vardias Tyne]]|Star Wars Galaxies}}During [[1 ABY/Legends|1.5 ABY]], [[Vardias Tyne]], a resident of [[Anchorhead/Legends|Anchorhead]] on [[Tatooine/Legends|Tatooine]], killed a [[Bantha/Legends|bantha]] that was destroying his [[Moisture vaporator/Legends|vaporators]]. Unfortunately for Vardias, Brother [[Chonar]] of the bantha-worshiping [[Dim-U]] monks learned of this, and hired Rhalia Jinsari, a [[Zabrak/Legends|Zabrak]] [[Bounty hunter/Legends|bounty hunter]], to kill Vardias Tyne.<ref name="SWG" />{{Gamemechanics}}However, before Rhalia could reach [[City/Legends|town]], she was killed by a [[Spacer/Legends|spacer]] who agreed to help Vardias.<ref name="SWG" />{{Endgame}}

name: Nadia Grell
description: Nadia Grell was the daughter of [[Senator/Legends|Senator]] [[Tobas Grell]] of [[Sarkhai]]. Nadia had not spent much time off her home planet. She held an intense curiosity for all the species and experiences that she had never seen before and picked up an interest in diplomacy from assisting her father.When the [[The Barsen'thor|Barsen'thor]] was tasked with meeting and aiding the Rift Alliance on the Republic ship, the [[Fortitude (Valor-class cruiser)|''Fortitude'']], [[Sith/Legends|Sith]] ambushed the ship. They rigged it to crash and kill the leaders of the [[Rift Alliance]] and separate them from the [[Galactic Republic/Legends|Galactic Republic]]. Nadia had hidden and been trying to contact anyone she could. She was able to warn the arriving Barsen'thor, who saved the delegation by evacuating to the Jedi's ship, where they stayed for a time.On [[Quesh]], the [[Jedi Consular]] discovered that Nadia was unusually [[Force-sensitive/Legends|strong]] in [[The Force/Legends|the Force]] during an incident at [[Attis Station]]. Force-users were practically unheard of on her homeworld, rendering Nadia as a freak in the eyes of her people. Nadia's father took her along on his diplomatic missions away from Sarkhai hoping that he could find someone to help her control her abilities and help her meet similar people. But upon seeing Jedi, he noticed she was more powerful but uncontrolled in comparison to the masters he met.After her father's [[Death/Legends|death]] at the hands of "[[Stark]]", a mysterious [[Sith Lord/Legends|Sith Lord]] whose name was taken by the [[Syo Bakarn|First Son]], Nadia was inducted into the [[Jedi Order/Legends|Jedi Order]] as a Padawan under the guidance of the Barsen'thor in accordance with her father's will.Nadia would inherit her father's position representing her home for the Republic and would have to leave training for these duties from time to time.[[File:Nadia Grell Ossus.png|thumb|Nadia Grell on Ossus]]At a later point during the [[Galactic War]], Nadia was reciting the [[Jedi Code/Legends|Jedi Code]] with her Master when Lieutenant [[Felix Iresso]] interrupted, explaining that their ship's [[Navigation computer/Legends|navicomputer]] had been [[Slicer/Legends|sliced]], it's destination plotted towards [[Rishi/Legends|Rishi]]. [[Zenith]] chimed in that Rishi was a haven for pirates and gunrunners, so there was no way anyone from there could've done so. As the crew checked the navicomputer, Nadia's Master had a [[Force vision/Legends|vision]] that compelled the Barsen'thor to announce that they were going to Rishi.During the Eternal Empire's Conquest, The Barsen'thor went missing. For some time, Nadia consulted the Noetikons and decided to rally the Barsen'thor's old allies, including [[Gaden-Ko]], the [[Esh-kha]], and the [[Balmorran resistance]] to search for her master.<ref name="KOTFE Mail">{{TORcite|exp=kotfe|type=message|I will find you|Nadia Grell}}</ref> During this time, she also was promoted to knight, and, at her request, replaced as senator by Theriki, so that she could better serve the war effort. At some point before the return of the [[The Commander (Alliance)|Outlander]] she met Jedi Master [[Gnost-Dural]] and joined in his efforts to establish a hidden Jedi colony on Ossus.
